reviews.review: Very interesting place to see. I enjoyed visiting this area and found it extremely interesting but very busy. The clock is a must see. Lots of interesting shopping in the area as well .

One of a kind. Very popular destination at old town in Prague. It is hard to miss as there will always be a crowd in front of the clock. It chimes with a little animation every hour and the tourists mill around it to capture the event. The clocks on the tower are one of a kind. They are impressively large and still operational including the little animation that happens. There is also the clock tower that you can purchase a ticket to go up. You can take the elevator or walk. It is quite busy since it is a popular designation. Once up there the views of Prague Old Town are quite impressive. Some of the best pictures I have of Prague are from the tower. I believe that it is worth the few extra Euros to go up the tower. I don't really know if there is an off peak time or not as there seemed to always be a line and crowd, but having said that still worth it. 4 stars for the crowd but a 5 star attraction.

Beautiful complicated mystery!. The tower and imposing Astronomical Clock is a mystery, there are people standing there all the time trying to make out what it means. Yet you stand there enthralled by it beauty. A must see in Prague
A technical jewelery. Created in 15th century, the astronomical clock is still working, telling the time, the zodiac sign, the phases of the moon and the position of the sun and the moon.

Mrs S Sharma . Visited on 14th October. The amazing Astronomical Clock was beautiful to look at. Architectural work was amazing! There was a huge group of people waiting for the clock to chime. But that was about all I can say about it.

Must go up the Tower. The clock and its history are worth exploring. To have a wonderful view of the square take a trip up the Tower and you will be rewarded. I'd suggest taking the lift unless you are feeling very energetic and also booking a fast track ticket as the queues can be very long.

Lovely and Beautiful. We spent a lot of time in this square looking at the buildings and eating that Prague special of goulash in bread. The clock is interesting historically but a bit disappointing when it swings into action. Architecture fab.
The clock is a must see. This location is busy day and night, but is a must see on any tour of Praha and centrally located in a delightful square. .

Disappointing. This was one of the most hyped and under-whelming of any attraction I've ever visited. Only the Mannekin Pis fountain in Brussels compares. I was expecting a complicated array of mechanical actions to take place on the hour. That didn't happen. There are a few religious figures popping out like the man and woman in a cuckoo clock and not a lot more.There were hundreds of people who were expecting, I suspect, a spectacular son et lumiere type of show. Instead we got a fairly boring display. I wasn't impressed.
Gotta see this one. A circus in your mind. Experience the beauty of the architecture and the movements of the clock when it strikes. Noon is the best, but every hour has it's attractions.
Astronomical clock is worth a viewing on the hour. This is popular, but worth waiting for on the hour when the clock starts. Lots of eating places nearby and shops.
Interesting. The old town hall is definitely worth visiting, and is handily located in the old town square. Beware the crowds around the clock - it gets very busy

Lots happening and a great view . From the history on the way, the climb up the tower, the top of hour show, the view from the tower... it's all very beautiful. I highly recommend it. If you are only climbing 1 tower, make it this one.
Beautiful Timepiece. The clock itself is beautiful. The crowds we encountered were a bit daunting so we didn't spend much time with the clock.
Nice area. Nice area very busy with tourist, especially on the hour when the clock goes off. Many places to dine, have cafe ,etc. lots of shopping and many photo opportunities

The clock is a major attraction. While these huge groups appear at each hour to watch the clock work including the apostles at the doors, the skeleton and the greedy statue. The tour of the town hall begins in the Information Booth to the left of the clock and can provide a means to get to the walkway around the tower for fabulous views of Prague.

Worth a look while in Old Town Square. Very historical but the hourly chimes are nothing to plan your day around.
Plenty of other things to see while in the square or have a couple of beers while waiting for the hour to tick over.

Quirky clock entertains!. The Astronomical Clock is a must-see for tourists in Prague. It's a great little show every hour, and it's right in the heart of the city. Be sure to buy a ticket and go to the top of the town for the best views of the square and St. Mary's.
Highlight of Old Town Prague. A must see when you visit Old Town Prague. The clock is a stunning example of medieval architecture. Absolutely fascinating to watch

A Must Visit To Prague. The clock strikes every hour, which makes the square very, very crowded. As with most crowded spaces anywhere in Europe, be careful with your possessions and watch for pickpockets. The square is lined with outdoor and indoor dining and all of the choices are very good. We found that most of the tourist locations in Prague were walking distance from the Town Square so we started our day there on most mornings.

Must See Sight. This is the must see attraction of Prague and of course its free. Situated at the side of the old town square it is easily accessable.. The clock strikes on the hour and you must see the moving figures. Stand a little distance away to get a better view as up close it is difficult to see the figures. It is always very busy so early morning is best

Beautiful Old Astronomical Clock. This is a great looking, old, astronomical clock which still rings every hour on the hour. People run from all over to hear and see it when it rings. It is located right in the old town square so there are always a lot of people.

Mechanical wonder. I'm always amazed at the intricate engineering that was done hundreds and hundreds of years ago. The precision and understanding of time and celestial physics for this time period was amazing. Try to be in the square for the hourly show. Will definitely enjoy.

The tower provides a panoramic view. But the clock is vastly over rated.Hundres of people fill up the square to see (on the hour( the 12 apostles figures appear in the 2 small windows above the clock.But their appearance lasts maybe 1 minue and you can barely see them.The ony way to see them is very 4 hours in the 1st floor of the tower.On the other hand, the climb to the tower is very easy, through a sloped access way. The walls are full of informative and interesting plaques. And the views from the top are excellent.

Cant miss this clock!. Right smack in the middle of old town Prague. Such a charming town but packed with tourist. We went off season and yet it was packed. Cant imagine peak. But one on the bucket list and well worth it

Our hotel room was right opposite the clock face. We stayed in the Old Town a the Grand Hotel Krakow and our shuttered bedroom window opened out onto the astronomical clock face, so the twelve apostles hourly ritual featured large in our three day trip as they all came and went at the little tower window on the hour every hour, day and night. It was fun to watch and they are a novelty, but I suspect the better choice is the climb up the adjoining bell tower. We didn't do this as the days were hot and the queues long. Most fun was watching from our window the LARGE crowd gather every hour with cameras at the ready waiting for these twelve little wooden dolls to pop out. Hilarious.

Amazing clock! . This clock is very unique and we visit with tour guide named Andy, very nice British guy. He can explain in a very good way.. This Asteonomical clock is in old town area and it will be crowded because many people are curious with this clock. I suggest to enter the building to know how the machine works and it is about 4-5 euro. .

Amazing . It is must if you are in pragueThe square is large and the buildings are amazing like you live in a legend The clock is very attractive There is lot of restaurants in the square and very good shops nearby

Wonderful old building and hugely entertaining clock!. This is in Old Town Square, one of the loveliest squares in all of Europe. Buildings date as far back as the 1200-1300s and the "new ones" are from the 1700s! The town hall itself is an architectural masterpiece and the clock still works (!!) with revolving figures that come out of small doors near the top every half-hour accompanied by chiming bells.

The ancient miracle still works. Yes, it is nothing but some moving wooden figures of apostles when the clock strikes an hour. For the 21st century public spoiled by cinema and 3D effects it may seem funny and even pathetic and not worth milling in the tourist crowd. But take time, look at the details of this wondrous building and the clock with all its additions, then have some reading in history and legends (ghost on the clock, necessity to keep the clock in good working state, a boy, born in New Year’s night, etc.) about the clock and just go a time back in imagination. Then the miracle will work even in the middle of the bored tourist crowd, even in the 21st century.

One of the best. We went up the Old Town Clock tower on our first evening in Prague for the nominal fee of c.€5. The views at night time were spectacular and there is even a lift to the top if stairs arent your thing.We returned a few days later and took in a guided tour of the Old Town Halls which was excellent. The tour guide was a young guy who knew his stuff and kept his audience interest. For us, the best part of the tour was the tour of the underground cellars and old streets of Prague; it was just phenomenal.The Old Town Hall is smack bang in the middle of the Old Town Square and you cant miss it. Tourists gather outside the clock on the hour every hour to see the 12 apostles appear in the window of the clock which is worth seeing. If you take in the tour you get a closer look at the back of the clock and the individual apostles.Definitely a must see in Prague.
Must see. Fun place especially on a nice day. Sit in the outside restaurants and enjoy the people as well as the clock and coffee.
Great to see...once. Interesting piece of Prague history. Take it in on the hour, getting there early so you can watch before the crowds roll in at the last minute.
Orloj. Unique building with unique machinery. This is taking 3rd place in MUST VISIT in Prague after castle and bridge ;)

Tick Tock. See the Clock. This history OF the clock is fascinating. Read up on it before you go. then "on the hour", deal with the throngs of people looking upwards to see the clock go into action. don't blink! it's quick and, after all that fuss, a bit disappointing. however, across from the clock is the "grand hotel". go upstairs to Cafe Mozart and have a drink - you'll be right across from the clock and away from the mass of humanity!
Old town clock. One of the oldest clocks in the world well worth a visit on the hour each day.Be prepared to stand in a large croud

Pretty but it's just a clock . Intricately designed - seems to get s lot of tourists standing when it goes off. It's well made, seen nothing like it in my life. whilst on the old square should wait and see this as glad I did. If I go again will see it again..... but ultimately as the title suggest it's just a clock
It is truly astronomical such beauty. the clock is such a fascinating sight the architecture wonderful and it s seems somewhat magical as on the hour .... Just go see what happens

the clock is disappointing. I was expecting much more about the clock. I went to watch it twice and in both times it didn't do anything amazing. It is still worth the visit because it is a beautiful clock. But if you miss it, don't feel sorry. There are a lot more interesting things to do in prague
Astronomical Clock. Make sure you're there on the hour because the clock comes to life. And, the bells sound lovely chiming across the Town Hall Square.

Must-see but the show is over is a blink!. As you can tell from the number of reviews, this is a must-see; the clock movement is very interesting to watch and quit fun. But don't be late because it's over with very quickly. The chimes and movement occur on the hour.
Has to be done!. You can't go to Prague and miss the astronomical clock! It is smaller than I would've thought but the workmanship is truly amazing!

Forget the clock but enjoy the square. The clock is of interest but don't worry about missing the "moving figures" on every hour. It's a beautiful clock to look at and if you look closely you can see it has a several hands. The square is where to begin your trip by taking one of the walking tours which gather there. After you've developed a sense of the city, go back to the square to take a closer look at the churches, galleries, sculptures, and all the little lane ways which lead from the square.

Fascinating hourly experience. On the hour there are two doors over the clock which open and a saintly figure is moved along and to the front of the opening one by one. It is better to visit at 11 or 12 noon when there are more chimes rather than 1pm when there is only one, however, it is very atmospheric just as the light fades at 6pm.
Amazing history.... Lovely old town with interesting history, Astronomical clock is quite intriguing, also the underground tunnels are a must see.

A large gathering of tourist come here to watch the clock strike on the top of the hour.. Beautiful clock tower to view but the clocks hourly show is not the best I have seen. If you miss the show, no big deal because the best sights are the clock tower and the Old Towne Square of Prague. I enjoyed the 360 degree view of the entire city of Prague from the top of the Astronomical Clock.

Old town square . Lovely place but can get very busy in evenings would recommend early mornings to by pass mass groups of people to get good shots with camera. Good spot to go up tower see square from hight very nice there is elevation In building if you do not want to climb flights of stars. As it is quit high.

Great or not? . History is good and visually stunning, however the timing is everything as it only fully performs once a day , all other hourly performances are ignominious, although attended by vast expectation of the throng.
Must see, but not at busy times of day!. Gorgeous old clock, but gets massively busy, surrounded by tourists all pointing their cameras at it!

Tick tock. We didn't go into the old town hall or clock we just admired it from the outside. The clock is beautiful so much going on but you have to be there on the hour to see all the little surprises that will be revealed. It does get extremely busy so get there a few minutes early to get a good viewing point.

Very interesting piece of machinery. Very hard to get a good position unless you get it 20-30 minutess before the hour.
Unfortunately at night it is not lit up so could not get good view

Birthday bash. You can't go to Prague and not help but visit this place but be warned you are going to get loads of visitors here and at times can be busy, you will also get people asking you to take certain tours but be polite they'll soon leave you alone unless that's what when just one word of warning if you plan in eating around here you pay top price but it is a lovely place to visit, enjoy your visit to Prague

More than meets the eye. Blink and you miss it! Crowds gather on the hour to photograph this clock but it will be worth while finding out a little more the history behind the restoration and reasons why it became necessary. Taking the World War11 Tour will offer you a unique insight and opportunity to go beneath the Clock Tour and learn the full story. A further tip is to grab a seat and coffee in the Cafe Mozart opposite and view the hour striking in comfort. If it's cold go inside to the Hotel Bar and find a window seat!

Worth seeing even in the rain. Tourists are there in droves no matter when.. Short peek and picture taking over heads of the crowd. Disappointed that there was not more interesting action at the hour chime as is the case in other european sites which are similar.

You are not allowed to miss it. Why ?Because to be in Prague and to miss it would be ... weird ... Yes, back home the first question you'll be asked will be: "Have you seen the Astronomical clock" ?Then what will you say ? No ?Then what have you done in Prague, why have you been there ?Of course it will be overcrowded between June and September...And yes of course the place is way overrated and besides stopping for a few minutes in front of it there is not much more to do (I might have missed something there so let me know if I did)....But you are already anyway there ... so do see it ... And enjoy the atmosphere of a fair from another century ...Skipping it would be like being in Brussels and skip the Manneken Pis...And anyway you'll probably have to pass in front of it on your way from the adjacent Old Town Square to Charles Bridge and to Prague Castle ... So stop there ...You can take a look at the pictures I have attached to get the feeling of the place ...By the way I preferred it at night ...You see ... this middle age mysterious atmosphere ;-)So yes again, it is a MUST in Prague ... Remember, it is one of the most visited attractions in Prague, and missing it would leave a FOMO taste to your visit in Prague.

Nice, a must to see.. The anatomical clock is a big attraction. People start gathering 15-20 minutes before the clock strikes for the marionettes to circle around. It is a beautiful clock, great picture moment. It is hard to get a great picture ,since the marionettes are circling inside not outside the clock. You can go up the tower for the view, but we did not do this.

Very Pretty. Lovely! Lots to see around the area. Can get extremely busy, especially near the hour! Not worth waiting around for the clock to strike but definitely worth a walk by. Wouldn't bother with the food in the area, not the best and quite pricey. Better off going for a little walk and finding something a little of course!

Just a fun place to be. Watching the clock tower is amazing just because you see the craftsmanship, the workmanship, and old traditions of Prague. They ring every hour on the hour and is sure to attract crowds, just be mindful of pick pockets. Just a quick little stop and neat thing to witness. The history there is really neat.
Lots of tourisr. it was quite an interesting experience worth the trip. there was an old guy there selling a kind of toy. please buy from him ;)

Admirable. Very nice atmosphere, with nice view to central square, lots of nice coffee shops and restaurants, and u can't miss the beautiful attraction around the tower , and lots of shopping center around u also
Very beautiful. It is amazing to see, you have to time it well to see it in its full glory but worth the wait! There are plenty of cafès in the square to take the weight off

Just beautiful. On a family trip to Prague and it wouldn't have been the same without a visit to the town hall and watching the clock chime. Our wee one loved seeing the animation around the clock. Bit of advice though if you have small kids, try to get near the front as it bustles up the nearer it gets to the hour. Well worth seeing as the architecture is amazing.
Not to be missed. You cannot visit Prague without seeing the clock do its thing. Amazing considering how old it is and the wars and destruction it gas seen in its past.

Astronomical Clock Disappointing. There were hordes of tourists gathered to watch it, it was an non event. Apart from the fact that it was one of the oldest clock of its kind in its days, we did not see any figurines came out when it chimed.

A Prague "must see". The clock is very interesting but, best of all, the view from the tower over the city is really spectacular. Get there for 11.00 am and be the first up the tower (which has lifts) otherwise you may have to queue for quite a while. Groups can pre-book tickets. The cost is about £2.60 per person to go to the top of the tower. The Old Square itself is really the hub of Prague.
Fascinating . The clock was built in the 1400's and has only stopped once. Very beautiful and has a good historical story.

You won't forget this clock anytime soon. Large, animated clock that goes off on the hour. Hundreds of people gather to watch the animated performance. The square is packed with people and lots of restuarants in the area.
Do not miss. Walking in Prague there are many worthwhile sites the clock is a do not miss site. The clock is near many other attractions. Our guide gave us the history of this clock
Top notch craftsmanship. Just one of hundreds of attractions in this beautiful city has to offer its a must see city need a minimum 3 full days to get it all in
Beautiful yet crowded. A must see in Prague!you should visit it early in the morning when it's less crowded to really enjoy the scenery.If you're on a budget, avoid the restaurants in the area.

Astronomical clock and The Old Town . The astronomical clock is another must for Praque with it being the only still operational astronomical clock in the world. It was built in 1410 and at the time of making it the third oldest created. Every hour you will witness a mini show of The Walk of the Apostles. These are moving figurines and sculptures that will begin to move on the hour.You can enter the clock tower for a small fee of around £4-5. You enter and either by the original staircase or via a lift if your unable to make the venture upwards. At the top you'll be greeted by a spectacular view during day or night but the latter is the best option. All the lights of Old Town will glisten as you peer outwards. Again for a small fee you use the provided telescope for a close up view of the castle on the hillside. Overall a thoroughly enjoyable bit of medieval history

Slightly over rated, after all it just a large animated clock in an otherwise good square. Enjoyable if passing on the hour, and mildly intersting on the quarter hours, but would not walk more than a kilometre just to see this.

Amazing Clock. I was not aware of the clock until we were there a few days ago. It is truly amazing. I still do not understand all the things it does. Probably good to go on line and see if there is a good explanation. Certainly a place that needs to be seen.

The Clock. People come from around the world to view this famous clock! Make sure you have plenty of time. Stop in for coffee, wine, something to eat at the numerous little cafes around the square while you wait. The many people from all over the world can be entertaining too!

Does not match the hoopla!. The area is nice and the buildings in the square are beautiful. The clock is pretty cool. However, it does not live up to everything that people say about it. Once an hour, parts of it dance around but did nothing for me.To be fair, the clock itself is a wonder, but most of it does nothing. Unfortunately, with hundreds of tourists packing the square, it is a prime location to get your wallet, purse or bags stolen. Be careful when standing there for minutes on end to watch the dancing clock for a few seconds.
Packed with tourists!. Beautiful bustling area packed with tourists from around the globe. The clock is amazing to be working and be so old!

The view from the top of this tower is spectacular. If you want the best view of the old town then climb the stairs (or for those not so adventurous, take the lift) to the top of the tower and look out from all four sides down to the surrounding old town.And here is a tip, get there before the tower opens and time it so that you start your tour on the hour. Everyone else will be busy watching the clock whilst you make your way up without the crowds. I went at 11:00am on the Monday (the tower opens later on Mondays) and had a clear run to the top. And don't forget your camera!

Blink and wait another hour!. Perhaps we were expecting too much but the clock certainly pulls in the crowds. The best place to view is to be seated in the adjacent Cafe Mozart directly opposite either in the open cafe or to venture into the Mozart Hotel restaurant bar for coffee and cakes. These are a little more expensive but well worth it.

Astronomical Time Square. Definitely an interesting spot to explore in Prague. Great for kids with the various musicians and human statues. Many food options including the famous Prague ham (pricey), and cafes lining the square. Carriages await but only worth it if nice weather! Tree lined street full of expensive name brand designer shops. Amazing crystal store across from clock. Walkable to Charles River Bridge and various museums.

Great place for a view.. The clock is charming and visually quite splendid. It garners enormous crowds on the hour to hear and watch it's performance. We utilised it as a means to get an exceptional view of the old town. There is a ticket office at the base of the clock and for the equivalent of about $6aud you can take an elevator to the top of the tower and walk around the rampart to take beautiful pictures. Really good view in all directions. It can have a very long wait but if you go after 4-5pm it is almost a walk straight up. It is open to 10 at night but in October it was gears by 7. You enter through the tourist info centre next door and walk up 3 flights or take elevator, show your ticket and then take the elevator for the last flights. You can actually walk back down the top flights (ramp not steps) which offers several photos and information along the way. There is also a gift shop at the midpoint. Worth the money. During the day the wait would be a negative. Can't imagine how tedious this might be in high season.

Take a brief moment to stop here! Amazing photos!. This is one of the most iconic locations in the country - if not all of Europe! The clock is exquisite and a true masterpiece. Enjoy the juxtaposition of art and science in the center of Prague!
Historical old town. Beautiful area full of history. Old Town historical site great for history buffs and amazing monuments which survive the last world war. Also area with some horrific events

Learn the history . It's quite cool and after doing a free walking tour we found out a bit more about the story behind the clock which means we appreciate it a bit more.
Though saying that, I understand why people find it underwhelming

Plan 5 minutes of your day here. When in Prague, take five minutes out of your visit to see this interesting clock. Plan your visit to arrive four minutes before the top of the hour and stay through the chimes and trumpet announcement.
Eyecatcher.... ...so a must see. An artsy piece of work. Do you need to wait for the bells to chime? No! Is it worth a 10 minute 'close up'look? Definitely!
Amazing architecture and engineering. Be sure to be here at the top of the hour and watch the 12 apostles go around.....there are many places for food and drink so no need to stand and wait.
Very cool. Great place to go and stop by! You can feel the atmosphere of this and have a break with the multiple bars and restaurants.
A Cuckoo Clock with Saints. Rather disappointed by this clock although I am sure it it is mechanically superb. I thought more was going to happen on the hour.

Amazing town Centre. The first thing one notices when entering the town square is how decorated and 'pretty' all the buildings are. The Old Town Hall is no exception. The Astronomical Clock is fascinating. you can stand and look at it for ages trying to work it out.

The clock disappointing, the view amazing . We sat there at a cafe waiting for the round hour. It came, very crowded but a bit disappointing.... The nice thing about it and is a must is going up into the tower, amazing walk up and amazing view!

Must see. Although it is a bit crowded when the clock strikes each hour it is worth seeing. The square is lively and has beautiful buildings. Walk along small side streets to quickly escape the crowds and see picturesque parts of the city.

A Must See in Prague. The clock is well worth seeing when in Prague. The square is very busy, and readily filled with tourists (also we were told to watch for pick pockets, although we did not encounter any). There is a nearby market, a number of restaurants and interesting side streets.

Terrible service at Reception and Good service by Guide. I visited with Prague Card of Toursit information of Prague.Terrible Reception Ladies 1) 7th Oct 2016, 17:00  Opening is 9:00-18:00 ( accroding to Prague card guide ) We went to City Hall at 17:00 on Thursday 07/Oct/2016.But it was closed. 2-3 receptions including one old lady told us " it is closed ! "It is not normal to close it at 17:00 !We asked them the opening time of next day ( friday) to be sure,then this old Lady confirmed the opening time 9:00 am2) 8th Oct 2916, 9:00 , 11:00am.We went to back there at 9:00am next day, because the old lady at the reception comfirmed us the oprning time 9:00amBut we could NOT visit this site at 9:00 am.The other old lady at the reception informed us " this is only visit tour. there is only 1tour by hour."And english tour is only at 11:00 .What a terrible people at this Reception!!!I met only really nice and kind person at Prague ! but this reception gave us really bad experience.Good thing3) The girl guided at english tour at 11:00 is really nice and did a good tour !

A visit to see the Astronomical Clock in Old Town Prague. Old Town is a fabulous place to visit, from stores to street shows and food fests. If there are no site shows at the time of your visit, trust me the Astronomical Clock is an experience in itself. The statues rotating the clock, and finally the skeleton as one of the statues is unique. So, have your cameras ready! My advice, do research before you go, read about all the places you want to visit, so you won't leave out anything you feel will be meaningful for you and your family, because there's just too much to see!
Prague trip October 2016.. Fantastic piece of architecture - brilliant clock and mechanism!!! It is well worth a visit if you have the time and best viewed from the street.

Be there on the hour. Although you'll pass this clock tower numerous times while in Prague, stop for a while around a full hour. You'll easily recognize when's the time when you see crowds gathering and hear them cheering.It's an 600 years old mechanical astronomic clock that perfectly works today.For a small fee of around 3 euros you can climb the clock tower for great views over the city.
Nice view from the clock tower. It is quite a nice view from the clock tower, but very crowded and quite a long queue and small fee to get in, but the view is worth it.

History Alive. Great attraction to visit. Area is alive with restaurants and other attractions and safe to be in at any time of day and night. History of the clock tower is very interesting to people of all ages. A must see in Prague.

It's A Nice Clock. I had heard that this was overrated but once I was in Prague I had to see it for myself. If you go there being realistic and realising that your going to see a clock it's actually really nice. The clock is over 600 years old and still tells the right time which is amazing. There are a lot of tourists in the area so be prepared to push your way through. But whatever you do don't miss this, just be realistic about what your seeing and if you are it's really quite beautiful.

Tour. Main square in old town with astronomical clock from 14 century. With some kind of preformance every 60 min. Visit only to take some pictures and procced to next location. Food and drinks in restorans on this square are very expensive and food not in match with prices.

Ugly . Not what i expecte . I was expecting something wonderful breathtaking as much as i heard about it and as much as the amount of the clock figurines in the souvenir shops. But in fact it was dull ugly and reflects nothing of the culture of the country. As if they needed something to conpete with Jesus of prague so they looked around and the only unchristian thing they could adopt was that clock

Must-See when in Prague!. The Old Town Hall plus the Astronomical Clock is definitely the place to see when visiting Prague. The next question is how do you manage the time. The Astronomical Clock ring every hour. Therefore touring the Old Town Square and its surrounding before the witness to the hourly show or the reverse. If you are in the early minutes of the hour, spend your time with the other sites and get back to the clock around 10 minutes to the hour. Most people is underwhelmed with the show however a sighting is a must.

Great view but don't wait for clock show. The clock is fascinating to look at, on the hour the bells ring and the mechanical figures can be seen. Huge crowds gather every hour to watch it but it isn't really worth the wait. What is highly recommended is a visit to the viewing tower. There is a small charge and a bit of a queue but the views across Prague are spectacular. Tip if you have difficulties walking take the 2nd lift inside the tower to get to the top rather than take the long winding slope upwards.

You'll want to see this but highly overrated.. The clock is beautiful & you'll find it by the huge crowd in front of of it. On the hour, don't blink or you'll miss the brief show at the top. Also, get squarely in front of it or you won't see it at all. There is lots to see and do in this square so your time won't be wasted.

Wonderful antique clock. Thousands gather for each hour as the clock has a mini- show. The visual of the clock , calendar, and tower is one of the best in the world. The town hall has a major visitor center. You can go up a modern elevator to the top of the tower to see the city.

Simply amazing. Like most of the ancient sites in Prague, this is a wonderful site to visit. At certain times, the 12 apostles appear from within and the ingenuity of its designer and builder is incredible.

Tick Tock - come to Prague See (and climb) the Clock!. If you have appropriate expectations and pay close attention you will enjoy seeing the clock do its thing on the hour. Expectations: This is a 600 year old clock, NOT a cirque du soleil show. A clock that has hand made characters that move is cool. Pay attention: Watch the skeleton and guy next to him (right side of clock) in addition to the moving apostles above. Also, be sure to buy a ticket and go into the clock tower. There is a paved path you can climb up to the top. There is an elevator, but as long as walking on an incline is not a problem/health risk, take the walk. It's cool to see the inside of the tower and there are posters explaining the history and all the things to see within the tower/town hall. Once at the top, you have a 360 degree view of the city which is beautiful even in the rain. The view is like that seen at the top of the Eiffel Tower in Paris or Space Needle in Seattle. It's pretty cool. I must comment in agreement with another TA reviewer that the people taking selfies can be annoying and self-centric. It's a small walk about on the top - basically single file. If you stand there taking 100 selfies in all directions you block the flow of traffic and are just annoying. Take a couple pics and keep moving!They also sell tickets for tours to go under the tower to the Old Town Hall. It's not expensive (100 kc) and only 30 min. with a few tours in English, Spanish, German, Etc. this is a nice to have option but not a must see. Our "English" guide barely spoke English and was very soft spoken so we only understood about 20% of what she was saying, but still cool to see it. It's very medieval.

Wonderful despite the crowd. This was by far the most crowded part of the town as people flocked around the astronomical clock especially when the hour was about to change .Initially I wondered how can it be such a big deal and so we waited in the nearby cafe and then when the time came we rushed and flocked like others around the clock.What we saw was really really amazing :) :) must see and must watch !!

In truth this was disappointing. People rave about the astronomical clock. I dont know why. Most wristwatches are more sophisticated.People rave about the figures that pop out and bob up and down on the hour. I dont know why, its an oversized cuckoo clock. You know when its near the hour as hundreds of people stand in front of the clock, cameras and phones held up, waiting for the supposedly magical moment. I dont know why.I think that modern day people are so used to technology and things doing stuff that they get tired of seeing old churches, towns and castles that do not do stuff, and so go a little moggy when a wooden pops out of a town clock on the hour and bounces up and down.Dont worry about the clock and its cuckoo clock like features. Watch the people watching the clock, and be amazed how they appear to be amazed by .....very little.

Astronomical clock. Was different but was not too impressed by it. Besides, there were a lot of merchants shoving souvenirs in your face which is very annoying. There should be some kind of a regulation against this kind of activity so that tourists like me who travel from far away can enjoy what we went there for.

Must see. Must see attraction, very popular with the tourists. Aim to be there on the hour to see the clock chime. There are some good restaurants right by the clock, so you can guarantee yourself a good view.

A fun spot day or night. We were in awe of this place when we first arrived in Prague. So much going on and to see it was really awesome. There are very good street performers here and please tip them! This is their source of income. Very very busy place so be careful especially with small kids and many tourists seemed pushy when we were there. Restaurants are very expensive here as well I wouldn't recommend eating here as you are generally overcharged.

Amazing mechanical wonder. Every hour people gather to see a door open and little figures of the Apostles circle out of the clock. For me that wasn't much of a thrill, but seeing the mechanical clock and the astronomical dial, representing the position of the Sun and Moon in the sky, built in 1490 almost a century before Columbus sailed to America, that was a thrill. Besides it's beautiful.

Disappointing. Having, like so many other tourists, stood in the rain to watch the hour go by for the clock to ring it was sadly disappointing. Not dissimilar to the Glockespeil in Munich there is much anticipation for not much result.
go to the top. It's worth taking the time and effort to go to the top of the tower. It gives you a great view over the city - and a great sense of the history roaming in this amazing city.
City break. Gorgeous architecture and the square had a good atmosphere with all the other tourists waiting for the clock to strike the hour.
A masterpiece! . Beautiful historic clock. A must see when you are in old town. The only minus is too much people around taking pictures with a selfie stick. You can loose an eye if you are unlucky!

Worth a visit!. Have seen other clocks like this, but this one is so unique and so old, it's a must to visit. Loved the twelve apostles making their appearance as the clock struck Noon and the little skeleton striking the chime reminding us of our mortality. The poor old golden rooster can hardly be heard, but he is 600 years old, so we can cut him some slack. It was a cold day, so we had coffee at a place right in front of the clock. Had a great view, no crowds to negotiate (crazy busy in front of the clock), and heaters and blankets at the outdoor restaurant. This Prague tourist attraction is one worth seeing.

Very interesting . The astronomical clock tower and old Town Hall are located in the old city square which is a living area during the day and the night with many people. The clock is a sophisticated artwork providing lots of information (sun moon status, day of month, season and time of day) simultaneously. The figurine show on round time adds additional amusing nice sense.

A vibrant plaza with plenty of eating, drinking and people watching. Like any other major piazza in any major EU town (like Marienplatz, in Munich for example). Lovely architecture, the clock building is lovely. The square is full of restaurants (I think they are all supplied by the same kitchen as 3/4 of them had the same exact menu) and the people watching with a beer or a coffee is fun
It's just a clock, A BIG OLD CLOCK!. Where else can you see a 500 year old clock, THAT STILL WORKS. Most of todays clocks don't last one year. It's probably the number one thing to see in Prague.

First day in Prague . The clock was such a joy to see in person. I went there with my friend that speak just a little English. A tour guide was explaining the history of the clock and I joined in with his group. I went back again and watched the clock perform on the hour. To think that this 600 hour clock is still going strong is simply amazing. Make this a must if visiting Prague.

Must see . Beautiful piece of architecture. The clock is a must while in Prague. Take the tour to the top of the tower the 360 views are amazing and well worth it. Wait for the 12 apostles to come out and be camera ready! Be careful it will be very crowded.

Fascinating area. The Old Town area including the Astronomical Clock were quite wonderful to see. We weren't at the clock at the right time to see the changing of the hour events, but to learn about it from our guide was fun

A must see attraction. This is a big tourist attraction and always has a large crowd on the hour when the mechanisms of the click show multiple moving parts. The click itself is extremely old with the internal mechanisms hundreds of years old. If you go during the daylight hours when large crowds are there, just be careful of pick pockets while you're taking pictures. Nothing happened to us, but we were made aware of this by our guide. Definitely worth a visit and easy to find just off the main square.
Must see. To get the spirit and to enjoy the local life. You need to see the clock at exact hour for little puppet show at the clock tower.

fantastic clock. The clock is beautiful with its intricate astrological depictions and moving parts as it strikes hour. The square below gets very busy, in wet weather with all the umbrellas can be a bit hard to see. Worth a visit particularly at midday.

Very overrated. It disappointed me in 2004 and it disappointed me now, the best impression you get is when the whole "show" is over and then all of the people who are watching take a deep breath while thinking "that was it?". But still it is one of the most popular tourist attractions in whole of Prague.
Great. Once again, get a tour guide or you are not going to get the full history of this area. Very popular attraction, people everywhere.
Trip. I thought it would be much larger. The story was interesting, but no one explained how the clock worked.
Well worth a visit.. The Astronomical Clock is wonderful to see if you can get close enough, the square is very busy. The Town Hall is a remarkable old building and well worth seeing.
Worth the wait!. Fascinating...worth waiting to see the clock in action on the hour between 9am and 9pm. Was part of Keith's walking tour so knew what to look out.
serious crowds but stil worth it. This is really worth seeing but only once. It gets really crowded. The cafes ro9und about kno9w how to charge but hey don't be mean.

A must see . The clock is beautiful
But very busy with tourists snapping photos
Go early morning
Wait for the hour when the movement starts and you see the whole show !

overrated. If you have never seen astronomical clocks in Strasburg or Munich then you will likely enjoy this but it pales in comparison, The little figures are very hard to see and do not come out of clock like Strasburg/Munich, You must stand directly in front if you want to get any sort of decent picture,

Nice to see. The clock is very unique and lovely and an absolute must see. The buildings in the area are old and very well kept. There tend to be a lot of people gathering near the clock when it's about to toll so it may feel a bit crowded.
Must see of Prague. Attraction to visit in any weather One of the historically most influential places of Czech nations history.

Old town square- and the astronomical clock. Prague Orloj- The Astronomical clock in the old town square shows the medieval perception of the Universe: the Earth is the center. The blue part of the dial represents the sky above the horizon, the brown part the sky below it. There are Latin words ORTVS (east) and OCCASVS (west) written above the horizon, andAVRORA (dawn) and CPEPVSCVLVM (twilight) below. There is a Zodiac ring, which represents the stars in the sky and it moves according to it. The two clock hands bear the signs of the Sun and the Moon. [Wikipedia]Though, the clock does every thing but show the time... :pdo plan to spend a leisurely couple of hours in the square

Crowded on the hour. We went passed the clock on a number of occasions when traversing the Old Town Square. We usually timed it to miss the hour (not on purpose). However on 2 occasions we were there for the hour. We had a table at one of the restaurants right in front of the clock and witnessed the event - with lots of people crowding the area between the clock and the restaurant. We had a front row seat in the restaurant, although we had to stand to ensure that we could see over the crowd. On the other occasion it was early in the morning after a brisk walk across Charles Bridge and there were only a few people present. One must visit this piece of history when in Prague.
Very busy in front of the clock.. This is cute. nice different, but actually Average. There are so many people in front, so hard to take photos any photo. But take a shot, its part of the travel.

Amazing Clock 700 Years Old!. A very unique clock that still works after 700 years. It is very crowded most of the time so be prepared. There are several cafes and bars to sit and have a drink and a bite to eat so you won't have to stand for an hour to see the faces in the clock move.

Lots of people but it is easy to see why!. The place and the clock are both beautiful but you will have to fight your place into the crowds! Everybody wants to see the clock show which wasn't that great.
A special area of Prague. This is full of restaurants and atmosphere, beautiful architecture, and very much the essence of Prague

Fascinating. Just did the clock, not really the town hall. As it is a prime tourist attraction you really need to get your timing right. I don't think that there is a "best" time to go, but we aimed to be there for midday. It is very popular so you do need to get there early for a prime standing spot directly opposite the clock.If you can spare it, get a table at one of the restaurants opposite and enjoy a drink or something before the hour. Alternatively there is a narrow corridor between the two restaurants where you can stand which is a little less crowded than right out front.The action on the hour is quite fascinating especially when the skeleton on the right side rings the bell. Whoever designed the automatons did a good job, way back when.Definitely worth waiting for.

Worth the Visit. The clock itself is very unique and a historical monument. We did not walk up the steps to the top of the tower which is an option. Apparently it is a tradition for newly married couples to get their wedding pictures taken in front of the clock. There is a lot of activity going on with the town square with a lot of restaurants and cafes.
Amazing place, especially at night.. Amazing place, especially at night. i was speechless of the beauty of the old town. it was a bit crowded.
happening place. a must see place to see the locals .the happening place of Prague .The astronomical cloack is wonder clock
Fun vacation. Wow for a 700 year old clock it is amazing It wows today let alone when it was built we came by 3 times before we final hit the top of the hour a sight not to be missed
Very impressed. We just came up from Italy for a couple of days to see the sights. Wow! We're we impressed. The architecture of this old town blew us away.

Major attraction that is worth a visit . This is a major tourist attraction that should not be missed. The clock contraction had an interesting history. Try to see the clock on the hour to see its full movement. Also pay the fee to go up and learn the clocks history and take in some spectacular views of old town square and the city.

Magical place. I love this clock on Old Town Square. The clock looks very unique and every hour there is a huge crowed to see the two small windows open and the twelve disciples comes out one by one.
For a fee, you can visit the historical halls and go up to the top of the church and enjoy the view.

Climb the tower!. The price tag is higher than most European towers at €5 per adult but in my opinion, the view of the square, old town, castle up on the hill = totally worth it and better than any other tower we've climbed on our trip so far. We went up just before sunset and stayed til after it got dark, lovely to see all the city and castle lights come on. The astronomical clock is really cool, especially if you learn how to tell the time from it!

Lovely clock - but a little anti-climatic. Crowds gather every hour in front of this clock tower to see the "show". The little figures do not even come out of the tower, they just pass in front of the little window.The clock itself is gorgeous, as is the entire square, but I would not waste a lot of time waiting for the hour to strike. Take a look if you are near close to the time.

Beautiful buildings. Very beautiful buildings and the clock is quite the attraction with huge crowds gathering! Be aware of touts of all sorts from segway tours to heroin and ladies of the night! There really is something for everyone! Worth a look during the day especially!

Attractive building. One of the must-see's of Prague, this ancient and ornate timepiece is worth looking at. It has a few small moving objects when it strikes the hour, but it's not that animated. Best to avoid the hour as that is when coachloads of tourists stand there to film it's movement (hardly noticeable to be honest). Go at a different time, look, admire, photo it and move on.

Great architect. The clock is absolutely stunning. Lots of people gather before the clock 12pm to watch it run, which makes me think of the crazy crowd before the painting of Mona Lisa in Louvre Museum. Be careful of the street vendors. Check your change carefully when buying something.

Had a wonderful visit of "Old Town" Prague with Alena. Prague "Old Town" was a beautiful city. The buildings were amazing and the Astronomical Clock was great to see. I highly recommend going up the clock tower. I had a private tour on the first day of our trip with Alena (alenaguide.com) which I'm so thankful that I booked in advance a four hour tour with her. It made the entire visit much easier to navigate and she was the best tour guide I've met in all my travels. Beautiful city!

Great Attraction. This working clock is amazing. On the hour a skeleton pulls the bell and the 12 Apostles turn around in a circle. It tells the moon and sun cycles and zodiac, day and time. Avoid twelve noon. It's the busiest time of the day.

Make 'time' to see it!. If the clock isn't enough for you its in a stunning medieval square surrounded by restaurants, bars and street stalls. Ideal for people watching. Romantic at night but can get very busy.
Gorgeous City. You cannot come to Prague and not come to this Square. See the movements of the clock on the hour and enjoy some of the restaurants in this square too.
Impressive engineering + beautiful architecture. When strolling around the old town, plan it so that you come across the astronomical clock at the hour for the little show.
Not that impressive. If in the area at five before the hour, take a look if not walk on by and see more beautiful buildings in atmospheric Prague

Forget the clock. Forget the clock and watch it on YouTube. Lot of people waiting each hour to see twelve figures that you can barely see move inside the clock.
I would suggest you go to the top of the clock tower and watch the people and get a great view of the whole square. Seniors get a nice discount.

To view clock . Although this is not usually my cup of tea it was interesting to visit.
There are bars and restaurants surrounding the clock and it is very very busy.
Worth a visit to tick it off your tour and a short walk from the Charles Bridge

Clock view. Everyone gathers in front of the clock on the hour. Not so great. Take the lift up the the clock tower for an incredible view of the city. Opposite the clock is the U Prince Hotel. Go to the rooftop terrace for dinner or drinks and have an amazing view of Prague. They have heaters and blankets for you when it gets chilly

Impressive 400!year old technology. The astronomical clock is impressive, considering it was built 400 years ago. The Yokohama Seiko clock has more elaborate displays but it was built in the last century. Here two curtained windows open every hour and different wooden statues circle by, most impressive when you think when it was built. The crowd of people is massive at 12:00 pm, very understandably.

Lovely stroll. What an amazing piece of history! The clock is beautiful and such a wonder. Get there early as there is always a large crowd Definitely a true tourist stop. A fun little side stop while on the square
Packed with tourists.. Fascinating clock. Comes with famous stories of its origin. Do not wait for the show on the hour. Disappointing.
Amazing. Can't believe that such a great work of art still works after centuries. It is a must see. Be sure to be there on the hour to see the apostles circle around the windows

Great to see but not wondeful. Waited in nearby cafe as the crowds gathered for the strikes. Rather disappointing as it doesn't really do much but it does add to the bustling crowds and atmosphere around the square.

Again you have to tick it off the list. It looks pretty, not sure what it does and it says something I could not be bothered to find out. The old town square is not welcoming too many beautiful buildings ruined by drinking holes and tacky souvenir shops

Check it out. If you are exploring Prague then this place is a must visit. There is a cool atmosphere to take in with several things to see and watch. The clock of course being one of them. Its really cool looking and on the hour it comes alive with music and moving characters. It probably has more meaning but i don't know what it is. I Just happened to be walking by at the right time to see it. You should too!

Touristy Prague. There were a lot of tourists when we visited Prague. I loved the Old Town Hall and the Astronomical Clock. It is good to visit these places during the day but they are lovelier at night. These are some of the must see places in Prague. We even waited for the 12 apostles to come out of the Astronomical Clock. This happens every hour.

Beautiful Prague. Great Area! Beautiful, Picturisque. Modern and yet Old Charm. Romantic and Party town. Very safe. During the day, you can have agreat day in the area with so much rich history and quaint places all around. Great for family, couples and/or partygoers. There are great restaurant and lounges and cafes around there at night. Great place to be.

Overrated as Reviewed. The astronomical clock is pretty, no doubt. But the whole gathering of crowds every hour to watch the random "ceremony" of figures moving in the windows and bells ringing is a waste of time. If you are in the area or crossing this around the hourly strike of the clock, you can stop by I guess.

A must see but with a guide on a free walking tour. We went to this watch with a free walking tour and an amazingly knowledgeable guide, Mr. V. The history and importance of the clock becomes real once all the parts of the clock are explained as well as the symbolism of all the decorations. Be there on time, watch for pickpocketting and enjoy the short show that reminds us that life is short and we need to enjoy it to the fullest.

Disappointing to me !. Big write ups but disappointing to me. YES figures on the clock move but I have seen better !! CROWDS gather and photos can be difficult. I enjoyed the characters in the Square more !
great all round views. 165 plus steps to the top.......then I saw there was a lift/elevator!!!The walk was worth it. Breathtaking in more ways than one!

A place to stay. I enjoyed the lighting festival took place at the old town at the night, as well you can enjoy a lot of underground music and on the other side is the astronomical clock is really interesting.

It's pretty but wouldn't go on whatever o'clock . Hi,I passed the first day by at 15:20 or something like that and thought that was very pretty but as everybody else was curious about coming at rush hour.Came back next day, around 12:55 and the square was full of people. I though that the clock would be very espectacular but I didn't see anything worth going at peak hour.To be honest was a bit disappointed and glad I went previous day with square empty and time to appreciate the beautiful astrological clock.

Get Upclose. This is a pretty small clock and you have to be watching carefully to see it. The saints come out each hour. Just look for the crowd gathering just off the main part of the square. It is amazing when you think of when this was built and what all it represents. Was missing some parts when we were there.

Visited on walking tour - both amazing and underwhelming.. The clock in itself is probably amazing but it's performance is totally underwhelming in terms of something to watch. As our guide said, "the most underrated tourist attraction ever"!
Great spot. you could pay for the ticket the see the square view fromt the top of city hall tower. it's better to climb stairs and downstairs by the lelvator.

Astronomical Clock. A must see of course.
Crazy crowded especially at the top of the hour.
Not to be missed.
Careful with the pickpockets

Four horses of apocalypse . The clock tower is fascinating read up so you understand how it works before you go Be there on the hour to watch the tower bell sound Pay close attention to the doors as they open the apostles come out and learn the story of the four corners (I liked the skeleton representing time and your reminder about it ticking)
Amazing views from top.... the clock itself is magical and the view from the top is amazing...we went just after a short spell of rain and the rainbow was added bonus...

Awesome!!. Hall and clock are awesome. There is some kind of coo-coo show at every hour at the clock , make sure to see that. The place is bit crowdy. You can also go to the top but there is a ticket you need to but for that.

Classic piece of Czech history. Draws hundreds of tourists every hour to see the windows open and the old figures when the bell tolls, nice to sit at a restaurant in the square and watch it, not so much tussle with people.

Loved it!!!. This is a must see clock. Our guide explained it to us. Absolutely, mind boggling, and the saints coming out on each hour was so interesting.
Watch your surroundings closely in this area around the clock.

Not all that it seems. We were greatly disappointed by this famous clock, having read a book on the workings of the clock in the Jewish museum, it would seem that many parts are not working as they did many years ago. A great pity.

A 'must see' in Prague. A 'must see' in Prague and for that is very crowded....Despite this, it is a very beautiful, interesting masterpiece.The Old Town is perfect for a walk through Prague historical buildings. There are lots of restaurants, souvenir shops and museums.Take notice that this walk could last all day long so you might consider to have a pair of comfortable shoes.
Good, but be on time, the clock tower has a short display.. Good, but be on time, the clock tower has a short display. Bring a zoom lens to get fantastic close up photos of the dials on the clock.
Astronomical clock. The clock is big and impressive. There are a lot of tourists around but you maybe able to get a nice shot of it.

verry nice!. intresting, but do not expect more than a 30 sec show on the hour, heard too much "that's it?" there.the place gets verry busy on the hour, and it's a nice 30 sec show, the clock itself is verry beautifull, surely worth the visit

Terrific sights and sounds. As crowded as it may be this square is very much worth a visit. The astronomical clock is fascinating even if the hourly show is brief. Early morning before 8 beats the crowds. From there it's an easy walk to anywhere
Must See. Located in Old Town Square this is one of the main tourist attraction in Prague. This 15th Century astronomical clock is the unique one in the World.

You should see it, but don't make it the highlight of the day. This is the place to be in Prague Old Town on the hour. It draws lots of tourists and only takes a few minutes. The views from the tower are wonderful in every direction, but you will need to be patient, take your picture and keep moving. There are always some street performers nearby and kiosks selling beer, cider, sausage and ham creating a kind of permanent Octoberfest atmosphere

A Must See Attraction. The main square and the astrological clock are some of the main attarctions in Prague. Make sure you are there on the hour to see the clock "perform" . Square gets very crowded.

It's not over until it's over.......... The astronomical click is a must see. Probably worth a short video as the moving figures are hard to capture unless you have a super zoom lens. Also.....look up after the clock finishes.....you might get an extra surprise.
Nice clock . But do not wait until it struck. It is a tourist place, so dont expect to have little amount of visitors.

Over hyped? . Just you and 5000 of your closest friends!! Yes, crowded, but the building is beautiful and interesting detail. The clock striking on the hour is a little over hyped, but still fun to be there. Yeah, you got to see it. So just go and enjoy all the company.

Prague - a city with a picture at every turn - the famous clock. Another must see. Make sure you go about 5-10 minutes ahead of the hour chime so that you can get a good view of the clock mechanisms when it strikes the hour.
amazing view of prague. Don t miss a little climb on top of the astronomical tower in the old town of Prague, amazing view, you can take nice pictures of the surroundings, only few euros entrance

Wonderful experience . We wondered into the old town by accident later one night & wow !! What a beautiful place with loads of atmosphere !! There is so much to see and so here , we watched the magnificent clock strike the hour and spring into action !! What a treat.We returned the next day in the daylight and found the place buzzing with people I have never seen so many people in one place !!! The street entertainers were so entertaining & the whole experience was full of vibrant energy !Would highly recommend on a trip to Prague

This clock is incredible!. This clock is incredible! It tells not only the time, but so many other details as well! Be aware that about 10 minutes before the hour changes, a crowd will gather to watch the puppet apostles appear and put on a bit of a show. It's short, but fun to watch! And climbing the clock tower offers an amazing view of Prague!
Astronomical!. The astronomical clock is really beautiful. Iconic must-see feature of Prague, surrounded by Good resturants and bars and nearby the imposing town hall.

Unique Clock. A must see when visiting Prague. The clock is situated in the old part of Prague, complete with cobble stone streets, little lane ways and great architecture. The clock chimes on the hour with windows that open parading the 12 deciples past them and finishing with a crow from the golden rooster that sits above the window. We also walked up to the top of the clock tower providing us with a great view over the city... This is not as strenuous as you might think as most of the tower has walk ways rather than steps

Definitely Take the Elevator for Panoramic Views.. It is certainly a required experience to watch the movement of the clock on the hour. But be sure to pay for the elevator ride that takes you to the top of the tower (walking down is also fun). The views are fantastic and allow a panoramic view of a lovely, historic city. It is a picture taking bonanza.

An amazing and inventive piece of machinery. We were staying a short walk away and frequently strolled through Od Town Square. Hundreds of people waited to see the Astronomical Clock magically come to life on the hour. It's well worth seeing.

Beautiful area and clock. The clock does not start to have the "show" until 9 am and you need to realise it was built in 14th century so even though very short it is an amazing construction that runs perfectly and totally accurate time. Love the cock a doodle do.
Our favorite place to be. We stayed just a few blocks away so we spent a lot of time near this square eating and shopping and staring! Ancient and wonderful buildings everywhere!

View from the tower worthwhile. Only visited the clock tower because I am keen on clocks, crowded and had to queue a bit(to be expected) fancy glass lift built inside tower. We didn't use the lift but walked up the ramps built round the inside edge of the tower. To be honest the clock mechanism was a bit of a let down, but still worth visiting for the great views at the top.  Busy and crowded on the viewing platform when we visited. Tried to buy a descent book on the clock but failed miserably,, dragged my wife around many bookshops in Prague but to no avail.

So cool!. Each hour this clock magically and mysteriously comes alive. The apostles move across the windows, the figures below move and the skeleton pulls the chain that rings the bells. It concludes with the cock-a-doodle-doo of the rooster. Awesome!

Beautiful looking clock. You could appreciate tht they could build such a clock hundreds of years back but it's nothing much really, the long walk and the sun was just too much for the action if the clock you actually get to see at 1pm. I personally felt it's not worth it but tht square is brilliant with some good shops for bohemian crystals and restaurants. It's one of the places you must cover off while in Prague

Somewhat of a Letdown. Like so many squares in Europe there is a building with moving figures that "performs" every hour or so. In Prague it is the Astronomical clock. The performance is short and rather difficult to see (stand back a bit for the best view) and nothing quite as magical as the glockenspiel in Munich. So if you're there on the hour, it's worth seeing but don't be upset if you miss it.

Very disappointing . We were lucky dat we didn't have to wait for half hr like other people. It is nothing but a cucu clock which is der in every old houses. When it started and when it finished and what happened we didn't realise it. For dat reason we went back again to see if we had missed on something But it was same . If u are passing by and around the time wait and have a look. Else dnt bother wasting ur time

Great views from the top!. This is probably one of the busiest attractions I have ever been to, so try and arrive here as early as possible, and if that isn't possible, get here at around quarter past to half past the hour, before the crowds start milling around for the hourly striking of the clock. You can certainly get better photos and get much closer without all the crowds around, and once you have done that by all means stay to watch the actual striking, although it is bit of a disappointment as not much really happens. The clock itself is a fantastic looking object though, and amazing to think it was built over 500 years ago!After this, certainly consider taking the time to climb to the top of the Old Town Hall as the views are fantastic. There is a lift, but if you prefer to walk, there is a ramp and on the way up there are plenty of pictures on the walls to look at. The cost is 130czk (about £4.50), and tickets are bought from the small room under the tower, although the entrance is confusingly through the tourist centre about 50 yards or so further down. Allow at least an hour for this, as there are queues and only a certain amount of people are allowed at the top at any one time.No matter where else you go in Prague, this is a must-see.

Beautiful clock. Lovely buildings and the clock itself is beautiful, however the hourly display was a bit of a let down! Not worth making a trip on the hour to see it, avoid this time and go when it's quieter to be able to fully appreciate the clock.

Easier than we thought. This was one of the main attractions we wanted to visit but we were concerned about the hike up. Fortunately they had lifts all the way up the tower. It was very clean, well organised, and informative. The view of the city is lovely even if it was a little crowded at the top.

Slightly disappointed.. By all accounts a mechanical clock of this age is a wonder to behold but the hourly chimes no longer hold the fascination of a 21st century traveller. Great to see if you are in the area but don't lose sleep if you miss the hourly chimes.

Watch the clock on the hour, every hour.. A display is put on for the huge swarm of tourists that flock to see the clock in all its glory. The clock dials are supposedly representative of the position of both the moon and sun in the sky at that time. As the clock has working parts older than the USA, it makes for a very intriguing show. This is a MUST SEE!
Must see. The clock is of course one of those must sees but the hourly walk of the apostles might not be worth the wait. Very crowded.
Worth seeing.. The astronomical clock is beautiful. The old town hall together with the clock make a really nice composition.
Disappointing. The town square is touristic but nice.The astronomical clock, however, does not live up to its hype. At all.

Well worth Watching. This a marvellous timepiece and worth getting to just before each hour strikes for the mechanical performance. It can be very crowded. You will get the best view in the morning when the clock face/s are lit up by the sun.

Fun but short. Don't blink, you'll miss everything and we were there at 12 noon. Be sure and stand a little ways back - you'll be able to see the figures move better. Fun, but not the Glockenspeil in Munich!

Buzzy. Buzzy area , packed with tourists day and night. Sip wine and cappuccinos in one of the cafes in the square and you will surprised by two or three weddings in the old church nearby. Try eat local fare ie goulash and dumplings and will check weight after the holidays
Obviously. This is obviously one of the jewels in Prague's tourist crown. It's quite nice, the view is spectacular, but my goodness are there a lot of tourists.

A must do. The clock is fascinating - the hourly chime less so. Enjoyed learning of the history behind the clock - if you're fascinated by clocks, visit the tower of the church by the castle. You can't miss where the clock is - at the hour, thongs of tourists stand and point at it. Beware of pick-pockets - we saw several opportunists looking for marks.

"Is that it?". The Old Town Square is very beautiful and has so much atmosphere, particularly at night when it takes on a fairyland look. However the astronomical clock was a real tourist magnet and, having stood amongst the huge crowd to watch the display, I wasn't the only person who exclaimed with disappointment "is that it?".

Lovely atmosphere. The Old Town Hall was a stunning building with lots of activity going on around it. We patiently waited for the astronomical clock to strike on the hour. When it did we were both underwhelmed by the sight. Somehow we had expected a much more dramatic display. The group of trumpeters who performed in costume at the foot of the clock were the highlight of the visit.

Amazing Views and spectacular Clock. The views from the top of the tower were amazing, probably the best in Prague. The clock striking was very interesting, but there early as the crowds are incredible.

Great Architectural and design.. Enclave in the Old Square. This is a marvelous piece of engineering. Beautiful during the day and at night. Many restaurants and shop around. A must see during your tourist visit to Prague.
Good view of Old Town. Offers a great view of the Old Town. Great photo spot during blue hours, right before and after sunset.

Crowded. Lots of people will gather here to join one of the many tours - walking tour, a hop on hop off, a day tour to a nearby place like Kutna Hora. Their tour leader is recognised by the T- shirt that they wear or the umbrella/ flag that they used. While waiting, they would admire and snap photos of the attractions in old town. A particular famous attraction would be the Astronomical clock. At the dot of every hour throughout the day, people will gather by the hundreds in front of the clock to watch the wooden statues of the 12 apostles parade. Do view the statue of Jan Hus, look out for the Powder Tower next to the Old Town Hall. Have a nice time in the guided tour of the townhall

Interesting. Lovely buildings all around - just beware of the pickpockets who take the chance to rob the tourists when they are all looking up at the clock and taking pictures when it strikes the hour. Interesting clock with great history attached. Must see.

Fabulous must see. The square is surrounded by awesome architecture and there is always a free show or something to admire. On the hour the clock strikes and puppets make an appearance, this is when you will see massive crowds gathering by the clock. Horse and carriages, Segeway and vintage cars are the means of transport in this area and its nice to see so many different nationalities having a fab time.Please do try a a traditional ice cream in the ring doughnut style cone, "Tridle" sorry that not how it was spelt or probably pronounced, can't for the life of me remember; anyway they are delicious, you can have them with whipped cream or chocolate spread equally delicious!

Great but try and avoid the crowds. If you are staying near the main square you will get a much better view of the clock if you're there not on the hour. It is lovely and on each and every hour the movement works so try to see this outside peak time as the crowds can be pretty claustrophobic.

Amazing medieval clock. This is just a review of the outside of the hall and clock - i haven't been inside. The clock is an impressive piece of medieval monumental timekeeping, demonstrating the town authorities' expertise and control. It's amazing that it's still there and working - essential viewing for anyone interested in medieval history. That said, there are always crowds, and lots of people are disappointed by the parade of apostles that happens on the hour. They're missing the point: you have to remember it's 600 years old!

Don't wait for the clock to chime. Oke, first things first. The astrological clock itself looks beautiful. However: do not wait for it to chime. [spoiler-alert] 2 shutters will open, some wooden puppets will look through the opening and.... That's just about it [/spoiler-alert]. We also visited the top of the tower. The view is simply amazing. The balkony of the tower is very narrow, so if you are afraight of heights the balkony isn't the best idea. However, you can stay inside and enjoy the view as well.

Nice square to get around . This side of the town is very nice and fun to look around. There are a lot of nice places to get a drink, eat and even to buy.
I strongly recommend to be here at night also. It looks different.
Wonderful View. Very crowded at the time we were there. Hard to take decent pictures. We saw the figures of the clock from the inside --not very interesting.
Beautiful . The astronomical clock is a work of art which I found amazing. Every hour on the hour the clock bell rings and the figures move people gather below it to watch.
Must see attraction. Quite a specimen of skills from a clockmaker. A show takes place at every hour and ends to the brass music from the top of the tower.

Get ready to say "Ohhh is that all". Everyone stands around waiting for the clock to strike the hour, all with anticipation for something grand. Then it happens. Everyone has their cameras out recording and waiting for the magic, but what is the clock actually doing? The figures on the side nod and up the top some people turn around in windows.... Oh. Not so great. It would have been amazing 600 years ago when it was built, but I guess I expected more things to move or pop out. Don't be sad if you miss seeing it in action.
Disappointing. The workings of the clock itself were quite disappointing especially when compared with the amazing clock in Messina, Sicily. However the views from the top are well worth seeing.
Caution pickpockets. To Prague without seeing the big clock, it's like a shower without soap. It is therefore imperative to get to watch the clock. Every hour on the hour ride out the dolls.

Old Town worth a walk round, missed the point of the clock. Stood around and waited for the clock ''to do its thing'' and not sure what it was all about.But as with all of Prague it was worth the walk, a lovely city to wander around.

Nice to see. It is good to see it but do not have huge expectation. You need to get there at the top of the hour and the show of the figurines is short and they are quite small. Still, it is a very nice picture of the history. We have also visited tower, there is a great view of the Prague

Tick tock. This was one of the most popular and anticipated things in the old town square. Every hour, on the hour tourists would gather to see, hear and of course photograph themselves at the chiming of the clock. The clock is really beautiful, but I wasn't as enamored with the ritual as much as others. I found the plethora of cell phones annoying.

astronomical clock. Highly unusual clock in the tower. You can climb or go to the top on an elevator. Up there you have wonderful views. If you choose not to go, you can wait at a outdoor cafe for those who do.

Bit of a let down.. The clock itself is interesting and attractive and deserves a very good rating. However when the figures appeared on the hour I was unimpressed. This seems to be the main reason why the vast crowds gather and it does seem to please very many spectators. Go to Cologne if you want to see a clock with really enjoyable animation.
Nice view. Its beautiful place full of history ! Its great show at astronomical clock every hour (9-23 hrs.) 12 apostles appear. If you visit tower you can see beautiful skylines of Prague!

Nice Square with lots of stuff to see, eat, and shop, but astronomical clock disappointed me first time. I came to old town square on the evening of August 18/16. We got to see this attraction in the late afternoon.
