All I can say when the clock goes off I was only able to see the skeleton move a bit out of the multiple figures surrounding the clock and I say I was disappointed not too really see anything.I do say that if you are in prague you do need too see the astronomical clock, which has 2 types of clocks, worth seeing at least once.It is a beautiful clock.... And I do like the figures around the clock, I will recommend seeing this attraction once as I said before. Nice thing is, it is free, but if you come here in the May thru September months there are a lot of tourists so the square is really really packed.The old town square is a nice square with shopping,entertainment, food and restaurants and of course a tent merchant that sells a delicious dessert called Tredelnik.This is all I can say about this attraction, so run and go see it soon.

Watch your pockets, but a must see. It's something to see while you are there, but there's sooooo much people every hour! Watch your pockets... Perfect for pick pockets! (300 tourists looking up at the same time...) although it does look like a safe place. The gothic church across is truly breathaking :) and have a taste of the ice cream in these "cones" like waffles but rolled hmmm

Beautiful place, the clock is overrated. The area is filled with beautiful buildings and many restaurants. The clock itself, although historically important, and hundreds of tourists come see it ring every hour on the hour, is nothing out of the ordinary.

Touristy must do. It gets extremely crowded, so plan to get there early. We didn't have the best viewing spot, so we didn't get to see everything, but some doors open up and you see the apostles moving. Some of the statues move too. One of those things you just have to do while visiting Prague.
Nice but crowded. It was awe inspiring to see a clock that was built so long ago, but it was very crowded and difficult to watch the hourly performance.
Amazing. I was very impressed with the astronomical clock. Very good work. The view from the tower is nice. You call see the whole city and worth to pay the ticket.

lovely buildings and history. Soak up the atmosphere in this busy square oozing with culture and history. All the buildings were beautiful and well preserved. The clock is worth reading about as there is so much to learn about it. Beware the higher the average prices at the restaurants here as you would expect.

This should be separate. Lota of stares but we loved it and climbed it with a smile, the hall after the castle was boring but the clock and view where amazing,
They open early ao better go there early 9 am otherwise tons of people
Of course you have to visit .... A landmark -- and there is a Starbucks nearby! So you can have history and a taste of home. Even in late September, however, there are a lot of tourists ...

Great visit!. We were here in the day and night. Both are beautiful and crowded with tourists, We watched the astronomical clock striking at the hour. Nothing impressive by current standards but an incredible achievement during historic times! We were warned against pickpockets by a friend living here. Just a precaution to share. Lots of eateries and souvenir shops in the small roads around.
Pretty. A pretty church with an interesting clock in a row of attractive buildings. The movement is not amongst the best of its type but is very popular with crowds of tourists.

Beautiful. The town hall is so beautifull. It's a great place to go to to temple watch and have a snack and a coffee and get off your feet. The clock itself is so pretty and the history behind it is amazing but standing there to see it for a long time would be disappointing.

All over in a flash!. The astronomical clock is considered a major highlight of a trip to old Prague. It is an amazing piece of workmanship and the history associated with it interesting. Massive crowds gather on the hour to watch the clock chime and the twelve apostles flash by whilst small animals chime on the sideline. Yes it is worth a look see if only to say you have seen it...its over all too fast and the crowd moves on....you can go up the clock tower which has fantastic views but it is the hourly chime that is the greatest attraction.....recommend an early rise to beat the crowds.

Still ticking after all these years. Wow, with only 3 true moving parts( I was told?) this is a site to behold. The crowds start forming roughly 15 minutes before the hour, like people cramming into Time Square in NYC to watch the ball drop on New Year’s Eve, then shortly afterwards scatter.Even more amazing is how often you’ll want to return just to see the clock strike the hour, and watch the little windows open and see the apostles pass by, or the skeleton clang its little bell.This one of a kind is truly worth marveling at. In brief when the clock was finished, the clock makers were blinded so as never to build a clock of its beauty again. Last laugh was on them, as an apprentice of theirs sabotaged the clock, for which it would not operate for almost 100 years til being “fixed”.I found taking pictures at night were far better than in the day, as the clock is lit so well from the lights on surrounding building, also less crowds.
Amazing. It is unbelievable that a clock this old still works. Be prepared for a crown when the clock is about to strike. Very beautiful.
Prague Astronomical Clock Review. Very nice attraction. It's a must see. I recommend you to go to the top. It is also good to walk, because you will see some really interesting things on the way up.

amazing!. very beautiful and romantic place. very crowded as well, but it is supposed to be so looking at the huge amount of tourists. Lots of caffees and restaurants. it s good to be there at a whole hour to see the clock moving.

Do not miss out a visit to the old town hall.. Occurring about 4 times a day they are excellently guided,full of interest and reasonably priced.Most people look at the clock and run up the tower for the view; Do not miss the town hall visit. We were in Prague for a full week and this was one of the best visits we had. Takes about an hour and you must arrive in time for the guided tour.

so much history. a must see when you travel to Prague-gets crowded on the hour but don't let that stop you viewing such an amazing historical sight even better with a guide to tell you of its importance and its amazing history

Overrated?...depends on your taste!. After our city guide explained the intricacies of its creation and workings (dating from the 14th century!), it became much more a marvel than we had gathered from just watching the little figures appear and quickly disappear. My husband was fascinated; I was underwhelmed, preferring to watch the people watch the clock!

Beautiful clock in a beautiful square. This is a must see when you are in Prague. Make sure to be there when at the top of the hour to see the full splendor of the click. A brief top of the hour performanc.

Lovely square. Visited in September on a very hot day, you could spend a couple of hours here, just people watching. Food available and local street buskers who are very good. Bus tour rides also avaliable

Don't expect too much from the clock at noon. We picked a place in front of the clock one half hour before it was to ring for noon in case the crowd was too thick to push through. At noon and midnight two little doors open on either side of the clock, and statues of the 12 apostles turn around, one after the other in each door. While this must have been really something to those in the middle ages, I confess to being somewhat underwhelmed by the event, and that is not to take anything away from the genius of the artisan who originally built it.Definitely see the clock but my suggestion is that you don't put too much emphasis on seeing the clock exactly at noon or midnight.
Lovely evening . We have been quite few of us strolling around the old town and this place is absolutely fabulous. If you are aroud Prague you cannot miss thia one.
Gotta see that clock. Old town square is the center of activity in Prague. The clock is an amazing landmark. Lovely old buildings-restaurants.
Incrediable. very interesting to watch, when the old clock mechanism comes into effect again. A lot of tourists going to see on it

Sightseeing in Prague. This is such a special experience...I think we returned several times during our visit to Prague to watch the clock and the characters "perform"! It's one of the most famous sights in Prague, summer or winter!

Amazing Astronomical Clock!. Amazing how people at that era could build something so complex! You have to view the amazing clockwork, intricate designs and long history. Tip: Pay to get up the Old Town Hall and from the top (don't worry there is an elevator so you don't need to climb) you can have a birds eye view of the old town square, Old Prague Castle, Church of the Lady Tyn and also many other Prague monuments.

Somewhere you should see. Somewhere that you should visit as it is impressive but the astronomical clock was a bit of a let-down I must admit. Would probably have been better if I had done a bit of research into the clock before going to see it

A Must See in Prague!. Go early in the morning, before the 9am bell, for the fewest crowds. The show at each hour is quite interesting, read about it ahead of time so you know what to look for and can appreciate each little detail. Quite an impressive piece and amazing how well it functions given the age!

you owe it to yourself to do this. not terribly dramatic but unique enough to make it part of your Prague experience. Binoculars useful. You will wait in a large crowd but it only takes a few minutes for the play.

Clock. This clock is beautiful really old and very popular with people visiting,on the half hour and hour the clock has moving parts that you can see from the outside so lots of crowds around these times

Stunning despite the crowds.. Beautiful display of mechanical clock engineering coupled with stunning architecture and cornet playing from high up in the tower. Watch the crowds for pick pockets, got there at 12 Midday a bit too busy for my liking.

Prague from top . The astronomical clock so beautiful and old in a historical way .. From its tower the view was so amazing astonishing.. We have plenty of photos from all 4 sides.. Before the sunset was a good time
good. good place in the old rown square. very crowded. colouful clocks in a old but beautiful building....

Iconic site for all Czechs. When in Prague, you shouldn't skip this site - it's true, there is a lot of people to see the Orloj (Astronomical Clock) but the spectacle is worth it.Just don't fall in those many tourist trap restaurants - they are overpriced and mostly not very good.
wonderful. as everything in prague, this is wonderful and I'd recommend everyone to stop by the astronomical clock, because something like this can only be found in prague
wonderful. as everything in prague, this is wonderful and I'd recommend everyone to stop by the astronomical clock, because something like this can only be found in prague
Cool area. We enjoyed walking through the area. It was a very popular place for tourists. We did a lot of shopping.

Huge crowd, and for what...?. We'd heard a lot of hype about this clock and were interested to see it chime the hour. Of course, when the top of the hour came around the place was rammed and the idea of getting a beer within sight of the attraction a total failure. Instead a skeleton rings a bell and some doors open showing some rotating biblical figures. Sure it's impressive for its time but for us it was an anticlimax!
The clock is the sight. It is a must see in the old town. The history of it is nice and fun. Is it all true? It is so pretty and watch the 12:00 show. Let the time begin.
Beautiful. Beautiful detailed work of craftsmen. Every hour when the clock strikes you can see the figures of the apostles

What a clock.... The architecture is delightful. I've always been fascinated with clocks and the Astronomical Clock tells me to enjoy each moment of life. When the skeleton shakes the bell and the apostles walk across the doors....it touched my heart.

best views up the tower. enjoy the architecture, listen and watch the clocks hourly features that draw a crowd, if you have time definitely go up the clocktower for a fee, the views are incredible,from all directions, red roofs,spirals, cobblestone lanes,its magical.There is a lift inside if you don't want to walk the hundreds of steps ,best photo opportunities await
Amazing buildings. Definitely worth a visit but watch out for the crowds. The buildings are beautiful and the clock fascinating.
clock show is a joke. hundreds gather on the hour to watch the clock show. Its 30 seconds of disappointment. Though it is fun to see the disappointment on peoples faces, like what was that?

Somewhat Disappointing. We were expecting something special when the clock struck the hour, but were totally underwhelmed when it happened : "Now you see it, now you don't!" Great crowds, lovely architecture and Hari Krishna procession in full sunshine made it a festival occasion.
People Watching in Prague. This is a great location, not only for the architecture and the clock, but to people watch if you are lucky enough to find somewhere to sit and watch everyone.

Not all that and a bag of chips . Look for being designed and built 600 yrs ago and amazing achievement. However to hang about for the hourly chimimg is not the end of he world.
If you miss and sit next to someone on the plane home they won't be saying it was the highlight of their trip. Unless they are clock nerds.

Another wonderful landmark. Ad part of the old town square.., the clock tower is a beauty and another must see. You find the Square you can't miss the clock tower. Every hour you can see the clock at work. You can buy tickets to get up to the lookout area too. A nice vantage point to see the Tyn Church

About death, time and life. The astronomical clock is a sign of multiculturalism but does not function totally today. The only parts that are functioning as far as I see are the sculptures which represent the death. Two sculptures represent beauty and money. The three sculptures below represent arts and sciences. The story is that the clock maker aimed at showing that the time is short, life is short; don't spend it on beauty or being stingy, deal with arts and sciences. That is how the story goes.

Do some research to fully appreciate this clock! . Do a bit of research on the clock before you go. This clock is extremely impressive, so much so, that Charles university offers an entire paper on understanding it's workings. Make sure you are there on the hour to watch it come alive, and imagine that working back in 1410! It's free to the public of course, earlier the better to avoid the crowds.

View from astronomical clock. We took the lift to the top to see the view. It was great, panoramic view of Prague. You can see Petrin hill, the castle and other monuments. Just breathtaking. We went in the evening so it wasn't too crowded. Cost is reasonable.

Climb the tower. Every hour, the four statues flanking the clock moves and the 12 apostles shows up from windows. There are lots of people taking pictures and be careful with your belongings. You can also climb the tower and see old town from above. If you don't like stairs, you can take the elevator all the elevator all the way to the top.
Not amazed. We where expecting a lot more from the astronomical clock. Fun to see the whole crowd applaud after the "show" was over.
Beautiful architecture. This is a magnificent building, but can get very busy with tour guides. I didn't manage to go up the tower, but we visited the castle which had spectacular views

A trip to see the astronomical clock. We took a free walking tour and we were shown the clock and advised to come back on the hour to see it's 'show'. So on our last evening we went to see it strike 7pm. They say it is disappointing - but I quite enjoyed it! The figures either side move and the 12 disciples revolve round it.

Best view of Prague and definitely a must see. The astronomical clock is interesting to see, although the area in front of it is almost always crowded with tourists. Going up the tower doesn't cost very much and is certainly worth it - the view is incredible! Annoyingly the viewing area is quite small and so very cramped and crowded, but I wouldn't let this put you off.I would suggest going up when the weather is good, it would certainly make the views better. There was also some information about buying tickets online to avoid the (small) queue - this may be something to look into if you're planning a visit.

really old town hall. The unique old town square with remarkable buildings around and sculptures in the center. Old town hall like all old buildings are well preserved and maintained. Therefore you can emagine that you have few centuries back. Unbelievable! One of the best place in Prague.

A bit of an anticlimax, but interesting all the same. In the Old Town Square, the clock is a gathering place with hundreds standing around to watch the clock strike the hour...Not much to see but people gather underneath to have their pics taken just the same

Make sure you read signs on the way up!!. The tower is so much more meaningful if you read the history behind it on the way up!I have been up twice on two different visits to Prague. The first time we marched up to get the good views (which are spectacular and well worth the money) and missed the info signs. The second time I went back to show how amazing the views were to my partner and we read the signs and I couldn't believe I hadn't the first time around! Such an incredible history that is worth knowing before you get to the top!Ps if you buy the ticket online you can get it a little cheaper but most importantly skip the long wait!

Must see attraction. Lovely unique clock that really needs to be visited 'on the hour' to see it at its best. Worth visiting anyway as it is quite unique. Gets very busy as the clock strikes but should not be missed.
Very cool . Very cool clock. It is worth the trip up the stairs to the top. It was nice to see the inside of the building and view the square from above.

It is crowded with tourists, but worth seeing. The astronomical clock is still a marvel even after 600 years of operation. The guts are run by modern equipment now, but the creativity of the designers is truly increadible.

Best view in Prague. We recently spent time in Prague and of course visited the Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. We arrived about 9:30 in the morning and were able to go to the top of the bell tower with no wait. The view was unbelievable - absolutely stunning.

Not to be missed. Even though the crowd builds for the top of every hour, this is an amazing site. It's fun to watch all of the various moving parts and the complexity of such an old clock is very impressive.

So much to see and do !. Old town square is a very good place to spend and afternoon and evening. Many fun restaurants and shops to visit. the old town hall and astronomical clock is cool. The history of the area is worth the trip.

Great view from the top. Great view of the old town from the top, just time your run to avoid the large tour groups.
Interesting information on the stairs, but it is easier to see this on the way down...lift available for the way up.

Touristy . I stayed at an apartment right behind the old town square. I walked by this clock every day during my stay. Beautiful design. The rotating marionettes would peek out the window of the clock on the hour. Hence, the square would be filled with tourists before and after. The whole show was less than 5 minutes but it attracted hundreds to watch. If you have not done it, go at least once. Be extremely careful of pickpockets as it has always been chaotic before show time.

Another point in Prague not to be missed.... The astronomical clock is impressive, particularly when you realized that it was made before America was discovered...This area needs a couple of hours to be explored: incredible Czech crystals, excellent ice cream at reasonable prices, do not forget to drink a Pilsner beer while seating, people watching...My recommendations: Be aware of pick pocketing in crowded areas... Read about the Astronomical clock, therefore you can appreciate what you will see...Take many pictures, every corner deserves one picture to be shared with you friends and family... If you want water, do not forget to ask for "still" water.
Touristy!. Touristy but it's free and won't take so much of your time. Might as well do it. You can observe and experience the grandeur of the Old Town Square while waiting for the clock to strike.

So you're now in the Square. Don't miss the clock!!. Well actually you can't miss it. The crowds waiting for it to chime on the hour promises a treat to be snapped and treasured. Excitement lasts for about 1/2 a minute then the crowd disperses only to accumulate for the next hour display. Well worth the waiting. Climb up the tower. A view not to be missed.

Get there early. a wonderful old clock, in a great location, with a lot of history. make sure you arrive early as the crowds quickly build up about 15 minutes before each hour to see the mechanical figures perform, as they have been doing for hundreds of years. please do not take a seat at the surrounding restaurants just to wait for the clock, this is rude as the restaurants have to make a living too.

brittany best tour guide in praha!. Brittany must have been a search engine in a previous life because she is everything you are looking for in a bar guide in praha! Being irish and having indulged in one or two. . .10 of my native jamesons, i had the night of my life in praha! cant remember where we went, or what we did. . .or making it home. . .but i had a great night with brittany touring our guide i remember that much, and i usually dont remember what i had for breakfast.!! lots of fun and nobody is left behind. she was the pot of gold at the end of the rainbow, the marshmallows in my lucky charms. . butter on my potato?? haha! was great fun get down to the clock tower bar crawl.!! ;)
Flying . At the top of the astronomical clock you will find a amazing landscape . You can fell you are flying

UNDERWHELMING!?. The astronomical clock, regardless of its reputation, isn't worth standing around to see a really underwhelming display of - nothing much! Going up to the top of the tower, however, is worth the effort (seniors and physically challenged-there is a lift) fir a remarkable view of Prague.
Fascinating. The tower was built before America was discovered!! How amazing is that! Wait for the hourly chimes and bells....well worth the 30 seconds.
Worth Look. Defo worth a look but don't get too excited ! You can't really avoid walking past this on your way to the square and Old Town.

A must do in Prague. I have visited the Old Town Hall Tower many times. Each time the experience is unique. The view from this place is astonishing and not comparable.I would advise to visit during the Easter and Christmas holidays to enjoy the best view Prague could offer. However, at any other time when it's sunny, it is also worth a visit. Might be quiet busy on the weekends, so mind the queues outside the ticket office and inside the tower.
Must see. Beautiful clock on the town hall in the fabulous Old Town......definitely on our 'must see' list but slightly underwhelming after a long wait with hundreds of others in the scorching sun!
Tick Tock. What a mesmerizing building. Get there on the hour to watch the dancing click show and you might hear the trumpet player in to top tower as well!

Very nice. Had nice time on my visit the sites sounds and the foods are very good. The clock was really neat. It only last for a few seconds but was well worth the wait to see the operation of it. The architect of the entire city was amazing. Just be careful the food is very cheap and and GOOD....you can eat yourself to another waist size

Interesting..... Can't quite understand why people would queue up for an hour for a 2-3 minute show, but we were passing by at the right time. Hold onto your bags etc as its a notorious pickpocket area due to the crowd that gathers.
A Place in Time. The old town square with its unusual clock is a placed not to be missed. The Astronomical Clock is a Time Piece to be marvelled at.

Great view of the City. We spent three days in Prague and saw the astronomical clock go through its hourly "dance" three times. It lasts for less than a minute and is done on the hour. The view from the tower is worth the price and hike up to it, but do it early in the day when the crowds are still thin. If you are over 60, you get a significant break in the price.
Amazing. The Old Town Hall and the Astronomical Clock are amazing. You have to be in time to see the clock. The whole place is really bustling with people and many eateries.

Overhyped . Enjoyed a visit, but definitely overhyped. We took the English tour, which was okay, but no more than that. I certainly learnt more reading the boards as I walked up the tower. Glad to of gone, but I wouldn't make it a priority.
Lovely. Mesmerizing. A must visit place. If you haven't visited this place u haven't seen prague. Lovely colorful and full of ppl all time around. Don't know how it looks in winters

A Must See in Prague. This is something you have to see -- the show begins with a skeleton ringing a bell and ends with a golden cock crowing. In between, representations of the 12 signs of the Zodiac, and of saints (the apostles) and sinners (symbols of the deadly vices) make their appearance. On the day we visited, the bathrooms in the town hall visitors center were closed, but we were able to use the one in the nearby Starbucks.

Very Cool. Have to go by to see the Astronomical Clock when in Prague. It is a very interesting attraction in a very vibrant part of the city. From there you can go to old town, the jewish quarter, the charles bridge. Its across from cafes so take in the view.

Pretty, unique & a must see.. This attraction only lasts a couple of minutes but is unique. While pretty it also displays some beautiful artwork & the chimes are so charming. Stand back quite a way from the clock for the better view.

Disappointing . It's OK, but not as good as the hype. I expected more, which is a problem as I'm sure if my expectations had been lower, I'd have enjoyed it more. A click with some animated puppets strike the hours. Very old and lots of astronomical markings decorate the clock face. There are always big crowds but everyone gets a good view as it is very high.
A fine landmark building. As good a place as any in the city to say, 'Meet me at...' Easy to see and get to. The clock is very interesting but I couldn't work out how to tell the time from it!
Morning Walk. Very busy area good for pics and plenty of restaurants around the area. Plays music with characters that move at certain times .

Amazingly Unique. Really. Where can you go to see such a sight for free. Not to mention that the Czechs have kept this automated attraction running for hundreds of years. Although throngs of people gather every hour for the show, it is worth it. It doesn't last long so make sure you are there before the hour. Kudos, Czechs!
See the clock. Worth a look. Just the history behind the timepiece and the maker makes this a must see in Prague. Included in almost all tours of the city, so sign up to one and get the story.
Word's most amazing astronomical clock. Do not miss the famous astronomical clock in Prague. It can be a bit overcrowded over there, but definitely worth it. They run every full hour.
Nice views and a great atmosphere. The old town and the area around it is great for a stroll around town with many interesting views and places to stop for a beer.
Watch it!. In this nice square this beautiful watch is worth the tour. Fantastic creation. Very crowded and a lot of tourists though.

Nice landmark and popular sight. The astronomical clock is a popular tourist sight in centre of pragues old town. It helps contribute to the ye olde appeal of Prague and is worth checking out. The surrounding square in the evenings is a bit of a gauntlet with people trying to hustle you onto nearby tours or clubs but really it's a must to go look at if you are visiting Prague.
Astronomical Clock. Great attraction to see, beautifully crafted clock. There is a little show every hour the clock chimes.

Nice and old. Square is usually crowded but it is a very nice place to be. During the day, visit nearby old and historical buildings, astronomical clock is just amazing and it still works. We found it very interesting as it was built years ago and is the only working clock now. Nearby restaurants are not so expensive so grab some food and relax in the evening. During summers you can expect lot of people at this square but everything and every place in this city is so beautiful . We loved this city and food was awesome, not expensive at all.

Main tourist attractions of the Old Town.. A visit to these attractions is a must when in Prague. You have been in Prague, if you have not taken at least one walk to see these places. However, when we were there, some renovation is going on infront of the Town Hall, so we could not fully appreciate the beauty of the place. Naturally, these places were teeming with tourists, but what can you expect? A newlywed couple were being photographed in front of the Astronomical Clock, when we were there, and they did not seem to mind people taking photos of the Clock with them in the foreground.

Irá a must. Take time and relax to enjoy the astronomical clock. Try to sit in a cafe overlooking it and you'll find tons of details in the figures that show at the hour. Sometimes we tend to see things in a rush, without really enjoying it and this one, needs time. The history behind it is beautiful and rough, when you find that the builder was later attacked by his own mate leaving him blind, to avoid him creating a better one for another town. Years after, the clock needed to be repaired and nobody could, so the local government had to hire the blind mans, who knew the clock so well, that even with his limitation, was able to get it repaired.

Sunday Market, Many affordable good Asian Restaurant (compare to western europe). Many souvenir shops, restaurants, sunday market, and interesting architecture places to see surrounding the area. Chill out in Asian Restaurant is quite nice, price & taste are much better compare to many asian restaurant in western europeMost of people gathering at the hour of Astronomical Clock to watch it chime is as fascinating as the actual chime itself. It just running out the figures, puppets waving hand, and done haha! But the design is extraordinary unique

Cool old building with amazing clock. A little bit of cash gets you up the elevator to the top of the tower (walk back down and see the displays). Quite a panoramic view of the city from the top. Watch the astronomical clock do it's show on the hour, but be very wary of pick pockets in the area. Money belts are recommended.

Crowded square for 15 minutes . The clock was amazing and we had surprise trumpeters on the day the added panache. The crowd were loud in their appreciation of the trumpets the atmosphere was great. A brilliant day and the clock is incredible a must see for all who go to Prague
Quirky combined clock, very busy though. This is one of the main tourist attractions in Prague just off old town square. It gets very busy on the hour as the clock activates at that time.
Iconic sight of Prague. I enjoyed seeing this. Just gather in the square a few minutes before the clock chimes. and enjoy the sight and sound. It is one of the Top 10 things to see in Prague.

Wow!. This is a must to see in Prague! It's a huge clock in the square and has life size figures that move as the clock chimes. It's pretty spectacular to see! We had a wonderful lunch at one of the restaurants in the square. This is really cool. Get a guide book so you'll know about the clock and all it's components.
The symbol of Prague. Don't have to miss the historical city centre with many churches and the Astronomical clock which is the symbol of Prague. The first thing to see in Prague.

The crowds when the clock is about is strike is crazy!. Old Town Hall is mostly shops and interesting places to see surrounding the area so just walk about, grab a trdelnik or a large ham and bread and beer and chill out.As for the astronomical clock, it is quite a beauty. Aside from the touristy ooh-aah about the clock chiming, it is definitely a must-see. Something about 100s of people gathering at the hour to watch it chime is as fascinating as the actual chime itself.

Beautiful clock!. What more can you say about a clock that has been working for more than 400 years? It's an incredible piece of artwork and engineering. It is worth, before you go see it on the hour, to at least get some background on what you are seeing. Each moving figure has a part and an explanation. The clock maker himself has an interesting story....he was blinded and had his tongue cut out so as not to be able to tell or show anyone how he made it....some thanks!The view from atop is beautiful, especially around sunset...be warned, the line is long!
very vibrant area. usually full of people especially on the hour when the bells ring and some hidden statues move around the astronomical clock

Hmm. The Old Town HAll is a great looking building. You can go up 250 steps to the top if you want (I wanted, my wife didn't...we didn't). The closk is an engineering marvel, and quite pretty. If you are there on the hour you will see it work. But watch quickly as the figures move around, but be prepared to be underwhelmed. But heck, it is on the square, all around great buildings and shops and cafes and little restuarants, so you can't miss it (and you have to go to the Old Town Square if you are in Prague.

Amazing . Any visit to the beautiful city of Prague would not be complete without visiting the Old Town Hall and Astronomical clock. On the hour the doors open above the clock face and the twelve apostles file past the open doors. Make sure you arrive at the base of the clock early as crowds gather to watch this spectacle . Climbing the clock tower or taking the lift will reward you with stunning views of the city.

Unusual Historical Clock and Tower!. While there are many towns with "astronomical" clocks, this one is unusual. In addition to the Astronomical details on one level, every hour there is a "walk of the Apostles" as the clock strikes the Hour.

Interesting to see when the clock chimes!. I absouletely love the fact that there is a 600 clock that still is working and has been capturing peoples hearts for many years. I found it hilarious when the skelton which resembles death, was using the bell and many other figures come out to make the crowds go wild. Seriously, the clock is just brilliant and if you ever gonna visit Prague, you have to see it to believe it !

Clock is interesting. The astrological clock is a work of exquisite craftsmanship. The mechanism must be incredibly complex. In order to tell the time there is a good video on You Tube which explains all. The so called show on the hour is not spectacular and was voted the second most disappointing tourist attraction in Europe! That said if one remembers when this clock was constructed the show is impressive. The clock is beautiful and well worth seeing.

Go and see the clock!. You must go and see the clock striking, but get there early! Huge crowds here every hour! Make sure you go up the tower,great views of the city. You can get a lift all the way if you don't want to do stairs!
Nice to see. A must see as a tick off on the to do list. Can get very crowded with large groups all waiting to take photos of chiming clock - watch out for pickpockets.
Very interesting, I would deal with the crowd again.. The whole area is so historic and beautiful. The large door to the left of the clock is a must see too.

Not worth the wait. My least favorite of all the tourist sites offered in Prague. I was very disappointed in the clock. Here is my tip to you...stand directly in front of the face of the clock. The doors which open and the figures inside are difficult to see from any other position. Be in front of the clock 2 minutes before the hour, sooner to fight the crowds. What "show" there is ends quickly. I did go inside the old town hall, mostly for the view. (Side note-bathroom has a fee) The view is very nice and if you time it with sunset you can enjoy Prague by day and night all within minutes. We went in the evening and had very little wait time at 7pm. If there is a long line, consider saving your entrance fee and going to St. Vitus for a better view.
Sad the clock hardly works!. We eventually were there to see the hourly "performance" - what a joke. Many of the doors didn't open and the bird don't sing. Pathetic, needs repair!

Amazing old clock. Amazed by the clock, it's still working till this day, indeed a masterpiece. The "reminder" represented by the four figurines is still as relevant as few hundred years ago. A must see attraction.

Be there on the hour!. This old apostle clock is amazing, in that it is still functioning! Each hour the little figures do their thing and the chimes strike. Beautifully made and well preserved, it should go on for ever!

Disappointing. As one reviewer said, "clock is ho hum" and I agree. I was disappointed that more didn't happen as the clock struck the hour. I had been told to be sure and not miss seeing it while in Prague, so I can say I saw it, but not the best place I visited while in the city. I will admit I did not go up in the Tower, but didn't have time. Old Town Square is lovely, but it was very crowded when we were there mid-morning. I can only imagine what it's like mid-day, mid-summer.
A Must See. Don't be put off by the hordes of tourist each hour. The clock is impressive and one of the " must see" in Old Town Prague.

Charming Historical Area. The clock itself is a highlight landmark in Prague and that entire square near the clock is phenomenal with it's gothic architecture. There are many good, reasonably prices restaurants to choose from as well. This is a must see area of beautiful historic Prague.
Not overwhelmed . It's fine piece of machinery and gas a lovely history. On the hour the clock strikes and some small figurines move about above the face. Your standing in a large crowd watching this

Prototype clock. The astronomical clock is in the old town and every one hour it rings and you can see the twelve students of Jesus come by as Death pulls a string. It is free so if you are there you should wait until the clock bells!

Walk in town. The clock is beautiful. We stopped to see the noon show of the apostles but the alarm that is done once a month ruined the effect. Lots of people and shops. The atmosphere was good. The segways are a pain. The beauty of the details of the clock were spectacular.

Clock is Ho Hum. But the area is beautiful and the Town Hall Tower is fun to go up and have a great view. Every hour when the clock strikes the crowds get so thick you'd think there was going to be a movie or something. But you'll wait for it you know you will.

Clock a true marvel. The Astronomical clock is incredible!! Make sure you look up the history of the clock to understand the significance of it still working. Make sure you arrive right before the beginning of an hour! When the clock changes hours, it comes to life!!

Fun and Intriguing square.. The Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock (Staroměstská radnice s orlojem) was established in 1338 which makes the intricacies and accuracy of this antique clock even more captivating. You will arrive at this jam packed square full of people waiting on the clock to strike and mechanically move a host of saints and characters around for a minute or so. I might recommend standing closer to it than not so that you can make out the little figures better. I also suggest reading about the clock before arriving ( or while waiting) to enhance the experience.

Must have in Prague. Try to be there at the whole clock. There will be a lot of people especially during evening, but it's worth of it.If you will have time go also to visit tower of Town Hall there (ticket are for 150CZK).

Worth the time to be there as the clock strikes 12.. Amongst the huge crowds in old town sq is a surge to watch the clock on the hr. Compared to some I've seen this was okay, but still worth the cost- free.. If you have time for the insider tour I would avoid being there on the hour as the crowds are much less. Interesting.

Seconds Out. This review is for the astronomical clock only. I was having a drink directly opposite the old town hall and realised that with the top of the hour approaching here was a great opportunity to see the world famous Prague astronomical clock. I found myself a good vantage point and readied the video on my phone. The clock struck 8pm. A small skeleton figure rang a bell followed by a dozen figures (saints) in two small windows, then...well, that was it. Prague is a beautiful city with so much to do and see and the clock has to be done but don't expect to much.

The star attraction in the Old Town area.. We had booked a hotel directly in front of the clock, thank goodness for great double glazing. On the hour the square is packed with iPhone, iPad, cameras or anything that can record. All to watch on the bewitching hour the twelve apostles, (replacing the original ones destroyed by the Germans in 1945) rotate on either side of the clock. But it is such a beautiful spectacle that it is a must see. If you want good photos get there early morning before 9 am when there are much smaller crowds, also you can watch the many brides and grooms having their photo shoots done. For a fee you can go to the top of the tower for a panoramic view of the square and surroundings, they also have an elevator if you decide not to walk up.

Sweet and short...very very short. In the time it takes you to read this review the clock highlight will be over. 20 seconds give or take a millisecond-). All that said Its worth while to get the story of the clock and its different hands and characters and signs to make those 20 seconds really count. Its one of those things you cant miss bit you should do it on the way to the palace from the old city. Do Not make it a main event in your trip or you'll be dissapointed.

Worth a visit, its like stepping out of Time. The astronomical clock is a work of art, engineering and precision, Beautiful by day and stunning at night. plenty of cafes and bars to sit out even in Winter (most have heaters) and enjoy the world going by
Unreal. This astronomical clock is an absolute wonder and I could sit and gaze at it for hours. Not only does it tell you loads of information but it is so old?

Not to be missed !!. If you are in Prague then this should be your number one destination , the astronomical clock looks even better in real than in pictures. There are huge crowds around this place with people from all over the world wanting to witness it. It makes for a great photo op and you can even carry the souvenirs of this clock back home.
one of the best squares. always alive, anytime a day, at one of the corners of the old town square, you can climb the tower (for some fee) to see the square from above
The clock is a must see!. If you're visiting the Old Town Square you can't miss this. If you want to go up the tower, you should consider prebooking as it can be very busy.

Many visitors, unique clock to view. We enjoyed walking around this area, plenty of attraction spots to visit and see. Lots of visitors but soak up the atmosphere and take pictures like everybody else!

The center of Prague. It seemed that no matter where we were going we ended up at or going through this square! The astronomical clock is amazing (given how old it is and that it still works). Crowds gather each hour to watch the figures moving. They are a bit underwhelming for a modern audience, but still worth seeing.
Shortbreak. Worth a visit just to say you've been .i don't know what I expected but I was a little disappointedit didn't impress me very much.

Time your visit close to the hour. When the clock strikes a new hour, a parade of saints takes place. There is lots of room in the square to watch this so you don't have to be early - just be on time!

Disappointed. One of the most popular tourist attractions in Prague. I was slightly disappointed. There were huge crowds to watch the moving figures which only appear on the hour so it was difficult to get close. Also there was not too much action from the moving figures. I have certainly seen better elsewhere.

A Clock full of surprises. This clock is a one off. We took advice and booked a coffee break in the upstairs of the hotel facing the clock, what a view, when it chimes there is so much to see and hear, be warned they queue for hours to see this clock.

Interesting place to wander through. Classic buildings and ultimately where all tourists will wander through at some stage. We didn't do any shopping here so can't comment on prices. Watching the clock was interesting but was a little underwhelming (which is probably disparaging to the creator)

Short display but interesting. Very complex clock and worth seeing, but check out the information on it in the building its in to really understand what you are seeing. The display on the hour is quite short, but impressive. Go up the observation tower if you have time. Great views of the square, the city, and the crwod waiting for the clock to hit the hour

I waited 15 minutes for that?. The clock is very cool. Read up about the meaning of the various dials and their functions to get a better appreciation of this masterpiece. The top-of-the-hour "show" is interesting but don't waste your time standing around waiting for it when there is so much to see and do all around you. You'll miss it if you blink or busy fussing with you camera.
Get there early. The clock is amazing, but you must be there for the 9 am show. The rest of the day the place is jam packed.

"time" will pass you by here!. The clock which was built in 1410 still stands tall today. it is very historic and very well preserved. Deciphering how to tell time on it will take one days unless you take a guided tour of the city (recommend). every hour on the hour is a quick show which dates back to the 1400s when the skeleton pulls the cord and the 12 apostles appear through the windows above the clock. Interesting to see for sure!

A bit of a let down. Just before the hour the crowds start to gather in front of the clock. On the hour the clock chimes and the doors above open to reveal a revolving show of characters. 15 seconds later its finished. Everyone then looks around as of to say "i's that it".Like the Charles Bridge a lot of the attraction of the clock is the history that goes with it. The age of the clock and the fact that it still works accurately after so many centuries. It's worth going to see and of course it's free but go with a bit of information on the history of it so you understand what it is you are seeing.

Always crowded but some pleasant architecture. It's on the must do list for Prague and it's pleasant enough with the clock and some great buildings.But it's always packed with sightseers and the restaurants surrounding the square are as you would expect premium priced.

A Must See When in Prague. The Prague Astronomical Clock, also called Prague Orloj is another must see while in the city. I recommend getting there early before the top of the hour so you can get a good location to see the moving figures which come out of the clock on top of the hour. Head over to the clock at night and you'll get some great shots as well.

If you are passing by, you should see it. Not as impressive as some, but still pretty cool. There is a Starbucks directly behind it, with clean toilets (you pay small change to use it) and it's a good reference point while in the city. Go around the other side, and see where half of the building was damaged during WWII.
Stunning. The details on the Astronomical Clock are phenomenal! Obviously, there is quite a crowd on the hour, so be aware of pickpockets when taking your photos.

Highly entertaining. Wow I saw a picture of the old town hall area under Nazi rule on TV. The architecture looks exactly the same however the center of town is crazy with tourists and vendors. The vendors are NOT aggressive which is great. You can enjoy without being bothered. I wish I had time to have checked out the museums better. I would have like to have seen more about czech under Nazi rule

Best coffee shop . As good as a latte can get. Greatest coffee I had in Prague. They only do one thing "coffee" and do it well. Very friendly barista, not many tourists around, great music and great location.

Don't stand around too long. If you happen to be around at 5 minutes til the top of the hour I would say that is the absolute longest you should wait to see the clock go off. The actual chiming is unimpressive, but the clock itself is beautiful.

You have to see it on the hour (do not go out of your way for it). We waited, along with a horde of other people to see the clock go off at 11am. We should not have waited 15minutes for it though. I videoed the thing and I am glad I did because as I was watching afterwards I see where I was going wrong. Hint: watch the little blue windows rather than the skeleton. Had a god laugh though.
Excellent. I like this clock. Fine work of craftsmen, with a beautiful combination of colors and lines. A small show each hour

Take the tour.... Fascinating.. My hotel room was opposite this clock... I came to think of it as " my clock". Do take tour... Up close look at the inside, history and insight into underground Prague... Plus, of course the observatory. Well worth the time and money.

Time to move along. It's an historic clock but don't expect to tell what time it is. The gathered crowds expect a lot, but when the time came to chime the hour, it was all a bit disappointing. Perhaps if people knew more about who the appearing figurines were, then maybe they'd get a bit more out of it. As it stands, the clock is an astronomical oddity.

Not so awesome . The place around the astronomical clock is very crowded every full hour because of the apostles coming out. Only worth if you pass by at full hour. Finally not so special but you'll pass by in any case.
old town & Astronomical Clock. We found he Astronomical Clock pretty boring, do not forget to beware of thief's when looking up! the old town itself is beautiful!
Prague's show. Free and hourly little show that demonstrates complexity of the world's oldest astronomical clock. Don't forget to go up the tower and visit the level below!
Do not miss. A wonderful square, lovey atmosphere and lovely cafes. Very busy but worth the crowds. The clock is so interesting to see, go on the hour to see a little "show". Do not miss!
Watch it early. If you want to not be bugged by a bunch of people watching the clock at the top of the hour, go early in the morning.

Hourly show. Every hour a little show plays before your eyes. It's nice but the crowd keeps you from finding the best spot to make the recording. The prices at nearby cafes and restaurants are astronomical accordingly to the place.

Very touristy but must see when in Prague!. A visit to Prague would not be complete without a visit to this part of the city! It is a unique clock in many ways and while it gets quite crowded you can still admire it !

Its great when it goes off. Can become very busy in the area when the clock goes off as everyone stops to take photos and videos when the clock goes off. It is very interesting when it goes off all these little figurines come out and do crazy things at the top of the clock. I'm not sure why people are mentioning that its not worth waiting for as someone has spent a lot of time creating the masterpiece. Nice area and there are places to get food and drinks

Take your time.. Be there on the hour when the characters of the clock come to life. I would say that this is the main attraction of the Old square and shouldn't be missed. Have your camera at the ready. If you are brave and fit you can pay to climb the tower which I'm sure would offer great views.

Fantastic views from the tower. We did the tour of the chapel, old town hall and underground and bought combi tickets so we could go up the tower too. This was 180 czk each (rather than 100czk for the tour and 130czk for the tower) and didn't seem to be advertised so if you plan to do both ask for the combined ticket. The tour was excellent. Very low priced and lasting more than an hour, our guide was more than happy to answer any questions. There's tours in different languages available throughout the day.The tour begins with a visit to the chapel, where you will see the figures from the astronomical clock from the inside - much better view and less crowded than the view from the square itself during the day.The underground segment was really informative, and there's a few older items kept in that part of the building which you would otherwise be unable to see.We found the queue for the lift surprisingly short, but the viewing platform around the tower seems to always be very busy. It's worth the crowds because you get an excellent view of the city, and of the square from this vantage point. It took us about an hour and a half for the tour and the tower visit.

Quirky relic from a bygone age.. Arrive at least 15 minutes before the hour to get a good viewing point to see the clock figures move when the clock chimes on the hour. A must for any tourist visiting Prague.
Beautiful clock but not worth waiting to see it chime. The clock itself is stunning but don't go out of your way to see it chime as that's not actually anything special.
A little overrated I would say. We did only the exteriors; huge crowd thronging the clock for a 15 sec display. Can miss. Lot more in Prague to do.
The masterpiece of Prague. I think is the masterpiece of Prague, people from al over the world come to watch the clock. It is a great experience and it also is at the city center and it is free.!!!!
Good for markets!!. Another good attraction, atmospheric with markets stalls. mime artists and places to eat If you like hot chocolate, this is the place to go .
Yawn. Pretty but not worth more than 5 minutes out of your way. Go as part of a much longer tour and, if you miss hearing the clock chime, don't be concerned.
Lovely Astronomical Clock.. Beautiful square. Lovely clock; working replica. Hundreds of people (tourists) gather every half hour or so to see and hear the clock in action.

Stroll around Old Town. Lovely old buildings, outdoor dining areas and the popular Astronomical Clock. All part of the interesting old town area of Prague. Continue through this area to Charles Bridge.
The highlight of Praha!. Simply amazing! Highlight of the trip! Very crowded at the bottom but worthwhile. Pub crawls start under it at 9 pm
Great experience!. Nice experience, get there at least quarter to the hour else you won't get a nice spot. The atmosphere is nice!!

The clock. Amazing clock especially when it came to every hour as the skeleton pulled the cord and the doors opened!! Great views as well at the top, not too expensive and good pictures on walls as you went up told lots of history!

Great Experience!. Lol! i remember this place as i found this is the only place in whole city where you will find People(humans)...else i was surprised when i found myself in no man's land around castle....so to grab amazing food, shopping ..this is a must go place in Prague...:)

A Must See When In Prague. The Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock are probably the two most visited sights for tourists in Prague. Thirty minutes before the hour people start claiming their spot in the Square to either photograph or video the thousand year old Astronomical Clock. The beautiful facing of the clock tower and the finely crafted figurines that perform on the hour are well preserved considering the age of the clock. The Square adjacent to the Clock and the location of the Old Town Hall is a hub of activity during the tourist season. Many street performers entertain the throngs. There is no charge to visit either of these popular attractions and no trip to Prague would be complete without seeing them.
Very popular. If you want to take photos get there well before the hour as very popular. Its lovely to watch and cafes nearby to have a drink.
Lovely!. You can climb this tower, but you have to pay for that. It's not expensive. Inside, you can buy some souveniers.
Must visit!. Beautiful place to visit at night with all the church lights and lots of crowd. You can easily spend hours walking around and just not get bored. Must visit!!

Particular spectacle in the centre of Prague. Beautiful building, like a legendary castle, where we can see the connection between the religion and the astronomy. You can climb up to the tower, if you are enough brave...

Just check the sights!. Go early in the day to beat the crowds and heat. It was August and by 11:00am you could hardly move around the clock or main square. Very interesting shops that sell different items for souvenirs from cheap to expensive. Just walk and enjoy the various buildings food stalls and sights.
Astronomical Clock. This clock was in walking distance of our hotel. The extra moving parts went off every hour. Even though there was a large crowd watching it, you could still see it.

Must see. The Town Hall was teeming with people every time we were there.
The Astronomical Clock was well worth seeing & watching the time go by.
Buskers aplenty.

Astronomical clock. The mechanical clock "performs" every hour on the hour up until about 10 pm. Crowds flock there and it is almost as interesting to see everyone with their smart phone video cameras waiting for the action. It is very interesting and the plaza is a buzz with activity.

Take time to watch the time.. This ornate, generations old clock is gorgeous. Take your time to marvel at the craftsmanship and enjoy the colourful figures. The clock is similar to the one in Vienna, Austria, yet unique. If you really want to have a good view of the "on the hour show", try early in the morning.

Amazing clock and Tower. The Astronomical Clock I think, is one place that every tourist will have to visit in Prague. The clock is simply fantastic and if you have time, visit the Tower and it's wonderful city panorama. This place is a face of Prague, don't miss it.

Beautiful Clock Tower and Good View From Top. I went to the top of the tower very early and thus beat the queue. Can use either the elevator right to the top or using the stairs (with histories and posters along the way) - in my opinion better to use stairs when coming down the tower. The view from the top was breathtaking with the view of the Church of Our Lady Before Tyn and also The Prague Castle
Clock of History. The clock has many moving parts. We enjoyed watching it tell us the time. The crowd was large so go early to get the best location to see it all.
Do the tour if you can . Go to the too of the clock, then do the tour, our guide was very nice and knew allot about the old times, you need at least two hours for the both
Centre of Prague Old Town. Prague has so many beautiful buildings, bridges, squares and parks....and this is just another great example. Well worth a visit
near the square. restoration has been a success, as this was dismal indeed in the Communist era when Soviet forces occupied the country.

Over six hundred years old mechanical marvel. this medieval Town hall is really must to see, unfortunately because of tourist vandalism the clock show goes now only to 10 P.M. and except for mornings it's crowded

Worth the effort to get to the top of the clock tower. A must venue if you are visiting Prague. There is also a lift to most of the clock tower if you have walking problems. We only visited some of the Town Hall as you needed to book onto the relevant tour time slot and we kept missing the time for English tours.

Amazing clock, but very touristy. The clock looks amazing and the whole square is really quite fun to be in. Can get very crowded with the tourists though and at night there are quite a few drug dealers about offering their wares... Overall worth a visit though

Over rated in my opinion. Again, huge crowds gathered to watch the on the hour display of the clock. I was under-whelmed by it all. Take the elevator up the tower though for a great view of the square.

Long queues and a tight squeeze. The queue for tickets was only a 15 minute wait which was surprising considering how busy the square had gotten over the weekend; we however ended up waiting in a queue inside the building to get to the top for at least 45 mins. This wouldn't have been too bad had they warned us when we bought the ticket; my pregnant sister was with us and could have done with the warning.The views from the top are amazing and we got to experience a beautiful sunset while we were up there. Unfortunately it was extremely crowded and difficult to move around. Better crowd control is needed especially in a day as hot as the one we were there and better signage to explain waiting times and the narrow viewing areas.It's good value for money especially as you get a 360 over the rooftops of the town. I would definitely recommend it.

Breathtaking. Definately worth going to the top of the tower and taking in the views from the top. Allow enough time to read all the information on the way up and take in all the pictures on how the town hall and clock have changed over the years.

Enchanting and unique experience. This part of the city is indeed its most vibrant and interesting.as you snake your way through the cobbled streets and alleys,absorbing the various colours of Prague and admire the numerous souvenir shops and restaurants,you disgorge yourself into this massive promenade with a tall clock tower at the centre.not only is this one of Prague's most distinct landmarks, the cyclical show of the figurines at the stroke of every hour is indeed most unique and exclusive.must watch for every tourist

Astonomical clock - don't bother. The best thing is to get to the front, turn around and look at the hundreds of faces all with the expression of "Is that it?".Really - it does nothing: 2 windows open and some figures pass the opening. That's it - nothing pops out and there is no animation.HOWEVER - if you get a tour guide to explain all of the elements of the 2 clock faces, it is actually very interesting.
Oldest working clock. Take the free tour and they will explain the working of the clock and it still has the original parts.

Get there every hour on the hour. From 9 am everyday, the clock goes off with a 60 second show from the clock tower. Be very careful and it gets mobbed around the clock each hour and pick pockets are out in force!!
A must do. A must see but get there early for the hour chimes as tour groups will be around for the best spot in front of the clock
Astronomical clock. The Astronomical clock is a beautifully designed large clock. Every hour, when the two hands join a tune is played and a 'special thing' happens

A charming little activity. A really lovely activity for families. It was not as impressive as I expected as I'd really heard a lot of great reviews. Although I'm glad we saw it, I wouldn't visit it again unless it was a family activity. :)

Neat clock but hard to tell what time it is.. This is a really neat looking clock but because it combines three ways to tell time on a single clock, it's hard to figure out what time it is. On the hour, doors open and figurines come out and twirl. It's very crowded on the hour but still something neat to see.
Try to read the clock. This clock is amazing. Try to be in time to see the twelve apostles and to see death ring the bell..

Amazing to experience. When you consider that this clock was installed in the early 1400s and it still works, then its value becomes more apparent. You must find literature to explain the clock's mechanism and you will stand in front of it for quite a while just analyzing it. You also get a darling little show on the hour. Go see it!

Interesting history. The clock itself is very interesting which I learned about in a walking tour. If you are not doing a tour look up how the clock works as it makes it much more fascinating to see. The clock has a 30sec show on the hour, it is not worth it to go out of your way to see this part of it.

A must do in Prague!. You can't go to Prague and not visit and climb this amazing landmark. Pick the time of day carefully as it can get quite busy. Try and go on the hour as the crowds are usually outside watching the clock tower show. For an adult it costs 130czk, so is very reasonable! Also had a lift in side so wheel chair accessible. In terms of the clock tower show, you have to see t once but it's actually very disappointing so don't get your hopes up.

Truly worth seeing. The old town Hall is an amazing place.. Close to the powder tower and the Charles bridge. Many places to ear, drink and rest your feet. Best to go before 9AM to be able to enjoy the building without the crowds. Go later in the day when the clock strikes the hour, to enjoy the crowds and the amazing working of the clock.

Going up tower is a must do. There is an elevator to the top of the old town hall. It is definitely worth doing as the view from there is incredible. We also took the tour of the basement area under this. It was interesting. It also gives you a chance to see the inside of the clock and see the 12 apostles up close.
Worth a visit, but pretty simple. The Astronomical Clock is beautiful and it's quite impressive when you think about the age of the piece, however, the "show" is not much and it's over very quickly.

Wow. Another wonderful attraction. The clock wad awesome
I also loved the trumpet player at the end of the clock chiminng. Another must see attraction!!❤😉
Very pretty. The Old Town Hall has lots of different architectural styles and has wonderful views over the town (there is also a lift if you don't want to do the climb)

Know the what the clock is, before visit. The clock is not overrated at all. If you know the history of the clock you will be amazed with the technology. Worth checking the drama happening every hour. make sure you check the clock at 60th minute. Don't just check and pass.

Fun place to see. We caught this at 9pm. So it was still light. If you don't like crowds then this isn't for you. The area in front of the clock starts to fill up about 10 minutes before the hour. It is wall to wall people. They people did not seem to be to pushy. Kinda like a party atmosphere.
Iconic place in Prague. When visiting Prague, this is one of the iconic places to see, like going back in time, especially when the clock strikes at the top of the hour!!!

One of the best things in Prague. On the hour every hour people congregate in front of the astronomical clock to watch the little people go past the window, it's a bit of an anticlimax but still has to be done when in Prague but the best thing is climbing to the top of the tower, there are two lifts if you have trouble with lots of stairs but the view down into the square is delightful, both my wife and I thought it was one of the best things we did on our trip to Prague.Go early when they open at 9am to beat the crowds as there is not a lot of space up there.
Great views. For the best view in Prague get up this clock! Definitely worth the queue to the top. Will be breezy up there!
Crowded experience. Whereas it was interesting the crowds were too muchTook away from the experience Best to go very early before everyone o solid ages to the place

Historic and Beautiful. This place is a "Must-Visit" while in Prague. I recommend to take the Old Town House tour. Ours with Daniel and we got to see all the rooms, halls, and cellars while we received a lot of information of the buildings' history and many fun facts.The Astronomical clock attracts many people who gather by the hundreds by the clock to see the moving sculptures and take photos.The tower offers an excellent view of the Old Town. It is very recommended to walk to the top and read the information of the tower along the way.

A must see. I loved the clock which has a little show on the hour. There is a lift to the top but limited space to walk around the edge of the clock tower. The views were great. Very hot day and busy.

Early start. Really worth while getting up early to see the clock before the hoards of people. Visited shortly after 8am and very few people about, there was a bride posing for her photos. History of it is fascinating.

Interesting. This is a must when you visit Prague. I would say this is the most popular sight to see. Particularly busy when the clock is due to strike the hour. In fact it can get so packed you can hardly move.It's a fantastic medieval timepiece. So ornate and a little bit sinister with the sculptures. When the clock strikes the hour the disciples pop out of two boxes above the clock. It is fascinating and amazing this was produced so many hundreds of years ago. It's well worth seeing.There are people hassling you to buy souvenirs and would say be careful cause it is so busy.Great souvenir shops and bars around.
Fascinating . I stopped several times to watch the clock do its thing on the hour. Worth seeing it at least once. You have to get there a bit before the hour or you will see it from afar.

Iconic. That's Prague's main and largest square. During summer, you can just chill, there is always someone playing some music, there is good food and drinks. Besides, the square has the most iconic landmarks in Prague: the astronomical clock/tower and Adam and Eve's Church both built in Medieval times and astonishing!!

Worth The Overpriced Coffee To Watch From Restaurant Across The Street. The Astronomical Clock is definitely worth seeing. Our first visit was 3pm on a Friday afternoon and we were standing in a huge crowd off to the right side, so we didn't get to properly view the clock. We returned the same day around 4:40pm and sat at a cafe directly across the street with a perfect view of the clock. Although there were many people standing in front of us it wasn't a problem because you need to look up to see the clock anyway. It was worth the $10.00 for a coffee and a beer to avoid being jostled by the huge crowd that gathers every hour.

A beautiful piece of medieval history, amazing view from the top. A must in every Prague visitors list.Lose yourself in the crowd that slowly, yet steadily gathers up as the minute hand of the clocks approaches 60. Experience the show and the trumpet player's song.I definitely encourage to climb to the top of the tower. You can buy the tickets right by the clock. Don't forget to bring your camera as the view of this city is just amazing from there. Red roofs and small cobblestone streets.
Must see. This is one of the many places you have see in Prague. It's in the center of the square. The clock is so beautiful.

This is a must do. Yes there will be crowds. Yes, many will try and take pictures with their arms outstretched and block your view ... but this is a busy attraction for a very good reason. If I had a chance I might have gone early in the morning to see if the plaza below the clock was less crowded but there was too much else to do.Take a moment to read the history and meaning of this clockwork first and then you will be so much more impressed.We are so spoiled with technology now that we often fail to appreciate what a marvel this clock was for the age it was built and what a beauty it still is.Use Binoculars if you must but do not miss the show.
get there when the hour strikes. Somewhat hyped but fun to watch as the hour strikes. The square is always very busy. Lots of shops, cafe's and other stuff to do

Wow. This place is at the heart of the city's magic and needs to be visited. Even if you stand there and think simply why? It's still necessary regardless! A teenager may say "that's a few minutes I won't get back" but they will appreciate it in the end Go there

Amazing. It is a phenomenal clock.. Was one of a kind when they did it. It has the 24 hours of the day. It has the horoscopes signs and shows where the moon and the sun is at the time.. The satues that shows the good virtues and the other statues that represent the bad ones. The 12 diciples passing in a circle.. Just amazing and who did it at that time is a genius.

Fantastic if you understand astronomy. A lot of people tend to think this clock is overrated and boring. It's true that it is just on the side of the building and doesn't even tell 24hr time, but it is really cool if you care about the mechanics and planning necessary to make such a clock. It tells solar time (whenever high noon is or sunrise to sunset) accurately for every day of the year, the arms of the clock changing length as the length of the day changes throughout the year. If that interests you then it is definitely worth a visit, also to see the intricate paintings and names on the yearly calender face. Plus it's right on the only square so there's no reason not to look at it for a minute before seeing something else.
Amazing Astronomical Clock!. An amazing astronomical clock, along with intriguing story, awaits in the old town square! Charming, and entertaining, this place and clock are not to be missed!

Ascent of Prague Town Hall Tower. Worth the climb up (we spurned the lift reserved for the less fit) for great panoramic view of Prague, with many of iconic buildings visible and directed to from viewing balcony. Just a little crowded up there, though, on our visit.
Great view. Got in on the student prize and it was well worth it. Amazing view of the city and was able to take some fantastic panorama photos.
Great atmosphere. Its a beautiful place. Fun and busy all the time. Great place to eat and drink with beautiful scenery. Happy vibes whether your young old or with children..

A bit boring at night.. The Astronomical Clock is a significant part of the history of Prague but there is always a crush of tourists on the hour when the show starts. Our hotel porter warned us that not much happens at night and he was right. Some chimes and a few moving pieces so high up you can barely see it. There was a hoard of tourists trying to get a photograph, and the nearby restaurant impinges on the viewing area making it difficult to enjoy the experience.I recommend going during the day and early in the morning is less crowded.

Its a beautiful place to walk. This is a beautiful place to walk, but there are so many other places where you could go up a high tower and see the city from there, that makes this place not worth it because of the lines of people outside. I reccoment the Astronomical tower from the library. Its much higher and the tours can be done in several languages. Meaning lesser lines, more information.

Amusing hourly show . I absolutely agree that the clock is beautiful and worth seeing. I know that what the clock can do is impressive because of its age but I was very amused at the number of people whipping out their phones and cameras to take videos of probably the most anti-climactic show ever.

Vantage viewing. I went to the early in the morning to go to the top of the clock tower, as the day goes on queues and very long. Views across the city are just fab. On the hour characters appear when two small doors open. large crowds gather in from of the clock just before the hour, lovely to watch. the Town hall has some interesting features too.
Cannot miss this. One of the most impressive parts of Prague and you will enjoy a mini show every full hour you spend there.
Captivating. The place in generally crowded and one has to jostle around for space around here, but for good reason! Must visit...

This is Clockwork!. It could be hard to miss if you don't know where to find it, but when it's close to the full hour, just follow the tourists :-) Nice clockwork "show"! A must see for architecture tourists when in Prague.
Beautifull. Tower was nice, area is really nice view, took a lots of pictures, as pictures are my first priority to remember the monuments I visited
Not to be missed. The clock is a wonder as it is so very old and is mechanal and still works. Make the effort to go to the viewing gallery at the top of the tower. The view is spectacular.

Clock view . This clock is a classic part of Prague s history. The view of the clock is amazing, the only disappointing factor was we were unable to go up into the clock tower, due to the high volume of people waiting to purchase tickets to do the same visit. Maybe tomorrow maybe a better day for purchasing tickets. The queue was at least and hour and a half wait. Way to long to line up in the summer weather.

Every hour counts! Free to see!. This is simply good. Every hour there is splendid display of the characters in this precise clock! Remember to be careful when the crowds gather to see this free spectacle.

Overrated. A wonderful clock but what happens on the hour does not justify the hundreds of people who congregate. Coventry is a lot newer but more interesting. Great architecture for the other 59 minutes of an hour too.

A must see!!!. The clock is beautiful, learn about the clock mechanism and its components, also check the hourly chime.Climb to the top of the tower, you will have a lovely view of the Old Town square as well of the entire city of Prague.

A must see!. Some people have come to think of the astronomical clock show as overrated, but the clock is around 700 years old, it's beautiful to look at, immensely complicated and impressive in the ways that it tells time and the fact it still runs! It's certainly one of the sights to see and if you catch it on the hour and get to watch the show, even better!
Old town. A Segway tour along the old ton was a cherry on this cake! easy to operate and fun to see the city on a Seg

Town hall and clock. Even with the crowds in June we loved the feeling as we entered the square. Well worth waiting for the clock to strike the hour and wait to see what happens next. And yes you can climb to the top of the tower (or if lazy take the lift). Great views and worth the cheap admission. As you walk the stairs you see the black and white photos details local events in WW2. This was my favourite highlight of our visit to Prague
Beautiful to see. This clock is a must see while visiting prague,,while there we were lucky to see 2 prague brides ,be patient to get to front to seeclock its very popular

Birds eye view of the city. You can climb the stairs in the clock tower if you're feeling energetic or take the elevator to the top for a great view of the city. Or you could just stand around and wait for the top of the hour to see Death ringing a bell to summon the parade of saints above the clock. Be warned; no matter how early you get there and pick the perfect spot for your photo or video, a few seconds before the start someone will, either barge in front of you or casually sidle in. It happened to me many times. No point in getting mad, I think of it as an excuse to return to Prague.
