A Must See. A trip to Prague wouldn't be complete without seeing the Astronomical Clock at the top of the hour. Time it right so you don't have to spend a lot of time there though because it's really crowded with tourists who are just like you - there to see the clock - so be polite and aware of others. Watch your bags and your wallets. But do go see it.

astrononomical clock. It is exciting to be ready in front of the Old Town Hall to enjoy a fascinating mechanical performance of clock (every hour you can see it).You can also search the interesting history of it. In the Middle Ages it was considered one of the wonders of the world.

Architecturally beautiful but far too many people. We waited amongst a huge throng of tourist faces expectantly gazing up at the astronomical clock at the turn of the hour. Hundreds of years old and it still captures the popular imagination to the point that hundreds of people will stop and stare each hour of the day to watch. The clock is charming, the building housing it is beautiful, as are all the buildings in the vicinity but at the turn of the hour there is only one star in town and it is the clock. The mechanics, the simple but effective movement of the elements is mesmerising even in an age of technological marvels. The only problem is that there are hundreds and hundreds of other people waiting and these people all shuffle and block each other's way when other people try to move. I know it's a major attraction but sometimes I feel a bit grumpy when I'm stuck in the middle of a throng of people unable to move!The clock however is a must see!

Fuss over nothing. The square was brilliant, variety of street entertainers,restaurants and food stalls a vibrant and beautiful place.However when the clock struck the hour the crowds had gathered and I eagerly anticipated the spectacle that was about to happen, a huge disappointment, a fuss over nothing.The square is definitely worth a visit and if you happen to be there on the hour have a look yourselves and make your own mind up.
very scientific clock. I visited the clock and heard what the clock represent. I think it is complicated and scientific clock. I respect the clock maker.I was happy to see the show on time.

So crowded and performance underwhelming. Crazy crowds and an underwhelming experience. We had expected movement of the pieces. Just two small doors opened and closed. The detail on the clock is stunning, so go anytime but on the hour and you'll be better rewarded. The large square and surrounding buildings are beautiful too so this area us well worth a visit

Beautiful but overrated. The clock is quite lovely and goes off every hour
However for the crowds of people that gather and for the very short 15 seconds display I do think it is a little overrated
If you go on the hour get there a few minutes early to secure a spot and pay attention it is over quickly

Charming clock right in the heart of the city. The clock is from the middle ages. When it goes off, you see about a one minute presentation of animated characters. Lots of tourists converge here so get there early.

Not much of a show. The tower and decorations are good for some photos, especially the skeleton. But if it's not time for the clock to strike, I wouldn't wait around. Just a few figures rotate in the viewing area. I found the square to be more impressive.
On the hour amusement. Truly amazing clock when you think how old it is and it still works. The action only lasts for a few seconds, but well worth the effort to get there.
Fascinating . This was the only worthwhile reason to visit old town square. Try to make you visit just before the changing of the hour.

Tick tock...worth a watch.. You don't just go here to watch the clock do its things for a minute or so, you are in the town square, so spend time walking around the square, see the performances and the shops, get a drink, but when it gets close to the hour, get around the clock and wait. It's a nice little attraction. The clock is truly stunning, the amount of detail! Definitely check it out and plenty to do around the square.

Lovely views. Prague is a lovely city with a real cultural and European "feel" or vibe to it and while Old Town is arguably the heart and epicentre of this, it's the iconic tower and clock which are at its heart. My wife and I visited Prague last weekend and had a fantastic time. We went up the tower and saw some amazing views of the city's buildings and landmarks (eg the castle can be seen in the distance). If you like being romantic and, like my wife, enjoy your "selfies," I'd pop up there for half an hour while exploring Old Town. Enjoy!

simply amazing and not to be missed. I visited this clock tower in the in the old town hall square and it is one of the city's main highlights. Make sure you read up or have someone explain the events that happen when the clock strikes on the hour. Hundreds of people jostle for photos so try to arrive 15 mins or so before the hour-dont miss it!!

Re-living History. Well, I have to say: Prague is a very pretty city. It is really nice to visit, there is a lot of cultural events and at the old town.You get to live aa city in Europe so different from many others, with so much history and pretty sights.Go to the Castle, go up the astronomical clock and eat at its centre. Oh and don't forget U Kroka (a little off-center, but for sure is worth!)
Impressive. We climbed up the Clocktower to see the magnificent views of the city. This was probably my most favorite spot to view all this wonder. Something I definitely would not miss.

Beautiful on any day. Visited the square on a rainy day, it was still busy with tourists and still beautiful. You can go up the tower and have a great view or choose between many restaurants around and just enjoy the day and view.
Beautiful but very dull information. Unless you come with a tourguide or well prepared then you can almost miss it. The movement of the statues is minor, and lots of crowd.
Old but good. The "performance" doesn't last very long, but it's amazing to think that the clock was made so many years ago and is still going strong. They don't make them like they used to!

Cool clock!. So noon is probably the worst time to try to watch the clock (our first visit) .... At 10 AM, it was better. I imagine, the earlier the better so if you can get there at 8 or 9, you might have more of the square to yourself.

Worth watching, but, ....... Worth watching once, but it gets so crowded, it's the place for pickpockets. So, as the hour gets near, go inside and upstairs the café opposite and take your photos from the windows there. They serve excellent coffee and pastries, so it's not too much of a chore and your wallet. etc., is safe.

the weather was excellent. great to see what people were able to create in years gone by.
bring your video camera, its worth recording

Saw this towards end of a city tour I took. Very interesting craftsman ship. Beautiful to look at. Would like to go back and bring my husband who missed seeing it because of work. It works every hour with 12 Apostles passing by a window above the astronomical dial and with symbolic sculptures moving aside. The clock shows medieval thoughts of the universe. The Earth the center, the blue dial represents the sky. Latin words for east and west written above the horizon and Latin words for Dawn and twilight below. There is a zodiac ring representing the stars and sky and it moves according to it. The two clock hands have the signs of the sun and the moon. Three circles on the dial, show different times/ the outer circle shows the Old Czech time. (Italian times), the circle with Roman numbers shows the Central European time and the inner circle with Arabic numerals shows the Babylonian times. (The length of an hour differs there according to the season. It's longer in the summer and shorter in the winter. The Prague Astronomical clock is the only one in the world that is able to measure it. The Calendar dial is the newest part of the clock. There is the Prague old town symbol in the center. The rotary outer circle describes every single day of the year, the current date is indicated at the top, also has medallions with zodiac signs with pictures depicting every month.
Astronomical Clock. This is something not to be missed given it has been operating since 1410 & this third oldest largest clock in the world still working. It in the heart of the old town
a must see. Even after the explanation, I still would not be able to use the clock, but the history is rich and the views are amazing. Nothing else like it in the world
Old school clock. Very cool. It is always crowded but extremely interesting. The entire town square is lively and brings you back in time.

Stunning view from the top!. It's not just the astronomical clock that deserves an "ovation", but also the view from the tower is absolutely stunning. You can get there by stairs or by elevator. The thing I liked most about it is how they are presenting each important building that you see from the tower, on all four directions. Definitely a must visit.

JT. A must see attraction is the 'Astronomical clock.' It is situated in the heart of the "Old Town," and is one of the oldest and most elaborate clocks ever built. It attracts large crowds in the square, as you can watch 'The Walk of the Apostles' - An hourly show which sees the apostles and other sculptures appear from within the clock.
What a clock. Amazing square with loads of food vendors and cafes. The clock is amazing to watch when it chimes as many parts of it moves. The only problem it is very popular so quite crowded.

So busy!!. You need a real good spot for piccys on the hour for this one. Everybody is wanting to see the action and it's amazing. Even the buggle player is amazing and always gets a round of applause xxxx

Crowded & the toilets were disgusting!!! . Really wanted to go up the clock tower purely for the views & history. The queues and crowds ruined this experience slightly, but I suppose that's to be expected at such a popular tourist destination. The views were spectacular although the time you get at the top of the clock tower are far less than the time you get queuing! The toilets located within the old town hall you pay to use and as you've just visited the tourist attraction connected you'd think these would be free. I wouldn't mind paying for clean toilets but these were mixed and absolutely disgusting!!! I won't go into the gruesome details- but believe me- DO NOT USE THEM!!! Such a shame for such a beautiful building!! The clock itself is quite lovely- and I'm glad I've seen it, but not as amazing as expected. Pleasant is all I can say!!! It chimes every hour and the crowds gather beneath.
Take some time . . .. Be there at at least 5 minutes before each hour to enjoy a few moments of the mechanical wonder. Less crowds in the morning (before 10 am).

Beautiful sight. The clock is well worth visiting as it is quite the spectacle.The Dance of The Apostles which takes place on the hour between 9am and 9pm is described as the second most disappointing sight in Europe after the Mona Lisa. You judge for yourself! There must be 500 people crammed round it to view it on the hour so get there early if you want to see it.
Quaint Old Town Square. Walking around the Old Town Square was fun, good restaurants and shops all around. The Astronomical clock was beautiful.

Walk by, give it a gander... but not a moment more. Is there a more over-hyped attraction? Maybe the Glockenspiel in Munich's Marienplatz. It is worthy of walking by, snapping a photo. I wouldn't stand around for anything to see "the show."
a Prague must!. The tour is worth it - lots of good history and the view from the top is amazing! Clock tower is in the middle of the town square.
Master piece . People just gathered around at each hour on the clock to hear this master piece go off. You need to be here in order to really understand what this is all about. It is amazing

A must-see while in Prague. Don't just watch the "show" as the time changes. You must listen to a guide, take a tour or download history while you're there. The details make the clock uber impressive. Built in 1410 it's the oldest still working astronomical clock and its symbolism and workings are truly wondrous. Totally enhanced my understanding of the Czech people with their blended genius and strong sense of faith.

See the Tower Too - Advice on Buying Tickets. Try stopping by to see the clock strike the hour more than once. The Town Hall tower stop is an important thing to do on a clear day to see well beyond the square. Such a beautiful view of the entire city.ADVICE: Avoid the long line for tickets and get a better price if you buy your tower ticket online (can use your cell phone) using the QR code at the office directly below the tower just off the square (not the ticket collection point on the second/third floor of the building).

Closk is better than the one in Munich. Not only is the square the focal point, it is beautiful to behold both by day and night. So many things to see and do right in the center of this magical town. Shop and find yourself a cafe and just pinch yourself.

Astronomical Clock. A must see while in Prague, but be prepared for large crowds as this is a main tourist tour area. It is centrally located amongst restaurants and fun to wander through the streets and square all around this area.
Awesome. Loved watching the old astronomical clock and the light show experience. Great sight to behold. Loved the trumpeter up the tower to start it off. Magical.

Pure Prague. Old Town Square is simply a fun, vibrant place to visit. After some wanderings around the square, consider a tour of the Old Town Hall. Many of the rooms are very interesting, and the tour concludes with a climb to the top of the tower and a wonderful view of the square and surrounding area. Even if you do not have time for the Town Hall tour, you can wait til the top of the hour with hundreds of others eagerly anticipating the clock chiming and going into action. The clock, especially, is almost a "must do."

my visit in 2008. we traveled to Prague in 2008. me and my friend luved it there, was such a relaxing vacation.you must visit the astronomical clock, its a beautiful place, especially in the evening,so many tourist and locals in the cafetieres and restaurants

Very touristy but still a must. You can't miss this spot on your visit to Praha. However I agree to not get any exchange done here, the exchange rate we were offered was a total rip off. The old town tower gives good views. As with all tourist attractions , food is priced high with not such great quality. However I would still recommend it as it's lovely in summer.

Beautiful clock and great history . Beautiful clock with many details. It is worth to wait the time change to see the belt ring and all the details of it. At the old town I did an excursion and the guide showed us all 3 clocks and how it shows the solar and lunar hours. Great place!

A middle ages clock with figures that move and it still keeps correct time.. I just loved this clock and it rings out every hour. If wanting to catch the movement, don't go before 9am and be sure to stand at the very BACK of the crowds, not the front! I was so enamored I bought myself a replica clock to bring home.
Interesting but just ok. . While thousands wait for the hour to turn and watch the clock, it really isn't all that exciting. Seeing it is enough .. Waiting is not worth it.
praga 2016. what amazes and fascinates is the atmosphere and the air that you breathe in this square where every corner offers a moment of wonder!

A unique event. It was great to see Apostles and other moving creatures coming out and ringing the bell at the strike of evry hour. The place gets crowded many minutes before the strike of the hour. People are seen capturing photos and videos - a real great event

Great city views and amusing tick tock !. You should climb up this astronomical clock in the night to have beautiful city views. Every hour when the clock strikes with the apostles and the cock there is a huge crowd and it is a delight. Must visit !
Beautiful Clock and Great Views. The clock is very beautiful and the views from the top even better although the line was very long. Good price.

Almost missed it.. It's a clock. Slightly interesting. Not much about it in the guide book we had. I assumed it was because there wasn't much to write, but if it's history was indeed more interesting, apologies to the clock.

Unique but not spectacular. Probably the most famous clock in Eastern Europe. It's history is intriguing and it is physically a spectacular piece of 14th century architecture. Well worth a visit as part of a guided tour, but don't over estimate it, by its age and the limits of engineering at the time or creation, it is incredibly impressive, but many fail to see past that and can be disappointed, either way, it is well worth a stop, albeit a brief one.
love it. if you go to Prague you should visit the old city center and its astronomical clockwork.many things to do thee. don't miss it.

Wow!. We visited the Old Town Hall square several times and there was always something interesting going on- acrobats, musicians, mimes- or just people watching. This is my first visit to the rich culture and history of central Europe.

Everybody was there.... We have seen the Orloj in action - the 45 second performance - too many times to count. We were married at the Old Town Hall. All we wanted to do this time around, was just to walk by for old times' sake.Staromestske Namesti has changed, it most likely never be the same. The way we remember it - civilized. Tourists sat on the ground, with their belongings spread all around them. Monks dressed in orange sheets aggressively asked people to buy worthless trinkets.Junk toys were peddled by vendors.The crowds were unbearable. All we wanted to do at that point was to push through and leave.We ended up in the Grand Cafe overlooking the Square. Getting a table by the window with the Orloj view was easy in the surprisingly empty Cafe. It felt like winning the lottery.We had the best view of the Clock and watched the madness down below. Next time I will skip Staromestske - and consider it lesson learned...

Can be crouwdy but it is worth a visit. While being in Prague you should visit the old city centre and see the astronomical clockwork. Be aware of your belongings, it is still a city full of different kind of people.

Can't Miss THIS!. This IS the place to visit in Prague. The crowd, the food, the music and of course the astronomical clock are the cornerstones of any visit to this country and of course the mixture of gothic and baroque architecture in just ravishing.
On the hour. Clock rings every hour and crowds start about 10 minutes before. Information center is inside of Old Town Hall, some interesting rooms to view for free. Fee for inside tour.
a focus. Steeped in history and amazing creations. Good to have a guide to explain the intricacy of the clock.
Nice. It's a very nice place to visit and to have a walk in the square and don't forget to take lots of pictures. Lots of restaurants around also for a break. Totally recommend it

Not so impressive. Too much hype for... meh!. I mean, yes, its nice to see.But nothing to write home about.The Charles Bridge is way more interesting.Probably the most crowded spot in all of Prague, everyone flocks to see the astronomical clock - a clock that tells time in old rune symbols, arabic numbers, roman numbers, horoscopes, sun and stars, with moving statues every hour...I was expecting something bigger, larger and way more imposing.

Crowded . It's well worth a visit to see this stunning building. Not only is the clock one of a kind, the tower offers one of a kind views as well. The only downside to both climbing the tower, and seeing the clock are the crowds. There is a crowd permanently watching the clock, which only gets bigger as it gets closer to the hour. As for climbing the tower, it's an easy walk up, or there's a lift. My only complaint was that it was hard to move once at the top due to so many people stopping to take pictures or chat. A not so polite lady knocks on the glass to get people moving, but it's still hard to get around the top without shuffling. You definitely need to have a bit of spare time, as there are queues to get tickets, go up the tower and get down again. Nevertheless the views aren't to be missed and do offer spectacular views of the square below and the city itself.
Just stunning. WE had this on our list of must do's and we were not disappointed. It is a stunning piece of architecture and history. You must read the story behind it. We loved it.
Excellent old style buildings. Me and my family thoroughly enjoyed this square on both the days we were in Prague. A very good way to spend time. Loved the stalls selling ham hocks and chilled beers

Main attraction in Prague. It's always crowded near the clock, but 15min before the hour changes masses of people gather in front of it to see the apostoles benedict the town. If you want to climb the tower, don't buy the ticket from outside, because you can buy it from inside the tower and this way you will stay at only one queue, not two.
Amazing to see. Well worth standing around to see a clock perform a display. I have never seen such an amazing clock. It draws crowds from all over the world and to see it is worth it.
Interesting clock. Avoid the rush during the hour, great place to visit. Lots of tourist traps in the vicinity, so better watch out for what you get.
Magic place.. Wonderful place day and night. Beautiful architecture, well-maintained buildings. I would recommend Astronomical clock, every hour a nice show.

Orloj. This astronomical clock belongs to the Prague's "must see". It is unique. Can read in every bedecker about it. I always admire the skills of the old craftsmen. What they were able to create with almost bare hands and very little knowledge. This clock is situated in very middle of the old town. Very special atmosphere though.

Worth stopping by "on the hour". Definitely worth stopping by as the clock is about to strike on the hour to see the super accurate and centuries old time piece do its thing... All powered by weights and pulleys, amazing, but I won't spoil it for you, go and see for yourself.We didn't go inside the old town hall as the queues were just too busy (there is a tourist info office opposite, which were very helpful and provide a free city map).

Beautiful Old Buildings in the Heart of Prague. Wonderful place to spend some time on the square. Surrounding the area are lots of beautiful buildings and restaurants with many nice walking streets and shops.
Would recommend stopping by to see this. The Old Town Hall and clock goes off every hour and it gathers quiet the crowd. You'll get a spot no bother at the side to see the Astronomical Clock.
The best part of Prague. Love this clock and all the places around Old Town' square. Gets very busy from mid morning so watch our for crowds!

Amazing clock.... but lot of other things to see. OK, I admit the story and just being able to create this clock is amazing, especially if you think about the year it was done.If you are close by when it hits the hour stop to watch the clock with the other 100's of people standing there. But it is nothing special (I think)..
Nice architecture . The clock is nice to see but I don't see the big deal about this. Every hour there is a little something going on but not worth the wait.

Lovely but so busy. Icon of prague. A real icon of prague. The clock is lovely to look at and really historic.
Always so busy to try and look at it especially near to the hour when everyone gathers around it.

Very cool!. The Old Town Hall and the astronomical clock are worth seeing on any trip to Prague. Clocks that have a variety of different things moving around on them when they chime the hour are pretty common in Europe, but this is an especially cool one, because of the skeleton ringing the bell as the display of various figures progresses through. The square is beautiful, and this particular section has a great deal of medieval buildings that set off the clock tower. It's also just a beautiful clock as well as a wonderful feat of engineering. It's worth waiting with the crowd for the hour to hear and see this fabulous attraction.

Did not really do it for me. Crowds waiting patiently for the hour mark and then very little happens other than the cheers and clapping.. But it was nice to see and appreciate the history and the atmosphere is great. Agree it is a must see but dont bother hanging around for too long for the hour mark.

A magnificent piece of engineering.. The best part about this astronomical clock is how people gather around to see it work. The clock works fine and rings the bells occasionally but, little do they know, the astronomical mechanism actually stopped working hundreds of years ago and there are many legends and stories about how it stopped. I find that the best part of this design is the look of disappointment on people's faces when they realize it doesn't work anymore.

Beautiful old building and technology. The clock is amazing piece of technology for its time. The movement of the pieces at every hour in the clock is nice. Do go on top of the tower for the view. Its breathtaking. Walk down and read about the history of the place
Tower . Amazing view from top! It looks like a postcard. You can go up by escalator and walk down. It's something different for the experience!

A Little Disappointing . It's a really pretty clock. It has some neat history to it. It's amazing that the mechanisms still work. Actually more impressive in concept than reality. Go take a picture. Not worth braving the crowds for the hourly "show" though.
Beautiful monument. recommend highly to visit, such a beautiful landmark within the town square. Every hour it creates a great atmosphere with cukoo's and the dongs

A 600 year old clock. Admittedly this clock isn't the most entertaining as much does not happen upon the hour mark. However it is only when you understand the history, culture and science behind the clock that you can begin to appreciate it. It was built over 600 years ago and still works today. That in itself is impressive! The fact that the mechanics from centuries ago still produce a cool display is fantastic. Even more so are the rings around the clock which are related to lunar cycles, the time and even one dedicated to an individual people names in the region depending on the day of the year. An invention ahead of its time really, and one that is worth seeing. Don't forget to arrive on the hour mark!

Must see, but with a guide. The Old Town is probably the best place to start sightseeing Prague. Definitely with a guide, because otherwise you won't understand the meaning and significance of what you see. And there are some amazing stories behind the buildings and monuments. Remeber the word: defenestration - "Czech's national sport, as one guide put it." :-)

Go there early. Seeing Prague from the top of the Astronomical Clock tower is really a beautiful thing but go there early because later in the day the queue is just crazy, and as there's limited space on top you can only go in when other people go out.
Do you really know this clock? . John Paul gave the most complete and interesting explana tio about this clock that I even didnt pay attention when this "show with de figures came out!
Great!. Make sure you visit at the top of the hour to see the 12 Apostles turn around at the clock. Really fun!

Naked tour.. Took an early morning, 8 -10 am Naked Tour of the Old Town Square and Clock. The tour guide Was excellent in terms of explaining the old town tower clock. This is a must if you want to truly appreciate the intricacies and complexities of the clock.

Thursday afternoon visit. . Very very crowded. Clock is neat - the second time seeing the display. Only 36 secs !! My kids felt it was underwhelming.
We did pass through the square that evening and it was much more engaging and enjoyable
Beautiful. Worth the wait. Very busy place but go early in the morning when the rest of the city is srill asleep.. perfect for photo shoot when the sun is rising.

Not bad. Everyone seems pretty impressed by the astronomical clock and it is old (600 years old) so pretty amazing that it works so well but I wouldn't stand there at the hour to hear it ring. It doesn't take that long and it gets pretty crowded for the few mins if not seconds itakes sounds.
Really great! . Definitely something to see on a trip to Prague. The area fills up quick closer to the hour so be sure to allow time to make your way down beforehand!
More impressive at night. We visited during a rainy day and was a little disappointed. Next day we came back at nighttime. The place had a different ambiance. Well worth a visit.
Amazing !!!. What amazing place, incredible architecture, beautiful work. We made a wish but I can't say what it is... Absolutely beautiful... Merci Prague, nous reviendrons

Kuku clock. A pretty amazing clock which was build ages ago but still amazes people from all over the world, I would say the best thing about Prague is that all the touristic places are close to each other so what ever happens you won't miss out. The clock definitely something to look at, you can also climb the tower to the top and have a view of the old town square from the bottom really worth it. The clock it's self it's amazing and make sure you stand there to hear it chime as well really is a master piece.

a clock like no other. it is worth the wait to see the astronomical clock strike on the hour. The skeleton rings the bell, the apostles appear in the windows, and it is loud. There is a crowd, so be careful. The square is nice, with lots of restaurants, ice cream stores, gift shops.
Fun!. Lots of shops, historical sites, beautiful historical clock, plenty of shops around, Bars every where.. what is not to like! AND safe

Pick your spot early for photos!!. Loved the old town hall square with the astronomical clock! Arrive early and position yourself on the hour before the clock strikes. Best photography time is early morning when crowds are light and not too bright of a morning sun. Carriage rides and old classic cars abound. Great little Prague chocolate shop within close proximity and ice cream!

The landmark with the most crowds . Whether it be night or day this place seems to always have a crowd round it. You won't know why until you join them and look up at the clock. Every hour (I think?) there is a lovely little 'show' which is worth hanging around to see. The clock itself has a great deal of history and detail in it. I advise a free walking tour to ensure you get as much knowledge on the clock as possible.
SuperLovely. One of the nicest old town squares I have seen in Europe. A must see if you are in Prague. Highly recommended...
Interesting . Good to see, always plenty of people crowded to see the clock on the hour. Pick your spot and try and avoid the tour groups.

Wonderful clock.. One of the marvellous things that have impressed me in my life. Incredible technology for the year that it was built and all details that it has.The legend around the clock manufacturer that was blinded by the Prague authorities to avoid that he build up a second and better clock for another city completes the scene.
A must see. This attraction is easy to spot and nice to have a drink next to at a bar! it is a good idea to visit it at exactly the hour to witness things coming out of the clock

Great View. I went on a tour of the clock and hall and it was well worth the money. If you want a tour check what time is your language. The view at the top of the tower is amazing but if you fear heights do not go. There is a elevator for those who can not go up all those stairs.
Lots of history. Lots of history linked to the town hall and clock. For those who waited a long time to see the hourly clock display it is soon over and a little disappointing.

A bit of a letdown. The clock is beautiful. Well worth seeing. But the hourly extravaganza is underwhelming. Catch it if you are there, but really, not worth waiting around. The saints circle around inside the tower. If you are expecting a charming Disney-like exhibition, you will be greatly disappointed.The tower is worth climbing, but only if the line is not too long. As in almost everything in Pargue, the key is getting there early, before the enormous crowds descend upon the Square.

Quaint & interesting. A bit complicated unless you read up about its various facets. Its a massive 3 stories high clock in the centre of the city which strikes the hour by playing musical notes & showing moon's movement, equinoxes, season changes, etc. The 12 apostles also bless the audience below as their statuettes peep down. Its claim to fame would be its age- about 600 years old

Join the masses to see the clock strike!. This is indeed a must for any visitor to Prague. Stand with the masses during the day to see the clock strike on the hour and then it comes to life. Any of the guides will give you the history and fables associated with the clock, it is very interesting.I have never been up the tower so I cannot comment on this.
An interesting part of Old Town. Very Crowded, go early in the day. Rings on the hour. The history is interesting - read up on it before you go. Free.
Interesting old town & Clock. Interesting area but very crowded in the summer time. It is near the Charles bridge and the Lennon wall, all of which can be seen on the same visit to the area.

Go up by elevator. The climbing up devided to: you go up by free elevator 3 floors. Than you by tickets 120 k and go up. It beautifull and worth it, specially after visiting the city you can see it all from obove.
Go on the hour. The clock makes a little display on the hour every hour. A must see whilst on Prague. You can go up the clock town and get amazing views over Prague!

Every Hour. We enjoyed watching the clock on the hour. The crowds gather in front of the clock and wait to see if the creepy creatures will come out of the little doors or not. I liked watching the skeleton ring the bell!

Very beautiful. In my opinion, one of the most beautiful old towns in Europe. Its huge, with beautiful architecture, lots and lots of restaurants. The astronomical clock is also very beautiful and colorful. We were there in July and it was very, very crowded.

Clock is very interesting. Just seeing the clock is beautiful but we learned a lot more of the relevance and impact to the Czech culture through our sandemans tour. Make sure you read up on it before you go, we found a lot of info online after that required a second trip back.

Interesting for history, but a bit of a tourist trap. Every hour on the hour, you'll find hundreds if not thousands of tourists jammed together in front of the astronomical clock to watch it's <5 min performance. Don't get me wrong, it's pretty cool to see the centuries-old clock's show, given that it doesn't use any modern technology whatsoever, but it's also very... anti-climactic in some ways. At some point in your visit, take the 5 minutes to watch the clock, but don't expect anything over the top. Also, be wary in this area as several walking tour guides pointed out to us that pickpockets are rife, given that they know tourists' attention is trained on the clock and not their belongings. We didn't walk up to the top of the clock tower, but it's supposed to have good views of the city. Instead we took the cable car to Petrin Hill and did the lookout tower for a view.

Pretty incredible. This clock sounds every hour on the hour and the crowds gather so pick your hour carefully. Avoid 10-3 during the day. You will need some explanation of how the 4 different types of the clock work whether you get this from a guide, or guidebook. We took a free walking tour - there are many so our guide explained it to us.
Amazing but short thing to do.. While seeing the tower and clock doesn't use hours of your time it is certainly worth a look. Especially considering its age.
Not sure what all the fuss is about. We went a couple of times and stood with the crowd to see it do its thing. It was ok. It's a must if you go to Prague but I wasn't thrilled.

If you do one thing in Prague.... The clock itself is great to see, don't expect anything too spectacular but it is definitely worth a watch! Gets very busy on the hour so show up 15mins before to get a good spot. Then, head up to the top of the tower for fantastic views of the city! Best to go around sunset in my opinion!

One of the main attractions. The clock is huge and nice to watch. We went there at 18:00 sharp and watched it in action together with all the people gathered there. It is very crowded and there is no way you can take a picture of it without hundreds of people in it. But it is not to be missed.
Clock and tower. Good fun and part of my Prague pass. Went early morning before the crowd. You can see forever from up in the top of the clock tower

A real must see when you are on vaction in the beautiful city of Prague. This is a real must see if you are on vacation in Prague. You can walk around in this part of the city for days and find new and gorgeous houses and streets, and interesting places all the time and the astronomical clock is just one of all the interesting and historical places and buildings you can see when you walk around in this part of the Old Town of Prague.
Beautiful view from the top. You will have to buy tickets & stand in a long queue post which u will have to climb the stairs if you dont have to wait for hours for your turn to the elevator

Take a trip to the top! Not to be missed!. While the clock is most interesting in and of itself. It can get crowded on the hour when people gather to see it in action. It is well worth going inside and purchasing a trip to the top (either by elevator or walking) where one can view the city and surrounding area from all sides of the tower. Take your camera as the panoramic views are fantastic! This turned out to be a real highlight of our time in Old Town.
In Prague ? have to see the clock. A very busy place on the Hour when the clock comes to life. Figures move, bells chime. Right on the Square so easy to find.

marvellous historical clock and beautiful tower. The tower offers a 360° panoramic view over the city. De elevator is something special. At the front of the tower, there is a historic and astronomic clock. Every hour, some of the figures play a little play. funny, and it attracks many spectators. Must see if you are in Prague.

Take binoculars. It is a must see, but I found it a little underwhelming after the build up the guidebooks had given it. It is best visited early or late as huge crowds gather well before the hourly "performance" begins during the day.

Lovely building and views but too busy. The building and the views are stunning, but it really is far too busy to enjoy it properly. It's alright when you're going up the stairs where there's a lot of space, but on top of the tower itself it gets very cramped. Sometimes people just refuse to let you pass even though there's enough space, so you can't even walk to the exit normally.Service at the ticket desk is extremely unfriendly and unprofessional, refusing to answer a very simply question that could be answered with one word. However, the people that work in the tower itself are very friendly and polite and there's one lady at the souvenir shop who's happy to tell you about how the tower works and what everything represents.I think there's more to see on the outside anyway and there are other areas that provide a great view of Prague which are not so crowded (Vysehrad, Letna Park for more distant views, Prague Castle for view on the city itself which is also busy but it's far more spacious).
Don't miss this fun. The Square is delightful and seeing the clock is a must. The clock is amazing and to think it was built in the 1400s makes it even more incredible

Beautiful. Really amazing to see the clock in action. You need to get there 10mins before the hour to get a good vantage point. Please read the history and be informed of the meaning of the clock before you go. A few times I heard people say "is that it"? Clearly the detail and history were lost on them!

Astronmical clock is worth spending some time. At one side of the old town hall you can find a speciql clock. It is worthwhile to spend some time at this masterpiece of art. Not only is it huge and elaborated, it is also a technical masterpiece. If you look at the art- side of it you can find many statues and paintings, and also the hands of the clock are one of a kind in the world. Looking from a technical perspective you wonder how people managed to bring information on time, sun, moon and several stars together in one piece of work. We waited for the bell at every full hour, if is ok to do, if you can spend a few minutes, but do not wait too long, it is not as if the playing statues do bring a lot of additional value to this masterpiece. Ok, the skelleton ringing the bell is funny.
Cool Buildng. Nice building with a very impressive Astronomical Clock (Europe's First).The chime is impressive with all the models moving and music (lots of crowds at this time)

Beautiful Views and a brilliantly disappointing show!. Prague is my favourite city so the clock was a must see! The whole clock experience is great and would recommend to anyone, the view from the top is breathtaking. Just be careful with your bags as pick pockets lurk around and in the lifts to the clock entrance.The show at the bottom of the clock was disappointing as expected, but its known for being that way so its a definite must see also! if you visit the area, definitely check these out.

An absolute must!. The clock is amazing. Be sure to see the chiming on the hour. You can also go to the top of the clock tower. There is a lift, but we took the stairs. The views from all sides are just stunning. You can look across the whole city. There are also little plaques with all the facts about lots of the buildings and sites that you can see.

Queue up to see the clock chime the hour.. We waited twice for the clock to chime the hour and to go through its little routine. We watched along with about 1,000 others. Worth some patience but try to get there early to be right in front of the clock. The buildings of the town hall are very impressive, they had preserved the facades and replaced the interiors. Worth a visit.
Very cool. This a very cool clock and you should try and see it when it does it thing on the hour. It is usually very crowed, but worth the wait.
Stunnig Place. If you are in Prague- you must pay a visit to this place. Its a beautiful place , always filled with thousands of Tourists .

Manic . This gets absolutely packed around 10 mins before the hour!! Every available space is taken to see the clock chime and the appearance of the 12 apostles. We did it early one Monington and this is the best time. When the clock has finished chiming the crowds normally applaud and cheer! !

Very Crowded and Not Much There. As our walking tour guide told us, the clock is a lot of waiting around for 30 seconds of disappointing. Yet, there are crowds milling under it at all hours. Going up to the tower is extremely crowded. It gets stuffy, particularly in the summer, when we were there, and the views aren't really all that spectacular.

Clock is interesting historically, but slightly underwhelming. There's a lot of hype about the clock, and it is certainly gorgeous and worth seeing and photographing. The actual movement is a bit underwhelming for those with modern eyes. It would get five stars from an 18th century peasant on a rare visit to the city. You will enjoy it more if you have a guide who explains he movement and the history or if you do a bit of reading first. Be prepared for a large number of tourists when the clock strikes the hour.
old town and famous clock. A must when visiting Prague. Visit the old town hall and wait together with the tourists for the clock to strike the hour. A masterpiece .

Great piece of time. Every hour the astronomical clock displays a certain number of saints. This masterpiece is so complex that a certain preparation might be useful. Wikipedia could be an option. When visiting make sure you have a good look on the windows above the clock. This is where it happens. But this is also what all the hundreds of other tourists know as well :-)

Great piece of time. Every hour the astronomical clock displays a certain number of saints. This masterpiece is so complex that a certain preparation might be useful. Wikipedia could be an option. When visiting make sure you have a good look on the windows above the clock. This is where it happens. But this is also what all the hundreds of other tourists know as well :-)

Must visit location but be prepared to fight your way through crowds.. Beautiful square and buildings so worth a visit to see these. Lots of "entertainers" dotted around but nothing you do not see in every other European City. Busy and crowded so watch out for pickpockets. Plenty of cafes dotted around from which you can enjoy a drink and people watch.

Interesting clock...with a great view!. If you want to get a bird's eye view and have a coffee, tea, food or dessert, go into the Mozart Cafe (when you are facing the clock, turn around). Find the man dressed in his Mozart finery, and ask to go upstairs. You can sit peacefully in a beautiful cafe at a window right in front of the clock and drink coffee, eat lovely desserts and watch the clock do its thing for all of a minute.
Clock is amazing. The clock is amazing. It helped that we visited on a sunny day. There are plenty of places to get an ice cream to enjoy it. Would definitely recommend

Interesting historic site. Loved the clock and the old historical part of town with its narrow streets lined with cozy restaurants and cute shops.It's beautiful and worthwhile visiting however, the hordes of tourists flocking in front of the building when the clock is about to strike makes the experience less enjoyable. Next time I'll come "off-season" because there were just too many people.Prague is an architectural marvel that needs to be enjoyed to the fullest without being constantly bumped into by uninterested tourists who don't seem to appreciate the beauty of the city.

Old Town Hall & Astronomical Clock. Old Town Hall is an ornate building - but the Astronomical clock took my interest. It is not electric or battery and provides all types of information on day/ weather etc. On the hour it comes to live and you have 45 seconds to watch and take in the movements.
Vacation 2012. Another great attraction in Prague. We didn't go up to the top but there was so many people that we decided to do it on our next visit.

Stunning. This clock is one of the most beautiful things I think anybody will ever see, definitely hand around for it to strike upon the hour, it's something that you should say that you have seen once!

When the bell tolls. A place to be when the hour is up. 2 small windows open and statues revolves in them.The place is generally crowded but I feel that it is the best place to be in Prague. Lots of eating joints.Be careful of pickpockets.

Whoopie. Watching the clock chime 'the hour' seems to be one of the things to do in Prague. Really I found it to be an anti-climatic non-event. The one in Berne, Switzerland, has much more action from the 'characters'. The most fascinating things are the mechanics of his the clock works and the information on the clock faces.

Wow, what a treat for the eye. What a sight to see such an intricate and delicate piece of work in working order and the history around it is very interesting. Do go with a guide as they are very knowledgeable about the stories and history. Would love to go and see it again.

one of a kind. there will be thousands of people waiting in the square to see this amazing Astronomical Clock which every hour you will see the clocks tower open and the figures come out and back again

Beautiful views. The view of Prague from the tower was beautiful. You have to pay to go up the tower, but it is worth it. The clock itself is also unbelievably beautiful. It is better to go out of season as it is very busy in the school holidays.The tower is in the square in the middle of the old town.
Great Walk. If you are at the old town, make sure to walk to the astronomical clock. Great place and absolutely beautiful.

Disappointed. The clock is very beautiful to look at - since its very intricate and colourful. However, when it starts working it is nothing special. It's over in less than a minute and nothing happens. I was so disappointed since people rave about it's beauty.
Must come to see when the clock strikes the hour. It's being a tourist at its schlockiest, but it's so much fun to watch the characters move around when the clock strikes the hour. Not to be missed.
nice. could be little crowded in the ringing time. but its worth it as it is spacial peace of made. its all in one place of the old-town squire

Very busy tourist area. The clock is an exceptional piece of equipment and artwork, particularly when you know the history associated with its construction. The piazza area around the town hall and clock are usually packed with tourists, especially on the hour to see the clock perform, but you need to put up with this during peak season.
Underwhelming . Very pretty but the crowds when the clock is about to strike the hour is intense! Its nice to look at but that's about it

Nice and crowded. It is definitely an impressive place. The buildings are picturesque, the atmosphere is carefree and it is commercialized to the bone. Centrally located, it is surrounded by shops and restaurants and as such, it is crowded day and night.But, still, touristic or not, the Old Town Hall is a place one passes through and, despite its downsides, worth a visit.

Crowded, but worth a look. We have been to Prague a couple of times and this area is almost always crowded. When the clock is about to chime the crowds begin to show. Try to get there a tad early to get a spot for good viewing. It's a must see when in Prague and doing the tourist thing.

Glad i've seen it. The history of the building and the architecture is most impressive, we just happened to be passing on the hour so watched with hundreds of others. I would recommend hanging around to see it if you are passing at ten to but if you have a longer than fifteen minutes wait then just enjoy the wonder of the building and the rest of the square.
Love this. This is a must thing in Prague its a must see at the top of the hour it can be be crowded but its a thing that defines Prague

Lunch time at the Old Town Hall. It is one of those things to tick off the list when going to Prague, but there is not that much to see. Across the square you could see the large bells being peeled in another church. Good to see, but don't expect too much.
Awesome. Had to read about its history, still not quite sure how it operates, and I certainly cant read it ... but, its a sight to see in Prague Old Town.

Very crowded. Take a guided tour.. We visited this place a couple of times (during all hours). The least crowded time is before 11 am.We eventually decided to take a guided tour and I'm glad we did. There are a lot of very interesting stories surrounding this ancient clock, and it would be a shame to see it without knowing its spooky history.

Well worth the time. Our tour guide explained in detail how the clock was built, why and how it works. I would like to live in Prague just to watch this clock in operation. We were lucky enough to be there when it striked the hour. It was magnificent. I only wish that we could have gone inside the tower to see all the gears and intricate features of the clock. Do go if you have the opportunity.

Way Cool !! . I have been visiting old town for many years and have noticed a huge difference...people! More Asians and non-white non-western folks. Older Czechs are also becoming friendlier. It's a good thing! This is such a nice square with lots of restaurants, shops, and people to gawk at. No Czech, no problem...English is widely spoken here including menus and signs. And THE CLOCK...this requires some close look first before getting online to figure out how to read it. Every hour, the crowd grows bigger and bigger in front of it and rendering the area impossible to get around. People from all over hold up their phones and cameras to record the hourly chime and the moving figurines. After the second time, it gets old. But I like to stand away from the crowd and instead, I people-watch...the best sport in Old Town. So soak in the history, learn the culture, and take lots of pictures. And enjoy your fellow humans!
Visit the clock terrace. You just must get up there! I mostly recommend to be up there at a round hour. The best view of the old town.

Don't expect fireworks!. Although the Astronomical Clock is a big deal having been conserved throughout the centuries, it's really not that big of a spectacle for the expectations of millennials. That being said, it's a very beautiful clock and the trumpet solos every hour are very nice.

Amazing clock!. We walked around all morning and were able to watch the clock on the hour chime. There were a lot of people waiting and it was worth it! To think how old the clock is and that it still captivates people is amazing.
Go with a guide!. Get a free tour in the city to listen about the history of this amazing Clock. You will definitely want to take a few pics in this spot.

GOOD BUT WE EXPECTED TO SEE MORE.. I think this was a case of an attraction being built up too much above our expectations. Yes it was very good, the history of it etc, how on earth was it even thought of never mind built ? But when the clock struck "one" I'm sure apart from my wife and I, many people in the large crowd expected to see more.

There is a story behind the art work and the clock still functions!. First, it is a clock that was first installed in 1410 and it is still functional. Second, it represents months, days, and zodiac signs with each day having a name. Next, it is beautiful. It chimes and performs every hour on the hour. It is worth a visit for the artwork and for appreciating the square in which it is located. If you get to see it function, that is bonus.

Math science nerd awesome. Before watching the clock show on the hour, read up on how it works and what it does. AMAZING!!! Then watch it, walk by and check a few time to see the changes. The show is short but worth a 5minute wait, because it is easy to miss.

It's.... A clock. A lot of tourists gather here to see this clock. And that's probably the most special thing about this clock. Every somewhat minutes the clock rings its bells and people are clapping for it. Not all that spectacular.

What a nut-head selling tickets . The clock is something special but we wanted to go to the tower. It took the nut-head 3 minutes to decide to speak to me. Within 3 seconds his attention turned to his cell phone again !,!!! I can never understand why people like this bother to get up in the mornings. The people gathering around the clock all the time bugs me a bit because, although very beautiful it is still only a clock. Don't visit on the hour as it will feel like leaving Wembley stadium after a game.

On the Hour in Prague. Finally on our last day in Prague, we were in Old Town shortly before the clock was to strike on the hour. The crowd was gathered in the square and we found a place to eat right in front of the clock to await the opening of the windows. Great fun and such a beautiful Astronomical Clock. No idea how to read it, except the one at the top that strikes the hour. Guess I should have taken a tour to ask my question.

Astronomical Clock. The Skeleton and the 12 Apostles put on quite a show at the top of each hour - on the hour (except for quiet hours for the Hotel guests a few feet away). After the show, you can ride the elevator up the Tower, for breathtaking views of the City.

Read the history first!. The clock rings on the hour, every hour, so see it once as you walk by, then read all about it, and come see it again. You'll be awed by it the second time around. Guaranteed.

If you have extra time. WHile all the sites recommend this I would suggest if you are in the old town square near the top of the hour, go watch the apostles circle around. IT is similar to many such clocks in European town squares. THere are big crowds and we were warned that it contains many pickpockets, so be careful.

Busy. Very busy. Lots of tourists.
A very vibrant part of the city, with market stalls, street entertainment and several foodie outlets. Enjoy!
Free time tour. Unbelievable structure in a great tourist location with plenty of food venues Cafe and restaurants The only annoying facet is the number of Sedgeways' touting for business.

Beautiful square- but the clock doesn't really do anything!! . While on a tour of the city, the tour guide had declared the astronomical clock to be the second greatest disappointment in Europe after the Mona Lisa. Having seen the latter I must disagree and say this one is even less impressive- merely because the expectations for a spectacular show every hour led us to laugh at the hundreds (including ourselves) gazing up in confusion.Literally almost nothing happened! We enjoyed the experience nonetheless- it's just worth to not raise your expectations :)The clock itself is lovely, just don't bother staying there for the bells...

See it day or night (or both, if you can!). We were lucky enough to see the Astronomical Clock by night and by day, at the top of the hour when it went off. Such an interesting piece of history - even better if you can get a local or a guide to tell you about its intricacies!

Short but worth it. We were on an Old Town tour and our guide included this as part of the tour. Every hour, on the hour this old clock does a little show. The great part about seeing it in our tour is our guide and a lot of knowledge about the old clock. This is worth seeing. Be there 15 min early to get a good vantage point. If you don't have a tour guide, read up on the clocks history and the info about the moving parts.

Just in time for the clock to strike. We were on a city tour through our Viking Cruise pre sail trip. The tour guide had us in front of the clock just in time. I am so glad she did, people gathered and waited for it to strike There are many restaurants and shops in the area. Make it a point to be here and enjoy the show. I always enjoy a guided tour at the first on any city visit.
Great view. One of a kind. Try to avoid the lines and buy your tickets early or you could spend a long time waiting. View is worth it. Beautiful city

Astronomical Clock.... The astronomical clock is very nice to look at and take a few pictures, but don't even bother waiting for the Apostle Parade (hourly - when the hour changes)... if you do it any way, remember the parade only happens from 9am to 11pm.
a must see. a must see for visitors to the old town in Prague, the clock chimes on the hour, then little doors open and little figures come out and dance by
lively place. When you visit the astronomical clock do wait till the clock strikes the hour, you get to see the full clock in action at that time.
Interesting . The astronomical clock itself is somewhat underwhelming despite the intriguing design and history. Located conveniently close to numerous other sites.
Busy busy. This must be one of the go to places. Heaps of people, but certainly worth a look. We were told to be cautious of pick pocketing, but didn't sense this! Heaps of history to appreciate.

A must visit! Awesome!. When visiting Prague, Old Town is a must visit and even recommend staying in this area. The architecture is simply breathtaking and amazing to look at. In and around the square you will find it bustling with people and tourists alike, and find yourself taken back in time. There is so much to see and do here including the famous astronomical clock where you can go to the top and take some amazing pictures of the view from above for memories to cherish for a lifetime. You will find a lot of segway tour companies soliciting your business, but don't fret, and I highly recommend chatting them up. It was a great way to see the city and visit some really cool spots in a unique way. I highly suggest Cool Segway Tours as they were awesome setting up our private tour and you can't beat the value. But again the square and entire Old Town area is a happening place with plenty of shops, restaurants and cafes to enjoy and take in all scenery has to offer. Don't miss walking around out of the square and going down all the side streets too as you you'll find lots of interesting places and more of the same to enjoy. Certainly a great place to visit.

Fantastic Clock and a must to visit. Really busy in July but must go to the top to see an excellent view of Prague. Once you have got your tickets and are looking to go in to the entrance do not take the lift as landed up having to walk back down to the start.

Architecture rich - and mobbed. Yes, tourists from around the world home in on this beautiful urban space. Ringed with restaurants, the old world urban architecture is very rich, brooded over by the towers of the Tyn Church. Every hour on the hour, crowds form to watch the astronomical clock.

Check it out. You wont know what to expect but you must watch the hourly displayOnce we had a tour guide explain to us what was really going on it made it much more interesting that just looking at a clock tower It is also worth it to pay to climb up to the top of the tower and see a 360 view of Prague
Great experience . Each hour the clock puts on a nice show. Try to time your visit around the top of the hour. You won't regret it. Great for kids as well.

Don't stand too close.. The clock is actually around the corner of the main square and huge crowds wait for it to chime. We thought that the figures came out of a door and moved across the front then went back in again, they actually just move past a window near the top of the tower. As we were stood near the front of the crowd we did not have the best vantage point. If you are in the area check it out but I wouldn't make a special trip.

Remarkable if you understand it!. This clock is breathtaking but the additional information we received during a free walking tour (which we would recommend) made it seem all the more remarkable! Well worth a watch!

Great place and the astronomical clock is just a wonder. This place has been reconstructed after the Second World War as it was destroyed in the fight, but they have done an amazing job to keep the key features intact. The absolute two highlights are the clock and the chimes activity and movement on the hours and climbing the tower for a great view of the old town

Good meeting point -- and so convenient for pickpockets. Big crowds gather to watch the astronomical clock strike the hour. I don't think all the components of the clock were working the day we saw it. A majestic (and historically inaccurate) statue of Jan Hus is at the center of the square. You can hire a ride in a horse-drawn carriage or a classic convertible here, and there are many restaurants and cafes.
Must get there. Must get up and see the view. We were there in summer time holidays so it was unbelievably crowded! A bit hard to navigate to the entrance, they need more signs.

Amazing. Visited the clock about four times while we where in Prauge it is a beautiful setting and a fascinating thing to watch ,it is always extremely busy in this area but strangely it is still easy to get pictures of the clock as people seem to give you room ,gets really busy leading up to the hour mark as that's when the figures moves and the clock chimes,this is a lovely area to spend some time lots of cafes round it but some only let you sit if you are having food and are a little pricey compared to others in the city

Huge, Important & Beautiful. Very crowded, because of the attraction of the Astronomical Clock. Loved the place, as it was filled with activities such as: there were different eateries near the clock, front and corner, then you will find people driving in the Segway, vendors selling their stuff, some shows even. Saw the 5pm musical show of the clock, it was raining but even then full crowded. It was excellent, the four statues showing the cycle of life: birth, wealth,lust and death.

The clock. We watched the clock many times on our trip but our best vantage point was from the top of the tower looking down at all the people. The views from the tower were amazing. If there is a line for the elevator, just walk up ...
Beautiful Clock. Beautiful Clock with a wery interresting histori. our guide had a lot of information about the making og the clock. We didt not see the town hall

Pretty and interesting. Interwsting piece of history and engineering. Large crowds gather on the hour which gives some atmosphere. Worth a visit. Didnt climb up it as the humidity at our visit was so intense and we chose to climb one of the other focal points

Timeless and artistic. Don't miss this clock and do try to be there a bit before noon to see the clock's own show. It is a lovely work of art in itself, in a very interesting location, and has a place in history.
Prague Anniversary trip. Go early in the day to avoid the crowds. The tower is great, the clock is okay, but don't get too excited.
Charming. It's well worth the wait and dealing with the crowds to see this charming scene of the disciples emerging from the clock. Children in particular will love it.

History worth Visiting. During our short stay in Prague, we visited the Astronomical Clock to see the clock strike at 11am, and on the next day, we visited both the observation deck of the clock tower, and took the tour of the Old Town Hall.The clock itself presents a display of the apostles of Jesus when the clock strikes the hour, and a hanging skeleton rings the bell. The display is cute, but short, lasting perhaps 40 seconds at most. Of course, this does not stop the massive crowds of people from assembling to see it.The next day, we took the tour of the Old Town Hall, which offered a comprehensive and interesting look at the Old Town Hall with stories of its history and many interesting historical relics to view. The tour is available in numerous languages, scheduled at different times throughout the day.The clock tower is accessible to the public (for a fee), and it is definitely worth ascending to the top for some breaktaking 360-degree views of Prague. The most appealing view is that of the Old Town Square, encompassing the Jan Hus Memorial, wide variety of architecture along the square and surrounding streets; and the imposing and impressive gothic architecture of the Church of Our Lady before Týn.Despite the touristy nature of the venue, it is worth a visit, but be aware that the observation deck can become crowded rather quickly, and there is very little room on the exterior deck, so my recommendation is to arrive early before crowds of people descend upon the area.

You have to see it, but don't blink. By the time you get to prague you have to se this clock. The movement and show is very short, but when you realize what the clock is tracking you will realize how truly amazing its engineering actually was.

Astronomical clock . It is interesting due to its age and clever design but feels unimpressive as an attraction. Lot of people left with a shrug. .. is that it? When in central Prague you should time your walk through the area so you see it but don't go out of your way or expect anything special

Not worth waiting in the rain atleast. We discovered the place because there were too many people waiting. Unless you have a short wait time please don't wait. If it is raining, you can skip waiting. The experience is too short and nothing spectacular.
Beautiful. The astronomical clock is really beautiful and worth a visit, but if you can't stay for the "clock-show", don't mind it, it's not so spectacular.

Tick Tock- the beautiful clock. I loved this place, pretty,historical and wonderful for people watching. You can sit and have a lovely meal and drink with the family or friends and watch the clock perform on the hour. Its magical and worth staying to see, children will adore it-fab

Beautiful clock. Climb the tower it's a nice view of Old Town. There is a lift for those who choose or cannot climb. The clock it's a beautiful site. It rings/chimes and the figures move but it is crowded every single time. Not to keen on posting my travel pics on here because ppl can steal them. Then again they can steal them from my IG as well.
A Masterpiece!. Marvel at the grand architecture. Embrace the magnificent engineering. Be prepared for throngs of tourists at this site. Not to be missed!

Waste of Time! Ha, get it?. We hadn't planned on going here, but just ended up at the back of a hoard of people at 5 minutes to 2 or some other hour. People were getting so excited to see a massive clock! Not I. I tried starting a New Years Eve style '10, 9, 8....', but people were on a different wave length and didn't join in. When the clock thing happened, I have never been so underwhelmed. A man actually clapped at the end. And when I say end, I didn't know it had finished. I thought the thing that happened was just the warm up act or something. The ice cream just down the road was nice though. I had watermelon and my daughter had pear. Top marks for the ice cream. Very little for the clock.
Where's the point about ist?. There is a clock, some wheels are turning, a skeleton pulls a string... I did'nt find a point aubout that. I guess it is overrated.
Such a charming place. It's a really charming place and a must see if you are in Praha. The place does seem to be filled with tourists waiting for the clock.

Very cool example of what old world genius accomplished. This is an amazing example of how a successful city parlayed its wealth into functional yet beautiful buildings. The story of the creator/builder of the Astronomical Clock provides insight into the cruelty and naked greed of those in power. I will let the reader research the story for themselves. Keep an eye out for pickpockets and theives, but the worst we saw was a drunken man and aggressive elderly woman in confilct, then a pilfered tip from a restaurant table. The art museum across from the Town Hall offers various installations- Dali, Warhol, and Mucha (a favorite son of Prague) were on display while we were there with admission for under $15.

Cool concept. The astronomical clock is a major attraction in Prague. It is pretty amazing with how they made the clock and story behind it. However the performance / movement of the clock on the hour hand was a bit boring. Not worth waiting for. Just go 2 mins before it starts. Everyday 9 to 9

Quaint AND Exciting. The town center bustles with excitement , outdoor restaurants and shopping ! THE CLOCK is a major attraction. On the hour everyone stops and waits for the clock to move and chime. It is worth getting there a little early to get a good position to video all the excitement. The building designs are breathtaking and the shopping is fun.Prague has every right to be proud of it's Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. If you are visiting Prague this location IS A MUST SEE !
Way cool! . Watch for pick pockets and enjoy the show. Great display of rooster, monks and saints, etc. every hour on the hour.

An Icon of Prague!. This clock dates back to 1410 and although it's been damaged and restored many times, it still proudly boasts being the oldest working clock in the world, making it a must-see while in Old Town. It's located in the main square, so you really can't miss it! A few minutes before the strike of every hour, crowds gather to watch the clock do its thing, which is almost anticlimactic, but still interesting to watch.

Astronoical Clock Splendour. One of the hifglights of Prague. The area in front of the clock gets very crowded on the hour. Try to avoid being near a group as the guides will drown out the sounds with their constant commentary. I was disappointed that there were a limited number of moving figures. However, for its age and its almost total destruction on more than one occasion, we are lucky that it has survived.

Such a beautiful building and history. On a rainy stormy day in Prague went up the tower. Elevator all the way if you want it but we chose to go up the very easy ramps to the top..great history panels about the building on the way. Views were stunning..fantastic fun being up there in the storm!

Astronomical clock is a must see. Beautiful and very old clock. A must see when in Prague. It rings every hour on the hour and it is extremely crowded with tourists at this time, but worth it. Just beautiful. The whole square is beautiful!

Astronomical clock. It was interesting to watch the clock at the hour. The figures move inside. Well worth a picture, however, an even better picture was of the crowd watching. You can climb up to the top of the tower and watch the crowd below and get a great view of the square

A quick "thing to do". The Astronomical Clock is worth seeing - amazing in that it has been in working order for hundreds of years. You haven't missed much if you don't see the apostles rotating by the 2 windows on the hour, but if you like ticking off items on a list, its over in a matter of seconds. A huge crowd congregates there all of a sudden every hour, then disperses immediately afterwards. Like a flash mob. Amusing to see in itself.

Old Town and Astronomical Clock. If you really want to learn the culture and history of Old Town I suggest taking a tour. Numerous are available. To really appreciate Old Town I think you need to know the history. Same goes for the Astronomical Clock. The clock strikes every hour in case you would like to record it. Go during the week to this area if you don't want it to be so crowded. You can cover Old Town and the Castle in two days.
Wow.. Worth sitting in the bar with a cool drink. Plenty of tourists gathered round with cameras. Very busy area around the town square

Breathtaking!!. Getting there as it chimes is a really spectacular show- make sure you try and make it. there were plenty of christmas stalls around when i was there, so while waiting i was able to browse and get some great photos. definitely worth a visit!

A must see!. Seeing the astronomical clock on the hour is a must see. It is the only working astronomical clock in Europe! The display of the 12 apostles appearing is really cool. Beware, however, that it tends to be very crowded and ripe for pickpockets. Also, it is worth it to go up to the tower . The views were great. Also, sign up for the optional tour of the rooms inside the tower. It was very interesting and we got to see the apostles moving from the inside.

Astronomical clock and old town hall. I love the fact that the clock is accurately featured on Leo which is the sign that the sun is in right now. The clock is huge and is a fabulous feature of the square.The old town hall is well worth checkin g out as well.
Amazing. It was fun watching the clock strike the hours and see the action figures. The square is abounding with activity, eating, and shops. A great find.
City centre walk. Historic city centre with at the hour mini show at the clock :) ull understand what I mean when u r there at the hour ...
Gorgeous!. Must visit when you go to Prague!!!! The clock dates back to 1410!!!! So beautiful!! Old town hall is very nice as well. There are lots of places to eat around the area as well!
Impressive. Lovely clock- but it's a clock folks. You cannot miss it as in Summer it's constantly surrounded by tourists waiting for it to strike the hour! Interesting history... For a clock!
Must see place. If you visit Prag, Astronomic Clock and Old Town Hall is the first place that you must visit. The mystique air around is really wonderfull. They protected it for years.

Historical Clock!. We were there a few minutes before 5PM to watch the clock come alive. This was part of our all inclusive tour where it ended at the old town square. The clock was so charming as every hour it chimes & the characters come alive & move around. It was a delight to see!
Astronomical Clock. Best viewed on the hour but not around noon as the sun obliterates the figures who appear when the clock strikes the hour
THE BEST VIEW!. The view from this tower is probably the thing I liked the most of Prague. You will feelm as bird flying between buildings.

Beautiful square, skeleton and saints. This square is popular and always crowded but can't be missed!
On the hour the skeleton representing Death on the Astronomical Clock rings the bell, the 12 apostles walk.
hhourly entertainment. Lots of cafes across from the clock so you can sit, have a drink and wait for the creatures to immerge.

Fantastic orology. One of the main sights. Make sure you are with some one who can explain it all or have a good guide book that can explain it. It does a hundred things and be sure to see it strike the hour.

A delightful treasure. We visited here last November.,What a piece of work.
It's amazing.
Read up on its History.It was not a good outcome for the designer.

Dancing skeletons-you bet. . The Astronomical clock is worth seeing, especially on the hour when circles move and a skeleton dances. The square gets very crowded, but since you have to look up to see the clock, all the spots are good ones.

Beautiful square. This square is popular and always crowded but can't be missed! On the hour the skeleton on the Astronomical Clock rings the bell and four figures present themselves. Fun and historical!

Beautiful clock. Every one hour there is music and characters dance inside the clock. Must see, Its the oldest clock of such kind. Similar clock is there in Munich too but that was build few centuries later

We were there at 10AM.... ...so we saw ten of the apostles show up and greet us... it takes a while to figure out the clock. It even shows sunrise and sunset info...Did you know it's the oldest working clock of it's kind in the world. Don't miss the story and the folklore surround this wonder.

very crowded. waited with the crowds for the astronomical clock. Good but not as much as it was hyped. It was very busy hence was a bit uncomfortable with the belongings. Lots of restaurants around. Worth seeing once if you can stand the crowds

Prague Astronomical Closk. This clock is a must see while in Prague. It's in the Old Town area, so you will be able to visit other attractions in the same area as well. The clock chimes every hour, on the hour. Very cool to see. Hard to believe it was built so many years ago, and still functions today. We also did the tour inside the town hall, and from within the building, you get to see the inner workings of the clock. And, learn that there are only 2 people who are educated enough to work on this clock! Very impressive. Must see while in Prague.

Arrive early. Clock chimes on the hour so arrive half an hour earlier and find a table in opposite cafe, preferably with high stools, so you can enjoy the wait and spectacle with a brilliant view and a drink!
