Astronomical clock, the best in Czech Republic. Astronomical clock, the best in Czech Republic but not the best in the world. It's must to see in Prague, but not worth to wait more than 15 minutes for figures to move
Is that all?. Expected a lot more of the astronomical clock spectacle so I was a bit disappointed. Nice area of Prague and yes, a must see.

Whats all the fuss about.. OK so you cannot go to Prague and not go to see the Astronomical Clock which is in The Old Town Square. We're told that on the hour there is a spectacular display, well if you call a skeleton on one side of the clock pulling on a rope that rings a bell, another on the other side turning its head back and forth and some figures at the top of the clock going round and round a spectacular display I feel sorry for you. The clock itself is a marvellous piece of machinery to look at with its 3 faces, but, that's about it. There are crowds of people turn up to see this "display" only for half of them to go away disappointed. Watch out for pickpockets!!!
Crowded place but amazing . Actually stunning square and clock. We enjoyed every minute of our stay. Place is amazing and is surrounded by a lot of animated small streets. Lovely

Amazinggg ..... . Its enchanting ... and beautifully made ... that too back den ... m sure out of d world ... there are loads of resturants arnd which r amazing have to sit there sip wine or beer n enjoi the beauty if the clock and every hr they have band that cmes and performs ..

Another 'must' in a 'must see' city. Our first night, we took a walking tour around the older city and learned all about the clock. We then returned to watch it on the hour the following day. Sitting at an outdoor cafe was a great way to get an unobstructed view but watch out. Some of the cafes have nasty practices like bringing you larger drinks than you ordered and charging double. Read the fine print on the menu and don't be duped.

Do not come with high expectations... To be honest, this clock is remarkable and adorable once you considered when it's built and what it's been doing so far :)The main problem about the expectations.. When you see more than 500 people holding cell phones and cameras to the clock and waiting for the bell, you think something big is going to happen (no matter if you read what is going to happen)Then once the shoe is over, you'll hear the silence of the unsatisfied people :) My suggestion; just come to see what is happening and enjoy :)

You want history?. Wowzers, this is too cool! I must say, we had great weather first of all. Second, this square and the clock blow your mind away! All the beautifull buildings, this IS culture! A MUST see! Trust us. You can go there by yourself or take a quided tour who will show you around, what is whise for the great details. Have fun.

Truly iconic. Of course, this site has become something of a cliche, and the souvenir shops are packed with replicas. Also, it's very crowded with tourists, especially just before the top of each hour. Still, it's quite a spectacle, and not to be missed. And "bravo" to anyone who can figure out what everything means. Even if you can't figure it out, just enjoy.
Crowded. A common example of European old market square - with old flats and churches. In the center you will find also a Jan Hus monument.Astronomical clock show is a bit dissapointing
European vacation . Astronomical clock is just that, astronomical, very nice, it is a must see, very different, would definitely go there again, old town hall is great also.

Take time to watch the clock when it chimes. This is the oldest operating astronomical clock in the world today. Make sure to get there before the top of the hour so you can be near the front of the crowd (maybe 20 minutes), and beware of pickpockets.

Cool.. Very cool clock, especially since we had our guide from the walking tour explaining it. Without explanation, I believe it can lead to some frustration, since it's not a very splendid and glamorous clock by itself
Go early!. If you want to take a picture without loads of tourists, again, early in the morning is the best bet.

great landmark - a must see when the clock strikes the hour. This is one of the places you have to visit when in Prague. The best time is when the clock strikes the hour when all the skeletons etc come our to play. There are plenty of cafes here BUT are pricey so you have to off the square to get a much cheaper deal

Beautiful. Prague is a beautiful city, and the Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock is THE place to go.
Try to be near the clock by the hour and have your camera ready!

Must see. This is one of those things you have to see when in Prague! The clock is a little basic and doesn't last long, but it is a must see. We went early morning for the first one at 9am and there weren't so many people
sightseeing. we stopped to admire this clock but did not take the opportunity to go inside as time (ha ha no pun intended) was not on our side) beautiful craftsmanship
The interesting clock is here!. I was tried to understand what is the clock functioning by seeing it for a while. It is pretty unique photo spot. Perhaps now it has PokeStop there =)

Beautiful. Very very busy . Its a lovely clock take some time to look at it when there are less crowds (not around the hour mark) I admired it more after our tour when I had learnt about all the history what the dials ment etc . The display it does on the hour is nice and worth watching but don't expect a full disneylike production with lights and fireworks it's just some moving wooden men

Great view from old town. I have been there with my wife during Christmas, and the visit to the tower was a nice surprise. We had an outstanding view from the square, with its Christmas lights at night. It is unforgettable.

Views from top worth seeing!. This whole area of Prague is just stunning. Spend a few bucks and go to the top for the 360 views...you will not regret it. Walk around and see the many historical buildings. Take half day woalking tour to learn more about this beautiful city! An electric bike tour is the best way to see the many bridges and parks.

Worth the Crowds. Be sure and be there before the clock strikes the hour to get a good viewing position. People start gathering about 15 minutes before the hour. Only lasts 15 seconds so watch it instead if trying to take pictures the first time. Be sure and read up on all the different aspects of the clock so you will know what all the moving parts mean.
Old town. Fabulous place to just walk, meet new people and eat good food!The clock is quite something to see.Amazing city!

must see in prague. You will end up here without even trying as all roads in old town seem to lead to the main square and this beautiful clock. Prague is very touristy but it doesn't matter...it is a gorgeous old town with the most amazing architecture. This clock is one of the beauties
Very Neat Attraction. This is one of the most visited attractions in Prague. If you want to get good photos and beat the crowds, come early. It is not to be missed.
More excellence. Same as my other post about Prague.. I don't have enough words to describe the beauty and awe surrounding this city!!

The area and the clock is a must. Area is full of tourists but it's so beautiful that you will not even tell. Full of restuarants and pubs. Great place to hang out. Clock every hour has a cool show too
Check out quick trips and tips on youtube for tip videos.

Beautiful clock, ceremony and views from the top!. This is the second must-see attraction in Prague for any visitor. The clock strikes every hour and without fail, a huge crowd gathers to witness the spectacle. TIP: Make sure you are there at least 5 mins before the hour strikes, so that you can get a decent viewing spot in front of the crowd.TIP: Do go to the top of the viewing tower above the Astronomical Clock... it's a magical experience to go on top, with the narrow stone staircase, the ultra-modern elevator right in the middle of the clock tower, the castle-like turret viewing towers! Do not miss!!TIP: Be sure you spare enough time to go up the viewing tower. We bought tickets to go up during the twilight hour, but only managed to reach up after nightfall :( We could still see the views, but not as much fun as during day time. The queues to go up can be hour to two-hrs long at times.
Get ready for large crowds.. Watching the clock at the expected on the hour ritual is a great experience with the entire area filled with onlookers.

Tour. We purchased "skip the line" tickets for the Astronomical Clock Tower online thru Trip advisor. We were given access to the tower and a tour of the hall. Started the tour by watching the clock at the hour from the coffee shop across the street.  There is an elevator available. I recommend you take the elevator the tower then go down the stairs, so you can read/view the history of the tower. The hall is beautiful and it is a treat to see to clock statues up close.

Too many tourist and disapointed by the astronomical clock. The old town is very beautiful as all buidings around but too many tourist in afternnon. But in early morning is so beautiful. But the we were disapointed to wait 15 minutes under hard sun just to see the 1 minute in action the famous astronomical clock , the Strabourg and other ones in the world are far better than this one.
Interesting . Very interesting and in a beautiful area to take your time and wander through looking at all that history has preserved.
Actually pretty cool. So the clock strikes every hour, and it's pretty cool to see, a must when your in Prague,Try to arrive 15 minutes before so you can get the best view

Underwhelming. Even after understanding the story of the puppets that move at the top of the hour, it was quite disappointing. I thought the clock puppet show in Krakow's Jagellonian university was better (at least there was music and the puppets came out). More entertaining is watching the disappointment on other tourists faces after the puppets are done. Still it is a mechanical marvel to witness.

Still working since 1500. Ok, many people may say the 15- 20 second show is overrated ... but I think that is ridiculous when you realize this clock has been working and accurate since the 1500s... or maybe actually the 1400s. Don't miss it ...and get a decent tour guide or write up so you know what the multiple dials and decor mean.
I love this city. The clock was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still operating.

Marvellous structure . The astronomical clock is right in the centre of the city. Beautifully designed and maintained, it attracts a huge crowd around it at the stroke of every hour when the apostles appear. In an incredible engineering feat they have managed to build an elevator inside the main tower which takes you right up.. The views of the town are truly spectacular. We went crazy just clicking pictures! Reminded me of the views from the tower in Venice's St Marks square..A must visit...

A must see when in PRG. This is the heart of the town... The Astronomical Clock is truly a great piece of art work done centuries ago & still clicking on the dot... The movements that chime on the hour, every hour is a huge tourist attraction...

disappointing. on the hour, two little windows above the clock open and the 12 apostles go by at speed , 6 in the left window and 6 in the right. I wasted 20 minutes of my life waiting for a bad punch and judy show.
Try to go early to avoid the large crowds. Interesting and great photo scene and try to make it on the hour if you can but earlier than noon as it was very crowded

You need to do it just because you are in Prague. Crowded, all waiting for the top of the hour - yes it's cool but once is enough. We had a nice table under a cafe safe from the rain and crowds to view it from.

Be sure to climb the tower. Watching the movements in the clock is fun as long as you can put up with all of the peopel, but be sure to climb to the top of the tower, where the view of the square is wonderful.

A must see when in Prague. This is one of many places to visit while in Prague. The town square is very busy on the hour as people gather to watch the apostles move as the clock rings out. One just has to be diligent of the possibility of pickpockets when there are that many visitors. There are several sidewalk restaurants, shops and an open air market that offers a huge variety of items and souvenirs.

People love cuckoos. This huge cuckoo clock always seems to have a crowd parked in front of it snapping photos and making intricate calculations I'm sure. Don't get me wrong, I'm impressed by intricate clock works and the craftsmanship involved - this one's just not that impressive. If you need to check this one off on your bucket list do so, and then quickly move along so as not to block traffic.

Do not miss this. I forget what time the clock goes off but when it does this little square fills up with tourists. The show is nice to say the least. Before and after the show you can get photos when not so many are around. There is a clock tour as well, but I still have not taken it.

Get there at 10 to the hour. If you want to see the clock strike you need to get there before the hour. Never seen so many people. Worth a visit though. Restaurants are very expensive around here though as you would expect so walk a little along the backstreets and you will get same meal for a third of the price
Nice place. Its a nice place to explore the city by walk. You definetly need a guide to understand how the astronomical clock works

Nice concept, lots of history. This is one of the most iconic places you can visit in Prague, an Astronomical clock which has been operating for around 700 yrs, with a few disruptions in between.This is normally the meeting points for various city tours, so the front of this land mark is quite busy. The clock is close to the town hall and St Nicolas Church. I didn't stay much at this place due to the large number of people attending and making it difficult to enjoy the details of the historical clock.
Hourly. Old artistic clock in the center of old town it works on the hour and one has to reserve his place earlier as it is very crowded the royals appear on the hour to greet the masses

Very strange. I been told that Astronomical Clock is a big thing in Prague. So I waited it´s a big thing. Clock is very old but that´s all. Hundreds of people were watching clock like crazy, I walked away to see real Prague! Well, if you like to see old clock this might be something special for you...

History at its best. This outstanding Astronomical clock is around 600 plus years old Its chimes are soo interesting to watch as there is a skeleton which pulls a rope and other statue also moves there headIts on the old town squareExpect heavy rush in day light specially when it rings

Amazing oldest operating astronomical clock. First installed in 1410, it is the third oldest astronomical clock in the world, and the oldest still operating. It is mounted on the southern wall of the Old Town Hall in the Old Town Hall Square. At every hour, the Apostle, plus Death (a skeleton) figures will walk out. The tour guide said that this was voted to be the second most disappointed tourist attractions in the world (with the Little Mermaid being the first). However, I thought this is a must-visit due to the fact that it is over 600 years old. There are many other interesting attractions, photo opportunities, and shops in the Square.
Take Time to See Time. Read about the details of this amazing clock in any tour book. Then get there early to enjoy the show. Use your large crowd common sense and you will enjoy the spectacle.
Beautiful!. Beautiful clock! It's frankly not that exciting in my opinion when it does its thing on the hour, but absolutely stunning just to look at.

Worthwhile to visit. I thought this was to be just viewing buildings, but it turned to be something quite different. There were so many people in the square as if there is a festival. There were uniformed musicians with trumpets and drums. And the astronomical clock was indeed a unique sight. I don't know how people read time in this clock, but every hour on the hour, it chimes with two upper windows opening and a parade of statues of saints pass through the windows. The view on the square is beautiful with church buildings towering around the hall with a clear blue sky as a fantastic backdrop. There were stalls selling food and drinks, and a park where weary walkers can sit as doves flies around. There are musicians who perform on the road side. A good experience of Prague!
This is one of the most beautiful clock tower you can see!. It is a beautiful and icon tower clock!One of the most beautiful and iconic in the world!Don't miss it!
Cool police of history. If you're in Prague already you will see this. Just look for the massive crowd. Hey there around noon for a good show from the clock!

Highly recommend night tour. We caught the last tour of the day and we were all quite satisfied. The tour guide was knowledgeable about the history and workings of Old Town Hall and the Astronomical Clock. The view from the clock tower is amazing, especially at night. Thoroughly enjoyable!

Engineering masterpiece. We were on a whistlestop tour through the city but we took time to see this masterpiece of genial engineering.The clock is a beautiful thing to look at with so many intricate moving parts from dials to figurines. The lower dial has the seasons of the year on it, and on close inspection and to my Czech girlfriend's delight, it also has the Czech name days around the perimeter. You need to pay attention when it starts and keep looking around as there is so much to see.
Astronomical :). Was very looking forward to this place and yes its nice and mind blowing! My daughter loved this place! Recommended for all ages.

Amazing!!. I am an engineer, so watches and clocks are my thing. This is an amazing clock and the 2nd oldest astronomical clock ever made and is still working. Would recommend reading about it on wiki so that you have greater appreciation.

Piece of history. A stunning and clever astronomical clock of its time. It is situated in Pragues old town square and attracts many tourists throughout the day. We visited at midday and it was great to see the clock and figures in action! A must see!

Stunning but let down. Recently visited Prague with my wife for a few days and we had the pleasure of seeing the stunning astronomical clock but was disappointed with the show on the hour this is probably due to me thinking it was going to be out of this world. My advice get there for 5 to the hr few pics and watch what happens next. Worth a view while your in the old town.

The hour on every hour. This is a very old clock which moves with the time every hour. The 12 apostles get to the windows of the clock every hour. Be prepared to have lots of people watching it with you. Really a must.

Amazing Piece of Work. This is the oldest astronomical clock in the world. You must plan your walk near the clock so that you can see the clock in action. The entire spectacle only lasts one minute but at least you can say you have seen it.
The clock opens up every hour on the hour.
Interesting hourly chiming show. Need to stand directly in front to see the hourly chime properly. Worth seeing. Read up about the dials & statues on wikipedia.
Great photo oppotunity. I took some great photos that I always like, during the day, in the evening and even in winter. The cost was about CZK100 for the lift.

very unique. you will see 1000 of tourists standing waiting for the clock to tick while the characters will start moving. very well preserved and one of a kind. watch out from the pick pockets while standing and starring
What a great of engineering. I have seen reviews by visitors who expected more, but quite honestly, imagine this being manufactured in the 1400's, that's mind blowing.

One of a kind clock and great views from atop the Tower. A visit to the hourly chiming of the Astrological Clock is a must. Also, if you get the opportunity, go up the Tower to get a great panoramic view of Prague. The clock is one of a kind. Relax and enjoy.
worth seeing. We were there at 10pm and it was a joy to see the clock working with all the figures coming out of it. Many people were there in the street to watch it, it's definitely a nice event

Clock is overrated, but the area is NOT!. The clock has an interesting history – I recommend taking the FreePrague walking tour to learn about it. The clock is beautiful, and its situated in the Old Town Square which is a great place to catch a beer and sausage and chill out.
first visit to Prague. This may be the only clock of this kind in the world, I certainly have never seen one like it before. Haven't got a clue how it works though!
loved it!. Very nice although the clock is a bit creepy and macabre --but if you can get over the skeleton, it makes for an impressive enjoyable sight.
THERES MORE TO IT.. Some people just take pictures of the clock. What is interesting is the building or the Town Hall. Go in and see for yourself.

The second most disappointing tourist attraction after Mona Lisa. Or so we were told by our Czech tour guide! it was very crowded from around 20 min before the hour, and the whole show is done within minutes if not seconds. The clock itself is beautiful but of course heavily restored so no sure how much of it is original. I would recommend getting there early for the first chime at 9am.

Beautiful architecture and history... As many people have gathered to watch as the hour was rounding for the play that was made. It was actually a minute of som mechanical figurines that was displayed in the windows of the clock and ending with a man blowing a horn melody. It was beautiful but not as expected. But thinking if its age it was a wonder.

Death starts the hour. Super crowded day and night, clock is fun, Not as much activity and movement as some of the big German ones. Definitely need a guide to explain the statues on the clock and all the dials.

A must see in Prague. This place is easy to visit, it's in the middle of Prague so you can fit it easily in your schedule. they have small shows around it on daily basis and you can visit it and take pics with it day and night. the location is close to other attractions as well so you would really enjoy a walk around the area that's also full of restaurants and pubs.

Everything in old town iscgreat. The Astronomical Clock is amazing. The square gets busy as everyone wants to see the each of the clock figures come out during the hour each hour. The figures and history of this piece of art is super. Also, so are the crowds.
One of the Busiest Areas in Prague. Every hour, the clock rings, characters (like coo coo clocks) revolve around this historic place. Crows gather like bees making Honey. Worth the jam!

The astronomical clock is still working .... The clock was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still operating. The oldest part of the Orloj, the mechanical clock and astronomical dial, dates back to 1410 when it was made by clockmaker Mikuláš of Kadaň and Jan Šindel, the latter a professor of mathematics and astronomy at Charles University. The first recorded mention of the clock was on 9 October 1410.[2] Later, presumably around 1490, the calendar dial was added and the clock facade was decorated with gothic sculptures.Formerly, it was believed that the Orloj was constructed in 1490 by clockmaster Jan Růže (also called Hanuš); this is now known to be a historical mistake. A legend, recounted by Alois Jirásek, has it that the clockmaker Hanuš was blinded on the order of the Prague Councillors so that he could not repeat his work; in turn, he disabled the clock, and no one was able to repair it for the next hundred years.

The clock is important but not for the show of the statues.. The clock is full of history with his creator that decided to throw himself in the clock after being blinded from the king. Then, more important is the all structure of the astronomical watch..unique in the world
Beautiful and worth a visit. The Old Town Hall and Astronomical clock are a beautiful sight but the action of the clock is a bit over rated!
Beautiful clock. Lovely sat with a drink in the old town square admiring the impressive buildings and clock.A must do whilst in prague...
Don't miss. Get the tour of the old town hall and the underground beneath it. Very interesting. And don't miss going up into the tower. Incredible view.

Beautifull Place. We passed from there 100 times in a week! We like this area. Beautifull architectures. Thousands of people are over there for photos etc. All the area is full with cafe-restaurants, traditional small food and sweet shops. Amazin area in Prague.

Hourly let down . Every hour, crowds gathered in the square to see the clock strike but very little happens. Interesting and unusual but not worth hanging around for if you have more interesting plans

Interesting attraction. It's easy to get to through the old city and walkable from Charles bridge or wecesles square. It's an interesting thing to see the different changes on the building every hour. You need a ticket to go inside the place and be able to see the city from the top. Not sure I enjoyed it as much as the people that were lined out to see it, but it's an interesting thing to see.
Just to be there. Always pleased to sit on old town squere. A lot of people a lot of artist and great vibe....Beat place to start with while you visiting Parague
Great historical spot !. This clock has some interesting history - it is a must see and make sure you are there on the hour to see its movements ! Portions of the clock are all original

An Amazing Site to See. The Astronomical Clock is amazing---take a look at historical photos especially during WWII and you will take a away a greater appreciation of this amazing piece of history. The square gets busy as everyone wants to see the each of the clock figures come out during the hour each hour.

One amongst 3 wonders of Prague. This is the third part of the 3 wonders of Prague. And it's a marvellous wonder. You can see the small show every hour and Marvel at the engineering excellence of the people of yore. The entire philosophy is so well depicted but you would need someone to explain the entire thing to you. The show happens every hour at the stroke of the hour. Gets over in 30 seconds, but it should not be missed.Really wonderful.

Owner craft tours egypt. This place need many things first should fix chairs or any kind of seating for touris Second need cleaningThird need securityFourth need platformsPeople cannot stay anywhereRubish around the sqouareInspite that the place full of tourists all the days hours around all weeks daysIts v nice place but need attention and care from the governmentsIts v important place for all visitors i hope governments will take care of it

Old Town Square & Astronomical Clock. Old Town Square was about an easy 10 minute walk from our hotel. The square is full of locals. visitors, hawkers & buskers. Shops & restaurants galore in the area. You'll find beautiful architecturally kept buildings & the iconic 15th century Astronomical clock here. Not surprisingly, the clock is one of the most visited sight in Prague throughout the day. This is especially true at the top of the hour, when figurines appear from behind closed doors, on the face of the clock. I went to take pictures of it around 10 PM & even then, there were people milling around the clock. A great place to take in the sights & sound of Prague & people watch. A must see when in Prague.
Excellent. The astronomical clock has a long history and what better way to experience that by a tour of the attraction.

Worthwhile . I know people say this is a disappointing attraction but if you consider how long it's been working it's quite amazing. A walking tour will explain how interesting it really is. If you stand in front of it without knowing its history it can feel quite underwhelming. Very worthwhile visiting this sight.
History. Take a guide and hear the story (free walking tour) and be there before the clock hits an hour so you could see what's behind it! Fun :)

Beautiful Clock. I did not go inside because the line was really long but just walking in the Old Town and seeing all of the sides of this clock was wonderful. It truly is a must see, if only walking by.
Great Landmark. Every time I come to Prague I love to stand and gaze at the astronomical clock. It's a must see when visiting Prague.

Interesting. Definately worth booking a guide to see around the old town hall, our guide was extremely helpful and knowledgeable, it takes around an hour full of interesting facts. You can see the inside workings of the astronomical clock. Then take a walk to the top of the tower where the views are breath taking(there is a lift if you don't fancy the climb)

Excellent views from the top! Climb the stairs!. The view was wonderful, especially since there was a jazz concert in the square. The clock is interesting but I thought there would be more to the display on the hour. My 13 year old son thought it was "anticlimatic" and I agree.

Its the number one place for tourist. The square is great because it has nany points of interest around itThe tourists flock the square to see clock ticking on the hourOn the night when the area is lighted is so picturesque is a fery tale picture

Unique - worth a moment. Since anyway you'll find yourself in the town square, it's a very unique and worth while - come at a round hour to enjoy the mechanism of the watch - and that's it (don't walk to the square just for this attraction).

not worth to long a visit. Considering it's age the clock is impressive, however don't believe the hype.
The crowds can get very large every hour as it does it's very little show. but get out early see it once and enjoy the rest of this beautiful city.

Must see!. The Old Town Hall & the Astronomical Clock are quintessential Prague experiences. They are the first ports of call when sightseeing in Prague and warrant more than one visit. On first viewing you'll stand there with the hordes to watch the astronomical clock on the hour, then wander off to other parts of the old square to dwell in a less focussed but possibly more pleasurable manner. Maybe, like me, you'll marvel at all the ancient stone buildings in that square and the vibrant community life still evident amidst the tourist bustle. It's a truly beautifulplace to be and a memory I'll keep with me always.

Every hour on the hour see it in action. If you can plan your visit to arrive just before the hour, you can see the massive astronomical clock in action. Dating back to 1410, it is one of the oldest in the world.
Clock was broken. It was interesting to hear about how the clock was made and what it did, but it had been broken for quite a while and hasn't been fixed since.

Worth the wait to see the action. The clock is a work of art as well as a mechanical marvel. There is quite a show when the hour strikes. If you are lucky you will hear several tour guides talk about the history as you are waiting. Usually crowded, but worth the effort.
Beautiful site.. It was very interesting to watch the clock and view the square from the tower. A little crowded on the hour during the chiming.
Fantastic clock. Great city loads to do and this clock looks amazing so well made and always a pleasure to watch it every time I was passing by

Funny!. After reading about the operation of the clock, we decided to wait a few minutes and watch the way the hour change in front of the clock!More than 200 people at the same time staring at the clock went: "Oooo" snd clapped their hands!!!Nice funny touch!See it for yourselves, it's worth the wait!
Astronomical clock. Best to take a guided tour which will tell you the meaning of different dials. Make sure to be there at hour end when it dongs and windows above the clicks open.

Nice building and interesting clock. I have always wanted to see the Astronomical clock and it is better seen in person than in pictures. However, the place can get busy and crowdy, so if you hate crowdy-touristy area, it might be a good idea to time your visit after the clock chimes each hour when tourists seem to flock in it.
Just something you need to see. Visiting this famous landmark is a must. It doesnt take too long but it is pretty amazing that the bell has been ringing that way for 600 years!!

Great architecture. I fell in love with Prague and it's architecture. It's simply amazing, and with such an interesting history. The plaza where the Astronomical clock is, it's absolutely packed with joyful tourists and locals. There's such a great atmosphere here that you will just want to sit down, enjoy a Czech beer and watch the commotion.
Ting ting. We watched the puppets come by the clock while having a drink at the opposite terras.. The clock looks very nice and is beautiful but the hourly sound is ok.
Lovely. This clock is amazing I did so much enjoy see it on the hour .so intricate .get a good view before the crows appear

A must see. You were not in Prague if you missed this spot. It doesn't take long but it's worth it. Be sure to secure a good spot. You can't really see much of the clock from a bigger angle.
Once a year one of the best video mapping events takes place there. Impressive, yet different, every time.

Clock experience. A must see experience the astronomical clock in the centre of Prague when the clock strikes. Always seems to be busy around this area but well worth visiting. You can go up the clock tower for a wonderful view of the city. We also were there at night when they showed images over the last hundred years projected onto the clock tower. Wonderful history lesson spectacular.
Lovely square. Very fun to be out in the square with the locals and tourists...ooh and ahh at the clock. Many newbie segway riders - watch your step!
Timing is everthing. If you time it right, you can see the figurines come out of the clock. I believe it's once an hour on the hour. The crowds are huge, but it's a great little "free" show.
interesting. This was interesting but very crowded and very busy!! Best to wait later in the day as it tends to be more calm and less of a crowd gathered around
Another beautiful building. It gets very busy round the bottom of the clock when it strikes o'clock. It is worth a trip up the tower for the views.

A Magnificient Clock. Prague Astronomical Clock was built in 15th century and it has lots of stories about its construction. Old Town Hall is always crowded even if you visit there around 6 o'clock in the morning. However, this place is one of the magnificent places that you must see in Prague. Be there round the clock and watch what will happen.

An iconic and historical landmark!. Anyone visiting the Old Town in Prague will definitely not miss this iconic and historical landmark as it has been there for many years over centuries. It's impressive architectural design. And if you are in Prague and not visiting it, its like you would have missed out something!The design and theme was nice and lovely and its one of the few remaining oldest astronomical clock that is still working. At every hour, the clock will chim and there will be "dancing movements" on 2 small windows with the 12 apostles moving around.And this place is the "crowdiest" here in the old town as people would gather, 30 minutes before the full hour and wait to watch the dancing movement. And nearer to the time, many more would gather and its very difficult to find a spot where you will not be blocked from the view! (advice: if you have a good camera with a HD zoom, you may stand far, perhaps even at Starbucks or the Jewelry Shop and will have a better and clearer view with it)When we were there, it was about noon and guess, many more people were gathering there. It was a sunny day then, crowded and warm!When the clock chimed at 12, the sound was nice with the dancing movement that lasted only about a couple of seconds, where people would snap pictures at it and cheering.Honestly speaking, there is really nothing much to see except the short movements and really not worth waiting and squeezing through the crowds to watch it.And if you want to have a good view over Prague, you can consider to go up to the clock tower (payable and about 4-5 Euros). It was gorgeous from on top! (the entrance is via the tourist office)In fact, the clock will chime every full hour and every time, big crowds of people would still gather to watch it.Personally for us, even if you miss the dancing movements, you don't lose much as you can still take photos in front of it at any time.Caution! Like any other cities that attracted large crowds of visitors, do pay close attention of your personal belongings as pickpockets like to operate in these places to pry for targets.

Old clock. I've seen this clock on the internet many times but it's not the same as being there.I can't quite believe the number of people who wait for it to chime on the hour every hour come rain or shine.emotional but don't know why.

Over-rated . A must see when in Prague and luckily its on every hour. I do think it is slightly over rated. When you do go to see don't expect miracles to happen. However, at the same time its good to see what all the hype is about.

Beautiful, watch for pickpockets!. The astronomical clock is definitely very cool to watch, but would I wait an hour for it? Probably not. While you are gawking at the clock, hold onto your bags very tightly! Our tour group had 3 close encounters with pickpockets. They were very clever, they dressed like tourists and pretended they were in our tour group. Beautiful town hall and clock. The skeleton is my favorite!

Very busy but worth viewing. Only a 5min walk from our hotel to the square. As is a lot of Prague the buildings are beautiful and this area is no different. We did not climb the clock as it was Peak tourist season so very busy and 38 degrees so a little warm. We preferred to wander around the street stalls that were there and then wander the back streets which were quieter. The clock is beautiful though and hard to get a good photo with all the people.

A very popular must see. This is something I wanted to see when visiting Prague as it ialways seems to be on people's photographs. It was interesting to watch but gets very busy. With the crowds you need to watch out for pick pockets as I was warned by a friend it's a hot spot for this

Great view. I always find it fascinating how the astronomical clock moves and the history behind it and the tower that holds this ancient clock. It is always crowded close to the top of the hour when the procession of the twelve Apostles begins. You can view this parade between 9:00-21:00 pm on the hour. For a small fee you can climb up the tower and get a premium view of Prague.

Great views over Prague. One thing I don't understand are the crowds and crowds of people that gather about quarter to the hour to wait for the clock to strike the hour... it lasts for 10 seconds and it's really nothing special.What is special is the view from the top of the clock. It only costs the equivalent of about 4 euros to go up (110 in Czech currency) and once you are at the top you get great 360 degree views over Prague. We struggled a bit to find the entrance, its just to the left of the Astronomic clock in what is the tourist information centre. Excellent views and very cheap, well recommended.

Interesting historical clock. This clock is very old, and we were told it is the oldest outdoor astronomical clock still in operation, and it is very impressive to look at. However, the square in front of it is always extremely crowded, and while the display on the hour is interesting, it's hard to get a good view. It also only lasts a minute or two. I would recommend to see this, but go at a time when it is not busy (early or late). The clock display is supposed to happen every hour on the hour between 9am-11pm. And, it's only worth a couple minutes of your time to watch the figurines.

Must see but a bit of an anti-climax. The views from the top are amazing. The clock itself is the last astronomical clock so it's interesting. However, the crowds wait around for the big "ringing of the bells" show which is nothing special at all to be honest. Still a must see though.

Disappointing . A huge crowd gathered on the hour to watch the clock change and I was expecting more of a show so was slightly disappointed when it lasted less than one minute. If you are in the area around the hour, go check it out but don't go out of your way for it
Worth. Despite the crowds. You almost have to fight to get a picture but that's pretty much what good free attractions will cost.

Statues of the Clock move every hour. But they don't do lots and lots of stuff, so you don't have to wait there for a long time to see them move. Take care of your belongings because it gets crowded during the clock's show time.
Best view of Prague!. For no more than a view euro you can climb the clocktower . On the way up you pass by many exhibitions with great information about Prague's relation with the Nazi's .
Extraordinary . I came here with my husband..summer time .. Sunny we just loved itthe streets.. the buildings.. the clock ..everything was extraordinary I Loved Prague Don't miss it

Great Views of Prague. The best views of Prague are found by going up in the tower. However, I recommend that you take the elevator up the whole way (2 elevator rides) as it is a lot higher than it looks. Also, there is a very narrow spiral staircase at the end that can be avoided by using the elevator.

Beautiful. Beautiful, picturesque area. The astronomical clock has been functioning for around 600 years and has an interesting design. Don't bother waiting around to see the clock strike the hour. It's uninspiring. Also be warned of the overpriced tourist trap food stands. You can get much better and more reasonably priced food elsewhere.

Easy Walk to Explore many Aspects of Prague Old Town. Convenient to HiltonOld Town and Marriott, there are meant restaurants and shops along the way. For serious shoppers there are large, indoor shopping malls and department stores in the area. The Town Hall has the impressive 13th century astronomical clock, Which is a marvel of complicated mechanical workings that one would not expect to see from such ancient times. There is a plethora of movement, sights and sounds in this old clock. Every hour everything comes to life with the procession of Jesus and disciples, a scythe-wielding Death figure, an hour glass turning over, gongs and a rooster crowing (in addition to other more subtle movements). Our guide did warn us to beware of pickpockets while we are standing mesmerized by the goings on of the clock. We were also luck enough to be there during a display of Korean culture with fan dancers in geisha-like costumes. The clock is a must see and there are many other attractions close to it.
Has to be done. The clock is a masterpiece though the hourly chimes don't seem that exciting to a modern viewer. I enjoyed the inside of the tower and the Martyrs memorial outside.
Brillaint. Killed me walking up the stairs and avoid a late admission as its so busy but highly recommend a visit

Another popular attraction. This is another one of those impressive historical buildings. It felt a little dwarfed by other sightseeing during the day, I including Prague Castle. Either easy, it was interesting to have a look and take some pictures.

A "must see" when it strikes "on-the-hour" . We just happened to be walking past at 5:59 pm when we noticed a crowd had gathered and were all looking up. Then we noticed the clock. So we waited for it turn 6:00, and were not disappointed! Two doors open and a parade of the 12 Apostles come peeking out, while other characters around the clock "chime in", with a grand finale of a live trumpeter at the top of the tower.

Very interesting. If you like history, this is a great tour. The Old Town Hall tour takes you through the halls and the dungeons of the Old Town Hall where a very informative and entertaining tour guide gives you the history, the stories and a little bit of gossip about the place. Wonderfully done. The clock is a whole different issue. It's so cool!! Then the view from the top of the clock tower is amazing. Prague is a beautiful city and this astronomical clock is just one of the many historical highlights of this town. The clock though is VERY cool.

A marvel of engineering. The clock is just amazing. It is humbling to see what could be accomplished so long ago. I recommend to read up on it beforehand, in order to fully appreciate that it showes all of: time, time until sunset, the part of day, the moon cycle, and an old time unit where the day is divided in twelve parts. The time was one hour off but I suppose that has to do with daylight saving time. Most people come to watch the figures move, but it is the actual clock that is the thing here. Do not miss it!

If You Are Passing. My husband and I were lucky and were about to pass at 14:55 so we stood for a few minutes to see the clock do it's stuff (completely underwhelming).I loved the whole crowd which gathered every hour well into the evening and watched for the few faces who like us were a little perplexed by all the hype.It is fascinating when you learn the history of the clock but wouldn't have stopped if it wasn't so close to the hour!

How old is it!?!. It's amazing to think that this has been working for a few hundred years. The crowds that show up on the hour are immense at times and the gentlemen who played trumpet on top was a cool touch as the crowd cheered for him. It may not be an app on your phone but it is mind boggling to think that has been ringing all these years.

Disapointed - the tower. Very very crowded, takes ages to go in and when you get there you don't have impressive views from the city (my opinion). - tower.But the struture of the clock from the outside is much more interesting! You can see the "show" every hour.

A must see. A great picture and visit, but definitely overrated to sit around and wait for the 30 second show every hour. Too many people stand to watch. Recommend to eat at El Negro Steack house and watch it while you are eating!!

Brilliant views from the top. The Astronomical Clock is fun, but can be missed if you need to. The tower is a long way up with many, m,any many, steps, but thank God there's a lift or two to help the climb! It's a symbolic tower, with some magnificent views across the city, personally I have a love/hate realtionship with towers - I love the view from the top, but can't stand heights. Even so - it was worth the trip up, and the walk down gives a great over view of the history.
Tourist overkill. Only option for having a good time here is to go there early. Like to every tourist hotspot in Prague - if you wanna enjoy your trip.
The Astronomical Clock in Prague. A definite Prague highlight!Be sure to arrive 10 - 15 minutes before it starts changing at the hour mark, to get a spot, as it can be quite busy.
Great. Great atmosphere all the place buzzing with tourists having selfies photographs.Lot of activities going on fully lively.Astronomical clock a huge tourist attraction

Good clock/crowd madhouse. By jockeying in to position about :20 minutes before the top of the hour you can get a good few of the movements of this clock and its "residents." It goes off on the hour exactly and be careful as you might get stepped on or pushed aside.

Awesome clock. I've got several videos of the clock in motion. It's great fun. Make sure to learn all about the meanings behind each moving character. Time waits for no man!Also be sure to go inside and to the right - it's free - to see the historic mosaic just behind the clock. It's lovely.If you grab a spot at a cafe facing the clock you can enjoy its hourly performance in the shade sipping a local beer.
Bit to crowded. A nice square but very crowded with a lot of large groups of tourists. Of course it is not to be missed but better visit Prague and its special places outside the regular holidays.
Amazing. You have to visit this clock. Its truly amazing. Get there early for a good spot. On the hour amazing things happen. Was a stunning show. A must see for any Prague visit.

See the famous clock, then climb the tower to see Prague. The famous medieval astronomical clock is a marvel of precision engineering and a job to see in splendid action at the top of every hour. Watch the show and then climb the stairs of the tower to get some of the best views of this beautiful city. On your climb, take time to see the historical images and to read the history of the place. Educational, fun, and a bit of exercise!

Amazing clock. The clock is cool, and it's definitely worth taking a photo of, but not sure how much it's worth standing around with the hundreds of people who gather to see it chime on the hour. It's interesting, but not that impressive.
Old town astronomical clock. Great historical story - said to be 700 hundred years old . Rings on the hour very hour - ta big tourist attraction but is quite quaint

Not impressing if you dont know the history. On our first day in Prague, we just went to town to explore it. We went to the Town Square and saw the clock at 3 o`clock. For me it was not that impressing but I think it is because I do not now any history of this at all. As other users claim, I agree that it is more impressing if you know something about the history.
History...!. Perfect place for a group photo with a historic part of Prague. The history is amazing and is one of my go to pictures from the trip.
Beautiful. Loved the Astronomical Clock and stayed to listen to the chimes on the hour. Lots of shops and restaurants around to enjoy.
Disappointing. Very disappointing waiting for the clock. Didn't really know what to expect but based on the crowd thought it would be impressive. Thought it was a waste of time.

Love this clock - so much history!. Loved visiting this site, the clock draws great attention every day on the hour and crowds gather round to see the movements change. It's really lovely in this area as surrounded by bars shops and restaurants. Children especially love it - it's like a fairytale story and to see their faces is magical.

Oldest astronomical in current operation. Quite something to witness considering it's over 600 years old and isn't missing a beat. Aesthetically beautiful, however mechanically fascinating. On the hour, the clock comes alive with moving figures displaying what is known as 'the walk of the apostles'. According to local legend, the city will suffer bad luck if the clock falls into disrepair, perhaps why it is still chiming away for all to enjoy! Read up on the story behind it before you go. really worth a visit.

The city in your palm. The astronomical clock is fascinating. A must see! The best though is climing to the top of the tower: a dolls houses scenario will unfold, to be truly never forgotten. A precious memory a thousand times worth the price.

Astronomical clock is amazing. Wow, this clock I walked past so many times, and then took the time to watch it on the hour when all the little characters pop out of the top. Such amazing architecture, I fell in love with this clock which was just around the corner from where I stayed, so was lucky to see it many times. In a beautiful big square in old town where there is much activity going on, always something different as well as the usual food stalls, horse and carts and much much more.

Fascinating!. Beautiful to see this - you must witness it on the hour when it will fascinate you as it springs into life. Get your front row spot early....everyone wants to take photos. If you're lucky you will see a wedding too

Even more impressive if you understand it . This astronomical clock is especially impressive considering the mechanism was designed in the 1400s. Before you go, quickly read about the different features and you will enjoy the experience even more. The clock shows the phase of the moon, has a calendar for what day of the year it is, the month, the zodiac. For those more astronomically inclined, it also tracks sidereal time.It's also worth seeing it strike the hour. The 12 apostles can be seen at the top of the clock. In addition, the 4 figures come to life. The skeleton rings the bell, signifying the end of another hour and our mortality. The other three figures, signifying vanity, greed, and hedonism, all shake their heads refusing to accept that it's time to go. Don't think of it as being depressing though, that's just life :)If you have the time, it's also worth it to go up the tower. The views are awesome, especially around sunset. The walk up the tower also has a history of the tower, when it was built, extended, burned, renovated, etc. Finally, there are also some good books and pamphlets about the functioning of the clock which will help your understanding.

Love the View. We went up in the tower while the sun was setting and the view was beautiful. We could look out on all of Prague and see the buildings and architecture. We had a great view of the Prague Castle and St. Vitus Cathedral. The view was definitely worth it. There were also plaques with the history of the tower along the walls of the ramp going up to the top of the tower.

A beautiful clock! . This clock was very grand with a lot of history and unusual in that it uses three different systems of measuring time. Every hour you get to watch the 12 Apostles appear in little shutters and this is always a busy time.

One of the most photgraphed locations in Prague. Terrific experience, and while definitelty one of the most crowded places around, it is a must-see in Prague. Old world elegance at its best. Beware of the pickpockets though, you can almost pick them out. Relatively easy to protect yourself, just don't let your guard down. Enjoy the experience of the stunning clock.
well worth seeing. The clock is well worth seeing, be there on the hour to see it function. When you see it think how old it is!!

A must to visit.. What a lovely square plenty of bars to choose from to eat and drink.plenty of shops in surrounding area.he clock is an amazing structure chimes every hour nice to see.you can have a ride on horse and carriage.

Beautiful Square. The clock is beautiful but the rotating disciples last only a couple of minutes on the hours every hour through out the day! And the crowds are huge but dissipate as soon as this is over. We preferred taking the elevator up to the top of the Old Town Hall and seeing the square from that vantage point. There is a small fee for the Tower.

Overcrowded but ok. The clock is a little underwhelming when it finally strikes the hour. I've certainly seen better cuckoo clocks elsewhere.The old town is cobble stone streets filled with restaurants & other tourist items.

Stunning. Place is always crowded with tourists, it is annoying. A lot of beggers. Architecture is stunning. Astronomical clock still works nowadays, it works at o'clock time (12.00 for example). You should visit this place at the evening, when ligjts are everywhere it is so beautiful.

Beautiful beautiful historic place. Love this part of Prague and the beautiful historic buildings all round. Worth starting here but then wandering off into the maze of little streets surrounding this area.
Astronomical Clock. Interesting historical artifact. HOwever, I wouldn't worry about missing it. It happens every hour on the hour.

Very unique. Went to see the clock strike on the hour 1:00 in the afternoon. Wow what a clock. Loved the passing figures of saints. Crowds of people had their cameras ready to watch the scene. A must see when in Prague.

The hourly chiming of the clock.. Make sure you are square on to the clock to get the best view. We stood well back, near some wooden doors, you get a great view from there, without been too crowded. The crowds are not as big in the evening.

lots of tourists to see a fantastic place. if you can be at the clock on the hour when it chimes you will see something lovely, it is a must to see,I would advise that you be very careful as there can be very large number of tourists be careful of you're bag but there is a very good police presence.

Nice to see while walking around. Another one of those sights you can see for free in Prague by just walking around and soaking up the atmosphere. Take your time and get lost; there is so much to see! The clock going off isn't all that impressive - better to get a close-up on youtube.

A beautiful part of the city. the chiming of the clock was somewhat underwhelming until you realise quite how old the mechanism in the clock is, at which point it becomes a historical marvel. a must-see part of Prague, right by the tourist office, that will only take a matter of minutes to behold.
Day out. Not much you can say about this beautiful piece of architecture, just an absolute gem to see and line I say just beautiful..
Worth a look. The clock is good to see at anytime but if you are there on the hour the clock opens some doors and moves....
Great view. A great view over the city and the clock is beautiful. (And sometime 100 characters is just too much for reviewing....)

Neat clock not so impressive action. The clock attracts lots of spectators and tons of people taking selfies with it in the background (slightly lame). The action, when it struck the hour, was cute, but not worth standing in a smelly crowd that could very well allow pick-pockets ample opportunity for snatching from you. I may be a bit cautious, but the clock wasn't amazing enough for me to join a crowd of people staring up at the same thing while others, who see it regularly, can easily watch you as a lion watches a Gazel at the watering hole. Just be mindful of your things. This isn't an overly dangerous city, but it is a big city, so the same warnings exist.

Yet another historic icon in Prague.. The historic astronomical clock at the base of the old town hall tower is interesting to look at. The crowds of tourists can get very thick, so if you want to watch the clock chime and see the accompanying movement of figurines, be sure to get there in time to find a suitable viewing spot from which to watch it, or find a less busy time to visit.

Very very busy.. We visited on a Saturday around lunch time. All I can say is wow, it was busy.Seems a very popular time for tours to arrive.I would advise to be very wary of pickpockets and thieves as we both immediately noticed a couple of people acting strange. The clock is a must see when you visit Prague.

An important part of Prague history. This is a must to add to your list of attractions to visit. Be prepared for the crowds and tour groups when it strikes on the hour.You can take the lift (at a cost) to the top of the tower as well.

Panoramic views of the entire city - avoid crowds. The is an interesting place for those who have no fear of heights. It is exciting to climb the stairs - but more importantly, gives a lot of interesting historical information about the town hall and the clock along the way. If you choose the lift for both directions - you miss this,I was expecting to see the mechanisms of the astronomical clock from inside - but was disappointed as it was only the main clock mechanisms which were visible.The view from the top was amazing as one could walk round - to see from all directions. Crowd control was poor - and the directions of walking at the top were not clear and most people were not adhering to it, Best would be to go up when most people are down waiting for activities of the "clock"

Old Town Suare. Very worthwhile and shouldn't be missed. You need to be in front of the astronomical clock on the hour to see the figure move.There are plenty of old buildings in the square that must be photographed.
360 Experience. No matter what direction you turn, you'll see history, beauty and activity. This is the place to be, and for good reason. There is an energy that you can feel. A must visit in Prague.

Overrated and meaningless. Sure, it's an old clock with figurines or whatever. But nothing really happens. Tour guides seem to think this is the number one thing to show their ducklings in the amazing city of Prague. The truth is that it's grossly overrated and I can't believe why anyone would want to see it in the first place. Don't fall into this trap.

Gorgeous square and clock. The clock has a show every hour that's veg cute to see but not necessary to do so. What is worth seeing is the clock in itself without the wait for this show. It is a very interesting clock and it's quite stunningly placed in the old town square. The history behind the clock is also very interesting. Read up before you go or take a tour guide who can explain various aspects of the old town when there. It's quite useful to do so.

Total let down.. Yes, huge crowds and very interesting architecture, but the clock was a total let down. Could barely see any movement and the sound hardly inspiring - not what we were expecting at all.

Everything in Prague is Beautiful. So does the Old Town hall and the clock. It functions perfectly indicating different things. The hour, the planets, etc. The hall of the Town Hall, before getting to the clock tower view point is beautiful. The art in the ceiling is unbelievable.

A must-see if you're in Prague. The Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock are must-sees in Prague. They're right in the Old Town Square which is a nice place to stroll around and have some refreshments. Try to get there a bit before the hour as this is a very popular attraction and you want to be able to have a good view of the clock as it strikes the hour.

That's it?. Guess I expected more. The clock is interesting. Stood in front for about 20 minutes in the crowd. Camera ready and focused on the entire clock, since I wasn't sure what to expect. That action took place inside the tower, which you could glimpse through the open windows. but the figures didn't come outside, and were sort of hard to see, especially through the camera's view finder. Oh well, the rest of the Town Center was wonderful

GREAT VIEWING AND FUN TO WATCH. Located in the Old Town Square, this is a must see for all tourists coming to Prague. The Astronomical Clock draws hundreds of tourist from around the world, with cameras in hand, to view the hourly 22 second mechanical performance and procession of statues representing the Apostles. This clock, which is 600 years old, was once considered one of the wonders of the world. I have never seen so many selfie sticks in one place and it was fun just watching them watch the clock. The Old Town Hall has stairs or an elevator that takes you approximately 228 feet high and offers you one of the most amazing views of the city and the Old Town Square below. This entire venue is also a major attraction, especially early in the morning, for wedding couples wanting to get this attraction in the background while being photographed in their wedding gown/tux.
Hanging Out. Great place to hang and have a drink. Sidewalk cafes, people watching, shopping, street performers, carriage rides and "gelato!" Some good restaurants, too.

Impressive. . The Old Town Square is an amazing tourist attractions and the crowds here are amazing and one of the main attractions is to see the clock.You will be stunned at the crowds here to see the clock striking every hour.I find it more interesting to either walk up the clock tower or take the elevator up and see the square in all its glory.If your a keen photographer then don't forget your camera as some of the view's afforded from the tower are awesome. A great tourist destination and one I highly recommend you visit on any holiday to Prague.
You can feel the history.. This place is always full of people. Sightseen is also very popular wedding picture taking place. In the christmas time, square has big christmas market place.
Super crowded, but gotta do it. It's hard to get a good view with all of the people around but it is just one of those things you have to do. It is beautiful and interesting.

Sight seeing . Amazing piece of architecture. Well worth the small entrance fee. Lifts all the way to the top. Can get a little congested at peek times, but that's mainly due to people not observing the direction of flow around the top.

Worth waiting for the hour show . Try and get here about ten to the hour to get a good spot in front of the clock tower. It does get very busy! The show is over very quickly so make sure you are paying attention to the 2 little square Windows above the clock face. Unbelievable given the age of the thing. A must do in Prague.
£5 (ish) entry - totally worth it.. There is a lift for reduced mobility, it was super busy so be prepared to wait 30/40 mins to get in! Worth the entry!

Big Crowds. Big crowds gather as the " hour" approaches .......so do the street salesmen!
The clock strikes the Apostles move round and it is very quaint, a work of art in it's own right and a must see if near the square.

Nothing that special. The astronomical clock is in theory amazing, really nothing special anymore. In it's own time it was a wonder how it worked like that, but these days it's digitalized and shows stuff that we can find out and know without it.On the hour, when the clock does it's "show", the square will be packed with people and packed with pickpockets, so beware. Also, the show can be a cool thing to be seen once, but can feel like kind of a letdown. It was voted one of the most overrated sighs in Europe for good reason.Also note that the restaurants and stores along the hall, square and close to the clock are greatly overpriced.

Amazing mechanical and art piece.... This medieval clock has so many features that you should enjoy the "walk of Apostles" without wasting your time trying to get pics or record this. (Many videos and images in internet may help you)... if you waste time trying to get best pics you will miss all the beauty on this animated figures starting with the skeleton ringing the bell. Such of great beauty!

AMAZING!. We went with a fantastic tour guide, Mark, who is a Prague native. He pointed out what to watch for and the nuances of the clock as it was approaching noon. Make sure NOT to have your cameras ready, as the time is brief for the "display", and better to see it without a lens! (You can find a picture of this in many publications.)

A moment to remember. It's magical. The architecture of the clock's tower, all the functions of the clock, all the expectation and the waiting of what is going to happen, the ambience... Oh, yes...it's pure magic!Best time to visit is at 12:00 pm with a cup of hot wine or a bottle of beer -whether it is winter or summer! !!

Ok. It only lasts about 10 seconds so don't be really excited and it's crowded and overrated.It's OK if you're just cruising around town and don't have anything to do but I certainly wouldn't stand there and wait for an hour for it to go again and again again

Worth Seeing, just to work out whats going on! But the busiest place in Prague!. This is an amazing piece of engineering in reality, and worth seeing as a premier thing to see in Prague - However, the huge crowds etc, certainly make it the busiest single spot in Prague.. So head here early in the day, or be prepared to be surrounding by thousands of eager tourists, and several pick-pockets making there through the obvlivious crowds too.

Disappointing. We visited the Astronomical Clock and I have to say that it was disappointing. First the huge crowds made me feel unsafe, and quite honestly, it is really no big deal. Not sure why it is so visited.

Wonderful insight into the great minds of the time. The more you learn about the various functions of the clock, the more you marvel at the precise calculations and engineering that went behind the creation of this magnificent clock. It is so much more than just the figures that move on the hour, so do take the time to find out more about the clock.

Not quite as spectacular as I imagined. Past the clock several times during our visit and it always seemed to be on the hour when crowds are gathering for the chimes. It's nice but not overwhelming. We saw a few wedding pictures being taken here - maybe it's good luck?

Go up in the tower for great views. It's free -- if a little crowded -- to stand in free of the tower and watch the display on the hour. But the best thing about the clock is being to go up in the tower for great views of the city. It costs us around $20 US for a family of four (including a 17-year-old not covered by the family ticket), but it was definitely worth it. We were actually hoping to do it again to see the city at night, but we ran out of time on our trip.

See it, but don't build it up too much :). Friends and I had lunch at one of the spots just adjacent to the tower where we could watch the "show" from our table with a beer. Its possible that if we had read more about this we would have been more excited about it? Don't want to give too much away... I'm sure it was incredible when it was first built and Prague is probably very proud of it, but I also think visitors will enjoy it better / better appreciate it, if you know to not build it up too much in your head before going :)

Astronomical Clock and Old Town hall. Clock is an excellent place to visit. Get a guide to explain the way the clock works with the sun. Worth the visit and if you can spare the money a trip up the tower to get views of Prague will cap it off. Square is a very relaxing place to watch from and have a nice meal.

Old Town Hall Tower is worth the visit, but the clock wasn't our thing!. The Old Town Hall Tower gives great views over Prague and a there is plenty of information displayed about its history.We happened to be there when the clock struck- as we were having a drink in a pavement cafe at the time- but I'm glad we hadnt waited especially for it .

Just Mesmerizing!. I was mesmerized from the first time I saw the clock. Just the atmosphere and all that beautiful buildings took my breath away. You could stand in front of the clock all day and absorb it's beauty and history. Good thing to know, just few feats away from the clock is Starbucks which has free wc.

Interesting and very clever. Worth seeing as part of a tour where somebody can explain how it works, how to read it and the gruesome tale about the man who built it. Don't get too excited about the hourly show though...
ok. Lovely to see but don't know what all fuss about as nothing special when 'goes off' , draws extremely large crowds on the hour to watch it.
Overrated, but pretty. I don't understand all the fuzz about this clock, almost nothing happens when it hits the hour, I got disappointed... But the tower is pretty anyway!

I love this clock!. I've heard a few people talk about this ancient clock as 'just a clock' but I would definitely not say that. The intricate and beautiful craftsmanship as well as the history behind the clock make it definitely worth a Visit on your trip to Prague.
Go up the Astronomical clock tower. Pay 130 Kroner to go up that offers a panoramic view of Prague. Excellent view on a clear day with description of buildings and sites.
ok. very crowded square, so be careful of pickpockets not really worth standing around waiting for it but ok
A Little Disappointing. I have seen other Astronomical Clocks with a better display. Unfortunately the rooster was stuck and not working which takes away from the usual workings of such a clock.
Very popular tourist attraction. The clock draws the crowds and rightly so. Very unusual but attractive clock. Do visit a few minutes before the hour, it will be worth it.
Beautiful Clock . Definitely stop by to see the Astronomical Clock. Try to be there on the hour to hear the chimes and watch the movement. Gets rather crowded.

Great clock. It's amazing a 600+ years old clock that is still working. Beautiful tower and astronomical clock. Definitely must have a look. Just beware that it's crowded with tourists. I would recommended you come here early before 12pm, grab a seat at one of the restaurants in front of the clock. Enjoy lunch and watch the clock chimes away at 12pm.
Go by and see it.. Good to see during the day and the night. Great ice cream right in the front of the clock. Enjoyable

Crowded but interesting. Don't miss it.. If you can tell time by this clock, you are far better than me. However, that is not the attraction. You need to be in front about 5 minutes before each hour to get a good position to see the "action" once the clock strikes the hour. I will not tell you exactly what happens, but it is something you should see when in Prague. And it is free!

Go to the Top. By all means go to the observation deck at the top of the tower. Great views. Best time?? Just before sunset and watch the sunset. When yoiu are done, have dessert outdoors at Hotel U PPrince rince.

Unless you're tall, if you want to see, get there early. The astronomical clock is similar to those in Bern & Munich. If you've never seen one, be sure to get there before the hour to watch the movements of this historical clock.

Tick Tock, be there when the hour strikes!. The old town clock is one of the symbols of Prague. It is fun to watch the clock strike the hour, but most people expect the figures on the lower part of the clock to move, and they do not. The upper clock features areas on each side where a parade of figures ( that seem to be on a turntable or wheel) twirl past your eyes as the hour is struck. Finally the golden bird at the top squats once and it is over. Be warned, no matter how good your position to film this, others will stand right in front of you at the last minute as the tours move in. . Go very early in the morning if you want a good view for photography.

Go To The Top!. The Astronomical Clock is a sight to behold from the Old Town Square but don't miss the chance to go up to the top! The views of Prague are AMAZING!!! We briefly looked in The Old Town Hall and marveled at the beautiful mosaics. This was an absolute delight and a highlight of our visit to Prague

Worth timing your visit to see it in action. Take some time and try to understand this clock. Get up close and look at the writing. But it is better to stay back when the clock is chiming to better see the apostles. The bell ringing skeleton is a hoot.
Tour guide. The history about the clock was very interesting if you just look at it and no one tells you the history it is very boring

Fantastic Views. Whilst the Astronomical Clock is free there is a small charge to access the Old Town Hall. The visit is completely worthwhile if only for the views from the top of the tower. Crowds do tend to build every hour to see the clock in action so try to get there about 15 minutes beforehand to get a good view, there are a couple of local cafes opposite the clock at which you can sit. The Old town hall tower has a lift from top to bottom so no need to worry about the steps and has a great view from the top. If you are there at the same time as the clock strikes you will get to see the trumpeter sound the hours on all four sides of the tower.

Amazing. We arrived in the square 10 minutes before the hour, there is quite a gathering upon each our before the clock does its magic. It only lasts for about 20 seconds but woukd advise videoing it as there are so many buts moving on tjis clock in a shirt space of time you would miss bits as its so huge. One of my favorite memories of Prague
Must see. Be sure to join the crowd to view the chiming of astronomical clock. Buy a ticket to walk to the top of the clock tower for a great view of the city.

Underwhelming, but still incredible.. This clock is a FEAT for the time period it was built in. However in the age of incredible technology and always being visually stimulated, the clock may underwhelm and even disappoint. Still, you can't NOT stand there on the hour and watch it do it's thing. A must see, but keep expectations low.

Astronomical clock tower. Excellent clock in an old square. Do not miss the opportunity to see the apostles come out at the top of the hour. Take the elevator to the top of the tower for awesome views of the city. Recommend going there just before sundown so you have the chance to see the town lit up at night.

A little underwhelming, but interesting all the same!. Spent hours running in circles to find this clock, as we were told that something special happened on the hour, and while the actual hour-ceremony thing was a little so-so, the building itself was beautiful.
Must see while you are here. What a fascinating place. Great for clock lovers and general tourists alike.Didn't walk up the tower but would be interesting to do so.

another wonderful sight in Prague. the clock is an amazing piece of work as it tell so many things apart from just the time, you can also go up the tower for a fee and get a lovely view of the surrounding are, there are also lots of lovely cafes and bars around to enjoy the clock while relaxing

Do it!!. My girlfriend and I had a really awesome time seeing and climbing up the Astronomical Clock tower! Would highly recommend for the astounding views of Old Square and Prague as a whole, definitely a good photo op ;)Students: remember your student cards to receive a discount on tickets - this applies to other places too so just keep it with you!

one of the most beautiful old towns within Europe. The Old Town in Prague is a place that I went all days while I was in Prague. Why? Because it's so beautiful and its architecture speaks for itself. Medieval style, the old town is full of restaurants, bars and crossing it you will find the amazing Charles Bridge. The first thing you see when you get there is the huge Astronomical Clock, which still works until nowadays (it was installed in 1410). It's also the 3rd oldest one in the world. Through there, you can also find the Jewish quarter, heading to Vltava river. Almost in front of the Clock, you will find one of the best bars I've ever been, Black Angel's Bar (been there more than once). On its surroundings, charming narrow streets. Perfect place for photography lovers and history ones!

Cool Old Clock. Stand before the clock as it strikes the hour and watch the figurines move. Take some time to read up on the clocks history and what the figurines mean; greed, lust, death etc. Beautiful piece of machinery and history. This will only take a few minutes, but crowds do begin to gather at about quarter till the hour mark. Do take the lift to the top for stunning views of Prague.
Beautiful . Loving the clock and shops in this area. Do becareful of your belongings as there are crowds everywhere. Highly recommended place to visit for first-timers.

Fascinating. The astronomical clock was one of the things we knew about before arriving in Prague and we were looking forward to seeing this attraction. We were not disappointed. The whole "performance" is over quite quickly but considering how long it has been going it is an impressive attraction. Get there quite early as the crowds are large.

Must visit- Don't forget to go up the tower for fascinating views of Old town!.
