Astronomical clock in Prague is the oldest operating astronomical clock in the world and the whole drama of moving skeleton and other puppets at the stroke of every hour is the biggest tourist attraction with hundreds of people waiting outside to record the barely 10 second long show. The thing that I would definitely recommend about old town hall is the climb up the observation tower. From there, you can see 360 degrees view of the entire old town and truly appreciate the beauty of this part of city.
Not much to see. The clock is in the main square and is interesting because it functions four different ways. It's beautiful but maybe not worth it in the rain or summer heat.

Town Hall worthwhile, Clock not so much. If visiting Prague's Old Town one must climb the Old Town Hall's tower. There is a lift available all the way to the top, and the view is very good. Unless you particularly want a view of the Castle from this height (which is more achievable from Charles Bridge), go in the evening. Far fewer people both up the tower and down in the square.The Astronomical Clock, although worth seeing if you happen to be around the area near an 'o'clock', is really nothing special. Honestly, when you see it, you are left expecting much more. Some little statues move around for a bit, and a skeleton rings a bell, and then it finishes. Maybe more happens at noon, I do not know. Again, go in the evening to avoid the tourist hordes and actually get a good view.

Good experience . Walking around w tour guide then seeing and learning about the significance of the design makes u appreciate the intelligence and ingenuity of the designer. But just as an FYI there's no real "amazibg" effect when the hour changes and they hack a "dancing of the statues show" as our tour guide explained. She even did not include that on our tour to save us time and so we did it on our own and realized she was right. The useful information she gave was to say it's better to stand under the tower clock and watch everybody else's expression after the dancing of the statues is done to see their disappointment :).

Art and Engineering. All of Old-Towne is interesting but the Astronomical clock is a true work of art. Stick around to the "hour" and watch it do through its motions. The clock dates back the e 1400's. You can but wooden replicas in the stores for a reasonable price to bring home to your kids. (My kid is 38 and he loved it)
Clock tower. See the clock strike on the hour and see what happens, but pay the small fee ($5 each) and see the view at the top!! Well worth it.

There is nothing special about the show at every hour. We were told that at every hour there will be something special such as show of sort. We waited with other tourists for the hour, but it wasn't as expected. A few bells and that's all.However, I would highly recommend climbing the stairs inside this building to get to see the view of the amazing city.Breathtaking views and definitely worth the money!
Beautiful area.. The entire area around the astronomical clock is superb. With restaurants, street entertainers and wonderful architecture it's a must see area.

Busy but worth the trip. There are a lot of tourists to see the clock but you can always find a spot to stand and view. You can go to the top of the clock and overlook the city which is beautiful for a great price. They only take cash (Czech crowns) and if you are weary when it comes to heights stay down at the bottom. The top is quit busy I'd recommend going close to the top of the hour as people rush down to see the clock go.
Such a cool clock!. I took a ton of pictures on this clock as it was such a pretty spot and clock itself was so pretty to look at.

Superb View from the top. Visited the town hall and astronomical clock whilst on a short break to the city.Well worth the walk up the ramps (rather than taking the lift) to the top of the tower.Historical information and photos as you walk up to the top.When at the top you have a superb view of the city, we timed it right as on the hour the trumpeter plays a tune on his trumpet on all four sides of the tower to the masses of people gathered below.
Great Clock. I went there on the free tour and the guide explained well the working of the clock. It was really cool.

MUST see! . You might need to muscle your way through a thick swarm of tourists, but get a spot to see the Prague clock chime on the hour. It's very neat, and the history on it is amazing. It was first installed in 1410, which actually makes it the oldest astronomical clock still functioning.
Interesting clock.... The town square is very lively and the tower is well worth climbing to see the city scape. The automata of the clock are worth seeing when the clock strikes on the hour.

Nice views of the square from the top!. The clock itself is beautiful. Watching it ring once is nice but enough. If you go to the top, you get very nice views of the square. Not a must do but if you like photography it is worth it.

Must see. This is one of the only attractions I paid to go in in Prague. The climb to the top is challenging for some, but so worth it. Fantastic views.
Be there on the hour to see it in action

Tour of the Astonomical Clock with Ian !. On Tripadvisor this clock is listed as underwhelming. It's only underwhelming if you do not have a proper explanation. This clock is from 1400's and is absolutely beautiful and needs to be explained properly which was with Ian from Sandemann's tours.

Amazing City. Prague is such a wonderful place, we saw this beautiful clock and the square next to it. Lovely cafes around, especially behind market area to right of clock lovely cafe that does the best pizza and beer :)

It's one of those Prague things you have to see. Many people congregate around the clock on the hour so photo taking can be difficult. If you wait until after the clock rings, people wander away and then you can take your photos. We managed to get a table at an outside cafe, El Toro, right by the clock which allowed us an excellent view of the clock while we enjoyed a drink. While interesting, we think the clock in the city square in Nuremberg is a better experience.
Amazing, beautiful clock. Amazing, beautiful clock that is still keeping perfect time. It's fascinating to see the 12 disciples making their nodding appearance every hour on the hour to large crowds.
Must see. A pleasure to be surrounded by so much history. Shame there are so many people though. Get up early and see this in the quiet times. Need space to look around and not be jostled.

Good when you can find it!. Our guidebook had this in the wrong location on Dlouha. It is part of the staromismieska radnice building with the large clock tower, on the side of the building away from the Old Town Square. Huge crowds at lunch time so try and see it at a different time.

Definitely a must visit in Prague . I visited Prague with my family, but I decided to visit the Old Town Square and the Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock by myself. There's always the excitement from the astronomical clock to see the changing of the time and the little puppets popping out every hour. I also climbed the this building, which was really easy (there's an elevator) and it also has some history of the old town hall/astronomical clock. When you get to the top, the view is spectacular...
Great to see. In Old Town Square. Very crowded so watch your personal items. The clock is very interesting so read about it before you go. There are numerous outdoor cafés. Don't miss this!

Great View of Old Town Prague. The clock is fairly central to the old town of Prague. While the workings of this clock are impressive, the reason to visit the clock is to ascend to the top and take in the glorious views of the town. The price is about $4 and well worth it. There are both stairs and an elevator.

Awesome!. This is an awesome experience to go through. It is absolutely beautiful. The buildings, the architecture, the atmosphere, all combine to make a visit really worthwhile. And then there is the astronomical clock. And what a clock it is! To really be able to see it in all its glory you need to be standing, or even better to be sitting in front of it, if you can sipping on a cup of coffee or some other drink if you prefer, at one of the cafes and restaurants around the area. The clock strikes on the hour, every hour and a lovely procession goes by, as a trap door opens, of Christ and the Apostles. As this is going on, a skeleton of Death tolls a bell, just above. A rather funny and interesting sequence. Below the clock there are signs of the zodiac. The clock was built in 1338, a long time ago. Lots of fun. Not to be missed.
Clock. The clock was everything I had been told. Amazing to see what it does on the hour. Great area great courtyard.

Nice skeleton. Astronomical Clock is definitely worth to see. The ringing bell skeleton is the main reason for it. He every hour reminds you that time is running and you... be dead soon. I think creators of this clock had a good sense of humor.Better choose working day to see it, not weekends (lots of people).
Fascinating . The Old Town Hall Building was one of the most fascinating Buildings I saw in Prague especially the Astronomical Clock which can't be missed or its a must see at 12 noon..

Take a table, beat the crowds. Apparently a "must see" as the clock strikes the hour. There are two cafes just across from the clock, so grab a table, have a drink, watch the people and avoid the crush.

Astronomical Clock of Praga. For me is one of the best things to see in Prague, It's amazing that such an old clock is still working (the oldest in the world). The tower has one of the best views of the city. I recommend to watch the sunset.

My Fave. The entire town center and clock are amazing. The architecture is so typical of the region and the clock is beautiful. I must tell you that it will be packed when the clock chimes the hour but youmust see and hear it.
Beautiful clock but.... This is a beautiful attraction but there no point in waiting for the round hour to see the clock's show. Not that interesting.

Nice building and a must see attraction. A really cool building, with a clock which has some cool animations to watch. The inside of the clock tower is nice, has a good elevator (which we used to come down) but we took the ramp all the way up which was MUCH better than stairs, everyone hates stairs a slight incline ramp is always better. The view was really nice from the top, could see a lot of the surrounding city - a bit busy at the top but nothing major - a definite must see and do attraction in Prague!

Nice view if you can see above the tourists thronging. Just too many tourists over here to watch the hourly spectacle of the Astronomical Clock. However, if you happen to get here very early in the morning, you will enjoy it thoroughly.
Nice to see. We went to see the clock as was told it is interesting to see ,it is lots to see & places to eat & drink too .
No much to see. If you like to see this our maybe take some photo be there early after that the square will be full of people that will take pictures
The clock strikes. Such a site to see. Every hour on the hour the clock comes to life and the magic begins. Don't miss it.

Fun place to see an amazing clock and fascinating tourists.. Watching the tourists watching the clock is almost as fun as watching the animations of the clock. It is truly astounding that a clock this old still works and is accurate.

Well Worthwhile. Something to be done in passing, but timing is all! The lovely old clock chimes only on the hour, of course, so it is necessary to be there on time. Today at midday, the crowd was large but so enthusiastic that they applauded the clock! The old town hall is another of those wonderful old buildings which typify Prague. The whole experience is part of the positive atmosphere of this beautiful city.

One of the most striking buildings in Prague. Over the years the town hall expanded and consists of a row of colourful Gothic and Renaissance buildings. The tower offers spectacular views over the city, although it can get quite crowded at the top. The clock, which is one of the finest and oldest astronomical clocks draws huge crowds of people on the hour as the clock strikes and various mechanical figures perform.
Boring . It is so crowded, and unimpressive, I recommend walk by glance up, pass by. Take a picture when it is not going off. Watch out for pick pockets.

Nice to See. Nice to see at least once. Amazing as on how it was built, and how it work and how accurate it is.The history and meaning of each statue and the actions they do when they start moving on the hour.Wikipedia will explain everything if not guided by a tour guide.
Go to the top!. Pay the $ and take the elevator to the top! Walk down! Be sure to be in front when the hour strikes! Definitely worth the time to wait!

an experience not to be missed.. This was one of the highlights of my trip, you have to walk to the front to get a good view of the clock, but slightly back a bit and central to get a view of the two blue doors. I am not going to say no more otherwise it will spoil the event

Historical Clock. Area is packed with tourists well before the hourly clock activity. Well worth the wait. The clock chimes and has character movements above the clock with apostles and on the sides with skeletons.

Bit disappointed. We were at the square just before 6pm and saw lots of people looking up. Sheep as we are, we joined in and the 'spectacle' started at the hour.
Intersecting movements of the click and the puppets movements but don't drive out just to see this. Interesting when you are in the area around the full hour

Beautiful architecture. The architecture in the old town square is gorgeous, so much to see. The clock was interesting, but not as impressive as I was expecting! Lovely place to wander and enjoy the impressive buildings. We found a lovely tavern for lunch about five minutes walk away from the clock, we had a beautiful lunch and plenty of wine for 25€ , much cheaper than the restaurants in the square.

Packed with tourists. Be prepared for a deluge of tourists with cameras jostling for position to take pictures of the clock. The clock strikes at the top of each hour and it goes for only 16 seconds so if you are not ready you miss everything. Go early or late to really enjoy it.

Kitty Club in Prague. We went there every evening for dinner in the restaurant opposite the clock, the crowds all gather to see the clock and the figures moving as it rings on the hour. Great atmosphere.
Stunning Architures. The Old Town Hall situates just at the corner of the the Old Town square. You will find a very famous medieval beautifully preserved clock right at the side.

A great attraction. Spent an afternoon in Old Town Square and took time to watch the 4pm chime. Splendid example of a old world timepiece, worth a visit just to see it, although the area has so many beautiful buildings around.
Wonderful Old Clock. Amazing clock considering how long ago it was built. Pity the figurines only rotate for such a short time.
A must see. Be sure to be there on the hour to see the clock in action. It gets very crowded . Watch for the rooster at the top after the saints go back into the clock...he gives a little wing action

Neat experience . The clock itself is amazing and the story behind it makes it all the more interesting. What the clock does every hour draws a lot of people but it's kind of anti climatic but I guess you have to experience it. The walk to the top of the clock tower is worth it. However be aware the tickets can only be paid for with Crowns. No other payment is accepted.

Pretty clock and moving figures on the hour but a bit over rated. Attracts huge crowds but unless you happen to be in the square at the time for other reasons you might think it's a big fuss over a short event. The building and the moving figures are pretty but it is only hourly and doesn't last long.
Wonderful atmosphere!. Filled with history and great for people watching! Good window shopping but very high prices! Loved to sip coffee and enjoy the atmosphere

Lovely architecture and beautiful places. The buildings are colorful and very beautiful. Relax in the middle of the old town and you will have a lovely 360 degree view. Lot of segways available if you wanna try one. And the astronomical clock, u can find huge crowd gathering in front of the clock every hour to witness the clock. But it was notthat good and was a disappointing as it doesn't last more than 3mins.

A must see. It is the center of old Praugue and the clock and buildings are beautiful. Apparrenrly the poor clock maker has his eyes poked out afterwards so he could mot make another one!Prague has to be one of the most lovely and picturesque cities in the world

Very pretty, but too much fuzz around it. The buildings are amazingly beautiful. Absolute must-see. The fuzz about the clock makes it kind of disappointing once you get there and there are always so many people gathering right in front of it. It's beautiful, don't get me wrong, but it's not THAT mind blowing. Good to have seen. Doesn't take hours to stay here, but definitely go.

is that it?. We didn't go into the building, because we just wanted to see the clock open at every hour. We waited in the intense heat for 15 minutes to witness hourly spectacle but it lasted only about 1-2 minutes at most. Movement is very limited and nothing spectacular. Ok, it was done long time ago. My advise is, if you happen to be in the area near the time, fight with weather and crowd to see puppets wiggle a bit, but if not just enjoy the clock and tower as it is, which is very, very impressive!

Stopped here many times. We came by the clock many times. We came by on the hour to see the movement of the figures. The last morning I also went there at sunrise to get pictures with no one there. Worth seeing

Gotta See this. This was the best tourist investment we made, wait for a sunny day if you can.And take the elevator to the top, then walk back down the tower and read the history along the way. The views from the top of the clock tower are spectacular and help you choose your lunch destination ahead of time

Amazing artifact. It's worth the wait to see this ancient clock perform every hour on the hour. While a skeleton rings a bell 12 times, the 12 apostles appear circling through a window. A large crowd is gathered to view it amidst the shops and outdoor cafes of the Old Town. A fun Prague tradition!

Not must to see !, but its in the Old town square, drop on your way.. Not must to see !, but its in the Old town square , so on your way ,you can give it few minutes some photos and move on.It short display for every round hour , nice simple and short .i guess its impressive work regarded to the time it was build ,but dont expect too much . The place is very crowded most of the time , and by rumors you should watch your wallet .

Must see before you die. Prague is so wonderful, that deserves several visits to enjoy it to the fullest. One of the most characteristic elements of the city is that medieval clock dating from around 1410. The whole area contains wonders of architecture, and stroll through its streets is an experience that should take advantage of all our senses. Indispensable.
Centuries Old. The Astronomical clock is the oldest clock in this world. Its has seen all the good & bad times of Prague. It still is running with the same attitude.

A BEAUTIFUL PIECE OF ENGINEERING. When you walk through the square make sure that you are around here at the change of the hour. Then stop, and enjoy the beautiful clock go through its paces as the hour changes. Its magical, and very very pretty. But not only that it is a fantastic piece of engineering set into a beautiful building, which is a joy to see on its own. I never tire of watching this its like something from a fairy tale

SIMPLY GREAT. A visit to Prague and Astronomical Clock is synonymous . It rings on the hour every hour and is a sight to wonder. The 12 men come out from side windows, the evil man and the guitar man by the side are super. The lower clock goes around once in 12 months. A great photo op. for all.

One more checked off my bucket list. Now I know why the Astronomical Clock Tower attracts hundreds (thousands?) every day. This 600 hundred yr old instrument which keeps on ticking is better than a Timex.To see what happens every hour, you have to arrive early. Crowds gather quickly to watch the apostles appear.The whole large town square needs to be visited in a relaxed manner to appreciate all that it has to offer.
walkng old town. Enjoyed walking area. Watching clock. Lots of locals making declicacies and musicians and arts. Had fabulous time.
A must see. What an amazing and interesting time piece..Don't go to Prague and not watch the clock strike the hour!
Very busy. A very busy place, therefore did not stay long as felt vulnerable to pickpockets etc, Also too many sales reps, of various varieties, trying to get your money in a more legal way.

The Clock is a worthwhile sight - don't miss the clock on the hour. The Astronomical clock is fascinating - so old and still working (watch the display on the hour - the apostles appear and several statues move) This is another place to guard against pickpockets but don't worry unduly as you will enjoy the Town Hall and Clock.We climbed the town hall clock steps (there is a charge but its not expensive and the 360 degree view from the top is so worth it)

Prague Old Town Clock Tower. We waited with baited breath for the hour to chime and when it did, it was slightly disappointing. The only mechanical movement is the parade of the 12 apostles past a window. But the clock is unusual and you stand there for ages trying to work it out. After that I climbed to the top of the tower viewing gallery, halfway by stairs and the rest by a circular (and very old) lift. The view is tremendous and worth the effort. Walking all the way down, you can learn about the local history from plaques on the walls. A must if you are in Prague

Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. And yet another unforgettable Prague experience. Right next to the clock is a fabulous art deco building that had an incredible exhibit while we were there in December of 2015. The exterior, as fabulous as it is, is no comparison to the beauty inside.
Must see !. The place to visit on the hour every hour as the astronomical clock comes to life.A wonderful piece of architecture amongst many others in this great city.
The clock is stunning. It is in the corner of nice old town square and it is a gorgeous site! The clock is definitively interesting to visit and hear about it.

Historical experience. We enjoyed the square its history and cafes. The clock is unique, old and worth standing around to witness the hourly 'spectacle' even if it only lasts 30 seconds. The crowds that are there are proof of that.

Busy Place, The clock has History. This stands in a busy market place, The clock has history of moving in 2 directions as it has 2 sets of dials and there are funny characters on either sides which moves during certain times.

Great views of Prague. My wife and I took the elevator up to the viewing platform and walked down the stairs so that we could view history photos and learn about the history of the building. The views over the city of Prague were great from the top of the tower. The Astronomical Clock was interesting to observe on the hour. There are many moving parts to it that are very interesting.

the astronomical clock is a must see. You really can't say you've been to Prague if you haven't witnessed the clock and it's parade of figures - look for other things like the figure of death who tips the hourglass. You can also pay to walk up the tight spiral stairs for the view but we opted not to.

too good, both in day light and night. though they charge too much, but the top of the old town hall, gives such a view of the city that you will fell in love with the city. you can see all the places of historical importance. people stare on the watch at the click of every hour, what amuses them, I don't know

Must see in Prague. You should absolutely go see this wonderful monument in Prague, however I first visited around half past 12 and the square was relatively empty and I was able to see the clock and take some good photos - come 1pm the square is absolutely heaving you can barely move, found the clock chime underwhelming compared to seeing the clock earlier in the day!
Nice. Nice to see but maybe a little overrated so far as seeing the hour change. If you are there though, it is an amazing use of technology
Part of your Old Town Square tour. Nice to see but don't go just for that. Worth including as part of your Square visit. Clock goes on the hour (big surprise!)
Very cool. Wow, this clock has so many details and intricacies to it, that I kept returning to it during my stay in Prague. I was especially intrigued with the Saint of the day feature.
Exquisite,. The worlds oldest working astronomical clock. Worth taking a seat at the restaurant opposite - outside table...and have a beer while waiting for the clock to strike!

Truelly Amazing. If you can handle the crowds heading into the town center and seeing the clock is a definate must on anyones day tour. The place is just amazing and when it chimes if you are lucky enough to see (I wasn't) it is something to see. A must on anyones travel adventures. And if you can find the stairs at the start of the George Bridge head down and find the Lennon Pub and Wall, a massive tribute to the time John Lennon spent in Prague
Touristy, but interesting. Crowds...all to watch a clock chime. Somewhat interesting, and fascinating to watch. Looks quite beautiful, but you only need a few minutes to "get it".
Lovely trip and don;t miss out on this lovely place.. Lovely trip and don;t miss out on this lovely place. There is so much to do around this beautiful landmark and lots of lovely places to eat.

The best preserved clock ever. This beautiful decorated clock dates back to the 1600's. It's said that the clockmaker was made blind by the owners who assigned this man to build the clock in the first place. Because it was such a unique clockwork they where affraid for any duplications and they wanted to be the only one. Weird but true.Each hour the little statues next to the clock move and the 12 aposteles wil pass by.

Evening visit.. Went to the square for dinner and a rock group were setting up for a concert the next day so much of the square was blocked off for the stage and seating however the main part of the square was still accessible.

Stroll. Prague is a beautiful place. The Old Town is wonderful with lots to do and see. The Clock is beautiful and combined with the myth of the designer enhances the experience. Make sure you stay till the clock chimes on the hour.
not really worth the time. Little bit underwelmed crowds of people high exitement, and then the clocks strike 12 not much happened,.
really very interesting to see. try to see it while things are moving in and around it when every hour comes, its really nice to watch, i loved it
Just one beautiful clock. One histirical and beautiful clock. While walking the the old city you can see it. I was inside the building and i had amazing view of the city.

Lovely clock. This clock is well worth viewing especially on the hour when it chimes and the mechanics make the movements. Be warned it gets very packed but it is good. You can climb to the top of the clock to get an amazing panoramic view over the city, worth the climb up the steps!!

Hey it's free and easy and pretty cool. Right in the middle of town. Be there at noon and the show is kind of what you would expect- figures come out with swords and crosses and swivel around then the clock chimes and you know it's time for lunch and a beer. And the beer is good. Just go.
Interesting but not worth waiting for too long. Clock good to see for one occasion but does not last too long. The clock tower worth going up but use the lift up and walk down. Great views of Prague
A really nice square to visit.. Beautiful buildings, fascinating clock and cheep beer, what more do you need?! Well worth a visit when visiting Prague.

Great View of Prague!. We really loved this attraction! Great views of the square and the entire city - you could see in every direction. Great history on the way down (if you walk up or down) on the walls. Old Town hall has been through a lot! A must see in Prague!

Just beautiful. You have to visit this on the hour to see the little doors open and the figures move. It's so beautiful. The building itself is so special and we decided to get tickets to go up to the top. It was so worth it, the views were amazing. Not a difficult climb and a fairly cheap "must do".

Very quaint but also complex!. I think you need to be incredibly clever to be able to read this clock, let alone whatever genius possessed the man who built it. It is a feat of very clever engineering and a pleasure to behold. Be sure to catch the "performance" each hour on the hour.
Stunning views. The clock is well worth the visit and recommend a trip up to the top and views over old town and beyond are beathe taking.

Good !. The clock is very unique. Its actually not just a clock but has astrological version to it as well. It would also tell you that how long would the day last and when would the night end. The cute 3pm show at the clock too is good. Moreover the feel of that square is great

Highly overrated . It's cool to see the big square and the clock but it is pretty overrated if you ask me. Hundreds of people crowd together to watch the clock tick on the hour and it's always kind of a let down. Please watch your pockets as it is a pickpocketers paradise

Tick tock; Czech it out☺. The clock chimes nine times at 9:00AM or 9:00PM, so why visit when there’s a crush of crowds? My first visit was at four in the afternoon. Thousands of people surrounded the site. I heard the chimes, saw the “skeleton” tinkle a bell, but it appeared to be only a few inches tall. The next day after breakfast, I arrived at 8:50. Few tourists were there and I stood front and center under this magnificent astronomical clock constructed in the 1490s. Not even a Rolex would work after that many centuries. This cuckoo clock-like mechanisms perform for the audience. The “skeleton” in the right side of the attached photo rings a bell, and the other menagerie of characters interact with each other. This is far more than a timepiece. The clock measures astrological signs and astronomical events much like the Mayan calendar foretold of eclipses and the moon signs. Knowing that this was created more than 500 years ago staggers the mind. I have trouble adjusting my watch for the extra February day in a leap year. This is a must-see site in Prague, just off Old Town Square—where you’re likely to be, anyway.
Clock display. well we waited with bated breath for the display on the hour at the Astronomical Clock, but it wasn't that spectacular, but the building were very nice
Cool Clock. The Astronomical Clock is very cool to look at. The detail, architecture, and beauty is amazing. The buildings and colors around it just seems so surreal. Amazing!
Bucket List. Wow - I went up the clock in the tower, and you could see all over Prague. Also, the square is always having fun events and there's a lot of cool places to eat.

A nice city spot to be seen!. This is a beautiful medieval astronomical clock, the third oldest in the world and actually the last one still working! See it operating while the hour changes and live a unique moment with that great piece of history!

Rewarding climb. We did the climb to top for incredible views. It was quite easy as most was a comfortable ramp rather than stairs. It was really worth it.The clock was worth a watch and humorous to watch the crowds from above. My tips:1) Dont miss the photos exhibition on way up esp from Nazi period.2) The ticket office on corner of building doesnt take credit cards.It caught us out, and the bulk of our long ticket queue. They direct you to a red door to the left which does- and this office is much larger.3) Even when inside you still need cash for toilet.

I was a little underwhelmed.. The Astronomical Clock is high on most folks priority list of things to see as it was ours, however after waiting for it to get to work when the hour strikes, I expected a little more than the two little windows opening and models of the saints to revolve past. Maybe in previous centuries this was enough to wow the crowds but in 2016 it's a little meh.

So much history. We loved visiting the square and staring up intently at the clock - such magnificent innovation so long ago! Then from the square you can look across to the Powder Tower where the kings and queens of old would make their final wardrobe changes before proceeding to their coronations! So much history in those cobblestoned streets!!
Amazing time piece. Everyone that gathers at this Astronomical clock is aw struck to see this clock,astrological machine still works the way it did 700 years ago

A must see but be prepared for the masses!. The old town hall and its astronomical clock is one of the most impressive things to see in and around Prague (in my opinion). Be sure to try and visit on the hour to see the clock figures move and the apostles make an appearance. However, it is extremely crowded (especially on the hour because everyone else has the same idea) so just be aware that it most likely will be rammed.
Tourist Heaven. Why 1,000 people feel the need to watch a clock chime the hour with each other and take photos is beyond me - a nice clock but ruined by the clamour of tourists

The clock... maybe the most famous of all. First of all know .... if you dont go there you havent been to prague!!with that said. The clock is beutifull it is very recommended to get some explanation about it so as to enrich the visit you can get one from the free tours supllied by different companies in prague. If you dont it is 2 minutes of staring at a clock. Any way must see but not the most interesting one.

Has to be done. It's one of those things you just have to do when you are here.The clock is beautiful and it's a must see but it does get busy and being early doesn't matter because people just appear at a few moments to the hour and push in which can be bloody annoying but even so it's worth a look.

Good but crowded. The clock is one of the highlights of Old Town Square - but not the only one, and it's well worth wandering around. Unfortunately the crowds gather thickly (in all senses of the word) around the clock on the hour, so maybe if you want to see it in all it's glory, go early in the morning.

The place I love in the Prague . At old town hall and astronomical clock, I saw many lovers to take wedding photos at the same time in the morning.The place is so beautiful, and I also saw some touching pictures, the groom carried his bride in the crowd. So romantic ~

A fairy take. While I was told to be very wary of pickpockets near the astronomical clock (while you are staring up in the air lost in awe!), there were no issues when we visited Prague. At busy times, the crowds can get overwhelming. Just be aware of your belongings and use common sense. But the clock, the medieval church with spires and the feel of the square in general is just magical!

Kids will love to check this!. The clock looks good and the tower climb is a highlight too! Fee if covered if you've bought Prague Card. There're many stairs that you must climb up though.... Need strong feet, but it'll worth it because of the view!

Very nice place . Right in the Center square overlooking Tyn Church..A magnificent structure .,with city bird's eye view from the top..a must visit place..Good to get information on how clock works will make it more exciting...!!!!

A day well spent . We managed to get a front row seat in an adjacent coffe, and stayed until the top pf the hour brought out the various figures on the ornate clock. Attended a gorgeous baroque organ concert in am equally imposing cathedral. A very worthwhile day.

Science & History merge together. The zodiac signs in the clock, the history behind is fascinating and every hour the clocks show is absolutely great and fun, location was great and the restaurant around the area are good too.
Not terrible, app not working. Not that exciting, busy, some good souvenir shops, decent price , a few sit down cafes. Come early, less people. Many walking tour groups
Beautiful!. One of the best places in Prague! Can you visit Prague and not walk to the old astronomical clock? I liked it very much!

Very busy but great to see! . During the week is far better than on the busy tourist weekends. Gaggles of American and Asian tour groups staring at the clock to chime on the hour. I overheard a thick accented woman sharing with her tour group how the celestial clock area is the prime area to be pick pocket in town. Whilst staring into the air toward a clock in the air, watching diligently, simultaneously at iPhones to count down to the next hour- we forget to bring at h our wallets. So hold on tight while waiting for the clock to chime and rotate 12 statues of the apostles. Worth the visit once. Pay the 130 krona and climb to the top of the clock tour. Beautiful views of Praha.

A Mechanical clock which has not faultered..... The whole area is so lively with people all around, eateries busy serving the guests, and then when it gets closer to the hour - then the rush starts.The rush is there to see a very very short performance of a mechanical marvel, which has not faltered in ages. Yes, I know I spoilt the fun of waiting anxiously for the figurines to move and perform their action for a short 25 second performance.But the fact you were there to see the clock, is amazing.Walk around the area to notice the varied food options, from an open smoke pit roasting to fancy restaurants. The cobble stone roads will sure enhance the sights. Move further inside to the small by lanes, and the smaller cafes start appearing.

Rudimentary robotics in action. I suppose in the middle ages any display of moving figurines was high entertainment, they did not have TV, radio, the internet, movies, cars, airplanes, smartphones or iPads to distract them. We do, and because we do, a couple of wooden figures on springs going around in a circle, just aren't that entertaining, and if you say they are, you're flat out lying. The astronomical clock was conceived and made when people still thought that the world was flat, sun orbited the earth, dragons guarded the edge of the world and there was no America or Australia. Chances are excellent its astronomical computations are WRONG since they are based on some very bad data. Looks nice though, and that's what matters...right?
Very good. I love it but do not waist you time on the clock. Highly recommended to use a guide to hear the story behind. Not far there are free guides offering their service.

good view at the top. Situated in the old town square. To get here by public transport use tram 17/18 or metro line A Staromestska. Wasn't around to see the clock strike on the hour so missed out on seeing the doors open on the clock. Did climb the tower though - no lift. There is a charge, but I can't remember what it was. give yourself at least an hour if your climbing the tower. Plenty of places to eat and drink.
Not the most overrated place at Praha . Enjoyed a wonderful evening there. Learned the historic significant and the medieval technology behind the clock.A must watch area of Prague tour.

Over in the Blink of an Eye. This clock attracts large crowds on the hour every hour to see the saints appear as it strikes the hour. I don't understand the attraction as it is over very quickly and there isn't much to see really. The clock is beautifully constructed and worth a photo or to but don't hang around for long and get their early to hear it strike the hour
Tick tock astronomical clock. On the dot every hour - the magic starts - and two shutters near the top of the clock open to reveal saints moving in a circle while clock strikes the hour,
Impressively. Fine work of old masters attracts thousands of tourists every day. Their art is amazing. This is a must see. And nearby there is an observation tower and many restaurants.

Must ser. A beautiful and intriguing piece of engineering. Miraculous views from the top of the tower. The 20 second shows of the clock are cool. A proper guide can explain how everything works and what each of the complex dials does what.
Astronomical clock. This is an amazing piece of art - every hour it puts on a 'performance' which you need to watch a couple of times to see everything that happens.

Be there 15 minutes before the hour to get a good spot!. The Astronomical clock has a great show that runs each hour. It is amazing to watch and the clock itself has so much history and meaning to it. Be sure to get there at least 15 minutes before the hour to get a good spot as it gets packed
What an interesting thing. So unique. It was fun trying to figure out what all of it meant. Then you can read about it and find out for sure.

Worth the walk. Read wikipedia for the detail but it is so worth going to see as it was installed in 1410, that alone deserves your site-seeing respect. The only downside is the endless Segway tour reps offering you deals, but go anyway, you're on holiday and it's what you should be seeing. Now just because it tickles me, either on your way there or back you really should drop into the Apple Museum as the 1410 "app" and the 2016 apple are both telling you the same thing and both are cool.

A must visit to the top of the tower. Surprisingly the climb was not on a spiral staircase but a gentle slope and a good little walk. There is even a lift! The views are magnificent although if it is busy it can be nose to toe at the top. There is always a crowd in the square to see the clock strike the hour so get there early if you want a good view.

Great place . If you go to Prague you must visit here lots going on all day.
Time it to the hour to see the clock strike
Lots of nice places to eat around and some street food
Just go and visit

You should definately visit but to be honest its a little boring. Crowds gather every hour to watch the clock. There are often a couple of hundred people waiting to see the skeleton ringing the bell and the Apostles moving across the windows. It only last for a couple of minutes and to be honest is a bit boring - go and watch it and then move onto something more exciting

Marvelous!. The design and craftsmanship of this old clock is just amazing. To imagine the knowledge and the time that went into creating this Marvel just blows my mind. I have found the best place to see the clock.is actually the Mozart room. Have dessert or dinner and enjoy the marvel of this gorgeous workmanship.

Err not sure what all the fuss is about, but it is elegant.. Well it is definitely popular and you can tell that its getting near the hour because every guide currently within a half mile leads their particular party there from up to a quarter of an hour before hand. The skeleton is amusing and every one applauds at the end, but in my opinion the clock in Leicester Square does more, lasts longer and is more entertaining, so now I know I wouldn't have lost any sleep over missing it. But its free so nothing lost except time from clock watching and if you are an horologist, then I am sure you will be happy.
Wonderful. very special place..obviously a must see if you travel to praga..even by night was beautiful and full of life

Underwhelming clock show. The clock show was cute, but underwhelming. The square has beautiful views of buildings all around. Also, the last clock show is at 9:00pm each day, so don't be the tourist standing around waiting for it to go off at 10:00pm!
Lovely location. It is extremely lovely to go there both day and night and watch the amazing buildings, incredible architecture and nice people wandering around

Huge disappointment. On the hour at the hour, the square fills up with people eagerly waiting to see the clock - and while it's very pretty, I can't help thinking what all the fuss was about?If you can see through all the Japanese tour groups, and their ubiquitous selfie sticks, you see a clock with various moving figures....but tbh, the Swiss Centre clock in London does more and is more entertaining. I wouldn't rush back to see it again.
Amazing feat!. This must be the crowning glory of Old Town! Lots of shopping opportunities in the area. This is a beautiful area, and so easy to just meander from.shop to shop!

Worth a visit. Enjoyed tower visit and tour of the Old Town Hall, the tour guide was great, cant remember his name but a lovely young man who was very knowledgeable and engaged really well with the group - added some humour too which is always nice. Great pictures from the tower and information provided about the clock.
Main Attraction of Prague. Whenever any searches for any attractions of Prague, this place is invariably mentioned in the information. I could see this moving clock in the afternoon.

Getting to the top is well worth the View!. The Old Town Hall is a complex of several ancient houses in the Old Town Square, Prague. The view from the top is most impressive over the red tiled roofs of the surrounding buildings and streets and the Old Town Square. Don't worry you can go up by a lift.The horologe (Astronomical Clock) is the most famous feature of the Town Hall and , it was first built in the first decade of the 15th century. The moving features and chimes - the Parade of the Apostles show occurs every hour on the hour,No visit to the city would be complete without going here.

Good looking Town Hall. Prague is one of the oldest and stunning cities in Europe. The city is very clean and has plenty of sites to see, downtown. We were amazed how clean everything is and how the residents are proud of there city.

Must go for the views. The view from the top is simply unmissable. There's very little space however, so pick a time that is not too busy so you have some room to manoeuvre on the viewing platform. The underground tour was closed on that day due to a special occasion.

Never boring. I never get bored of going there. I stayed three days in Prague and had to go there every day. You can enjoy the crystal shops and the very nice cafés in the square while admiring the astronomical clock and all the tourists.

The place to go!. This was a wonderful time, we got to see the clock chime also. Because this is centrally located, we walked by many times. There are street performers and food stands in the area that are great as well.
Relax and watch. At the end of 'all inclusive tour' of Prague, one will find oneself in front of the Old Town Hall and Astronomic Clock.Highly recommended !

600 years in operation and beautiful too. So much to be said for the history yet standing before it was jaw dropping. I love that this magnificent timepiece is an engineering marvel yet is beautiful to behold in person. Take it all in as you enter the old square as you eyes will naturally go to the castle and elsewhere.

Astronomical Clock Orloj. You have to be there on the hour when appear in the window 11 Apostles and St. Peter. at the same time the skeleton left hand turns an hourglass, it displays the time expiresa. Right pulls the bell which means you should start to go. In addition to the death is three figures that symbolize the three qualities of men, the first shows irresponsibility and enjoyment, the secend avarice and the third arrogance. All three men shook his head swaying showing that they do not want to go.
City of Prague. Wouldn't say you've been to Prague unless you made a trip down here; albeit the clock action was, average; but be here or be square :)

Great attraction. We had to visit this place, it looked so interesting and we weren't disappointed although perhaps not if you aren't good with heights! you pay a reasonable amount to go up. We walked some of the way and used the lift for the remainder. You walk around the tower at the top and although very busy, you do experience the most remarkable view over the city. We walked all the way down and there are old photos and information, very well exhibited, on the walls as you go down each level. The history of this tower is amazing!

Beautiful ,,,,,. A little deception once you compare the clock with the ones in Beauvais , Lyon , or Strasboug , but the location outside is perfect . Be sure to have a drink in a bar facing the clock , and record it .... you won't be trapped bt the crowd . the Old City Hall is superbe , but take a tour with a guide to know more about it .
Great views from the tower. After watching the Parade of the Apostles show which occurs every hour on the hour, climb the clock tower to get a great view of the Old Town Square.
You did not see Prague if you haven't been here. A must when you're in the Old Town. There are lots of stories to learn and hear about in this beautiful place. " it's magical especially at night"...

People are as much fun to watch as the clock!. A visit here at the top of the hour is a rite of passage every visitor to Prague should consider. We find the crowds of anxious tourists are as entertaining as the star of the show.

Clock great but be careful exchanging currency at Chequepoint money exchange...ripoff. This is not about the clock, but about the currency exchange house across from the clock....in the morning I had exchanged euos for czech currency near my hotel for 1 euro for 26.2 czech money....the currency exchange house called chequepoint directly across from the clock only paid my wife 15.1 czech money for euros....BUYER BEWARE...they have audio recordings saying do not exchange money on the street, but meanwhile supposed reputable firms with big storefronts rip you off as well.I will never EVER DEAL with CHEQUEPOINT again!!!!!

Most fav place ever!. Prague is definitely at the top of my TOP list! Its culture, atmosphere and food is just so exceptional! Each season is very specific and I love it at any time (winters are pretty cold but super romantic!). Highly recommended! :)
Beautiful!. This is a free must see land mark in Old Town Prague. It's from 1410 and the oldest working astronomical clock in the world so don't miss it!
Lovely city BUT A LOT OF DRUGS SOLD EVERYWHERE . I loved the city and history but was offered drugs and escort mid day and evening time in all central areas so this spoils the atmosphere.

Has a really nice feel. Going up the tower wasn't that impressive and costs money... but every hour they have a show where the apostles wave at you from the clock tower. The most annoying thing was the Segway tour people asking you to get on a Segway and trying to sell you a tour. Other than that the square is really nice and chilled.

Square - nice. okay the square is very very beautiful but what's with all the rush about the clock ? you can read about it in every single guide book but it's just a few apostoles going around. not so magical. worth seeing, but i dont see whats all the hype about

Everything is moving. An impressive feat of mecanical engineering
And perfectly maintained
Show is at every hour sharp of course early morning is better to enjoy it

Tic tac.... The most cool thing about the clock is that it was build centuries ago and still working. The figures at all fix hours are making a mini show about the matter of time in life. And time is the same no matter the social status. Pretty amazing!Try to get there in the morning so you'll avoid the crowds, we didn't and it kind of stress you out as you have to enjoy the show and take care about the pickpockets...

Go for the Old Town Hall Tour!. The Old Town Hall Tour is absolutely worth every penny. 100 Kc (~S$6) for a 45min of informative and enriching tour of the Town Hall (including the Chapel of the Virgin Mary, Municipal Hall, Old Council Hall etc.) the old underground cellars, the vestibule...You will also get to see up close the 12 apostles who parade through the windows of the Astronomical clock hourly! With this tour, we also got a combined and discounted ticket up the Tower (80Kc instead of 130 Kc), for an unparalleled view of the Old Town and beyond. You can take the elevator up to the top (save your energy), than walk down the tower, where the isles are lined with pictures and history of the old town, telling us how much war and destruction the city has seen just in the past few decades....For the guided tour, we could just turn up 10min before the tour to purchase the ticket. Obtain the timings from the red building's tourist information desk, right next to the clock tower; the staff are friendly, polite and welcoming.

The Old Town Square is Magical!. The Old Town Square is a very magical place to see. Every hour the the clock action-movement along with the dinging of bells takes place. Everyone wants to take a photo! Its a must see when you're in Prague!

Exciting Sight. It is a medieval clock which over a period has suffered damages several times and restored. The last renovation was in 2005 and the parade of the wooden statues etc at the strike of the hour is must see. Hoards of people gather around close to the hour.

Really Fun to See Old Technology and Marvel. So, this clock has seven different times that it is managing and recording. It's fun to sit there and try to figure out exactly what each one is trying to convey. There is also a coockoo style show on the hour from like 8am to 9pm. The top of the clock opens up and passes the apostles through it while a skeleton rings the bell. It's pretty cool. Also, just wait around and listen to some of the tour guides explaining the information about the clock, (that way it's free to you). It's definitely worth the trip and wait. Make sure if you're going to watch the clock, stand away from the clock farther back or you won't see the figures at the top.

Wonderful site in Prague. No doubts, it is a must do while in Prague, it is located just in the city center. Every hour, tourists will gather around the clock to see the 20 seconds spectacle. It is a unique clock. In the clock tower, there is a sightseeing deck where you can ascend to get a nice sight of the city.
Cool clock. It's a clock with a short (<1 minute) show on the hour. Not very impressive without more information about it. So definitely read up on some information before going there.

Worth the wait!. We walked from the Szech Bridge down to this area and enjoyed the wait for the clock to strike the hour.Won't tell you what happens just go and have a look!!Beautiful building and a very busy place.
unusual clock in Prague. The clock is an icon here and must be seen if you go to Prague. You just have to be in the square at the hour. The "show" is very short.

A buzzing square with great archtectural building especially the Astronomical clock. This is a very lively area and the Astronomical Clock has a display of the statues movement on every hour by the clock. It is a fun thing to watch and also because there are so many tourists all around waiting to see this together. There are cameras going up everywhere. this place has some great restaurants and cafes also.

Don't expect much. Nice for a quick picture.. This is a pretty clock on an old, impressive tower but the clock just does its thing every 60 minutes and it only lasts about 90 seconds total. Much of the fun is watching the tourist crowd excitedly taking hundreds of pics as if it was a moon landing !

The main attraction in "to do" list for Prague visit !. The main attraction in "to do" list for Prague visit ! Yes, I'm sure ! It is oldest working Astronomical Clock in the World ! The Astronomical clocks developed by Richard of Wallingford in St Albans during the 1330s, and by Giovanni de Dondi in Padua between 1348 and 1364 are masterpieces of their type. Do not miss it !
Interesting clock. Definitely worth quick look at this unusual clock, which is near the old town square. Lots of interesting buildings nearby too.
Pretty but no information . Very pretty. No information of what it is. Too many people round it so you can't really see it. Bit of a waste of time
wonderful clock. The clock is something of spectacular. Around it there are a lot of stands and this part of the city is full of restaurants and people

Another one of these things you just have to do when you are in Prague!. It's best to get there about 15 minutes before the hour if you would like to get an unobstructed view of this fascinating astronomical clock when it has it's hourly show! It is in a very busy and crowded Old Town Square. Fun thing to do!
Just make sure you're on time. Each hour, on the hour, the little doors above the clock open and little people come round in turn and bow to the watching crowd. You just have to watch it - once!

Crowded, historical central area. The clock chimes & activates hourly until 9 pm. Not an elaborate or long show & there's always a crowd. Cereal area for shopping, eating, being approached for Segway & other tours. A few blocks away (on way to Wenceslas Square) is the old crafts/ souvenirs/ fruit market that is daily until 6 pm & has been operating since 1232.

Make time to see it...... The clock is a lovely example of engineering and technology from the 1400's. The area itself has beautiful buildings, lots of restaurants but also comes with huge crowds of people (and beware of the pick pockets there). The view from the clock tower is delightful (and accessible by lift, or you can choose to walk up the ramps). I thought it was worth the 10 min wait in the packed square to see the clock strike on the hour. People have been gathering in the square to meet and greet for century's so it's great to be part of that ongoing history. I did hear someone complain that the clock 'show' wasn't that spectacular, but I suspect they also thought Stonehenge was just a pile of rocks! You need to appreciate it for what it is, the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and I believe, the oldest one still working.The clock still stands after 606 years and shows not only time but also indicates the location of the Sun on the ecliptic via the Zodiacal ring. Definitely a must see.

Gets very busy on the hour!. This truly is a beautiful clock, however, I never actually saw it chime on the hour as it always got so busy around it! A very touristy area! A beautiful clock just to look at though!

Impressive!. The view from the top of the old Town Hall tower is one of the most beautiful sights at sunset that we have seen. All of the old buildings are bathed in a golden light, and the sun reflects off the red tile roofs. You can take the elevator to the top or walk up a long and winding ramp. Along the way are posters, depicting the history of the tower- fascinating reading. The Astronomical Clock is a wonder in itself. Every hour the figurines begin their little dance during the chiming of the clock. The Glockenspiel in Munich has a more extensive routine, but this is nice also

I mean...if you must . This is on the "to do" list, but I don't understand why. Every hour there is a massive crowd waiting to see a 20 second show. We stood there for 20 minutes waiting and when it was over we, and everyone around us, felt slightly foolish to be honest. Still, if I hadn't done it I'm sure I would be thinking I left something undone. We were basically done for the day so it was a good laugh. But please, please dont think you need to plan your day around this. If you're there, great. But don't run in a frantic pace to make it. You'll be ok not set 12 little statues pass by a window. However, after all 12 apostles pass, the little golden chicken above the window flaps his wings and clucks. It happens in a blink, but the people who saw it all laughed. My son missed it which was a bummer, so be watching. (Because I know you're going to go anyway no matter what I say).
very crowded. it's worth the wait to see the astronomical clock along with all the other tourists. beautiful buildings and an array of great shops and restaurants.
A wow!. Beautiful example of engineering and technology, even if it is 600 years old! A must see if you are in Prague. Beware of pick pockets here, as this is where we found many.

One of the Worlds Great meeting Sites. Coolest Clock I have seen in a long time. I loved Old Town Prague and this was the center of everything. People gathered and clapped as the Clock struck on the hour. Prague is brilliant for maintaining this super cool Tourist attractions.

Amazing!. Given the period it was created, this astronomical clock is amazing. Watching it strike the hour is a treat. The characters of vice are interesting and in line with moral training of the time. Worth the time!

Charming chiming of the clock - a must do when in Prague. The astromical clock has so much history and is fascinating to see and hear. We saw it as part of a city tour and went back to it a few times after. You can hear it from any part of the Old town square. There is the option to go to the top too but there is a charge for that. Big crowds do gather for the chime which is on the hour so get there about 15mins before to ensure a good view of all the figures.

Very Neat Clock. City hall looks like a church but is several connected buildings. You can climb the tour. The clock displays figures of saints on the hour. Big crowds gather. The figures of saints don't come out but rather move behind the doors.

The Clock Work!!. Considering the fact that it is the oldest astronomical clock in the world that is still under operation, this is worth the time spend for visiting. A good guide can explain you the working mechanism which is quite impressively accurate after all these years.
Visit on the Hour. Didn't know and I wish I would have...every hour from 8am-8pm the clock goes off and the figures move. I hear it is quite a scene!

Beautiful piece of art . The astronomical clock is really marvelous, but I didn't feel it was that important to see it when it rings. Just looking at it is enough. However when we happened to be around we watched it ring.
Old Town and Clock. Very touristy area! Lots of shops and restaurants....even Starbucks. The clock is a must see, very crowded at the hour of the "show".

Definitely worth a visut. This is a lovely landmark in the old town square and worth a visit. You can walk to the top and see for miles over the city.
There are lots of restaurants around the square so you can watch it from the comfort of your table if you want.

come at sunset. lovely square, lots of things to look at. Try the coconut Geloato at the U Prince kiosk, see the amazing Astornomical Clock and watch the sky change color at sunset behind the church. great shops, theaters and food in this area.
Astronomical Clock Show. touristy area and will become more crowded when show begin, the 12 apostles will be shown in the tiny window above.
Beautiful building. The building is beautiful and the clock as well. The "show" every hour is a bit of a disappointment but still a must to see.

"A place to be". The splendid Astronomical Clock is a show piece of the old town square of Prague. Tourists gathering there hourly wait for the clock to chime. The figures of the Apostles and other moving sculptures parade out to greet you.Behind this famous clock there is a tall 13th century Gothic tower and several ancient houses connected together that make up the Town Hall. From the outside you can see the Clock Tower, the chapel and other buildings. Each building has a unique architectural style. The interior is beautiful. They offer guided tours. The door at the left side of the clock is the main entrance.Happy Travelling!

W got the full show!. Walking free tour on a Sunday afternoon, guide Rafa timed our walk so we saw the "on the hour" display of the old clock. Cute. Very old. And he explained all the dials and figurines, excellent.

Beautiful heart of the old quarter but get there early. Beautiful, fascinating buildings at the heart of the old quarter but get there early to avoid the crowds and take an informed guide if you really want to get the best out of the experience. Just half an hour made all the difference between being able to have a really close look and enjoy all the interesting fine detail and having to battle with selfie poles and those just wanting to tick off another "must do".

Amazing clock. The Astronomical Clock is located at one end of the Old Town Square. The crowds get bigger as the hour approaches. Worth seeing the figurines appear once but would recommend avoiding that section of the square near the hour from then on.
Very nice. Nice place to visit but very busy and noisy loved the clock lots of placed to eat but expensive compared to other parts

Architecture nice but very underwhelming.. I had read mixed reviews of this so wasn't sure what to expect really. I couldn't believe the amount of people that turn up on the hour. The area around the clock is jam packed. When the hour turned and the clock chimed and did its thing I found it extremely underwhelming. I was staying only 2 minutes walk away from the town square - would have been very annoyed to have travelled across the city and dealt with the crowd for this.

This is a must see if in Prague. Everyone gathered in the old town to see the figures appear when the clock chimes. It was a great experience, but choose a good place to stand if you are taking pictures or a video as people don't seem to care if they get in your way

Amazing to see so many people wait to see the figures in the clock go around for 20 seconds. The Square and clock are rich in history and a must see when in Prague. Be sure to look around while waiting for the clock. The gold decorations and tiles in the Square are beautiful. Great place to people watch and get your pocket picked. I am amazed that so many people wait 30-45 minutes to see little figures go around for 20 seconds.

Charming Old Town Centre . This square is very beautiful and the hub for performers, tourists and travelers. The Astronomical Clock is certainly worth seeing, but don't spend too much time waiting for the brief "show" on the hour. If you are nearby at that time, check it out, it's interesting and perhaps most impressive that it's still working after all these years. The cafes surrounding the square are great for people watching over a drink but perhaps not the best value for meals. It's seems all roads lead to the Old Town Square so you'll likely end up there several times on your trip. The square is particularly charming in the evening when it's lit up!
Phenomenal time piece. Watching this clock is a must do when in Prague, the problem is everyone agrees and it's really difficult to get near it when the clock strikes the hour, but it is beautiful.

Steady climb for great views . Apart from watching the astromical clock do its thing every hour, a climb up to the top of the tower is recommended. A steady inclined walk rather than steps makes it fairly easy. Great views from the top. Information on the wall as you walk up explains the history. There is lift but it wasn't working during our visit.

Heart of the old town. This is the heart of the old city where everyone converges to see the clock tower, church and other beautiful buildings dating back 800 years. It is a beautiful plaza and a must see when you are in Prague.

Old Town Hall rich in history. Took an ad hoc English guided tour after visiting the clock tower. Highly recommend this as you can see and learn alot more of Prague's history. Mosaic art in one of the halls ia just magnificent. There is a lift service up the clock tower for the amazing breathtaking view.
Mesmerising!. Although some tourists feel this is overrated, I love it, and find it mesmerising, no matter how often I watch it.

Center of the town. Of course you need to see the old town hall and clock but keep in mind that the beauty of Prague is mainly the architecture and the sculpture and details on the buildings. The interiors do not always live up to the exteriors.
No highlight. The place is nice to visit, but do not bother to wait in a crowd for the hourly appearance of 12 apostels in the clock; better see that in Munich
A must-see. Crowds gather round to see the hourly spectacle, in a beautiful setting, with great outdoor dining in the square. A must-see
Worth seeing. Worth seeing but not a lot to see to be honest.very crowded on the hour when it all chimes etc but not what i expected.

Gets very crowded. Best to secure a spot up close---the "show" is only a minute long but study the characters in and around the clock face---interesting. Restaurants around the square are great.
Watch your belongings.
Old world charm. The old town hall square is an interesting place in Prague. Astronomical clock is the centre of attraction for the tourists.
Night view . We went up in the tower at the end of the day because we ran out of time and we got some nice view of the buildings all lit. There was no wait at that time which was an added plus.

Nice history place... a must visit when in Prague. The Old Town Hall is certainly a must visit when in Prague, with the nice architecture and overall ambience. Worth waiting for the on-the-hour Astronomical Clock 'performance', though it is relatively short.

you want to be there on the hour to see the clock. 'everyone' stops to watch the clock w the 12 'apostles'
who appear on the hour along w the chiming of the bells
great sight [especially first time & for kids]

Its a must see . You will never get the idea of this clock untill your in front of it and it goes off. But be careful and be careful and keep a close eye on your belonging as some people get targeted by pick pockets around that time due to the distraction and the big crowd.

Crowd pleaser!!. This is unusual sort of clock. Take the time to wait for the hourly strike and watch what happens. Beware of pick pockets as you stand and watch as you are all looking up and they are all out working in pairs.
A photographers paradise. Absolutely stunning buildings. Gets very crowded, but when we were there, there was a wedding which was beautiful to witness. The clock is amazing and chimes on the hour.
Beautiful Old World charm. A must see in Prague, especially the once an hour spectacle that everyone gathers for! Really lovely and a great photo opp as well!

The Clock is Wonderful!. Go at 10:00 am and look for the two blue windows and watch carefully - the windows open and you will see the statues change in them. We must have taken 20 pictures of the clock!
The clock was turning but .......... Seen similar clock's in other parts of the world and the twenty second view of the monks in the bell tower was not worth the wait.

Interesting and curious. I loved this place. I had read about this wonderful clock and be there was fantastic. You must know its history and how it works, formidable. Unlike any other in the world. People are up to some time in which for a small windows parading the 12 Apostles. Beautiful.

A must see. So much history in Prague. This is one stop you have to make if you are in Prague. Every hour there is a short show at the clock. The two small doors open and the apostles can be seen while all the stature move. Pretty cool to see. It's a short show but pretty cool if you are in the area. Make sure you get there a little early if you want to see it. The crowds will get bigger as the hour approaches.

View from the top. Went up the clock tower and found it really interesting inside. Could either go up in a glass lift which for people scared of heights is no good or you can walk up a path to the top. You get to see some interesting facts about it being hit in the sea one world war and how it was rebuilt. And other facts. Also on a night one of the tour companies does lamp light walks below the foundations of the tower and town hall which I thought was great well worth a trip up the tower to see the lovely view of Prague

Historical amazing lovely Prague . The wonderful view from this tower seeing the hall Prague with all the amazing detail full of history and beauty you will stay hours and hours looking for it and enjoining the culture and history looking for the people coming around all the world is really an Wonderfull city
Take the tour. Everyone comes to see the amazing 15th century clock on the Old Town Hall but if you have the time taken the tour of the building the views are fantastic

Excellent clock. I love clocks and this one is completely amazing. It's the only old working astronomical clock in the world and was fascinating. A dig disappointed with the hourly chime sequence but really worth the visit.
Needs to be seen. This attraction is one of Prague's most famous and busiest tourist attraction. The square is full of restaurants and bars ideal for people watching but also expensive
Cycle of life. You are mesmerized by the story the clock tells. The simple way life and its cycles are shown. Absolutely ingenious!

delight. the old town hall from architecture point of view is good, the clock really boring, but the fun part of it, watching the people gathering around, getting their cameras ready to photograph that thing, then most of them go bored in a while

Definitely worth a look. Very busy around the clock but that just adds to the experience, some amazing architecture around the square with lots of paintings on buildings also very close to designer stores for a bit of window shopping or posh car spotting!!!
We watched the clock with a glass of hot wine in cafe opposite - flippin lovely x

Beautiful building and brilliant tour. We chose to take a tour around the Old Town Hall which was fantastic. The tickets were bought from the Old Town Hall itself, and the staff tell you what the time slots are that day and in what languages (they offered tours in English, Russian, Czech and German from memory). The tickets were only 100kč each and it offered great value for money. The tour lasted approx 1 hour and explored the ornate rooms of the building, the chapel and the cellars. The tour guide was very knowledgeable, friendly and happy to stay behind after to answer questions. This is by far the best way to explore this beautiful building.
Worth to go. We paid to go up to the top in order to see the whole view of Praque. It was worth to be there and nice scenery!

Unique Astronomical Clock, Great Tower Views, and Interesting Subterranean Space. The clock was originally built in 1410 and is the oldest astronomical clock still operating in the world. It is a wonderful example of medieval master craftsmanship and understanding of math and astronomy. It is both a piece of art and a highly functional timepiece and calendar, It is worth either reading about it from a guidebook, available inside Old Town Hall or having a guide explain how it works. It is a bit of a walk to get to the top of the tower, but the panoramic views of Prague are well worth the effort and small admission fee (there is also an elevator).There are a series of rooms under the Old Town Hall, which were used in medieval times (the Hall was built on top of it) and also used during WWII.
Disappointed . Ok.....so we didn't do any of the museums or formal tours, but after waiting for the chimes on the hour we were a little deflated.......perhaps we just missed all the action.

What a view of city. As much as Astronomical clock is a mechanical wonder, it's really worth to get up the tower, see the history of the building while walking on the way to top and enjoy the great view of the city from above. Good is that climbing is not with stairs (except bit on the entrance and winding ones on the end with traffic light on it due size)

Brilliant view from the Tower. Brilliant view from the Tower of a wide area, a bit of a queue but it moved quickly and was not expensive. The clock was beautiful and gathered lots of crowds at midday to see the fabulous movements.

The old clock still works and people assemble every hour to see and listen to the chymes. The clock is in the old town.A beautiful town Center for leisure shopping and enjoy the food specially the local Pisner beer

Lovely. The astronomical clock is different from anything I've already seen. It's beautiful in it's one way, unique and especial. The old tow hall holds the possibility of going up the tower and see Prague from above. Amazing!

All within walking distance . We didn't know about the Clock and just happened to be walking past on the hour, the blue door/hatchs open on the hour and bird comes out Huge crowds were around Nice expensive Irish bar just up from it

Stunning views, incredible engineering, very sad back stories. Prague is all about the old town square and the clock. It dominates the skyline, and the square dominates the nightlife.The clock frontage is a remarkable piece of engineering for the time (albeit now restored), but the best is the view across Prague from the top, and in my case the walk back down as you read the history of the tower and clock on the walls, and especially the WWII era which is both sad and moving, especially the town Mayor who effectively gave his life in 1940 trying to stand up for his city and country against the Nazi occupation.I cant recall how much this cost, but it was well worth it. Take your time, take your camera, and enjoy.
Fabulous. Prague is a fabulous city with such history and beauty. Our guided tour was fabulous. The clock tower was great. One regret is that I did not purchase a pocket watch there.

Amazing place. I just love everything about this place, the architecture, food, people and everything! The Astronomical clock really is interesting and is a must see if your a tourist visiting Prague. Can't wait to go back!

Fasinating. Beautiful building and amazing history. You can go up the tower to get a better view of the Old Town Square. The clock is amazing and considering it is free to see it is amazing. Worth the visit. Would go again if i get the chance

Great views, go early!. We left this till the last morning, and as it opens at 11am we waited to get tickets with no problem (most people were stood watching the clock) Avoid the rush add walk the first set of steps, then get the elevator UP and walk down the tower to view the pictures and history. At the top you have great views (it was sunny) and well worth taking your time. With wording explaing the views it is easy to see whats in Prague from up here. Definietly worth the trouble of getting here, on our way down we saw hundereds of people coming up, so GO EARLY.
Interesting . Very interesting and every hour there is a small clock show from the medieval times which last May be a couple of minutes little but overrated but interesting

Amazing Clock that You Must See. Seeing this clock won't take long, about half an hour, but be sure to get there at the top of the hour to see the 12 apostles showing in the two doors on top and be sure to read about the astronomical features before going. This is definitely worth a visit, and it is free to boot. Can't beat that.
Unique attraction.. A must see when visiting Prague. Crowds are guaranteed, but a hint would be to leave your visit to see the clock until late evening, when there are less people around.

Great tour of the town hall. We took a tour of the town hall, and it was very good. Our guide was great, and it was interesting to go down below the town hall and to see the area below level.
