We took the elevator up to the top - great views from the top of the square down below. We took the 1:00 tour, and you can purchase tickets for it in the entrance area of the town hall.

Must do for every visitor. It's a must do for every visitor to Prague--just look at the crowds every hour on the hour. The clock display may not be the most spectacular, but it's old fashioned and very charming and literally everyone watches it at least once. So go and see it! It's almost worth to watch it just for the reaction of the crowd, some of them get so excited, it's truly funny. There are many fascinating details, like a skeleton that reminds us that we are all mortal. Definitely recommended

A place to see before you kick the bucket.... Take your time here, don't bother with a tour but you can wander past them and listen in because there are so many of them going on all around you. The astronomical clock is a marvel, and after a few hours wandering the streets you'll be convinced that all roads lead back to the main square...
Great Architecture. This attraction has survived the World Wars and Soviet control and is still beautiful and definitely worth a visit.
One of a kind show. It's over in a matter of seconds and the crowds pack the square in front of the clock, but it's a mechanical marvel

It Won't Take Long.... ...but try getting there on the hour (you'll have a little crowd), to see the character movements. You can go up to the top (which I recommend and catch some gorgeous views of the city). The clock is cool and it's right in the old town square, so you can catch it all without spending a lot of time (although like I mentioned in a previous review, it's a great hang out place with great people watching.

Just a clock and a moment in time. This is an ornate clock- everyone stands around it chimes and then it's over. That brief moment while standing there in anticipation with the crowd is pretty exciting! The square fills almost magically- a must see!
Gorgeous Old Clock. Make sure the see this marvelous historical clock. It's unique and make sure to read the guidebooks about the history of the clock.

It's a nice clock ..... The Missus dragged me along to see this clock she had read about. So we arrived about ten to three and there was already quite a large crowd, and we sort of squeezed our way through so we could see this magical thing on the hour. Three O'clock arrived, and i'm afraid, so did a dose of disappointment, nothing really happened. But the square itself was very nice and I was rewarded with some ham and beer.
Clock. To my great disappointmentClocks are beautiful, but I expected more from it. During the entire hour was a lot of people everywhere and it took very little. I was disappointed.
Nothing exciting!. The old town hall and the astronomical clock is not so exciting. If u happen to be there in the evening time do observe.

Incredible views. This was one of the only paid activities I did while in Prague and I'm so glad I did. The astronomical clock is a must-see and climbing the stairs of the clock to the top is so fun. Once you get to the top you will have the most incredible views of the city. Don't miss out on this one!
beautifull central square of Prague. When in Prague one has to stroll around the main square and see Old Town Hall and observe a one of a kind Astronomical Clock.

Terrific Views of Prague from Clock Tower. I visited the town hall/clock in the evening time with my hubby as I wanted to see Prague at night. The interior of the old town hall was very impressive with painted walls/ceilings & statues at the main entrance.There was a lift that took us up to the upper level - from here we walked a little to get to the next lift that took us right up to the top of the tower. There was the option of taking the stairs but I wanted to get to the top without losing my breath, therefore, the glass lift was a necessity!Once at the top of the tower the outside space was really limited & a very tight squeeze. It was very busy when I visited so I felt obligated to only stop for a minute to take in the views & then move on to let someone else see. You do get great views of the Old Town & can even see Petrin Tower in the distance. The views at night were worth getting squashed for. There is no time limit to how long you can spend at the top of the tower but you will probably find 1/2 hour is enough time to get a 360° look around.There was also an exhibition in the town hall area but, unfortunately, it closed at 1800 & we were there around 2100. At around 240Kč (approx £6.70 for 2 people) it was definitely worth paying to see inside the tower. Great attraction in Prague's Old Town & I would highly recommend it.

Unique and Fascinating Astronomical Clock in Prague. We could see the astronomical clock from our hotel window (the U Prince Hotel). Of course, that means we could also hear it every hour! We also paid to go to the top of the clock tower where there were breath-taking views of the area. Every hour, on the hour, crowds gather to take pictures as figurines "do their thing" both inside and outside of the clock. It was all very fascinating! A must-see attraction in this beautiful city!

Tour of the Town Hall and Clock. The tour was very good and well worth the money. Guide was very knowledgeable.You go thorough areas well under the current city elevation and see where the oldest parts of the City were built.

Most famous clock in Prague. People gather in front of the astronomical clock as it nears the hour. Cameras are ready to watch the apostles make their hourly appearance. They don't actually pop out they just serenely pass in front of the little doors that open simutainiously.
This is one thing you can't miss when in Prague.

Pick a seat and enjoy. Prague beer is lovely. Just park up in one of the cafes, order a cold beer and watch the crowds go by. The clock is really nothing special, but so what, just enjoy the whole atmosphere.
Tourist attraction. The clock is the one of the symbol of Prague, mark of history. Many visitors are waiting to see clock on every one hour.

Astronomical Clock: One of Prague's historical gems. Take an elevator up Old Town Hall Tower at sunset or in the evening for some of the most incredible views in the area -- and bring your camera! What can be said about the Astronomical Clock, located on the southern side of the tower, except, GO!It's a tourist attraction, to be sure, but it's one of the medieval wonders of the world -- so why skip it. Watching the procession of the Twelve Apostles is fun; we sat across from the clock in a cafe, enjoyed drinks and a light lunch, and watched the crowd gather a couple of times.A video we took and a small clock replica made for enjoyable learning for our young grandchildren. Highly recommend.

It's over fast. It's amazIng that the clock is over 600 years old and still functions. We were able to go both in daylight and at night, but you may feel underwhelmed since the movement is brief. Hopefully, you will have someone explain the story behind the figures and the history of the clock.

Overrated sight. We found the clock to be totally overrated but on the other hand the views from the tower above to be well worth experiencing. One takes two elevators so there is no climbing involved. Of course it is crowded but get through the initial section of the tower and it is less crowded as most people just stand closer to the beginning part.

Phenomenal clock face!. The clock is absolutely fabulous. I would highly recommend that you opt to get a tour round the city as this generally includes the clock. My merely glancing at the clock you will not get the rich history and detail such as the zodiac signs, and he clock hand with the sun. It's also interesting to learn about the history of the town hall which was damaged in WW11. Clock is incredible but would recommend going early in the morning as the square gets quite busy and it would be a shame to miss the exquisite detail.

Classical clocks . This was impressive to visit, well worth it for the views. If your wanting to check out the clock on the hour make sure you get a good vantage point directly in front of it, also get there way before the hour as the crowds get large and you will miss the display if your not directly in front of the clock faces.

Will appeal to the train-set crowd. This was no doubt an achievement when it was first designed, but ultimately it is several small characters an a track mechanism that pop out on the hour. We queued with hundreds of others for the 1 minute performance. It was so-so. If you love train-sets, dolls houses or puppets, you'll rate this 5/5.

History at it's best. Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock are historical jewels of Prague and you have not visited Prague if you haven't been to these places. Astronomical clock is a wonder and every 1 hour is a special occasion for tourists during the chimes. Make sure you witness one of them during your visit.

Beautiful old clock in middle of old square. We waited for the on hour display. The Windows above the strange clock opens and a skeleton rings a bell whilst the dead saints parade across the windows. Like much of Prague the historic religious icons and church buildings feature strongly.
One of the top tourist attractions!. Interesting to watch the tourists faces when it chimes etc. Came here about 10 years ago and sure something came out of the closed door half way down !

Untouched. You've possibly heard that Prague is one of the few European cities that didn't need rebuilding. Its all the more amazing when you walk down the old square and see the astronomical clock and try to imagine how the other cities would have been too. If not for any other reason, try and see every sight in Prague to know what original and untouched looks like.
Love it!. When you visit this, it is important to know all the stories about the old town, and the Astronomical Clock. They are awesome.

So much history inside and out of this clock. It was amazing to walk up to the top of the clock tower, all the while reading about the history of it, and the history of Prague at the different times. What a view from the top!

just enjoy. I recommend that you go there and stay 15 minutes before it rings. All the people around who you assume doing something else is actually waiting it to ring so in about5 minutes before the bell there will be a big crowd around it.

Go up at evening for amazing photo ops. Go up the tower at sunset or at night for some amazing views and photos. There are elevators that can take you all the way to the top. It's a great way to see and experience Old Town. Even if you have to line up, I think it's worth it. As for the Clock's "show", get there about 15 minutes early for a good view.

time and beyond. gotto see the clock and try to gaze into the past. The time when it was built, how everything was back then.. and then you gotto watch out for the people waiting for the clock the come into life and avoid having place in their precious pictures with it

Great tour, but skip the hourly clock display. I had a wonderful tour given by Filip. It was 9:30 in the morning, so we only had 6 people total, and we got to see the interior of the clock, the council room, several other rooms with incredibly intricate seals and artwork, and the cellar. However, don't bother sticking around for the clock display. It's perhaps the greatest disappointment in Europe--just a bunch of statues showing their faces through the windows.

wow photos from top. no cues for tower ticket mid pm. The hundreds of people who gather each hour to watch the clock are very characterful. As always in this area the buildings are beautiful just to look at
Great Clock. Astronomical Clock is great, every hour there are a lot people in front of clock who is waiting for show.

One of the most beautiful old squares anywhere. I have visited Prague many times, and never fail to be impressed by the beauty of this quaint old square. Now more crowded than ever (especially on the hour when the astronomical clock goes through its motions) but quite unmissable at any time of year. A lovely winter market, and worth paying a little extra for your coffee or drink just to people watch. You can't miss it - but rember that Prague has so much more to offer.

Old Town Square. You have to go there just to see the clock if nothing else but there are also all kinds of fun musicians and entertainment going on plus wonderful stores and restaurants to check out all around the square, if you go in September or before be prepared for tons of tourists ( the only downside!)

Prague Old Town. This clock strikes on the hour throughout the day but it the display only lasts for a few minutes and is mainly statues revolving in a clock face window. Despite this it is very busy with tourists, so it is worth arriving 5-10 mins before the hour and combine this with a visit to the tourist information office which is nearby.

Beautiful creation of medieval clock makers. This beautiful piece of medieval art is conveniently located in the center of the Old Town in Prague. It is a must see but be prepared that tens of other tourists visiting the city will think exactly the same. It is quite difficult to admire it in peace and quiet, not get hit by a selfie stick or someone trying to push you away as you are right in the middle of their picture composition.
Interesting and nice. This is one my favourites. I love not just the square but also the beauty of the building. Amazing and a must see.

Prague Clock a Chime a Loo. There was hundreds of people waiting and waiting in antisipation for the hour to come. We were expecting the whole works but were sadly dispapointed a few chimes and that was it. However you must admire this clock as it is hundreds of years old and a master piece so enjoy the work of art and that its a miracle that it chimes at all.

A crowd magnet. Our City guided tour was timed so that we happened to be adjacent to the Town Hall when the astronomical clock was due to "go off". I think most other tours do the same hence the hordes of people milling in the area. It would be a nightmare at peak season and you need to make sure your valuables are safe.The Town Hall and Astronomical Clock are fascinating structures with the details on the clock amazing. The actual "performance" was a little underwhelming but it was one of those "been there, seen that" moments.A bit like the Charles Bridge, you need to visit when in Prague but if your interest are architectural or craftsmanship related, go when the crowds are not milling.

Magical experience . Not to be missed but as any busy venues watch your wallet and purses.. I had no probs but it does happen so be aware! The clock is truly amazing plus lots going on in the square around !!!

Great Ancient Technology and Art. This is an old complex made of several connected buildings utilized as Town Hall.The area is for pedestrian only and can be easily reached with several public transportation means.The tallest tower of the complex feature a very interesting Astronomical Clock that every hour perform the fully mechanical and automated "Walk of the Apostles".From the top of the tower is possible to have a 360 degree view on the whole city.Greatly recommended place but be aware of pickpockets and extremely high prices in bars and restaurants of the area.
Bit of an anticlimax. If you are expecting exciting things to happen on the hour you may be disappointed, but to hear the history from a guide makes all the difference.

Not worth the hassle. Nothing wrong if you like standing around with a couple of thousand of your closest friends waiting for a few figurines to scroll past an opening. If you happen to be there, great. Otherwise there are too many things to see and do to stand around waiting.

Something you must see visiting Prague.. A rather anticlimactic experience but still a must see in Prague. The clock is near a open market with food vendors and restaurants along the side. The clock chimes on the hour and has figures that march in a window at the top. The design is interesting but I couldn't figure out how to use the information it presented. Enjoyed eating in the square and at the Meet Burger.
Must see attraction. If you come to Prague you will certainly visit the old town. Make sure you are at the clock on the hour to see it chime.
Nice Area. Great shopping and restaurant area. We loved people watching at a great restaurant near by. A lot to see!
Pretty sight. This place is a sight itself - its history, its beauty and everyone crowds around it to awe at it (and take photos)...

Hyped touristy spot. The Town square is much more interesting.. The Astronomical is a little theatre that is played every hour but more during the noon and also at midnight when 12 figurines (Apostles) come out of their closet to tell the time. Finally the cock crows and the hour is rung. Beware of pickpockets as the place tends to get crowded near to the hour.The town hall is partly a gallery. We witness a wonderful photography show by Pavel Mara (April - May 2015).

Very interesting. We did a combined Clock Tower and Old Town Hall tour. The top of the tower is easily reached via a lift (but you can walk up if you wish) and the views from the top were wonderful. Very enjoyable and informative tour of the Old Town Hall made all the better by our enthusiastic, English speaking, guide. The tour also included underground vaulted rooms, which were once at ground level.

Fascinating and Beautiful. Go where the crowd is. Fascinating to watch this gem but watch out for pickpockets. Handy police van parked nearby for reporting. I got a great picture on a rainy day of all the colorful umbrellas underneath.

Neat clock, but not worth waiting for the action. We visited the lovely Old Town Square and waited to see the clock chime the hour. It was underwhelming compared to Munich's Glockenspiel, but has its own charm. The clock is very interesting and its locale is great as there are many choices of restaurant and shops. You can sit at a cafe outdoors and watch the show.

Astonishing Piece of History. This 600 years old Astronomical Clock in the old town Prague should be declared as one of the world's top wonders, it's only one of its kind on this planet. Cheerful crowds wait every hour for thirty seconds as small skeleton rings a bell, which is worth watching. If you want to fully enjoy this moment, I would recommend to keep your cameras in the bags or pockets. Unfortunately I was making a video and missed the real show.

Scientific piece from 14th century. . We visited the old town several times during our stay in Prague. We did look at the clock several times, but didn't appreciate the science and intricate beauty of this structure until we visited the clock again with a guide. It's a marvellous piece of work, which makes the latest iPhone I am writing this review insignificant!!It shows the sunrise, sunset, zodiac sign and some philosophical teaching as well, would not like to review anymore. Yup Prague trip is not complete without visiting the clock.

Fantastic views. I was surprised that there was an elevator all the way to the top. This seems rare to me for this type of historical site. We ascended in the evening just before closing and had some amazing views. It was a little crowded, but well worth the admission.

This must be the most underwhelming tourist experience in Prague. We waited for a while along with hundreds of other tourists looking up at the clock tower waiting for the clock to strike the hour; unfortunately the twelve apostles made a very brief appearance behind a window and made there way back just as fast as they came out. Just take a photo and move along, not worth waiting around for the hour!

Great view, dont bother with the clock. We saw the clock chime the hour. Not very impressed. Venice much better. Then took the lift to the Viewing balcony - really great views and an excellent way to start our visit to Prague. The balcony is a must do. If you can see the clock chime the hour as well, then great, but not worth more than a 10 minute wait to see that.
Great. The astronomical clock is a brilliant piece of engineering for its time and should be appreciated for its historical context.
The view. Amazing view from the top of the building, it's worth visiting. The clock is interesting, making a little show on every full hour.

A must see in Prague!. The astronomical clock is stunning and very interesting. Hearing the history of the clock and what each clock face means is worth taking a walking tour for. The view from the top is not to be missed as it gives you a 360 view of the Old Town. It can get quite crowded up there but it's worth it. The site is very crowded as the hour approaches but it's neat to see the mechanism when the hour strikes. A definite 'thing to do' in Prague.
Cool, but pretty over rated. The clock itself is awesome and the story behind it is very interesting, but the experience is pretty overrated and busy
Amazing. Smaller than I envisaged but beautiful design this draws a lot of the attention but you can still get great views for photos
gotta see in Prague. when you follow the crowds once you get in to old town square you won't be able to miss it. Each hour there is a show of the apostles of Jesus on the clock.

Alright to look at. very crowded.. but nice to look at. I believe you were able to go up and check out the views for $$.
The "show" that everyone watches was lame in my opinion, but the crowd was there every day to watch lol
A must see!. This is a well-advertised site and attracts many people. Every hour the astronomical clock chimes and marches the 12 apostles out. It's a beautiful site. Get there early for a good view.
Astronomical Clock. Must visit if you in Prague.... Great view from the tower on Prague,.. Great unique elevator to get on the top

Another tourist hotspot.. The clock is an amazing sight even when it isn't doing its hourly show. So many tourists ( like myself) so moved on as there is so much more to see and safer places where you won't get poked with a selfie stick.

Old Time Square where the Astronomical clock is..... BEWARE Do not exchange any currency at the bureau in the Sqaure advertising 0% commission. I got done! I exchanged £20 and only got the equivalant to £12 back.
I immediately asked for my £20 back and the man just pointed to the "No Refund" sign.
Ripping of the tourists! Disgusting!!!

Not spectacular, right? Wrong!. The Clock has always a crowd waiting for it to strike. And you can almost hear the sighs of dissappointment when it does.
But remembering when it was built (about 600 years ago) and it still works, that's cause to wonder and admire.

A lovely place to pass if you're touring the old city. A lovely place to pass if you're touring the old city. a few steps from the main square where you can eat and drink beer with roast. very romantic.

Climb tower for 360 degree view of city. My first visit to the click was shortly before noon so that I could witness the top of the hour machinations. Hundreds of tourist crowd the area before the top of each hour, so I decided instead to view from an adjacent cafe and have lunch. I can't say the event was that exciting, however, the following day I purchase a ticket to walk up to the top(taking elevator is also an option)The trip proved to be worthwhile as one can see for miles and get a different perspective of the Old Town and surrounding city.

An astronomical masterpiece!. At the center of the old town square you will find the infamous Astronomical clock. Its architecture and build are really amazing and you must definitely go upstairs and check the view from the tower!

Amazing, even when cold and raining. We walked around the center and crossed Charles bridge a few times while in Prague. It was raining the first day which was nice since it cut down on the amount of people that were out. The old center still has the old world charm and attractiveness. My only issue was it felt like Disneyland a bit when the rain cleared the next day as the Segway tours and large groups of tourists were everywhere. Some of the groups were large enough to block paths and impede foot traffic. Once we got away from these we were able to enjoy it more. Definitely want to go back and enjoy more of the Czech food and sights.

ASTRONOMICAL CLOCK. History of about 600 years showing the intelligence of the people to construct a clock tower to represent movement of Earth and Moon and Zodiacal circle .There is also a presentation of statues of the Apostles at the doorways above the clock, with all twelve presented every hour.This is worth watching particularly at evening at 8 pm when the area is full with tourists watching the Apostles moving with the bell. You will not see such an icon anywhere in the world. The area is full of restaurants with czheck cusine and sovinier shops.

Great show when the clock ticks :). I enjoyed the view of the clock changing different characters. I was scared a bit by the skeleton on thr lrft side of the clock but I was amazed by the 'show'. Great place.

REPEAT VISITS ESSENTIAL. We visited the clock at least once every day we were in Prague, every time you will see something you missed before. On the second day we went into the Town Hall and Tower and read an explanation of the clock; it was then far easier to make out the figures knowing what to look for and what each part symbolised....apart from that it is just simply beautiful.The tower is also a must do. Not being great on heights I was a little concerned but take your time and go to the top, it is a wonderful view out over Prague and well worth the effort - there is also a lift for those unable to make the climb. Along the walls on the way up are pictures, photographs and articles on the various changes to the building, damage, ownership, etc, all very informative and interesting.
Great historic place. It's nice place to visit specially if you know how lång time this klock has been there and still work.

Nice square. Super nice square, big enough so the hordes of turists have room enough. The main attraction is of course the clock in the old town hall, which does it's thing every hour on the hour. Don't hold yout breath...

Amazing sight. Prague's Old Town Square is picturesque, no wonder why it's always crowded. This is my second time in the City of a Hundred Spires and the Astronomical Clock looks eerily more attractive at night. There are a lot less people around here after dark, love that feeling.

Make sure you find out more about the clock. This spot is fascinating when you find out the history and explanations of what the clock records. Just passing by gives none of the insight to the amazing skill and knowledge which existed when it was made. We had an excellent guide who was amusing as well as knowledgeable. Unfortunately there are always large crowds when the clock approaches the hour which does detract from the enjoyment.

Such a beautiful clock!. While visiting the old town square, make sure to stroll towards the astronomical clock close to the hour, so that you can enjoy a beautiful, centuries old, mechanical clock, with several movements.

Be sure to visit!. I loved the Old Town Hall, and the architecture in the square was excellent. The crowds get HUGE for the hourly display at the Astronomical clock. I must admit to being a bit underwhelmed by the hourly activity, I expected a longer display. I love the architecture, but wouldn't stand in the rain for the hourly display. You can climb up to the top, but I didn't.
Astronomical clock is awesome!!. Great historic place to visit! Although somr says,that the clock is overrated, it's not! One just have to take some time to learn the insights and background! :)

Tour group . Really cool clock! The designer was way ahead of his time. A must see when in the square.
The area is very crowded so hang onto your personal items. Pick pockets are everywhere.
Every hour the clock puts on a "little" show.
THis sia must do when in Prague. Very interesting and quick site. The show begins evry hour on the hour so get their eary to get a good spot, or go first thing in the morning before the crowds arrive

Great Except for Crowds. It is hard to enjoy this lovely old place due to the massive crowds. If you feel like you need to se the hourly "performance" of the Astro Clock, then get there about 30 minutes early to stake out up front space and hope that some massive tour group doesn't come crowd in front of you at the last minute.

Astronomical Clock Overrated. The Old Town is beautiful and the square is bustling, but the Astronomical Clock isn't worth more than a quick walk by and maybe a snapshot. On the hour, hundreds or even thousands of silly tourists gather near it to listen to the bells chime and watch the saints cycle across. Takes about one minute and is very anticlimactic!
Phenomenal architecture. A must see, but can be crowded. Spectacular buildings with great history. Great idea to get a guide book before you visit.

Impressive view. Thus church is stunning both inside and out.. Beware, they have many services in which you cannot gain entry, however, the shops are all around and the cafe line the street along this location. When we visited they had concerts in the evenings.

Not so great. It's a part of tick-off, been there done that, kind of place. The clock itself is a bit disappointing. Two windows open and cut outs of apostles revolve behind the open windows and some of the figures move a little. It's worth going up to the observation gallery, if the lines are not very long. Get a good view of the city from up there. There is a lift that takes you all the way up. Recommed walking down, as there is a lot of interesting information and pictures to see and read on the way.

Our favourite spot in Prague at the centre of the old quarter. On a warm sunny day nothing beats sitting out at one of the many bars/cafes surrounding the old square and watching the world go by.There is some amazing architecture to view and of course, every hour, brings the spectacle of the moving figures to watch in the windows of the Astronomical Clock. Crowds always gather for this event

Reviewing the Clock. We did not go into the Hall but did see the clock and watched it do it's thing on the hour. The clock is a must see, simply beautiful. As far as what the clock does, on the hour, we were a bit disappointed. I think we had read so much about it we expected it to do more. If you stand up close when it "chimes" you will see the figures on the outside move a bit, if you stand back you will see the figures moving higher up on the inside where the two little doors open. If you miss the clock chiming you have not missed a lot but you must see it.
A delightful view to the Past. The Old town hall Astronomical Clock was built in 1410. It is still standing and working and a brilliant work. Well worth seeing in moving each hour on the hour
Be on time. If you want to see the clock when it chimes, make sure you are there on time. And it's cheaper to get a coffee or ice cream a few blocks away from the town hall.
Ho hum. The clock was beautiful, the show not so much. A local said the real view is from up above the clock (you can buy tickets) watching the tourists gape when the hour strikes.

5*. Great buildings and unbeliaveble atmosphere.
The Clock is something that I can't ecxplain,when I stand of front I was speechless!!!

One of the 3 only astronomical clock . There are only 3 astronomical clocks over the world and this is one of them. Each hour the clock rings and appears figures of the Apostles and other moving sculptures—notably a figure of Death (represented by a skeleton) striking the time; and a calendar dial with medallions representing the months

Spectacular Old Town Center. The atmosphere and architecture is fascinating. My wife and I spent a lot of time here. Great shops, entertainment and Food. There are alot of other attractions located nearby.

Beautiful clock on a old, historic ground. I love to sit down in one of the ourdoors restaurant and just watch the clock and people/tourists, while drinking a cold drink hot summer day in Prague. It is very relaxing.
Once I participated in a guided tour telling me about the clock, but reading about it in a book at the outdoor restaurant will do the trick too.

Clock of the Ages. A must see if you are visiting Prague. I don't know much about it's history but it is very interesting to see the type of clock used in the medieval ages. The 12 Apostles showing up at the windows while the bells are ringing is an added attraction. If you do a bit of research before you visit the site I am sure you will enjoy it even more.A word of caution, be careful with your belongings while watching the clock display. A person in our group got pick pocketed during the display but was fortunate to have her wallet returned to her with everything intact.

A little disappointed . My grandmother had informed me that I must visit the astronomical clock during my visit to Prague. On our first day we happened to stumble upon it not long before 2pm. We therefore waited to see what all the excitement was about and were left somewhat disappointed. I am not sure if this is because we were expecting something outstanding to happen or what. On the other hand, the clock is very intricate to look at and is worth a visit, although I am unsure I would stand waiting anymore than 10 minutes to see it chime. We didn't go up the tower as we had made plans elsewhere, but I would've liked to have done this and think it may have been an extra touch on this trip.

Fascinating, considering when it was built.. I waited and watched. Then said, "is that it?"But, considering when and how it was constructed, it is quite amazing. Just not impressive given technology today.
AMAZING. So cool seeing this clock and seeing how well it is taken care of ....the amazing thing actually of the whole city is that it is so clean.

Best view of the historical city. OK, astronomical clock is awesome and it is well worth the wait to see the "show" at least once during your Prague stay. But for me the Old Town Hall's tower is much more interesting - maybe because I have seen the clock show so many times already. From the tower you will get one of the best views of the whole historical city center, it is absolutely beautiful from up there. You can wait for the elevator or choose a little excercise and climb up the stairs all the way up.
Crowd's gather to watch the moving apostles on the hour. A big event every hour where a large crowd gathers to see two windows open on the town hall clock and the 12 apostle move past the windows

Truly amazing. What an amazing piece of history. There are so many details included regarding the three times that it reflects, the walk of the apostles, the ringing bell and the rooster crowing. The crowds can be large but it is high enough up that you can always see it.
The Astronomical clock is a highlight.. You may need a guide to expialn the nuances of the Prague Astronomical Clock but it is a great thing just to see it on the hour.
great. Excellent place to visit and going up to the tower is a must. Great views of the entire city, but very long lines and crowded at times.

May 2016. The clock is stunning however, the approach roads were shoulder to shoulder with people and being in the crowd to watch the clock was horrendous. This was in May at 6pm! I'd hate to be there at high season

The most popular attraction in Prague. Every hour, people will crowd around the tower in the thousands to watch the animation and activity of the figures in the tower. Worth a visit, but if it is too crowded, you can watch videos on the Internet. Watch out for pickpockets.
Amazing. Best time to be there is in the evening when the chimes go on and you can see a skeleton with the bell come out! It is located in the centre of the city and cannot be missed

See it both day and night!. The Old Town Hall and the Astronomical Clock are worth seeing both during the day and at night when they are illuminated, adding a magical and mysterious look to these must see attractions.

Magnificent . Magnificent structure. I especially liked little ritual that occurs every hour.
I think you like it too.

Hmm. It's nice but not that spectacular. Just a nice little attraction, one of the points you might want to hit on your tour. We saw about 200 people gathered under the clock at 12.45 to watch it chime at 1. When 1 o'clock came there was a pitiful little tune and 1 strike. It was very funny to see the disappointment and disbelief on everyones faces. Like i say, nothing spectacular
Top of the clock. A must in Prague to go to the top of the clock via the town hall. The views are the best in the city. You can see in every direction. Don't miss this..

Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. I didn't get a chance to visit inside, but the history of the clock is quite interesting. If you take the Free Walking Tour, you can learn more about the clock. Every hour, some of the miniature sculpture will move while the bells are ringing.
On time. You will pass by several times strolling around the city. Be sure to catch it on a whole hour as that is when it's moving. Focus on the upper part of the clock.
Tick tock. This is a very popular attraction due to the hourly appearance of moving characters when the bell rings huge crowds gather for a short show of the mechanical decorations.

Another must see in Prague. Who has been to Prague and not seen it ?The place is always mobbed so I would suggest being ultra careful with your valuables as you will be a target for pickpockets.At night the whole square is lit up and is quite magical

See it from the top. The Clock is part of the historical town square and the Old Town Hall. Come about 5 minutes before noon and be ready to see the full display starting exactly on the 12th hour. The crowd usually gathers way too early. No need for that. Be aware that among the crowd there are number of professional thieves. They are indistinguishable from the rest of the crowd because they dress like any other visiting tourist. They usually work in groups of 2-3. You don't need to worry if you keep your personal belongings in safe place like in your zippered front pockets of you jacket. Take the elevator to the top of the Old town Hall. The view is worth the cost of the ticket. If the weather is clear you'll see not only the whole center of the Old Town but even the part called the New Town.

Neat Attraction. The Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock is a neat attraction. Towering above shops and cafes it attracts quite a crowd when it goes off. Definitely something that you want to see in Prague.

Amazing technology from the 1500s!. Such fun to watch the clock on the hour, when apostles move past the windows above left and right, the figures on the sides of the clock move, and the golden rooster crows. The technology amazed and delighted me.

Weekend trip!. Nice location with big squares and small alleys.
The astronomical watch was just a watch.
A lot of cafes and restaurants to sit down for a nice dark ale-:)

Very nice . It was very nice experience to see but i think i was expecting more .....
Maybe the less impressive thing ih the town
Well looked after . The clock is so old but well looked after. The history buff in me loved this. The square is full so you need to be very careful

Fun Site - Square. The Clock is pretty unique we stood in front of it for 10 minutes. The statues danced and the clock moved. its similar to the one in Munich in Marienplatz. The door next to the tower had a lot of couples come out just finished getting married I guess is a Hot spot for weddings. the plaza next to it has a lot of performers great entertainment for adults and children.

Top View. We walked up to the top of the Old Town Hall for a fantastic view of the city. hilst we walked up to the top there was the option of an elevator to ease the burden if necessary.By walking there was a pictorial history of the building along the way.Cold (11c(} and windy at the top but worth the effort.

Prague in its best. The most famuous attraction in this city is definetely worth a visit! You absolutely must wait until a round hour to hear the clock clinging with its bells and exhibiting its figures! Worth a trip!

Niche and fun . Make sure you go on the hour! Worth braving the crowds- keep your eye out for the skeleton on the right hand side as he pulls the bell into life. We found a spot at the cafe opposite and had a beer whilst we waited for the hour. Lots of people waiting for the chime in tours so you can pick up lots of interesting facts.
Nice Place in Prague. The Rathaus and the astronomic watch are located in the most beautiful place in the city. Everything is old here. A must.

A must see!. This is the 3rd oldest astronomical clock in the world. See it! It's beautiful! Go up the tower, see the sights! If you come to Prague out of season it is so much less crowded. So be prepared, June-August it is packed. I recommend just reading up about the clock tower. It has a fascinating history and explanation of what you are seeing.

Definitly worth the money.. It's an awesome view from the top. Especially when you see the old town square from such height.You travel up with a classic elevator to a higher level and then a modern elevator to the top. Awesome experience. Strongly recommend. Totally worth the charge fee.
Must visit. It is just charming! The setting, the weather in spring it is simply amazing, and to watch that magnificient clock you can just sit there for hours!!

Amazing clock. The old town square and this clock are worth spending lots of time in especially if you get there every hour on the hour when the chimes ring out and the characters behind the door show themselves. So many people are taking photos and watching in awe that the atmosphere is wonderful.
Worth a quick look. Not much exciting here, but worth going by and seeing for a few minutes. If you are walking the old town, you will go by this site, its free so why not take a minute to see it.

Climb to the top for amazing views. For a very small fee, you can climb to the top of the tower and look down on the bustling old town square below. There are a lot of stairs, however lots of in-depth interpretation board on the way up. A lift is very sensitively incorporated in the middle of the building - however, unless you have accessibility issues I would recommend climbing up and reading about the fascinating history of the building.At the top, the platform can be quite busy however there's an inside area where you can sit down and take a break. I would highly recommend a climb to the top of here, along with St Vitus Cathedral within the grounds of Prague Castle. These offer very different views, located on either side of the river - however both are equally as incredible.

You would be sad if you miss, but you do not loose much, if you keep only dreaming of it. I was seeing the clock with a group of my foreign visitors. It is nice, but the secret behind it is better, than the tourist presentation itself ..

A bit underwhelming and very crowded. Still definetily worth a visit.. Visited the clock 10 and 11 am on a monday, and it was still pretty crowded so i think the crowds will be huge later on the day. We saw the clock strike twice and though it is entertaining i somehow expected a little more. The clock still looks great from the outside, and inside we didn´t visit. Some people might appreciate the building a bit more than i but even i think you should see it at least once on your prague trip.

A visit to the past. The town hall is not to be missed. Ensure you are aware of the 1 hour tours conducted in different languages - the guide who took us around was fantastic. We went on 14 May for the 2.00 tour
Amazing Clock. Amazing clock and excellent craftsmanship. I found myself going to the square several times a day just to admire the beauty of the clock.
This is the start and finish of the Prague Marathon. Great course starting and finishing at the old town. The weather was perfect and course very well supported. Highly recommended.

Worth 15 seconds... On the hour.. Waited for the hourly strike & it was the best 15 seconds of my visit to Prague.... You get big crowds waiting for the hourly chime but was slightly disapointed it sosnt last longer

Bit of a let down!!. The clock itself is stunning. However dntbgetbsucked into,all the hype about how wonderful its is when it chimes on the hour.....if you happen to be there on the hour, stay and watch the characters move round, but don't make a specific trip ...it really isn't that entertaining...in fact it's a bit of a flop really!!
Must see. You have to at least check it out. It is interesting but really crowded and the tower is not the best view because the tower you are in can't be in the photo.
Great place. We came to Prague for the first time to visit. Took an tour and saw and learned about this old clock. Unfortunately we did not see it at the top of the hour but it is still fascinating.

Very interesting for taking pictures of the old town.. Usually is a very crowded region but if you go up in observation deck at the top of the Tower you will certainly enjoy one of the best views of Old Prague.

If you are in old town square , you will not miss this. A clock which id running from the year 1410 and you miss to see when your are in prague especially...no way..This this old beauty near to old square.The clock was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still operating. Always be there when it's ringing. You can see the saints coming out and bless you...

A timely visit!. The clock is famous and every visitor gatheres in front of it so getting a good view is not easy. The features of the clock are best seen on the hour. There is a cafe/bar with tables on the street and I recommend you have some refreshment in good time so you then have a view of the clock.
Astronomical clock. Amazing! Make sure you are there on the hour to watch the apostles come out ant the rooster crow. Beautiful buildings and amazing to watch.

Everything happening in the square. Great square to sit and watch the world go by,good eateries, and places to have a drink,we tried several,none a rip off,you have to watch the clock on the hour,silly not to if you are in the square,but worth waiting for
Good Place... This is around the Old Town Square.. Nothing much to say.. You can go up the Astronomical clock if you want but its not free.. Its gives a good scenic view of the city..

Astronomical Disappointment!. The square is beautiful and full of tourists The clock is an engineering marvel and tourist gathers to watch clock strike. When the clock strike, it an astronomical disappointment! This must be the most lame attraction in Prague.
Charming. Ok, the square is filled with tourists (watch your wallet), but don't miss this fascinating sight. The buildings are beautiful and the clock is charming..both young and old will enjoy!

Awesome. A must to climb to the top. It's a ramp and not very steep. The view was great. We had a young people tour behind us and we'll they were horrible but what to do. On the way up they have old pictures of bombing and restoration. Go.!

Worth the wait.. At every hour the bells will ring and the automats will move around the clock. The crazy thing is that they are nearly 500 years old. They survived vombs during the war and now we can still look at them. Dont forget to check your watch sometime when you're aroind the square so you will noy miss it.

Busy square. Our guide Colorado Dave was very comical about this clock. It may be a piece of superb engineering but he is always amazed not by the clock but the look of disappointment on the faces of tourists as the clock strikes ! The clock has lots of stories relating to its maker and the symbols so again worth reading about it beforehand or taking walking tour
The clock is great. However the thousands of people aren't. Go first thing in the morning!! So so many tourists, we tend to ruin things for ourselves.Beautiful clock and tower and architecture though

Fantastic glimpse into Prague's history. Spent a great morning looking around the astrological clock tower and the old town hall. The tower has lots of pictures of the history of the tower including quite a few during the nazi occupation of Prague. If you are interested in world war 2 I would also recommend doing the guided tour of the old town hall. Lots of interesting titbits about restorations and the uses of all the rooms.
Show is amazing. If you are in old town, do check the clock show. It is amazing. The clock is real piece of engineering and physics.

Incredible to see the results of 600 year old engineering. When I hear "600 hundred year old clock" I expect something old and probably not functional. I would never have expected the wonder of this clock. It's intricate with a lot of moving parts and it's beautiful in its craftsmanship. The background doesn't move, but it has a sun and moon that move. The sun will move above and below the horizon on the background depending on whether it is day or night and also shows the time. The moon shows the phase of the moon. There are four animated figures that move at the top of the hour, which represent death, vanity, lust, and greed. Watch as the skeleton that represents death rings the bell and the other three shake their heads. The twelve apostles are also seen every hour.Be sure to grab a spot well before the top of the hour, because it can get crowded. I recommend going during the daytime for the best visibility. There's a lot of jostling if it gets too crowded so be careful with your bags and/or small children. My friend felt someone try to tug her bag.

Watching the Astronomical Clock. Great clock - clearly a masterpiece to behold. And the crowds there are just unstoppable. That took away the pleasure of having a good picture without too much photo-bombing.
Amazing. A magnificent structure which has a display on the hour. Beautifully crafted and well worth visiting, especially at night. Superb, but can get very busy leading up to the hourly display.

Medieval astronomical clock. One of the most interesting places to see in Prague. The tower completed in the 14th century. Destroyed by fire in 1945. The mist interesting part - The Horologe - moving figures, the astronomical dial and the calendar dial. The figures are set in motion every hour.

Underwhelmed!. Bagged a place early and stood for 15 minutes until 9pm.
Frankly, whilst the clock is very ornate, the Trumpton clock gave a better animatronics show.
Perhaps noon is different. I will have to check.

15 th Centuary clock. This astronomical clock was built in 15 Th century at the one side of old town.Below the Astronomical Clock are 12 medallions with the signs of the zodiac, added by Josef Manes in 1865.

a Great place to kick back and watch the clock. The clock is not only the normal 1-12 clock face but also has an astrological face below it. Every hour on the hour you will see a very interesting show at the top of the clock tower. It gets really crowed in the square, but we had lunch in a café right across the plaza from the clock and got a great view. The characters perform on the hour, so be there to see the show.If it is rainy the café as a tent like covering which is handy.

Make sure you get here early for the bells. We stopped by a bar and used their high tables on the side to watch the clock. We had a great view with a glass of beer. Who could beat that? A marvel to watch this ancient clock still working.

Everyone ever going to Prague...has to stand and watch the clock!. I guess it is a rite of passage for every tourist who has ever set foot in Prague to pack around this clock, every hour, to watch the 1-2 minute chiming of the world-famous astronomical clock. Beautiful and historic timepiece.
Christmas holiday. The square was full with stalls for the xmas market bustling with people lots food and drink great atmosphere the clock was fascinating ever corner there was another wow moment

One to see on the Hour. A brilliant clock and well worth its hourly performance. The square is packed with tourists so make sure that you can get a good view - standing at the back near the shops is an advantage - great ice creams too!

Climb the clock and enjoy the city view. Never go the astronomical clock and watch it only from outside, you must get into it and climb it, the view of the city and the old houses is amazing and good place for memorable pics

Worth waiting for the Show?. Maybe, depends upon your expectation. Extremely crowded for the hourly performance but studying the clock at any time is impressive. It's a 'happening' of sorts to be there on the hour but not a necessity to appreciate what it is. Beautiful setting as you look in any direction.

An absolute highlight. Climbing Town Hall Tower will give you the most spectacular view of Tyn Church you could ever imagine.
I wouldn´t miss this experience for the world.
Watching the Astronomical Clock is fun, however I would not say it was anything to write home about amidst a large group of tourists.

Very crowded but friendly and lively. The whole square is busy at all hours but generally friendly(no doubt the usual pickpockets will be present but the normal simple precautions suffice) and easy-going. Local cafes are busy with tables packed together but service better than expected and prices more reasonable than I expected at an obvious tourist hotspot.Astronomical Clock is smaller than I expected but given its age and complexity an engineering marvel.Base of Tower includes a helpful Tourist Office.No doubt view from Tower is good but after viewing the city from the heights of the Castle and Mala Strana it did not seem worth the climb (I did not read about the lift until back in UK!).

"Stepping back in time....". We just loved strolling around Old Town, and found many small alleyways and streets absolutely charming. Sitting in the Square, you can people watch and enjoy a cappacino. It is easy to find your way around, a walking map is helpful. There are many shops that become repetitive after a while, and just so many souvenirs that you can purchase. We loved the walk up into the Astronomical Clock and the story that the many pictures show on your way. There was a trumpteer who was at the top, and it made for a charming experience. Be sure to take note of the flyers that advertise various local concerts that may be happening while you are there. It's easy to make wonderful memories in such a beautiful place!

Interesting underground tour. The clock is very impressive, but way too crowded after 9am. The hourly figurine show is not worth the waiting. However the visit of the town hall, especially the undeground part is interesting.
Awesome!. Fight your way thru the crowds and grab a spot in the shade around the top of the hour for the show. Every hour it happens!

Underwhelmed . Nice history to it, and a beautiful building, but no one really understands the clock, and it is a clock that you cannot interpret. On the hour it has a 32 second presentation that is terribly underwhelming. Amazed at the number of people there to watch it. Beware of the Oriental tour groups that will trample you to get a look. We had lunch at the cafe across from it, so we had beers to get us through the event.

Every hour is always nice to watch it. Every hours it is possible to watch the performance of the 12 apostles that show to the crowd and announce the new hour.The square is very nice and characteristic and it is just nice to sit there for a coffee or just sit there on the pavement to enjoy the view.And why not? take a chance to climb the stairs and enjoy the view from the top of the tower.Loved it
Best views in the city!. A must visit when you go to Prague. The best views across the city! Be sure to hang around until the clock strikes!

Far to technical to read time. Located on the Old town Hall clock tower, the clock is beautiful to look at, yet very busy and confusing.Telling the time is near impossible unless you study it and have someone experienced tell you how it operates.Its easier to look at the conventional clock at very top of the tower..
Marvellous technology for its time. The locals say it's astronomical is the envy of Europe. That's a big call, but it is wonderful but I've never before seen people applaud a clock striking the hour.
Astronomical Clock. Worth seeing, crowds form to see the figures appear on the hour. This was a little disappointing as they are quite high but the clock itself and the mechanics are amazing.
Very interesting!. Great attraction to see. There is a 30 seconds show that takes place at set times, which is worth waiting around for.

Very pretty clock! . The clock was our first point of call when arriving in Prague. We managed to get a seat in a bar opposite with a great view. Now as lovely as the clock was I was expecting it to do more than it did!! The crowds gather each hour to watch. Worth a visit but don't expect anything too fancy to happen!!

Fantastic view of Prague. For a small fee either walk up the narrow stairway or take the elevator to the top of the town hall building to get the most breathtaking views of Prague and old town square. There were a couple of tour groups there at the same time, and walk areas are narrow (two adults are pressed to get by each other), so patience is key. If able, recommend walking down the stairs to read placards on the walls with significant events, drawings or photos of the hall in different stages through its centuries old history. Plan on taking at least an hour to complete the visit.

A Very Nice Looking Clock & Town Hall. The astronomical clock is a great attraction and is extremely popular, make sure you visit on the hour, as that is when the clock comes to life just be aware also of pickpockets with loads of people standing around / trying to get through to town etc you could (hopefully not) become a target.I would also recommend spending some time in the square as it has plenty of shops, bars, restaurants and a gallery (showing works by Warhol, Dali & Mucha).The Old Town Hall is worth a visit also, cost is 100Kc for Adults for the Full Tour (The Chapel, Historic Halls & Underground).

What's all the fuss about?. People stand for up to 45 - 55 minutes waiting to see this clock in action and it's completely overrated. The clock spend' t crow, there's no devil to be seen and the apostles give a cursory glance to the spectators! I suppose that if you're in Prague you might as well have a look, but don't stand around waiting for it.

Very good but spoilt by intrusive tourists !. A fantastic sight is the astronomical clock in the old town hall square. Fabulous detail of moving figurines ( apostles ) when the clock strikes the hour. Worth while buying a Prague tour book that explains how and why this was made. Unfortunately the Old Town Hall square is mobbed with tourists and some are very intrusive. Getting pocked in the eye with selfie sticks and selfish people walking around filming themselves ( I kid you not !!!!) Not to mention a gang of youths that ride around on segways ( beware !!! ) But if you can manage to see the clock at a quiter time - a MUST SEE.
Couldn't see much. Many people wait for the clock to chine, but I couldn't see the movements although we watched it 4-5 times. Puzzled.

Lucky day and lovely day. Lucky day for us becoz is nice weather and lucky to saw some beautiful couple has married on that day...... We been there before a clock 15 Min.... For wait when the time be .00 Every hour the watch will show us to see a doll moving maybe just 23 Second but on that time people around there is quiet..... And listen to the sound of the old watch.....:)

Overrated. Went there at late afternoon on a weekday and crowded with people. Couldnt really get a good photo. Decided to go back the next early morning to get a picture when only a handful of people is around. The mechanical performance of the procession of Apostles is nothing special. I think the special part should be that it is the oldest astronomical clock in the world which is still working.
amazing. this is the best clock building i ever seen in my life , try to catch it while ringing to see the moving puppet moving in each window

Nice?. The clock is very beautiful and if you look up the details and try to figure out, what parts of it mean, it makes a nice activity while visiting Old Town. The thing that happens at full hour is not so impressive though. But still a must see!
Nothing special about it . The clock is good but i didnt find it much interesting.It is very old clock and involves a lot of thing which was very boring to me.

Must Visit. The clock is a great attraction and is extremely popular. Make sure you visit on the hour as that is when the clock comes to life. It was a cool experience and the building itself is beautiful. We decided to have a drink at a restaurant directly in front of the clock.I would recommend spending time in the square as it has plenty of shops. In addition, it can be crowded so I would suggest going earlier in the day.

Interesting clock, a must to see. The old Town Hall and Astronomical clock is very interesting, it has a lot of history, so you need to go on a guided tour with the guide who can explain the history of this clock. The clock displays the month, year, astronomical year, chimes, and has moving parts.
Pretty nice. Actually on the on town square. The astronomical clock was impressive view. You were also able to climb to the tower at town hall but there was an entrence fee for that.

Crowded, But Don't Miss It. The old town Hall is beautiful and the clock is mind blowing. A definite must see if you are in Prague. It's a lot of fun to see the characters emerge from the clock when the bell tolls. People gather around to watch this happen. You will never see anything like it.

Ok.. We had very high expectations and expected the clock to be bigger and grander than it was, it was still nice to see but we didn't find it as magnificent as we expected, don't get us wrong it is still a work of art and worth a visit but we wouldn't rate as the number one attraction.

a fairy tale walk in a fairy tale city. as soon as arrive and see the amount of people waiting for the hourly show you know its some thing special.brought a smile to everybodys face. a brilliant way to start the day off.

Must visit - particularly start of every hour. Huge medieval tower with marvellous astronomical clock. Every hour 12 apostle dolls appear from the windows and add to the overall charmth. Cant afford to miss and be mindful of the timing.

Absolutely brilliant. Must must see. Make sure you are there about 10 min before the full hour to find the right place before the crowd gathers. Read about it before you visit so you know what is what. Also it is in the city centre so you can visit it multiple times..
Go early!. We started out early in the morning and there was only a few people around when the chimes started. I really enjoyed it! It is so interesting to see all the moving parts of this clock.

See city from top of tower. The clock every hour draws lots of people and if you happen to have your hotel room opposite to it you enjoy it every hour and you participate of the noise the crowd makes. But to reach the top an view Prag from above is outstanding a must do
Everybody waits to see the clock!. When in Prague,you will go there for sure!It is the monument everybody goes and wait patiently for the clock to go on top of the hour so to see the apostols!!Nice!

Busy and overcrowded. Supposed to be one of best sights in Prague - the clock is disappointing and the whole area is packed and not really enjoyable. Bars are expensive and better places just yards away

4 days in Prague. The old town is a beauty and a must with all the different buildings style. Mix of Gothic, baroque, and rococo and colorful your eyes cannot get enough of the beauty. The clock is a small disappointment but then it is OK.
Take the tour. The views from the tower are great but the tour of the underground rooms is the best part. We had a fun and articulate guide.

Highlight of Prague. Loved this site,even got to hear it chime on the hour! Very crowded so watch the pickpockets- prime opportunity for them whilst you are distracted but well worth seeing! Lots of detail on the clock - especially liked seeing the skeleton moving! Can pay to climb up to the top of the tower for a birds eye view!Great atmosphere !

Might seem overrated but quite cute!. Enjoyed the short but comical show on the hour of the clock. Despite most people being underwhelmed by the "show" it really is a technologically advanced amazing piece of history.

Astronomical Clock a Must See. The Astronomical Clock is a "must see" during your visit to Prague. The crowds start to gather about 10 minutes before the top of the hour; so, try to do this earlier in the day. The clock itself is fascinating as well as all of the figures that moves at the top of each hour.

Didn't live up to the hype. I joined the thronging crowd at 14:55 in time to await with eager anticipation the hourly strike of the clock. By the time it had struck three it was all over. Quite what actions the clock had undertaken were not obvious and the crowd was in a state of being underwhelmed.As a vision the clock is beautifully designed and extremely ornate but, at least for me, it was not worth turning upon the hour to marvel at it's uninspiring mechanical actions.
Interesting. Very busy but different to most other clocks we have seen, lots of crowds on the hour, loads of guided tours

Interesting acctraction. We stopped by and waited for the top of the hour. The skeleton ringing it's bell, while the Apostles moving by is quite the juxtaposition. The Square get's very crowded at the top of the hour.A must do in Prague.
Crowded. The clock display was very short, and perhaps not worth your time if you are crunched for time. It was also very crowded so be careful of pick pockets!

Easy climb up to a great view of the city. It was easy to get to top with both elevator and stairs options. There's a description to understand each of the iconic buildings you can see. Great for free and easy travelers. No need tour guide explaination.

Outstanding but could not stay to see the chime.. An extremely busy area especially on the hour. We were on a walking tour that briefly stopped for a photo opportunity.....the tour guide mentioned we could go up to the top for a small fee payable in the building next door...we did not have time.Visited 2nd may 2016.
everyone is waiting. each hour from9 to 9 everyone is waiting the clock , the place is beautiful with many restaurants around,also have a seat at bench and enjoy seeing the place and people

Worth a Visit. This is a good place to visit in Prague. The clocks chime on the hour and there is a big crowd to see the apostles and skeleton move above the clock. Plenty of nice restaurants in the area
Fell in love!. The Old Town Square during the Easter Festival is absolutely amazing! I loved every minute of it. From the food to the items for sale, it was all amazing!

Good to see, but.... Its was extremely busy when we visited in Springtime. The clock and its history are fascinating. Do some research before you go to see it. It chimes on the hour and that's the busiest time.
Clock. The clock is very interesting. A real wonder for how old it is. We waited for the show on the hour but it was not worth the wait
Just great. Great place to be and see the streets come to life all day and night. Great food all over and great views of everything, especially the clock.

Still going after all those years!. What an awesome experience! Walked all the way with a bunch of oldies and so glad that we pursuaded them all. Got there a few minutes before the six o'clock chime and it was worth it! Still going after several hundred years.

Obligatory. Centerpoint of the city, make sure you are there to watch the clock tick the hour. You could watch a video of it on Youtube of course but do yourself the favor of witnessing it yourself. For north-american children it's not that spectacular and there's no monster truck with fireworks coming out of it but for adults who understand the age and history of this clock it will mean more.
Cannot be missed. No trip to Prague can miss this. It does get extremely crowded around the time of the chimes.difficult to take pictures without getting others in the picture
A must do. This is a beautiful clock with an amazing history. Make sure to climb the stairs or take the elevator. The view from the city is amazing!!!

Beautiful to look at. I was a little disappointed with the astronomical Clock. Don't get me wrong, it is absolutely stunning and amazing story behind it. We were told when the clock strikes on the hour you see all things moving, singing and dancing but in actual fact you only see a little skeleton pull a rope and some dolls come pasted a window. It's still the only one of its kind and I'm very glad I've seen it and been to the top, you see some stunning views but please don't go for the movements.
Mysterious clock. It took a little time to figure out how the clock worked but we did it. It is right in the center of old town.

Too crowded and touristic. It's basically a clock that every round hour does a small "performance" that takes about a minute. It's probably the most touristic spot in Prague after the Charles bridge, so watch out for your stuff... :)

Another wonder of the world. You have to visit this. It's why everyone goes to Prague after all.What an amazing piece of genius this is when you think how old it is.I highly recommend that you climb the clock tower and just enjoy the view. Also you can see the astronomical clock work as it chimes and notes on the hour. Be prepared for the crowds that gather to watch but the atmosphere is amazing.

Interesting!. You automatically end up here when visiting the Old Town Square, but make sure you do, because it's the most interesting part of the square in my opinion. The astronomical clock strikes every hour, and then, various parts of the clock move and make sounds, so make sure you're there to see it. When you buy a ticket in the tower next to it, you can go up the tower. There's an elevator there to take you upstairs, but I recommend you go with the spiraling stairs, as there are boards with information about both the tower and the clock itself. Once upstairs, you have a wonderful view of Prague. Recommended!

Amazing clockwork in the middle of Old Town. The Astronomical Clock should be on everyone's list of must-see in Prague, whether you are here for a day or a week. Watching it chime in the hour includes a display of revolving saints and a tolling skeleton. It is amazing to see such a complex piece of mechanical wonder continue to function over the centuries!

Definitely worth a visit. Great view from the top and they have a very well done history of the tower done with historic pictures on the walk up. If you go during the Christmas season you get a great view of the Christmas Market. The history of the tower is very interesting being that it was nearly completely destroyed and rebuilt.

You stand there for 20 minutes for a one minute Puppet animation. The astronomical clock is a nice attraction and considering its age it is a wonder of technique. But waiting there to see the animation is not worth the waiting time. I have been there 3 times, this occasion was the only one when I stayed long enough to see the display and it was disapointing.
Anamated. A middle ages masterpiece of machinery. There was never another like it as they blinded the clock's creator afterwards.

Take a guided tour . The guide is able to explain the history of this place making it very interesting. We took a tour with Callum- free tour, he was great explaining the clock and made it more interesting to see. We saw it at the start and thought what was all fuss about ,when you know the facts it's worth seeing.
Crowded. We were there in April before the crowds and it was very crowded. Clock very very interesting. Nice to have a tour guide to explain the clock and area to you.
Un exciting. Lot of hype for 10 secs. Not worth going out your way to see but is in Centre of square so easily accessible if visiting square.

Very crowded on the hour . We got there at 3:54, so we stayed until 4:00. The "show" lasts about a minute. There was a huge crowd. It's definitely not worth going to the clock on the hour. You're not missing much.
Really exciting and memorable. Hundreds of people gather around to watch and hear the mechanism of the clock. It's an amazing clock.

A slightly odd but attractive continuation of the old town square. The buildings in this area have more originality than those of the town square - partly because they have developed over the centuries with each epoch leaving its mark. Although I found the 12 noon astronomical clock performance a little disappointing (there are better ones to be found in Rouen and other European cities) the overall impression is agreeable and a must on the tourist trail. However there are warnings about pickpockets and the crowds provide a perfect opportunity for them.

Ok but busy and underwhelming. . We took our small boy who loves robots and machines. The huge tourist crowd meant we couldn't get near enough for him or ourselves to see the clock working properly. Once the crowd had cleared we could see the workmanship which is incredible. We hope to visit again and be amongst the front of the crowd. Other attractions in the square were brilliant for small children, including a bubble performer!
Blah. This is definitely overrated and not really worth waiting while standing. Just drop by in the last 5-10 minutes.

Just outside our window.. We stayed directly in front of the Astronomical Clock and the crowds gathered right outside our hotel. It wasn't until the 3rd day that we finally viewed the hourly show and also climbed to the top to view the city. A must do for Prague tourists.

Stunning clock. I have to laugh at people giving this clock a bad review...it's a clock...not a transformer!! The architecture is unbelievable and was so amazing, that when the clock was finally built, the architect has is eyes cut out so another one could never be made. On the hour, a small window opens up with figures representing life and death. A stunning work of art and the most beautiful clock in the world....if you don't like clocks, don't see it :-)

Not just for looks. If you have a chance to join a guide in the Stare Mestro, have him explain the mechanics and purpose of the Astronomical Clock. It is amazing to watch, but the technology and science that was used in 1410 still drives this complex device today. The astronomical aspects, the ability to predict the seasons and estimates of sunrise and sunset were important to residents for hundreds of years. Most people just watch the procession of the Apostles without understanding the complexity of the clock. Have a tour guide explain it, or pick up a book nearby and read it while you study the face.
beautiful. Was a neat experience to watch the clock chime on the hour and to see the little show when that happens.

Nice. Been here recently, it's a nice clock, but very busy with tourist. Your lucky to get a photo before someone comes and stands in front of you to get their picture. Nice square though which has free tours and stalls around the outside.

A required landmark. The square and clocks are must sees when in Prague. Theyre a stop along the way to all the wonderful little alleys and sidestreets adjacent.A nice attraction amongst the many offered in this beautiful city.

Quirky . The guide pointed out that this is the 2nd most overrated attraction in Europe (after the Mona Lisa). Still if you're running a tick list you have to see the hourly strike with the clock's various moving parts (also helps to have the FREE walking tour guide - Discover Prague - explain the history and workings)
Worth the visit. One of the most peculiar sites of Prague, and is worth the little price to get over the top, to get some impressive picture of the centre

Amazing architecture!. Full hour play is super! Waiting until clock is full hour and then the show begins! Worth waiting and defenitely must see in Prague. Up from tower is breath taking view to the city!

Interesting construction. We did not enter the town hall but we studied the clock with the help of a guide who explained the three major features of the clock, as well as the legend behind the clock. Very interesting history!

Beautiful old Building. What a beautiful old structure and the clock was amazing. Definitely worth visiting, especially if you are wandering down to the Charles Bridge. The square gets very busy so go early and hopefully beat the annoying segue reps who swoop in on tourists non-stop trying to sell them a ride....

Nice. busy at the time and the square. easily become crowded and people walked on without looking for .
plenty of restaurants, coffee places where you can sit o watch the clock .

Underwhelmed. Don't get me wrong the technical work that went into the clock is fascinating. However, if you are spending time in old town you will walk past it loads and inadvertently be there to see the chimes. Don't wait for any length of time to see it, you are likely to be underwhelmed.

Clock tower. A great European town square. Make sure to stop and have a beer or a cafe. The people watching is wonderful and the locals are very friendly. English is commonly spoken in restaurants and bars. Plus the setting is beautiful.

Brief and crowded. The crowds assemble early to see the show and are generally disappointed that there is not more to it. I would encourage people to walk up the campanile to see great views of Prague instead of, or in addition to milling around waiting for the clock.

Beautiful, fascinating & VERY busy. This favourite part of Old Prague is is almost fairy tale like to look at...... Apart from the never ending throws of guided tours, street hawkers, pickpockets, tourist tat sellers and hoards of maniacs on Segways. Still a wonderful place to visit, if you get there early in the morning, or if out and about at night. A must see, even if, like me, you hate crowds.......

Very popular. The chock 'performs' on the hour and it's worth spending a couple of minutes to view. Beware of pick pockets in the area as the square becomes very busy when people are watching the clock.

Climb the tower for great views!. It's neat to watch the clock chime on the hour. It's also worth paying to climb the tower since the 360 degree views at the top are great (or you can choose to take the elevators is you prefer). We visited early April so it wasn't too crowded.
Facinating Astronomical clock. We did a walking tour of old town Prague. Interesting architecture and we watched the clock in action. Must see area of Prague

Fantastic. Make sure you do the tour under the clock and go to the top of the tower. Take the lift to the top of the tower and then take the walk down and enjoy the photos of its history. Tickets for both of these can be bought in an office at the clock tower .

Ok but no cigar!. My daughter had visited Prague before and said that she was underwhelmed by the astronomical clock. It is not worth standing under for twenty minutes as many seem to do.
