It strikes on the hour and does a little clockwork display, but the whole thing is over within a minutes. One tip is to go to the first floor of the cafe opposite (can't remember the name). We went and reserved a table for the next day and sat eating cakes while waiting for the clock to strike. I got some great pictures and I was comfortable!

Clock tower steals all the attention..... And rightly so!! The colors, the shape and the characteristic "show" that occurs when an hour clocks in is just a thing to see. Being in Prague and missing this is dumb and very difficult since it really is in the center of town so you are just bound to bump into it.It is always filled with tourist night and day so keep a look for pickpockets alhough I must say I never felt in any moment anything else but safe and at ease.

Must see in Prague. Located in Old town square (Staromestska). A Marvelous invention at the time it was constructed, legend says the maker was blinded after he completed work so that he could never make another such clock. They must have had faith in the durability of the work as well... It activates every hour, don't miss the show!
wonderful vew. we wiseted the old town hol, and it was beautiful, but very windy, so we had to stay behind the windows. The vew is spectacular!
Astronomical Clock. The best time to se this clock is at noon when the bells strike, and two windows open and you can see figures inside moving.

Great walking area and interesting clock. The clock in the central square is wonderful. We were constantly warned to be on the lookout for pickpockets. Many side streets full of shops and restaurants to keep you busy as long as you want.

Interesting history. The clock on this tower is so cool, it's the only one left in Europe that still has the same working parts from when it was first built. I'd advise you to do a free walking tour, I did one with Tomas from the walking tours with the yellow umbrellas. He told us all about the clock, the workings of it and how it tells you the time, date, where the planets are, the phase of the moon, how high the sun is etc. I went back the next day to see the very short show on the hour, which is lovely, you really have to appreciate the mechanics involved for something that old to still work that way.
Unique and interesting astronomical clock. Do not say to your colleagues that you went to Prague if you missed this monument. It's really a must see monument of the beautiful city, Prague.
Turist center. Nice old town square but be prepared as it is very crowded. The old clock is impressive but again some of the fun is taken by the massive number of turist.
Tick tock. Very nice square with a lot going on. The clock is always surrounded by people in awe. So much history here

No idea what the time was!. It was something 'o'clock', a bit of an anti-climax and extremely packed from about 10minutes to every hour. A haven for pickpockets if you are unlucky, so be aware of your surroundings.

The show is over before you know it. But then the enjoyment of something is not tied to its duration. One has to admire the mechanical genius that went into constructing the original parts in the 15th century. Some details have been added much later, such as the calendar under the clock. If you pass by at the top of the hour, by all means join the hundreds of tourists gazing at the short-lived spectacle. But consult a good guide book for real appreciation.

Entertaining, get there early! . I would say to time this particular stop about 20 to the hour, for the very short show on the hour. Find a good viewpoint from a tall table in the opposite restaurants and grab a prosecco. Watching the international crowds who gather to see the sight is almost as interesting as the clock itself.
Astronomical clock. This is well worth seeing it is in the old town. Make sure you have a camera with you. Plenty of eating places just facing the clock and only a short walk from the newer town.
Unique . Must see!! It's a unique tourist attraction if you visit this beautiful city. We visit on April it was pretty cold still.

It is the MUST !. To be in Prague and not to visit this place = not to be in Prague at all... This area of the city has its own special spirit, atmosphere and magic colour. The Prague Oldtown Hall, founded (as the first in Czech countries) in 1338 and this is the complex of the buildings closely connected to Old Town Square. Astronomical Clock or Prague Astronomical Clock is a medieval astronomical clock located on the south side of the Old Town Hall tower in Prague. The clock is first mentioned in a document dated October 9, 1410 and it is the focus of the vast majority of tourists. I fully recommend not to be restricted just by this veiw - nearby you can see many other interesting sights of Prague.
LOVELY SQUARE BUT BUSY. This square is lovely. There are street artists, musicians etc (lots of Segways!) we came here several times and had a nice drink/Watched the astronomical clock
Fascinating. The Astronomical clock is fascinating. However you really need a guide or book to see how it works or else you will miss out on the significance of it all.

Pretty impressive . I'm not going to lie, when I first set eyes on the tower and clock I did think 'what is all the fuss about' it's not awful or anything but it just seemed a bit of a disappointed from the build up. However the following day we did a walking tour and the guide explained all about the clock and I was amazed... It really is a pretty impressive thing, especially when you consider ow long it's been around and the technology that was available at that time. Is definitely worth a visit (ideally on the hour) but make sure you check out the extent of its wisdom!
What a beautiful Clock. . This clock is well worth a visit. You will not believe how beautiful the clock is, go early to avoid the crowds. Hope you enjoy yourself.
Astronomical clock. It's very nice piece, you definitely need one guide to understand better this clock and how it works.

High Noon....best time to visit Old Town Hall & Astronomical Clock in Prague!!. My guide took me to the front of the crowd to talk about this clock at around 11:40 am. To see how old this town square reminds me of being inside of a old story book. The crowds kept crowding around till the stroke of High Noon. Then the clock came to life. Parts of the clock starting moving and various figurines started coming from behind the clock face. The entire time there in that square was great. If you have problems with large crowds...just take a deep breath and relax. Many vendors to purchase magnets of the clock face. Just shop around. Same item can be purchased for next to nothing or you can spend a great deal.

Go to the top of the tower. Lets face it, the town hall and the entire square are just stunningThe clock is a piece of art that is great to seeBut you do need to take the walk into the towerDont use the elevator but do the walkSince its just a pathway instead of staires it is not that difficultAnd you'll find a lot of neat historical info along the wayBest part is at the top.when you have a great view over the city!
Amusing. Found ourselves having to stop and watch the clock every time we passed through the square. Clearly amusing

Amazing craftsmanship. Very Very crowded at all times of the day. There are lots of shops, Cafes around and one has to pass by the clock to go to the Charles bridge. The Clock is a must see. One must try and get a guide to understand the intricacies of the clock. its amazing how they managed to build a clock with such details.

Go up to the town hall !. Of course everybody wait for this 30 seconds of little show of the Astronomical clock (not so interesting, just touristic) but the most interesting thing to do is to go at the top of the town hall. From there you'll see a view, from the real center, of all of Prague (and also the past history of this place), the place below, the churches, the castle, the different hills... The most complete view of the town. And to do it in the night is still more interesting.
The clock is an amazing to see... The clock is an amazing site to see, most people wait until the hour to see the clock working. It is a very busy placeand a lot of tourist are there.

Missed out on seeing the Astronomical Clock in action since the clock was not set to the proper time.. We visited Old Town to see the Astronomical Clock in all of her splendor. Since we had roughly 30 minutes of time to kill before the clock was to activate on the hour mark, we visited a church across the courtyard. As we walked out of the church and looked up to the tower to see what time it was, I commented, 'Perfect! We have ten minutes to get to the Astronomical Clock to see it 'ring!'' After crossing the open area, I noticed all of the people dispersing. I double checked the clock on the tower which still read ten minutes to the hour. After rounding the corner to face the Astronomical Clock, we noticed that clock read three minutes after the hour. We never did make it back to that touristy area during our visit.
Very Nice!. The Astronomical clock is a must visit. It is not only that it's beautiful but also if you spent sometimes to go up to the tower you will get a lovely view.

Fun time. Get to the old town hall early and stay at the back with a pillar to lean on. The clock only takes about 30 seconds to do its thing and you don't want to miss it. Enjoy the crowd while you wait. Great people watching.

Underwhelmed. The only reason we saw this was that we were passing by a couple minutes before the hour and there was a gelato stand nearby. Both were underwhelming. It was the worst gelato I've had in Europe and tiny scoops for more money than elsewhere. As usual, the clock bells chimed and the windows opened and the apostles (or whoever) marched by but they don't come out from behind the window and the window isn't lighted in the evening so they can hardly be seen. The march takes about 10 seconds. See the clock face as it's beautiful but don't waste your time waiting to see the "show".

Good. We viewed the astronomical clock from the restaurant whilst we enjoyed a cocktail and a sit down. Also went to the top to enjoy the views. Not too expensive and o enjoyed reading about the history on the way up.

Not that impressive.... Came by to see what was all the hype about the Astronomical Clock but we were not impressed..we have seen more impressive designs e.g Cambridge, UK. Lots of tourists, crowded. Another tourist trap. We were more impressed by the Old Town Square area and its surrounding buildings..

Centre of activity. Surrounded by tourist but a great place to pick up a free tour, and pay only what you think it's worth, and it is worth a lot. Very knowledgeable guides who are dedicated to assuring you get a terrific tour

Nice building and view from the tower. Here you can see the astronomical clock and just with 120 crown (around that, forgot the exact number) you can climb the tower (they have lift, don't worry) and also read and see a lot of history about this building.Worth to visit, nice view from above. When I was there, lucky me, they have a wedding going on right there.

Great meeting place. Clock is fun to watch on the hour as it does it's act. Also found the yellow jacket tour guides here. and booked a walking tour of Prague as well as a castle walking tour. All met and started here at the clock.
Fun Anticipation.... It is a busy and crowded environment, however it was defintely worth the wait for the local experience

Old Town, Prague. The Old Town around the area of the Astronomical Clock is bustling with students, tourists and locals. We climbed the clock tower which was actually and easy climb because it has a ramp rather than stairs; it also has an elevator if you don't want to climb up. Great views once there.
Overnight Stay. We stayed in Prague for one night whilst on the way to Poland. I loved the area where the Clock is situated. Very vibrant and well worth a visit.
Have a tour guide for this attraction . Very interesting historical site, but not without an experienced guide. You will miss out on the wonderful history of this site. Bring camera.
Worth a look. Located in the old town square. It is a beautiful piece to look at. Worth going to see when in Prague.

Fun and Historic. We had a great time waiting for the clock to work it's magic. The place was VERY crowded and we came in the summer so the place had little shade and it was hot the day we visited, but it was still worth it! It was awesome!
Interesting.. Very beautifull to see all the work that went into this clock and right in the square and lit up at night.
Did not meet expectations!. I brought some friends to see this and after it was over, it was like...is that all there is? I wouldn't bother to go out of the way to see it.
Super Beautiful. It was the best place which I visited in Prague. Very beautiful and colorful. It is very attractive and eye catching. Do not miss it at all!!!

Be vigilant. The clock has many attributes. Lots to look at but be quick. Just b4 the clock strikes
The skeleton moves to make the anoucement, the two doors open and the figures
Begin to move. Be quick to count or u will not get to 12.

Never to miss while in old town.... Ok, i had heard a lot of hype about this astronomical clock and when i visited the site and watched a clockwork hourly show of figures of the Apostles and other moving sculptures...i just said ok but now wow factor. But yes it is well designed mechanically and holds signs of scientific part of sun, moon, zodiac etc but one needs to understand the logic behind this so to appreciate. many tourists flock here and fully crowded and take some videos/pics for this 15 seconds show... anyways you are not going to miss this clock while walking down to old town. Best view is from the clock tower and must visit...or get a seat from the open restaurant and have a coffee on hourly time so that you can view the clock show.

Overrated. The clock was touted highly and the crowds were thick at noon, even in April. I understand that in mid-summer, it is almost claustrophobic. I don't know what I expected, but I was disappointed. The Apostles moving in the windows are hard to see if you are not right in front. I think something didn't work , because nothing appeared in "the door." Anyway, the square is a lot of fun.

Relaxing . We saw this as part of a guided tour then went 2 times afterwards as the square is lovely.The restaurant opposite the clock is not expensive and is a great way to watch the clock and the people.The outside part is heated.

Beautiful area to visit. The old town was awesome! We were there in January and there were lots of markets and stalls still around from Christmas making the atmosphere inviting. The clock is in the center and is glorious, but not the main attraction in this part of the town as the buildings and architecture are very picturesque.

Magical views from the top of the tower!. To be clear, I'm giving this 5 out of 5 because the views from the top of the tower are incredible. Also, climbing the tower and seeing the lift that runs up and down the tower is pretty cool too. For anyone who is a photographer - this is a MUST when visiting Prague.We didn't do the town hall tour, though you can get much of the history of the town hall from the displays on the walls as you ascend the tower anyway (if you walk up rather than taking the lift).What I am not giving this 5 out of 5 for is the little routine that the clock goes through on the hour every hour (except midnight apparently), featuring the skeleton and figures up near the clock face. Sure you might as well watch it if you're there at the time - but don't wait around for it - it's underwhelming at best and you might as well watch it on YouTube.

Astrpnomical Clock. Old town, Jewish cemetery and Castle hill, where Astronomical clock is also located, are the first places I visited in Prague. Although The Clock was under construction at that time.

Don't blink or you will miss it!. I was there on a 99F day and chose to sit at a cafe drinking an ice cold mojito. The crowd gets very thick toward the top of the hour. The clock routing takes only about 15 seconds. It is cute and a "not miss" but only once is necessary.

Worthy a visit or two . Go there during daytime to look at the clock, buildings, etc...Go there in the night to soak in the atmosphere.But keep away form the "half scoop for the price of a full"-ice cream mafia...Prague is a wonderful city, so see more than just this bit.
The daunting clock in Old town. You are awestruck and cant escape looking and peering at the clock again and again. It looms large of the square and is incredibly beautiful

Astronomical clock and Tower. Yet another example of human ingenuity! Amazing clock but also phases of planets, and the Moon. The guy who designed had trouble getting paid for it, so tragically ended up throwing himself into the mechanism, an action which prevented the town burgers from using it, this lasted 150 years, efficient sabotage!! It's now working well (all cleaned up!!) and an interesting display on the hour! The tower also gives splendid views of the city (there's a lift!!) Plus an historical review on the way down(recites War damage, Nazis and so on, massive restoration work, impressive!).
Old Town Square. Old town square is the most beautiful square in Europe I must say, have been in many places but such wonderful square I have not seen anywhere in the world. Have a great day friends!
Wonderful Old World ambience. We visited this location several times during our sixteen day stay and really enjoyed hanging out in the Old Town square..going to come back for more next year!!

Good views from Tower, clock is boring . There is good views from the Tower, you can have an amazing view of Prague from all sides of the tower, the clock is boring, looked at it once or twice but couldn't understand the hype around it.

Astronomical Clock. If it wasn't for the fact that the astronomical clock is in old town square so you are more than likely going to stop and watch it as it is famous, I wouldn't go out of my way to visit this clock. It was very disappointing and I was glad that we were sitting in a restaurant having our dinner when it started as I would have been disappointed if had waited about in the cold for it.

Beautiful piece of architecture. Wonderful display of the 'skeleton' man on the hour every hour. Great history behind the clock and you can go up the tower to the top. Picture taking is a must.BEST TIP aim to arrive just before the hour chiming
Clock. Fantastic view from the top and wait for the hour to strike on the clock it's fantastic to watch. Lovely square outside to people watch

Stunning and Fun. We were fortunate enough to have a hotel room located directly across from the clock, which was absolutely wonderful. Crowds gather in front of the clock at the top of each hour to see the clock do it's thing.

You have to see the clock chime. You've got to do it - brilliant mechanical item for its time and so beautifully decorated. I can imagine it will get very busy in summer, so worth getting there beforehand to secure a good spot. The square itself is beautiful too.

Beautiful building and wonderfully significant clock. The old town hall and astronomical clock strike you from any angle in Old Town Square and are a focal point for all visitors to Prague at least once, especially when the clock strikes the hour and the bells resonate across this area of the city

Beautiful. The clock itself is a work of art. I was lucky enough to be there when it chimed the top of the hour and I think that the "show" is a little over-hyped, though still impressive, considering how long ago it was made. It seems to be very tourist-y now, but I still say it's a must see.

The Amazing Clock Prague. My wife and I passed by and stopped at this attraction three times over 2 days. But it was 't until Sarah of Sandeman's New Prague tours explained the invention and the workings of this magnificent invention, that we were awed by its existence. It is truly worth seeing but try to get a good explanation of the history and the way it works.

Crowded with tourists - a lot of fuss for a short show. Not worth it - if you are in the main square - for sure you'll see the hour change sometime in your visit. Hard to enjoy because of all the tourists.

Scam everywhere in Prague. From restaurant, taxi driver, money changer to those who try to sell you staff at tourist spots. They will find ways to trick and charge you with exorbitant rate.Most of the time, u will find out the final price when receiving receipt printed in Czech, which u won't be able to understand.I suggest that you ask for final price in any possible ways to prevent this happening to u.Overall, the attractions are ok but the culture of doing business here is shady.

Time for a visit!!. A lovely experience on the hour. Watch as the skeleton rings the bell announcing another hour closer to death (yikes). However the other saints and scholars shaking their heads and urging us to embrace life . A fantastic if complicated piece of work and well worth a visit. But remember to keep your hands on your valuables and cash as you look up at the clock as you will find a few unsavoury characters in the huge crowds that gather.
Only Time Will Tell.... The clock is amazing... learn the history behind the clock (if you don't already know it) and the surrounding architecture is beautiful.

Nice. Lovely views from top of Tower and lots of interesting facts on walls on way up. Lots of steps but not too bad a climb...There is a lift though if you are not keen. The clock itself is interesting to see but after all the talk a bit disappointing. ..still nice to see.
Tourism attraction. It's one of the must to visit this location while you are in the old town ,in order to get some good pictures for this beautiful piece of art.
go to the top . you could spend 25 minutes looking at the clock and understand all the specificities of each pictures, circles, statuesdefinetly go up in the tower for an amazing view of Prague
Stunning . This clock shows the technology of the era. It is stunningly beautiful to witness. It is a must see for anyone visiting Prague.

A great view is the reward if you walk to the top. Like the towers in many European cities, the Old Town hall is the best place to orient yourself to the city. It's a great place to take pics and learn a little of the history of Prague. Must do.
Interesting. Seeing the clock on the hour is neat. It's amazing it still works after all these years. Worth the wait. Nostalgic

Nothing Special. Hubby and I heard so much about this clock. We made a point to be there to see the show that occurs on the hour. The clock itself is very pretty and 'photo-worthy', but what happens on the hour is, in my opinion, nothing special. Nothing that should stop you from doing something else. According to some locals, the real show is the gathering of the tourists who stare up at the clock each hour. I have seen similar type activity which were more impressive.

Go Inside. The astronomical clock attracts large crowds, but few go inside. We walked up the tower and enjoyed reading the story with pictures as we went. After we joined up with and English tour of the underground tunnels that connect buildings and learned about the history.

Not very impressive. The click itself is very pretty, especially when you understand all little pieces on it and what they represent. However, the show itself is not so impressive. It last about 20 seconds so it is better not to expect much from it.

be there on the hour. be there on te hour to see the astronomical clock chime. Always busy. Go up to the top of the clock there are lifts available, not for those who are afraid of heights (like me )but up i went and it offers the most amazing panoramic views of the square and the whole of prague
An intersting story. Which i am not about to tell, this is a must visit on the itinary, there are many bars and restaurants nearby.

Great looking clock!. Hello all Reader'sJust a quick review on the clock. Everyday, every hour on the hour the clock does a little display where the 2 small window above the clock open and you can see the 12 disciples dance past the opening.. That's it.. The funny thing is seeing the looks of disappointment on people's faces who have stood there for sometime for 20 seconds.They also sell tickets to go up the tower and look at the view... Don't... Just over from the clock is a hotel / restaurant next to the "Black Angel" bar. They have a roof bar (from where I took the photo attached) it's free to go up there and you can have a beer at the same time.Overall, it's a must see otherwise you've just not done Prague... **warning**Be careful the area is full of people selling tours and pick pockets...!!! Keep your pockets and bags zipped up.Thanks for reading, I hope this has been of help, if so please give me a thumbs up.. I need the points!
Overrated. Every hour a whole bunch of people gather around to see the apostoles come out, but they dont really come out! You can see them from a little window, if you get a good place to stay.
Very Popular attraction. Chimes every hour and various parts of the clock move. It attracts a lot of people on the hour. Get a ticket and climb up or get the lift to the top and view all the sights.

Before going, read its history and significance. The Old Town Hall and of course the Astronomical Clock are considered to be a real not-to-miss / must-see thing in Prague; Situated on Staroměstské nám (Old Town Square) it's really hard to miss. Visit the Old Town Hall building and climb it to the top (great view of the Old Town Square and the city). In order to see the Astronomical Clock, try to get there 10-15 minutes prior to the "show time", get a nice distant spot to photo-shoot as it gets really crowded (beware of pickpockets, ignore all guides trying to sell their services) and focus on the clocks details.

Prague City Break. We arrived at The Astronomical Clock just before 7pm and decided to wait to see the "show" - two small wooden doors above the clock open and pictures of saints revolve and then the golden chicken crows. Not that spectacular really!

Should watch. The clock is very nice... I went after the ester vacation so there were still some easter kiosk which were selling the easter egg and some other stuff
You should stand by the watch to watch the show (it happen every hour) so you can not miss it
clock left me speechless. clock leave me without a word, wonderful design, I bought a small figurine of this clock at street shop.

Must see. Astronomical clock - Having heard the story from Callum (Discover Prague guide) - absolutely amazing even by todays standards.
Old Town - fantastic meeting area -

That was is? . Astronomical clock looked and sounded really cool, but you should not stay and watch it move when the clock hits 00. It was not worth the ocean of people taking pictures and pushing each other.

Amazing views from tower. At all times the square is full of visitors which says a lot. On our last day we climed to the top of the tower, a lift is available for those less mobile. The view from the top is stunning even on a cloudy day
.

The Most Famous Clock in the World After Big Ben. This confusing looking clock is a must visit when in Prague. I like to visit in the early evening as the crowds are much less than during the day and you can grab a beer in the square nearby afterwards.
Obviously, try showing up 5 to 10 minutes before the hour as all the action happens when the bells chime.

Worth a visit or two!. This great attraction on the old town square must not be missed. Make sure you are there a couple of minutes before the hour to see the clock's hourly display. Good fun and free to do! A must see in Prague.

Looking at a clock and still wandering what time it is. Amazing to see. Just a little disappointed about the "show" that should take place at the top of the hour. Just 2 blinds opened and showed some characters. Expected a little more
Still a unique piece of art and a must see if Prague is on your bucket list

Visit the top of the tower on the hour!. We walked to the top of the tower and were up there on the hour. A young girl came out a played the trumpet over the square. The view was fantastic, even on an overcast day. The clock only requires about 30 seconds of your time.

Old and interesting. great history behind this clock and I like the details put into creating this. Most anticipated and biggest disappoint. Go see and you'll understand what I mean. Don't get me wrong, I still really like this clock.

A beautiful, still operational, astronomical clock from 1410. The Prague Astronomical Clock (Prague orloj) is a medieval astronomical clock with special mechanisms and dials to display astronomical information, such as the relative positions of the sun, moon, zodiacal constellations, and sometimes major planets, located in Prague, the capital of the Czech Republic.It’s old, it’s beautiful and impressive in many ways: It was built in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still operating. This is allegedly one of the “must-sees” in Prague.
clock. Lots of people to watch a clock,If you want to see the front of the clock make sure you get there early.
Hard to miss. Every hour the crowds build...the suspense is unreal!!! I really enjoyed the clock and anytime we walked by we got another photo it never disappointed

(Astronomical Clock) Too many going to see it!. It is worth putting on the to do list, but a bit over hyped, with hundreds of tourists packed around for less than two minutes of viewing. If you are nearby, on the hour, perhaps worth it.

Good. It's amazing how every hour the crowd gets so big you will struggle to get from one side to the other. Basically on the hour little figurines go round in circles at the two windows above the clock, it doesn't last long a minute if that but it is good to see even just to say you have seen it
Interesting history . Great views and photos from the top at night. We used a Prague tourist card but probably would not get it next time. Was cost neutral for us.

Amazing Clock . In the old part of town is the famous astronomical clock. This is a sight not to miss on a visit to Prague. The detail and the sheer beauty is amazing and when the clock strikes and the figures around start moving it is quite something. The square where the clock is situated gets very busy and crowded as you would expect but just all adds to the experience.

Beautiful!. As a whole, Prague is one of the most beautiful cities I have ever visited.The Old Town Hall and Astronomical clock is really interesting and impressive. My friends and I went there during the Christmas markets and we went up to the top of the tower. The view from up there is absolutely amazing.
astronomical clock. a must see for any prague visit! beautiful clock, on the hour little figurines can be seen at the top spinning round. got some gorgous pictures.

Fun to watch. The whole area is fun, from street performances to restaurants and cafes to small museums.The Prague astronomical clock is the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still operating, so prepare your camera to get some great shots !

Not as good as I hoped but still pretty good. 50%. Guide was CALLUM. We came to prauge having a idea of what we wanted to do well with that said one of the stronger ideas was to see the asternomical clock at a hour and when i saw it to be honest I was not very impressed the performance was just some.dolls going around the inside of the clock. Being disappointed I told my tour guied CALLUM and he explained the very dramatic history of the clock after the history lesson the clock was 5 stars but science I know most people can't learn that history lesson just for the performance I would have to give it 3 stars
Clever. The clock is the main draw in the square. Its show on the hour was interesting. The statues and overall decoration is fantastic.

Interesting. I guess it is one of the most complicated clock I have ever seen :pTo start with, it lies just next to the old town square. So you need to cross the place and you will straightaway locate the clock.!It is always crowded, so getting yourself clicked perfectly here can be a tedious task.!Nothing much to describe. It wont take up much of your time, I guess hardly half an hour (at max I believe).

Great views from the tower. The tower was restored following damage received during world war 2. Interesting to read about its history. Great 360 views from the top of the tower (2 lifts take you to the summit). The clock is a tourist attraction each hour. Hundreds wait in anticipation for the clock to strike and for the 12 apostles appear in the Windows above the clock. The tower is worth a visit as the view is fantastic.
Rxcellent. Come at the topic the hour to see the Astronomical clock go off and see the apostles go around and the bells ring. The square itself is full of outside cafes and restaurants and gelato.
Manage to get there before the full hour.. Very interesting clock.I tried to identify my sun sign, it was fun.Also the buildings around the hall of the old town and some statutes were very nice.
Qeirky clock . Interesting clock, I'm sure there's some history behind it! When the clock chimes at midday keep looking for the surprise!

Technology at its best. This clock which was built more than 600 years ago is still working and 4 times a day, it opens up like a cookoo clock and these figurines rotate around. Beautiful to watch, BUT be careful of the pick pockets in this area. Our tour guide warned us about this. As people are intent in watching this open, the thieves bump into you and take your wallet

Town Hall . It's very picturesque. Don't wait long to watch the clock as you will be disappointed went up the tower to see the sites well worth it .Good history tour of the town and clock house while you walk up no steps until you reach the vey top but you can use the glass lift if your hard pushed or just knackered. There a young lad up the top playing the trumpet who's gets in the way but it's his job.

Do the tour inside the Old Town Hall. I went several times outside the Astronomical Clock, first with a free walking tour and they explained lots of things, later I went back by my own to see the change of the hour when the apostles march happens, it is something really interesting because this clock comes from 1410 and has suffered lots of difficulties (like a fire).After this I decide I wanted to see it from inside the Town Hall, so I paid for the tour and to go up to the towel, I think this was really good, the guide was funny and told us a lot about the clock and the old Hall, I could see the apostles march from inside (really good) and went up to the towel that has a very nice view of the city... so, if you go to Prague, please do it!
Be there 10 mins before the hour. Astronomial clock was wonderful. Get a good postion because at 5 mins to the hour everyone rushes to see the clock strike !

Over 600 years and still working. Yes that's true, it's just an old clock, and not very clear on the dial and what time it is, but it's 600 years and still ticking! So once you're there, and the hour is round, look up and enjoy the show, the applause and excitement. Just be aware of the pickpockets
So pretty, and the views are awesome!. The building itself and the clock is a delight to look at, and make sure to climb the tower for some lovely views of the rest of Prague!
Beautiful clock but. we all stood in the square waiting for something incredible to happen and nothing. But still a beautiful piece of architecture.

Great. Fabulous clock really unusual on the hour figures appear and go round. Massive crowds you can go to top of tower but unfortunately never managed queues were so long as a lot of school tours were there.

Go to Top of Clock Tower. There is a lift! After climbing all these old belfrys, I as thrilled to see a lift. Great views of Prague from the top. But, CROWDED up there. The Old Town Square is where tourists tend to congregate to watch the clock strike the hour. So, lots of people go to the top while they are waiting. Similar views, a lift and no crowds from Henrys Tower a few blocks further east. You need to see the clock strike the hour, but be prepared for the crowds who will be joining you.

Great to sight see. We took the tour of the underground city. It was informative and good for more information on the history of Prague. The ticket can then be used to get you a discount up the clock tower where you can see the Apostles from the inside, there is even a lift. The view from the top is great as are most high up views over the city.

Just so many people. This is a well sought attraction with tourists and as such there are so many people. If you don't mind crowds then join the masses on the hour to see two small windows open to see some statues rotate. The square itself is full of places to eat and shops to buy popular items such as glassware and jewellery.

unique town hall with clock as an attraction. One can always spot tourists clustered aroung the Town Hall building, waiting for a full hour to swing - that's when the Orloj gets live (ehm, with its skeleton). and at 12, it gets even better.Not to be missed is the Town Hall - Radnice itself, as it i rewarding to climb up the stairs to get a cute view of mostly reddish rooftops of the buildings around.
Very cool. It was nice to see the hourly change with the scheme tor ringing the new hour ,funny and Unic. I raccomand to anyone to see it.

It's beautiful architecture . It's lovely to see but was expecting more!! The architecture is beautiful though and you can go up and see a view of the old town. Make sure you get there before the hour to see its features.

Stunning views. The astronomical clock is nice, one of Prague's landmarks, worth seeing... but what is really impressive is to climb to the old town hall and enjoy the views of the old Town. That's impressive!
The only drawback is that it's packed with tourists and the lines are usually very long :(

Starting point of the city. Located in definitely one of the most beautiful squares of all Europe. Its the best place to start your sightseeing. I recommend to get a walking tour, or get a book so that you understand all the symbolism of the clock. Its incredible!

Underwhelming. The second most disappointing tourist attraction in the world, according to our guide. Don't expect much, though the clock is indeed beautiful with it's intricate designs and hourly movements. The 4 people on the clock depicts 4 sins.Tourists will scramble to get a view of this historical clock every hour, so do find a good place to get a nice view.To get a proper understanding of what each detail on the clock represents, join the free walking tour where the guide will explain everything.

Walk up. If you walk up the well restored tower you can see the clock from looking out, the crowds below and the city spreading out. The are old photos showing the now demolished north wing and the history from the war, it's worth it, and not too strenuous. The tower is crowded, you shuffle around, but you can see surprisingly far.

Beautiful clock. A stunning attraction which you can go up inside to its viewing deck. Every hour on the hour the bell chimes and the doors open with the model men looking down on the people. It gets very busy every hour as everyone is waiting for the man to ring the bell.
Absolutely fantastic. Simply fantastic, a must see to climb the tower. When we were there and the clock went off the crowd applauded afterwards. Fun sense of community.

What a View. People seem to be talking about the clock. I wasn't interested in that, but the Old Town Hall Tower! I turned up at 18:50 when it shuts at 19:00 due to work, and they didn't care, got my ticket. There are lifts to get all the way to the top! Thinking I would get kicked out bang on 19:00. I didn't want to waist my €4 on entrance and miss out on the view. I had more than enough time and I had no one else around me. Really so pleased to have done it an such a good view.

Great views!. We enjoyed great views from the clock tower the other day. We were there by about 9.20am so it was very quiet but choose your time carefully. The astronomical clock "show" is incredibly popular on the hour but I personally wouldn't recommend rushing to see it.

Alright for a clock. After going up pretty much every other tower in Prague, we decided to give this one a miss, but took a bit of time to watch the clock which admittedly looked impressive. After seeing crowds gathering, we decided to see what all the fuss was about. The spectacle was alright...but nothing to wait around for.

Learn the story of the Clock!. What a fabulous, historical site this is. On the hour, you can enjoy the "show" of the clock which is an acting out of life vs. death. Read about the meaning of it all before you watch it and you will enjoy it even more.

Seriously?. There were hundreds of people watching this every hour, we had to watch twice as we thought we must be missing something but, alas. This is a lovely clock and the engineering is superb, but the level of excitement and the lack of delivery was very underwhelming. A couple of the characters move to ring bells, then two windows open up and some characters go past – save yourself the crush and watch it on YouTube. However the square that adorns this clock is awesome and with a Starbucks it has something for all tatses.
Pay attention. Most everyone who visits wants to watch the clock.It happens fast, keep your camera ready. The clockis very beautiful.

so much fun!. I had a lot of fun walking the Old Town Hall with my mom. There are a lot of restaurants, gelato places, shops and places to just sit and people watch. The best part of the Old Town Hall is the Astronomical Clock. The clock is old and interesting but the most fun part is watching all the people crowd by this one clock every hour and raise their cameras in the air to take their picture. I did it!
Disappointed. Don't know what I expected but was a little disappointed in the clock. I expected it to do more than just the moving figures.

wonderful. The clock chimes on the hour and little religious figurines circulate past the window , at the side of the clock , small figures , greed , death , vanity etc , all move about. At the end a cockerel pops out at the top of the clock and flaps his wings . Its truly an amazing display , I visitied day and night and I must say night is beautiful looking at the town lit up so beautifuly and magical .

Overrated! . Yes it is nice to see the buildings and the history of the place. No it is not worth waiting the hour to see the clock. The spectacle is disappointing. So go whenever you feel like and see the nice clock without having 100 people and pickpockets around!

Astronomcal clock and tower. Around the hour here are almost all tourists currently in the town waiting small windows to open. One have to try more tham once to see the dance. First time is almost always impossible because of the worse position taken.
Well worth a visit . Definitely recommend paying to go to the top and taking in the view of Prague. Beautiful views on a sunny day. Only 200 csz each

Unique Clock. I wouldn't be bothered about waiting for the clock to do anything on the hour as there a loads of people and to be honest its nothing amazing. That said I would definitely take the time to see the clock at any other time as it really is very impressive and the concept is truly unique. If you either do a tour or just loiter around the clock you will overhear one of the guide explaining all about it. Overall a must see but don't worry if you aren't there on the hour as not a lot happens, its just like a slightly elaborate cuckoo clock.
Cannot be misssed. We came upon this walking into the Old Town Square every hour on the hour the clock strikes and the twelve apostles appear.

Fun but busy. The clock doesn't take much finding but it is incredibly popular and as the hour approaches the crowds gather it can be a little difficult to get a good position so go early if you want a good view. A word of warning the outside cafes are convenient but expensive so if you must eat there shop around for the best price.

Love, Love, Love!. Okay, I love the Astronomical clock!! What I don't get is the people who stand there waiting for the clock to strike the hour. It is less than impressive and you care barely see the figures as they come out. That being said, it is still one of my favourite monuments in Prague!
Must see. We were lucky enough to be there at 12 noon when the clock has a little routine which is a must see. Its definetely worth a visit.

Worth checking it out!. The clock chimes on the hour and the 2 doors open and little religious figurines roll past and the skeleton on the side jangles. Like the Glockenspiel (for Prague though). Watch your possessions though as the crowds throng and there are some dodgy characters around ( best tip: choose a seat at a restaurant and watch in comfort!)

Worth Taking the Time to Appreciate This Work. I was filled with a feeling of intrigue and wonderment as I looked at this amazing piece of history. The clock is really beautiful and the craftsmanship was great to see. The little moving statues are great. I found out that of those that move, the 12 apostles are represented and I thought that was pretty special. It is definitely worth passing by since you'll be out and about the Old Town area.

Old Town Astronomical Clock. A marvel of medieval architecture and ingenuity. Stunning to look at and a testament to medieval engineering. On the hour, out come the apostles and above the statues representing the religious and moral mindset of the time. Everyone's favorite seems to be a skeleton (Death) shaking its head.

Much ado about a clock. The town hall is pretty and the architecture is worth seeing. The clock is pretty and you should see it. Be prepared, however, that it is a very short and underwhelming performance.
Historic clock. Every hour crowds gather to watch the action as mechanical figures rotate around. The tower is well worth a visit with super views over the city.
Cool. On the hour is very very busy, as every tourist in Prague is there to see the clock move. On the zebra bike tour our guide explained the clock in detail. Definitely impressive.

Disappointing . Went to see the clock as we all do on the hour all that happens is two doors at the top open and a few spooky characters rotate round and 4 other figures on the outside just move their heads from side to side don't really know what I was expecting but a bit more than that 😩
Must see. When you visit Prague you have to go and see this clock and have a read about it,it truly is fascinating and a sight to see,you need to wait till it hits the hour for the full effect.

Beautiful clock tower. Absolutely fascinating tower. The views from the top are fantastic and it is easily accesible via two lifts, so you dont have to worry about the steps... the only thing which is a bit disappointing is the o'clock show which is too basic for what everyone expects while waiting patiently for the bells to strike the o'clocks... Not to miss the trumpeteer at the very top!!!
Crowded!. Difficult to see clock because of crowds. Worth paying for entry to tower - superb views over whole city.

Beautifully built (tho the hourly show is not exactly riveting). On the main Old Town Square the astronomical clock is another big tourist draw.It is beautifully designed and built that's for sure.Every hour a small "show" occurs- be forewarned its not the most elaborate in the world but considering how old the clock is, its fair. Definitely worth a visit whilst wondering around the square.Ideally go on a tour of Prague (i really recommend the Sandeman's free one) so that you can learn about the history of the clock and the surrounding area too :)

You must go there !!. Crowded, not crowded, you MUST watch the clock on the hour doing its thing!! It is just an amazing experience. If you're looking for the best panoramic pictures of Prague, don't miss the tower....the entry is not that expensive, sometimes it gets crowded but believe me, you will not regret getting up there and enjoying the view ! If you can get there for sunset, that is even better!

Fantastic views and loads of interesting info. Brilliant views of Prague from the tower. Avoid taking the elevator to the top and walk up if possible, there is loads of information and pictures along the way. You will have to queue at the top to get out to see the city but it is well worth the wait. Definitely a 5 star attraction except it is not free and it can get very busy.

We managed to see the underground as part of a tour. The clock is 'OK' - it was a big buildup to a 5 minute presentation! But if you're there, you have to see it! The Town hall though, has a unique underground part that we saw as part of the WWII 2-hour walking tour. Pretty cool, you have to see it!

An astonishing mechanical instrument. An absolute fascinating 600 years old mechanical clock which in the Middle Ages was considered one of the wonders of the world. The Prague Astronomical Clock, is one of the greatest treasures of the city, still amazes people with its procession of Apostles, moving statues and visualization of time almost unparalleled in the world.
Must see attraction. A must see tourist attraction to tick off the list. Go early to avoid the crowds. The clock is situated in the old town square so near to many bars and restaurants.

Clock tower. Excellent to watch the clock do its thing on the hour, but a trip up the tower on a sunny day is AMAZING . Views are stunning, if space cramped, and definitely study the posters on the way down, really informative and explains the clock and history of the tower post war
Must see. Definatly worth a watch on the hour, when it does its thing. It's free and historic and beautiful. Highly recommend whilst in Prague.
Praque is a dream. If you walk through Praque it is like a fairytale so romantic and elegant. The clock is a wonderfull piece of art.

Interesting clock . Beautifully designed, this clock has precise and unique information.. I definitely recommend doing your research before visiting this popular attraction, as it will make this ancient clock much more interesting.

Great guided tour of Old Town Hall. We bought combined ticket to visit the old town hall on a guided tour and to climb the tower for 180 czk and I would recommend it to everyone! On a guided tour you can visit historic rooms of the houses that constitute the old town hall, see the apostles figures that move on the top of Astronomical clock every hour, visit the chapel, go through Renaissance doors and even descend into cellars that are in reality houses from 12-14th centuries. Everything very unique and with a lot of fascinating facts provided by the guide! And of course views and pictures from the top of the tower are amazing!

Must see experience. Crowds gather 15 - 20 mins beforehand so if you are little hover around the front! Have your video or camera focussed on top part of the clock as the little door opens and the apostles go around fairly rapidly . Take note of all the figures around the clock too , there are so many details to observe . Delightful .
Visit complete. Can't go to Prague without seeing this clock. Much better if you see with a tour as they tell you how to read the clock. Amazing considering how old it is
Join the crowds. If in Prague how could you not? Join the crowds and enjoy the clock striking the hour. For those that are not impressed I would urge you to remember its age!
Great place to be.. The buildings of the Old Town Hall and the clock are very decorative and worth seeing. The clock itself is a masterpiece and it still amazes me how it was made so long ago.

Beautiful and Interesting . Beautiful place filled with history. On the hour the crowds gather to watch the clock strike when the apostles appear. I couldn't read the clock but I believe there's information on the Web how to. Absolutely charming
Great History and Amazing Views. The history of the astronomical clock and the old town hall is learned as you climb the tower. The views of the city from the top of the tower are truly magnificent!

Clock at midnight was underwhelming . We waited around the square for the clock to go off at midnight. It rang and it was not a hug deal. People clapped. We were hanging out on a patio nearby until then; glad we didn't go out of our way. Not a bad experience but I wouldn't be too upset if I missed it.

Historical & Interesting Clock History. Part of our walking tour...fascinating to view clock & hear history of Town Hall & entire area...this is one of the must stops when in Prague...lots of activity

Anatomical clock and old town square . The anatomical clock is sited right next to the old town hall, this is on the old town square. There is so much to see in this part of Prague.The anatomical clock chimes every hour from 09:00 to 19:00, you will see and hear the clock strike the hour and see the skeleton pull the wire to strike the bell, there are a lot of tourists attracted by this so get there early and pick a good spot!You can also go up the old bell tower at a small price, we didn't go up there but apparently you can see the majority of Prague rooftops there! Well worth a visit, so if your in Prague even on a bender, go there and start your drinking at the old town square and include this as a bit of culture! Enjoy
Astronomical clock: a must see!. The clock and its history is unique! Try to be there a week day in order to avoid the crowds of the weekends. The view from the tower is fantastic!
Big Tour Draw. Very busy on the hour mark, most walking tours seem to congregate here on the hour.Must see when in Prague, but very very packed, so keep a hand on your wallet.

Elevator to the top for great views of Prague. We bought our tickets and checked back 3 times but finally had less than a 10 minute wait around 18:00. It was worth it to see the square and surroundings at dusk.
Be thee at least 3 minutes before the next hour starts. Most impressive mechanical clock with figurines coming out every full hour, moving and shacking bells.

Incredible. A great sight. Try to get there on the hour as the clock itself moves and characters come out. Make sure you go up the old town hall also, you have to buy a ticket but the sights are well worth it once up there!

Must see in Prague. The heart of beautiful, old town Prague. Take a stroll here, then to Charles Bridge and in to the castle.Very picturesque and full of history. There are Christmas markets during December. Dining is expensive so walk 2-3 minutes in any direction to half your bill. And watch out for pick pockets!

Amazing clock built in 1410. Although beautiful to look at, it's even more beautiful after you learn the parts of the clock and how to read it. The clock has multiple movements indicating several methods of time, location of sun: time of day in sun, night, dusk and dawn. 24 hour time and boheimiam time. Astrological signs, Plus a lot more. Try and be there on the hour to see what happens!

Fantastic sufgt. Worth a visit no matter what the weather. Clock is something not to be missed- detail is fantastic and very pretty to look at. The square is like something from a chocolate box when the sun is out. With the music playing it is the perfect place to absorb the atmosphere and chill out after a long days walking in the city.

Climb the Tower. The Town Hall and clock is the focal point of the beautiful town square. Make sure to check out the old clock chiming on the hour and appreciate the engineering that went into the old clock. Also make time to climb the tower to get sweeping views of the City.

Lovely. A classic must-see tourist attraction when visiting Prague. It is right in the heart of Prague to easy to get to. Would recommend getting a seat in one of the cafes ahead of the hour to watch the beautiful clock.

A very interesting place to see in Prague. I would recommend people to see this part of the city. it is beautiful and people would go the Astronomical clock 10-15mins before each hours to see the figures from the windows.

Splendid tower with multiple clocks... Had completely missed the astronomical clock in my first visit to the old town square - ddint miss it in my 2nd visit. Well maintained clock with decorated paintings and tastefully lighted buildings.
Amazing!. Visited with the free tour guide and listened to the story of the Astronomical Clock. It was one of the most beautiful and interesting places i've ever been.
Lovely. Right in the heart of Prague. We visited in December 2014 so the square was full of christmas markets. Everyone stopped to watch the clock. It really is beautiful. Definately worth seeing.

Beutiful clock, but watch out for pickpockets!. Really beutiful clock in the center of Pruage! The astronomical clock lies on the old town square, and evry hour twelve fun figures come out of the clock. I can really recommend this for all people in Prauge! It's so beutiful. Take the metro (line A) or the tram (line 17 or 18) to Starometska and then walk in five minutes and then you're there, too ser this masterpiece! But becareful! Watch out for pickpockets!

Magical Views of Prague at Night. The astronomical clock is a beautiful oddity situated in the centre of Old Town - apparently it is the oldest operational astronomical clock. It has beautiful detail, and is fantastic to watch on-the-hour - I recommend you arrive a good 10 minutes before the hour strikes to get a good vantage point.We decided to climb the Tower later in the evening as the queues looked quite large during the day -we weren't disappointed! I took the stairs and sloped ascent to the top, whilst my friend took the lift. At the top, we were greeted by the wonderful, panoramic view of Prague - beautiful. We got slightly lucky as we got to witness an impromptu firework display because Chinese President Xi Jinping was in town - best view in the City! Highly recommended.

Stunning views, worthwhile visit . Really glad we did this, got to see all of Prague from the height of be tower. Be aware, it may make you feel a little on edge, but you have to do this whilst in Prague, you get to identify buildings you may not have seen on foot and really capture the lively bustle of the square. I recommend taking the lift up and walking down, just so you're not too tired when you get to the top. Also if you're a student, make sure you get the discount. Prague attractions offer excellent student discount so it's worth doing!

Worth the visit and WALK!. Was quite a bit of a distance for us (hotel was located further out) but well worth it. Definitely a must see and a lovely stroll through the town and its (easter?) markets with the amazing gingerbread (must try) is recommended. Great time to visit.

Heart of the city. Spend time in Old Town while in Prague. There is so much going on, it's hard to take it all in. Make sure you're in front of the Clock at the top of each hour so that you can view the clock in all of its glory. Great area to sightsee and people watch.
Great view of the city . The clock and the history behind it is interesting. Once you get to the top the view of the city with all its red roof tops is quite nice
Great views. Has a lift to the top, great if your not so mobile (not wheelchairs) big queues during the day better late evening

A must see when in town. Simply put, it's beautiful and special to look at. Full of history and a central location make is a must see when around. Beautiful architecture all around and the cafes and shops here are just wonderful, full of local goodies and delicacies.

magnificent view. theold town hall was builtb in1338.It has a beautiful tower with a big chapel and a astronomical clock. called ORLUJ-where every hour between 9a.m to 11p.m 12 apostles come.always there will be a big que to enter very much crowded too. it takes us by lift and the entrance fee per person is 100 czk. it takes us to the top where we can see the all cathedrals and monuments with its architectural effect from the top .fantastic view . in that place they are selling cute little watches and small clocks .even for 100 czk we can buy few souvenirs

Alright. My friend and I were really looking forward to the old town hall tour to learn more about this city and it history. But I was disappointed by our tour guide who spoke English not very well at all. If you wanted to understand even the slightest bit of what she was saying you had to be standing right next to her, and that was hard because of the size of the group.

Unique Czech Monument. This is the one and only Astronomical Clock. It is renown all over the world for its beauty and the legend of how it was made. I thoroughly enjoyed the details and the functionality of this wonder, especially the figures that surround the clock and what they represent. Try to avoid the crowd if possible.

Interesting HistoryBehind the Clock. Some call the clock one of the most overrated attractions in Europe. It is actually fascinating, the design, construction, and preservation of the clock are very interesting. Although the clock display does not impress many people used to modern technology, the fact that it was built hundreds of years ago, and still keeps accurate time today, is am impressive achievement. Not the sole reason to visit Prague, but a must-see if you are in Prague.

Underwhelming. So, we were so excited to see the clock as it had been recommended by many people. This was very underwhelming - there was a lot of people waiting to see the show that lasted all of 1 min.
If you are in the area, stay and watch but do not make a special trip for it.
Huge Crowd, Loved It. Have to see this when you come to Prague, just watch for the huge crowd when you get to the center. Happens every hour so do not miss it. Recommend it

Fascinating and nice place to go to. This is sure a little bit touristy, but worth the stunning view from the top. You should walk up all the way. Make sure you spend at least 10 minutes at the top of the old town hall so you can shoot nice pictures. I would recommend to go there early in the morning to avoid long lines.

You don't see this every day.. Located in the Old Town Square, the Old Town Hall with the astronomical clock is one of the Prague treasures; the clock operates every hour with a nice display. For those with a little patience, the tower and surrounding views are excellent. Be prepared for large crowds in the square, particularly if later in the day.
Very Cool. The Old Town Square is beautiful - from the architecture, to the Clock. The cathedrals and churches, as well as the Tower, make it magical (if a wee bit full of tourists.

must see . must see but try to go early morning or late evening otherwise you will end up in a crowded place. Also try to be there 15 min before a full hour to see the nice mechanism of the clock. Also give yourself some time to understand the clock as it isn't a normal clock and don't forget that this one was built 400 years ago.

Amazing Clock.. I have been by this clock a number of occasions and am always amazed that this clock was built in the 1400's. The crowd ebbs and flows with the hour and half hour but there is a constant supply of beggars, street "artists" and segways for rent. I am sure there are pick pockets as well. Be prepared to jostle for a good view because just when you think you are in the front row a group of 50, selfie-stick waving tourists park themselves directly in front of you. If you plan on taking photos of the figures which move between the windows, get your shot figured out before the chimes strike as the show is over in about 30 seconds.

Climb to the top for a great view of old town. The astronomical clock was cool but the best part is paying to climb to the top of Old Town Hall for a incredible view of old town. You can get some fantastic panorama shots of the city from up there.

Busy but loved it. As expected it was very busy with tourists but I loved the clock and it was well worth waiting for the o'clock to watch it do its thing, made me feel like a small child again (in a good way!)

Beautiful old clock/very entertaining. We passed through the square about 6 times during our stay. Three times were just as the clock was about to chime. We stayed and watched it each time. The first time the crowd was really into it and was counting the dings. The various elements of the clock and the animated figures are definitely not to be missed.

Loved the Astronomical Clock. It was so coo to see the Astronomical clock in action, and to see that it's the oldest working astronomical clock in the world too. I thought it was beautiful to look at and a great piece of history.
Nice at night. Lighting makes a difference. Even so it is nice to see during the day, also pass by during the evening or night too for enjoying the place.

2nd most overrated scenery???!!. I have passed in front of the astronomical clock and would agree that it was overrated until my tour guide explained about it. It was built in 1410 and when this is considered you understand better why this clock is significant. It shows mechanical genius:)

Interesting clock. This clock is quite popular. People stand in a large crowd on the hour to watch it chime. Honestly, the German clocks are far more impressive. I would listen to the chimes but not bother fighting the crowds to see doors open.

Disappointed. The clock was really nice but we got our hopes up. We expected something more. It didn't last long as others we have seen. It is recommended to see it but you don't miss much to watch it go off
Really cool History. The clock has great history so i recommend you look it up or have a tour guide tell you about it. It has different times that is kept from long ago and it does chime every hour.

Go on the hour to see the clock work. This is a medieval clock in Old Town, It announces every hour with 12 apostles passing by the window above the astronomical dial and with symbolic sculptures moving aside. It is very very quick so make sure you observe on the hour. We were warned this is an area for pickpockets to so be careful with your belongings. The clock stops at 22.00pm so dont wait around after that for the movements. A very beautiful clock and a quick stop as you visit the rest of the surrounding areas.
world famous sight. world famous sight but be prepared for crowds especially just before the hour.there in march which is quiet season .wouldnt like it when hot and crowded

Magical and Unique. If you are planning to visit Prague - for what ever reason - then the Astronomical Clock has to be on your short-list of 'Must See' attractions.The actual 'activity' that takes place on the hour is quite short so taking a video is recommended for further viewing afterwards - once your interest has been triggered by what you have just seen!Do not miss this!
A must see. The clock is a must see when in Prague but is very anti climactic. Get this stop out of the way on your first day to say that you saw it.

Good views, terrible queues . The view from the top is definitely worth the trip up the clock tower, but get there early in the morning to avoid ridiculous queues. We went when it was a little busy and it took us almost an hour to reach the top. I can imagine queue times double this are not uncommon.

Lovely town square. Near where we stayed in Prague , lovely square selling food and decorated Easter eggs etc... Lots of Easter events with children on stage, trees decorated and a lovely atmosphere lovely to see Easter being celebrated with so much enthusiasm !

Impressive. A really impressive clock tower in the heart of the old town square. Try to get here in time for the hourly clock bells but the reality is you can spend an hour or 2 in the square either eating and drinking or just people watching.

Actually Awesome. The Orloj : 605 years old, has a really interesting Wikipedia page, a disturbing (false) origin story, a cautionary legend in-situ and is a tourist magnet and must-see in Prague. We tourists look at a photo-op, and marvel at the workmanship but are no closer to understanding what it is in the 15 minutes we spend looking up. Then it's down the street to the Hard Rock Cafe. It's pretty awesome and vaguely oracular. So you know...don't miss the snap & ponder moment, who knows where it may lead you. For me...it was the Hard Rock Cafe down the street.

Must see. The clock in particular is a main focal point and definitely a must see. The wait to get up the tower was although long, quite breathtaking. Perhaps there were a bit too many people up at once but I found it worth it
Amazing must see. The clock was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still operating

Wonderful town and a cool clock. Went here with my girlfriend for our first trip together. The old town with its astronomical clock is really awesome! Small alleys, old houses, small cute stores. The clock itself is a wonder to watch with all its small details. You have to wait for the strike every hour but its worth to see it atleast once

Get the right hour . This is hard to miss just off town square with a crowd forming on the hour every hour. But do your research. Some hours it's a bell ring and a cock crow some hours it's a full performance. Build it into your itinerary carefully.

Underwhelming. When we saw the crowds gathering for the hourly bells we thought we were in for something special. When it happened we were slightly underwhelmed. don't get me wrong, it's a grand example of a clock tower and worth going to see, but don't expect to be blown away by the show.

Must see attraction in Prague. Located to one side of the Old Town Hall Tower on the corner of Old Town Square, the Astronomical Clock is an architectural wonder that dates from the 15th century.To fully appreciate the clock's intricate construction, join the crowd in front of the tower to watch the procession of the Twelve Apostles. On the hour, every hour, a small trap door opens and Christ marches out ahead of his disciples, while the skeleton of death tolls the bell to a defiant statue of a Turk. Below the Astronomical Clock are 12 medallions with the signs of the zodiac.

Enchanting achievement in medieval engineering. This Fabulous old clock is centuries old a wonder to see. Beautiful & enchanting visual experience in this medieval square. Every hour the clock strikes & curious crowds gather to watch The 12 apostles emerge from two windows to nod at the crowds below. It comprises of three main components: the astronomical dial, representing the position of the Sun and Moon in the sky and displaying various astronomical details; The Walk of the Apostles, a clockwork hourly show of figures of the Apostles & a figure of Death striking the time; and a calendar dial with medallions representing the months.It is truly
Lovely . Lovely little square of beautiful buildings and architecture. Plenty of bars & shops. Loved the clock chiming every hour, beautiful craftsmanship loved the skeleton striking his bell

Don't Miss It. Clock is beautiful be sure and see it on the hour, It gets very busy with crowds waiting but worth seeing. We also bought tickets to go up the tower, there can be big queue's but as the queue is inside the town hall you may not be aware, we had about 1/2 hour wait, I would get there early if you want to visit tower. There are lifts inside and the views over the city were worth the wait.Also did the guided tour around the Town Hall whilst we were there, it was very interesting, they do them in various languages at different times.
Interesting but show is not worth waiting for. The clock is interesting and we used about 20 minutes studying it, while the 'show' at each full hour is not worth waiting for. Took less than 1 minute.
Nice watch.... I´ve heard lots of this watch. It was great and i´m sure it wasn´t easy to build. But still i was waiting for something bigger show.

Must see!. A must see whilst in Prague. Every hour the clock chimes and tourists flock to see the figures pop out of the tower. Go early if you would like it to be a bit quieter - it gets very busy later on in the day.
Amazing architecture. Lovely unusual clock, need to be there on the hour to see the small window open, fantastic architecture with unique engineering, got to be seen to be believed!

Super interesting!. This is a must do if you are visiting Praga. You need a tour guide or somebody to really understand how to interpret the clock and what does it means. Hats off to the inventors of this magnificent clock. The show start every hour and last about 45 seconds. You need to be there like 5 minutes ahead to stand in a good position.
A must see when in Prague!. When in Prague you have to see the astronomical clock and its show, which happens every hour on the hour. So much history and such a beautiful clock

decorative clock. This is in a central location so you will probably walk by this lots. The show every hour is short but something to see. The clock itself is impressive to look at. Big crowds gather here every hour so be wary of that. There are plenty of shops, restaurants and stalls all around this.

Great place. Fascinating after reading about the dog mess I thought this was going to be a dirty place in fact it was really clean with bags provided for dog walkers so I think they have been trying to clean up their act wonderful attraction lovely Prague we had a great time

Not wonderful but can't miss it. Great place, full of nice old buildings but also packed with tourists and people trying to sell you tourist attractions. The astronomical clock is really more beautiful than the photos, that's why you have to go. But don't wait much about the "show" every hour in the hour when the clock characters move and ring a bell and stuff. We didn't climb the tower. The photos we have seen didn't seem appealing enough. If you wave to see the clock show make sure got arrive a few minutes early. It is always packed with tourists and their cameras.
Beautiful!. As other reviews have said try and go when it is less busy to avoid crowds. Weekdays instead of weekends if possible!
Wonderful free attraction!. Whilst the Town Hall itself is a great example of Czech architecture, the Astronomical Clock is fascinating. Just watch it - amazing!

The place to be in Prague. Select a sunny day and enjoy one off the hottest spots in town !A lot of things to see and do for all the ages.Read the history of them to understand what you see and don't forget to be there at o'clock to see the clock !!!

Touch the history. Yes, look at the Clock from the outside but do not forget to get inside too! There is a lot of interesting things to see inside the Old Town Hall including a fantastic view of surrounding old town houses.

Check out the clock tower. Recently visited the Clock tower, we didn't realise before our visit that you could take a lift to the top of the tower. Views from the top are excellent, although it can get a little crowded at times. I would def recommend visiting the clock tower.The clock itself is beautiful but I was a bit disappointed with the workings of the clock

Wonderful site!. Seeing the Astronomical Clock when it strikes and all of the mechanical figures move is really amazing. The crowds can be extremely large especially on weekends. We were there at Christmas, which is a magical time to visit Prague and the crowd around the clock at night was huge. The Christmas Mart was also set up in the square which made this one of our favorite cities!

Don't miss this!. Go early in the morning to avoid crowds. You can pay and go up to the top for observation, but I didn't do this because there is a giant staircase just a few meters away where you can do it for free.
great place to eat and people watch. The restaurants around the square are great. We enjoyed the restaurant with pale green exteriors and outdoor glassed cafe. They have menus in many languages

Interesting. It's worth hanging around the Old Town Hall at the top of the hour just to see the astronomical clock in action. It's quite a short thing but rather lovely and quaint. Again best viewed at early hours or late in the day with less tourists around.

Interesting historical instrument but the "show" is pretty short. You really need to find a book (or guide) to explain the clock to you. Then its significance is clear. Beware - the hourly "performances" are pretty short.
Amazing. The clock is the 3rd biggest of its kind and the largest still working in the world. Full of a charm that is hard to describe!
Set you watch. This is one of the must see in Prague. Just make sure to get there in good time before the hour, many others want to see it too, so be early to get a good place to stand.

Beautiful experience. Such a unique clock. Stop here on the hour to see the clock chime. Beautiful old does on the building and you can buy tickets to see inside the old town hall and go to the top of the clock. A definite must when visiting Prague
Lovely spot in Prague. I love to be on this spot - history and modern people joining the sight of the beautiful square, the beautiful old buildings and the spectacular astronomic watch.

Very popular spot. Yes it is a great attraction to see, but its very popular, the crowd was crushing and at the critical time there was a commercial van pushing its way through. There may be better times to visit if you ask a local. Historically interesting.

The view. The biggest mark for the view from the top. Don't miss to see Prague from here. You will be amazed.
When you are watching the clock show, be careful about your money, phones, etc.

A must see. Crowds gather every hour in the Old Town Square to see the performance put on by this fascinating clock. It tells the time of course but also gives information on the position of the sun and moon, and also signs of the zodiac and saints' days. One thing to be wary of; pickpockets are very active all over the city but find rich pickings here as tourists become fascinated by the hourly display only to find out later that they have been relieved of their wallet.However with a little care it is most enjoyable and something unique to here.
Interesting and unique. Worth visiting on the hour to get the best experience of this. Figures appear from the Windows followed by a trumpeter!
Disappointing attraction. we expecto see a lot of mechanism but in fact there were only two poor articulated dummies...Too poor to wait in order to see the attraction
Going to the top is a must for breathtaking photos.. Went on a small group tour and learned a lot about the clock. Definitely recommend a guided tour of Old town and surrounding areas.

Hickory dickory dock, the world's oldest operational astronomical clock!. The Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock is a must-see when in Prague. Even if you just pass by and see it from the exterior, it's simply beautiful. We did not go to the top due to time constraints, but you must stop to soak it all in.

Definitely go to the top!. The Astronomical Clock Tower is a beautiful piece of history in it's own right.
