Inside it tells the story of it's beginning and takes you through all the restorations, damage, repairs and changes it has undergone, to give us what we see today.However, more than just it's unique appearance, inside it gives us a chance to see the amazing view from the top, the town square, rooftops, statues, churches of Prague - from a birds eye view.It's a must see! It costs a few Czech crowns, but the 360 landscape is so beautiful. It just envisages exactly what 'Prague' is. Also, a great photo opportunity.

Prague is amazing and so is the Old Town Hall & Astronomonical Clock. This is amazing. I am not sure which I fell in love with more...all the buildings or the astronomical clock. I could just walk around for days. So much beauty! If you get the chance take a tour so you can learn more about the astronomical clock and the city. There are people in the square that you can catch up with and join the tours. I am in awe of this and cannot wait until we go visit again. Definitely great for people of all ages and stroller friendly. Great places to stroll and grab ice cream or another treat while enjoying the area. This is a must see while in Prague.
Passing visit . We went to this location to view the famous clock. Is in amongst many other attractions so great as part of a diy walking tour.
Very interesting sight. The clock is the third biggest of its kind and the largest still working in the entire world. Very cool! You cannot miss this while in Prague.
Interesting place. Nice to have a cup of hot wine and watch the hourly movements of the saints across the clock. Short walk to Charles bridge and all the other sites

Excellent Views of the City & Old Town Square. Lift system was slightly confusing once inside but completely worth it. The views from the top of the tower were truly amazing. This is a very popular attraction so the balcony does just quite crowded, plus there isn't a great deal of room. But would advise simply taking your time, particularly if trying to snap a few pics as best to wait until your at the front to get the really great photos.

Grand old tower slightly spoilt by crowds. A wonderful old tower housing the world famous astrological clock in one of Europes most beautiful town squares. Tou have to pay a modest amount to ascend and whilst there is a lift for people with disabilities, once at the top anyone in a wheelchair will be unable to exit onto the exterior walkways for the great views. The only dissapointments: the overcrowding at the top (so bad the authorities should consider limiting the numbers) and the constant grafiti. This old lady survived being partially destroyed by the Nazis before being rebuilt only to be slowly degraded by morons who feel the need to scrach or write their name over every inch of this beautiful tower.

Must See in Prague. The old town square is beautiful and great for taking pictures of old Europe. Crowds gather each hour to watch the clock chime. It's a big deal. Lots of tourists so watch your bags but still very safe. Great for shopping and restaurants but some are a little pricey (which is still cheap compared to US prices).
Dont blink!. The histiory and beauty are a given, but the on hour mechanical display is over in a heartbeat. Don't be late. Be sure to go,up inside the tower.

旧市街の真ん中　Central of city. 旧市庁舎の天文時計は、定時になるとからくり人形が出てくる。観光客のお目当ての一つ。
天文時計のある塔には上ることができます。エレベーターがありますけど、これがまた狭いのです（笑）。塔の上はあまり広くないので観光客で一杯になり、回るのもけっこう大変ですよ。眺めはバッチリです。
You can climb to the tower with the Astronomical Clock. I will have an elevator, this is also narrow for you (laughs). Becomes full with tourists since the top of the tower is not very wide, it is pretty much also to turn. The view is perfect.

Beautiful Area. Simply full of a charm that is hard to describe, this is a very beautiful area and the Astronomical clock is uniquely fascinating. This area does get very busy, especially approaching the hour as visitors awaiting the show put on my the animated clock.
Lovely. Worth a visit but the hourly clock chiming was not the spectacle we were expecting and it was very busy at the time. Lots of beautiful buildings and plenty of cafes and eateries.

Both great, just super busy. We loved seeing the Astronomical clock, as it was so fascinating to have it rebuilt after it was destroyed in the war, but it now has a covering of bird mesh on its sides (unsure why) which really detracts from its beauty. Going up to the top of the Old town hall was great, but you were sandwiched between lots of other tourists trying to see the lookout. Oh and beware you are charged 3CZK to use the toilet at the basement of the Hall, it's really not obvious until a lady in a hatch of the toilet wall, calls out to you to give her money....awkward indeed

Fabulous tour. What a great tour and very informative. Well worth the visit but like most things in Prague try to time your visit to avoid the large tour groups and when you decide to go up the clock tower time your climb to quarter past the hour as a lot of the groups try to be at the top for when the clock reaches the hour ( although you can't see anything )
On the hour.. This beautiful clock chimes on the hour with a little difference. A great attraction right beside the square.

A unique must view popular attraction. At the centre of the Old Town the square is a very popular attraction both day & night with many street artistes. The Clock is a fascinating piece of craftmanship

Interesting . We didn't go inside, however we stood outside here and waiting for the clock to ring. The clock is very interesting to look at and I enjoyed looking at all the details. We sat in a restaurant outside here called Olivia verde which was nice (see my other reviews) and we could enjoy life going past.
Every hour attraction. Must to see, while you are there. Nice snizzing place, many attractions, coffehouses, restaurants, sights.

Loved it!. Absolutely amazing, picturesque square. Enjoyed the clock tower.
The only downside was the people on segways who were really annoying.

Take the guided tour. If you go there, go to the top and make pictures to Prague city and then go to first floor and continue with the guided tour. You will go through all rooms of the Old Town Hall and then in the underground. The guide will give you some interesting details about local life and the use of the Town Hall.

Birds-eye view of the city. The Astronomical Clock is an amazing piece of architecture. The intricacy that has gone into the design of the clock is quite something. It announces every hour with the apostles and symbolic sculptures on the clock moving. You can also go up the clock tower to get a good view of the city from above. The ticketing booth is on the ground floor. This was a great opportunity for me to take some beautiful pictures of the city. The top of the tower was milling with people of course, as everyone was cramming to take shots of the city from above.

GREAT VIEW FROM THE TOP. Went up the clock tower there was a lot of steps to get there, but you can get the lift to the top if you don't want to use the stairs, once you are up there the view is wonderful.

Awesome View from the Top!. First you get to see the Tower and all the people standing in front of the beautiful astronomical clock, but there's also the possibility to get on top of the Tower to get an 360° view of the city which is pretty amazing! We were a bit worried about climbing all those steps, but it turned out this wasn't an issue! The walk up is pretty nice, without many stairs and you can also just take the lift - on the last few meters are some steps, where only one direction at a time is possible so there's the red and green light to show who has to wait and who can go..and on top of that a guy with a trumpet, to guide those going down when the green light was on - it was one of a kind ;) and like I said the view on top was pretty amazing! Highly recommend it!

Nice views, long queue. The views of the old town from the top of the Old Town Hall were incredible. You get a 360 degree view and an opportunity to take a few great photos. We had to queue for ages though, and it was packed at the top so we had to rush. It's worth it for the views though.

get there just before the hour strikes. The old clock just get there before the hour look up to the 4 doorsThen wait for the surprise if you are having a meal In the lovely eating places around at that time outside people. Will gather round the clock in front of the tables so choose your time eat after clock has struck
beautiful. The clock is beautiful but it does get very busy so earlier in the morning is the best time to see it for a closer look.
Beautiful clock. The "show" only lasts for about 30 seconds but it is really interesting if you know the history of it.
Tick tock. If you are in the square, you will see this timepiece. If you understand it, you are better than me. Part of the free walking tours route, the guides will explain it!,

Go up the Tower for some amazing photo opportunities... Regarded as a top ten attraction the clock is impressive to look at but the hourly chime and clock animation was a bit of an anticlimax. We paid around £3 each to go up the tower which was brilliant. We cheated and used the lift up to the top. The views were stunning. You can walk around outside. It's a bit of a squeeze and scary if you don't like heights but the views are stunning. You must go here.
It's just a clock tower. Probably quite good if you don't have clock towers in you're country but wouldn't recommend if coming from the UK. Just a standard clock tower really.

Amazing. The clock by itself and its concept are amazing. You ahould absolutely check it out. Also the location of it is very good. Totally recommended to go up to the tower. The view is breathtaking and you can enjoy the whole city. Also the show every full hour is impressive

Fabulous view. The astronomical clock is really nice. You can pay 135czk and go to the top of the tower. This is highly recommended as the views from the top are fantasticThe clock itself is an exquisite piece of craftsmanship. People gather near to the clock to see the magic when time hits the hour. Its not worth the hype but still enjoyable once you understand the history a bit more. Tip.. there will be lots of tour operators explaining the history of the clock so you can learn about it easily ☺

An old world charm. The old town hall in Prague is not a colossal building and neither was it spectacular in architecture. However it is eye catching and charming day or night (make sure you go at night as I feel it looks best when lit). It's astronomical clock of course is one of the most notable attraction as it draws a big crowd on the hour when the twelve apostles dutifully show their faces. Spend 120 czk and go up the tower either taking the lift or walking the spiral stair case and you will have a breathtaking view not only of the immediate old town square but also the entire city landscape. This attraction is something you cannot afford to miss when in Prague.

One of Prague's most famous symbols . The clock is really cool, if only for the fact that it is so old and yet so elaborate and complicated. I don't think I would ever have figured out how to read it on my own. The on-the-hour performance is way more interesting if you read up on the figures that are a part of it (or ask your guide if you have one).

A Trendsetter in the 14th Century!. The astronomical clock is worth seeing even in the 21st century but, when you think that it was actually constructed in the 14th, it must have been fantastic to tourists in that era.

Mechanical marvel . The clock is among the most amazing parts of Prague. The ingenuity of the clock designers is definitely appreciated with large crowds gathering every hour to watch the figurines and the clock work it's magic. Make sure you get here early to get a good spot so you can see it all happen. It's over in 5 minutes but if you plan your day efficiently you won't waste much time. Plus there's lots to do around the area so not to worry if you miss it and have to wait another hour.

The Top sight of prague. If you visit prague you have to visit the old town square and the old town hall. The astronomical clock is usually crowded but its worth enjoying the parade of the 12 apostles

Emblem of the old city. The asteonomical clock is a must see sightseeing located at the center of old town. Every hour from 9 to 21 it bells and for one time you must see the change of hour. You can also climb the tower to see the view.

You cannot go to Prague and not come here. I guess this is the main thing to see in Prague due to the popularity of it. Considering how old it is, the mechanism must have seemed amazing in its time (1400s) and although it has suffered many repairs throughout the years, it still constitutes a major landmark. Unfortunately, like most of the old center, this beautiful square is also filled with tourists and it's hard to even move around, let alone take a good picture. It somewhat feels like people waiting for New Year's in a public square when the time comes for the clock to chime. It which makes for a sort of weird anticipation, which is why understandably some people feel its underwhelming when it chimes - it's very hard to put it in context with all those people there.

nice but Meh. Its a cool thing but be there for a morning and night time chiming. other than that its a clock and its been retouched so that very little is truly original, but still neat. be weary of pick pockets when gaping upwards

All hyped up for nothing. The atronomical clock is not much to view- its just a small set of puppets going around in a small circle. Its very impressive to view, but not worth waiting to see the movements. There are lots of people standing waiting to view this, so we expected more. The inside of the tower, and going to the top is a must. The views are spectacular from there. The square infront of the tower is also alive with people, and a good place to find a tour. This area at night is magical. Its like a fairy tale setting.

weekend visit. This is one of the city's most popular and unique attractions. Arrive early to get a good spot for photos before the hour strikes, when automated figures emerge on the hour. Large crowds gather so be careful with belongings as Prague is notorious for pickpockets

Hmm, not sure. Well, the big hype around the clock is what disappointed me i think. We got there early, waited in a huge crowd, for something that took about 5 seconds. Was not really sure even what happened. Still a must see, its in the center of Prague
Amazing!. Five minutes till full hour you can see a great show on astronomical clock. During whole week it is full of tourists so watch your wallet carefully.

Pay attention!. You have to arrive a good 15 minutes before the hour so that you can get the best position. It does not last long but it is worth the wait - you just have to make sure you see it all happen. Look out for the figures moving from window to window and the skeleton dancing. We had to see it twice to get it all in and get a good position. Its all over in five minutes but it is worth it.

Fascinating!. Situated in the old town square this clock is a fantastic example of the ingenuity of of our forebears. It has many moving parts and attracts a great many admirers. The town square invariably has lots of stalls and has a marvellous atmosphere
Very intricate piece of clockwork. There has been a lot of handicraft gone into this wonderful example of clock. Well worth going on the hour to see it.
Pretty clock. Hundreds gathered to watch the clock chime midday. Was nice to see but wouldn't have hung around if it was any further away from the hour when we arrived

Every Hour Show. The beautiful building at the Old Town Square. You may climb atop of the tower to enjoy the beautiful view of the Golden City, but the star of the show is the old astronomical clock with mechanical figurines that makes performance which causes many people to overcrowd the square every hour. Applouse is inevitable at the end.
don't miss. one of the highlights of the city, but almost impossible to understand. don't miss it though, even if it's just to try and figure it out
Ok. Went to the clock twice, it's a must visit place but I wasn't overly impressed by it. Gets very crowded on the hour as you'd expect.
Cool clock. On our Segway tour, we were able to get up close and personal with this clock. We heard that it was put together by a blind man and it is very amazing.

The historical clock. Good atmosphere of the square especially in the evenings and nights.The clock strikes every hour and you will be lucky if you can witness the gong done manually by the hour admist crowds of tourist waiting to capture this on video.

One of Prague's highlights. Take a few hours to roam the cobbled lanes surrounding the Old Town Square to discover a collection of small shops and cafes. If you're looking for a souvenir avoid the shops selling mass produced merchandise (most of which is not manufactured in the Czech Republic) instead look for the genuine products in shops recommended in many travel guides. Cafe prices are cheaper in these lanes compared with the cafes in the Old Town Square.The Astronomical Clock is interesting but didn't have the "wow" factor we were expecting as it's listed as one of Prague's top attractions.
Must see thing. Join the throng of folk on the hour watching this spectacle. Much better though to get on a guided tour to understand first what your looking at .

Amazing views and very beautiful clock show. Every hour every day you have the opportunity to see the clock show, where some figures are moving. Its just 15 seconds if your time and it's very worthy and of course free!!! (Even more if you previously hear about the figures and the clocks and what are their meaning)About the views... Amazing. You can see all prague from there, not to be missed.

Beautiful views. We didn't make it round the hall itself, but we did go up the tower. Highlight on my trip so far! Really good disability access to the top via a (really really cool!) Lift but also a good ramp winding it's way up as well. Is pretty cramped at the top, even though they keep an eye on numbers up there. The info boards are really interesting, but the panoramic views over the city are the clear winner here.The clock is pretty cool. Neither of us could work out how to read it. Everyone says the moving parts on the hour are a key down but I thought it was pretty cool!

Amazing views and history. Was not sure about climbing the tower due to recent health scare but it was no problem at all. There are a few steps but most of the climb is up a 4 sided ramp on the inside of each of the tower walls. On each incline there are large photos on the walls with a brief history of each. By the time you have read all of these you have reached the top without a hint of breaking sweat!! Well worth the small entrance fee. Alternatively you can use the lift which reduces the number of steps even more. Once at the top the views of the city are amazing, even more so on a clear sunny day. Don't forget your camera!! When back on the ground outside you can record the Astronomical Clock and its operations on the hour every hour.

Great view. Reasonably cheap at only 120czk to enter the view from the top is great. Gives a really different perspective of your local surroundings and is also nice to see a top down view of the maze of the old town.Advice to go earlier in the day as by mid afternoon it was packed at the top with very little space to move about
Crowded on the Hour. The crowds on the hour are to be expected but once the clock has passed the hour there are plenty of opportunities to take your photographs
Beautiful. A must see and when you do you won't take your eyes off it..lovely area of prague to visit. Lots of shops and quirky ginnels to explore to get to other areas

Very interesting place to visit!. The clock is very interesting and also the tower near by is great to climb if you'r up to climbing the steps....if not use the lift. Buzzy place where lots of tourists hang out

Like the Tardis!. If I'm honest when my wife said lets go up the Old Town Hall Tower I didn't think it looked much. It was fab. You can either take the two glass elevators (one was like Willy Wonka's and I thought it was going to go sideways!) to the top of the tower or walk up stairs to the third floor then a spiral ramp to the top of the tower. We took the lifts up and walked down, and I'm glad we did as several people younger than us came up puffing and panting!The tower doesn't look much from the square below, but it is taller than it looks and the views from the top over the city are spectacular. All the spires and green domes and gold are stunning. I thought the clock was ok. It's not the original as that was destroyed when the Nazis fired tanks at it and set fire to it. I would have loved to have seen the Old Town hall, but that was destroyed at the same time and was demolished. There are now rows of trees where this was (I think they are cherry) but the old photos of the rooms look fantastic.Definitely worth a visit and I can't recommend it enough

Beautiful clock, disappointing show. You can't visit Prague without a stop at the Astronomical Clock. The clock is large and beautiful. Stick around for the show that happens every hour, not because the show is anything special but so you can say you've seen it. It's quite amusing actually, with large crowds gathering with their cameras and phones waiting for the show. The disappointment is somewhat palpable when the show is over. Climb up the clock tower for a great view!
Wonderful sights . The astronomical clock is a unique feature to Prague and you can get trinkets and replicas everywhere in the city. Well worth a visit!
Flavours of Prague. Very nice view from this tower. There is an elevator that takes you to the top. You can see the whole Prague.
A must. You can see as far as the eye can see . A lot of places you must see. You can see how near to everything you would want to see.
Its pretty cool!. If you're visiting Prague these attractions are difficult to miss. For a 600 year old clock it is very impressive.

Watch time go by. I found this tone a very nice looking clock,there are plenty of bars opposite and cafe's to get a drink or something to eat too. It seems the closer you are the more you pay. In a couple of weeks at Easter they are already setting up a market and it looks like it's going to be really good a not to miss. You can buy food from stalls to and always when buying goods haggle trust me it's worth it.
Night sightseeing. We were tonight, the light and colours are amazing, you should visit the tower tonight - views are spectacular and perfect for photo.

Worth the visit, lovely at night.. The tower is beautiful but gets very crowded and popular spot for pickpockets. It is worth seeing but not necessarily spending a lot of time at. If at all possible, take the moment to enjoy it at night, it's beautifully lit and from there you can also get a lovely view of the Powder towers.
Very interesting. Don't miss this. It is lovely and unique. I don't think we have seen anything like it before and if you go on the hour you will see the "show"!!

Be there early for the clock!!!. Located at the corner of the square and cant be missed as the tower dominates the square but an attraction for everyone is the clock, great for kids but my advice is to be there early to get a good vantage and viewing place so as not to miss this wonder of ancient mechanics. Many restaurants face the tower and clock but the crowd will reduce your viewing if you choose to view from here.

Well worth seeing. A great looking clock full of charm and history no visit to Prague would be complete without wondering round the cobbled streets of the old town the architecture is something to behold and a highlight of our trip

Fabulous Views. The 360 degree views from the top of the clock tower are worth the climb, there is also a lift available, the information boards on the way up are well worth a read. It was quite congested at the top of the tower but there are fabulous photo opportunities of the city. Then you can join the crowds at ground level to watch the hourly clock display.

Clock. This is a must visit. The clock chimes on the hour and the apostles move past the open windows but also the little statues on the outside move which can easily be missed. The highlight is a trip up the tower where you get wonderful views all over Prague and get some great photos
Beautiful. The clock is simply stunning as is the whole of the old town square try and visit early before it gets too busy.. Charles bridge literally a stones throw away from here too.

A Must Do In Prague. This is an amazing building and tour, which takes you up above the Old Town Square with stunning views around Prague, then down below the existing town to the one it was built on because of flooding. This is a really interesting tour. The clock is beautiful and fun when it chimes on the hour.

It's one of those things you have to do!. You can't visit the old town square without watching the clock strike the hour! It is such a random and unique event, and a tribute to those imaginative souls who designed and built it. It does get absolutely packed in the front, so get there about 10 to and just be wary of pickpockets and keep your pockets zipped and your handbags safe!
Old watch. If you are in the prag dont forget to visite here. This is a one of populare tourist attraktion in the Prag. Astrononomishe watch.

Take the Old town hall and Astronomical Clock tour. Some of the reviewers below say that it isn't a "fuss". Of course it is not if you simply look at it and you do not make an effort to understand. Nothing is interesting if you are not interested!Having bought the Prague card upon the arrival in Prague, we enjoyed a free tour of the Town hall and the tower. We learned a lot about the Clock, Prague rulers (some of them were killed by the people in the main square) and got to stand on the old medieval street which is precisely below the clock and which was gradually lift up because of often floods. Even in modern times the basement of the buildings in Old Town were completly flooded at times by Vltava river.Many thanks and congratulations to the young student guides that shared with us beautiful and interesting stories of Prague!

This is Prague. This is the place to spend a whole morning or afternoon walking, beautiful streets and everywhere you look is worth a picture. This is like a fairy tail and free!It's perfect for couples and families.

Read in advance so you know what to look for. The clock is a masterpiece, however, make sure to read up on the meaning behind the clock pieces, characters, and why they are placed where they are. It will truly enhance the experience.

Beautiful. The center of old town... A nice place to explore during daytime as well as at night. Live music of often played, food stalls add to the atmosphere. I would recommend doing your history homework before coming as no explanations are posted for the free attractions such as the clock, the church, the statues, etc. Most restaurants are not the typical tourist traps you'd expect in such a central location - prices are usually fair for good food and service.

Great views and interesting tours. We climbed the tower in the evening and got stunning views - but it is pretty hectic up there as it's always busy.We also did tours of the undercroft in the evening and a guided daytime tour and both of these were very interesting.Well worth the visit.

Old clock - Always attractive. It's is indeed mesmerizing to see this astronomical clock. It just makes you look for how someone thought of it so many years ago. Don't miss to be at the front of the clock to hear the beautiful music every hour.

Worth a Look!. Watching the clock on the hour is definitely worth it - it was really beautiful and only goes for about a minute! I saw it about 3 times! It is also worth going to the top of the tower, it is a short easy climb up mostly ramps and a couple of stairs, of course there is a lift too, and has breathtaking view of the whole city from every angle!
Ok. Beautiful architecture but rather overrated. Standing, freezing, trying not to lose an eye amongst a forest of day-glo selfie sticks was a bit of a let down.
Not sure why all the hype. really not sure what all the hype is about. It was cute, and you need to "do it" but it wasn't such a "Great show"
old town hall. Personally not sure what all the fuss about the clock is about but the views from the tower are stunning and there are lifts
Damp squib. Worth a look but nothing special, the "show" lasts about 1 minute and is pretty dull, architect is decent and I suppose it's worth a look for the history

Worth a look. This is worth a look at every hour from 9 am till 11 pm the clock goes into overdrive and from 2 doors that are on the side of the building you can see the 12 apostles from the floor and then the clock strikes the hour

Not only the tower with viewpoints, but medieval ballrooms too. It's strongly recommended, if you buy a ticket to enter the tower, pay a little additional price to combine with one of excursions, offered in the reception.You can see a several historical halls above, and a lot of ancient ballrooms below the ground level.Guides speak different language, including english, spanish, german, russian - you have to select a correct time to meet a guide speaking language you need.So if you pay for visiting Prague and even for entry the tower, you really have no reason not to pay really a little for discovering a part of Prague History inside.

Beautiful place. This was my favorite place in Prague. Not just clock that was amazing but the old town square that was a great place to walk around or sit and have a drink or some food. And watch the street performers. Be very careful in the crowd's of people because pick pockets are all over

the views were amazing. it was beautiful. went to the top and took some great photos also we walked the whole way up but if you cant walk that far they also had a lift which took you right to the top which i thought was great so anybody can go and see the best view of the city

Views to die for!. Very popular square and rightfully so. The square is bound by numerous buildings of various type of architecture and most have some history attached eg.King Charles Bourne there,Issac Newton used to visit a house and play violin there.The worlds oldest Astronomical clock( surviving and working)Nice town hall to climb and survey the view

Stunning views from atop the Astro Clock. The clock itself is a small miracle - all the more so as it's been ticking for 600 or so years! Lovely place to visit - see the clock, then wander around the Square.
Big time peice. I have never seen so many people wanting to watch the time but when things happened it looked very nice

Worth Your Time. So versions of this amazing clock has been here in this tower since 1410 . It's lovely to just look at when it strikes the hour but I suggest learning about all its symbolism to really appreciate it . It's more then just a cute clock . For one thing it's a morality tale of sorts warning against " vanity and greed " . Anyone remember them ??

14th Century Wonder for Us to Marvel !. Site of coronations, exhibitions & executions ! But even the carnage of WW 2 couldn't keep this building down. It is a fascinating mix of the Gothic Caverns, Religious Chapels Assembly Halls, Council Chambers & an Astronomical Clock dating back to 1410 AD thrown in to the Mix !! The Glass Lift offers entry to every level for the elderly/infirm or the circular stairway for the Young Uns ! Once up top it offers a commanding view over all of Prague & is well worth the cheap entry price which covers talks about the Clock & other levels. The only negative is that up top is one way (anti-clockwise) on the outdoor viewing platform but just like some other sites some groups either can't read or refuse to follow the norm ? Annoying little bus people !!
Old Town Hall. Just something else to add to the magic of this amazing city. We went at night and saw the 2100 display.
Very interesting. Great place to visit reading all the history. A must visit and ensure to have video ready on the hour to watch the fascinating clock !

Nice but swarmed with tourists. Nice to look at but swarmed with tourists and well over sold. Its not as impressive in person as it is on the pictures. But still worth a visit. Avoid the crowds and go early in the morning.
Something you must see in Prague. you must see this! Very nice old part of the Prague! :) Astronomical Clock is something very nice :):) every hour show :)

A haven for pickpockets! 😊. It gets very busy here, everybody crowded together, everyone looking upwards at the clock with their mobiles and camera's, very few paying attention to their bags....and the pickpockets make a killing. Even though it's so cold everybody is really wrapped up, you would be surprised at how skilled the pickpockets are! Enjoy the clock, but look after your valuables! Het wordt hier erg druk, iedereen druk met elkaar, iedereen op zoek naar boven op de klok met hun mobiele en camera's, maar weinig aandacht te besteden aan hun zakken .... en de zakkenrollers een moord. Ook al is het zo koud is iedereen echt ingepakt, zou je verbaasd zijn hoe vaardig de zakkenrollers zijn! Geniet van de klok, maar kijken na uw waardevolle spullen!
Worth the wait!. This is a very quick event but well worth the wait. This exquisite ancient clock chimes on the hour. Centrally located in the heart of the city this is a must see!

Beautiful . We walked past the clock a number of times but we're lucky enough to be eating lunch when we saw a crowd gather. We had a look and saw the clock start to move. Little people come out of it every hour on the hour!! Very different and quaint!

Amazing!. We found out about the clock before visiting, and we were still amazed when we saw it. The clock looks beautiful (although it was refurbished), and we recommed going up the tower to look at the view.

Worth seeing . The clock is interesting and well worth a look. If you visit on the hour you will see the clock in action. It is not the best animated clock in the world but it is a bit of amusement to see in action.

lovely to see and to eat by. we had a lovely meal whilst we listened to the clock chimiing, the restaurants around the square are good, some very expensive, we ate to the right hand side of the cloxk tower out of the way of the SEGWAYS.
Whats the time. The clock s awesome, again I had no plans to see it but tired as I was I had to stop. Sadly the view was spoiled by the cluster of people taking selfies.
Just a visit. The ticket was 120 Czk for one adult gave a very good view in day time.must b more awesome in night.also tht in winters activities on street start dying at around 8 pm....

The view from the top of the tower is amazing!. Old Town Square includes: The Astronomical Clock, The Church of St Mary of Tyn, the statue of Jan Hus. It is necessary to climb the Astronomical Clock Tower for a wonderful panorama. When the clock strikes the hour, from one of the windows from above, it takes place „The Procession of the Twelve Apostles”: Christ’s disciples and other figures on the astronomical clock are set in motion.

The clock is so over rated. Blink and you miss it, I was ready for a wonderful show of characters and figures....the large crowd gathered, braving the snow....the clock chimed...anticipation grew....a small door opened up high above the clock...a hundred iPhones went up in the air....4 figurines moved past the open door....the door shut....100 iPhones came down again.....It's charming it's quaint but it's only worth seeing if you are passing through at the top of the hour...don't wait around to see it...it literally lasted 15 seconds
Very intricate. Worth going to see, especially at night. Make sure you are there on the hou but beware of pickpockets as it gets very crowded.

Wow!. This was amazing! Be sure not to miss when the clock ticks the full hour and see the apostols coming out. Looking at it closely just reveals more and more interesting aspects of this spot. Center of sightseeing! Climb the top of the tower to get an amazing view!
Astronomical tower. Don't bother hanging around for the clock to chime on the hour, very disappointing, not much to see. The clock itself is worth a look

Must see. The clock and the square are a must see for any Prague visitor. When the clock chimes it's well worth seeing. You can get tours from the square. Lots of places to eat near here as it is the main centre of Prague.

Best Place on Earth. Probably one of the best places in earth, this place is full of culture, easily you could stay there all day and wouldn’t fulfill the need of this beautiful place. The food in the different food stands it’s incredible, from pork to sweet bread, the atmosphere it’s full with good vibe. Take a walk and just let your vacation sink in. I can’t wait to return to this place, don’t hesitate to visit Prague, loved it.

interesting history, and a beautiful view of Old town from the top. We went in the middle of the day on a Monday and the Queue was significantly less than it had been over the weekend -(45 mins advised queue on the Sunday, virtually non existent on the Monday) and bought our tickets from the little shop on the right of the clock tower. The queue her was about 5-10 mins to get tickets and they do not accept card - however if you wait until you get inside you ban buy the tickets from the 3rd floor and there was nobody queuing there at all and they do accept card. Be warned the toilets inside charge to use! We did not buy the extended ticket and chose to do only the clock tower itself, and got the lift up to the 3rd floor after looking at the ceiling inside the lower doorway. You can either get the little glass lift up the tower or walk up (Ramped not stairs) and read about the history of the tower as you wind your way up. We chose to do this and it only took us about 10 mins to get to the top, and we enjoyed reading about the history of the clock and the town hall and looking at the photos of it during the war and the revolt etc. The very end bit of the climb is a traffic light controlled windy staircase (as it is too narrow to fit people going up and down simultaniously) but this is not too strenous, i would just imagine this is what may cause the queues on really busy days. Once at the top you can look at the view from either inside the glass viewing platform or go out onto the outside balcony. This has a one way system to walk round the balconies and it did get quite busy up there, with a few people ignoring the arrows etc. We did get a beautiful view of Prague and Old town square from up there, and it was funny when the clock was due to go off and we could look down and see all the people standing waiting to watch the astronomical clock do its thing! A very lovely view of Prague and a great way to see why they call it the city of a thousand spires!

Pretty, Quirky, & Interesting. The clock and building are great to look at, even when it's not striking. The clock face is beautiful, very intricate, and shines fantastically in the sunshine.It strikes every hour, and is worth hanging around to have a look at (although I found the characters very creepy!) During the day, there are trumpets and other brass playing from the top of the tower when it strikes.We didn't go up the tower, but I would have liked to!
Just beautiful!. The best to visit this place is on the hour so you can see the apostles. Don't miss seeing it also at night.

Quirky piece of history. A great clock that really draws in the punters! The views from the top are great and the bell action is amazing with all the apostles rolling around. Definitely worth making the effort to see it once!

Very old clock. Every hour on the hour the clock chimes and has moving active figures, quite amusing and it's free! Didn't bother going up the clock tower as it was late and we were tired but I think it would have been worth the charge

Be there five minutes before the hour .... ...or else, find yourself a seat ten minutes before in the cafe directly opposite the clock, as we did. You get to have a rest and see the spectacle of the clock at the same time! :)
Worth your time.. The Astrological Clock Tower is located within the old town square and it is worth your 5 minutes of staring at this magnificent creation.

Very Cleaver Clock and a Great View. . Clue is in the title to what you get here. You stand and watch the clock strike the hour, with the characters on the clock doing their "thing", you've got to watch it once. Then pay to climb the bell tower for great views. Time it with sunset to top it off. We went when it wasn't busy but I would think that in high season it gets very busy going up the bell tower.

Command performance. If you only see one sight in Prague it has to be this one. The clock is an unique treasure. Great place to watch the clock at top of hour is the cafe across the street in front of Grand Hotel.

Worth the wait?. We hung about waiting for the clock to chime and I'm glad we did, it was cute to watch the procession of figures and even after it had finished we tried to decipher all the mechanisms relating to the astronomical clock.

Underwhelmed by the clock!. The Old Town Square has some beautiful buildings and one of the first you come to when you enter from Wenceslas Square end is the Old Town Hall and Astronomical clock. I stayed around to watch the clock on the hour as it was supposed to do some fancy stuff but I have to say I was totally underwhelmed by the experience! I was not alone. It is lovely to look at, and on the hour some of the characters do move and make sounds, but it wasn't anything to shout about.

A place with history. Astronomical clock is clicking for ages and it's mostly famous for accurate time.It's mechanically driven and sun and Moon on the dial signifies the sun rise and sun set time along with the usual day time.You can get a 360 deg view of Prague from top of tower.Every hour people gather to see clock clicking and believe me it's not at all fascinating.For great view and learning about history you can plan a visit.
It gets crowded. It gets crowded every hour but us worth wailing for. The action starts a few minutes BEFORE the hour.

Beautiful and busy place. We turned up many times to see the clock in action but always timed it poorly. Decided to sit and have a beer which gave us a good site for the clock chiming. Glad we saw it and the clock itself is beautiful. Not too taken with its action but glad I saw it once at least.

cliche, but fun anyway. every full hour, there is a huge crowd under the tower, waitin in the anticipation. if there, go for it. it's fun.i like it in the night, because the lighning of the tower is really, really god.the story behind the clock is: the architect made this piece of art and then the authorities blinded him, so that this beauty could not be repeated anywhere else.

Old Clock Keeps Time in Town Hall Square Prague. A colourful and dramatic mediaeval clock - with astronomical signs and symbols adds a sense of the incredible history of Prague ( the Paris of Eastern Europe_) this is a must see! Usually a crowd congregates beneath the clock and it is a focal point for tourists visiting Prague...Enjoy!
Tick tock 600yr old clock. Wow what a great clock such a pretty sight the clock itself is astounding. Brilliant to see I would recommending going to the top of the tower if you can stunning view
Very vintage . Beautiful vintage town centre with many restaurants to pick from. Very lively during the day with live music and lots of entertainment. Would definitely recommend!

Don't expect astronomical entertainment!. All the guide books they this is a must see and that crowds gather to watch the display on the hour every hour, which gives the impression there should be something spectacular. It really isn't!If you out it into perspective and look at the history and science that went into making the clock them that is fantastic, so if you like to know how things work then a trip to the tower and a tour would be worth the effort. But please don't get excited about the hourly chimes!
A must see place. This is definitely a must see place in your life... A couple of times... One of the most magnificent places in Europe. Prague in general is IMHO the best and most beautiful city.

Know What to Expect. The astronomical clock is really a marvel. But don't go expecting a huge display on the hour. Huge crowds lined up for several minutes prior to the hour. But the display is really just a few characters that rotate in front of the opened windows. Yawn. But take the time to learn about how the clock works and what the different dials measure. That's worth spending some time looking at.
Definitely worth a visit. Worth visiting when the hour strikes as the bells chime and the characters are animated. Beautiful and unbelievable that it's over 600 years old!

Astronomical clock Prague. We were expecting a bit more from this. We were told by friends who had been there that it is a must see on the hour.Not much happened at all, a couple of little figures came out of a box and then went back in!

Beautiful. A must see if you are in Prague. Astronomical Clock does its thing on the hour every hour. Some seem to feel it's anticlimactic, but it is a 400 year old mechanical clock! Worth it to go up to the top of the tower (even has a lift for those who don't want to climb) for a great view of the city.

Fine Engineering!!!. At the very outset, I would like to say that this review is about the Clock only. We didn't visit the library or take any tour. The clock is an engineering masterpiece. With the metal and golden tints it looks really beautiful. If you are a mechanical engineer by profession, you should definitely visit this. The location is also good. It's right at the historic city center - round the corner. There are lots of food trucks selling fast food (sausages, beer etc.) there. Beware of pickpockets and vagabonds.The area is crowded by food scavengers who look into the dustbins for thrown away food. Take your time. Eat some worst(sausages). Have a beer and enjoy the crowd. Take a picture in front of the clock.

Beautiful Clock. Right in the heart of the old town, a beautiful sight with plenty of other nearby attractions and lots of bars and cafes. Waited with the crowds for the hourly clockwork display which was sadly disappointing.
Clock show. The clock puts on a quick, short (45 secs) show every hour on the hour. Cute and free. One of the quirky things that makes Prague unique.

Amazing place. We recently visited Prague and went on the clock tower, liibrary tour, it was really interesting and very informative, although we did want to take pictures of the library it's self but you wasn't allowed, it was temperature and lighting controlled to protect the books, which is understandable. This tour is not for anyone with walking difficulties, there is a lift but only so far, then very steep old wooden steps, but well worth the view from the top of the tower.

Worth seeing but don't expect too much. You wont notice the clock straight away as it's at one of the corners of the Old Square but you'll definitely notice the large crowds standing in front of it. The clock its self isn't as breath taking or big as some other well known clocks around Europe, buts its selling point is that it still uses the same mechanism that was first installed in 1410.Every hour when the clock hits 12, two small doors within the clock open and a series of heads pop out with different expressions. To be honest if you are watching this without any explanation on what the faces mean and all the little intricacies of the clock, it could be quite underwhelming.I came back the next day as part of a city tour and the tour guide spent 15 mins explaining the history of clock, what all the little marking were and what the faces meant, and this made the express a lot more interesting.I believe you can also pay a small fee to walk to the top of the clock and get a view of the square.
Watch with your eyes - not through your camera!. There is a lot to see in different places, so might be worth trying to see it twice. A fantastic piece of work.

Amazing astronomical clock! . The astronomical clock is amazing! The town square is great! Some of the most amazing architecture! Don't forget your camera. And the view from the clock tower is awesome!

Clock show and views. Another 'must' on the Prague visitors hit list is the old town hall. Stand with the throng as you await the chiming of the astronomical clock and watch the movements (get there early if you want a good view of what happens..no spoilers here!)The view from the top is amazing which is served by a sloping stairwell access. There is a small entry charge naturally.

Beautiful astronomical clock. This was on our list of must visit in Prague. When we reached there we just missed the hourly chime. So we roamed around and came back to see the show in the next hour. Too much crowded to see the show. The show was very good but very short. Better go 15 mins before the hourly chime to get a better spot to see the show.

Nice clock!. It's very impressive to see an old construction even if it's a clock and it works perfectly. I was there at 11am and we saw how the rooster sings and it's very funny. I didn't visit it inside. Walk for the old town hall is amazing.
Marvelous architecture, underwhelming show. The architecture was marvelous, we were underwhelmed by the show. It's very very short. It's definitely a place to visit. Enjoy!

Walking through . So we stopped at Starbucks to get a much needed caffeine fix and wondered what all the commotion was outside . Quickly realised we had stumbled upon this gem and people where gathering to see the hour chime .I can safety say this is the only place I've ever been where the turning of the hour was applauded! Still beautiful ornate clock , and worth a visit.

Great views at the top of the tower. The clock itself is fun and if you're in Prague it's probably one of the things everyone does. But that does mean it gets packed every hour so you don't always get to see everything. It is worth a look though, very impressive for its age.The trip to the top of the tower is great - on the way up you can read about the history of the town hall and when you get to the top the views across the Old Town Square and all the way to the castle area are very impressive. From the ground the tower doesn't look that high, but from the top you realise it is quite tall!We went just before sunset so you get the best of day and night views, it is busy up there but you can spend as much time as you like to walk right round and get some good photos.
beautiful sight in beautiful prague. I love just to stay and watch the clock - it is very beautiful and unusual, come early as it gets very crowded.

A beautiful piece of Historic Prague. As a centrepiece in Wenceslas Square this is a must see on your visit to Prague, and you can also climb the 60 metre tower if you have a head for heights (charges apply). The clock itself lovely in design, but it is not the most exciting of movements, as may hundreds of people including us waited for it to chime, but don't expect lots of action though. It is however a beautiful piece of architecture and history.
Great Clock!. But don´t stare at it, get on the tour and get inside and look at the mechanics. The thing is a work of art!

Fascinating. Stand to the side and see the clock express its passage through time. Feel yourself as part of a bigger whole and accept that the past reaches through to today. Then try to get a good photo with the milling throngs all wanting that same personal astronomical photo. Enjoy the crowd and the sight but take your time.

Beautiful Clock. The Prague astronomical clock is the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and every hour on the hour, two little doors open above the clock and figures do a little circular parade. The clock was first installed in 1410 and is a working piece of history.
Fascinating. Get there early for a spot. We eent twice as it is qiite quick and you can't see it all first time. A beautiful thing.

Nice Square. Nice square can get very busy especially on the hour when everyone stands infront of the clock to watch the display.There are some covered restuarants where you can just have a drink if you want but you pay a premium as you are paying for the location,however it is good for people watching and a breather from walking on all the cobbles.

Three great attractions. This isn't really one attraction, but rather three: the astronomical clock, the bell tower, and the tour of the Old Town Hall. All three are well worth checking out. Our tour guide denigrated the clock, but in my opinion it's still very impressive given its age and well worth watching once during your visit. The clock tower offers a great view over the city and has a lot of interesting information about the building on offer as you're climbing up (assuming you're not lazy and don't take the lift). The highlight of our visit was the tour, which takes you through most of the surviving chambers in the hall and even into the cellars. Our guide, Filip, was friendly and knowledgeable; I learned a lot. The chapel is beautiful, as are some of the statues and paintings around the building. Both the tower and the tour are reasonably priced, and definitely recommended as part of your exploration of Staré Město.

Visit the top of the tower. The clock itself is beautiful but climbing up the tower is a must. Pay and then climb up while you read about the history of town hall and the astronomical clock, very interesting. The views are extraordinary as you can see the castle and Petrin tower.Definitely worth it!
Underwhelming .... Architecturally beautiful ... but don't waste your time hanging around for the hourly chimes. Just take a picture by day and night, and move on.

Gorgeous clock tower. The astronomical clock tower is a sight to take in. It is truly an engineering marvel. Along the ascend to the top is the evolution and history of the tower, very informative and interesting. At the top is a breath taking view of Prague! Highly recommended!!

Wasn't expecting the view!. We bought tickets for this as we were passing by and it was something to do.. Once opening the door to the top of the tower, it was breathtaking to see how high we were and how pretty it was.. We saw everything! While we were up in the tower a man in the square was playing bag pipes which made it all the more memorable, would recommend!

Shake, rattle & roll. Our tour guide had previously warned us that the "show" would leave is disappointed, but I quite enjoyed it, if only to judge the accuracy of his portrayal of the dancing skeleton.

A little under whelming. You have to see it as a visit to Prague wouldn't be complete but it is slightly under whelming. You need to make sure you are there just before 5 to the hour to make sure you don't miss it.
Very pretty. Didn't wait until o' clock for the money shot, so u tubed instead...brilliant. A very fine piece of architecture and a beautiful clock in a very picturesque square.

Missed it !!!. My husband and I went to Prague with another couple and had a list of things that we wanted to see including the Astronomical Clock. I would have to say I don't know what I was expecting but I was a little disappointed, it certainly is an excellent piece of engineering but the souvenirs that are made for you to take home are much more colourful than the real thing. The square where the clock is situated gets very crowded and I would not want to be there in the summer months in the height of the tourist season.
Charming. This entire area is charming. It was fun waiting with the hundreds of others in anticipation of the clock striking.

So fascinating!. Old Town's town hall was setup in 1338 form a town council. As the Town Hall expanded a number of houses had to be demolished. The building suffered at the hands of the Nazis in 1945. They destroyed a Gothic chapel and a neo-Gothic north wing. The chapel has been reconstructed. The most popular part of the tower is the Town Hall Clock. Built in the early 15th century, the Orlij, is the oldest functioning clock of the world. It is not just a mechanical marvel but also a an architectural and sculptural masterpiece. Some say that the four levels of the astronomical clock represent the four elements of the universe- water, earth, air and fire. Over the years it was repaired, reconstructed and restored after a ravaging fire. It displays 12 signs of zodiac, a bell and a procession of Christ and the apostles. Just like Prague's many other buildings this clock too has many legends associated to it. The story of Master Hanus tells us that he was the builder of this unique machine and after it was completed the town councillors started fearing that he might make a similar one for some other town. So they sent hitmen to blind him but even when he was blinded he took one if his assistants with him and did something to the clock that stopped it and could not be fixed by anyone for a 100 years. Other legends relate to the skeleton figure fixed on the clock. This figure is said to predict the good or bad times for the city and it's inhabitants. Some say that he is a symbol of hope.TipsDo not miss the 27 crosses in front of the town hall.Do go up on the tower for some stunning photos of the city.Beware of pickpockets when you see the Orlij demonstration.

3rd oldest clock of its kind in the world. It is the most well preserved clock and tells the time in 4 astronomical ways. The area is very crowded so do be alert at all times. There are many free walking tours around the area that you could join, and they'll bring you to many other parts of Prague, including the Charles' Bridge which is usually the last stop.

Christmas Market. I climbed the tower of the Astronmical Clock in the evening while the Christmas was in full swing. The views were marvelous. Old town was beautiful. Added to watching the clock in motion. Prague is a beautiful, a unique city.
Beautiful but overhyped. The building itself is beautiful but the clock show is very underwhelming. Lots of people park out at the bottom of the clock to gawk at it and it's a bit annoying.

Impressive medieval technology. Saw this clock during a free Prague tour of the Old Town. The functionality and engineering skills back in 1410 something should put the modern Apple watch to shame. Think of it, this is more than just a clock. It shows celestial positions based on the signs of the zodiac, the dials are made of gold (I think!) and you can use it as a magnetic compass because there is a north pole position. There are 4 animated figures that come into view during different times of the day reflecting various sins like lust, vanity, greed, death etc. The allegories are pretty medieval but again, I love medieval era.Oh, there was this Old Town hall too, where this clock is mounted. Forgot what was the purpose of the remaining building. The clock is called "Orloj" in Czech.

Very Touristy and Crowded. Had to check out the clock and area while touring around Prague. It is one of the must see sights. I thought the clock and buildings were very impressive, but the huge crowds and touristy add-ons make it less appealing. Had to see it, but wouldn't bother seeing it a second time.

One of a kind. The Astronomical Clock is a wonder that attracts many people to its hourly show no matter what time of day or night. The building itself has amazing detail on it and there is a tourist information inside as well which is useful as a central point in the city. The square looks equally as good from the top of the town hall as from the ground.

A Must See . The Anatomical clock is a must see, however if you don't like crowds then you need to go very early in the morning. The clock is a mechanical marvel that is accurate and has been running for several hundred years. It is a medieval marvel.
Do not miss the midday show!. Very nice attraction for the whole family. The best is to see it exactly at midday. Just a tip: come before 11:50 am to secure the best view.

Do You Have A Head for Heights?. The climb up the tower was easier than expected as there are few steps, rather there are slopes inside the tower which lead up to a final circular staircase. The view from the top was incredible ( it was a bright and sunny day with a clear sky). My husband has lost his head for heights but he managed to look out over the city rather than down so didn't miss out. Cost was 120 Koruna each but worth it for the views. Don't bother on a foggy day though!

Just wow. Some here complain that there is not enough "show" when looking at the astronomical clock when it strikes the hour. To them I say: by all means, go see a Michael Bay movie and leave spectacular sights like this one to civilised people instead.The clock is a marvel of engineering. Sure, on the hour it's just some wooden puppets crossing in front of a small window, but look at the whole picture please. The clock shows the time, the current zodiac, the season, place of the sun and moon, and a lot more! It's a must-see.The town hall itself is nice to visit as well. A ton of history can be found here, and you learn a lot about the Czech people and Prague itself. The guide was a fun young guy who knew everything we asked, and his English was more than adequate. This is a "tourist trap" only for the mindless masses who visit a beautiful city just for the bars and shops.
A must!. Everyone comes to see this beautiful creation. On the hour the square is packed but everyone is very polite ant anxious.

A place worth seeing!. This was a very pleasant sight to see. It has so much history and is fascinating to look at. It's best to read up on the history before you go and see the clock. A must- see if in Praha!

Cool but touristy. The astronomical clock itself is very cool and has an interesting history. The area surrounding it is touristy and busy and it's difficult to have the space around to take a photo. Don't bother waiting on the 'show' that happens on the hour - it's pants! Definitely an anti climax.

Typical for Prague. Beautiful clock that shows moving puppets every hour. But be there in time, as it gets really crowded, even on a rainy day. Would have been nice with some explanation about the different parts, even without a guide or brochure.
Prague 2016. This you must see on the hour at any time but keep a eye out for all the diffrent movements on the clock piece

Be there just before the hour!. You have to make your way towards the clock and ensure you locate the part of the tower you need to fix your gaze on. Because, when the clock strikes the hour, a little short-sighted person like me was frantically scanning the facade of the building and finally located the sight. It was charming to see the carousel of apostles through the windows and before you know it, show is over!Remarkable that such precision was conceived and maintained for hundreds of years without a problem!
must see. have to see this in Prague - fascinating and lower down than I had realized so easy to see . need to be there on the hour to see the "show " with the 12 disciples

Worth a visit and a picture. Visit for a historical moment in time. The clock itself is worth the visit as it chimes which is quite mystical.Visit and ensure you have some water if you plan going up the towers steps.

Romantic . Took my breath away when I first saw it we landed in Prague at around 6pm so it was early evening and just getting dark. The town square and lock were absolutely awesome in the evening light. An unforgettable experience

Cool To See. people standing there looking at the clock and you can hear them discuss how the clock works and at the same time people are getting their wedding pictures taken. Unique on so many fronts.. Great to see and experience.

Most beautiful clock tower. Just looking at the clock tower teleports you into a different time. When I saw it the first time it reminded me of a fantastic story à la Harry Potter. That's one of the feelings you get when you're in Prague.

Great informative morning . If you want to understand the history within the old town there is no better place to start than a guided tour at the old town hall...... And the views for the tower are simply brilliant
Steeped in History. The oldest working astronomical clock in the world sits at the base of a restored tower which has superb views over Old Town Square and the rest of the city - not to be missed!
Just wow!. Fantastic place. Lot of people but it doesn't matter. If you're for the first time in Prague you have to go there. If you're for the second, third and so on, you simply want to go there.

Impressive piece of history. . Definitely take the time to pass by this clock. It's gorgeous architecture and working clock will not disappoint. I believe you can also climb to the top of the tower, although I have not done so myself. I imagine the views would be pretty impressive.
Also the clock comes to life around 13:00pm. Check it out.

Iconic Prague. A trip to Prague should include a visit here for lovely photo opportunities and interesting architecture. It is within walking distance of most of Pragues attractions so is worth a detour to see the famous clock

One of the "Must sees" in Prague. Apparently this is the worlds oldest working astronomical clock .On the hour , every hour ,large crowds gather to hear the clock strike and see the movement of various figurines on the instrument .

Overrated clock, great view from tower. The clock is a major tourist trap because while nice, it doesn't take very long and isn't very impressive.
We did climb to the top of the tower and had an amazing view over prague.

Lovely. Visit the clock on he hour to see the movement and hear the bells. Take the tour to the top of the tower to learn the history of the clock and of WWII times. You can walk or take a glass elevator to the top of the tower. Beautiful views of Prague below.

The performance is a let down. If you want a laugh just wait for the hourly kookoo clock and watch the peoples faces.
The clock is amazing and the oldest working astronomical clock in the world.
It is beautiful and the detail in the clock is so interesting.

Personal Opinion: Over Rated. Please take this with a grain of salt, this review is written after my fourth visit to Prague and the clock, the first trip I enjoyed watching the movement etc. But by the third or 4th time it got old. That said, on an earlier visit I did climb the tower and enjoyed the view and found the history of both the building and clock fascinating (take a tour and the guide will give a great explanation). I do suggest checking it out though as it is a "must see."
fantastic. An hourly show..When the figures begin to turn I remember my childhood and want to play with them.It has an interestin history too..Go and See...

Great Clock. I love the astronomical clock... BUT it is better when you have some history context as well as explanation of what it can do. It tells the time, yes, but it also tells dawn and dusk, what sign of the zodiac we are in, all the things that a medieval astronomer would want. Also, the apostles only come out during certain hours. In the winter, it is something like 9am-9pm. I went there at 8am the first time and no apostles. Note, the apostles come out for 45s or there about so if you miss it, you have to wait another hour. Once the roaster crows, it is done for that hour.

A great old clock, don't assume it'll have wi-fi or internet connection :^). It's definitely worth a visit, this is one of the oldest working clocks in the world. No technology, no electrics, it just works mechanically and very impressive what people at that time could do without all the modern gadgets
worth seeing!. The clock does it's chime every hour on the hour and it's definitely worth seeing if visiting Prague. Great vibe and lots to do in the Old town square and surrounding areas!

Old Town Clock. Not worth making sure you are there for the 'show'. If you're there, you may as well watch it. It's impressive in that it's so old and how much it reads etc, but other than that, it's nothing spectacular.

The clock. The clock is a must see architecture from a distant past which is still working and moving.
On each full hour the clock comes to life and many parts are moving but do not expect something fancy. When nearing the bell ringing you can find this place by looking for big groups of people.

First time in Prague. Came across the Astronomical Clock during my walk around the old town. I arrived 5 minutes before the hour and didn't stay, which was a shame, but will watch on my next visit. Alot of tourists here and a few hecklers trying to entice you into different bars and restaurants, just ignore them.

The clock is beautiful but there are better lest touristy places in this gorgeous city!. This was one of the first places we visited and yes, it's a gorgeous piece of architecture but I'm not so keen on the surrounding area. The square is beautiful but full of people trying to get you to take a segway ride and some very strange performers doing statues… the baby one was very disconcerting. Please don't restrict your trip to Prague with this area as you only have to go down a few back streets to find some beautiful places without the distraction of tourist luring! I can't deny the buildings are beautiful though!

Amazing view of the old city center, but clock event itself not so special. The entrance fee was around 4€ for the top of the clock Tower and totally worth it. Inside the Tower you can read about the history of the building and walk a round way up or you take the fast way by Elevator. At top you have an amazing view over Prague and especially the old City Center. The astronomic clock on the other side itselft Looks also very interesting but too wait for the hourly Event is not really worth it.
the old town clock is a must. a great place and a not to miss but pick your time ( no Pun Intended) avoid the most popular time 12:00 midday try 09.00/10.00 or 14.00/15.00

Worth a visit!. Great to see as the clock itself is beautiful but after waiting twice on the hour to see the clock going off (as we thought we'd missed something the first time!) I didn't get the hype.Best seen late at night with less crowds and sipping on a prosecco

A must see!. This is one of the best preserved medieval sites I have ever seen. The old astronomic clock is fascinating - once in an hour the clock chimes and you can see apostles appearing in the window. Another attraction not to be missed is the view from the balcony under the roof of the tower. For a little admission fee you can see all these amazing old buildings in the area.
Fascinating!. Just watching this clock for what it is makes for interesting viewing, but when you discover the history of its inventor and learn its intricacies it's positively mind-blowing!
great. very beautiful architecture, the clock is magnificent, figures move on the hour and the cockerel lets out a squawk but be careful its very quick and you might miss it

Underwhelming?. The guide book describes this as Underwhelming and it is not inaccurate - we still went to see it. Stand around on the cold for up to an hour, get ripped off for hot chocolate at Hotel U Prince, while waiting for the "saints" to parade at two small windows above a complex clock from which it is impossible to tell the time - in the freezing cold - yes, UNUSUAL

clock disappointment. We tried several times to get to the Astronimical clock as it only chimes on the hour, and eventually made it on our last day. Was actually quite disappointed by it. It was over within seconds, and the statues (4 of them) whizzed so past you couldn't really see them.

Prague. Prague has become my most favourite city. The people are polite & pleasant. The architecture is amazing & something not to be missed. The cultural experience is expanse & a visit to the opera or ballet is a must.The food is wonderful & diverse from fine cuisine to a peace of ham or sausage from the street venders & of course don't forget the 'Hot Wine' or their perfectly lovely beer.The clock is not to be missed but read up on the meaning of it so as you get the full experience. It only last a few seconds but worth the wait even so. So if you want a superb break full of interesting things to do do & see. Go to Prague!

Very cool. It's always crowded when the clock is going to chime, its got to be the busiest place in the square. If you come into the area the right way, you will walk down a narrow ally then suddenly the clock will be in front of you.

beautiful and worth a see. loved the old town was fab. saw the clock go loads of times, was worth seeing just to have done it, was cool the first time by the end of the trip we had seen it a lot. deff worth a look!
Interesting visit. It was facinating to read within the old town hall of its history and the clock.Well worth the small admission cost and a wonderful view from the top.
great atmosphere. deffo worth a visit and to see the astronomical clock and here it chime was one of the nicest things about prague

Still standing since the 1400s. Famous astronomical clock which took us a while to figure out so spent quite some time looking at every detail. There were 3 parts to the clock, moving figures, an astronomical dial and a calendar dial.(Found this out later). Huge huge crowds and tour group earpieces must share same wave length as our english commentary turned french for a few short minutes.
Worth a visit . Quite a sight when the bells chime on the hour and the disciples make an appearance. Very interesting and attracted the crowds.

A MUST SEE . Loved this place. When you visit Prague you HAVE to go to old town and visit the square. When there you can't miss the fabulous astronomical clock. Every hour you will see a crowd gather and you can watch, a mulled wine in hand, as the figurines move and preform. It's great to see!Go a step further though and pay for a visit up the tower. Stretch your legs (or use the elevator) right to the top and see Prague from above. It's a sight not to miss. That ticket your bought for the tower? Keep it! It gives you a discount on a guided tour of the town hall. Alow the knowledgeable guide to take you through the many halls inside and see the paintings, statues and even the underground of this fascinating old building. A must see on your trip to Prague!P.s. It's cheap!

Bohemia is Alive and Well.. What a wonderful city to visit. We took a self tour to the top of the clock - the view is amazing. Strolling down the streets and going into the shops was really fun for everyone. Lots of color in the architecture, the history and the people. Prague Old Town is a definite must see in Europe and a place my whole family has agreed to come backto for more.
Bit of a disappointment. Nice building but THE famous moving clock has only the statues appearing before a window, barely viewable. Nice to see if you are there, but dont plan your visit around it

Amazing history. When you visit the old town hall and climb the tower; you learn about its history which is really very interesting. There are some fabulous black and white pictures of the town hall on the walls. the view from the top is great as you look down onto the square. The astronomical clock is a sight to see on the hour every hour. but get there early to beat the crowd.

It took us a while to find it!!. Great, and it would be good if you sit at the café opposite the Old Town Hall as you can watch it and take photos of it and sit back. We went inside as well and they have a lift and full of history.

Must see?. I suppose if you are visiting Prage & the Old Town you will make the effort to see the clock. It is indeed quite interesting but it is mobbed by the crowds. I returned to see it shortly after sunrise when there were very few people around.

The tour is worth paying for!. We went on a guided tour of the old town hall and the underground city during our stay. Our tour guide, a young guy for the tour in English (I can't remember his name), was really great and cheerful, and he made the tour even more interesting than it was. It is cool to see the Art Deco rooms and also the underground city to learn more about this wonderful city.

Great views. The views from the top of the clock tower are very good. However, it gets very busy up there and people don't seem to observe the one-way sign. There are so many people taking selfies that it just completely blocks the path to walk around.The astronomical clock is interesting and entertaining when the display happens on the hour. There are leaflets that explain how to read it and the meaning of the display that happens on the hour. Be aware of pickpockets here - I felt like I was being targetted at one point...
Old World. This area of Prague is a must see to experience the essence of the city and you definitely must wait for the hourly chiming of the clock it is a cultural area with the buildings a

Plenty to do and see. I must admit I found the clock a disappointment but I guess you have to see it while in Prague. I did however enjoy the various aspects of the old town hall. Once again nice views from the top of the tower (a lift is available) and plenty of history in the underground 'city' below.

My favorite European City for that old school feel.. Wow. They really keep this area in great shape. Old school buildings, fantastic eateries and lots of history, this area of Prague is a must see for travelers of all kinds.

A must visit. This is must visit. be sure there when the clock strikes. Do keep in mind this is haven for pickpockets. Everyone is focused on the clock and not paying attention to the people around them. Wear your money belt, Make sure purses are extra secure or better yet, don't care one. Don't have you wallet in your back pocket.

Be careful. We ran into a bar opposite the clock when it started raining, Olivia Verdi, having just had lunch for 4 including a bottle of wine and beers for around £30 we were shocked to pay the same for a bottle of wine and 2 large beers. From our vantage point we could spot the pickpockets lurking about in the crowd.
Amazing views. Its really worth it to take the lift to the top of the tower for the views. Also take the ticket which includes the crypts. Really excellent tour

Mysterious and magicplace!. I visited The town Hall and astronomical clock in late January 2016.
The first impression that I remember about this area is mysterious and definitely it's one of the distinguished highlights of Praha...

Wow. The Old Town Hall and Main Plaza area is incredible. The surrounding architecture is fantastic. The Clock is incredible. The whole Plaza fills up at the top of the hour for the show the clock puts on.
Must see if in the area.

Brilliance . Quite a brilliant clock in the tower, wonderful how this was created centuries ago when calculations were not as accurate as now and still the clock is spot on!
Lots of people get disappointed of the clock show, so don't get your hopes up, there are no fireworks
