Old Town Hall with astronomical clock is beautiful. Old Town Hall with Astronomical Clock is the most beautiful we there líbyl clock and some souvenirs from there we have but, anyway, we most líbylo the hotel.
Great views. The astronomical clock building is beautiful and it is well worth the climb to the top. Fantastic views of the whole city from up there

Things you may not know what lies beneath the old town hall!!. On our 2nd day in Prague we went to the old town square where we found a tour operator that did an underground tour under the city and also a nucleur bunker tour! We booked for both these tours as we could do one after the other. Our guide for the underground tour was Katarina and she was very informative about how the street level buildings became the basement or celler rooms. It was strange to think that above us there ere people milling around the Square! She showed us how high the river level got to in the bad flood of 2012!After that tour we went with our guide James who was very enthuiastic and informative to the nucleur bunker tour. we had to walk a bit, travel on a tram to get to the bunker, which was all very interesting!
Brilliant. Saw this by myself initially and thought what is all thi fuss about, then saw it with a guide, she explained the construction and all the various time variables. It is amazing

An amazing clock. There was a HUGE crowd waiting and waiting for the clock to strike. People from all over, had conversations with some Brits, Kiwi's and some Spaniards while we wandered and sipped on hot spiced wine. the clock itself was amazing when it struck. I cant fathom how they managed to build that so many years ago. Definitely something to see if you are in Prague.

Beautiful Views!. It's worth the money it costs to climb the tower. The way up is filled with history about the creation of the tower, but the piece de la resistance is at the top when you can get the breathtaking panoramas of Prague.

Only one in the world!. This attraction has so many viewers every hour when the clock strikes it is hard to find a viewing spot. The clock maker who made the astronomical clock had his eyes burned out so that he could never repeat it, a horrible story but this is a truly unique clock.

Don't go just for the clock experience as it(the clock) is not the most inspired one I have seen. Don't go just for the clock experience as it(the clock) is not the most inspired one I have seen However the rest is very old and except for the usual tourists traps well worth the time.

interesting , uniqe, impressive !.. must see espacially to wait to a full hore... you'll have a nice supprise. warning!!!be awear from thifes when you are looking up. keep your belonging close to youe chast! have fun! :-)

It was great on an sunny February day. This is definitely worth seeing. I have been told that it gets a bit crazy in the summer months however we were there in early February and watched it a number of times. Well worth it.
Work of art. While I didn't go in the Town Hall, it is definitely worth seeing the clock. Old school workmanship, truly amazing that is was created so long ago.

Cool clock - just don't have high expectations of any fancy show. The square definitely grabs attention from tourists who congregate in their massesAccompanied by street performers - the square gives off a lively vibe as people wait for the clock to reach the hourOn the hour, you get to witness a mechanical 'puppet' show that lasts for a minute or twoIt's OK, just lower your expectations and you can then move on to Charles Bridge etc

I keep wanting a huge house with an astronomical clock. That's the essence of the experience. It looks gorgeous. Loads of people gather for death striking the hour, so if you want a good proper look and possibly a photo, pick any other time.

This Is the Real Prague!. The Old Town Prague never ceases to amaze and enthrall the visitors! From the Town Hall to the incredible Astronomical clock with its hourly parade of statues, to the countless restaurants and shops, this is where the real Prague is to be savored and loved.

Old Town Hall & Powder Tower gives you great views all over Prague. The clock is beautiful. People gather to "see the apostles walking past on the hour " - the Old Town Hall and powder Tower are a must if you are able . You can walk up and there is lots of information along the way. Access is stairs to third floor and then a walkway to the top so a gentle enough climb or there arrow lifts for those unable to do this - one to the third floor and then another to the top. The top can be enjoyed for inside or outside - which is quite narrow and not accessible to all - the views of the Old Town Square and the whole of Prague are just fantastic and it is a great photographic opportunity. We did not have time on our short trip to visit all of the Old Town Hall but we will the next time. Really worth the entrance price.

the view from the clock tower is one of the best in the city. The famous picturesque astronomical clock tower is very captivating and sits in the heart of the old town square, beautiful day and night. The famous "clock show" isn't that good for waiting for it only if your there by the hour . On the other hand it's very recommended to go up the clock tower and have amazing views of the city , day and night, I did it only in the daytime .
A must in prague. A must. On the hour, crowds gather to watch the figures/ apostles in the clock, move along the wooden doors that open.

Great Area for Photos and Crowds. The astronomical clock is one of the most famous sights in Prague as seen by all of the clock themed souvenirs and the flock of people that come to watch the "clock show" every hour from early in the morning until 11:00pm. The show is pretty quick and simple, but still cool to see in action once.The Old Town Hall is the central part of the Old Town Square. On the outer facade facing the square you will see a plaque with 27 names and a corresponding 27 crosses on the ground serving as a memorial to 27 people executed in Czech's history. The Old Town Hall actually has quite a fascinating history that you can learn all about as you walk the ramps up the Old Town Hall Tower.The tower itself has a great view, but can get very crowded at prime times especially since the passage at the top is very narrow. I would recommend going mid-morning or mid-afternoon to get a great view of the Old Town with still a lot of people around the city, but not necessarily in the tower. Enjoy the view!
A bit of fun with a bit of history!. You can't easily miss this clock's performance on the hour with the huge crowd that it attracts. A bit underwhelming but we still watched it 2 or 3 times!

Great place for photographer during Christmas Markets. If you want to take a typical picture from Prague, you can't miss the view from the Old Town Square Tower. Especially during Christmas Markets it's a place number one. Entrance fee cost about 120 CZK for adult.

If you are willing to go up the stairs, it's a great site!. Just waiting for the clock is great, but the view from up the tower is amazing! In fact, many sites in Prague are more beautiful if you go up the stairs ('bird's view').
on the hour !!. the old astronomical clock ,a must see in old Prague ,gets busy on the hour for the clock display, very photogenic and a great area full of bars,cafes and street entertainers ,
clock. oh... i have such clock in my region and even old also. but i found that one is well maintained and along with great architecture..

Beautiful, show was also nice. The clock is just beautiful with it details. Also the show was great, actually quite fun at the end. I think it is one of the must see destinations when visiting Prague.
Tic Toc.... Astronomical Clock.. Great location right in the old town square of Prague. Lots of crowds waiting to see the clock move!!!!! A must see to visit in Prague.

Surprisingly fun! . Can't say much about the clock, its better if you go there by yourself and see it! What I can say is that I had fun watching the clock and it is a really nice history behind it. Go with a guide or pay attention to guides near to you. It is also a pretty clock from old old old times!

Has to be seen. This clock and its history are not to be missed it's absolutely fascinating, please find out or get a guide to explain before you watch on the hour it's wonderful display but you will miss so much if you don't know the story don't miss it

Great clock Great views. This is a very enjoyable experience in Prague. Lovely to climb to the top and see the beautiful views for miles around. Not a difficult climb and there is a lift for part of the ascend.
Detailed. The clock has so many details and colors - nice to look at and discover the many details. Come at O'clock when the clock strikes and statues move
Quaint clock . Get there just before the hour strikes to see it all working . Not worth hanging around for 50 mins though go and get a coffee

A most unusual clock. A must see at night with the square and buildings lite up. To find out more look at the splurb next to it. From the roof top walkway you can get a fantastic view of the city during daytime hours.

Disapponting clock but tower is great!. After hearing so much about the astrological clock we were expecting a spectacular show, especially when a crowd of people gathered to watch it on the hour. However it was a bit of a disappointment - just a few figurines going round. Despite this, the hall itself was fantastic, especially the tower - a visit to the top is highly recommended, though not for visitors with a fear of heights! Note - there is a free elevator to the top with frequent trips to the viewing platform.

Understand the history. Make sure you have someone with you who can tell you about all the elements of this fascinating clock or do your research beforehand. It is well worth seeing in a square which is well worth spending some time in (particularly when there is a Christmas market!)
beautiful and different. located at the old town square, the heart of prague. must visit of course. if u go on top of the clock tower u get to take a nice view of the city. dont miss it (:

Interesting. You can take the elevator up the tower instead of climbing the stairs. The view from the top is amazing. You could see the entire city from the ancient castle on one side with the modern tower with babies crawling on the other side. Make sure you keep change to pay the restroom attendants. Public bathrooms charge a small fee. It was fun to take picture of the people taking pictures of the clock. The clock itself was an intricate instrument. Every hour, the show starts with Death tipping his hourglass and ring the bell.

What a clock!. An incredible must see clock in a beautiful location. The square is so interesting and surprisingly not full of tourists. We did it on a walk around the traffic free area and cobbled streets.

crowded but beautiful. It's before Christmas that we were there. It is really beautiful with lighted Christmas market. The only disadvantage is that there were always so crowded and difficult to walk and always come someone to ask if you want to change the money.

wander at your leisure. Full of restaurants, gift shops and street vendors, a great place to stroll and watch the world go by. Top tip. Don't just look straight ahead or down at the cobbled streets; look up. There you will see an incredible mix of architecture, baroque, renaissance, gothic and medieval. Home of the astronomical clock ( don't even try to tell the time. It's not that kind!) On the hour the apostles slide around, there are always crowds gathering to see this so you'll know when it's due. Careful when buying gifts. A lot of the gift shops are owned by Russians so there are lots and lots of Russian dolls.

Beautiful City. Prague is a sight to behold. The old town is structurely amazing for the length of time it has been in existence and looks like something out a film. The clock is a bit of an anti-climax. The design, colours and sounds are very pretty but its reputation on this occasion does not proceed itself.
Real Nice!. Had a great time!! The way up was really cool- I recomand going up the tower on foot and not by the lift.

Fascinating. Looks impressive, though the hourly show is a bit of a squib ! Though in fairness, in medieval times, it would be something to behold,I'm guessing. I did have more of an appreciation once I understood the significance of the figures that are represented.... Access into the tower is 100 crowns, given what you see and what you can learn, I would say this represents good value. Go up the tower to watch the crowds watch the clock! Does get very crowded. We were there in winter, it must be hell in summer. Mentioned in a previous review that hawkers and segway tours make it less pleasurable to hang around.

Stunning buildings & clock, try not to get run over by segways. Beautiful pieces of history are dotted around the square and it's a hub of activity - street performers (bubble blowers, musicians and yes, those dreaded human statues), amazing gothic architecture, busy tourist-trap restaurants and bars... A lovely buzz even if you don't want to get involved which is nice. Lots of segway tour operators whizzing around and whilst they weren't pushy we did decline a lot of offers.
Amazing watch. Beautiful watch in center of the old town looks great. Its easy to find so it is a meeting point for people around the world.
Lovely atmosphere. A lovely clock, gets very busy when the clock strikes. Plenty of bars and restaurants with outside seating to enjoy when the weather is nice.
Nice Old Clock. Being fond of quality timepieces this was a no brainer 5 star. To be so old and still work was a testament to the craftsmanship involved. A must see when in Prague.

Best thing I did in Prague was climb the clock tower. The astronomical clock is fairly anti-climactic if you just look at it but the free walking tour gave a great back story and history to make it so much more exciting. Best thing I did in my entire week stay was pay the 110 crowns to go up the clock tower. There was tonnes of historic information about the building and the views were absolutely spectacular. A definite must if you only have time to do a couple things. The 110 crowns were well spent.

Worth a look! . We learned all about the history of our walking tour. Very interesting. Clock show on the hour is very short, ppl were disappointed as it's built up so much. We went up to the top of the clock, fantastic views, scary if you look down!

Intriguing!. The place is just bathed in history and it and it was just so beautiful and interesting. It's super busy though in the afternoon so I'd recommend visiting before 12. Loads of stuff to do just off the square too (like restaurants or the chocolate factory!)

View from the top. It can get very packed around the clock during the middle of the day, we were there in December and there was lots of Christmas market stalls around the square.there is a small ticket office at the front of the clock tower where you can buy tickets to go up to the observation area at the top of the tower. It was worth the wait to get to the top as the views over the city are great, would try and go on a clear day to make the most of the views available. I would also recommend walking up the tower it has a sloped walkway all the way to the top so no stairs and lining the walk way are photos and information about the history of the building and square.

Plan to arrive "on the hour". Once an hour the clock chimes, the apostles appear, and the tourists stand gazing and recording the machinations of the historical clock -- join them, it will entertain for at least 45 seconds!

Old Clock, nice show. Every hour many tourist got around the clock to see how it comes to life. Many figures start dancing and making sounds. It is curious because it have different kind of figures from angels to pirates. It is well located in the middle of the old town in which you can have lunch or dinner or just a beer, also many spas around it. If you get there, try the tubular bread with sugar and cinnamon, it is traditional and yummy.

Give the old town hall a miss. The clock is fine, you'll want to see it once during your stay, but give the tour of the old town halls a miss. The tower is great, lovely views from the top and there is a lift if you don't want to walk up. For the halls, we were given a booklet which was just as well because the English spoken by the official guide was dreadful. She was very difficult to listen to a d I don't think I made out one whole sentence in the one hour tour. Some of the rooms were moderately interesting but the tour was not worth the money. Seriously boring. Give it a miss,but see the clock and go up the tower

Not to be missed. The astronomical clock is something of a genius creation. Not only is the clock aesthetically charming it is also fascinating. Every hour on the hour the clock performs a small show & it will be something you'll never have witnessed before. I would recommend that you go into the tower as well to learn more about the history & to better understand its existence.
Dream city. Obligatory walk, the old town is full of details, wonderful building, a fair story, lovely restaurants.

Nice clock, with a very interesting history. For some reason, even though I spent a quite a lot of time in the Old Town Square, I was never in front of the clock on the hour... But I definitely recommend going to the top of the tower, the view is gorgeous, especially at night. Also, if you choose to walk up the ramp instead of taking the elevator, you can read lots of interesting information about the history of the clock. On a whim, I also took the guided tour to the town hall, and it proved to be a very inspired choice. The tour takes about an hour, and it reveals a lot of interesting information about the history of the place.

Timing is everything!. Loved this clock! We went up the tower for only 120czk per person and the views you get are fantastic! There is something to see in every direction! We got the lift up then walked the ramp back down which was good. Though make sure you don't go up the tower just before the hour and miss the clock going off!!

Unimpressive but must do. . If you are in the local area you might as well stop by, but it really isn't impressive and only takes a few minutes. The crowds are huge and it's the sort of thing you should go to so you can say you have seen it.
Old town and the Clock. What's not to like, every hour the crowd gathers, no matter the weather, it was -11 one day -3 and snowing the next the crowd still came. Be sure to go up the tower!
Very pretty - a must-see. It goes every hour with a little display and people congregate in the square to watch it. A very unique experience

Waiting for the clock is a waste of time. The Astronomical clock is intresting to see and it's right in the center of old Prague but do not waste your time and wait for the hourly "show" which lasts 20 seconds and is not impressive at all.

Get to the top. This clock is fabulous and there is always a crowd around it on the hour. We paid to go up the tower and it was brilliant. Lots of interesting pictures and history on the way up the clock. We saw the mosaic hall of the town hall which are spectacular. The view from the top of the tower is stunning, even on a dull day.

Historical!. It brings one back to old times when clocks played such a great role to old men. The big astronomical clock in the old town hall in Prague has its unique beauty. It has paintings on its face and another round figure just below it. It is right in the center of the old town square where people gather the most.

Clock is VERY over-rated.. The square itself and indeed the old town hall are truly beautiful, But the focal point of the Clock is a big let down, large crowds gather to watch a few seconds of movement which is all a bit lame!

A place to be but not to change money !!!. THe place is very nice and the clock interesting. But do not change your money to the office in front of the clock and having a facade on the place. THey claim that they do not charge commission and offer the best change. But this is not the truth, instead of changing for example 100 € at normal change for 2500Kr, they change it to 1500Kr !!! This is close to thief and the people are agressive when you challenge their behaviour.

Spent a long time staring at a clock I didnt understand.. But WOW!!. This was a must-see for Prague and we didnt know what to expect. But it gets your attention. The apostles who come at the hour is an interesting experience. Dont expect to understand everything on the clock unless you read ahead of time. It is a curious piece of work. Very elegant piece, colorful and reflects the gothic/Bohemian architecture of the city. There is a REAL clock for the actual time in the same tower. Highly recommend taking a tour to the top of the tower to get STUNNING views of the castle. We were there for Christmas, so the market and the clock were an excellent combo.

Throngs for a clock. A very nice astrological clock, however I'm stunned at the throngs of people taking selfies in front of this old town showpiece. It is certainly worth a look however each time I visit I'm still not amazed by it and the crowds it attracts.Guess I'm still shell shocked by all the crappy tourist shops and touts that lead up to it.

Another must see. This is incredible to see, the detail is amazing,and you can climb up the tower for a birds eye view. Gets very busy when the clock is about to strike, so worth getting there a few minutes early for a good vantage point.

Yes, it is old but. Crowds stand around to watch the apostles come out on the hour - I was more interested in the history and intricate construction. There are many things to discover just looking at the clock. For a fee you climb the old town hall tower.
Have seen better. Interesting period architecture but not outstanding. Astronomical clock is underwhelming and not worth killing time to wait for it to perform.

A Must See in Prague. If you want to be infront of the Astronomical clock, I suggest that you be in the old town between 6:45 to 7AM. Less people are in the plaza and you will be able to take pictures or video. The clock will run a minute or a minute and a half. It is busiest between 11AM until 4:30 to 5PM during October. As most people have said, the Astronomical clock is a national treasure of the Czech Republic. I watched the clock 2 to 3 times inorder for me to see everything. After viewing the clock, I always make it a point to go to nearby shops. The clock is in a huge plaza of Prague.

Old town hall. Make sure to take the tour of the birds view of Prague it's beautiful.. a lift takes you right to the top where you can walk outside and see different parts of the city.. also if you don't like the idea of a lift you can walk up a ramp right to the top with different parts of history info on the walls, definitely recommend this

it is beyond beautiful!!!. I loved it so much!! Make sure you are ready to take plenty of pics...Perfect for anyone who loves history ....make sure you stay for a long while! i feel inlove with Prague

Great if you know what to expect. Go on the hour!. The Astronomical clock is a national treasure of the Czech Republic, but it is literally just a fancy clock outside that opens its windows to show you the 12 Apostles when it chimes on the hour. It's free to access, and you can also climb to the top. It's beautiful and a great place to snap a picture, but don't expect it to be more than a clock.

Again very intresting. This is a most unusual attraction and it gets busy after around 11am and every hour thereafter, top tip- best time to get up close and personal is earlier in the morning when the crowds are small and you'll be able to get some photos, read up on its history its very interesting indeed

Photo opportunity . Everyone likes to take photos with either the town hall or the clock in the background. Incredibly historical place. Pity some of it was destroyed during the second world War. There are worthwhile tours that take you into the lower floors and also learn about the history. We were told about the occupation. Then the resistance and freedom. After that the occupation of the communists. Prague's recent history has been very sad.
historic. on both days we managed to get to the clock just about 1pm and it was chimming ,what a spectacle display very beautiful

View from the top is beautiful . We went to see the clock knowing it is rated as one of the most disappointing tourist attractions and were not wrong. As a piece it is interesting to know but the actual hour chime is quite the anticlimax. However I would highly recommend the tour to top of the tower. It's a beautiful view. We went at sunset and it was snowing so got some gorgeous photos. We went at the end of our trip so could point out and look for all the places we had been over the past few days. I have a extreme fear of heights and falling so it is always hard climbing towers however I still recommend. If you really struggle there is an elevator to the top but the walk up there is a series of ramps. Not stairs. It's a long way up but the information on the walls in the way up shouldn't be missed. Oh also, be prepared for a small steel spiral staircase at the top. Anyone with height fears will know how it feels when you get taken off guard when you are facing your fears. But just do it. You only live once.
Not something you see every day. Great history and if you climb to the top you can see across the rooftops of Prague. There is both stairs and elevators to the top and the views are worth the trip.
Interesting and complex!. This clock is rather beautiful and i have never seen anything similar anywhere else. Crowds waited for the hour chime with cameras at the ready!

Need to see if you visiting Prague. The main attraction in Prague is for sure the old astronomical clock in the Old Town. It's super nice to get to the Old Town around full hour and just walk around, which is super nice and cozy, and then to come to see the clock at the full hour. It's something I've never seen in Spain, and it's worth to see. But be careful, cause it's getting super crowded especially in a touristic season.
The clock. This is one of the most unusual clocks in Europe. It rings every hour on the hour. The windows open and character come out.
Tick tock fabulous clock. Well worth a visit,but does get very busy,I would say go early morning to enjoy this attraction,at weekend total mayhem with tourists on walking tours

Underwhelming . Don't rush to get here as a main event, it's nice to walk through and have a look, but it gets very full on the hour to see the 'show'. It's beautiful to look at and admire the detail and skill in its making but this can be done anytime of day. Eating around here is expensive compared to else where, as are the souvenirs which you can get from several hundred shops dotted around every street in Prague.

1* for the Guided Tour, 5* for the Clock itself. I couldn't find them listed separately so I break it down like this: -1 star = Guided Tour. The tour of the hall (and cellars below which were 'Old Prague' were simply awful. The free walking tour guys knew more about it than the woman guiding us around. At 100 Crown each, save your money and go buy yourself a few beers. The Clock - 5 stars simply because of the age, history and the amazing engineering relating to the 'show' every hour. I was impressed.
fantastic. be sure to be here on the hour to watch the clock chime and see the movements(loved the skeleton and his bell) the actual clock is amazing and the building is beautiful.

Worldwide sightseeing. Everybody who visit Prague should see it ! Unique astronomical clock. From the top of tower very nice view. Restaurants and shops all around. Also market around with Czech food and souvenirs.
Just wonderful. To see the clock dinging, you need to sit somewhere nice. In front of the clock, there are a couple of bistros. It might be worth to sit in and watch. Beer is also good in Prague.

Go when it hits a full hour. The astronomical clock is very popular with tour groups - they crowd in front of it for a full view of the clock face. The clock chimes every hour, lasting for about 2 minutes each time with figurines moving around the clock face. I'd say to see it when you happen to be in the area, don't have to travel specifically for this attraction.

Time your visit well. It's one of those items on the list that you need to tick of your list as a must see as its one of the oldest clocks in the world.Having said that there's not that much to keep you captivated so plan your trip so that you are not waiting on it forever ( on the hour)There are lots of tourists there in the warmer months and there is plenty going on in the square to keep you amused. It's also good for sitting out in the square bar terraces and people watching( although it's too cold to do this in January)
Excellent Authentic. This place is real in the heart of Prague. The clock is famous and fits exactly in the surrounding of this Old Town.

A spectacular work of science & art. Ok, so it's free to view the clock from the outside & to witness it chiming on the hour, every hour & reveal the apostles, etc. Unfortunately there is a charge to access the clock tower itself. Book in advance if you wish to access the tower as it is very busy. Get to the tower itself five mins before to view the clock chime on the hour as it becomes thronged with tourists & this can make viewing difficult.

Worth a visit to see this giant clock. Eventhough there wasnt much happening staring at the clock , it has a long techinical side to it and i think it is worth a visit for a snap of the entire structure

Remarkable place to visit. Although it was significantly damaged by the nazis, the reconstructiono fthe tower is remarkable and I really enjoyed it. It contains bits and pieces of the history of the city hall and tower, and it has a very interesting lift inside that takes you to the top. In addition, the view from there is beutiful, specially in the snow of this cold winter.
Astonishing. BE aware of being at the .00 every hour to say it working at it's best, and in the morning and late in the afternoon and night to see shifts
very nice and historical place. nice place to visit, a lot of tourists and restaurants around and very crowded sometimes, a must to visit in Prague

Head up the tower!. Last time I visited Prague I only watched the clock chime and never went in. I recommend being there to watch the clock chime in the hour with the rest of the crowds but then a trip to the top of the tower is a must.The ticket price is reasonable. Unlike many towers I have climbed in Europe the stair case is modern and there is lift access all the way to the top. There are some great pictures of the history of the whole building before and after WW2 and some interesting history posts.The best part of it is the panoramic view of the city you can see from the top of the tower. The views are spectacular and an absolute must

Amazing old building with astronomical clock. The Old town hall building is beautiful, the view from the tower is extraordinary and the astronomical clock is old and beautifully designed. Do not have your expectations very high about the "clock" show. It is very basic and does not contain a lot of action. There is always a huge gathering under the clock tower 10 minutes before the hour so that people can secure good spots. It is good to see it once but it is not a disaster if you miss it.
Underwhelming . The actual astronomical clock is fairly underwhelming, I would plan your time around waiting for the clock to hit the hour. Instead go up the tower for the views

Impressive. To see the clock in person was really a great treat knowing how old it is and how unique and beautiful it is. We came during the Christmas holiday weekend and the area was just hustling and bustling with tourists like us. It was vibrant and the Christmas spirit was awesome.
one of the oldest clocks in the world.. a must see. one of the best landmarks in prague.. ppl enjoy staying there for hours watching the clock and how time passes during day n night

Great views. It is worth paying entry (roughly £6) to gain access to the panoramic viewing gallery. This viewpoint gives breathtaking views of the city from all angles. The clock is a true masterpiece and is worth waiting in the crowds to see the hourly display.

A must see.... The crowds start gathering about 15 before the hour to watch the action at the top of the hour when the clock chimes and "does its thing". Since it is like 600 years old, it is worth the 15 or so minutes to get there to get a "good" spot to watch the "show" at the top of the hour.This is HIGHLY tourisity, so the people watching is pretty entertaining as well..

Fantastic Old Clock. Well just to stand and stare at this lovely timepiece is worth considering but look at the rest of the architecture here and around the area - exceptional This is the oldest Astronomical Clock still operating anywhere in the world and fitted in 1410 - just a pity that they don't have some signs around to publicise this to the Tourists - this would give them a better sense of its importanceThe Clock chimes regularly and the figures of lust, death, greed and vanity are animated - worth a look and waiting for or planning forAbsolutely worth a visit when in Prague as this is wonderfulEnjoy

See it at least once!. The Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock are amazing to see. So ornate and beautiful. It is really worth at least one visit to the Old Town Square to see the clock move. It is an ancient marvel.
Fantastic at sunset!. A wonderful experience, fun with the crowds all tking photos and videos. Lots of places nearby to grab a drink or bottle of water.

Superb! This iconic monument of Europe. Amazing history, amazing architecture, friendly people superb restaurants. Pragu. Superb! This is one of the major iconic monuments of Europe. The clock alone is worth the trip.Amazing history, amazing architecture, friendly people, superb restaurants. Prague has it all. No better place for a short break-or a longer one for that matter
Astromical clock is amazing . Make sure to pass by on the hour so you can see the show, really impressive piece loved it, haven't seen anything like it yet
Astronomical Clock. You just have to join the hundreds of folk in the old town square to see the clock in action.......read up on the clocks history.

An astronomical clock for astronomical tourists !. This is a hell of a clock. The best time to take few pictures of it with nobody around is very early in the morning because then it will be very crowded. At night it's like if the clock was giving a concert and the huge crowd was there to enjoy the show. There are shops and restaurants around which is very convenient. The clock is a must see for every kind of tourist.

Living a fairytale!. Prague was one my first European cities I had ever visited. I felt like being trapped in a fairy tale. The view of the castle and Charles bridge at night is priceless. Since then, I have visited hundred of cities but Prague still stays among the top ones.

Perfect place to use as a base. Loved it here and went every day during our 3 day visit in December. Perfect for a drink, people watch and to use as a starting point when venturing off to different places.
Nice experience. I loved the square and this special anticipation waiting for the clock to start! A really nice vibe with all people waiting there and the atmosphere is pretty unique!
unusual. This clock it unique, slightly over rated, but worth a look. It is situated in Staromestske square, bit of a tourist trap.

Well-known attraction but not something special.. It was nice to see the famous astronomical clock, but it was not something so impressive to remember for the rest of your life. I believe that many people talk about it but it isn't worth all this promotion.
Stunning. Incredible 600 years of history..... everyone should also see the link on utube to the celebrations of the clocks 600th birthday...wow
Impressive Clock and Buildings. Lots of tourists walking or sitting at outdoor cafes. Impressively old historical buildings. Astronomical Clock is the only working one of its kind,
Astronomical clock is brilliant.. On the Old Town Hall Tower are actually two clocks. One of them is astronomical. Every our you can sea some action of normal clock.
Historical overload. The astronomical clock is well worth a visit. A really interesting piece of history, amazing for its age.

Every 2 hours the planets move to the next Zodiac sign!. It was exactly to this title that i went to see and it was great experience, the 12 Sun Signs change their respective positions every 2 hours. now thats astronomical... this is how the earth works vis-via the rotation and revolution adding to 24hours.It was such a bliss to see the clock ring and such a wonderfull large scale creation.Buy coffee from Star bucks bang opp the clock( might take 20 mins or more) walk a little further and buy some hot dogsThe street food, the live music, the evening entertainment and the christmas trees all soaked with an air of seasonal greeting!!! the Hot dogs are outstanding for 60 korunas, the kava(coffee is ok) and the whole place is just one happy group trying to take a memory back!The castle sight the hard rock cafe, irish bar and the torture muesum is all worth the glitz and glamor. add a lot of small souvenier shops and dont forget to by Czech Caps (2 Euros per peice & Magnets and T Shirts and gloves and oh... so much to buy and they all look good. an interesting point to note is you get sunglasses polarized and uv protected for like 200 Krouna and upwards thats very cheap!Best advice, wear sunglasses to always watch out for any one trying to pull tricks on you.

Terrific Time Machine. The Old Town Hall and the Astronomical clock take you back in time. The markets in and around the area were fascinating. Shop around before you buy any jewellery and confirm the exchange rate prior to your purchase. Be aware of pickpockets around the area and keep your bags and backpacks in front of you.

Very impressive. The view from the tower was magnificent!!! The coloured buildings and huge square below was beautiful. All the colours of the rainbow and the bustling crowd made this a wonderful attraction.
Amazing!. The third oldest timepiece in the world! It's stunning! A must see! A medieval masterpiece for all to see!

A December Trip to Prague. The Astronomical Clock is a must see in Prague's Old Town Square. I visited during Christmas Market and there was much hustle and bustle in the square. I did not desire to go inside, I merely enjoyed viewing it outside especially on the hour when the clock chimes and the statues of the 12 Apostles come to life. It really is a marvelous construction and as you stand in the square, you feel a part of medieval history.

Worth a stop in Prague. A very interesting site in the center of Old Prague. Quite a bit different from the clocks in Germany, especially Munich, but a marvel of art and engineering. The oldest operating astronomical clock in the world (that I know of)
Nice to see. This was a nice thing to see. It's very interesting. Definitely go to the top of the tower at sunset. Gorgeous views!
So cute!. Prague's old town is as adorable as one would expect. Strolling through the streets and stopping at the astronomical clock to see the miniature show. It's simply cute!
Meeting point. I love Prague old town square with its historic clock, best time to visit is on top of the hour to enjoy the bell rings of the clock.

Stunning building. The town hall is a stunning building and the clock is very interesting...I think it was made in the 15 thC.....it's a wonderful work of art....it's free to see the clock...but you can go up the tower for a fee
Nice attraction. We arrived at the Astronomic watch by chance on a round hour and got to see and hear the nice show of the figures. The watch itself is impressive and special.

An essential visit. It is inevitable that any visitor to Prague will find themselves in the Old Town square and therefore a visit to the Old Town Hall and Astronomical clock is absolutely essential! The climb to the top of the tower is spectacular. On the way up one can pause to read the history of the building, set out on information boards, which was seriously damaged during WW2. The restoration is amazing and the views over the old Town Square from the top of the tower are impressive! There is a lift for the less able bodied.
Heart of the hustle and bustle!. Busy place especially when the clock chimes on the hour. A lot of market stalls and places to eat in the area too.

Well kept and a visual treat. The clock is a major attraction in the town square. It is very intricate and interesting to look at. The show isn't spectacular, but takes about a minute to go through it's routine. It always draws a crowd.
Really interesting clock. Definitely get someone to explain to you not only how to read the clock, but the history of it as well!

Wonderful in the winter. We always wondered what Prague Woodrow will look like in the winter. so we took a road trip and visit in January and we're fortunate to get a nice snowfall why visiting. this section near the clock in the church was especially beautiful in the snow. It is a wonderful place to visit anytime year but the winter was especially nice in the snow. The surprising thing was there still was a great number of tourist it seems that is one thing you can never escape in Prague.

Very Popular. The town square is just wonderful in it's own right, and the town hall is part off that. Unfortunately I was up in the tower when the clock did its thing, but my wife said it was very interesting. Regarding the tower, the views are great, but when I went it was so crowded that I had to wait 45 minutes just to get to the entrance on the third floor, and then the observation deck was so crowded (selfie takers, have mercy on the rest of us) that it was difficult to enjoy the view. But if you can get there when it is not so crowded I am sure it would be a great experience.

Must do!. I know it's massively touristy, but it's really worth the view. It was first built in the 1400's and is truly representative of what man is capable of creating in the interest of art and pure creativity. It's a beautiful thing to behold. It does its thing every hour on the hour; for best viewing, try to get there about 15 minutes early for a good vantage point. It will be crowded, and it's probably a good idea to watch for pickpockets roaming the crowd (good idea anywhere abroad).

Interesting!. The Old town Hall is one of the most characteristic building in Prague. With it's clock which every hour (till 19.00 I think) gives his performances, which consists of movements of all the figures surounding the clock is being a place where people are gathering like I said every hour. It is situated near the st. Nicolas church and near a really big square, where during the Christmas holidays you can find all sorts of stuff in small shops. You can also get on top of the tower to get a panoramic view of the city, but there might be a cue in the entrance of the tower and NOT in the ticket office, so be carefull not to stand in line without knowing if you are in a rush!.

Lovely clock. Lovely clock to look at. Worth paying to go up the tower, see the views across the city and learn a bit more about it all. Ticket only cost 120 czk no ques and not crowed at this time of the year
Overrated. The clock is a beautiful in itself, but don't wait for the show it's not worth it. You will be disappointed.

Worth a trip to the top of the tower.. You can't really miss the town hall/clock if you're in the Old Town area. We came by a few times on our wandering around as it was close to our hotel and we always found it to be very picturesque, both night and day.I think it's worth noting that it's not worth going out of your way to see the mechanical show every hour. If you're in the area when it takes place, then there's no harm in hanging around but definitely don't force it in as part of your trip.You can go up the tower of the astronomical clock for a reasonable price and we thought this was definitely worth it. There is a lift or a spiralling ramp and some steps so it's suitable for all levels of fitness. We enjoyed going up the steps as there are information panels detailing the long history of the town hall and the tower. The views at the top are excellent, with all the major landmarks visible. We went at night time and found it very atmospheric.Didn't go inside the town hall as it was closed when we visited the tower but it is another option available to those interested.

Loved it. Not sure why, but I am obsessed with clocks and fall in love with this one. Although it's very popular to see it at the "top of the hour" the performance only takes 45 seconds and is a bit underwhelming. The truth is that this clock it is beautiful at any time of the day and also at night time. You could go to the top of the tower and actually there is the option to take the elevator (excellent for disable people). LOVED this clock-

Go to the top at sunset or after dark. We really loved the view of the city from the top of the Town Hall. We waited until our last night and would have come back for sunset if we'd had another evening. You get some really great night time views of the surrounding city. If you take the time to walk up (and avoid the elevator) you are treated to a pictorial history of the Town Hall that is fantastic. Each set of stairs seemed to have another set of photos and narrative about the tower. It was well worth the walk, and great exercise. The astronomical clock was fun to watch and free.
It worth the wait!. I have waited for so long to go up the astronomical clock and see the old rown square from above and it worth it. really, it did. So much fun. Another must see.

Interesting. Considering this dates back to the 12th century it was wonderful to go up the tower and see pictures from the history of how it's changed. Glorious views from the to as well. Don't wait for the second lift...take the stairs up and look at the historical pictures.
Worth a walk. Worth a walk and make sure to check out the clock at the stroke of every hour for a surprise show! :)
very old skool feel and authentic!. full of tourists and a lot of heritage! take lots of photos and there is like market shops selling local food & stuff!

Be there at the top of the hour; go up in the clock tower. The clock is beautiful to see any time, but the show is at the top of the hour. Get close enough to see the windows above the upper dial. The windows will open and you will see the various statutes meander by. It is a short show. But your visit to Prague will not be complete without witnessing this. There are fewer people present earlier in the morning than later in the day. Go up in the tower to take in the views of Old Town. You can get tickets in the small office at the base of the tower. The entrance to the tower is at the other end of the building on the same side as the clock. You take two elevators to get close to the top and take stairs the rest of the way. The outdoor area is a one-way (per clear signage) slow walk around while you wait for the person in front of you to take their photos and move forward, and of course, there are people who insist on walking the wrong way. You can stay as long as you like.

Expected something more. Based on reviews and stuff, I thought the 'top of the hour' was going to be a massive mechanical show. It wasn't.Although amazing and pretty cool to go up the tower itself, prepare to see the time, the Astro clock and the view. Built in the 14th century, it's very awesome.But don't expect a massive show.

The Astronomical Clock is a marvel...and fun to decipher. The astronomical clock was not meant to tell time! It was built to illustrate the supposed circumnavigation of the sun and the moon around the earth - and so has some very interesting details. Google the clock before you go, and try to decipher/"tell time" it with your family as you gaze up at this marvel. DO take the time to climb or take the elevator into the tower for spectacular views of Old Town Square.

Pathetic. What a joke. Yes it's historical, yes it's old, yes, many tourists come here, and yes — they all say after "what??? Is that all???". Yes, that's all. 2 seconds of a pathetic puppet show. If you're not quick enough even your camera's not going to capture the event. It's one of the most ridiculous things and places I have ever seen and been to in my life. I'd say skip it, but you won't be able to, as thousands gather in this old town spot to see the "wonder" for their own eyes.
Beautiful and insightful. Take your time as there are always lines but it is a beautiful spot. Recommended to check out both day and night
Crowded. A World Famous place that draws everyone here to see. a lot to explore around this square, await to hear the clock strike.

You have to see the clock chime!. You have to see the clock chime at least once while in Prague (it chimes every hour on the hour)! If you go inside the clock tower up to the second floor, they offer hour-long guided tours behind the clock tower. I highly recommend taking this tour in order to see all that is in the tower! There is a church, several banquet halls, a court-type room, underground tunnels, etc that you can only access on the tour!
Beautiful and amazing clock. The clock in the corner of the square is beautiful, it is best to visit with a guide who can tell you what all parts of the clock do.

An amazing. Clock. An amazing clock always busy with visitors standing and admiring especially on the hour to watch all the animatronicsToo many Skegways in such a small place for my liking and be aware an potential pick pockets here.But a must visit location when in town

Astronomical Clock; A fascinating work of medieval engineering.. This clock's fame is widespread and during our visit to the Old Town Square we checked it out. While the clock is very pretty and we were lucky enough to be there at the top of the hour and got the opportunity to see the glockenspiel show. It isn't much to see by today's standards (as my son made clear), but 600 years ago, the clock and the show must have marveled.

Not to be missed!. The Astronomical Clock quite rightly attracts hordes of sightseers eager to see what happens when each hour bongs. Fun and quirky, with the 12 apostles appearing in little doorways and miniature statues moving, the hourly performance is over within a couple of minutes, and if you're taking lots of photos, you might well miss some of it and have to return, like we did, several times! The Old Town Hall, despite being a payable attraction, attracts lots of visitors too, so you have to plan your visit inside for the quieter times. In our case, we went up the Tower early one evening, which, being dark December, meant no distant vistas across the city, but, on the plus side, excellent views of the Christmas Market in the square below, and the beautifully lit up old buildings. Great for night time shots of the city. The history of the building and the clock is explained on info boards on the staircase walls, and they are exceptionally helpful in picturing the building's history. The before and after war images of the Town Hall and clock are very enlightening, esp if you didn't have time for pre-holiday historical research. The modern lift is an interesting piece of technology itself, though rather small, I'm guessing, for the summer crowds. The whole building, Tower and Clock, shouldn't be missed when visiting Prague!

Very historic. The astronomical clock is such an iconic feature of Prague. On the hour, the apostles appear when the small doors open just above the clock. It's beautifully lit up. We didn't go to the top, but I imagine there are beautiful views of the square

Be there on the hour. Every hour on the hour, the clock's bell starts ringing, a skeleton "pulling the bell", two windows open and behind them, 12 apostles show one by one; it is an interesting display. The clock tower and the ORLOJ (clock), is beautiful. Some people see it as overrated but I guess they never bothered to find out how old this clock is and the history behind its making. There isn't another one like this.
History lesson with a view. Make sure to visit the inside of the Old Town Hall. A historical lesson (also in English) of the tower and Nazi occupation

Old town hall with a view. It is a graphic townhall that offers a scenic view of the old town of Prague from the top of the tower. If you want to go there and have more space and time to watch the view, try the late evening hours.
Timeless. Beautifully designed piece of art.You cant miss it with all the crowd gathering every hour to contemplate the show. Too bad when we visited it it wasn't fully functioning.

Real Treat to Stand in front of the Clock early in the morning before the Sea of Tourists Emerged. If possible, try to visit the astronomical clock early in the morning before the sea of tourists flood the square (because they will). It was wonderful being in front of the clock in the morning before all of the tourists emerged from the warmth of their hotels. Since we were in front of the clock early in the morning (it wasn't even that early - it was just a little after 9 am), we were able to take unobstructed views of and with the famed Astronomical Clock that was first constructed in the 15th century. Just an hour later, the swarm of tourists would have prevented that from being possible. We also enjoyed our visit to the astronomical clock in the evening. It was beautiful and looked as if it were glowing.The Astronomical Clock, which has been one of Prague's greatest treasures for 600 years, is located in the heart of the Old Town Square surrounded by exquisite historic and romantic buildings and is mounted on the wall of Prague's Old Town City Hall. During the Christmas season, the magical aura of the square surrounding the clock was intensified by the kiosks of Christmas markets that were lined up in the middle of the square. The kiosks sold all kinds of goodies, including souvenirs, trinkets, baked pastries and other baked desserts that emanated sugary flavors into the air as we walked by, candies, chocolate, hot mulled wine, and other yummies.The medieval clock does not display the time of the day. The clock had two dials: a calendar dial and an astronomical dial. The outer circle of the calendar dial describes each day of the year while the astronomical dial demonstrates how the universe was perceived 600 years prior with the earth at the center. It displayed the phases of the moon and the equinoxes. Each hour, the twelve apostles emerge two windows and nod to the swarm of tourists below.

Beautiful but overrated. OK, the building and clock are beautiful and an engineering marvel, but we cannot understand why literally hundreds of people gather every hour to see 'the show'. It only lasts 20"...
Very interesting clock. Very interesting to see all the movement of the figures on the hour. This clock has a lot of interesting history, worth a bit of research before you visit.
Great feature and a must see. Be prepared for 100s of tourists when you go after 11:00. Best time to visit is in the morning so you don't get run over by people, horse & carriage, old-timer cars etc.

Amazing atmosphere, even in winter!. No trip to Prague would be complete without seeing their famous Astronomical clock. It is very historic and a huge crowd gathers to watch it chime and the figures moving on the hour. Even in winter, it is a must see. Also, nearby is the old Henry tower that you can go up for amazing views of Prague and a restaurant, too.
Beautiful. Crowded over new years eve and a lot of random fireworks at close proximity, perhaps not to every ones taste. The next day the city cleaned up very well.

The medieval Astronomical Clock in Prague. The medieval astronomical clock adorns the southern wall of the Old Town City Hall in the Old Town Square. It announces every hour with 12 apostles passing by the window above the astronomical dial and with symbolic sculptures moving aside. That makes it a popular tourist attraction.Legend about clockmaster Hanus:The origin of the Astronomical Clock was misrepresented for centuries. It was believed, that the author was clockmaster Hanus, also called Jan of Ruze, who lived in the 15 th century. The story said that the clock was admired by many foreigners, but Hanus refused to show construction plans to anybody. When Prague Councillors found out that he was going to make another, even better clock, they became jealous and blinded him so he could not finish it. Later he allegedly damaged the astronomical clock in revenge, and nobody was able to repair it.Real history of the Astronomical Clock:The real author of the clock was discovered in 1961 in an old document, which describes the astronomical dial and says it was made by Mikulas of Kadan in 1410. He probably cooperated with the astronomer and Charles University professor Jan Sindel. The Astronomical Clock was repaired and improved by Jan Taborsky in the 16 th century. However, it became very faulty as time went by, and it was mostly out of order. It was even considered whether it should be liquidated in the 1780s. The clock soon stopped working for a long time. The major repair was inevitable and it came in 1865. The clock was modernized and a new Calendar Dial was painted by Josef Manes. In 1945 the German army damaged the Astronomical Clock and some of the statues burned. They were replaced by replicas later, and the striking of the clock was changed from the Old Czech Time to the Central European Time. The Astronomical Clock consists of the windows with apostles at the top, the Astronomical Dial, which is the oldest part, the Calendar Dial underneath and various sculptures around.
Magic town. I spent the new year's eve in Prague and it was absolutely magic. I definitely recommend to have a look at the town from the top of the clock tower.

The Heart of Prague. This is definitely the heart of Prague. With the Astronomical Clock on one end and St. Vitus on the other, this square is bordered by glasshouse cafes, restaurants, churches and a wonderful large cobblestone square to stroll and watch people. It is the center of action in my opinion. The clock is just mesmerizing and St. Vitus a definite beautiful Gothic landmark. It is a perfect spot to take a break and sit down in one of the outdoor cafes and watch people while you rest and sip something hot during the winter in one of the glasshouse type gas heated cafes, Some even provide blankets on the chairs! We visited during Christmas so the square was filled with kiosks of the Christmas Market offering hot mulled wine, sausages of all kinds, chocolate, candy, bakery, souvenirs, artisan's ware, general crafts usually involving bohemian glass, so it was a definite bonus. Beware because on special days like New Year's Eve (Sylvester for them) it becomes a swarming sea of people, multiple tours of 20 plus people and annoying tourists blocking the way while they take selfies with the extension sticks. Despite all this, it is the heart of Prague and worth visiting and spending some time there going up the Astronomical Clock Tower to take in magnificent views of the city or just spending time there, hanging about and getting a feel of this vibrant city.

interesting clock theme at top of the hour -- only 20 secs long. you can tell when the top of the hour is close, the crowds get to be huge (could be a pickpocket's dream). watch death chime the bells and the saints parade. fun to watch, but is only about 20 seconds long.

3 nights in the most beautiful city in the world. we arrived in prague on new years eve!what a treat!the old town looked georgious,with the xmas trees,the lights and the markets.although it was bittterly cold we stayed in the square to see in the new year,it was wonderful,we watched the astronimcal clock strike midnight with thousands of others,awasome!better than london,where some people dont know how to behave!there were lots of fireworks(no health and safety!)they were just let off by young kids,oh well yolo as they say!best nye ever,would definitely do it again,despite the cold!

Visit the clock ! . It is an important place to visit in Prague.Thousands of people are coming to visit this place anytime of the year, and we recommend it as you will have a perfect view and chance to take as many pictures as you want also to get the history knowledge of course.
Nice but too crowded. Beautiful place but too many tourists. Czech people extremely rude and maleducated! Wouldnt Wouldn't visit again

Stunning square in the heart of Prague!. With the added magic of Christmas stalls this was a very special experience for us. Beautiful, historic and romantic buildings all around us. Restaurants and coffee shops to satisfy all. I cannot imagine there are many places in the world that match this for sheer beauty and extensive history.

Beautiful! Head here just before the hour to see the clock in action.. Simply gorgeous clock, which, on the hour, has figurines that come to life and move about both within the clock tower and on the outside.You'll see crowds gathered just before the hour to enjoy the show.Very close to other major attractions as well, I was lucky to be there as the Christmas markets are still on, and it was snowing, such a lovely atmosphere to see the sights in!
Anti-climax. Advertised as a major tourist attraction, but very disappointing. There is always a crowd around the clock.

Interesting Centrepiece of the Old Town. The Square is crowded on the hour to watch the Astronomical Clock, the oldest working in Europe, and it is a cute though underwhelming display. But it is 600 years old. You must visit it.
Number One City Attraction. Despite the crowded area, this is the Meeting Point and Visiting Point everyone visitin Prague should see.

Fun to see when it isn't too crowded. Watching the clock was fun but the museum and going up the clock tower was even better. This is a much better experience when there aren't massive amounts of tourists. If you do have to go during the summer then go to the clock tower as early as possible.The architecture around the square is great too. After checking out the clock and the museum it was a lot of fun wandering around the old town for the rest of the day. There are some excellent and inexpensive places to eat a few blocks away from the crowds.

Amazing. If you reach Old Town Square and is wondering where the astronomical clock is exactly, look for a big group of people who are looking up and that would be it. It's an amazing clock, one of the highlights spots of Old Town Square.

Make sure and climb to the top!. Try and time your visiting of the clock tower right before the hour, as at each hour the bells ring and a little door opens where you can watch figures circling around in front of the opening. Afterwards, for a fee, you can climb to the top where you will get wonderful views of the old town. The old town hall was also interesting as there were photographs hung on the wall and information you could read on each level as you made your way to the top.
Fascinating story, but dull. It is well worthwhile getting to know the story behind this clock - it is trul fascinating. But I wouldn't bother spending too much time for the show.....

Old Town Prague. The old town is charming and fun to tour, New sights around every corner. Good places to eat, not expensive horse drawn calashes carry tourists around the area. Take your time and enjoy.

Underwhelming . 45 second display of virtually nothing. You of course have to tick it off your 'must see before you die' list (along with the thousands of other tourists) but you've been warned! Take a pic and move on I say. The inner workings and history of the clock is cool. Google it. Going up the tower.... You'll buy a ticket, then stand in a huge line for quite a while to get up there.

Key Thing To See In Prague. My wife, 2 kids and 2 relatives visited here in December 2015. The Astronomical Clock is mobbed with tourists and a huge crowd. You should be careful and look after your belongings here. I stood in the back just in front of one of the cafes where there were slightly less people and I felt more comfortable. When the clock struck 7 pm, the show began. You need to read your guide book to understand in detail what is happening (I recommend the Rick Steves guidebook) but it was a lot of fun to watch. I videotaped the whole thing with my iPhone. It lasted about one minute. The crowd was a little slow in dispersing so you have to be patient. I returned here on my last morning in Prague and watched it again. Same crowd and I took the same strategic position near the cafes in the back. For some reason, the show only lasted 40 seconds this time. Anyway, this is a must see during your visit to Prague.

Different perceptions of time. As everything in Prague, there's a meaningful (hi)story behind this attraction. It is interesting to observe the different perceptions of time that poeple had along the ages.

Beautiful Clock. The clock itself is beautiful, but the on the hour attraction of two little doors opening, with some wooden figures rotating, was a bit underwhelming. However, hundreds of people gather to watch this. The viewing tower is worth the climb.

Surrounding is more entertaining . Got there and was full of other keen eye tourists. Being shoulder to shoulder with strangers wasn't ideal to relax and take in the view. There were stalls there selling souvenirs, hot wine food and live music. Was a nice stroll through.

A must see in Prague. Historic center of the city. Worth the effort to climb the clock tower stairs to get great views of the city. There will be tons of people waiting on the hour to see the clock. Really not worth the crowd.

Clock is a unique and a must see. The apostles appear at the 2 windows above the clock on the hour. The complexity of the clock is a marvel of clock making. Read about all the information about time that the two clock dials present.

More history!. Our tour took us to this historical location as well. Amazing to see and be close to. There was a line to go up inside, so we only wandered around and enjoyed it from outside. We definitely recommend looking up the history and function of this awe inspiring feat of medieval engineering. It will add much to your visit.
Very interesting . Sat in the square and drank mulled wine and watched the world go by very relaxing. Clock very interesting also a lot of other things going on.

Heart of Prague. You have definitely to see this.The old town hall is amazing and you will feel welcome. It has a lot of music, food and people.The astronomical clock is an amazing construction and if you get to know how it works you will be amazed. I also recommend you to get up the tower of the astronomical clock, because you will get one of the most amazing views of the city.

Lovely old town centre. Very historic and beautiful and the clock is well worth waiting for the animated figures when it strikes the hour. However, because this is the centre and main street it gets very, very busy and hundreds of people stand around doing the same thing. Still, it's a "must do" at least once - after that you can avoid the centre and go round the side streets to get across the town. Nice atmosphere always in the town centre and people are friendly

Christmas at the Old Town. Awesome decorations and Christmas at the Old Town walking around and soaking the atmosphere.Christmas is good at the Square around this time because there are not so many people around but lots of things to do.I thoroughly enjoy the time here

A masterpiece!. The astronomical clock deserves its place as the top tourist attraction of Prague. Don't let the winter cold discourage you, it is worth the waiting, even though it lasts only a few seconds. It gets crouded so beware of pickpockets.
The astronomical clock is great!. When visiting the Old Town Square you will masses of crowds heading to watch for free the ticking of the clock and it's performance! You will find out why!
Very busy, but worth a visit. The clock is very busy during the moments it chimes but it is worth timing a visit so that you are walking past when it does

On everyone's must see list. If you don't want to stand in the crowd go to the Grand Café Praha, right across from the tower, for coffee and cake. The windows of the café are at the same height as the astronomical clock face so you have a great unobstructed view, over the heads of the crowd below, of the 12 apostle statuettes as the hour strikes. This is a big tourist attraction for reasons that are unclear to me but it isn't any more lame than a similar clock in Cologne, Germany and I made it a point to see that one too. Maybe everyone (like I was) is wondering why everyone else is there!
The old town/amazing clock. We spent the whole day outside, in the old town, Charles bridge, and there were also kerstmark.Super nice and cozy !!!

A must when in Prague. A trip to the top, either walking (and forget narrow claustrophobic stairs this one has paths inside or even an elevator) is a must, queue in December was almost none, came in within a few minutes, bit crowed on the narrow balcony surrounding the tower though. Lovely view over the city and a great history.

The clock is just fascinating.. Before I actually visited, I had read a lot about the clock and hall and knew I had to visit, even if it was just to say I have been there.It was just so beautiful ! The clock itself is amazing, the history behind it astounding and the hall is architecturally fantastic.Even if you go to view it for minutes, it is worth it.

Astronomical Clock. Lovely old clock in a beautiful area. A must see in Prague. Little tip - arrive early morning to climb clock tower for stunning views as the queues can become large as the day / evening goes on.

Must visit . We reached the Square around 6:55 PM and headed towards the Astronomical clock immediately. There was a huge crowd waiting for the strike of the hour to see the skeleton ring the bells. We were lucky to be there at the right moment. Plan to be at the clock at the strike of the hour of 'see' the bells ringing. View from the top of the tower is also not to be missed.

Nice but overrated . The clock is pretty cool but also overrated. It is pretty impressive for what it is, but the crowds around it each hour are more than are justified by what it does. Worth seeing once and moving on. Beware the pick pockets!

Part of history . The old town is offering an amazing view from the square. the climbing of the old town is giving us the chance to see the picture and read the story of the old town. It has been preserved correctly. If you are around the square, you should stop and wash the historical clock.

Travel dairies - Prague . Magnificent work of talented and gifted human made an amazing clock. It is a unique experience you can ask for . Make sure you are able to see the music placed during the hour change .

Magical Christmas experience. The square was magical on our first winters evening in Prague. Lighting, stalls and atmosphere created a unique experience. Worth the visit. And didn't disappoint when we returned in daylight to watch the clock operate.
Nothing spectacular . The clock is cool and and to take pics but to stand and wait for it to change hands is not worth standing in Jan weather for in my opinion.

No point to go up for the view. Except busy, crowded, and time-wasting, I couldn't find other words to describe my experience going up to the clock tower. The ticker seller locates in another place, rather than the entrance; therefore we didn't realize we should wait for one hour to go up to the tower due to many visitors. At least, while selling the tickets, the authority should mention how long would it be. Otherwise, visitors like us would feel cheated. Besides, if you want to appreciate the city view, there are more other spots worth to go. There is no point to visit the clock tower at all, waiting for an hour and taking photos for ten minutes.

Watching the clock. Only visit this if you are passing by when it is due to do its thing (which is on the hour) and don't judge it on today's technology because you will be disappointed. Judge this on the engineering skills of the time it was built and you will appreciate the amount of work that has gone into it.There are 4 statue that represent a Muslim, vanity, greed and death. Death rings a bell and nods, whilst the others shake their heads.Above the statues are 2 doors and there are 12 apostles that make an appearance.At the end the golden cockerel flaps it's wings and makes a noise. A trumpet player then plays at the top of the tower and gets an applause from the crowd once done.It takes about 5 minutes and draws in a big crowd.
Saw this square multiple times!. Prague is a bit elusive in terms of streets... they seem to move!!! So as a result of constantly getting lost, we always seemed to end up back there!! :-)

The Clock & Tower Impressive. The animatronics leave something to be desired. The astronomical clock and the tower in which it resides is impressive to say the least. Very hour the skeleton rings the bell and the figures move around. Everyone should watch the figures move around on the hour once. On the second hour watch everyone's face as they are disappointed by the figures. I'm sure this was very impressive a couple hundred years ago.

Enjoy the show!. Ok, so the clock striking on the hour is a little underwhelming, but the clock itself is completely unique and stunning. The view from the tower especially at Christmas time is utterly breathtaking, and if you're at the top of the tower on the hour a trumpeter comes out and plays a wee tune on all four sides of the tower.....fab!

Worth the one hour wait!!. Great views from the top of the tower You have to buy a ticket in one location at the corner of the clock and then re-enter the next buildingYou have to queue about an hour and 15 mins but worth it. You'll need your camera and take your time at the top to go around the viewing gallery

Very good for clock. It's hard to believe how many people remains in front of the astronomical clock of Prague. Located at tha heart of the old town in the most crowded point. It's very nice for clock.
Neat. Good but it is always packed every hour to watch the chimes which causes a backlog for people who have already viewed

Too crowded and touristy. I was very underwhelmed by the astronomical clock. I had read on several travel blogs to stay away from the clock due to the crowds and the fact that the clock does not "do" all that much on the hour. You would think that with the hoarded of people who crowd in to see this thing that it would be pretty spectacular but ssdly, that's. It the case.

Wonderful View. Stunning view of the city. We climbed up the tower rather then take the lift and it was great - there were pictures showing the history of the tower over different periods. Climb was easy - gentle slope (rather then stairs).

A must to see in Prague. When we came upon this place it was packed with people and Christmas markets. Everyone goes to watch the clock at the top of the hour. I must say when night falls the lighting of the buildings surrounding this area was breathtaking. They really know how to highlight their architecture. A lot of great food and you can go any direction from this point and find many things to do. Get your camera ready!!

Beautiful view. Lovely view from the top of the tower and excellent for pictures. We quite enjoyed it and it wasn't too terribly crowded. I would recommend the view at night but I'm sure by day it's lovely as well.
busy. The astronomical clock is very interesting however the area gets very busy and the queue to get to the top of the tower was always far to long, if you don't like queueing get there early.

If in a hurry avoid top of the hour. Yea, its neat especially if you bother to read about it a bit before getting there.
If all you need is a selfie, go there half anything. At the top of the hour the street can be packed by tourists sipping hot wine and snapping photos, waiting for something unique to happen... :-)

Symbol of the City. Every tourist shop has a collection of clocks modelled on the one in Old Town Square. Beautiful face and great views from the tower, but the hourly display is a bit disappointing. Two windows open and figures appear. A bit 'Dad's Army' but part of the charm of the city. Very, Very busy on the hour.

Impressive. The clock is brilliant. A work of art. The statues around the clock itself are also impressive. Find out about its history, a guided tour should provide you with the information you need to find it as interesting as I did.
Click Clock. Prague itself feels as you are set back in time. The clock was great and when the hour hits there is a small animation that takes place that is nice to see
A real must-see. Excellent views from the top of the tower - and an enlightening history to read on the posters and photos on the stairs back down (went up the easy way, by lift)
Good views from the top. Brilliant views of Prague from the top. Lifts are available or you can climb the stairs.go early as it gets very busy .

Fascinating. A must if you visit Prague
Great invention and I wondered why the world couldn't adopt this system. It would be fun and help us all slow down a bit more.

Worth to take a look around. You can have a unique view from the top of the tower. Consider that the catwalk is really narrow, just few people can have enough space to look around. It was 6 pm when two musicain played trumpet side by us, was really uniqe experience.

Nice. It's a lovely clock set in a beautiful building and if you are in old town why not stop take a break and have a look. It's one of those things that you can say you have seen whilst visiting Prague.

The clock is a work of Art. You can see this clock for free when just arriving in the square and its well worth it. Once every hour the doors open and you can see a statue of a guard inside with a musical instrument and a golden bird emerges to chirp away to the world. I would highly suggest buying tickets to look out from its highest point, no difference in price between day and night but there's roughly an hour wait at night but better photos my girlfriend tells me.its roughly £4.50 to visit per person and I think you can pay a little more to be allowed to visit the other attractions inside the building which may include some tombs and more I'm not sure.

600 year old tech. This was worth it to see knowing that they have never replaced the clock in over 600 years. Also astonishing to know the architect got blinded afterwards in order not to be able to copy the clock anywhere else
Got to see. If you go to Prague you've got to see this! It does get crowded at each hour but it's worth the wait!

A must-go. If you know what you re looking for, the clock itself is really amazing. Our tour guide said that the disappointment on people's face after the clock show is the best.... well, did see that. Very crowded, very very.

Central location and picturesque. A must-see when visiting Prague.
