Didn't go up the tower of the astronomical clock but just saw it from the square, great to see on the hour as it does a little show (I think people expected more as the crowd did laugh a little bit once it had finished), I wish I had researched it more so I knew what all the dials and faces meant. It is beautiful though and very intricate. The square itself was amazing, all decorated for christmas with stalls and street entertainers, lots of local food to try, restaurants, shopping, etc. And a gorgeous christmas tree which also does a light-show to orchestra music, very dramatic!Just gorgeous!
Another must see in old Prague. The square is magical and the clock fascinating. Many cafes and bars to rest, drink and watch the international crowds go by.
Beautiful Clock in the center of town!. Crowds tend to gather when the show happens every hour. It is really a nice monument in Old Town Square and certainly needs to be seen if in Prague.

Interesting. The Astronomical Clock in located in main Old square and you would not miss it. Every hour, there is a small mechanical show of sorts. All the touristy crowds seem to be congregated here. It is interesting for a short while - and you will anyway not miss it due to its main location.

Central Location with Street Performers. We enjoyed the postcard perfect Town Hall, Clock, and the general square. There were street performers and restaurants and shopping galore. Great location for spending an evening, morning, or afternoon.
Picturesque center of Prague.. Must see the clock turn on the hour. Locals and tourist together watch the walk of the apostles and other moving sculptures.

The clock is interesting. We didn't go into the Old Town Hall, so I can't comment on that, but we did examine the Astronomical Clock carefully as we have seen several, working and not working. This one still keeps time. It is very interesting as it has the old Czech numerals on it as well as modern numerals. It does an entertaining show when it strikes the hour, with death ringing his bell and other stuff happening.
fab. loved this went often and very quaint. Lots of crowds but didn't matter. Went at midnight on 24th Dec and it wasn't working!! Still great but funny.
Interesting piece of history. An interesting site, literally next to the main square so you can't miss it. It was built in 1410, and still works

Typical touristy stuff. While the clock tower has its own historical significance, as a tourist, it is quite typical of anywhere in Europe. Reminded on another similar clock in Bern. There is a 30 second display of mechanics etc of old times - which is interesting. Wait for the show if you are around, else watch on YouTube and you are done. Tons of very expensive restaurants nearby.

fantastic. beautifully decorated for christmas with a lovely look from the tower down on the square and christmas markets was nicer to go up by bight with all the lights shinning and glittering- we took the elevator up as its a long way up by stairs
Gets a bit cramped at the top. Great views over the square. Elevator is great with excellent information on the way down. Just be prepared for a tight squeeze at the top.
Cant go to Prague without seeing this. especially wait for the clock hour to go off so you can really witness the clock in action. there is an option to walk up the tower which we didn't try

Most unique outdoor clock.. It's only a quick show fo the clock's movement but it's worth the wait. The tourists waiting for the clock are also interesting as well as the locals in the square. It's the center of the the city where every one meets to start/end their day. You can spend the entire day here chillin and watching people.

Interesting Timepiece in Okd Town Square. When in Praha.... Do as the tourists do and get a neck ache as you watch the astrological clock strike the hour. It is beautiful to watch as the figures move on the hour. But the clock itself is a lovely design and wonderful photo op at any time of the day. We sat at a pub during the Christmas markets and had a great view of the clock.

A "Must" while in Prague, and non the worse for that. Czechoslovakia, as it was, must be one of the most historical places in Europe and the Astronomical Clock is one of its most famous attractions. It is now just over six hundred years old and. as such, is the third oldest such device in the world. It says much for the mathematical skills of our forebears that they realised that the positions of the planets in our solar system could be predicted centuries or even millennia ahead.There is a display every hour on the hour which draws huge crowds and lasts for over a minute if you wait for every stroke of the noon performance. If you want to photograph the whole event, and hundreds do, my advice is the watch it once and then do the videography an hour later. This is to find out which parts of the clock are animated which you might miss if you are not prepared.There is a tower there which you can mount and from which there are outstanding views of the town. That is a crowded attraction as well despite the fact that it incurs a fee. What is free is a view of the vast number of Segways which frequent the area (and a number of others in Prague). They could be a danger but I did not see any collisions and the skill of the more experience riders is worth seeing. It's a pity our namby pamby government in the UK won't allow their use in public places. In Germany they are authorised with their own number plates as actual vehicles and are probably the best way to see Berlin. Wake up UK! At the time of writing this we are less than a week away from 2016. Time to get modern.

Astronomical Clock is Disappointing. So the whole town square is really beautiful and the highlight of the day is suppose to be when the clock strikes and the puppets start moving around etc. its a 30 sec fiasco at best and not the most entertaining thing. If you are around when it happens then well and good. Waiting around for it may leave you disappointed
Must see from the top. On a clear day, one should not miss going to the top and have spectacular views of Prague. There is also a mini show of the 12 apostles each hour.
Xmas in Prague. We visited the square in the evening. Lots of people were there so we stood directly in front of the clock face or you would miss a lot of the action.

Interesting. You will be a little bit disappointed whilst waiting for the clock to strike on the hour. However, it's free to watch and something to do. The Astronomical Clock itself is very beautiful and the architecture is incredible. Worth the visit.

Magnificent.. Gather around with all the other tourists and watch the movement of the clocks figures on the hour. Fantastic. We were there on a very busy Christmas Market and it was packed! A must see. Turn around from watching the clock and find the White Horse restaurant. What looks like a normal outdoor spot is a historic cellar restaurant if you go inside. Great food and service in a unique setting. Entertainment starts around 8. Our group of six all enjoyed it.

Nice view from the tower. Visited here an early morning at 9 am. You could either take the lift or walk up, we preferred the latter where you could see various pictures of historical events. At the top it was perfect view and panorama for pictures. The morning fog disappeared and changed the view magically.
Amazing!. Such a fascinating and beautiful clock. A real treasure set in lovely old buildings. Go ten minutes before the hour to watch the chimes.

One of the highlights of visiting the old town (Prague) is seeing their massive clock. I wish I would have had more time to visit this venerable and historical site. It was a sight to behold, but I guess I'll just have to cite the opinions of others. (Why didn't I think of using all three homonyms for site earlier??? call me crazy.)Of course, there is much else to see as you walk around the square, waiting for the next chiming of the clock.

A unique ancient astronomic clock in Europe!!. Come at one hour o'clock and the figures will come out. Very beautiful and unique. One of the spheres shows the different situation of the moon and the sun. The other sphere represents the months during the year. You have to see it!!

Tower good but Clock chime a let down. The Astronomical Clock itself is beautiful and a lovely architectural building. On the hour it chimes and crowds will gather to watch. I personally would say it wasn't as I expected and I wouldn't have rushed to get a good spot, was quite underwhelming. Whilst everyone is watching that (I recorded it... took 1 minute, 33 seconds, and my phone couldn't even see what was happening) go up the Clock Tower where you can view out over the Old Town Square and across some of the city. Beautiful views and where we went at Christmas time was very pretty with the lights and looking at the markets down below. Makes for some great scenic pictures and a good ol selfie! Very cheap to go up. Can walk up. There is a lift to the level of where the clock tower starts or alternatively can take the stairs if your not a lazy unfit cow like me. As for going up the tower, again there is a lift that shoots straight up the middle. If you didn't wish to take the lift, its a gentle slope going round and up with a slight incline, so better than stairs. I did the lift up and walked down as there are some little windows you can stop and peer out of for more lovely views and picture memories! Enjoy!

Nice clock and tower. The tower is very nice with excellent views from the top. After passing the ticket scan to enter the tower I suggest to walk up to the top using the ramps. It is fun to walk up there and the Ramos are not steep.As for the clock, it is nice to see especially at the top of the hour. It gets very bust at that time. Do not expect a big show, but it is certainly wonderful what you put things in perspective and know that this clock was built hundreds of years ago.

Surely everyone who goes to Prague must see this?. Even in December the square was busy, beware of Segway riders, they're quick but quiet.The square looks amazing in all the decorations, the tree, the lights...Of course as with much of the Old Town, beware of the cobbles!I kept missing the clock striking, but next time I will be sure to watch the action!

stunning clock!. This clock is very beautiful but something amazing is meant to happen on the hour every hour. We watched it 3 times and didn't see anything. It wasn't until we watched what happens on the Internet we saw what happens and wasn't exactly blown away. That aside, it is a stunning clock. I am glad we saw it and it is very unusual as it's astronomical and the 3rd oldest of its type in the world built in 1410. It is also the only one which actually works .

Loved the clock but skipped the tower and hall due to long waiting lines . The astronimical clock is absolutely beautiful and worth a visit. We would have liked to visit the hall and tower but skipped this due to very long waiting lines. We where there around noon, probably better to visit early in the morning or late afternoon

Good tour . We took a tour of the astronomical clock and the old town hall it too about an hour and was pretty inexpensive in comparison with other tourist things in Europe. The tour was very informative. The guide spoke good English, not great, but good. The top of the clock is a must, it was a little crowded, but it is Christmas and a lot of tourists are out I guess. You also get to see the apostles, that are part of the clock as it strikes on the our, from the inside. Very cool. Go here.

Remarkable Timepiece. One of the must see attractions on Prague. Not only is the clock a beautiful time piece but it "reads" many other functions that I cannot begin to describe. Every hour there is a glockenspiel like procession of the 12 apostles. As a bonus you can climb or take an elevator to the top of the clock tower where you will have spectacular views of the city and square.
Fabulous atmosphere. A must do clock performance , especially after dark to appreciate its illuminated colours. Then pop up the tower for some fantastic views of the Christmas market and square

Amazing clock work and historic surrounding buildings.. Awesome area surrounding the magnificent clock but stay away from the so called"authentic Czech cuisine" restaurants! Their prices are "astronomical" and the foodhas nothing to do with Czech cuisine.Beware of restaurant,taxi and shopping prices because you will be easily cheated bydishonest merchants,restaurateurs and taxi drivers!!Also watch your pockets in crowded areas where pickpockets make a good living just like in any other mayor city in the world.The clock is an amazing feat of workmanship and you'll enjoy the parade of characterswhen the hours strike.Hard to believe it was made a few centuries ago and still worksto perfection! A must see while in Prague.

Hot mojitos and tick tock the clock. Whole area is really beautiful (and of course crowded) at Christmas time. I love Astronomical Clock and story behind it. Boyfriend thought it was quite small:-) It is nice to have so many restaurants just nearby, so you can warm up with hot mojito in your hands and wait to see the "clock characters" to appear.

Worth to be there Super Early to Beat the Massive Crowd. I loved this Astronomical Clock a lot. And I think it is the best features of our Prague visit. It is astounding to imagine its engineering that time and the fancy clock face is full of art. I enjoyed the hourly chime too, though I don't think it worth to wait & do nothing just for the chime. Timing the visit to the nearest possible hour is better & more productive things to do.The only thing is that this part of the old town is always loaded with lots & lots & lots of people; especially during the hourly chime. It can be so crowded that I hate to be there. The best time to enjoy this attraction is early in the morning. There were almost nobody when we were there at 8:00am last few days.

The heart of Prague. As the main touristic place in Prague, there is no skipping this one. The town hall is beautiful, with important historical buildings around it. During christmas the lights make the place extra charming. The clock itself is somewhat disappointing if you're seen other clock before, but the view from the tower is worth the waiting time. It is worth taking a tour here as there are a lot of historical facts you might miss otherwise. Only downside might be the crowd, although at night there are not that many people.
Fab!. Definitely worth a visit to the top of the Town Hall - especially at night, you get to see and experience fantastic views.

Great views from the top, cool clock. Prague's astronomical clock is the oldest working in the world. We were walking around Old Town Square and decided to do the tower since we noticed people were taking pictures from the top. We also happened to be 10 minutes from the top of the hour so decided to wait and see the clock move. It was cool, but you're not missing much if you don't see it. The tower is the best part because the views from the top are amazing! It was not busy when we went, and we took the elevators up and down without having to wait in any lines. Roughly $5 to go up, so not expensive at all.
nice place to visit. this place is nice but it is a one visit only place no much to see but u will enjoy the atmosphere there.
Beautiful. Every hour thousands of people gather round to watch the various things come out of this eye popping old clock If in Prague you must pay a visit

Great Clock but Terrible Crowds. Yes, the Christmas Market was on. And if that was the reason for the dangerously overcrowded square I am glad it is not like that throughout the year.The clock itself is interesting and contrary to what many say (especially guides) it is not all that difficult to learn the basics of how it works (at least to being able to tell the current time). Also wish there had been more readily information (guides?) about the fascinating history of the clock and how even though it was started 600 or so years ago, what we see now is of more recent vintage.
Views from the Astronomical Clock. Definitely worth a visit outside on the hour each hour to see the movement but the best is the views from the top of the tower across the city!

The clock. As we were walking around Prague we came across this very fascinating clock. It is a clock that still works from the Middle Ages and the third oldest astronomical clock that still works. The clock strikes on the hour with the apostles and also it has the zodiac signs and the world famous skeleton chasing time. It reminds me of a Hugh cuckoo Clock. The tower is available to climb to the top. You can get some wonderful views of Prague. You do have to pay for this but on a clear day it is worthwhile. Again bring you comfortable shoes. There are shops and eateries around which are great especially After you experience the beautiful views.

A little explanation of how the clock works. The astronomical clock is one of the coolest things here in Prague and what's even cooler is that you can spend about half an hour reading up about it and understand a lot of how it works, and once you do that you would appreciate it a million times more than what you would without understanding it. So, here goes a brief and hopefully easy explanation from what I've learned. First, an astronomical clock is a generic term used for a clock that tells you about the sun, moon etc. in addition to the time. What's amazing about this is that when this clock was made about 600 years ago people used to think that earth is at the center and the sun and moon revolve around it, so if you see the top dial called the astrolabe, you'll see a blue background which is the earth and on top of that there is an arm with the sun on it and another one with the moon on it. Look at the sun first, and you'll see it is in one of the signs in the inner dial. These twelve signs represent the sign of the zodiac and they are the same signs that we use today and you can Google up which image represents what sign. I was lucky in that we went in December which is my birth month, I'm Sagittarius and the sun was in the Sagittarius sign, so cool! Now, look at the other hand, that's the moon. That also falls in one of the zodiac signs, you can Google up to see where the moon is when you go and then find the moon in the same sign when you visit. The second cool thing you can see about the moon is that this clock shows you which phase the moon is in! When we went it was almost a full moon so most of the moon is white, and only a little part at the bottom is dark. I think the half moon would look so cool on this. The third thing it shows about the moon is its relative position to the sun. Now let's go to the time. Look for the golden hand and where it is on the dial with the Roman numerals. This is the common civil time which is almost the same as we tell time. Our clocks just have twelve numbers and this one has twelve numbers repeated twice, but if you go at 8, the hand should be around VIII so you should be able to read this immediately. The hand with the star tells you the sidereal time which is a bit complicated and I didn't quite understand it. Now, to the lower dial which is called Máneś calender plate. Here, you see twelve paintings which represent the twelve months of the year. In January a child is born, February, farmer warms his feet by the fire etc.  You can Google all the paintings and then check it out on the clock, it's very wonderful. Inside of it shows another zodiac sign which is a different design from the top and quite beautiful as well. Now for the simple stuff. At the stroke of every hour, the twelve apostles show up in a procession on the two windows at the top. This is a big crowd puller but I'd say this is quite underwhelming for most people who don't really know what to expect. The real beauty of the clock is in the other things that I described earlier in my opinion. There are four sculptures which represent four negative things. Left most is vanity depicted by a man looking at his mirror, to his left is a miser holding a bag of gold, then comes death which is a skeleton and lastly there's a guy who represents lust, but I'm not sure how he's doing that. At the bottom are four positive things: philosopher, angel, astronomer and chronicler. There's a rooster at the top of the clock as well but God knows what he's up to. Phew, that was long. I have touched upon all the major things that I found really fascinating and easy to understand about this clock. I hope this will add to how much you appreciate it and enjoy it!

Beautiful clock, but not worth the wait.. The clocks is fairly close to the ground, what makes it easy to look at it. It's a beautiful masterpiece. Every hour on the hour, the doors above it open and some mythical christian guys appear, but really, not worth the wait.

Use your time well.... I just wanted to take so many pictures as possible. Later I noticed I have had not enough energy to observe the many details of the clock. So I must go to see it for the second time ....

Finally not busy. I've visited Praha almost every three to four months over the last two years and I've never actually visited the Old Town Hall until this past November. The crowds, lines, and overall buzz around the clock is too much for someone who can risk visiting it "next time". It offers a beautiful and unique view at night and we were able to sit upstairs for about 10-15 minutes due to the low attendance. Summer is going to be a headache, but I highly suggest spending the roughly €10 for two people to ascend the tower and peak out! We held our baby the entire time and left our stroller at the bottom where it was watched by the cashiers. A little freaky getting to the edge with her, but all in all safe and doable!

Old Town Hall. The Old City Square is a must visit in Prague. It's always packed with people, including several entertainers in the street. Also, there are several tours you can start from here (such as hop-on-hop-off buses, segway tours, and walking tours). From there you can reach many other areas of the city with a short walk. It's a great meeting point, if you're able to find each other among the crowd.

Stunning!. We arrived late afternoon when the Christmas markets and people were out and the square was magical in many ways. This us a beautiful tower/clock but has an elevator! And views even at night were spectacular. A DO NOT MISS attraction.

Brilliant Clock and Views. The astronomical clock is amazing, it pays to check out what the dials are beforehand. It also pays to be outside the clock before the hour as when it strikes the hour the 12 apostles rotate around the upper windows PLUS the skeleton nods and strikes a bell. Ride the lift up and take the ramp down, easier on the legs. The views from the top of the bell tower are just brilliant, especially with the Christmas fair below with the Christmas tree and singers. The Christmas market was varied between food stalls and decorations stalls which was a really good mix. You must try the warm apple cinnamon cider and mulled wine - a real treat.

Fantastic cultural architecture - steeped in history. Crowds gather before each hour just to watch the antique figures make an appearance in the clock tower as the hours chime out over the market place below. Another "must see" in Prague!

Great Views!!. We took the lift up to the Astronomical Clock tower at around 3.30pm. There was a queue to get up to the tower as most people wanted to get the sundown/sunset shots. We managed to get up there by 4pm, at which point the Christmas tree in the square light up with a song/light display. Definitely worth seeing from the tower! The views are great so make sure you do this!

I'll quote my tourguide: the second most dissapointing attraction in Europe. Well, you've got to see it. That said, don't get too excited. Not all of it works, and the crowd is enormous. It is beautiful as a piece of art, and pretty cool, but doesn't live up the the hype. (The tourguide's most dissapointing attraction? Brussels Boy. We agree.)

Wonderful and great square nearby. The Christmas market was in the square right next to it when we went and was wonderful! The clock was a nice site and you are even allowed up in the tower, which I highly recommend.
The best views. Amazing views over the whole city, climb up it's worth it! The prices were fairly cheap and you can use the elevator up if needed

Great views! and a lift to the top. Fantastic rooftop views of Prague. Worth the climb or the lift if your knees are past it.It gets a bit crowded at times but you can move around OK. I loved it that the Authorities are not into the Nannying mind set that the UK has and allowed the tower just to have it's original wall to stop you falling over the edge. In the UK you would be behind "Persex" sheets to stop you ending it all.

Lovely history of the clock!. The mechanical ingenuity of the times early 15th century is amazing! when it broke it was not able to fixed for decades since no one had the skills except the original clock maker who had already passed away.

Clock a site to be seen. Clock was interesting if you can understand when it was built and what it does. Everyone was waiting for the hour to strike but it was a disappointing show but still worth it to visit
Read about it!!!. At first I did not understand the fascination with the hourly performance of the clock, but once it was explained to us by our guide, we understood and were amazed!!!

Very old clock. Each hour a crowd gathers. If you film clock chiming do use a stand. However, it is better to watch the show as some action is by the small statutes around the clock. You can always describe the action later.
Lovely views from the top of the tower.. Lovely views from the top of the tower. If you are lucky you may see a wedding as city hall next door.

Outstanding . Impressive technology, creativity for its time, the astronomical clock has always a lot of people enjoying the mobility of figures as well as the Precision it manages of day and night, a must see in downtown.

Historical Building with a good overview. Seeing the centuries-old Clock is a great event. Getting up to the tower and enjoying the view is really woth the 120 Krones.Especially at nighttime-it is open till 10 pm.
Must see. We have a painting of it in our house so it was great to see the real thing , old simple magic clockwork

Great Xmas atmosphere. . Lovely variety of markets. Great entertainment. Explore the little side streets to find other small markets and lovely restaurants. Beautiful buildings. Night scenes beautiful.

a must to see. Right in the middle of everything in the old city this is clearly one of the main tourist sites of Prague. We didn't have time to go in or up the clock tower but I've done it before. Round about is the square with great cafes to rest up, beautiful crystal shops and an open market etc.

Boast with your cultural savvyness. The Astronomical clock in Prague is the oldest one of its kind that's still in operation. There is even a copy of it in Seoul.
Even if you're not into astronomy or clocks, this is definitely worth taking a look.

Interesting and with great view. We visited the Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock on our first day and it was a great start of our visit. We were able to take pictures of the city from different angles. We saw beautiful Prague on a lovely night and also enjoyed looking at the town square filled with people waiting for the clock to hit the hour as they watched the changing of the saint figures.

Walk to the top of the tower and view all of Prague. The walk to the top of the tower, via easy sloping romper there is a lift, is worth it for the view over all of Prague. Time it BEFORE the hour strikes as people gather to watch the clock show on the hour and then rush into to walk up the tower. I thought the Astronomical clock was interesting, based no the fact it was designed so many centuries ago, so make sure you are there a few minutes before the hour to see it, during your travels around this mazing old town.

Pretty just packed . So this is great, super pretty with great views from the top.The astronomical clock was awesome and we watched it tick on the hour.The only problem is it was fully packed when we went and the people can be pushy
xmas treat. with the xmas market, singers ,street performers the smells of the timber fires they cook most the food on barbques out side great place to go beore xmas
Most photographed clock tower. One can just enjoy people watching in this part of the city. It is fun observing people from all ages enjoy the show each hour.
Worth a visit. We visited in December when the Christmas markets are on and it's great, would like to pop back in the summer. Very picturesque, lots of bars and places to visit

Must Go Up!!!. If you are already in Prague, the one thing you will regret if you do not do is not going up to the clock.The historical tower will give you the most beautiful view of Prague. It look absolutely like fairytale land. You ought to come up to see it for yourself. We are totally in love with the views from up there.

Astronomical Clock. They say it's an overrated tourist attraction. But if you're in Prague I think this is worth your visit. You'll be standing where people back in the 14th century first saw this majestic clock.

Lots going on. We waited for the hour to see the clock and it is worthwhile however on camera there is so much going on, need to be back a bit to get the best view I only concentrated on the hatches at the top but missed the other figures further down the skeleton ringing the bell for example, suggest just watch the whole spectacle first before trying to photograph it.

some good information. Only guided tours available here, which I'm not a fan of, I like my own speed of looking at things. This was no exception, I found this a bit boring and unnecessarily long. Also could have been a more interesting exhibition, felt like the place wasn't taken care of properly. Staff was really nice though, so maybe that's just me.

Historical Tower. Best time to visit is early in the morning to avoid crowds. It it not easy to climb The final spiral stairs to to top of the tower. The views are amazing from the top of the tower. Walk slowly around the tower and take lots of pictures. The walk down is very nice with pictures with descriptions all around to help show the story of the Clock tower. The other rooms are an additional cost but to see the apostle figures close is very nice. You should buy tickets and enter by the tourist office not the door under the clock face since that will get very crowded. Also purchase the Prague card in the same tourist office to save alot of money on other sights as well. We could not find the Prague card our first 2 days so it was not worth the purchase later. The Astronomical clock is one of the top sights in Prague and to be inside it is an awesome thing to experience.

Beautiful historical gigantic timepiece. Read a little about this timepiece to fully appreciate what you are seeing. The accuracy and complexity is astounding. The size is overwhelming. 2-3 stories high. The character movements on the hour along with the chimes have meanings for each of the characters you see. Stay after the crowd disperses to examine it features closely.
Magical . This is a must see when visiting Prague! We loved seeing the spectacle. We were lucky enough to have a guide telling us the history of the click and also the legends that surround it!

Magical!. We didn't know what to expect as this was a last minute side trip from Bavaria. We spend two days walking around old town square, very romantic. The clock was amazing, just wish it wasn't raining. But you can't control mother nature! Lots of trinket shops, so didn't buy anything. It would be great if they would include more local arts instead of just the cheap trinkets. I could have walked the bridge every day, it was so relaxing and magical.

Beautiful Clock. The clock is absolutely beautiful! Everyone should be there at least once on the hour to hear the chimes. Now there is a wonderful Christmas market in the square below adding to the charm of the whole area.
December Visit 2015. Wonderful Architecture, a delightful place to visit, sit and have a coffee or a, very reasonable, Czech Beer and marvel at this beautiful building.

Magical Christmas market. Just returned after visiting the Christmas markets. I must say that the market set in the old town hall was one of my favorites. Beautifully decorated it was truly magical. Be aware it is extremely crowded after nightfall
Essential. A beautiful and amazing astronomical clock to be seen on each hour move. The visit of old town hall is essential to understand the story of the city.

Beautiful Biews Of The City. Stunning views of the city and an easy walk to the top of the tower. Very interesting information boards on the way up to the top and a lift if you don't fancy the small winding staircase towards the top. Lovely attraction to fill 30 minutes of your day.

The Clock is Amazing!. You must see the clock in action on the hour every hour! Many people like to be there at noon since that is when it chimes the most and is the most active! You must see it to believe it! One of the highlights of my visit to Prague!!

Gorgeous clock and elegant City Hall. We loved looking at this gorgeous clock 'perform' on the hour at night with crowds of people around and the City Hall was very elegant as we visited it during the day earlier.

A must see in downtown. This astronomical clock is an impressive piece of engineering art and it is decorative too. I love the main place since it is a vivid spot where people gather all over the year. At the moment there is the Christmas market with lovely food and tasty mulled wine.

Beautiful but that's it. The old town square around it is beautiful but the clock isn't that impressive, we didn't understand what's all the excitement around it. It beautiful but that's it, it's not really impressive and exciting to wait for the dolls every round hour...

Not worth it . People wait too long for a very simple thing and in a very crowded place I would just enjoy it if I'm already sitting in one of the restaurants that are right in front of it an still it is not s very good show.

Beautiful clock. The astronomical clock is very special and nice to see. But to love prague and it's buildings and corners you have to know about the history. This place is one of the most special ones in the city when your interested in the history.

Unforgettable views of Prague. I didn't have a tour of the whole Town Hall, but paid 120K (under £4) to ascend the tower. Because it had to be rebuilt after wartime destruction, it actually has a lift! However, there are conventional steps, an interior ramp way and very tight spiral staircase if you fancy more of the medieval experience! I tried both! The walkway also has photos and info about the history of the tower and astronomic clock. From the top, you enjoy a 360 degree panoramic view of Prague and the surrounding hills. The balcony can be a squeeze with all the selfie sticks but it's worth it, especially with the Christmas tree, etc, in the square below. If the weather's bad, you can enjoy the panorama through clear glass. Highly recommended!

Worth going into the Tower. We watched the clock several times and it's very cute, but draws a lot of crowds especially considering that it's such a short display. We chose to go up into the tower and got some spectacular pictures of Prague! It was well worth the $4.75/pp entrance fee!

A true landmark of this city. Interesting to see day or night on the hour every hour. Always a very large gathering of people awaiting the on the hour show.
I
Quite lovely. Being in the Old town main square this is something not to be missed. Need to be quick to get a good unobstructed view for a photo.

Mostly for the amazing view. Everyone can watch the spectacule of the astronomical clock from the Square which happens at every hour on the hour, when the figures flanking the clock are set in motion. Honestly, I was a bit disapointed, everyone was like "go see the clock working, you have to go!", and then it was just like one figure ringing a bell for like 1 minute, and the others spinning around. It was fun, and you should see it, but don't expect a magical show. Went to visit the tower inside, very cool to climb to the top. It's a good climb, but it has an elevator too :) For me it was only worth it for the amazing view of the city from above, but if you went to other places where you can see the city in the same way, like the Astronomical Tower in the Klementinum, the view it's similar, or even better, so it may not be worth the ticket.
Amazing monument. It's even mesmerizing. Just spend some minutes contemplating it.Super beautiful and full of history

#1 Must go in Prague. This place we couldn't miss. It is amazing works from the past. We were there in December, so we enjoyed very much the Christmas market in the old town square. In the second night, we decided to go to the top of tower, we ended up waiting for an hour in the queue. But once we got there, the view from the tower was really unforgettable. Worth the long queue.

Must see historical building.. Very interesting historical building. The views from the tower are fantastic, but not for vertigo sufferers. For those physically able I would recommend using the stairs as the story of the building is told on different levels.
Touristy but very popular. Everyone calls it very touristy. Everyone makes a visit too. One of the most photographed places in Prague.

The icing on the cake. The some of the beauty of Prague is obvious the stunning river, the impressive castle, the great restaurants but this unique spectacle brings out the pure charm of the place, Can get crowded but that's part of the atmosphere.

Overrated, unless you understand it. Don't go and see the clock without first learning something about it or you will be disappointed. You need to understand what the clock does, the stories the figures tell and how it works. Without that, while it's pretty to look at, you will be totally underwhelmed by the experience of the "performance" on each hour. With understanding, you'll realise it is very special.
One of the best parts of Prague. This area is a hub of tourist activity! But, once you've fought off the crowds, it's a great place to visit. The astronomical clock is very impressive!
Well worth a visit. Beautiful architecture, great selection of bars and restaurants and at this time of year home to the largest Christmas Market in Prague, well worth a visit!
Good view of Prague. Recommend taking the lift up the clock tower and then walk down the inner walkway. See pictures of bombing during Second World War. Views from the top are awesome.

You have to see it. You cannot visit Prague and not go to see the Astronomical Clock. Always appeared to be very busy at the hours. Large crowds seemed to attract unsavoury characters, just be aware when standing watching the clock strike

Great views from the top of the tower and surpising tour. Frankly, we expected less from the Old Town Hall. The site looks small from the outside but the tour lasted a full hour and was great. We took our tour in spanish and were very happy with the guide. Despite she mentioned that it was her first spanish tour, it was great. Really take the tour

Nice square. Christmas is better in that square. It was so vibrant and the way they celebrate is quite easy to get used to. It is best if you get some of the history of the city to enjoy it to the fullest.

Ancient engineering that still works!. Marvellous example of how they did stuff right in the old days. It works, it has lasted and folks flock to see it do its thing every hour. The bell ringer is particularly appropriate under the circumstances.
Confused. Watched the clock in action 4 or 5 times - couldn't quite figure out all the parts of it but it was amazing anyway.

The clock tower is the center of the old town square. The clock itself is worth the visit- an old medieval clock with interesting sculpturing, it also chimes eac hour. Climb the tower and you have the best views of all of Prague! The climb is easy- it is a ramp rather than stairs, and they have added a pictorial history as you walk up.
Always a crowd and a cheer. It is a lovely old clock and no doubt very clever, but after all the fuss and the crowds every hour I'm afraid I was a bit underwhelmed . Everyone else seemed to love it!

Unlike any other. If you find yourself in the old square just before the hour it's well worth waiting around to see the clock strike. It's unlike any other clock I have seen, highly recommended as a little addition to your day.

Precise clockwork. You should wait for the top of an hour and look at the show constructed hundreds years ago by Mr. Hanuš. His precise work is operational up to date and I bet that you cannot catch all the movements during one session.When it's a less crowdy (around half each hour), you can try to find all information, which this clock offers. And then you can visit a tower and overlook Old Town square from higher perspective.

Hourly shows when the clock strikes. The decoration on the clock is well worth a look but it comes alive every hour on the hour and several figures including a skeleton become animated and perform basic movements.A fun few minutes but should not be missed.

Definitely have dinner here and explore but.... The Astronomical clock was a bit overrated. I apologize for my ignorance but what is the big deal about those things coming out every hour from the clock that all the tourists are lined up just waiting for it. Have you never seen a cuckoo clock before! Same concept just on a bigger scale. The 4* is for enjoying the square nearby and just sitting there and having dinner, not for the clock itself.

Well worth the climb. Offers great views over the city following a bit of a climb up the steps. There is, however, a lift if you didn't feel like the exercise. One tip would be to go about 10-15 minutes before the hour as many people seem to watch the 'display' on the hour and then head up the tower leading to long queues. (When we were coming down at about a quarter past the queues would have meant a fairly long wait)
Spectacular. Enjoyable both day and night. Clock gets a bit crowded on the hour when the bells toll. A must do though. The Christmas markets here are great. Nice food.
Old Town Hall. Lovely views from the top of the tower. Very reasonable 110 crowns. Well worth a visit on a clear day.

Cool but not amazing. The building itself and the astronomical clock have a cute design, and the story about the clock is interesting. But after waiting for long time to see the clock show, we kind of expected something more exquisite. But still, the pictures look very nice ;)

Go up the tower ! There are lifts !. This is a place with alot of stories to tell. Yes, the astronomical clock is stunning (don't just look at the Apostles, look at the figures around the clock too). It can get crowded.Take some time to read the wall plaques - there was a battle here on VE Day, and the Germans won (unfortunately).If you do decide to walk up the tower (it's a sloped walkway) there are plenty of wall boards explaining the history of the place.We'd go back.

Interesting place to walk around, even in the rain. We found our way around using the hop on, hop off bus, as we were told taxi drivers were not the most upstanding citizens and would try to rip us off. Loads of interesting architecture to see, and the locals were very helpful when we asked how to find places.

Very Cool--try catch all the movements!. We spent 2 "watch'' in front of this amazing old tower clock and still think we missed some of the moving parts. It is very interesting and extremely crowded. Fortunately, the second time we got wise and some of us staked out a good viewing spot, while the rest of us held down an great table with a view of the clock, from a nice little sidewalk cafe in Old Town Square.

AMAZING CLOCK. Stand in the square with all the hundreds and hundreds of tourists and soak in the atmosphere of this amazing clock and all the surrounding beauty. As it nears the hour crowds gather to listen to the chimes. It's spectacular and is one of the most striking buildings in Prague. Well worth a visit.

A lovely sight. This is a great attraction. The detail on the clock is astounding and you should allow yourself time to stop and look properly rather than just in passing. You can go inside for a more thorough exploration.

Fun Sight. While in Prague you have to see the Town Hall and its Astronomical Clock performance. My favorite part, however, was the view from the tower. I would say it's unmissable, especially since there is an elevator for those who can't climb tons of steps! The hourly clock performance isn't super impressive, but it's kind of fun to see the figures surrounding the clock move and the saints parade by above. And what's really interesting is watching the crowd during the performance - every tourist in town seems to be in the square for the show.

Breathtaking. This place is full of good pubs and cute little cafes that make you feel like never going home!I walked around with a traveller I had met on my trip, and we stumbled upon this open air concert. Sadly, we were unable to remember the name of the artist and band, but there were really good! Plus, there was free beer and breadsticks!We went to a few pubs (cheap beer, and good vodka bulls), had nachos at a cafe, and then dinner consisted of the famous fried cheese basket! Yum :)

Always fun!. What's not to like? A skeleton ringing the bell and a rooster crowing. Walk out of the square down the small alleys for the best food. And consider a ride up the U Prince roof top bar for a view from above.

The clock everone likes to see. We have seen thus clock twice now and people gather around on the hour. Lovely ti see and here the chimes going. There is Christmas sralls around this and you can also go up the tower worth a visit. Lots of shops and restaurants around this area.

Interesting. On every hour, the astronomical clock not only chimes but windows open up in the tower and miniature figures are shunted around in procession. Impressive given that it was built many hundreds of years ago. Well worth a visit.
A classical must. Beatiful astronomical clock located in the famous Old Town Square - lot of restaurant around and cafes.
right as the clock struck 1300. saw all the figures moving the square was packed with people worth getting there for the right time very easy to find

Highligh of the day. Superb view, historical value and a must see for all visitors. Just remember to buy a ticked before entering, and have local currency available. The ticketdesk did not accept Euro and cards.

Most famous spot in Old Town. Watch your time and be here on the hour to enjoy this amazing clock. Worth the trip and the cafes around there are a wonderful place to take a break and have some coffee.

Beautiful. You will not pass by without noticing the astronomical clock in the old town in Prague. Beautiful monument. What probably not all people do is visit the tower. It is a must. Go up to the clock and try to be there at the hour. Seeing all the people below watching the clock show is quite impressive. The view of the city from the top is as well very beautiful. A well deserved visit.

Wonderful view of the town. Buy a ticket and walk your way to the top. First of all, start with the stairs. If you choose the elevator, and there is a queue, you are sent down to the start of the queue ... so why not come from the right direction. When in the clock tower, we chose the stairs also here, lots of history on the pictures on the wall if you want. On the top, an absolutely wonderful view over the city of Prague. A "must see" in Prague.
visiting Tower. good view over the city and it has an elevator :-)not suited for those in a chair however as you do need to use some stairs on some places (but hey it is an historical building :-) )

Amazing. You will no doubt visit the clock when in Prague and decide for yourself how good it is - the detail is incredible and if you are patient you can get in the queue to go to the top. The clock does attract huge crowds so hang on tight to your bags - whilst we had no problems we were warned by our hotel standing here gaping at the clock was a prime area for pickpockets
Beautiful!. This is one of the primary, most famous parts of Prague, and a must see. I strongly encourage making it by here to take photos and see the area.

A brilliant invention. This structure is quite remarkable. The guy who built it was so unbelievable ahead of his time. And there is a very interesting story behind it (I am not going to spoil it for everyone). All I will say is please check this out if you're in Prague. You also have the option of going to the top of the tower for a few korunas (maybe 250 kournas). You get a really great view of the city from there. Also, given that it's in the main square, you have plenty of things to do after this. Don't miss the hot dogs that the street vendor's serve around the corner. Best hot dogs I've ever eaten and it only cost's like 100 korunas.

Cute but not amazing.. The astronomical clock chimes on the hour and does a cute little animatronic performance. However, its usually very crowded at this time and the performance isn't a must see. There's so much else to do in Old Town that i wouldn't really bother with this but it's free so not a big deal either way.
easy to get to top by Lift. you must go up to the top of the tower for the 360 panoramic views which are spectacular,the whole city can be seen for miles

Join the Millions Who View This Wonder Every Year. This is a must see! Crowds swarm around this facility every day. It is easy to see and great for photos....and it is free. It is located in the Old Town Square and easy to find. You can also take a tour of the building for a small fee.

Stunning Architecture!. We walked past that building at least 10 times this past weekend and every time it felt like the first time. The architectural design is so beautiful and the building as such a charismatic look to it. The area surrounding the tower is even more spectacular at night during the Christmas markets.

Still a puzzle. Having now visited this clock twice now I am still not able to understand it but fortunately there is a traditional clock face above it. Worth watching on the hour when the mechanism starts.

Big spectacle. This is an amazing sight to see in the LD Town Square. Each hour on the hour there is music and the twelve apostles are seen to appear from behind closed doors above the clock. The only slight downside is that in order to get a good view you need to stand there for about 15 minutes prior to the event or sit in one of the cafes opposite the clock and have a coffee whilst you wait -we did this and actually had a good view. You can by a book for 100kpk (about £2.50) which explains all the workings - book is available in many languages. It is a must see when in Prague and am glad we did.

Worth a visit and beautiful sight . After the 'show' when 100 of people watched the clock many people laughed because they expected something more. We went to the tower. The watch is worth a visit but the tower is a must if you want a perfect view over the old city. These days there is a christmasmarket and a christmas tree. It made the view almost perfect.

A must-see, and do go up in the tower. The clock is beautiful, and you must watch the saints come out on the hour, although you'll only want to do this once. The tower gives fantastic views over the square. It has a lift!
interesting. One of the stops in Old Town you should stop by. We stopped by at night when it was less crowded. The clock is a quick stop while exploring the square.

Astonishingly beautiful. It's a beautiful antique clock with superb design. Every xx:00 hours tons of people would wait in front of the clock, and the bell will ring plus the statues from inside the clock tower will come out and give a little one-minute show. Honestly saying, the mini show wasn't impressive, but since I'm in Prague, why not come and see.The more interesting part is the inside of the Old Town Hall. I entered from the information center; it's connected. There's an elevator so it's disabled-friendly. Floor 1 is takes you to the town hall history if I'm not mistaken, but I wasn't interested. I went to the top of the tower to see a bird's eye view of below, Church of Our Lady before Tyn, St. Nicholas' Church, Prague Castle and Parizska street. Ticket costs CZK 120 for adults. I'll say both daytime or nighttime is fine to go up and see some of Prague from up there, but to take pictures, daytime's still better any day.Once you have bought the ticket, you can either walk your way up and read the history of Prague's legendary Astronomical Clock, or take the elevator. Once up, you can go outside and walk around. It's a one-way passage and it's pretty scary up there. There were explanation boards but I don't remember everything; it has the churches and Prague Castle but others I can't remember.You can also pick your own souvenir; a little commemoration of you coming all the way up. One machine is the simple souvenir machine: you pay and pick which one you want. The other one requires some effort; you spin until you reach the souvenir you want, take a token (it's provided next to the machine) and CZK 20 or 40 (I just remember it's very cheap), push both coin and token to the machine and then spin the lever until the souvenir pops out. Spinning the lever will be easy at first but it gets heavy in the middle until right before the souvenir pops out.If you go to the clock, make sure to come inside!They even have a special souvenir: (replica) pocket watch! They only sell it here and in Prague Castle Area V (Torture Museum). The small one costs 14 Euros and the big one 28 or 38. Go buy the small one to reminisce your trip to the Astronomical Clock :) it's cheaper to buy here than other souvenir stores.

Beautiful Clock. We joined the crowd waiting for the "on the hour" bell at the Old Town Hall. It was just very very crowded and the bell was nothing too fancy. But nonetheless it is a must do if you are at the Old Town Hall in Prague.

picturesque. stunning buildings to be seen in this area. The clock itself is stunning and well worth a visit. The Christmas market was on at the time of our visit but would definitely do it again at another time of year. Very busy place

Interesting to watch. get there at least 15 minutes before the clock strikes as quite a few people gather and you really need to be at the front. You can also buy tickets to go up the tower and i hear the views are good do take a camera with you.

Probably the most famous clock in Europe - come on the hour. The old town hall has a famous (maybe the most famous) astronomical clock in Europe (Bern and Strasbourg do compete). Its worth coming 5 minutes before the hour for the chiming and the parade of clockwork figures. Even the gaudy souvenir sellers go quiet when the clock chimes. The view from the top of the tower is also worth the entrance fee.
Amazing clock. A must see of any visit, not only for the clock but also the surrounding stunning churches and buildings.
A must in Prague. We enjoyed so much that we stopped and waited on 3 occassions as we explored Prague for a week, get there early so you have a view from the front.

Place to stop for some time. The great astronomical clock is a real piece of great history. Tourists really line up and patiently wait for the hourly show of the clock's mechanical performance. The only negative experience though was that one friend was victimized by a pickpocket.
Awesome views from the top. I walked all the way from my hotel to here (3 kms) and it was worthy. Enjoyed those beautiful views from the top.

Beautiful clock, lets hope that it keeps going for a very long time. Prior to our recent visit to Prague we had identified the Astronomical Clock as one of the 'must see' attractions in this beautiful city. We were not disappointed. We saw it in both daylight and the dark, once on the hour when the 'movement' was working for all to see. On one pass of the building we were amazed at the sheer number of people standing in front of it taking photos. As it wasn't the full hour we couldn't understand what was happening. It turned out that a newly married couple were having their wedding photos taken. Not something that you see every day.

The astronomical clock is a sight to behold.. Get there early for the best view. The area is rather commercialised and is expensive by moving a few streets away the same goods are usually more than half price.

one of the Oldest. Astronomical clock in the Old town square is a great place to see, especially at the beginning of each hour when people are stacking there to see the bells ringing. You can also walk up the tower and watch around.

One of the Most Impressive of Its Kind. I've seen a few European glockenspiels in my day, and this may be the best, for all that's going on during its "performance." Beautiful clock faces and animated statuettes make this a must-see if you're in Prague. Be sure to do a quick read-up on it before you visit (Wikipedia, anyone?), so you can appreciate the significance of all that's unfolding before you.

Disappointingly interesting!. There were many people crowded around the clock as it was four minutes to mid day; we were sure something exciting was going to happen but was disappointed when, as the clock struck twelve only one small figure worked ringing a bell!! The clock is beautiful to see and may be there is more history about it inside the Town Hall but there were huge queues to get in so we did not stay.

Great view. Such a great view from the top, especially as we were there while the Christmas markets were set up. A great thing to do in Prague. The lady who sold us the ticket was incredibly rude though.
Well impressed!. Well worth a look and the cheapest cleanest toilet in the whole of Prague. This clock selfie should be in every one's photos!#
Watch the hour chime. This is justly famous and highly complicated timepiece and is very popular so you need to find a place to watch the hour chime a good ten minutes in advance.

Great views from the top-even for those with a fear of heights... Definitely head to the top of the clock tower if you get the chance. There are absolutely beautiful 360 degree views of Prague. I'm someone with a fear of heights who gets vertigo when I get in certain situations but I had no problem here. Even if you chose to climb up, it is much easier to go up the ramps than most observational decks which require you to climb narrow spiral staircases.

A Very Large Moving Clock. Take your cameras with you - you will need them - there are so many places, buildings etc etc to take photos of and specifically the Astronomical Clock - perhaps so-called - because there are loads of bars/restaurants in the area. And... if it's cold - these restaurants have the most hi-tech outside heating I have ever seen and they all have nice blankets on the chairs if you need them!
Loved this. This was one of our favourite things in Prague. It has a lovely atmosphere with the Christmas markets just outside.

Amazing. Be prepared to find a spot to be able to watch the clock. There will be a lot of people. The nice thing about it, it's that this clock supposed to be one of the only ones from that time which it stills work. That being said, it is worthy to take the time to see it.Plus, the clock is located in the heart of the old town and there is a lot to see and do in there.

Stunning! . This clock is very stunning and the building extremely impressive. There are Christmas markets that can cater to most needs, selling all sorts of tourists gifts and tasty Czech food, such as the pastry, potato chips and classic sausages! Go easy on the hot wine though, it's strong! The cooked ham is also to die for. This is very pretty at night but if you visit in the day there are restaurants a plenty. This also attaches to a road with lots of designer (very expensive but) stores like Cartier, Gucci etc. Christmas time there's always a spectacular Christmas tree.
Beautiful view of the square. We took the elevator up and walked down, so we were reading the informational placards in reverse order. To avoid this walk up and ride down.

Superb. I was so excited to see the clock! I watch it on earth cam all the time . It's truly spectacular and it's lovely to see the figures moving around although it's difficult to make out what they are . You can also go up the tower. Don't let the crowds put you off having a look . Just snuggle in there and wait for the tick tick!

Beautiful but very crowded. Beautiful square and click tower. It can get very busy, particularily when it is coming towards the hour. You will catch the clock ringing on the hour as you go about your sight seeing. I would not make special time to see it. You will be in and out of the old town square, especially if you are staying central. The display only lasts 3 minutes. If you arrive and its half an hour to go then just wander down a side street for a quick coffee or beer.
Fasinating Old Town. Lots going on around the old town, live music, hire a horse and carriage, segways, tour in an old car was great there were 5 of us so only £6 each for the car.

Over-rated. It is certainly worth a visit. You cannot go to Prague and not visit the Astronomical Clock, but it is not worth standing there for most of an hour just to see what happens. So if you are near the hour mark, wait.... If not, come back again later; perhaps your timing will be a little better.
Worth the climb. Take a visit to the top of the tower, only 120cz each. Either walk or take a lift! Views are magnificent of Prague.

Astronomical site. You must make this Landmark a must stop when you are in Prague, beautiful old charm. Best time to go and avoid the crowds is early in the morning before the tour buses start coming in.

Loved the Astronomical Clock!. Every hour on the hour huge crowds gather to watch this spectacle of an event where the chiming goes hand in hand with the intricate workings of the figures. The clock itself is stunning and its well worth a visit, if you prefer not to be in the crowd there is various places nearby you could slip into for a hot wine and watch instead. You wont be able to miss this attraction as crowds start gathering 30 mins prior to the hour, I didn't go up the tower as the queue was considerable, but a highlight of Prague all the same!

Stunning. A must if you're there if only from the outside. The best times to go are rather early in the morning or rather late at night and avoid the masses and droves of tourists standing in the way of the picturesque architecture.

Very energetic small space!. Every hour, on the hour, the masses build to wait for the Apostles to rotate around the clock, and listen to the Skelton ring his bell and other assorted characters in motion, all waiting for the cock to crow. The tower itself is beautiful. The experience is so charming and childlike, we rushed back for a second view. One can elevator up for a maximized view of the city. I love Prague.
exactly what rhe name suggests. The c,oak is very beautiful and draws large crowds of tourists very beautiful to see. The other structures in square make this a sightseers dream.

Loved the Astronomical Clock!. Despite reviews that the clock is underwhelming, I found it really cool. We went during the day and at night to see it at the top of the hour. If you're going to pick one, go when it's dark out and the clock is lit up! It's a quick show, but impressive! Recommend making a stop to see the clock in action. Death ringing the bell was my favorite part.

Great views from the clock tower.. The clock is fun to watch , on the hour every hour there is a liitle disply but get there early for a good view as it gets really crowded, It is worth buying tickets to go up the clock tower as there is a fantastic view especially on a clear day and you can get some great photos.
The cock crows. The crowds assemble way before each hour, and the cock crows after the apostles have been round . All to watch the spectacle from around 1410.

Best view of the city. The tower is an interesting place to visit
The walk up gives you great info about its history and condition and renovations
Once up there you have the most incredible view of the city
That alone is more then worth it

Wait upon the hour. No trip to Prague counts unless you have waited with the crowds to see the chiming of the astronomical clock and the intricate workings of the figures. Amazing and just adds to the treats offered by one of the most beautiful cities in Europe. You can even have a front row seat sipping hot chocolate in the Olive restaurant right in front of the clock.

Vertigo stops me going up. I wish I did not have to put up with this relatively minor handicap but such is life. Beautiful from street level. Huge queues to watch the hour chime on the astrological clock- over in 30 seconds and you need to watch your wallet here. If you want to drop Kc 100 get to a cafe approximately 30 mins before - yes that is when people start to arrive- and enjoy a lovely hot chocolate or something similar.

Head Up The Tower. I guess most people who visit Prague tis up on the hour to watch the clock and although its OK I have to say I was actually just a little disappointed. The Town Hall self is a fabulous building and well worth seeing, and photographing at all times of the day. You also get a great view from the top of the tower but it does get very crowded.

A Historical Highlight with a Bonus.... This is a must see in the evening. The beauty of this Clock speaks of the wonderful architecture of Prague. The bonus at this time of the year is the wonderful Christmas stalls and the holiday spirits that flow throughout. Regardless of the massive crowds, it is definitely worth the effort to see.

Amazing views, worth the climb. I climbed the tower, amazing views and worth the climb. I went at dusk and gave some wonderful pictures, also got pics with all the christmas lights. Worth the admission fee.

Packed to the rafters. Went to see the astronomical clock it performs on the hour till about 9.00pm didn't know what to expect but it was not bad but the crowds are enormous and lots of pickpockets worth a visit but beware
Good if you like the old buildings. So much history in this building but suggest you take a guide book with you to get good info, so many people visit

Main Attraction. This is the main place of the square. You have to see the clock at 12:00 noon to see what the clock does. Read up on all the meanings of the clock's functions and make sure you climb to the top for a bird's eye view of the city. A must see!!

Old Town Clock . Must see! Get there early to take pictures. 150 Czech if you wanna get to the top. It can be a little overwhelming with everyone there at the clock tower taking pictures but push your way through to get food pictures!

Beautiful. Prague is such a beautiful city.
Breathtaking sights and unbelievable architecture .
So pretty . A must visit city.

The finest clock I have ever seen. Even bought a replica to take home for my family as words cannot describe the beauty of this clock, nice cafes on site to stare at the clock or simply people watch the hundreds of tourists and see their reaction to this thing of beauty
Must see.... This clock you must see. At each hour you'll see the appostal in the two small windows. Take your time for this historical point.

Precision engineering. The Astronomical Clock is mounted on the 228 foot tall bell tower of the Town Hall. It shows position of the Sun and Moon in the sky, current time, season, sunrise, sunset and much more. The Walk of the Apostles which is filled with animated statues that come alive hourly peeking through the window. There are side statues of Vanity staring at himself in the mirror, a miser with gold representing greed, a Turkish man bringing entertainment and Death is represented by a skeleton chiming his bell with the sounds from the tower. A Calendar Dial is also displayed. An elevator goes to the top of the 228 foot tall Bell Tower for a 360 degree view of Old Town Prague. There is a vast underground as well. Open on Monday from 11am -10pm, Tuesday-Sunday from 9am-10pm. Entry CzK 110.
Very nice. Always crowded , especially during Advent , but beautiful to see. The clock is beautiful , the view from it is certainly admirable , that's for another time .
Climb the tower. It is worth taking a trip up the tower to get a view of the city. A lift will take you all the way to the top, for those who do not want to climb the spiral staircase.

One of the best outside clock's to see.. I found the best time was in the evening, when you can have dinner or a drink at one of the local restaurants that has a patio.You can sit and watch the clock while dining and see the movement of the clock characters when the clock chimes, its magical

Interesting. Very nice buildings, never seen such beautiful clock, every hour on the hour there is a melody coming from the clock and some statues appear, there is always a big crowed watching it! If you sit in one of the restaurants opposite you will have a good view on the town hall and clock.

APT Eurpean River Cruise end. During our visit to Prague we went on a walking tour of the attractions. We visited the Old Prague City, Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. This clock has several moving parts including wise men skeleton and surfs. When the clock signals the hour, the skeleton on one side pulls and rope and chimes the hour signalling it's time to die. The noblemen on the other side shake their head to deny death and the wise men at the top of the clock rotate through 2 windows. The clock has 24 hours as well as astronomical signs. Well worth seeing.

Go to the top!. After waiting for the clock to strike at the top of the hour (watch every detail of what's going on with the clock; you may need to go back and watch again. It's amazing)it's worth it to take the time to go to the top of the clock tower and enjoy the amazing view and the inner workings of the clock.There is a lift going up; but if you can handle the walk up it is really worth seeing the history on the walls, the views from the Windows going up and to see some of the clock mechanisms. Once arriving at the top the views are outstanding!!! But be prepared to wait to walk around the entire top as it is one way and you will be waiting as others stop to take pictures. We went up on a beautifully sunny day. Would love to have gone back in the evening.Do not miss seeing this beautiful city from high up.

Beautiful. The astronomical clock is not only absolutely beautiful to look at, it's also the oldest clock of its kind in the world that is still functioning. Be here on the hour to watch the clock strike and the different characters march in and out. It's a little piece of magical history right in the heart of Prague.

Unique Euro Feel. I really enjoyed my time in Prague! Prague feels very different from any other city that I have been to in Europe. The Astronomical Clock is also well worth the view! It's really really cool and has an awesome history!

Visit and landscape view. We visited the clock's tower when it was getting darker and once we were on the top we could appreciate the fantastic view all around. We could see the castel, the churches and all the lightened attractions and it was fantastic. We choose to go by staircase instead of the elevator because we had the possibility to read all the historical information regarding the tower and the old town hall.

Great view of the square beautiful at night. Great views from the top lots of history to read through on the way up or down.There are lifts to take you up and down.Well worth the £3I would say get the lift up then walk back down.

Beautiful & historic. An absolute delight, an amazing place with so much history and colour. This city is blessed with beautiful buildings and amazing places such as the astronomical clock and town hall.

A Taste of Old Europe. The Staramesto Namesti (Old Town Square) is a rare opportunity to taste old Europe. The building structures' architecture is on a class by itself. If you like to experience old Europe, this is a must see. It is comparable to the old town in Kraków, Poland.

Beautiful and full of history.. This is a must when staying in Prague. By day it is a busy hub of activity with shops and restaurants. By night it is full of entertainment and street food. It's a lovely place but I must admit that my wife and I really didn't understand the attraction of the astronomical clock. It's pretty but that's about it. I must have missed the point that seemed to attract at least 100 people every hour to watch it chime.

Must do. You buy tickets at the bottom of the tower and then enter through the City Hall. It appears to be fully accessible for disabled visitors. There is information about the history of the building along the walk ways.
Wonderful buildings. The buildings are many and varied. See the clock strike on the hour and watch the characters perform, this is likely to be when it is busiest but it is worth seeing.

easy to visit even if you dont move well. The town halls tower has got a lift since our last visit. Now it was easy to go to the tower as there were less than 10 steps to take to get to the top. wonderfull view. The astronomical clock is free to see but the tower visit was 120 CZK / person.

In the heart of old Prague. The Astronomical clock is a "must see". Big crowds at 9am (on the hour) when everyone looks to see the parts in motion. You can climb to the top if you want and look down on the square and surrounding area. Tourist information office is just across the square.

BE THERE ON THE HOUR. The clock is a mystery on its own. You will not understand much if you don't hire a guide or have the Lonely Planet's Prague book that have a description of the very minute details. It is a nice object built in 1410, high tech for its time. They are all there. The main attraction, Death. reminds you that you are not here forever. The pagan Turk, the omnipresent moneylender Jew(cosmetically altered after WWII),vanity, greed and on the lower part, historian, philosopher, angel and astronomer will keep you company. Go the crepusculum time (Twilight) and you will see it lighted which is better.Beware: This place is extremely popular, even in winter time and it gathers thousands of tourists. The guy that offers you a better exchange rate are going to fill you with worthless old Bulgarian Levas. Pick pockets work this area 7/24. So before this mouth opening, jaw dropping awe you feel seeing the clock take care of your wallet or your friendly pick pocket will do it for you. The cafes around the square have the most horrible, undrinkable, most expensive coffee in Prague. Don't order water, say tap water or you will be served a small Evian bottle for 5 Euros a bottle. Well the rest is up to you. Be good and travel.
Fantastic. Watch from the street or from the Mozart cafe directly opposite (in the hitel on the 2nd floor)...the machinations of the clock are amazing.
Amazing. Looked seeing this clock. You can decide just to wait for the mechanism to go off without going up the tower. However, the view from above was great.

Overrated??. i just came back from 1 week vacation in Prague during thanskgiving. Let me say that I did not go inside the Hall nor the Tower. My review solely is on the "houly chiming" of the clock. The reason why I didn't even bother going up the tower or inside the old town hall was because after I saw the clock and the "hourly" chime...I wasn't impressed at all, i saw something moved on the clock for like 15 seconds??/ I wasn't sure what everyone is taking a photo of? Don't get me wrong, the clock is really nice looking....but not sure what the hype is about? It's more just a photo stop for me, you see it, you stop, you take a photo of it, life moves on.

Full live city. Once u enter this place u feel like want to stay in this yard for days and nights..astronomical clock is the most important enjoyable event to witness knocks and bill each hour..the shops there are amazing the daily shows are so interesting ....lovely place and represents Prague
Great Attraction. This is well worth a visit for both the clock, history and views from the top. The history of the building damaged in the war is also explained with some great pictures.

we kept returning!. We loved this area and kept returning to experience it at different times of the day and night. A lovely atmosphere in this spot: it's lovely to be in the crowd as the hour approaches! We even experienced someone proposing to his girlfriend just before it rang and everyone cheered! A special moment. The clock itself is beautiful. Watch out for the cockerel at the end of the strike. We missed it at first, but it crows and flutters its wings. Nice touch.
Very musical. The city hall is fantastic. you will be lucky if a concert is going on and believe me you will not like to come back. the restaurants inside the Town hall is gastronomical

Well worth paying to go up the tower.. Great pictures from the top and there is a lift. We were lucky as didn't have to queue but when we came back down, a tour had just gone in and the queues were long. Try to go when there are no tours in.
This is a magnet for tourists .... We had a meal in Olive Verde , alfresco & loved it !!! Sat outside under a heater. Felt like we were with the crowds watching the clock ...
Fairytale. Stunning architecture all around. There really is something beautiful around every corner in Prague. The astronomical clock is a must-see
Quick Show. Climb to the top to see a spectacular view. If you happen to be near the clock you will see a show at the top of each hour. PLEASE NOTE...stand close and it only lasted about 45 seconds.

Busy place around Christmas . This place was busy last time I visited Prague in summer, but appears packed with it been the festive time of year. The place was heaving with lots of market stalls, pubs shops etc. The old town hall was established in 1338, with a astrological clock placed on the south side of the tower in 1410, this was rebuilt to what it resembles today in 1490 by Hanus. A place where all will gather on the hour to witness the little figures move. Lovely part of Prague.
Astronomical clock - very recommended. Do not miss the hourly bells ringing and moving people at the windows. The museum at the top of the tower is also very recommended.

The highlight of our trip!. Strikes on the hour, every hour. Get there early: its SRO!!! This fantastic clock, first installed in [gasp] 1410, is the third oldest astronomical clock, and the oldest one still working! Updated in 1490, the clock has suffered a number of mishaps and been repaired numerous times. It is a sight to behold! While you're there be sure to try the local Turdlniks, especially the ones stuffed with strawberries!

Very cool clock with "Death" pulling the strings. The town square is (of course) right in the middle of everything.
