We stopped several times when it was close to the top of the hour and waited for Death to ring his bell, and for the apostles to parade by the open window. Very crowded square -- don't lose your traveling companions, and keep a hand on your wallet.
We Loved the Tower. This is a mandotory place to visit in Prague!! The views of the tower were simply amazing and everybody could go blecaute there is a lift to the top.

A bit of a let down.. Was really looking forward to seeing the astronomical clock in action but its over in seconds and is not that special (in my opinion). The clock itself is beautiful and I think it might be more interesting to do the tour inside and look at how it all works. Thankfully we were there in November so the crowds weren't that big but I would hate to be there in high season. Blink and you'll miss it!

beautiful clock. the area gets packed during the day, you can sometimes see it when only a few are there but its rare. another place with a great dark history, look into the clock makers life and death.
nice to hangout. Hi,A nice to place to hang around, seeing people walk by, alot of eateries and shops to shop around.
Amazing old town square. An unmissable landmark of Prague. Definitely get there early (15 mins to the hour) and get a good spot... just watch your bag.pockets!
good trip up the tower. We went up the tower in the evening and loved it. Beautiful scenes over the city and we had no queues. The Saturday night, it was queuing out the door so be careful of timing.

Highly recommended. Make sure that you arrive to the tower with about 10-15 minutes before the hour. It will give you just enough time to grab a hot mulled wine and a pastry treat from a local stand and get a good spot for the show. The 'show' occurs on the hour and lasts a minute or so, consisting of all of the original mechanical workings of the clock moving and dancing around. I'd recommend going on a free walking tour (specifically the HostelCulture one) to find out the history of the clock which makes you appreciate the show even more.As per any busy tourist area, pick pockets apparently operate here so be careful - especially when your eyes are glued to the clock because you don't want to miss it! I didn't have any trouble but just keep alert and enjoy the show.TOP TIP - Ladies... do NOT bring high heels to Prague. It's unavoidable to be around cobbled pavements about 90% of your trip. Because of this, hardly any women wear heels so you won't stand out. Don't ruin your trip trying to look good as you will injure yourself and will frankly look pretty silly trying to walk.

Old Town Hall Tower. After many years, we finally got around to going up the Old Town Hall Tower, but only at the second attempt !As there were no queues at the ticket office next to the Astronomical Clock, we decided to purchase tickets. However, when we went to the entrance the queues filed down two flights of stairs. Saturday afternoon is clearly not the best time to visit. Rather than wait for one hour or more, instead we returned on Tuesday afternoon and were able to go straight in.Rather than take the wheelchair friendly path we took the modern glass lift to the top, from where we were able to experience superb views of the city and the square below.The tickets cost 120 KCS each, which I thought was pretty good value.
Astronomical. The astronomical clock a must see - golden. Consider going when it's quiet if you want a photo.Easy to get lost in the streets around here - GPS / Google maps handy.

Spectacular views from tower . We arrived just in time to see the astronomical clock chime. Then, for 250 Koruna we got a family pass to go up the tower. The views of the old town square, Kostel Matky Boží před Týnem, and the castle are some of the best in the city. This was my kid's favorite attraction in Prague.

A large square surrounded by restaurants, and a fabulous clock.. There is always a crowd waiting for the clock to chime the hour. The magic only happens once a day though, when the doors open and the saints appear. This is the meeting place for a lot of the tours so a busy place. There are lots of restarants here and streets leading off everywhere. Such a lovely centre.

A Fast Worthwhile Treat at the Top of the Hour. The clock operates on the hour with a quick mechanical treat. It is worth the visit to see it work! We did not do a tour but hear it is great. Make sure you are there at the top of the hour!
Amazing square. So many people and such variety of activity, from stalls, soap bubbles, restaurants, romantic coach rides, the clock is a must to see how much work has gone into it.

going again. this square have to be the prettiest i have seen. i made a point to start my day for 10 days trip by having my breakfast and coffee there. the clock tower look very grand and magistic. best on winter mornings

Fascinating. This is an absolutely fascinating "clock" You need to either have a wen guide or other guide to explain everything this clock does. It is located in a square that is a hotbed of activity for street music and other gatherings of primarily the young.

A two minute wonder that shouldn't be missed. The clock is easily spotted in the Old Town Hall square.If you arrive close to the hour the floor in front of the tower is much harder to see as it is covered with people standing looking at the clock waiting for it to perform. The clock mechanism is very detailed and the animation is interesting, good if you can video it.A Prague high-light, better caught early in the day when there are fewer people in the crowd.

Bit of a let down!. We missed the clock going off through the day but knew we were going back to the old town at night so got there for 7pm and must says its a bit of a let down for all the hype and crowds that build up!Few people passing the windows inside and the skeleton ringing the bell! Dont go out your way but nice to say we've seen it!

A tour of the tower is worthwhile . The tour of the tower was definitely value for money and the tour guide was very informative. The astronomical clock is an iconic part of prague town square and watching it come to life on the hour is worth a watch. The tour of the tower takes you all the way down to under the ground and the tour guide has many great stories to tell. A climb up the tower gives an amazing 360 degree view of Prague. Stunning!
Unique. The architecture in the Old Town Square area is beautiful. The clock itself is worth the trip, and there are plentiful bars to rest your feet

Great View. There are many towers in Old Town Prague, if you only have time to visit one tower, this is it. In addition to the view, the history and the inside of the tower is very unique. We took the award winning elevator up the tower and then walk down to learn about the history of the tower. I would recommend watching the clock bells ring outside after you take the tour, it means more after you know the history and meaning of the statues movements.
Interesting Attraction. While in Prague we walked to the Old Town Hall and the Astronomical Clock. What a fun and informative visit. Everyone was friendly.

You cant say you came to Prague without going here!. The square overall it's so atractive to the eyes. You feel in a fairy tail. It's really hard to see very well because most of the times is really crowded but I feel it's a great experience to go and watch the dolls moving around the clock. Tecnically the clock rings every hour but the best "show" its a noon because it's longer. I dont see anything super special and this but if oyu are in Prague and go to the square it should take more than 5min to watch. Just be on time fore the "show"

A Great meeting place. A beautiful square with the famous Astronomical Clock. Make sure your their on the hour to see the clock movement. Only suggestion is do not eat at the restaurants on the square, The are overprice for their food and especially the beer, Have a snack at the open stands

a masterpiece. This is really a bit of a mechanical marvel. Although it only chimes for about 10-12 seconds, it does it every hour. If you are in the medieval square, you absolutely must see the clock.

The clock strikes every hour. Even in late November crowds start to gather 10/15 minutes before the hour to watch the clock chime and the figurines appear.It may be important to I k it of your list - if you miss it just return an hour later.

Tour. Lovely place to visit , also a very reasonable price , the hall and tower are very professional done for everyone's needs with elevators and stairs would recommend to anyone , the views from the top are spectacular

Magical old area of Prague. Happened to be working for a. Joke of days - stayed at Rott Hotel, 1 minute from the clock and square. Last week of November and they set up the Christians lights and stalls while I was there. Beautiful - you will love it

Unique clock and great views from the tower. Great to see such a unique clock close up - not so sure about the fanfare over the striking of the hour?We paid to climb the tower - interesting summary of the history on the way up and excellent 360 degree views from the top.

Town hall tour and tower - both worth it. Got to know the building in two attempts - the first one was to see the clock and its show on the evening I arrived to Prague, and the other was the guided tour next morning. The clock show itself did not change much in my childhood memories of it when after twenty minutes of waiting for the show, it turned out to be what it is. :) Well, unlike back then I am now able to value its artistic and technical qualities, not just the show, so together during my 1.5 days Prague visit I stopped by and waited couple of minutes for it three times. The tower, in turn, was quite a nice visit and, if only physically able, do not take the elevator, but go up the stairs - then by the time you get to the top you will know the history of the tower and its adjacent building from the panels on your way. The nightview from the top was great too and there are also pointers what to pay attention to in the panorama and why. But from all the things I preferred the guided tour most - I went for 9.30AM English one, that ended up to be for me and another couple. We got a really good, kind, friendly guide, ready to tell, explain and, as he commented "due to the small size of our group" let us go some places that are otherwise behind those red ropes of "no go here".
Interesting to watch the clock strike. You haven't been to Prague if you don't see the clock strike! Definitely add this one to the list of things to see, fun to see when it strikes.
The astronomical clock????. It's great to see, but if you've just missed it as it strikes every hour, go away and come back because it's really not worth waiting there fot

Worth a look. The clock and the story behind its creation is quite fascinating. The Old Town Hall has a viewing deck on at the top of its tower where you will get a good overview of the Old Town Square as well as 360deg panoramic views of the entire city.
Underwhelming. To be honest I thought the clock would do more - waited in the cold for it to strike and it all turned round and that was it.

Clock. Missed the hour but listened to other people who were underwhelmed.
The clock is interesting without the 'show' chime.
Beautiful clock. This old clock has figures which move every hour. The building is lovely to look at, and the surrounding buildings are very attractive as well.

Lovely square. Good visit here, day or night. The atmosphere is lively. Lots of shops and restaurants. The clock chimes every hour. A lot of people always wait for the hour, but don't expect much. The event lasts about 30 seconds. Worth the view however.
Lovely history. Best to listen to a tour guide to fully understand the history of this clock. Lovely piece of history.

We did the clock at night - fab. we arrived at the square as it was getting dark. the view from the top is fab. the old town is lovely. we arrived on Thur and enjoyed our meander through the streets however it felt a bit less safe on Friday night to be meandering.....
Nice building . That's all I can say about this and the chimes are a bit poor - not really worth waiting around for - nice little restaurant near by though

OPEN WINDOWS. Famous for the chimes on the hour when the window open for all to SEE it gets very busy for this is a main meeting place 4 ALL arrive about 15 mins early for the best view well worth a visit

Fun. The Astronomical Clock is quite interesting. A lot of moving parts. It draws a large crown in the square. It's worth waiting around for. Watch for pickpockets. Lots of food and outdoor eating and shopping in the area.

Beautiful and Intriguing. I did not go up the tower. I was just in awe of the clock from the square. It is beautiful. It was my favorite thing in the old town square. I wish they had an explanation of how to tell time from it.
Beautiful on the outside and in. If you're planning on going up the cathedral tower in Prague castle by day go up this one by night as it's a nice to see Prague by day and night :)
Popular site. Of course our guide had us at the clock on the hour to see the moving figures - the square was full of tourists, but it was fun to see

The main attraction. The Astronomical clock in the main attraction of the old city center area. Each time at xx:oo hours, many people gathers in the front of it to see what it happens. It is really interesting piece of art with many meanings. I recommend in case of not having a tourist guide to read before about the clock and what the many details on it means. Would increase more the wow effect.

It's not big . Ok so the actual clock is only 4-5 m up on a much higher tower. We passed by twice on the hour to see the "show" and it's not much but worth it, definitely something out of the ordinary!
Never tire of watching the clock and the people watching the clock!. Love sitting in a cafe with hot chocolate. The drinks are more expensive there than they are in nearby cafes.

Awesome Views. A great place to take in the amazing views of Prague. This place has such a rich and intriguing history. Make sure you pay the couple of extra dollars and climb to the top, day or night it will blow you away.

Buy a combination ticket!. If you are in Prague, just do it! Buy a combination ticket for 160CZK, allowing you both the tower and the guided hall tour. If you are able, don't use the elevator to go up to the tower, walk slowly by reading all the valuable information on the way to the top. After that, you can go back to the first floor, attend your guided tour either in English, Italian, French or Czech. The tour takes 50 minutes, allowing you to understand the old city hall better. In addition, you are going to discover the underground and experience how the historical 5 houses are connected to each other and for what purposes the underground has been used in the past.

Quite the disappointment. Every tourist guide tells you that you have to visit the clock when the full hour strikes. Do not expect a spectacular show or actually a show at all. It is a cool clock, that's it.

Take the tour!. The clock is world famous but rebuilt following a fire late in WW2. The full show is on the hour from 9am but to get the fuller show, you need to go on a tour of the Town Hall. Well worth it....interesting history and a chance to see inside the astronomical clock plus a trip up the tower. There is a lift but if you're claustrophobic the ascent is a spiral walkway, not steps (like the round tower in Copenhagen). The tour will also take you underground to the cellars and dungeons. Be careful if you later book into an "Underground Prague Tour" because they will bring you here. Enjoy the view!

relax and wait for the clock to click. after enjoying your walk at the old town square and local shops, have a seat at one of the coffee shops facing the clock, enjoy a snack while waiting for the clock to click on the hour

View from the tower... perfect!. Unique clock, with a very long history, performance on a full hour's worth of your time. Visit the tower, you are rewarded with stunning panoramic view :). A modern glass lift takes you up to the top of tower. The views from gallery offers the most beautiful views from a bird's eye perspective: spiers and domes arrayed in Prague's diverse architecture.

This is a beautiful clock. If you are in old town square area, it is a must that you check out this clock, and even take a picture or two. Every Time l see old town/square, it remain me of old movies, like the sleepy hollow film shot to look really old.

Like a fairy tale. Spectacular city with touches of magic that remind me of a Disney film. The Astronomical Clock seemed amazing above all by the time that has old, throughout the area that surrounds the clock is very nice and highly recommended for tourist who visit this city.

Good site to view in Prague. This area is a popular tourist attraction in Prague. Be sure to bring your camera and good walking shoes. For us this was a short visit, but we wanted to see the clock and the surrounding area. The architecture is different than other European cities we visited and we like to view different buildings with decorative arts. It is a good starting point for a walk around the city. The clock was distinctive.

Buzzing!!. You can't miss this place as it's almost in the heart of Prague. It's very buzzing. Lot of big n small food joints serving great food n beer. The clock is very intricate and crowd puller. The entire street was full and waiting for clock to strike 12. Must see.

Beautiful Site!. The clock and all the surrounding buildings in the square are architectural wonders!! The square is bustling with many, many people. The area is filled with cafes, restaurants, outdoor vendors selling food and street entertainers. It's such a joyful environment!

Beautiful Prague. Short haul to the Czech Republic. Prague is such a beautiful City. Very reasonable with plenty of hotels to choose from. I stayed in a five star hotel, not too far from Wenceslas square and further along is where the famous Astronomic Clock is situated . Plenty to see both in the Old and the New Town. Two days hop on-hop off is recommendable to give time for the castle visit, museums and the local restaurants.Plenty of souvenir shops. The Christmas markets are colourful and buzzly; it gets even more exciting at night when the beautiful lights are on. You must try the local delicatessen and cuisines. Beers are very reasonably priced. Will definitely go back, but this time during the Summer season. Oh, not everyone speaks English,but overall, it was a lovely trip! Go and see for yourself...
Fascinating. A beautiful clock, worth seeing. The history and legends behind it are also interesting. Mind you, I was expecting more movement on the hour.

Clock Tower Beauty . While on a walking tour of Prague, we had the pleasure of visiting the square where the famous Astronomical Clock is located. It is more than a clock, it is a beautiful work of art.
Wonderful place !. This is one of the best attractions in Prague ! The Astronomical Clock is very interesting and every round hour people stand and wait to see how it moves .

Experience a medieval world wonder – the Old Town Astronomical Clock!. Every hour, hundreds of tourists from all over the world with cameras at the ready gather in front of the Old Town Hall to enjoy a fascinating mechanical performance which in the Middle Ages was considered one of the wonders of the world. The Prague Astronomical Clock, which for 600 years has been one of the greatest treasures of the city, still amazes people with its procession of Apostles, moving statues and visualization of time like no other instrument in the world.

Crowded but worth it. The clock is the oldest operating astronomical clock in the world and performs a brief show every hour complete with bells and automatons representing different aspects of human life. The top of the hour does draw the biggest crowds so get there early to have a good view.

Just HOW Does it Work?. So we spent many times at the top of the hour looking at the clock as it rang the new hour and tried to figure out how it worked. Truly a lovely spot in the square, surrounded by lovely cafes and restaurants.

Terrific View of Prague. Every hour, the Astronomical Clock does its performance. Although the crowds are huge to view the clock its a fun experience. The Town Hall Tower provides a fantastic 360 degree viewing sight. Neither should be missed on a visit to Prague.

Principal Attraction. No visit to Prague is complete without a visit to the Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. Every hour, when the clock strikes, a couple of small windows open to reveal figures slowly moving by. This is always interesting and reminiscent of the more elaborate parade of figures in the Munich Clock Tower. Predictably, a large crowd always gathers here on the hour. The more adventurous can climb to the top of the Old Town Hall Tower.

family. this is part of old town square and this clock which there are only 2 in existance if i am not mistaken goes off every hour with saints going around and it is to be seen and hundreds gather to watch.

Overrated. The square itself is beautiful. Atmospheric and charming. The trip to the top of the clock tower is worthwhile for great views across the city, though it can be very busy even in low season. The show when the clock strikes though is very underwhelming and disappointing, I can't quite believe such crowds flock to see it. Be aware also that the cafes overlooking the square charge an inflated cover charge and two coffees can cost in excess of £10! Also be aware of the food venders that quote prices per 100g, you think the price quoted is very reasonable but it can cost you many times more.

Tourist place, astronomical watch. A lot of tourists spend last quarter of the hour in waiting to astronomical watch to count a round hour.Многие туристы ждут без четверти каждый час, что бы увидить как часы бьют.
Must see. In the main center of old town. When you got there, buy a ticket and go inside of the clock, magnificent view above the roofs of old buildings.
Short Break Prague. The square the clock is in is spectacular enough without the clock, it makes you wonder how such things were constructed all those years ago, a must to see in Prague.

Be on time. It's a very popular touristic attraction of Prague. Every hour, 2 little windows open up and 12 wooden statues come out for less than a minute. You need a well documented touristic guide book to understand and appreciate the history and meanings of this astronomical clock. It's usually very crowded every hour so beware of pickpockets.

Be there before the full hour. Its near many attractions so no harm going there just to have a look at it. The clock is pretty, and the area around it is lively and interesting! Loads of tourist and performers. Be careful of your belongings as it can get really crowded at times!

There is something magical about Prague - The clock is really fun and unusual. If you go to Prague, you have to watch the clock! It's really fascinating and unusual. There are lots of pickpockets that wait for the tourists to be distracted, so go at mealtime and grab a seat at one of the restaurants facing the clock so you can watch it while you eat. The square itself is really huge, and there are lots of side streets and little shops to wander around.

Another amazing sight to see. Still can't figure out though how to tell the time on it though. But when the saints or maybe they are disciples come out every hour, it gathers a lot of people to watch.

Center of Prague. You can't miss this hall and clock! You probably won't unless you are at the airport. When they made the movie Amadeus, they didn't have to edit out much, as the city is in its historical condition.
Nice space.. Big square in the centre of things. Fancy astronomical clock in one corner and loads of interesting buildings and churches around the edges.

Must see place in Prague. Of course the Old town Hall and the astronomical clock is must see objects in Prague. But you definitely should buy a ticket and go to the top of tower. From there you will have the most beautiful views of the city. As you can make your way slowly around all four sides of the tower, your view will be truly panoramic. It can be very crowed on top, even they regulate number of persons going up…

History at its best. What a beautiful clock surrounded by much history. Don't miss it. There are shops, restaurants and entertainment in this area. Go during Christmas and New Years and have the opportunity to see a Christmas market.
Ticking Away. A beautiful piece of work with great design and an extensive history. Very photogenic. Just got an instagram honorable mention for my photo of it.
Incredible. Most interesting and ornate clock, make sure that you see the clock strike the hour. crowds will congregate 5-0 mins beforehand.

One of the famous Prague sites. This clock and tour are a very popular site. People crowd around it on the hour to see its little display. The tower is inexpesive to access and offers incredible, sweeping views of the city.

lovely to see. The Astronomical Clock is one of the oldest in the world. make sure you go on the hour to see it work. We did a walking tour and our guide explained how it worked. Also, make sure that you go to the top to take in the views from the Old Town Hall Tower

Charming place with beautiful and interesting sights. The clock is very cool. The actually clock show is a bit lackluster but it's worth seeing. It shows each hour. You can go up into the clock for a fair price which offers a packed but beautiful 360 view of the city.

a must when in Prague. one cannot leave Prague without visiting the famous clock. You can get 2 different tickets. One to enter the Astronomical Clock where you get to go up to the top and enjoy the view of the city, and another one that provides you access to the underground and halls.
Mid week break. A lovely open area with a beautiful town hall and clock which is very large and unusual. The square is surrounded by all manner of shops and cafes

Touristy. really enjoyed a trip up the Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. Do make sure you get there early as it does get quite busy. Offers some fantastic views on clear days around and great photo opportunities.
At noon and every hour!. Grab a seat at one of the restaurants near by and wait for a little magic every hour the clock becomes live!
Entertainment for the middle ages. We got to see the clock work as it hit noon. Very interesting when you put it in context of the middle ages.

Fabulous building and contents. The old town hall and astronomical clock are fab from the outside if a little congested on the hour. We paid to go to the top of the tower, it was great story boards all around the inside as to its demise at the end of the 2nd world war, well worth a visit

Prague astronomical clock from - 1410. Prague astronomical clock is the oldest clock that work!!
The clock was first installed in 1410
And from my picture i can tell that it still working.... :)

Past and present in movement!!. I you go solo, read before. Y you don't like to read, join a guided group ( the Sandeman's ones are free) if you don't have the time, join a group that is in front of the clock and listen what the tour guide is explaining so you will be able to grasp what is the history of all the components of the clock. Nice and interesting, past and present in movement.
Beautiful experience. You get to see the very old interior of the tower and from the top is such a beautiful view on oldtown square and Prague castle.

Amazing and unique!. A trip to Prague must include the Old Town Hall, full of beautiful landmark buildings, fun cafes and great shopping. Well visited by locals and visitors, it is a lot of fun to experience. The Astronomical Clock was built in the 1400's and still is working!

Fabulous clock. This is a must see if you are in Prague. The clock attracts large crowds to see the animation when the clock strikes on the hour. It is also possible to go to the top of the tower but after the striking there is a big queue for this so probably best to go earlier.
Its a Clock. The clock is truly a wonder its accurate still to this day and its centuries old If you take a guided tour you can learn the very interesting history of the tower.

Something interesting and dramatic . I don't fall into Prague-lovers group as I found the entire city a tad overrated. Stumbled upon this engineering marvel while strolling on the streets to kill time. It was fun as it's not just a clock striking the hour but there's an entire drama attached to it. Gospels come out, music is played and so on. If you want to see the city, you can go to the top but to view the clock and its theatrics, standing on the streets with a full view is the better choice. Didn't find it as crowdy as people make you believe.

See the movement of a wonderful work of art and engineering in the Astronomical Clock. Make sure you check the times to see when the clock will be operating.. There are a number of cafes and places to get a good view of the movement while waiting for the show.

Must see in Prague. For the best panoramic views of the old town square and the wonderful architecture of Prague get to the town centre for 9.30 and climb the steps of the town hall tower. Incredibly busy but the early start will give you some breathing space. If you time it right you get to see the clock chime for 10 which is a lovely experience in itself

Love that clock!!. I've seen ones like it elsewhere, but considering the setting, this well kept, romantic European square, Lovely Gothic buildings all around, just great.But choose a good time to come here, all the times I was here, there were armies of tourists, and it just doesn't do anything for the character and my holiday spirit, piles of Korean tourists shouting and clicking their big Nikons in your face and then shouting again, gotta seek solace after that, I would say, go early in the morning, when all the mobile phone brigade are raiding the breakfast buffet in the local hotel!

A must see in Prague. you have to visit this if your in Prague, it does get very busy but worth it,try to go on the hour then you will see and hear clock at its best,
Lots of cafe's and restaurants close by.
Beautifull. Beautifull buildings and ancient atmosphere. The astronomical clock is to be seen at the full hour. Nice show.

Clock watching. Like every other tourist we tried to get the best vatage spot to watch the clock.Every hour hundreds ofvtourist st a nd around waiting for the clock to strike the hour. It was a little disappointing. The clock itself is interesting to look at. The square was a fun place to peple watch. A few brave people climbed the stairs to admire the view. This is something that only needs to be viewed once if st all
Get there early for your spot. Try to check this out at least once, but more if you can. Get there early to get a good view of the entire clock - it is quite a show!!
Over-rated event. The astronomical clock is an over-rated event, just like the Glockenspiel in Munich.Visit the Tower when you have a few minutes of free time, the lines are never long.

Really awesome. This is one of the sights you must see in Prague. It's very crowded at the top of the hour when the clock chimes. It is very cool to watch. Even teenagers think so, although they might not tell you.

Best vantage point in Prague!. When you visit the astronomical clock, you really should pop in and purchase a ticket to ascend the tower. The entrance to the tower is just to the left as you face the clock and there is an elevator (or a 'lift' as we say in the UK :-) ) to get yo to the top. From here you will have the most amazing views of the city and, since you can make your way slowly around all four sides of the tower, your view will be truly panoramic. Make sure your camera or phone or i-pad is to hand!
The clock. We actually waited to see the clock in action. It is special but it was so crowded that I regreted for not just coming to see it while stationary.

Be there every hour. Whenever the clock complete one hour, the crowd round the clock, the sound of the clock is amazing. We also went to the top, it was amazing view, don't miss that opportunity; later, we sat in the open space watching the crowed with our cup of coffee; we complete our walk though the narrow roads near the center, and every road lead us to a new surprise place. its very nice old city, never got board, walking and walking is the best to explore.

It Was, and Is, an Engineering Marvel, But Seeing It Is a Bit of a Let Down. No one should leave Prague without seeing the Astronomical Clock; it is incredibly complex, even for today. When it was constructed in the 1350's it must have held people in awe. Everyone gathers, on the hour, in the square to watch, and the little show begins with death draining the hour glass and then the apostles come out of the door. It is definitely worth seeing, but for us, it was a bit anti-climactic. We needed to keep reminding ourselves that it was an engineering marvel. We also needed to consult our guide book to identify the several complex functions the clock performs. I wouldn't miss it, but I wouldn't go see it again--unless I was just enjoying people watching in the square.
Cool spot in Prague. This a cool spot to see the sights and sound of Prague. It has many good places to eat and near some cool buildings. The clock is near the center of the city. It is a must see.
A unique site...don't miss it when in Prague. It was worth the wait and battling the crowds to see this clock. You need to either have read up about it or see it with a guide.

The Christmas market and lights are magical.. We really enjoyed the atmosphere of the Christmas market in this medieval square. There were lots of food and drink stalls and textile and gifts of all sorts. Surrounding the square were lots of bars and restaurants with terraces and the whole place was lively and fun. Well worth a visit.
Nice old clock.. Lots goes on on the hour, but to get a good view you need to be there well before, when we passed there was always a massive crowd.
An amazing piece of engineering. This was probably one of my favourite landmarks in prague. We climbed the tower and had awesome views of the city

A must See. This is probably the main attraction for tourists along with the Charles Bridge. Everyone gathers to see the clock strike on the hour/s with moving parts such as skeletons ringing bells etc; If you dont get a photo you haven't been to Prague! Best go at night when it is lit up, looks brilliant and you can walk up to the top if your a patient person and don't mind queuing!!!
Nice place to spend a morning coffee. The place can get quite crowded during the day, but nevertheless this didn't spoil my last afternoon coffee in Prague. It's a great place to feel a tourist :)

Must see but don't wait around . The clock is a must see while in Prague but while the clock is impressive I would advise to visit on the hour or half hour as the actual chiming is worth seeing but not overwhelming. Waiting 25 minutes to see it may cause disappointment. Didn't see the old town hall from the inside so cannot comment

Nice, but not for such a fuzz.... It's a beautiful tower, but the chimes of the clock are not so amazing and it's always super crowded. The view from the tower is nice, but it is so crowded and narrow that make it a bit annoying.
Enjoyable. Enjoyable experience. Saw it both at night and during the day. Did not climb up to the tower as it was very busy.

Astronomical Clock. The fun is the palpable anticipation and excitement at the prospect of the movement of the clock and its surrounding figurines. We thoroughly enjoyed the clock striking on the hour and the lone bugler playing from the upper balcony.

Impressive. The clock itself looks really good, as a time piece I'm not too sure how easy it is to use as I spent most of the time navigating my way through the crowds of 'photographers' standing in front it, the Segway guys trying their hardest to floor me and the human statues squeaking to their hearts content.Crowds are a given around any tourist location in Prague however, and this is a must see site.

Must see. One of the must see's when visiting Prague. The building is tall and the architecture is exquisite, like all of the Prague buildings. The clock in itself is very interesting and unusual, but you have to battle through the crowds to see it.

Worth a look but very touristy. Old town square gets very busy. The clock strikes on the hour and is not really very remarkable but most of the walking tours come to observe so the square becomes even busier. There are lots of tourist restaurants in this area but just off of the square tastier and cheaper fayre can be found. I think it is worth a look but there are nicer places to be found in Prague.
Charming Square with Beautiful Architecture. The Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock adorn this charming square. It is inviting to walk through the square and enjoy the beautiful architecture.
fantastic old clock. impressive that this clock was made so long ago, but is hardly worth hanging around for the strike. suggest you get a good seat in an adjacent café about 20 minutes early

It's a tourist attraction for a reason. You cannot believe the complexity and the fact that it still works after 700 years until you see it. Sure there are crowds on the hour. Get over it. You have to go.Also go up the tower - great views and modest cost. Be aware the the entry point for the tower changes between 2 doors. We went early and thought they were closed...but no.

Need to see. This is one sight that every person needs to see when visiting Prague, it is after all, one of their main attractions. The clock is nice to look at but not for a long period of time. I suggest going up the clock tower though which has fantastic views over the city and was reasonably priced.

Old Town Hall. A very busy stopping place for tourists. Every hour, the clock does a little 2 min show which is great for kids. I went on the free tour and David was great in explaning the ins and outs about the clock and its history. Tip: look for David at the Square and follow him to know everything about the clock
Beautiful city of Prague. The Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock is a 'must see' when visiting Prague.Part of the old town and Wenceslas Square - lots of nice restaurants in the vicinity.
Great fun. We enjoyed the sites in old town Prague, but the Czech people are not a friendly bunch. They even boarderline on being rude.

Unusual and Beautiful. This clock dates back to the early 15th century. It is the upper part of the clock that draws visitors. On the hour for 40 seconds the figures play the same scene. The 12 apostles proceed along the little windows which open before the chimes and a young rooster flaps its wings and crows. The clock tower is 228 feet high and worth a stop.

One of the must-sees. . Orloj is one of the "must sees" of Prague. That being said, I'd suggest putting it along the way rather than a destination. If you are there when it tolls, all the better. If not, there are places nearby to get a cow or snack.It's beautiful and a mechanical marvel (to my untrained eye), but not something to marvel at for very long. Unfortunatly, there's usually a crowd surrounding it, so you may want to allow some time to position yourself for photos or the tolling.While you're there, I'd suggest stopping by Týns cathedral on the opposite side of the square. It's an often overlooked wonder. And, if you're there during Christmas time, they used to have a really nice open air stalls shipping thing. Can anyone confirm its still going on? If so, you can easily spend a while there.

wonderful sight. We sat in a bar opposite this clock on the first night we arrived and although drink was more expensive than the side alleyways it was such a wonderful sight at 11oclock when the figures moved.

Must see. The old town hall and clock are a must see in and of themselves, but if you are able to schedule one of the tours that takes you to the tunnels under the old town hall and the square, do it. We went with one of the ghost tour groups and while you would think it might have been a cheesy tour, it was very interesting. You learn about the history of Prague back when the tunnels and underground were still used. Very interesting experience and something that you don't get to do everywhere.

Fourt five seconds and it's all over. The clock itself is pretty cool...but once you have seen the figures move and death ringing its bell you won't need to see it again..we paid to go up into the tower. For the views. We went up at night and it was lovely...there is a lift to the top so don't worry about the climb...worth a visit.

Amazing and Beautiful. The astronomical clock is truly well designed and beautiful. Many tourists and others will gather around the clock every hours. The whole surrounding will be very packed. At this moment, you have to be very careful about your wallets and backpacks. There were many people who will try to jostle around. They might be pickpockets using the opportunities on unsuspecting tourists.It will be better to admire and appreciate the clock after the hour or perhaps in the evening when there are not that many people.
Interesting site.. The clock is worth seeing, especially on the hour while in action. Fascinating old clock with great history.

Touristy, but the tower is worth it. The clock performs a small mechanical show every hour and is interesting to see once. The bigger attraction is the tower for a bird's eye view of the square and the city. This tower has a very modern elevator (lift) which whisks you to the top quickly. We had assumed it would be a walk up tower like the "Powder Tower" but it is not. From the tower you can see quite a distance and get a great overall view of the area. You can walk down a series of ramps to the bottom and read some history on display next to the ramps. You can also take the lift down. The tower was reasonably priced.
Nice . Try to be there on time to see it but don't expect something magic, don't forget to go on top of the tower when the sun goes down. It's amazing.

Stunning view that is worth the fee to go in to the tower. Prague was crowded with tourists the days we were there. Although it was busy at the top of the tower with tourists too it was nice to get away from the crowds and see the city from up high. 360 degree view once outside with great photo opportunities! Walk up or down the tower (instead of taking the elevator) in order to see historical photos and corresponding information related to the town hall and astronomical clock. To be honest the astronomical clock 'show' that happens on the hour is interesting but I wouldn't go out of your way to see it as it was a little lack luster, but if you are nearby on the hour then definitely check it out. Essentially, the doors open and the 12 apostles pop their heads out (like a cuckoo) and the 4 men on the sides of the clock wiggle (including the skeleton, aka 'death'). But the astronomical part of the clock itself does not move during the hourly clock 'show'.
Busy clock. Beautiful clock, gathers people every hour so if you want a good spot get there early! Also for 120 Karuna we went up to the top of the tower which had stunning view at night.

Must see whilst in Prague. After walking around the old town we came across the square which was totally packed full of people, as it was nearly 12pm we squeezed into a space and waited to watch the clock chime, would recommend hanging around after the crowds disperse so you can get a better view of the clock. Word of advice, keep an eye on your bags/backpacks.

Fun in the square. The Astronomical Clock is a fun clock full of history! It is here I learned I have a name day as well as a birthday. Lucky me. Worth learning about with a guide - loads of details you might miss if you tried viewing on your own.

Such a beautiful Town Square with great views. The view from the top of the Astronomical clock tower is picture perfect. The town square was a bit crowded but it was summer so that was to be expected. We waited a while to get to the top of the tower but it wasn't too bad. Definitely something to put on the bucket list of things to do whilst in Prague.

Attractive old clock. This ancient clock is hard to miss when you're walking through the old town square. Unfortunately, as with many of the other main attractions in Prague, the presence of large crowds of people someone detracts from the quality of the experience of looking at it. That said, it's still possible to get some decent photos without random strangers getting in the way.
Captivated our 4 year old. Our little boy loved watching the clock and couldn't wait to see what happened next. It was extra magical watching it at night.

Astounding Clock. The clock is astounding considering when constructed - the story/fable behind its creator also interesting. I wouldn't worry too much going purely for the "clock show", seeing the clock in all its glory is good enough.

Nice clock. I'll admit, it's a cool clock to look at. Very pretty and lots of dials and moving parts. However, that being said, don't plan your trip to Prague just to see this clock or the chimes on the hour. Show up 2 minutes before the hour and don't expect to be wowed. All those tourists standing around will be just as underwhelmed as you are after all the hype that had been built around the clock. Prague had so many other cool things to see, this is a side note, not a main attraction.

Time to watch. This hourly event is quick and may not have the bang power of a video game but it is a marvelous event to see. The real treat is the story behind the clock and the wimsical objects surrounding the clock on the building (look closely). Also if you see the clock at 1:00 pm and hear 13 gongs, it's not broken. The clock chimes using a 24 hr skeem not the AM/PM method. I suggest getting there 10 to 15 minutes early if you need to be close to watch. This is a crowded event but once done the crowd leaves like a puff of smoke.

Astronomical Clock what a masterpiece. We were on a free guided tour, and it was so nice to hear the history of the clock. It's so complicated clever structure, from 1410 and still working!!! Well worth to see the hourly "performance" of the figures. It is very crowded around the square. --There is so much history in Prague ,every where you look there is something, which is amazing.

Nice clock . The clock is very nice but read about the clock before you see it. My family really enjoyed the skeleton on the right ringing the bell. Get to the clock about 5 minutes before the hour to get a good location.

The Famous Astronomical Clock in Prague.. My family and i stayed at Prague for a week, we visit the Astronomical Clock every day and night, is busy and a lot of peoples, we like it very much and you should come one day.You can find a lot of cafes, souvenir shops, theaters and street food and churches.

Interesting Stop in Old Town. The best way to see all these points of interest is to take one of those local tours that last at least six hours. This is pretty interesting to see it in operation and have someone explain it to you while you witness the top of the hour.

Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. Great place to visit and explore shops and places to eat. Clock going off is a bit of a one-trick-pony and slightly underwhelming. Once seen best not to bother again. Old Town Square offers lots of places to eat, al fresco, whilst being entertained by a diverse collection of "extroverts". Best part of the Old Town Square is the U Prince hotel, where we stay, which has a great restaurant and terrace bar with good food and a great selection of drinks and cocktails. Best place to stay in Prague.

Very nice. We have visited Prague before but did not really know much about the clock until we visited with Jana ( with the green & white umbrella) who is one of the free tour guides.She was able to explain what all the figures on the clock meant.Earlier we climbed the tower as the clock struck the hour and a trumpeter plays a short burtss on each of the four sides of the tower.It is worth the climb but there is also a lift for those not so fit.

Don't really get it! . Personal choice I wouldn't give it a bad review but I can't understand the hype. I waited until midday to see what happens on the hour and I'll leave it as a surprise! I think I took one picture its just a clock!

Read about the clock first. Particularly the astronomical workings, and you will get more enjoyment when you understand how it works.The crowds gather in anticipation, then the skeleton rings a bell and the fun starts. Figures move around, the cock crows and then everyone claps.

Lemmings clock. When your sitting with a beer at the many surrounding cafes, its probably more amusing to watch the toudists experiencing their first hourly chime knowing that you were apart of the lemming brigade following suit of the millions before.The draw of this clock is a feat to the culture of modern day tourism and how we can be drawn to something that clearly needs an overhaul and maybe a magical input from disney. Forget the clock and enjoy the beer or a coffee whilst people watching.

A must for every tourist in Prague. Its really amazing to see so many people just staring at the astronomical clock every hour. One has to do the same to be a part of it. The clock is amazing and really astonishing how such a thing was made so long back and it still functions perfectly. This can be done in a tour and also independently as you will be in this area a lot.

Fascinating. I love this amazing clock and the beautiful building that houses it, its a great sight to see the clock on the hour from the outside. And if you take the tour of the town hall you'll have the pleasure of seeing the workings from the inside as well as an amazing tour of the halls you will be taken below to part of an underground town that is a very surprising sight.

Fun stop in Old Town. We arrived in Old Town just as the Astronomical Clock was about to mark the hour. Huge crowd waiting to see the interesting show, so we were actually able to see the full show upon that visit. Returned later in our stay and staked out a spot from which we could view everything. Worth the visit.

Nice clock but... Arrived just before the hour to get a good look and thought I had better video the action of the hourly chime. The clock chirped up as expected and...oh was that it? Don't expect the holy grail of performing clock animations as a little window opens and; well I'll leave that for you to find out.
The clock and the crowds. The clock is worth watching two times to get all of the symbolism. The crowds around it are also a highlight.

The clock is amazing!. The clock is amazing and you must go there on the hour, for the clock show. You should take a free walking tour, where the guide will discuss with you every feature of this amazing huge old clock.

A necessary visit. The clock is very busy, but it's also fascinating, especially given how it was made hundreds of years ago (and then refurbished). Everyone should see it once if you go to Prague - take photos at the bottom of the hour, and go watch at the top of the hour!

A site visited by EVERY tourist in Prague. The square is quite a thing. It is edged by stores and restaurants, street entertainers, food stalls, the tower itself, and a beautiful church. You can be entertained by musicians, jugglers, and even a church service at night. The food stall vendors have great sausages, ham, and traditional Czech doughnut type pastries. One warning about the meat vendors - the sausages are great, but the ham & potato/egg mixture is priced by weigh. Unless you stop them, you may wind up with 16$ worth of meat! Make sure you request a SMALL portion unless it is for two or you are very hungry.The tower puts on a display every hour with moving figures and ringing bells. Large crowds standby for this, and especially at noon when the display is bigger and longer. You really can't see old Prague withoput coming to the square.

A Timely Visit. The astronomical clock in the town square is one of those not-to-be-missed touristy places to see. Make sure you are there for the clock display on the hour (although the astronomical clock in the Strasbourg Cathedral is more complex and "busy"). It has a history worth hearing or reading about. There might be brides who appear, coming from the town hall, all beautiful in their gowns. We saw several, to the delight of the crowds.

Must visit place. Astronomical Clock is something you cannot miss while walking around Prague. You will definitelly enjoy this unique clock mechanism that recently celebrated 600 years. Find some legends about astronomical clock before you see it, you will find it even more magic.Short version:Based on the legend Master Hanuš was chosen by the councillors of Prague to construct a unique time measuring device at Staroměstská radnice that would have many other functions besides measuring time. Hanuš did what he had promised. After he had introduced his perfect machine to the councillors they got scared. They wanted the machine to stay unique and they worried that the clockmaker could make a similar machine for another town. So they were thinking how to get rid of him. One night a group of people broke into the master´s house and they blinded him with a piece of iron. Hanuš knew very well who was behind that and therefore he asked one of his pupils to accompany him to the very heart of the astronomical clock. The pupil did what he was told and Hanuš, despite his blindness, stopped the clockwork. Based on the legend it took more than a century before the astronomical clock was in operation again. Source: praguecityline.com

Outstanding Value!!. Paid a mere $160 Krowns. It included a trip to the top of the tower to take in the sights as well as a tour within the facilities, seeing the apostles rom the other side as well as some great state rooms.Then we went underground through the several rooms. Granted, the guides English wasn't great but it didn't matter. The tour lasted 80 minutes and was heaps better than the other 400 Krowns tour I did earlier in the day.And there were only 3 of us doing try tour! Fantastic!
Good tour. I went on the tour actually inside the tower as well as watching the clock from the outside. It was worth it to do the tour; you get a guide and the actual building is very interesting
What is the fuzz about?. I cannot really understand why all these people were there to see the clock. It is very ordinary and without any special features.

Old Town Square. The only caution the tour guide told us was to be careful of pick pockets. Secure your bags at all times.
We were cautions, but had a great time without any mishaps.
Great view to Old town. Amazing urban view . It was very nice to see Prague from this place . it was nice to see all location that we planed to visit in order to know directions !!!

Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock.. At the entrance to the main town square is the Town hall building with its World famous Prag Orloj medieval astronomical clock.This clock was first installed in 1410 which makes it the third oldest astronomical clock in the World and the oldest astronomical clock still working in 2015.

Busy. We were there for the striking of the clock on the hour and it was not worth the effort. There were soooo many people. We were there in what I believed to be off-peak. If October is off-peak I would hate to see peak time.

Wonderful View but.... This is the prime location to get a great view for Prague, but also a super hot spot for pickpockets. I personally witnessed American lady have her bags voliated. I give that lady a shout which made the thiefs back off, but we are also pretty scared if there was a team up there giving revenge towards people who interfered with their business. More security cameras should be installed up there to make a more hazardous work environment for the pickpockets.

Beautiful at night. Everyone gathers here on the hour to watch the clock strike the hour, many more than once. We watched it twice but didn't really need to, just happened to be there. We did pay to go up in the tower at night and it was beautiful with the city full of lights.
Watched the hourly show. Very over rated show that lasts a little over a minute... very picturesque and worth a visit but the hourly show is not really worth waiting around for..
Beautiful place . The clock is very beautiful and it was surrounded by many tourists when we were there. Be sure to wait to see the clock chimes on every hour.

Great Clock. The Old Town Hall and astronomical clock is located in the town square. The clock is fascinating to see and every hour on the hour, the apostles appear. The other statues move. Take a walk to the top of the tower for a great view of the surrounding area. Continuing walking around the square to admire the architecture and numerous street performers.

crowded place. Go by the hours or a bit earlier so you see time changing. worth checking how it works ahead or picking a free walking tour for complete explanation. crowded place pay attention to Pickpockets
Beautiful building!. Especially impressive at night when a lit up. Situated in the middle of a nice plaza, it is definitely worth seeing.

This beautiful and interesting animated clock is not to be missed!. Located in "old town square" this important landmark is incredible to see as its animated characters come to life at the beginning of each hour.

Great Clock. The astornomical clock is a must see. It is fascinating to watch and is amazing. Every hour you can see the 12 apostles appear. It is worth paying to visit the top of the clock tower to see the views over the city. Just beware that most of the restaurants on the square are very expensive so you might want to find somewhere else to eat and drink.
A must see!. Beautiful and lots of people around. Gorgeous place for pictures and walking around.The architecture is just breathtaking.

The clock that chimes every hour. I recommend getting a table in one of the cafes surrounding the square for a beer and snacks and watch the clock come alive every hour with dolls parading in the windows. Gets very crowded in the afternoon and evening. It reminds me of Munich where the same type clock and dolls come alive.
So pretty. We arrived in the square just before noon and in time for the clock striking - and the horn (I think that's what it was) sounding. It was an experience despite the hords of tourist.

More fun inside of the clock!. We have seen the clock both from outside and from the inside and its much more interesting on the inside =) cause they also show you the "underground town" and the insides of the clock where the figurines are, as well as insides of town hall.

Most awesome clock ever . Amazing the history behind this clock. Would recommend doing the free tours that start couple min walk away from the clock (twice a day) to learn about it. The clock is incredible (and complicated to read). Check some simulations online before your trip to understand how it works. The hourly clock show is a bit over hyped but still cool given how long this mehanism has opperated. Show up a couple min early as it gets crowded!

The clock is ticking . . .. It was interesting to see the clock in action . . . big crowds gathered waiting for the event. The whole square was very interesting architecturally, but the clock definitely made it unique.
gorgeous by day and night. lovely when it is lit up at night, just as stuning in the day, it does get very busy when its due to strike and chime on the hour

Astronomical clock watch closely don't blink. Tourist line up in the heart of old town to watch the twelve apostles come out each and every hour. It is very fast. Over in a few minutes.. If you don't look closely tou miss it. Great story behind the clock.
LOve taht place. Its an amazing place to visit and to stay all day walking around and have you lunch in one of different kind of restaurants( vegetarian-Italian-Iranian-......)

History is more interesting than the show. After watching the hourly show of the astronomical clock, I was underwhelmed. The hype was so much but the show so little. We have to keep in mind that this thing is 600 years old and that it was pretty advanced for its time. Take the free walking tour guide to get a full history of what the significance of the clock is (it's just a part of the tour and you dont need to go inside). After the guide, I found a new appreciation for the device.

history. I've been to Prague a few times, this time I decided to bite the bullet and pay to go to the top of the clock tower. You can go up the stairs/ramps, or take the elevator. All along the ramps there are pictures and history written on the walls. There are always a good number of people at the top of the tower, nothing moves quickly. The views over the entire city are great.
interesting but croweded. the clock was cool when it chimed on the hour but was very crowded. Still it was worth seeing the clockwork.
Interesting. Old town hall is in the city center. There's an astromical clock which is quite interesting thing to see.

Impressive clock. The oldest astrological clock in the world is worth viewing, especially on the hour when the chimes are marked by a procession of characters appearing in windows above the clock. Enormous crowds gather to watch

Be there on the hour!. One of a kind clock that chimes on the hour; this includes some rotating icons, and a few other little charming surprises, you will enjoy. Great place for a photo, too. This plaza is alive day and night, and has outdoor patios of restaurants where you can sit, relax and see the clock chime, day or night. Don't be worried if it is chilly, these places have good space heaters, and the added bonus of supplying plush throws, to cover your knees in warmth, as you enjoy a drink and an appetizer, or a meal. What a great idea! Just an enjoyable place to be,any time during your visit to beautiful Prague.

One of the Best City Clocks. Standing in an old city square with a bunch of other tourists waiting for a clock to chime is not really my favorite activity. But it's compelling. This clock is so old and detailed and so interesting to watch, that it's worth it.

Its a nice Clock and house, but the businesse around is desturbing the view.. The Building and clock is nice and whole square is a nice place, but all the Restaurants who have expanded out almost over the whole square now a day take away the nice environment from this old place. It difficult to see this special place proper now a day.
Amazing. Try and visit the clock on the hour when it chimes and the twelve apostles rotate around behind the open windows. Well worth seeing.
Vibrant and bustling. Great place to start a visit in Prague. There is always music in the air, plenty of food around and a beautiful place to take pictures especially at night.
A must see in Prague. The Astronomical Clock is nice, but I think it is a bit overrated. Lots of fun things to do around the clock though.

Astronomical clock. This is a must see . What a stunning clock you can cimb up to the top of the tower for a fee. Viewing the clock is free on the hour the clock strikes and the 12 apostles appear. Stunning

Old Town Hall - Astronomical Clock. Its famous for its Astronomical clock, which was built around 1400. Its a place where the tourist flock at every hour and clearly the most crowded place in Prague. So every hour, as the bells chime there are two small doors that open and there is a rotation of the 12 apostles followed by the cock crow. Truely recommend this place if you visit Prague

Oldest working clock in a romantic setting. The clock itself is stunningly designed! With the animated figures that's still working, no wonder it is a must-visit in Prague. While waiting for the animation figures to be in action every hour, suggest to visit the tower to capture the great views of Prague. You might want to start waiting in front of the clock to film the figures' animation 15 mins before the end of every hour. It's one-of-a-kind feeling to be in awe with the crowd when it happens :)

Fun to do.. It was just plain fun to see the Astronomical Clock after a 2 hour tour of the Jewish Quarter. Again, the architecture was phenomenal! Small replicas are sold throughout the area and I couldn't resist. I bought 3 for gifts as they are made of balsa wood and are well boxed for easy packing without fear of wrecking them. Great conversation pieces and a wonderful remembrance of our great time here!

One of the best sights to be seen in Prague. I saw the Clock 10 years before, heard the story and saw the moment ... but only this time I bought a ticket (120,- crowns) and climbed on the top of it.Yes, a bit overcrowded, but the views and photos are great:)Just try the same experience.

Queuing!. We paid and queued to go up to the top of the tower - took about 30 minutes, if however you took the lift, you bypassed the queue and got straight to the front of the line - not very fair and not well managed at the top

Astronomical clock: magical . We were here with a guided tour and got the chance to see the astronomical clock, I've never seen anything quite like it, I don't want to give anything away, but I just want to tell you that if you're going to Prague, the astronomical thing will impress you, I loved it and I wish I'd had the chance to see it more.

Great views from the tower. The astronomical clock always draws a large crowd each hour. We went up the tower at night, took the lift as we'd been walking around all day so having the option of the lift was very welcome. The views of night time Prague were excellent.

Nice clock. Well it is a nice looking clock although under repair when I visited and some of the parts were missing. Watched it strike the hour from a first floor coffee shop opposite. All over in about a minute and not a lot happens really but not to be missed.
just average. the square is quite large with so many street food and souvenir shop. but there are many homeless people and i dont think it is secure enough. u need to be alert there
A must see!. Go a bit early and choose your standing spot in the square, it gets quite crowded. I went to watch the clock three times; I just was enchanted.

Iconic. This is what people recognize most about Prague! It's huge and can be seen from anywhere, and the views from the top are pretty impressive! Love the history and science behind it. I recommend a visit.
As they say..... not a very exciting experience as many will say. Lots of people for a lot of nothing. Get a postcard and you will say you have done it/.

Should be on anyone's list in Prague. The area is very dense with tourists, but this is the heart of old Prague. You shouldn't miss it. Especially the apostles that come out of the clock when it strikes each hour!!

lasts around 30 seconds. Wow. We kept trying to catch the famous action packed chiming on the hour but seemed to keep missing itHowever, when we did catch the big moment, i can't say it was the greatest experience I’ve ever had. I won't bore you with the details but don't worry about going too far out of your way to see itPersonally, I’d say whipping past it on your Segway city tour would probably be the best way to see it!:-)

The gem on the map of Central Europe.. Prague is a magnificent city in the Czech Republic . A lot of things to see ,among them a medieval astronomical clock in the Old Town Square. The clock shows figures of the Apostles and other sculptures each hour while striking and it gathers a lot of tourists .When you are here visit also Vyšehrad , a historical fort , built in the 10th century, on a hill over the Vltava River and Basilica of St Peter and St Paul,The view from the hill is outstanding and we both had the feeling of some magical force here.We have been in Prague twice and always discover something special.
Fun to watch. I tried to watch this as many times as I could. Truly a marvel, not to be missed. Gets very busy as the "hour" draws near.
Long weekend trip. THe square in front of the clock gets extremely crowded just before the hour so try to get an outside seat in a bar or restaurant with a good view
Not to be missed. Try to get here early morning as from about 11 am its very crowded on every hour. Watch your purses wallets etc as we were warned about pickpockets here

Arrive few minutes earlier before hits an hour! Awsome night-view. I recommend a visit in the evening. Arrive there a few minutes earlier before it hits an hour to watch the show! Don't expect much! The show was even more interesting few years back; now its shorter somehow!

Inside the oldest working astronomical clock. It was a long plodding walk to reach the top of the clock. There was an elevator but I needed the exercise. The walk up was uneventful; there were just signs explaining various aspects about the clock. The view from the top was amazing. If you do not care about the view, then just check out the clock on the hour instead of paying to go inside.
Interesting and a pick pocket Mecca. The crowd gathers hourly for thirty seconds of the biggest waste of time in Europe. It's tight and pick pockets are plentiful. Avoid the show.
City Clock. Before every hour, hundreds of tourists gather to watch the emergence of the 12 apostles, together with the alarm of the magnificent Clock, on the main square of the old town.

Again an amazing place . Been there few times and I have to say in a coold September at night in the middle of downtown square walking on cubble stones ,looking at that watch , surrounded with people from all nations and different languages spoken ...it's a beautiful feeling ...if you are in Prague. ....go there it's a must .take someone you love there experience it together...the place has some magic I just can't explain your have to experience it your self only then you will understand

Highlite of Old Town Square. Thousands crammed the square to watch the clock rotate on the hour. Although we were warned about pick pockets we never experienced any safety issues .Highly recommend visiting it.

Beautiful place, but doesn't worth waiting for a full hour. A beautiful square, both archetecturally and culturally, with many street performances at the area and stands which offer some local pieces of art (mostly made of glass) and sweets.But the "show" that happens at the astronomical clock with every full hour isn't that unique so it doesn't really worth waiting for.I highly recommend getting to the clock just 2 minutes before it happens, so you won't wait too long and end up disapointed.
Center of Prague not to be missed.. Wonderful experience on the Old Town Plaza. Food booths around the plaza were also lots of fun. Even on a cloudy drizzly day it was enjoyable.

It is a "Must" while being to Prague!. Astronomical clock is one of the most wondreful things to see in the capital of Czech Republic. It is so old and mistificated so it seems that town legends become more real than tourists here. I advice you to visit it not only in day time but also in the evening, especially with good tour guide' like I did. Mikhal (whom I found on 2Polyglot) is a gifted one :) His stories were so interesting that I nearly fall out of time. Thanks for all and I hope we'll meet again
beautiful. I was sitting in the restaurant facing the astronomical clock, The food was not good, but the view was!

Astronomical Clock Tower Tour. A must do when in the square, great views and history related to the Astronomical clock tower to the battles that took place there.Large queues for this attraction so early morning viewing recommended, crowds gathers to view and take photo's of the hourly chimes and display of caricature's that form the feature's of the clock.Be prepared for a slow climb up the tower with winding steps, something to take into account for people not to steady under foot.I actually found a lost wallet on the stairway and when handed it to the ticket counter found it strange that they didn't really know what to do next with it so finally took it downstairs to main reception who were more accommodating. (hope the person who lost this reclaimed it ) All in all a good tour and highly recommended.

A must see in downtown Prague - The clock is amazing. to think this was built back in 1400.... amazing what this inventor came up with. Likely some type of an astronomer/mathematician. The history of the clock is interesting,.... but I got to see it when the city was doing their light festival..... check it out on lione.
Underground tour. I really enjoyed the underground tour. We got to see several rooms and learn about what it was like in the past.
Well worth seeing. This clock is worth a visit. Neat automatons. Get there close to the hour to see them in action. They are popular so get a place early.

Unique Town Square - Clock Is the Highlight. We visited in Sept. It was really crowded. The clock is beautiful and unique but there are so many people you have to get involved with the crowds on the half hour to see the hour chimes. I recommend visiting in late Oct when the crowds are gone

Wonderful place, the old town is fantastic. Could be very crowdy, but soo lovely. The architecture is fantastic. Lovely buildings, lot of restaurants, musicians. We feel safe there despite the crowd... Specially around the hour, everybody check the astronomical clock...

Best meeting point in Prague. Each of the three days spent in Prague, I found a reason to be in the square and hence witness the Astronomical clock. The square is full of interesting characters performing for money, some acrobatic, some comic and some singing. It is worth going to the square just to see the "happenings."The clock attracts many many people. To get a good view of the hourly ritual get there early. Stay focussed becasue it isoverin the flash of an eye(about 10 seconds) I missed much my first viewing and went back an hour later to really see what was happening.

Do not miss the tower (you can skip the clock). Every hour the beautiful astronomical clock gives a “mini show” to the people in the old town square. Little figurines move and hit the bells. It all lasts a few seconds and the place gets packed. If you miss it you are not missing something major. What you should try not to miss is visiting the tower where the clock is. The views to the old town square are brilliant and are completely worth the fee.

beautiful building. The Old Town Hall was founded in the 14th century under the policies of King John of Luxembourg. Now you can see the tower of the town hall: every hour march apostles, astronomical clock and calendar by J. Manes, oriel chapel by P.Parler. The tower can be accessed by elevator. There is a beautiful view of the city.

Magnificent multi- functional clock . An extremely popular attraction especially when the clock is about to chime ! However the chime is less impressive than than expected . The clock is absolutely amazing in form and function . It is amazing that they were able to build a complex masterpiece like this so many hundreds of years ago that is able to not only keep time fairly accurately but also the phases of the moon etc . I suggest visiting it both during the day and night time permitting.

Tourist attraction.. Tourists start lining up about 10 minutes before the hour. There is a lot of jostling and it was the only time I worried about my pocket being picked. On the hour, the characters in the clock come out and the clock chimes.

Great to visit at night. I visited the square twice the second time at night and the atmosphere was far better and the lighting around the square was special don't miss it this visit was when I watched the astronomical clock. and the air of expectation was palpable.

Clock Interesting. The clock itself is beautiful and easier to view in the evening when the crowds are less as every hour there is a "show" which is quick and disappointing, don't believe the hype. The clock has at least 2/3rd original working parts and is very old and depicts various time eras - fascinating history.
Impressive. Amazing to see in the daylight, fantastic to see st night all lite up at night, such wonderful music

Beautiful and functional.. Very impressive both for beauty and function. It shows more than the time, and definitely should be included in any tour of Old Town. However, the hourly performance of the figures around the clock is not as impressive as the massive crowd in front of the clock.

Don't miss this hidden treasure - And it's not the Clock ;-). It's a beautiful clock in a beautiful sq. The perpetual crowd takes a lot of the visual impact away however. There is a hidden treasure on the edge of the sq: Moser. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and uniqueness of the products in spite of it being a chain store. Go to the basement to admire the interior design! I tried to be discreet and respectful when looking around since I knew I was not looking as a prospective buyer. Who knows, you might actually buy something there. Really stunning. Exceeded my expectation!

Very quick chime on the hour but really beautiful. The clock is stunning, you'll get some fabulous photos. The chime on the hour is worth watching, it is very short but it's really interesting. The square is lovely, and it's easy to find. Definitely worth a visit.

Nice atmosphete. Every time I go there I enjoy it like it is the first time
This city is awesome do not hesitate to visit it :)

The centre of Prague. We thoroughly enjoyed our first ever, but long overdue, visit to Prague. What a lovely city and a history buff and tourist paradise. We were there for Christmas ... the Christmas market was superb ... and so are many of the sites and venues within walking distance. We enjoyed taking in the astronomical clock and the old town hall and, of course, the Christmas market and its festive decorations.
Worth a look. Everyone stands around waiting for the clock to strike and the figures pop out. Everyone leaves a little disappointed! The street entertainers in the square next to it are better.

Must climb the tower!. You definitely have to climb the tower for a small fee, you will be impressed by the view!! A bit too crowded at the top when I went though, could hardly move because there were too many people. Nonetheless I would definitely go back!

A must see. A must see in Prague. Stunning at night when illuminated. Costs about £3.50 to go to viewing tower....well worth it ....views stunning. Only negative point there is no one to guide to the tourists and at busy times can be a bit of a free for all!
This place is awesome!. Very fun area, lots of shops and cafes, and you must get there when the clock strikes time. So wonderful.

It ain't over till the rooster crows. The clock is a wondrous contraption that chimes on the hour with a skeleton that pulls on a chain and turns an hourglass upside down to remind you of the passage of time. The apostles parade by an open window and the entire show ends with the crowing of the cock. Well worth putting up with the crowds.

Must See. A visit to Prague is not complete without seeing the astronomical clock. The event takes place at the top of every hour. Crowds gather to watch the clock.
