Be careful to keep your wallet secure while you watch the walk of the apostles where wooden statuettes appear from mini trap doors and move from left to right. Then go to one of the nearby kiosks for sausage and for palacinta with apricot jam or chocolate. Surprisingly we found the palacinta to be more authentic in Prague than in Budapest where they now make a modern version that misses the mark.

LOOKING DOWN GREAT LOOKING UP NOT SO MUCH. Spent a part of a day wandering around the Old Town Square and eventually waiting in the crowd to see the action at the Astronomical Clock when it struck the hour. Well the bells and chimes went off and two small windows opened for about 20 seconds while the Walk of he Apostles took place. While the clock itself is certainly amazing considering its age the walk is so so, not as exciting as the animation in the Munich Square in Germany. However the views from atop the tower are certainly worth the climb up the stairs to the top, or take the elevator part way up, either way it is worth it.

Not worth the hype. You will be shoulder to shoulder in a crowd of tourists, all with phones and iPads held out for snaps, with someone breathing down your neck as you wait for the time to hit the hour and for the clock tower to do its thing.Yes, it's amazing that this clock has existed for so long, and yes, it was a majestic feat of engineering ingenuity in its time, but let's be honest: no one is being blown away by rotating figurines behind a clock face.If you happen to be around while it's going on, sure, take a peek. But don't plan your day around this and don't wait around too long.
Beautiful clock. Try to see this at a time when not so many people are here (early morning). Crowds gather near the top of the hour, when the clock "performs."

Avoid evening? . Great views but we were there at night so the huge lights that illuminate the tower are very bright, slightly blinding and make it hard to see below. My advice, go in the day, or even better, it would be great at sunset!!
A must see stop on the Town Square. A most complicated clock that is not as exciting as it is cracked up to be. The mechanism only does the "big" show every two hours and it is less than exciting.

Nice view of the city . The simple your is perfect for a family with kids. No hassle. Buying the tickets and then going at our own pace. The view from the top is beautiful and helpful for orientation!We went down on foot along the the sloping track which was also fun for the kids and the interpretation material was great along the way.

The clock is worth the trip. The only part of Town Hall I saw was the clock. Every hour for ~30 sec. one is treated to a parade of saints at the told door while a skeleton strikes a bell as the hour rings. Entertaining BUT watch your pockets/purses, it is a HAVEN for pickpockets. They prey on unsuspecting visitors everywhere & are not unique to Prague.
Great visit. Best time between 9am and 10am to see and hear clock chiming. Great experience for anyone to go and see

Visited on its anniversary. Visiting this well known clock on its 605th anniversary make me feel over the moon. Every hour the skeleton rings the bell and all other figures shake their heads. There is also a presentation of statues of the Apostles at the doorways above the clock.

Love it, but very crowded. I love the square but there were so many tour groups that it was very difficult to get from one place to another - especially on the hour when everyone wanted to see the figures on the clock.

Make sure you are there on the hour!. Its fun to stand around with 100 or so total strangers as the clock strikes the hour and the show begins. Its mostly amusing, not particularly spectacular. But seeing the reaction of the other tourists is always entertaining.
Astronomical Clock. No visit to Prague would be complete without going to the clock. Go on the hour to hear the chimes. Great place to sit and watch the people go by.

Underwhelming..... I suppose wherever you go, you should see the major attractions, and yesterday we found ourselves wandering into Old Town Square just before 1pm, so we joined the throng already waiting, cameras at the ready for the action..... and it was a bit like a damp squib! Not much action at all.The astronomical clock is impressive, but does little to add to any sense of anticipation. The square itself was overcrowded and the prices at cafes and bars around the square were higher than elsewhere, unsurprisingly. As I said , underwhelming.

Magical at Night. I had heard about the clock before coming to Prague and it did not disappoint. I did not know that much about the Old Town Hall. This was a treat. We took the last tour of the day after dark. What beautiful old building these are. The door are especially ornate. The guide gave us a very good overview of the history and how one section was burned when the Germans left. I really enjoyed going down into the cellar to the old medieval dwellings. After dark it gave the whole place a slightly spooky atmosphere, I felt. It was quite amazing to be in a place where people had lived so many years ago. They showed us the inside workings of the clock as well. At the end we climbed the tower to gaze upon the beautifully lite Prague Old Town Square. Thoroughly enjoyed this tour.

Historic centre of Prague. Well worth a visit to see the architecture and history all around the square. Costly to eat/drink here but cheaper a short walk away. Clock is facinating and both dials move - not bad for 13 century engineering.

Highly Over-rated. The clock is the most over-rated attraction in all of Prague. Every hour, thousand of tourists gather in the square to watch the clock perform. I would advise you to come back at a regular time, and enlist a guide to tell you about the clock and its functions. The mechanism of the clock is ingenuous and a big feat to have achieved in those times.
astronomical clock carries lot of history. every hour there will be a grand show when the clock strikes 12. worth seeing the show. take a walking tour for better understanding of the clock work
Excellent place to go!. Located in the square, perfect place for a great selfie or picture of family. Lots to do in the square as well. Don't miss the on hour show!

Old Town Great--Clock Not Much of a Show. The Old Town Square is fantastic to see. The Astronomical Clock is very interesting to see, but to be there on the hour for the "show" is anti-climatic. I'm not saying don't see it; just don't expect something a neat as the Munich Glockenspiel at Marienplatz. You do want to experience the square.

A must see and do while in Prague!. If you don't mind crowds and heights, this is a must do and see while in Prague. First, stand at street level before the Astronomical Clock and marvel at it while it chimes the hour. Then, buy a ticket to climb the clock tower and enjoy a fantastic view of Old Town and surrounding areas. Do not forget your camera!!

Best to do in off hours. Due to where our hotel was located, we walked through Old Town Hall several times a day to get to most places in Prague. We found the hall and clock area were less crowded later at night (after 9) and early in the morning (8 or 9a, depending on the day of week). If you are trying to get the perfect shot, this is the best time to go. As it got closer to mid-day, the crowds got larger and more people were posing with the clock (even brides and grooms and they would be there for long periods of time!). Don't miss out on see the 27 crosses at the base of the tower. They are located on the ground near the small park with trees facing the square. They are a memorial for the Protestant nobles, merchants & intellects were beheaded in 1621 after the Battle of White Mountain.
A must do, but .... So you need to see it as it is a one off, but once you have .. so what! The Downhill in Munich is better for the display.

Fascinating Landmark w/ a Beautiful View. On our recent trip to Prague we decided to go up in the Astronomical Clock Tower to kill some time before our brewery tour. This ended up being one of my favorite things we did that day! The walk to the top of the tower is full of plaques & pictures detailing the history of the clock & it's unique features. For those not able to climb the tower, a lift is available. Once we made it to the top there was a 360 degree incredible view of the city. We went at night, which was stunning. I'd go again during the day just to be able to make out the various city landmarks with more clarity. After our experience inside the tower weren't down & were able to see the hourly show put on by the clicks working figurines on the front facade. I highly recommend taking some time in Prague to have the full clock tower experience rather than just a walk-by...it's worth it!

Great looking clock...... Hundreds of people stand and observe the clock show at the top of every hour. The show is a bit underwhelming, but whatever, I did see a fight break out between a tour guide and a tourists, that was quite fun too....

Timing is important. The hourly Astronomical Clock show is the key event in Old Town. Get there early if you want to see it without the large crowds that form from mid-morning throughout the day. Be sure to read about its history beforehand so you can fully appreciate the story behind the clock and its creator. If you get caught in a large crowd, look for a place on the corner where the coffee shop is situated (assuming you have good vision); we found that location offered an easier view than jostling with taller people standing in front of the clock.
A happening place. It was fun to watch the hourly show where the apostles come out of the clock and march around for less than a minute.

Good but a little strange. A really nice place with lots of bars and cafés. We had several drinks in different bars while people watching. The clock is just madness incarnate...the thing that threw me was the crowd applauding the automata.
The clock dates back to 1410. The clock tower is quite imposing and towers over the other buildings nearby. Its amazing to think that this dates back to 1410 and still tells the time on the hour.
See the clock. See the clock, climb the tower on the tour. The night time view is terrific. The "show" on the hour is underwhelming.

Goes off hourly. Not to be missed. This clock is very interesting and has a very intriguing history. It goes off every hour on the hour and is something that shouldn't be missed if in the area. It only goes off for about a minute so don't be late. It's in the middle of the Old Town Square so it is surrounded by shopping and food as well as other sites.
Top of the Town. Taking the steps to the top is worth every step. The view as you walk around the tower is absolutely stunning.

Historical Site in Praha. The Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock have been viewed for hundreds of years and they still delight everyone when the clock strikes 12 noon and the little people begin coming out and circling around the clock. We were there while they were having a street market so very busy area...lots of tourists in this area...the crafts and artwork at the market were beautiful.

A must!!! be there on the hour to see the twelve apostles. This clock has not stopped working the last 605 years... it not only gives the hour (24h), but also the hour that Bohemia would have had if it was still in existence where the day started at 1am instead of midnight.. this, among other surprising elements!

Telling time. With most of us now glancing at our mobile phones or Apple Watch to get in tune with civilization, the wonders of astronomical clocks built hundreds of years ago are a marvel.When I see such a sight, I think of how astronomy, physics, engineering, fabrication, craftsmanship all come together to tell the viewer more than just what time of day it is: the phase of the moon, the sign of the Zodiac, et al. And then the motion of the statues, the crowing of cocks. The downside is that the crowds are always something to behold when the clock strikes the hour. No starlet on the red carpet hears so many shutters click, whether a film camera (every now and then), a modern DSLR, or the ubiquitous mobile phone camera is pointed toward the behemoth.What a sight!

Nice clock. There is a little "show" by the figurines around the clock every hour. Each figure does an action that represents something I don't remember from our guide right now, but you can google.Cool. Videos available.
Five stars for the clock. The clock is a marvel piece of engineering and alone worth a visit. Nothing special happens on the hour but you are still going stay and see it :-)

A must see attraction in Prague. An amazing clock dating from the 12th century (?) - everyone want to be there and see it when it strikes the hour - you get to see the 12 apostles rotate around the top of the clock. Being an astronomical clock it shows the phase of the moon, month and lots more - amazing for it's age.

When in Prague........ .......you really have to go to the square and see the astronomical clock. Every 15 minutes the windows open and all the little characters pass by and give you a wave. Be warned that the square is always busy just below the clock and everybody is waiting for the clock to perform. It is clever and you don't need to see it a second time, but make sure you see it once!!

Very very Crowded. If you want to get a good view of the clock ringing the hour and the doors opening you will need to get your space at about five minutes past the last hour! By half past the area in the square just in front of the clock is already packed with walking tour groups stacking their place. Personally I thought the event was a bit over hyped as all that really happens is that two doors open and a parade of figures (Saints?) go by.

Beautiful clock but not worth being there on the hour.. This clock is beautiful but it's hourly performance is less than exciting. My tour guide says it's the second most disappointing tourist attractions in Europe. Go without expectations and enjoy the beauty of it.
get the story behind this clock. It is quite remarkable all that it does: astrological, moon clock, etc. go on the hour to see the moments
Difficult to miss once your in the main square. Usually very crowded especially on the hour. A pleasant 5/10 minutes can be spent watchning the old clock go through its motions.

It's unique, see it at least once. Of course, everyone who visits Prague goes to see and watch the astronomical clock do its thing so that is where the crowds are. There are a few of them throughout Europe, but they are still unique so it is worth seeing at least once. We saw it a few times from the ground. It is pickpocket heaven so beware. You also have to dodge lots of segways and selfie sticks in that area as well.

An Amazing Place. The astronomical clock is amazing. It keeps great time AND the position of the sun and the moon. It is flanked by four figures(vanity. the miser, death and lust" which strike the time and on the hour small doors open above the clock and there is a "parade" of the 12 apostles.A negative is the pushing and jostling of crowds who gather to see the show - but it is worth it
nice clock. Astronomical clock is nice, but i expected more from animation that is every hour. little disappointed

Over so quickly. Crowds gather in the square to see this event on the hour and seem very excited. Whilst the technology of the astronomical clock is clever, if your understand it, the event is not. The apostles appear at the window one by one and it is over in about 25 seconds and our crowd applauded as though they had seen something amazing. When in Prague you have to see it but do not expect too much.

Magical Old Town Square. The square has beautiful architecture, sculpture and lots of action. The star is the Astronomical Clock and its hourly ringing when all of Prague seems to watch! Restaurants, shops and horse and train rides abound the area but this does not detract from the historical beauty. A sight to see at all times of the day/night - one night a guitarist was playing to a crowd who were all singing - magical.

Doesn't look a day over 1600. This clock has been around since the 1400's and it doesn't look a day over 1600. Show up at the top of the hour every hour to watch it do its thing. I'd rather not tell you what it does but let's just say it's amazing that after all these centuries it still 'does it thing' and considering it's the oldest working astronomical clock in all of Europe is pretty impressive as well.
Interesting stop on the old town tour. Take a few minutes to watch the clock and appreciate the clock and its components and its operation, which is interesting in and of itself.

Prague's Astronomical Clock Tower. Prague's astronomical clock tower is a medieval astronomical clock located in old town hall. The local guide said it is one of the most over rated attractions. People stand waiting just to watch this presentation of the Apostles at the two doorways. We didn't intentionally waited for it as it was 2 mins to go when we were heading back to our bnb.

Cool part of town, but skip the clock. Old Town Hall and the square that surrounds it is really great. There are shops and restaurants on the perimeter, and some great public seating where you can relax and do some people watching. This area gets a lot of foot traffic, mostly when the Astronomical Clock is due to move. The gawking crowds combined with people trying to cross the square made that experience kind of a nightmare. So, I would recommend steering clear of that area during those times. Other than the clock, that is a super fun area.

Brilliant view. The clock itself is impressive, but very crowded outside it when it's about to chime so it's hard to get a good vantage point. Quite interesting display but it's been refurbished so not sure how much is original. We paid to go to the top of the tower. Was a long circular ramp up to the top (though there was a lift). There were historical photos on the way up with information boards, which were interesting enough, but there's not really enough room to stand and look at them for ages if people want to walk past you. The view from the top is great, but if there's a large crowd you can feel a bit rushed. People are supposed to move around to the left, but some people ignore this. Got some good photos from the top.

Not as great as what I pictured. Went to see this today and was looking forward to it, got there and omg the crowds!! Really? I've never seen such an excited gathering of spectators turn into a disappointed mumbling crowd which then dispersed so quickly. The poor guy who designed this was blinded by the people who commissioned the work because they didn't want there to be anything like it anywhere else... That guy got a rough deal.. In all honesty is worth a look but it's all over in 20 seconds, it's not as great as you might think..

I'll tell you a secret - Mozart cafe on upper floor gives great view of clock. The astronomical click is nice but frankly the one we saw in Italy was more complex - for that matter so was the one in a Austria. However our tour guide, Ljubia from Tours By Locals brought us to the second floor of the Mozart cafe ( the also serve on the lower level) and there was no crowd and a great view
Rare thing. a unique attraction of prague. Located on the heaet of old town in the square. U will find a lot of people looking at this clock. Bit difficult to understand it's reading.
You Have to Stand in the Plaza and Watch the Clock Do Its Thing.. No trip would be complete to Prague without standing in the crowd in the Plaza waiting for the clock to do its thing.

Clock Design from 1400s Still Mesmerizing!. Crowds gather to watch the striking of the hour at the Astronomical Clock on the Town Hall. This is not the original clock that was built in the 1400s, but one that was reconstructed after WW II damaged the first one. It is amazing to watch the various movements on the clock when the hour is struck and imagine what a marvel this was at the time of its invention. The Old Town Hall offers rides to the top as well as a tour of the hall and Gothic chapel. Tickets are sold at the TI.

Clock Tower Tour / View - a must see. Besides the beauty of the square, and the people, and all the entertainment going on, there are two things you should make time for. First, pay the admission fee that will take you to the observation platform at the towers top. Half the fun is getting to the top with a series of stairs, elevator rides. We did this at night and the views of Prague were breathtaking. Second, is listening in on guided tours that explain the workings of the tower clock. Then on the hour, view a quick 20 sec movement of clock tower figurines.
Prague. Had a great day loved the clock will use the tour guide again and would visit again beautiful city one thing I will say food and drink cheap but shopping is cheaper in dublin

fantastic view!. We visited the Old Town Hall tower which is 69.5 metres high. You will see Prague in full panoramic view for only 120 CZK. There's a lift inside the tower so you wont need to climb all the stairs...

Great place to people watch. This is a must do in Prague. The views from the top down to the square and streets below are breathtakingly beautiful. Try to go up later in the day as it tends to be quieter and the sun is in a better position for taking photographs. The square is a good place to people watch while eating a snack or drinking a glass of wine. Visited the square every day we were in Prague.
Every hour. Whilst in prague you have to stop and watch this amazing clock . On the every hour every hour crowds gather to watch the display. Well worth hanging around for.

Must see sight in Prague. This is a must see place in Prague. Not only is the clock from the 1400s, but it is very beautiful. You can take an elevator to the top and enjoy the observation deck to get a bird's eye view of the colorful city. Absolutely worth it! Note, if you decide to walk up, it is mostly a ramp all the way to the top, until the very last bit, where you take a very narrow spiral staircase. If you are afraid of heights, this part might be a little uncomfortable. But the rest of the view is great!!!

Watch the clock with all the other tourists. I really enjoyed our stop to see the astronomical clock, which was a serious wonder when it was built. I think some may be a bit of let down for those that are expecting something spectacular since the saints appearing in the windows of the clock when it strikes the hour is a bit uneventful by modern standards. But even so, I found it very fun, even though the spot to get a good picture of the saints if fairly small and you end up standing in a mob of tourists waiting for it to get a decent shot. We also bought the ticket and went up into the old town hall for a nice view of the city.

Historic place but don't bother waiting for the clock to play on the hour. A historic area of Prague from which it is possible to reach most other areas. The clock is over 600 years old and is historically interesting, but not worth waiting for the mechanism to work on the hour as it only lasts a few seconds.
Amazing Engineering. If you are a history buff and like old architecture and engineering wonders, this is perfect. Plenty of street vendors and shops. Good for people watching.
Very interesting. There are always a lot of people around the clock, waiting for the hour that it will bring some surprises.
very interesting experience. I visited the clock twice while in Prague. I enjoyed it most while having dinner in the square. There are always many people around but plenty of viewing space.
Loved it. Loved it. It is crowded and awesome. Went back here many times, sometimes several times a day for drink and food in the plaza. just awesome fun.
What an atmosphere. Beautiful place , ancient building lots of activities . Beautiful restaurants lots of lanes , pubs and restaurants to explore. Soak in the atmosphere

Absolutely amazing!! Must see!!. No visit to Prague would be complete without going to Old Town & seeing the Astronomical Clock!! After learning more about it's origin while on a walking tour of the city, I appreciated it that much more. And absolute must see!!
Beautiful clock. Stunning click, both in daylight and at night. The wooden figures are some what overrated but worth a watch if you happen to be there on the hour.
Amazing to watch. Be there well before the hour strikes s the area around the clock it fills and you may loose your best camera shot, but it is worth the wait

SOOOOOO Crowded!. While the climb up shoulder to shoulder with everyone else was not nice, the views of the square and around the city are great. Even rode the elevator with a docent who was wonderful and informative. Got to do it; one of the most famous attractions in Prague, but be prepared for the crowds.
Amazing to see worth a visit. Don't want to spoil the fun but when it chimes something amazing happens, well worth a visit. Very busy with tourists, can actually visit the building for a small fee.
Genius Piece of work. Geniuse Clock tower take the time to watch it move and stick the hour. A very busy part of town close to trendy shops and Jewish sector
View!!!!. Old town square like on your hand!!! The best view in Prague!!!! Walk the stairs up to the tower and enjoy breathtaking view :)
Iconic in Prague. A fun place to hang out and people watch. Again watch out for pick pockets in Prague. It's fun to watch for the clock but people push to get a good view.

Fantastic old world city. This is a really interesting old clock in one of the most beautiful plazas in the world. The cafes and restaurants surrounding this plaza a great place for people watching and some really good food also.

A Clock with a Show. Very ornate astronomical clock that gives a show hourly during the day. Recommend grabbing a seat at one of the cafes that face it and enjoy a drink, ice cream or sandwich. Great pit stop at the end of a walking tour.

An unexpected highlight, most recommended. We decided to 'climb' the tower at the last minute on a particularly bright final day of our stay. I am so glad we did. It couldnt't be more accessable with either a lift or a curving ramp, which we opted to meander up, largely so we could read the unexpected and hugely informative story of the tower and town hall as we went. It really enhanced our whole stay in Prague.My only word of caution is it is very busy at the top with very little space-it does feel that they should restrict it more/allocate time slots. We entered the clock tower just after watching the Astronomical Clocks 2pm display and walked back out the door just as it struck 3pm- longer than we'd expected to enjoy it for and offering great value for money.
Disappointed. Huge crowd of people for seeing 30 seconds of disappointing show. The clock itself is nicely made, but that's all.

One of the most beautiful areas in Europe. Each of the town squares in the Czech Republic is unique and beautiful, but Wenseslas (sp) is probably the most beautiful and full of life. The Clock is amazing.

showstopper. The music, intricate figurines and interesting design almost blended in to the business of Prague. It is a hidden, albeit in plain view, gem brought to life by the hundreds of people who admire it during it hourly chime.
Must see. If you are in Prague there is no way to miss this unique piece of art, it is something you will never forget...
Unique. A unique & beautiful clock attested to by many who witness it hourly ringing. A must see in rain or shine...best early in the day before tour groups throng the area.

ASTRONOMICAL CLOCK. Do go the viewing deck and get beautiful views of Prague.
crowd outside evry hour when the clock chimes.
Your typical clock tower but still nice. It's your typical clock tower but very nice. Every hour, I believe it was, the top windows would have little fake men going around and playing instruments.

Underwhelming. Very minimal movement of figures, on the hour at the clock, has literally hundreds of people rubber-necking up at the clock face. It's over in 30 seconds, and there wasn't much of it. Gotta do it, I guess, if you're there but not much to write home about.
Extraordinary pieces of art. The clocks are at a much lower level than I expected it, so they can be analyzed properly from a few meters.

A must-do in Prague. No doubt this is a must-do when being in Prague. The clock is in the city centre so you really can't miss it. It is interesting and fascinating but of course at the top of the hour there are many people pushing in front of it.

Great view of Prague. We were going to climb the Town Hall Tower and were surprised to find an elevator. Actually you go up a couple of floors on one elevator and then almost to the top on another. A few flights to climb. Great view of the Town Square.

Fabulous views. Climbing up to this magnificent clocks is a feat, although you can take the elevator for a little way. The views are spectacular as you can walk 360 degrees around the tower. The clock strikes every hour and provides a spectacle of changing medieval characters passing under the clockface. The area gets very crowded during this time.
Very interesting . Don't forget if in Prague to make sure to catch this its every hour on the hour and draws a massive crowd 😁

Amazing piece of architecture. A must see if you are in Prague. The clock was installed in 1410 and it is still working! It shows the position of the sun and the moon, the zodiac and also somehow manages to tell the time. Every hour the skeleton figure rings the bell and the 12 apostles are presented. An amazing piece of history and architecture.

Worth the Wait for the Show. We got a table at a cafe across from the clock--enjoyed a glass of wine, while watching all the people in the square. During our time at the cafe, we also saw the show . It was
interesting seeing the 12 Apostles appearing, but the show only last for a few minutes.

Astronomical Clock, Prague. It was okay. We were expecting more from the clock. Waited 10 minutes or so. All that really happened was some chiming and a few figures way at the top moved around a few times. Kind of disappointing.

Beautiful piece of history. The clock tower is situated in the square and is very beautiful! there is always a crowd when the hour strikes to watch the display come to life. It is well worth paying the £3 to go up to the top as the views are spectacular, I would recommend doing this earlier in the day rather than later to beat the ques! Make sure you read the signs on the way up the tower to learn about the sad history of the tower.

Place you should not miss. For me this was the most beautiful clock among many that can be seen on many Prague towers. Although astronomy was studied by many civilizations long before Christianity came to the scene, it was quite unique and unusual for that era to build an astronomical clock.
Beautiful. This is a must see if you are in Prague. Best to see with a guide. We had Simon arranged by our hotel--Hotel Maximillan. Prague is a walking city and Simon took us everywhere.

Get tickets early to avoid crowd. Tower opens at 11 AM. but get your tickets early at the office to right of clock. Get in line at the tourist info office to beat the crowds up to the top...fantastic views.

A must see!. The square where the clock is located is a must see with a massive memorial in the centre and historic building on all sides.You can not aviod the crowds but if you make your way over to the tourist info. centre they are excellent and very helpful.

Cute clock but wear your glasses. Yes the clock is clever but not thrilling and I could not really work out what was so entertaining. The square itself is however well worth a visit...some interesting shops and some very good buskers. More than anything we lived the buildings. I filmed the clock striking, having waited with countless others in the rain but deleted it. I did however retain my pictures if the beautiful buildings around the square.
great place. great place with many activities from daytime to night time. and accessible to many shopping ares too. fantastic for relaxing while walking around the place
Must see . Beautiful Old clock with clockwork animated figures.. draws huge crowds on the hour every hour for a short sequence to mark the passing of the hour. ..a must for any visitor to Prague..

Nice but not wow. I personally don't understand all the tourists lining up to see the clock. It's nice but not special. However the Old Town Hall is interesting. If you take the tour you can see the underground rooms. I also recomend going inside the tower of the astronomical clock not just stand in front of it wainting for the "show".

Pretty amazing. Wow this is an engineering feat. And amazingly enough it still work after more than 600 yrs... Place can get quite busy so get there before the clock goes off to get a good view of it .Enjoy

Do the town hall tour, skip the hourly clock show. The town hall tour covers both the insides of the five buildings that comprise the town hall and the medieval below-ground town hall which the current one was built on top of. The decorative elements in the town hall are spectacular including wonderful wall murals and painted ceilings. The below ground rooms include a tavern and a prison. The tour is wonderfully informative. While the astronomical clock is beautiful and interesting, the hourly show of the figures in clock appearing lasts about for a very short time and it is difficult to see more than the outlines of the rotating figures. But if you take the town hall tour you get to see the figures from inside the clock tower up close and watch them rotate. A much better show than the one outside.
Prague Icon!!. The Astronomical Clock is a main tourist draw in Old Town Square. Climb up the clock tower to enjoy a beautiful bird's eye view of Prague.

The View from the Tower Shouldn't be Missed. Every hour a huge crowd gathers around to see the show that the clock puts on (and try to make sure their wallets are held onto as pickpockets circulate). The real attraction is to ascend the tower and get the best view of the old section of Prague. You'll take a modern elevator in an adjoining building up a few stories to get to the entrance. Once inside the tower, you can take a small, circular elevator to the top if you have trouble walking (or a touch of vertigo). Otherwise, you can walk up a spiraling walkway that has a series of photographs of Prague and other exhibits that are worth the price of admission alone. At the end of the ramp, there is a steep spiral staircase that doesn't have enough room for people going up and down simultaneously. Be sure to use the light as a signal or you can spend a long time waiting for people going in the opposite direction during crowded times. Up top, you have a narrow balcony with 360° views of the old city. Signs tell you to proceed around in a counter-clockwise direction, but some tourists (mostly Asians for some reason) insist in going the opposite way, and getting past one another is very difficult. The views on a clear day are well worth the bother.
Astronomical Clock. Interesting hourly diversion.....apostles come out, skeleton waves a head up and down....very popular attraction....get there early.

Must-see, but once is enough. I know it's a must-see, so we did. Try the evening to beat the crowds. I didn't think it lived up to the hype. The figures are wonderful, but without a telephoto or binoculars you can't see much. And there's a real scrum at viewing time.
Lots of groups on tour!. Surprisingly busy and very interesting. Lots of crystal and head shops. Very clean, but lots of graffiti.

Definite must see in Prague. We went out looking for this clock specifically on our second day and realized we walked right by it on two different occasions and didn't even notice it. Great sight for all the gear heads out there with the fact that this dates back to 1410. Crowds gather on the hour to watch it in action although it is quite anti-climatic as it really doesn't do anything spectacular other than work! It is right next to Old Town Square, the buzz and vibe there is just great!

Astronomically Overrated. A clock tower where hundreds of tourists are standing in front of .Overcrowded and hard to understand why. if you are there, have a look at it briefly .it is not worth going up to the tower either. It costs you about £4.
Amazing. The clock and surrounding are a must visit when in Prague there's so much to see and do restaurants a plenty as are the bars.

Interesting Clock. Situated just off the Old Town Square, you can see the Astronomical Clock, one of the may famous attractions in Prague. The area gets very crowded, and you have to push past all the Tour Groups who insist on all standing in front of it, as if they are the only tourists
VERY touristy. Super crowded but you must go.. Watch your pockets. We preferred it at night.Restaurants away from square a better value and cuisine

Stunning views from the tower. The clock itself is very beautiful. What it actually does on the hour is probably not worth battling the huge crowds that gather. The tower is well worth going up (there is a lift) and has gorgeous views of the city. The other rooms usually on show were only available on guided tours and I don't do them, so missed that. There are wedding photo shoots going on outside quite often. The Tourist Info inside is very helpful.
Must See. A must see in Prague. The Astronomical Clock is a site to behold, just watch and experience. Completely centrally located, near many popular and busy locations.

A Clock is a Clock is a Puppet Show. Everyone has to see this when in Prague.A truly wonderfully weird thing to see, but it can get a bit crowded when the hour strikes.I actually prefer the Clock in Hameln, Germany, but that is just me.

Not a disappointment.. I had read that this was not worth seeing but thanks to a tour guide I was fascinated to listen to the history of this clock,even in the pouring rain,I thought it was a wonderful piece of engineering and the story behind it fascinating.
Old Town Hall. By all means don't miss a walking tour of the Jewish Quarter and the Old Town Square then a stop at the world-famous Astronomical Clock and the Town Hall.

Dont miss the tower.. The Astronomical clock by itself is nice. It is interesting to see it once at a round hour, and even more interesting to see all the tourists doing the same, You cannot see all the  characters very well, yet it is interesting . The view from the tower is simply great, and is not the same view from other view points in Prague. It cost 150 Kc to get there and two elevator but it worth it (entry is from the ping building. DONT MISS IT !!
Everybody must see this place. It is good to see this historical town hall, it is tourist attraction once you visit Czech Republic and inside staff are helpful.
Old town clock. One of the things to be seen in Prague. See it on the hour so that you will see it working. Get there 10-15 minutes before as there are crowds
Worth Seeing. Worth seeing. Many tourists in this area, but this is a must to see, the astromical clock. Try to be there on the hour to see the special movements of the clock.
Climb the tower!. Great views from the top for 120czk. Climb up don't take the elevator. Great history and pics on the walk up.

Good View but Don't Wait for the Clock. This is in the central square so the location is from busy to absolutely packed with tourists. The tower can give you a panoramic view of the red roofs of Prague and beyond if the weather is clear so it is worth the effort (use the stairs). The clock is a disappointment as its celebrated movement is muted to say the least. You will be much better off learning about the clock, its creation, meaning, operation and what happened to its designer. If you do stay to see its operation be prepared for heavy crowds and have your pictures photobombed with selfie sticks.

Skip the hourly crowds and learn about the clock instead!. We went on a tour with a fantastic guide who filled us in on the actual clock and its very complicated mechanisms. It is absolutely fascinating how the different dials represent the different cycles of the moon/sun/months/hours, etc....The actual letdown is the hourly show at the clock. It is ridiculously crowded but it all lasts for about 30 seconds and you are left wondering "is that it?". Learn about how the clock works rather than queuing up to see it on the hour.
Center of Prague. Fun to go, street performers, loads of Tour Groups, thousands of tourists, & overpriced restaurants & souvenir shops. After a couple hours, I've had enough.

The Mozart cafe. Went in here just before 11am to be able to view the astronomical clock chime and watch the figures. Great vantage point especially with a Czech coffee and a slice of delicious gateaux!

Very interesting. I never could figure out how the clock worked. The Old Town Square is very crowded with tourists, tour groups, locals, vendors, musicians. So, be careful with your purse/wallet as you are peering upwards.

Disappointing clock. After much hype we waited (with around 2ing.00 other visitors) for the hour to strike. Some very poor effiges of the disciples trundle around for a short while. The clock itself did nothing. Very disappoint

A Medieval timepiece. This is a major attraction of Prague. The astronomical clock along with the hourly display draws heavy crowd. We also joined the crowd to see the display at 11 am. This clock is 600 years old and is treasure of the city.
The march-past of the 12 apostles is an interesting spectacle.

Top of the Hour. Good fun; the biggest attraction in the square
Don't stand too close at the top of the hour as most people do.
Keep your eye on the rooster!

Fantastic central viewpoint. Took the 2 lifts to the top of the Tower and rewarded with the best city centre views in Prague. Can look down over the main market square and across to the castle. Although not the highest viewpoint in Prague giving the most commanding view, think it is the best of the central area. Worth a visit

A very vibrant place. A popular destination for tourists. Shops and restaurants everywhere, street performers, and the hourly anticipation of the machanic clock which turned out to be a disappointment.

The wonderland. The colors, the architecture, the people: everything is beautiful in this square. The clock is absolutely amazing and I advice you not to miss it when it strikes the hour! A dreamy moment!Praga is wonderful and you enjoy every corner.

Very impressive 1410 clock. Very ornate clock faces. The highlight of this clock is the on the hour ringing when the apostles walk in front of the small doors. It only lasts half a minute or so, so have your camera ready or you'll miss it.
Prague's pearl. Hundreds of people awaited the beginning of each hour of playing.Then it became a beautiful pass around he clock of the characters.İt was a beautiful image
Stunning clock.. This is a masterpiece of engineering considering it is centuries old. The precision work that went into it's making is astounding.

Tour of Old Town Hall Was Fantastic!. This was one of the best tours we have ever been on. The tour guide was very knowledgeable and spoke very good English. The best part to me was going underground to see how the people used to live and also to see the back of the Astronomical Clock Disciples to see how they work. Outstanding!! We also went up to the top of the Old Town Hall and it did give us a great view of Prague! This is a don't miss and all of this is available free on the Prague Card.

The view is worthwhile. We visited the square as part of an Imperial City tour organised by Rail Discoveries of York and later we returned under our own steam to climb the clock tower. The square in front of the clock is crowded all day but particularly as the hour (every hour) approaches. There are cafes near to the clock, to wait but sitting too near can obscure the view as latecomers stand in front of you to view the chiming. In truth the chiming is not spectacular, but given the history of the clock is remarkable and always draws a round of applause.We paid our fee (we paid 140 Czk for senior citizen tickets) at the base of the tower and then went into the Town Hall to take a lift up. There is a second lift to go up almost to the top but we walked up a winding gallery and steps reading the historical descriptions as we went. The final spiral staircase takes you up to the viewing gallery, which is narrow and when we were there very crowded. The view is worthwhile.

Time is of the essence!. Interesting curious site, try to avoid a weekend as you will be shoulder to shoulder with guides, selfie-sticks, and probably pick-pockets. The area is beautiful with a variety of architecture.

Incredible!. Seeing this clock was the highlight of my trip! See this magnificent time piece restored my belief that such precious antiques must be loved and taken care of. The genius of the clock makers is mind boggling. . Today time replication of such a grand clock wouldwould. Most likely takes dozens of engineering specialist, computer technology etc and most Luke a new on will not withstand centuries of working correctly. DO NOT miss seeing this marvel.

The Clock. We stayed right across from the clock and big crowds do gather. although it is a beautiful building and you can see all the parts of the clock, I was never that sure what was actually happening.

Get to the clock early.. The Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock is a must see. We walked through the Old Town Square numerous times in the three days we were in Prague. If you want to see the clock in action, on the hour, go in the early morning. We went to the square one day at 4:00 P.M. and the throng of people waiting for the clock to chime was tremendously huge! There were so many people standing around that it was difficult to get through the throng to get to the other side of the square. Go in the morning so you can get closer to the clock for better pictures. At times the crowds are so large during mid-day and in the afternoon (this was in mid September), that it is impossible to get a good close photo of the clock unless you have a good telephoto lens on your camera. If you want a close look at the clock go in the early morning and then in the afternoon you can sit at one of the near cafes and people watch.

Worth 2 minutes of your time. The clock itself is unremarkable, every hour a couple of doors open and you can see some faces go by in the openings. Meh, go there at a couple of minutes before the hour and then leave after the "show". It is a very crowded area but you can see the clock from anywhere in front. You can also pay to go up to the top of the tower for a scenic vista.

Take time to go up the tower. The Astronomical Clock draws a lot of crowds and good to see but take the time and go up the tower for the views. You are able to see all sorts of things from the top and the elevator is cool in itself. Take the time to walk up and down the stairs as they have a lot of information on the history of the tower and how the Nazi's destroyed it at the end of WWII. You don't get the chance to see this if you use the elevator so walk up or down at a minimal.The tower is open late and you have far fewer crowds if you go after 6:00 pm so have dinner first then go.
Worthwhile visit.. very busy location,lots of tourists,especially when clock is about to do its thing!!!But a not to be missed visit,just off the old town square,so easy to find.
Overview of center of prague. Very Busy, lots of people and a beautiful sunny day, we even saw a wedding , lots of music in the square

People watching!. The Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock is certainly worth stopping to look at. Don't worry about seeing the clock chime the hour, it's not that impressive and you will have to stand with hundreds of others standing there at the same time. Rather, get yourself a good seat in one of the many cafes or restaurants around the clock and square, outside in the summer, and watch the world go by. Believe me, at times it feels like the whole world is going by!!
other meaning of time. you will forget that the time is going on . when you stay in front of the clock and look for ticking a time . it is sensitization and unbelievable . cool and funny

Worth a minute of your timr. In the very crowded square you'll find this clock. It's a cute novelty to join the crowd and watch it strike on the hour or half past. Centuries ago I'm sure it was quite impressive.

The Clock-Tower review.. The clock and its tower(small charge for tower) attract many visitors and are worth seeing especially on the hour when its quirkiness is displayed at its best.The views from the tower are amazing but the walk to the top could be offputting for some even though a lift takes you up 2 thirds the way up.The final thirdis in ramp style which although is steep is easier than if it were stairs.
coffe break. Very nice and quiet central terace with a very good coffee and a very good bear Simply one of my favourite places during the sommer
Great views. Make sure you go to the top of the tower for a birds eye view of Prague. There are steps or a lift if you prefer. Clock is beautiful.

An item of genuine intrigue with interesting history and mythology. One of the things you must see in Prague. Make sure you see it on the hour to see some of its charm. Unobstructed pictures are hard to come by at that time but hang around for a few minutes after the clock does its thing and you will be fine.

Great views and easy walk up. . Went up the tower for views of the city. An easy walk up on sloped stairwells. Much better than hundreds of stairs. The views are sensational and worth the walk. There is also a fast lift for those less able to walk up. To go up the tower cost 120 K per person. I thought good value. The clock is worth seeing but nothing special.

Worth taking in the tour. We took in the tour of the town hall as well as the tower. The guide in the town hall was excellent with lots of good information. The astronomical clock is disappointing - better seen from the inside.

old town hall tower and clock. This was good fun, great views from top of tower of the whole city although it was a bit busy up there! Well worth the small fee though as breathtaking for photos of old square etc.

Touuristy Attraction. The Old Towne is a very interesting place to walk around for shopping, sight seeing and a variety of good food, especially at night when it is well lit. The Astronomical Clock is a waste of time to see a few mechanical puppets appear in the windows of the tower every hour. The kids would enjoy it as I think it constructed to amuse someone with little minds. There other better things to do around that area.

A 15th century high tech wonder. The guides joke that the Astronomical Clock is the second most disappointing touristic attraction in the World (the first being...). It certainly is not comparable to its similar in Munich, but if you you stop to imagine how high tech it was in the 15th century, than you'll be awestruck!

A PLACE YOU MUST VISIT. It is the "heart" of the city.There are a lot of restaurants and cafe and also the famousAstronomical Clock.In the area there is a lot of visitors and there is "life" all the day and night.There are also a lot of attractions and street local food.You must try these foods.

Slightly overrated. Everyone raves about the clock, but as it's in the centre,I wouldn't waste time waiting for the animation. The animations are a bit random and a bit of a let down. Maybe worth waiting for 5 mins to see it, but don't feel like you're missing out if you don't see it!The clock itself is very pretty & worth wandering past though.

Every hour on the hour. The big attraction is the Astronomical Clock and the chiming of the hours. Large crowds do gather for essentially a 2 minute "show". As the clock chimes the hour, the skelton rings the bell and the other statues shake their heads. Do get the explanation of what is happening to be able to appreciate it.
Nice Views. Good vantage point for taking photos of the town square and surrounding area. Get here early though as it gets quite crowded.
a must. A must see and odds are you will walk past it many times if you stay in the city center. It gets crowded on the hour for the show but amazing to see something old still mechanically sound.

Beautiful Views of Prague. The vistas are worth the six euro and the ramp up. Or you can wait for the elevator. Either way the views of the surrounding city are amazing. It can be a nice way to get your bearings if you are walking all over Prague, as we were. One thing is for sure, if you want to find something fun and interesting in Prague all you have to do is get lost.

A wonderful stroll in the autumn sunshine. A super town square with a most amazing clock we enjoyed the clock over a couple of hours sitting in the adjacent restaurant. A truly remarkable piece of engineering it is a must see in terms of the sites in Prague.You can climb to the top of the tower for a stunning view of the city and surrounding old town landmarks

Worth a look see and listen. Fantastic archetecture with an astronomical clock with a nice "show" on the hour. To get a good spot to view the ringing, get there about a good ten minutes before the top of the hour.

Great Views, Short "show" on the hour. We climbed (although there is also an elevator) to the top of the astronomical clock. It's an easy climb up ramps instead of stairs. I recommend walking at least one way as there are photographs and history of the clock on the way, if you take the elevator both ways you will miss it. The views from the top are great. On the hour, every hour the clock does a little "show" with a skeleton chiming the bell. It is very short, and the crowd it see it is enormous, but it goes every hour so you will get a chance to see it. It's free to see the clock and the hourly show, there is a fee to climb the tower.
Astromomical Clock. The Astronomical clock is amazing! Learn the history of the clock and what everything stands for and you will appreciate it.

Medieval Marvel. Ok, so your smart phone is able to conduct more tricks then the Astronomical Clock. But keep in mind - this amazing piece has survived 7 centuries, dozens of wars, and the dedicated maintainence and support of an entire city, even during the harshest of times. If you can't appreciate all of this this, go home and eat your bucket of buffalo wings.

5 days in a beautiful fairyland city. Wife and I saw the clock first day we arrived in evening. If you want great picture and not many people in picture go early. This a must to see when visiting the city square
Amazing!!. Absolutely beautiful architecture and everywhere you look is just one jaw dropping building after another.

A popular place. The old town square is surrounded by beautiful architecture. Make sure you wander down the side streets there are some quaint shops and excellent eateries and you can get away from the crowds. The Astronomical clock is located in the Square and has been around since the 15th century. Amazing piece of machinery

Spectacular views of the church . Spectacular views of the church of our lady from the top of the astronomical clock. The climb was pretty easy.The clock show though is a waste of your time. I tried craning up twice (5,6 pm) and both the times a senile nodding puppet is all that there was to see!
Amazing Clock!. We happened to arrive in the Old Town Square on the hour and enjoyed seeing the clock work. It is a remarkable feat of engineering.

Full of people. The astronomical clock, if I'm not mistaken, is 1 of only 2 in the world that are still working, so it is really a must-see when visiting Prague's Old Town. People - throngs of tourists, to be exact - gather at the front of the building at the top of the hour to watch the clock chime and a number of statues come out. For the sheer experience and to mingle and "chime in" with the crowd, it is worth the experience watching it. There are numerous restaurants in the vicinity to pass time, if you feel like hanging out for a little bit more.
OLD TOWN HALL & ASTRONOMICAL CLOCK. The Astronomical Clock id beautiful, visited a while back. The square was packed with people looking up and waiting for it to strike.

Crowded but you should see this. Very interesting but PACKED with tourists on the hour when the clock goes off. Be wary and watch your personal belongings,,,wlk the side streets off of the square and grab a beer!

Old Town Square Astronomical Clock. A fascinating ancient Town Hall clock that has has many mechanical characters that come to life every sixty minutes when the clock strikes the hour. It also shows the relevant position of the sun, moon and planets to the earth, hence it's name. A truly exceptional piece of early mechanical engineering.

Great to see. . Visited this twice, once with a guide and once without. Needless to say with the guide it was 10 times better. The guide was able to explain all the different components of the clock and it mechanisms.
Another Prague tourist attraction. Many stores and souvenir shops to wander through. Everyone crowds in front of the clock to watch the hourly display.

Avoid "o'clock" periods! Nice to see when it is not chiming. The clock is a must see if you go to Prague due it is a unique piece and amazing workart when you get to understand how it works.However, do not go when it is expected to chime, as it will be full of tourists and the show itself is really disappointing. Whenever I passed by the clock during the chiming, I preferred looking at people's frustrated faces.

Fabulous views of the city and a clock like you've never seen!. The astronomical clock is free to see but if you want to go up the clock tower you do need to buy a ticket but and is approximately £5. There is a lift that goes up and down so you don't have to walk up the stairs if you don't want to or are unable. There are boards on the walls on the way up with interesting facts and photos giving information on the history of the city. The views are spectacular and it's well worth the visit.

Quick walk by. Yes it's old and ingenious. But it also is partially dysfunctional and disappointing. A stupid number of people gather for the top of the hour to see little things in the air barely move. Even our tour guide didn't feel it is worth the time. The show stops early.

Must see and climb!!. the mechanism of the clock work when it chimes on the hour is a little underwhelming and it gets so busy but the clock itself is beautiful, climb the tower for amazing views of prague - must see!
Old Town Hall and Astronomical clock. amazing, we kept going almost everyday of our visit, to see the surroundings, listening to the bands and see this marvelous attractjion

The Clock is worth every second you spend there!. We visited the Old Town Square and the Astronomical Clock many times.! It never gets old. (uh yes it is old!) I looked for a different view of the clock from everywhere in the square we were. It looked different from every angle. i especially enjoyed watching the different people that were watching the clock. We had dinner at a restaurant on top of a building nearby...it was another interesting view of that fantastic piece of history.
Unique clock!. Old town hall is full of restaurants and a must see. The Astronomical clock is unique. I haven't seen anything like it in Europe.
A must see site while in Prague. You can't miss this amazing old clock if you make it to Old a Town Square. It goes off every hour and there is always a crowd below it to watch the process.

Great View from Top. There is an elevator most of the way to the top of the clock tower. The view of Prague is great for photos, but it's quite crowded at the top when you're trying to get a photo. You're supposed to move counterclockwise around the top to reduce the people jam-ups.
Amazing for its time. Make sure you get a guide to explain all the things the clock can do and a history of the clock itself, make yourself available on the hour for some additional features

"A Most Interesting TIME". I can not put into words the features of this build and clock. The intricacies must be seen to understand. The story of the clock is intriguing and interesting. Once again a must see in Prague.

Astronomical clock show on the hour very underwhelming. If you are getting hyped to see what will happen when the big hand hits the 12 on the hour, unfortunately you will be disappointed as me and my mates were. In my opinion it was very short and underwhelming, although it was probably considered pretty great back in the day. If you just miss it don't feel like you've missed out on something great, or good.
Make sure you arrive by five to the hour to see the action!. Each hour the clock comes to life....watch the bell ringing skeleton, it is the most active! Very crowded so watch your wallets!
Unique... Illuminati watch :). Unique, it looks out of this world, I heard stories about it linked to the illuminati but who am I to talk about such things! You should definitely check it out!
Fun to see.. Great fun watching the clock chimes. You can also go up the clock tower, where there are great views across the city, 360 degree view.

Amazing place.. This is for sure a must visit place. The architecture is wonderful, but it´s better if wake up early to visit, because the place gets really crowded during all day. Take time to watch the astronomical clock working during a sharp time.

Busy! . The square and around astronomical clock were very busy but worth a look! The clock itself is awesome. We waited around for the chiming, was a little disappointed but perhaps would have been better if had a better view as was so busy! Definatly a must see in Prague!
the clock. crowds at the weekend could spoil the experience.justmost amazing experience.Could have stood watching for hours.its a must when u visit Prague
Stand with the waiting crowds. We waited with the crowds for the clock to chime, it was all over in 30 seconds, interesting to see.

Astornomical clock parade. Be sure to look for a good spot at least ten minutes before the hour so you can see the apostles parade around the two windows that open. After they parade then you can hear the chimes. Also take the underground tour form Old Town hall, its the best in my opinion over the others.

Tick Tock .... Very much enjoyed taking photos of the clock. Get there early to avoid the crowds of people who were there for the same reason as I was. Makes it a little harder to take a decent shot. But wow, what amazing features the clock has.

Fantastic Energy. This place is packed with visitors, street performers, street vendors and open cafes. The energy level is at its peak during Summer. Even more interesting are the side streets with interesting architecture and intricate detailing. It is like an architectural showcase of craftsmanship competing with one another.

Take your camera. Great historical place, tons of details to see and take pictures.
There's usually some nice band playing there.
The restaurants there are expensive - go 4, 5 streets from there and you'll find great restaurants cheaper.
Beware of pickpockets on crowded areas.

Astronomical clock tower views. Why not club up and look down? For 5Euro you climb up the clock tower, with boards along the slope walk (or escalator for cheaters!) to get a feel for the history of the place. Full of information, it can take you a whilst to get up there if you stop to read everything., but would recommend making sure you get to top for the bell toll on the hour so you can look down at everyone looking up!Also - we went around 12:30 when there wasn't so many people there as after the hour (and maybe everyone looking at it) when we walked down there was a queue to get inside..Great view from top!

Czech the time!. The old town hall and the atrological clock dominates one end of the old square. As many of the reviewers have said an early start is recommended. The clock chimes every hour and it is worth coinciding your visit with this free show. It's also highly recommended that you pay approx. £2.00 to go to the top of the tower. This can either by taking the 300 odd steps or riding in the lift. The views over Prague are spectacular.
A clock worth understanding. A clock that was built in the 14th century and it keeps time perfectly. A real marvel with so many moving parts and pieces. Must wee at noon.

Wonderful history. My wife and I found that we were immersed in Czech history and culture during our visit to the square. Very festive and busy. An overall good time with lots to see. However the food and beer were very overpriced here. I suggest you take the tram several blocks in any direction to get authentic Czech cuisine and excellent beer for fraction of the price payed here. Na zdravi !

Unique experience. The experience here comes in many parts. Firstly the square itself is fascinating. If you are having any problem locating it then just follow the path of the tourists in that area at about ten minutes to the hour. On the hour the display at the clock has to be seen as part of the Prague visit.

Interesting viewing. The crowds can be a bit off putting at times but I found a seat at one of the restaurants opposite the clock to share a drink and bide my time until the hour struck. It is an amazing feat of engineering with so much to look at in such a short space of time, definitely worth the viewing although it is over very quickly. You really need to view it more than once to take in all the features. The queue to climb the tower was lengthy the day we were there so didn't get to do it.

Pickpockets Paradise. Old Town Square is big, beautiful, full of historical buildings, and busy (pedestrians only though).It seems as though most of those beautiful, winding cobblestone streets of Old Town Prague lead to the Old Town Center. The astronomical clock is fascinating and goes off every hour on the hour. It's worth seeing. Large crowds will form 5-10 minutes before the hour right outside the clock, and unfortunately some of those in the crowd will be pickpockets- so beware!

Visit Town Square Twice. You should visit the town square at least twice, once as early as you can manage so you can enjoy this historic sight without people. To see the Astronomical clock without crowds is a treat. However the convivial atmosphere in the evening with the street performers and cafe life is not to be missed either. Many beautiful photo ops when the light is right!

Crowded but still worthwhile. This astronomical clock is still interesting even though there are crowds of people. It's too bad that people in the museum area can't tell more history about the defenestraton that occurred in the Town Hall area, as that had a significant impact on the religious history in this region.
Great astrological clock. The crowds tell the tale--the astrological clock on the Old Town Hall is amazing, and watching it is free--albeit along with a few hundred others. But watch at least once!

Visit on the Hour, Then Relax. So you have to see it and try to understand it and it is a lot of fun. Crowds, crowds. Plan to arrive close to hour, enjoy the show, deal with the crowd and stop in the many eatreries and relax.

View over Prague. Went up in Old Town Hall in the evening when sun gone down. Saw the centre of Prague in the light from houses and street light. And view to the Castle in full light. A must see - view..

Technical developments put into time (literally). Make sure to grasp the whole historical story behind this famous Prague astronomical clock as you can find it as part of the old (remains of) the town hall. Put that in perspective with the time scale to even more admire it.

Great view of prague... As soon as i arrived there, i paid an entrance fee of going all the way to the top (it wasn`t much) you can either walk to the top or take an elevator.. When i arrived at the top, the view was gorgeous and breathtaking from all angles.. Such a great place to be.. This place is a must do if your visiting this fantastic city..
lovely building. If you don't mind the crowds then the Astronomical Clock and building are worth seeing when the 12 Apostles make their appearance but I would not go out of my way to see it again.

Town Hall & Clock. Yes, this is one of the great attractions, and it is interesting. However, although the square was crowded with tourists gagging to spend their money, the authorities had decided to close the Town Hall itself to visitors.....very strange. Thus we cannot comment on that. The clock itself is in a prominent position and looks to be quite unique, but with no one to explain the intricacies of how it works, we were all left to stare and thus lost interest.It is certainly worth seeing if you are there, and if you can find a day when the building is open, I am sure it would be interesting

Stunning views! Fantastic photos. Definitely head up the tower when it first opens at 9am! The tower has very small space to walk around on top so getting a nice photo is almost impossible at busy times. To truly enjoy the stunning views & get great photos, head up the tower when it first opens. There's an elevator to take you to the top, unless you feel nostalgic & want to take the narrow stairs all the way up. Views are the BEST so definitely worth heading up.
Cool . Something different to look at,very nice piece of architecture right in the town centre too so lots of things nearby
Just Gorgeous Architecture. The biggest highlight about this historical attraction has to be the clock. Everything about it just screams beauty and history.

Beautiful, but not as expected. I had heard great things about this amazing clock. It is true, it is a fine example of engineering, very pretty and the crowds really gathered when it chimed. When it chimed...a wheeze, a limp 'ping' and 'is that it' exclamations in 25 different languages from the crowds. Lol You have to see it. It's great!
Astronomical Clock beautiful. An absolute must see when you visit Prague. Went to see it a few times on my short visit to Prague and noticed new things every time.

Wonderful history. This was my forst time to Prague and certainly wasn't disappointed. The astronomical clock is interesting and a great piece of engineering with many aspects to its workings. I particularly enjoyed the history told by the guides and by books. The people were friendly and curtious and i would definitely go there again.

Wonderful townscape. Didn't go inside the Old Town HJall but it's certainly a lovely run of buildings (originally 5 houses) The Astronomical Clock draws huge crowds when it's due to strike and the 12 Apostles make their appearance but you have to see it.

Interesting history of the clock. Would not go out of my way to see the hourly rooster and moving statues. However, the history is fascinating and the tower that has the clock in it is well worth the visit it affords a good view of the main square from above.

Another Part of the Town Square. This beautiful building with its' long history is another part of Prague's beautiful Town Square. It is NOT important to stand there and wait to see the hour change (really), but it is nice to have a good look at the clock. Lots of great photo opportunities here. Enjoy!

Go to the top for great views. This is a must do and worth the small fee! The view you get of the city and all the red rooftops is spectacular from above! When you get to the top, it’s very narrow and tough to move around with the other people there, but it’s totally worth it. I loved the bird’s eye view and got some great pictures. The Astronomical Clock is a work of art. Lots of people are crowded around to get pics. Bring a zoom lens to get close ups of the detail.

Prague highlight. Crowded but well worth the walk up to the top of the tower. Fantastic view over Prague.Plenty of information about the town hall and tower.Astronomical clock strikes hourly until 9pm. Great to see the 12 Apostles appear on the hour.
Anticlimax . Was expecting something amazing to happen during the 'clock show' but was very disappointed. Very beautiful but not worth staying on the hour

So many people distracted watching the clock. A haven for pickpockets. So many people distracted watching the clock. A haven for pickpockets. Two animated statues next to the clock were removed for maintenance; rather than leave empty hole could put copies. Often the newlyweds leave the car parked right under the clock.

Over rated. I have seen the clock a few years ago when I was single. After getting married and blessed with a beautiful girl, I decided to visit Prague again with my family. The clock is so over rated but my wife wanted to see what the fuss is all about. She bursted in continuous laghter when it all ended with nothibg but a few rings.

Great History. OK Views.. During my visit to Prague, I checked out the views from the bell tower of St. Vitus Cathedral, the Charles Bridge Tower and the Old Town Hall Tower. The views from St. Vitus Cathedral and the Charles Bridge Tower were definitely better than the Old Town Hall Tower – you could see more of the city from the first two options. However, the Old Town Hall Tower does have two things going for it: (1) While you walk up the inclines to the top of the tower (no stairs), there is an outstanding pictorial history of the tower, the role it played during WWII and the damage it received during that war; (2) You can take an elevator all the way to the top. So, for those individuals who don’t have the mobility (or desire) to climb hundreds of stairs to the top of St. Vitus or the Charles Bridge, you can still get a pretty decent view over the old town rooftops by stopping here. If you chose this route, make sure you walk on the inclines on the way down so that you can read about the history of the tower.The clock outside is definitely worth a (brief) look.

What a view!!. Great view at the top of the clock. Worth the fee. Highly recommend. Lots of history inside the clock if you have the time while walking up the stairs to read the history of Prague. Very interesting.

Interesting. A mechanical marvel and worth being there when it strikes the hour. We got further information by listening to other tour guides explain how it works. Since it is on the old town square it is very easy to see. Go to the top and get a good from of Old town.

I did not really get it?!. We saw people every hour standing to watch the clock which in itself looks very nice and is very old but we did not really understand.
I think it was our fault as we did not have any guide or read about it.
Watching the clock was pretty boring
Town hall the same
Much more to do in Prague
Underwhelming. The clock is a huge disappointment, it really does nothing.we waited and it was over before we knew it . It is not very impressive.

A bit of an anticlimax but still,worth a look. The clock tower is a beautiful sight and should be seen as part of a visit to the old square. However, the display on the hour is not necessarily worth the wait. But it is entertaining to watch all the tourists who crowd around to,watch it.

Very crowded place but a mandatory thing to do. This place has a lot of history. The square and this area are very lively. Don't eat at restaurants here because they can be tourist trap - pricey and of questionable authenticity.

"The place to be". This square is with its beautiful Church and Astronomical Clock is the heart of the city. Thousands of people come to watch the clock on the hour and there are musicians performing , shopping galore and restaurants everywhere. The energy is absolutely amazing and it is the definite place to be in Prague. It is within walking distance to the Charles Bridge and Castle area.
Free view from below. Watch on the hour from below. Good views from the top of the tower. There is a lift! or walk up its a ramp not steps for most of the way.

Excellent. Loved this clock and the story behind it. It chimes on the hour every hour so there really is no need to plan your day around it as you will almost always pass it nearly on time. Also if you were to wait there are loads of beautiful cafes around it that you could grab a coffee/beer and people watch

Beautiful magical place. What a beautiful place to visit. You need to spend a good few hours here. The wonderful buildings all slightly different. The magnificent church, the amazing clock. Be sure to be at the clock on the hour to see it in action. Have a coffee at one of the many restaurants. Visit at least a few of the shops and enjoy the buskers. Fabulous!

Go early. We were slightly disappointed that part of the clock was under reconstruction and repair but it did not stop the overall enjoyment of viewing. It's best to go early in the morning before the crowds arrive. Lots of entertainment in the afternoon and evening as well as tour groups fill up the area, making viewing difficult.

SO COOL. ONE OF THE COOLEST THINGS I'VE SEEN! Mind that I love both clocks and old architecture. If you're in Prague for any amount of time it would be pretty hard to miss this, but I suggest anyway that you make sure to at least stroll by.

Beautiful landscape. It is a total birdeye view from the astonomical clock tower. Nicely preserved and rebuild after ww2. Breathtaking landscape of prague with a nice souvenir watch to buy from there.

When you're in Prague you have to see the Old Town Hall. I think my favorite part was walking up - not taking the elevator - to the top of the tower for a fantastic view of the city. On the way there are many historic photos and charts where you can read about Prague's past. I ran into a charming little boy, maybe 8, who told me when we bumped into each other, "Oh, thank God, someone who speaks Canadian." Ha! He meant "English."
Unbelievable piece of work!. This is the place that is hard to visit because of the crowds, but don't miss it. It is the gem of the Market Square!

Fantastic view from Tower top ..and a lift to help. The view from the top of this tower is fantastic. You can look in all 4 directions and the view over the main square is tremendous. One other great benefit is you can ride all the way to the top by lift. At my age that is a definite plus .We went up early in the morning as we not only got a great view of the square but also out to the west towards the castle and St Vitus Church

Visit on the hour to watch the clock in action. I wouldn't have thought watching a clock would be enjoyable. However, as the hour struck, I found myself with a few hundred others staring as the clock conducted it's 'performance.' Located in the old square, it's a great stop along a self-made walking tour and is a very family friendly activity (free/no lines/etc.). Grab a drink and a sausage around the corner afterwards and enjoy the square.
Worth a visit. Well worth visiting the clock for the hourly chime. A wonderful piece of machinery that leaves you in awe at the craftsmen

Gorgeous. The clock is gorgeous and the hall is nice too. The fact that the clock could do all those things is impressive. There is a little show that goes on at the hour between 9 and 9. Its pretty lame but I think that is part of the charm. Listen to the disappointment of the others watching and chuckle to yourself.
