One of many "must-sees" in Prague. Before you go read up on the clock so that you will understand what you are seeing. Be sure to be there on the hour to see the show. Fascinating what they were able to do so long ago; I am impressed that it still works.

Beautiful but silly to. :-). The Astronomical Clock is another beautiful structure in Prague. But waiting for the "excitement" on the top of each hour is a bit of a disappointment. If you happen to be in the area at the top of the hour, you'll see a crowd around the clock waiting for the chimes and action. Cute to watch but not a big loss if you miss it. It's just part of the charm of the square.

My favorite sight in Praha. we made it to the square and went straight over to the Astronomical Clock (as that was one of my goals to see) also known as the Prague Orloj - the third oldest of its kind and the oldest still in working order. It is such an amazing structure to see even now, but knowing the history is even more impressive. The top section was created in 1410 and the lower calendar was added in the 1800's. As death strikes the time hour after hour the people of Prague keep the clock in wonderful working order as legend has it that suffering will follow if the clock falls into disrepair.
Lovely, traditional and easy to find.. Great little shops on winding streets, plenty of choice of bars, restaurants, cafes. Easy to find your way around.

Ringing of the clock. Prague is not a visit without going to see the clock in the old town square, stand out on the cobbled streets on the hour gazing upto the clock face waiting for the show to begin. With the chimes in place watch the doors open and see the 12 wooden figures appear all bearing a symbol of the saints, once they finish the doors shut and hung below are 3 figures hanging on the wall all shaking there heads from left to right, then the clock strikes, the hours on the clock represent a 24 hour day but it will only ring 23 times, other components on the clock face represent the sun and moon, the zodiac signs, simply stunning piece of clever work. Then take a visit inside and buy a ticket to go up the clock tower and have beautiful views of the old streets below and the city itself, entry costs around (120 czech koruna) £4.50.

Overhyped!. What a letdown. People line up to stare at this historical astrological clock every hour. There must have been about 100 people in the are of the clock when we were there, They come on the hour to see the apostles circle around inside the clock. This lasts for approximately 10 seconds! Blink twice and you miss it. This is more hype that substance. Otherwise the square is interesting.

Beautiful Clock. Go on top of the hour so that you can see the 12 Apostles swirl around and the skeleton of death tip his glass to the crowd. The story behind the clock is one of interest. The clock maker had his eyes gouged out so that he could never replicate the clock. The story goes on that the clock maker wanted to be with the clock one more time before his death, he allegedly did something to make the clock stop working for 100 years. Then another guy made it work again. Not sure what happened to him. BEWARE of PICKPOCKETS in this area when you are looking up at the clock!Also, for a small fee, you can go to the top of the clock. The lift was broken when we were there. But you can go up the ramps to the top.

If you go there, and you will - Climb the tower!. This is the first thing we went to see in Prague. We were told by our host (we rented an apartment on our stay) that the clock doesn't work because it is so complicated that when it broke one day no one could fix it until now, so they just kinda gave up.the little "show" that takes place every hour is still working though.The best thing about it is the tower itself - spend those few $$ for a beautiful view point on the old town square, the castle (though it's kinda far away) and other spots in the city. In night time those spots are lighten so it's both easy and beautiful to watch.

Must see. Amazing views from the top of the clock tower. Try to visit around sunset, as the sky is amazing then and you will get some wonderful photos. There was no wait at all when we went around 5:40 p.m., which was so wonderful to hear after having waited in hours-long lines for similar attractions in other European cities.
a must see place. the clock is outstanding and worth a visit itis close to a square and there are lots of cafe's and bars near by

A Definite Must See. Lovely clock with surprising 'bell ringer' to help call out the 12 Apostles. Amazing that it is over 600 years old. A definite must see and very viewable regardless of the crowds on the hour. Make sure you see it in motion.
Great View. Great Old astronomical clock but very poor "show" at round hours.Anyway a nice and must view in Prague!

Climb the tower. The clock tower is definately worth going up. It does have an elevator for those in need. The top of the tower if VERY crowded and this can take some time to negotiate, but the view of the old town square are worth it. The tower is on the Prague Card.

Very impressive, nice history behind... but nothing soooooo special as they say!!. Prague is just wonderful! Of course I took several pictures of the Astronomical Clock! But I see no reason for soooooo many people like that stand for minutes and minutes, almost fighting to make a photo there! hehe

A truly amazing piece of mechanical engineering. Set in Old Town Square this is the icon of Prague. The mechanics that went into producing this masterpeice of mechanical engineering is truly amazing and the fact that it still keeps such good time after all these years is a credit to the craftsmen who produced it. Next time you stand and look at it when it reaches the hour think of just what a complicated piece of engineering this is? and could you find the skilled people to produce it today?

A must. The guided visit to Old Town Hall is very good and interesting to discover new things about Prague. And you can have a close look at the Apostles!. You should book the ticket in advance though, since there are several visits in different languages but not all of them at the same time (e.g., there can be only one visit in English from 3:00 pm on). A trick can be to buy the ticket in the morning and then go in the afternoon at the scheduled hour.You should definitely combine this visit with climbing the tower. Views are amazing and there is a lift in case you don't want or are unable to climb so many steps. A real must

Go for the people watching. Its amazing that the original instruments still run the clock. But the show on the hour is more Disney that anything. Grab a table and a cocktail at a bar across from the clock and watch the crowd gather on the hour. Go for the crowd, not the clock.
WOW!. Worth a visit but can be extremely crowded. the whole square nearby is absolutely fascinating. A very picturesque part of Budapest.

Tick Tock. We watched the clock strike the hour and saw the Apostles move past the window, fascinating. The area is lovely with differing architecture. There are plenty of eateries in the area as well.

Magnificent, in Magnificent area. This clock is beautiful. Every hour it bells and it becomes a little show. Don't come just for it, but if you are around and few minuets away from the end of the hour, absolutely go check it out . Your kids will enjoy it too.

Nice On-the-Hour Show. It was nice to watch the on the hour show put on by the astronomical clock. The 12 apostles peek through the windows, death rings the bell and the rooster crows on the hour. Tons of people gather around for the show so watch your valuables.

Must see in prague. Yes it's ridiculously touristy but it's beautiful and the fact that it still works after all these years is very impressive. It's one of those things you have to do even if you hate "being a tourist". Every hour there is a small puppet show as well but it's s bit disappointing if you've seen the glockenspiel at the Marienplatz in Munich.

Climb the tower - it's worth it!. My recommendations:1. Don't expect too much from the clock display. That thing is some 500 years old and back then both technology and people-amazement-level were much different. It has a bell, some figures that move, some doors that open and close -and, that's it !!! 2. The true beauty is the tower itself. It was inside totattly rebuilt. 3. Three elevators and a long ramp make the climb super easy. With many interesting historical info-photos on the walls, I recommend taking the ramp.4. The view is amzing. While you might see farther on top of the Vitus cathedral and Petrin tower, here you can see more of the inside Prague downtown.5. Take time to watch people, segways, and performers on the Old Town square. 6. Often, there are tons of people on the tower and it gets crammed. Watch your pockets, bags, and walltets. Also hold on to your camera. A lady next to me, pushed on accident a guy and his fancy camera nearly fell off the tower.7. I recommend going twice (or more): once during the day and once at night8. Consider combining your visit(s) with the Prague Card. If you have an airport transfer, it likely pays off for you9. Look at the mass of other tourists on the day you visit, try to plan your trip around the time when "everybody else" visits

Must do but don't get too excited about clock!. The square is like a St. Marks in Florence but not as awesome. I found the clock beautiful but to wait an hour to watch basically nothing happen was funny. Lots happening in the square from street entertainment to vendors to lots of restaurants. Of course touristy but great place to people watch and relax and have a beer for few hours. Enjoy!

Great Views of Prague. A friend and I paid to climb the tower, and like most things in the Czech Republic it was very reasonable. Definitely bring your camera because the views of Prague are fantastic. It's a small space and gets a bit squishy up the top, so I wouldn't recommend if you're claustrophobic. A great attraction to pack in to a day of exploring the centre of Prague.

The clock is beautiful, the hour strike not so much so. Since this was a large mechanical clock, I expected more bells and whistles. There was a strike, and a few statues moved around and that was it. Hundreds of people waited around for something to happen and very little did. I would not waste my time waiting for the hour to strike. Just look at the click, enjoy the beauty, read the literature and go elsewhere.
It's just a clock . On this site thousands of tourists gather every hour to see the astronomical clock come to live. I admit it's pretty, but it's also overhyped.

The must-see of Prague???. OK, I agree that the clock is special and really nice to see. It gives you 5 different ways to look at the time of the day. I only have one on my watch :-) The work on the big 2 clocks is exquisite. Too bad that the statues have protective wires around them. I guess the pigeons liked them too much. It is an intersting piece, but not the only astronomical clock in the world! There is for instance one in Lier, Belgium, not as old as the one in Prague; but also an ingenious piece of work. The one in Prague dates from the 15th century. That makes it probably the oldest one in the world.Anyhow, most tourists come for the procession of apostles. Once every hour little doors open up above in the tower and you can see them passing by. Be there on time (or come at an early hour) as a lot of people seem to come only for them. I went twice ;-), once to see it (I wasn't much impressed) and once to make a picture of the people watching. That was fun.So, if you're over there, don't miss the clock and have a look at the others around to while watching the parade of apostles.

Underwhelming clock movement when the o'clock arrives!!. Rated in the Top Ten most Underwhelming attractions list I can certainly understand why! It is a beautiful Old Town Hall and indeed a most beautiful Clock Tower however, if you are basing your trip on seeing the clock towers movement then you will be extremely disappointed!! It is really pretty and if you go on a Walking Tour then you will find out sop much about this beautiful clock tower
Cool. Really cool place to visti, definitely a must see, but fairly crowded and you have to pay for each exhibition separately.

Gorgious !. You will definitely see this on your visit ! As with most things in Prague it is gorgeous !Not sure about the little guys that come out every hour - a lot of people waiting for not a lot :-)

A delight. What a wonderful clock or should I say array of clocks. The Tower itself is full of architectural detail and the views from the top are great. Fantastic to watch and feel the crowd's anticipation every time the hour approaches.

Lots of fun activity!. We thoroughly enjoyed the town square and seeing the Astronomical Clock. We enjoyed time at outdoor restaurants and it's a great location for lots of people watching. This is a must see when you are in Prague!

Mob scene in Prague. If you like crowds and a variety of crazy entertainment you will enjoy this. The clock is a huge let-down as you can barely see the figures mark the hour. Everything from jugglers, to mimes to bubble blowers to Segways and horses congregate here. Be careful navigating it with your belongings
Listen to a guide. There is a lot of detail on the clock and you really need a guide to explain it all. We did a free walking tour that started nearby and other people standing around were listening.
Must see - but not that spectacular.. Lonely Planet describes it as 'underwhelming' - about right. When visiting Prague it is a 'must see' but no need to take your heart pills before doing so!!

If you're short of time, give it a miss.. This was an interesting thing to do, but perhaps not worth all the hype that surrounds it. There were a lot of visitors jostling for space, and the movement is over very quickly.

Center of Prague. You have all tourist flocking to this place not just to visit clock but for tours, eating, stay, shop and all. Everything is surrounding to this place. You can stay close to this place any enjoy day and night life specially during summers.
highly recommend. awesome to see. It was quite cheap for me as a student. The birds eye view is priceless from up there.

Old town is Great. Clock not that much of a deal.. Really beautiful area and streets with great atmosphere and good street food and buskers. Enjoyable experience to absorb.The clock is not really that much of a deal i can tell you that.The tower nearby that let's you go up and admire the view is NOT recommended because it sucks. really. you go up the stairs to find all windows have bars installed. They could find another solution for safety other then that.

A Beautiful Evening. Actually a great place to spend an evening in Prague, where culture and folk artists mix with the wonder of the Astronomical Clock. What better way to spend a peaceful evening drinking beer and observing people singing, dancing and enjoying themselves. Couple this with the scientific and cultural revelation of the Astronomical Clock and this would end up as the best time spent in Prague. Do this as the last event of your visit to the city and you will feel blessed!!

Brilliant handscraft. The astronomical clock, one of the tourist attractions you have to visit, is located at the pulsing market place and comes along with a nice historical story. Good place to start your inner city sight seeing after a visit of the tower.

Beautiful work of art!!. Amazingly beautiful! A must see attraction in Prague! Mechanics works flawlessly every 15minutes! Unfortunately there were too many tourists when we visited, so we weren't able to climb the tower.

Pretty cool. Even though the actual play of characters up in the windows above the clock is a bit disappointing, realizing this clock has been around for centuries and it's accurate and shows the sky map, the amount of moon light and location of sun and moon in the different orbits is amazing. been in prague a few times in my life, and each time I am amazed by this clock.

Must see. How amazing to stand in front of a clock that has operated for the past 500 years. Every hour at the hour, the clock reveals the 12 Apostles and chimes. It is said to be the most accurate and longest running clock in the world.

An Astronomical Wonder. The famous astronomical clock in Old-Town Hall clock in Prague, Czech Republic, also known as the Prague orloj is worth the stop when in Prague. The central portion was completed in 1410 and has four figures that are set in motion at the hour, with Death (represented by a skeleton) striking the time. On the hour there is a presentation of statues of the Apostles at the doorways above the clock, with all twelve presented at noon. In 1870 a calendar display was added below the clock. A golden rooster also makes an appearance. It's historical, complex and a little mind-boggling.During World War II the clock was nearly destroyed by Nazi fire. The townspeople are credited with saving most of the parts so that it could be gradually restored.

Expect a nice hourly show.. Interesting the different style of the buildings, and a great astronomical clock. The view from the top is grat. A little carillone each hour. The plaza is a great turist attraction.

Never made it up the tower. Clock is a "good to see once experience" but although it looks great the actual striking at the hour is a bit underwhelming, but i guess you have to remember how old it is. Gets very busy in area on the hour especially with tour groups but usually plenty of vantage points to watch the show/mechanics perform. To see the clock is obviously free but there is a charge if you want to go inside and climb the tower, although it looks like there are good views, but we never managed to go up.
Great History . I suggest you see it all. It was the culmination of our grand city tour. Very wonderful. Great history, people, restaurants.

Watching Time pass by. The Astronomical Clock on the side of the Old Town Hall is one of the main tourist attractions in central Prague. Every hour (on the hour) it triggers a display with puppets, watched by dozens of tourists. The other attraction is the viewing gallery at the top of the clock tower. Lifts take you up to a walk around gallery offering superb views of Prague, and in particular of the Old Town and the Square.

Busiest clock ever. The old town hall tower gives a great view (but is a climb and if you've done a few towers in the same day be ready for your calf muscles to ache) The tourists gather around the Astronomical clock for around 15 minutes before the hour, all wanting to witness the chiming and the actions of the Apostles. The Skeleton with his bell is the one the kids seem to love the best! Was told to be aware of pickpockets in this busy time, but to be honest we never experienced or saw anything dubious. The amount of times we passed through the square and we only witnessed the clock chiming once. If you want to see it make sure you get there early to get a good position
Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. Was exceptional at night all lite up! Asrtronomical clock with fantastic huge dials Just amazing to look at and to think of the detail and talent going into this

Astronomical Clock and Views of Area. The clock is quite an attraction with moving parts every hour. We also went up into the tower for fantastic views in every direction. They have signs that name and tell you about what you can see.

A must see. . Everybody must stop by and see the astronomical clock. Every 15 minutes the clock bell rings in every hour on the hour the doors open at the top of the clock and cards characters rotate through the windows you can also walk up the steps make sure you turn your pacemaker up. There are thousands and thousands of people in the square lots of restaurants lots of traveling entertainers trying to collect money to travel to the next location

go early to beat the crowds. We went at 9am to see the clock and then we paid to go up the tower as it opens at 9am on some days as well. There was not many of us at the top of the tower so it was easy buy the tickets and then to access the tower and we could take our time to look at the views and take photos. There are 2 lifts which can take you to the top of the tower or you can walk up a ramp and some stairs. The ramp has interesting information and photos on the history of the tower which is good to read as you walk up. We visited the clock a number of times on the hour to see the display as once isnt enough as it only goes for 30 seconds and its over very quickly.

No trip without seeing this. Not possible to pass through the city without seeing this. Every hour lots of people from all over the world are waiting to see the miracle. Is a must !!!! Rain is not an issue not to see it!!!

Fun time. Our experience seeing the clock would have been so much better had it not been so rainy and cold. Overall, however, this is a fun site, worth seeing because there are so many other attractions around it. Go with a plan to visit some of the other sites in the area. If we'd had time and better weather, we would've gone up the clock tour for a view, but the weather didn't permit.
A must see. Very nice building, with great view from the tower. Must-see.Just be advised, if you're affraid of height, you should probably avoid the tower.

Take time to go here. Wow...what a clock! Watch out for pickpockets and Russian con-men whilst you struggle to find a spot in the crowd where you can get a good piccie. There are usually several guides giving commentaries that you can hear.

Beautiful views from the Bell Tower. Climbing the Bell Tower is a must. Once on top, the views from each side are stunning and unique. Such a beautiful city ~ don't miss seeing it from this presepctive.

Walking through historical city.. If you like to walk,that's the best way to see this city. Leaving wensleslas sq. Follow the information signs at bottom of sq. In fact just follow the crowds of other tourists making for the old town hall and astronomical clock.That is something very special to see .usually very big crowds of tourists all taking pictures of tower and the lovely sq.nearby.Worth seeing.

Asrtonomical Clock. The Astronomical Clock is amazing. It is huge with multiple dials indicating various conditions of the earth and sky. Popular site. We took pictures of a bride and groom under the clock. Don't miss this.

Great but is there anyone in Prague who can explain the workings. Had a very brief description of this very interesting clock . Unfortunately could not see the mechanism or find anyone locally in Prague who knew how it works, our guide certainly didnt know!. There are descriptions on the internet but guide books are very poor. A pity since it must rank as one of the greatest feats of the early clockmakers art.Very crowded around when it operates
Well worth a visit. The Astronomical Clock is well worth a visit while you are in the Old Town Square. It is best to visit on the hour when the twelve disciples all appear at the widows
Lovely Clock. A lovely medieval clock with astromical designs. It gets crowded near the hour so get there early to take up a good position
Overrated . I was puzzled to see such as large crowd gathering for this attraction, however learning about the history of the clock it must of been quiet interesting in the 14th century.

Arrive at 9am. Get there for the clock's first chime at 9am otherwise the crowds are absurd, and then whilst the crowds build for the next hour, use the opportunity to climb (or take the life) up the clock tower, the view are incredible!
beautiful buildings. I went to the top of the Astronomical clock... amazing views from there.A must-see attraction in the old city
When the bell rings. Every whole hour the clock comes a live at it is fun to see.The clock it self is nice. A lot of details.

Do stop and listen when the talented street musicians perform. They are really entertaining.. Apart from its historical significance, its undoubtedly the best hangout zone in Prague. There are a large number of cafe, restaurants and bars! Just pull a chair and take a laid back sip of your drink and enjoy the view. Its going to refresh you without fail.

Take the Climb to the top!. It is fun to stand in front of the Astronomical Clock and wait for the time to arrive for the bells to chime and the 12 apostles to appear in the small window above the clock. But what is even more interesting is climbing to the top of the Clock Tower for an exceptional view of Old Town Prague!

Quite amazing . When you consider the age of this clock it is quite amazing to see it in action.You may have to move around to get the best view but it is worth it as no other place has anything like this clock.

Stop and watch, and listen to an explanation of the various rotating dials,. We certainly saw a lot of this as our hotel was right in the square, so we heard it and watched it move It is amazing! Poor inventer though, he was blinded so he could not produce another! The whole square is alive with people, cafes, musicians, food vendors, buskers and of course tourists.

Very Enchanting!. Visited this place more than 5 times and there was a huge crowd waiting for the clock to strike at each hour. It was even more enchanting once I learnt of the story behind the clock and the characters represented as part of the design. A somber reminder that we have a limited time to make our impact felt on this earth. There are several lovely buildings in this area and lots of eateries so it's a great place to sit and watch for a while or just enjoy a meal. Highly recommended.

Keeping time.... This is probably the best known 'tourist attraction'.And most tourists seem to know exactly when the clock configuration 'strikes'.At those moments, within 'seconds', the whole world 'comes in time' to gather around the clock.And when the performance is over, everybody disapears again in just a few 'minutes'.If you arrive a bit late, the gathering crowd is so large that you can hardly even enter the square.However, if you wait for everybody to disappear, you can 'take your time' to inspect from up close.You will be surprised by all the perfect little details.

The tower is worth a visit. The tower is worth a visit if very crowded and full of people waving selfie sticks. So be patient when trying to get a view and work your way round. There is lots of info on the stairs leading up to the top so you can take your time and learn a bit on the way up.The Astronomical clock is undoubtedly a beautiful thing to behold though the hourly activity has to be ( as I heard a guide tell his audience) one of the most over rated sights in Europe. Not a lot of note happens to make it worth hanging around in the crowd especially. If you are on a tight schedule and are there on the hour, fine, if not don't hang around especially
Amazing!. Every part of Prague is beautiful and the Astronomical Clock contributes a lot to it. Very interesting and lots of people seeing this area. Very unique!
Outstanding clock. Loved the astronomical clock, beautiful and still working. The buildings next to it has some outstanding architecture. Take your time and meander around the square.

photo spot. If you talk about prague, this may be one of the most popular icons of prague, the astronomical clock. I've been to prague 2x and I've got the same photo taken under this clock. At a certain time of the day, there's something that comes out (sorry i forgot what). something like a cuckoo clock that tells you it's a certain hour of the day already.
Iconic. An Iconic feature of Old Prague that's a must see for all tourists. Easy to get to and plenty of other attractions/places to eat in the area.

Great view of old town Prague from the clock tower. The town hall and its tower are centrally located on the Old Town Square in Prague. A visit to the tower is well worth the entrance fee as it is the best location for a panoramic view of the old city. There is an elevator to the top so it is an easy visit. There is also an interesting old clock at the base of the tower.
Super fun, a must see. Good to go up the old town hall tower at the end of the day as the lines are not so big and you can take pictures during the day and after the sunset.

The hourly Clock show in the Old Town. Our tour guide was in a hurry as he took us across charles bridge, then we found ourselves in a square where thousands of people were gathered. i must have missed our guide telling us what it was all about but at no time at all, i found out that we were waiting for the clock to strike at 2 pm. Promptly the bells rang and a window opened where puppets pass through one after the other. it was a short show but i like the suspense and the surprise!

Do the Tower twice, morning and night. After 10 is a really crowded. Go early or late.. Very crowed after 10 in the morning, you will need to stand and watch this clock more then once to catch the action. I think sitting at the restaurant and getting food and drinks might not be a bad idea. You need to catch a tour and the tower. All tours in your language is not all the time. English maybe three times a day. The night tour 8 pm was worth the money. Same price as the day tour. Less crowded. Pictures from the top of the tower are great again, you might want to do the tower in the day and the night.
Amazing intricacies. Watching the intricate moves of the many parts was amazing. The story behind the clock is very interesting. It is a must see in Old Town.

a gem in the crown that is Prague. This clock is a must see feature in what must be one of the most architecturally amazing cities in the world. Don't get to excited about the hourly feature its the clock that's the real showstopper

Worth going to the top!!. This is right in the Old Town Square of Prague so you cannot miss it. The clock is beautiful and fascinating. The clock tower is 100% worth going to the top of. It is 120 Czk to go up so very cheap and you get the most stunning views of the whole of Prague. There is also a lift so anybody can get up there to admire the view. Take you camera :)

Fantastic Architecture. Went to this attraction in the square and while we were very impressed with the whole visual of this historical attraction, we did find the 12 apostles appearance a little disappointing, we had heard so much about this but we kept comparing it to the similar attraction in Munich and we were a little disappointed

Memorable visit to old prague city. Lovely place to be, roaming in the old town of prague and walking around the streets all over covering iconic monuments like astronomical clock with street shopping,

Go anytime during day at least 10 min before clock ticks to next hour. This attraction is in the old town square and nice engineering marvel. Be there 10 minutes before clock ticks to next hour. In case you need some action , you can goto top of clock tower and enjoy the hourly animated magic for few seconds

Amazing Astronomical Clock, but in a very crowded place. An amazing Astronomical Clock located in a very nice square. The clock was first installed in 1410. It is the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still working.We were there twice around noon and late afternoon. Both times the square around the Astronomical Clock was very crowded. Might be because we were in Prague late June? We might try next time to visit Prague during the shoulder season and hope is not that crowded to be able to spend more time to see all the amazing details of the clock.

View from the top is perfect . The story behind the clock is quite interesting in itself. Read the history of the clock and you'll enjoy seeing it that much more, be sure to pay the entrance fee to the tower and treat yourself to a stunning view of the city . There is a lift or an easy walk to the top.
Make sure you arrive just before the hour strikes. Worth waiting for the hour to strike to see the action, large crowds though so watch your wallet. Hard to write anything more about it.

A must visit at Prague. Admiring the ingenuity of our forefathers to make a clock which works on the lunar solar and zodiac revolving earth and moon on sun. The place is busy and eating places around are great

A must see in Prague. We did not go into the Old Town Hall, but the Astronomical Clock was amazing. You really need to spend some time to truly appreciate all of the amazing details. It can get very crowded with tourists, so go early for the best picture opportunities.

Prague Old Town and Astronomical Clock. The Old Town square of Prague is charming and has a lot of options! From this location you can walk to the Charles Bridge and other sites. The restaurant "El Toro Negro" has wonderful food and if you sit at the end of the patio you are in a perfect spot to watch the clock strike the hour. Between 9am and 5pm a couple of the statues move and panels open up for saints to be seen. I highly recommend paying the very small fee to walk to the top of the clock tower and take in the view. Recommend you go late afternoon for the coolness and great time for picture taking! The area in front of the clock gets crowded so arrive early then stick around to listen to wonderful singers in the square and grab some ham, potatoes, sauerkraut and a beer from the outdoor vendors or visit one of the great restaurants. The area is full of life and things to do. There are often bubble blowers and jugglers in the area as well. Great for all ages.
Go early or go late. Very nice square late in the afternoon or early in the morning. Otherwise just so many people hard to move on really appreciate the area

Amazing Clock, Interesting History. If you can, try to catch the walking tour when it stops in front of the clock. We heard tour guide Pistis give the history of the clock and he made it come to life. He was so interesting, we joined the group. We did not go to the top, preferring to admire it from the outside.

The very heart of Europe. What shall I say ... this is my home town and it is the cuttest one in the whole word. I am not saying it, because I live here, but as I traveled and lived for several years abroad I learn to appreciate what we have here. It is very unique town. Most of the people I have met all over the world sait that also. So come and visit. You will fell in love.

Awesome architecture. I think I stood and watched the clock and looked at the architecture more than I did anything else! In fact most of my pictures from out visit involve the clock .....! It's a MUST SEE and there are a couple of cafe bars just outside. It die get very crowded though at the turn of the hour due to people wanting to see the mechanical display, which of course you must see.

A beautifull clock tower. A very beautifull monument.Every once in a while there is like a popet show, a mechanical dolls are getting out with music accompanied.It is located at a square with a lot of restaurants.Totally worth a visit!

One of the best town squares in the world. Tons of people, focus of many tours of Prague, this is the place to appreciate the best of the Prague from. The astronomical clock is beautiful but presents a disappointing demonstration that centuries ago awed common folk. Make sure you go to the top of the clock tower for awesome views. Wander around the square to appreciate great architecture. A great stepping off point for exploring the Jewish quarter, New Town and Wenceslas Square.

Too crowded; not worth going up. Paid to climb up the tower, but it was disappointing. Too crowded, and frankly there isn't much of a view. You also don't get to have a look at the inner workings of the clock. Skip the climb.

Iconic -- go see the clock, but we didn't think the performance was worth the wait. No doubt the Astronomical Clock is a beauty, and the Old Town Hall and surrounding area offers lots of great photo ops. We walked by the clock several times, but never seemed to catch the "show" when the clock comes alive and the characters move. So, I was adamant that we would be there to catch the performance of this iconic landmark in Prague. We got there early to get a good vantage point, and soon the square filled with thousands of other tourists waiting for the same thing. What a disappointment! We felt let down and definitely wish we hadn't wasted time waiting for a performance that just lasted a few minutes and wasn't that impressive. If you are nearby at the right time or have plenty of time to see all of the sights in Prague, by all means stop and watch, but don't give up time you could use for something else just to catch the clock move around.

Astronomical clock never fails . Definitely worth seeing. The dials and the building are beautiful and when the clock strikes the hour you can see why it is rated as the world's most disappointing attraction. The story behind the clock is pretty gruesome if you do a city tour.
unique and beautiful. An icon of Prague: the old town hall is great to go up as it has a fantastic view, and the astronomical clock is amazing!
very busy in high of season. Wonderful buildings and atmosphere, great to be their to hear the clock strike. It was very busy everybody trying to take a picture.

Astronomical clock. Beautiful architecture. .must see.. the square it's in made for many photo opportunities. I only went for the clock. Other than that there was too many people bumping into each other

one of a kind clock experience. This is a favorite attraction of many in old town Prague. Each hour the clock goes through a routine, not quite as impressive as a Munich glockenspiel but nice. be sure to stay until the end, there is always a little something quirky. While you are in the area check out the people in the old square. There are always street performers and the diversity of people highlight the universal attraction of the city. Be careful, pickpockets are known to frequent the area, even though there is a police presence during peak times. Standard vigilance should be enough

Czech excellence in combining art and science. This is arguably the best display of Czech excellence in combining art and science. The astronomical crlock is an engineering Wonder of its time but the whole thing is also set in gorgeous architecture.

Good place in the old city. Astronomical clocks are interesting, and town hall is decorated with mny sculpturs and bas-reliefs, mot of them covered with net but it's for security reasons i think. And they are almost invisible.

amazing but.... the place and the clock was amazing but always keep an eye on your wallet or your back-pack because the place is full of thieves. in just 15 min there were 3 poor tourist they left without money or passport.

must see. The clock is amazing and still working after so many years , every hour it strikes and all apostles come out of the window to bless the crowd , for those who want to climb up ( pheww) you can have a closer look.
There are numerous restaurants around it which serve beer and yummy food
Fun. Loved watching the clock work. I think we were told that this is the oldest working clock in Europe.
From other ages. One of the best places to visit in Prague.Beautiful impressive and feelings from other ages of the past.Don't miss it.

Watch out for ticket seller. The ticket seller failed to listen to my corrected numbers and gave me a ticket for 5 rate re than 4. Then his supervisor would not refund the additional ticket as we had been up to the tower. What a cumbersome, inoperative system and in the end not worth all the hype. Watch your money here they will rip you off.

Agree with the Hype!. Since we stayed at a hotel nearby, we walked by the clock many times during our visit. We enjoyed the crowds that gather near the top of the hour. Such a wonderfully unique experience!

14th century and still 'goung strong!'. Of course, everyone must see this clock, especially when it strikes on the hour with all of the 'bells and whistles'. Sadly the performance only lasts about 20seconds!
Interesting!. Lots of people here.I will definitely recommend to chk it out.It's conveniently located.Still do not figure out how amazing old clock work.
Changing of the hour. The clock itself is interesting looking at the different clocks but on the hour the performance is not worth wasting time to wait for it

Amazing view. Once you have watched the clock hit the hour take a trip up the tower to enjoy the amazing view of Prague from the top....reasonably priced to get in and although busy was very well organised and you don't queue for very long.

One of the things to stop by and see in Prague.. One of the places you sort of MUST see in Prague. The kids love the clock and it is of course interesting to adults, too. don't bother to stop in the restaurants here, the prices are much higher here.
A must see if your one and only trip to Prague.. Crowded - especially when the clock is getting ready to strike. Since it is a must see try to go off hours if possible. Bring your video camera.

Great experience at Astronomical Clock. Its was a wonderful experience at Old town and Astronomical clock.The clock plays music at every hour so, it was really great that even if you miss at one of the hour you can enjoy it next hour and in the mean time you can enjoy good food and do some shopping at the town square near the Charles Bridge.

Time it well to see the Astronomical Clock. The Astronomical Clock is right in the center of Old Town Hall where streets leading to it are filled with a variety of shops (souvenirs to high end crystals) and restaurants so it's a great place to hang around to see the top of the hour show. Only problem is, it's easy to miss it if caught up inside a store or a few streets over jazz club but there are several hours in a day. Was able to be there two different times - both time, very crowded but if you go 15 minutes prior, you can get a pretty good spot to see the clock straight on which is important as you can't really see the figures if you are too close as they stay within the clock. Regardless, the clock itself is quite impressive and the whole mechanics behind it is as well. Saw it at 6 pm and another night at 10 pm. We had been warned to watch for pickpockets which would be easy with the crowd but fortunately we did not experience that and enjoyed seeing people have a good time. Did not go to the top, didn't even realize it but glad to have seen the Clock -- not many in the world.

My favourite part of Prague. . As far as clocks go, this is my favourite. Like nothing else in the world. Come and enjoy. Watch as it chimes every hour on the hour. Make sure you get a good viewing point early before the top of the hour as it gets VERY busy when it's time. Best thing in Prague!

Special experience. Everyone that visits Prague really has to stop to see the clock. It strikes on the hour every hour when the skeleton rings the bell and the apostles then parade around the windows. It only last a few minutes but the earlier the better to avoid the crowds.
Amazing. It's is just amazing . Go and visit the tower it is well worthed and the view from the top is so good .
A must see. Hard to get your head around how this was so brilliantly designed and constructed for the period in history when it was made. You'll definitely want to see it.
clock. when visting Prague we spent several days in old town. One of the highlights of old town was waiting for the clock on the hour to watch the figures cime out.

If you are pressed for time, don't bother waiting for the hour, just go up the tower for a good view. By 14th century standards, the show put on bybthe clock on the hour is impressive, but by our standards today, it is very tame & unremarkable. Seeing it at 9 or 10am in the high season is stress-free, but 11am to 3pm it is not even standing room anywhere straight in front of the clock, which is where you need to be to see the moving apostles when the clock doors open - they do not come outside the clock.The view from the top of the tower is worth seeing as it not only gives you another perspective on the square, but the tangled mess of rooves around the square emphasises the narrow twisted streets you experience on the ground. The elevator takes you right to the top. Again, go early or late to avoid the crowds.

Wow. We went up the tower which is only €4.40 to get in. Walk to the top and do read the articles on the walls on the way up if you have time. It's small up on the outside of the tower so be wary there will be loads of people out there! Beautiful views of the whole city, breathtaking. The clock is so cool, have to see it for yourself.
More gothic gorgeousness! . The astronomical clock and town hall are in the most beautiful square in Prague which is at its medieval heart - houses, churches and cobbled streets - delightful!

Saw it and videoed taped for closer viewing.. While the clock is lovely to view, not sure I really needed to stay for the hourly chime. It didn't live up to the hype in my book. Large crowds perhaps in off season I might enjoy it more.
Not to be missed experience. Gets very busy on the hour each hour as tourists stop to take pictures of the astronomical clock but don't miss this.

Up to the top!. For a few dollars you can climb to the top. It had an elevator, but it was broken. Most of the climb is relatively easy using ramps although there is a spiral staircase at the very end.
The top provides very nice views of old town.

Overly Hyped. The clock itself is beautiful. I love the blue and gold colors! However, the fact that there are always huge crowds at the top of the hour waiting to see this little figurine walk out of the clock is a little silly.
what's the time...:). even though everybody has watches on theeir phones today, but they still stand under this clock and wait, watch the time:))))

Beautiful Medieval Clock (but I'll tell you the very best place in which to watch the display). This is a famous medieval clock in the old town square Prague. Every hour on the hour a door opens and Jesus Christ leads out his disciples whilst on the side a skeleton tolls a bell to the statue of a Turk. For a fee you can climb to the top or take a lift which is wheelchair accessible for a spectacular view of the city. Hundred of tourists gather in the square with their cameras ready to capture this sight. Want to sit ,have a coffee and cake with the best photo opportunity? See my review 'Step Back in Time Grand Cafe Prague' and I think you'll be pleasantly surprised.
Fancy clock. Absolutely lovely building and clock, but unfortunately vastly overrated not one of the things you to see when you are in Prague it's a clock folks that's it

Great view!. This is a good place to start your tour in Prague. It is easy climb by foot, or just take the elevator. It's a good idea to come early in the morning, or you will have to wait.. And share the view with many (!!) tourists.
Beautiful fairytale. Prague is the most wonderful town in Europe. To walk around is like being in a beautiful fairytale. My whole family wants to stay here for allways.

Tick Tock check out the Clock.. It's worth waiting for the hour to strike in order to see the windows open and saintly characters parade by. This clock is hundreds of years old. You can take a walk up to the top of the tower for a great view of Prague. Don't forget to people watch as hundreds gather on the hour.
Great site . Clock show runs every hour on 59. Stay a bit further away to take excellent pics. There is a lot of weddings mostly Czech, Russians and Israeli

Get there early!. Best location spot to be when watching the clock on the hour would be straight on. Be aware that it becomes extremely crowded just before the clock is going to chime. I'd recommend staking out your spot at least 15 minutes before. It is quite a remarkable feat.

Underwhelming. Really didn't see what the fuss was about. The clock itself is beautiful and the fact that it is the oldest working clock in Europe is a remarkable aspect too.On the hour every hour, masses of people gather eagerly for up to a quarter of an hour before hand... to watch an odd couple of puppets and pulley systems ring a couple of bells.Not quite what the guidebook made it out to be!
Packed with people . Short Walk from the square. Lots of people watching. Try to understand the history and purpose of the clock prior to seeing it or you'll be confused.

A got to see it place. This, top me, is another one of those place where you have to visit if you're in Prague. It's not where you'd expect to see it, nor at the height, it's round the corner from the main square and faces a parade of hope and places to eat. The are fills up on the hour which is an ideal time for pick pocket to have a go, so watch your stuff. That said it's a place you'll want to tick off your list.
Interesting. The clock is in amongst a busy square. As you walk around looking at all the sights the clock is there easily to be seen! Take a photo and then move onto the next incredible sight.
Beautiful!. Simply beautiful! The clock is quite impressive and the old town house is amazing! A must see! But be prepared, there's so many tourists out there!

Crowd puller!. The clock attracts hundreds of sightseers at all times, and especially so every hour on the hour when the skeleton chimes the bell, and the figures of the apostles appear in the upstairs windows.

Disappointed. We had high expectations after seeing some of the other European Astronomical Clocks.This was no big deal. Lasts at the most 30 seconds and I am being generous. The Old Town Hall is beautiful, but the clock itself is not worth waiting for.

Be there at the top of the hour. The astronimcal clock is unlike any other clock I've seen. Situated right off the amazing Old Town Square, be sure to pop by near the top of the hour to see the clock at work.

Don't try to tell the time!. Crowds of people looking at a clock that is impossible to decipher unless you are a 15th century alchemist. Figures that "move" - not really. Very underwhelming - and the cock never crowed! But it gets the tourists into the square and those cafes!

Seven centuries and still goes on time. The Prague astronomical clock, or Prague orloj (in Czech: Pražský orloj), is a medieval astronomical clock located in Prague, at Old Town Square. We walk around several times in month. The story says that the clock was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still working.The clock mechanism itself is composed of three main components: the astronomical dial, representing the position of the Sun and Moon in the sky and displaying various astronomical details; "The Walk of the Apostles", a clockwork hourly show of figures of the Apostles and other moving sculptures—notably a figure of Death (represented by a skeleton) striking the time; and a calendar dial with medallions representing the months. A legend, has it that the initial clock-maker Hanus was blinded on the order of the Prague Councillors so that he could not repeat his work; in turn, he broke down the clock, and no one was able to repair it for the next hundred years. Every hour on the hour there are hundreds of tourist taking movies and photographs of this medieval miracle.

Clock used to be impresive 400 years ago. Town Hall is a great place. Too crowd in summer. Restaurants are average.Astronomical clock was great 400 years ago. Now it's like a toy. I can't understand why people is standing in front of it for such old and basic mechanical show.Just take a picture with it and move on.

Disappointing clock but still worth seeing.. The clock was a little disappointing. We had expected more action, but it was still beautiful! The bugler played well and the square was packed with tourists waiting the hour. Definitely should go see for yourself.

Beautiful at all times of day. Many people come to Prague thinking the top thing to do is see the clock toll. Honestly, don't waste your time!!!!! The tolling is nothing special, difficult to see and lasts maybe 30 seconds. Instead go to enjoy the scenery, take pictures listen to music and have a cup of coffee at a cafe.Come in the day and at night. The square is beautiful and a must see at both times of day. Square really comes alive at night with music performers, and people having fun eating dinner and having a drink in the square.

Stunning . The clock tower is something I have never seen before and cannot compare to anything else! It's beautiful! Go to see on the hour to see the figures move! The whole area of the old town square is breathtaking! Something from a book!
A little underwhelmed. Had heard this was a place to visit, on the tourist trail, but to be honest didnt find it all that impressive. I guess its down to personal taste.

Astronomical clock. Gotta see it but so underwhelming if you've been to Munich. Just not much movement at top of hour...apostles rotate through doors. Didn't see anything else happen. It IS beautiful to see, but if you're unable to be there 9-9 on the hour, don't feel cheated.
Wait until the hour!. Such a picturesque clock and a must see if you visit Prague. Best to wait until the hour to see the clock in full motion

Amazing Clock. This is many clocks in one. The person who constructed it was a pure genius. The workings were explained to us but we still did not understand it. Be there on the hour to see the performance. For a fee the tower can be climbed.
A must see. Touristic area to see the clock and enjoy a nice trotoire meal . Food in this area is tasty and not expensive. You enjoy the guests intrests of this historical area
Was okay. Early in the morning there's nothing. Later it gets crowded. The place is close to Old Town Square so it's not difficult to visit here. Worth going once.
wonderfull. The best attraction in praga.It's the first target for your visit in praga.The tower with the astromical cloch is a singolar and amazing show every time that you see it.
Nice place. The astronomical clock is really big and amazing , there is a nice atmosphere down there , artists , musicans , just find a place , sit down and enjoy what's happening around ;)

Fascinating. Very much a touristy thing but still amazing that this was originally built so long ago. the restoration work has been very well done and it is just fascinating to watch. We were warned about pickpockets but felt safe throughout.

very popular place. Great people place. Lots of restaurants near by. Blazingly hot and no shaded place to sit other than going to a restuarant. Interesting clock with different figures and planets. Very popular with tourists.

ok. very very overated
could not understand why all the fuss
view from the top of tower is great and worth it.

Good place. Very good place to go.
There is always something happening there and it is very central.
If you can wait for it, you should definitely see the astronomical clock's show.

Great view from the top. Although the astronomical clock was overrated, the view from the top of the Old Town Hall Tower is great. The elevator doesn't go all the way to the top, so there is still a lot of stairs to climb. However, the view is worth it. Best view of Old Town Square and the Tyn Church. Also great panoramas of the Castle area and the rest of Prague. While on top, we spotted a rooftop restaurant across from the clock that we made a beeline for as soon as we descended. Great views from there also.
gets busy. Everybody loves this part of the square and it gets very busy get there about 10 to the hour as the action happens before the hour.
A must see. A must see square in Prague, very busy. the clock is a landmark great to see at 11 am. you can spend a day in the nearby streets

Amazing piece of mechanical wizardry. Great to time this with the change of the hour and watch all of the elements come to life. Amazing to think of the work that went into this creation. This is something you may want to see more than once.

Distinctly Underwhelming!. Why do huge crowds hang about for ages, cameras poised, for what must be the least spectacular spectacle since the original coat of paint slowly formed it's skin?I guess it must be all the guidebooks raving about it. Am I missing something, or is it the Emperor's new clothes scenario? If you happen to be passing through the square on the hour, then by all means glance up, but don't even break stride; wherever you are going and whatever you are doing, it's more interesting!

Fantastic Views over the City. Great views from the top of the Astronomical clock.. Well worth the climb up, although there is a lift, but this attraction is popular.. Be prepared to queue for the life
Overwhelming . It's really overwhelming! It's always packed with people, full of life, energy and music, a great place to be for young people.
An experience for all ages. Be among those watching this historic clock open, revolve and continue to chime on the hour. It is a cultural experience in Prague that one must not miss.

Historical must-see.. Must see. Be there on the hour and get a good vantage point and have your zoom lens ready! The streets surrounding the Old Town hall have enough interesting sights, sounds, and tastes that you can easily spend a whole day in the vicinity.

An Icon in the Midst of the Old City. You know a place is significant when wedding couples come to have their photos taken beside it. On one morning we saw now fewer than six couples in their bridal gowns and tuxes have their photos taken beside this iconic clock that has become an hourly event in the Old City. Come in the morning after a sunrise stroll on the Charles Bridge to see the show, (the clock and the photo shoots) before the rest of the tourists mob the square.

A piece of art worth viewing. Absolutely beautiful to look at, and worth touring too. The level of artistry involved is definitely worth a look. Also, the front looks different at different times in the day, depending on the angle the sun shines on it.

Old Town Charm. The best way to explore this area is through a slow stroll on the famous Charles Bridge. The beautiful Medieval bridge is like a preview to this Old Town, which is the heart of Prague and gives you a glimpse of the city's great past through its historical buildings, authentic Czech food, and various souvenir shops.
Well worth a visit to see an amazing work of art and science.. This historic Astronomical clock is well worth a visit when in Prague. The crowd can get pretty big.

Very interesting. This is a very good location to visit. The Astronomical clock is the oldest working clock of it's type in the world, this one dating back to the 14 hundreds. A Czech explained about the clock to us and said at midday it barks. Unfortunately we arrived late so we missed the midday event but I think there was something lost in translation when it came to barking!!!! There are figures at the front that represent vanity, greed, death and pleasure. On the hour, every hour, the figure that represents death rings it's bell and the other three shake their heads symbolizing there unreadiness to depart. The story aside it's a fascinating time piece to look at. Well worth a visit.
I don't get this. Hundreds come every hour to see this and I don't really get it. Are they the same 1000 people or are they different? It really isn't that good.

A Must in Prague. A very beautiful and elegant piece of architecture. I recommend going with a tour guide simply because all the different fables also make this clock that much more interesting. Also around this area are lots of little food areas. I got a delicious crepe there that I still dream about.
Neat clock. If you want to get up for a close look be prepared to deal with a lots of people, as it is always crowded here. Did like the clock
View and Leave. It's on many most disappointing attractions for a reason. This truly is an anticlimax. The square is beautiful and so may as well check it out as you walk past.

Enchanting. Best spot in Prague. So many beautiful buildings, authentic Czech food, live entertainment, and shops. This is the heart of Prague and just about everything of interest in the city is here or close by. The clock is so unique and engaging.

Worth the walk up. Definite must to go up the tower and get a view of the city - great perspective and orientation. History of the tower told as you walk up - a reasonable ramp up makes the climb doable - not steep stairs -
Well worth it. Well worth the walk up to see the beautiful view of Prague. It wasn't very busy at 6pm the views really are terrific. A must do, even if it's a bit touristy

Cool buildings!. great architecture in the square. The 12 disciples moving at the hour was cool but if you are coming far for it, not really worth the trip or waiting for until the hour. It is literally only 30 seconds that the 12 disciples figures rotate.
Crowds galore. Like the rest of my Prague experience, very crowded, but certainly worth to fight the crowds. A must when you are in Prague
On the hour. The clock is well worth seeing. Make sure you see it when it strikes the hour. It definitely comes to life. Watch the skeleton and the mice plus the small opening doors.

Over before you blink. To start with the clock is stunning, there are not many example of these anywhere in the world, but the game it has for when it strikes the hour is that you will be inundated with crowds. Do go and see it chime and watch the parade of the apostles, but beware the whole thing lasts about 30 seconds. You will need to be there about 10 minutes before the hour to get a good spot.We also went up the tower, don't be put off by the height as it is a very easy walk and is in fact a ramp most of the way and also a lift if you are that way inclined. The view from the top is stunning and there is a very good illustration of the towers history as you walk up including the incredible damage done during the nazi occupation and also the subsequent restoration. Finally pay for the visit with the tour as it includes a visit to the clock which they don't tell you, and if you don't pay if upfront it works out very expensive.I would recommend a visit.
Amazing!. Definitely have a look at this building! The clock is fabulous - make sure you stop to take a look at it! Make sure you take the time out to go up the tower - the views are amazing!

Magnificent view - confusing entrance system / Nádherný výhled - zmatený systém vstupného. There is really magnificent view from the Old town hall tower. You can enjoy the view on the most famous sights of Prague. If you are partly handicaped, it is also possible to get up by the modern lift. Pay attention to the entrance tickets. You can combine access to the tower and city hall rooms or tower and astronomical clock chamber or by all together. If you come just hour before closing time, go to see the clock first. You could miss the clock while spending time on the top. Ask for information about the entrance time for various parts of the city hall !! Be in front of city hall astronomical clock just some minutes before whole hour and enjoy spectacle (short) of appostels defilade. Watch also the statues around the clock. They move too.
Astronomical clock.. A fascinating piece of history, in the Old town square, the views from the top are very good, and when the clock strikes on the hour all sorts of things happen, Superb.
Fantastic views. Fantastic views over Prague from the top of the tower. The tour of the town hall fascinating and the guide was very knowledgeable and enthusiastic.

The clock is overrated. Large crowds line up to see the two clock windows open on the hour with the moving icons. Blink you eyes and it's over. The only surprise was hearing a roster crow when the two doors shut. The old town clock is way over rated but hey, you've come all the way to Prague to see it and it's on your bucket list.

Interesting buildings. Very attractive with lots of architectural feature. The clock is very attractive though it is difficult to tell the time. I feel that the performance that takes place every hour on the hour is slightly over rated.

The clock was a disappointment. . The clock is beautiful and great for photo opportunities, it gets very busy towards each hour as the clock changes and provides a show, this was very disappointing as nothing happened and even my tour guide said that it wasn't good!

Clock time. Astronomical Clock can be visit at the top. Sometimes there are queques for almost one hour. There is a lift or you can go by scale. The tower gives you great sight views for the most attraction af Prague: Charles Bridge, the Castle, Vltava , Weacheslav Square . The Astronomical Tower is a jewel of mechanics and astronomy . On the stairs you can read a part of his history and understand what all this mechanism do and mean. When you go back in the square you can see the spectacle given by puppets from the clock.
Overrated!. Interesting but not as exciting as it is made out to be. The huge crowds every hour make you think something amazing is going to happen, but actually just a few moving figures!

Beautiful artitecture . The clock is absolutly Beautiful. Big crowds when it hits the hour as there is a skeleton that moves. The Old Town Hall is right beside it stunning! Lots of overpriced food places about. And people selling things outside the Tower. You can also go upto the top of the clock get beautiful views of Prague. Beautiful artitecture. Buildings all around are stunning. Go early to avoid crowds and also good to see the Old Town Hall all light up.

Don't bother - real non-event!. This is billed as one of the major attractions of Prague - this is not the case! The building itself is beautiful and the astronomical clock is an incredible piece of engineering when you consider how old it is. But every hour, tour guides drag packs of tourists to stand in front of the clock to watch a few small figures appear just inside two small doors. Very, very disappointing!Prague is a beautiful city with countless wonderful sights - this is not one of them. Do not waste your time hanging about waiting for the clock to chime - use your time visiting some of the much more interesting better attractions.

Impressive detail with first digital clock and seems to tell more than just the time . Great impressive clock and seems advanced for its time. It is more than a clock as it can tell you the astrological signs, along with changes of the moon, zodiac signs, seasons, and I'm sure I'm missing a few more features of this impressive clock. Climb up the tower or elevator for amazing view of Old town square and learn historical facts of the tower. Wait for top of the hour everyday from 9am-11pm for a showing of its work in action. Loud bell ringing and changing of its panels, apostles showing and a golden rooster screaming gives everyone a great hourly show.

Clock Tower & Old Town Hall. Well worth taking the time and effort to go up the Clock tower. It was a bit busy when we went up and therefore crowded around the viewing balcony, but the views over the city and the square are great once you're up there. The tour around the Old Town Hall was interesting, if not a little long. The clock itself is worth a look on the hour, although not as much happens as you might expect!
Great clock. Great clock with a rich history! I loved seeing it and being able to hear about it's history. It is truly a marvel to behold.

Nice but nothing breathtaking.... It is nice, but nothing that you should hold your breath for. At the hour, there are some puppet looking characters that rotate and that's all. Apart from the fact that it is a big old clock, you are not missing much if you skip this...

Tourist trap!. Now don't get me mistaken... Prague the city is breathtaking. But please do not get caught up in the hype of the astronomical tower. Every hour as the clock strikes twelve, it behaves like a elaborately constructed cuckoo clock. I still don't know why so many people got to see this and take pictures.

Be prepared for crowds but the Clock is phenomenal!. Unbelievable that it has worked this many centuries. Very interesting and a Must See sight in Prague. Bathrooms in several shops near by. Enjoy the Czech beer - I'm not a beer drinker and I loved the dark beer. Nothing like the U.S. beer!

Amazing. This is after Charles' Bridge probably most famous thing in Prague. I recommend being in front of the clock fifteen minutes before full hour to get the best place to see the show. It is really amazing clock. Death rings the bell as the apostles parade by. Then there's the bird and after the bell rings. You can even sit at a cafe just across, as we did. Prices are a little bit higher, but view is amazing. We sat there for an hour and saw clock at 11 and 12 am, I'd say the best time to visit it because the show is the longest. Enjoy!

Old town hall clock tower highly recommended!. Go up the old town hall tower for fascinating views of Prague. More than reasonable admission charge and was not as busy as you may expect. Astronomical clock was interesting to look at but you may want to go early morning to see it as very busy from midday onwards.

Astronomical clock.. The od town hall and astronomical clock is probably one of the most photographed things in Prague. Crowds gather on the hour when the clock chimes and puts on it's display which is worth a visit. It's possible to climb the tower for an aerial view of the town. This area is a real tourist trap so not the best place to shop or eat.

The Astronomical clock and old town hall. This town hall and the Astronomical Clock is in the heart of the old town in Prague. This draws thousand of tourists each hour each day. There are lots of restaurants and food places plus shops around the area so you do not have to just wait

Clock. When we saw the clock we did not know the time but when we walked past we were shocked to find out that this clock not only told the time, 7:30 if i recall correctly it also informed us of the position of the moon and sun. Something I have always wanted to know at every point throughout the day. The clock is quite low down but that does not matter because if it was any higher you could not read the time. When I realised this it was 7:35 the clock is nice and correct me if I am wrong but also one of the oldest astronomical clocks that still functions as a clock as well as informing the visitor of the astronomy.

A highlight. One of the highlights of the trip since I am an astrology fan. The place is crowded though. Somehow the first day I went there I ended up beneath the clock and still couldn't realize it was above me, which was very odd, since there were crowds taking pics and selfies in front of me. A mystic place I do believe.

Center of Praha. Situated in the heart of the old town. Is an attraction outside because every hour you will listen to the bells and you will see 12 apostoli going out from the window. The best anyway is from the top of the tower because you can see a panoramic view. Go up by lift and down by walking.
Astronomical clock. The clock's performance is often called the most disappointing tourist site in Europe. Good thing my tour guide had a few interesting stories to share regarding the maker =)

Skeleton the main man. The Astronomical clock is the main feature in Prague old town square, is delightful, watch the skeleton get the figures moving on the hour, very detailed and well worht stoppin for 5 minutes to watch, gets very busy all day long.

It's a clock. Very busy tourist attraction with people waiting patiently for the hour to chime and the figure to appear. It is a beautiful clock. Take you pictures but the figures on the hour aren't worth the wait.

If you want to get mesmerized, this is the place. One of the main attractions in Prague. No trip to this city can be complete without it. This place is bustling with life specially in the evenings. The crowd is awesome, street food sumptuous & the atmosphere is electric.When I visited the place there was a local band playing latest pop numbers. There is more to this place than just being an attraction!

Magical Building. Although we did not visit inside, we managed to be at the Astronomical Clock exactly when the revolving figures were going around. It's truly such as marvelous event. The building and the clock as well as the nearby buildings are gorgeous and were extremely technologically advanced for their time. I would really recommend trying to arrive on the hour for the figures. It really adds a sense of medieval magic to the city. Another must see in Prague!

Interesting clock- but what time is it?. This is considered a major attraction in Prague with a unique clock- that can do many things except tell the time. However it you want to know the start of every hour, look for the throngs of people gathering around to hear and see the figures going around the top of the clock every hour. It is always crowded and be aware of pickpockets. All said and done- worth a visit!
Heart of Prague. Place is located at the heart of old town; therefore, there are plenty of people and street performances. Clock is nice to look at, especially when it starts to be animated.

A must to see the revolving figures.. The clock strikes on the hour every hour. The best place to see the little figures go round is directly in front of the clock. Watch out for the moving skeletons below the figures and the golden hen which is placed above them.
Old Town Hall. Too crowded, but unquestionably a must-see place of Prague.Hard to take photo without some strange heads on it.
Old town square. I would suggest worth waiting in the crowd for the clock to reach the top of the hour to see the running theatre artists..worth to watch it provided if you got amble of time.
One of the sights. It's a clock! Busy tourist area. Take a photo and tick it off your list! Can climb tower I think but you get better views for free from Letna park.

Historical clock full of interesting detail. Some would be disappointed by the show that the Astronomical Clock makes as the hour is struck but the level of information displayed in the clock's face is amazing!

Looks nice but ?. We waited with the crowd for the clock to reach the top of the hour and after it was over looked at each other and thought is that it, nice to see but don't waste too long waiting for the chimes on the hour.
Loved it . Well worth doing especially when snowing. The views are incredible, got some amazing photos. It is a bit busy but if you time it right you won't have to que at all.

Quick Stop - and a Must. An obvious must do. Be prepared for many people - at least there were when we were there. Probably because it was a weekend. This was a quick stop for us, on the way to see other parts of Prague.

Great clock, overrated chime. The actual chime of the clock on the hour is overrated. And you'll have to deal with throngs of tourists. Just go at any other time during the hour and you'll get to enjoy a clearer photo.

Fascinating. Apart from the obvious attraction of the twelve figures moving with the hourly chimes, it is worthwhile doing some research to determine the meaning of the three clock faces and the way each works. Particularly the astronomical clock is quite amazing. For a wonderful view of the movement, might I suggest going to the first floor of the hotel opposite and having a drink whilst sitting at the window directly facing the clock.

Definitely worth a visit. This is a VERY popular tourist attraction (probably also a popular place for pickpockets) and the square is really crowded, especially when the clock is about to strike the hour. Very interesting to observe. The walk or elevator ride up the tower is definitely worth taking even though there are a lot of people crammed into a small space; the view over the city is spectacular.
Don't Miss. This tower had us riveted as we stood by for half an hour to watch this wonderful clock strike on the hour.
smaller that imagined. a bit overated, but worth seeing. Millions of people flock to the area on the hour to see the 12 apostles come out.

Amazing. to see with a better view the Astronomic "Show" at 12 -- but I think every round hour- try it from the restaurant " Mozart Cafe" they have an up store restaurant. sitting near the window you can avoid the crowd and have great ice cream and view
Must see. Stop in front of it few minutes before full hour and you will witness the oldest puppet show. Don't miss it

The heart of the city and what a view!. The Astronomical Clock is very cool, dating back a long way its great to see it. On the hour it gathers a lot of people to have a look at it and although it isn't anything firework like it is still very nice to see. The tower at the town hall is really great. The views (I have written how beautiful the views are at 3 different locations in this city!! BUT THEY ARE :) ) are stunning. Watching over the square and just a great building.

Very nice view of the city and guided visit inside the tower. Be sure to buy the "Prague card" for as many days as you plan to stay in Prague if you intend to visit most tourist places. It is worth it! It will make your transportation around the city stress free and it entitles you with several free entrances to most interesting places such as this one(old town hall and astronomical clock).You can take the elevator to reach the tower top and enjoy the beautiful view of the whole city. You will take some of your best photos from up there! On the way down do remember to take the guided tour in the "hidden" underground internal of the tower. You will understand a lot more than you will read in any written guide and you will experience the atmosphere of previous centuries in the well preserved remains and paintings.For sure a must do during your visit to Prague!

Must Go. the town hall is full of life, shopping places, nice restautants and cafe.The astronomical clock show (every hour) is a big letdown, perhaps it grows on you , but the 3 times I saw it , I wasn't impressed, given the number of tourists taking videos maybe I missed something

Amazing view. A must see view!! It was breathtaking- especially with the Christmas market below. We went in December and it was not too chilly to be at the top of the tower. Could have spent hours looking at the stunning colors. The red roofs really give Prague a unique and look and feel.

Not a glockenspiel - Pragues Astronomical Clock. My wife and I and ten other tour guests turned up on the hour to see the clock do its thing. I have recently bee to Muncih and seen the glockenspiel and expected something the similar. No they are not the same. the Asrtonomical clock is more remarkable for its information on the sun and the moon as well as the time. But the passing of the apostles each hour still has its charm to attraction a thronging crowd each hour.
Astronomical clock and Old Town Hall. History galore in these surroundings.Lovely to look at all the different historic buildings.Astronomical clock astounding.
Old Clock. On the hour you cannot move for tourists taking pictures of this magnificent old clock, the detail and characters moving are marvellous.
animated clock with tower to climb for the agile and young at heart. Pick your time to see the clock do its act. Gets crowded but you'll be passing anyway and its a nice place for a stop.
Overrated but must see. Probably the most overrated attraction of Prague, but the story behind it is extremely interesting and tje tech unique as well. The attraction itself is not to special.
