On top of the ClockTower. The Astronomical Clock is very peculiar, don't lose the chance to visit its insides.We climbed the tower, the view from the top of it was pretty neat!

A Prague icon. Definitely one of the most iconic landmarks of Prague. One cannot miss it unless one chooses not to walk through the old town. On the hour every hour, scores of people wait for the ranging of the clock and observe the rotating Apostles. Walking up the tower could be interesting but nothing I would consider a must.
Watch the Clock Strike. Pretty buildings and a great clock. Make sure your there on the hour to see the clock strike, Worth seeing.

Ranked #2 Disappointing Attraction in Europe, but . The hourly show of the workings of the clock is interesting, but a big disappointment if you haven't researched the why behind what it's doing. The look on most people's faces after the brief display (that seems to start during the minute before the hour) is one of disappointment, "is that it". I would advice to read up on the history of the clock and some of the smaller animations that are happening (hard to see unless your fight under the clock and the two on the left are missing right now) which makes it much more interesting. Also take a look at the white X's on the ground facing the square and learn about their history. Also the astrological components of the clock are amazing considering all that is being displayed and the accuracy involved. Very cool sight, just read up on it or risk "is that it".

A Great Medieval Clock. I was a great experience when we rushed to Old Town Square (Staromestska) to be on time to watch this astronomical clock with lots of history behind it strike 12:00pm. Many tourist are attracted to watch this clock and quite a big crowd gathered. A good advise would be to there, at least, 15 minutes before so that take a good position for pictures and movie.Another good experience was when when we went up to the top of the tower where one could see an extremely beautiful view of Prague with all its red roofs.Paul GaleaMALTA
Beautiful ol' clock. It's a beautiful clock and beautiful square. But so crowded with tourists that it felt claustrophobic.

Mrs. The old town is very quaint and the buildings stunning the clock strikes on the hour every hour is a very big attraction. It is an amazing piece of engineering and architecture as is most of the old town can imagine it being quite magical at Christmas time. However if eating DO NOT EAT at the Olivia Verde just in front of the clock service appalling food and and any attempts of a complaint falls on deaf ears.

Medieval Engineering Marvel. While visiting the rounds of the old town,i came across the oldest part of the old town hall which consists of a Gothic tower with a bay chapel & an unique astronomical clock which was considered as a `wonder of the world` in the medieval times & can still be considered as a marvel of engineering.It still continues to be the greatest treasures of Prague.Here on every hour hundreds of tourists from all over the world & local people gather to enjoy a fascinating mechanical performance which still amazes people with its procession of 12 Apostles,moving statues & visualization like no other instrument in the world.Here it follows the belief that earth is considered the center of the universe & shown accordingly along with other zodiac signs.A new calender dial has been added in modern times with pics for every month.You can also visit the insides of the town hall by buying a ticket & take a lift to have some magnificent views of the city.A definite must visit while in Prague.

Fascinating. You have to see it just to marvel at the ingenuity of the man who designed it. The clock in Munich presents better, in my opinion, when it goes into action. But the genius behind this clock which shows so many different things at once is something to contemplate.

A let down!!. So this was a major let down... everyone there and online say "Go see the clock!" It was not that great of a show (done hourly). It's a very nice, extravagant, and large clock in itself, but the hourly "coo-koo shows" were not impressive. Take it off your bucket list, just don't go in expecting something big. Nice architecture.

Great view from the top. A must see in Prague. It's fun to watch the medieval engineering tell time, among a lot of other things. Everyone gathering at the top of hour to watch, It's neat to be among the crowds at the base but my favorite part was going up to the top of the tower to see the beautiful red roof skyline. It's well worth it the climb.

Interesting for a quick visit. Its a interesting monument and its much more interesting to know the history behind it. But the clock itself is okay to be viewed for a few minutes. That's all.
The place gets too crowded as people are waiting to see what happens and then the look of disappointed faces when nothing much happens is a must see.

Oldest Astronomical Clock. This was really an amazing site to behold. We were lucky to arrive well in advance as the area fills up really quickly just before the clock chimes. The clock chimes on the hour so keep this in mind when visiting. Every detail of the clock has a story and a meaning, so if you have not done any research then it might be a good idea to get a guide when visiting this attraction, otherwise it will just be another clock chiming and you will not appreciate all the activities that happen during that event.
Jazz on the plaza. visited the plaza during the jazz concert so it was a little bit crowded but still a great experince

A must.. The astronomical clock is stunning. Those that don't enjoy it clearly don't appreciate the fact it's the oldest working astronomical clock in the world. A true delicate engineering marvel.The Tower is an absolute must. The entrance is reasonably priced and the information inside is immense, with a poster essentially every few meters all the way up the tower. there is a brand new lift for those that can't make the walk too. Once at the top the view is wonderful, and although it's obviously crowded at all times, if you're patient, everyone makes it around the top eventually.The hall (houses) are explorable with a tour. I can recommend this since it's the only way to see the rest of the hall, but unfortunately the tour guides English was of sporadic quality, and she was very quiet, but she did try and answer all questions thrown at her. The tour itself was pretty extensive covering the insides of the clock, the houses, main hall and the underground, which was a nice surprise.I highly recommend this as an introduction to your stay in Prague.

great place to spent. the old town squer is the best place in Prague to visit and more then one time. it can be the center of your visit. you can start your day there and finished it with the squer . Alot of places to eat and drink and spent like the black theatere

Interesting to look at (for a minute or two), good meeting place. This is the place that all the roads lead to when you're in Prague. You can tell your loved ones that you'll meet up in front of "the Clock", and you'll avoid misunderstandings. It's a beautiful and unique thing to look at, even between the full hours. You can almost tell what time it is by observing how thick the crowd in front of the clock is. As a kid I liked the apostles. As an adult I was mildly amused by all the fuss. Of course, you haven't really been to Prague if you haven't observed this happening. It's kind of a ritual. Go see it.

Good place to start a tour of the city. You definitely want to see the clock, but you don't want to spend a long time waiting for the top of the hour "show." It's good, but not worth waiting more than 5 minutes to see. Move on and enjoy the area.

A beautiful example of cutting-edge 15th Century technology. We wound our way to the Astronomical Clock, which was about to strike 5:00. Gracing the façade of the Old Town Hall, it was as advertised, a wonder of 15th Century technology, with its various faces displaying the position of the sun and the moon in the zodiac, the times of sunrise and sunset, the time in old Bohemian style and other, more esoteric data. We had expected a mechanical performance in the style of Munich’s Glockenspiel, but all that happened was that a skeleton rang a mournful-sounding bell and then the clock struck five times. No 12 Apostles, no crowing rooster, not Turk. Perhaps those instructive bits occur only upon certain hours.

Prague vacation. . A bit over rated. Lots of tourists. But a great story and a great history. The place is fun at night. Lots of young people hang out and musicians play all over. It's fun to have a drink and listen to the going ons.
Astronomical Clock. This is a really neat spot. The clock is super cool and definitely a spot in need of a picture op. We only saw the clock and did not go inside, so I cannot comment to that.
Unique Clock!. We returned to this place many times. Very unique and beautiful clock. Very nice view from the top of the tower.

Fascinating historical clock and tower. We went here very shortly after arriving in Prague and it was a fantastic way to see the city and get our bearings. Fab views of the square with all the street performers as well as more distant views of the castle and cathedral and Eiffel Tower. Easy to go up all steps by foot, with info boards all the way up to give an excuse to rest! Highly recommended! The clock was fascinating with hourly spectacles of moving men, spirits and music ... wonderful. Still don't understand how it works after all these years, but brilliant craftsmanship all the same.

Sad story about the clock maker . Apparently the king blinded the clock maker so he couldn't make another. Yikes! ("Thank you" would have been better, don't you think?) The clock is stunning (and i love the skeleton of death that rings his little bell), but the hordes of tourists in August (myself included) make it a bit of a madhouse.

Nice Old Town. It is a nice old town with expensive cafes for tourist. Lots of Segway Tour sales people bugging you to buy. It had so many tourist you can hardly see the clock. I was there for the hour change and it was not worth waiting for. Nice to see once but too many tourist during day but interesting at night when the locals come out to play and eat. Music to listen to and picnics on the ground around the square. However, there are better night street life on other roads nearby...much more local.

Not to be missed - Prague ex-libris. The Astronomical Clock is probably the most beautiful one I ever watched working. You should be nearby when the figures move, that is, every hour. I love to be there at midday, as we listen to 12 sounds. if you are very tall you can choose any place to watch it. But if you are shorter, near the arcades you have a better perspective and not so many people in front of you - they concentrate really close to the clock. he own Hall is paid but it is worth a visit: beautiful Tower View, painting (frescos) and furniture.

Prague highlight. A most fascinating monument right in the historical centre of Prague. This is one of the main attractions of the city, in fact there are crowds of tourists gathered there day and night to watch the mechanism of the clock when it strikes the hour.

That clock. The first day we wandered around the square, we came across crowds of people standing staring at a building. We then saw a clock, but decided if anything happened it would be on the hour and it was only quarter to. The next day we came back with a tour guide and learnt far more about it. The 12 Apostles are symbolised in this 600 year old medieval clock. Takes a while to work out how the clock functions, but worth doing so. Once you've worked it out, it's quite sensible. The mechanical operation only lasts a few seconds and a bit disappointing, but you're surrounded by hundreds of tourists all enjoying the experience which adds to the fun. Worth a climb up for the view.

Beautiful clock in beautiful square. The town hall and the clock tower are undoubtably examples of great architecture and the clock face is a shimmering gold colour and just begs to be photographed.The greatly anticipated appearance of the figures on the hour was for me a bit of a disappointment however and made me ask myself what all the fuss was about. The figures were tiny and dull and if you blinked you missed them.I would certainly recommend a visit to the clock tower but I certainly wouldn't wait for hourly appearance again.

360 views of the old town and beyond. Fantastic views From the clock tower So make sure you take a cameraqueues can also be very long So I would suggest you take water with you TipNo point in buying your ticket outside Walk in Take the lift or walk upTo the end of the queuethen judge the size of the FIRST queue ! Then stay or go back another day (the ticket you buy outside doesn’t let you by pass this queue !)Also NoteEventually When you get up to the tower (take another lift or the ramp walk then a spiral staircase great fun when you’re going up and people coming down !!) There’s also another queue and a one way systemSo be warned Go early or late Still 360* views are amazing and worth the visit Aug 19th 2015
Delightful city center. Beautiful city center. Centrally located to get to St. Charles bridge, the castle and cathedral Great food.

Take time to understand purpose of dials. The astronomical clock is worth seeing but unless you take the time to understand what the dials are depicting the intricacy of the clock will not be appreciated. So many stand to wait for the top of the hour and the mechanical action which is not particularly outstanding.

Fun, historical clock. The astronomical clock comes to life every hour on the hour to delight the hordes of tourists gathered to see the show. It is quite brief, but fun nevertheless. We took a video of it, which our friends have enjoyed also. The apostles rotate around the clock, which ends with the rooster crowing. Fun to see when you are visiting Old Town Square.

Stunning!. The clock draws the crowds for the hourly procession of the Apostles (just above the astronomical clock, which is half way up.) The motifs around the clock are quite macabre; the skeleton tolls the bell; the Turk symbolises lust; the Jew with moneybags represents greed - yes - reading a guidebook gives you context and colour! It's worth the (inexpensive) climb up top for one of the best 360 degree views of Prague's spires.
Unique and special. Amazing is how I would describe this centuries old timepiece located in the square. Although always crowded, look beyond that to examine the beautiful work here
Beautiful clock.. Seeing the clock is worth the effort. The area around it is very crowded at all times. Make the effort to get close to the clock one time.

Astronomical Clock!. Interesting site to see! But the wait and crowd for the few seconds was totally crazy! Best to spend a few dollars and have a cup of coffee or an ice cream at a window table that faces the clock in Cafe Mozart on the 2nd Floor. The cafe is right in front of the clock! There is no real length of time. Depends on how long you want to stay, just so you could see the few seconds of activity this clock does!

A Must See but Dissapointing. Yes, everyone needs to go see the clock on the Old Town Hall Tower but don't expect anything spectacular when the top of the hour comes around. There will be views of the apostles in the two windows but they go by so fast you can barely see them. The clock face itself is spectacular and worth the visit. And there will be people - lots of people.

Amazing clock. this is a very attractive clock and all the more amazing for its age.On the hour the door open and you see some figures. Worth seeing if you are there on the hour but don't wait around as we were a little dissapointed.
Must see. When in Prague, you can't miss it. It is in the heart of Prague and is very interesting mechanical clock with figures that have a little performance while appearing at certain time of day.

Interesting but busy. If you are passing by on the hour, definitely go see the clock in action, but I wouldn't go out of the way to hang about for anymore than 10 minutes, as you may become frustrated by how busy and crowded it gets.

Special. Climbed the tower which is fantastic for views over the whole city. Great story boards as well telling you about the sights in front of you. Watched the show along with all the thousands in the square. We decided to have a drink in one of the cafes...prime seats so sat and people watched and then enjoyed the clock. Quite amazing when you think how old this clock is and the craftsmanship ...another Prague must do :)

This Clock deserves your time.. One of the main attractions in all of Prague is the Astronomical Clock at the Old Town Square.This medieval clock might not be as famous as Big Ben, but it has so much more to offer.During daylight hours, at the top of every hour is more than just the typical ringing of the bells. While the bells ring there is a related show that tells a story. I'm not going to tell you the whole 'story' here, because I think you should have a tour guide tell it to you while you are there observing it. But you will see a parade of the Twelve Apostles. You see a reaction of Three Vices and Death.And there is more that the clock does on a functional basis then its artistic show that they can tell you about.With such a wonderfully made clock that was impressive both in its day and now, you have to be curious about it's magnificent creator. And the story involving the clock's creator is just as amazing as the clock itself.Take a tour or read about the clock in the guide, and get there at least twenty minutes early so you can get a good viewpoint as the crowds fill in to watch the show at the top of the hour.
Nice visit. Very interesting with the amount of history and effort took to build these places, but most of all they were breathtaking to look at, minus the incredible amounts of tourists.

crowded but really nice. you need to wait in few queues, but views are worth it. you have to climb some stairs and then take a lift to go there, but you can take a lot of nice pictures and see a lot of places in Prague.

Astronomical Clock - Prague. Worth seeing, but not worth a special trip. I thought it was over-exaggerated, at least watching the clock and the animations on the hour. The view from the top was good. Recommend going at sunset - less crowded, same view.

must see. the clock is awesome although not as big as I thought but the whole square surrounding the clock is full of restaurants and pubs, beer is very cheap, shopping and great buildings. also street performers and such. nice area to sit, relax and enjoy.
Interesting achetecture. I found the clock highly over-rated but then we didn't wait for the hourly show. The archetecture was very nice.
Timeless. The clock was as you see it on pictures, amazing that it still works after so many years. A must see in Prague.
Very beautiful . Magic but in my opinion the change of the hours made by the clock is not so impressive as you aspect.

Free lovely spot. Best seen before 10 am, after that is a very crowded space. Try to be at the change of the hour to see the astronomical clock working... even before 9 am there is always a big crowd of tourists.

More than just an amazing clock, this clock is the anchor and centerpiece of a delightful Prague Square.. Much has been written about the history of this clock. The clock dates from the 1400's and has been rebuilt and improved many times over the years. On the hour, crowds gather under the clock to witness the "parade" of the Apostles who do a little parade through opened windows above the clock face. It's a fairly simple event, but it is pleasing to watch what the old master clock builders created to entertain and inform the populace. The clock is surrounded by restaurants and is adjacent to the large Old Town Square where many people congregate in the evening, to sit, to stroll, to talk, to enjoy. We much enjoyed our visits to this area.

Interesting Clock for a Minute. The Astronomical Clock is interesting, but does it really rate hordes of tourists jostling for just the right angle for their twenty-seventh selfie in front of it? Go early, spend a minute looking at the clock, and skip the crowds and pickpockets.

Don't make a special trip . Absolutely brilliant city and if your passing the old Hall on the hour then stop in the throngs of people to watch the 40 second display but don't make a special trip because afterwards you'll say 'oh was that it'!

Amazing clock, underwhelming experience. Go see it. No, really, this thing is worth a look, as it's amazingly beautiful and fascinating. But don't bother sticking around for the famous ring, as all that happens is that two small doors open and a few crudely carved figures rotate behind them.
Disappointed. We made a point of being here on the hour. While the clock did chime, the apostles did not revolve. Some of the figures were not present; it may have been because of maintenance.

Disappointing but free and fast. So every hour this clock chimes and hordes of tourists stand outside with their cameras ready to take a picture of it. Now the clock is definitely cool it was built in 1421 and still uses the same mechanism. But the movement of the figures was not really that impressive. Although it is funny to see all the tourists when it is over look at each other as if to say " was that it?" Frankly if you have seen the clock in Munich or even the cost in Central Park in New York you will be slightly disappointed. The best part about seeing this is the party atmosphere in Old Town Square every night when everyone crowd around to see it. If you're in Prague you can't miss it so go look at it and then go into the square to see all the amazing musicians magicians and other acts.

Wonderful old town and amazing clock. Soak up the old town feel even when crowded this is lovely place to visit. Gets very busy near the clock on the run up to each hour but worth waiting for. We stopped at quarter to for a drink at a bar directly in front of the clock, my husband had the biggest beer EVER and the bill wasn't astronomical, only the clock (couldn't resist). Watch out for the selfie-sticks!

Great Clock. Situated at the heart of the old town this clock adorns the southern wall of the old town hall. Consisting of windows with apostles at the top, an astronomical dial, which is the oldest part, and a calendar dial beneath with various sculptures. It provides us with a amusing exhibition every hour I like the skeleton. Legend tells of the master clock maker Hanus who was reputed to have built the clock refusing to show construction plans to anybody. When Prague Councillors found out that he was going to make another, even better clock, they became jealous and blinded him so he could not finish it. We now know this is not the correct version and that the original clock did not work well for a long time. In recent time the legend continues when on the 21st of June if the clock stops it is a sign of something terrible will happen. It was considered to remove it many centuries ago! I and I would say millions more are grateful they didn't also the Czech people of today as it is a wonderful free landmark that everyone visits more than once during their stay in Prague.

Beautiful. I loved this square and spent a lot of time here! Walking around the city you always seem to end up here time & time again! It was my favorite place filled with people of all ages, street food, shops, restaurants, street performers, horse & buggy! The gathering at the clock is fun to watch! We took the elevator up the tower for a fabulous view of this beautiful square!

Time waits for no man.. There's no way to accurately describe the excitement of waiting for the clock to strike the hour and the dancing apostles to come out! The tour up to the top is worth the price and slight sense of claustrophobia! The view is phenomeufrom that vantage point. The people who work in the museum were pleasant and helpful. What a totally unique experience of a lifetime!

Interesting. Time your Old Town Square visit so that you're at the clock at the top of the hour. It does not tell time, but shows the phases of the moon, etc., but on the hour, doors open at the top, and the apostles can be seen, and there are figures below that depict the evils dancing and moving their heads, ringing bells. Look to the right side at the skeleton, our favourite. There are a lot of people there typically, so as anywhere that's crowded, watch out for pickpockets.
Old town. Spent almost whole day walking stunning place a beautiful place lots of cafes restaurants lots to see for the whole family

Unique. It is definitely one of the best places in Prague. Although it is a little expensive for my taste, It is worth to visit the tower of the Clock, on top of it you can see the whole square from above.
Amazing clock. This is an amazing clock; the construction, when the little guys come to the light, I can't describe it...

Cool clock!. Huge crowd, but worth the wait if you are close to the top of the hour. You need to be standing right in front to get the full experience. From the side you can't see the statues turn around at the top.
Wow. The clock itself, the structure, meaning, breathtaking. You start to wonder yourself of beauty in the world.

Interesting for history fans. While most of the people stop short of visiting the old Prague town hall, stopping at the astronomical clock outside (a true marvel), the insides are interesting too - although mostly for history geeks. The building has a cool history and pretty much every room is different. The view from the tower is great (although the balcony is really narrow, really crowded and can be petrifying for vertigoed people).

Go early!. The earlier you can get up and go the better as there is no one about early in the morning.The clock strikes on the hour and is great to see but the Square will fill up later on. Very worth a visit Pam J NZ
Nice spot. A must see when in Prague. The area is one of the most beautiful city centres around. Take a walk at the sorrounding streets.

Astronomical clock show - Old Town Square - Prague. On the hour every hour the astronomical clock chimes. The clock has opening windows and the Apostles pass by the windows. Worth a watch as it is free.

Nice to have seen . The clock is fascinating just because it is old. Good craftsmanship. Worth the visit, but remember that you are not alone when you stop to glare. Back of a little and let people through.
czech names for new borns. part of the Town Square , look at the clock to choose name for the new born on a particular day of the month.

Old Town Hall Tower. You must have to visit this place if you want to get a bird's eye view of the Old City. The modern elevator will help you to rise by the belltower of the Town Hall and you will be able to admire a beautiful view from gallery of a tower. Choose a stay time on the tower at the end of the current hour and you will see many people on the square under the Town Hall with the eyes turned up waiting for a striking of the clock. Registrations of marriages happen in the Old Town hall still and if to you carries, you can see the happy newlyweds leaving big doors of the Town Hall. You can see a strict ascetic interior of the Old Town hall if you happen to be present on wedding.
Check it if you Can. Do not wait an hour to see this time it right or just catch it while you are in the area. If you wait more than ten minutes I guarantee you will be disappointed.

Magnificent story and view!. We were lucky to have a friend who lives in Prague so she directed us where to go and what to see in this beautiful town. The one of the first things on the list was the Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. The tour around it lasted for about 45 minutes and the tour guide was fantastic! She told us a lot of fun things and not only historical. And the view from the tower...amazing! Even though I'm veeeery afraid of heights, it was breathtaking. It was definitely worth that fear I felt when I looked down to the square! Every hour, the trumpet guy announces it from the tower and the crowd gathers to see the apostles and the other figures going in circle outside the clock. Interesting, both the clock and the crowd :) Try to be at the top of the tower at that moment. Don't miss it!

Great Tour. We booked a tour tru the town halls and climbed the tower afterwards.It was very nice.The town halls were very beautiful and so many different invluances and building styles and types.It was very nice that we went underground too and saw the old city.Our tour guide was a small blonde (I guess czech) lady. Her English was very good and she made it a nice tour.Afterwards we climbed the tower and took amazing pics. You can walk up or take a elevator. I suggest the walk upstairs tho haha
Amazing clock. I have never seen a clock with so much functions. It wills the sunrise, sunset, full moon, time, season and more.

When in Prague, do what the tourists do and see the Astronomical Clock. The Astronomical Clock is one of Prague’s top tourist sites. Be prepared to join a wall of tourists trying to get a glimpse of the clock movements. The clock is located on a wall of the Old Town Hall in the Old Town Square. There are four figures flanking the clock and two windows where the 12 apostles glide through when the skeleton rings a bell. This movement occurs every hour on the hour. Below the clock, are medallions showing the signs of the Zodiac. It is said that the stationary figures represent vanity, miserliness, astronomy and death. The clock has been in existence for over 600 years.

Take time. This is an amazing piece of machinery and how it was invented and put together is beyond belief.Go on The Naked Tour to get a detailed description of this incredible piece of time and there was me thinking that the Swiss had the monopoly.
Inside the Old Town Hall. The Astronomical Clock is wonderful, but crowds very heavy on the hour when it chimes. Be sure to go into and enjoy the inside as well.

You gotta see it, but it's not jaw-dropping. Skip the climb to the top.. You will remember watching the clock strike the hour for years to come. That said, I overheard a tour guide tell his group to bear in mind that the clock is the "second most disappointing tourist attraction in all of Europe." Cracked me up, because when it's over (about 20 seconds) you'll think "That's it?"We waited in line for about 40 minutes to get to the top of the clock tower. That was definitely NOT worthwhile. The views are great, but they're also great from other towers with little to no admission charge and no wait. You don't get any extra insight into the functioning or symbolism of the clock.

Ding dong . Ok. It's really amazing when you think that it was created so long ago. I mean the mechanism involved. On the hour of course when the clock is to "play" is crowded. U can't leave prague without seeing it. It's a tourist must. Lol.

Its good, very pleasent location. Its quite crowded place but nice, Quite a large crowd had gathered in front of the clock and we're waiting for it to strike the hour, must visit if you are in prague.

Every hour "clock show" and amaising view from the tower. Every full hour people waiting in front of the tower to watch the apostles moving and the death shaking the hour glass. The tower can be visited till late and there is a spectacular view over the city. Easy to reach via an elevator.
Ok, but not as great as we expected.. We explored all around the Town Hall waiting for the clock. Well, it was over in no time and not worth the wait or the crowds.

Touristy but Worthwhile. Everyone has to go & stand at the corner of the Old Town Square to watt the amazing mechanism of the clock... Do yourself a favour & go to the top for the view.... Watch out for pickpockets though
Something to remember. Quite a large crowd had gathered in front of the clock and we're waiting for it to strike the hour.I won't give it away.Go see Prague for yourself.It's beautiful.

Awesome Clock. As far as clocks go this one is pretty damn cool! Stumbled across this when walking around the square in Prague and just had to stop at it and learn more about it. Definitely worth a visit!!
overrated . not worth hanging about until the next hour. impressive that something so old still works but don't go out of your way to see it working

What a view!. The Astronomical Clock is one of the main attractions in the Old Town Square, and for good reason too! It's beautifully constructed, well maintained and once you're at the top you can see for miles. Word of advice, be patient! There are lots of people trying to get to the top (not just in life but of the Astronomical Clock too). It's a tight squeeze once you've reached the top and you have to shimmy past people to get to the edge for a real view - but it's worth it when you get there.If you want to see the hourly show, get there at least 15 minutes early otherwise you will get a side view or no view and its better to see the whole show.

Amazing . For a clock that has been working for hundreds of years it is absolutely amazing that it can be so accurate as well as beautiful. To see the apostles on the hour as well as other moving things including the golden rooster and the skeleton is a sight to behold

We loved every minute. This was our first visit to prague and we were not dissapointed. The atmosphere, architecture, history and the friendliness of the local people made our stay one of the most enjoyable that we have experienced. The old town square is especially impressive with the ingenious astronomical clock. We loved every minute.

Venture Up in the Tower!. When you visit Prague, you will find yourself in the Old Town Square at some point. You will quickly discover that the hourly chiming of the Astronomical Clock is a special treat, as thousands stop what they are doing and gaze skyward to see and listen to this treat. If you are lucky, you will also here someone at the top of the tower play their trumpet! As cool as this is from the ground, every visitor to Prague owes it to themselves to pay the small admission fee and venture up to the top of the tower at some point. During the day, you will be blown away by the beauty of the Prague rooftops and extended landscape. Plan to be there at the top of the hour and have a who new perspective as you see the crowd looking up at you! It is also pretty cool to stand next to the guy playing the trumpet! This is one of the best views in Prague and well worth the price of admission!

It tells you four different times, the zodiac sign and position of the sun and moon. I recommend sitting down in the opposite restaurant and observe. The clock displays many interesting information. The dial with the sun and hand shows the present time on the Roman letters (Central European Time, not taking daylight savings time into account), the ancient Czech time on the outermost circle (its first hour starts at sunset, so it moves around) and the Babylonian time with the Arabic numerals (a 12-hour day, divided between the time when the sun is up). The little star on the other side of the dial shows the so-called "sidereal" time. The "sun" displays the current zodiac sign on the inner wheel. If that would not be enough, the little moon gives information on the current moon phase (full or half for instance), and the background of the clock indicates whether it is dawn, day, dusk or night according to the sun's position. Wonderful! Interestingly, this is the oldest working astronomical clock in the world, and only one which can measure the Babylonian time.

Amazing View of Prague!. You should not miss the beautiful view of Prague from the top of the Old Town Hall tower. It's a postcard view! The architecture is truly amazing! The area in front of the astronomical clock get super crowded with everyone waiting for the hourly show, but since you are there, you have to watch it as well.
Pretty cool. the clock was awesome of course but what was really nice was the fact that one of the restaurants near by had a sprinkler going! It was a 95+ degree day and that was magical.

Great view of the Square. A great view of the Square from the Old Town Hall and we waited with the crowds to watch teh clock strike the hour. However a little disappointed in the clock action! It was all over in a couple of minutes and really you could blink and miss it!

Death Takes a Holiday. For all you slacking clockwatchers, this clock offers a chance to see what the grim reaper does for entertainment. The tower has several clockfaces, but look lower on the tower for the original Anita Ward fan. Who knew ol' Grim was a disco fan?

So Many Tourists. Old Town and the clock are very pretty, but so overrun with tourists it is not terribly enjoyable to visit. Obviously you have to visit this square when you go to Prague, but I don't find it necessary to spend much time here at all. It seemed like most things in the area were overpriced and somewhat of a tourist trap. I preferred the less hyped of areas of Prague personally.

Very large crowds every hour!. I guess there's not too much to see in Prague so one of the highlights is the astronomical clock in the old town square. There were crowds of people every hour to see it chime. It was a beautiful sunny day whilst we were there and we watched the clock chime about three times whilst we had a long and lazy lunch.
Cute. This is definitely a very cute clock to watch strike on the hour but get there early to secure a good vantage point! Also watch out for the pickpockets!

My very first time in Europe,I was totally amazed by everything! This place was the best of all the clocks I saw!. My favorite one! Lots of people gather right before the hour, keep a close eye on the clock and on your personal belongings. It's a very short show don't miss it!

Will blow your mind!. After visiting the Old Town Square, every full hour, the astronomical clock on the Town Hall will go off for one minute, revealing a truly unique piece of history. Huge crowds assemble below, so better grab the best spot!

Awesome stopp . Stay there and watch the 12 Apostels passing by we enjoyed it 3 times in Prague. Not too much happening so u gotta know the meaning of the figures in advance. However the astronomical clock is a fascinating invention!
An absolute must-see!. A pretty sight that you must see when you visit Prague. The architecture is sublime and it's great to see the clock chime on the hour.

Really nice. We visited the watch during our free tour,the guy explained everything about it and how the maker of the watch was treated after and also about the watches curse, recommend it to all watches lovers, like me :-)
A must. Amazing and the story around it is also charming... Should not be missed at all cost. One of the must visit in Prague.

Our local shopping centre clock is more interesting. Why do people in their hundreds stand here every hour to take photos of this. Sutton In Ashfield's shopping centre clock is more fun. It has miners moving around!!!. The only thing I saw was a skeleton ringing a bell, a bird tweeting, and some apostles moving around. It would have been truly amazing when it was built but now we have technology. Don't waste your time

Amazing view from the tower.. Watching the clock at the turn of the hour is a treat in itself. It gets VERY busy around the clock with lots of crowds and we were warned against pickpockets (Especially if you had your hands up to take a picture!) Maybe try to see this early in the morning, as when we were in the square around 9ish (On a Friday) there wasn't anywhere near the crowds we saw later around 4 when we went up the tower. We paid the small entrance fee to go up the tower and it was definitely worth it. There was a bit of a queue and it was slightly confusing where to go and saw a number of people turned away for not having bought a ticket first. (You have to buy a ticket in the ticket office just to the left of the clock and then go through the tourist information to the 3rd floor to enter)When we did get to go up the tower the descent was extremely easy as it was a slope, so very accessible. There is also a lift straight up to the top, but would recommend if able to to walk up as there are LOTS of information boards and pictures all the way showing the history of the tower. When up at the top it is a little crowded with lots of people trying to get the perfect picture at various view points. But you get an awesome panoramic view of the city. We really liked the information boards explaining what the key buildings you could see were. Having walked round the city throughout the day it was great to see it from another perspective. If like my partner you're not as good with heights the views are still spectacular without being right by the edge. Definitely worth a trip up.

Can't miss it!. You have to visit the astronomical clock but be careful of pickpockets (at least that's what I've been told)..best place to stand is opposite the clock under the arches. No obstructive views or crowds!
Beautiful clock and the tower view is awesome. The climb up the tower is one of the easiest and they have elevator as well. Wonderful views. Can be crowded so go early.

Astronomical clock. Chimes etc on the hour , over in 30 seconds. If you don't know what to expect you will be left cold. I advise you to go on the free walking tour first to find out all about it. Then it makes sense!

It's just a clock. It's just clock. If you want to know the time. Use your iPhone or your watch. The only thing which makes a visit worthwhile is sitting on the terrace watching the toursits making pictures of a clock.

Wonderful Views from the Tower. Fantastic views are to be had from the 60 meter Gothic tower of the town hall. Our visit was in the late afternoon, we avoided the crowds. there is a lift or stairs for the energetic.The tower attracts a reasonable fee, certainly worth it on a nice day.The Astronomical Clock is certainly a sight to be seen while in Prague.The clock itself is fascinating. On the hour, the area becomes very crowded to watch the 45 second parade of the 12 Apostle figures and hear the clock chime.Once the clock has chimed take the time to look the amazing detail of the whole mechanism. Most of the crowd moves away.

The best view in old town. Do not expect too much for the puppet show that people are waiting every hour. However, it's still worth to watch, especially considering it's invented long time ago. Actually the reason why you should visit the clock tower is the view from the top, which is spectacular from the old town even to the castle. The space on the tower is very small, so try to avoid the crowded time.

Take the time to read about it or take a tour before you go. At first glance, its interesting to look at in a vague sort of way, then if you're there at the top of the hour it makes a fun little show for a couple of minutes.Learning what all the dials, numbers and figures mean will make it a much better experience.

Astronomical experience. The chiming of the clock and the parade of the apostles was fun at the top of the hour. The old town hall has a great view from the top, I am told. Tickets are very reasonable and there may be an elevator available to the top. The only problem for us, there was a line to go to the top and we had limited time. Recommend going early in day, if that helps.

Crowded place but full of atmosphere. Hot day in Prague visiting the central market square. More tourists than you can imagine. However, local flavor of music being played and plenty of places to eat or look for a special souvenir from this beautiful country.

Climb the tower!. It’s like going up the Eiffel tower in Paris…you kind of have to do it. Great beautiful views of the city below. The top is very crowded, so make sure you have time to walk all the way around the tower to get views from all angles. In the city of a thousand climbable towers, this is the one you should climb.

Ancient clock, pride of Prague. Situated in the tower of old town hall of Prague, the astronomical clock is a famous attraction. About six hundred years old and surviving several troubles, the clock is working and at the stroke of each hour it is nice to see the sculptures coming out in display. The place is very crowded and noisy though. But certainly the entire ambience around the area is interesting.

One of the symbols of historic city. I can call it one of the symbols of the city. Its nice place to take a pictures. I didn't have a time to get more information about this clock. But i knew that it doesn't work. I believe so architect did it on purpose, because he were going to kill by king. But it is in amazing historic part of the city which they call it "Staroe Mesto", means Old place, or Old city.

The Heart of Prague. A Fantastic Atmosphere on the square with the Old Town Hall and the Astronomical Clock. Numerous excellent cafes and restaurant, just in the heart of Prague connected by the walking street from the Square to Carls Bridge. To me this is the main area of Prague.

Old Town Hall tour. Take the "historic rooms" tour which takes you behind the clock (you can see the saints that walk past the door on the other side). Even better, you get to see the 800 year old basement and hear the stories behind it. This tour was the total-suprirse-highlight of our trip.

Beautiful clock with boring hourly show. Every hour people gathers to see "the show" - well, it's few ding dongs and two opening doors, where are figures for some seconds - thats it! After that people clap hands and continue what they were doing.The clock itself is beautiful peace of machinery, but don't waste your time for the every hour "show" :D

Main attraction in Prague . You can't miss this place. Clock tower, lots of age and restaurants. So much happening around and it's rays full till really late at night. It's safe to walk there at anytime.

an intreguing clock though you'll need a local to explain it.. This clock works on the number of hours since sunset which is why it looks to be wrong all of the time, the 12 apostles do appear to have been added later.on the hour if you look carefully you will see the figure of death ringing in the hour

A must.. You just have to go to the top of the Old Town Hall and look around, eat street food in the square and stare at the gorgeous Church of Our Lady of Tyne on the opposite side of the square. Take your camera.

Sorry to say that this is just.... Do this for the books, the bucket list etc. Stop and watch the clock, it is the third oldest medieval astronomical clock. My point being; it is just that - a tourist attraction.

A must see.... Wow...is beautiful and a must see whilst you're in Prague attraction. Situated in the Square,surrounded by wonderful cafes and stores,my tip is to sit in one of the cafes,enjoy a leisurely drink and then about ten to fifteen minutes before the hour go stand in front of the clock,before all the hordes of people arrive to see the clock in action. Another must do is to go up the tower adjacent to the clock to see the most magnificent views of the stunning city of Prague. Not for those of you who are afraid of heights though.

Very interesting . Astronomical clock, Adam and Eve towers. .music in the town square. .traditional eateries around..enjoyed it! Should try the tredlnek at one of the local shops. .we liked the plain one. We spent 3 hours there.

A Bit disappointing but a must see. The clock is abit disappointing.
Every hour at the hour, bells ring and 2 small doors open with rotating figures.
However you must go, everyone waits, and claps. :) there are lots of places to eat, great views and street performers in the square :)
Beautiful. Beautiful building & busy area , the Astronomical clock is beautiful & all part of a lovely experience

Unremarkable. I read a lot of reviews on this and I have to say I was not impressed. I am not knocking it if you enjoy clocks in particular or if this is one of the few European cities you have been to but overall, I found this whole area to be jam packed with tourist and I could have lived without the crowd to see the clock do it's thing. I don't like to leave a negative review but there were so many reviews over fantasizing this clock, I feel that I had to give honest feedback that I would give it a miss if other options are available.
Big crowd grows every full hour. Very nice experience, especially at full hour with growing crowd in front. But when looking at the clock you might forget to look after your wallet.
amazing views of praha city. astronomical clock tower has a varied and interesting history down through the ages must do to see the hourly strike of twelve disciples and cockeral crow

Take the trouble to go to the top .. One must go up to the top to see the great views from there . And do buy the Booklet describing the History of the Clock . It is after the first lift as you walk to the second lift , going up .

One of the great clocks in Europe. The clock does its thing on the hour and attracts quite a crowd. I agree best to see earlier in the day otherwise you are jostling with a thousand others for a shot as it is probably the best known site in the city. Great but gruesome story behind the maker of the clock some 500 years ago. Very intricate detail showing the sun revolving around the earth.

Beautiful historical building. Really enjoyed the visit to the town hall. Amazing historical significance. The lift is itself a wonderful feat of engineering. The views from the top are breathtaking. I loved the facinating figures on the astronomical clock but was underwhelmed by the actual figures that appear on an hourly basis.

Old style and a must visit. The old town and clock are beautiful, architecture is stunning the buildings have minute details and ornate quirks, a very interesting part of Prague, a must visit if your around the city.
Disappointment. Talk about overrated! There are so many better looking and more interesting mechanisms of this type in the world: Vienna, Poznan, Olomunc... What's this crowd about?
Midweek for 2 nights. Watch the clock on the hour. I think the designer has his eyes poked out to prevent him from making a better one

Awesome--you must see this timepiece of history!. If you visit Prague you have to see this old timepiece that dates back to the 15th century. It's beautiful, ornate and still runs with all its original parts. If you go during the day, you'll fight the crowds to get a good picture (especially in peak seasons). I suggest waking up early with your camera, making your way to the square to take pictures, and then finding a cafe. Great start to a day in my book! :)

Tempus fugit!. The clock is amazing - so many details that you can't spot them in just one viewing. You have to remember that Prague was one of the places where the idea that the Earth is not the centre of the universe were first put forward - an astronomical clock is the perfect manifestation of that 'heresy'!
Very interesting!. You have to go there. It's a nice area with old buildings. I was inspired and taken too by the architectural design of the astronomical clock. I loved it's colours too.

The clock "performs" every hour on the hour from 9AM until 9PM. Although the performance of the clock lasts only 1 minute, it is lovely to see it. Expect a lot of people watching the clock. At 9PM it was less crowded. We saw it twice as everything goes so fast you have to see it a second time to realy have seen all the figurines move.

Nightime visit to see the clock tower. After a nice walk across Charles Bridge around 9:30 at night we happened to arrive at the clock tower just at 10pm when the glockenspiel started up. Huge crowds - it appears all US college students have gotten the word that beer is $1 in Prague - and interesting street performers. My favorite was the performer juggling fireballs and captivating hundreds of people.
places to see. a clock you must stop and see how they even thought to design such a clock begs belief the different faces all incorporated in one clock stun the eyes

Amazingly attractive. We have traveled Europe extensively but the astronomical clock of Prague has its own charm and elegance. I do not think, there would be any tourist who has not seen this beautiful wonderful clock in Prague.

amazing considering teh year it was built. on the hour every hour, must see. must take pictures, and stand a bit further back than most tourists, as you get to see the movements right up to the top of of the tower.

Most notable sight in Prague. It is a masterful work of engineering. It is the one sight in Prague you cannot miss or you will never feel like you really saw the important sight.While the hourly show is one that draws a crowd the rest of the time it is much less crowded.The tour of the tower itself is well worth it as you feel a real sense of history. You can also buy a ticket to the top of the tower for a 360 degree view of Prague. You can walk to the top or take an elevator.

Wonderful sightseeing. You need to buy tickets if you want to ride up the tower ,need to pad 120 czh each Many many people in the top of the tower ,although you can take pics ,have many visitors nearby ,need take care of your cameraI prefer use Gopro to take pics ,be more safety and easy Inside the tower ,have a museum,also need to paid on ,if you have no interest ,I prefer no need to paid and visit there Overall is a wonderful place I met in Prague

Most notable sight in Prague. It is a masterful work of engineering. It is the one sight in Prague you cannot miss or you will never feel like you really saw the important sight.While the hourly show is one that draws a crowd the rest of the time it is much less crowded.The tour of the tower itself is well worth it as you feel a real sense of history. You can also buy a ticket to the top of the tower for a 360 degree view of Prague. You can walk to the top or take an elevator.

A walk in history. I was there in Christmas time and it was just it was just incredible. Prague is one of my favorite town. You spend time in a open museum by just be in the old town, there is a lot to see and to do. I definitely recommend Prague for a staying at Christmas time !

Stunning. The astronomical clock is the number one attraction in Prague to see. It is absolutely stunning and the history of the clock is fascinating. The restaurants by the square are very expensive but offer very nice and cozy atmosphere for waiting, if needed.

Peace of history. If you come all the way to Prague, this is what you have to see. Very nicely renovated clockwork. Not very spectacle, but remember how old the clock is! Try to explain it for yourself how it works and what it shows. Crowdy, when tourist groups gather between 1:00 - 17:00.

Crowded but beautiful . Every hour on the hour a little window opens and the twelve apostles circle by a little show of about 20 seconds. The crowds were immense but the clock still Beautiful. If you have a guide they will tell you of the legend of the clock and how it was constructed. It is a gruesome ending but makes for a good story. BeautifulArchitecture and kind of something you have to see when here

Icon of Prague. The astronomical clock is an icon of Prague, especially that its the oldest clock that stills working. Standing under the Orloj at the chime of the hour an experience that everyone who comes to Prague should undertake and only then will you understand the real magic of the Orloj.In addition to its tower that gives the tourist a panoramic view of Prague.

Beautiful. . The Astronomical Clock was gorgeous. There are a lot of crowds surrounding it. When I visited it there was a couple taking wedding photos underneath it. The show the Clock performs is not that exciting, basically just plays music.

Amazing. I would recommend going to Astronomical clock we loved Prague the old town square is lovely place Charles Bridge is great place we crossed the Bridge a few times The Jewish quater and the churches were amazing lots of history

Clock nice but square very crowded. Clock nice but square very crowded - we were there at 5pm and probably earlier another day. Watch your bags! I liked the black statue at the other end - has seen lots of history.

The historical charm... still ticking here. This is the one Prague attraction that you just can't miss. A historic clock in a historic square in a historic city. Unfortunately the square is usually chock full of tourists, especially around the top of the hour when the clock strikes and the apostles do their dancing. Luckily the clock is high enough above everyone's heads so it's still very visible no matter how many people are crowded around it. Years ago I lived near here and liked to visit the clock and square during the winter when there are a lot fewer people. But it's a great sight anytime of year. We bought a ticket and went up the clock tower and people watched for awhile - that was a lot of fun too.

Squished like sardines. Gotta see it once I guess. Clock strikes on the hour with a skeleton ringing a bell... no other movement from which I saw but have been told that at midday, other mechanisms come to play. So get yourself squished and pocked from all directions... and then question... was it worth it??

A must see when in prague. Visited prague a few months back and by far the old town and clock were among the highlights. Aim to be there for 12 when u will see the clock in all its glory. Get an amazing crepe in the town square and sit and eat as u watch the street performers and tourists. Prague is an amazing place to visit. We went as a couple for 4 days and saw all we wanted too. Be careful of pick pockets in town centre as they as lurking around the clock as tourists are unaware as the clock rings.

Wow! What views?. Perhaps the most stunning views I've ever experienced! There's not a better way to see Prague than from atop this magnificant edifice! While there, spotted the perfect place for lunch after. The Astronomical Clock Tower tour is a curtain-downer on a visit to Prague. The area, filled with restaurants, bars and shops, is quite lively and peopleful, but weatch out for the pick-pockets!Make sure to buy an Astronomical pocket Clock at the end of the Tour. I bought myself one, and was so sorry I did not buy one for me son, who simply adored mine. They cme in many shapes. I wore mine to the wedding I attended the next day and everyone so loved it!

It's an old clock and it's a viewing tower. Amazingly the old clock is still working. It is one of the oldest clock available today. Every hour, there is a small show on the "walk of the apostles". While it is short and simple, it attracts a big crowd so if you want to see the display, make sure you are there at the hour mark. Since it is quite high, no worry even if you are not in the front row. Since the clock is at the corner of the Old town Square, there are always large crowd around which can be a nuisance at times. We didn't go up the tower but was told by our guide that you can get a good 360 degree view of Prague City.

Amazing!. Visited Prague on a business trip and stayed in old town on the extra day over the weekend . Old town square is an amazing and lively place all through the day and it feels like life in Prague is only here! The astronomical clock is among the tourist attractions and to watch it chime every hour is an experience to watch - its almost magical and you get transformed to a magical world for those 2-3 mins!! Must watch...

Amazing sight!. I would highly recommend going up the Astronomical Clock tower! It gives you a great 360 degree panoramical view of Prague, it is magical! Also, little tip: try to be outside the astronomical clock at an exact hour (example 1:00 sharp), because when the ringing of the clock is an attraction in itself.

cute and interesting, but avoid the crowds. There is loads of history behind the clock's story (same goes for the Old Town Hall), best described elsewhere. Needless to say, it's a fine sight for kids to watch the figures dance about on the hour, provided one is not surrounded by pushing hordes of (sometimes drunk) tourists. See it early in the day, as part of a historical walk around the Square. The view from the top is excellent as well.
Very busy area. The area is very busy but it is a fun spot. There are several outdoor dining areas that are reasonable and provide a view. There are shops that offer everything you could imagine.
Medieval clockwork. I have seen a few clock performances but this one packs the maximum punch. Very interesting sequence of events. The crowd around the place is vibrant and a sight in itself.

Fun. We had just arrived in Prague and had to wait a few hours before we could enter our hotel room. Just by chance we took some coffee opposite the old Town Hall. We had no idea that there is a 'display' every hour above the astronomical. clocks. Every hour hundreds of people gather in front of the tower to watch this display and honestly it is more fun to watch all the people than watching the display

Beautiful View of the City. You don’t want to miss the “Walk of the Apostles” every hour on the hour. This is the third oldest medieval clock in the world and the oldest one in operation now. I would recommend to take one of the FREE “Good Prague Tours” as they share with you a lot of detailed information about the clock. This is also a zodiac clock so it shows the zodiac signs and the bottom circle shows there is a name for each day. So in the old times, whoever was born on that day that was their name they were given. I’d recommend going early in the morning before 8am to get a great picture in front of the clock with no one else around. I’d also suggest to go up to the Old Town Hall Tower to experience the beautiful view of the square and the city. If you purchased the Prague Card the tower view is free. If you are looking for somewhere to eat, the U Prince Hotel is a great option as this is a very nice restaurant with a terrace that offers a 360 degree view of the city! The price is very reasonable as we ate pasta and salmon for only $35. If you don’t want to eat there you can order just drinks or just go to the top and snap a picture! The terrace doesn’t open until 11am and it’s free if you just want to take a photo!

Cant believe your eyes. This was a beautiful square with so much to see. You could easily spend hours here just having a beer and watching the people in action. I am sure there are tours to have but I prefer to watch like the locals.

Fascinating. The clock is fascinating. Even when it's busy you get a good view of the clock. We took the tour up the tower, worth it to get a great view of Prague. We went at 9 am and there was no wait time.

Not much clock action on the hour. from what I had read, I was expecting much more movement of the characters and on several levels. There were only 2 small characters that appeared, and only briefly. Fortunately, what there is to see is easy to see because the clock is so tall, and the square is large. Did not venture up the steps to the top of the tower.

Dracula not supplied!. Fabulous architecture, would have done Bram Stoker proud! The astronomical clock is lovely to see, especially when it does its thing, which is not always when you think - check timings. There is a lovely bar/restaurant opposite, get there early before the chimes to get 'pole' position.
Great views of the city. Spend the few crowns to go the top of the tower the views are breathtaking. I would recommend walking up (there are ramps with only a few steps at the end)

Astoundingly disappointing. I can't stress how overrated the clock show is. Make sure that if you're in Prague you don't waste your time by waiting until the hour for the clock show. I'm sure it was interesting during King Charles' tenure, but all it is now is crowded. The clock itself is fairly interesting--be sure to find a guide or guidebook to explain its intricacies to you, because to the untrained eye it's just confusing. Worth a glance if you walk by or an investigation if you have a guide, but it really doesn't need more than 5 minutes.
If your there it's worth looking up.. If your there look up. Don't make a special trip to see it. Lot of outdoor booths with all kinds of food,toys etc. for sale.

Small but beautiful. The buildings are beautiful, especially the ones with paintings all over their exterior, the clock is fascinating and when the clock chimes when it strikes the hour the little dolls are cute, though a little disappointing. The good thing was that even though we visited in July, it wasn't very crowded.
The most known tourist atraction in Praque. Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock are really nice and all the buildings around the square are beautiful.
Astronomical clock. Fascinating and beautiful clock that still functions after hundreds of years! A must-see! Chimes every hour.

sorry, not impressed.. Crowds start to congregate in front of the clock, well before the hour, so you have difficulty seeing very much, but there isn't that much to see!
Yes, the history of the clock is interesting, but the actual movements are very disappointing, I've seen several other better clocks, elsewhere in the world.

Must see. Take the elevator to the top for astounding views of the surrounding area. You can see Prague Castle, The National Theatre building, the Jewish Quarter and lots of beautiful red tile roofs. It overlooks the square and you get a birds eye view of the activities below. Admission fee required.

Lovely clock. We went there around 15 mins before the big show, the clock it self is quite amazing, simply a work of a genius considering its age. The mass hoards of tourists congregate outside from 15 mins before the clock strikes the next hour, all eagerly anticipating... When the clock finally strikes the next hour, you are disappointedly rewarded with a poor show of really nothing. Definitely not worth waiting for...

Amazing story but not worth a long wait for the hour to strike. The story and function of the clock is amazing (told to us by our guide) - definitely worth learning about. And it's certainly worth looking at the clock (which is very easy since it's in the main square close to everything else. But waiting around for hour to strike is really not worth it - if you're there close to the hour then wait around for a few minutes, otherwise go do something else.
Weekend with my daughter. This is an mist if you go to Praha, the clock hava an unike play ewery houre, you can also enter the church and look at the city from the church tower.
Wonderful. The old town hall and clock are really amazing all the buildings around the square are really beautiful this is a fantastic city.

Great astronomical marvel. Not such a great thing when the clock chimes when it strikes the hour but it is one of those things that you have to do but realise it was a waste of time. No use saying, I would skip it. Do go and see but do be prepared to be disappointed when the show at the hour isn't very exciting. When we were watching the crow didn't even crow, not that I noticed, anyway
Beautiful view from above to Stare Mesto. It is best to visit early in the morning. The tower opens at 9:00 am, and always have a large tail. But the view from above worth it.

Beautiful!. I went there to look at the clock. The clock is beautiful. When it's like a whole hour or like 12pm, 1pm, 2pm, etc, the clock will have some sound, first there is a skull that'll pull a string and the bell will ring also in the window next to the clock, 12 apostles will come out from the window. Have to visit there.

Must see. Very vibrant, hustle and bustle place. The Astronomical Clock is a very unique feature. different characters every hour. Beware that the area around the clock will get very very busy and when your sat in a restaurant / bar opposite the clock during the busy period it can get a little difficult to continue a conversation over the crowd noise.

Beautiful European city. Old Town Hall and the Astronomical Clock are not to be missed. The clock is very elaborate and beautiful. Do take the time to go to the top of the Old Town Hall. There is a fee and you can either walk up or take an elevator. The views from the top is gorgeous. We were there on a bright sunny day, and were able to walk around had get the 360 degree view. You will easily spend 40 minutes there. Do not be put off by the waiting line. It goes fast and most definitely worth it. Be sure and take along your camera since you will have a birdseye of the awesome architecture of the city.
Astonishing clock. You need to see this clock. There's nothing like it around. The old town around it is lovely, too. Enjoy the antiquity, the old European atmosphere.

A wonder to see. The clock and the area also takes time to see. Best bet was an outdoor restaurant just accross the street to eat a lunch then coffee so to watch the clock twice at least as there is a lot going on with all the figures. Hard to believe men made this so many years ago

astronomical clock and old town hall. Quit confusing at first but once it is all explained it all becomes clear. Wonderful views over the city from the top of the tower, but very busy. Go early or late to stand a decent chance of not waiting in a que for ages.

Amazing, still operational astronomical clock. The fact that the clock is so old and still working is what makes it amazing. That and its scientific and odd, esoteric beauty. It looks ornate and complex, and really takes you back in time (ha) to the era whence it was made. The Old Town Hall has a foreboding air to it compared to its surroundings, which is actually quite charming. I enjoyed being here a lot, though there are swarms of tourists, especially in summer!

Amazing clock tower. Prague is full of history and this clock is well worth a visit (cant miss it if you venture into the Old Town Square). It is the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one that is still working. Make sure you make it to the top of the tower (small fee involved...120 CK) and peer over the square to get a good look at the amazing city. Every hour, crowds will gather to see the "walk of the apostles" - definitely worth watching if you are near the hour but wouldn't make it a priority if you're not as the show is a bit anticlimactic.

overrated. The astronomical clock itself is a marvel. It was constructed 600 years ago and still works accurately showing all kinds of astronomical things like sun rise and down, moon phases or eclipses. The "spectacle" of the apostles however is not worth waiting in the crowd for seconds entertainment
Enjoy. Amazing Place to visit, sit have a drink, watch the world go by and enjoy your surroundings. Nice and clean, with no rubbish anywhere.

On the hour every hour. The clock is a very popular Prague landmark. Just before the hour, lots of tourists gather in front of it, cameras at the ready, to catch the twelve figurines depicting the Apostles mechanically flue past two little widows, to the sound of church bells. Blink and you miss it. :)

Great views, hefty queues! . Going to the top of the old town hall should definitely be on your to do list when visiting Prague! It provides some amazing views at a reasonable entry price. However we did have a queue of over an hour in very hot conditions. I would still recommend spending your time queueing for the views you get at the top however!

It is fancy - but just a clock. We stood looking at the Astronomical clock with a few hundred other tourists, waiting for something exciting to happen. On the hour above the face/s a little door opened and being quite tall, I could 'just' see some figures moving. If we are passing on the hour in the future - we would stop to look - but not go out of our way so to do !

Amazing mechanism still going strong. Apparently a lot of tourists feel the clock is over rated - they wait with bated breath for the hour to chime, and are rewarded with the figures of greed, vanity and an infidel shaking their heads while the skeletal death rings the bell. At the same time the 12 Apostles rotate through the windows, and the Golden Rooster at the top flaps his wings. Once you recall that the clock mechanism which runs all of this, and shows three types of time and the Zodiac on its beautiful dials, was crafted over 500 years ago and is still running accurately, you may appreciate the genius of Master Hanus. The Town Hall itself has good views from the top, and was the site of the first Defenestration of Prague

My highlight of Prague!. Seeing the astronomical clock itself was a amazing experience but going up there to see the panoramic views was mind-blowing! I highly recommend this as your no.1 thing to do when in Prague!

Amazing evening view of the city. We decided to go up the tower one warm summer evening, only bought the tickets about 45mins before closing, and it was an amazing experience. Not too crowded at that time, with an amazing view of the city as the sunset was approaching. The changing views as it was getting darker while walking around the tower was beautiful! Cheap and unforgettable!

The heart of Praha. Old town square is essentially the heart of this wonderful city. It is one of the quintessential European city square which encapsulates the essence of the entire city. The square is dominated by a wonderful gothic church and you get the city hall with the astronomical clock, the barque st. Nicholas church and a statue dedicated to Jan Hus. Its a tad bit crowded for obvious reasons but you it is the heart of Prague and you would keep going back there for more.
Climb the tower!. Yes, it's crazy crowded. Yes, it's worth the wait and the climb to the top of the tower. Views were amazing!
Be ready for the crowds. As the hour approaches the crowds swell and it can be squashy. Its a good idea to come at night when the crowds are much less.
Interesting!. Beautiful workmanship, which can be enjoyed byall. Just be in the square at the right time and you can see this clock at work.

Awesome views. Situated near a historical square, you'll get to see a lot of beautiful buildings on your way here. When I arrived, the Town Hall was already closed as it was evening, but we were able to go up the clock tower. Definitely do this -- you can see Prague lit up at night, and it's a very beautiful sight to behold.
Don't miss the crazy clock at top of the hour.. Something you should be sure to take in. Go early or late to avoid huge crowds. The symbolism of the characters on the clock is quite interesting.

Great Square. Loved this square and all the great buildings, especially the Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. Don't expect a major performance on the hour though. It was cool but very short, and considering how long you have to wait if you want a prime spot, not really worth the effort.

Interesting Attraction. Be prepared for a busy square to watch the Astronomical Clock do its hourly display. Mechanical figures move as the clock chimes on each hour. A local tour guide can give interesting background and history of the feature in the Old Town Square. The Prague airport transfers tour guide is recommended. Or enjoy a lunch or drink at one of the outdoor cafes facing the clock and watch in comfort. A little pricy but worth it.
Don't get too excited. It's a historical clock; and a beautiful one, however don't go to see it expecting too much animation - it is rather modest.

Fascinating & Historic. Our tour of the the town hall, the astronomical clock, and the square in which it all sits, were among the top highlights of our trip to Prague. Although the clock is nothing "spectacular" by today's standards (no loud bells and whistles), the mere fact that it's been around since 1410 makes this a fascinating piece of history and machinery. Once you've seen it from the square, you MUST go up in the clock tower itself to get an amazing bird's eye view of not only the square, but of the city as well.Also, our tour of the town hall, including the basement and prison were so interesting. Our tour guide was so knowledgeable and we really enjoyed learning about the history of the town hall throughout the centuries. Amazing stuff.I would totally recommend taking 2 or 3 hours to tour this historic and fascinating place.

Good history but a little dull. Don't get me wrong this clock is pretty amazing from a history point of view and has a really interesting back story but the actual clock chiming on the hour is a bit of a let down. This is no disrespect to the clock or the history but possibly due to too many people writing 5 star reviews you expect more to happen. You are left afterwards thinking is that it? Considering when it was made and the fact it still works are marvels of engineering. We stayed opposite the clock and saw it many times from our window. I was hoping it would do something different each time I watched it but it was the same. Some people even clapped and cheered after it chimed. Not sure why as it was pretty unspectacular. Yes see if it your around but it is very busy and people will literally stand on your feet to get a better view and it is difficult getting a good view through all the phones and cameras. People need to enjoy the moment in real life instead of recording it. People don't realise that by recording the event they actually miss the real event and go home with a memento recording of something they didn't actually see for real.

A little overrated. Old Town Square is beautiful. There are lots of restaurants and sites to see. We went back specifically to see the astronomical clock. On the hour everyone waits to take pictures/videos. Well, it was a little underwhelming.....only lasted about 30 seconds. We didn't go up to the top which would have been really something - but a big line of people. Previously we saw the clock changing in Rotenburg and Munich, Germany and they were much better.

Remarkable!!. Visited the Old Town Hall and saw the mounted Astronomical Clock as well. On the hour there is a mechanism that triggers revelation of apostles, skeletons, gnomes etc. It is well worth watching!The Town Hall itself has a very ancient, bricklike structure!Enjoy the markets afterwards.

Fascinating complex from the Middle Ages. Visit it on the hour to experience the little marionette display that is part of the astronomical clock, then proceed to take a tour of the Town Hall. This is a complex of five old houses, purchased over time as the needs of Prague's Town Hall grew. The tour unexpectedly includes a visit to some older houses, now beneath road level, which were built over when the old ground level, subject to flooding, was increased by eight meters

Nice, But Highly Over-rated. OK, it's old, still functions well and the "technology" was ahead of its time; however, the actual show that goes off on the hour between 8 am - 10 pm is somewhat ho-hum. Stop and see it yourself one time, but be warned. Watch your valuables because while you're watching the clock, pickpockets are busy scanning the crowd and watching you to see if there's an opportunity to help themselves to your stuff!

Nice view and side note . Most people enjoy the Clock especially as it rings on the hour. Just to the left in the pink building is a museum which has access to the under ground used by the locals during WW2 resistance. You need a tour guide to walk the under ground. The Town Hall is of course not the current facility.
