One of those things you've just gotta do!!. One of those 'cant miss' things to see in Prague...unfortunately, in July...10's of thousands of others 'can't miss' it either....pushing and shoving, and lots of screaming babies...be sure to arrive at 10 minutes before the hour, so you can watch the show unfold at the top of each hour!!

Travelling Back In Time. This place is one of a kind, magical and blows the breeze of Disneyland. Maybe it's just me, growing up in the metropolis of KL, it's not an everyday experience seeing buildings that's all castle like and look as if some knight in shining armor is gonna climb down a ladder from one of these historical buildings. It's "wow" just being there. Like you've travelled back in time and whoosh, you're right int he middle of a medieval town, everything medieval.

Cute & Fun. Very interesting experience, you stopped for a few minutes to admire something very different. Be careful with your purse and packages, it's a time that you are focus on something else and there is a lot of purse pocketers around there because they know the tourists are with their attention someone else.

Pretty to see. The clock is worth observing from a technology/historical viewpoint. Otherwise, very crowded with tours waiting for the show. To be fair, it may not seem like much to our age, but appreciate the clock for the wonder it is from it's age.
Nice piece of history. Didn't go up the tower but watched the clock, read about it before you watch it as you'll then have some idea about the mechanisms, nice to see if your in the old square.

Highly overrated clock show though. Do visit the old town hall and beautiful astronomical clock. However do not get your hopes up high for the show at the top of the hour, it is brief and not much to see. Watch youtube beforehand so that you know what to expect and what to see in person.

Tourists are theatre. A lot has been said and its as much the 'theatre' of the Astronomical clock and the tourists themselves which are of interest here . Its clearly still a centrepiece of Prague and a must see .

Highly Overrated & The Perfect Spot to be Pickpocketed. All of our tours mentioned the need to observe the clock on the hour so, like everyone else, that's what we did. Not all that impressive and overloaded with tourists. If you get the spiel about the clock on your walking tour, that's perfectly fine.

Don't Miss at his Piece of History . A great horological spectacle. Get there on the hour to watch the complex mechanism. My advice is go and buy the leaflet explaining this complex clock before. It brings it much more alive.

A must see in Prague. We visited the clock earlier today what a real eye catching clock in the centre of town, there were plenty off people around however still plenty of room to catch the perfect picture.
A must see on your visit, either in foot or by Segway.

Very interesting next time i think i would do the tour and not just a chevychase family vacation stop.. The place is mobbed with tourists, but it is very unique and interesting to watch, photograph and ponder how this still works! Very lovely area by the platz.

Unique Clock. First installed in 1410, its the oldest astronomical clock of the world that is still working. A true work of art, the clock has a zodiac calendar, a rotational moon and lots of beautiful details all around. You can also climb to the top of the clock tower (for a small fee) to have a privilege view of the square and the opposite Cathedral. A great attraction to see and enjoy....
Very cool - well worth it!. A trip to Prague isn't complete without viewing the Astronomical Clock. Just get there at the top of any hour and enjoy the short show. Really, really cool.

Astronomical Clock. One of those attractions you have to see - on the hour between 9am to 9pm the walk of the apostles and other moving sculptures occurs on the upper section - huge crowds gather to watch this happen.

Climbing up more steps!. This is definitely worth a visit. Fab photo opportunities, very informative and really cheap to get up there. The crowds outside waiting every hour draw you to it and, if you can cope walking up lots of steps, the excitement of being inside it when it rings is great.

Location, Location, Location. Great place to walk around and explore Prague. Restaurants/shops/high-end stores (rival to Rodeo Drive). I would highly recommend a visit to Old Town and to see the Astronomical Clock.

Amazing old clock. he Old Town Hall was established in 1338 as the seat of the Old Town administration. The oldest part of the complex consists of a beautiful Gothic tower with a bay chapel and a unique astronomical clock – known as the Orloj – where, every hour between 9 am and 11 pm, the twelve apostles appear. The Gothic Revival eastern wing of the Town Hall was destroyed during the Prague Uprising on May 8, 1945 and was never rebuilt. The guided tour includes the historical halls, the tower and the underground areas.
Astronomical clock. A must see site. The clock chimes by the hour and it feels like u are being transported to another era

Blink and you'll miss it. Frankly not much happens and given the crowd that gathers hourly it's hard to catch it in any case.
That said, it's a 'must see' and the setting phenomenally picturesque.

The oldest working clock. Pražský orloj was built in 14th century and is the oldest astronomical clock that still working. If we like astronomy we will enjoy the detail of the dial with medalions which represent position of the sun and the moon.

Marvel of human creativity and ingenuity ... lot's of interesting history. The Astronomical Clock is an amazing technological marvel once you understand it's history and the significance of each and every detail of the clock. Must get a guide to explain all this to you or read it up on the internet. The Clock itself is very beautiful to look at, if nothing else ... admire it's beauty and take a few pictures :-)The views from atop the tower are amazing. There is a bit of wait sometimes so plan your visit accordingly.

Stop! and take some time to visit/see. One of the many places that you need to stop in Prague, where you can opt to enter of just look at the clock 'show/dance/' every hour.Nice few moments where everyone stops in the middle of the hectic center.

Big Attraction. We stayed in an awesome location across the street from the clock. Quite impressive. No auto traffic in the square. Plan your visit in the early evening and enjoy the many performers---don't forget some tip money for them!!

The classic!. Be sure to set your camera so that you can see the 12 Apostles in the blue windows, and also the skeleton who rings the bell. For a small fee you can climb to the top of the tower; I say "climb" because there are elevators (lifts, for my Brit friends) which can take you to the top. The view from there is the BEST in the whole town. Trust me on this; it is the best.

The Cultural Hub of Prague. No visit to Prague would be complete without a trip into the Old Town Square and the astronomical clock. On the hour, crowds gather to see the animated figurines of the twelve apostles and a charming skeleton that rings the clock bell. Definitely consider paying the small fee (about £2 I think) to go to the top of the tower & take in the stunning views of Prague.

Really beautiful medieval clock, a must see in Prague :). Totally the tourist thing to do in Prague. The astronomical clock is in the main square, where there are also a lot of restaurants. (Note: Be VERY wary of the restaurants, they charge ridiculously expensive prices. Make sure you ask the waiter for all costs prior to ordering as they slug you with a bunch of unexpected costs at the end. They will keep leaving bread baskets or sauces on the table without being asked, make them take it away as it is not free.)The clock chimes every hour with characters around it moving. The tower is surrounded by tourists wanted to photograph or video it.It is really fun to watch.The tower and clock themselves are stunningly beautiful. If you like history, it is worth reading up on the legends relating to the clock before you see it as it adds another dimension to the experience. Just use google.Cost: Free
Endless mystery. Puppet mystery continues every hour is already seventh century. But look at it not once; changes not only to the audience and shadow on the wall, but also a place, that you enter.

Tower offers a great view. We wanted to avoid crowds, so we watched the clock turning 8 AM. The clock does not perform the famous disciple routine at this early hour, but you can take great photos with no destruction. We came back later and went up the tower on foot. We decided to go down via lift. The stairs are narrow and possibly considered steep, but the top of the tower offered a great view. We utilized our Prague Card to get in for free.

Beautiful at every time. The old town hall area has few historical buildings including astronomical clock with skeleton and disciples which make move during every hour. The area has many good restaurants to eat and can watch the great view in the night.
One of the must see items of Prague. An interesting spectacle to watch in central Prague. Interesting to see all the various section of the clock all in action when it chimes.

Enjoy Prague!. To write one review about Prague it is impossible and would sound fake. Everything in this city is interesting and kinnda mystic, I would say. I would definitely go back there if I had another chance.
Tempus fugit. The astronomical clock, with its animated figures of a skeleton, self-absorbed rich men, and the 12 disciples, is an amazing and amusing ancient reminder that time is fleeting.

Prague sightseeing. This area has some really great buildings, the actual clock area was really busy as it was almost time for the clock to show it's stuff. The best photo's can be taken after this as the crowds move away. There are plenty of places to eat and drink around this area, however I would recommend moving a couple of streets away if you want a less expensive option.

Beautiful place. The whole square including the clock is such a beautiful place to be. To watch the clock we sat in one of the restaurants and had a meal so we got a ringside seat . The area does get full just before the hour.

Get there early!. This is where the crowds gather, the 1st time I went, we didn't know where everyone was going, so we just followed through some narrow streets, before we came out in the main square where the most popular Prague tourist attraction is, the wonderful Astronomical clock. It's a wonderful clock that chimes every hour, my favourite is when the Skeleton does his funny little shake at the end of chiming. Everyone gathers from about 1/4 to the hour in the summer time, to about 5 to the hour in the colder winter days (I've been both Summer & Winter, and it does get cold in the winter). So if you are thinking of sitting at one of the restaurants around the clock tower, remember the prices for a coffee will be treble the prices of anywhere else, but why not as it is "Tourist Central" location, so perhaps just have a drink and treat yourself. It's well worth just people watching.
Worth seeing. The clock is well worth seeing and draws big crowds and you can enjoy a meal or a drink in the cafe opposite while you wait for it to do it thing on the hour

Must see - but not that impressive.. The clock is a 'must see' icon of Prague. However, you'll likely stand in a group of several hundred tourists for approx 15-20 minutes - all with their cameras pointed to the clock - to see a less than one minute "show" on the hour, every hour. Note: You will get some fairly nice views if you go up into the tower. I am glad we did that, and I would recommend it.

The show only after 9 AM. we were here at 8 AM it was tooo early. u can watch it from 9AM and i think it ends at 9PM. we watched it around 8 PM and it was very crowed and was lot of fun to watch the clock go.. the crowd clapped after the show and it was a lovely expirence to watch it with a lot of ppl.

a beautiful place to be, with wonderful place to go and see. on arrival in Prague the warmth of the Czech people was wonderful, we travelled to our hotel which was the Assencio hotel just 1 km from the old town,The hotel was beautiful and spotlessly clean, We had five days seeing the sights and a must the hop on hop off bus, the ideal way to get to see a lot of the city,Epecially Prauge castle which is stop nine on the hop on bus and a free tour of the castle was wonderful. The old town was a must see and the people and resturants bars are all great, We felt safe and had a wonderful time, id recommend anyone to go and also as part of the hop on bus , you also get a river cruise to see the Charles bridge included in the price it was a great hours cruise up the river .

How to Have an Astronomical Time in Prague. We were warned by multiple people to be very wary of pickpockets, who strike the preoccupied as the astronomical clock is striking. So here's my tip: go across the street to the u Prince, take the elevator up to the rooftop, order a cocktail and watch the astronomical clock do its thing from your perch above. In the process, you'll also be treated to an awesome aerial view of Old Town Prague. The drinks at the u Prince are expensive and second-rate but the view is fabulous.

shame it's such a tourist trap, but still worth a visit. Every hour, on the hour the astronomical clock has its performance. This area was overrun with tourists carrying cameras, iPhones and iPads in the air recording every second of it.The tourist trap factor sadly takes away from the multi-sensory experience, but considering that this was at one time a miraculous feat of human invention and innovation, I believe it's absolutely still worth a visit. The apostles and moving statues are truly a work of art that should be appreciated in person.

We loved the Astronomical Clock and Old Town Hall at Christmas time!. We visited Prague during the Christmas holidays (highly recommended) with our children -- and dragged them kicking and screaming out of our beautiful Airbnb to the Old Town Hall and Christmas Market. When they saw the Astronomical clock, any thoughts of vegging out in the apartment were abandoned. We were all charmed by the bizarre and beautiful clock. We never got around to taking the tour, but we visited the clock each evening for the duration of our 7 day stay -- and when we all looked back on what we loved about Prague, the Astronomical clock was one of our favorite sights.

A bit overrated. From what we had heard about the clock we were waiting for something mind blowing, but it was not as special. There are tons of people on the square waiting for the clock to strike so you can see all the saints and the rooster move and it is very challenging with all the people around you trying to take the same photo at the same exact moment. Also the restaurants and cafes around are very touristic and expensive.

The astronomical clock dates from 1410 and is an artistic and mechanical wonder.. This ancient clock draws a large crown of people every hour from 9am to 11 pm. On the hour the clock chimes and rotates Christ's Apostles around in a parade which you see through two opened windows. The clock tracks the sun, the seasons and other stats which the clockmakers have added over centuries of time. Watching the clock is like watching a brilliant sculpture come to life and dance before your eyes. It's mesmerizing, interesting and truly amazing, given its very old vintage. Bravo to the people of Prague for maintaining this masterpiece over the centures.
Staromestska Radnice. Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock are historical site. It's a Prague landmark for tourist for years. We enjoyed the sites, especially the Astronomical Clock.

Don't take a picture of this the first time!. I don't know if the "Excellent" rating is for this 600 year old marvel or if it was just so much fun waiting for it to go off. It's a miracle it survived the bombing in the area, and there are many legends about it, but beware: the whole "march of the Apostles" or whatever it's called takes about two seconds, so if you are messing around with your phone or your camera, you WILL miss it. However, you can watch it, so you get the hang of it, then wander around the wonderful Old Square, go to Our Lady Before Tyn, or have a refreshing beverage at one of the numerous cafes, then go back prepared to take the picture.Make sure you observe the really amazingly well-preserved little figurines around the clock - a little skeleton is the character that rings the bell, or at least wiggles a chain - always time for Death, eh? There are a couple of little Turks, and some wise-looking men. It really is a very cool thing to look at while waiting for the Apostles to come out, which, incidentally, they don't really do - they parade around inside the clock while you are hopefully looking at it right at that moment. But don't feel bad - if you go in high season, there will be a thousand other people looking confused along with you! But it's a must see, and you won't see another one like it any time soon.
WOW. This was a fantastic place to visit. I went this year with my wife on a short break. it is a must see on a visit to Prague.i guess it there version of Big Ben

Astronomical Clock Good for all ages. We went up the Tower in the afternoon after watching the clock from a restaurant opposite. My adult niece and I had three children with us we had to pick the four year old up to see the sights.The whole experience was worth it. Great views and awesome photos!
Lovely city. The old town is quaint with brilliant architecture, lovely to walk around and explore! The Astronomical Clock is a must see if you're visiting Prague!

Get there early or ....... Great old clock with an hourly crowd that watches the "show". Best way to see it - get a good seat at one of the restaurants which face the clock, and enjoy it with a refreshment!

Beautiful detail work on the clock. Waiting for the clock to strike so you can see all the saints and the rooster move is very challenging with all the crowds around and in front of you all trying to take that special quick photo. All and all cute.

Nice but surprised by the people. It is a nice place, good restaurants around, nice stores , but I was surprised how many people were waiting for a small show!!. I liked the view from the top of the building
Main attraction of Prague. Lively place. Be there at least 15 minutes before the hour to see astronomical clock in action properly. It gets very crowded during the hour. Quite tough with pram.

Very interesting. This clock was amazing, strikes on the hour and so worth a look. The disciples around the clock move. Gets very busy around the hour time. We also went up the clock tower and the views were spectacular, another must when visiting Prague. Restaurant opposite does good coffee whilst waiting for click to strike

Beautiful clock . This clock is so well maintained and what feels and looks like 100's of people congregate to see it chime the hour and for the apostles to move past the open windows... Same it's over so fast. But definitely a must see while in Prague

Part of Prague. It is beautiful with bright colours and amazing to think it has been working for centuries. It is an integral part of Prague's history and needs to be seen. If you miss the hourly display it is probably not a huge loss. I am thinking that the Marienplatz clock display in Germany is almost nicer? But that is just my opinion. Plus the crowds pack together every hour to see the display, and I have never been a fan of big crowds.

????. Came here thinking I was going to witness something spectacular but was dissapointed. 20 seconds later that's it. Bell chime on the hour 2 doors open then figures go round that's it. On a positive side this is 600 years old.
Lots of history. A great sight to see, very popular to see the hour strike! Lovely walk about to and plenty of restaurant and cafes to people watch!

What a clock?. The ol;d Town Hall might be something however the Clock is a waste of time, we stood with thousands of others to see this supposed gem of Prague. There is nothing at all to say this was worth seeing.
If you want to marvel at a clock and its workings then Munichs Glockenspiel would leave Pragues clock for dead

A place you must visit when in Prague. A great meeting place and a place to people watch. We travelled to Prague in March a pond it was a very busy place. The Old Town Square has bars and restaurants- obviously you'll pay a higher premium to dine or drink here! The Astrinomical Clock is very charming but to honest I think you would need a tour guide or have read up a great deal about its 'workings' before you see it. It isn't a working,chiming clock so don't expect anything more! My friend actually got down on one knee here at 8pm on the 31st of March 2014 and proposed to me so it holds a dear place in my heart! Do visit,it's enchanting.By the way - I said,YES to him and we married this April!!
Really nice, too tall to read the intricate dials and readings on the face. It was beautiful. Not sure how old it is, or that it still keeps proper time, but it looked really cool.

Clock with atmosphere . Look out for the bullet holes so sad to think what these people went through. History everywhere you look.The clock is great day or night we choose to sit and have a cool drink in one of the bars in front.

Seemed bigger in the pictures. The square is beautiful,we visited this place during christmas time where there are food stalls all over the square...the clock look nice,we were a little bit disappointed it looks bigger in the pictures.if you are in Prague a must see.

Great place! . You can get a cheap but very good guided trip around the city hall (and basement, both highly suggested) if you get a ticket on spot. There is also possibility to buy ticket to go up in the clock tower, where you can see figures from different kind of angle as well as get nice view on the city. From information point which is right next to it, there is possibility to get information about great, detailed guided trips around the town for just a tip (much cheaper than expensive guided tours, yet you have professional guide).

Inaquate ticketing . Asked for tickets for the tour and we got it tickets for the tower and then told us the climb the stairs for 3rd floor the we realized that they have the wrong ticket we asked for our money back but then told us to go outside the get our money back but then told us that they can't it back.

Picture book perfect. The whole area is so scenic and picturesque. Kept coming back to this area to sit and enjoy a coffee after a day of sight seeing. Do get the story of the clock it is an amazing story very interesting . Yes it is crowded but just be patient and relax.

Interesting Curiosity. A visit to see this clock was the culmination of our walking tour of Prague. When we arrived there was a wedding couple being photographed in front of it. The clock was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still working.

Interesting but too touristic. Astronomical clock which is in the Old Town Square of Prague is usually surrounded by tourists who are waiting for the clock to show the puppets at the top of every hour. Try to be there before the the top of the hour in order to enjoy this little show. It may not be an amazing experience but seems really interesting.

The work of a genius. This clock is at least 400 years old.The story I hear is that after the clock was done by this genius, the king made this maker blind so that he could not make any other clock like that for any one else. The maker of the clock manage to eventually climb up and removed some critical pieces so that it would not work anymore. It was only after a few decades that another clock maker managed to repair the clock and its been working ever since. When we were there on a sunday, the place was full of tourists. We could hardly move from one place to another

Excellent Views.. The highlight is the view from the top of the tower. I expected to have to climb many stairs. You can walk up if you want to but the tower is served by lifts that go right to the top. The final lift is a wonderful piece of engineering which has been installed without detracting from the architecture. Views of Prague are excellent. Well worth a visit.

Is the astronomical clock overrated, perhaps?. One evening there was a huge crowd outside the Town Hall. I asked what it was about and found out that the clock does a performance on the hour. Waited and yes, there were moving figures for a few minutes. OK, been there, done that.Later, I did some research and found out that this clock was first made in 1410, and is the oldest one in Europe that is still working. (It was most recently renovated in 2015.) I could not figure out how to fully interpret it but the next time I saw it, I had a greater appreciation for the technology. And it really is quite attractive and colorful.

Lovely preserved and elegant clock on well maintained building. The tower is perfectly preserved or restored and the clock is a delight, illustrated in beautiful colouring. The tower could do with the stonework being cleaned to match the spleandour below. A must see.
Amazing Views. The views a top the astronomical clock are definitely worth the entrance fee, these are the best views in Prague for me and I would recommend it to everyone

Magical Experience. Our guide managed to bring here right on the time. We were able to see the functioning of the clock which was really magical. It was fascinating as our guide told us that each time the clock strike something happens to someone. I really felt like i have been transported to ancient times and felt awesome. Its a must visit place.

Amazing clock . The most visited thing in Prague besides the st Charles bridge I think it's the astronomical clock. It makes a wonderful spectacle every hour. Such an amazing work for those ancient times and it remains working very good.
Historical clock. Very interesting to watch but massive crowds gather on the hour to watch the movement of the figures on the clock

A seriously ornate time piece. You can tell that the hour is upcoming because a crowd begins to gather. The front of the clock itself promises "fireworks" at noon but it doesn't really deliver. Well, I'm not a catholic so the marching of Saints across the tower doesn't really speak to me.But it's free, you WILL be in the Old Town Square, you have to see it once.
Beautiful. In the heart of Prague, this is the typical postcard of Prague. It deserves its fameThe clock is a beauty. Only be aware of pickpockets around !!

Amazing views!!. We visited the Town Hall and went up the tower at night with wonderful views of Prague. It wasn't too busy later at night. As part of a walking tour, we were taken into the underground part of the hall as well which was very informative - would thoroughly recommend visiting here!

See What It's All About. The square gets packed to watch the figures chime the hour, so be prepared. We also went up the tower as well, which gives you excellent views out over the city, well worth the trip up there.

SEEING IS BELIEVING. This clock is just phenomenal. The clock striking the hour with the walk of Apostles is a visual treat. Each time the fascination increases and one spend hours there. It is VOW !!

Must see. Everyone talks about this clock and it is worth seeing. A local guide described all the components of this clock from time of day, to the position of the moon to the Arabic time table, etc. Of course, the promenade of the apostles is just short and long enough to use the video on your camera or phone. You'll be glad you captured it in motion!

Clock. It is amazing that the clock still works. It is interesting to look at all the details. The clocks strikes on the hour, with figures going around. It's jam packed with tourists. If in Old Town it's worth a stop.

Old town clock. Access to inside the clock tower. Adjacent to square with German market stalls. Close to a Hard Rock Cafe. Plenty restaurants and cafes around the square. Very busy as tourist look at clock and favourite meeting place for everyone

A European Gem!. This is one of must see spots in all of Europe! The old city, cobblestone streets, THE AMAZING CLOCK, the square and the beautiful old Europe feel. This is one of my favorite spot is all of Europe! Go! The beer is great and the sights amazing. This is one great city. STAY IN THE OLD CITY AREA!! WE stayed once a few miles out and a few rail stops away which was nice but convenience and walkability is the key to Prague. You want to walk around to eat at the great bistros and shop in the nice shops.

Fantastic View - do it during the day and at night.. The view over Prague is wonderful from this vantage point and there are panels as you walk around describing the most important buildings. If you go just before the hour strikes, you can look down at the crowds looking up at the clock, which is a bit of fun.Unfortunately its not suitable for wheelchairs, as the viewing platform is narrow and the surrounding wall is high, despite there being a lift.

This amazing clock from the Middle Ages i. This clock brings art and science together in a majestic way that will mesmerize those who watch its performanc each hour. Bringing alive everything from earth' s rotation, the position of the moon, seasons, marching figures, and even tells time. The craftsmanship is astounding, and this is a must see for anyone visiting Prague.

Fun to Experience. I a fascinated by this clock...it is so pretty and OLD! Although the square is crowded, it is fun to watch the animation on the hour. Then take the elevator to the top for a fantastic view of the city.

Amazing to See.. for the most part. The Astronomical Clock in Old Town Square is absolutely beautiful and unique. To be honest, the clock in itself is worth visiting. However, I would not bother trying to crunch time in order to see it change at the strike of the hour. It is cool in a way that you can say you have been there and saw it change, but the presentation itself is not super exciting or amazing. Actually, you might not even notice it was changing at all if it weren't for the crowds gathering all around it to see it.
Underwhelming. Obviously the work behind this 100's of years ago is astounding but the mechanisation on the hour is not really a must see by any stretch.
Go go go. very interesting would recommend going but make sure you sit infront of it because the first time we saw it we missed most of it because we were in a cafe to the right of it!

An iconic part of Prague old town square. Whilst there will be hundreds of tourists to see the chiming of the clock and the figurines, perhpas pick a time early in the day or later after the day trippers have gone when there are less people in the square. We stayed in a hotel only steps away so could go for walks nice and early before breakfast when the square is totallyl empty. It is a wonderful historic sight and if you are going to Prague you are not likely to miss it.

Fantastic view of Prague!!!. We were lost in the midst of Prague's circuitous streets and alleys overflowing with shops and restos when we came upon a square and lo and behold, a huge clock on top of this building. Since I'm a sucker for clocks having appreciated the machine over time, we decided to go up the building after paying an entrance fee. It was worth it!!! Since the stairways and elevator were small, we inched our way to the top. What was waiting for us was a most spectacular view of Prague!!! Below you'd find the red roofs of all houses and buildings in Prague and the mountains nearby. We were lucky we were among the first visitors, otherwise, it would have been very uncomfortable going around the small balcony to take shots of the 360 degree view. You have to move fast with your camera or other gadgets. But the experience was very worth it!

How the ****?. I have absolutely no idea how they pulled a clock like this off 500 years (+/-) ago.. Absolutely incredible. Got the whole story behind it as a part of a free walking tour - very recommendable.

Tourist Trap with Predictable Crowds. Not so great. If you like crowds and a 1-minute clock display, be my guest. Otherwise, enjoy the square, but don't go out of your way to think this is a "must see."
Amazing view from above!. Very crowded but doable, don't forget to get some ham roast from around the corner of the clock tower!

Dont Get Stuck Here on the Hour. Gorgeous and breathtaking at sunrise (when we arrived by train) but gets very crowded very quickly. Prague is my favorite city so far in Europe, so I could sit in this square for hours, but don't bother standing around to watch the clock tower chime each hour (its an old school cuckoo-clock with saint statues peeking through the windows up high) but do make sure to grab a photo (there is not a bad angle of this clock!).

Fantastic views.. The Astronomical clock itself is a unique sight .The views from the tower are magnificent.The square where it is located is the main square in the old town.The place has a good buzz.

Time Gentlemen Please. We joined a large crowd gazing at the Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. The surrounding area is full of interest but the Astronomical Clock which burst into life on the hour is fascinating. I will not describe the action as this would spoil the event but, suffice it to say, there is not another like it and well worth the visit.

Great views, but you work for them. Great views of the square and across Prague, but a bit of a walk to get there. Gets very busy and whilst you can get a lift, it is small - so probably worth the walk to justify the drinks and lunch later!A great way to orientate yourself and take pictures of the main landmarks for a few crowns

Join the throng. Came across a huge crowd in the old town square. They were all looking at the astronomical clock and waiting for the chime. It came and went quickly. At night the square is beautifully lit and it is truly wonderful. Don't miss the square at night

Great for a spot of lunch. I always seem to find myself wondering in to the Old Town Square for either a late breakfast or lunch, but I've never seen the great fascination with the Astronomical Clock. I appreciate its significance but i do think it is odd that crowds of people crowd around to hear it chime when I think it's a bit of an anti-climax.But this in itself is a great thing to observe, as I am a big fan of "people watching" I can sit in the square at one of the various bars/restaurants with something to eat and (usually) a beer and watch people come and go as well as enjoy some of the street performers.If anything else, it's a great place to be to pass the time before a flight home if you don't want to get in to a big activity.

Worth a visit. The astronomical clock is situated in Wenceles Square which is worth a visit and gets alot of visitors .You can also go to the top of the clock tower and the view of prague is beautiful day or night

Really, we waited for that?. After hearing all about the amazing clock, we waited with the crowd for 20 min for it. After wards, we were all confused as we've all seen much better clocks all around Europe. Yes, it is very old and unique. But as much as it was talked up, we were all very disappointed. Also, watch for pick pockets as several around us were picked while focused on the clock.
Worth getting lost. Great wandering about the Cobbled Streets getting lost. Try and go off the tourist trail and visit the pub Golden tiger for some proper Czech hospitality.

Lovely view from top. For view lovers its a place to be...They charge 250czk per person to go up though it is only a 15 to 20mins thing but you can see the whole city from there try going in the day time or a lil late when all the lights are lit up.Closing time : 9:30 pm

A 10 min must see, go in the morning to avoid crowds. As most others on TA have said, this is just one of those things you need/must do in Prague while there..and only takes 10mins. Best bet is to go in the morning, the crowds are considerably smaller at that time. If you have kids, make sure they're looking at the skeleton figure to the right of the clock.

Take the time to see the Astronomical clock chime!. Although the square is very crowded some of the appeal is the hustle and bustle amongst the historic buildings in the city's Old Town Square. Make sure you get a good spot early to see the Astronomical clock chime which is one of the city's greatest treasures as it is a crown puller and a must see.
Old Town Hall. I kept going back to look at the clock as it strikes the hour, fascinating. Prague is gorgeous, the beer is great and the girls are pretty!

medieval mechanical wonder. on the hour tourists gather outside to see a medieval mechanical wonder well it would be in the medieval times you must go to to see it just once if you visit prague avoid the pricey bars nearby though or you will leave a lot poorer

Go up the tower. Get to the top of the Town Hall for a great view of the city, especially the view of the Old Town from the top. Simply great. This is the only tower that I have been in Europe where you don't need to climb up to the top if you don't as they have an elevator to bring you to the top. Anyone can share where else is there an elevator?
fairy tale place. out of this world is just here, in the Staromestske Namesti, the Astronomical Clock is one of the best seen

Amazing... very crowded. This whole square is magnificent. It's like re-living the past... my inner child was expecting to find King Arthur and Merlin anytime. Is different from most of the big cities in Europe, and captivating. The only thing that wasn't great was how crowded it was all the time. Almost impossible to take a picture without one hundred tourists in it. But worth it.

Just one of those thing you need to see on your first time. Tucked in a corner of the old town square is the clock which you'll need to visit on your first time for Prague.It's just one of those touristy things like the Eiffel or the London Bridge. Spend a few minutes and move on.Protip: don't buy alcohol in this area. You'll pay just a fraction if you buy it in a grocery store anywhere else.

Carpe diem meaning use and enjoy your (day) time. Every time being in Prague I am ready to stop trying to catch the time observing the old astronomical clock. This artefact teaches people to value time, knowledge and craft. There is a chance to join the guided tour to get close to the inner mechanizm inside the tower.

Got to see...!!!!. The clock is amazing, you must not leave Prague until you see the clock, it will be busy, no matter what time you go on the hour, loads of people waiting to get a look. You can also go up to the tower at a small price, stairs all lifts available and public toilets to use, but you have to pay.At the top the views are amazing and well worth the wait.

In the old town square. You will want to visit the old town square and the astronomical clock is right there anyway. The face is interesting, however the show it puts on, on the hour, is not that interesting. If you decide to watch it, stand right under the clock, not to one of the sides. The "March of the Apostles" takes place behind two small openings, and from the side you really have no view of it.

Full on the Hour. In front of the town hall, opposite the clock on the hour and every hour is full to busting with every man and his dog watching the clock strike the hour. Not to be missed, best viewed in the early morning for the best effects. Less crowded just?

Trip wut daughter. . We enjoyed the Old Town clock Tower. It's a very old but neat clock that still works. On the hour it's almost like a cuckoo clock. The bells ring and it displays a changing of the priests in little windows that open. The top 4 statues beside the clock represent death, greed, vanity, thievery. The skeleton rings a bell. You can look over the top of Prague from that tower. Such an amazingly beautiful sight. You can also tour it's halls. They have an underground tour available Also.

Lovely old clock. Make sure you get there early as there are thousands arrive to see this attraction. Also be careful, pickpockets are around and it's so crowded you don't see them . But a great attraction . And it all happens very quickly you could easily miss it.

Our fav.place in Prague.. This is place were there is always something going on not just a astronomical clock.There street performers of all kinds here the square is always bustling with people ,lots of great buildings to photograph including a fantastic looking church, St Nicholas'.Yes there are a lot of tourists but its them that makes the place buzz everyone in the holiday mood .Its just one of those places everyone ends up at.We were there most evenings taking photos till about eleven. You can just sit around watching the performers or just people watching.

Amazing town hall and clock. The astronomical clock really is an amazing sight to see, as well as the show that is only twice a day, make sure to look up the history of the origin of the clock, which is wonderful. There are lots of crowds, but of course its for a reason, and it really is a sight to see!
Very busy. The Astronomical Clock is interesting but difficult to see properly as so many tours/people flocking around it. Probably best to view in the later part of the day.

Impressive old clock.. blink and you miss the show. The clock is over 600 years old, looks quite spectacular and if you are in Prague going to see it is one of the things expected to do, but if you miss it don't lose sleep over it.The area around the clock is extremely busy for at least 30 minutes before the top of the hour show. Best to grab an expensive beer near the clock and watch from there.Now I was not expecting a Cirque du Soleil performance, but it's a bit underwhelming and over rated.In saying that, go and see it and make up your own mind and watch out for the pickpockets.

Really nice view. The view was charming from the top of the tower and though there are crowds we didnt let it rush us. Just tuck yourself around thw boulders and gaze out to the charming square. We spotted from up here the restaurant that we wished to dine at(cannot remember the name but its on a rooftop with outdoor cozy heating as yes it was chilly!). From here you could also hear the musicians that are in the square daily.

Lovely square. We visited here on a Friday early afternoon. Beautiful buildings, lovely atmosphere, loads of eating places, very busy! Clock is interesting but wouldn't bother waiting around for it to chime on the hour, lot of fuss about nothing really! Just the doors above the clock open and figures pass by inside

An excellent piece of art - definitely the top attraction of prague. Its simply amazing. It astonishes one by simply looking at the sequence of events that takes place at each hour. Its unbelievable that such a technical piece of clockwork was invented more than 600 years ago.Be in front of the clock tower atleast 5 mins before strike of an hour to find a good place to see the action taking place. The clock is set in motion at strike of each hour. The skeleton rings the bell, all other figures shake their heads, side to side,followed by presentation of statues of 12 Apostles at the two doorways above the clock and finally crowing by the rooster... Its too good...

Going up the tower. I went up the tower of the clock. They charge the whole ticket although part of it is closed and you can't go into this place. At the moment of charging, they don't tell you anything.The view from above is good but the visit incomplete. 8 euros for 5 minutes is too much.

Touristy & historical. A bit to many people for me at the time I was there. I'm just not into crowds; that being said I'm glad I was able to see and witness all the history the clock tower and surrounding square offer. I do not suggest eating in this area. Walk outside of the tourist areas and grab a MUCH better quality and value of food.

Have your camera/phone ready. All tourists are obligated to view the medieval show at the top of the hour. The figures shake their heads, the skeleton dances, the apostles tour by, and finally the cock crows. Have your video ready, since the entire thing takes less than a minute.
Main attraction in Prague. This is an amazing attraction in old Prague. No matter how long you watch it, it is still amazing and how to understand the magnificent clock!
Worth watching. Watched the clock perform amidst a big crowd also enjoying the spectacle was worth the wait lots going on in this area

Really cool history. We saw this clock while on a walking tour of Prague and our tour guide described this clock as the second biggest tourist let down in the world. Although the puppet show that the clock does was nothing crazy, it was still very cool, and the history behind it made it even more interesting. If you enjoy learning about cultural history, definitely worth a visit on the hour.
Unbelieveable. The clock is a very popular attraction. We found it very difficult to get close to it as it is surrounded by tour leaders and their groups

Brief but stunning. On the hour, the astronomical clock gives one a view of the mechanical figures contained inside, but it is only a very brief glimpse. Crowds gather for the show on the hour, every hour, so make sure you get a spot in front in time

Keep your expectations low. Well, to be honest, i have expected something very special about this clock after reading and hearing all the stuff. As the beginning of the new hour approached and tens of people gathered in front of the clock staring toward it without blinking an eye, I was definitely sure that I would witness a remarkable show. Anyway the show is so short and it isn't so spectacular, but considering that the clock was built 600 years ago and working since then, it is definitely a must see in Prague.

Cool clock. The Astronomical Clock is worth a study. It's many details are magnificent. Every hour the bell rings and a mechanical show starts with small sculptures parading over the clock. Legend says that the constructor of the clock was blinded after he finished the job, to prevent him to make such an amazing construction anywhere else.

It's Not The Clock, It's the people. It's amazing that everyone gathers around this tower at the top of every hour to view the " show ". Believe me , the show isn't that great , but the reaction of the people gathered around the clock is worth the trip. Don't look away or you'll miss it.

Do not get the appeal?. I really don't understand why this is rated so high? The clock itself is very beautiful but that is about it. Every hour you will have a display where the clock will move at various parts. Chances are you will walk by this at least a few times if you're walking around Prague. If you want to see the mechanics make sure you make it there well before the hour as the crowds are huge. This will take a max of 5 minutes of your entire trip. Average.
Right on Time. It's amazing how they made that clock hundreds of years ago, and that it still works...definitely a must-see while in Prague.
Goregous but crowded. A beautiful clock, worth a visit, but crowds are a bit much so get out early if you want to see this in some solitude.

Gorgeous details. I just love this area of Prague and seeing the Astronomical Clock is really neat. You will likely walk right by it on your way into the square, so it's worth your time to stop and admire the intricate details.

Great place to experience Prague.. Beautiful square. Clock is very nice but really just an excuse to be there. The atmosphere around the square is very lively and carnival-like but not cheesy. Prague is magical!
Most beautiful view!. Most beautiful view of Prague, the walk to the top and back down was much quicker than the line to go up in the elevator. It gets pretty crowded up there.

Visit here first!. After conking out the night we arrived, we woke up early and wandered into Old Town early. There was no one around! Perfect opportunity to take pictures and go to the top of the Astronomical Clock when it first opens. We came out of the tower to the quintessential view of the rooftops of Prague. It was stunning! This is also a fantastic way to orient yourself to the city. As you walk around the tower, there are plaques with sights listed and a picture so that you can find it in the distance. That way you'll know which direction from Old Town the Castle Quarter is, New Town etc... The ringing of the bells show at the top of each hour is quick and is much more crowded the later in the day it gets. That is free and is seen from outside - there is a small cost to go up the tower but I think it's well worth it.

not so overrated .... Some might call the clock overrated but when it was built, it was considered quite cutting edge. Totally worth the large crowd that gathers to see the "show". And it's basically impossible to take a bad picture of it. If you get the chance, definitely go to the top of Old Town Hall. There is an elevator if walking up some stairs and a ramp isn't for you. The view is worth it. You get an amazing 360 degree view of the city.

Half a minute of excitement and expectation. Amazing attraction symbol of centuries old scientific craftmanship and ingenuity. Many espectators and keep your eyes on the clock at nono to see the show. if you look elsewhere you lose the attraction.

#3 to visit in Prague. After the Prague Castle and the Charles Bridge, this definitely lies amongst the top attractions in Prague. Pretty crowded area though. But definitely worth it for sightseeing and clicking some pictures of course!

Interesting find. The astronomical clock is really interesting. Go before the hour for a spectacle! But be careful, there are many touts in the area and it gets really crowded.
If you climb up, there are great views of old town!

Very romantic sqaure. It is like a fary tale.... The old town of Prague is unique. But be careful is full of people waiting to see the astronimical clock that gives a performance every hour. Of course you can see it drinking coffee at one of the traditional cafes around the square. Also, if you go during the winter Prague is really cold!!!

One of life's must-sees!. We saw it by day but our late night stop was the best. While the crowd that gathered late that night was large, it was "festive"! The clock is an amazing piece of art in motion in an even more breathtaking part of the town/world !

A captivating moment. I joined the large crowds gathered in front of the old town hall to see the clock strike the quarter hour and watch the characters move in concert to the music from the clock. Be prepared to arrive at least 15 minutes before each presentation and expect to be jammed in with hundreds of your fellow tourists. Less spectacular than the Munich clock tower, but this one has been putting on a show for hundreds of years and is the real deal.;

The clock is awesome and the beer is better. Prague is a fun place to wander and explore. One find was the square that surrounds the Astronomical Clock. The clock still functions and is the centerpiece of a square lined with cafes and restaurants. Many visitors enjoy the Czech beer, which is very good, while watching the clock.

What's all the fuss about. this is a beautiful tourist spot and really interesting. At each hour, there is some activity obviously and so many people looking. The trouble is, it's a bit of a let down as there is not much to see and it is over in a minute.

One of the must-sees. Quite the crowd milling about outside every hour during the day, at least, but since the attraction is high up in the tower, it's easy to get a picture of the goings-on. You can also go inside the tower for a tour and it's OK if you have the time. :-) Plenty of other things to see on the square, too, so plan to spend an much of an hour there, which you would if you just missed the last performance, anyway. Nice little pizza joint next door, too.

Take Time to See the Clock in Action. Every hour on the hour there is a crowd gathered to view the action - nothing exceptional but worth the wee wait or wander around the buildings and visit the square - where there is usually some form of entertainment - then come watch the clock. Try to get close and in front is best to view the detail. Meanwhile, the surrounding area is of great picturesque and historical interest.

wait to see the astronomical clock. The astronomical does not only indicates time, but also days, position of the sun,phase of moon and stars. Every hour many different statues of saints appear; wait to see it!!
History. This is one of the attractions in Prague located in the center.A little bit crowded but its a great experience to visit this.Easy to access by foot
Cool clock. Actually visited in the summer of 2006, when I studied abroad, and highly recommend visiting. Tough to miss when you're in Prague, as it's not a huge city, but make sure you check it out!

You need the history..... The famous clock is beautiful, but unless you know the history behind it it will seem like a very hyped up, over exaggerated attraction. While I recommend a walking tour to get the tour guide to explain it to you, basically it is an incredible achievement from the 1400's that is a real testament to the ingenuity and craftsmanship that people are capable of.Old town hall is a beautiful representation of old and new, history, architecture, and shows a story that, again, is best if you know why it looks the way that it does. The building appears split in two where the original meets the reconstructed back end that had to be redone because of war damage.

Now you have seen it !. Rather like the Mona Lisa you join a large crowd and gaze for a few minutes at a great work of art. The action is limited and quaint by today's animatronic standards but remember what people must have thought when first seeing it all those centuries ago.

Full of HIstory. It is a medieval astronomical clock located in Prague, the capital of the Czech Republic. The clock was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still working. A definite must see in Prague and experience the moving little statutes when the clock hits the hour.

Amazing view and experience. We stumbled across this clock our first evening in Prague, whilst walking in the old town square. Every hour the clock does its thing..... Bells ringing, skeletons shaking their bells and figures looking out of the little holes. If you can get there 10 mins before the hour, this gives you a better view as it does get really busy.

Astronomical clock. The clock is definitely worth seeing. Make sure you are there a few minutes before the hour to see what happens!You can also go up the clock tower and see amazing views of Prague. This is well worth a visit. You can buy tickets inside the clock tower and they cost 3/4 Czech Korunas. There is a lift that takes you up to the top of the tower. From here you can walk around the top and take some fabulous pics. It it a tight space and could maybe do with a staggered visiting time for a few people at a time. We did this the day we arrived and loved it. It made a great start to our trip!
Cool views. Almost didn't go but very glad we did. Cool climb to the top and amazing city views. Worth the small price of admission.

Amazing clock. This is the main sight in Old Town Square. The crowds gather each hour to watch its unique astronomical clock toll the hour, warning us everyone that they are an hour closer to death. Then they applaud. I loved it and never missed it myself when I was nearby.
Beautiful. Specially when you know the story behind the dance of the hours with Death starti g the sacred march and all other Vice of the times following after her and the Apostoles dancing too!

Fantastic view. This is a magnificent building on the edge of the Old Town Square and the Clock and all its movements is a must to see. Below the tower do not miss the well worn brass tablet memorial Dukla. www.dukla1944.com It is really well worth to climb the Bell Tower from where you can enjoy a fabulous 360 degrees view over Prague.

Interesting.... ...its very interesting to watch the Clock. One must make sure to get there well before the full hour, as the area around (large place) fills up. But make sure as everywhere in Prague's large crowds to watch your pockets. Also do not accept anyone proposal to get you a better exchange rate for your money, you will end up with worthless paper.

The Centre and the Bridge. Was just a short visit for 4 days from Germany, beautiful City but liked Konlavie Vardy better, about an hour away Sight seeing was great, but beware of pick pockets I had my purse stolen while shopping, so have no wish to go back, such a shame,
Amazing. For me is the most beautiful view in the whole world. The clock is magical and makes you want to look into him over and over again
a unique experience. every hour on the hour people gather to see the big clock ring in the time. Located in the center of everything. Many outdoor musicians, shops, and people watching.

Major attraction. Situated in old town amidst cafes you cannot miss it .On the top of every hour through the clock window a tiny show takes place & to watch it tonnes of tourist gather around . Try to be there 5 to 10 min before the hour , you can climb up to the top with a ticket ,but we chose to see it from below sitting in a cafe right in front .

Tower views are incredible!. The Astronomical Clock is fascinating to look at, but don't get too excited about the "performance." It was kind of humorous to see everyone waiting with their phones ready to record on the hour, and when it was over, a kid nearby piped up, "That's it?!" which is probably what all of us were thinking! However, if you're there, seeing the clock should be part of the experience. It is definitely worth the few dollars to buy a ticket to the top of the tower. You can climb the steps and ramps or take the lift, but the views of the square and the rest of the city from the top are incredible!

Incredible view. You can't miss this attraction as it is in the middle of the city and there are generally crowds of people in front of the clock and in the square. It is definitely worth a trip up to the top of the tower to see the magnificent views of the city. The tour through the old buildings was interesting and the tour guide was sweet but her English was very broken and it was very hard to understand. If your time is limited then just visit the top of the clock tower. A definite must during your Prague visit.

You got to be Quick. A Beautiful Building on the edge of the Old Town Square. The Clock and all it's adornments and its movement are truly beautiful. Try to be there for the striking of the hour as this is when the top doors open to reveal the figures inside but you had better be quick because they don't hang about and they only come out once an hour no matter what time is struck. You can also go to the top of the tower where you will get great views of the city. But it is free to watch and why not sit in one of the eateries opposite relax with a coffee and experience the atmosphere of the Old Town Square and watch a spectacular Time Piece marking Time.

Great view from the top of the bell tower. The clock is a real mechanical gem but you may only to see it chime once. Actually, too huge crowd with the noses upwards stand below there waiting for the hourly chiming.Really well worth is to climb the bell tower from where you can enjoy a beautiful 360 degrees view over Prague.You should expect to stand in line for awhile before accessing the top but the fantastic view from there really rewards your patience....!!

Cool to see once, but Underwhelming. From the crowds gathered around the clock as it approached the top of the hour, I expended some big "clock performance" but it was more of a glorified coo coo clock.

Amazing clock but not because of show. This clock is really awesome - but not because of the hourly "show" hundreds of tourists expect to see when the clock strikes the hour. In fact, it's most disappointing. But this clock is amazing because of how well it works after more than 600 years.... and the make of it during that time. It's definitely a clock ahead of it;s time

I mean, I'm rating history here..... You can't miss this. Mostly because it's in the middle of town and you'll probably walk by it even if you don't care to see it. But who wouldn't want to see this? Now please notice that though this is a tourist attraction, you really reallllly must read up on it before you just take a few quick pictures in front of it. The history and story of it is amazing. Take a closer look at the clock and notice all of the names?! Read the history. It's a fascinating clock that I take time to see each time I've been to Prague. It really never gets old. The colors a simply stunning as well. Do yourself a favor and get a guide while you are in this city, because there is SO much to take in and learn, it's always easy to go back home and read about something, but having a guide point things out while you're there in person is really truly wonderful. I've yet to go to the top of the tower (I have another place in the city that I really love), but I imagine that it's well worth the money spent to get up there and to see the behind the scenes. It's on my to do list for next time I pass through. It's a busy little corner, especially to watch the little "show" that happens every hour. The clock comes alive with characters coming out of the clocks. Nothing crazy, but cute to see. I once heard someone I was standing by say, "That's it?" When it finished. Yes, because it was created hundreds of years ago, now appreciate what the creator made with what he had back then. I think it's beautiful to see at night, but of course, get there in the early morning while everyone's still asleep. Grab a coffee and just hang out in front it for a bit, before heading off to the St. Charles Bridge.

Beautiful view. One of the best places to have a panoramic view of Prague and it is beautiful.the clock is one of the most popular attractions of Prague but not everyone goes up to have a look...Go up by the sunset, do not miss the opportunity to see sun goes down on Prague...

Delightfully Busy :). While the clock itself is very beautiful and delight to watch the area or old square where its located is more fascinating, tons of eateries and feel good things happening around you to keep you pleasantly busy, Place is bustling with activity, also don't miss the Prague delicacy Tredlo, hot and soft freshest bread from the oven sold everywhere practically, its a good snack on the go!

Fascinating and busy. The clock performs every hour with a cuckoo show that last about 10 seconds. If you want to catch that make sure you are on time. Crowds gather for some time before but it's really not necessary as the clock is huge and can be seen from fairly far away. We loved the view at night time when the lights were on, feels a bit magical, almost like you are on some movie set.

Reputedly,the most photographed clock in the world and it is not hard to understand why... You cannot miss this clock; just look for myriads of people gawking and clicking their digitals. A lot of people say that they are dissappointed with this site, but we think of it ,as being something special , and are so pleased that it is still here for us to admire. Thank you Czech Republic, for caring for this monument and please look after it for future generations.
Great view from the top. The view from the top of the Astronomical Clock was wonderful, especially the view of the Castle at night. It seemed like a fairy tale.
Fascinating clock. A crowd puller, the clock "performs" every hour to huge crowds. Lots to watch, the clock is beautiful and fascinating. Worth watching more than once to see it all.

Interesting and Buzy. The tower is actually a big cuckoo clock. Every hour you can see creative things from the clock. The astronomical clock is interesting. The place is cheap for having food as well and is quite busy both day and night.
You need to see before live from Pragha. The history of this clock. The movement of figures, and the death with their cascabell informing all of them that the times its end.

Ummm.... So, I had heard it was interesting but it was kinda of let down. HOWEVER, I would recommend learning about the astronomical clock before you see it. One of the walking tours did a great job informing my group about the history behind the clock tower.Once you learn about what the figures represent and how the people of Prague interpreted it ~250+ years ago, you will have greater appreciation. It is pretty fantastic when you consider that this was designed hundreds of years ago and is fairly accurate and still functional.

Awesome view of the city of Prague from the center of old town. For about $5 you can go to the top of one of the most famous landmarks in Prague and enjoy a beautiful view of the city! You can see EVERYTHING from the top. Even the crowds gathering for the "TOP OF THE HOUR SHOW" of the apostles statues showing through the tiny windows of the Astronomical Clock Tower. I stayed for over an hour. You can also attend a tour for about $2 more (every 30 minutes in different languagez, Czech, French, German, Spanish, English) of the historical halls and get a view of the figures of the apostles. This one I will do in my next visit to get the full experience. The top of the tower offers uninterrupted view since there is a balcony with many open windows (no glass) and you can enjoy the view and take pictures to your heart's content. If you can only go up one tower because of limited time in Prague, this must be it. And you can tell your friends, "I was up there!".

Prague - Beautiful City. Beautiful city, lots to see and do and all reasonably priced. Saw this clock and architecture whilst on a walking tour of Prague. Would highly recommend visiting the city & immersing yourself in it's culture.

Touristy & attractive. Morning, noon, afternoon, evening, whenever you pass near the astronomical clock you will see a lot of tourists watching & shooting the clock tower of Prague.. Try to be at an hour sharp.. The skeleton rings the bell and immediately all other figures shake their heads, side to side. So lovely experience
Very Entertaining on the Hour. Missed one opportunity to witness the hourly display but caught it later. Wonderful event and worth a visit to see. Lots of little things going on on the clock.

Old Town Hall Astronomical Clock. The Astronomical clock at Old Town Hall in Prague is a site to see. It is intricately beautiful and people gather to hear it chime on the hour. It is located on the side of the Town Hall on the Old Town Square. Stop by to see this clock as it moves and chimes.

Must see. The astronomical clock is a must see it is tucked away just off the old square, but at 10 to the hour you can't miss it as the crowds gather, it does not matter what time you get before it strikes somebody will stand in front of you but it is well worth it

Atomicad Clock? Atomic SNOOZER!. We'd read/heard the Atomic Clock was a marvel and the thing to see and a "must visit" part of a trip to Prague. It was OK. And that's being generous. There was a HUGE crowd filling the square, packed in tight on a warm enough day. We (wife, 2 kids and I) arrived ~10 minutes before the hour and waited. People jostled, pushed my wife and kids. Still we waited for the big moment...the top of the hour...here it comes!What an absolute snooze-fest! A couple doors open (above the clock), some figures/busts rotate through it, and then the doors closed. Lather, rinse, repeate 60 minutes later. I wanted the last 10 minutes of my life back when it was over. Take a picture of the clock any time after the top of the hour and skip "the big show."

Take the tour!. In addition to having a 360 degree view from the top(elevator), there is a tour that allows you to see the 12 apostles (that come out of the clock every hour) from the inside. The guides give a great Prague history lesson and you get to see the dungeon where prisoners were kept at one time. Very interesting building. Families will enjoy this.
Impressive engineering!. It is beautiful, but was both at night and day very crowded. Ensure that you are there on the hour, otherwise wasting time standing around waiting.
Charming old town. The astronomical clock is amazing, the old town is so charming, like you're in a fairytale. The city has an inimiatable vibe.

must be visited!. One of the most beautiful and famous sights in Prague. It had a tower with great view of the city. They have a special price for european students if you show your student identity card. The tower also have two salemen/saleswomen who sale some fantastic souvenirs! The astronomic clock is sourrounded by tourists who wait to admire its special strike. The only disadvantage of the sight is that it is very crowded.

Crowded. Recommend viewing the clock before the hour, then getting in the crowd for the hour chimes and viewing. If you can go early in the morning or late in the evening you will get better pictures without everyone being there. Tip: Before closing go up in the tower and take night pictures of the city. A few stairs but worth it.

Interesting. The astronomical clock is beautiful. The story says that it has moving parts, i.e. two dolls who should exit the small door when the clock strikes on the hour. However, either the clock was broken during our three-day visit or we were jut not lucky enough to see that any time on the hour we were passing by. However, the crowd in front of the clock waiting for the dolls to show up was very impressive :)
Popular attraction. A popular tourist attraction so if you want to see it you will have to get there early before the hour. There really isn't that much to see. It does look nice though.
Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock, Prague. Very impressive early engineering. Worth seeing, but very crowded. Personally, I prefer the clock in Rothenburg, Garmany.

How not to be underwhelmed..... I heard so many things about the Astronomical clock... and don't get me wrong, it's cool and if you're in old square it would be a shame to miss it... the story is interesting... the crowds to watch it are unbelievable which only adds to the hype about the mysterious clock.. so, lower your expectations.. it's an old clock with moving parts that has a cool story and you'll like your experience at the Astronomical Clock.. I actually had more fun watching the crowd watching the clock than I did watching the clock..

Beautiful clock. I really don't know what the fuss is about this clock. Yes it's beautiful, but to stand around waiting for something spectacular to happen, when it strikes on the hour, well don't waste your time - you can't really see anything - anticlimax!

Liked the story behind it, nothing extraordinary otherwise. This show how intelligent the people were in those times. the clock does a lot of things which I didnt understand.There is nothing special about this place otherwise. they say that every hour some things move there, we saw nothing. thought it's on the old town square so it's hard to miss it..

What's the buzz. The clock is located just to the side of the square. While it is interesting to see it isn't all that impressive. A skeleton comes to life for a few seconds. The clock in Munich is far more interesting.

Unusual clock. Walking through the Old Town, you won't miss this very unusual clock. Worth having a look as it is the oldest astronomical working clock! There are also souvenirs you can buy to remember your time here. And don't forget your camera!

amazing sight. The tower is in the center of old town, right next to the main square. It would have been just another pleasant sight but our tour guide (from the free Prague tours) explained to us how each of the hands and parts and different numerals worked, and how it was made and then repaired etc etc so it became quite an interesting memory to keep

Part of our walk from the Castle. There is so much character you need to walk the old town. The clock in the picture while we were there had two couples who had just got married posing for wedding photos. Takes you back a few years (40). Follow our walk. Thank you.

Fantastic clock. This clock is a work of art considering how old it is, built in a time when most people could not read let alone tell time. The engineering that went into it's construction for the age that it was built is mind blowing.

Worth Catching at the Top of the Hour. If you're in Prague for any length of time, you'll likely be near old town square around the top of the hour. The astronomical clock is beautiful and worth seeing. It'll be surrounded by tourists (which means watch your belongings) but worth the free show. I also recommend buying a ticket to climb up the clock tower for beautiful views of the square.

Must see. Were in Prague for a week and in the area of the Clock on 2 days. Stood and watched the clock go at the turn of the hour, every chance we got. Does get busy at the foot of the tower, so watch your pockets. Went to the top of the tower, has great views of the city, very picturesque. However can get extremely busy at the top, and very congested around the walkway, with a lot of pushing and shoving going on. Best to go early in the morning or late in the afternoon to avoid the major rush around midday.Definitely recommend going.

Astronomical clock. Old town is a real nice area to seat eat and drink but don't get too excited about the astronomical clock! On the hour figures appear in the 2 doors but not very exciting even though large crowds appear to see it! Boring really!
A must!!. This amazing clock is a must for anyone visiting Prague.......enjoy a drink or a coffee on the square, watch the world go by & witness the change in the clock

Enjoyed watching the historical clock. We were in Prague for several days and happened to be near the clock twice as the top of the hour neared. Most enjoyable was to sit on one of the patios facing the clock and enjoy a local beer while watching the clock strike. This gives one a little more elbow room than just standing in the crowd. Of course, the beer (and patio seating) is not totally inexpensive, but worth it to us.
Great views!. Amazing history, we went up to the top which had a great view over the old town square and of Prague. A must for all travellers to Praha!
Lively square. The clock was a bit of a let-down, I was expecting something more dramatic! The square is very attractive

Spectacular!. The clock dates from the 15th Century. Every hour Christ and the 12 Apostles appear at two windows above the clock, and then the skeleton of death toll the bell. The place gets crowded of visitors as each hour approaches. It is unique!

Visit to old town Prague. I was really looking forward to seeing the clock on our trip. So we got there 30 mins before it was due to strike, grabbed a table at a bar opposite and waited. Just before the hour the area in front fills so you have to move to take pictures. Then it strikes and about three mins later it's all over. All I can say is I was disappointed, you see some movement above the main clock as some carved figure move in small doors that open.i was expecting a lot more. Maybe it's just me.

BEST THING to do in Prague. Prague is the kind of city which is beautiful to see from a tower : there you can see all the nice roofs and stuff. It was breathtaking. Best thing to do in Prague. Definitly.

Great story and view from the top. The clock is impressive and worth checking out. You can't miss it if you walk through Old Town. If you buy a ticket, you're able to climb to the top of the tower (not a very strenuous climb) to get a great view of the city. It's definitely worth the price of admission.

Time your visit. Very neat clock to see - it's the oldest working astronomical clock in the world. Try to be there on the hour when it goes off. You should be able to show up within 5 minutes and see it, but know that many other people have the same idea each hour. One day we stopped at a restaurant with a good view of the clock and enjoyed watching it from there (with our pilsners).

Crowded, Somewhat over-rated.. Hundreds of people crowd around to see the clock chime and the figures move. If you have a guide, then they explain what everything means, which is helpful. But I woulsn't go out of my way to get there to see it.I'd recommend finding a seat in one of the cafes or bars and people watching for awhile instead.The view from the top of the tower is awesome, and well worth the effort to get there.

Fantastic Clock. We didn't go into the Old Town Hall or the clock tower but did watch the clock's whole routine during the daytime (actually, at 10). Despite the crowd that quickly gathered on the hour, my wife and I enjoyed the show, and I took literally dozens of pictures to prove it. Yes, it's crowded, but that's what happens around touristy features in a city. This one doesn't disappoint, in my opinion.
Loved it!. The views from the tower...WOW! be sure to get yourself up there. I like that its not steps but platforms to get to the top as well a a lift. The chiming is very quick.

Panoramic view. The clock is worth watching on the hour as the crowd gathers to see the artwork working. But that's it, it is a clock, that with fine detail and a great place to arrange to meet if in a large party or just in small groups. Would recommend the tower part of the clock. The panoramic views all over Prague a amazing. If you going to Prague then well worth taking your camera up the tower.
Brilliant Place. This is a must when visiting Prague! The clock is great and is of great historical significance but the 'show' which takes place on the hour can be given a miss!

Nice to see but on the hour show not much. The Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock was great to ssee such a masterpiece, crowds waited for the on the hour clock show which was only a few figures passing a small window at the top , bit of a let down to be honest but worth seeing .

Nice to see. Nice to see but over-rated if you ask me. Hundreds of people standing waiting to see it do it's thing on the hour, but hohum. If you're there at 5 to the hour, ok, but don't wait around too long for it.

Tower good. Show hmmm!. Really worth a trip up the tower giving amazing views over the rooftops of Prague. However the 'show' was not what's built up to be! Very, very crowded and over in a minute. If you happen to be there on the hour probably worth stopping to look but wouldn't make a point of it.

Don't blink or you'll miss it but go for the panoramic view. The astrological clock is fascinating to read about what it does. Every hour the glockenspiel goes off but it's over in less than a minute. Do yourself a favor and go inside and buy a ticket to go up to the observation deck way up top of the tower. The view of Prague is incredible. There is an elevator if you have bad knees as I do. Once you get off you enter another room with another elevator right in the middle of about 9 levels of ramps going up in a continuous square pattern. This is a definite do.
