Tower views are excellent , clock history is good, yet the show is in the eye of the beholder !!!. The clock SHOW can be somewhat underwhelming to some people. Many say its not what is expected !! ( true ) however to those that take a tour/free tour and learn the history of the clock and its maker, then this masterpiece is a must see attraction.The tower and its viewing area is a must. A great photo arena of prague and when the clock is ready to strike ....even better .....you can look down at all of those happy faces looking up !!! ;-)

Over in a minute!. This is a bit like going on the London Eye. Everyone expects you to do it, but the value of the experience is more in confirming to those back home that you've done it or seen it. Crowds gather in expectation on the hour and the rotating figures stop moving as soon as the clock chimes finish. The other surrounding figures can be studied and compared with your guide book when the crowds disperse.
The place to be. . Tourists and locals alike hang out here. It's where it all goes down. Bar crawls. Pubs. All that good stuff. Make sure to get there.
Very cool clock!. The clock is definitely very cool, and worth seeing to snap a couple quick pictures (while trying to navigate the sea of tourists).Aside from that, a quick picture and move on.

Cool. A little strange, but cool. The crowds are pretty funny at the base of the clock when the hour strikes, and the actual show is pretty underwhelming, but the clock itself is so detailed and intricate that it's hard to not stare at. If the lines aren't too long, go up the tower and have a look around - the best place inside the city to see from above (although the Castle and the TV tower have great lookouts as well, just farther away).

Its a 600 year old clock!. Ok so the "show" that the clock puts on is kindy silly and short for how long you feel like you are standing there waiting but, its a 600 year old clock. and its free to look at. the square that its next to is large and when we went had a festival with local booths to buy local product, souvenirs, gifts, food. in addition there are lots of places to eat right there on the square and it is so much fun to people watch.

What a beautiful viewing point to see Prague. Definitely pay the small fee to go to the top of the Clock we only paid to go to the top. There is a lift to take you to the top which is great and we walked back down to read the history along the walls which was interesting. It can get busy at the top as it is only a small walk around and people often stop taking pictures. However I could not fault the view and it is good to see Prague from this angle. The clock show is different to expected but a must see when in Prague!!!
Historic , great place. Lovely square, lots of cafes and restaurants. Beautiful shops and lots to roam and potter around for.Loved the clock,we went up for a great view and some history.

Worth the Climb. The Old Town Hall is a Must Visit in Prague. It is worth the climb - but also has elevators. You purchase your tickets at the base of the town hall. Finding the entrance is tricky. Go into and then through the tourist office to find the stairs and first set of elevators. Once you find the first stairs/elevators finding your way to the top is easy.
Cool clock. It's definitely an iconic emblem of Prague, so it's worth a visit. However, the "show" at the top of the hour was rather disappointing and not worth sticking around for.
v nice old place. the place is full of tourist , full of restaurants , v nice place to have lunch in historical place .

Astronomical clock. Went to see this for last show of the day at 8pm. Street was crowded with folk but managed to get a good spot. The twelve apostles passed by and saw the skeleton ringing his bell but in all the performance was underwhelming. Have seen many much more interesting clocks in other cities. Trip up the clock tower is well worth it for the views. Take the lift up the last bit - saves a lot of time and energy! Was beautiful at sunset.
Great. A must visit for tourists.Our tour guide told us the history of the clock tower as well as its workings.Amazing, how much foresight people had back in those days.

Fantastic View. A must see. When you climb the tower you have a beautiful view of the city from the old square. We went when Prague was hosting the ice hockey championships and the city had big screens set up in the square below. This created a very fun environment and an amazing view of the town in action.

You just have to see at least once. The history about the clock and the way our tour guide, Ion, from Sandeman free city tour described made it enjoyable. If you want a good picture do it after the "hourly show". There will be less people.

See a 15th Century Megacomputer!. The Old Town Hall’s astronomical clock was one of the world’s technological wonders in the early 15th century. Cultural changes between then and now may obscure the meanings that would have been obvious to Prague’s residents back then. The three statues that surround the clock represent mortal sins: vanity, greed, and hedonism. The fourth personifies Death. When the time comes, Death moves his hour-glass and pulls the cord, which rings the bell. Two windows open and the 12 Apostles move swiftly by, each looking at the crowd below. The rooster crows – perhaps a reference to the text in which Jesus tells Peter that Peter will deny knowing Jesus three times before the rooster crows. The windows close and the clock then tolls the hour. This is definitely worth seeing despite the crowds!

Fun way to pass 5 minutes in old town. Was eating at a restaurant in front of this clock in old town called oliverde, and all of a sudden hundreds of tourists starts to gather in front of the restaurant. Out of curiosity, I looked up and heard bells and saw a little show from the clock as it rang on the hour. It's an amazing structure, and thank god I was in a restaurant because this little event causes a serious crowd! It is a sight to see and many recorded it. Great place to watch however is from a restaurant so you don't get run over or pick pocketed!
Goes Off Every Hour. If you happen to be in town square close to the hour, stop and watch the clock -don't make a special trip.
Ultimate beauty.. It is so funny how everyone waits to see the clock chime... when it is not that big a deal. But what a beautiful masterpiece of time.

Quick top attraction - unique. The astronomical clock and the square should be at the top of any list of to-dos in Praque. Free, quick, and an entertaining very short display every hour on the hour. Lots and lots of tourists in this area. Don't eat at the places on the square, but just walk a short distance on any nearby side street and there are lots of good inexpensive cafes.
not bad. its free and lovely you can see it when you are walking a round the old town area. so, you will not lose any thing if you take some photos there.

Historic center of Prague. I was with my 18 year-old daughter, and I was pleased that she and I could both feel the march of history, with all of the historic buildings and the astronomical clock. I highly recommend Sandemann's Tours. Tour guides are very friendly and informative. And cost-friendly way to view the city.

Underwhelming. I suppose everyone waiting with me to view the hourly show felt the same way. The hour struck, the little statues came out from the doors above the clock and returned. Maybe we have all become jaded with all our fancy electronic devices or maybe this is just an overblown attraction.
Wow. stay here and watch on the hour. Never seen a clock like it and probably will never see another as long as I live. Stunning

Special moment. It is incedible, I had a special momente because I left there at five o'clock in the afternoon and the clock was ready for the show, the bells and the toys are so beautifull we loved it. We had a good time there in the square looking for the clock, the people seams so happy

Interesting piece of work. The astronomical clock is an interesting piece of science. Fascinating how accurate its functioning is, given the period it is from. You can also climb up the tower for some nice city center views.

Good clock. Nice clock to look at but was a little of a let down at the hour point.
Great design and structure for its time but wasn't amazed by it.
If in the area check it out and see it for yourself if not don't stress lots of other better sites to see.

Come see it, but don't climb it. Chances are if your In Prague, you will see the clock cause it's located right In central square and it's hard to miss, and if you plan it right, come on the hour and see it in action. My friend and I have a thing about climbing our way through Europe..: we climbed the cathedrals In Italy and every other tall building we can find with a lookout, so we were pretty psyched to hear we could climb the clock. We had to pay to climb, and when we did get to the top, it was actually pretty disappointing. It's not really high enough to see much further out than the streets around central square and we weren't too pleased to have spent money on it. If you want a good view, walk about 10 minutes down the street to the park with the giant pendulum... The view is amazing and it's free!
Old style clock rocks!. Hang around to see this old clock and its fun characters wind into action as the clock reaches the hour mark.
Don't miss this. Wonderful to observe the clock at the hour and half hour. Great fun. Climbing to the top of the tower gives a great view for photography.
Very vibrant!. there was a couple having their wedding pictures taken under the clock when i went, very magical! Definitely a must see.

The second most disapointing tourist attraction in Europe. OK your in Prague, you have to see it, but afterwards everybody just stands round and says "is that it"Whats the most disappointing tourist attraction in Europe? Name your own. Perhaps tripadvisor should run a competition
go later. A beautiful and unique clock, I'd reccomend getting there at later hours though as it is still lit up so you can see it, but you're not being crushed by the crowds

A long wait for very little. We saw the crowds and joined in only because it was close to the hour. It's a very pretty clock but the end result was disappointing with only a little action. can't see what all the fuss is about! Seen more active cuckoo clocks!
Wooow. Nothing to say but waiting for the hour in order to see the animated clock...amazing at all, also after several views about

OK but dont worry if you miss it. My other half and I ate in a restaurant opposite the clock and kept an eye out but so many people gathered we decided to get a closer look after dinner. It wasn't really worth the wait. It's nice to say I saw it but it didn't change my life - over in 60 seconds. I hear if you go inside it's more interesting.
Amazing Clock. this clock is an amazing sight - not to be missed - it has history and love seeing the Apostles - it is crowded but worth waiting for

Best clock ever.. Do not skip seeing this. Visit it on the hour for a great show. It's amazing that this clock is so old. One of the best things I saw in Europe. Usually a huge crowd gathered to watch, so you'll get bumped around, but the whole area is busy.
Clock. The design of the clock is interesting with is astronomical movement and the figures which adorn it. On the hour a skeleton rings the bell and figures appear.

There is a lift!. The entry to old town hall is breathtaking with the domed ceiling.This is the first clock tower that I did not have to climb as there is a lift and that made for comfortable viewing esp with children. Go to the top at sundown, as the clowds create patterns. You can enjoy the street performances down in the square from the top as well!
Interesting. Not particularly impressive but interesting. Very old but working. Did not stay to see the movements.

Walk to the top. Buy a ticket and make the effort to walk up the stairs and ramps and stairs to the top of the tower and look down on everyone in the square. Even better see the view of the city and pick out a roof top bar to visit after your descent. If you take your time to make the climb it is not too difficult but you can be lazy and ride the lift right to the top.
Walk and enjoy it.... I liked the architecture, the clean streets, the many people walking around, the restaurants and bars close to it. Excellent!

Real life Disney World. The clock is unique and beautiful but needs explanation. The buildings around the square are also beautiful making the square unique, but the huge crowds can make you think it is the magic kingdom. The restaurants I tried in the area were good and reasonable as was the beer. Good way to relax and take in the sights.

Historic not to be missed sight!. You can't go to Prague without viewing the clock tower. We climbed to the top and were rewarded by an amazing view of the old town and also the urrounding area. You can climb the stairs or take the elevator.

Go inside to see the best part.. You'll see the clock in the Old Town square and hundreds of people standing and waiting to see the Apostles in the clock at the top of every hour. Take the tour and go inside for history and a great view of the apostles and the entire square.

ok but not amazing. the clock does its thing every hour and people gather about 15 min before. we could see from our hotel room. but stood out side the clock to make sure we saw everything. for the time it was built and still works that something- but I wouldn't walk more than 30 min to see.

Don't stand around waiting. This is a very interesting clock, but standing around waiting for it to go off is really not worth it. We heard the description from our Sandeman Guide (free tour) and we were impressed with the history of the clock & the fact it's been working since 1410. We happened to see it in action on another day as we were eating nearby, and, truly, the history is more interesting than the vision.

More than a clock. The clock is in the tower on Prague's old town hall. One will find a swarm of people standing with head back looking up on the hour when the characters play their part. This is a crowded place so be careful at your belongings. I think it is a one time experience. Remember to read up on it before you go in order to know what you are looking at. The areas around the clock has fantastic little cafes and restaurants to sit, drink, eat and enjoy the architecture of the city and watrch people passing by.Prague's Astronomical Clock is an intrinsic part of the Old Town Hall. The clock was created in 1410. It displayes the motion of the planet and the 12 apostles. Apart of the 12 apostles the clock features moving figurines including Vanity, The Miser, the Skeleton and the Turk (a simbol of lust),

Get the full story on the Clock. 15th C marvel of math and engineering. Don't just watch the hourly animation. Understand the amazing operation of the clock using sun, moon, zodiac, etc. Based on old notion that the sun goes around earth. Very accurate.

Not necessarily for a 'show'. The clock is beautiful, no doubts. But if somebody want to see 'the show' that is every hour, waiting in the crowd... don't! you wouldn't even have enough time to take out your camera or phone. it's just 12 figures passing by in little windows (quickly).so YES,enjoy it walking by when you are around but don't wait for a full hour.
Nice clock. The clock is rather pretty but the main attraction is the figures that move when it strikes. Worth a look though.

Great Fun. I have never been in Times Square on New Years Eve, but the enthusiasm and expectation of the crowd gathered to witness the Astronomical Clock had to rival such an experience. The crowd packed every square inch of space from which you could see the clock. Cheers erupted from the crowd in the minutes and seconds approaching the top of the hour. Then, a hush, to enjoy the movements of the clock. A grand cheer signaled the end of the show, and the crowd was slow to disburse in their many ways to further enjoy the beauty of Prague...the jewel of world capitals.
Get there before the appointed hour.. Ideal scenario is to be having a coffee at one of the numerous cafes, just before the clock strikes. Eyes upwards and don't blink - you could miss it.

Very cool spot. The clock was mesmerizing and blew me away with all of its features. An icon of Prague, with a strange history. I would encourage you to learn about the history before seeing it. It will make you appreciate it all the more. To climb the tower, you'll have to pay 120 crown and then wait in line to go up. The line gets real long after mid day so plan early. The view at the top is worth the wait though. There is an elevator that will take you to the top, if your not up to the climb.

Wee Break. The Astonomical clock and the square are worth a visit. The clock is great and you have to watch as it strikes every hour on the hour to see what happens. It does get very crowded as everybody wants to be there to watch it and all the tours go there as well. The square itself is big, lots places to eat/drink and again lots of entertainment on all day and night. Very much worth going for a walk around it all to capture it all and make sure you have your camera.

Visit the terrace for nice view. There is a beautiful Machine (a clock). This would only get interesting if during a tour or in general someone guides you on how to read it. The town hall is nothing special but the view from the top is nice.
Pretty!. Very pretty tower, views from the top are unrivalled - the hourly chime and movements are OK to watch - but if you are there you may as well stand and watch with all the other tourists!

Like the previous poster said: go up the tower!. The clock is right in the Old Town Square, so is pretty hard to miss. It's quite lovely just to look at, with its impressive architectural feature of the clock face on the facade of the building.However, my favourite thing about this was going up the tower. There's a fun walk up to get to the observation deck. Once you're up, you get some really beautiful views of Prague. We were there just a little before sunset, so the light and the city beneath with all the people milling about was really quite a sight to see.

beautiful working cuckoo clock. In summer the square where the astronomical clock is situated is busy and people from everywhere come to see the clock chime on the hour every hour.. considering how old this working clock is it is worth a look
Great view from the clock tower.. Joined the crowds to watch the clock chime at midday.However the best was yet to come.Took the lift to the top of the tower and the views of Prague were amazing !!!

Cool Clock - Awesome Square. The clock mechanism itself is composed of three main components: the astronomical dial, representing the position of the Sun and Moon in the sky and displaying various astronomical details; "The Walk of the Apostles", a clockwork hourly show of figures of the Apostles and other moving sculptures—notably a figure of Death (represented by a skeleton) striking the time; and a calendar dial with medallions representing the months. It is neat to see the Walk of the Apostels...!

Go up the tower. we waited for the clock to strike - then took the lift to the top. great views from here. Amused to watch a guy appear complete with guitar in hand ready to sing his song. His first few notes were loud and as he played let his trousers fall !!! A policeman promptly showed and spoke a few words, we expected him then to pull up his trousers - but no he had to tone down the music - very amusing.

What time is it?. There are hundreds of people waiting every hour on the hour for this exhibition of exquisite artistry. You can't take it all in and invariably you need to come back and try to spot what you missed the previous time.

A marvellous must-see.. You can't go to Prague without ogling at the world-famous Astronomical Clock, tucked away in the outer walls of the gorgeous Old Town Hall. Make sure you are there on the hour to watch the clock come to life and enjoy a quirky display of figurines popping in and out of the renowned attraction. A trip to Prague truly isn't complete without passing by this beauty.

Astronomical clock. The atmosphere waiting for the clock to "chime" is fantastic. Crowds of tourists from all over the world stand around chatting or sit in cafes waiting for the event. Great to ge part of this

Overrated. The astronomical clock is very pretty, but it is not worth standing and waiting in the huge crowd of people that gathers every hour, as very little happens - massive anti climax. Just have a look at the clock whenever you walk past, you really won't miss anything!

Amazing clock!. The astronomical clock dates back to centuries and shows the time, date, phase of moon etc. Also when the clock strikes, there are the 12 Apostles making an appearance. Dont miss this sight that happens every hour!!

A plus in the main square!. Very nice to watch the astronomical clock do its show every hour, there are a lot of details that you probably will see if you watch this more than once. It is a plus for the amazing old town.

Nice for photos. The crowds stop here every hour for the clock to strike. Can get a bit congested, but as a very tall clock, every one can see. One the hour the 12 disciples, come out of the front of the clock. All very short and sweet, but a must see, because one if the main attractions of the old square. Tip behind you here is Starbucks, free toilets !

Not worth all the hype. All the hype that was given regarding the clock was worth going to see but very disappointing with the scene and the crowd waiting to see the clock. The old town is a lovely place and worth the walk about.
Amazing. Difficult to understand how someone designed such a piece of art and accuracy. A great sight in the old town square.

Stunning Landmark, History and Craftmanship...Must See. Set in the old town sqaure you are instantly overwhelmed by the sight of the clock and its setting. You can climb to the top or simply enjoy its beauty. Tourists flock to see the clock on the hour and two trap doors open to show moving sculptures, Christ and his disciples. Simply beautiful and the craftmanship speaks for itself. A great sight if you are in the area and not short of things to do within the wider square and spoiled for choice for eating and drinking. Take a wander and enjoy the atmosphere and bring your camera! 10-15 May 2015
A must. when visiting Prague. On the hour, up until 10pm, when the clock strikes, the 12 Apostles are visible. Lots of bars/restaurants on the square, a great place to people watch.
Adds to atmosphere. Worth seeing, especially at midday. Being part of the crowd at midday adds to the atmosphere around the square.

A must area to visit. Nice area to walk around. Street performers, lots of people and restaurants. The clock goes every hour for about 30 seconds. Go in the day and night, both times beautiful but different.

a historic highlight. I had heard and read about this clock and now I was standing there looking at it, Christmas day, freezing cold, but what a great experience, of course we stayed to watch what happened on the hour.
Unique piece of time. At the top of the hour, the complex mechanism gives you a show of craftsmanship, while enjoying the plaza and it's energetic visitors.

Pure beauty. Old town is absolutely beautiful so much to see and do! Climb the clock tower to see much more amazing views of prague. Restaurants one street away are half the price of the ones in the old town just so you know

On the hour every hour. The clock is amazing , quaint and on time .
Mystical and accurate , a special moment in time .
The figurines are delightful and it is the only one of its kind

A very long time in not a lot of time. When one considers how long ago this clock was designed & made it is an engineering marvel. Certainly, a must see. Also, it won't take a lot of time from your other tourist duties. All of its actions are complete in a minute or so. It draws a crowd.
Tick Tock. What a beautiful experience of history. Loved the sound of the clock chiming. The town square really sets the mood as well.

Be here at the end of the hour!. The main attraction here is the happening at the end of each hour. Do not film it, enjoy watching it, as it lasts only 30 sec. Be sure to spot the skeleton on the right hand site, ringing the bell. Wherever you stand, the gathered crowd won't bother you, since the clock is quite high and visible from each spot in front of it. Just be sure to watch your stuff from thieves.

Amazing clock. We went to see the clock to see the Apostles which takes place on the hour. It's great to watch but it last about 10 seconds so I wouldn't be too excited to go there! Old Town wasn't really for us, very overcrowded.

Mayfair in Prague. This is apparently the most expensive place to live in Prague. The Old Town Hall looks like something out of a fairy tale and the Astronomical Clock is one of the top tourist sights in the city.
It's really cool!. Located in the main square with many beautiful buildings, this is one of the most amazing clocks anywhere..make sure to stay for the "show" on the hour.

If you are clock-happy, this is for you. Some of my favorite souvenir photos are of this clock. I had not seen anything like this before. Unlike where I live [Salt Lake City], look up anywhere and find a clock. Obviously, I am clock-happy.

Noon!. Get there at noon for the best show because the bell rings twelve times, or just make sure you are there at the top of the hour to see the clock in action. It's a wonderful show and a truly unique clock.

A Must See. For a tourist Visiting Prague this clock is a Must See.,it's over 600years old, one of the only working astronomical in the world. You get to see the apostels along wthe other figures walk pass the open windows and "Death" represented by the skeleton ringing the bell every hour. History has it that, that is why the figure pass through the window speaking their head meaning they are not ready for death. It makes a very interesting sight. You need to get there a few minutes before the hour to get a good position for your viewing pleasure, as the old town square is always filled with tourist.
Loved loved loved. We waited over half hour to see the clock got the best spot too so we could see it full on and I was not disappointed.
Too crowded. So many beautiful places to see in Prague- the old town square too crowded and the clock nothing too special!
Timeless. This clock is so well maintained after all these years. The working and design is a delight, it is a must do. The clock stands even today in all its glory.

Photo opp!. This is such a beautiful clock, and worthwhile to stop and get a picture of it. Be aware that the area is often crowded with people. It's pretty hard to get a picture of yourself or your family in it, as it is tall, and there are many people around it. For an amazing image of the clock, check out some of the street artists or artists in the markets that sell paintings of the clock. I purchased one, and it is absolutely stunning!

don't blink. get there early as the tourists will be out in force. the session takes only a few seconds and while very interesting and imaginative, takes only a few seconds to complete. Nice place to people watch
Crowded place. As many places in Prague, this is a crowded place so be careful at your belongings. There are many pocket pikers in Prague.

Royal Salute. Fascinating clock nice architectural monument that inspires the past glory
I liked when the king,queen and family appear to salute this happens on hourly basis
Very crowded area. Well worth a visit but the area around the clock was absolutely packed with tourists taking the usual photos! Lots of little shops to explore..

small clock. Interesting mechanism, but didnt see in process. Because you need to wait some time. But i though that is bigger than in real life. You can go above to the clock and see town, but if you been at Television tower or Cementerium(or smth) - like us - we didnt went, its costs only 80czk, but its much if you know how to spend money

Nice to watch (but slightly overrated). I won't deny it's beautiful and funny to watch the Astronomical Clock. But you will have to include the herd of tourists who gather in front of the Clock to watch the spectacle. For me it's a one time experience, I won't do it again.

A must if you like astrology. Very historical, must be there on the hour when the characters play their part (like a cuckoo clock). Be mindful of the crowds that gather in front of it. A good view is across the street in front of it.
Get your timings right. Unfortunately we didn't pass this on the hour but was a great place to chill out and take in the hustle and bustle surrounding you

Stunning Clock. One of the most beautiful clocks in the world.... Great place to use as a meeting point, I will never be tired to seat under the clock and watch... The areas around the clock has fantastic little cafes and restaurants to sit , eat and enjoy the architecture of the city.
go up the tower. you can go up the tower, there is a lift inside to take you to the top if you dont want to use the stairs which gives you good views over the city

Brilliant clock. This clock is located in town centre and you cannot miss it when visiting the Prague city. It's on a short walk from Starom.. metro station clearly sign posted as soon as you get out of station.Highly recommended.

The oldest working astronomical clock. The clock is a stunning example and the oldest working astronomical clock in the world. dating back to 1410. On the full hours the apostles move past the windows and a skeleton representing death tolls a bell. Some visitors are disappointed that 'the show' is not more elaborate and thereby miss the point of the clock. To understand the clock face you need to read up about it first or have a tour guide - it is far from intuitive, however once understood you will marvel at how this was designed and assembled in 1410.

A must in Prague. Old Town and its famous Astrological Clock are certainly worth the cab ride or walk. The view from the observation deck in Old Town Hall's tower must be terrific, but the 228 feet must be climbed by stairs, as there is no elevator. We chose instead to have pizza and pilsner at the sidewalk cafe next door. I recommend that plan. Be sure to time it right so that you can watch Mr. Death turn his hourglass at the top of the hour!
Don't expect too much. A great creation for the time period it was built in but not a must see. You do see it walking through the old town but I think this attraction is way too hyped up.

Amazing!. The astronomical clock is amazing and was way ahead of its time. It draws crowds at the stroke of the hour so do take care of your belonging when you are there. The town hall had some interiors and paintings preserved from the earlier centuries. A tour will bring you in to see the mayors office and the back of the clocks. However, what was amazing is what is not seen at street level. The tour of the underground shows what life was like before the ground levels were raised 7m to aviod floods. It was amazing to find cellars, wells and walkways underground!

Nice surroundings. It is nice to have a drink in the sun on one of the restaurants in front of the clock. Funny each hour when the clock strikes and the figures appears. This most have been an amazing attraction at the time it was built, and judging by the massive crowd gathering each hour, it still is.The restaurants in front of the clock are probably the most expensive in Prague (and there are many cheaper and better) but they are still affordable compared to Sweden (probably half the price).A must see if going to Prague.

dont be disappointed with the clock performance. on the hour , every hour, the clock makes a performance. dont expect too much. but make sure you do a tour of some sort so you see all there is to see about this clock

Disappointing. The clock looks good but that's all. On the hour it chimes and there is the tiniest of movement from a couple of the parts of the clock but that's it. I had read that something comes out and moves across the clock but that didn't happen the couple of times we saw it.
Must see. The astronomical clock is that each traveler to Prague must see. The design of it is stunning and it is much larger than I thought it would be.
Interesting to see but read up on it before you go. It draws a crowd for sure, but since we didn't have a tour guide with us, we didn't really know what we were looking at.

Prague Old Town Astronomical Clock. Worth a visit, watch the animation on the hour and consider going up the elevator to the viewing platform at the top of the tower, the views of old town are spectacular!

Interesting and old!. Worth the wait to see this old clock move on the hour. The square gets crowded to see this but there are plenty of Cafes to relax at and plenty of things to see while you wait. Stop in at Erpet Bohemia Crystal (at your back when you face the clock) to see the beautiful handmade Czech crystal that is very reasonably priced.
Tour of Prague. Very busy square see the crowds gathering on the hour to find the clock tower. Fascinating clock movement with chimes. Have your VCR ready.

It's Free!. The clock is unique, old and historical. Not bad if you have time to kill, but you're an easy target for pick-pockets in the crowded street. Not near as spectacular as the Glockenspiel in Munich.

Take a tour. Take a tour to get the history behind this site - both for the clock and the hall, otherwise you will miss the complex social, political and technological aspects of these fascinating parts of Prague.

Prague Castle. Biggest castle in Europe - or palace really. Have their own changing of the guard - not quite on our scale but still nice. The whole complex is massive but there are restaurants where you can have a drink or eat and people watch/rest. We had drinks on a terrace that looked down over the whole of Prague and the weather was fantastic so it was a lovely experience. Lovely atmosphere. Went up the tower in the Town Hall where the astronomical clock is. I took the glass (indoor) elevator and fantastic views of Prague. Had lunch opposite the clock afterwards and watched the clock strike on the hour - you get quite a gathering about that time. It was very busy the day we went to the Town Hall as Czecvh was hosting Ice Hockey World Cup (or European??) so people came from everywhere. They also had their own "London" type Marathon that day. All back to normal and cleared the following day though. You should try and see Prague by night. The castle across the river looks beautiful when lit. We ate in a boat moored permanently at the side of the river right opposite the castle and watched as the night closed in and the place lit up. As we left there were 2 firework displays - possibly I think Czech had won the ice hockey game. Eating is very reasonable. Food it great - various schnitzels, goulash, salads. Pretty fussy eater but loved the food something for everyone. LOADS of shops from souvenirs - lots of beautiful crystal - to the top designer shops like Dior, Cartier etc. Hadn't realised just how big Prague is. All the buildings beautiful, you can get anywhere on the trams, metro or buses and buy very cheap day passes so you can use all 3 all day - or walk around and take in all the buildings. Jewish Quarter, Old Town, Wenceslas Square (yep - the very same Good King W from the Christmas carol!). We took a horse and carriage ride around as well. Hundreds of cafes, shops and lots to see and do. We also took a boat trip on the river - about 45 mins with drink and gingerbread thrown in. We loved our time there and had fantastic weather as well.

One Direction?. Having seen the astronomical clock and the crowds that view it just before it strikes the hour to see the moving parts, we decided to view the interior and climb to the top of the clock tower for panoramic views of the city and the old town square beneath. Sloping ramped access until the narrow one person at a time spiral staircase, which is traffic light controlled at the top.Wonderful views across the city only spoilt by one particular group of visitors that insisted on circulating in the opposite direction to everyone else and completely disregarding the obvious directional arrow and instructions displayed therefore ending up going the wong way.
Clock Show. Make sure you stay the full time to enjoy the show. Also be aware of pick pockets and keep your wallets safe. Go early and get a good spot.

Rooftop view of Prague. On a clear day, you can see the well manicured roofs of old Prague from the tower. The tickets are also sold on third floor. Usually a 15-20 min wait for the glass elevator. Seniors get a discount ..entrance 70 kr above 65. The gentle ramps are a good small exercise. Extra to see the wood sculptures of the astro clock. Definitely worth the small detour up.

Fascinating. Follow the crowds and you will end up in Old Square . You need to get there about 10mins before the hour to see the Astronomical Clock but definitely worth it. Its advisable to wait a little after the clock chimes to go in the Old Town hall Tower to avoid the queues.There is a lift or a ramp to the top and the view is worth the effort.
Make sure you see the show. Although it can be seen as a tacky tourist trap, it is worth seeing, make sure you get a good spot, worth seeing once only
just a lovely vibrant town. Lively May Day and very friendly people. Lovely atmosphere in town. Shopkeepers are not pushy but very helpful. Waiters in cafes very friendly and attentive.

Over hyped. The clock itself is a real feat of engineering, and is absolutely fascinating to see, however, the hourly show has massive crowds and is over on a few seconds.
Worth seeing but I wouldn't make a special trip for it.

Go up. We waited for 10-15minutes for the clock to reach the hour. It was rather disappointing. We heard a lot of "was that it" from the mass crowd. However, we got tickets up the tower, and although it's small up there, the view was great. It only cost £4 so well worth it. It was a beautiful sunny day and the view was just stunning. Wish the other people up the top would stick to the one way rule, but otherwise great!

it's a clock. I might sound a bit of but it's a clock... it's not worth the crowds and it doesn't do a lot, wait until the crowds have left and you have plenty of time to admire what is a great piece of architecture. the clock in Munich is much better.

An amazing clock in an amazing building. The clock and its sculptures are easy to see over the heads of the hordes of tourists milling around. Street artists and musicians, people drinking beer or coffee, eating langos or pork slices, sausages or fried potato spirals...you can see them all from the top of the tower.
Worth waiting. Watching clock's work once an hour was fascinating. So many people visiting same time so finding a place to watch wasnt easy.

Inexpensive, great view of Prague. You get the lift half way up and then the rest is a spiral staircase. There happened to be about 10 brides having photo shoots - don't know if that was normal or not! Simple - no guide so make sure you grab a brochure.
Don't Blink. Loved the clock; however, if you think waiting 10-20 minutes is going to get you a long show, forget it. The whole thing takes about two minutes for the clock to do its thing.

Up the clock tower.. Lots of people packed in the square, but seeing the clock was amazing. The climb up the Tower was well worth it to see the Panorama of Prague. The lift is available but we worked off our breakfast by using the stairs. Make time to listen to the guides who explain the dials of the clock. We think computers are brilliant, but the knowlegde from the 14th century was mind blowing.
A must see!!!. Take the time to stand in the crowd and watch the clock. Make sure you dont have someone standing in front of you!!!!!

The tower all above. Watching the way the old clock works is fascinating, and sharing the excitement of the crowd is something that adds to the experience. (Just take care of your bag. I didn't have any bad experiences, but I felt it's better to be on the lookout in the huge crowds that gather on the square.) And yes, the clock-attraction only lasts for a short time only, but it's nice, and you can always return for another round an hour later. What's even better, though, is going up the tower. As they only let up a given number of people at the same time, you will probably have to wait a bit (around 20 minutes), but it's worth the wait. Granted, it's somewhat frustrating that the whole process of letting people up the tower resembles the process of leading animals to the slaughterhouse, but I guess that's the way it is when visiting a site in which thousands of other people are interested as well.Anyway, once you're up, you can hang around and take your time, and look at Prague from all the different angles - and it's beautiful.A big plus is that the tower is accessible with wheelchairs as well - either by lift, or by going up the ramp (no stairs).

A must see. If you have not been to Prague: You have to see it! it is part of Prague, this enjoyable city of lots of fine Things to see and enjoy. Be aware of Your wallet. Lots and lots of People around the old town hall, packed! Go to Prince Hotel, the top floor outdoor restaurant. From here you get the best view of the clock Tower.

The clock tells all. This is the most amazing and unique clock in the world, and it is hundreds of years old! Please be sure to read up this before seeing it or go with a good guide. It is truly incredible and a must see!

Somewhat of a let down. The clock itself and the building is extremely impressive. However, we found the clock going off on the hour to be a bit of a anticlimax for what we had had read. Glad I visited but not my favourite.
Go up to the tower instead of watching the Astro.clock. Don't bother to watch the clock when it hits the hour. Not much to see actually. Instead, go up to the church tower. Amazing view!!

Not what I was expecting but nice to see.. It is a beautiful clock and is worth going to see as it is part of the Old Town which is lovely. Every hour on the hour the clock does a little act where some of the statues move and then a door opens and you see faces spinning around, I think they are the apostles. It is nice to see but don't expect too much from it or you could be a bit disappointed like me.
Amazing view. The view from the tower in the astronomical clock is just perfect. You see the whole city and you are in the old town center in Prague, where all people take a walk around.
Amazing Clock. None like it anywhere and over 600 years old and still runs. There will be a lot of picture takers so be patient.

Fabulous Views. Go up and enjoy amazing views - only 120 kroner. Photographers dream both day and night time. Lift up and down so no long climb for those of limited mobility. Open until 10pm with last entry at 9.30pm which is plenty time to get those evening pictures.

Clever Mechanics. Very clever bit of kit, but the number of people it attracted amazed me, as it only chimes on the hour and everyone stands to see it, however, though very clever, not that spectacular really. Glad we went on a guided tour that explained all about the meaning of it. Well worth doing. You can climb or go by lift to the tower of the Old Town Hall, and it looked crowded the whole time. We went to Henry's Tower instead, which was cheaper, had a lift, offered amazing views and you could put a coin in a slot and the bells rang for you and that was brilliant, they played "que sera sera" and it was lovely.

Don't miss it. Once u go to Praha don't miss the old town hall and the clock. U might say it's just a clock but it's way more than that. Despite the fact that it's located in the middle of a shopping dinning very friendly full of life part of the city I do advise u to wait until the clock show starts. And if ur with a guided tour u ll enjoy watching and listening to the story behind it. This clock is full of so many philosophical ideas and vision. It might make u think for a while. It's a magical moment not to be missed. Don't miss trying the food in the shops around and kiosks. And if ur cold try the hot wine. My regards to Praha and to the nice friendly devoted ppl. Respect to this great city that is romantic and full of history and magic. When we went there it was snowing and -15 degrees but we only felt warm from all the love and care the ppl showed us. I always say I don't visit a city twice but there I ll be back again for sure. Love

Over-rated. I sure am glad we didn't wait longer than ten minutes.It certainly is a novelty, and the clock face itself is interesting to stare at for a bit, but for all the hype, I definitely expected more. Way more. The courtyard in front of the clock gets crowded, as you'd expect, but it wasn't terrible. We were able to saunter in at around ten to two one afternoon, and found a couple of spots with a good view of the clock. We spent the next few minutes trying to decipher all the hands and dials and faces in front of us. I looked at my watch – we had 7 minutes. The clock face looked like it was saying we had another half hour to wait. But I had confidence in the fact that the show would start on the dot, even if the clock was blowing my mind.And start on the dot, it did. The little skeleton started to ring his little bell, the doors opened up, and the apostles started their trek through. And then the golden rooster crowed and…done. That was IT. I thought there'd be more pomp. I thought there'd be more apostles. I thought it'd last longer.I could hear the tourists around me, once it was clear it was over. There must have been four or five different nationalities around us, but even though I can't speak Chinese, German, Italian or Portuguese, I didn't need to to understand their disappointment.It was a sentiment I shared wholeheartedly. It's a lot of hype for not a lot of entertainment. At least it was free, and the weather was beautiful, and I was able to stand there with my Czech beer in my hand. At least there was that...

Still Spectacular. We visited the clock with 4 friends, one in fact a real "clock fanatic". We a arrived just before 5 PM and were able to witness all the bells, chimes and antics of all the wonderful characters. It was just like I remembered it the first time we saw it in 1998, only many more folks now looking at it.
Spectacular View. Take the time to climb the Old Town Hall tower on a clear day. The views are amazing from the top of the tower!!
Worth checking out!. Be at the Astronomical Clock at the top of the hour. Around 20 minutes or so prior the area fills up with tourist to watch the hourly display.
Something to see. A bit over rated n my opinion. For the prominence the Czech people attach to this I was left a little underwhelmed.
Lame. So much hype and thousends tourist packing there and for what. Just to see some figures rotating around in the shadows for a minute.

Worth learning the story. Many reviews indicate travelers are disappointed when they see the clock. If you take time to hear and understand the story from a local guide, you will look at the clock differently and see it for the amazing work it is!

Most Overhyped Attraction Ever. Yes, get someone to explain the macabre history of the clock. Yes, try to understand how exactly it works. No, don't waste any time waiting for the "show" though, it's about the most boring thing you'll see in Prague!If you want to know how to tell time off it, here's how:Stand in square facing directly at the face of the clock. Look straight the the centre of it, and then tilt your head back to about 45 degrees, focusing on the top of the tour, where you will see a conventional clock!
Time to visit this clock. The famous clock that is a must see. Just off of main square but you will see it from the crowds around the bottom of it when it gets close to the hour and chimes.

Neat to see. You can use stairs or the lift on the clock tower, but the stairs offer you opportunities to look out small windows and read signs as you go up. It offers interesting insights into the tower. The Town Hall tour was quite interesting, and you can choose tours in your language. They walk you through areas that are off limits without a tour, and the price was reasonable. Our guide worked to make the tour interactive rather than just spewing out facts. We were allowed time to look, ask questions, and take pictures. It gives you a glimpse into the dwellings and jails of long ago.
On the list of "must see tourist attractions". Gets very crowded around the hourly chime. Amazing it works great after all the years. It's in Old Town Square

HIghlight of Old Town. Astronomical Clock is the highlight of Old Town Square. Every hour a huge crowd gathers near the clock to observe how it works. Gather some information on it before visiting the site which will make it more interesting.

Center of it all. You probably can't miss this clock in the middle of old town prague, it draws huge crowds and is the most visited site. Don't just take photos or video there, read the panels and learn about it, and then go into the tower. The tower is cramped up top but the view is spectacular and probably the best spot in prague to see it all. Check out the metalwork on the gates as you go through :)

very good. see review for old town square, always full of people have a good time felt very save there but like everywhere else keep a good hold on to your bag/ wallet The trams and metro are notorious for pick pockets so be very careful of your bags and wallets.

Awesome clock and tower. So, It does what it says on the tin...! Tourist central and ques of people looking for that arty photo.It is pretty cool but build it into doing some other things.The square is full of hawkers and street performers all trying to get your change... Some are very good though.

You have to tick this off your to-see list. A beautiful and gloriously intricate timepiece, it formed the focal point of my trip to Prague, with me and my friends using it as the meeting point each evening. We made sure to get there on the hour as well, to get the full show as the clock strikes the hour. Well worth your time...

Worth to see many times. This area is very good indeed...especially, astronomical clock is worth to spend time in front...A lot of details on the clock and, with explanation it becomes a different place...Every detail on the clock tells you something from the life...

Astronomical Clock. The famous Astronomical Clock, this is what lot of tourist waiting for in the Old Town Square. Peoples are standing there wait for the clock in action. Becareful with your stuff, lot of people will bump into you, and some of them maybe pickpockets.

What an astonishing building and clock. This attraction is situated in the middle of the "old town" and is a must see. The building itself is magnificent but it is the clock that blows most people away as it doesn't tell time as we know it! The clock design is astonishing given that it was constructed so long ago and it is one of the "must see" attractions in Prague. I won't tell you how the clock works as this will ruin the mystique however i would advise that you you either get some written information on how the clock works (available from the Tourist Information Centres) before visiting it, or take a city walking tour with a guide who will explain the clocks workings. This is very popular attraction so go early in the day to avoid the crowds if you can!!!

Astronomical Clock On The Old Town Hall - Interesting To See. Every hour between 9 am and 11 pm, the twelve apostles appear in the upper windows. There are 4 figures (Death, Vanity, The Miser and The Turk) Death starts the hourly sequence by ringing a bell and other figures look over as he rings shaking their heads to signify their unreadiness to go with him. It is the oldest clock of its type still working (originally 1410) and certainly worth a look on the hour!
redefines clock watching!. Be there on the hour to watch it in action, crowd joins in and its a fun experience. Keep an eye on all the figures to get the full benefit.
the clock and the vendors. The Town Square with the vendors roasting ham and sausages, etc. was very nice. The clock was worth seeing.
out of this world. No trip to Prague would be complete without seeing this clock. Approximately 200 years old . It worth a visit on the hour to see the 12 apostles apoear at the windows

Do not wait too long.. The magic of this clock arrives every hour-do not wait too long to see it, you will see it on several other occasions anyway.
To see this great place at it's best-buy the ticket, go up the tower then spend more and do the full escorted trip-well worth it.

Amazing Clock. This 'Astronomical Clock' attracts lots of toursists and is a very busy place. The Old Town Hall has many statues and carvings on the facia. The half hour and hour are marked by chimes and different small figures appearing in small windows.

Loved it!. We found this area on our own with our city map, and then went back to it with our day trip tour guide. Prince Albert of Monaco was visiting the same time, so glad we got to see it a few different times. It is really interesting and beautiful. A must see!
beautiful timepiece. craftsmanship history and architecture all together. not to be missed if you are in Prague. it can get quite busy at fix hours as everybody gathers around.

The Astronomical Clock. Its best to get down to the town square early because it gets very crowded later in the day with tourist,
you can pay to go up the tower but why would you the clock is out side and very interesting.

Pretty cool. I suggest getting someone to explain how the clock works for you if you aren't familiar. It's way cooler if you know the history and mechanics behind it. Also watch your bag at noon; while you are looking up, you're an easy target for pickpockets.

Awesome!. This clock is pretty darn cool. Be prepared that weddings take place constantly in the building. Best tour I had throughout Prague was the tour inside the building. Better than the Prague Castle tour. Check it out!

Beautifl clock and great view from the tower. We had to see the astronomic clock of course during our Prague trip. When we got there, we were surprised that the astronomic clock is actually outside. I would have expected that such a masterpiece of medieval handcraft would be protected or covered in some way. It is a really beautiful piece of art. If you want to see it in action, better be there a little in advance to find a good space because a crowd gathers there at every full hour. We actually went on the tower at first to enjoy the great view over Prague. It was a beautiful sunny spring day and I really enjoyed the view over the city and the square. It is very narrow on top of the tower and we were not really alone, so it took a while to get around. Time passed really quickly with so much to see and when we realized that it was 5 min to the full hour and we needed to go down to see the astronomic clock, we didn't quite make it in time. We were not the only ones who had that plan ;-)

Cool. It is fun to watch the clock. There are tons of people standing around waiting to see the clock strike on the hour. So many brides and grooms come out to have their photos taken as well. I think we saw three or four while standing at the clock. There is a Starbucks near by to grab a coffee while you are waiting. There are tons of people standing and milling about since it is a well known square and famous clock. Beware of pick pockets. This is the area where you can also find free walking tours, hire a horse drawn buggy ride among other sightseeing options.

Amazing. In comparaison to other cities i have been too there is not that much too see in Prague in terms of tourist attractions but the astromonical clock was my favourite!! Considering that someone made that in the 1400's is just amazing so so clever and beautifal. You can also go to the top of the tower and get a birds eye view over the square. Very narrow viewing area once your at the top but 100% worth a visit.
Beautiful. Stunning square, the clock is very impressive. We were lucky we heard the chimes! There is a lot of history in this square - this clock is over 600 years old!

Very nice town hall and clock. I enjoyed my visit to the town hall tower and learn about the astronomical clock. Climbing the steps up to the balcony is worthwhile, although there is an elevator to take you up and down too. It got a little bit busy trying to get out onto the outside balcony, since some people/nationalities have problems queing up nicely to wait their turn, but once there you will have a great view of the city.

Every hour on the hour. The moving "show" only lasts about a minute, but the crowds are fierce under the clock to watch. It's best to have a tour guide, or at least a written description of what you're seeing as all the parts of the clock.

The most famous clock in the world. A must see when in Prague as the clock has an amazing history and is a stunning piece of architecture! I would recommend learning about the clocks history to truely appreciate it. I can't believe some people have said the clock is boring...it's a clock not a transformer! A truely amazing sight and the most beautiful clock in the world.

Don't miss the tour. One of the highlights was to see how the Apostoles work from inside after we booked a tour guide. You can see the Apostoles every hour from outside, but from inside they had tours at 12.00 and 16.00. The guide also took us to the basement of the Town Hall where there used to be houses, prisons e.t.c. After the tour we went to the Tower who had an amazing view on our own. There is a lift that takes you up and down or alternatively you can walk the uphill.

Incredible time piece. Make sure you get there 5 minutes before the hour to see the moving characters in the window when it reaches the hour. This must have been quite something 2-300 year ago! It still is today.

!. this is one of the best places in Prague. The clock every hour gives a small performance for the tourists but its not something amazing.Watch out the pickpockets that will try to take your wallets while looking at the clock.Its better to go there at around 20.00-21.00 that is less crouded.

built in 1400's. this wonderful clock chimes on the hour from 9am-9pm.a must see .hundreds of folk from all over the world gather to witness this marvel,cameras ready they will not be disappointed. watch your pockets ! pick pockets about.

Tour and Eat. We were there right after Easter and the center of town is full of vendors with the most wonderful food and local crafts. You should definitely try the skewered potato spiraled down a large stick and deep fried!

Underwhelming. The clock itself is beautiful, but the parade of figures, on the hour, was a sort of "was that it?" thing. Luckily, while waiting, a guide behind me was giving a brilliant talk about it to a small number of visitors. I'd have loved to know which company he was with. On the other hand, the trip up the tower is well worthwhile. I was expecting a stone spiral staircase and a rickety, slow lift. Instead you go to it via a very modern interior, with plenty of room, and two efficient lifts (including a circular glass one). The views are stunning, but I wouldn't like to go in high summer.

Fascinating. While in Prague, visiting the old Astronomical clock is a must. It has a remarkable design with dials showing the 24 hours of the day, the position of the sun and the moon, and also the actual position of the sun in the Zodiac. You should visit the clock just before the hour strikes, as for a couple of minutes the 12 Apostles appear in two small windows on the top of the dials. The square in front of the clock is fairly crowded, but by walking around you can always get a good sight and take photos of it.There are also several restaurants in front, where you can sit and watch.
Magnificient. Well worth a visit to the bell tower where the views of Prague are second to none. Worth the trip just for that.

Astronomical clock. It's one of the oldest and most elaborate clock ever built. It has 3 main components: the astronomical dial, representing the position of the sun and moon in the sky ,the walk of Apostles a clockwork hourly show of figures of the apostles and different other sculptures and a calendar dial with medallions representing the 12 months.Try to be there and watch the 12 Apostles appear every hour from 0900 to 2100.Usually the place is overcrowded but it's worth visiting while in Prague.
Big snow when I am at the top. When I am at the top of the clock, it snow heavily. The snow of the prague, I won't forget it in my life

"Definitely a must". I love clocks and photograph all types throughout my travels. This is one of my favorites. Every hour the 12 Apostles make an appearance and death, a skeleton strikes the time. The sun, moon, zodiac and calendar are all part of this amazing clock. The square does get crowded, but it is not packed so that you feel uncomfortable. Try to view it both during the day and at night,
Very tourist place. It is pretty, great atmosphere and the clock is beautiful, but unless you want to eat or drink, there is not much and it is usually very crowded
Astronomical Clock. Don't miss this! Stay for the very short entertainment on the hour. It can be seen from one of many cafes across from it. Then explore the market square, which is close by.

You can not go to Prague and not visit here. As the title says, You can not go to Prague and not visit here!
Many people gather round the clock to look and get photos and for the turn of the hour.
You will be disappointed if you do not visit here whilst in the area.
Love the clock tower. love the clock tower and the square, a lot of restaurants and cafe, and next to the main shopping streets. The clock looks amazing, and every hour shows nice poppets.
Very crowdy. The city is beautiful and has lots of attractions. One of them is this place, avoid on the weekends.
wow. so long back man was able to make a world clock,working till today and the only one in the world my grand kids were thrilled
what a clock. Amazing wall sized clock. Fascinating to watch and worth the extra steps to see. Even though early in the season, the area in front of the clock was quite congested.

Magical!!. When standing in the Old Town Square, this gorgeous historic building will be your main attraction. The Old Town City Hall was built in 1364, paid for by the duty levied on wine – how cool is that! The Town Hall consists of 2 prominent features, the first is the 70 meter tall tower (which we went up to – breathtaking views from the top of all of Prague) and the astronomical clock.This clock is a big tourist attraction and every hour there are 2 doors that open on either side, and the 12 apostles march past – there are symbols to the clock to read up on and legend has it the clock maker Hanuš, who perfected the construction in 1490 was made blind by the city council to prevent him from making a more beautiful clock elsewhere.The Town Hall is built in a combination of Renaissance and Gothic styles and boasts beautiful sgraffito from the 17th century. You don’t want to miss this building when you go to Prague, put 2 hours aside and just do it!
Beautiful arrogance. The clock is a work of mechanical art, but it does represent man's incredible arrogance - we are the center of the universe.

VERY TOURIST. Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock are located in the Stare Mesto (Old Town). The square is fantastic, surrounded by beautiful buildings. Very busy and cheerful, all with a beer in hand.By hitting the right time joins always a little big crowd to see the clock is running.I advise you to climb the clock tower because there can have a magnificent view of a city also magnificent.

One of the sights.. This is one of the main tourist attractions of Prague and worth seeing. The small figurines on the clock become animated on the hour, every hour. This normally attracts a crowd. You can pay to get access to the top of the tower which is bound to give a great view of the surrounding square.

fabulous expirience!. This fabulous Clock, meticulous created tells you about the son, the moon, the time... bells sounds every hour and wood dolls dance on top! An once in a life time experience! Amaizing

All night party near the old town hall and clock. The astronomical clock it worth looking at and try to be there at 12 noon. The square itself is full of life and with the Tyn towers are a great site. Don't miss the basement dungeons under the clock tower itself...there is a tour!
Amazing. So much fun to see this in action. The square is lively and filled with history! Great spot for pics!
Over crowded and overrated. The Old Astronomical Clock is over-rated but still an attraction not to be missed. Go there and see the small (show) every hour.

Time your visit. Best to come and see the clock is when it strikes the hour and you can watch with the crowds the clocks movements, after climb to the top of the tower or if you are less energetic take the lift, the views are amazing
Spectacular . Best view of Prague ever. It is in The heart of the city yet high enough to see whole city. It is very easy to acces. They also have an elevator as plus.

An amazing site..!. Want to tell the time..? Look no further than this amazing clock..! Surrounded by beautiful buildings and architecture this is a must see for any tourist - it costs nothing to look and admire..! It was 2013.

too many tourists. i lived in Prague and had to pass this clock almost everyday to get to the library. i hated everyone who went to see this stupid clock its clock get over it. this clock is a life ruiner

Nice clock in the old town. The clock is in the centre of old town in Prague, every hour people gather to see the window opening and the dolls rotate and the bell rings with nice sound. Good place not to miss.
Another one of the Top Sites to see in Prague. Take the time to understand how this clock works and.........take the time and money to go up in the tower for the views!!
Need to see when in Prague. Astronomical Clock is cute but quirky - need to see it when in Prague - amazing how it just keeps going after all these years!

Amazing. Highly recommend visiting this.Totaly worth it!
*Vistit Astornomical Clock at 6pm and you will be abele to experience something very unsuall,but I promise that you will enjoy it.

Get up the tower after you watched the clock. The astronomical clock is of course a marvel, especially when you hear the story of its origin and the fate of its designer. But after you have enjoy what is arguably the most beautiful medieval square in the whole world, go up the tower. Many people miss that to their detriment. Buy the ticket to the right of the clock and go inside some 50m to the left from the clock. You can take the stairs or an elevator. From the tower, you will have the whole Prague lie open in front of you and the hustle and bustle below will transform into a distant rustle. Enjoy.
clock. Beautiful, be there on the hour to see the trap doors open to reveal Christ and his disciples appear,

Go on the hour to see the apostles and the skeleton ring the bell. Fascinating to see how complex, intricate and accurate the clock maker was, even if he was subsequently blinded by the burghers to stop him replicating it!! Allegedly then climbed a ladder and 'threw a spanner in the works' which kept it out of action for a century. Get there a little early to get a good view.

Must Visit. This old town Hall astronomical Clock is certainly the very first thing to see for every visitor. You will get the feel of how old this city's history is. The Clock strikes every hour and thousands of people come to watch it. During our visit we came across many couples exchanging their wedding vows in front of this clock tower. An experience I will never forget

timing is key. it may be the best attraction in Prague but it's very important to know when to visit it, as thousands of persons, literally, wait for the 6 o'clock strike to see the splendor of its mechanical movement, where the 12 disciples walk and the statues shake their heads to remind us about the most essential thing in life...the best time to visit is 8 am, when the city is sleeping, and when u can enjoy the movement, and have enough space for individualized pictures...a good tip: if there is a police cordon around it don't try to walk between the crowds...just a take a turn around and find your best spot, near the art passage.
good view. Worth a visit. Great views from the tower. Sit and have a coffee in the square and watch the clock change on the hour
Chimes. The clock chimes on the hour and the crowds gather about fifteen minutes before. Hardly worth it in my opinion, but to each his own.

Love the Astronomical Clock. Maybe it's the engineer in me, but I enjoyed watching the clock go through its paces. While some may be underwhelmed by the clock, they seem to ignore its long history. Go see the clock and enjoy the little things it does.

Time is of the essence . The Astronomical Clock is conveniently located in the old town and is symbolic of Prague. It's amazing that this astronomical clock is still functional and utilised by people to tell the time. At specific timimgs, you get to view the little figurines moving, but the area around the clock gets really crowded then. Worth visiting in the early morning if you want to marvel at the intricate design of the clock and capture a beautiful picture, uninterrupted by tourists.
Beautiful square. The clock is situated on an old square. It's a fun place to go for a drink outside and enjoy the view.

Astronomical clock. This clock was fun to look at and even more fun to watch. On the hour a golden bird appears and there is a 30 second show from the clock. It gets very crowded at that time so scout a meeting place once the show is over. They did a good job of restoring the clock after it was partially destroyed. On the side of the clock you will be able to see part of the pry building which was destroyed.

Beautiful Clock. I was wondering why everyone was standing around as I hadn't heard anything about this clock and then it started to ring its old fashion but beautiful, after I was told I should be careful in the area as people go around trying to get things out of your bags while you are busy waiting and watching the clock. I didn't have any problems.

A must see!. This is the oldest astronomical clock, and a must see when you are visiting Prague. The animated figures are set in motion hourly, and the clock itself is absolutely stunning. Don't forget to take in the history behind it, leading to its' 2005 restoration.
Nice to look at. The actual movement is somewhat disappointing, but the clock itself is beautiful to look at. Very crowded at the top of the hour. Keep close control on your valuables in the crowd.

Interesting.... Expect tons of people. We even saw a wedding take place there! It's neat, worth it to wait for the hour, and see the clock. Lots of tour guides around with umbrellas...definitely worth it! A good overview of the area, and very friendly guide.

Wait for the Golden Rooster. This clock is centuries old and strikes on the hour. There will be huge crowds around the clock but you can see it since you are looking up. Watch the apostles go through the windows and the skeleton ring the bell. Wait for the end when the golden rooster flaps his wings and crows.

center of it all. Quaint, historic, and easily accessible. What is not to love? We stood with the scores of tourists watching the clock chime, and it was corny and fun all at the same time. Definitely take the time to join in this touristy activity.
Amazing Clock. Our guide told us that when the mechanic finished constructing the astronomical clock, they blinded him to make sure he wouldn't make another one!!!

Beautiful mechanics. This is a must see if you are in the city. It allows you to admire pieces of Czech history and the brilliance of Master Hanush and his amazing astronomical clock which has no match.
Borring. That was very borring to watch. There where soo many people very time ones in a hour. But they had a very good restaurant, just in front of the watch.

Great View of Old Town and Castle. Out of pure luck, we arrived at noon in December to the masses surrounding the structure, while the bells called out and the wheels were turning. There is a visitor desk inside the main entrance to provide details of the areas within the structure. After wandering around the buildings, we hiked to the top of the clock tower. The views at the top were worth the exercise (elevator available) but it became quite crowded and tortoise-like. I was pleased to see a patron enjoying the view from a wheel-chair on the outside platform at the top of the tower.The 360 degree views of Old Town from above were second to none and provided a great starting point for our day of touring. Clock souvenirs were sold at the entrance/exit of the tower including different pocket watches of the "clock", T shirts, and other small items. The various souvenirs appeared to be of qood quality for the price and most were not available elsewhere in Prague.Worth the visit if you can handle the crowds.

Clock Tower & Clock are Amazing. The clock tower is a great place.You must go to hear the clock ticking at every hour and see the amazing scene that happens.The clock tower is amazing ( with fees ) and the best place to go there is at sunset.The view from the tower is amazing with great view for the Old Town square and the beatiful traditional Prague rooftops.I would definitely go there again.

Beautiful!!!. We paid to climb the tower inside the Town Hall. The view was epic! Only thing that slightly worried me was the hand rail at the top was lower than waist height, I was a bit frightened to go too close to the rail and the space you have to walk around was tiny. The astronomical clock is amazing! Beautiful! It chimes every hour and the 12 apostles peep out to say hello. Only thing I would say is the area gets very crowded when the clock is chiming the hour, please be careful of pick pockets!....

Awesome story and architecture!. First off you can see the at least two different eras in this clock. You can see where repairs were made to damaged areas. Not a big deal, much of Europe is messed up due to the wars and revolutions and what have you. But the detail and thought, not to mention the blood sweat and tears that went into making this thing is mind boggling! Upon first glance you can see the clock and you admire it for it's beauty. Then you see the clock working and the 'show' that happens every hour and you realize the time period this was made in and you have to think 'holy cr*p'! It is a thing of beauty and is a must see in Prague. The good thing is that if you start at Prague castle, head over the Charles bridge you walk straight into Old Town and to the clock, so it doesn't take and extra day or anything like that. Prague is know for it's beauty and original work beacause it wasn't affected by the war like so many other countries were. It makes you think what if all the other countries still were intact? The beauty Europe must have had before the war!Anyway, back to the tower. The walk up is a mini workout, but the views are worth it. Sometimes there are lines and groups around the clock, so come early in the morning to avoid this. We were there one morning at 9 am on a Thursday and we had a clear path to the tower and up to the top. We got to take tons of pictures with our family and then left as people started coming. Best to do that for this particular attraction more so than some others.

Clock tower plus views. Walk or ride the elevator to the top of the Clock Tower for nice views of the Old Town. There isn't much room at the top so be prepared for crowding and a quick visit. Downstairs and outside, be sure to see the Astronomical Clock do its thing at least once. The hourly "show" is very short so read up on what all is going on--pictures of saints rotating, birds calling, skeletons moving, etc.--to get the full effect. Amazing to realize the clock is hundreds of years old and still working so well. Get there a little early for a good view and watch out for wedding parties (and their attendant cars--the only ones allowed in the pedestrian-friendly square), especially on weekend, as civil ceremonies are conducted right next door.

The clock is amazing!. Didn't get the chance to go into the hall but the clock is really amazing and looks fantastic like something out of a movie. It's really worth going to see if you get the chance.

Worth a visit to the top. The astronomical clock is definitely a work of art and well worth seeing as long as you don't mind sharing the experience with a few hundred other tourists taking selfies in front of it. Going to the top of the old Town Hall is a must though as the views from the top are amazing. It is a tight squeeze once you are up there and there is a lot of jostling for space to take pictures, so it may be better to wait until later in the day to go up when it is less busy. There are great views from the top with information boards about the surrounding buildings. There is a lift that will take you up and down or a slope if you would rather walk! Worth the entrance money if only for the views. Card payments on the 3rd floor of the old town hall if you prefer not to pay by cash on the ground floor.
Exclusive. Disliked, lots of people, specially at peak times, when the figurines moved. It is important to be careful because there may be a pickpocket.
Pretty. The square was full of people and a bit too busy for my liking , but the clock is certainly impressive and worth a visit

Every hour on the hour!!. Lots of fun, big crowds but friendly happy people a must to see!!
Charming city center and so many paths to walk leading to great shops and restaurants.
Loved the energy.
Neat to see and pay to go to top!. It was a very neat thing to see and we paid to go to the top of the tower and we were happy we did! There are amazing panoramic views to be had! Great photo opp.
Has an elevator and ramps!. You could do this attraction almost entirely without stairs, and there is an amazing view! Try climbing the tower at dusk or after dark.

Interesting legend. Love the legend around this clock, and was interesting to learn about how it works, however hourly "puppet show" as it was referred to was nothing special and lasts about 20 seconds if that! You gotta see it though and at least its free!

Information over load. This is and amazing contraption with all sorts of animated characters but it is a little over whelming without a guide or some written explanation. You need to arrive a few minutes before the clock strikes the hour. It is accurate but not intuitive to the casual observer.
Amazing . It's so amazing watching that clock working after all these years. You will see it once and come back twice and again and again...
"Advanced clock". This is a "must see" while in Prague. Easier a little early in the morning - we saw weddings but later in the day it is very crowdy here.
