A must see in Prague. It's in the center of the city of Prague and something hard to miss. One will wonder how centuries old technology still works. It is one of the must see places in Prague.

Not a must see - but you will see. When we arrived at Prague around 7 AM in the morning, we did not have any idea where to go. So, we found our way to Old Town through the new town. On the way, we had Trdlo - amazing!When we entered Old Town through a lane which had Sex Machine Museum, we saw Starbucks Cafe and a giant clock. It is none other than astronomical Clock. I never knew that the clock is one of the main attractions of the city. We saw the event at 9 AM. It was good. Buy I was a little disappointed but gave a thought that given it is 6 centuries old, it should have stood out in those days.When we were free walking tour(A must), He told the story of the clock - then I felt it is amazing. you never know - what you like and dislike!!!
Really cool! . Me and my partner loved this! It was really busy, packed with locals and tourists. But we were able to get a good view and enjoyed the show put on by the clock, it really is magical.

Loved it!. Apparently some people find this underwhelming, but perhaps that's because they're comparing it to today's loud, garish electronic entertainments. Remember when this clock was built: it's medieval, for heaven's sake (pun fully intended), installed in 1410, and an amazing technical achievement of its time! We found it absolutely charming, and beautiful too. It goes off on the hour, every hour, incidentally. Not to be missed!

Make Sure You Go Up the Tower!. This clock is so interesting! To think this was designed so many years ago is mind-boggling. Make sure you take a free tour, or have someone describe all of the parts so you can truly appreciate it. Don't miss going up the clock tower to the lookout point. Beautiful views all around Prague. There is also interesting information about the process of the clock all the way up.

Got to be done. So, the clock chimes on the hour and hundreds of people watch it for the half minute this takes. It's not very exciting but that's not the point, it's a landmark that has to be seen. It's worth going up the tower though to join the crowds taking photos of the rooftops and views and there's a quirky lift up if needed. You can also go underground. Worth a half hour.
Hourly display. Not quite the fantastic display we had been led to believe! however, very ornate and when it works on the hour vast crowds gather and all seem to leave a little bemusd!

Fantantic, gothic and cryptic. I think this is one of the most amazing things to see in Prague, a city that is packed to the gills with tourist sites. Do wait around for when the top of the hour to see the clock in play. You'll know when it's about to happen because there will large crowd waiting. Stick around for a few minutes after the clock is done. The crowd will have dispersed and you'll have time to get up close the clock, as close as you physically manage, and not have to worry about in someone's way. This is a must do in Prague.

Can't go to Prague without seeing this thing.. It is a wonder. I do suggest going to the Municipal museum to see the replica of the original face, close up. Watch out for the abundance of "opportunists," aka con artists and pickpockets.Saw more of them there than anywhere else over the following week down the Danube.

Best way to see the Apostle Figures. Book onto one of the English tours - not expensive and it is really worth the time and cost. Includes a peek at the figures which appear on the hour at the 2 small windows as part of the Astronomical Clock. This way you get to see them up close and in full. The tour also takes you underground and explains the former structure of the town and how the level of the ground has been raised over time and the city built above where the original levels were formed - fascinating!

Be There on the Hour. The king made sure to blind the clockmaker so he could never build another clock this pretty and interesting. Be there on the hour to see the apostles make their appearance and the rooster to crow. The clock doesn't chime at night, so you'll have to go in the daytime.

An essential viewing.. Ok, this review is complicated.As an actual attraction this is dire, in fact its the second most disappointing attraction in Europe (#1 is Mona Lisa).The puppet show lasts about half a minute and wholly underwhelming.As a feat of detail and engineering this is fantastic and still surpasses most modern horology (google it you simpleton).If you just go to the clock and watch the show this is a one star, however if you read the history and understand what you are watching then you will be impressed.So since I'm arguing the toss I should give it an equal three however.add it will just take lead than three minutes of your time to go see I'm giving it a five and saying go, watch and remember this is more advanced than modern timepieces.
Beautiful!. The clock is amazing and it is the oldest Astronomical Clock that still works in the world. It is very nice to look at and is a lovely landmark to mark the Old Town Square.

Iconic landmark of Prague. Many people say it is very overrated. I actually enjoyed it. I was on a walking tour and the guide explained how it works somehow. It is pretty interesting and you have to visit it anyway when in Prague!

Astronomical clock. . Absolutely amazing. A great landmark on Old Town Square. Can't walk past it without taking lots of pictures. The exterior is gorgeous, and the clock fascinating to look at. Visit it every hour.

The Clock Tower is the heart of Prague. Fabulous photo op and a must see. In a great location; if you are in Prague at Easter, the Easter Markets are located just around the corner from the Clock Tower.
fantastic views. Reasonable price to go to the top of the clock tower, the views were fantastic. also well worth turning up on the hour to see the clocks slightly cheesy performance
clock. An interesting construction and worth looking at but a bit disappointing when it struck the hour. Very popular area with masses of people taking pictures

just loved it, the atmosphere, the beautiful buildings the hussle and bustle, the market stalls.. Reatraunts & food stalls galore. Such a beautiful place. We waited fr cock to chime to see the 12 apostles, rooster crowing and skeleton shaking. v sad story to it but worth the visit. Amazing to see how a man hundreds of years ago could design and make it and it will never g out of date.

An interesting sight. The old Town Astronomical clock is an interesting one - it rings by the hour and has several figurines moving along in a cyclical manner. While the chiming of the clock every hour was a bit overrated (considering the number of tourists who assemble under it and wait with bated breath) - the look and structure of the clock was definitely unique.

Popular and fun part of the town. The whole display takes place at the strike of each hour when the mechanics of this giant clock puts together a great display with all the apostles. The crowds gather around almost every hour and if you are keen you could also climb the clock tower for a view of the city. The location of the clock tower in itself is pretty interesting. Located at the old part of the town, there are so many options around.
Get there on the hour. Stunning spectacle on the hour to see the clock work. Impressive range of buildings which now make up the whole of the town hall.

A must on your visit to Prague. This is a must see site when visiting Prague - go see what happens when it strikes on the hour. Such a beautiful piece of history to go along side it.Well worth climbing up to the top of the tower and having a look around (not very expensive). However towards the top could be better managed as there was a lot of congestion trying to get up and down a very small spiral staircase - the traffic lights don't work as well as they should. Would be an idea to have a member of staff at the top to ensure people adhere to the one way system as this slowed it down for the rest of us keeping to the rules! Nevertheless, stunning views of the city and beautiful on a clear day.

A landmark not to be missed.. One of the most iconic attractions in Prague. Tourists gather at the foot of the astronomical clock every hour on the hour to see the spectacle of the 12 apostles parading across the top of the clock. Surprisingly, the apostles, the symbolic figures and the bottom clock were apparently added in the 1800s, but the rest is truly medieval, together with the tower and most of the Old Town Hall building.For a small fee, we went up to the top of the clock tower, one of the best ways to see the best 360 degree panoramic views of prague. Also, the building houses the public toilets, the cheapest in town, with a mere 1p admission charge!
Worth a look if you are in Town Square. Interesting historical architecture - worth a look if you are in Town Square already. It is very busy with tourists.

Hourly 'show' not worthy of the hype. After reading about the clock, I had my doubts, but since it is one of the biggest attraction's in the city we didn't want to miss out. The first time we arrived as the bells were chiming, unaware that the 'show' takes place just before that. We came back the next day and waited with the crowd, heads looking up, to watch. While from a historical perspective it is pretty cool, all that you see is a rotation of the apostles passing by, which lasts about a minute. I agree with some of the other reviewers that the tower/clock would be best viewed at a time when it wasn't mobbed with onlookers. That said, it is an 'experience'.

Amazing clock. On our many walks around this amazing city of Prague we saw the clock many times there are those people who find this disappointing (fools)get the history of the clock it is around 600 years old the oldest working clock of its kind and the small display on the hour every hour from 9am-9pm is fantastic also climb the tower views are amazing
Amazing clock. This clock is a show in it self. Try to go there and see the amazing show when it rings. There is always alot of turist at this side, so stay together. Old, but outstanding clock.

A must.. Don't expect a mind blowing experience. But consider when this was made. Wait AFTER the crowds disperse a bit (on the hour) and then look at it. It's actually quite intricate and cool. If it's not too crowded, climb up to the look out. The roofs, the towers of churches...it will get stuck in your memory. I prefer the winter months, as the people load is less than warmer times. Watch your pockets and DO NOT EXCHANGE one on the street. You will end up with worthless pieces of paper (sometimes cut up newspapers). I still see people doing it (despite a gazillion warnings in every tour guide book).

Always draws a crowd. One of the more interesting sites in Praha, try your best to go when there aren't mounds of tour groups taking pictures in front of it (early morning and evening). Notice the detail and craftmanship of the machine, but also its vibrant beauty! Loved it

Symbol of Prague with the Charles bridge. The clock is beautiful and unlike its equivalent in other capitals, it has the advantage to be very low so that it is easy to see it clearly. Don't miss the striking of the hour 8am-8pm (9pm in summertime).

Beautiful!. It was absolutely beautiful to see such a clock. After studying it a bit in university it was neat to be able to see it up close and personal. It is also located in such a beautiful square. There is amazing gelato right across from the clock in a little restaurant as well! Every hour the clock has figures that move and you will know because the crowds around it get quite large so if you want to have a good view try and get there a bit early.

Ok. Pretty average but worth seeing and it's a good photo op, so pay a visit and enjoy the market. I dont have more to add, but i am forced to write at least 100 words, so you can go to the next review if you would like. You readed this also right? Well, sorry for keeping you here that long. Here is an extra tip so your time was not wasted reading, pay to go the tower for the view.
pretty clock but dont need to spend a lot of time there. worth the visit to have a look at this quirky clock. its really pretty, what you see is what you get
Quite disappointing. It looks great thought I was hoping for more to be totally honest. I did not quite get the clock. But the tower offers a great view of Virgin Mary's Church.

Get educated. If you have no idea about the clock and just sgo see it it will seem silly and totally dissapointing. IF you read about the story of it, the person that created it and the fact it is one of theoldest clocks working still with the originally system is totally amazing. Don't miss going into the tower (there is an elevator) You will have a great view from the city and they sell a pocket watch for 15u$a super cute as a souvenir

Lovely building. The Astronomical Clock is really beautiful. Every hour the little figures move and a crowd appears around the clock. It only lasts a few minutes but its one of those things you should see when visiting Prague. We didn't go up up as it was very hazy and we wouldn't have been able to see anything but definitely next time

View from the Tower. Felt that the clock was a beautiful, historical piece, but the hourly "show" was not worth the time. Check out the clock (but don't linger) and instead pay to climb up the tower. The views are incredible.
Atmospheric. Lovely atmosphere in spite of weather being changeable. Market stalls giving off delicious smells, lots if places for a coffee or beer. Fab.

Fantastic views and interesting visit. Climb to the top rather than taking lift. Lots of interesting things to read on the way up. Once there views are spectacular so choose a clear day to do this. Very busy but there is a one way system so you can walk all the way round and take photographs. Really enjoyed the visit.

The clock's just okay, but climb the tower.. We eagerly awaited the hour to watch the clock--it wasn't that great but when you consider how old this clock is it's pretty amazing. My 11 year old loved it, though. I thought the view from the tower was breathtaking--was nice to climb up after walking the streets, I had a good feel for how the city was laid out.

First visit to Prague!. This is really worth while visiting. Not only is it lovely to look at from outside but also to be able to reach the top and see the view over the city. The good thing is that there is a lift to the top or you can climb the several flights of steps. Definitely worth while!

An antique marvel. Upon arriving in Prague, my first act was to make a beeline for the Astronomical Clock, as I had heard plenty about it and felt it was an appropriate starting point to get my bearings in the Old Square. The clock is situated just beneath the Old Town Hall and is easy enough to find; if you happen to be approaching towards the end of the hour you can't miss the queues that inevitably develop to watch the quaint display that occurs every hour between 9am and 9pm. The 600-year old clock consists of two intricate faces, and features a mechanical display every hour, where a skeleton figure (named 'Death') rings a bell prompting twelve apostles to make an appearance in the windows above the clock. The display culminates with a cockerel crowing which usually draws a few laughs from the captive audience before the crowds disperse. It is certainly worth visiting at least once while in Prague, although those expecting something a bit more substantial might be disappointed.

Place to be on the hour.. Yes, it get crowded on the hour, but it’s still fun. Also, once you have seen it you don’t need to keep coming back (one and done). If you stop and think of the technology it took to make all these parts move back way back then and then you think how this is still working after all these years, it’s pretty amazing.

Unique. Watch the clock strike the hour for the best experience and go up the tower and enjoy the fantastic views. There are information panels around the tower describing the main architectural features in view. There is a lift inside for those concerned about the upward hike.

Cool but underwhelming. Yes, go see it, but it will be better if you don't build it up too much. It will also be more meaningful if you read the information about what the different elements signify, and also how they were modified after WWII.
Great place to visit. Great place to visit - the place is buzzing and a lot of history and the old town is a great place to hang around and eat outdoors.

Fascinating. This is a very fascinating and beautiful clock which is definatly worth the visit. We saw the clock both during the day and at night and was great both times. If you do not have time, the little 'show' it performs every hour is not really worth it, so do t worry if you miss it!
Quintessential european central square. Get yourself a beer from one of the local cafes and enjoying people watching around this beautiful old square.

Very nice clock. However to be pushed in huge crowd full of pickpockets is nerve-racking experience for just few seconds of show - try to get here really early in the morning.The observation on the top of the tower is recommended.

Disappointment with Clock. You have to look fast or you have waited in the cold for nothing. Crowded with tourist on each hour. Somewhat of a letdown. Would have liked to climb tower to get above city; but time did not permit.

nice but really overcrowded. The old part of Prague (place, clock and surroundings) are very beautiful, but masses of tourists make it impossible to enjoy it. As a tourist myself, I don't like the fact of Segways going around and plenty of guides offering tours or how much thai massages, etc.there are now surrounding the area.

solar eclipse. We happened to be at this clock the day of a partial solar eclipse and was amazed to see it showing on the clock. The black orb of the moon was covering the golden sun. Amazing something made so long ago is so accurate even today

Not thrilled. When we eventually managed to get there at the right time we were rather underwhelmed. But you have to go and see it and watch it at least once, the surrounding square and architecture is a must see.

The location of this clock is nice but the clock itself is just ok.. I love the location of this clock: Easter was alive, celebrating the resurrection of Christ. It's gorgeous with the Easter market going on, however, the clock itself if beautiful but waiting for the hour to strike was another thing and not worth standing with the crowds.

Beautiful clock - look past the crowds! . The clock and the tower are definitely very beautiful. But beware there are a lot of tourist, especially on the hour to see the show. We loughed when we saw it, a little over rated but fun nonetheless

It's intresting yet not spectacular. This beautiful piece of art/engineering is stunning to look at yet the hype around is overrated. If you are in the square & it begins to chime then watch it. Just don't go out of your way to view it.
No need to see the show. The show is really nothing special especially when you don't know the meaning behind. Visit a free tour or check the internet to understand it

What a fabulous clock - it's a must see. On recommendation we seated ourselves for a coffee in a cafe opposite - it is exceptionally crowded as it comes up to chiming. It is an incredible piece of workmanship. So much happening to try and watch all at the same time.

Oh how we laughed. If we had a penny for all the tourists that said ' is that it ' as the clock chimed and did its performance on the hour. Quite what you would expect from something built hundreds of years ago I don't know. It's besutiful, it's charming and its quaint. I loved it, but then I like old things. It's not all singing and dancing but worth a peek if your visiting the square. Plenty of places to sit and have a coffee whilst you wait.
great. Lovely atmosphere in theis square. Must go and see the astronomical clock. There are lotts of bars and restaurants to choose from for food/drink. Try a coffee in the Cafe Paris.

Lovely. This is a must see in Prague, the building is spectacular, as are most buildings in the square, but the clock is truly wonderful. About ten minutes before the hour it gets very busy as everyone wants to see the figures appear at the clock doors on the hour.
Lots of hype, not really much to see. It is a great clock, but the crowds gathered for an hourly exhibition that was very low-key and disappointing

Go there day and also night - Up to tower view - must.. Note: Everything I am writing and wrote is my opinion, taste and experience only and could be different to others.To think it is install on year 1410 and to build it took many year and also to add the dolls took around 80 years. Amazing!Must see it in a tour and I recommended also to see at night the clock, tower and also the area.

Brilliant free display by clock on the hour.. Atmosphere of the area both the attraction of the building and the Easter market in the square was great however very crowded ,best to go before high season.

Amazing landmark!. Be sure and stick around for the chiming and watch the life-size figures do their tour. This is an extraordinary example of the technology of a bygone era. We've visited this spot many times and never fails to amaze.
Another must see. The clock is stunning but gets very crowded with tour groups and people wanting to take photos around it, in front of it, etc.
What a clock. Never seen anything like this, it was lovely and the Town Square is a real treat. It is crowded but then it's unique, you just ahve to see this. Wonderful.
View from the Tower is excellent!. It was fine wether and we could enjoy 360° view of Prague. You can see how the city is well preserved.

Recommended With a Few Qualms. The building itself is absolutely beautiful. Definitely take the time to wait in the crowd to see the clock. Although somewhat anti-climatic, it is still a neat bit of history to take in. If you decided to go to the top of the tower, plan your trip wisely. We went during peak hours and it was really unpleasant. It felt way oversold to the point of being dangerous. People couldn't move. Of course there were some people also trying to go against the flow of traffic in an already too crowded area. It is good for some photo opportunities but perhaps it is best to go early in the day.
Nice view at the top of the tower. Nice views from the top of the tower and the area was filled with many shops, restaurants and a quaint marketplace to enjoy local crafts, food and drinks.

Land mark and not to be missed to see it chime. A must in Prague, watch the magic unfold when the Astronomical Clock chimes. Beautifully preserved and kept and a must during the day and in the evening.
fascinating clock. a must see for everyone in the area, wonderful square with great restaurants near by, food not expensive and very good, or stop for coffee and a sweet bite.

Beautiful Building. From street level the clock itself is a beautiful piece of architecture. We went up the tower of the clock to look out over a Prague and what a fantastic view. Bit busy but to be expected. Is a must see.
The best view of Prague. Hearing the story about the astronomical clock was simply fascinating. Worth taking the trip up to the top with breathtaking views of the city from high above.
astro clock. delicious and cheap it had a great location and a great staff, food was well made and nicely presented, wine presented was good
amazing piece of clock. The astronomical clock is amazing. The story behind it is very interesting as well.Within the same vicinity, there are a lot of interesting places as well.
Whimsical and beautiful. The history and meaning behind the clock is amazing. Be sure you read up before watching so you can catch the meaning of each figure.

Fascinating look at how previous cultures regarded time and the earth's relationship with the surrounding planets.. This is best experienced after researching the importance of the clock online. We saw this clock as part of the "Prague All Inclusive" tour (highly recommend George by the way) where the guide was describing in detail each of the three faces of the clock. This narration from an informed historian really helped me to appreciate not only what I was looking at but also the historical significance of the clock.

Busy, busy, busy.. Visited on a lovely sunny morning. Had a wonder around looking at the many stunning buildings and then opted for a drink on the roof terrace of the U Prince Hotel. Great views and not overly expensive. Watched the clock on the hour - I was somewhat underwhelmed! Lots of Easter market stalls and buskers one of whom was truly talentless but we thought that he was " performing" for a dare! Overall we enjoyed it.

Old Town Hall - Tower. The Old Town Hall was established under the rule of King John of Luxembourg in 1338. A monumental prismatic quadrilateral tower was constructed in the second half of the 14th century (69.5 meters hight). The town hall chapel was built in the first floor, dedicated in 1381. The most devastating were the events of 1945. Under the Town Hall area , there are spaces, which were created on the level of medieval terrain during the 12th and 13th century. Large Renaissance window from 1520 with the inscription Praga caput regni - Prague the Head of the Kingdom, in the middle of the group of Gothic houses remodelled to form the Old Town Hall. The view from the Tower is ranked among the most beautiful ones in "hundert spired" PragueThe historical centre of the town, included in the UNESCO Heritage list.The Horologe on the Old Town Hall Tower was contructed in 1410 by clocmaker Mikuláš of Kadaň, it was reconstructed in 1490 by Master Hanuš named the Rose. The calendarium with scenes from the life of country people is a copy of the original by Josef Mánes from 1864. The statues of the apostoles created after 1945, when the original burned down, sculptor Vojtěch Sucharda. The most ancient is the central astronomical-astrological part, based on the geocentric conception of the planet motion and representing the chronology method of thet time.
Incredible. What can be said about this beautiful clock which is so much more that a clock! Really should be seen as part of a tour so that you fully understand and appreciate what is going on.

Try and go on the hour for the spectacle. The old town hall is a pretty special building There are 3 clocks here and if you get there on the hour you can enjoy the spectacleThere is a tower you can climb if you are fit and the view is amazing from the top
Iconic Time Piece. The Astronomical Clock has a lot going on. Best viewed at dusk or dawn, or when later for more rings. It really is very pretty.
Picturesque. We just happened to be at the front of the clock as it stuck 11' it was very picturesque and beautiful,

Must watch the clock.. The famous astronomical clock puts on its show every hour - for a full 26 seconds. Not to be missed, this is definitely worth watching. The incredible animated figures warning of death and hell to the ungodly were created over 500 years ago but still work with amazing precision.
Got to watch !

Amazing clock. Something to see, blew us away just to see so many people standing camera in hand waiting for the action. Which in reality didn't last for long, however it was still very special to see.

Very crowded. The square is in the heart of the tourist district and is very crowded. We were advised to watch our pockets but did not have anything stolen and so were happy. The clock itself is a wonder and even at two O'clock when we watched it, it was difficult to know what time it was telling! Still it was very enjoyable, and the square and amazing buildings along side were nothing short of wonderous. It would have received 5 stars if not for the hordes of other tourists.
Disappointing. Not as impressive as expected. The revolving figures are high up and not that easy to see. I didn't think it was worth the time when there are so many other things to see in Prague.

See Prague; see this clock. If you visit Prague you will want to go to the old town square, and you can not visit the square without viewing this clock. Then you are caught! Because once you see the clock you will want to wait for the hourly performance when the figures move, the doors open, the death statue pulls the chain to ring the bell and the cock flaps its wings and crows.Luckily, there is lots to see and do while waiting for the next performance. There is beer or mulled wine to drink, baked goodies to nibble, sausages or pork during festivals, and lots to see including you fellow tourists. If you have time you can also climb the stairs to the clock tower. It's a good time,

Absolutely wonderful. Lovely to see, as everyone says get there before the hour to see it in action. Very crowded tho but worth a few push and shove to see it. Decided after tho we could see everything and relax having a cocktail or snack in "Hotel U Prince" just opposite.

iconic!. Loved seeing this clock because it is such an iconic part of Prague. It’s absolutely stunning, so colourful and ornate. We did see the show when the clock struck the hour and honestly don’t think that is a must see part of it (not to say it wasn’t cool to see, but I don’t think you HAVE to go at the top of the hour). I would recommend looking at the clock during the day and after dark as well, as it looks so beautiful when it is lit up at night. We paid the equivalent of around 4euro to get to the top of the tower. This was a highlight of the trip for us! SUCH a wonderful view of the entire city! There is an elevator that takes you up to the top or you can walk up too. Don’t miss the clock or the top of the tower!!

Fun to Watch, Crowded, Watch Your Belongings. Come to the clock just a little before the top of the hour to watch the action. It's free, fun to see, and usually crowded. The spectacle lasts fewer than 10 minutes. This is a pickpocket's dream. Keep an eye on your belongings and you'll be fine.

A quaint, world-renowned sight. Old Town Hall and the Astronomical Clock are a wonder. Every hour crowds form to watch the procession of saints (carved figures) that appear. Try to get there well before the hour, and I would suggest sitting in one of the many cafes that face the clock and enjoying a beer or wine while waiting for the hour. Also, the Town Hall Tower is worth visiting for a panoramic view of Old Town Square. This is a very gentle attraction; just let the experience soak in!
Simply amazing! The oldest functioning astrological clock in the world!. Prague is absolutely beautiful and so worth the trip. I would go back to this city over and over again.

Pretty cool. We were there right at 2:00 in the afternoon. There were far more animations than I expected. I would have enjoyed some information about the clock, but I probably just need to google it.

Amazing. Be there early, 10 minutes before the hour to see the 'spectacle'. If you are not there right in front of it, you do not see all the movement going on.This, like many buildings in Prague, also has old horror stories. One is about a craftsman who was asked to restore the clock. He refused to believe that he could not work on the clock when it was working and so he took it apart.Within a year he got very sick, went crazy and eventually died. People still believe it was because of the curse of the clock
Best view. As simple as that: the best view of Prague.The price is reasonable and the best thing is there are elevators taking you up all the way.
keep on coming. every time it is overwhelimingaccording to the legend the eyesight of thecreator was taken, that he should not repeat his masterworkit is amazing even after all the centuries passed

Beautiful in night, must eat Czech dessert 'Trdelnik'. The Astronomical Clock is one of the attractions of the Old Town Square. There is lot of live music (don't forget to tip the artistes!). Street food that must be tried includes sausages and the yummy Czech dessert TRDELNIK.Its great to spend some time sipping beer, coffee or wine. One good shopping destination is Erpet shop, which is right in the square.I suggest a visit late night for a great experience at Prague

Tick Tock. It is an amazing clock. It is worth your time to go see something different. It Astronomical clocks were created at a time when it was not necessary to show the minutes on the clock. A moment of time did not matter much. The tower clockmakers created separate dials to show the minutes. You have to be there early, 10 minutes before the hour if you want to see the 'show'. At every hour there are numerous people coming together. They can almost ruin your experience if you are not there right in front of it and you do not see all the movement.

Simply great!. This is peace of art.Totally impressed. You can not miss it.After seeing and selfying on the bridge, do not hesitate to walk all the way to the Staromestky namesti through Karlova street.

Best clock ever seen. Only in Prague for two days but made sure I saw the clock strike the hour three times. The history and mechanics are amazing. Get a pamphlet on how to read the many faces and hand. We were there for an eclipse of the sun, so the hands were even more special as the moon was sitting over the sun on the clock. Very special memory and go up the tower to see Prague at night with all the beautiful lights. Truly fairyland.

The clock will take you back in time!. The Old Town Sqaure (Stare Mesto) of Prague is dotted with historical artifacts.. from old buildings to new restaurants. We were there a few days before Christmas, so the town square had turned into a Christmas Market- with lots of food stalls, warm wine stalls and knick-knack shopping, along with a lot of crowd and music. Worth experiencing. Going back to the Clock, it is one of the most well-known and popular places to check out while in Prague. I was a bit disappointed by it, however, when I took a closer look and go to know the history behind it, I was happy. If you can, you could buy tickets and climb up the stairs of the clock tower and have a bird's eye view of the Stare Mesto (Old town square).

It's what's inside that counts!. The Astronomical Clock is one of the highlights in the city of Prague. However, many people only take the time to catch the clock on the hour and grab some food in the square. The greatest part about the tower is what's inside! Take the tour underground and see the old dungeons where they threw prisoners! Or tour the top part of the tower and check out some behind-the-scenes action of the saints spinning in circles up close. There is so much history and beauty in the tower and I highly recommend spending a morning there!

Easter market. I had been looking forward to this as its somewhere I've wanted to visit for years, when we arrived we were surprised to find the Easter markets had started which added to the atmosphere. The bars are obviously more expensive here but that didn't spoil it and would definitely visit again.

Somewhat underwhelming but still a must see. The Astronomical Clock is somewhat underwhelming by today's standards but is really impressive if you consider the time when it was made. Definitely worth checking out although don't expect too much at the 'show'. There are nice views from the top of the town hall (and public toilets in the tourist building).

Worth watching on the hour. Everyone will gather around the clock on the hour to watch the doors open and see the 12 Apostles move around on the inside of the clock. It's silly but fun and lots of people gather for this.

Amazing. Join the throng and get your camara at the ready and join everyone else vying to get the best view of the famous clock. There are plenty of cafes from which you can get a reasonable view so you can sip your overpriced beer and watch everyone else with their cameras.

Amazing. To see this clock is amazing. It chimes every hour and there are hundreds of visitors there every time it chimes to see the doors open and the twelve disciples appearing as the clock is chiming.

What a clock. Real master piece of clock making The clock is really beautiful! A person must have a background of it's workings so read up about it. You should be standing in front of the clock when it chimes to experience the thrill.. Not saying more as you have to experience it yourself.

Just a beautiful piece of history. The astronomical clock was my 12-year-old's favorite thing to see in Prague. We were there for the 5 o'clock 'show' which is very brief. Nonetheless, it was a great place to be at any time of the day. The area was also decorated nicely for the Easter holidays to come. And there was some really great music by local musicians. Overall a very enjoyable experience.

Unbelievable! Beautiful!. The clock is really beautiful! Be sure to read about it so you know all that you are looking at. Be there, right in front when it chimes! A site you will want to video. Some of the shops have small replicas you can buy to take home.

Restaurants, sidewalk café's, shopping, street entertainers. Lots to see here. The main square has much to offer and there are many upscale shops close by. We were entertained by local street musicians, mimes, and artists in different forms.
City is preparing for Easter and decorates for this holiday as it does for Christmas.

Largest Cuckoo Clock Ever?. I waited around for the top of the hour to witness this amazing piece of machinery dating from the 1400's. It is simply amazing to consider this level of craftsmanship dating from that era. There is plenty to do around the square in the meantime while you wait. Take a few minutes to research what everything on the clock symbolizes, to enjoy it more and give the context of what you are seeing. A must see in Prague

Very Special Clock. A unique clock - The clock was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still working.The Orloj is mounted on the southern wall of Old Town City Hall in the Old Town Square. The clock mechanism itself is composed of three main components: the astronomical dial, representing the position of the Sun and Moon in the sky and displaying various astronomical details; "The Walk of the Apostles", a clockwork hourly show of figures of the Apostles and other moving sculptures—notably a figure of Death (represented by a skeleton) striking the time; and a calendar dial with medallions representing the months. According to local legend, the city will suffer if the clock is neglected and its good operation is placed in jeopardy and a skeleton, mounted on the clock, was supposed nod his head in confirmation. Tourists gather in front hourly to watch the Apostles appear in the windows above the clock. Many interesting stories and legends are connected to this clock so it is worth having a guide

Engineering marvel. Based on the age and accuracy of this clock, especially given its size, it is simply mind boggling that this feat was achieved when it was. While in the Old Town Hall square, you can't miss it. Also, if you use an iPhone (and I'm sure there are several others that do the same), there is a Panoramic pic feature. Don't forget to wear this feature out on your visit. I was able to get an outstanding vertical pano pic of the clock that I simply couldn't get with my regular camera.

Must see but not for what you think. The clock strike on the hour is rather underwhelming however it is great to watch people's reactions to it as they all realise the clock does very little.Be aware of all the Segway tour people about, great fun but gets annoying when they ask you all the time.
Very interesting sight to see. The astronomical clock was beautiful! The concept itself is very interesting. Make sure you get to the clock on the hour to see it change!
Classic!. very beautiful, but short! Come a bit earlier and take a beed or brandy in cafe oposit the Clock. We took slivovica and really enjoyed it!
Amazing Clock!. If you do not go to Old Town Square and see the Clock strike on the Hour then you missed the best FREE attraction in Prague.It is a one of a kind clock!!INDESCRIBABLE- must see!

Every hour on the hour, watch the crowd form!. We saw this on the off chance and didn't really understand what the big deal was. Much better when enjoyed with a tour guide - ours explained the history of the clock and how to read the various hands. We didn't go up the clock tower, although it would be very entertaining to watch the crowds reactions from a height!

spend some time to see this interesting old clock in action. such a cool place. there is a tourist center in the building to the left of the Clock so get all your maps and info there and then get going...there's lots to see. Also worth noting, all McDonald's restaurants have nice free maps of Prague. One of my regrets is that I didn't get to witness the clock in action. I see on you tube it's quite something to see.

Lovely sunset. Sunset looked good here. Nice little open area with two towers surrounding it. The astronomical clock... well, I think we walked straight by like five times before even noticed it. Nothing special about it - bet it doesn't even keep in time.

As the word suggest -it's astronomical !. Monumental clock in the center of Old Town Hall. One can also see the position of celestial bodies on it. Always crowded where people would wait every hour by the hour for the clock to strike and its interesting to hear the history behind it so make sure to get a tour guide :)

The Ancient Gem. The astronomical clock is simply unforgettable and mind-blowing. Ancient, beautiful, brilliant piece. One of the best things i have aver seen in my life. I would go to Prague again to just see the clock (and probably also to eat the roast pork from the stand behind the clock :p ). The figurines around the clock move hourly, so just wait until the time for the 'attraction'. You're probably gonna need some time anyway to stare at the clock, trying to figure out how it works and even how they could build it in the 14th century. Just amazing, you cannot skip this one!
As time goes by. Great place to soak up the wintry atmosphere, especially in the cafes opposite, with hot coffee and brandy its worth a sit and watch the crowds watch the clock, take your camera.
A little overrated. Try to go with a tour guide so you know the history of the clock. Otherwise it's not that interesting.

Popular and busy attraction. Very cool to see the clock finally, along with the 200 or so other people standing around with their selfie sticks. I would suggest early morning would be a good time to go to beat the crowds.
Fun. I know the locals think we're crazy, but this is fun to watch and listen to golden chicken crow at the end. Like they say, it's a little bit anticlimatic, but still fun.

beautiful. the cafes, history, the astronomical clock everything is just magical! In the evening, one can see the various street performers performing and simply enjoy the Bohemian evening and good beer.

Pretty cool but not breath-taking. The clock is definitely cool, and you would be remiss to skip it, however, you might end up being a bit disappointed as it is not as impressive as the pictures make it out to be. You should visit the clock on the hour though, because each hour (from 8am to 8pm, I think), two little windows open and you get to watch the twelve apostles walk by while a skeleton rings the bell. Interesting and it just might put a grin on your face.

Lovely. A bit of a walk from where we are staying, but certainly worth it. Lots of side streets and sights to see. The clock was amazing and climbing to the top was a must. Too many people using the lift, but you miss out on all of the information boards and history of the clock and the tower. Wow, amazing view from the top and with the weather today being clear the photo opportunity was just stunning.

Was Expecting More. Good to look at, as crowd gathered atmosphere built and then... well couple of figurines move at top(nearly missed them) chimes rang out and a then a bit of a "is that it " feeling, worth going to but don't expect wow factor
Cool!. Amazing history and enjoy the show every hour. don't miss the history part as you will remember it forever!

Prague Highlight. On the hour a parade of the disciples appearing at the little windows. The chimes operated by Death. Astrological symbols. Old Czech time based on the hour of sunset. What's not to like?

Second oldest mechanical clock-be amazed by how to calculate time(atleast for two zones), date, holidays. You need to understand how to calculate the time(specially for two zones), date and holidays before you are amazed by how it used to work in those days. Just viewing it won't thrill you. You can climb the tower by stairs or using lift. Entrance is chargeable. But the beauty of Prague from the top will be worth the money paid. Also, please be reminded majority of the staffs here will be mentally or physically challenged. A huge achievement by the authorities for promoting this. One of them will explain to you in good English how to proceed for the clock calculation. But if possible, please buy something from them(very cheap) for their efforts. Also the washroom is cheaper than rest of the city.
well worth waiting. You have to be there early before the hour to get a good view as the area is very busy but well worth seeing
Complicated clock.... Again...I'm not much of a historian but the clock was really interesting. On every hour there is a little 'show' which is interesting as well.

Too crowded, too touristic, waste of time. Prague is indeed beautiful. However there are few sights that are too touristic and too crowded - and one would better avoid them. Prague main square in one of them (Charles bridge is another). It is full with restaurants that offer touristic menus, guided tours swamp the area, and street vendors aggressively try to offer tours, concerts and other attractions. I really didn't enjoy the sight, it doesn't offer any authentic value, I enjoyed much more the surrounding small streets without the mass of tourists
Crowded but awesome!. This is probably one of the most crowded attractions in Prague! Tourist flock the square to witness the Clock strike by the Hour!
Lacks sting. Even though it is a nice piece of work, it lacks some sting. It has a lot of meaning and history, but the whole movement on the hour is overrated. Go and see, but don't expect much.

Have a beer and watch the clock.. This place is buzzing, especially on the hour when the clock does it 's turn. We sat in the bar and watched as the crowds gathered and on the hour the spectacle began. Watch out for the skeleton pulling the bell as the saints go by.

Clock is overrated. Prague's astronomical clock is one of the most iconic landmarks of the city - along with Charles Bridge. Hundreds queue to see it chime every hour.While I wouldn't advocate missing it - I was disappointed. It's just a chiming clock. Yes some mechanical figures move around - but if it wasn't so old no one would be in awe. Let's drop the act, this isn't much of an attraction.That said, we went to the top of the tower for 120 crown each (around £3). We weren't up there long as it was very crowded. However, the views are fantastic and it is well worth seeing.

a bit disappointing. The clock itself is excellent but the chime movement was a bit disappointing. we waited in rapt anticipation, camera at the ready and on the hour we blinked and nearly missed it!!

Impressive. This clock is just amazing!! It is a must in Prague. I would recommend to look for the meaning of every single part of the clock (figures, decoration, drawings...), not to miss anything when you see it. Maybe it is a good idea to book a tourist guide there (some of them are free). Usually it is so crowded, so we decided to see it for a second time with less people in the early morning (8am). What a surprise! it does not work at that time, so be careful and go later.

Christmas Market. We had the pleasure of being able to attend the Christmas Market and it was such a beautiful sight! We actually got engaged next to the big Christmas tree! Its the perfect place to see! The clock is so neat to see!
The clock is a marvel of mechanics. I am happy I was with a tour because it took the guid a good 10 minutes to explain all the functions of the clock: Brilliant!

A slight disappointment. I was slightly disappointed of the outcome when the clock hit the hour, making simply chimes. One of the statues rung a bell and a cockerel comes out to shout. There are also religious characters rotating at the top which actually look quite scary! This beautiful clock did let me down, with a great exterior, I really did expect more

Great view from the top. The view over the square from the top is not to be missed. The light was great in the afternoon. The clock is stunning and you must go during the hourly chimes to see the show although it is a little disappointing it is still worth seeing. It only chimes from 9am to 9pm and it gets very crowded around the clock then. Watch out for pick pockets in the crowds!

Don't get over excited!. Loved this for it's non-eventful entertainment! The clock is lovely to look at, but the fun comes on the hour as the crowds gather to watch the opening of doors to see the characters rotate around. Worth being a part of, but it's not overly exciting which makes it quirkily fun.
The famous Astronomical Clock. don't miss this! It doesn't that much time to see it. The details are so beautiful! Just be careful with the pickpockets.

must do in prague. there is always something happening at the old town hall square. someone will be singing or performing an act and if nothing you will see huge crowd waiting for the clock to finish the hour so that they can enjoy the musical animated characters which come out of the clock. It's nothing extra ordinary so don't waste much time. if you happen to be there 15-20 minutes before the hour then do see it, otherwise move ahead.

Interesting. Worth seeing at night....find a good spot to wait. An interesting attraction well worth the wait for the chimes and animated figures to make their appearance. A quirky end to the performance that was quite unexpected

A must do in Prague!. You must visit this area if you are in Prague and visit the Astronomical clock! it is a must do, also enjoy the flock of tourists moving around the vibe that Prague gives you! it's not like any other place, there is something here that gives you that spirit of adventure!

watch out for pickpockets. the shops and restaurants right here are grossly overpriced, go a little deeper into the city to get better prices, the clock is beautiful, and the area is also very nice, but watch out for pickpockets since this is a heavy tourist area. do a little research on the clock beforehand or take the free tour from just a little ways away and the information can help to understand the clock and appreciate it that much more. also, it chimes every hour from 9 in the morning till 9 at night, then it doesnt so there's no use being there hours early or late.
astounding. the clock with all its features is a thing worth seeing.You should wait for the clock to strike its hour when all the activities begin. There will be a crowd waiting/
still crazy after all these years.... I saw this clock for the first time at least a decade ago-and no visit to Prague is the same without standing a few at the base of this amazing creation!

popular. Every hour, a little animation takes place in front a large crowd. It is worth seeing it if you are there around the time it happens. But I don't think it is worth waiting 30-45 minutes for it.
Clock disappointing. Everyone stands waiting for the clock to chime,with cameras posed.Try and look at the figures under the clockface as well as the apostles coming out.Worth going up the tower.
Great view from above the Tower. The view is simply awesome you get to see Prague from all sides its really great view. I recommend to go up the Tower & take some photos you will enjoy the view.

Fascinating. It would take me a day to give the details if this wonderful work of art. If u only see one thing in prague u must see this . Not only will.u have the pleasure of seeing this multi century clock work. But all the intricate details that went along with the work the man put into it

Make sure to get some background info. I saw this attraction on my way to a free walking tour. It seemed rather over-hyped and amused me how many people would wait around for it (I wasn't disappointed because I had heard that it was one of the most ever rated attractions in Europe). However, towards the end of the walking tour we ended up back at the square and once again i was waiting for the clock to strike on the hour, but this time the tour guide was explaining why the clock was so unique, all of the stories behind each of the characters and it really did impress me!

Fun place where people of all sorts gather to watch.. It's a very unique timepiece, with a lot of other information too - tourists gather in crowds to see the action every hour. The square it's in is full of great eateries and fabulous old architecture.
Well worth the watch. A very iconic clock, get there a bit before the hour to make sure you don't miss anything. Earlier in the day the better to avoid the crowds.

Just beautiful. Went to Prague "as a complete tourist", but without really planning anything, so I didn't get to see the clock ring the hour, but even without that, you can enjoy the details and the beauty of it.
The square is also worth spending a little time, enjoying the wonderful architecture.

Amazing Clock & less amazing town hall :). The clock is a work of art, you might want to stay here and see the procession every hour _ i ahve doen it once - and it is interesting enough - But, be warned this area is mobbed, and you need to be careful of your things.I would advice going round the corner, and up the tower, you can see the clock and the square without the hustle below!
Amazing!. This clock is just incredible!. The surroundings are also a joy if you love photography. You can't miss it!

Love the Clock!. The Astronomical Clock is well-worth a visit. We were fortunate in that we happened upon an English-speaking tour group so we listened in on the history of the clock, which was really interesting. We were there in early March and it was fairly crowded, can only imagine the crowds in high season. But, don't miss it!

Astronomical clock. The clock is lovely, it chimes every hour when a skeleton hits the bell. It's a shame the figures do not come out, they just pass a window but still worth a look, very popular with the tourists.

Don't expect much from the "show". Nearly everybody is curious about the "show" performed by a skeleton, a rooster, and and other guy...Don't expect too much, it last only for 5 minutes. Have a beer instead in a restaurant nearby, and let the curios crowd entertain you.

Worth your time. The clock is amazing. Every hour it provides a great show. Beware that the show is only minutes but worth the time. Expect large crowds. Take a trip to the top. You will not regret it.

Pretty cool. I know that people are underwhelmed when seeing the astronomical clock do its thing, but keep in mind it´s been standing there for quite some time! I think it is impressive, and pretty beautiful. Old Town Hall is impressive in its own way, with its history. Take the free walking tour, and find out about these things, it´s worth it.
Get to know the past. Climb the tower and then get into the dungeons to experience the life of yesteryears. You. can also attempt to learn the functioning of the astronomical clock

major tourist spot. This area is very busy, great variety of restaurants/pubs and shops down all roads leading to area. Be warned very easy to get lost especially if you don't have a detailed map. A must to visit if in Prague

How is this 13th out of 1,210 attractions in Prague?. Maybe im missing the point of this clock but as far as I was aware it was going to be quite an impressive show. I think the most entertaining factor to this attraction was seeing crowds of people look and feel as bemused as I did. As the top of the hour passed and the underwhelming display finished I realised that was two minutes of my life wasted.

Beautiful. Loved the Astronomical Clock as we were meeting relatives who were over at the same time, we spent about 3 hours in the Oliva Verde whilst waiting and meeting so had a great view of the Clock.and what it did! The town hall is also very ornate and worth a few photos.

A nice coffee with a great view. Sat in one outside seating areas drinking a beer and watching the clock-plus the odd bit of people watching-what a great way to spend an hour- they may charge you more for your beer than some of the more distant places but I thought it was worth every penny!

A genuinely unique symbol of Prague.... Be there on the hour (every hour) to watch the procession of the Twelve Apostles and the representations of Vanity, Greed, Death and Pleasure all set in motion on the facade of the Astronomical Clock - supposedly the oldest in the world still working! Moreover, the Sphere or clock dial shows the most important astronomical events: movement of the sun, phases of the moon, the equinoxes, the seasons, the days and the zodiac. This is a marvel indeed!

Beautiful. It is a really a stunning clock which such detail on it. The show every hour is brutal. I read that before going it was underwhelming and was expecting that. It still disappointed. Still glad I got to experience it though, definitely worth checking it out.

ASTRONOMICAL TICK TOCK. A true work of art . Incredible to actually see for real. Only read and viewed photographs of THE Astronomical Clock. Old Town Hall stands proudly in the square. Plenty of restaurants on main square inclusive of hotels. U Prince a must see. Food served inside and out is the same. Priced good too . Plenty of bohemian glass products to be purchased at little family run shops around this area. Pashminas hand painted. If your a handbag person well the world is your oyster here. Lovely cafes also to sit and enjoy some good cafes and nice local baking. Apple Strudels. Yummy. The different building on the square so beautiful. Bring your cameras. You shall want to show and share to all.

A treat for both art and science lovers!. The astronomical clock attracts crowds as the hour nears. While the intricate designs and details of clock, angels, saints attract some people, others are lost in the scientific details of the clock. It is a must visit when in Prague.

Of course it's a must see. Great to get some info on how it works, too. Of course anyone who comes to Prague will see the clock, but it's also good to find out how it works. You can buy a little flyer (kind of an instruction manuel!) inside the tower, or else listen to one of the many tour guides standing under it explain it. Fascinating and after all these centuries....it' still accurate!Definitely worth it to go to the top of the clock tower, too.

Go behind the Scenes. The clock itself is fun to see but nothing like as interesting as touring the building and seeing the back of the clock and some magnificent rooms. Even more exciting is the underground visit, which tells you a lot about Prague's history and the way people used to live.

A scoientific marvel and a captivating display. This is a scientific marvel and the display of the skeleton on the hour is truly captivating. End your tour of Prague in the evening at this location. There is so much else happening around the area. People throng in hundreds to witness the clock.

Fascinating piece of art, a must seein Prague!. Loved the clock, recommended that you also get to know the story behind it prior to visit! It's fascinating how a piece of art such as the clock could have been crafted and installed as long ago as back in 1410!

Great View from the Top and a very interesting bottom.. We visited all aspects of this top attraction, from standing out side the front to watch the best 45 second show in Prague as the holy figures parade past their window on the hour.We then took a guided tour of the rooms of the Old Town Hall and also the basement of the building , which is truly fascinating. Our female guide was such good fun , that our tour over ran ....bless her0n another day we climbed to the top of the tower , the weather was good and we were rewarded with a spectacular view.The lift was being serviced but it was not a steep a climb as the Powder tower.

Do not miss the one the hour display. The clock is in Old Town so you won't have trouble finding it and make sure you see the "show" on the hour. The clock actually does tell time but the baseline is from sunset to sunset so when we were there the hand was on 18 which meant it was 18 hours since the prior sunset. It also tells the date of the year and the saint appointed to that day. It also tells you the phase the sun and moon are in - for example now it says Pieces. It is very interesting. The statutes were added later as well as the apostles who move on the hour. The statutes symbolize vanity, greed, death and other characteristics. The rooster cooes at the end of the show and this symbolizes the optimistic dawn of a new day to come - even though it may not be morning when he cooes, it is to symbolize hope. It is remarkable how someone could create this clock so many years ago. Worth a visit. It is not as glamorous as many clocks (for example in Munich) but worth the visit.

Beautiful and Fun. This beautiful old clock is easy to find. I liked joining the crowd to watch the clock animate; any event that involves both a skeleton and a chicken is fine by my books. Amusingly, it's possible to hear many people afterward bitterly complaining that the clock animation is not more exciting. What were they were expecting? I wouldn't recommend going far out of your way to catch the top of the hour, but with so much to do and see in the Square, it's definitely worth popping by.
love this. my wife and I came here a week before Christmas ,we enjoyed the Christmas market both day time and night time. the clock is is beautiful , loved watching it.
So much to see. This is a great area of Prague. The clock is beautiful and be sure to experience the hourly view. Fun shops and lots going on in the square. Day or night a good experience.

You can't go to Prague and not see the clock. Be sure to get there a bit early to get a spot up front. Ignore all the hucksters working the area. Keep your ears open to hear the history from the many guides working the square.
not so wonderful. we had been told to see this amazing thing crowds gathered but we felt a little let down as not so wonderful as guides say

Amazing!. I loved this building, we climbed to the top of the tower for the most breathtaking views across the whole of the city. We then explored underneath the tower and walked round the hidden chambers learning about the part they played in the Czech Resistance of World War 2. Stunning building, don't forget to be there on the hour to watch the clock strike... a sight not to be missed!!

My favourite place in Prague!. This may be sad but the astronomical clock was my favourite place in Prague. I would recommend watching the display on the hour by the figures on the clock. It was very cute and attracted quite large crowds.

I Just Dont Get It.... Got told to visit the astronomical clock and expected loads of stuff to appear out of the clock.Nope, just 12 little men going past the top window! Was really shocked at how many people actually showed up to watch this at 10pm as we were walking back from dinner.

Can't miss this if you are in Prague. Be sure and be standing under the clock on the hour- it's certainly a site but at the same time only a clock!I would have liked to have taken a tour of the town hall but our schedule didn't allow!

Got to see!. Lovely square with so much to do! We did go during the busiest time of the year so it was totally packed, but really great vibe! Main tours of Prague depart from here, so very convenient.

Stunning and interesting. I don't think this needs too long at all, though I'm sure it's interesting to those who know about it. Cool looking clock with no doubt a tonne of history- I really recommend learning about it to make the most out of your visit, something that I didn't do. Maybe I'll get onto that now- good landmark for meeting people at- gives you something beautiful to look at and appreciate while you wait.

Iconic, intricate clock. Iconic, intricate clock with a beautiful face that dates back to the 15th century.There is a procession of the 12 Apostles on the hour, every hour.It is best seen during the day, but I would not recommend waiting for the venerated apostles more than 15 minutes at the most.So make sure you time your visit.Below the clock are 12 medallions with the 12 zodiac signs.One gets an insight into how people in the past measured time and the Christian values that they held dear.The area has many cafes and shops to browse around.Or you could watch the world go by as you amble along in the Old Town Square and take in its beautiful sights.We passed by the clock both during the day and the night, but only saw the apostles during the night.Do stop by, since it is one of the most popular touristy things to do in Prague.We didn't have the time to visit the Old Town Hall and there is a fee for it.However, the clock and the old, town square next to it are free for anyone to enjoy.
Lower your expectations. the clock is very disappointing so do not expect much, it is a very beautiful clock but the little show it does at 12:00 everyday is not in accordance with its fame.

Back in time. The Old Town Square (Staroměstské náměstí) is one of two main squares in Prague (Wenceslas Square is the other, just 5 minutes walk away). With its ancient buildings and magnificent churches, this is one of the most beautiful historical sights in Europe.The most notable sights on the square are the Old Town Hall Tower & Astronomical Clock, Tyn Church and St. Nicholas Church. Step into the Old Town Square in Prague and journey back in time, 600 or 700 years. As you stand in awe, the dramatic history of Prague permeates the air. We can have a nice sight on this place by the Old Town Hall tower.

Nice but underwhelming. Our reaction to this was not as expected, not sure why but it was not as spectacular as we expected. How about should see, not must see?We didn't go in to the building and not sure if it's possible.

Medieval design that still works. Stars, moon, sun, astrological signs, prophets. They all work together. It's staggering to think this hundreds of years old design was successfully built and still runs. Of course, it needs periodic maintenance, but still, this complicated design works. Just before each hour, the crowds gather to watch this miracle. You should too, but as always when crowds gather in any city, beware of pickpockets.

Time to be entertained. In the old square in Prague there is a clock tower known as 'the astronomical clock'.On the hour this clock not only chimes, as it does at other times during the hour, but also a mechanism cuts in which opens 2 windows and each of the apostles troops past the window. At the same time a skeleton on the right of the clock pulls on a rope which operates a bell (or at least it is made to look like that) and this signifies the death of the old hour, before the cockerel hails the beginning of the new hour. The clock also tells you the season and the date.
It's a clock. It chimes on the hour, some statues move about. That's it! You can't miss it as its on the main square and tbh we found the musicians much more exciting!

Tours . We visited the clock tower and found it quite interesting to read about the history on the way up the stairs. The 360 degree view is stunning. However, we really wanted to visit the passageways beneath the tower but the man on the desk shooed us away, telling us we were at the wrong entrance. We headed up and saw the tower and when we came back down, the last tour in English for the day was finished so we couldn't go. We were very disappointed with how impolite the staff were all around, including a woman who wouldn't let me use the toilet because I only had euro to pay her in! I used it anyway when she wasn't looking :PThe other qualm I had was how silly the little performance on the hour was! What's laughable is that there are always mobs of tourists standing gawping at it and they don't have a clue what's going on. Definitely worth a visit, but don't be surprised if you're treated rudely and be sure and find out the times of the tours in advance if you want to visit the underground passageways.

Great location. A fantastic square with lots of atmosphere & street entertainers,The clock even though it is a historic & a beautiful building, we were disappointed with the sound & we expected more movement of the figurines.

The clock is quite but really?. The crowds were deep at the clock, and I was expecting something truly amazing, but it really was just cute. The clock itself is magnificent, but don't feel the need to see it when the bell chimes.
Amazing clock and tower. Clock interesting any time, but especially on the hour. View of Prague from the top of the tower amazing

Just walk and enjoy. As most of Prague, if you just walk you'll have a thousand things to look and enjoy. There are better hours to enjoy the Astronomical Clock, I don't remember those yet but I think it is it has to be with day light near the sunset time.

Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock - Prague. Amazingly intricate clock mechanism - not by today's standards of course - and easy to understand why thing king did what he did to the designer/maker - not going to spoil the story...Rather than standing in a huge crowd on the pavement waiting for the hour to strike, we chose to sit on the terrace of the Toro Negro bar, in a comfy, cushioned armchair with a a beer instead.As the bar's terrace is raised and for customers only we managed to get a great view of the clock while avoiding hundreds of people in the December cold. This also negated any possible pickpocket situation which inevitably presents itself in every city where crowds of tourists may gather to focus their attention.
beautifully ornate and crafted. gather by the clock and see its spender beautiful clock and unique in its own right, enjoy the hourly show
unusual. it stands out you can't fail to miss it , very unusual and unique set in the old square, well worth tracking down to see.

Worth seeing in Prague. I found the Old Town Hall and the Astronomic Clock fascinating. The clock itself is a historical and engineering masterpiece. It was a great idea to build such a clock. The Old Town Hall is also worth visiting if you have some extra time. The views are very nice.
Recommend while passing. Was recommended to see the clock strike on the hour. A big crowd gather every hour. It's worth seeing, look out for the skeleton with the bell as I missed him the first time.

amazing sight. Went to this attraction and wasnt disappointed, around the clock a crowd gathers almost before the bell rings and on the hour as the clock strikes figures move around, the structure of the building is more interesting than the actual clock itself but its a must see if you visit prague

Worth a look. Go on the hour and watch the little show. There isnt much to the clock itself but we did the free walking tour and got to hear about the history behind it which made it all the more interesting!!

Loved it. On the hour every hour, the clock tower performs its dainty routine for the viewing public. Best time to catch it is at twelve o'clock. The area does get a tad crowded but it is well worth the effort.
Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful place to visit. I am not one for normally walking around looking at things but this is a must see!

Great Views, Lame Show. I appreciate the history behind the clock but don't go out of your way to watch the clock turn. It's not that exciting. The structure itself is more spectacular as are the views from the top.

underwhelming. Everyone tells you to see the clock but in all honesty I was pretty underwhelmed. On the hour you will see a crowd gathering - a bell rings, some doors open and figures move then its all over!!!
SIMPLY AWESOME!!. Praga is amazing, a must-to-see before the death, it's a very awesome city, i think is one of best cities in the world!! :)

Gee is that it. There was such a big deal made of this one...so when in Prague.......we waited and waited....then it started and then it was finished before we could say wow. I suppose it is an ancient clock...so maybe a bit more wow factor from me is necessary....sorry, didn't have it. Maybe it has changed, I was there in 1997...not 2014

Very informative tour. The guide for this tour was superb, we gained a lot of understanding about the history of, not just the clock, but also the whole history of the Czech Republic - fantastic guide. If you do this, be sure to take the tour of the underground as part of the tour. Highly recommend this

A 'must see' in prague. It gets very busy here as the hour comes round. Worth listening in to one of the tour guides giving their speech and pick up a bit of free information. There are a lot of sales people here looking to tout for business. Its definitely a spectacle to see it all in action + 75% is still original .
Not that special. You have to visit this place when you are in Prague. Take a walk to this place. Enjoy the view. Look around.

A unique design.... that will make you stare and gaze and the sheer complexity of this. The Oranje Explorers travelled here recently and not much has changed over the many years!
Worth a trip to the top to see all the graffiti etched into the inner walls!

Dont bother. See alot people crowding around this area wondering whats going to happen. At each hour, the windows above the clock opens and figures move around while the bell chimes. Total waste of time, standing around lasted longer than the actual clock moving. Its pretty scary too!!!

A must see. There are many splendid sites and sights to be seen in Prague but the Astronomical clock is a must on your list. I won't spoil it by saying what happens but please take the time to Czech it out.

Beautiful, but overrated. The square is definitely worth walking by (the tourism office building is gorgeous) and the clock is beautiful, but I had heard and read so much about it that when it came to the hour and I saw what happened I was actually disappointed. It's beautiful and worth seeing, but you don't lose anything if you don't see it on the hour (and that way avoid crowds).
Stepping back in time.... We loved spending time here - such an olde world feel about it! The crowds built up as the clock was nearing the hour.

Astronomical Clock. Don't just rush into Old Town Square to see the clock and move on to the next destination; take some time, enjoy a beer and watch all the action in the square. If you are lucky, there will be vendors selling Prague Ham roasting over an open pit or Czech Sausage, both of which are wonderful. As for the clock, get into your position about 20 minutes before the top of the hour because about 10 minutes later, all the walking tours show up and it is difficult to get a good spot once they herd into the place. When the clock strikes the top of the hour, the show is really amazing.

old town experience. I stood with hundreds of other people in the charming old part of Prague on a chilly day,anxiouslywaiting to see this amazing clock strike the hour. Right on schedule the characters came out to greet us and then retired for another hour. Awesome. Afterwards I joined a few new friends and we went upstairs in a nearby restaurant for coffee and were treated to an incredible view over the rooftops of Prague. Some of my best photos.
Really interesting. Great time lovely clock we managed to catch the Chinese New Year celebrations which was just fab really good good at the restaurants and reasonable prices
Overhyped!. Frankly, found the entire hoopla around the clock to be funny. There was such a crowd to see this clock, but nothing extra ordinary. Over hyped, must say.

Stunning. A must - relatively cheap but what viewsThe lift construction is absolutely fabulous and has won many design awards. Make sure you buy the leaflet on the clock - explains the History and workings in plain and simple English
Fantastic views. Well worth a trip up the tower for the views. Reasonably priced and has the option of walking or taking the lift!
now you see it - now you don't. you can't be late for this performance on the hour, it last such a short time you will have to come back an hour later.
Very lovely. Some people say it's one of the most disappointing attractions in the world, but I found it peaceful and lovely. Just focus on how it would look for a mediaeval mind.

Clock worth a look but definitely make sure you visit the tower. The clock outside is quite quaint, it's hourly spectical is worth a look if you are nearby at the right time but not sure it's worth a special visit on its own. However, the tower it sits within is well worth a climb. Access it through a door to the left of the clock. Top tip, there is a big queue downstairs for tickets, go past it and up the stairs and you will find another ticket office with shorter queues. There is a lift inside to make the journey to the top easier, although apart from a short spiral staircase the whole way up is on ramps anyway. Top was quite crowded when we went but you can stay up as long as you want and the views of prague and the square below are really lovely.
The striking of the clock. Join the crowds on the hour in the Old Town square to watch the clock strike, it's a popular fun 10 minutes!
It't jsat a clock! Not.... Every day a crowd gathers to see the Apostols. Weird and wonderful experience! It takes you back to the times when that kind of mechanical skill was deemed magical.

Engineering at a different level. To stand and look at this just brings home how clever some people are. Whe workings on it are just spectacular. As others have said it is in the old town square so is just part of the whole beauty of the square. Another must to visit even if it's just to say you have seen it.
Is a Clock, with some old figures. This one of the most less interesting things to see. Is a extremely beautiful clock, but is no more that that.

Watch it on the hour. It's so gorgeous, and all the little figures move on the hour, amazing piece of engineering and by all accounts the guy that constructed it had his eyes burned out so he couldn't create another one, but he saw them all off by throwing himself into the works of the clock so it didn't work for a hundred years cool!

Happens to be in the Old Town square - not a trip on its own. It's very impressive to look at but don't plan a trip around it. It happens to be off the Old Town square which is worth a trip. Not sure this merits its own category as it's one of the things you'll see when you visit the square and look up as you go past. But it is beautiful.

Great Starting Point!. Old Town Square seems to sit right in the middle of everything and it a good place to begin your exploration of Prague.
