The tour through this old building is worth the time, interesting in it's history topped by a great view from the tower. The clock itself is a masterpiece of machinery in that tells so much more than time but don't expect fireworks on the hour. Two panels slide open, little figures of the apostles, turn by the openings, and then the clocks strikes the hour. A bit anti-climatic but fun just the same.

Beautiful!. Went with high expectations of the show on the hour! The clock is stunning and is one of the main attractions to see, but the display wasn't as grand as expected and only lasted a minute or two. Still an experience to see the the 12 Apostles peering down at you. Pretty different to anything else I have seen, and definitely worth watching during the day and at night. It can get a bit of a crowd around it, but I imagine it would be crazy-busy in the summer. We heard you could go up the tower for some good views and that this was open until 10pm however we were there around 8pm and it seemed that it was closed for access which was disappointing. It was also supposed to cost 110 CZK which is a bit pricey when you can get other views for cheaper.

Appearance of the clock is excellent but.... What it actually does is a bit disappointing. A guided tour is worth the money as you are taken underground to the original street level. Also, take a trip up the clock tower as the view is spectacular.

just wow. located in the old town hall. mostly can be clubbed with a self guided tour of a day. this in itself does't require much time. it is advisable to read about it before visit or reach out to a guide to learn it's importance. it looks amazing. a pic in front of it is a must.
Great view from the top. Absolutely mesmerising to watch but a complete let down on the hour! Worth the walk to the top of the tower for a panoramic view of Prague.

Positively surprised by the astronomical clock. Apparently it is one of the most overrated touristic attractions in Prague, however if your guide explains the functions of the clock properly, I wouldn't claim it is overrated...
Astronomical Clock. A must when you visit Prague - stand and watch the characters come and go on the striking of the hour - time waits for no man but this is worth a minute of your time!

You have to go and see it. Some people think its overrated, some people don't think it's rated enough. Personally, I think it is it what it is; a stunning astronomical clock that is amazingly difficult to understand without someone explaining what you're looking at. Oh yeah and every hour some of the figurines move for a couple of seconds and everyone watches open-mouthed with anticipation, and when it's over, people disperse feeling either confused or amused. Don't expect a big show, and find the humour in being surrounded by people expecting more. Watch as confusion washes over their faces, laugh at the rooster "crow" at the end and then tell everyone back home that they must go to Prague and watch the Astronomical Clock.
Listen in to a tour. The clock itself is impressive but when you hear about all the different features and see it in action you gain a new respect for its creators.

Great :) well worth a visit . Great trip up to the tower. There's lifts which is great. Overall happy we decided to venture up as the last time we visited prague we didn't go up the tower. Great views over the city

A quick visit to the clock is worthwhile. The clock is a must-see, especially as it only takes 5 minutes max and it's free! It will chime and move on the hour, but make sure you get there a little before the hour to get a good spot to watch it as it gets very busy with tour groups. We also paid to go up to the top of the tower. We did this at night and it was lovely to see Prague lit up.
Amazing clock!. The astronomical clock is incredible even the story of the inventor is really sad. If you are too good bad things can happen.

"One of the world's most overrated tourist attractions". The old town is beautiful. But the review of the clock is a bit exaggerated. During the day what you see are different kinds of travel groups from different countries occupying the small area in front of the clock who are waiting to see the magic while young and old doing all sorts of funny selfies. Kinda distracting huh. Anyway the story behind was much more fascinating. So stick to your tour guide, especially the guy named Michael of Sandemans, who makes your whole trip a joyful and knowledgeable one.

Don't miss it's run at the hour. You can also visit the tower where the Astronomical Clock are placed and see the Prague from the top. You need to pay a fee for going to the tower but I can highly recommend this.

MUST SEE .....AND try to figure how it work?. Is really an eye opener and knows the story how it was built ! The town hall which lots of people do not want to go, highly recommend that to up to tower and see the full view of Prague from here.

Great views from the clock tower. Well worth to visit. Great views from the clock tower. Great history. Catacombs under that building are amazing. Clock is a piece of art. All those moving parts and figures. A must see when in Prague.

Absolutely Stunning.. I will keep this short. As visitor to Prague I would not have missed seeing the Astronomical Clock on the wall of the Old Town Hall in Old Town Square. There are many sites that will give a highly detailed description of this beautiful object, my purpose here is simply to suggest that this is well worth visiting. It strikes me as truly amazing that the clock has been around since 1410 and over the centuries has undergone a series of transformations, arriving as we see it at the present day. It has variously functioned and not functioned over the years for one reason or another including significant damage sustained in 1945 from German anti-aircraft fire. It is maintained currently by a group of highly skilled enthusiasts. Absolutely beautiful,not too be missed.

dont miss this time less feature. its ll part of the square go down the wrong street and you miss it the detail is awesome didn't go inside but view out side was beautiful the entire block i must have taken a ton of pictures

Prague astronomical clock. If you go to Prague, you must visit the Old Town Hall and its Astronomical Medieval Clock built in the XV century. It´s a wonderful machine that has been preserved, and it is the oldest still working.The clock not only includes the figures of the apostles, a skeleton and the representation of greed and vanity, but also all astronomical science, it shows the years, the months, the days and the hours. The rising and setting of the sun and moon, and the zodiac signs.Every hour several tourists meet in front of the Old Town Hall tower to see how the clock strikes the hour and the 4 figures of the clock set in motion, as well as the presentation of the 12 apostles. All the figures shake their heads. It is really nice and beautiful.Nearby you can find restaurants where you can taste local food and the Pilsen Urkel at reasonable prices. But also, at the end of the day, in the afternoon you can also try a local sweet fresh bread rolls (Trdelnik) and other kinds of breads. They are served hot. You can see how they are prepared in a roasting grill. They are delicious, and some places serve them with hot wine. I include one picture of them. The price is in local currency.

Wonderful. This is a must see attraction when visiting Prague. It is amazing that the trades people of long ago crafted such beautiful masterpieces, which is admired by generations of tourists. The clock chimes at regular intervals and when the light is angled correctly, the colours and stonework is magnificent. We did not use the outdoor seating in the covered bars as they catered for the tourist market with high prices.During the Christmas markets we ate from the stalls and the hog roast together with the local bread and brew warmed us up.

lovely place to spend a few hours everyday. The tyn church, astrological clock, St.Nicholaus church and the many beer options make this a wonderful place to stop by everyday while in prague just to people watch and soak in the beauty.

Lame but still a must-see. The mechanics are pretty boring indeed, but when you go with low expectations it can be entertaining.Anyway, the clock itself is really beautiful and complex and you can't really miss it (you shouldn't and you probably won't even if you try). It's in the very center of the city, where you will hear live music, start your tours, change money with the best rates, find some good food, etc. It's a great reference point and truly a masterpiece.
The view is great!. The Astronomical Clock is interesting to see. However, for a fee, you can go to the top of the tower in the Old Town Hall for a magnificent view of Old Town.

Disappointing. We were really looking forward to seeing this but found it rather a let down. There was a collective groan from the crowd when it finished so quickly as people were saying 'Was that IT?" as they turned away.It is pretty, and do go and see it if you are there, but don't make a special journey.

I expected too much. It's an amazing sight considering when it was built, but without thinking about that I was expecting a much more elaborate display. See it for the historic interest but don't expect Swiss-cuckoo-clock style choreography.

Magnificent Timepiece. I had the good luck to see the Astronomical Clock chime on the hour. Well worth the wait. I read that the clock maker was blinded by the contractor after completion of the clock so that it could not be duplicated. I purchased a small version of the clock and it keeps perfect time.

It is a kind of magic. The Old Town Hall was established in 1338 as the center of the Old Town administration. The complex consists of a beautiful Gothic tower (for a fee, visitors can climb to the top to experience terrific views over the Old Town) and a unique astronomical clock.The astronomical clock, installed in 1410 on a wall of Old Town City Hall in the Old Town Square, is the oldest astronomical still working clock of the world.It is a kind of magic to see, on the hour, every hour, "the procession of the Twelve Apostles" and, in general, the clock in function: everybody stays still and silent.

Its Okay. In the middle of old town there is this wonderful clock from the middle ages and it was a wonder back when it was built , its interesting in that aspect. You won't really go out of your way to see it if your in old town plaza but by todays standards its not more than interesting

Astronomical Clock. Found out afterwards that there was a stairway in the Old Town Hall. Would have loved to have visited this. The Square around the Old Town Hall was buzzing with all kinds of activities - performers, etc. We had to return 3 times to the Clock to catch the 2 windows with 12 apostles dancing around inside of the clock with an encore from the Cookoo bird above these windows. Finally! Worth the trips back to the Clock.

It's a clock.... Admittedly, the clock is interesting, but do this when the weather is nice and you can sit at the adjacent sidewalk cafe and watch it cycle through an hour of so. I was there in December and it was mobbed due to the Christmas market, which was very good, but it was too chilly to stand and watch the clock for very long.

Amazing clock. Its a must see when you visiting Prague its free to see but i would turn up way before the hour to get a good spot to watch the clock. It gets really busy so just beware of the crowds there also loads of shops and places to grab a bite to eat. Ive been to see the clock in Munich and i love this one more its smaller than others but i think its way cooler.

"must see" - if only to say you've seen it. Well worth tne visit if "checking things off your list" is important to you. Although just about every old world European city has an astronomical clock, the colors and movement on this one will keep you entranced. Make sure you get a good viewing spot before the hour if only to see tne beautiful blue doors open to see the 12 apostles. It is not tne brilliantly colored photoshopped clock you see on tne internet, but it is beautiful. Free to watch. Be wary of pickpockets while you're in awe watching tne clock.
Prague's ORLOJ. The best attraction in Prague, every hour you can see 12 apostels ... You can feel the histoty there. May is the best month to visit Prague.
Noon Time Never Sounded So Good. This medieval astronomical clock has figures of different colors come out and parade as the bell sounds at noon. It is a sight to behold!

Amazing Plaza. We saw this as part of the walking tour. The history behind this is just fantastic and you should definitely go here with a guide. You will learn a lot about czech republic and the history behind its origin.

Prague Old Town Hall.. Fantastic Architecture, stunning views just stand there and look around and you will get a complete 360 degree picture of amazing historic buildings that will leave you smiling.
Quirky clock. The astronomical clock is at the old town square and every hour it puts on a show.you can go inside the tower and climb to the top and get a great view over the city of prague

Do not miss this in Prague!. This is one of the most fascinating sites in Prague. Try to be there on the hour in order to see the wonderful action of the clocks. The whole square is magical. Important note: watch out for pickpockets!!
Astronomical Clock. If going to Prague a must is to see the astronomical clock and climb the tower where you can get an amazing view over the city.

Love the history. The Astronimical clock was amazing. On the hour it would chime and the Apostles would show in the doorway way up on the building and music would play. it was a great site. We also went to the top and saw a great view of the city. Lots of pictures

Beautiful. Check the amazing history behind this clock before you visit - it makes 100% more impressive!It's just a beautiful piece of history but unfortunately it does get extremely busy on the hour with tourists and cramming around to watch.We were luck enough to catch it at night time after we went on a late night stroll at about 10pm - the city is even more lovely at night! - and there wasn't half as many people around to watch.

Clock - Prague. Very interesting but be sure to be there before the hour!! A lively square with something for everyone. Took a ride in a horse drawn carriage from the square, a lovely leisurely pace, and plenty of time to admire the buildings. Well worth the money.

Make Sure you are on time. The astronomical clock is quite interesting you have to be alert to see it, there are plenty of places to eat and drink around here, be warned it gets very busy especially during the day so take care of your valuables. As to be expected the cafes are a bit expensive, though still not as expensive as home probably

You need a guide. To get the most out if the clock visit you need to be there when it chimes and have a guidebook or guide explaining it. Otherwise you will miss all the significance of the statues and clock faces
Amazing. Its a MUST if you travel to Praha.Both, the views from the Tower are beautiful and the Astronomical Clock is one of those unique monuments you have to know about.

Medievil working clock. The clock tower is great for photographers especially when the light is right, stunning in the sunlightThe little windows above open on the hour and the Saint's appear one by one, it also chimes every 15 minutesOpposite the clock you have outdoor seating in the covered bars when you can enjoy a tasty snack, meal & drink, they even supply blankets and heaters for the winter weather

OK but there are Better. The Astronomical Clock is an OK thing to see, but not on a par with other similar "clocks" around various European citiesHowever, the nearby square has plenty of restaurants, buskers etc to keep you happy. Can particularly recommend the Back Angel Bar,[downstairs not far from the clock], great service, and, at the time our visits, a great piano player.So... head for the Bar, and while you're there, see the clock

Don't Miss the Clock and Apostles. The old Town Hall and astronomical clock is well worth the visit (watching the clock is free). Be sure to come before the hour and get a good spot to watch the 12 apostles come out of the two blue doors. Also be wary of pickpockets (my Czech friends told me to be careful but nothing happened). It is a free attraction and unusual, so hey, don't miss it while in Prague.

The clock is a puzzle. I loved the clock because it gathers around the crowd every full hour to try and decipher what's going on and what it is that it is actually showing. Additionally, it looks like a time machine and it is just lovely to look at.

View extraordinaire. The clocks great, just to watch the faces of those gathered to watch it do its thing ...on the hour. Great views from top of tower but can be very busy and a bit squeezed at the top!

A Must for All Travelers to Prague. we got to the square just before the clock went off and the square was packed. But there are a lot of things to see and do around the area. The cone-shaped dough baked over an open fire is yummy. You must try it.
Very pretty. Clock is amazing, very beautiful. Plenty of restaurants opposite where you can sit and watch the world go by.
Worth a visit. We went here a few times and always missed the clock, on our last day at the end of our city tour we saw the clock doing its thing, very interesting.
Very touristy!. Buildings are lovely, clock worth a view on the hour . Lots of bars and restaurants including the Hard Rock Cafe just off the square which seems to appear everywhere now!
Nice. Must see this place, the square, the clock, the shooping place's, restaurants is all there. But beware, the prices are quite steep
Pre Christmas break. This was a huge disappointment. The square was heaving with tourists coming for the Christmas markets. Unless you stood right info t there wasn't much to see.

stunning clock but average show. The clock itself is beautiful, the show on the hour is quite basic (I guess it was great at the time it was made) but worth a viewing
Interesting story about the maker of the clock as well ask your guide ;)
errrm. What was all that about? pretty uninspiring stuff. nice building, naff entertainment! it got really crowded too for what is a bit dull at best.

Beautiful!!!! . It really is a great thing to go and see while you are in Prague. It does its hourly show which I found to be nice and charming and definitely worth the way. 600 year old piece off history and it's beautiful. Definitely go see it while in Prague!!!

Best aerial view of Prague. There's a crowd gathering in front of the clock at every hour, rain, snow or shine. But there's always space for a great shot / selfie with the clock in the background. It's more fun if you join one of the free walking tours available to know the stories of the clock. But what's more impressive than the clock, is the view from the clock tower. You can buy tickets from the ground floor office or head straight to third floor where you can also get tickets and avoid the crowd. There's a state of the art elevator that takes you to the top of the tower and also ramp that goes all the way up, if you feel like a short walk. You can get unobstructed aerial view if the city from top of the tower. Now surrounded by glass or wires like many observatory towers are. Definitely worth paying extra to visit the tower.
Nice but doesn't measure up. The Old Town Hall is a wonderful building and houses the Astronomical Clock. While it was great to see, the Astronomical Clock in Rouen France is far more spectacular
Worth a trip!. Weird ancient animatronics anyone? Yes please! Keep your eyes peeled for a freaky skeleton too! Lots of tourists though, but its up high and on every hour so take your time :)

Climb the tower and watch the clock!. The clock itself is lovely and a good photo opportunity. On the hour, every hour this 24 hour click clicks into life. 12 apostles rotate out of the upper doors while other characters jiggle about! Make the effort to climb the Tower, views are spectacular... Lots of steps but easy for the reasonably fit... Or there is so lift.
a grate place to pass the time. a lovely spot to enjoy local café culture, enjoy the street theatre or have a snack. starting point for a lot of tours, and a selection of great pubs

We Got Lucky!. We were enjoying the Christmas Market and moved toward the Astronomical Clock as the hour approached 2. It was delightful but crowded and over way too quickly. We regrouped and purchased tickets to the viewing tower atop the Old Town Hall. Due to the large crowds we were in a significant queue and it took a while to move up to the top (at least it was warm). As an absolute gift, we walked out into the viewing area just seconds before the 3:00 show started. Wow! Looking down on the hundreds looking up and the ability to see the entire Christmas Market from above was the high point of our trip for me. It also provided the best photos of the crowd, market, rooftops and architecture of the Old Town. This attraction is not a "must" in Prague for nothing.

Amazing clocks. The Old Town is fascinating in itself, and the Astronomical clock was just divine. It is such a beautiful, intricate piece of machinery and the tourists lining up to take pictures of or with it are testament to that. You can't leave Prague without seeing it!

Compair to Munich and Rotenburg,well worth seeing. We sat right at the window in a nice close by coffee shop with good service and a good view, it was an experience. The apostles are lovely carved and it is very well done, a must see.
did not like the smoking in restaurants and public places

A must. If you go to Prague and do not see this no one will believe you. It is part of the history of the city and a most unusual clock. Read about the different clocks on the face...The square there also has an entertainer or more so it is a fun place to meet and catch a drink at one of the restaurants.

Take the tour to the top - it's worth it. For 100CKZ ($5) you get a ticket to the top of the tower, and you don't even have to climb if you don't want to. There is a funky cylindrical elevator that feels like being in Star Trek. The views from the top are brilliant and if you walk around the turret there are handy notices explaining what you are looking at at various points. I suggest walking down the steps when you leave. It is not very steep and there are fascinating storyboards along the way
Neat clock, worth seeing if you are in the area. I wouldn't go out of my way to see the clock but it is pretty cool when you are there. Prague itself is great and this area is part of the reason why.

When you are here, you are at the heartbeat of the city.. This clock is simply amazing. it is the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world. Legend says that the clockmaker Hanuš was blinded so he could not repeat his work. As retribution, he demolished the delicate workings within and no one was able to repair for hundreds or years.

Great views over Prague. We visited the underground tunnels during one of the ghost walks & went up the astronomical tower on another occasion. The ghost walk gives you some interesting information regarding the history of the tower - see if you can count the number of crosses on the market side & find out what they represent!Firstly, the astronomical clock is very impressive, but the hourly display leaves a lot to be desired. The figures kind of pop out of the little doors above the clock & it is all over in about 20 seconds!The views from the tower were very picturesque, especially having the Christmas market in the Old Town Square below. The only thing is it gets packed up there & no one seems to pay attention to the directional signs & it can be a free-for-all in a confined space! Worth the visit.
gorgeous but the moving statues are a little bit of an anticlimax. the clock is stunning but the moving statues (although lovely) are a tad of an anti-climax but we'd 100% say you should see them

something different. It is just a clock but it's impressive to see the time change because it is somewhat original.Dont worry if you miss it though..If you want to comfortably watch it choose a cafe just opposite to drink coffee and wait for time to pass.

Visit on the hour, but it's not just about the amusing clock. Enough about the clock, yes it is very entertaining but there's more to the mechanism (and the building) than a couple of mechanical doors and the parade of saints' puppets. Take time to examine the astrological and seasonal symbols, and the astonishing perpetual calendar of saints' days. It's an incredible achievement and far more impressive than the admittedly crowd-pleasing clock trick. What skill and artistry they had to design something so sophisticated based on limited technology.

fascinating and impressive. TIP: get an explanation of the clock from a tour-guide! On our first day I thought the clock-tower was great and I took a couple of pictures, but the nextday I went on a walking-tour (with Good Prague Tours) and it's infinitely more interesting when it's properly explained to you! On our last day we bought tickets and took the lift up the tower - it's fabulous and worth the (relatively low) price. The views are ace and the small plaques telling you what you;re looking at are really handy if you haven't been before! (there's a loo on the ground floor)

Must See. Set in the bustling Old Town square crowds gather to watch this lovely clock strike on each hour.
Climb the tower (or use eelevator) for a fabulous view over the whole of Prague in every direction

Book a guided tour of the old town hall!. My husband and I were the only people on the tour (early February, mid-week is quiet) and our guide was fantastic! She took us through all the rooms upstairs and below ground and gave us so much information! We saw the 12 apostles go round from the back of the astronomical clock - they are beautifully carved! It was my favourite guided visit of our tour!

For the clock and beyond =D. The sight of the clock was something that was worth visiting and would I rank it second only after the Charles bridge. Anyhow you could give this place a visit anytime as this clock was placed at the very center point to a lot of trademark visitor spot. The souvenir Street is just 4 minutes from this clock.

Amazing historical clock. The third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and oldest one still working it was first installed in 1410 (OMG and still working) .. before you go do some research about this clock otherwise it will look like a normal clock.
Clockwork. This place is packed of tourists every full hour. People come to see, what's going on in the Astronomical Clock. Must see!
Go on the hour. A great site in the middle of the old town square. Make sure you go on the hour to see the clock chime and the characters appear
Amazing construction....... A must see...An amazing thing to see should spend more than an hour in this place area is filled with lots of shops........

The most romantic tower in Prague. Many have seen the clock and it´s famous statues greeting every hour dear crowd gathered on the Old Town Square and stretching necks in order to see the show up on the side of the tower. But to climb up many stairs or take a lift that looks like DNA structure is something I would recommend to all. Especially in the evening. Just buy your ticket, grab a dear hand of a friend or partner and go. It´s unforgettable. PS: If you find a restaurant on the roof in nearby, try to find out which one it is ;-)

Interesting. I really appreciated this "spectacle", which was, like many have already mentioned, quite short (very much shorter than what I expected). It is still one of the most important things to see in Prague, and if you know the story of the astronomical clock you'll be even more enthralled.

A wonder. The astronomical clock is a wonder that everyone must see when in prauge but remember that when going to see it make sure your there on the hour so that's when the real show starts its a mechanical wonder .

impressive. There are boys offering really reasonably priced city tours around the clock: if you get there eauly in the morning you can set off and enjoy a good amount of the most recommended attractions Prague has to offer. My advice: sit down on a bar facing the clock at sunset en enjoy!
Great timing!. Well organised, good information and ultimately a great view. A lovely experience on a cold February night.

Get there on the hour. Every hour on the hour the clock does its thing with lots of moving parts. Big crowds gather in front so try get there a few minutes early and be prepared to be surrounded by people trying to take a picture!

is that it ?. saw a lot of people gathering for the clock striking the hour and then something whirs, a couple of "apostles " peek out and that's it. fair enough in the 14 century the locals probably went wild but I would have a quick look and move on, also a lot of touting & and those silver statue guys

A beautiful and inspiring piece of history. I could have watched this clock for hours. It is beautiful and the fact that it is so old and the science behind it was so interesting just makes it more special! The atmosphere is amazing - old Town Square makes you feel as though you have stepped back in time.

Rare clock. Beautiful clock tower with a rare, working astronomical clock. We also bought tickets and went up at night for a view of the city all lit up. The square below was also fun, to see street performers, food stands etc from above.

Really cool. The astronomical clock was great. Very touristy though, lots of crowds in front of it all day long. When we were there, the Christmas markets were open, so it was very fun to visit. The food stalls were great. The ham that one of the stalls had was the best ham I've ever had. By the town square near the white church, there is a tour guide company that we booked a day tour to Cesky Krumlov. I recommend them as well, we enjoyed our day tour with them. Beware of the currency exchange places around the town center, however. We got ripped off, I lost about 50 euros which is a great deal of money for a backpacker, and they take advantage of tourists. It's better to go farther away for currency exchange. Definitely worth the visit overall.

Nice view. It's very recommended to go upstairs to the tower.Pay attention that the ticket you buy is single use. Once you get down, you can't go up again and use your ticket (even if you just bought it 30 minutes ago, like we did).We recommend to watch the sunset from the top, it's amazing.

Quite a crowd gatherer. We spent quite a lot of time in the old town square as there is a good number of lovely restaurants there. The clock is worth waiting around for (although we did keep missing it) on the hour is comes to life and is quite a crowd gatherer.

Nice place. It's a must in Prague. Not so a big square as in Krakow. But very nice with all these buildings and the astonomical clock that are exceptional. Unfortunatly in the middle of the square they have put the most uglest statue in Prague ! So dark

High point of Old Town tour. Beautiful place to visit. Surrounding the square are many resturants wher you can grab a snack or meal. The astronomical clock is a wonder to see. Time your visit so you can be there on the hour when the clock strikes and the figures move around.

Impressive technology and great view. Beautiful must see. Should see once in live time. Be aware when people gather there to see when the clock goes on.
Take the tour for few dollars is worthy and beautiful view from there

A free show every hour - there's no reason to miss it. Old Town Prague is a spot not to be missed - beautiful cobblestones, vendors of all sorts, restaurants, and of course the Astronomical Clock which is a recognizable symbol of the city found everywhere (like on the cover of Fodor's and Frommer's guides!)Grab a crepe from a nearby booth and be ready to see the show which starts just before the clock strikes the new hour.

Amazing spectacle!. 3rd oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest working one! This was a very beautiful building and with the opportunity to climb to the top of the tower and look over Prague was well worth the couple krown! If you are wanting to watch the mini show every hour I would suggest timing it so that you are in the area. My girlfriend and I waited 20 minutes LOL
Must see. Everyone who visits Prague must see this clock do its thing, but join a green umberella free walking tour and you ll get a full explanation of whats happening!

Time began.... Our excellent guide explained the story of the astronomical clock, and the legend behind this. I was spellbound, learning the antiquity of this work. Someday I would like to return and get a tour of the insides of the clock, as the exterior itself is really amazing.

Great to see inside and out!. If seen from the outside, it is surely beautiful but may fail to impress. For medieval technology, it is quite impressive to think that they had this clock available...I would personally suggest going in the tourism office next to the tower, For about 4 dollars Canadian, you can go up the tower and have a lovely view of Prague, have a guide explain to you the medieval and Roman underground dungeon under the tower and see behind the tower (to see all the pulleys that orchestrate the clock and the apostles)

Best views of Prague! - May 2013. First saw the clock on a Killing Joke CD, so it was surreal finally being there. Supposedly the world's oldest working astronomical clock, a climb to the tower will give you the best views of Prague and a perfect bird's eye angle of the Square. There are tours, but it's more fun to just wander around and read the historical plaques on your way down the tower. Be sure to catch the show that the clock gives, for which people never fail to applaud. The statues tell a story of the 4 vices of man and of death ringing the bell that tells the time of our demise.

quaint but not inspirational. I expected something spectacular after reading the reviews but found it all a bit underwhelming. I am sure it is fantastic in a historical sense but as a spectacle, not so
Gorgeous. Gorgeous collection of buildings and not too crowded when we saw the clock strike the hour. I personally felt African drumming did not add to the atmosphere.

its a happenning vintage place:). I loved old town so much, at square during weekend its like a open party, so much music, every one dancing plus the food :)
the astronomical clock is a crowded place, every one waits down there to see it, its totally worth the wait though :)

Join the tour so you can trully appreciate how amazing it is.... The clock is definitely a piece of art, and a must to see when in Prague. I would recommend joining one of the free tours that start next to the clock few times a day. They do tell you an interesting story about its history, and explain how to read it. Make sure you time your visit right and actually see the clock in action. Area around it gets very busy and locals warn you to be mindful of pickpockets in this area.

The Wonderful Staré Město. The historical capital of Bohemia has a lot to offer with its beautiful Gothic and Renaissance architecture, taverns, squares and local culture. We stayed in a historical building hotel a few steps away from the heart of the city: The Old Town or Staré Město, as the locals call it. In the Old Town Square, we visited the Astronomical Clock and its 12 apostles, the Old Town Hall and its tower, for a panoramic view of the city. The square is also home to The Church of The Virgin Mary Before Tyn, a variety of restaurants, stands offering souvenirs and local food including Prague’s Ham and the Trdelník, a sweet spiral pastry which is freshly baked in front of you.

Everywhere past but always come to Prague.. Astronomical Clock is a medieval astronomical clock located in Prague, the capital of the Czech Republic. The clock was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still working.

On the must see list. The Astronomical Clock is beautiful, and chimes on every hour with a display. It's enormously complex, and our guide explained how it all worked and what the dials all meant. It's an astounding accomplishment when you consider it was built in 1410 and is still fully functioning.

Week in Prague. What a beautiful city, so much to see and do. This clock was so fascinating to look at, you can see why there is always a large crowd waiting for the hour chime. The detail of the clock was awesome. Lots to do around this area too.

So interesting!. We did a walking tour which started at the astronomical clock, the information and history of the clock is so interesting and really worth knowing about. The clock is very pretty and the building itself is just great. If you are around at the clock chime which happens on the hour it is worth watching but an anticlimax if not. Great views from the top of the clock if you pay to go up, pricey though!

Just look for the crowd, a must see in Prague.. Standing at the Astronomical Clock waiting for the main event may be a little disappointing as it is over quickly but if you use a guide you realise just how amazing it is. The guide will explain all the details to the clock and the history. Our guide also pointed out the relevance of the White crosses on the pavement which we hadn't even noticed. My advice is do as much in Prague as you can but get a really good guide it makes history come alive .

Love to look at it. Is nice to see how it work every hour, it is in real good conditions, and is so much details in it. At the same time there are a lot of restaurants to enjoy at the same time you see the clock give it shows
Time to move on. There was a massed crowd each hour on the hour. So many photos taken of so little happening. The back story of the clock maker is interesting though.
Must visit. If going to Prague this is somewhere you must go and see - magical - will keep you transfixed for hours.

Worth a look ( and a photo). Visiting Prague without going there, and taking a photo of the Astronomical clock ( complete with all the tourists trying to do the same:-)) would be silly.It is quite an intriguing and unique thing...Yes, This is worth a look.Just make sure your handbag is safe ( and guys, do not put your wallet in your back pockets:-)

tick tock there were more than mice in the clock. Architectural brilliance at its finest. Then from a childish perspective you could watch and see whether the mechanics of this amazing feat of engineering worked. I was fascinated by the many colours in the street and pathway stones.
time stood still. Very disappointing. The one in Messina far out classes it.It chimes every hour and gets very busy A bit of history

Marvellous view over the Old Town. You can get a glass lift up to the top of the Old Town Hall Tower and there is an open balcony to walk round and see the town, or you can stay inside behind glass where it's warmer.

Just magical. The clock tower is wonderful , In the whole square is such beautiful buildings it's like being in a fairytale the christmas tree was fantastic and more than once we perched ourselves in the bar opposite the clock to watch it
Symbol of the city unique!. The wonderful view from the tower! Climb anyway! The most beautiful roofs in a complex embraced!! The impressive Church of Our Lady before Tyn !!!!

Lovely area. Beautiful old square with amazing buildings and a completly bonkers clock.
Very busy during the day so explore it mearly then find a cafe and sit outside and watch the crowds.
Amazing at night. A really amazing clock tower. Try to be there on the hour to see the clock chiming and the characters moving.

Easy access to great views, photographer friendly.. We walked up the tower, with its sloping ramps for most of the climb, which are easier than steps for many - the fantastic circular glass lift is even easier for the lazy. I wanted to catch the rooftops at twilight and as the lights came on. After a full on day walking with a backpack full of gear in freezing conditions it was good to be able to shelter as I waited for the light to change. A pity nitwits choose to go against the clockwise flow around the outer path. Tourists from certain parts of the world seem determined to get their selfies and stuff everyone else.
Great tourist experience!. Amazing 16th century moving clock, great theatre. The Japanese really love it. Worth buying a coffee and cake in the square to watch the tourists/ local buzz

On the hour, Every hour!. It's great to just walk around the Town! You can warm yourself up with a yummy hot cherry drink or hot chocolate with cream for 29 cents! You can also treat yourself to a beautiful garnet - I chose something modern, not like the usual old designs and negotiated a price. They resized my ring and I went back an hour later to collect it! There are lots of shops on the cobbled streets. Every hour, the Clock will chime and you will see the famous statues moving round the Clock. It can get quite packed, even though this was winter (there always seem to be someone taller in front of me!). So get a good spot - and if you miss it, don't worry; go and have a coffee and come back an hour later, with a better space! ;0) You can also pay to climb up the tower, but we didn't bother.Lots of beautiful buildings to take a photo of! Loads of restaurants to choose from. You can also still eat outside as they have heaters and rugs to keep you reasonably warm! Great if you are a smoker as you don't have to leave your table and your partner isn't left sitting on her own while you normally have a cigarette break!
nice nice place to shop, eat. Next to the, nice place to shop, eat, or have a drinks. And enjoy the architectuur. Easy and most of the interesting places are at walking distance.
Reach on time. Be there on time, a nice experience. Make a video and cherish the moment. The whole place around is beautiful so have enough time in hand to go there
fantastic. have to be there on the hour good camera too zoom in need to be there at least twice to get all the movements too much happens at once.
great landmark. as described earlier, seen to be believed and historical landmark. Beautifully preserved, would love to go again

Must do!. This clock is beautifully created, and every hour it plays it's theatre piece, as lovely as it is outside, you must go up at night, the city looks beautiful all lit up and it's a sight that should not be missed, and you will not be sorry if you do it.

Must-Visit, Albeit a Disappointment. You can't visit Paris the first time and not see the Eiffel Tower, so the same applies here. There's absolutely nothing spectacular or breathtaking about this clock, besides the fact that it is the oldest working clock of its kind in the world. If you're in Prague, you'll inevitably be in this area anyway, so walk to the southwest corner of Old Town Square and see what the fuss is about. Do NOT wait for the top of the hour to watch the clock chime and figurines to appear because it lasts barely 10 seconds and you'll miss it if you blink. If you don't have time, skip this attraction, although that means you may also exclude visiting Old Town Square and the Tyn Church (inspiration for Disney's Sleeping Beauty Castle), which are worth seeing during the day and at night when it comes alive.

See it anyway. Well, what can I say, the clock itself is pretty smart looking and worth seeing. Obviously a great achievement to build something so complex in the days it was built. The crowds gather and wait for some sort of spectacular event, the actual show is very disappointing.
See it whilst you visit. Even in the quieter month of January the atmosphere around the clock was lovely with the restaurants filled and the square full of passers by.
top thing to see and take a photo. typical place to see and have a photo with. Available to get ticket for lift on top of the tower and have a great look

The best of the worst. The Astronomical Clock was once voted second most disappointing tourist attraction after the Mona Lisa. Build in the 1400s, it was a feat of engineering at the time. Now it's worth having a look just to watch the crowd lower their cameras, turn to each other and say 'Was that it?' You have to see it!

Great view. The astronomical clock is a must when in Prague. Every hour during the day the clock chimes and you can see the figurines. The square does get busy so you need to arrive with about 10 minutes to spare to get a good view. We also paid to climb the tower which was well worth the small entry fee. The view of the city from the tower is fantastic, although it can get very cramped at the top! Not to be missed!!

A lot of Fun to Visit. The astronomical clock and town hall are a lot of fun to see. The clock gives an interesting performance on the hour, but due to the many tourists you should arrive about 10 minutes early to get a good view. We then paid to climb the tower which was an easy climb and provided an excellent view of the city. We went to the lookout in the evening and found the lights of the city enchanting. The viewing area also has very good interpretive signage and provides good explanations about the city's architecture.

Superb views over the Square and Old Town. This is the highest vantage point over the Old Town Square. Take the elevator to the top, and you have a 360 degree panorama of Prague below you. There is a nice exhibit, with detailed explanations of the Astronomical Clock, its workings and history. Not to be missed and the entrance fee is quite reasonable.
Great view and interesting history. This is a good thing to do in Prague on a nice day. The view is very nice and the history of the tower is interesting as well as the clock.

Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. The tour of the Old Town Hall is certainly one not to be missed. To go from the top of the tower to the bowels of the Town Hall is an amazing venture through history. We loved it! I went back to the Astronomical Clock at least half a dozen times to view it's workings but on the tour I was able to see behind the clock and the apostles much closer. We got great photos from the top of the tower. Yes it was breezy and it was cold in December so take your warm clothes. I suggest you go on the tour as the tower included and better value.

Such a wonderful experience. This is the second time I have been to Prague and for both times the memory that I will hold dearest is climbing to the top of the Old Town Hall. The tower is the first thing you see when you are approaching the Old Town Square in Prague and the sight really is breathtaking. It's cheap to climb the tower 110czk each which is less than £4 and you can spend as long as you like up there. Although, be warned, it does get rather busy! You get a view of all areas of Prague once at the top and you can be mesmorized by the skyline of the city.Another thing you shouldn't miss is the 12 apostles that come out of the tower when the clock strikes on the hour. Join the multinational crowd as you watch the show, but be aware of pick pocketers. Overall, fab experience

wonderful. lovely place to be, lots of wonderful places to visit when in Prague. This is one of them. Lovely view over the city from the tower. And a wonderful surprise when the clock chimes at full hour

Interesting but not brilliant. We had this explained to us as part of a tour. It is historically significant and a marvel of engineering but as an attraction it is more reputation than delivery - a bit like the Mona Lisa - when you see it you feel let down after the build up of anticipation.In any walk around the Town Square it is certainly worth viewing - whether its worth waiting in the crowd (and there will be a crowd) for the clock to go through its motions is probably not as good if there were other attractions on your list.
When in prague this is a must see. There will be quite a crowd gather to see the hourly clock performance but it is really quite good an fun too see
Not worth the wait. Worth looking at as you pass by, but if you have to wait more than a couple of minutes for things to happen, don't bother.

A must see in Prague. The central square is surrounded by impressive architecture. We visited at the time of the Christmas markets so go for good local food & mulled spice wine! A bit crowded around the clock on strike times but you need to say you have seen it.
Tower visit. Go into the tower, it can be reached by elevator so no stairs to climb, well worth it for the views!

A Great Observatory Tower with an Overrated Clock Show. I would say the tower is the main attraction here. From above, you can get one of the best views of Prague. Although there is an elevator for the disabled, I would say that walking outside for the disabled might be impossible.The clock is great, too. It is one of the oldest and one of the most unique.However, the 'hourly' show is definitely overrated. Yet, people still wait and watch it. Lucky me, I was just passing it when the hour hit the clock.
Real beauty. Too many clocks in Europe but they are all different. This one stands out. Interesting to see but better to listen to what tour guide tells you about this clock and it's history.
Overcrowded. It's main value is great architecture which is hardly seeing behind street cafes, souvenir shops and crowds.

Great views of the city. This clock tower was built in the 14th century and it is just great. We didn't take the guided tour but went up to the top and you get this 360 degree panorama of the city so this is great for photo lovers! From memory it cost 110 crowns (~€4) so not expensive at all!

nice. if you go in Prague, you must take some time to go and see this attraction, but first read about the history of the place and the intricate design of the clock; didn't climb to the top, but it should be amazing there

Twice in two years - beautiful in all ways -. The Christmas market in the square was a lovely setting, albeit very crowded, for seeing the clock and tower in the winter. Also saw the tower and clock before a river cruise the summer of 2013 - but the Christmas Markets are a great setting for the clock, albeit the crowds overwhelming. Cold and wintery, the gluhwine was good and sights remarkable. A must see if in Prague.

Amazing clock. Fabulous astronomical clock and tower. Go up the tower for fabulous views and buy the very informative leaflet on the clock and its meanings..makes looking at the clock so much more interesting

Iconic and fun to see at the top of the hour!. The clock chimes at the top of the hour and the clock shows its amazing mechanics and engineering with the movement of the chimes, statues even after all these years! Yes, there are throngs of tourists during peak seasons but you cannot miss seeing this masterpiece while in Prague as there is no other clock like this in the world!

watch out. As with many other tourist areas watch out for the pick pockets, they wait until the cameras come out to either film or photograph the clock and try their luck..but no different than any where else around the world. Hve fun.

Excellent views. The old town hall and clock really are the centrepiece of the old town square, huge crowds gather outside the clock to see the display on the hour, it is well worth going up the clock tower I found it very intetesting how they had managed to fit a lift inside the old building, a self supporting structure of steel pipe work, if you are height sensitive it might be a bit much as the walkway at the top is very narrow but offers commanding views over the city, it's also very cold, however there is a sheltered inner area, all in all a good place to visit.

One for the bucket list. This is one of tha attractions that you have to pay a visit to when in Prague. Its a bit underwhelming in all honesty but can easily be incorporated into a day wandering around this beautiful city. I didnt climb the tower but would imagine the views are great.The outdoor bar directly across from the clock is great for a relaxing drink while waiting for the hourly spectacle of the chiming clock, but be warned its all over very quickly !!

view from tower. this is the must see place once you are in Prague. Clock is very beautiful, but don't be too disappointed if you can not see its famous hourly performance, nothing "wow" about it, it is actually on some lists of most disappointing tourists attractions. But climb to the top of tower, view is something that is worth every cent you pay for it. And I was lucky to be there on Christmas time, so even more beautiful.
Beautiful Views!. It is worth the $8 U.S. to go to the top of the clock tower. The views are amazing, the walk or elevator ride up is something to see as well. Take your camera.

A must see when in Prague. We were there during the Christmas markets which filled the Old Town Square with vendors selling hot spiced wine, ham, sausages, fresh potato chips and much more. It was a beautiful setting which we visited numerous times each day. We ended our trip with a concert in the square - it was amazing!

I'd say the view is a must do. I didn't visit anything but the tower so take my review as you will. But I am touring Istanbul, Budapest, Krakow and now Prague. I'd say the view from the tower is the 3rd best thing I have done so far. The view is incredible and you could spend probably 45min doing that. There are long lines later in the day. Cost about 110 crown for that. For people who have a hard time walking there are 2 elevators so you can get up there

Nice. Every hour there's a show (couple of minutes) and the place gets crowded but it gives a touch of magic to the square. You can get upstairs and give a look at the city - we actually didn't but enjoyed it anyway.
Panoramic View Of Prague. Take a trip up the Astronomical Clock tower to enjoy the breathtaking panoramic view of Prague. Credit card payment could be made at 3th floor.

Lovely. The Prague astronomical clock is one of those things you just have to see in Prague. It's beautiful and fascinating. You can get tours around the clock tower to learn about its history and the ins and outs of the building. You can also climb to the top of the tower and get views out over the square. It's quite good to have a guide to point out all the intricacies to you otherwise you may miss them. It's quite spectacular to get in front of the clock when it chimes on the hour too. It's a great attraction to visit in Prague.

Go Early or Late...on Your Way to Somewhere Else. The clock itself is remarkable. You can examine it with great comfort any time but on the hour and marvel at its mechanism and history. However, on the hour, hordes of tour groups with leaders holding umbrellas aloft swarm before the clock. jostling and bashing each other for the pleasure of standing before the clock. Once they have fought their way into the center of the pickpockets dream, they will witness the miracle of two small doors creaking open and small mechanical figures not really doing anything of interest. But if you must, go early or late night.

Long queues up the tower. There were long queues up the tower, you had to read up a little on the history of the clock to understand more on the significance, if not you wouldn't really appreciate what you were seeing. Lots of people standing around the clock once we were near the hour mark.

Great, but crowded. I guess it's a 'must see' if you're in Prague, along with the Tyn Church and the Old Town Square (located right near the Old Town Hall.) The astronomical clock is fascinating, but can be very busy, especially on the hour. It's worth the climb up the tower to get a great view over Prague, and one of the best views of the façade of Tyn Church (which can be difficult to see from the ground.) Unfortunately, it is very crowded at the top in peak times. A timed ticketing system is really needed.
Great clock. We waited 20 minutes in a cafe facing the clock until 10 pm when the show started, it was an amazing 5 minutes in front of the tower

Amazing!. The astronomical clock was fascinating. Our tour guide went into great detail to explain all of it's functions and how it was used by illiterate people at the time it was created. Very beautiful piece of history!

Brilliant location. I am a student from Warsaw and had a chance to visit this wonderful city with so much history. This is one of the attraction I have visited. To know more about the history, you can always look around for the free tour guides, like the one I met Petra(if I am not wrong) from the tripadvisor, gave me a brief insight about the location, Czech culture and some important places in Prague, definitely have to thank her for that.

Unique, but you need to read the history to understand the Presentation. The functions and features of the clock are amazing. However, if you did not have a local guide to point out the clock features and the movements you likely would not observe or appreciate just how intricate this clock actually is. It was great to see and an experience to remember. We were there around Christmas and the Old Town Square where the clock is located can get very crowded during the evening so be sure to make your visit in early morning or afternoon to be able to get close enough to the clock tower to see and enjoy the movements and show that occur on the hour.
Walkable. The area of Wenceslas square, Old Town Square, clock tower, Jewish area, until Charles bridge is really walkable. Just enjoy wondering around the city and see the buildings.

Beautiful views from the top. . The Astronomical clock is beautiful and on the hour every hour the little doors open with bells sounding and the twelve apostles move around in the ports. For an entrance fee its possible to climb or take the lift to the top of the town hall tower and view the city from above. Not for those with height fears as its open at the top. Well worth the visit to the top for the views alone. Visitors can also visit the basement to see city ruins of the original street level of Prague and chambers used to hold prisoners of war during ww2 and the cold war era.
Climb the clock tower, it's worth the queue. Go late afternoon and the queues are not as bad, a fantastic view and you can stay at the top for as long as you like

See the clock when you arrive--save the tower for your last day. The clock is much more complex than most realize and I admit that I haven't completely figured it out yet. The animation that comes on the hour is unexciting by today's standards, but when you consider it started in the 15th century, it's pretty amazing. Save the trip up to the lookout in the tower until you have learned your way around a little. It's much more fun to see the places you have been.You can buy the tower tickets at a booth on the side of the clock for 110 Kr per person with discount for students or kids. Tower has elevators, or you can take a series of steps and ramps which make you appreciate the tower's height. The spiral staircase at the top is especially interesting with its stop and go lights. At the top, extending the main castle in the west, the river circling the town, the Vseyhrad Castle in the south and the Zizkov TV tower in the east. Don't forget the camera for this trip. you are rewarded with a view of the rooftops of central Prague.

clock is cool at the top. Lots of people gathered at the bottom to see the clock and the top part gives you amazing views. Would recommend this for sure, it is a fun place to be especially at Christmas

Great views of Old Town and Prague. We would certainly recommend the climb to the top of the tower. It offers great views of the neighbourhood and the city. We went at 9am and beat the queues - it looked quite nightmarish after 11am. Prague Card makes it value for money. The Astronomical Clock is impressive and worth a photo with. Huge crowds surround it throughout the day so beware of those.
Very interesting. A must see! It chimes and comes to life on the hour, every hour. Look out for the skeleton ringing below the clock. Please also keep an eye out for pick pockets around this area.

Prague st Christmas & New Year great. ASTRONOMiCAL CLOCK...dissappointing.... Other sights great, Swan Lake at the Opera House brilliant.NYE fireworks watched whilst on Charles Bridge amazing but chaotic when leaving, fireworks set off in streets (scary) & lots of broken bottles n glass ..... not for the faint hearted..but lots if police prescence

Huge line worth it. I've waited more than 1 hour on the huge line but it's definitely worth to have a full view from the city! The employees there are educated too. I was a little bit dissapointed that I couldn't see the Apostols (you have to buy another ticket for that).

Unsafe and terrible. My partner and I were just strolling when we were attacked by a local lunitic with fireworks. My legs and one foot were badly hurt. This happened within 5m from the police who did absolutely nothing. What a disappointment in a city and its law and order. Beware when you are here.

Beauty and Age. We stayed just a 5min walk from the clock tower and I had no understanding of its background, but it is a thing of beauty and amazing to watch, with a little help from google watching the clock for its age it makes you wonder what a sight it would have been when created and the atmosphere of the square is fantastic everyone is happy to watch and food and drink in the area is good! The cobblestone is something to watch out for (wear sensible shoes)! Definite place to see, you feel the old town and buskers within the square are great for atmosphere too!

Wonderful people watching. This place was a fantastic place to sit and watch,people and just take in the atmosphere. There are plenty of outdoor cafés where you can grab a cold drink and just relax. They don't bug to buy more and just let you enjoy your time. The clock is beautiful, but the crowds really swell at the top of the hour to watch the little show. I loved Old Town Hall and wandered through here many times. I picked up,some fabulous gifts and some fun stuff for myself.

Freeze to death in Christmas 2014. The clock is very particular and if you do not understand what is all about it would be another clock for you. So read before you get to that point. Unfortunately the weather make it no so pleasant (-7C) and windy :-O but the Christmas market give another tone to the whole visit. I recommend to all visitors to exchange money to Czech Rep. Korunas if they do not want to be "robbed" in the shop. They usually charge more when you pay with foreign currency. Also to European travellers watch out because they do have very similar looking coins to Euros but with lower value of course.

You need to understand what you are looking at. The clock is different yes, worth the visit alone...probably not. You do need to understand what you are looking at otherwise it will be a bit of a damp squid. It is in the area with other sights so it would be silly to overlook it. If you take a walking tour it will all be explained to you

Unique but be careful. This is one of the most recognized tourist attractions in Europe, and consequently one of the busiest. The clock is incredible to watch, particularly the march of the saints, but arrive at the wrong time and you may miss it. Be prepared to wait along with the throngs also waiting for the clock to begin its little show, it gets crowded quickly, and be prepared to get jostled. Be careful of the toursit horse carriages that circle the squares, I saw quite a few people bumped by the horses or carriages as they watched the clock, completely oblivious to the animals - and the drivers do little to warn anyone in the way. Beautiful attraction, but best seen off-season to get the most viewing pleasure.

Beautiful Craftsmanship!. Such a beautiful clock with spectacular craftsmanship! There will be a lot of people waiting in front of the clock to see it on its hourly dingdong, you would expect a lot of movement in the sculptures/figures on it but there won't be as much. Just a little bit of disappointment but still a beautiful machine/art. Don't miss out on it. Still worth a visit for such art and architecture.

Notice something different every time. Although very crowded, watching the clock strike the hour should be an activity on your to-do list, and you can easily do this multiple times and notice something different each time.

Brilliant clock and view of prague. It's only £3 to go up the tower in the clock. Great views from the top. One of the main attractions in prague. Has lots of history and is worth going with a tour guide to understand how to read it.

Christmas Spectacular. We visited both Munich and Prague for Christmas; Prague has the most festive atmosphere. There were so many wonderful vendors and the Christmas decor was so special. We loved our second visit to Prague for Christmas.
Do not miss!. Although very crowded, you must not miss this place, especially the clock tower observation. The view was simply breathtaking. Pay attention to your pockets.

Amazing views. I took my little one (aged 3) up the astronomical clock mainly because he wanted to go up the steps! Under 6 were free and adults were 110czk (roughly £3.50). We paid and were sent off to another building, which I wasn't expecting, but it wasn't any bother. We had the choice of a lift or steps to go up to the third floor where we had to queue to get in. Again we then had the choice of a lift or steps to take us up the tower... we took the steps! It was really busy up there but there's a one way system in place around the tower (it is quite narrow up there though). We couldn't have timed it any better as it was just starting to get dark as we got to the top. With all the Christmas lights and the markets below the sights were truly amazing. Twilight is definitely the best time to go up ( during Christmas time anyway). You could see for miles. What a beautiful city. Definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful from above and below. The clock is amazing to look at when standing at ground level. It's incredible to think about how this was engineered. We took a tour of the rooms beneath the clock and town hall. A ghost tour in fact. It was a great way to learn and see more of this city site.

Very well engineered mechanism. despite the Christmas crowds we were able to have a good look at this clock .
Also looked at it from the cellar underneath !

Breathtaking view and very nice clock. There is a small entrance fee and you can go on the top of the clock. The view is really breathtaking. You can see the whole city and the Church of the Virgin Mary before Tyn which is amazing. The Astronomical clock is very impressive. In general it is a very beautiful town hall with a nice christmas market.

Beautiful clock, great views from the tower. Beautiful clock and great atmosphere walking around the square with beautiful buildings lit up in the background as well as the Christmas markets. Lots of tourists which is to be expected but well worth climbing the ramp up the clock tower. It's a little narrow around the outlook but no real problem and the 360 degree view across Prague is wonderful!

Try to understand the meaning :-). I stood in front of this clock for maybe half an hour trying to understand the meaing of all its parts. I came to them twice. First just walking around the city center, then on the next day after reading about it in Wikipedia in a hotel. Made some notes in phone about what is what there. Fantastic!

Great piece of history. Our tour guide mentioned the astronomical clock was installed in 1410, making it one of the oldest astronomical clocks in the world and the oldest one still working. Also interesting, from photos he showed us, was the heavy damage suffered in 1945 when a large portion of the building was destroyed. Restoration work took place to get the clock to work again in 1948. On the hour four figures move, one being Dr Death, a skeleton, that strikes the time upon the hour. Ingesting to watch and very impressive architecture.

Great View of Prague. A walk up the Astronomical Clock is a definite must for all visitors to Prague. It gives you an excellent view of the city. We went up at around 4pm so the sun was setting and the city really looked magical with all the fairy lights and Christmas markets. The clock itself is amazing considering how old it is. If you want to get up close to see it chime, best get there at least 10 minutes before the hour as it gets quite crowded.

Amazing. Just returned from Prague and was very impressed with the clock tower and square. Walking yo the tower, it looks like something out of harry potter, very magical. There were many tourists but I guess what else is there to expect as everyone needs to view this area if you go Prague

The tower is awesome, the clock, not so much. The view from the tower of the Old Town Hall is very much worth your effort, while the Astronomical Clock is a kinda cool relic from the 1600's that really doesn't do much. In fact it was so mundane that we had to brave the rather large crowds that gather on the hour twice to convince ourselves that we were looking in the right direction and didn't miss something. We didn't. The tower on the other hand affords a magnificent view of the square, castle, and a 360 degree view of Prague. The elevator ride costs 6 euro at the ticket office, and I imagine the line gets quite long during busier times as there is only the one elevator, and it's somewhat small. In any event, the view makes whatever you had to go through to get there worth it.It's all in one location on the west side of the square on the way to Charles Bridge, so you're going to go that way anyway, so you might as well stop and take it all in. A Prague icon is a Prague icon afterall.

Cool but..... This is a site you must see if you visit Prague, but don't get too excited about or wait around for a long time because you'll be disappointed. The puppet show happens at the top off every hour so you'll do fine to arrive Just a few minutes before. It goes very quickly and, while cool, is still lack luster.

Quirky interesting clock with little display!. I actually loved this, the clock is quirky and set in a beautiful square... the bell ringing and the way you see the apostles come out when the clock chimes on the hour is really interesting! The crowds certainly do gather just before the hour so get there early to not get squished.. we saw the 9am chiming and it was really cool. Do not miss this when in prague!

Worth a visit. Took a tour inside the Old Town Hall, which covered some rooms and the underground floors.The guide told a lot about the history of Prague and the Old Town Hall, which was very interesting. The underground floors where nice to see.The view from the tower was real nice. Great view on the Christmas market on the Old Town Square. The Astronomical clock is beautiful, although the moving figures were not that special. So skip the crowd and visit the clock, between the hours.
Beautiful!. The clock is beautiful! The whole setting in Old town square with beautiful buildings around and cobblestone streets is amazing. Don't miss to visit this area if you are in Prague.

Magic Clock. Several different clock faces tell a variety of stories: horoscope, phases of the moon, hours of daylight...On the hour, prepare for a "people sandwich" as onlookers scrunch together to view the appearance of the apostles from two doors at the top. Still worth it.

Impressive clock lovely square. This is the only clock in the world that shows the time, hours till sunset. Time of the year and also date and has the signs of the zodiac. On the hour the skeleton rings the bell and the twelve apostles appear above the clock. Incredible well worth watching. Then go up the clock tower which costs about £6 for two and you have the most amazing views of the town and up to the castle. Take in one of the free walking tours well worth it.

Clock - At the top of the hour. Visited on a Saturday (5pm) over the Christmas period; I Did not go up the astronomical tower over the clock due to the amount of people but it is not expensive (110 Kc). However, stayed for the top of the hour "show", On cue with the hour, the small windows at the top pop open and the figures start rotating through them while the outside marionettes pull the string to the bells, really simple and probably over hyped but it is cute nonetheless. (small children will enjoy it).
Genius invention. Absolutely fascinating, the story behind this is unbelievable. The clock performance is on the hour and not to be missed. A mini theater show and very very enjoyable
Beautiful tower. Perfect timing. The tower and the clock itself is absolutely charming! I didn't planned to be there at 2 p.m when the bells rang the little figures came out. :)
When the clock strikes..... You really must see this when the clock chimes to see the animation and etc, as that is what is unique. It is also an iconic attaction of Prague, so a must photo to share.

It is a place to visit. It is a place to visit during your stay in Prague nice to see the q clock and stay during the beginning of any hour to hear the song and to see what happen every hour also the shopping area and dining places there
Wonderful. Well you can't go to Prague and not spend a few minutes watching the hour being struck and the resultant movement of the figures. Charming.

Best Place to see Prague from Above. If you want to have great photos of Prague, this is the right place to come. There is elevator provided inside the building, if you don't want to walk through the ramps. The view is amazing. You can see the city lines from this place. Many great photographs can be taken from here. But, there are many travelers also there. You can't just stand there and enjoying the view for long time.

Nice Architecture, Awesome Views From Top. I would say it is pretty neat just seeing the outside, but for a few euros you can go to the top (by stairs or elevator). The view from the top is simply awesome as you can see all of Old Town, Lesser Town, Jewsih Quarter plus the other sights around like Charles Bridge and Prague Castle.I would say go at sunset to see the day and night views with all the lights. During Christmas time, it is especially nice!

That's it!. The astronomical clock is surely a beauty. Understanding how it works enhances its value than just looking at it and walking away. The tiny figures that step out of the tower during the hourly chimes are cute but the show is not impressive. Could literally feel people from the crowd waiting for the chime asking "is that it". Probably a one time watch. But the views from the tower are supposedly splendid. The huuuuuuuge waiting queue made us decide its not worth our limited time. We instead walked around the cobbled streets of Prague and exploring the winding alleyways. What you could probably do is get inside one of the cafes in the square overlooking the astronomical tower and not only give those tired feet a bit of rest but also people watch and clock watch :)
Great engineering. Best to see this at night. Looks superb at night when lit up. Very detailed and superb craftsmanship.

Beautiful and novel. We joined the crowds as they gathered on the hour to see this amazingly beautiful and ornate clock burst into life. On the hour the small doors in the centre open to reveal figures who move and accompany the bell chimes. Just lovely.

A great example of medieval clock tower. Can get crowded especially at noon. Stop in a sidewalk café. Get a drink and watch the show. If in Prague it is certainly something to put on your list. Now the big Christmas tree and Christmas markets are there as well.
Beautiful Square. Must do, a short walk from our hotel and a beautiful square, photo ops everywhere you look, but that's very true of most of Prague.
A must see. The clock is one of the highlights for every tourist with large crowds gathering for the clock to chime on the hour so be early for a good view

A Wonderful Sight. The Astronomical Clock was beautiful. Watch the animation as the hour strikes. For a fee you can go up the tower (by elevator). At the top, you will get amazing views of the old town square and the surrounding area.

Excellent views. Watch the clock on the hour as the disciples come out.
Then pay the nominal fee to go up the tower.
You can walk the whole way as we did, or take the elevator some of the distance.
Fantastic views from the top. With great photograph opportunities.
Amazing
best clock. That astronomical clock attracts a lot of attention. it is interesting to look at it and try to understand it. some people come especially to hear it and look at it when it is sharp time.

amazing video-mapping on the wall. .... about history of Prague and Czeck kingdom&republic - very impressive work, funny moments on the biginning and the end of show, with stars, space and astronauts:)
The saints go rolling in. the lock. Homes on the hour, the saints turn and go around. The crowds here! It an amazing astronomical clock, not sure of its date.
Great views. Great view once you are at the top of the tower but be prepared to queue if visiting at weekend both at the entrance and once you reach the top!

Awesome place. Great place to visit in the evening, when the ambiance light up in yellow. You will find great and happening crowd. The bird's eye view from Astronomical clock was great, in late night hrs. You can spend hrs here.
The Clock Maker. When the Clock Maker had finished his work, they took out his eyes so that no other city could have a clock as beautiful as this one.

Excellent place and crowdy. Located at the heart of the city, people gather here every hour to see the hour ticking in a traditional way with music. Extremely crowded and fun. One can see how active and enthusiastic the tourists are, when they are in mood.

The best views. The easiest way to go up is by elevator. There are also inclined ramps to walk to the top though you must negotiate a tight metal spiral staircase to come the ascension to the top. (Take the elevator) The views at the top show old town in all it's grandeur! 360 degree views are especially nice at night. Be sure to watch the clock show @ noon each day from the square.

A bit dissapointing. I'm not sure what I was expecting standing with the large crowd of people. Perhaps a display similar to the one in Munich which lasts a few minutes and a number of statues parade around. Here the windows opened two figures appeared, the clock struck 5 and that was it. It was a bit dissapointing. However the clock and surrounding buildings are beautiful. And the Christmas markets give the area a very festive touch.
Great city. I love this city everything is compact. People friendly and the history of the aea and buildings are fairytale

very good, but be prepared for crowds. Extremely interesting. Be prepared for this to seem more like the chaos of Disney World than the peaceful lure of Prague. Neat to see, but the commercial carney atmosphere makes a stay short

Well worth the money to go up. Cost 110 CZK to go up the tower, and I think it was worth it. Tickets can be bought at the tourist office at the bottom before heading to the 3rd floor to go up.
