You get signboards to tell you what are the different buildings you see from up there. We took the elevator up, then walked the spiral ramp down. It's a shame that many of the walls and surfaces are vandalised badly though.

A mild stroke of genius!. Not sure what I was expecting. Maybe more of a fanfare and windows/ doors opening as the skeleton rung the bell. I can however appreciate its genius at the time it was created and the complexities. A nice feature however. Got the crowds.
Astronomical indeed. Amazing clock and design, true ingenuity. I also enjoyed the show as well, as short as it was...just make sure you are there on time as it does get busy.

Go up the tower!. We visited the rooftop viewing area in the evening when we had lovely views of the Square with Christmas market stalls, local churches and the city at large with winter illuminations. Landmarks are nicely highlighted around the parapet and traffic flow was remarkably civilized given the large number of viewers.

Beautiful area. The clock and surrounding area is wonderful to see. It is of course full of tourists but what can you expect. Definitely visit after dark as well to enjoy the way they have lit the attractions.

Perfect. This place is just beautiful.The perfect place to spend time walking around and take pictures In the sumer the place is full with people.The perfect spot for seeing the clock it is in front of the clock,wiht a large beer.perfect....

A bit disappointed. our guide told us this shouldn't be missed so we waited with hundreds of people in the rain and cold, and was alittle disappointed wasn't sure what was meant to happen but just looking at the clock it is amazing workmanship
Interesting. Very interesting and a great view of the city from the top of the tower. You can either get the lift or walk up the stairs.

Interesting thing. That astronomical clock attracts a lot of attention. it is interesting to look at it and try to understand it. some people come especially to hear it and look at it when it is sharp time.

Time to go digital. Ok can clock looks beautiful and is really old, but how do you tell what time it is? Maybe it needs a digital clock added 😄, still worth a see and you can climb the clock tower for an overview of the square

Astronomically beautiful. A really unic experience and a place someone must see when visiting Prague. Every hour the clock gives its own show to the people gathering around. Amazing and astronomically beautiful!

Amazing clock. Great view from the top.. On the hour, see the clock! Be a little early before the masses descend.You can also visit the top of the clock tower (for a fee if memory serves about 120czk) either by lift, or by walking round the tower, and finally a spiral staircase - make sure you obey the traffic lights!The view of the city from the top was amazing. But, off-puttingly, you couldn't necessarily see the places mentioned on the information boards from the top. All the same, a great view!There's also a public toilet here at the bottom which charges 3czk.

Do not miss the top of the tower for photo opportunities of picture perfect Prague!. The clock itself is a wonder with so many features. Crowds throng every time it strikes an hour.Its a legend, that the guy who built it, was blinded so that he couldn't build another one.I would strongly recommend to everybody to spend the 110 koruna amount and go to the top of the tower. Your camera's battery will run out, but the photo opportunities won't! It's the postcard Prague, the picture perfect Prague just like in the movies!No Prague visit is complete without this one.

Great attraction , a must see.. The astronomical clock which " performs " on the hour is a must see when in Prague.There is always a big crowd which gathers in front of the town hall but you can easily see what happens. A word of warning , it's the perfect place for pick pockets in such a congested area so beware.The tower is really good value to visit. Don't worry , there is a lift as it's quite a way up. The views over the city are tremendous. This reaklly is one of the great attractions in Prague.

Wonderful views from the top of the tower. A huge crowd gathers in front of the Astronomical Clock at about ten minutes before the hour strikes but it is always possible to see what happens as you have to look up at the clock. Figures of the twelve apostles emerge one by one from a door to the left of the clock and progress across to disappear into another door. It is absolutely fascinating and, judging by the crowds, we weren't the only ones who thought so. We took the lift to the top of the tower and were lucky to have a clear but cloudy day to see right across the roof tops of Prague and down upon the Christmas markets in the square. A visit is highly recommended.

Blink and you'll miss it!. Maybe we should have persevered and found out a bit more about it. We got here a bit before the hour, joined the crowds and waited with bated breath, but ti was over so quickly we almost missed it! Seen a lot better.

Classic sight. The Old Town Hall and clock is a classic. When it strikes on the hour all the small bits and pieces are hard to watch all at the same time.Although the crowds are thick its worth the effort.

Oldest working astronomical clock in the world. 600 years and it keeps on ticking!. Installed in 1410, this clock still draws huge crowds on the hour, every hour (or at least the three hours we were there when it happened. The clock is so high that it is difficult at first to see what is happening. There are four characters on the outside of the clock. From the far left, is vanity holding a mirror, next greed holding a bag of gold, then on the right is a skeleton that rings the bell on the hour. To his right is a Turk who represents pleasure and entertainment. When the skeleton rings the bell that it's time to go, the others all shake their head, apparently that they don't want to leave. Windows at the top show the 12 apostles every hour. The movements of the clock showing all the aspects of the day, month, and year, move so slowly that you can't see them moving. However, you can Google a link that shows slow-motion cameras that reveal the movement. I've put in a link below for you to watch a slow motion animation of the clock as its movement is so slow that it's impossible to just look at it and see how it all moves. For your own contemplation, just realize that in 2010, Prague celebrated the 600th Anniversary of the clock. Most of us have a hard time thinking about that length of time, even when we look at buildings. But to see a complex working clock that has been working that long is amazing.

Interesting clock and clock tower.. Another must do in Prague. The clock is interesting especially when you have the dials all explained to you, and the clock tower is certainly worth the climb up although you can take the lift. There is a fee for climbing the tower.
It does get quite busy outside, but you can usually get a good enough viewpoint.

With the tour of the old town hall ending with beautiful view from the top of the tower is a must. Do the tour of the inside to appreciate the history of the old town hall, architecture and view from the top is the ultimate
Pretty clock. Interesting historical clock, there is a lift inside up to the top with fantastic views, great photo opportunity!

A must while in Prague. wonderful, the christmas market was weak to others I have been to in Europe but the site is so special, loved it, grab a coffee and take it in and enjoy each view on every angle you look

Breathtaking. The clock is one of the most amazing things I have seen. It is so amazing how it works and when it goes off on the hour mark, wow what an experience. It virtually comes to life with a little pantomime happening. Beware thou as crowds gather to see this and I'm talking like 100's so get there early and stand in front and wait. Also be aware that it only starts at 10 and finishes at 8 (i think) sorry can't remember exactly the finishing time.
Amazing it's that old. Fantastic views from the top, not a too difficult climb. Also a lift for the unfit out there watching the clock strike the hour is also good fun.

A special piece of history. It's not an attraction for people expecting a spectacular light show or beeps and whistles but it's beauty is in it's amazing history and the amazing setting. The clock was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still working. That fact was enough to make me appreciate its unique special place in history and I'm glad I got to see it in the wonderful Old Town Square on a frosty evening with the smell of hot mulled wine in the air!

Beautiful but watch out or segways. I love the old town and this year with the Christmas Market it was fantastic. The Christmas Tree with the led trailing light make the tree. While it I always crowded, safety became an issue with the zooming around of the Segway. They would come up from behind you, cut in front of you and block the iconic views. These really took to ambiance away. They salesmen were very aggressive to the point of rude. Enjoy the view but watch out so you do not get ran over.

A must to visit in Prague. We booked airport transfer at http://www.prague-airport-transfers.co.uk/and was given a 4 hour free walk tour. We started the tour to watch the "clock show" with the guide Ross who was very informative and made our trip more meaningful. Clock show is at every hour. My son loves it. Read more about the Clock prior to your trip.
Fuss. Wasn't sure what the fuss was about to be honest its a clock that chimes and large crowds stand and around watching it so watch your pockets or bags

Wonderful. On the hour this beautiful astronomical clock puts on a good show. There are figures (including a fascinating skeleton) which "pull" chains and doors open above and saints appear and move in front of the Windows whilst the bells chime. Really charming!

Not worth the wait.. The clock is impressive but it is not worth the wait for the clock to strike the hour. It gets packed but it is not really worth waiting for. If you happen to be there spend a couple of minutes.

Legendary!. The legend behind this clock makes the visit to this monument far more interesting than simply watching it chime on the hour. Make sure you read about the legend or take one of the free tours to get the full experience.
The Clock. Well, we waited like many others to see the clock and I was honestly not blown away with it. It was just okay. But it's a must see due to the fact that is history.

Over 600 years old and still ticking.... Everybody who visits Prague should see it. I would suggest before you go learn and read about it's history. So easy to do with today's technology. Just google it. You will be impressed and awed by the Orloj's mechanisms related to astrology and history. It is one of the oldest if not the oldest clocks still working. I think of when we were children and used to wait for the march of the apostles. The clock chimes each hour and the skeleton rings the bell. But it is not really just about that little show. When I come back to Prague these days I see it more for the amazing work of art and architecture, surviving wars and occupations - repeating the same ritual hourly, ... just continues ticking. After more than 600 years...

Must see. This is the land ark in the Old Square and such an interesting time piece. I still cannot believe i never read up on the clock nor did I listen to any of the tour guide information about the clock itself. One you do that you are bound to have an even greater experience of this ancient machine than I did. Looking at it purely for it's aethetics was enough for me and seeing the show on the hour, weird and slightly wonderful. If you go to Prague this and the Charles Bridge are not to be missed!I neglected to say you can climb up the stairs for a great view of the square. Would haave been a great place to view the lighting of the Christmas tree in Old Town Square.

astronomical clock. Ok so going into the first time we saw the clock on the hour we had already been told by a great tour guide to not expect to be blown away by the clocks performance. Hegave the history of the clock so I definitely understood better what was happening. Around the moon cycle and name day clocks nesr the bottom of the tower are these 6 fears/sins and when the clock hits the hour desth shakes his head yes and rings the bell while tbe others shake their heads no. Meanwhile some figures rotate pass an open door above this, now for 2014 this see silly and some people expect a light show or something crazy . for the time this clock was designed and constructed this was the best technology, therefore in my opinion making it a wonderful must see attraction. Just be sure to not get your hopes up for somethjng spectacular. The first time we were there for the "show" there were alot of disappointed faces around us.
A little disappointing. People gather in their thousands to see the spectacle of the saints emerging from the clock tower. I have seen it before & really it is worth seeing once.

Great!. It's a must-see place in Prague. It's in a very central location, so it's important to be in a hotel or hostel near it. This square is the initial point of many tours.Keep attention on the guys offering you many types of drugs and "bar" entrances. OBS: The clock "show" isn't good.

Make the Time. We saw the clock last night. Today we saw it with an explanation from our free guide. What a difference to our understanding. The clock hand has a golden hand, obvious. Many dials, arabic, Roman and Babylonian. The figures and who they represent. The disciples the centre disc and the lower disc. And it told the right time. Really good.
A must. Try to find a nice spot in front of the astronomical clock to enjoy the show of the puppets every one hour

Really interesting piece of architecture. The clock itself is really interesting and complicated to look at and there's a little show on the hour every hour, which tbh isn't hugely impressive but worth checking out all the same. I'd recommend going into the building itself and seeing the views from the top. It's pretty inexpensive and there's also a lot of information and history on the clock if you walk back down rather then take the lift (don't worry, it's on slopes so you don't have to walk down loads of steps!).

Should watch!. To watch the clock change on the hour is a must see (especially since it's free)! My 9 year old loved it. We did not go up to the top but did get a very detailed explanation of why it's 1 of a kind, another reason. To go see it!

Welcome to fairytale land. Beautiful area that was only enhanced by the decorating of the small retail outlets for xmas, we loved the Astronomical Clock and the square in general.People were lovely and always willing to guide you in the right direction, shops and bars were plentiful as are the off shoots to the many different shopping malls (Palladium was our fave).

Great view from the top. We thought the astronomical clock and the rotating saints that do their stuff on the hour were quite interesting but we really enjoyed the view from the top of the tower at night.

One of Prague's most famous sights. While the clockwork mechanism has the apostle parade on the hour, no matter what time you walk through the square there will always be a crowd taking photos. You'll be in the square at some point anyway, so definitely worth a look.

Beautiful at night. Plan on wearing very comfortable footwear when walking through the squares of Prague!!!I have heard that there are many pickpockets so I suggest keeping valuables in inside zippered pockets. There are a lot of sketchy people around so be alert. Carry smaller bills for buying street food, trinkets etc.

Most Beautiful Clock I have Seen. What a beautiful sight to see this Town Hall Clock at night. The first clock was 15th Century.the mechanism displaying astronomical data was added in 1573. After World War II damage it was remodeled with wooden figures of proletarians replaced those of Saints. Plus a mosaic was added that shows the workers. Truly a must see and a must see at night in Old Town.This clock draws a crowd every hour.

Go on the hour. Unless you are on the hour, there is a beautiful full clock with lots of clogs, but it is worth it to time yourself on the hour, but be warned- It gets very crowed and have your movie camera out and ready as the movement is very short, and on that a bit disappointing. Lots of eateries near by are overpriced but none the less, ambiance and people watching are at their prime. We did not pay to go inside, in fact at the time, we were unaware you could do so.
A Must Do. This is one of the big attractions in Old Town and large crowds gather on the hour to watch the clock do its thing. It is beautifully restored and a great experience to watch.

Major attraction. More stunning architecture and a beautiful clock face.
On the hour figures and revealed that rotate and other figures perform actions.
There is always a crowd in front of the clock to admire it.
Don't miss the visit to the top, accessed via the town hall, fabulous views.
Love it. Nothing to say love it try to get there at .00 every hour!! Also nice at night but best during the day

Worth a visit.. Views are amazing and cheap entry too.
Well worth a visit to see the whole city at a height.
Few stairs though but there is a lift.

unique experience. check out the astronomical clock that is been activated every hour.. you should know about the figures that move when the clock rings and what they represent.
Also. check out for 27 crosses near the clock, on the pavement, that represent 27 people who killed there for their faith.

Nice clock with seeing but not spectacular. The clock chimes every hour. It only lasts for 17 seconds, so don't blink. Be sure to watch the small figures as the do move. Across the top the windows open and you see the 12 apostles. Very pretty clock. Watch out for pick pockets. We had no issues, but be aware.
Tourist hotspot. When you in Prague, you totally should visit this sightseeing. But bear in mind that this place is always overcrowded and in Prague you can find much more beautiful places to enjoy.

Loved the clock performance. It's a landmark so you have to go plus it's one of the few free things to do! The clock itself is very interesting. On the hour the square fills with people to watch the parade of saints and moving statues. We went twice...once to really watch everything in motion and another time to take pictures. If you're lucky you can get a good spot in between the cafe tents facing the clock. Check it out on the web before you go so you know what to look for and the symbolism of the statues. We didn't go up to the lookout but you can probably get a good look over the old town. I'm sure there's a fee for that.

Visit to see the clock is a once only event in your life.. The queues gather early every hour to watch the clock chime and the small characters appear at the door. Its a bit of an anti climax when you see it but you need to just to put other well known world sights into context. Its an important historical clock and watching others watching it is just as much fun. Beware it's ideal pickpocket territory in the crush to watch the event.If you can do steps the view from the top is good. It costs to go up the tower but is free to watch the clock.
different. We waited to see what happens as the clock strikes the hour & although it was good it didn't blow my mind,

Missed so much. There is a feeling in that place but I cant describe it by words. This place has an atmosphere which is so warm and bohemian. I loved that so much. You can see gift shops, food courts and beautiful people who play and sing. You should try their traditional pastry 'Tredelnik' while listening beautiful voices in this square. And architecture, this place is surrounded amazing buildings. Astronomical Clock's architecture is wonderful, I loved this clock! But I have to admit that its hourly show is so meaningless, but you will already have to watch it because there will be huge crowd and you wont be able to move on:) So dont forget to enjoy it!
Beautiful. This beautiful clock on the heart of Stare Mesto attracts thousands people no matter the time or weather. Its architecture gives a charming look to the square.
Another Prague must. Absolutely beautiful building, cheap admission prices and a stunning view of prague. Not to be missed

One of the Prague tourist hotspots. Let's face it, this is one of the must see attractions in Prague.It's fascinating to look at and you can't help but gather with everyone else as the hour approaches - but as the show gets underway you realise it can't possible live up to expectations and it doesn't but it doesn't matter, it's all part of the experience and as the golden rooster crows just a little feebly at the end you can't help but smile. Take the time to go to the top of the hour, it offers a great view of the city.

There are no words.... There are no words to describe how beautiful this clock was you'd have to go and see it for yourself I couldn't believe it. Stunning!! Try and get there to watch it on the hour to chime it's wonderful.

Busy but worth it. The clock and the church with its gothic tower is a real treat not to be missed go on the hour and the place is packed as the clock opens up and statues move inside and out. There are great places to eat opposite I suggest El Toro as its opposite and serve great beer and food

Most beautiful clock. We stayed very close to the old town square, so have been there several times. The clock is really beautiful! The colour, design and legend have made it a must see in Prague. Quite some young guys were trying to rent segways out. It's a two-wheel vehicle with reasonable speed. Looks very cool. If I hadn't been with my father there, would have tried. For me the old town square is the best attraction in Prague.

Very clever interesting clock. Was taken to this clock by our tour guide who explained it all to us, it is a very complicated design which without explanation just looks like a beautifully designed clock but is extremely stunning.

Lovely Sight. Really lovely sight to see, gets busy on the hour for the little show it does, not as great as I had imagined so don't be too worried if you miss it. Overall, a beautiful attraction to wander over and see! Love the colours to it!
Great place to visit. The Astronomical clock is definitely worth visiting and if you are in old town it is hard to miss. It is massive!

Magical, Centuries-Old Timepiece. The townspeople of Prague have sustained the operation of this clock for multiple (5?) centuries, with few disruptions. It is beautiful at any time of day, and has a special show each hour on the hour.

Enjoyed the clock and square. Myself and my partner came across the clock by pure chance after visiting the castle and strolling across the charles bridge into the old town we arrived at ten to three just in time to see it go off there was a few people around granted but that only added to the atmosphere to be honest their was a guy playing music in the square which was great all in all a highly enjoyable day

Watch the Apostles Do Their Dance!. If I am going to check boxes on a trip, I would rather either do it at the beginning or all the way at the end. So when we got to Prague, I planned on us getting Old Town Square with its clock out of the way. And sure enough, if you time it right, it only takes a minute to see the clock chime and all the apostles do their dance. There are huge crowds that gather every hour as the time for chiming draws near, though, so it's good to get a spot with a good view ahead of time. We decided to have lunch right across from the clock at Oliva Verde where we would be able to get a good photo at the right time, and that worked out great. OK, box checked. Now on to some real Prague sightseeing.

Wonderfull Plazza, wonderfull Clock. You can wait for th exact time for the show on the clock, or you can climb on top of it and have one of the most beauriful sights of Prage.Careful with the picket pockings, when everyone is looking for the clock.

Bit of a Letdown. The clock itself is interesting to look at. The hourly chiming was a letdown--we were expecting a bit more than a parade of disciples past an open window. Chances are you will be in the town square at some point in your visit so you will probably see it because everyone sees the clock. But if you miss it, it is definitely won't be the ruin of your vacation!

Very intresting clock. Well, you can't visit Prague without seeing it.obviously you need to come on the hour.Many say that there are many pickpockets in the crown waiting for the people to look up...In our friend case the pick pockets happened on the stares to Carl bridge.
one tired rooster. An engineering marvel, BUT you will need to listen very carefully for the rooster to "crow" after the apostles finish their rotation, or like me, you'll miss it.

A clock with history. this is a place full of tourist, but yet, it is nice and you can visit an outside restaurant while you wait for the hour. If you can, get the history behind the clock, it is cute.

It's not all about the clock. The main tourist attraction is the astronomical clock and any time of day it will be surrounded by tourists waiting for action. While the science behind the clock is truly interesting, its half hourly performance is an anti climax. Instead of standing in the crowd, go into the Old Town Hall and climb the tower where you can look down into the square and also get a wonderful 360 degree view of Prague.

Of course you've gotta see it!. The actually chiming of the clock has been called a disappointment, however, do not forget this clock is more than 600 years old. Be sure to get the complete description of how to read the face. It's fascinating and very special to see.

Beautifully. We were at the tower twice. Once in the afternoon and then in the evening.Evening Prague I liked more.At least I enjoy plenty of clock with figurines in 20 00.But we need to take place next to the clock in 5-10 minutes to a representation. Then very closely and it is difficult to make a photo.

Grand City Tour of Prague - Best Tour. On November 4 we decided to see more of Prague. Luckily we ordered the above trip at the Reception of ABE Hotel. They made a reservation with Best Tour and my friend and I were picked up at the hotel by a gentleman who knew more about Norwegian skier Northug and other skiers than we do. He had travelled in Norway and knew a lot about the country.As we reached the down town area, we met 3 gentlemen from Japan ready to join us. They worked for a Japanese Air Company in London. We also had the pleasure of meeting our fantastic guide Michaela. All of us entered the minibus to be used during the tour and we started and Michaela explained the history of Prague in an excellent way. We toured the down town area for a while before we proceeded to the worlds largest castle.We crossed the river Vtava and could see the well known Charles Bridge(construction started in 1357). In the castle area we got more explanation and guiding in perfect English by our guide. After the castle tour our Japanese friends decided to leave us and proceed on their own and my friend and I was lucky to be alone with our sweet guide. Of course we invited her to lunch and she selected the food that was goulash for us Norwegians plus white wine. The food was very delicious and tasty and the splendid white wine made the lunch even better.After an excellent lunch we drove towards The Astronomical Clock(one of the best known tourist spot in Prague). Then the very pleasant tour covering all historic sites in Prague, was almost over. Thanks to our splendid guide Michaela, we can only say it was one of the most fantastic sightseeing tour we ever had. She even spent some overtime with us showing us where to find a good store where crystal was sold. We made some shopping for our families and could look back on a very succesful, educational and memorable tour in Prague that will never be forgotten.November 16, 2014Arne Magne TjaalandVisited November 2014

Anticipating the mechanical display on the hour....total anticlimax. Heard how this Clock was the oldest working clock in the world. Seen another mechanical clock in Messina, Sicily so anticipated another display of chimes and moving statues alike.... turn of the hour and it was a little wimper with little to get excited about. Then it was over in a flash- I was disappointed, it was a total anticlimax.

You haven't seen Prague until you've visited this. tourist packed area. you can hang around waiting for the clock to strike, while shopping.. I liked to wander around and happened to stumble upon a wax museum! great place to hang out, maybe meet a new friend or two..
A must see in Prague. One of the reasons I went to Prague was to see this clock. And I didn't get disappointed. It's beautiful and every hour you'll see the mechanical figures moving :)

"Must do while in Prague. A visit to the top of the Astronomical Clock tower is a must when in Prague. The 360 deg. view of this beautiful city is amazing. It was great to be able to look down on the many activities taking place in the square below. For the not so able, there is a lift you can take to the top instead of labouring up the stairs.

Must see Item. This is a breath-taking peace of engineering and a must see attraction, try and time your visit to the clock 5 minutes before it strikes the hour to see the clock work. (free)Also worth a visit is a trip to the top of the clock tower, with great views over Prague to be seen. a small entrance fee is charged for this visit.

Beautiful to see. One of my favorite things to see when I come, its a very quick thing, but its great to see, if you want to be up close, you have to be there about 15 mins or so before, otherwise its pretty crowded.

Go during the day. I went up the Astronomical clock last Saturday night (around 7). It was amazing, however I strongly recommende going during day light if you hope to see anything in the distance. Prague is a poorly lite city.

A must see when in Prague!. This astronomical clock is a must see (on the hour) when in Prague. Why? A very unusual clock that has mechanical fugures moving when the clock strikes on the hour.. On the weekends and Friday nights it is very busy so would recommend getting to the clock at least 15 ahead of the hour for a good view. There are local cafes and shops nearby and is a central gather area in the old city center.
A must see. It can get extremely packed here but the whole area is stunning and the Astronomical Clock is a must see if you're in Prague. Children especially will love it.

go upstairs!. the Astronomical Clock is such an attraction that everybody wants to take a picture so there's a sort of queue in front of it.
Going to the top is very easy also by foot (I expected it quite challenging) as there are not stairs but a path

Such beauty. What a beautiful astronomical clock. I was fortunate enough to have seen the clock on the hour presentation, but not the noon one. Will definitely have to visit Prague again next time, just to see this beauty.

Beautiful and Overwhelming. When we visited the Czech Republic and Prague we walked from our hotel and wandered directly into the main area of the "Old Town" where the Astronomical Clock is the centerpiece. We have had a few "jaw dropping" moments in our travels (Walking out of the rail station practically into the Canal in Venice, Walking into the Grand Place in Brussels (top moment of all!) and coming into the Old Town in Prague and its main square which was bedecked with Xmas lights and trees for the Christmas Market. Its was a Shiver down your spine moment especially since when we were there we were lucky enough to have numerous snow storms which gave Prague an unbelievable fairyland look.

lovely and interesting. The clock chimes every hour and statues of the apostles appear at two windows. This ensures there is always a huge crowd gathering to watch. my tip is to get there at least five minutes before the hour otherwise you will not see it. it is worth it.

Perfect Timing!. Got to the Hall within minutes of the Astronomical Clock chiming the hour--so worth seeing! The holy figures peek thru the opening doors as they revolve around a circuit--so unique & old worldly. The clock is charming & beautiful with rich colors & designs--wonderful craftsmanship!

ANCIENT AND GREAT. You should see it. This is one of the most beautiful spots in Prague. It conveys an old-medieval athmosphere and modern one at the same time. You will love it once you have visited it:)

Fun. This is very fun to watch but if you have limited time not necessary. You can see it on YouTube. Even out of tourist season there is always a crowd....be sure to get close if you can. The Square itself is great and has lots to offer.
Make time for the Clock. Be sure to "make time" to watch the clock strike at the hour.The clock is from the 1400's- truly astonishing!High tech in the middle ages.

Amazing clock. This clock you an watch several times to enjoy its beauty and all the interactive parts of the clock. When whew were there, there was a trumpeter in the Tower that would play each hour too. Very special and you have to see it.

Must see. The clock is wonderful but you have to go up to the tower. It's just less than 10usd and it's worth it. You have a very good view Prague. There is an elevator and the climb after that is not that difficult.

climb to the top. The clock itself is wonderful, but pay the admission and go to the top of the tower. You pay an admission (about $5.00 US.) at the base of the tower, and then go around corner to enter. You can take an elevator most of the way to the top or walk all the way. The walk is really not that tough,,,,, it is pretty interesting walking through the inside of the tower,,,,, if nothing else walk down.The views of the city are spectacular.
Go to the top. Worth taking the trip to the top, fantastic views of the city. Elevators available, but you do have the option to walk. We opted for the walk.
I suppose its kinda cool ... but we kind of expected more.... We waited patiently to see the clock ... the crowd built up ... everyone was so anxious and then it happened ... and we moved on.
What a clock !. A very special clock. Our guide told us a lot about it. It was very interesting, more interesting than the clock on our mobiles !

Go to the top. The astronomical clock is a major attraction in the Old Town Square and a huge crowd will gather every hour for the "show". However, one thing not to be missed is the view from the top of the tower. Buy a ticket and climb (or take the small elevator) to the top of the tower. The climb is an easy one since it is ramps instead of stairs. The view of Prague at the top is terrific and provides some nice photo ops. It can get a bit crowded on the viewing area, but it is worth it,
Worth waiting to see the clock strike the hour. Wonderful building and clock in this incredible square. Well worth the wait to see the clock strike the hour.

Time your visit. If you want to see the charm of this architectural marvel - time your visit to coincide with the change of the hour. You get to see the apostles and figures. Be watchful whilst there. Crowds tend to attract some undesirable people. A must see whilst in Prague.

Amazing, but be prepared for crowds. Such fun to see the apostles and the skeleton. The figures come out hourly, so to get a really good view of the clock and fewer people, go early and wait, or wait until after most people leave. As in any city, be aware of pickpockets, and be very aware of pretty young girls coming up to you speaking English. Czechs will not do that. In fact, no one in Europe will do that unless you are targeted. No, you did not drop that money, or if you suddenly have catsup on your shoulder, walk away, do not engage. Why is that person, who is wearing a watch, asking you for the time. No one on the street has the right to see your passport, unless you are 100% sure it's the police. If not, say you'll go to the police station with them and show it there. Again, just good travel advice, anywhere in the world.

Clock tower. A fascinating clock tower steeped in history. A trip to the very top is a must for any visitor,the views over the city are spectacular. The clocks are a wonderful sight,a great meeting place & the hourly treat is worth waiting to see.

„Pražský orlој“ - great&magic place. The Astronomical Clock is the Great&Magic place in Prague. It's tourist attraction. „Pražský orlој“.The Prague Astronomical Clock is the third oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest still operating.

Impressive for it's age but not magnificant. We were all told about the Astronomical clock and the fact we had to visit it. For it's age it is impressive but, don't put yourself out. All 4 in my group were left saying "Is that it?". Don't stress if you do miss it but worth saying that you have witnessed it.

A must see in Prague. The astronomical clock is an amaizing and beautiful piece of machine. Its incredible the technology involved to built this clock in the middle Age. It is said to be the oldest astronomical clock in operation. It display in one dial the position of Sun and Moon in the heavens. Besides the months and hour, it has what is call the march of the apostles and other figures including the death represented by statues that come out timely. There is always a multitude to watch the operation of the clock each hour.
Unique. A must do when in Prague...on the hour you'll see the apostles and skeletons!The area surrounding the clock has amazing architecture.

what is the big deal about this?. I was very disappointed over this clock, I have seen many others which are more impressive. However if in Prague you have to see it with all the other hundreds of people that build up in front of the clock at each hour to see the seconds of activity during the hour chime.

Kind of Reminded Me of Disney World. The Astronomical Clock and cathedral were the only worthy attractions. The square is full of restaurants and fast food chains, which take away from the history and charm of the area. But it is a tourist attraction, do I get it, and do not dismiss its value as a place to visit. Mala Strana is a much better destination for authentic old Prague charm.

Lovely clock and area. Went to see the clock, but the surrounding area was just as nice. Had lunch outside at one of the lovely sidewalk restaurants in the square/plaza. The clock is very beautiful, and unique. Did not get to go inside, maybe next trip to Prague, as was an amazing place to visit.
What A Clock. The Astronomical Clock is good to look at and it will be worth waiting for it to chime. It's got the time so should you.

"Would any visitor not want to see these?". The Old Town Hall - which seemed a popular place for what I assume to be upmarket weddings and Astronomical Clock to the side of the beautiful Old Town Square are attractions no first-time visitor to Prague would want to miss. I just cannot imagine any visit leaving these attractions out!

Wow! What a magnificent clock. 604 years old and still works! This is such an interesting attraction. Not only the clock and calendar but the building itself is magnificent. It is well worth paying to go to the top of the tower and view the old town square. We went at sunset and watched the town's buildings change colour. It can be crowded so choose a time early in the morning or later in the evening. There are some very ignorant comments on this attraction from people who expected a Disneyland experience. Not recommended for mouseketeers. My advice, do 10 minutes research on the net to learn the history of this wonderful clock first.
Must do. great atmosphere, try u prince hotel for great cocktails send views , opposite the clock tower, watch the crowds , eat off the square as its pricey

A quick must see. If you're near Old Town Square at the top of an hour, take a moment to watch the clock. The moving skeleton and other characters are interesting to watch. I'd love to see the mechanics of their movement behind the scenes.

Tourists do not understand it and then they can not appreciate the value of the Clock. It is a shame, but many tourist just ignore the fact that this Astronomical Clock was made around 1410. Yes, 1410, before Jan Hus, before Joan of Arc, before sea explorers like Columbus, before almost everything. Every tourist should say that to himself and than look at it again and maybe at the end they will understand how big is its cultural value.On the other hand, I am walking around it almost every week and I do not even look at it anymore. It is that type of atraction you can see just once, at the top of each hour.It is also nice to watch the clock, then (especially after the sunset) go to the top of the town hall tower to see the rest of the Old Town and Castle District.
Be there at the hour. The action starts at the top of each hour, so get a spot and watch the clock in action. Then jump in line to get on top of the tower to enjoy the view

My favorite place in Prague.... Well.... It's a great busy place, vibrant, energetic, so many people, good restaurants, great atmosphere.We have been to Prague for 4 days, and visited this place 3 times.Just a great place to walk around, hang out and enjoy Prague.Don't miss it.

A lot of hype. This is a lovely clock, fully three stories high. Its clock operations are probably very impressive, especially given its age. However, from a purely tourist perspective, it was worth no more than 2 minutes of my time - which is probably the amount of time it takes for the mechanical windows to open and "perform."

very complex clock!. The astronomical clock is on the wall of a tower in Old Town Square in Prague and is a wonder of mechanical ingenuity. It was built several hundred years ago, and shows the position of the sun during the seasons, as well as the various astrological signs in their orbits. It was built when people still believed the sun revolved around the earth. When the clock strikes the hours two doors open at the top of the clock and figures of the twelve disciples show themselves in succession in the open doors. Worth visiting when in Prague, but if you are their at the top of the hour when the clock strikes and the apostles show themselves, be sure to protect your wallet. It is a favourite spot for pickpockets as the square is very crowded, and everyone is looking up at the clock.

One of my favorites!. The Astronomical Clock is this massive and very old clock in the middle of the old town. At the top of the hour, the clock rings, the windows open, and Jesus and the Apostles rotate through the windows. It does not last long but it was really cool to see.We took a tour of the old town hall, which included, going up to the tower and seeing the figures from the back rotating through the windows. We also received an informative tour of the old town hall, including the basement. Tour runs about an hour and was definitely worth the time.In the old town hall, there is plenty of tourist information, which we found helpful.

Very interesting. We saw this twice while visiting Prague. It is a must see, however I would recommend seeing this with a tour guide. A lot of the subtle little details of the clock are completely missed on your own. Also the chimes are interesting to see but actually what is amazing with the clock is everything else it shows you.
View of the city. One gets a good view of the city from the top of the tower. There is not much to see of the inner workings of the clock itself.
Fab. every hour on the hour the bells ring and the display is amazing so we loved it. there was nothing we disliked

Lovely old town and weird clock too. The area around the astronomical clock is a very 'foodie' place to hang around as there are so many restaurants, cafes and food bazaar around the area. But the one i like most is the ice cream gelato selling around that area. YUM YUM! Anyway, we spend quite some time in front of the astronomical clock trying to decipher it out, but couldn't. HAHA! Thankfully that place is the meeting point of many free tours and we joined one of them as to listen to them explain on it and join them on the short tour around the old town.

Best in Prague!!. Ols Town Square is the best place in Prague to take a leisure walk, soak in the live music, energy and sun. The clock on the tower still works. Every hour the bell rings, and the figurines move. Good fun, lots of eating places & fund shopping around.

Great views of the city. Great views from the top of the tower! Lovely veiw especially over the square and good for pictures. The stroke of the hour clock is nice to watch but make sure you stand within sight distance as there are little details easily missed such as the Cockerell and skeleton chiming the bells. Does get busy too so just beware of the crowd. Beautifully lit up at night as is the square :-)

Beautiful, but the hourly chiming is very underwhelming. When you are in the old town square, you will walk right by the Old town hall and the famous Astronomical clock, well worth a stop to take in this beautiful site. However I would not recommend waiting more then a few minutes for the hourly chime, it is very underwhelming and almost a non event.

Stand towards the back. If you're going to watch the action on the hour, stand towards the back so you can see the apostles. The views from the top of the tower are some of the best views throughout Prague.

Well worth a stop. It's a gorgeous building to have a look at. Very old and regal. I wouldn't bother jambing in with everyone to see the hourly display though, it goes for about 20 seconds and really isn't woth seeing.

Interesting... It is huge, detailed, with very intricate pieces. A crowd will gather to watch the clock change so get there so you can see the little figurines in action. Make sure you also walk around also as there are great places to eat and shops to visit..

Interesting place!. This is a crowded place where all tourists seemed to gather and the entire town square gets very packed.Interesting place to be at, wondering how the clock works. There are also some street food around the square and plenty of restaurants.

Very interesting. Considering the time the clock was made, this was very high tech.The square is full of people with nice artistic presentations. However is good to remember to pay attention on pickpockets.

Absolute must. The famous clock is well worth seeing in its own right, but ascend the clock tower and you are greeted by stunning views of the city, by far the best vistas to be gained from anywhere we found-inlcuding the castle. If you want to see Prague in its entirety, this is the way to do it... Getting to the top is fun in itself, forget the lift, and instead opt for the Harry Potteresque walkway, it really is like something out of Hogwarts!

Dates back to 15th Century. Located in Old Town, it is pretty unbelievable that this clock was built in the 15th century and still works. Every hour on the hour it displays the "Walk of the Apostles"; windows open up and they rotate around in a circle. To really see them you have to be square in front of the clock which can be a bit of a problem with the huge crowds. We were there in the afternoon and didn't get a good view. Walked back in the evening and got a very good view then (less of a crowd). You can also pay a fee and climb the tower for a nice view of the city, especially at night. It is a bit of a climb and then you can walk out on a balcony at the top that circles the tower. If you have a fear of heights it is a bit of an adventure.

Be sure to spend a few hours here. The wait for the astronomical Clock to start its show itself is half the excitement. Some tourists will do it in style while waiting at the cafes and restaurants surrounding it but it isnt necessary to do so as the price for food n drinks here are quite dear. We opted for ice-cream and also there varieties of options that our kids have ever tasted before from Nutella to Watermelon . Near the Astronomical Clock itself you can find many souvenir shops and money changer which offer reasonable prices and rates. Other activities here includes horse carriage rides or even watching street performers do their acts such as the giant bubbles.

A must see on Prague. The Astronomical Clock in the Old Town Square in Prague is a must see attraction in Prague. This clock is amazing! We watched the show several times and we loved watching it each time. There will be a crowd at the top of each hour but if you get there a bit early you will get a good view. If you want good pictures of you and the clock, get there early as there are few people at the 8 AM hour. Please don't forget to listen for the rooster crowing at the very end of the parade of the 12 Apostles.

Great public loo!. The old town hall is an impressive old building with a great looking clock outside (the 'event' on the hour is a bit of a let down) but the great thing is that there is public loo in the information centre - 3 crowns a time - bargain! You can also get to the top of the tower for great views of the town.

Awesome view of the clock. . I was in Prague on a layover to Rome and I took advantage to visit the clock. It's amazing and extremely beautiful and very detailed. I absolutely recommend it to everyone visiting Prague.

Go up the tower!. Because you'll get rewarding views. Lifts are available but I chose the stairs. Once up there you move around slowly as people linger most on the side overlooking the old town square.But the views both down to the square and over the city are beautiful. The clock itself is a thing of wonder and well worth waiting to see it ring and the mechanical figures pop out (or so I've heard as we timed it wrong).

Be sure to make time to experience this. Be sure to leave some time to get yourself a good view of the clock prior to the beginning of the hour, as it is well worthwhile. As the hour approaches, the square in front of the clock gets very crowded.The clock is a beautiful piece of medieval workmanship.After the crowd dispersed, we went to the top of Old Town Hall, you can walk up to the top of the tower or take the lift. When you reach the top the lines are a bit long in the small landing and move slowly to get outside because everyone is so mesmerized by the views. As you walk 360 degrees around the tower the views of Prague are breathtaking, one advantage is that it helps you to orient where one site is in relation to the others and you can see the crowds in the square below and be above them all!Well worth the trip to the top of the tower.

Superb.. Everything about this was fantastic, from the rich history all the way to the tourist-friendly atmosphere.The clock itself is stunning, but the more important aspect is the lively old town square surrounding it, along with the shops, street performers, and restaraunts/cafes.Very highly recommended, and definitely give yourself enough time to see all the nooks and crannies.

great place to visit. This will be something you'll not forget in a hurry, loads going on with Street entertainment all over the place, loads of place to eat and drink, gets very busy at the o'clock time every hour as all the tours converge at the clock at this time. Restaurants in the square are amongst the dearest in Prague, so to save a little just walk down a side street you'll save loads and usually get as good if not better service and food.

amazing astronomical clock. The astronomical clock is located in the old town hall in Prague. It is a splendid place and a must see attraction. The most beautiful part is to view the chimes and the figurines that are dancing on the stroke of every hour. It is one of the world's oldest and functioning clock.
this clock was waaay ahead of its time !!. is for real...very crowded...but worth it. walk the entire area around it as lots of worthwhile old, funky,

Amazing Clock but the Square Gets Crowded Before the Hour. One of the top named attractions in the heart of Old Town - just be aware the clock figures and bell only perform on the hour and the area in front gets very crowded. If you want a good view of the city, go to the top of the Old Town Hall (we didn't because too crowded) - it's probably worth the climb.

Very Interesting (and unexpected). The clock tower is the obvious attraction and gives good views over the town.Surprising (and not publicised) is that access to the top was good even for limited mobility, with lifts and a ramp rather than steps for the climb (we were expecting narrow, twisting uneven steps)However the highlight for us was the 1 hour guided tour of the rooms and undergrounds. This was interesting both visually and from the narrative.Excellent value -- not to be missed

must see. Old town is a place you have to see not only because the astronomical clock which is really nice to see, but also for the atmosphere old town gives you...you can see street artists everywhere,the food is a bit prizy, but once per year you survive :)

Well worth the tour. We went up the Clock Tower, the view from there is fabulous. Would highly recommend this to anyone visiting Prague, also watched and listened to the 12o'clock chiming, great to expereince, stick hold of your wallets though - there's so many people about!

Well worth a look. Very interesting and well worth a look both from the top of the clock tower and to watch the clock chime on the hour (or to watch the people below watch the clock chime). The clock itself is a pretty amazing piece of work, but can't help but wonder if its now hooked up to a quartz device behind the scenes. Fairly busy and you have to push your way around the tower but some great views and worth doing.

Loved this place. This place gets quite busy . you enter the clock tower via the town hall . and the sights and the views from the top are amazing . the internal stairs are quite step , but you can use the lift
A must-see but crowded!. It is a must-see in Prague but, unless you get here before 7am, you will have to contend with oppressive corwds (and pickpockets).

Be there on the hour. Try and be in the area to watch the clock on the hour when the clock comes to life, well worth visiting if you're in the area. Plenty of places to eat around the square and you can climb the tower and have a great view of the square and surrounding areas.

The astronomical clock amazing in it's time. The astronomical clock facing the wrong way and chimes on the hour.4 circles the outer circle is all the Christian names and every year each person has their own name day. If a person wants to name their child something different they have to apply to have it approved then the child has his /her own name day. Next circle -seasons the Inner circle is the symbol for the city. There are many people all fighting to have a look however it does give an understanding at the intricacies of time and how magical it must have been in it's time.

Stand and look up!. This is certainly a bit unusual with the characters on the clocks. I was there at 3pm and everyone was waiting for the moment looking up for the happenings of the characters that come up.

Catch a performance of the clock, but also climb the tower!. The clock is wonderful and unique - it adds immensely to the picturesque nature of this square. Be aware of crowds however, and guard your belongings while you gape at the skeleton pulling the clock rope and the apostles peeking out from the windows! We climbed the tower, which is actually quite easy as the entire approach is via gentle ramps (and for those who don't want even that much exertion, there is a very modern elevator). The views from the observation level are fantastic. Watching the clock is free - you do have to pay to climb the tower.
Lovely Restaurant with Great Staff. We had our last evening meal in the restaurant and we weren't disappointed. The staff where lovely, the food was brilliant and again great value for money.
Well worth 10 minutes of your time. Recommend you read the story of what's happening when the clock strikes as it adds to the enjoyment of watching the show.

Worth a visit. Loved the history behind this landmark. Entry fee was affordable, however we went in the afternoon when it was quite busy at the top of the tower. Definitely worth a visit as the view of Prague was beautiful.

Cool Clockwork!. I was reading reviews about this clocktower here on tripadvisor. People claimed that by midnight was time to be there. We went there around 11:45 pm and waited; along with 500 other tourists. By midnight, nothing happened. Nothing.. A big disappointment. Went the the day after though. Around 10 PM and it was a cool little show. I guess it was worth going there twice :)

Beautiful. This clock is just fascinating to see. It is hundreds and hundreds of years old and yet seems so up to date with its detail. It displays not just time but seasons, astro / moon cycle, date, year. Brilliant.

Great Historical Timepiece. The clock at the old town square of Prague draws hundreds of tourists armed with cameras ready to shoot when the clock hits the hour. It is indeed a nice relic but I suggest that one reads up on the history of the clock before visiting to truly appreciate its value. I would also suggest lingering a bit after all the tourists have had their fill of snapshots, and appreciate the fine details like the dial which indicates the day of the week, or the statues and paintings in and around the calendar. If you do, I think you would realize just how much more special the clock is even when its not animated.

Fascinating Technology!. The Old Town Hall and Square is a place for people-watching and performance art. Everyone's here to see the clock's movements on striking the hour, but come early to get a good view because it's very busy in daylight hours (and also through the evening).In the square you're likely to see bronze statues on Roman soldiers, convincing until they step down from their box for a cigarette! We also saw a convincing Punch & Judy-esque screaming baby in a pram. He had a little more discipline than the statues, but I imagined it would have been funny to see him standing up and walking along, with his pram strapped to his back :-)The large square is surrounded by cafes and restaurants, with a group of stalls selling sausages and fresh roasted pork and ham.

Beautiful square, boring clock. Prague in general is a beautiful city and the square by the Astronomical clock is no exception. The clock is also really beautiful. However, I'm not sure why everyone waits around to see it chime - it takes about 10 seconds and it's just some windows opening at the top and some Saints revolving.Personally, I'd suggest you wander around the square looking at the beautiful buildings rather than waiting by the clock for ages just to see a door open! Maybe that's just me though...

Fascinating. Fascinating if you come to think about the time it was actually made. The building itself, as well as the clock, are beautiful from an architectural point of view as well. Know that the place is always overcrowded.
Do not miss this clock. This clock is something else. Build when the earth was the center of the universe and beautiful. It also has a calendar of all thesaints days through out the year.
AMAZING CLOCK. This Clock is over 600 years old and has an amazing history behind it with deep symbolism! A must see when visiting Prague!!!

Clock is great but the best show is at the top of the tower. I have nothing to add to reviews of the clock itself. It's really cool and a must see. The real attraction we found was climbing to the top of the Tower to see a 360 view of Prague at night (there is a charge for this). It's incredibly impressive to see it on a clear night with all of the lights on the old buildings around the city. They make the climb easy because instead of stairs like you normally see in these types of things, they have ramps after about 1/3 of the way which makes it much easier. If you're really dreading the climb, you can even take an elevator to the top but I recommend the walk.
It's a really nice clock. Lots and lots of tourists taking pictures in front of the clock. It's nice, but hard to say much else.

A must see, absolute work of art.. A must see when visiting Prague, can get a little crowded with tours and such when its time to chime! Impressive display if only a short one when you think how old it is. Worth a visit up inside the tower to the top for the views around Prague.

Don't miss the time when the clock alarm !. One of the most beautiful clock. So pity that the king made the clock maker blind after he has done the master piece of art. Don't miss the time when the clock alarm !
Not too exciting.. We went for a look and there were many tourists here for the bells ringing but it was a bit of an anti-climax.

Worth a vist. This is worth a visit, just remember that its a real tourist attraction and you will be amazed how many tours visit for when the clock chimes, glad we saw it, but it was a long wait for a short show. Lots of nice Restaurants around here, we took a Horse Drawn Carriage for extra sightseeing. The square always has lots going on.

Nice and you should look at it. I have seen it so many times that I am bored with it! But if you visit Prauge you have to see it! It is Worth seeing it for the first or second or third time. It is an art of work! Dont miss it

Def worth checking out but crowded. The Astronomical Clock is a must see in Prague but beware of the crowds. The crowds can very very intense especially when the clock goes off on the hour, but it is worth seeing. The clock is very cool and climbing the tower offers visitors a great view of the square.Don't forget to sign up for a pub crawl while you are there. This is where many of the promoters work.

Worth a bit of time.... See the Astronomical Clock (Get there ten minutes before the hour to see it properly.) Raining? Get a coffee in the front seats under the umbrella roof of the El Toro Steakhouse right across the street... great view from there, but truly expensive coffee. Good news is that they also accept Euros. Be sure to look clear up to the top of the tower... There are live trumpeters that play during the change of hour. .

Beautiful. Beautiful clock.. Amazing the way it works. Very attractive. It's true whenever u pass by it you will stop & have a look again & might also click 2-3 photos again. Yes little crowded & hard to click photo without others being clicked.

Wow. I think the clock is one of the most recognized attractions of Prague. And it deserves it. It's very unusual and no wonder so many people want to see it. I was impressed but the square bit next to the clock is always crowded so if you want to take a nice pic with it, good luck with that!:)
Very nice. It is very nice to walk im this area and view the simple show every hour in the clock. Please save some time to see the stores and the beaultiful architecture

Do your research first.... The clock is generally the starting point of the many walking tours of Prague, so it is easy to find. While it's easy to hear the clock striking the hour, this is only a small part of the experience. If you want to experience the marvels of this clock, you should be sure to do your research first: read what it shows you and how. In this way, you can take in the brilliance of this amazing piece of engineering. Finding this information while you're there, and the time to take it in is difficult.

Underground and Overground Prague. Buy two tickets here, one to climb the Atronomical Clock Tower for amazing views of the old town, and the second for the historical underground tour. You get to go down to the (I think 14th Century) rooms that are beneath the old town hall and tower. Very interesting!

Fantastic Clock. The building is on main Prague Sq. with lots of terraces of nice restaurants and the Astronomical Clock is an unique piece of art in a very old building with a high tower that you can visit.
Beautiful. Nice view from the top - stop in front of the clock right before the top of the hour to see the Clock movements - Interesting

Interesting. Outside with a guide book is probably all you need to do. I was in Prague for more than a week so had the luxury of time and decided to go into a lot of historic buildings. Saw Mary's Chamber, presbytery, Saints at noon (from the inside), Council Hall, basement, etc. All very nice but not a "must" see. The outside and Tower are the real bang.
Best clock view. It is a best clock you will ever see. Very colorful and synchronized movements of the parts of the clock.

Tour inside the Old Town Hall. With a group, you can take a tour inside the Old Town Hall - the ancient building that sits in the middle of Old Town Square (Staromestske Namesti) and has the Astronomical Clock. The tour was incredible! They offer guides speaking in multiple languages (ex. Czech, English, German) and they detail all about Old Town Square and the Hall. It's really fascinating. You hear about the history that the square (and country) has been soon, and you even go underground to the huge ex-prison cellar underneath the square.If you can't take a tour, even walking around outside is a great view. The Astronomical Clock does its "presentation" every hour and is a spectacle to watch (just be careful of pickpocketers while a big crowd is gathered).
don't expect too much. nice place don't expect too much you will not be dis disappointed . the clock look nice not more. the show is nothing special.

Another Must See Stop in Prague. This area is a must visit for anyone in Prague. The Clock, although very crowded at the top of each hour is something to experience, once. The square next to the town hall and clock is most interesting and fun to sit and have a beer and watch what ever is going on at the time. A good place to relax and enjoy.

Centre piece of old town square. Always love an old town square and a memorable building to visit. Fab views of surrounding area from the top. Entrance via tourist information office. Easy walk up or lift for those who cannot manage it. A small spiral staircase gets you the last bit to the top. Not much room to walk around the edge but remember to go the right way round as it can cause problems. I failed to read the big sign and forced myself round the wrong way. Duh!

Lovely at night.. An absolute must-see, of course. It was especially enjoyable at night. The crowds were smaller (when we went at 11pm) and the clock is lit up, so it's easy to see everything at work. Actually, there was a glare from the sun when we saw the clock during the daylight hours. 9am to 11pm.Free to see the clock "performance" but a fee to enter the Town Hall.
very cool. Clock is beautiful. Impressive viewing, Only complain is the massive hordes of people that gather in front of it making passing very difficult. Go early.

Well preserved. We went there to see the clock chime. You must get there about 15 minutes before the top of the hour, to watch the apostles. You must firmly stand your ground to get a good spot, as you can imagine, other tourists will walk all over you to get a spot.

Impressive building and unique clock. The town hall,is an imposing building (one amongst many) in the Old Town square. You can pay to climb upto the tower which will give you an impressive aerial view of Prague. The clock is unique and quite a feat of engineering. It is impressive to look at and you have to watch what happens when it chimes on each hour. Apparently when it was built the locals liked it so much they wanted to ensure it was one of its kind in the world, so invited the inventor to a party, then poked out his eyes and cut off his tongue!! So be warned, don't accept any party invites from the locals!!

Astronomical Clock. Good clock and the views from the clock tower are very good. However you will like it if you don't keep high expectations from it. The bell sounds every hour but that's pretty much about it . Nothing too fancy.

A technological miracle of the 14th century!. Once you arrive at the Old Town Square, on its south wall you can't miss the famour Astronomical Clock of Prague. It looks impressive just to look at it, but the real show happens every hour on the hour! I'm afraid you will have to share the show with thousands of people that crowd the old Town Square to wath the spetacle on the hour, but it's worth it!

Historical Clock. The clock is a fantastic historical piece, well worth seeing. There tends to be a large crowd at the hour. Mid-afternoon is much quieter, and there are a couple of cafes across the street where you can watch in comfort for the price of a snack.
WHAT A MARVELLOUS PIECE OF SCIENCE. I liked very much the scientific master piece. Moreover it is very curious to see the procession of the apostles every hour from nine am to six pm.

It was a place ot savor. We were amazed at the clock which reminded us of the same kind of clock on Bern. It took a long time to make and despite someone throwing himself into the clock it still works well even now

Clock is not worth the wait. We felt like we had to go see the clock on account of all that had been written. The other 'poor' reviews for this seem to hit the nail on the head - don't go in with high expectations - its over before you realise it - and don't plan your time around it.If you're passing by at 55 minutes, it might be worth staying the extra 5 minutes, but even then its a 'might'.

clock this. the astronomical clock, is wonderful, be there on the hour when it starts to go through its sequence of chimes , and watch the little figures as they move about, look closely and yoy will see the little skeleton carrying the lantern, what a wonderful peice of machinery(art), after the clock has finnished a guy leans out of the top of the clock tower a blows a trimpet, in the four directions, usually everyone in the square waves to him, a hearting experiance.
Great views from the top of the tower. Recommend anyone going to Prague goes up the tower at the clock, can't remember what we paid but it wasn't expensive. The views from the top are stunning

Not great, not bad.... As my husband said "not exactly the Rockettes!". I took 1 picture as I was waiting for the finale, but alas! there wasn't one. Yes, see the clock, wait around for "the apostles" if it is 59 after the hour, otherwise move on!!

Interesting history. Oldest working clock in the world. 604 years. Beautiful and amazing. The inventor had his eyes cut out and tongue cut off by the king so nobody else could hire him to build another clock like this one. People are constantly posing for pictures under this clock. The main square is just feet away and there are dozens of restaurants and street vendor within a few meters.
worth visiting. Clock is great attracion. can impress even in XXI. So imagine what it was back in medieval times!In town hall there is palace of weddings now and also a tourist information.

excellent. The other was bright than their counterparts in Europe.We visited a few times. Time the story is also very impressive.
.

Hub of city. The Astronomical Clock and Old Town are a must for a trip to Prague. This is the heart of OldTown and there are lots of shops and restaurants in this area. Very crowded in warm weather. You can easily get to the area via subway. Walk on over to the bridge while there. This is a beautiful view. Take the river tour as well. It's one hour, I believer, and though a little pricey, how many times are you going to Prague?You can get better prices on things elsewhere and do not charge currency in this area.

Fantastic square to visit with friends !!. One of the best place to be at any time of the day, while you are in Prague.Please don't miss an occasion to visit this antique and clean square, keep an eye on your belongings. Prague didn't seemed to be a place with lots of pickpockets as described by many.
Amazing. What an amazing piece of medieval tech in the middle of Prague town. Worth going to see and have a cup of hot choc whilst walking around the town in the snow. So pretty.

Superb!. I loved to watch and observe in detail all details of the working clock. A masterpiece!Loved learning about the cathedral next to it that was half blown away by the Germans.In order to truly enjoy it, go either early in the morning or late at night. Avoid noon hours, gets extremely crowded and it's hard to pay close attention to all things happening when the clock goes off on top of the hour. Enjoy~

Old Town Square. The area around the astronomical clock is a great location to tour. There is so much to see and wonderful shoppes and restaurants. The clock always draws large crowds as it is interesting to see. Don't miss the opportunity to pick up some Czech jewelry at discounted prices. I love the fact that the shop keepers will negotiate with you on lower prices. Take a tour of Old Town and all of its attractions.

Beautiful. The astronomical clock it very beautiful and you have to see it on the hour when the show happens. Be careful however as the area around the clock gets very crowded with tourists and there are many people going from group to group trying to sell knicknacks.
Disappointing.... We stood and we waited and had our cameras at the ready, but it was very disappointing and only worth seeing because it's so beautiful in the square and it's historical.

Not to be missed. The astronomical clock is a superb piece of engineering on the architecturally stunning town hall. We had a coffee and a nearby cafe and watched the clock do it's amazing thing at 1100. There was a large crowd and as we watched couples married in the town hall were coming out to have their photo taken beneath the clock.It is worth reading up on the history of the clock which the the oldest in the world still working and yet another thing of beauty and history that Prague has to offer.

Quirky. It's lovely to see so many people gather around the clock, I've never seen so many wedding photos being taken in one day. Play spot the bride if you go! We found a lovely spot on the first floor of Cafe Mozart to have a coffee and watch the clock at a higher level.The square is a buzz of activity and leads you in all directions, lovely place to go to on your travels.

Best view of Prague. I recommend taking the full tour of Old Town Hall. It was one of the most interesting we experienced in Prague. The underground tour provides insight into the time of the beginning of the Old Town, when the street level was much lower than it is today. Due to frequent flooding, the street level of the city was raised during the 13th century, turning the original ground-floors of the buildings into underground chambers. The oldest part of the Old Town Hall's underground is the Roman hall, dating from the 12th century. The second tour takes you through the city hall’s interiors, which includes a chapel and historical halls. You can see the apostles up close and personal.The clock tower is almost 70 meters high, and provides an all encompassing view of the city of 1000 spires. On a clear day, you actually can see forever...into the suburbs and surroundings of the city.You can climb up the stairs, but thankfully, there is now an elevator to the top of the tower. Plan to spend much time here, as the views are amazing and will provide for your best photos of this magical city.

You can't miss it!. For sure you will pass from outside as is located in the old town square, but worth to visit the place inside. Astronomical clock is an amazing piece of engineer and old town hall is a gorgeous architecture building.Quite hard to enjoy the outside view as thousands of tourists are passing by all the time. Recommended to visit the place early in the morning around 15 minutes before the hour as might be not so crowdy.

definately worth a visit if you like architecture. Centrally located its easy enough to get to and you will probably pass it if you are heading through the old town. The clock itself is pretty awesome but the best thing is to walk up the tower for some amazing views of the city.

Clock worth understanding. When you understand how this clock works, you'll be amazed to know it's been functioning since 1410. It not only has scientific value but it also has many other meanings like the 12 apostles dancing every hour and the 4 sculptures representing the four things that were despised: vanity, greed, pleasure, and death. Every hour the skeleton representing death pulls a string to ring the bell and the other three sculptures nod their head rejecting their time to die.Besides that it has the name of each day so if you're lucky enough to have someone that understands the clock, you might get to know when your name day is. People often gave their children the name of the day they were born but for those that didn't follow this custom get 2 bdays: their birthday and their name day. It is a very fun clock to get to know.

One thing overlooked by people.. There is enough reviews about this medieval astronomical clock tower. I would like to point out on the more recent but extremly important plaque above the side entrance to the tower. If you can read czech of russain read original. It is in commemoration of the events that took place at the end of the WWII in the region and had diect influence on the futher history of the Czechoslovakia.

Quintessential views of Old Town Square. Every visitor to Prague is naturally drawn to Old Town Square. The Jan Hus Memorial, Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock are individually beautiful and compliment the square. Unfortunately during our visit to Prague, the Jan Hus Memorial was covered in scaffolding as much needed repairs are made. The Astronomical Clock is an amazing piece of engineering for its period, but don't feel like it's a "must see." Instead, venture inside the Old Town Hall Tower and take in the Old Town Square from an elevated perspective. Old Town Square at ground level is very different compared to the observation deck inside the tower. An elevator is available, but the casual stroll winding up the tower is filled with history and unique snap shots of the Old Town Square. The small fee is well worth the view, and we found many large tourist groups completely bypassed this feature. This was an impromptu visit on our final day in Prague, and the rain (only day of entire stay) set a dramatic backdrop on the rooftops and cobble streets below. I was pleasantly surprised the observation deck inside the tower isn't publicized in more guidebooks, and we would highly recommend.

Clock. This was worth the stop. The first time we saw this was with our guide on our walking tour from the Castle down to the square. You have to be on the seen early or you will miss the action of the clock that only takes about a minute to complete its action. Amazing with all the that goes on in that short time when this was built so many years ago.

Astonishing views!. Really great place! Be sure to buy a ticket after watching the clock ring on the hour. The ticket will allow to go to the observatory on the very top of the clock tower. It was a little on the pricey end but still a very good value. You can take an elevator to the top of the clock to get to the observatory but if you walk up the ramps you will see different prints of information. It was great.
