On your way out be sure to stop by the old pocket watch counter to speak to the woman who works there. Very knowledgeable and sweet!

Clock is amazing but Millions of people. The clock is amazing but there are thousands of tourists and walking tours in front of it – so quite hard to enjoy. The whole old town area has really gone down hill with very tacky shops and too many tourists.... but Prague has plenty to offer and so many more nicer streets around.
Interesting. Great to find out how the clock works. Watching it do its stuff on the hour isn't all that dramatic but understanding it and knowing how old it is made it worth seeing.

Weekend Christmas markets. Had a weekend in Prague with its amazing architectural buildings untouched by the Second World War.Christmas decorations and the most amazing Christmas tree you've ever seen, there is so much to see and do in Prague well worth a weekend or longer.

Worth a stop; near great people watching square. Happened upon the hourly clock show, which was really clever. Returned later for a closer look and found the square that this was next to was a great spot for finding new things to do and fun people watching

Is that really all it is?. If you are in Prague, in Old Town Square you might as well stop with the thousands of other people to see this clock. The amazing thing about the clock is that it was built some 600 years ago and the technology used is very impressive. But when it if finished you say-really is that all there is? We did enjoy the skeleton ringing the bell though!
Great Views. Brilliant views, there is a lift that goes to the very top but if you want to walk there is a sloped walkway almost to the top and then a spiral staircase. Well worth the trip

Beautiful place!!!. There is a lot of people all the time. It is great if you are with a guide tour, because you can have a explication about the clock´s history, it is very interesting the meaning of each part of the clock.
Must-see. It's the oldest functional astronomical clock in the world. It gets especially crowded right before the start of the next hour. Go to the top, for a birds-eye view of the city.

The famous Clock. What can I say,if you dont visit the clock you have not been in Prague,its history alone will keep you reading way into the night.It has to be the most photographed clock in Europe.Its just magical waiting with the gathering crowds for it to do its thing n ach and every hour.When the clock strikes doors open and reveal thee moving figures a and bells ring and figures move but dont blinlk because its over in a moment.Even waiting is on the magic hour is a great social occasion for getting to know other tourists.Great tourist site,I recommend it.

Thronging night life. This is a great night-life spot. An array of restaurants, bakeries, live singing, fire juggling, etc etc and the famous Astronomical Clock which is about 600 years old. The huge clock tower takes ones' breathe away. There are many features of the clock which cannot be described here for brevity. At the dot of every hour the bell chimes and the mechanical puppets of religious value pop out. It is interesting to see the events. The best time to be here is post evening.
Worth a look if in Prague. Definitely worth a look, though the crowds when the clock strikes on the hour are a little intense. We waited for a bit for the crowds to go before getting a good look.
Mesmerizing. It gets very busy it is quieter later. West side or in the Centre is the best view to see everything. People start waiting 30 minutes prior to the hour so be aware of this.
wonderful. saw the square from both the daytime and the nighttime. enjoyed both experiences. had some late night dessert at the U Prince Hotel and found it a very enjoyable experience.
Great as always. We just saw this clock (again) some 30 min ago. It's a wonder. This square has some special appeal and is a must to visit.

Guide book descriptions don't do this justice. After reading through our guidebooks, this clock didn't even make it on my list of must-see attractions - I am SO glad that our guide suggested that we visit this clock on the hour. There are a few remarkable things about this clock - the first being that they were able to engineer such a complicated time piece in 1410 (it tracks time, moon movements, day length, the zodiac, saints days, etc), the second is that it still works and the last is that it is both awe inspiring and a bit fun at the same time. On the hour the 12 Apostles circle, a skeleton rings the bells (theoretically death striking time) and the figures shaking their heads - amazing.
Perfect view. in the morning...get there about 10 min b4 the hour for best picture taking photo op....afternoon alot of tourists...

Beautiful sunset and view. We climb the tower in the afternoon because there was no queue. When we got up there (there are lifts!) we were suprised by the amazing sunset behind the castle. The view of the square and the Cathedral were awesome. Totally worth climbing the tower. And regarding the clock, it is very beautiful and complex. Many people don't know how it works or what it shows. Read about it and then go there to see its complexity, even more picturing it in the year that it was built

Don't Miss It!. The clock is simply not to be missed. Extraordinary display and it still works. If you can handle the crowds, it's fascinating to watch the clock in motion. A lift will take you to the top of the tower for amazing views of the city. The hours vary depending on the season. There is no fee to see the clock, but there's a small fee (100 Kc) to take the lift to the top of the tower and to see the halls & displays in City Hall. This area is usually jammed full of people, buskers, tour groups - so be prepared for shuffling about - and mind your purse, bags, wallets as this is a prime location for pickpockets in the city. There are many restaurants, shops, and street food options available. Hardly any seating, though, unless you're dining at a restaurant.The entire area is cobble stoned streets.

'Old Town and Astronomical Clock' a 'must-see' in Prague. I got a chance to visit the magical city of 'Prague' with a friend in April 2011 after a gap of 16 years when I had first visited the magical city of 'Prague' during my university days in Europe; I had stayed a week in Prague to see everything, thanks to a friend, to conclude that it is the 'Paris' of Eastern Europe. A visit to the Old Town and the Astronomical Clock is a 'must-see'. The Old Town area is filled with gothic architectural buildings and I bet you that you have never see such a quaint but unique clock ever!

Not spectacular but nice. The clock is a great work of art. You should definitaly watch the clock on the hour, but it's not as spectacular as I expected it to be.Didn't visit the Old Town Hall on the outside.

A true memory of Prague. All roads lead to the old square and the clock. While the tourist spot it is a must see. Kind of sad to see a Starbucks has popped up literally across from the clock - argh - but still an amazing spot. It is a must see at the top of the hour. Beware of eating in the square. tourist foot and tourist prices

Beauty in the crowd. People would say it's crowded or too crowded. but thankfully during our trip we were able to one beautiful picture of me & my wife. so i would say, it worth the crowd. don't forget to go to the tower to see the square & city from bird's view.

Amazing that the clock still works. Events occur on the hour as the clock strikes. Amid the crowds, a host of food, entertainment, and fun happens at this square during all hours, both day and night. We returned again and again to this central location to clock watch and people watch.
Worth a look. Had a little trouble finding it, not sure why. It is an amazing clock, worth the effort to go see it.

amazing experience. Visit to Prague cannot be completed without visiting old town, specially the astronomical clock there! This place is always full of visitors and real fun specially on the hour when the windows open and you see the animated figures.
Old Town Square. Full of history, music, restaurants (local and touristic), lots of people... make sure you go on top of the clock tower to enjoy the beautiful view of Prague.

Go to the top of the Old Clock Tower. I would thoroughly recommend doing that. It was the highlight of our trip to Prague because it is so central and gives stunning views across the Old Town, and across the river to the Castle and Petrin Hill. I would suggest aiming to buy tickets and queue at around xx.40 where xx is the hour of the day. Don't go soon after the hour as people flood in having watched the clock do 'its thing'. While you are very likely to have to wait around in a queue, this is more than worthwhile. The queue is because the top is quite compact and so can become cramped. An absolute MUST DO in Prague.

Cool to see, but not worth the crowd. The clock itself was nice to see, but I felt the "show" that occurs at the top of each hour was anticlimatic. The way it was hyped up, I expected to be dazzled. Instead, it was just a 2 minute display of some small movement of certain pieces and figures. It's impressive that it still works, but I think the hype and the large crowds that gathered gave me higher hopes for something more dramatic.

Did Good King Wenceslas (IV ?) look out here ?. I'm not entirely sure, but we certainly did go to the top of the famous bell tower, with a few million other people, to gaze across old and new Prague. The town hall itself is an agglomeration of buildings starting with one house, then another and another, no doubt as city officialdom grew. Unfortunately,the Nazis demolished one end of the building towards the end of the war and that bit was never rebuilt. We had a little tour of the interior of the town hall which was not too long or too short and the amount of information provided was about right. The tour included some rather grand function rooms as well as the cellars.The astronomical clock is so well know that I will say nothing which has not already been said. Be there at the top of the hour and you will enjoy the little display. I felt sorry for the newly married/about to marry young Czech couple who had difficulty fighting their way through hundreds of tourists to get to the town hall for, presumably, their ceremony and photographs. A very picturesque place and certainly worth a visit. Just take your photographs quickly before somebody moves past and spoils your shot.
Prague Astronomical Clock. The passing of each hour joins a crowd to see the animation that reproduces the clock1Beautiful to see :)
well worth a look. I've never seen a clock cheered before. Id advise seeing it at night as it located in an area with lots of restaurants and bars.

Tick tock tick tock. This medieval astronomical clock was installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still working.You cannot visit Prague and miss this.

Time Keeps On Slippin..... The story behind their creation and operation is interesting and the clocks themselves beautiful. Please be sure to read about them before hand so you'll be clear or better yet, if you take a guided tour listen intently because your attention will be distracted by the beauty of the entire square. We didn't climb the tower, but I can imagine the views are spectacular from such a high point.
Good atmosphere. Plenty of people watching clock to chime with good atmosphere. Clock is beauty and elegantly built. It only chimes on the hour so you have to match the time.
Astronomical clock. This is a jewel on the side of the town square. You can climb the tower, but we did not have time. Beautiful!

Overrated. This attraction is worth seeing for its historical halls, some of them really nice. The view is okay but by far not the best in the city. The clock is worth a look but not much more than that. Overall, see the historical halls and glance at the astronomical clock but if you're short on time, spend it in Prague's beautiful and historic churches, synagogues, and museums, not here.

the heart of the city. this is like the master place of the city , poeple around , restaurants , the winter market or chrismas market there , I just ejoyed walking around with my friend ahh as for the clock , let me tell u , it is just the master peace , soo beautiful u can just forget the time and place while admiring it
Amazing!. This is an amazing clock. One needs to study the clock to appreciate it. We heard from the tour guide all about it. Lots of people come on the hour for the bell.
When the times ticks away. The clock is a piece of art by itself. You have to see it once, but then again once is enough. Still, don't miss it.

Everything in Prague starta right here!. The most busy and crowded location in Prague! The clock is really an attractive spot - as a giant marionette theater construction- although the most talked about performance on the hour with the apostles,is less impressive than expected, mainly because of their small real size. The square is full of people, artists , groups, performers,real busy and nice.Buy the tasty, giant Prague sausages with bread they sell in cantines, all around it, visit the fantastic Art Gallery of Prague opposite the clock- don't miss the Dahli, Warhol exhibition if you're visiting till september (11e) ticket - and walk to the castle through Karlova the busiest street in the neighborhood!

The big attraction. The old town square is buzzing, lots of free guides to show you the sights, be there at 11am or 2pm and you will find a knowledgable guide to take you around the city. It's a free tour but you should tip the guide at the end of the tour. It's a walking tour and it's well worth doing.On the hour the great clock strikes the time, be there and see what happens!

Week end in Prague. Both Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock are must sees in Prague. You will also see the Old Town Square with the Jan Hus statue in the middle. Be aware that after 9 AM there will be lots of people around the city center. We took a Prague walking tour, highly recommend this, from the square at the Astronomical Clock.

Hourly Chime bit of a let down. we took the free walking tour and learned the significance of each statue and the faces in the windows during the chiming. that was more interesting that seeing the clock chime, but still glad we saw it.

Great View. We used the lift to get us to the top to have a look round and it really was a beautiful view taking everything in and pointing out special parts of the city. This place is well worth a visit and the people as I keep saying are very friendly and helpful.

Cool Clock. The clock and town square are fantastic. I wouldn't worry about seeing the hourly clock "show" as its really crowded and the "show" isn't impressive - just movement of some of the figures.

A long wait for not a lot!. Spent best part of an hour at the old town hall waiting to experience the astronomical clock. Rather than stand we decided to have a beer in a cafe next to clock. The price of a small beer was double what we were paying in most places for a large one! Definite rip off. On the hour the show began and most of the large crowd which had gathered, while liking the show, wondered why they had waited so long to watch it. A big dis-appointment!
historical clock. extremely interesting, but watch out for pick-pockets-very crowded. fascinating enginerring and design for the time it was made

Wonderful.. This is the biggest attraction in all of Old Town. The clock is amazing. Every time it got ready to mark a hour or half hour, hundreds of people gather in front of it to watch the caricatures around the clock move around and around. Very cool.

Pretty. It was pretty, honestly it was just a clock I don't see what the big deal is. It's overcroweded so you can't even get a picture of it. the crowd of people gwaking at it is just ridiculous but the trumpateer at the top is quite a nice addition. the turn of the hour is ok, but not worth going to see it purposefully.

Very interesting piece of archetectural history. Although I thought it would be touristy (and it was crowded both times I went) we were able to get a seat at a cafe/restaurant in front of it and see the clock strike the hour. It's impressive.

We have seen better....... Astronomical clock is okay, The tour show on TV hype it up, we found it okay. It seemed like people from pacific oceans were more impressed than from the Atlantic side. We skipped the old town hall.
Astronomical Clock. We all hung around and waited for the clock to do its thing, heaps of people would gather around. There are plenty of places to sit and have a drink while you are waiting too.
Fun. Performs every hour. Gets busy. Cafes opposite where you can eat or just drink whilst enjoying the short performance. You can climb the tower for views of the city.

Amazing functional clock. Together with the Charles Bridge and the Castle District, I would say that the Astronomical Clock is the symbol of Prague.It is amazing how a mechanical clock could be created that shows more than just the time and still works after many years after its creation. There are statues on it and when the clock shows an exact time, the statues will move a little and two windows will open showing other statues moving inside. There are a lot of tourists waiting for that moment filming and taking picture, but it is not that spectacular as you may expect (or as I was expecting). The great things about it are the architecture, the mechanical mechanism and the history behind it (it is really an old clock, at its time people in Prague were using it to get the time).You can go up in the tower (you need to pay a fee) and there is quite a view from there. Definitely worth it. Choose a time when it's not so crowded, for example, when the clock shows an exact time there is likely to be a good time to visit it as people focus on seeing the show the clock makes rather than visiting it.
Wonderful architecture. Be in time to watch the clock, but more importantly stick to you position otherwise you find that you end up right at the back. Well worth a visit.

Interesting Clock and fantastic view from Town Hall Tower.. The astronomical clock was fascinating to see with its architecture. Crowds of people waited to see the clock strike the hour. It was such a build up but when it happened it was slightly disappointing after the long wait. The Old Town Hall Tower is well worth a visit. From up the top you get an amazing new view of Prague and surrounds. We did it at sunset which was a good time to see the change in light and then Prague by night.

The "can't miss" attraction. Even if you don't know about this place, seeing a huge crowd of people gathering will make you stop for a minute and look at this beautiful clock.. it's worth seeing, and wait for it to ring.. notice the details, they're awesome
Picturesque. This is an attractive area of Prague but it is visited by large numbers of tourists so tends to be rather crowded.

The clock is really nice, but don't miss the view from the tower!. The astronomical clock is a nice piece of art and clockwork, it's a must see while in Prague (don't forget to go when the hour changes to see it work). However, the highlight for me was the 360° view of Prague and the Old Town Square you get from the clock tower. Amazing! (Price for student was CK70).

Beautiful. Lovely town square and astronomical clock interesting to watch the figures coming out of the clock. Usually buskers and entertainers performing there. Several out odour cafés and places to relax and enjoy a beer or cold drink.
Worth a visit to watch it!. Be prepared for a busy crowd in front of the clock! However it's a bargain to go up inside the tower and see the fab views.
something different. Never seen such a clock as this well worth taking a photo of or even a video (old hat I know). Enjoy the view from one of the local bars or restaurant's.

Ok Must see. One known attractions that is on the must see list. Just moderately interesting. A lot of spectators, and all the outdoors restaurants Close by makes it easy to pend a little time here on a nice day.

The feeling of another era. The impressive thing about this place is that, despite the thousands of tourists visiting it, you can escape neither the feeling of an earlier era admiring the architecture of its buildings nor a sense of sadness caused by the obvious difficulties to maintain them.
charm of prague. wonderful setting in a beautiful square lots of street entertainers gifts are on the expensve side better walking out of the main square to get food at very cheap prices

Beautiful. The most central spot in Prague. Dont miss the time when the clock strikes every hour. The coffee shops around clock is very expensive and can charge a glass of beer up to 5 times more than the normal price.

Enjoy the ambiance. The Old Town Square is alive with music and performers; take some time and enjoy the ambiance. The clock is unique and interesting. It's not worth fighting the crowds or waiting around to see the puppets in the clock -- not interesting at all.

Had high expectations... Beautiful clock, but our expectations were too high. We waited to be there at the whole hour to watch the clock with hundreds of other tourists: what a disappointment, two small doors open and the apostles come by behind the open window and the doors close again... During the rest of our stay we kept on making jokes about this clock.You cannot miss the clock because of the many tourists but make sure your expectations aren't set too high.

Busy Square of Prague. This square is a very busy area with a good atmosphere with lots of entertainers/restaurants/stalls. The clock strikes/show on the hour, but you need to get your spot 10 minutes before, watch your belongings, pickpockets are rife around this area when the clock strikes.
Astronomical Clock. It's a very interesting sightseeing to see. Its mechanism is quite complicated and if you realize when it was built you'll be amazed as much as I was.

Good place to get an aerial view. If you have purchased a Prague card, this place is included in the package. Take a lift up to the top of the tower and you can get a good view of the surroundings. It is a good way to see Prague in a short period of time. After getting a good view, walk down the tower instead of taking a lift. You can get some details of the astronomical clock as you walked down the slope.

Your appointment in Old Town. When the hour arrives, then you must be in the old town square, nose up, looking at the few but intense seconds of magic offered by the astronomical clock. A masterpiece of technology and fascinating history. In the meantime, watch your wallet, as the place will we extremely crowded. Free tours of the place are available in several languages, too.
Much ado about little. We waited for the clock to toll the hour. When it did, the display was quite brief and undramatic. Now, the Edinburgh Millenium Clock, on the other hand...

Cock-a-doodle-doo. Brave the crowds to catch the hourly show at the famous Astronomical Clock downtown. If you're lucky, you can situate yourself close to a tour group and overhear some fascinating historical facts (or join a tour group for the full story). The show is brief, but makes for a memorable experience. A must see for any Prague visitor.

Loved it all !. Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !
gET THERE EARLY AS IT GETS VERY CROWDED !Loved it all !

wonderful place. a must-see astronomical clock that was designed and built by a man who subsequently lost his sight.
feel the spirit of old times, which are nothing less advanced than today

The most beautiful heart of Prague. Any visit to Prague must involve its Old Town Square and the Astronomical Clock. Just be careful to guard your wallets when standing before the clock and applauding on the hour!

So cool, what an amazing instrument.. Once explained by "The Naked Man Tour" guide Marcus we were blown away. We did not go up the tower but today we learned how it works and the meaning behind the adornments. Fascinating!!!
Impressive. Prague is a great city, I loved the views, the vibe and the best is walking around the streets of the old town. The Town Hall is an architectural gem and the clock is very impressive.

Center of town - easy to see. This clock is beautiful and historic. It's right in the center of the historic district, so easy to get to and see. We didn't go up into it, but enjoyed watching it strike the hour both during the day, and at night, when it looks kind of eerie.
Nice and musical experience. Street performers are excellent. Dont forget to try local bear and traditional sweet bread... They are a delight

Beautiful view. If you go up the tower you view is absolutely beautiful. Just what post cards of praague look like. There is an elevator for,those who do not want to climb. There are a lot of people up there so it does take you a while to walk around. Not really special if is not for the fact of taking beautiful pictures of the red roof tops of Old Town.

Must see and go up the tower!. You must see the clock of course - its a great piece of design and gets a cheer every hour. Also make sure you go up the tower for an amazing view - there are lifts so no need to walk up - view is especially amazing at sunset.

Interesting clock and good views. This is the oldest working astronomical clock in the world. Crowds gather on the hour to watch stuff happen. You can visit the top of the Town Hall tower to get great views over Prague.
a extraordinary clock. we waited to see it work you can also go to the top and it as a restaurant as well you have to pay to go to the top very busy you have to queue .

Amazing views from the top. Waited for the on-the-hour movement of the Apostles (along with hundreds or even thousands of others), but seemed like much ado about nothing. Took less than a minute and not worth the wait to me. But climbing up to the top (or taking the elevator) was definitely worth the time. The views of the square - and the city - were amazing. You won't be sorry!
Worth visit to the tower. Nice view from the top of the city. Go up by elevator and down by a ladder. Very comfortable and the view is breathtaking!

Hourly "show". Sometimes it's the little simple things... Just stand around with the crowd and watch the "show" then when the bell chimes wave at the people at the top of the tower and they wave back :-)
Nice place but a lot of people. The place is nice but around the full hour ther eis a lot of people so you need to be careful with your belongings !

Lot of fuss about very little . You HAVE to go to watch the clock movement on the hour, it's just something that everyone does - and then you wonder why you bothered! The best thing about it is the atmosphere of the crowd waiting in anticipation but once you've seen it once you won't bother to make the effort to see it again.
Lovely but Crowded. Suggest early morning hours to truly appreciate. It is lovely, but I would not go out of my way to see the clock only.
Tower. Very nice panorama view from the top.Good surprise was a free of payment elevator to the top. May be good idea to lunch application to say something about the city quarters.

Time does not stand still. I loved the clock and the history and that is still keeping time from medieval days and does not do daylight savings. The 12 Apostles on the hour for their 30 second premiere-spectacular. Very crowed near each hour. Careful for pick pockets.
The Top. Go to the Top of the building. It is an amazing view of Prague and old town square. And you get there by elevator. No stairs. Do not miss the hourly clock animation, and the cheering croud.

Not to be missed. A popular location with tourists, specially to watch the clock strikes on the hour when small religious figures passing a small window in turn. A trip by the elevator to the top of the tower of the Town hall is a must to see the fantastic view of the square and Prague.

The Hourly Gathering.. Every hour the clock chimes and you can see the soldiers popping out and a Skeleton pulling on the chain. Many weddings couples gather on their wedding day for photos right on the hour. Brilliant

Great Disappointment. Lot of fuss about very little. Totally disappointing experience after all the hype. I've seen it mentioned as having colourful displays .. the whole thing is faded and dull, would have liked to enjoy it after going all that way, but I'm not going to fool myself for that reason .. if you want to see a clock that strikes the hour with a moveable display I suggest you take a trip to Nuremberg which is better by far.

Loved watching the clock in action. It is very crowded to watch the clock. Arrive at least 10 minutes before the hour to beat the crowd and have your video camera ready. It is very cool! Be careful of pickpockets.

Amazing clock. This is one atraction that is impossible to miss: it is right there in the middle of Prague's old town, and even if you do not see it (quite a task!) you will notice the crowd waiting for the hourly "show", this things clocks do on the hour. But the sheer complexity of the astronomical clock, with its colorful displays that border on kitsch, is the real atraction here. And then you may just walk around or go to one of the many cafés and restaurants.

An Absolute Must-See!!!. To put it very simply and cut the long story short, if you are in Prague and you do NOT visit the Old Town Hall with its world-renowned Astronomical Clock, well, you don't have the slightest idea of what you missed and may God have mercy on your soul ! :-) Seriously, this is one of the very top sightseeings in Prague (Praha) / CZ !!! The other one top sightseeing will then be, the also famous, Charles Bridge and you can always have a look at my 1000000% trust-worthy Review of the Bridge. Whilst you will be looking upwards to see the Astronomical Clock, which is attached to the Old Town Hall itself, have a small eye around for any pick-pocketers springing into (illegal) actions. Of course, as the area is being supervised by Police, the above does not usually represent a serious threat to your wealth. And do NOT leave your Camera "at home", you will regret that!
Lovely area. Go both during the day and at night. The restaurants are great, and every hour on the dot, a little surprise from the astronomical clock!

Must See. Great place to people watch. There are lots of people in front of the clock on the hour to watch it do its thing. Afterwards, people gravitate to the center of the square to watch the street performers.

Interesting but Over Rated. Read about the clock or get someone to explain it to you and then watch at the top of the hour. Don't set your expectations too high and be ready for thick crowds who'll be watching along with you.It's certainly an engineering marvel but if you're looking for a show at the top of the hour, prepare to be disappointed.

If you like waiting in line by all means….. The astronomical clock tower attraction goes like this. Wait on line to buy a ticket. Walk up about 4 floors or take an elevator and then wait on another slower line to begin the ascent to the tower. Either wait on another line for the elevator to the tower or climb another 4 or 5 flights. In any event you will next find yourself in a very small space waiting on another very slow line to ultimately stand by a view and move as slowly around the tower as the slowest person on the line allows. I said to myself what if someone, heaven forbid got sick or if there was a fire, how would we get out of here. The big pay off for all this waiting was a view that was not as good as the one at the old Charles Bridge Tower.

One of my favourites. The astronomical clock is really beautiful, until someone explains it to you. Then it is just amazing. The tower observation deck is usually packed, but the views to the square and the old town are uncanny.

Great area and clock fun. Every hour the clock does its thing....takes maybe 3 mins but a must see. I love the square. Lots of good food, had beer 2 nights at same place. Just a fun lively atmosphere. We bought our kids some kind of a plane you shoot in the air, lights lit up the sky with everyone shooting them. They were all pretty much same price. The kids ran around with them. There seemed to be a ton of beggars at every corner around this square. I was surprised but they were non invasive and truly begged down all the side streets that lead to the square. Lots of restaurants have bathrooms so do not hesitate to pop in and use it if you need to. During the day there were performers, strings, a flame thrower. Fun night people watching. All the shops close at 9pm. So if you are not bar crawling, you are pretty much done at 9pm. They allow drinking on the streets and since beer is sold in glass bottles, there was a lot of glass on the streets. Suckling pigs were at a number of restaurants. People here seem to be put off by the tourist. Its very odd. While here you must try the Trdelnik - traditional pastry of Czech Republic spinning over coal with butter, sugar and cinnamon. They all cost the same, in a street vendor shop. Delish!
Overrated. Don't waste time waiting for the 90 second-long display, mainly an opportunity for pick-pockets.Go on your own time and just take a picture.

Brave the crowds early morning. I was too early to actually get into the town hall but hang around to watch the astronomical clock play - with only a hand full of people. It's THE tourist magnet apart from Charles Bridge that is free so if you want to see it working - go early or late - on the hour.

Hourly show- a joke. I can not understand why this draws such a crowd at the hourly show. Yes it is pretty to look at but the show was stupid and not worth standing in the crowd. Much better to watch or listen to the street entertainers.

Clock was cool, best view from the bakery. The clock was what we expected. We happened to be visiting when it was raining and luckily, I bought a cheap umbrella that injured me (to the point I was bleeding) in the square right in front of the astronomical clock. We ran into a cafe directly across the street and there was no seating, so they directed us to their dining area upstairs. Well, the seating was directly across from the face of the clock and you could see the entire show on the hour perfectly. I believe it was in the Grand Hotel, but we didn't take any pictures on the name of the restaurant. Try to find it anyway, it was the best way to see the clock in motion.

Looks cool, but "show" is short. Good for looks and history. It is a pretty neat-looking clock. The area in front of the square will have many people just prior to the clock going off, but it clears out right after that. Not so exciting for anyone expecting any type of show, as the only thing you will see is small movements behind small windows at the top of the clock. Fortunately we were sitting in a cafe across from the clock and the lovely dumplings and orange mint lemonade made up for the lack of show. The square is lovely as is the city of Prague.

Great piece of history. When my kids hear about history on a vacation trip their eyes glaze over but they loved this. Everything about Prague is history but this clock is extra special. We would try to catch it at noon, the show in the tower is amazing, we went back several time and noticed something different each time.There are lots of shops and church's close by to explore and just looking at the outside design of the buildings will keep you busy for the day. The bridge is pretty close as well, lots to cover.
Perfect. The clock is amazing. You need to have someone to explain everything related to it and how it works. However, don't wait for the show because you'll probably be disappointed

Worth a look. On the hour and only for a very few minutes, yet, when the time comes, the show does not disappoint. Read up on the clock in advance. the workmanship is amazing for something that ancient that still works!

A must!. This is really a beautiful clock that is well worth a visit - the area gets very busy and to get a photo you must be quick1 You can walk up the clock to see the views around the city, we didn't bother, but I am sure it is well worth it.

The Clock. It seems that every hour all the tourist go to the main large clock and watch the 12 apostles move around. This is a great time to make sure you purse is securely by your side or you may wind up having a bad day.
crowded. good. very scenic except for the crowds when the clock strikes on the hour .... then its 'packed in time'. lots of street entertainers but well known for pick-pockets, strong police presence

Very cool. This clock is not to be missed. It is the oldest clock like this in Europe. It goes off every hour from 9 am to 11 pm. The astronomical clock has revolving figures that shows the sun and the moon position. If you love clocks be sure not to miss this one.

Absolute joke!. Tonight was our first night in prague. After a lovely dinner we ventured over to the astronimcal clock, saw the clock display at eight and decided to venture up the clock tower. Over to the ticket office we went, cost of ticket was 110czk approx 4Euro. My boyfriend put a 200 note on the desk and was putting the rest together in coins when the male worker with glasses stated ' I cannot accept this'. We looked up, there was a slight tear in the top of the note.my boyfriend asked 'why' to which this rude man could not give us an answer due to lack of english. I found this to be unacceptable. If you are working in a tourist attraction you should be able to speak the English language to some extent. I then said that the watermark had not been torn and that we had just been given the note in a restaurant aschange but he still refused . After that we walked out. I could not justify paying any money to an ignoramus like that.Ten minutes later we walked into a shop and the note was accepted without a second glance. I must also add that I have never written a trip advisor review before but I felt compelled to do so after. this! Tourists beware of this ignorant man!

Lovely and historical. It is fascinating to know that such a thing was built thousands of years ago when mathematics was fairly new. Interesting place. Every time the clock stikes an hour its a must see at that point.
Must see!. Great place, beautiful architecture, crowded but was on the weekend. Many restaurants and cafes, car free so walking around was without hassle.
Stop to wonder............. Located right in the center of Old Town, this attraction is a wonder.Easy to find during any walking tour of the old central core of the city.A must see.

Thats all?. We were waiting for 20 minutes in order to see few characters moving from far away. really?
The building itself is more interesting than the clock, actually.

One of the main sights. Yes, it´s worth seeing and a mechanical miracle. However, the clockwork spectacle on the full hour lasts 18 seconds. Debateable whether it´s worth to stand in the crowd for half an hour to get a good view.
A beautiful and medieval astronomical clock. A beautiful and medieval astronomical clock with a procession of the Twelve Apostles every hour...Unmissable...
Atmosphere. So atmosphere place. Evry one who has ever visited prague must see it. There are some legends and even songs abou this place but no words can realy explain the real visit.

great atraction. When you visit the astronomical clock be sure and take the tour up to the Hall tower. The views from there are incredible and is very nice to see the rooftops from the old city. Summer sunsets are incredible from there.

A wonder of wonders!. It is hard to imagine that someone could of created such an amazing clock that continues to work for so long! It is stunning, hard to miss when every hour there are zillions of people waiting for it to 'go off' It was very crowded when we were there and actually never 'waited' but were able to be amazed by the clock every time we past in in our journeys!

Astronomical clock near our hotel. This is quite an unusual item to see. Not as fantastic as the clock in Munich, but nevertheless worth a look. The Old Square is the focal point for the city and they have many interesting shows there. They also have free Segways to use and it is surrounded by many very good restaurants.

Fun thing to do but don't wait 50 minutes for it. We arrived about 10 minutes before the hour so you did not have to wait long for the short performance to see the apostles and the carvings move. This was so crowded make certain to watch your pocket
Wonderful.. Beautiful square, convenient starting point for tours.Excellent architecture and fun place to walk around and watch the sights and sounds of Prague.
great view of the old town. Great view of the old town. Easy access via the central lift. Well worth it. Go early to avoid the queues.

Take in the magic. A magical area where everyone appears happy and the hustle and bustle of real life is forgotten while enjoying some good fun watching a very masterly constructed clock in a wonderful setting. A feel good factor without doubt.
Wonderful detail. Clock was different, and well saw it working. Building was wonderfull outside, we didnt go to inside.
Old Town Prague. Walking in that part of town was envigorating. The people were lovely. The art and history, the music, the restaurants all of it was amazing.

Tourist spot. History and story about clock are phenomenal,single fact that clock is there for 600 years and still works perfectly is stunning. But if you at full hour expect some great show with figures surrounding the clock you are wrong. Show lasts less than 30 seconds as the whole point about clock is its beauty and great history and manufacturing behind it.

Fantistic clock and surroundings. The clock is amazing. the archetecture is beautiful. This clock tells you so many things besides the time. It puts on a little show every hour and it gets crowded so be aware for pick pockets.. You can go up in the tower. Unfortunately i did not go up there. Well worth seeing

Time your 30 second visit. I usually love things like this and was looking forward to it. However waited with maybe 250 other people for this non event. The clock itself looks interesting and was worth looking at while passing. However the chimes lasted what seemed like 30 seconds. My comment was "is that it" when it finished while others clapped!!!!. My cuckoo clock is more impressive. Seriously go to Krakow to see their clock at the University to see an impressive astronomical clock.
Uniquely beautiful. Make sure you get to see the astronomical clock in action but don't give in to the temptation to eat at the restaurants on the square. You can do much better elsewhere.

Stunning piece of history. This clock is really something: it's beautiful to look at and photograph, it's captivating when it starts its little show every 60 minutes and it's absolutely impressive when a guide explains you how it actually works and has been working for centuries! And then you have to climb up the tower and be rewarded with the most amazing views of a city that looks like it came out from Walt Disney's imagination but it's real. Don't miss it!

Fun performance & walking tour departure point. One of Prague's iconic attractions is the Astronomical Clock on the side of the Town Hall. Crowds gather every hour to witness the short performance. On the hour, two trapdoors open and the twelve apostles process behind. Further down, you have a skeleton tolling the hour and characters holding a mirror, bag of money and a lute, representing vanity, greed & pleasure. A golden cockerel at the top, crows at the end of each show. Most Walking Tours of Prague depart from under this clock. Look for the people with different coloured umbrellas which mean different things - Ghost Walk, Jewish quarter, Pub Walk etc.
The taste of Praha. I liked this place very much with it's small tiny buildings and narrow alleys until you reach Charles bridge.

Great Lookout!. Totally worth it. Ask the ticket taker when is the shortest line, and come back at that time so you don't spend all your time waiting to go up. We tried mid-afternoon and that was way better than morning time with those lines!
Old Town Square. Everything expands off of this square. Great old clock, but have no idea how to read it. Many one man acts performing in this square. A lot of activity.

Don't both waiting for the hourly strike. The clock itself is very beautiful and I am lead to believe the the view from the tower are worth the climb, although I did not go as I am frightened of heights. We duly stood before the clock as noon approached to see the 'show' that the clock produces. The crowds were huge, so we waited with great expectation. Oh dear, what a disappointment. When it was finished all of about 30 seconds, a lot of the crowd just looked around wondering if there was supposed to be more. Go and see it but don't waste time waiting for the hour to strike.

Be prepared to wait.. Large crowds assemble on the hour to hear and see the clock operate, so in order to get a good view be prepared to get there early and wait. If you want to climb to the top of the tower, do not purchase your ticket from the office to the right of the clock. Go to the Info centre and take tower lift to 3rd floor and go to the shop at the head of the queue. that way you will see the length of the queue waiting to take the lift or slope up to the top. If it is round three sides of the lift shaft expect at least 45 - 60 minutes wait. However once at the top the views are well worth the wait.
A must go. The clock stood out from the square, a must go. Just add to the mystic of the whole square. It beautiful and a great place for some photos.

Unusual but worth the wait. The clock is one of a kind and when you see it in action you can see what all the fuss is about. It helps if you know a bit of background history for it, otherwise you might find it strange. The clock tells the time from sunset not standard GMT, so when the bell strikes at the end, it's counting the hours since last sunset. The clock is unusual, but that's part of its charm as you won't find another one like it anywhere else.
Tick tick. The building is amazing and the clock truly beautiful however, the hourly display of the apostles is a bit of an anticlimax. Big crowds

One of the best panoramic views!. The line was a bit long, but we are so glad we did this! It was one of the best panoramic views of the both Old Town as well as the city and castle area across the river. Plus the whole clock is an interesting thing too! A definite must do if you are in the Square.

Night time treat. We had a brilliant tour guide who told us all about the clock and it's history during the day and on recommendation returned to go up the tower at night. It was fab! We arrived not long before closing so no queues and plenty of time to take this fab building in. The views of old town square were stunning, a real treat and must do!

Not sure what the fuss is about. The clock is ancient, that alone is pretty cool but I'm not sure if I missed anything when it stroke every hour. Very few things move and within a few ding ding sounds, the crowd claps and it's all over. You won't miss this clock given it's literally in the center of Prague. I had lunch at a restaurant near by watching it strike and later passed it again at night. It is constantly busy. The vibe is good. It's like New Year's Eve, everyone is waiting for something to happen. Just not as climatic.
City break Prague. We climbed to the top and got lovely photos. It can be very busy so try and go early in the morning. It is well worth a visit.

Crowded but worth a look. Great atmosphere as just before the hour strikes the crowds gather and wait. As the clock is so tall, you can see and get pictures regardless of the crowds. Worth waiting for as the apostle figures come out and then the chimes begin. Really lovely sight.

The clock of Prague. Located on the old town square there is this beautifully clock. It is a bit hard to take a photo without anyone passing by because it is a very crowded place but it is a must visit.

Busy but Brilliant. The crowds gather every hour to watch the astonishing spectacle of the moving figures of this chronological sensation. Unfortunately the figures pass along the back as the two shutters open so they appear more like two dimensional figures as they do not actually come out but just trundle along. It adds to the moment in time if you read up or are told by a guide about the historical significance of the varied figures.

Tick Tock. This is the main attraction in the old town square. Pretty cool can be viewed from the bar right below...with a beer :0) that is what I recommend. Be sure you change a few Czech marks from Euros because you cannot enter the tower with Euros or Dollars.
So many people. We waiting with bated breath for the clock to strike the hour and along with hundreds of others we were enthralled as the figures popped out like an old fashioned cuckoo clock.

I've seen more spectacular alarm clocks.. It has been claimed that the maker of this particular clock had his eyes melting with red hot spikes so as not to make another clock life this one. For me it wasn't worth the few minutes taken to wait for the hour to strike so I cannot imagine how the designer must have felt. Having been told on a walking tour that it would be more entertaining to stare back towards the swarms of people that had come to see with their individual looks which cried "Is that it?" I tried both ends of the argument and can honestly say my time was better used watching people, much like myself scratching their heads in a puzzled nature. This attraction is one of, if not the most over-rated attraction that I have seen. It is such a relief that the rest of Prague exceeded my expectations tenfold, as the clock did not interest me in the slightest.
A View from the Top. The best view of the city! It is a Must! Climb to the top. There is also a lift. Not expensive. You will see the whole city and especially the square below. Amazing!

what a design !!!. Astronomical Clock, built in around 15th century.I loved the clock's intricate construction & it was great to join the crowd in front of the tower to watch the procession of the Twelve Apostles: on the hour, every hour, a small trap door opens and Christ marches out ahead of his disciples, while the skeleton of death tolls the bell to a defiant statue of a Turk.This small show is lovely specially for kids. Clock offer much more in terms of the parameters it covers & needs a visit sure !

It's a pretty, old clock on a pretty, old building.. I like this building and this clock. However I mama unsure why hundreds of people gather to watch it strike. It's lovely but it's not THAT interesting. Have a look and move on,

Pretty but over-rated.. I guess this is one of the things that you must see when travelling to Prague. The square itself is great - full with lots of shops and wonderful resturants. But the clock, its very pretty but I guess we expected big things, especially since there was such a big crowd forming from about ten minutes before the hour. We found it all a bit of an anticlimax and nothing really happened on the hour. Nice to visit though.
So much to see. Great to be there when the clock is on the hour so many people inthe square the atmosphere is fantastic

It's just a clock. In a trip around Europe that has included many of the most famous sights known, this has to be by far the most underwhelming of them all, it functions as a clock should and tells the time however I personally feel that the hype and mystique that people associate with this clock is incredibly overrated. I was left baffled by the people who choose to applaud a mechanical instrument that did as it was supposed to on the hour. As it has done for many years. My advice don't expect an incredible and unique experience. For the keen horologists I would suggest the Glockenspiel of Munich as a much better clock experience.

You'll be here, so see it, but don't expect much -- it's just an old clock.. Big crowd, we joined in. Top of the hour comes, a couple of small doors open up to reveal some animated doll characters. Um, okay... It's old and beautiful but it's just a clock.

It's just a clock. Ok, we were told a lot about this clock. How it was stunning and what a surprise you get when it strikes on the hour, well we were disappointed.When we got there, there was a huge crowd of tourists waiting. So we did for ten minutes, the clock struck and out popped two weird characters and popped back in again. That was it!The clock itself was very beautiful and the surrounding buildings boasted Prague' s Barque architecture.

A Tourist Delight. Every hour tourists stand before the old Town Hall to watch the figurines pass through the open windows of the Astronomical Clock. While the clock is very old and very famous I found it a little underwhelming.
Beautiful Clock. Both the Astronomical Clock and Old Town hall are so beautiful. If you visit early in the morning or in he evening it is much less crowded. Definitely worth a visit.

Thousands gather to see the clock. We arrived at the already crowded square at ten minutes before noon and took up our places in front of the Astronomical Clock. We were told by our guide that the clock dates from 1490. As noon approached more and more people crowded into the square until the crowd must have numbered several thousands.It was an enjoyable experience to see the figures appear at the windows above the clock and to see the rooster flap his wings. The crowd dispersed fairly quickly after the show was over.
timeless quintessential quaint. a stunning timepiece with an amazing array of features ideal photographic opportunity just stand and stare at the marvel people just stop and admire this
Old Town Historical Centre. Fairytale kind of place - very busy but you cannot help but admire all the beautiful buildings and history.

Great open place with a lot of Restaurants and Drinking holes.. Lots of tourists, great beer and nice atmosphere.
Liked the old buildings and the culture around. The narrow lanes filled with people walking and drinking beer, all the way upto the Charles Bridge. Amazing atmosphere.

One of a kind . Really one of a kind monument. There is so much detail. We got there five till two and the clock rung and we got to see all the apostles circle around the window. Gets crowded when the clock is about to chime but it clears up so you can get a nice picture

Worth visiting. It is so iconic that it has been in many movies, MTVs and the cover of many Prague travel books. It is always crowded. I visited its show twice. The show is good to me; maybe reading too many travel tips about it made me feel not that impressive. But honestly, it is good enough, considered it was built hundreds years ago and still working fairly good.
4 from Texasd. The astronomical clock was a masterpiece. We just happened to be there when it rang on the hour. The bells were ringing and the chicken flapped its wings. GREAT

All-time masterpiece. A very historical and must-visit spot in Prague. The clock looks very ancient yet still beautiful. A bit hard to take a picture or even get a spot to have a clear view since it's always crowded with tourists in front of the clock. Make sure to see the performance every hour from 9 AM to 9 PM. It's amazing that the clock still work very well. Definitely should not miss this one!
Must see. The old town is very charming but the clock is the 'must see' of the day.I won't spoil the surprise!Note: careful with pick-pockets!
Great experience!. Took a video of the clock "in action" on the hour..Played it back when I got home to family. Loved the history presented by our tour guide!

Very cool. The square and the clock are very beautiful. I watched the clock show, and though it was very short I liked it. I went on a tour earlier and they had told the history of the clock and it's meaning. It something that should be seen if you are in the square.

Very ancient and interesting clock. This is one of the best spot in old town, Prague... Try to be there say 10 minutes before the sharp turn of the hour. This is when the clock will chime and amazing things will happen. Do notice a few things just in case you will miss it and wait another hour. 1. The Blue Glass Door will open and figurine will be rotating 2. Notice the 4 figuring from left to right (Man with a Mirror looking at how handsome he is, next is Rich Merchant with bags of gold, next Skeleton and lastly a Turkish man with musical instrument.... close to the end please do notice the golden rooster... it will flap its wings.
Quaint but nice. Discover the amazing astronomical clock and the history that entails. See what happens when the tiny doors open and theclock chimes.

Beat the crowds and increase the enjoyment. We lined up for the 9.00am clock display which goes off every hour. A fair crowd joined us and we can only imagine how busy it would be in the middle of the day. The clock has four major figures including one that was a skeleton that we worked out was Death as he was holding the bell. There was a small cuckoo above. Death rang his bell and a number of old guys who were saints or apostles rotated through the window frames. Then the cuckoo hooted once. As these clocks go this was one of the better ones.We then got tickets for the viewing tower. This is located two doors down from the office. We took two lifts up to save walking. The first one was largely a glass affair and took us past an historical display of the tower. The second one was a scientific creation similar to the double helix structure. It was quite unusual. From the viewing platform at the top we had lovely views including towards the imposing Powder Gate. There was also Zizkov Tower from which we could just make out the climbing baby sculptures and several churches above the streetscape. The only disappointment was on the walk back down. There was info boards detailing the history of the clock and tower but the workings of the clock were not visible as we had read. Otherwise a wonderful sight to see.
Fun Place to Explore. Great place to have lunch and enjoy the scenery. The clock is fun to see change on the hour. Was surprised at the many restaurants to find wonderful food and wine as well.

An Unexpected Surprise. The Astronomical Clock dates from the 15th century. On the hour, 2 small doors open at the very top & Christ marches out ahead of his disciples while the skeleton of death tolls the bell. Below the clock are 12 colorful medallions with the signs of the zodiac that were added in 1865. This is a very popular sight just off of the square, so plan for a crowd.

Best get here early to beat the crowds. The clock and the square surrounding it, was a highlight of our visit to Prague. As historians, we appreciated the statue to Jan Hus. As lovers of gadgets and inventions, we were impressed by the Astronomical Clock. You will want to see it strike many times, so, during tourist season, go around 8 or 9 am, before the crush gets intense.

Astronomical Clock Prague. The Clock tower and Old Town Hall is certainly a notable attraction in the City of Prague.This unique Clock is worth a visit especially when it chines. Make sure you know the history before you leave.However the Clock Tower in part of the Old Town Square and unfortunately peddlers,food stalls and souvenirs arcades have spoilt the cultural identity of the Square albeit the magic of the Clock. Find a local Tour guide like Karolina at Benjamin Tours to really show you the real Prague. She can be contacted at www. Benjamintours.cz and tell her that Warren set you.

amazing clock. The astronomical clock is simply amazing, you should also stay every hour on the hour, this is when the real show is, all the tourists will be waiting for this and when it finishes all would clap their hands in amazement...but watch out for pick pockets when you are in the middle of the crowd waiting and watching because this is the perfect time for stealing your belongings.some tourists went all the way up to the clock tower to enjoy the view of the old town square but I was too lazy to climb the stairs, its too high.Whenever I looked at the clock, I always remembered how the king found it as the most beautiful thing he has ever seen, that he punished its maker by taking out his eyes so that he wouldn't make another clock to someone else.
Amazing History. Take the time to climb to the top of the clock tower (there is a lift for those like me) amazing views and architecture.
very historic. Very lively square and takes you back in olden times.We loved to hang around there and feel the city.

lively spot. i always pass by this area since it is few steps away from my hotel, lots of tourist, restaurants, shops, bars, the highlight of this is the hourly alarm and display of the clock, also you can go up the tower to view the city, theres an entrance fee for that.

NOT just a clock!. We were a few minutes early (the clock "performs" on the hour) and I was tired and considered giving up on the wait, but so glad I didnt - the show lasts for a few seconds only but it was worth the wait - really interesting.

Great view from the top. Make sure you visit the top of the clock tower...The story of the clock maker is one of hundreds you can hear in Prague. After he built the clock he was blinded to ensure he would not build another clock in a different city. Cruel way to protect intellectual property !!!

Beautiful but.... It´s a wonderful tower and the clock it´s really nice, but I was expecting more from the "clock show" that takes place every hour when a couple of figures come out the tower to announce the new hour. It happens really quick and it´s not too pretty.
Old Town Hall. In the 1980s it was marvellous to stand and watch the clock 'perform'. Still is, but you will be jostled (watch your pockets nad purses), and be almost deafened by shouting people.
Interesting. Nice to see and wait for the time. I was told to be careful with pick pockets while in that area. I had no problem, though.

Join the Crowd. A large crowd gathers on the hour to watch the show that lasts just a short time. An Interesting but not amazing performance from the clock and puppets, still it is free and worth a look. You can climb atop the tower if you have the legs for it and catch a great view.

Cool, but a bit underwhelming. We didn't go up the clock tower, but the clock itself is pretty cool. I expected it to be bigger for some reason; even so it's very different than anything else I've seen in any other city. It's in the Old Town Center, so you can't miss it.

Enchanting clock in the Main Square. This a very popular attraction on the hour as many people gather to see the figures appear when the clock chimes. It is very charming and something you must see while you are in Prague.
Highlight. Must see stop on walking tour of Prague. The hourly show is enchanting and a reminder of simpler times. The gold work on this clock is really beautiful.

Stunning. The square where this is situated is absolutely breathtaking - the architecture and history everywhere you look is amazing. Dining in one of the surrounding restaurants at night, sitting outside when everything is lit up is truly memorable.

Don't miss it. Here is the heart of Prague. Enjoy the architecture, the energy level of the tourists and locals, and the food. The clock is good to see, but you don't need to wait around to watch it on the hour. Not much there compared to other clocks.

Climb to top. The clock itself was a bit of an anticlimax. However, the climb to the top of the tower was fun. You can buy tickets under the clock or , even better, go in the door to the left of the clock through the Prague tourist office and there is a ticket booth on the third floor. You can take an elevator to the third floor, then another to the top. But it was an easy walk up a ramp and then a spiral staircase. Great views from the top allowed me to get oriented to the city. Just remember to go clockwise to relieve the congestion.

Beautiful clock and the starting point for many tours. You just must see this clock and if you book a walking tour which I would recommend this will probably be your meeting point. Right at the corner of the main square this complicated looking clock is a real photo magnet. We would recommend booking one of the walking tours where you will get to see the main attractions without missing some wandering about yourself.
A must see I suppose. Obviously a major attraction especially at the top of the hour when the clock strikes although there are hudreds of people all trying to see and have their pictures taken.
Average!. Average, not exciting at all. Loads of tourists. Prague too full. My whole Prague experience was one of loud, rowdy groups of drunks, hated it!

Amazingly intricate - loved the view from the top. The clock is phenomenal - built in 1410. I could stare it for hours. You must go to the top of the clock tower. I was going to pass because I was tired and had worn the wrong shoes to climb to the top, but fortunately decided that I did not want to miss out. I found that there are two elevators that will bring you to the top where you can see all of Prague! Absolutely beautiful at sunset. Not to be missed.
Must see it. We saw the clock striking twelve. It is all over very quickly but it is really a lot different to other things I have seen.

Beautiful architecture. The Astronomical Clock was beautiful, but be prepared for crowds. It was our first stop when we were exploring Prague. The buildings are gorgeous and worth the trip. We found plenty of places to eat with lots of variety in the town square.

Genius!. Interesting history surrounding the clock and the Old Town Hall. This is the main attraction of the square. We took a tour on our first day and we received the history of the clock and how it works. To think that people, back in the 14th century had the ability to build something so complex is mind boggling. We were never in the square to see the puppets move but from what I understand, it's over in the blink of an eye. Makes for gorgeous pictures, especially at night.

An astronomical clock, get over it.. I went to see this on one very hot day. The crowd was big to say the least. Then on the hour two small doors opened up and figurines passed by looking out. The clock is beautiful but I'm not a horologist. To tell the truth it's an anticlimax, the figurines don't do anything, yes they are old, yes it is beautiful architecture, yes it doesn't tell the normal time, yes some people like looking at old things, such as Catherine Zeta-Jones, personally though as Dionne Warwick said "Walk on by" it's not going to get much better. Unless of course you happen to be a horologist.
old. I liked that there were all sorts of guides that gave information about the clock and its historyI think it is the busiest goal in Prague
Astronomical!!. Loved it because it is so original. Nice to sit at a cafe opposite and have a coffee or a snack while you wait for the clock to strike the hour!!
hard to believe. hard to believe that this clock was built in the 14th century. It is so crazy in its novelty and inguenity
must see. I would go again it lasts just a couple of minutes. So we had ice cream coffee in one of the tents. the sorbet was excellent

Gorgeous - must see. The astronomical clock is a wander and you must not miss it!
As I've seen in another review, it's wiser to admire it from a nearby terrace in order to avoid the crowds in front of it.

Old Town and Praha Icon. In the middle of the Old Town is the astronomical clock. Standing nearly the height of the building, the clock can be seen from every direction. The clock certainly draws massive crowds, especially at the top of the hour. My favority time to see the clock is in the evening hours when the crowds seem to go home. It will be difficult to get a full length picture of the clock as tourists are always around. Find a nice ice cream parlor nearby and enjoy the crowds as they go by. There are several astronomical clocks within Europe (Strasbourg, France) but the Praha clock is the most beautiful.

Be On Time!. Don't waste your time by waiting for the clock to ring. Just enjoy it from outside (no need to climb!) and try to be there at 12:00 as it goes wild. Side-tip:The cafes around are very overpriced.
you will stop for time. This unigue clock has a special wish tradition. Travel there and see and hear the lore. Very special
See the Clock during the day. I saw the clock at night and did not get it. Seeing it during the day was much better and allowed me to really appreciate the cool features and the tooling on the hour.

Historic and beautiful. The place gets crowded and loud, so if possible get there earlier than later. It is a beautiful tower and functioning clock (especially considering this was built more than 600 years ago). The astronomical clock's main function was to depict the movement of celestial bodies (including the Sun and the Moon); showing the time was merely a secondary element. Not all the figures are currently working as they are in the process of renovating it. I think only the Skeleton was working. The clock is large and strikes every hour, so as long as you are there 5 to 10 minutes before the hour, you should be fine. Standing a little further back does give you a better overall view.

Avoid the hordes by admiring from a restaurant.. Albeit not the most inexpensive proposition, fine eateries surround the clock and town hall. Eateries are confined and slightly elevated, assuring a good view of the cuckoos at each hour.

Beautiful clock. My husband is into clocks so this was perfect for him to see. We stood in the plaza with everyone else and waited for it to chime. It was really nice to hear and see it operate. We did not take the trip to the top, it is a paid thing and was expensive and crowded.

A must see in Old Town Prague. At every hour on the hour from 9 am to 9pm, the clock displays the twelve disciples in the small windows at the top and the skeleton with the keys. Crowds gather for each event. It is a must see when visiting Prague.

Visit the Clock at Noon. This wonderful clock comes to life at noon and displays the twelve apostles who circle, look at the crowd, and continue. Below, the figure of death rings his bell and the other figures attempt to turn away. It is a marvel to behold this clock which continues to work after so many centuries.

Astronomical Clock & Old Town Hall in Old Town Square. This is a must visit for anyone visiting Prague. The clock and very famous, unique, 600+ years old and probably the only place in the world you will see one. The clock chimes every hour on the hour and this is a must be seen time. The Old Town Hall has long tradition of holding weddings and during your visit you will see newly wed couples taking pictures near the clock.We went there on a Saturday and the place was buzzing, we went back again on Monday and Tuesday.Enjoy the movie and pictures.
Interesting Feels. Enjoyed this area! I was very amused and was really excited to explore the area. I can't explain enough, but this place is definitely a go-to place! You should check it out!

Great views and amzing clock. Loved the views from the tower and totally amazed at the mechanism developed to make the clock work. This is a must see. I can not believe it was constructed in the 1400's. if only we had craftsmen like that

I have seen better astronomical clocks. Crowds wait to see the clock spring into action, but we didn’t. It really didn’t seem worth the wait, and it was a hot day. It’s worth seeing the building and the clock, but debatable if it’s worth waiting a longish time to see the actual movement, it operates in astronomical mode at the top of the hour. If your there 5 minutes before the hour, then certainly stop to see, otherwise, it’s probably better to carry on looking around the area.
A piece of history. This is a must-see, but it is over quickly. The whole show is over in less than two minutes. But it is interesting and amazing it was built 600 years ago.

Great square. An amazing clock face! Nice square lots of markets around loads of tourists all day long good resteraunts and bars, cafés slightly expensive but you pay for the view nice food market here when I visited!!

"third-oldest astronomical clock in the world". The Prague astronomical clock, or Prague orloj , is a medieval astronomical clock located in Prague, the capital of the Czech Republic. The clock was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still working.
Stunning. The only one of its kind in the world. Overlooking the main square and facing the Cathedral the tower only adds to a beautiful square with restaurants and bars.
old town clock. One of the most famous sites of Prague ,but get there early as every hour on the hour the clock chimes and figures appear ,a really mystical clock

Crowded area, but worth seeing. It operates in "astronomical" mode only on the hour, and the crowds there were huge. So, we've seen it, marveled at its beauty, and enjoyed the surrounding shops. We are sorry, however, that we did not see it function--because it was 93 degrees that day, and that was made even worse by the hot cobblestones we stood on. It was so hot that the city (and some restaurant owners) were actually spraying water mist on passers by--really!

You expect much more from what you actually see (astronomical clock). The Old Town Hall square is very beautifull as every buiding is a masterpiece by its own - there are so many details in every house which are worth looking at but all the attention of people seems to be concentrated on the Clock - the whole "show" is about a minute every hour from morning untill evening (not 24-hours). Lots of places to eat and drink but of course - the highest price. Nevertheless I would rather suggest to sit with a beer just to have a look at the square. But not the "drug of choice" to have a full meal. Once can find much cheaper beers in good bars a few hundred meters away.

Beautiful clock, but don't hang around or top of the hour. The best things about this clock are it is in an absolutely square and the clock is beautiful. At night the square reminds me of Disneyland. The square is packed with tourists. As one who stayed to see the clock at the top of the hour, I wouldn't fight the crowds to do it again. There is a charge to go up in the tower.

Tourist Hell unless you get there early. Premier attractions come with a big caveat: lots of other tourists will want to go there too and that means the tour groups, hawkers, buskers, mime artists, pickpockets, pricey fast food stands....huge camera-wielding crowds gather in front of the Astronomical Clock from a quarter to in order to watch the hour chime. So if you really want to enjoy the architecture and the undoubted beauty of the Astronomical Clock get there in the early morning or at night: then it's an entirely different, much less stressful experience!
Pretty - but not worth waiting for. lovely to look at, but really not worth waiting for the "big show" on the hour - blink and you would miss it. Take a photo and go for a beer...
be there on the hour... one of this things you hang around to watch and take a few pictures... reminded me of the clock tower in Venice... crowded and interesting to view
Amazing pice of work. This clock it fantastic! 600+ years old and it's still going strong. They have live trumpeters at the top of the clock. Quite a show! This is definitely a do not miss!
Incredible!. Amazing what they could build hundreds of years ago. To think of the incredible genius that created this clock is awesome.
Busy, but nice. Expect lots of people all the time, but it's a vivid, and awesome view, architecture of all ages and styles, mix of history pieces

A piece of history. This is a focal point and popular meeting place in Prague old Town. It's history is fascinating and it is lovely to see it in the flesh so to speak. We'll worth the walk to see it and you could stand for hours just looking at all it's very interesting features
Historical Landmark. The ambiance and the hustle bustle of the square is what makes it truly worth a visit. So many different architectural styles make it like you are in a fairy tale.
A must see place. this is one of the most importent site in prague but dont forget to go up and see the view from the top

Well worth a visit.. My husband and I visited the Old Town Square almost every day when we went to Prague early July 14.The Astronomical Clock is a lovely looking clock. But dont get too excited about hanging around for it to chime on the hour.Crowds get in this square because its buzzing with cafes, restaurants and buskers.On the hour the chimes are rung by the skeleton thats stands high up on the clock.Then the doors open and 2 at a time the apostles show themselves.All this lasts for approx 30 seconds.So dont look away because you'll miss it.You can pay a little bit of money to go up the tower.There is a lift to the top if you cant manage the stairs.Wonderful views from the top. And my last thing to say is :-Apparently the area is easy pickings for pick pockets so be careful.But please dont let those words put you off.Old Town Square and the Astronomical Clock is a must.The Architecture of the buildings are well worth looking at.Round the back of the clock near the park is Kotleta restaurant.Visited twice. Really nice food and staff friendly.Reasonably priced.

It draws a crowd. Part of the old town square, near Starbucks.The clock chimes every hour from 9am till 8 pm? Some 500 years ago the was amazing but now it is amazing it still works,One of Pragues big 3 tourist attractions and it's easy to see why.There were 500 plus tourists there at 9am so you can see it's popular

Clock at early morning; tower at late evening. One can easily tell when the hour is approaching without even bothering to view the clock, purely from the amount of crowds that cluster around it and block all walkway through the passage in doing so. Due to this, it is best to see the clock chime in the early morning before the crowds have a chance to gather.The tower itself is exactly the opposite: best climbed in the late evening as it is getting dark - for the best views. It is slightly confusing that the ticket office is around the corner from the entrance, by a souvenir shop. But after the doorman explained this to me it was not to difficult to find.The lift up the tower is rather spectacular also. It appears as if they borrowed it from the set of a sci-fi film and transported it into the middle of a medieval tower in Prague. If you take the stairs, however (at least one way: up or down), one can stop and learn about the history of the tower and medieval Prague from the mileposts located on the way up - which I would thoroughly recommend.Definitely something one should do whilst in Prague - but then, being located right in the central corner of the old town square and en route to most major tourist areas from there, it is rather hard to miss.

Lots of energy, interesting, and entertaining. Just walking around the square was well worth the time we took to go.
