The architecture was great, the musicians playing in the square was entertaining, and there was lots to eat, drink, and see. You could spend just a short time, or many hours in this area. The Astronomical Clock was not worth waiting for though and sort of lame. To walk by and look at it was enough, we didn't need to wait for it to chime.

Just a blast and a wonderful view.... It cost around $5 US to take the tour. You have 2 separate elevators for the ones that want to walk as little as possible. I did it the hard way and walked the whole way up taking random photos of the building. Its also a great view of the Old City Centre from up top.With a good camera, you can see the watches in the Omega Shop across the street. It was well worth the $5.

The Astronomical Clock is a 15th century wonder.. The Prague Old Town Hall Clock was a wonder when it was built around six hundred years ago. Now one's reaction to it may depend on one's level of cynicism. On the hour, a mechanical rooster crows, death tips his hour glass and the twelve Apostles parade by. There is always a big crowd there to watch. This was a marvel in its day and still entertains now. Those who have grown up on computerized animation may be less impressed, but I think it is very cool.

Still great as it was hundred years ago. Amazing architecture,unfortunately always surrounded by tourists.
Astrological clock should definitely be on your list of to do in Prague. You can see the figures moving every hour and there is always a huge crowd to applaud the end of short show.

Amazing...dont miss it when it rings (every hour)!!!!. Probably the most beautiful clock in Europe... really worths to see it when it rings every hour and the figurines start moving! One of the things I mostly liked in Prague.

Fabulous evening. While the clock itself is merely something to see as you pass by, the square itself is fabulous! Live entertainment going on evening - musicians, jugglers and amazing ambiance. Reminds me a bit of Venice's main square. My son loved playing with the bubble makers and I enjoyed the music greatly. Perfect at sunset.
Great shopping and good restaurants. The clock was interesting. The shopping in that area was good with friendly service. The outside cafes were fun.

Pretty Cool. At first you walk into a nice big open square, you have vender's and restaurants and a lot of Czechs offering this tour or that but they aren't to pushy. The place starts to come alive about 11-12ish and by early afternoon it gets really busy. We got there about 10am and got a great view of the clock and there wasn't the throngs of people that showed up for the 12 noon show. The clock itself was beautiful in it's own way because it's soooo old and has an old school charm. What I didn't expect is that the bottom of the clock it is only about 15 feet off the ground, I expected it to be pretty high and not being able to see much but it was just the opposite. The "on the hour" show is not even a minute long, it's not super elaborate by today's standard but several hundred years ago it was a huge feat and today it's still cool (even by today's standard its pretty cool engineering) We went up into the clock tower, which I believe was about $6 usd (approx) its pretty neat in there, you do NOT see any of the clocks inner working though, so be aware. The top offered a great view of the city below and I would recommend this since it's only a few bucks.*Warning: If you go during any of the busy times (we walked by it several times but didn't stop to see the show again) there are tons of people packing in to see it and bumping in to you etc so BE MINDFUL OF YOUR BELONGINGS!! take the proper precautions, purse/backpack zipped and in front of you, wallet in front pocket, camera cases locked and in front. You will be looking up for the most part and getting bumped into so you will be vulnerable.

WORKING FOR 600 YEARS!!!. This is an amazing clock, built in the early 15th century. Over the years it has been fixed and added on to, but the fact that it is still working is astounding.People gather in front of it for 15 minutes or more before the hour so as not to miss the 'parade' of figures or the cock crowing...but truly it is almost a non event. The 'parade' lasts only a minute or so and is in fact very difficult to see from street level.We didn't wait for it to strike the hour the first time we saw it, but when passing by another day just on the hour happened to catch it. You can not go to Prague without seeing this and snapping a photo!
Get there just before the top of the hour. What a great but very short experience. Watch the little windows open, the rooster, the skeleton and the figures.It all happens very quickly and is amazing.
World Famous Orloj. Another gem of Czech history working for ages. I also have to recommend view from the tower - really breathtaking:)

Very intriguing. It took me a lot of time to understand that device... Very intriguing and complex at first, but after getting some explanation from locals it turned out to be very smart! A must see and - photos and photos, of course!!!
Old Town Square. The Old Town square is fantastic, the clock is a must to see especially on the hour when there is a fantastic puppet show of the 12 deciples appearing at the windows.
This is a must see!. Everyone has cameras ready for the On-the-Hour happening at the Astronomical Clock--really no big deal but should be seen.

Don't blink. At the top of every hour the clock does its little show for 20 seconds. If you can't get close, walk back to along the restaurant wall that faces the clock. Go behind the patio, right up to the wall, Even shorter people can get a view over top of the crowd from there.

Go Up!!. Yes it's great to finally get to see the Astronomical clock and all the brides entering the town hall...but...Enter the hall and pay to go up the astronomical clock and don't worry they have elevator. Here on the top of the astronomical clock you would get to see a nice and great view of the old city of spikes. Great for pictures!!!

Climbing to the top is a must.. The clock is fascinating and beautiful (as is the entire square - absolutely gorgeous, and if I could do it again I would hire a guide to tell me about it all). The climb to the top provides absolutely stunning views of the city especially on a sunny day. It was a high point of our time in Prague.

Somewhat popular-. Don't be stupid, go up there! I didn't make the ascent to the top of the clock tower until my third time in Prague and I wish I'd gone up immediately. You can see everything! It can be bracingly cold if you go in January like I did, because I'm an idiot, but it's still worth it. There's always a Starbucks close by to grab a quick hot chocolate or try a cup of grog at the Christmas market in the square below. Again, depends on season.

One more visiting place of Pague. If you really wanna see the place be there exactly at the strike of an hour.. You get to see a lot of crowd so better be a bit early to catch a better view of the Astronomical clock
Interesting. Very nice place. It is a real piece of art, and great to wait until it is sounds. Best place in Prague

Great view. One of those things you've got to see, even if just to make up your own mind. The clocks are definitely impressive, and the architecture overall is wonderful, even if the show is notoriously underwhelming.

Beautiful artwork. It is a beautiful piece of architectural, mechanical and astrological artwork. We also did a tour and got to see the "inner" workings of the clock. That it is beautiful doesn't distinguish it from anything else in Prague because beauty is everywhere. The anticipation of the top of the hour is heightened due to the masses of people coming to see it but it isn't extraordinary. Make sure not to stand too close underneath it as you would miss the apostles.
Joy day or night!. Regardless you seeing it day or night it is very fascinating.Very busy area and since it is at old town no one will miss it.
Nice landmark but beware of pickpockets. Very nice landmark and possibly most busy place in Prague so pickpockets are praying on lost tourists.

Great meeting point. The clock is stunning especially when you figure out all the different ways of telling the time and even names of newborns. this is a great meeting point as well because its central and all the free tours start from there, We took two tours from there - one of the city and one of the castle area (the second one we had to pay for) Highly recommended.

A Must see. This is another must see while in Prague. Be there for the hour stricking but get there early. The crowd start arriving early and we fiound that if you stand back you get a better view. We saw it on many occassions while passing through the square and would recommend the same.

Great landmark. Beautiful tower and clock. The clock was so beautiful that the story goes that the maker of the clock was blinded so that he could not replicate his beautiful clock for anyone else. The maker then turned of the clock and it did not work for centuries until someone could figure out how to turn it back on. At least that was the story that I our guide told us. Regardless it is something that has to be seen along with the little show on the hour. Pay a few dollars and climb to the top for some nice views of Prague and the square.

Beautifully underwhelming. A very beautiful and interesting piece in the town square. Our tour guide described it to us as the most disappointing attraction in the world, and ironically it did not disappoint. Unusually I would describe it as worth seeing because it is so underwhelming.

Read about the clock and watch as it strikes the hour. We arrived about 5 minutes before the hour so that we could see the clock as it chimed on the hour. The square below was crowded but one could see the clock clearly. The doors opened and the Apostles came out. Look closely at the four figures on either side of the clock when it strikes the hour.

Not to be Missed. Be sure to have some background knowledge about the clock to gain a deeper appreciation of what you see when the clock strikes. It happens so quickly, you will want to watch it more than once. We had a private guide who was able yo provide us with a great deal of information about the history and symbolism. What a festive atmosphere as everyone waits for the the "show".

A lovely large square and animated clock. The clock animations are worth watching, but be aware like all such places prices can be extortionate. I paid 190 koruns for a .4 litre beer. Approximately £8.50 a pint. Making this the dearest beer I have ever bought.

Underwhelmed. Hard for me to understand the fascination with this attraction.Yes it'looks nice, and the movement on the hour is kinda quirky but I wouldn't go out of my way to wait for ages to see it.

Gorgeous clock, but overrated. The clock itself is a piece of art that can stand on its own as Excellent. However, the masses of people standing around to watch its movements on the hour left me baffled as to why. Maybe I expected it to be a phenomenal show lasting at least 5 minutes, not just 1. The technological workings to make the movements occur, done at a time that there was little technology, is of course, great... just a bit anti-climactic.

amazing clock. It's a large clock on the square look at the amazing art work. just ignore those horrible group tourists. they will try to block your way every where in Prague. just stand affront of them.
Don't miss it !. Good fun watching and waiting, get there about 10 minutes before the hour to pick your spot and take it all in.beautiful architecture all around.

Really amazing. We returned to the old town square several times to see this amazing clock. Try to get there about 10 minutes before the hour to watch all the movements as the clock
strikes the hour. Surprisingly it strikes on a 24 hour clock i.e at 9pm it struck 21 times!

Expected the clock to be larger. Maybe that was the matter of too high expectations or maybe there is indeed nothing too special in the clocks. If you are in Prague, you should definetely see it (and you will definetely do as it's in the city center) but it's not the best thing to see in Prague. The "show" which you can see once an hour (or half an hour? don't remember exactly) isn't too exciting. There will be a crowd of people around you so mind your money and gadgets, something may be stolen while you're in drowd.So, my conclusion is: go there, but don't wait anything special
Clock was over-rated but old town is nice. The Astronomical Clock is kind of over-rated (though it's always packed with people) but the old town area is nice for a stroll

Time on your hands. So many interesting features on this clock, which is practically in the Old Town Square. Large crowds congregate to watch on the hour, to see the figures which I think is called the Walk of the Apostles. Very impressive dials. Watch out for pickpockets
tourist trap. very crowded but beautifull square. people trying to get you on all kinds of tours and the sheer amount of people there make it difficult to really appreciate the place for what it is

Don't go for the tower!!. The clock itself is really pretty, a must see, but that's pretty much it.This will be more a warning not to take the tour to the top of the tower - it is really not worth the money!There were way too many people, way too little space – you can’t pass each other, you don't have time to either take pictures or enjoy the view, you basically are being pushed around like a sheep in a herd. For 110 kr per person – tourist trap…
A must. Great place to grab coffee or a beer and people watch, takes you back in time. Beware of people panhandling and trying to get you to attend their clubs and bars in the evening.

Grand view. Get to the top of the tower for the amazing view of the surrounding area. As most of the buildings are of same height, you get an unblocked view. Recommended to take the lift especially if you have difficulty walking uphill.Highly recommended.
Tourist Highlight. Go for the sighting of the 12 apostles when the clock chimes on the hour.....but it does get very busy.

Beautiful and historic. You can see the doors in the clock open and characters moving on the hour...but mostly it's just a beautiful place to hang out and people watch. Take the elevator to the top. The view gives a new perspective of the wonderful city of Prague

Clock is a must. The clock is absolutely amazing and probably the one must see. I won't spoil it, but get there early enough before the top of the hour for the show. The square gets crowded. The observatory/bell tower gives nice views, but is very crowded.
Quite Amazing. The astronomical clock is quite amazing. Although I could not tell the time by looking at it, it is quite an amazing structure. Go early to avoid the crowds.
nice beautiful clock. I saw this clock twice, do 'its thing' and it was very impressive. I took several pictures. I m glad i got to see it - the crowd cheered after the trumpet player finished.

Stepping back in Time. I have been fortunate to have visited Prague on three occasions for business. On each trip I have visited Old Town and stopped at the Astronomical Clock. Just standing in front of something dating back to 1490 is something awe inspiring. When you think of the history that has passed before this, and the famous and infamous people that have stood in the same place admiring it, you can't help but get a chill. Every hour thousands of people crowd the streets to watch it chime, and display the "Apostles", so yo need to get up close, or choose one of the tower views in the area. If you can't get a good view try a bit later. The crowd always seem to thin out about around 5:00pm. The attraction is free, and if you are in Prague, you must see this.
A must !. Go about ten minutes before the hour and see this marvel display the time. the mechanics were done around 1350... you will be amazed at what was made almost eight centuries ago !

Old Town Hall the best place to visit. You will get to know the architecture of Old Prague through this, the beauty of this place is the area designed by old architectures made the structure so beautifully that you will not even blink your eyes during the Hourly Bell Ceremony.The full house show specially at night, if you be with your loved ones that one gives you best shot in your life.
Nice stroll. Lots of culture, real buzz from all the restaurants and people milling around, lovely afternoon spent just walking and gazing.
Love the Square!. Prague in general is one of the place I would see again. The square is great with lots of stuff to do. Astronomical Clock is cool to see and won't miss it as you pass by.
Amazing! Amazing! Amazing!. Prague is a small and amazing diamond. Try to spend in this square as much time as you can, you will miss it just one minute after having left Prague!

Wonderful square. All roads tend to lead to this square... We found ourselves here pretty much every day as the atmosphere is so great with local musicians, street food and drinks, shops, etc. The homemade ice cream and Trdlka (not sure if that's the right spelling but it's the traditional sweet Czech bread that's turned on skewers set over burning charcoal) is the best in Prague. Just off the square is Dloughy - a street lined with small bars and cafés...
Gotta See This. Much cooler in real life than in the pictures. Even with the thousands of people there looking at the same thing as we were :-)

It is old. All Prague visitors can spend hours in the Old Town. It is replete with shops, restaurants, buskers, and crowds to entertain. With a local acquaintence we went upstairs to a hotel terrace and had ice cream on a boiling day, so near yet so far from the maddening crowd.

Take the Elevator to the Top and Go on the Tour. Everyone seems to gather here to see the clock which admittedly is pretty cool but it definitely isn't the highlight here. We just happened to notice people way up in the tower and then learned you can actually ride an elevator up ... well worth doing for a fabulous 360-degree view! And then we noticed that there are tours in various languages of the building itself ... again, well worth doing! We ended up learning a lot about the history of the building and this part of the city, including a great tour down into what used to be the first floor hundreds of years ago and is now the basement as well as a peek at what the clock (and the apostles) look like from inside. Our visit here ended up being one of our favorite parts of our time in Prague!
Missed the Apostles!. The Apostles appear on the hour but I wasn't in the right position so wondered what all the fuss was about. I did return and saw them the next day!
Great clock!. The clock is one of the most historic and important of its kind in the world. Make sure to catch the processionon the hour.

Fantastic. Every hour the clock chimes. Crowds gather to see the 12 apostles move across the clock, and the figures ring the bells. The people are lovely there, and the atmosphere is lovely too. The cafes around the square do tea and cake for a cheap price too.
Underwhelming.... Overheard a guide describing the clock show. He was very entertaining and of course we had to stay to watch the show. The clock is beautiful.
Worth the wait for hourly chime. On the hour, statues of Apostles peek out on the square as the Skeleton rings the chime. May enter tower for a fee.
Great view. We took the elevator to the top, the view was amazing. We enjoyed seeing the clock works, and the amazing ceiling below.

Old clock but still in the time. It is a very lovely and very old clock, with the very unique charm. There is always a bunch of viewers around waiting for next clock event. It is amazing how one old clock can be full of features still shoulder to shoulder with the very new smart watches. The architects of the clock have embed very impressive knowledge of astronomy, fine mechanic and art that is still today considerable for any graduated student in any of fields art or technology.
Another city must see.. Interesting piece of machinery. Beautifully colored and the craftmanship was perfect. Can get crowded when the timers go off, however, worth the trip.
Must see for Prague. Just stand in the middle in awe of the surrounding beauty. Yeah, it's crowded but who cares...you must see this square if you are in Prague.

Absolutely fantastic!. The old town hall is definitively worth a visit. The outside is one of the iconic images of Prague and the astronomical clock is very interesting ... don't forget to be there at the hour to see the whole mechanism working... it is fantastic!We also did the tour to the historical rooms (included in the Prague card), it is worth doing it

Be there at 12 'O Clock or at least at 11.. We did not enter the Old Town Hall but from outside it is very beautiful. The entire area is lovely and has the old world charm. It was around 11.45 PM when we reached the Old Town Square. We were pretty stunned to see hundreds of people gathered together and looking up at what is known as the Astronomical Clock. We didn't know what was happening so we also stood along with the crowd. As the time turned 12, a lot of things started happening above the dial of the clock. The dial also has significance and meaning but I will let that pass. The wooden figures of Apostles appeared from inside and many of the sculptures begin to move at the same time. The golden cockerel crows and the clock chimes the hour. This happens each hour but at 12'O Clock it happens 12 times ! With the show over, the crowd dissipates and involves itself into many activities which are happening at the square.The whole day people visit Astronomical clock and sit around it.
VERY COOL. Actually stumbled on this by mistake my first trip to Prague, everybody was gathering around and so did we, soon enough we seen why. and Hopefully you will too soon.

great to see this clockwork clock !. Seeing the clock was my number one priority re our short trip. Didn't get to hear it chime but I love clockwork and just seeing it was a thrill. A busy area with other tourists having the same idea.

Interesting history, but not a great hourly show. Knowing that it worked almost nonstop ( damaged during WWII ) for about 600 years, it is quite amazing.Figuring out how the clock runs while you are waiting for the top of the hour is kind of fun.Then the clock strikes on the hour, and the main look of the crowd is "that's it" Seeing is believing. It is still worth a look while wandering around the Old Town Square/

Lovely building, go up it tho for the best experience!!. Great building in the best part of Prague, but to truly get the most from this get a tickets and go up it, there is a lift up the middle to take u all the way to the top where the views are amazing, 100% worth the tickets price and makes Prague looks beautiful from the top.

Good but crowded. The clock itself is an amazing piece of engineering. So many parts to watch when the hour strikes. You can go up the tower that the clock is set into - you have to pay though. We didn't go up so don't know what the view was like.Stand well back to get a good view of the clock striking activity.

Disabled review of astronomical clock. I've read so many good reviews of the astronomical clock in Old Town square and we managed to find it at 11:55am for the show to begin at 12pm. I don't want to put a dampner on this beautiful clock or turn anyone away from seeing it because the whole square is magical, but to sit for 5 minutes in heavy rain to watch a few statues heads move, a skeleton pull a bell chain and a door open was a little bit of a let down. If you're there, see it, but don't break your neck to bounce over cobbles quickly trying to get there in time for the display as the clock is beautiful without it.
phenominal experience. the clock is a marvel to see and on the hour the figurines come out one by one. Go up the clock tower for the best views of Prague, absolutely beautiful.

A little disappointing. The clock itself is beautiful but the display on the hour was a little disappointing, still a must see. Crowds will gather at night and the best times tend to be later such as 11-12

How does this thing work so perfectly every hour?. Amazing piece of art, technology for the times, and sheer entertainment. There are crowds starting about 10 minutes to the top of the hour. The statues do not come out but rotate inside. This is when I wished I owned a pair of small binoculars.

1 down, 2 to go. What a beautiful piece of technology. It's stunning and complex and informative and perplexing, you'd be wrong to think you can go to Prague and not see this. If it wasn't for all the tourists milling around, I'd gladly pull up a couch, grab a Budvar and watch this clock all day. I'm not even joking. Get there early if you want photos sans tourists, but they're all part of your experience, yeah?
Amazing Clock. When in Prague you must see this outstanding clock.Get there on the Hour so you don't miss the Saints coming out.

Packed with tourists, nice views. Place was crawling with tourists (including me) but seemed to be plenty of space. Nice views and little places to visit around the square. Good locations in front of the clock get packed at the top of the hour, but worth seeing once while there. Horse/carriage rides available as our little stands selling food. Restaurants are located around the ring and a few streets leading away.

Fabulous. It was great to be there in 2006 to witness the Clock when it Chimes and the Characters come out to do their part. Moments before the hour, visitors gather around seeking the prime spots to view all that occurs when the Clock chimes. Photos and videos are done to record those moments in "time". When it's all completed people disperse and return for the next hour.

Breath taking. Like the remaining of Prague: all is clean and magnificent. The place as lots of café... great place for a stop (after walking hours in Prague!) and have a coffee while looking at other tourists enjoying Prague as much as you ! - Stop by!

Amazing clock. So the clock show wasn't all that impressive at first considering all that we have today. However when you hear the story of how it was built, what all it does and that it has functioned perfectly for hundreds of years it's amazing!

Beautiful! A must in Prague.. This clock is beautiful, unlike anything I have seen before. It is in the centre of Prague old town and is a brilliant place to start the day. However bars and restaurants around this area are rather pricey and the service is disappointing.
Left the best 'til last. When the clock chimes wait until the end when a golden chicken crows and flaps its wings, hilarious !
Worth a visit. This clock is definitely worth the visit especially at dinner time when it all gets started. Definitely worth the look out!!

Visit it at dusk. Beautiful old town square but best viewed at dusk or early evening to get the fully fairy tale effect. Very touristy and lots of people. Notorious for pickpockets around the clock but there was a very visible police presence there when I visited. Don't miss the clock chiming on the hour when the characters on the clock become animated.

Not to be missed !. When we visited Prague some years back, the famous clock had two figures appearing + one clenging a hammer onto the others' bell. Nowadays there are only figures who spin around when the clock strikes the hour, but this clock is still a work of genius and not to be missed.

Climb to the top!. The views of Prague are beautiful. Very cheap to go to the top of the tower, there is even a lift to take you up!
The astronomical clock is wonderful, hang about until it strikes the hour!
Unmissable. This is a delightful part of Prague; to watch the clock in action, take a drink at the bar immediately opposite - no worse than British prices and a perfect view!

Worth Seeing!. The astronomical clock is worth seeing. The crowds gather around about 5 mins before the hour. There is a restaurant opposite where you can get drinks as you wait, but you will probably have to stand up to take pictures as the crowds will be in your way. Note, the restaurant charges more for the drinks on the outside because of the attraction.

Great for it's age. The clock itself is one of the main tourist attractions in Old Town Square so do yourself a favour and get there early to view the clock. We were there at 9:00am and the crowd and Square were pretty quiet compared to when we walked by at 4:00pm and couldn't move due to the crowds of people!Basically what happens is that on the hour, a skeleton pulls a cord to ring the bell while at the same time the Twelve Apostles "walk past" the windows above the clock. Yes it is kind of interesting but to be honest, a little naff. The sound it makes is quite nice and yes it is a very old timepiece but not worth the hustle and bustle of the crowds. Go there at a time that is not on the hour to obtain a better photo with less crowds.

nice.... I think that was wow'de me here wasn't the clock, which was ok - don't get me wrong, but the understanding that every hour hundreds of people are gathering to watch it - probably all for the first time...

Must See. Such a beautiful clock in the middle of the square. Dates back to the 1400's and is quite intricate for the times. There are a lot of outdoor cafes in the square if you would like to wait and see it chime on the hour. It gets very crowded in front of the clock. You can also go up to the top of the building and see the view of the area.

Great Clock. Even though the clock is known as a dissapointment, we loved it. It is an incredible work of art and tachnology dating back many years. It is also great fun to see the hordes of people standing and waiting for ages to see the display. Well worth it and FREE!

really amazing. it deserve to stand every hour & watch what's happening, also to know about the history of the clock is interesting, we also buy nice & cheap accessories clock from there, u may also like the view from upstairs

A crowd gathered to watch time pass !!. My wife asked " why are all the people looking up at that clock?" well the watched time pass till on the hour a few activated functions occurred as the clock chimed !! I guess considering the workmanship involved, and worth a look. If you have TIME.

A must see. The Astronomical Clock is something that you must see while in Prague. Be sure to stop by on the hour. You will see the crowds gathering for the "animation". I watched it 3 times and noticed different things each time. The skeleton pulling the cord to ring the bell was a nice touch. Something to remember as well is just how old this is. It dates back to the 1400's and just think of how difficult it must have been to get this complex device to work with the technology of the time. The engineering itself is simply amazing not to mention the aesthetics.

History That Makes You Smile. The medieval architecture of the Old Town Hall is enough to make you stop and be amazed, but the clock and the 'action' on each hour is purely astounding. The clock is detailed in so many depths for which you could spend an hour just taking in the intricacies. On each hour the bell strikes as would any tower bell -- but the 'show' is the truly the attraction! Two doors open high on the tower and various saints rotate up to and partly out the doors, taking their turn showing their face to the crowds below, then pull back in so the next saint can rotate in and out. All the while, a skeleton hung out on a parapet moves its arm and rings a small bell, reminding us that time is fleeting and life is short. Try to situate yourself about 10 to 15 minutes before the hour to make sure you get a good spot. Don't get too close to the building since you won't be able to see the saints in the doors [vertical line of sight], so try to situate yourself closer to the sidewalk café across the cobbled street. Don't worry about people lining up in front of you since you'll be looking up [unless they're really tall people].

Nice to see. I didn't go in. On the hour every hour so maybe see it twice when you just happen to be passing. Second time you will take more in.It does get busy in front of the clock but I didn't see the need to get there early. The square is lovely and you don't need to sit in a bar. There are some seats and also take away food and beer stalls. If you like English tea there is a takeaway just off the square that does a great cuppa. If you were coming into the square from the Jewish side it's the first stall.
Magnificent View. Take the elevator to the top of the Astronomical Clock to see a magnificent view of the old city! You won't be disappointed...

Shortest show of it all.... The astronomical clock is one of the must with the history going with it... worth a visit 2 min then it's finish....On the old town square..... just look out for the big crowd standing still in anticipation.......
A clock like no other. Take time to catch the appearance of the 12 apostles on the hour! If you see it once of several times, it is so fascinating!

Nice to look at, but not worth the wait for the hourly chiming.. It was very ornate and cool to see, Although we only were in the area by chance the next day for the chiming.....I'm glad we did not wait around to hear/see it go off. Nothing worth writing home about.

Amazing clock!!. This is an intricate, many faceted clock dating back to the 1400s. It shows the year, months, days, hours, setting of the sun and moon, and the signs of the Zodiac. The figures of the Apostles appear every hour in the clock's windows. It is worth a look just to see something that was built so long ago and is still operating!!! Crowds gather in the square just to see the figures appear!! The side figures also move on the hour so watch for that.

A must visit. One of my favorite things is to sit at one of the outside cafes and have a drink marveling at this clock and taking in the Old Town Square. When the clock goes off on the hour, there are tons of tourists. We found that later at night the swarms dissipate, and you can get a better view. But, any time of day you go you should have a good time.

A medieval atmosphere!!!. A unique square and a unique monument. The view from the top floor of the clock is fantastic. During the evening many musical events took place. Advice: visit the square and the clock late in the night or very early in the morning. Less tourists, better photos and a totally different aspect!!!
Beautiful!. This clock is the 3rd oldest of it's type in the world dating back to 1410. The figures that come out on the hour are interesting; the clock as a whole just beautiful!

Needless to see. We have waited and waited and waited with hundreds of silly tourists like us and then.... nothing happened, I mean something did but did not worth the waiting, silly, ugly and no reason even to raise your head to look at.

Well Worth it!!. Then entrance to the Old Town Hall is about 20 metres from the clock itself. You catch a lift all the way up (and down if u want) and then just wander down at your own pace checking out the history of the astronomical clock!
Wonderfullll. The most important place to visit in Prague. This old clock is very fantastic, and we can buy a lot of things around this square, drink some biers and walk around old buildings.

Old town square clock. This is also a very beautiful area.lots of outside cafés.you can sit enjoy a cold beer and watch the clock go off.this is a wonderful city.so much to see.Prague is a place you want to spend some time seeing it all.lots of good food,shopping ect.oh and interesting street performers
Over rated. This is probably the most overrated attraction. Hundreds of people gather to see the clock every hour only to find that it lasts for only seconds.
Interesting but not a must see. Interesting if in the area but would not travel out of my way to visit. Other interesting attractions in the area.

wonder of the world- astronomical clock. How it tells the time I've no idea. Makes no sense to me, Looks good though but get there ten minutes before the hour to get a good view as the crowds gather quickly and its a thorough fare so watch out for the horse and carriages. Climb the tower for a price to get excellent views of the city.

Quaint town Square. We really enjoy traveling and walking around the town square and looking at all the stores. The architecture was very interesting and the stores had lots of of interesting things to see and buy. The astronomical clock was absolutely fascinating and we stood there for 15 minutes watching it.

A must see. You can't pass this, because it's located right in the Old Town Square. Walk up to the tower is worth of little entrance fee, because views are magnificent. Outside gets real crowded, because it's start point for many guided tours and people stop to see the beautiful clock, so beware of pickpockets.

History and atmosphere. We had a great time visiting this attraction as it is so unusual and historic. The views from the tower are worth the climb and the trumpeters every hour add to the atmosphere.

Sweet Place!. The Astronomical Clock was impressive and that part of town a delight. We got wonderful seats at a café directly across from the clock with a great view. Had the best hot chocolate I have ever had right there.

Marvel at this. The weather definatley made this. I went and watched this several times ( no pun intended) pay a few euros at take a trip up the tower for some spectacular views over the city. When your done pay the extra for a beer at one of the many bar/resturants, a nd watch the coming and goings of the wedding parties at the town hall

up the tower!. I recently climbed up the tower, and the views were stunning.Not overly expensive to climb up either.Go up at sunset and it is beautiful.I didnt take part in a tour but it was still nice to do.

ok, but EVERYBODY goes there. I have now seen the astrological clock move at least 10 times in the last week - yesterday it was 3x since I was having drinks and dinner just across at El Toro Negro - outdoor cafe to watch and listen and laugh. It take all of 2 minutes to complete the clock movement and bell ringing. However, with that said, it is truly amazing the history of the clock and the intricacy of how it works and how accurate it is. And everyone shows up, so it is fun to people watch, and everyone claps. I prefer the astrological clock in Messina, Sicily where I was in early May 2014 which is on the belltower and strikes at noon. It is far more intricate and spectacular from a spectator point of view. There the statues move, the lion roars and wags its tail, many mechanically-animated statues. Lots of fun - it lasts about 15 minutes.

The tower is definitely worth a visit. I started of my morning tour and stumbled into the old town tower. It just so happened that I was just in time for the English guided tour at 9.30am. It's a must-do if you are in Prague. The tour takes you to the several halls of the old tower but the gem is the old city underneath it. I highly recommend it.

beautiful and unique. Go see the clock with a for guide who can explain the history and significance of what you see. The show on the hours is not worth going out of your way for, so I recommend that you go get a close view of it between the hours when it's less crowded.
Funny. Bear in mind to focus on the windows (not the clocks) above the clocks as the disciples would only appear for less than two minutes or you will have to wait for another hour for the disciples.
It's ok. Nothing special. Just a lot of people waiting and waiting for a clock to do its thing. When it does it's just Ok
Historic Prague!. The center of historic Prague and a hotbed of activity morning, noon and night! A must-see and a good jumping off point for site-seeing.

Don't forget to climb the clock tower!. This is one of Prague's most known landmarks, and a must see. The clock gives a "show" every hour where the figures of the Apostles move while the "Death" rings the clock. It is fun to watch, but it gets really crowed.But the main attraction is climbing the clock tower! From the top you get an amazing 360º view of the city, the river, the old town, everything! Really worth it, specially at sunset. There's an elevator to the top if you don't want to take te stairs, and the admission fee is not expensive.
Very pretty. Gets very busy when the hour strikes, but absolutely beautiful clock, restored to perfection after the war.

Mobbed with tourists. Too many people surround this clock and it just isn't that great a sight. The famous clock in Munich is far superior. This clock only has animation on the hour and is underwhelming.

Definitely go up the clock tower!. Definitely worth a visit - the clock movement is a little underwhelming but the trip to the top of the clock tower is wonderful way to view all of Prague - and really cheap. 110kc (just over £3) for adults to go to the top. Lovely.

one of the prague attractions. Well, I didn't do my research before I went here so I have no idea of the existence of this clock. But then as I walked around the centre at night, I found alot of people gathering around this clock.It is a beautiful clock with fascinating history. However, since I went there at night, I couldn't get to see the whole clock, and it is one of my regrets.

Beautiful place, but dont bother with the clock..... at the astronomical clock you will see crowds gathered around every hour to see the clock move - its not really worth it, it was really disappointing. The clock itself looks pretty cool for a photo, but doesn't do much at all. However, the general area is just beautiful. Plenty of places to explore - beautiful old part of town and definitely a must-visit area! Walk around for an hour or two and visit the old shops and admire the architecture. Great vibe here too.

Great View. Spend the extra money and walk to the top and take in the 360 degree views of Prague. Easy walk up because it is ramped , not stairs. Viewing the clock from the street is not that special because you are so far from the figures, If you take video , zoom in on the figures and play later for better enjoyment.

A must see!. If in Prague you should not miss out on the Astronomical clock. It´s located right in the square of the old town. In the square there´s a lot of nice restaurants and cafeés. Also many other nice buildings and churches to visit close by. No charge unless you choose to enter the church.
Beautiful square!. We stayed to watch the Astronomical Clock. Amazing to see the figures moving with such precision. Definitely worth a stop.

Beauty & Rare Prague. Prague is such a beautiful place with all it's old style buildings . The astronomical clock is such a beautiful piece, a must to see. A climb into the tower will allow you to see all of prague surrounding buildings . Lots of picturesque photos. Also every o'clock the bugle is blown by a court jester, the clock does lots of movements and openings . It's most busiest time is the o clock time to see all this happen.

A Must See. This clock has a fascinating history so it is important not just to see it, but to learn about it. It chimes and " moves" on the hour and crowds gather to see it. Climb the stairs or take the elevator to the top of the clock to get the most fabulous 360 degree view of Prague. This is one of the most famous landmarks in Prague, located in Old Town, is historic, unusual, and fun.

Really?. Alright, I understand the appeal. It's interesting to be able to see the oldest working clock in the world. It was installed in the 1400s and has managed to survive all these years. But what in the world are you expecting? Fireworks? Fire? Real life gnomes?If you decide to watch one of the shows, you will be surrounded by (quite literally) hundreds of people. Our local friend that took us around town just laughed while we waiting, telling us about how the joke is, the astronomical clock is the most disappointing tourist attraction in the world; despite the fact it was rated as a travel's choice of 2014? Go and see for yourself, but don't expect much more than what you could guess the 1400s engineers created. There are cooler places to visit while in Prague.
A bit underwhelming, but a must see. After all of the hype, the clock is a bit underwhelming, but the stories surrounding it are interesting and if you are in Prague, you can't miss it.

Took the tour. Had an English tour and saw the clock from the inside, but the best part was the underground tour. Who knew all those tunnels were under there... ending with awesome mosaics. Best photo ops were at the top where one can see the whole city. great stop

Pretty Facinating. This is certainly the most interesting clock I've ever seen, and there's not another one like it (possibly because they cut out the eyes of the guy who made it so he couldn't make another one like it...). The doomsday show on the hour is brief but worth stopping to see if you're in the area. This is one of those iconic things you have to see while in Prague.

Go Early in the Day!. We watched the 30 seconds of mechanical wonder at 10 am and the crowds were significant, but not crazy. Our guide said that as the day go on the crowds will get bigger and bigger. This clock is unique and well worth making the "time" to see it, but beware that it doesn't give an hourly show during hours of dark and the crowds can be overwhelming later in the day. Go early and have the video ready to go so you don't miss anything.

Crowded but worthwhile. It gets crowded just before the hour strikes and the apostles make their debut and the bells are chimed, but if you are in Old Town Square it is worth finding a spot to watch this event. Afterward treat yourself to a shopping experience at the Erpet crystal store or to a sausage or potato stack at one of the vendor stands.

Ancient clock - animated at the strike of the hour. Get to the clock at least 15 minutes before it strikes the hour, choose a cafe with outside seating and wait for the short show.It gets very crowded in front of the clock and so be aware of your valuables, we didn't see any crime during our visit but with a crowd that tightly pack it would be easy pickings for pickpockets.Alternatively visit the clock later in the evening between day trips leaving and the party revelers hitting the Square.We didn't climb the tower but the view of the Square would be great for those that are fit enough to climb a couple of hundred steps and whose feet aren't killing them after all of the walking around such a beautiful city.

Beautiful clock and setting, crowded. This is a Prague must do thing. The clock goes off hourly and attracts massive crowds to watch the animation it performs each hour. In addition to the clock are some nice restaurants, shops and the beautiful square with all sorts of interesting performers, etc. Go early to get a good spot to watch the clock do its thing on the hour.

Enjoy the atmosphere. Crowded during peak season.But,that is the fun of it too.The waiting for the buildup to the chimes , the smiles and oohhs when it happens is fun.But arrive 10-15 minutes before the hour strikes.Apart from the visual ,aural experience, the clock itself is a marvel of mechanics and ornamentation,more so when one appreciates how old it is.Take close up photos of it if you have a good zoom,makes for very nice shots.A must visit.

A must see. Every hour on the hour. Try and get there 15 minutes early before crowds gather. Try and position yourself towards the back to get the best view. Get too close and you will miss the best part. Keep your eye on the windows above the top dial

OVERNIGHT VISIT TO PRAGUE. The old town square is always a pleasure to walk through but it was exceptionally busy at the this time of year but we always enjoy looking at the astronomical clock. Later in the year is less busy.

Well worth a visit. We did both the visit to the tower and the town hall tour and both were very good. The tour was particularly interesting because we saw the underground area and where the old roads in Prague used to be. Fantastic views from the clock tower as well.

Fab - have a drink in the bars across and enjoy its beauty. Lovely lovely lovely! Once we found it it was beautiful .... Tourists were in the way! A must see any time of year. The detail around the clock was also appealing and our 6 year old loved the clock when it chimed. Enjoyed a drink across from the clock and enjoyed the view!
A must if you are visiting Prague. If you are visiting Prague, the Astronomical Clock it's a must see, clock performs at every hour on the hour
Take the tour!. Make sure you do the tour of the Town Hall which is very informative and allows you to see the inside of the clock along with the old underground dwellings. A must!!!
before. Still brilliant. Still brilliant. Still brilliant. Still brilliant. Still brillant. What else do you want me to say!!!!!
Unbelievable that the clock is so old and still working.. It was very crowded with tourists in the square when the apostles made their appearance which added some merriment to the visit.

Watch the statues come alive and ring the bell. Astronomical clock is a marvel. Do take a guide to know the actual meaning of the symbols inscribed on and inside the periphery of the clock. Also the ringing of the bell by the statues every hour is not to be missed. Your trip to Prague is incomplete without seeing it.

Make sure you are there on the hour. Clock performs every hour on the hour. Make sure you have a viewing location directly facing the clock, as the figures appear inside windows that cannot be seen from an angle. There is also a cafe directly across from the clock if you want to sit and enjoy some food or drink while you watch.
OK. Its a very unique clock, great craftsmanship. I thought the display on the hour was a bit of a let down.

Great Old Town..... First Trip to Prague, and I love the feel of old town...the history of the clock, and seeing it actually chime is pretty awesome...sure brings in a crowd!
Having a coffee and watching the crowd in the evening is a must do...this is a great people watching venue.

The crowds spoil this. Tour groups all day long monopolise this. They really are a pain. It is lovely, and interesting, but once you have seen it go to a nice old bar on a side street, without any other tourists!

Yeah, it's touristy but so what?. This is a must see, no matter what your opinion of touristy attractions are. A beautiful medieval structure and mechanical clock worth waiting a few minutes for. Ascend the stairs for an iconic view of the city, particularly at dusk.
Fun town square. We watched sports and saw a concert there, fun place to spend the afternoon having good beer and people watching

WOW. You just need the knight and princes and we are back in midlle ages. It is crowded for the obvious reasons but don't forget to visit this place during the night or evening - it gets even more magestic. Astronomical clock reveals it's secret every full hour, so do come there during that time - it is very crowded infront of it so to save your self all the troubles go for a beer in the restaurant overlooking this clock. But don't dare to think it is going to be a cheap one. You can go and visit the clock tower and you will be rewardede with the most spectaular view of Prague. Deffinetely a must !!!

Nice architecture. The clock is nice mainly because of the architecture which is around, on the square and on the nearby colored buildings. At the clocking time, the show visible from the square is nice but nothing really special (it last about a minute). The show is mainly the number of persons taping the event.....all looking at the clock with the nose to the sky.Anyway, overall considering the enviroment, the atmosphere is very nice.

Another Step Into History.. Situated on the Old Town Square, this clock is worth a look. It is beautifully crafted and still works accurately. If you can, take a guided walking tour with a reputable guide. These people a well worth spending your money on as they can provide you with the real historical stories.

Ahead of its time. Attached to the side of the town hall, this clock must have seemed out of this world to people of Prague hundreds of years ago. Magnificently maintained by the authorities you shouldn't miss it. Listen to the chimes for a bygone era.

Worth Seeing. Clock shows phases of moon and other astronomical events with hourly display of apostles. Very interesting and beautiful. It seems many weddings take placed on the sidewalk OUTSIDE the church where the clock is located.

Thrilling piece of engineering. This thing just thrills when you think of it as the oldest astronomical clock still working in the whole world. The clock chimes every hour and some characters revive to make an interesting mechanical animation that amazes when you think of its age - that thing is six centuries old! There is an immense crowd of people staring at it each hour :)When you're here don't miss getting up to the top of the tower to see some amazing views of the city. You can walk up or you can take the elevator. I suggest walking (that really does not get you tired) and you'll see why ;)

Don`t go there on the hour!. As much as the outlook of the Clock is wonderful, its a bit disappointing to see the "show", once you have waited for half an hour. My recommendation is to go and enjoy the square, the clock and the tower in any hour, except exactly on the hour! Its too much of a crowd for nothing major, guaranteed to disappoint you once you have waited for it for so long!

Top of the Hour. This is an amazing piece of history and should be seen in the day time and at night all lit up. It gets crowded on the top of the hour and the top is a great view. You pay next to the clock but then walk a few doors down to get in and hike up the stairs to the top.

a highlight of Prague. When you visit Old Town Hall and the Astronomical clock, make sure you head to the top of the tower either by ramp (and easy walk up), or by elevator to see some incredible views of the city. You can also wait at the base till the hour to see some animation above the clock, although it's not all that impressive.

An engineering marvel. The old Astronomical Clock near the Old Town square, is an engineering delight... it is the oldest functioning clock still working. Every hour the clock will chime, the old Apostle characters rotate past the upper windows, the other characters on the face of the clock move. Not only does it tell time, but indicates the months and day of the year.

Nice, but overrated. Every hour, the town square fills up with a couple hundred tourists to watch the much-hyped astronomical clock display. On our second or third day, we happened to be passing through the square just before the top of the hour and stopped amongst the crowds to watch. The display takes about thirty seconds and consists of figures of the apostles passing by a window and some other moving figures. It's interesting, but doesn't live up to all the hype.

Great Views, Fantastic History.. People forget that the clock is extremely old and there have been many disappointed reviewers. I think many were expecting fireworks to burst out every hour... It is a beautiful piece of architecture that is shrouded in history. Climb the Old Town Hall tower. You get a lovely view of the city from the top with all the old red roofs. Lovely snaps. The only problem is the amount of people. Aside from that it is a must see whilst you are in Prague. I highly recommend a visit! Ignore the disappointed people - appreciate what you see.

Iconic. This is an iconic point of Prague and if possible, go to the top of the tower. The view is great and there's a lift. The Astronomical Clock is more a curiosity since the figures don't come outside of the clock, but crows are there all the time to see it. You will do the same.

Worth a stop for sure. I enjoyed the clock tower and the atmosphere around it. Every hour on the hour saints parade past windows up high, and you can climb the tower to get a great view of Prague for a fee. Tons of tours meet here.

Worth watching!. The old astronomical tower is worth watching at the completion of each hour. There is a beautiful show in it which is performed with the help of moving puppets. First know about the history and story from the trip organisers or locals and then see it..m sure then it wont be disappointment for you..keep watching ;)

technology. this whole area is wonderful and the square contains everything you want from things to see and things to eat. The clock and church are magnificent so please make the effort to see both. Plenty to see in the are including the Jewish quarter which is aonly a short walk from the clock. Do it.

Entertaining for 5 minutes but thats about it. The clock is cool to see, especially at the hour mark when the figures move around. There are big crowds mid-day so its easier to see if you are staying near the square (see my review of the Emblem hotel) so that you can go at anytime. best to go early in the morning to avoid crowds. Show up a few minutes before the hour, watch the short show and move on.

Disappointed. Was excited to see the hourly show and was very disappointed. That 'show' was over in about 30 seconds and I am glad we didn't travel there especially to see it but were there anyway and just happened to catch it. The clock itself is nice, but overrated in my opinion.

A must see. The clock is very cool. After you get your wide-angle picture, be sure to step up close and examine all of the intricate detail. Be sure to time your visit to be there on the hour so you can get the full experience of the animated clock. As long as you're there, pay the small fee to climb the clock tower for a panoramic view of Prague.

No fascination. Forgive me but I failed to see any fascination with this. Luckily, we happened to be there one day when it started chiming. Had we travelled in especially we would have been majorly disappointed!Looking at some of these reviews I guess had i been aware of it's history I may have appreciated it more. Maybe that's the key ... Research the story first, then you might appreciate it.The square in which it is based is beautiful - a fabulous hub of activity.

Nice.....but. I am glad to see it but I would not return. It is beautiful and well maintained and there are people everywhere for the hourly show. You can pay to climb to the top of the tower and the view is spectacular.
Wonderful. What a place, it's buzzing all day long, great atmosphere and the clock is wonderful, some fantastic buildings and restaurants.

Great view of the square and the red tile roofs!. We went up in the astronomical clock tower and enjoyed the view toward sunset. It was a little spend to go up - 8 euro, I think, but the view was great. You can see the castle and other notable buildings, as well as get great views of the people down in the square.

Awesome Clock!. Yes, it's touristy, but let's face it, isn't that why we all went to Prague....to see things like this famous clock? It's a must see and you should be sure and catch the hourly show when the doors open and the Walk of the Apostles starts, with a skeleton representing death, striking the hour. This is the third oldest astronomical clock in the world, and the oldest one still working.....definitely worth a visit....but get there before the hour because there are lots of people who want to see the show, and it's over quite quickly.
Must see sight. Not to miss town hall and one of a kind astronomical clock. Beautiful and well preserved. We enjoyed the old architecture inside and out.

Touristy. Well, what did you expect, this is the center of the tourist trade in Prague. The buildings are beautiful, neat clock! You have to walk around and just look at what goes on around the square.
Packed but worths to be visited. As much as I know this place was always full of people. Every day and every season. So If you wanna make nice picture you will have to go through the crowd.

Great place to be. The old square is like most city squares, however in our opinion this has everything and far exceeds any other we have visited. We spent 4 fabulous days in this fantastic city and visited the square every day at sometime. We visited early morning, throughout the afternoon and by night each time the square was full of tourists, street artists, a cleaning crew and a low key police presence who were always available to guide and help tourists. We visited a couple of restaurants on its perimeter and was great to eat good food whilst people watching and enjoying the performances of the street artists. Very pretty in the night and locals were really helpful and polite. We visited in October however would love to return in the snow. Fantastic city we loved our stay.

A must do. Every visitor to Prague has to stop by at some point on the hour to see the clock's performance. It simply contributes to the overall amazing beauty and atmosphere of the Old Town. We were expecting a little bit more from the clock, but made a point of watching it a couple of times to catch all the action.

Touristy but good. We were able to see the clock tower do its thing 3 times in 2 days. It is quite amazing that a 600 year old clock is still working quite accurately. Beware the idiot people that stand in front of you at the last minute and block your view.
Be there on the hour.. Everyone wants to see the figures move on the hour. A very crowded tourist attraction but you cannot visit Prague and not see the clock.
it is ok. The square and surroundings of this clock are amazing! but this clock is definitely not. It is ok to glance at it and pass by, too many great things to see.

Always cute to see these historical clocks. Crowds gather. It is a brief event. Worth viewing. Adjacent to an outstanding shop for Bohemian crystal that is a must see.
Right in the heart of old town

Classic Place. If you are in Prague, the first place to visit, in my opinion, should be Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock, and take a ticket to go to the top of it. All ways ends here, amazing view.

Interesting commentary on the walls as you proceed up the ramped access. We all enjoyed our walk up the astronomical clock. Most of the way is ramped and would suit many abilities. There's a good commentary in several languages on the walls as you proceed describing how the clock was built and explaining who was responsible for it! As you near the top (it's 70m high) there are some steep steps but not too many. The view from the top was great with lots of local landmarks to see. On descending we enjoyed the clock show more as we'd a bit of the history.

stay to watch the apostles march. If you haven't already, its an experience to wait timely for the clock to chime and the apostles march and can be peaked through their window. Fun for kids but they may not see the quick parade of apostles

Prepare in advance to know what you're seeing. This gorgeous clock is located right in the heart of Old Town, and strikes on the hour. The figures on either side of the colorful dial move (the skeleton strikes a bell and the figures shake their heads "no"). There are numerous dials and rings, with beautiful colors and gold. Do just a little research before seeing this, such as the Wikipedia site, that will explain what to look for and what's happening. It will make it so much more enjoyable.

Great clock - be prepared for crowds.. This is a really cool, quirky looking clock in Pragues old town square.Be completely prepared for all the hoards of tourists and tour groups though. Seriously there are so many it almost detracts from the entire experience.Definitely worth a visit thoughCheck out our trip: http://blog.travelpod.com/travel-blog-entries/nessandjess/3/1400697817/tpod.html
Wow!. Apart from the Astronomical Clock and it's hourly performance, it's well worth going up to the top of the tower to experience the 360 degree view of Prague. Breathtaking.

Go early to avoid crowd. The clock is quite a sight to see, and the rest of the square is really at the heart of Old Town. If you go before 10 AM to see the clock there are no crowds, which I preferred. The square is a great place to grab a meal, people watch, and enjoy the sunshine.

Great clock, better views.. Pretty straight forward, the clock and it's history are interesting, but the lookout from the top is the highlight.
It's cheap - like most things in Prague, compared to other Euro sites and absolutely worth it.
Do it.

Excellent view from the top. It is quite challenging to go to the top of the clock.
I do recommend old people to use lift directly instead.
However the view in the top is just amazing !!!!
You can walk around the coridor and see 360deg view of Prague.
It surely gave different perspective of how old town of Prague looks like.

One to see because you are there.. Nice clock. On the hour bells chime and figures move. Spent more time watching the crowd watching the clock. Lots turn up every hour to stand and watch the moving bits. Its nothing outstanding.

Go to the the top of the tower for great views. Make sure you're at the Astronomical Clock a few minutes before each hour (e.g. 11am) to view the Walk of The Apostles, which is figurines in the tower that 'move'.
For a few CZK you can enter the Tower of the Astronomical Clock and get great views of Prague city.

A must see. You can't go to Prague and not see this. Best photo opportunities are early in the morning, not too many people around, make sure you catch it right at the top of the hour, you'll be in for a treat.
Also best restaurant in Prague is behind it, just walk around the back you can't miss it.

You Must see the Orloj!!. This is a must-see!! This beautiful mechanical masterpiece still works, keeps time and displays the relationship of the main planets, moon and sun. It is a marvellous piece of art at the same time, and very enjoyable. Located in the centre of the city in a sqaure with markets, cafes and pubs, you can pass a most enjoyable half day.
Get there and enjoy the chimes. Worth stopping off to listen to the music of the street entertainers then listen to the chimes of the clock. Then just do something else.
You have to be there on time. And know what you are looking at. The whole thing is over in 45 seconds. It is worth getting an explanation of where to look and what each thing represents.

Must visit. Everyone of course is familiar with Prague's old town Clock. But do go and take a tour to the tower. You will be awarded with breathless view of one of the most beautiful cities in the world.

You have to go to the top!. Astonishing and well worth a visit. Lifts available but get to the top for the best views of Old Town and beyond. Only a few pounds to get in. Clock performs on the hour, every hour.

Hundreds of moving parts, very cool at 12pm!. It's a very cool thing to see! There's hundreds of visible moving parts and on every hour (Sunday anyway) look up to see the trumpeter sound off the hour, then he waves to everyone when he's done.There are so many places to sit outside and grab lunch to watch the clock as well. Shoot away from U Prince (the staff is not very nice to tourists) and go for a more central view on one of the patios in the square. Then you can sit and watch the clock, get some amazing photos, and enjoy a glass of wine with a great view.

Heart of the city!. certainly one of the most beautiful areas of Vienna. You have so much around- activities, performances, excellent restaurants, bistros, pastry & ice-cream shops, shops, etc....we had one of the best Italian meals in a small restrau near this place. also Indian Restaurant 'Indian Jewel' very close to this place....It is very close to both Mustek Metro Station as well as Namesti Republiky metro stations... also Charles Bridge is close to this place

My god its popular. Every hour hundreds of people watch the 'performance of the apostles'. Again, a must see. Personally I thought it was built up too much but judging by the crowds i was in the minority

The square is lovely. The square is lovely, the clock on the hour is a big disappointment not worth hanging around for. The old square has some excellent photo opportunities and the free walks start from here under the clock and are well worth going on.

Very strange attraction. The square is very cool but it's just kind of bizarre to see thousands of people clamoring in anticipation for this weird little spinning clock thing. It's weird to imagine peasants traveling the length of breadth of Europe for 25 seconds of clock heaven. I thought the whole thing was hilarious.
DEFINITELY. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. The views were amazing and it was excellent to get to read all about the building, maintenance, and life of the 1400s clock tower.
Beautiful old clock. Folks wait around excitedly for the hour. It's cute, but a bit anticlimactic. That said we did enjoying hanging out in Old Town Square for drinks

A lot of history in a little place. We took the tour of the halls and the underground. Tours are in a number of languages.The building is made up of many houses and you can see the statues from the astronomical clock up close. There are a number of crests on display each with its own history and explanation for the differences. The underground has its own treasures including 4 very large statues and the tour ends in a room with a fantastic mosaic display. This tour is not disabled friendly and is all steps, however the mosaic is on the ground floor and can be seen for free.

Anti-climax. The clock itself is fascinating to look at and as the crowds gathered on the hour we were expecting... well... more. Understandably it is very old clock, but we were slightly disappointed given the build up.
Watch the clock strike. This was actually pretty cool. NOt only does the gothic theme scream at you, but when the clock strikes the hour, all the bells and whistles jump at you.

Must see . Was lucky enough to stumble upon the clock as it was reaching nine. Got to stand as part of a large group of tourists and witness it chime. The clock itself is very special. It was nice to hear people share stories of it's history as we walked past. As this was my first trip to Prague the clock was high up on my to do list. I seen the clock numerous times throughout my visit and it's just as special day or night.
astronomical clock. On the hour a disappointing clock show begins ,not even the excitable yanks could give a "woo or clap" and they "woo" anything

TIC TOC. Like most of Prague, this is well preserved although a little disappointing. We'd stopped here in the perfectly positioned coffee shop to await the clock chiming the hour along with many other tourists.

Astronomical Clock. Just has to be seen. The crowds gather around the clock to watch the movements but there are also many street artists to watch and also cafe bars etc. There are also some vintage cars which you can take a tour in but they are expensive. As with anywhere in Prague pickpockets are rife. We didnt carry wallets to avoid the visible wallet bulge preferring instead to distribute cash between the two front pockets of jeans where hands can be kept on it.

The Clock is Cool but the Square Rocks!. Certainly one of the prettiest and most interesting squares of any major European country (and I though Piazza Navonna had that honour!) There is a riot of things happening all around you- musicians, costumed characters, acrobats, lovely Asian girls in bride's dresses, Slavic bands, and so forth. Enjoy it all from the lovely terrace at the U Prinze hotel (voted one of the best in the world). Oh yeah, the clock is pretty cool but may not live up to its hype.

Impressive & surreal. The Astronomical clock is not to be missed.I witnesses the entire clock show as I reached there just before noon.Expect lots of crowds so its better to reach there about 15min in advance.Do rake the tour to see the inside of the clock tower.The guide is very well informed & it was surprising to see the underground part of Prague.Also, the climb to the top of the tower is a 'must do'.You can get a wonderful view of the city.The old town square surrounding the clock tower is beautiful with horse cariage rides, street musicians & plenty of food stalls.

A bit of a let-down; sorry. So many people rave about the astronomical clock but my wife and I were a little disappointed by it even though we were there for 9 a.m-perhaps we are missing something. Whilst appreciating the 15h century technology and the symbolism, it fell a little flat for us I'm afraid. My wife prefers the astronomical clock at Wells Cathedral.

Everybody goes. This is one more of the places we go because everybody goes and talk about. It is full of tourists posing for photos and in one of the times we walked by there were 9 or 10 brides and grooms too... Posing for photos...

Be at the Clock on the hour!. The Astronomical Clock is an incredible sight. Our Walkabout Guide explained how it works, but I am still none the wiser. On the hour the clock goes into a routine which lasts about two minutes. Bells ring, windows open and apostles pass by, a trumpeting blast and a deep bell tolls. Very impressive. Do not miss the magnificent Old Town Hall or the many stalls around the square.

Nice clock, fun to see but nothing overwhelming. Again. It is a nice clock and fun, but was not overwhelming. Once we saw it, we did not want to see it again even though we passed it many times a day.

Impressive Clock. The Astronomical Clock in Old Town appears to be one of Prague's most popular sites. Crowds seem to begin to form a full 45 minutes before the hourly parade of saints across the clock's face. Like the Charles Bridge, the crowds of tourists are a major draw for local pickpockets so be vigilant. Although many people report the hourly clock operation isn't worth more than a 5 minute wait, this attraction should be seen when in Prague.

A trip to the top of the astronomical clock. Everyone who walks through the square sees the clock. Many people get up early for wedding photos in front of the clock. But, we did not really appreciate it until we listened to the Naked Tour guide's explanation of the clock. It is a marvel. My husband and I went up to the top and saw the city from above. The stairs going up were quite a trip. Along the walls of the tower there are many signs for one to read. I imagine in high season, the signs keep the crowds entertained. In May we galloped up the stairs like two gazelles. There is an elevator which goes to near the top. Eventually, everyone will have to walk up a spiral stairs to the observation deck. Once up there, it is madness because everyone wants to take photos and videos. When someone edges over to the outside wall, then one camps in that position until they have taken enough photos. Meanwhile, the people near the inside ring are trying to move around the inside. Some people are going left, some people are going right. It is a mess! But, it is a GREAT view of downtown. It is fun to take the photos from that position and then go to the ground level for the same photo. The cost was minimal. I can not imagine what it would be like in high season!

A Steampunk's Dream. If you love "steampunk" gears, and mystical stars and engineering out of a Sherlock Holmes movie, don't miss walking up to the top of the tower through the inner workings of the clock and learning its history! It might actually be better than the bell ringing, which you're better off watching on YouTube than trying to see in the throng of tourists while holding onto your wallet.

Right on time. We were quite luckily to reach the clock right on time to hear and see it chime (21h00). The astronomical clock was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still working. However cannot beat the clock spectacle in Munich at Marienplatz.

Not that exciting. This is interesting because of its age and the ability to do this so long ago, but it is a fairly short mechanical display that does not overwhelm a modern traveler. go but dont expect fireworks!

Go at noon or midnight and see the best display. This clock captures everything I love about Czech culture, the feats of imagination combined with brilliant engineering and the way they treasure the past and keep it alive. It's Prague with bells on.

Impressive for a clock. This is one of the must sees in Prague and is ornately designed. It can get very busy when the clock chimes on the hour, but definitely worth doing at least once during your visit.
Nice but.... Marvellous clock and impressive buildings which we couldn't enjoy because of the enormous crowd, which was waiting to see the clock at the midday.

It's still ticking and worth watching.... History and time right before your eyes. Festival event on the square so the sight was very crowded and busy. But along with time and patience it a worthwhile sight to see and enjoy.
Most overrated attraction of Prague. The clock is really not that interesting, but you kind of have to see it when you're in Prague :) The "shows" are on every full hour.

Astronomical clock. Definitely worth while visiting, even if super crowded. I feel there is little use of guided tours, since most of the bars around the clock (literally) have free wifi. Sit, get a couple beers, and while waiting for the hour read the details of the clock's mechanisms on wikipedia...

Beautiful both during the day and night. Always fascinating to see the crowds looking up and applaud when the clock strikes the hour. People of all ages and nationalities crowd the area for the spectacle.
Cool clock and tower. This clock measures time in three ways. Also there is a tower that you can go into, no stairs just a ramp, and read about the history of the clock and how it was made.

"Underwheming Experience". Stood in the usual crowd awaiting the turn of the hour with anticipation however it was all over in a very short time and my wife looked at each other and thought wow was that it! Very disappointing to say the least however the reason I have given it 4 stars is because of the view from the top of the tower which is a must see whilst in the square. Long climb up the stairs(which in my opinion adds to the experience or you can take a lift. All points of interest are clearly marked at the top, well worth the small entrance fee.

Nice Clock and Wonderful Views from the Top. I was impressed the clock is located in such a low height, approx. 5 meter from the ground, since they are normally located near top of the tower or church. That is why I could see the details of the statues around clock, and was surprised at the skelton death and saints near the clock. I also climed up the tower. I strongly recommend to take elevator rather than climbing up the internal spiral steps if you do not want to use the energy for this point (because you may need to walk around in old town). The elevator took us to the top of the tower for less than one minute. The veiw was nice for its red roofs and the big church in front of this tower, even though it was raining. The tower climbing is MUST-Do in Prague.

wheelchair access. visited Prague with my mother who required a wheelchair to enable her to see everything we had a lovely lady who helped us to access the top of the clock tower with lifts and a wheelchair lift.For a place that isn't very wheelchair friendly yet this was a nice touch.

Had a look as we passed by not our intrest.
