It was 11.50am so a large crowd waiting for the clock to do its thing, we could not get excited so walked on to the Old Square and heard the chimes without the visual effects, but hey everybody has different opinions that is the beauty of travelling to different places.
Beautiful and magnificent work. Was expecting more and longer "clock show" on the hour though, it finishes surprising fast.Don't forget to visit the old town hall tower, more gems to be discovered.

Mechanical genius. What a marvel of its time. Considering the age of this mechanism, it is a wonder that it still functions as exactly as it does. The symbolism evident is even more interesting. The skeleton chiming the bell on the hour indicates that the Great Leveller is watching and like time, applies to all. The three other statues on that level indicate vanity, greed and infidelity all relating to the results indicated by the skeleton. However, the answer to the impact of vice is shown when the two doors above open and a display of the apostles moving through the open spaces show the faithful the way. We overheard a tour guide telling people to watch the clock chiming as it would change their lives, his tongue was firmly in his cheek. Nevertheless, the clock is a clear indication of the time it was installed when few could read but all could understand the symbolism. It chimes on the hour from 9am to 9pm and a local joke is to tell people to watch it at 10pm. It only lasts a minute or so but its a feature not to be missed.

Very Interesting!. The clock is very interesting to see for it's historical significance. It still operates with no electricity (as in medieval times) and used to be a great entertainment for those who lived by that time. Today it's kind of cool to see but the show is not as exciting as one would think when seeing the crowd that gathers around the clock every hour.
A major drawcard. Thousands crowd in the square on the hour to view and listen to the clock chime. Pay a few crowns and go to the top of the tower for amazing views of Prague

Mr. Skeleton (aka Death or "Klapacek") Whacks Away at Time. Check your watch and make sure, on the hour, to stand in front of this beautiful, interesting and complicated clock located on the south side of the Old Town City Hall - you can't miss it. It is entertaining and charming - the best part is seeing Death (Mr. Skeleton) toll the death knell. Two doors open and the 12 apostles make an appearance. The clock is a historical marvel and survivor. You cannot visit Prague and not partake in this experience - it would be like missing out on the castle! Better yet, it is absolutely worth it to go up into the clock tower and see the square and 360 views of Prague from up high. For purchase is an excellent and educational two-sided, 8 page laminated fold out explaining and describing everything you need to know about the astronomical clock = its history, what it does, it's theory, how the horizon and positions of the tropics and equator are important, how to read the dial, what statutes are on it = on and on. Fun!

A little disappointing!. The architecture was well worth a viewing also the amazing decoration on the clock but as for waiting for it to strike the hour...well we were somewhat underwhelmed. However it is part of the city so like hundreds of others we stood and watched it!

Unique. Very unique clock that a must visit in Prague which located in the Old Town Square. Luckily, when we visit this clock was not too many people crowd around there where we could take great photos.

Unique. Like all of Prague, the centuries old buildings and architecture is wonderful and this is the epicenter. Prepare to stand in a large crowd which gathers well before each hour to see the apostles revolve and the little skeleton hammering out the hour. Rating this in Trip Advisor is silly, because you are going to see this if you come to Prague without question.
Make Sure your there on the hour. A great place to visit in Prague and to enjoy a coffee in the square and really get the atmosphere of the city. The views from the top of the clock tower are great

Worth paying to go up. The whole square and clock is just so beautiful. We saw you can pay to go up to the top of the town hall so we did and it was so awesome! They have an elevator but we took the stairs and it was great, many nice things to see already going up. And once you get up you have a beautiful view of the whole city right from the middle of it.Defitinely worth going.

Quaint. Lovely architecture was slightly spoilt by hordes of tour groups all standing around for the windows to open before the clock chimes .. but the square was great not least some of the musicians

Cool Clock. This is not the most impressive show ever, but it's cool nonetheless and worth seeing once! The trip up the tower offers up a great view of the city and is worth doing (although it is crowded and apparently quite scary up there!)

The clock thing. The clock was really beautiful, and I found it really fascinating. It was interesting to see how the clock changed and to see the way it moved and hear the bells. It was cool to see such an old and functioning clock.

Expect a crowd. Astronomical Clock is located in the Old Town Square. The Square itself is always crowded but viewing the Clock means being crushed by more crowd. Try to see the Clock at really early or really late.

30 seconds 12 Apostles. It is always amazing to look the European old buildings. This is one of clocks in Europe and one thing different from the others in other countires, you can see the apotles on time. it is very short seconds but interesting to see them through the window. The Sun and Moon are described on the wall with the clock. Someone told me it is one of the things we should visit. I am not sure it is that much "a must" see things since I watched many clocks in Europe, but should not miss if you are in Prague.
Worth the stop. A great show on the hour, but come early to stake out a good spot. Even better avoid weekends or heavy traffic times later in the day when the crowd gets pretty big.

Very cool clock. This is a really cool clock with an interesting story. Be sure to find out about it before you see it. I didn't find out the whole story by doing a simple Google search; probably because it is kinda sad what the king did to the clockmaker (or maybe I'm bad with search words). It is worth seeing at the top of the hour. In tourist season, go 10 minutes early. In my opinion it is one of the top things to see in Prague.
What a clock. This is amazing it's unlike any other clock and to see it working too, the chimes are lovey and the figures come out too. Young and old will be amazed.
Very interesting, worth the trip up the tower!. The trip up the tower is worth the entrance fee - it gives a terrific view of the city and the square - make sure you have you camera charged!

Enigmatic. Very beautiful building, with a mysterious and somewhat eerie astronomical clock. Check it out when it is ringing, to see the "death dance". Too bad it is always too crowded. Is probably better to go there in low season.

Turist magnet. Every tourist in Prague including us is attracted to watch Orloj as a one of top must see attraction in this city. The astronomical clock is worth to see, but the whole performance takes a few minutes.Maybe you will be waiting in the crowd longer than you will be watching the show. Walking to the top provides another view of Old town, it`s good for taking some nice pictures or looking at tourist waiting for Orloj to start.

Ho-hum. As a clock goes, it is interesting, but it is over-hyped! For the crowds it draws, expectations definitely build up, but the show is over before you know it. Atleast the Munich Glockenspiel has some pizzazz around it.owever, not to trash it completely, the story around it is interesting. You will go to the square, and its right there....so why not have a look. Keep your expectations low.

Best city view from the top of the tower.. The ascent is highly recomnendable as you are able, despite the crowd to admire the entire old city at your feet. The Saint Mary before Tyn church stands impressive in front of you.Great.

Just go for the square. While we did not go inside the clock, we found the square, shopping, restaurants, architecture, cafes and people watching the real draw to Old Town. Seeing the outside was beautiful. Our group was not that interested in the history so much as the culture of what was around us. If you are walking past the clock at 1900, stop and see what everyone is looking up and waiting for. Worth a 5-10 minute pause if you are on your way somewhere else. In our opinion, not worth getting there and staying any earlier.

Best "hidden" view. My wife and I love Prague!! Especially this old town section with the clock, architecture, and Charles Bridge. With that said, if you walk just around the corner from the clock to the Charles Bridge, right at the start of it there is the tower on your left hand side. If you walk over to it there's an inconspicuous door that leads up to the top of the tower with one of the vest views of the Charles Bridge, castle, and surrounding city scape. It was weird because the door and entrance weren't marked, and at first we thought it might be a maintenance access and we weren't allowed to go up the stars, but our adventure side took hold and we were well rewarded. I think it cost maybe $2 once you go all the way to the top, but we were Literally the only people up there with uninterrupted views! It was awesome!!!

The Clock. The Square is a very exciting place to visit and also to eat. Of course the Astronomical Clock is the attraction and as it nears the hour, it is a crowded, jam-packed area. Not knowing what really to expect, it was a delight to see all the figures coming in and out as the hour struck and even till the end when the rooster appeared, it was still exciting to watch!

Underwhelming. I won't completely trash the clock as it can be amusing, but truly, it's a large cuckoo clock. Crowds gather 15 mins to the hour waiting for something amazing to take place. When the clock chimes a little skeleton rings a bell and you can see figures of the Apostles rotate around. At the end people are continue to stare upwards thinking there must be more to it. We tried again for the noon chimes thinking it might be different/better but it wasn't.Overall it's nice to see and one of those must-do things in Prague but keep expectations low.

Great 360 view from the top.. Beautiful piece of history within the old town square. Hourly clockwork show is worth a few minutes of your time if passing. We did pay the fee (100 Kč each) to go to the top which provided great views of the whole city. It was busy when we were there but didn't cause too long a wait. There is also an elevator to the top but the stairs up and down justifies a beer in the square when you're finished!!
Very good view. After seeing the clock go off at an hour, I would recommend going up to the top of the tower. The view is great. 360 degrees, and an elevator has now been installed to the top.

Worth the visit. Seeing the clock is a tourist attraction that I think everyone should aim to see while in Prague. Its a cool clock - but watch out for the pick-pocketers as its a pretty busy spot when the clock strikes the hour and everyone is looking up and taking pictures. I was fortunate to walk past the clock twice, both times a few minutes before the hour, so I stood with the huge crowds of people to see the figures circulate past the doors that opened.

Why... Prague is a fabulous city and the architecture throughout is just beautiful. I m not sure why this clock draws so much attention, its like a cuckoo clock with a horoscope dial over the time dial. Just be prepared for the crowds it gets very busy.

Too many tourists. It's very interesting to watch, but there are hundreds of people who want to see the clock every hour, so it's too crowded. Also, don't sit and drink a coffee there, it's too expensive !

Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. A very ancient clock with the most intricate workings. On the hour of each hour of the day the little people at the top do their circle round . Very old figures and lovely chime. Worth watching but beware of the crowds.
Ok. It's a nice clock, and every hour apostles coming out of a hatch in the wall. That the clock was made ​​in 1410, is fascinating. But thats all it is to it.

Childlike fascination. Like all the other tourists, I waited with childlike fascination for the clock to strike the hour, and then a great buzz went up, the trap doors opened, and the parade of figures commenced. Each figure which appeared caused a ripple of excitement and then just as suddenly the trapdoors snapped shut, the happy crowd clapped and cheered and you could feel thegoodwill. It was over in minutes, but a great experience.
Overestimated. I don't understand why this clock and it's show ( ! ) is so popular and why everybody cheers it everytime.

Right in the centre of things. Nice to wander around and gather with the crowd for the top of the hour. Beware pick pockets, they love this kind of crowd. Some nice food stalls further into the square - Ham being roasted and you buy it by the chunk with some bread and beer makes for a nice lunch.Also, you can try some Absynthe Ice-cream.
Probably not worth the 20 minute wait to get a good view.. A bit over hyped. It's ok if you're in the area, but making a special trip to see it probably not worth the time.

This was the amazing clock!!!. If you go to the Old Town Hall, make sure you see this clock. It strikes it's chimes every 1/2 hour (if I remember correctly), and on the hour, these huge clock figures pop out of the window and circle a walkway that extends from it. It's truly a sight to see!

even in the cold , you feel warm here as it is so good .. This is just like going back in time , sorry i did not mean that , the old town and clock is one of the top 3 things , in the city. i have never been in the summer , but in the winter it is still a great place to visit , so much to see and do , i am looking forward to going back as it is one of those places that you could visit often and still enjoy.

amazing architecture. Every hour the clock performs its little theatrics, which is quite impressive as it was built ages ago. We saw on our own and then with a guide( walking tour) and without his explanation, we would have miss a lot. we also went to the top of the clock, for an entrance fee. and we went also at night time to the underground, with the Magees Ghost Tours

Perfect 4 Day Break In Prague. 'went here twice first day there was a lot of rain so couldn't really appreciate the wonderful architecture and Buzz from all the people wonderful places to eat not expensiveAlso the wooden shacks under the trees the food looked and smelt amazing A great place to go to

A must see in Prague. You can't miss this in Prague, even if the charachters moving each hour may be not as spectacular as other famous clock in europe (the one in Bern for example).Avoid the visita on saturday if you can.
Lovely to see. Very busy square, plenty of restaurants for a drink. Lovely to see chime and take photos. Often a market in the square and good streets surrounding to wander around.

YOU HAVE TO SEE THIS MASTERPIECE, AND CLIMB THE TOWER..!. Being In Prague and walking by here most days, I still found myself stopping and marvelling at this historic sight. But kept missing the hourly chimes until I made the effort to actually make a point of sitting in the overpriced restaurant opposite and awaiting the magical moment. When it came I was really disappointed with the display, perhaps I expected more? However what I found hilarious were the herds of Wildebeast tourists clapping and cheering, around the square like it was a live show.! Don't get me wrong this is one of those ancient masterpieces you have to see In ones life time I suppose, but do also go inside the tower for a small fee and you'll be rewarded with some stunning views across the city I promise you, that's after you survive the mad scrum and elbowing that goes on up there as there's hardly any room to swing a cat, I'm surprised someone hasn't fallen off already? Just be careful. Also, Hanus is the man who built this clock many years ago, and he supposedly had his eyes gouged out by the city fathers to stop him building another one.! So much for gratitude, but some say afterwards he got into the clock and put his hands in the mechanism damaging them in the process, putting the clock out of action for 80 yrs too, thus getting his revenge on the city.!Just remember that when you're jumping up and down screaming folks.

An Intersting Piece To Visit Briefly. Most likely as you wander through the city you will come across the clock several times. There are several walking tours that start here under the clock. On the hour the clock chimes and some of the pieces become animated. Usually at these times the area is very crowded. I think it is a good strategy to get a seat at one of the cafes at a table with a view and watch it seated while relaxing with a drink. The clock has some detail according to yearly, monthly, and hourly calendar. I would read up on the clock before you go to fully understand all the markings and fully enjoy the clock.

No trip to Prague would be complete without it. A mechanical marvel and very beautiful! We had dinner at the cafe right across from it and so sat and watched it chime the hour twice. Sure beats standing in the throng of tourists jockeying for position on the street. Enjoying a beer, wine, or cocktail while seeing this clock is a double treat and very relaxing.

History time. The scene of the clock or square is manic , full of people on guided tours following a man or a lady waving an umbrella in the air trying to keep their clients together ! The clock is wonderful and strikes on the hour so be there to see what happens and take a guided trip so you don't miss out on all the info.

The oldest working clock in the world. We went up to the top of the clock tower on our first day in the city. The views were pretty good from the top and also to look down at the square. It was quite busy at the top and a little of pushing and shoving at times.The clock itself was quite interesting but use a tour guide to understand what the dial actually shows. No need to wait around for hours to see the performance just get there five minutes before. Regardless of what time you get there it makes no difference as there is a always a huge crowd standing there.
The Clock is a must to see. The clock strikes on the hour and all the figures move, so be early because there are lots of people who go to watch.

Interesting. The whole square (Staromestske namesty) is wort seeing, the clock is an attraction for itself. Many people stand and patiently wait for full hours for The Apostles to show. Don`t miss it!
Great to visit. I was happy that there is a lift to the top of the tower but the walk down was easy.the old town hall can only be visited with a guide who spoke excellent english
Neat. A very neat thing to see when in Prague. Very busy especially around the hour mark as everyone stops to see the clock go off. But totally worth stopping and watching!

Interesting, but nothing "spectacular" really.... Area was literally packed with tourists ( on the end of April ) and clock itself was a slight disappointment, much smaller than I had imagined it to be but okay, it's interesting, worth 5 minutes visit and few photos, sure. I didn't see it to "unfold", maybe that would get more stars from me. If you have only short time to spend in Prague it's not the best sight around, there are lots more to see. LOTS! I promise! ;-)

Nice view from old town tower. The clock in itself seems rather plain although it seems to attract lots of tourists every hours (i was part of them, i must admit).Apart from a rather ininteresting mechanism, the main interest comes from the view you can get from the top of the tower of town hall, which is just amazing.

Read about it before you visit. Wouldn't recommend waiting for more than 10 minutes for this, just plan to go to Old Town Square 10min before any hour. Yes be prepared for tourists, but just find a good spot and watch the clock unfold - great considering how old the clock is.
Neat Clock. Every hour on the hour, Jesus and his disciples come out while death tolls the bell. It was very cute and the kids got a kick out of it
what a waste!. didn't get the big deal here. Stood around waiting for the hour. Just make sure you see it but avoid the crowds and not worth waiting to see the hour change
Must have seen in Prague. It's a beautiful watch and actually amazing if you think at the time it has been created. At every full hour it rings and the statues move.
Clock is amazing. Quite the sight - not a real impressive show, unless you consider the age of the clock & it is still going!!

Underwhelming. I should have read the history of the clock before visiting. The Apostles are not easy to define unless you have the right position in the crowds. I would hate to be there when it's a really busy time. To enjoy the experience more...do your homework!
Quite a clock !. I think I haven't seen such an Astronomical clock anywhere else. It is quite detailed . A must visit on one's visit to Prague.
stand straight in front of this. If you don't stand exactly in front of the clock when it strikes the hour you will miss out on seeing the apostles. And that is what it is all about

Huge amount of tourists at the full hour, but worth it - impressive clock!. The astronomical clock is an event at the full hour - lots of tourists come to see the figurines move and "hit" the bell, especially the skeleton showing you that yet another hour of your life is over is impressive. I very much enjoyed seeing this clock and buying a replica that is "more normal" is definitely not the dumbest souvenir to take home. A must-see and free of charge!

Better Than Staying Home. The Old Town Square was pretty darn cool, but the clock was, how can I say this, underwhelming. The best part of our clock experience was watching all the people watching the clock. A visit to the top of the clock tower is well worth your time and effort but the clock itself was a disappointment.I can't say enough good things about Prague, Terizan, or Cesky Krumlov. No complaints about anything really. But the clock wasn't as big a deal as we thought it would be.

Typically touristy mumbo jumbo. Not worth waiting for long for, but if you are passing by within minutes before the hourly opening of the clock including trumpet salute from the top, by all means: Be watching.Funny how people wait for up to 45 minutes for this, though.

Came for the view. To be honest, I was more interested, as most of the times in the view from top of the tower, than in the clock below. There were big crowds everywhere, and it was interesting to watch it all from above, and again get some idea of the way the old city is structured and organized.On the top it was also quite crowded, and many people ignore or miss the signs that direct you to go in a clock-wise manner through the narrow pathway. So it takes a little more time, but eventually you get to see it all. The square below was full of action due to Easter holiday, and overall it was fun.

The Astronomical Clock is a must see. The astronomical clock is absolutely brilliant, what a marvel that something like this was made in the 15th Century! Definitely worth waiting to see 'the walk of the apostles'
Allegedly a must see. Not exactly inspiriing but its OK - bells ring and some models come out. If you are near its worth seeing but would not make a trip to Prague just to see it!!

Astronomical Clock..was well a clock. Given it was constructed in the middle ages and still operates to this is pretty impressive in its own right. Tourists gather around the clock on the hour to watch it come to life. Its hard to compare this clock to what we have now with the smart phones and tablets we have now. But its beautiful in its own right.
Climb the tower!. The clock is, well, the clock. But do not forget the town hall tower with excellent views over the rooftops and down on the crowds on the square.

MUST SEE!. The clock is a MUST SEE in Prague. It's a beautiful clock that's one of the only remaining working astronomical clocks working in the world. Be prepared for crowds, especially on the hour when the saints come out and the clock makes noise...it's really not that big of a deal. Mainly you just want to see the clock, admire it, and get a picture. The rest of the time explore the square around the clock. There are great shops, places to eat, and plenty of awesome street performers.

Go inside, do the tour.... You can view the town hall and astronomical clock from the outside; however, I recommend paying the money and going inside for the tower and also historical tour. The tower will give you a good view of Prague and you can examine a very funky elevator. The tour will be guided by a local guide with good historical knowledge and you can see not only the back of the clock, but also various historical rooms and the cellar.

Astronomical experience!. Although the whole thing lasts a few seconds, it's worth it to wait and watch the clock as it strikes the hour and the statues start to be around out of windows on either side. Something which one will remember Prague for.
Clock watching is THE tourist activity here. It is hard to get a good view of the clock due to crowds. Just a short walk from the Charles Bridge. Square is charming.
Great piece of history. A great piece of history and only cost 110 Czech crowns (€3.50). A must see as it gives a great view of the city. I really enjoyed it.

Sweet clock. very nice building, the clock is superb - amazing design and very sweet, I sat down and had a cup of hot chocolate next to it waiting for the bells to ring, so I could see the "show" - well the 12 discipels came to view when 2 doors slides open and you can see small wood statues rotate inside the hole.. sweet but not worth the wait if you don't have much time

It's a clock. An intriguing clock with a colourful history. Worth a visit - on the half-hour. Every hour there are multiple anti-climaxes as people look at each other is if to ask "Is that it?" Yes folks, unfortunately that's all it does.Not really worth hanging around in a crowd, but get there when you have more room to really appreciate the workmanship.And also watch out for the pickpockets and extremely annoying segway riders.

Everybody knows that it's a must!. Full of excitements, actvities and people. The square is full of interesting buldings and monuments. The clock puts on a show every hour on the hour. Just hold on to your valuables when everyone looks up.

MAGNIFICENT. We find it at the very crowded Old Town Square and at 12 oclock exactly, bells and has this cute small show for us.Is really beautiful , you will see it anyway, as the square is the most visited place and i'm sure you will be there. Relax, take your coffee or a cold Pilsner Beer amd enjoy every minute as we did and would not regret.

Great view from the tower/loved the glass elevator. Go up in the Tower. Great views. I was a little nervous walking around the top because I have a disabled child that wanted "to look" a little to close to the edge. But it was all good. My kids loved the glass elevator. We were in town close to Easter and the square had many Easter Stalls in it. It was very charming.

Just fine. The tower is a must-go place, as it offers an amazing view over Prague, and the tickets are quite cheap. The tower is of course crowded with tourists, but nevertheless it's worth it. The astronomical clock, on the other hand, is indeed decorative and also interesting in itself, but the so-called "show" the clock plays every hour was a real let-down. We expected to see something really cool, what with all the people gathered to see it and all the hype about it. Truth to be told, the clock just played some music, there were some puppets moving on the top-floor windows for a little while and that was that. Really not so wonderful as many seem to think...

Bustling square. I could have sat in this square all day. As it was Easter, lots of stalls to look at, different food stalls, live entertainment. Definitely worth a visit. Watch out for pickpockets although there was a police presence.

A must-see place. This is a must to see place when visiting Prague. Very romantic and charming experience while travelling through the narrow streets of a medieval town in Prague 1.The clock chimes every round hour and everyone just stands there waiting for that moment. This place is massively overcrowded, so be ready for a hustle.The square near the clock is always full with fairs, local food makers and musicians.

oldest working astronomical clock. Although this clock made the top 10 overrated tourist sites, it's still a must see. I think it's unique clock in that it shows the sun and moon positions, the apostles and other animated characters, and the months represented in the calender. The 4 figures-2 on each side of the clock- represent vanity, greed, death, and entertainment. The skeleton is my favorite ringing the bell and the others shaking their head on not wanting to go. The characters represent what was despised of in those times when the clock was originally being constructed. It's actually interesting to know the history of the clock before seeing it otherwise you would be like...that's it and think it was pointless. On the hour the clock will go off so yes lots of people flocking to that area. Also mind your purse/wallets/valuables...since its crowded and most people are looking up/taking pic/taking videos at the clock it's the perfect time for pickpocketers to come through.

Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. Go up the Clock Tower and enjoy the view. They have ramps instead of stairs, AND they had an elevator. The view is great. The tour of the Old Town Hall was interesting and educational. We enjoyed it and enjoyed learning about the history of Prague. The rooms are interesting and you get to go into the basement level which where the old cistern in and can see how much the level of the city has risen. The mosaic art work in the final room is spectacular.

12pm. Catch the clock just before 12pm and you'll witness a great vibe in the crowds. Clock chimes and everyone loves it! Even if you miss it, it's in a great location as there are lovely snack bars near by to admire the hitoric clock.
A must to see. The famous watch is a must to experience when in Prague. Abit crowded on the hour, but that is to be expected.

Exceptional Piece of Work. When we have first seen the astronomical clock we were astonished by it's beauty and scientific difficulty. It is highly advisable to read about the clock to get the better understanding of how and when it has been built.I would also suggest to take a guided tour around the main square (or better around the whole old town) as we haven't and felt like we missed quite few interesting things and stories.

Great View from Top, but Crowded. So as other have said, watching the clock go off is quite anticlimactic. It was most humorous though to watch the swarms of people come out of the woodworks to view it and then see everyone's faces when they were like, that's it? We paid to go up into the tower which had several posters on the walls of the staircase that told some of the history of the tower and clock, but we were disappointed that we could not see the inner workings of the clock, itself. The view from the top was beautiful though!

Gorgeous clock tower. This is a must see when it Prague. The astronomical clock is quite a complex system which not only shows time but also stages of Moon and Sun and the zodiac and other data.There are 12 apostles which contrary to some Tripadvisor reviews do come out of the two windows but only on the hour. There are other statues which also move on the hour like the skeleton and three others. The astronomical clock celebrated 600 years on 9th October 2010 by a magnificent display of its history projected on its front wall.http://www.orloj.eu/cs/videoprojekce.htm
Seriously????. Hardly worth the accolades. Interesting if you happen to be walking by. Would not want to make special trip to see the clock. The skeleton is coolest part.
Famous Clock. Heavily viewed but not the best of it's kind. Very simple without figures moving out from the clock. Town Hall impressive from the outside.

time on your hands. what site to be seen here again tourist like us,crammed around this time piece plenty for to be seen,alleys run right and left shops cafes go in and out and have a look for yourself.
Fantastic clock!. I could stay almost forever looking at the clock ringing! All the small details are fantastic! Maybe too many people around but can´t blame them!!
mind blowing. This is an amazing piece of technology and history. It gets very busy every hour as the clock strikes and the tiny show begins, so be careful of pickpockets although we were alright.

Stunning view and amazing clock. The view from the top of the tower is fantastic. I recommend getting the panoramic guide to help identify all the landmarks. There are also signposts of key places on the rails but it can be crowded and difficult to read. The Astronomical Clock is a must see. It celebrated 600 years in 2010, amazing. Get there well before the hour to get a good spot so you can see Death the skeleton ring the bell (half way up) and the statues of the apostles coming out on the hour.

Great Views From The Top. You can get a great view of the surrounding area from the top of the tower. Some good photo ops as well. There is both elevator and stairs going up the tower but the final climb to get to the viewing area is via a small spiral staircase. Really enjoyed going up there. The clock also every hour on the hour puts on a little show worth seeing. Pull up a chair at the outside restaurant facing the astronomical clock and watch in comfort with a cold pivo in you hand!

Interesting and amazing for being so old. Worth a stop and look (didn't go inside) - conflicting stories about whether or not the clock maker was blinded afterwards to prevent him from making another.

A Must!. The Astronomical Clock draws large crowds for it short show. So you want to get there early, at least 10 minutes ahead, and find a good spot to watch the two small blue doors.I personally found the bell tower and the tour very interesting. The tour starts on the first floor. The tour starts on the hour, so you can see, through a large glass door, the Apostles and the mechanism that rotates them when the clock strikes the hour. Then you walk through the 5 houses that make up the Old Town Hall. The rooms and the furnishing are interesting, but what is particularly interesting is when you go into the lower floor, or what should be a basement of the Town Hall. You will be in houses that were built in the 1100's and all were occupied at least from the year 1190. You will also go through one that was an early debtors' prison, and walk on a street that was used for several hundred years, till the Old Town Square was raised to its current height. These 12th Century houses are the foundation for the "modern" Old Town Hall, but give us a view of life in year 1190 AD, something most of us will only see and experience once. The Old Town Hall Tower is wonderful. You can take the lift to the top, but I found it much more interesting to walk up. You do not want to walk down if you have vertigo. The spiral stairs from the top of the tower juts out in "mid air" and you are looking down about 8 stories. A couple of people coming down behind me had a serious problem with it. The view from within and outside can not be beat. Both the stairway and the glass lift are fascinating and it is even better once you walk around the outside on the tower walk. Terrific view! Great place for pictures of Prague.
A Classic. A visit to Prague wouldn't be complete without this one. Watch out for pickpockets and drunk Brits though.

Climb the clock tower!. The astronomical clock itself is nothing too exciting. By all means, see it while you are in Prague since it's a tourist attraction, but don't expect too much. I suggest climbing the clock tower! It was my favorite tower in all of Europe & trust me I have climbed quite a few. It offers a stunning view of the old town and well worth the climb!

Make sure you do the tour. We bought a ticket to go up the tower which in itself is excellent but also purchased a tour of the halls and underground the Old Town HallWas very worthwhile -as the tour starts which for us was on the hour we were left in the chapel where you could actually see the figures working on the astronomical clock as you are at their heightThe underground part was very interesting ending up 8 metres below current street levelPut this tour on your agenda

A must see. I was told a story from a local, who knows if it is true. They said the person that designed this clock was blinded after he created it, so that he could not create another. Sad if that is true! Was a sight to see.

Good, But Still A Clock. This is undoubtedly one of the main symbols of Prague, and so really is a must-see, but keep in mind that this beautiful clock is still, well, a clock. It does move a bit on the hour, and it honestly quite cool, but the crowds who gather on the hour in the peak parts of the day are almost more trouble than the slight movement is worth. If you must see the hourly "show", go early (before 10am). Otherwise, fight the crowds (and guard any bags) or simply go between hours - even if you don't see the movement, it's lovely and not to be missed.

Interesting but don't expect too much. This is just one of those things that is on the tourist hit list......it's interesting enough to look at and the story behind it is quite bizarre, but don't expect too much when it chimes on the hour! Be wary of pick-pockets too.

See the clock early. Saw the clock a couple of times. In the mid-afternoon/evening it is very busy. The first "performances" of the clock at 9 and 10am are much quieter. After watching the clock, buy a ticket (110kc I think) from the surly guy at the counter right inside and go to the top of the tower for great views of the city.
A must see. This square is one of the prettiest if not the prettiest in the world and is a complete must see for all visitors to Prague to see the astronomical clock and Our Lady before Tyn church.

Crowds and Crowds and Crowds. What a mess. It is like Disney World and Las Vegas rolled into one. Very irritating for sure. Very difficult to get any sense of history as the crowds and scene make it more like a comedy.

Amazing and boring. If you go to Prague, sooner or later you'll find yourself in front of the astronomical clock there's no doubt about that.While the clock, it's history and the engineering achivements involved in it are great and it's fame it's well justified, but you shouldn't expect much about the so called "show" at the o'clock hours.If you want to understand it, you must definetly habe a tour guide to tell you or read something first because it tells so many things that it seems impossible to beliave that someone build it 1410.
Best seen early in the morning. A must see while you are in Prague. Try to go there early in the morning when no one else is there to get unobstructed views of the Orloj. The details are amazing!

astronomical clock. this is an attraction everyone goes to see however me and my daughter were alittle underwelmed. The history behind it was interesting but the disciples come out for only seconds. However if you go to prague you need to see it for yourself.r

Amazing views. We walked past the clock several times and of course watched it but on this occasion we decided to take a look inside. About £3 each and just enough time for me and my partner to go right to the top and look down at the crowds gathering. 'WOW... What a view' I said. Why didn't we come up here on the first day. I can't explain how wonderful the 360' view was of Prague. Simply beautiful. Must visit

Worth seeing but a little over-rated. Nearly all tourists who visit Prague make a point of seeing the Astronomical Clock. My advice to anyone who is going to Prague for the first time is to google the Astronomic Clock before you go and get a basic idea of the complexity of its design. I thought the little figures who become visible to the public through the two little windows that open every hour on the hour for 20 seconds are a bit of a gimic but you will still want to see them! Don't miss the opportunity to get tickets to get to the top of the tower where you will have the most fabulous view of Prague.
take the time!. a very unusual clock and again well worth a look.makes you appreciate the craftsmen that were around years ago.

Incredible. No matter what, you must see this clock. It is stunning, was built in 1410, and is still perfectly telling you the time, day, and position of the sun and moon. The hourly chime is a little overrated, but you have to get over that when you consider how exceptional this clock is anyway.
Captivating. One of the must see landmarks when visiting Prague. It is usually surrounded by hundreds of tourists, but don't let this put you off - it's very unique.

A Must See. It's a fancy clock with little figures that come out on rails. I'm sure it was a wonder of the age when it was first constructed, and it still is one of the must-see items to be ticked off on any trip to Prague.

Wonderful Attraction. It is very, very interesting. People flock to the attraction to see it, especially on the hour. Get there early so that you can have a great view. It is something to see. Lots of history here. You can climb to the top for great views.You should not miss seeing the magnificent attraction.
Clock. It's one of the oldest clocks in the world and one of those boxes u have to tick off when ur visiting prague

The center of the world!. Based on the astronomical clock, Prague is at the center of the world. It is amazing how this clock still works today. Every hour, the images surrounding the clock come to life - symbols of Death, Pride, Greed. The 12 Apostles come out of the clock. This is a scene most tourists come to watch. The downside is that the area (Old Town Square) also attracts a lot of pickpockets so one has to be really mindful of his belongings while watching the astronomical clock.

Unique. Unique device, I believe the builder was blinded after completing so that he couldn't build another one. Still not sure how to read it but that wasn't helped by the alcohol level in the blood at the time.

Beautiful building and views. Really enjoyed the Astronomical Clock, it is an amazing construction. However I did think it was a bit of an anti-climax when it chimed every hour. I guess I expected a bit more than a few saints rolling back and forward and then a bird going "caw" at the end. What was quite entertaining was watching everyone else in anticipation, waiting for the clock to strike to see what would happen. Literally hundreds of people will gather every hour to watch this. I would recommend buying a ticket to go up the top of the Clock tower, as there are amazing views of Prague from up there. Especially the Metronome, which we didn't even know was there until we spotted it from up on high.

spectacular. another part of the wonderful city of Prague that you need to see- do make the effort to wait to see the clock work on the hour itself- it is remarkable and quite moving actually. The crowds do flock to view this so again if you want a good view - position yourself early

An enchanting attraction and a great view from the top of the tower. On the walking tour they said the astronomical clock was the most over-rated tourist attraction in Europe. We agreed to a point, the crowds were huge waiting for the clock to strike on the hour and then it struck and I don't know what we were expecting but it lasted for about 30 seconds and then the crowds dispersed! It is certainly a must see in Prague and the climb to the top of the town hall is well worth it. Some of the other towers you can climb in Prague are possibly too high - at least with the town hall you can see the detail on the buildings which is just super beautiful. Highly recommend you climb to the top whilst visiting the Old town square and the clock.
Big Disappointment. Waited 15 minutes, secured a good viewing point, for what?? Only 35 seconds of characters moving round.....sorry not the high light per reviews...

Prague old town clock. Interesting but don't blink on the hour when the two doors open and the twelve Apostles parade by the window--about 15 seconds. The square and old buildings are nice to see as well as the Charles Bridge.

Classic attraction. Beautiful Clock and stunning architecture in the square. Definitely worth the visit. The clock chimes on the hour every hour and worth while hearing it just to be able to say you did!
Must see. It's one of the best attractions of the old town. I think that you should definitely take at least a walk to there.

Enchanting. The square does get busy so be sure to visit early to see the clock. It is nice to enjoy a beer in one the many bars opposite while waiting for it to strike the hour. Takes the weight off of your feet while waiting too. Great timepiece and a must see in Prague.
Go and visit the tower. Great view from the tower. But take a lift to go up. Try to visit the tower when it is not so crowded, cause there is not much space to move.
Superb!. What an amazing timepiece. I am sure that with a little time I could have worked out how it worked but what a sight.A must have photo for your collection in a great area of a vibrant city.

a good piece of history. the square is a great meeting place but is really busy on the hour when everyone goes to see the clock, it is worth while going up the tower which gives great views of the city,
Love it!. The most magnetic place in the whole city! Be there every exact hour and you'll see "The Walk of the Apostles", a clockwork hourly show of figures of the Apostles. :)

Pragues most famous landmark. At the bottom corner of the old town square this is the other must see attraction of Prague. As it nears the hour crowds gather infront to see the little doors open and the skeleton ring his bell. As an attraction its more its historical interest than what it does that makes it interesting - and may people seem slightly underwhelmed by its hourly chimes - but its still something you have to see when in Prague. Watch your pockets and bags though !
Interesting. Can get crowded but swing past to see this interesting design. You have to appreciate the history and beauty.

Worth a walk past.. Old town square (the hall is there) and the clock are worth a walk past, if only to soak up the ambience of Prague. Very busy, but enjoyable. We did not go inside the hall, though learned a little of the history as to the the new town hall is no longer there.

Timely. How could you miss this?? Why, during one of your strolls through the old streets, make this a priority. If you read a bit about it first it will enhance your experience of seeing the clock in action.There are many places to imbibe while you wait for the Apostles to appear.

Underwhelming ;). It's genuinely not worth waiting around on the hour to see the "action" of the clock... despite this, hundreds of people do every single hour, bless them. You aren't missing much, I promise you :)

Brilliant Design. After reading the guide books, seeing this clock was on my list of things I wanted to see. The crowds really gather so make sure you have got your space near the front. The little skeleton (Death) kicks things off by ringing a bell whilst nodding his head and turning his hourglass. Whilst this is happening the apostles move across the two windows near the top and a golden chicken finishes it all off. It is all over very quickly, but I was glad to see it. Infact we went and saw it twice as I felt I had missed some of it the first time round, not knowing what to expect or where to look. Second time round I caught all the action. If you time your visit for about 5 minutes before the hour you won't spend more than about 6 minutes there in total so I feel it is definitely worth a look!

Definitely worth the visit. The old town hall and astronomical clock has been a tourist attraction since the 1400's so you have to visit it during your stay in Prague. It's located in the Old Town square so plenty of places to sit down with a drink or two and the views of the city from the old town hall are really good.

Stunning clock and amazing views. The Astronomical clock does its thing every hour so you won't miss it but be there a few minutes early to get a good view. It is raised so even with a sea of cameras, you will get a good view and a good shot. The Old Town Hall is worth a visit as the views are amazing from the top. We climbed up but you can take a lift if you are not so energetic.

Over rated. I guess the mechanical clock movement and the marionettes will be interesting to kids but frankly I think its over rated. By all means see it because you are in the beautiful city of Prague but don't prioritise it over the great castle, churches, bridges architecture........ Its ok to stop and look if you are passing and the atmosphere in the square on a warm day is electric.Beware of the restaurant prices and pick pockets in the area.

Wonderful Old Town. The Old Town Hall and the Astronomical Clock were beautiful and worth the trip to Prague. Spend the few dollars (6 euros) to go up the tower atop the Old Town Hall and get fantastic views of the Old Town.

brilliant experience. If you get to the square just before the hour mark you will see the clock in action. Well worth the wait and you can climb the old tower and the views at the top are brilliant overlooking the city Cost of tower 110 kr worth the climb or you can take lift right to the top
Atmospheric. Gorgeous architecture with plenty of history and an array of places to eat and drink. Be sure to explore the surrounding area and don't queue up for too long to watch the clock!

Wait for the twelve apostles to come out of the doors of the clock on the hour. This area gets very crowded, so make sure you get there before the clocks starts striking, also do walk around the area, you can walk to the jewish quarters near there.
Astronomical Clock. We had been recommended to take in the astronomical clock on the hour and we were not disappointed it was mesmerizing.

One of the must see places in Prague. This famous clock is placed just on the side of Old Town Square. It does get really busy on the hour every hour as this is when the clock comes to life and chimes, moves etc. At this point the area in front of the clock is packed even in off peak times of the year. Definitely worth seeing but once you've seen it, it's probably not worth braving the crowds again. The town hall is impressive on it's own with some spectacular architecture that's also worth a look.

Unique watch in the heart of the city. This is one of the things that people in Prague take huge pride in . It is a unique clock which has been operational and showing the correct time since the 1300 . Every time the clock strikes 12 , there is music and an act of the clock , which is a huge attraction with the crowd . The attraction is crowded by the hour . You would get an opportunity to see it several time as it is in the heart of the city and cannot be missed .The old Town Hall has a good view from the top. This tower has a lift , so no climbing of stairs . It will cost 100 Kc which was good and worth it . If you go before 1700hrs , there are tours which show the inner working of the clock as week.
Amazing. Beautiful town hall and the Astonomical Clock is to be seen. Facinating. Well worth waiting for it to strike the hour.

One of the best squares in the world. Beautiful, well designed, crowded but not too much, take a trip to the tower of the astronomical clock from where you can enjoy a fabulous sight of the city and eat Prague's famous ham at one of the stands just over the tower. To try once in a lifetime!
Worth a look. I loved the all area with many beautiful buildings. The clocks were magnificent and worth a photo or two.

good one. I was amazed with the astronomical clock. Take a bit of time to observe the clock, theres so much to it. Even it seemed not so facinting at first, but later I simply loved it . The location makes it perfect!

Bit of a let down. Sat opposite in a little café, waited for the big fan fair, bit let down to be honest, big crowds and yet it was all over in about minute, was expecting a trumpet player to appear from the top but nothing. Maybe I went on a bad day, it as a clock is impressive and the surroundings are great.

What a clock. Saw the Astronomical clock on our walking tour, waited for it to go off!! cannot believe how old this clock is and how it came about, very interesting history surrounding this and the old town hall. Again worth doing the walking tour. Watch your purse as the pick pockets act during the striking of the hour!!

Oh, was that it?. Totally underwhelming experience. I stood for 10 minutes waiting for it to strike and when it did a cockerel crowed and a couple of figures appeared and then disappeared, and the clock bell rang. Whoopy doooo!

Medieval astronomical clock. What an amazing feature in this city! This clock tells us relative positions of the sun, moon, zodiacal constellations, and sometimes major planets... and it is the oldest functioning one in the world. It's amazing to see it align on the hour, every hour. Throngs of people make their way to see this clock and once you are standing there, you can see why!

Good views.. We were staying just round the corner rom the main square and saw he clock many times.A big crowd gathers on the hour to watch the "show" however don't expect much as its over in a flash! Do go up the tower which is accessed inside the town hall . The views over the square are fantastic and you can pick out the major sites.

Impressive clock, excellent views!. A traditional meeting place, teeming with tourists and revellers. Really beautiful clock and an enjoyable show on the hour, every hour. Check out the detailed gold and coloured patterns. For wonderful views across the city, make sure you go to the top of the tower. You can take a nice walk around and take some great pics for a small fee.

Loved the clock. Okay. It is just a clock. It's not worth coming just to see the clock, as we heard from many people how disappointed they were with it. That said ...there is something about the lines and colors and flow of the actual clock face that I found simply striking. I love everyone of my pictures of it and every time I see it I am struck with the same awe. The movement of the 'statues' is at the top of the hour and while that is cool to see along with your 1,000 closest friends ... For me simply gazing at the clock face each time that we passed was delightful. Having lived on five continents - I've done my share of traveling ...and so far, there is something in that clock face that has me convo ended it is the most gorgeous man made thing I have ever seen. Sounds sappy, doesn't it? I know. I am hooked. So when you go to Prague and find yourself in the throngs at the top of the hour ... Stick so around once everyone has left and step a little closer. Check out the lines, the fluidity, the colors. The name date mechanism is pretty cool too.

Amazing name for a clock for sure!!. I thought my friends were making a joke when she said astronomical clock, but its actually the name of this clock!!! And if you stay there for it to strike the hour, you see something cool. Many pple crowd there to see it, so you definitely can't missed the crowd. But they only gather afew minutes before it strikes the hour. Prretty cool!
Nice area. Wondered what the huge crowd was, then realised the clock was about to chime the hour, when the clock features all move.
Must go up. We got very excited when we stepped out! the view! lots of selfies! stunning stunning….and to think we almost didn't go up…..would have been our biggest mistake!

Not worth much time. The Old Town Square is worth a walk through because of the architecture and location; if you happen to be there on the hour, by all means watch the striking of the clock. However, it isn't worth having to fight hoards of tourist groups to get a good look. Watching the tourists asking themselves "is that all?" is more entertaining. That said, it really is a remarkable object but has been way overblown in tourist books, etc.
interesting. very nice to look at, cool old buildings with interesting story. crowded place, seems like many trips stop there to watch the clock

Worth seeing. There are hit and miss reviews about the clock, but you have to see it; time it right and you do not have to hang around, be warned though it gets busy, we liked the trumpeter at the end who was at the top of the tower funny and everyone cheers.We did not go up the tower or see the workings, just looked the figures from the front.We think a must see.J & M

Not as exciting as you'd think!. We happened to be walking past the clock at 5 to 12 and figured we'd join the huge crowd that had formed to watch it do it's thing. However, when finally the clock struck the hour, the tiniest figure attached to it dinged a bell a few times then it was all over!I'm not disputing that it's a beautiful clock because it is, however I do think the enormous crowd draw is somewhat undeserved. My advice is if you happen to be about when it strikes, take a look but dont queue for half an hour (as it turns out a lot of people do).

Great view. If You are lucky with the wheather, as we were, don't miss climbing the tower of the old town hall. It gives You a wonderful overview. All You can see is very well described in a little brochure. It's a really good starter, where You can plan the "menu" of the whole day left.

The FINALE!. Apparently the Astronomical Clock show is something you can't miss when visiting Prague, and its so horribly boring that everyone should actually see how bad it is. Every hour, in front of the tower. The view from the top of the clock is truly amazing.

Best Thing to See in Prague!. The Astronomial Clock in Prague is absolutely breath-taking. It is worth walking by and trying to understand and decipher all its dials, eclipse illustrations and calendars as well as the story behind it. And of course it makes motions on the hour , every hour, and a trumpeteer is even involved!
Unique. Has to be visited and seen.Helps if someone goes through all the little bits that go on as to read it is really indecipherable.

Great views at top, but show is underwhelming. The clock is great for two things - it's a architecture from the ground, and it's views from the top, both of which I recommend highly. However, I have no idea what all these reviewers were seeing when they talk about the show on the hour - it was so underwhelming to say the least! I wouldn't wait around for it. If you happen to be there on the hour why not, but otherwise I won't bother. It was literally just some puppets on a wheel peeking out some shutters. Nothing much at all!
you have to see the clock. This is one of the most interesting clock i have ever seen. Every hour you can see the 'show' on the clock. You cant miss it. :)

A must see to admire architecture and genius. It's well worth nudging elbows with the inevitable crowds to watch the fascinating Astronomical clock come to life on the hour. Also to admire the charming collection of buildings that link together to form the Old Town Hall; unexpectedly domestic in scale when compared to the normal type.

nice place. the place is nice, specially at night. There are some restaurants were you can spend some nice time. Each hour the clock makes a short show. Just be careful of thieves while the clock are playing this small show....!

Go up the tower for great views.. Whilst the clock is charming, a trip up the tower is a must. There are both stairs and a lift to the top. The views of the square and of the surrounding areas are well worth the effort.

The only way is up. The clock tower is situated on the OldTown Square. You have to go up the tower, most amazing panoramic view of the city. This is also the best way to see most of the "Church of Our Lady before Tyn".
Crowded but worth it. Try to arrive 5-10 minutes before the show because the place gets super crowded. The show is very nice and lasts for around 5 minutes.

Lovely Evening Ambiance. Great place to sit in the evening at bars with throws and heaters to keep warm while watching the world go by. Plenty going on with a lot of nice bars and restaurants. Also good for a morning coffee while you watch the crowds assembled to see the astronomical clock which is very famous but a bit of a let down.

Very busy round the clock. Quite interesting to watch, but it gets very busy just when the clock is about to strike. Although if you are lucky you could sit in one of the restaurants close by and watch.

Unique. We loved everything about Prague and the places we visited and would love to visit again any time, you will not be disappointed with anything as it is an absolutely beautiful City and worth seeing!

Town square. Try a horse drawn cart or a nice cup of hot cherry wine in the old town square. There are plenty of free lance food stalls and also more expensive restaurants if thats your thing. The square is lined with shops and there is also sorts of artists performing for your entertainment.
Over-rated!. Yes it is beautiful but don't be too upset if you miss it chime, not much to write home about. Catch if passing but don't waste time waiting.
Worth just for the pictures. Well the only reason we visited it, was just to take pictures. The scenery from the top is amazing. You can see whole prague from upo there.
Beautiful and Meaningful. A beautiful clock that goes off on the hour. It is delightful and inventive. Too bad they cut off the clockmakers hands so he couldn't make another......
Beautiful !. What an amazing piece of architecture. Every hour on the hour when the clock strikes the skeleton comes to life and other things happen.
Great Atmosphere. Sat in a bar opposite the astronomical clock watching the world go by was great. The atmosphere could not have been better, carnival acts passing by and the clock itself, great

Great View Of Old Town Square. We decided to head up the tower & paid CZK 210 for 2 adults & 1 teenager (under 15). I thought it was going to be CZK 250 and thought it was a bargain. However, that would've paid for the whole tour including underground part. Make sure you buy the full ticket outright as if you want to upgrade to the underground part later it's another CZK 60 per person!The view from the top is excellent. It's quite narrow up there though and if busy would be somewhat of a squeeze and possibly claustrophobic. It wasn't that busy when we went up but I still started to get annoyed with people knocking against me.I've rated as very good just on the view side of things as opposed to price & space. The view itself is excellent.

Interesting. Interesting but a little disappointing. This was one of the sights I really wanted to see in Prague. I was disappointed because I thought the figures were bigger. So it wasn't easy to see to appreciate.

One of a kind. The Town Hall displaying the Astronomical Clock is an interesting site. Especially because you will then find yourself in Old Town Square, with shops and churches and food vendors and restaurants. Lots of action, a very busy place, where street performers abound, and you can indulge in an old fashioned carriage ride to complete the feel of stepping back in time.
Great to see. Great to see, but big crowds gather every hour on the hour. Cafe's opposite might offer a good view, but could be pricey. Lots of entertainment around - street vendors etc.

busy area in Praha. We spent a few hours in Praag (we stayed in Liberec). We visited a few big tourist attractions (like the Karls bridge), but also old town hall and astronomical clock. The clock outside was impressive, but not much to see, except on the whole hour. So we went into the tower. With the beautifull winter sun, it was a great climb upstairs, with a good view over the city. It looked so nice. We spend 30 minutes up and looked to everything. Up to tower you will find all sorts of signs with information about tourits attractions in the city. Which you can also spot from the tower. The climb itself is very easy. You can take the elevator or the easy walk path (no stairs!). The price was around 4 euros.

Nice clock. Probably the most popular tourist attraction in Prague. Lovely Square .,lovely interesting clock but hourly ringing is a little overated. Think most tourists , like myself , expected a longer show but that doesnt take away from the beauty of this ancient clock.

Worth a visit. The clock is attractive and historic but not as impressive as we expected. The hourly display was a bit underwhelming however it attracts a massive crowd with cameras poised. The highlight however was a visit inside the clock tower and to the top of the Old Town Hall. The ascent is quite easy, with ramps rather than stairs other than to spiral stair case (with traffic light system) at the very top. There is a lift for the faint hearted however. The views from the top of the tower are spectacular and it was interesting to see Prague laid out before us as well as amusing to look down on the assembled crowd as the hour approached. Well worth the money and the climb. Recommended.

The clock is more interesting than the show on the hour. The hourly show is not that impressive, but a more detailed understanding of what the various sections of the clock show gives a better appreciation of the quality that went into the concept. Read an explanation before you go, or use a good guide that will give the full explanation.

Lovely clock. Great experience. All tourists seem to gather by the astronomical clock. On the hour the clock chimes and the windows on the front open and apostles faces appear in the windows! It is a magical experience to see the different reactions of tourists who either cheer, laugh or look disappointed. By todays high tech expectations I think some people expect something more amazing. We have to realise how old these buildings are. Back in the 15th century this would have been amazing. However even today many people gather for the experience and this is what makes it a great experience. We were also lucky enough to see two wedding limousines pull up outside for pictures.
Great. Wow. We keep coming back. It is beauty at day and night. We went up to see Prague from above. A lot great pictures (memories). One day we will come back
Clock. It's a staple in Prague - you have to see the Astronomical Clock. You should have someone explain it to you, however, because there is such a great back-story.

Nothing like it anywhere.. Ok, so its a tourist magnet, but so what? There;s no other clock like this in the World. Bill Murray took a 5 hour train ride from Berlin just to see this clock strike 1 oclock in the morning! Read a guide so that you understand what all the different circles and symbology mean. Then climb the Clock Tower (or get the lift) (85 Czech crowns in Feb 2014 = £2.80 roughly) for an amazing view of the city.

Overrated. Due to business travel I've been in Prague 20+ times over the last couple of years, but never got around to watch the Astronomical clock. On a recent trip I waited around to see the figures, and was very disappointed. Maybe it was just because my expectations was out of wack, but honestly don't get what all the fuss is about.
Astronomical Clock. Grab a spot and watch the bells and the clock work its magic. A must do in Prague. May be difficult to get a decent picture with so many tourist around but well worth it.

Favourite in Europe. Prague and it's old town square was definitely one of our favourite cities during our travel around Europe! It is very busy, we were there around the Christmas period when there were christmas markets in the old town. Buzzing vibe, lots of restaurants and amazing picture opportunities! Cannot wait to return

travel back in time. I am always taken in when I return to Praha. I can go to this old historic square with its medieval buildings, the hub of the tourist wheel, and still find things that I have not seen previously. In addition to all the churches, historical buildings, the clock etc. it is the people that are captivating. Sit at a table in one of the outdoor cafes that line the square, have a beer or wine, and in the course of an hour you will see people from every locale and walk of life and their actions will either fascinate you or make you cry. From this square you can spend a day roaming down all the pedestrian only side streets of old town. The clock seems to still be the focal point but if you really want aview of it you need to get in line in front of it no less then 15 minutes ahead of time. .

Tourist attraction. When you say Prague, you think about Astronomical Clock. This is one of the oldest and biggest astronomical clocks of the world and the only one which works. Every hour it provides charade for tourists. Good to see but too much for my taste.

Fascinating !!. fascinating clock with amazing story behind, climb upstairs and take few minutes to speak to the lady that sells brochures (near the coin machine)- she has very nice story to tell about the man who made the clock (true or not - its still a nice story)
great. what a lovely experience to learn about this clock and to stand and watch the skeleton and figures play music and move with the cockerel at the end must visit

OK. We walked past the clock just in time to watch it chime. It was ok a few things happened but i wouldnt work my day around going to see it, its nice to have a look and it is in a lovely part of the city.
Great workmanship. Astronomical clock is a piece of workmanship and engineering. It was made 500 years ago showing length of day & night, day, date , month year etc.
Pretty, but it is just a clock.. Worth walking by but really it is just a clock. The architecture is really beautiful but the Jazz bands busking in the square are much more interesting
Verry nice. If you're in Prague it's a must see. Wait until the clock changes the hour. Also climb in the towers there
brilliant architecture. the architecture of the clock is stunning. everyday at 1pm the crowds gather to watch it chime and "come" to life

20 seconds of the show. Found ourselves in the cafe opposite on 2 occasions. Lots of crowds on the hour huddle together to watch 12 apostles appear at the little window and the skeleton ring the bell.Sounds silly but actually you just got to see it or you a'int seen Prague.

Interesting historical clock. A must see attraction in Prague, despite the crowds it is really interesting to watch the clock display at the top of the hour. A walk to the top of the clock tower gives a great view over the city

Different but not great. The clock is one of the "must do" attractions of Prague and we passed it numerous times when entering and leaving the Old Town Square and eventually arrived just before the hour and saw the famous figures came to life, but I have to say it was slightly disappointing.We did not climb the steps of the tower as our legs were recovering from the similar ascent of the South Tower of St Vitus Cathedral and the Petrin Tower.

Must see in Prague. We where taken to see the Astronomical clock at 6pm was very crowded but was worth the wait in the cold & dark later on our visit we went at 12 midday and had a better view I think the first time it does need explaining to know what will happen another great Prague attraction

fairytale!. the Astronomical Clock is absolutely amazing and the view from the top breathtaking! every hour the 12 Disciples appear on the clock. you can admire the whole sight sitting in a cafe, enjoying hot red wine!

Prague New Year. Whilst the Town Hall is one of the many beautiful buildings in Prague the Astronomical Clock is one of the most disappointing attractions I have ever been told I have to see! Only matched by the tiny mermaid of Copenhagen!

Climb the tower for great views. Avoid the crowd and don't wait until after the clock has chimed the hour - seems many then head for the tower. We went at 3:40 and went straight up, when we came back down at 5:15 the queue was huge. (Tickets are from a seperate part directly uner the tower and you then walk the short distance to another entrance to go in the tower)Many seem to wait for the various lifts - no need though. First part can be reached by large gently rising stairs (up 3 floors I think) and then once ticket validated there is a ramp that goes around the lift shaft although at the end there is a tight spiral staircase to negotiate). Time visit before sunset to enjoy daylight and early evening views.
A MUST SEE. Fantastic- especially - On the hour It is trully unique. Get there early, as everyone is poised with cameras to get best pictures when the figures go round
Wow. It was beautiful make sure you catch it on the hour we sat in a cafe opposite under the heat lamps drinking yummy hot chocolate

literally nothing special!. Ok so firstly Prague is beautiful, stunning architecture, steeped in history, beauty at every turn! The Astronomical Clock however is nothing special at all, you wait around in a packed area to watch a few figures emerge from the clock, nothing more. Watch it sure, them move on and discover the beauty of Prague.

Head for heights. The astronomical clock was voted the third most disappointing tourist attraction a little while ago! But the tower is well worth going up to get some quite spectacular views of the city. There is a lift and or lots of stairs. I expect that it will be very busy in the summer.

Amazing. At first sight it is a beatiful design - very ornate. On the hour crowds gather to watch it come to life - not that gripping. But the technology behind it is awesome. Make sure you research before you visit to understand the features, to fully appreciate it.

Go up the tower. For just about £3.00 you can climb up the steps of the tower or you can take the lift making it one of the rare places that wheelchairs can get to.
The views are breathtaking from up there, even on a slightly snowy day like ours.

Lovely visit!. Lots of interesting facts, great architecture, great guide, lovely views and photos from the top.
Oh, and bonus points for getting married there :)
Brilliant!!!. If I could give a score it would deffinatelly be +10!! well you will see it yourself !!! Also if you can go up the tower to have a view of old town from above

An excellent time. Well worth visiting, particularly in late morning or at noon. The clock is situated just off the corner of the Old Town Square and can be found easily from the large groups of people congregating opposie just before the hour strikes. The performance ends when the cock crows! There are numerous restaurants and coffee bars nearby and the Powder Tower and the Municipal House are on the other side of the square and well worth the ten minute stroll needed to visit them.
This is fun to watch. It was a bit of fun when we arrived here to see people watching this magnificent clock and what happens when it chimes the hour

Impressive!. If you are in Prague, this is must see! Be there several minutes before the hour to view the clock and all of its "treasures." Food and beverage establishments are close by, so enjoy some local cuisine and drink while waiting.

stuck in the middle!. What an experience this was. I saw a large crowed gathered and went off to see what it was they were so enamoured with! The Astronomical clock was about to do it's stuff. Amazing to think how old it is and all the working parts move perfectly. I was stuck right in the middle now of the crowed and could not move, then it finished and all the people vanished...great experience.
amazing. very nice square, the astronomical clock is a true artwork and it really works! you must to see it and take a picture when it start ring

Go up the tower for great views. The clock is charming and well worth hanging about until it chimes the hour. Buy a cheap ticket and walk up the viewing tower. There is a lift for part of the way but you walk the final part and it is an inexpensive way to get the lie of the land.
Beautiful. Although the clock is fab from the outside you must go inside it's roughly £3pp the lift is a work of art in itself, and the views from the top of the tower are great..
Truly Prague. This is the landmark of Prague.Located at the famous Old Twon Square, one would not miss it.One could pay a fee and enter the viewing tower.Breathtaking view.
Beauty. Interesting history and a great gathering place. Can sit around and people watch all day! I have never climbed the tower, but you can if you want.

The Clock experience. Our tour guide arranged the visit to the clock with utmost precision
You need to position yourself dead centre facing the clock at about 5 minutes before the hour to get the best view of the experience

Ancient atmosphere but beware of pickpockets. Well every small kid in Prague know the legend about Astronomical clocks - it was one of my favourites and I am going through the Staromestske namesti to see the clock pretty often. Despite the fact it is very tourist attraction, still it is popular within locals as well. Only please beware of pickpockets - it is one of the main critical areas - all the people watching the clocks on the tower and do not pay attention about their belongings.

Nice visit. We started out just climbing up to see the square from the clock tower. This was enjoyable. Then we went downstairs and got a ticket to take the underground tour of the Old Town Hall. This was at a discount with the clock tower tickets. The tour was given by a very capable guide that made what could have been a typical tour quite interesting.

A must see in Prague. The two attractions are really separate attractions and can be paid for separately, and one or both can be visited as wished.We visited the clock tower first, 70 metres high, with a very safe 360 degree view of the city.You ascend, not by steps, but by a circular ramp, and there is also a lift. The action happens on the hour, every hour, and needs to be viewed from the pavement. It becomes quite crowded.The 11 apostles and St. Paul appear, together with some animation of figures on the exterior of the tower. The clock itself is quite beautiful, especially when illuminated by the sun.The Town Hall tour was fantastic, and the guide was extremely knowledgeable.The Town Hall has a very long and fascinating history, and the tour was very informative, with lots of great, interesting details.An absolute must see in Prague.
On the Hour. Make sure to be there 5 to the hour to see the "show", it is definitely worth the time and effort, with numerous restaurants and snack bars close by

Timing Is Everything. Time your visit just before the sun sets. Climb the tower and watch the sky turn blue and all the lights come on around the square to get the best photo's, especially of Tyn church.
