seen better. Very lovely and ornate and attracts a large amount of tourists, but did leave after the fanfare thinking " was that it"! Maybe the freezing cold weather and sleet didn't help.
Its ok. Its a nice clock to look at. Don't go out of your way for it. But, it's definitely more interesting if you take a walking tour and hear more about the history behind it.

A must see!. I would say one of the main attractions of the city but of course almost always filled with people so better be prepared! And maybe also try to visit with one of the free walking tours to fully understand the functioning and elements involved

Amazing clock. Astronomical clock in prague. waitned for the colck to chime on the tower. it was awesome filming it. Make sure you get the skeleton ringing the bell half way up the tower while it chiming. that is the best. :)

TickTock here I come The clock. Amazing . Must do when in Prague. Very lively Christmas market around and beautiful and big Christmas tree.every hour there is a minute show at the clock as the little window opens an turns the statues.it also gives sun and moon timings. Very interesting. There is of course a little fee about 90 CZK to go on top of the tower and have a good view over old town. There is a lift or you could walk up. Nice pictures from the top. Lot of good cafés and restaurants around.

Stunning Views. You MUST go up the clock tower!You shouldn't visit Prague without doing so.The view from the top, across the city is not to be missed.The clock face is an amazing piece of engineering.
Great view. Amazing view from the top of the tower, but also a great entry to the old town square. The clock have a special "performance" every hour with little statuaries.

Squaresville. Exactly what is says on the tin. The clock is a clock, the square is mostly square. Regardless, you have to visit. The buildings are incredible (compared to Nottingham town hall), everything about this area summarises Prague, right down to the surplus of tourists.
Amazing design. This clock was minutes away from the Ventana Hotel. An amazing design. We waiting for the clock to strike on the hour, but not a lot happened, its still fascinating to watch though.

Amazing views from the clock tower. Beautiful building, good climb up to the top but lift available for the less energetic and what a view all over the city - amazing at night, puts the city into perspective when seen from that height.

A must see - Old Town Hall. As you will see, obviously a key sight is the hourly viewing of the Astronomical Clock. I definitely would recommend going up the Tower to the observation deck for a fabulous view of Prague - a must.
Awesome!!. All I can say is this was the end and the highlight of our tour!! Simply beautiful and amazing!! Loved the history behind it and the design. Magnificent even if very busy and crowded.

Nice views of Old Town. The clock itself is a very interesting thing. When you go up in the tower, you then have great views of Old Town Square, as well as the Prague Castle. It was pricier than expected, but worth the nice shots.
surprisingly beautiful. This clock is very unique! and I think is very hard to manage and make! I think the maker deserve a hearth!
Beautiful clock!. Beautiful astronomical clock with the movement of figures of the disciples at the hour mark! MUST see Old Town Square!

Just lovely. The town square sums up this city in many ways, but principally just because it is so pretty. The architecture is just stunning, as it is throughout this city. The astronomical clock is good fun, get there a little before the hour so you can get a good spot in the crowd. It's worth trying to be part of a group or tour, as like many things, the more you know about it the more you will enjoy it.

Great views from tower and interesting underground tour. This area is usually very crowded but views from the top of the tower are spectacular and the famous clock worth seeing. We comically kept missing the clock show by a few minutes but finally timed it right. The skeleton representing death nods his head and two other figures shake theirs.Very quickly over so you must stake out a spot relatively close to the clock to see properly. We had a city tour with a guide who offered to take us on a tour of the underground below Town Hall. We were not sure but were very glad that we did. The floor of the underground space was actually once the street in medieval times. Then the buildings were raised due to flooding.

Iconic Clock & Tower. Any visit to Prague should include a visit to the Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. If you happen to pass by a the top of the hour (e.g. 12:00 or 4:00), there is a little show put on by the figures around the clock. It's not amazing but it is enjoyable. The crowds can get overwhelming around that time though.I would recommend getting out your travel book/guide while waiting for the clock to strike the top of the hour and read about the history of the tower and the meaning behind each detail. It's very interesting.If you wish to go to the top of the tower, you can purchase tickets at the base of the tower. When you initially go in, there are stairs (or an elevator) which take you to the first floor and there you exit to the left and climb more stairs and then a swirling ramp (or wait for the elevator) to the top. The views are spectacular and if you want to go outside be careful because it is very crowded and tight! Regardless, force your away around that entire balcony area because it is worth it! When I went to the top, there was even the option to dress up in medieval garb (for extra cost of course) and there was a man dressed in medieval outfit who was playing a trumpet - announcing the top of the hour when the astronomical clock's show was completed. If you have a young child who is collecting the badges around the city, one of the machines with the badge is at the top of the tower here.One last thing - when you first walk into the lobby and pass the bathrooms (which cost money), instead of going left up the stairs, go to the right. There is a GORGEOUS room that has a million little colored tiles that paints the most beautiful mosaic.
The famous Clock. A must in Prague. We visited several times during on stay and each time saw something new. Worth reading the history of the clock. It's a great creation.
impressive!. Make sure to take elevator to the very top. It's the only tower in Prague that has elevator. Night view is breathtaking!
I'm a fan. Every time I come to Prague I make sure that I stop and take my time with the sights, the clock might seem cheesy to some travelers but they are the only ones like these.

Nice view if you can brave the crowds. It's an easy climb up the tower (or you can take the elevator) and there's a really lovely view of the city from the top. The only issue is that the observation terrace outside at the top is very narrow. There are arrows telling people to go in one direction, but no one pays attention and the the flow of people is often at a standstill. You need to push a little to make it all the way around, but it's worth it if you can deal with that.
Astronomical clock - on the hour!. You must see this wonderful fairytale monument. You must also join a tour to get the full explanation of how this clock operates - such a wonderful story.

Must visit specially during Christmas market. We visited this place - the astronomical clock and the christmas market together. Great place. Lots of people around and plenty of articles to buy!! The clock tower was good and we made it to see the events at the strike of the hour, though not great as the one in Munich but is unique. At that particular time, the place get crowded to watch the clock and later it disperses.
must see. you must see the clock on the hour every hour but it gets very busy round there .... but we did go when the Christmas markets where on so a lot of people there
not to be missed. Need to be there on the hour, along with a thousand others so be prepared. A must do when in Prague, fun to watch and a great place to people watch at one of the many cafes

Christmas Markets with beautiful views. The astronomical is definitely a must see especially while the Christmas markets were going on. The whole plaza is beautifully illuminated at night, don't miss it.

Amazing how well this clock still functions. The clock itself is pretty interesting inasmuch as what it does - keep track of time. The way the saints come to the door to greet the viewer is something else, although that's not necessarily a good thing, in that the waiting time spent to get to watch the saints and the chiming of the bells is somewhat an anticlimax. My first thought was "I waited all this time to see THAT?!" And, truly, for each and every chiming of the clock, a large group of tourists has congregated, upwards of 200 people at one time. I sure hope their experience was different than mine, which was that the clock serves as a tourist trap lure for the surrounding merchants selling their crappy trinkets.

Really worth the visit.. We aometimes stay right on the old town square and never tire of watching the clock. Even in the cold cold weather there is always a crowd outside waiting on the clock to hit the hour.

Worth the trip up the tower. Sunset is a great time to catch the view from the tower! It can get really crowded and difficult to move around so be patient or try to go just as the clock is striking on the hour - you may find almost everyone else is down the bottom to watch the clock.

Must visit early. Walk to the top of the clock tower or take the lift. The view over Prague is brilliant and you have a 360 degree view to get your bearings. A great place to start any tour of Prague City.

So much history!. This is by far the very best Prague has to offer. The history of the Astronomical Clock, although the carillon is very simple, takes you back a few centuries. Take the elevator to the top of the tower for an incredible view of Old Town Square. We were there before Christmas, so there was a Christmas Market set up in the square and the Little Square each night. Dreamy!!
Best place to meet New Year in Praha. Well, we have been there during Silvester night, so if I would droop, they could find it few hours later only - such a crowd, but it's worth it.

A must see in Prague, much better if explained. This is one of the must see attractions in Prague, whether it’s overrated or not, that’s another thing.I found the massive gathering around the clock a phenomena by itself, so much people expecting to see the moving pieces of the clock every hour.I saw the "show" a couple of times, but it was not after our walking tour guide explained us how to read the clock, how it works and the history and stories behind it that I really came to appreciate it.Beware that the moving pieces work from 9am to 9 pm.

Excellent views!. It was a beautiful clear night on Friday the 20th so we climbed to the top for some magnificent photos of the city below us. The Christmas market was right at the base and was magical. It was perfect way to start our vacation!
Got to See. I was fascinated with the buildings and the Astronomical Clock is just fantastic to see, you can't go to Prague and not visit this area.

It's a clock!. This is meant to be the thing to see in Prague, personally not that great. If you get on a walking tour the story behind the clock is much more interesting.But hey, you have to stick around for the show just so you can see what it is like
Stunning. The own town hall is indicative of the beautiful architecture of Prague. One needs to watch the whole ceremony of the Astronomical clock chime to really appreciate it.

Cool, but. I don't see the fascination. Just a clock with intrigue detail. I did not go up to the tower, but it probably would have had a great view. I did hop on the tall wood made bridge decorated for the holidays and that game me the same view for free.

A Fun Tourist Must See. This is an attraction you must see. When the clock strikes the hour, a short musical production takes place. You have various animated figures making appearances and if you are lucky, the rooster will crow at the end. The square gets very crowded, so stake out your location about 15 minutes before the hour. Once the clock show has finished, take the time to tour the Square. You will see amazing architecture that shows the development of Prague through the years and many wars it has endured.

Beautiful old town. We visited during the christmas markets and the old town was buzzing -there were lots of stalls with lovely smells of local specialities cooking. The clock is definitely worth a look -on the hour it chimes and the figures move around.
Great Place. We went here to take a look at the clock. But the quality of the shops around here were very good value for money and their was so much to see and do here.

A fancy clock, but that's about it.. To be frank ... it's just a clock. Yes, the clock is really splendid, and it isn't hard to see why the designer had his eyes gouged out, but it isn't particularly exciting to stare at a clock for an hour. You can, however, spend that one hour exploring the tower, which will probably make for a more meaningful one hour. I didn't do that, and spent the rest of my time exploring the Town Hall - there wasn't much, although there was a Christmas market with interesting stuff on sale (I visited this place on St. Nicholas Day). There is a performance every hour, if I am not mistaken, and in my opinion, the performance was mediocre. So don't come here just for the performance; you just may be sorely disappointed. Also, beware of pickpockets - there are plenty of them here.

WONDERFUL XMAS BREAK. well i nearly got to the top but couldn't face it. The others in the party went and said it was totally breath taking. The views went far and wide and the atmosphere was exciting.

Great Clock. The Astronomical Clock is well worth visiting, yes it will be crowded with other tourists but it really is quite spectacular. Indeed the square is also worth looking at. It is a pleasant way to spend an hour or so
looks good but its just a clock. i noticed an awful lot of people staring at this clock and to be fair i expected far more than what i saw. great photo opportunity but thats about it.

Need to go!!. What a lovely square !! Mind it's always packed to watch out for pickpockets!! There are so many things to see around there....churches and squares... that lead to little cobble streets and to the river.....there are so many places to visit... go at least for 3 days!!

Visit the tower. You certainly have to visit the tower, so you have a wonderful overview over Prague. And do not forget that when the clock strikes the hour, figurines pop out the Astronomical Clock. During the evening there are lights on the clock, so it has a more romantic feeling when it is dark.
You need to go to the tower. It is a beautiful clock but the best thing is to go inside and take a look at the view you have from the top...

Wonderful clock. It is really an amazing thing what this clock can do, but not in terms of "beauty of the show" at every round hour. But anyway, everyone should watch it. The square was crowded every time we went there, not sure if there is a good time to go. Beware of pick pockets.

Beautiful Clock. Its easy to see why this clock is usually the focal point for tour guides and tourists alike, Its setting in the square is lovely and is a nice way to just sit opposite and have a coffee and people watch.

The Astronomical clock. still a wonder to behold, and watch the clock come to life as it strikes the hour, saw it 2 years ago when they had a laser show on the clock tower, that made it even more special to watch…

Great place to soak in culture. The Old Town Square is a beautiful centre with age old spires, independent musicians playing their instruments, food stalls and souvenir shops. It is a beautiful place to just walk around and a great place to sit down and have a beer in the evening. The Astronomical Clock though is overrated. While, the sheer fact that it is so old makes it worth a watch - the overall experience of watching the twelve apostles and the mechanical cuckoo is a little underwhelming. Of course do catch it if you are there in time, but there is much more to soak in at the Old Town Square than just this clock

Nice view of the center of Prague from the above!. This is must see in Prague. The clock itself is beautiful and worth seeing but for me, the view you get from top of the clock tower is unforgettable.I also definitely recommend taking a long walk in the old town of Prague around the tower as it is very beautiful and you get taste some delicious cuisine as well.
Beautiful at night. Looks stunning during the day but at night it is beautiful especially with the Xmas tree and lights from the market. Fantastic view from rooftop bar in main square.
Really nice place. Its on old town square and you cant miss it.... during the christmass its really nice around here!!! and come in nigt!!!! lights everywere.

This is one amazing clock!. What can you possibly say when you are standing in front of the oldest working astronomical clock on the face of the earth? When it was created, hundreds of years ago, there were people riding by it on horses wearing armor! Awesome... It is so beautiful that after the creator finished it, the city government blinded him so he could never again create anything as beautiful. But, he sabotaged it and rendered it useless for a period of ? 100 years or so... depending on which story you hear.

Do the tour of the halls and cellar!. You should definitely go to the top of the Old Town Hall tower for a great view of the Old Town Square. I also decided to do a one hour town of the halls and cellar. They had an English at 11am. There were only 5 of us on the tour and the guide was excellent. I learned a lot about Prague from this tour.

not much to say. Rude, very rude info desk. Great view. Not much to see. Maybe because i got so angry with the woman at the info. Careful to ask for directions, they might beat you up since when you ask for help hthey get very angry with you.
good family ticket and great view of the town. Very good family ticket I thought for the price we the hole family of five to get up there , and it was a great view up there aswell

Amazing clock. Beautiful Clock, The area is very nice, lots to see. I have enjoyed going here three different times. Tour guides are availible or just walk the city on your own. Can't remember how often the clock sounds but when it does it puts on a little show.

If you do one thing in Prague this is a must. We have been to Prague several times and for reasons unknown did not do the Tower. This time we did and wondered why we have never done it before. The view from the top is excellent and the structured walkway to the top different, do not take the lift but take the time to walk up
Don't skip -- worth the wait.. Spectacular views. And the line moves quickly. Don't let that deter you. Make sure your camera is charged.
A Lovely feature. A good experience but you must watch the time and make sure you do not miss the action. Worth waiting for lots of people will keep you company.
Make sure you visit this. There are two sessions per day - so don't miss out. Be there at 9am or 4pm. Take a video as there is a lot going on. Beware the crowds and secure your belongings.

You have to be on time...... If you want to see the "show" on the hour, do not be late!!!......the bells ring and the appostles show up for about 30 seconds and go round and round. Best place to see is directly in front.

Must visit. It is an interesting building.In every hour , everybody gathers in front of the clock to see clock ringing show, but thats not the best part for sure...Yu have to climb top of the building to see the spectacular view...

Busy and beautiful. We went during christmas. It was very crowded but the whole atmosphere was filled with laughters, christmas markets, delicious food, people singing carols, giant decorated trees and much more. Initially you might find it annoying but you'll know you had the best christmas.

The clock. The clock is definitely worth a quick visit. Lovely to watch it when the clock strikes the hour. Was even nicer during the Christmas period as there were trumpet players in the old town hall and a very excited atmosphere!
Totally the best view. The clock ringing is interesting, but not the greatest show. The best part is to go on the Town Hall tour and go up the tower for the view.

Astronomical Clock. Everyone gathers in front of clock and waits for it to hit the hour. Its large and imposing and you cant miss it. There are many tourists having their photos taken beside it and lots of Tourist Guides with colourful umbrellas waiting to start their tours there
Clock this - Prague. This clock is something else, fortunately for us we had a guide to explain it a it very complicated, but stunningly beautiful. A must see!

Go to the top. The concept of the clock is incredible when you think how old it is. What happens on the hour is underwhelming but you have to see it once. The best thing to do is buy a ticket to go to the top of the tower (around £3). The views of the old town square (and in December, the Christmas tree and market stalls) are fantastic. Gets a bit crowded but be patient and you will get some great photos. Take the lift up and walk down. A must-do.
Crowded. Pretty clock, but with so many tourists around, it gets a little too crowded. A little overrated as well.

Nice structure. The crowds that gather to watch the clock strike get huge and actually it's very disappointing. The figures do not actually come right out but just move round. However you can go up the tower, I didn't do this but friends did and said the views were great. A bit over rated as an attraction I feel but worth seeing when you visit the Old Town area.

So cool to see. This clock was really neat to see. Its right as you enter the old town square so there are tons of people around and all the tour groups stop in front of the clock. But its really cool to see because its so pretty and different from all the other "normal" town clocks. The square was especially crowded on the hour when the clock struck.
amazing. the buildings are breathtaking, the filling is like to be Cinderella in a fairytale... a beautiful observation on the city
Interesting and whimsical. It's crowded so be careful of pick pocketers. Before you see it, make sure you understand the meaning of all the statues when they come out.

A magical experience at christmas time. Bbm there in the evening about 5 o'clock on a winter's evening around christmas time . The place was heaving with people. The whole town looks like a christmas market. Truly magical experience. Christmas experience to remember.

astounding astronomical clock. well worth a visit; beautiful clock, very ornate and well loved tourist attractions so area will be crowded when the clock strikes on the hour and visitors will want to see the figures emerge and take photographs; tower offers great views across the square.

History weds Science. This clock is a perfect blend of History and Science with an amazing element being that it is from communist era and rule. This one attracts huge crowd at time of bell being rung. A good tourist place with lot of other things to see in that area.

Picturesque .. You can spend lots of time just wandering around this area, and there is lots to see. Go up the tower for wonderful views, not for the unfit, but well worth it. Make sure your camera is fired up. The clock is awesome and one you won't see any where else restaurant and cafés near by.
Amazing. This is a facinating piece of history and I was not dissapointed as it was one of the main sights I wanted to see. It is well preserved and a great attraction.

The Clock. You just have to go and see this even if you have to stand around for 20 minutes. On the hour every hour there are crowds of people who stand and wait to see the movement of the 12 apostles. Well worth waiting for, try not to stand too close otherwise you miss seeing it all, the further back you are the better
Best view of Prague. U can see the whole town from up there, and the clock itself is a master piece of work. A must see, worth the ticket price to go up

ONE OF THE MAIN ATTRACTIONS IN PRAGUE. We were lucky enough to be here during the winter markets which made it even better. The clock is part of the history to this magical city and well worth a visit.

Beautiful!. Go on top of the clock in the night! It was so beautiful looking over the xmas markets.. and people unless you find it difficult to walk .. WALK dont take the lift.. walking up it was part of the experience! Scary though!
Be there on the hour.. To see the whole working of the open doors and Christ and the apostles going round, you need to be there a few minutes before the hour to get a view.

Historic building and quirky clock. This building is sited in a corner of Old Town Square and is the tourist spot. It's a lovely old building ,which for the fit,you can climb via stairs to the top for an excellent view of Prague.It is the site of the original Town Hall as the town developed around a horse market.The clock is a novelty,large , astronomical and with the apostles circulating on the hour visble through two windows above the clock.

Interesting clock, hilarious crowds. If you want to see something funny, hang back a bit from the clock tower a few minutes before the top of the hour. As the bell begins to ring, watch everyone running towards the clock. Just don't get in the way! The clock is very cool, but it's best to read up on it before you get there so you will understand the intricacies of what you are looking at.The tower is worth the visit, but if you can, take the stairs and not the elevator. You will get a better appreciation for what it took to build this. You'll also get a better idea of the heights! The views from the tower are very nice, but it is usually crowded so pack your patience as well.
two things. 1. the clock is probably one of the most overrated things to see2. you must to go up to the clock tower to see the view. it's amazing and worth the price (and even the cold)
Amazing,a must see. this was our 3rd visit to prague and every time we have come we visit the clock and are always as thrilled to watch it as the 1st time we saw it,a must see,on the hour,every hour

Impressive. The town hall with its astronomical clock is impressive. However, the hourly show takes only 1 minute, and one tends to miss much of the activity taking place in only 1 minute. There are others in Europe that are much longer and better.

Wow! Make sure you see the performance. The clock is a gorgeous piece of functional art that will make plenty of people think of steam punk from its design and movement. Of course the performances are well worth hanging out in the square for a bit, but even if you have to rush through and see the non-performing clock it's still very beautiful.
Interesting. It's nice to walk around the surrounding area. It's funny how people gather in front of this clock. So every hour, the clock will show the biblical characters.

Old town square. Had a meal in "U Prince" outdoor restaurant in the square. Food was acceptable, prices ok considering the fact that heaters were plentiful, staff were also ok. Followed with drinks on rooftop terrace of hotel which were rather expensive but the view was fantastic of the square and the main Christmas tree was probably the nicest we have seen in a very long time.

Have to see if you are in Prage. The most famous sight in Prague. While it is not a lot to look at, you can climb the tower for a few $$$, and get a great view of the square and city.In the winter, the square is alive with people, and vendors, and a lot of shopping. Try some Hot Wine!
On the hour. Crowds galore at the turn of the hour. A must see in Prague and if you are brave enough, climb to the top of the tower.

Wonderful Christmas tree outstanding clock. The old town square was delightful at night and the restaurant opposite the clock was very nice. We travelled by metro as taxis from the square back to the hotel were expensive.

Dont miss it.. Visit the square and see the clock and other sights. Come on the hour and watch the show, but get there early as there will be crowds. We went up the tower years ago and it was worth it at night. One of several things to see in this old town square.
Winter views. Go in the winter, climb the tower after it gets dark and see the entire square illuminated The smells of sausages and warm wine rise up from below

A must see. This clock is located right on the plaza. A lot of people gather here at the hour to watch the clock works. There is a entrance to a tower (pay) which gives you a nice view of the city and the square
Mediocre at best. If you are in Prague then you obviously need to see this as you can't see it anywhere else but don't get your hopes up for an incredible experience as it is pretty dull.

Be Sure to Go to the Top. Despite the crowds, the astronomical clock is really a thing of beauty. People start gathering about 10-15 minutes before the hour to watch and hear it ring. By the time it is ready to go you can hardly move in front of it. Off to the side they sell tickets that allow you to up to the top of the tower. There is a choice of stairs or an elevator. We went at night during the Christmas market and the lights were fantastic. It is crowded and you move slowly around the top BUT IT IS WOTH IT FOR THE VIEW!

Worth Stopping For. The clock is stunning; unmissable. And the buildings around are so beautiful, with angels in the architecture and frescos on the walls. Look up at the turrets and towers; lots of statues and unusual carvings on the upper storeys

Make something up!. Awesome! this is one of my favorite place in Old Town Square. It has historical value we should be proud of where you can see the figures of 12 apostles appear every hour between 9 a.m. and 9 p.m. As I walk through with my friends , the facade clock dates me back from the past centuries. It certainly amazed me. One of my momentous journey in my life!

Disappointing. We stood to watch this clock with the usual large crowd but how disappointed were we? We had seen the astronomical clock in Messina so expected this to do something similar but sadly it does not so it as a real let down

Very Interesting. This clock is a lot smaller than one might expect. Thank goodness we were on a walking tour and had the whole clock and how to read it explained to us. As far as we could tell there wasn't anyone other than the tour guides explaining the clock works to anyone. It's a beautiful piece of functional art. It's was very exciting to watch the hourly action start.
Crowded!!. One of those "must sees" in Prague but not really worth the wait and the crowds. Must be awesome for those looking down from the tower. Not so great for me but it is amazing history.

Interesting sights, great people watching. The Astronomical Clock is not as spectacular as the Glockenspeil in Munich but it is well worth a stop. It still functions daily. It is subtle so pay attention when it is time. The cafe across from the clock has the best mulled wine that we had during our trip and the heaters keep the chill away.
You can't miss the astronomical clock. It's amazing to see how the clock's mechanism still works. Our tour guide told us that the clock still has its original mechanism.
Popular Attraction. A very popular tourist spot and would suggest you get there at least 5 minutes before the o'clock chimes to get a good view.
Enjoyed the view!. The clock is a centerpiece that should be enjoyed. Pay to go up and enjoy the view - it is worth it.
Pick your time.. Excellent, especially if you time your visit to see the clock display on the hour. We also saw the 'switch on' of the Christmas tree lights, making the square stunning in the dark.

Wonderful Tour. We did the underground tour that lasts about 45 minutes. It was very informative and enjoyable. To be taken to the medieval levels of Prague and get an understanding of how the people lived, made the city more real and not just a tourist destination to me. Afterwards, we went to the top of the tower for an amazing view of Prague. You must do this!!Loved the clock as well! Always fun to happen upon the square, and know what time it was just by the crowds standing around the clock!

Unique to Prague. This is in an enormous square where I swear all Prague gathers at sunset. Besides being a historial square it has entertainment such a light shows, terrific food stalls making crepes as well as spit roasted pork, delightful cafes for drinking beer and people watching, and, of course, watching the Astronomical Clock "do its thing" on the hour. Don't miss it!

The clock keeps ticking (even after 600 years). You're going to walk past it anyway as you're walking through the Old Town Square. So, why not see it? Yes, there's a crowd of people standing around waiting for the 12 Apostles and the skeletal figure of Death to perform. The great thing about it is that you can see it from every angle. It's a huge clock. Just take a good camera and zoom in on it. You just can't go to Prague without seeing it. The astronomical details are very impressive. Even if you don't get to see it in action at the appropriate time. I couldn't help but be amused. It also nice to see everyone's face light up as the mechanical parts start to move. It's really cool.

Be Quick..... Worth a look, but not worth the crowds. If you happen to be there a few minutes ahead ahead of the hour, you might crowd around for a quick look. It's quirky and fun....but once is enough unless you love crowds. Many other things to see in Prague!

Old Town was Great- the Clock is a Joke. Ok, I use this site all of the time and when the clock was so highly rated, I made a point of seeing it. I understand that it is old and special in many ways. However, the actual "show" is downright pitiful. We only had one day to spend in all of Prague and wasted two hours getting to and waiting for the clock in the freezing elements. On the hour, the clock chimes and two windows open to reveal slow- moving figurines. Whoopie.Old Town was beautiful and the Jewish Cemetery is a must- see. The clock can be replaced by 100 other activities that would be far more fun/ entertaining/ enlightening. My friends and I joked the rest of our trip about "the greatest show on earth" (the clock). See what we did there?

Neat but no big deal. You'll want to see the astronomical clock while you are in Prague but the crowds are hugeand the performance lasts for about 30 seconds so be prepared for a quick look and its over....

old town hall and astromestska clock. eautical clock and interesting building. Unfortunetly it was cold and raining, With so many people gathered on one rather small square it was not much of a show stopper. No place to sit and get warm and dry. Do a quick walkthrough on an hour. Otherwise you might have to wait it out if your with a guide.

Gothic and Funky. It was all happening in the square about 15mins before every hour because of the astonomical clock doing its thing. It really is not impressive at all but then you must think that it would have been quite an advanced display many many years ago when it was first built. The clock itself is beautiful though and definatly worth seeing at night when the square is all lit up.

Astronomical clock Prague. During our 5 day stay in fantastic Prague, we obviously visited the Old Town Hall and its place, and of course admired the very large and impressive square.The astronomical clock is great and it is good that our guide could explain in great details how this clock functions and what it describes

Meh. I appreciate the clock is old but this is near the top of most to do guides for Prague and its really just a bit dull. I understood there was a show on the hour every hour and the crowd gathered for it was huge but it was such an anti climax.The clock itself is beautiful to look at and you can appreciate it for what it is so I think all the sides that are served up with it are unnecessary and possibly even add a tacky feel to something that is quite intriguing.

Gothic. Old Town here we come!Majestic, Spectacular, amazing and quaint.The clock rings every hour on the hour and it's better to arrive early to be in front of the people to really see and feel itOne of the landmarks of Prague and many things to do around here

Had to see because it's well known. Glad I didn't travel miles. Yes it's a nice clock but doesn't really do a great much on the hour. We got there 15 minutes or so before the hour and waited to see this magnificent sight. For me it was far from magnificent and very disappointing in my opinion

A must!. Quite simply a must if you are visiting Prague. You can stand looking at the astronomical clock for ages trying to fathom it out but you are best buying one of the brochures (100ck) to fully understand all the elements of it. If you have the energy then for 300ck you can climb up the tower to get brilliant views of the surrounding area. We did this on our first evening and helped us work out the location of places by eye rather than relying on a map

The Face of Prague. There are iconic places that with only one image can identify a city. Like the Statue of Liberty in NY or the Big Ben in London. Well, in Prague that is the Astronomical Clock. Located in the Old Town Square, the tourist center of Prague, gives a few seconds show every half an hour. Even being so quick in every (and I mean EVERY) performance a quite big crowd is eagerly looking up waiting for it. If you know the story about it (ask a guide) it's even better.

If you are there great...if not you won't miss much. All of the excitement about the clock, it's beautiful to look at however the "Show" isn't all that spectacular. If you happen to be there at the top of the hour great if not doen't waste your time standing and waiting the 30 seconds isn't that good.
Superb Clock. This is an amazing clock, I watched it for about 20 minutes before heading inside. Amazing exhibition as you go up the stairs and the view from the top is superb. Amazing experience
Hourly drama. Love it!. The skeleton is the coolest. We were incredibly intrigued by this amazing structure and its' detailed "story" that unfolds every hour. Would definitely go back to watch again.

Prauge day or night. You can go up the clock and walk around by lift ,entrance is just to the right hand side of the clock fab view of all the area. You can get to the clock by walking down Wenceslas Sq to the New Yorker fashion store & walk straight down the street into the clock sq The restaurant's will try and drag you inand they are very quick with slapping the bill on your table when they ask if you want another drink and you say no
Constand attraction. I keep on being amazed at the crowds that assemble in front of the clock rain or shine year round...it's somewhat like the Charles Bridge as a tourist attraction.

Prague at its Best. The Old Town square and Astronomical Clock were highlights on our tour of Prague. We visited it multiple times during our 5 day stay in Prague. The collection of buildings, the street entertainers and the restaurants were enjoyable and entertaining. This is a "great people watching" place with a wide variety of continual actions. On the square is an interesting restaurant with cellar in Prague, 13th Century. Zlate Konvice is a fun restaurant with tons of history. If you are in to high end shopping there is a street that flows into the Square with a number of major "high end" shops - Cartier, Mont Blanc, Dior, etc.
Fun to crowd watch. Spend some time (on the hour) watching the clock. . . then to really have a good time, stand under the clock and watch the crowd on the next hour. What a hoot!

Don't get your hopes up. Whilst this clock is beautiful to look at and might have caught your eye if you didn't know a thing about it; it's not something to get too excited about. The little 'performance' on the hour is a bit disappointing but worth sticking around to see since it happens so frequently - every hour on the hour.The clock dates back and adds to the historical buildings found in the city. So it's worth a visit if you plan to venture to Old town square when you're next in Prague.

Unexpected surprise. We happened to get there just as the clock was preparing to strike 12. We couldn't figure out what the crowd was for until we realized we were under the astronomical clock. It was an interesting history lesson.

Very interesting. We climbed to the top of the tower which holds this 600+ year old clock and took pictures of the city. Nice view all around. Big crowds gather in Old Town square to watch figures move in the clock on the hour.

History Lessons. Another great place of historical interest.Learnt a lot from this short visit from our well informed guide.Must point out that Euros are not widely accepted in Prague. They still use their own Czech Crown even though part of the E,U.so make sure you have a little with you if on a flying visit as we were,& please note they usually have to be pre-ordered from your travel agent.

Very nice to see. Make sure during your time in the old part of the city that you get your situated near the clock about 15 mins before the hour. We were in Prague in late October and it was crowded. The clock is very interesting to watch. Also, pay attention to the painted figures along the sides (4 sets of 2 figures). Some these figures also move.

Old Town Astronomical Clock. This is a must to see and a must to see it operate on the hour. Make sure you get a lecture on how the clock works and it's history as without this you will be completelybaffled by the many intricacies of the clock.

Have your camera ready!. Join the crowd and guard your wallet/purse. Fun to see the clock on the hour. Be careful though as there are pick pockets and do not exchange money with anyone on the street. Shops around the square have higher prices so venture off into the smaller side streets. Lots of great items to see and buy.

Worth a watch but don't get over excited. So, I suppose since it was made in the 15th Century, it was probably a lot more impressive back then! I dont think it justifies the crowds that gather every hour but if you're passing at the right time, look up and see the 12 disciples and a skeleton ringing a bell
Lovely. Definitely make this part of your trip to Prague. Do pay the 250Kč per person to climb to the top for an amazing view of Prague! Do watch watch the clock that chimes on the hour!

A must see old town and the clock!. The old town area in Prague is really nice! Restaurants, snacks, souvenirs, local toys, Bohemia glass and fashionable stuff are surrounded. Enjoy the area. Day time is nice and so as the night time. Every hour the astronomical clock plays the music, the figurines also move and follow by the trumpet by the staff on top of the clock tower. It last about 1-2 mins. If u miss it, just come again later as it plays every hour. You can check the high view of Prague from the clock tower. Entrance fee is CKZ 100. Around the area is the square where all the people dress up in different costume (angel, god, sharks, etc) come to the area to show their performance. If you like their job, just donate whatever amount you like.
Nice. If you like tourist come here to see all people from around the world. This is not my favorite in Prague

check list for Prague. if you want to find the biggest crowd in Prague - one of the right places))) it is definitely a sight on to-visit list but tiny old town street were much more impressive and atmospheric for me personally

A masterpiece with a view. A masterpiece clock! Take a few minutes to learn how the clock actually works and you can't help but be impressed that it was made 600 years ago! Expect crowds for the hourly show. If you want a better photo with the clock, go earlier in the morning before the crowds show up, otherwise, expect to have random people walking into or in front of all your pictures. For 100Kč per person you can take an elevator to the top of the tower for a great view of the city.

Medieval attraction at its best.. I had heard about the clock on the internet before coming to Prague and within an hour of arriving in the city I was caught up in the midday crowd looking up at this beautiful medieval creation waiting for the show to commence and it didn't disappoint, very quaint and the show reminded me of what a Shakespearean jesters performance may have been like.Definitely worth the few minutes wait to see what happens.

Beautiful to look at but........ This is really a hyped sight. You have to have someone explain what this clock is all about. Each hour hundreds of people wait for the hour to strike to see the clock do its thing. I was a little disappointed.

Lovely place.. I love the old town square and the astronomical clock in Prague, it has a great feel to it, is a lovely place to sit and eat a meal or have a coffee, and there is just so much to take in. You have to see the clock in the square, there is nothing else quite like it!

FLOCK AROUND THE CLOCK.. As my tile says folks do flock around the clock to hear the chimes and watch the animated figures.My viewing the clock on a webcam took away the wondering of what was going to happen,so when I did watch it I was not to impressed,but ha ho thats how things go.Dont get me the clock is a mechanical wonder in its own right,dont let this review put you off going to see it,if I had not watched it on a webcam I am sure my review would have been more favourable.

A hive of activity. Arrive at least a few minutes before the o'clock and get a good position as thousands of people flock to this spot to see the clock in action. They disperse just as quickly, so enjoy the activity and saviour a unique experience
Worth seeing through the crowds. This one of the most popular sights in Prague so be prepared for many people joining you to see this. The figures that come out are fastinating .

A magical place. This clock is a must see if you are going to Prague. We’ve almost missed it but luckily at the hotel the front desk told us we should visit it. First of all the architecture is breathtaking and the clock comes to live every our when then bells are ringing and you can see little figures inside the clock moving. Also the view from the top is just outstanding, I’ve made a lot of good photos and the view is beautiful. Even though you have to get through the crowd everything is worth it. As well the story and history of this clock turns this place in a magical one.
Amazing clock. It took me hours and hours to look at the clock and to admire the person who made it! Very beautiful. After being told about the story, I am even surprised!
Great for the children to watch. Grab one of the twisted hot spicy breads from a stall and wait for the clock to work on the hour! Great piece of puppetry!

Worth a stop if you are in the area. Can be quite crowded, but it is worth the time, especially on the hour when it strikes. The square is lovely, and often hosts mimes, musicians, and other street artists to keep you entertained.

Great views. The Old town hall tower is a great place to look over the city, stunning views, best seen at sunset (less crowds as well). The clock should be viewed at say 6.00 pm when everything happens. big crowds so pick you spot.

Disappointment. We waited an hour for the lights' show and 'the moving figures' in the 2 windows high up on one side of the Old Town Hall. The streets were overcrowded with people from all races and countries, young and old, waiting excitedly.. It was 7 o'clock. The windows opened, we saw some figures popping and the bell ringing, but no lights could be seen. It was over in a short while. Quite a big disappointment for us as we were told earlier that the lights' show was really something not to be missed.

OF COURSE - you must see this. This Astronomical Clock is a fascination for all and crowded when the time for the "show" begins. Before you go, read up on the various actions you will be seeing so that you don't miss anything. No need to push to be in front - the action is high up and easily visible.

A nice but short (five minute) tourist attraction. The clock is pretty impressive given its age and a pretty neat looking one at that. If you're around the area, then you definitely should drop by to see when it strikes at noon (or for any hour for that matter). What gives this spot the real added value is that there are a lot of other mini attractions/shops/touristy stores immediately around it. Very crowded though, so show up early to get your own seat in a nearby cafe if you really want to see it chime a few times.

Definitely take a tour to see the inner workings of the clock. This is a medieval astronomical clock which was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still working according to Wikipedia. A must do on a trip to Prague is to see the city from the top of the tower. Hear a trumpeter play a fanfare to mark the passage of time.Don't listen to others who just stopped in front of the clock to see the apostles circle around. Take the tour and see it from the rear.I do have to say I'm biased regarding mechanical workings of objects. This tour is for adults.
impressive. impressive architecture and incredible clock. very touristy area though, if you can get a spot at the cafe opposite then its worth it.

Astronomical clock. Bit disappointed with the Astronomical clock at 12 noon although most people get there at the appropriate time. I should be more greatful really because you have to take into consideration that the clock is 100's of years old. Just wasnt as good as the one I'd seen in Munich some years prior

must see it :). from old town to charles bridge and then to Hradcany...must see it...must go there at least three times to see all..to breath the atmosphere, to taste the beer and food. Near the clock which is on the square there is many of small restaurants with good quality food...must try knedlicky ..the best :))
20 second clock performance is weak.. Square is nice. Town Hall is picturesque. Clock show isn't worth the 20 seconds it takes. Clock is cute. Take a still picture - you won't be missing much.

Overrated!. Personally, I thought the clock was overrated! Had higher expectations given the fuss that was made and the huge crowd that had gathered. One of those things you just have to do while in Prague though!

Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. Interesting square. Was set up for the annual light show. Highlight was the clock. Each hour the clocks upper doors open up and medieval characters pass by. Last about five minutes. It was impressive.

Be there on the hour. Clock is lovely to view at any time however at the top of the hour it comes to "life". You will see the crowds gathering. It is possible to climb the tower for a small fee. There is also a trumpeter player who stops mid note on the hour as well (we also saw this in Poland).

Gorgeous clock but not worth all the hype. Much like many other tourists I waited around the clock to witness the clock ring in the new hour, yes there were bells ringing but the figurines move around inside the clock and are not very visible. When it is not around the new hour, I definitely recommend taking some pictures of the clock itself as it is definitely mechanical (and scientific) magic!

People Watching!. We visited at the beginning of October and were amazed at the number of tour groups in Prague at that time. It was worth watching the astronomical clock and even more fun to climb to the top and see the view of the city from every angle. We enjoyed watching the tour groups who would often stand for fifteen minutes or more to watch the figures in the clock, rotate for about 30-50 seconds.
Beautiful. The square with the clock is so crowded! It is still a must see. I would ever eat in any of the cafés in the square though, as there are just too many people.
Fun. It sounds corny but watching the Clock on the hour was a lot of fun and the square is terrific and lively with all sorts of food stands and entertainment.

Go Go Go. Be sure to show up right before the hour to see the moving characters do their thing. It is worth the $5 to go to the top and be there on the hour too. Its fun to see all of the people looking up and while up there you see the horn player up close and personal. The view from above is magical.. Bring your camera!

What's the fuss?. The clock looks impressive but the actual performance on the hour was a let down. We had to watch it twice, it was that quick (less than 30 seconds). You do need to be aware of the story and history of the clock to fully appreciate it. The view from the clock tower is worth taking the climb.

Climb to the top!. The view from the top of the tower makes it all worth it. It's amazing 360 view of the town square, and really makes you appreciate the beauty the city holds. The hordes of people below and the intricate weavings of the streets from up top gives you a completely different perspective, and makes you realize how beautiful the city is. It gets crowded! Go early!

You must visit the clock tower. Everybody who visits Prague will undoubtedly visit the Astronomical Clock which is part of the town hall. But you must also go up the tower as the views are spectacular. You can take the lifts if you want to get up there the easy way. It is busy at the top of the tower, and it is supposed to be one way round it, but there are some people who can't seem to read who insist that they go round the other way and they struggle to get past you! All part of being a tourist in Prague. it costs 100 Czech Crowns to go up the tower and see the town hall exhibits.

Prague. The clock is amazing but you need to read up on it to understand.It strikes on the hour and that is a must be there moment.There is a square next to it where you can buy food from street stalls.A pleasant evening can be had in this area.

Not the best in Europe. OK, czech the block and see it, but go to the little resturant accross from the clock about 30 minutes early( clock performs on the hour) and grab a beer/coffeee etc and see the clock perform. You will see 10,000 of your closet friends and a few pickpockets in the crowd that gathers in front of the clock- in the cafe you will be able to enjoy it in comfort and then you can move on to other better attactions. The clock in the catherdral in Stousbourg France is much more interesting, or try Rothenburg Germany

Worth going!. We deicided to head up to the top of the tower. Well worth it. Gives great views over the old town square. I would avoid going just after thr hour as it will be busy and full of people who hve come to watch the clock. Very reasonable.

Got to see the clock. Amazing works, and history... but if you are not there on the hour to see the ''show'' don't waste your time. There just ain't that much to it. so a few little doors open and figures move by, but it ain't no light and sound extravaganza. Be prepared for the carnival atmosphere of the place.

Don't wait around for the clock striking the hour. I must say at that the outset that the clock itself is a fantastic work of art that can be seen from the attached photos.However, the 'show' on the hour is not worth waiting around to see, although there are crowds doing just that on the hour, every hour. I was expecting a great show, but there was very little discernible movement to be seen.Now if you want to see great views, climb the tower itself, as this is well worth the money!

To the Top of the Tower. You must climb the tower and then wonder at the view as you overlook Prague and its' surrounding areas. At 100 crowns (about £3) for an adult, this is something that you should definitely do. Climb the stairs to around halfway up and then you can if you wish take an elevator the rest of the way. The contrast between the modern elevator and the centuries old tower is staggering, yet they seem to complement each other perfectly. Once at the top take your time to walk slowly round savouring the views down and around. Watch the bustling Old Town Square from way up high and then take in the stunning architecture of the various churches, cathedrals, castles and other buildings that feast before your eyes.

Worth seeing. Not really that exciting the clock is interesting, but doesn't really do anything that special. Probably best to see it as part of a tour rather than making a special trip out to see it.
The Clock that never stops. The Prague Astronomical Clock located at Old Town City Hall,said to have been installed in 1410 and the oldest one still working.

No way. Couldn't believe the crowd that gathered to see the clock. It was very anti-climatic when the bells tolled and tiny statues revolved outside. There are too many other beautiful sites to explore in Prague than to waste your time waiting for the clock show.

Listen to a guide so you learn about it!. Very interesting details if you can listen to a guide talk about it for a few minutes! " When the clock strikes on the hour, a skeleton rings the bell because you are one hour closer to death...."

Amazing sight when the clock strikes the hour!. A crowd gathered as we waited for the hour to chime .Then the music played whilst little figures moved in and out of their little boxes.Lovely surprise !

Nice clock but.... Really nice clock with great details and astrological signs however i don't understand why prople stays such long just to see it ringing... Don't worth similar vlock within the world... It's a kind of "coucou-clock" with 3 marionnettes showed during 1 min... Nothing extraordinary....

--- and it's still ticking!!. It was an experience just to see this marvel! Pay attention though, the show only lasts a very short time (@ 25 secs), Just as interesting is watching the tourists assemble! You should be able to catch this marvel several times on your way to other sight as you pass through this square.

Beautiful. Certain unique sites are memorable - this is one. The astronomical clock is amazing in its beauty and complexity. The Old Town Hall is a marvellous example of architecture of this era. Recommend highly.
impressive. this is the most impressive place in prague. especially in nigh time!! must go there, breathe the air, feel the spirit. beer is quite cheap also.
Very interesting. Great views from the top of the tower, try to go early to avoid the crowds. Try read up about it before you see it as it adds to the experience. Not to be missed!

pretty, and funny!. We walk by this landmark so many times, we still wait to see the next "ringing", so to speak:-) Our tour guide did an excellent job introducing the features, although he described the clock as the 2nd biggest disappointment in the world (with the number one being the Mona Lisa, LOL), the history and stories behind the clock tower are still interesting; you'll have to wait with the crowd each time, even in the rain, but still well worth it!!
Incredible Clock. Do not miss seeing this clock. It dates back to the 1400s and is still in perfect working order. The figures on the clock are amazing.

A must see. The Astronomical Clock is located in the Old Town Square and must be one of the most photographed things in Prague, this being said you can see why ! It performs on the hour so get there a little early grab a spot and get your camera or video ready. My advice is to catch it at least twice as its very easy to miss some of the automation. If you can, do a little research before hand so that you'll have an idea of what your looking at !From here you can take a short walk to the Jewish quarter, in fact everywhere in Prague is a short walk away from here !There are some good fast food shacks nearby selling sausage,beer,Prague Ham etc. Probably better value than the resturants directly in front of the clock.

Fascinating Clock, But Read About It First!. This clock does its thing on the hour.But if you wait until it starts, you'll probably miss much of the activity. There are all sorts of figures moving and each has its own story. Get a good guide book (we use the Eyewitness Guide to Prague) and you'll appreciate it just that much more. If you're trying to camcorder the activity, this is a must!Try to get to the clock early to avoid the crowds that start about 15 minutes before each hour.

The must do in Prague. You always battle the tourists in Prague, however it's such a great place.Always be careful of pickpockets in crowds... Men....wallet in front pocket. Women hold tight to your bags.Loved it loved it.
Very interesting . This site is pretty neat when you get all the info about it and you realize how scientifically advanced it was for its time. Very crowded area of the city, but worth a visit!

Great views. This is well worth the visit. There are great views to be had from the top. The walk up is like a set from Dr Who, if you go you'll understand what I mean. Be ready for a queue at the top though as there isn't a great deal of room at the top as obviously when it was built it was not designed for all today's tourists.

See the Excellent Views Between Hours. The clock's show on the hours is amazing. Read a little about the clock (like on Wikipedia) before you visit to fully appreciate the symbols and the fact that it was built way before electronics, computers, etc. The clock does attract large crowds, but it's high enough that you shouldn't have trouble seeing it. We didn't have problems with pick-pockets, but our guidebook reminded us that crowded places where everyone is distracted are good opportunities for pick-pockets, so hold your bag close as you enjoy the show.You can go up in the tower of the old town hall and enjoy EXCELLENT 360-degree views of Prague. Prague is so beautiful and fairy-tale-like, especially since it did not suffer bomb damage during WWII.Get your tickets at the base of the tower and then enter around the side. We recommend visiting the tower between the hours because if you go right after the clock show, the line can get long. The tickets were only about $5 US and worth it. The views are excellent, and you can stay as long as you like. I think there were some plaques too that pointed out some landmarks. Bringing a map of the city to compare to the scenery would be another way to enhance your visit at the top.You can take stairs or elevators to the top. The little room at the top has large windows all around, and there is a wrap-around balcony to go out on. The balcony is definitely the best way to enjoy the views, though that it is very narrow - we left our small umbrella stroller in the room.
interesting. The crowd was unbearable, but the clock is amazing.Try the McGee's tour and you will know why this clock was built.

Go to the top!. Watching the clock as it turns the hour is fun, but seeing Prague from the top of the tower is almost breath taking. Recommend going on a sunny day to see further than just Old Town Square.

Amazing. the clock itself is a masterpiece and you can actually climb up inside the tower by way of many steps (there is a lift for the less mobile) and view the awesome surrounding scenery from the top. Worth listening to the history of it if you get the opportunity to listen in on one of the tour guides :-) we took a tour on the first day to get a feel of the area then decided which places we wanted to revisit or hadn't seen and went back. I'd definitely recommend doing that
Be here on the hour. amazing clock even if rather complicated to understand it all, must be here on the hour to see it in action, beware you wont be alone as it gets rather crowded
a must see. take the elevator to the top and enjoy the 360 degree view of all of Prague. The tile roofs, the square, the castle, the river, bridges. Make sure your camera battery is charged.

Vibrant. Busy bustling square surrounded by beautiful buildings. The mob of tourists that gathered around the clock at the strike of the hour groaned with disapointment! I don't know what they expected, its a clock, a lovely ornate clock with moving figures on the hour.
Very different indeed. Didn't really know much about the clock if I'm honest, very odd but fun to watch on the hour and the view from the top is great too

Amazing astronomical clock. This clock is amazing, one of the best experiences in Prague and we had many! In the old town square the best time to go is on the hour when the clock comes alive and the trumpeter plays. Take the time to visit again and climb the stairs, one of the best photos I took was of the crowds below! Very small entrance fee. And views are great too. A must see.

Great Views at the top of the tower. Walk up the stairs instead of taking the elevator to see other interesting parts of the tower. It was an easy walk up the stairs, I would say that 90% people took the elevator. But for me the experience to walk up and come down was so much more fun. At the top there is so many people, to get a good picture from every corner of the tower you must be patient. The views are spectacular and you see most of Prague. All those colorful buildings are so pretty and nice. Loved my experience. Also make sure to save your ticket for when you leave, as they might ask to see it!

Not a must see!. Don't believe the hype. Read the reviews on here from average down to terrible and it will give you a better representation of what to expect. I rated it poor instead of terrible because I could appreciate it being a marvel back in the days when it was created but I was sorely dissappointed to have waited more than a minute (45 in my case) for this "attraction".

A "must see" in Prague. A beautiful clock that comes "alive" on the hour.A real tourist attraction - can become very crowded in the area when everyone is waiting for the clock to "perform". Good photo opportunity. Definitely a "must see" when in Prague.
Magnificent Views!. The observation deck of the Clock Tower is a must for visitors to Prague. The views are simply stunning and the access is easy!

great view from the top. Walk up the stairs instead of taking the elevator to see other interesting parts of the tower. The line to get in is upstairs where the little gift shop is, not down on the ground floor where you buy your ticket. Also make sure to save your ticket for when you leave, as they might ask to see it!
Astronomical clock. Waste of time waiting for 30 seconds for a skeleton hitting a tiny bell to chime at the "o'clock". The tower and clock itself was far more photogenic and interesting.

tick tock - skeleton moves. Fun to see the clock - crowded for the hourly "show" - the people move, the 12 apostles fly out and the rooster crows. What a delight. Ancient. Designed and built before Gallileo proved the church was wrong about the Sun revolving around the Earth!

It was cute to see if it's convenient. You'll run into this clock no matter what if you're walking around in the historical area- what you will see people waiting around for is the little show that happens every hour on the hour.The little doors open up, some characters spin around and the golden rooster crows.I thought it was going to be a little more involved, and I think others did too. It was cute to see- if you only have to wait around a few minutes... but if you have to wait around over a half an hour, I would recommend trying your luck one of the several other times you'll walk by this clock.Otherwise- it's pretty!
Astronomical Clock. One of a kind, very neat to see. Big crowds on the hour, plenty of restaurants nearby. A must see in Prauge.
Very pretty but overrated. Certainly should go there to look around but watching the clock is kind of pointless, not much happens haha but thats ok.

Fascinating Clock. I loved the astronomical clock and am amazed at the intelligence of its designer so long ago. It is a focal point of the Old City and a great landmark if you ever lose your bearings!
Interesting. I found this very interesting despite the hype. Its well worth the visit and taking home a few photos

Beautiful. The sheer workmanship is amazing, I am so pleased that I got to see this fantastic clock ! It is part of beautiful square of coloured buildings that make you feel you have been transported back in time

Beautiful Area. Of course, the Astronomical Clock is a must see in Prague. But be prepared for crowds, especially if it is close to the hour. To really appreciate the clock's construction, stand in front and on the hour watch the procession of the Twelve Apostles with Christ marching out in front. If you're a photographer, you might want to get there early in the day to get a good shot with fewer people.

Truly amazing. The fact that this old clock keeps time as well as doing everything it does with the moving statuary is amazing.Couple that with weddings going on below, the crowd in general, and a couple of pretty good restaurants and it is really an experience. Don't miss shopping in some of the better Czech crystal shops nearby!
Top of the clock rocks!. Well worth the effort, take the elevator up and walk down. The view is great from the top as you can see the range of spires and various roof lines.
Get there early. Loved visiting this. get there early as it gets exceptionally busy . we arrived at 8.30am and it was starting to fill up with everyone wanting pictures taken at the clock.
Fun crowd-pleaser.. Times Square New Years Eve, but every hour on the hour. The clock is splendid, but the crowds are even more so in their enthusiasm for all that is Prague.

Get there on the hour!. Very interesting whenever you see it but make sure you get there on the hour when interesting things happen. There is a very nice cafe right in front of it so you can enjoy a latte ...or a beer...while you wait.
Favorite Place. Prague is my favorite town in Eastern Europe. The Old Town is very charming and going up the Orloj Tower is an incredible experience. You might try the restaurants around it as well.

A must see. Such a cool clock with lots of history and a great story. I won't give it away but when you are in Prague you would be doing yourself a huge disservice if you did not stop at the clock at least once. There are a number of cafes in the area to bide your time until the top of the hour. It does different things at different times so once might not be enough! Don't miss it.

Astronomical clock in old time square in Prague. This clock was amazing. The best time to see it is noon1200. That is when it performs the most actions. Things like the 12apostles popping out of the clock and bells ringing. It is also the most crowded and if it is raining then people start putting up umbrellas in the way of your view. Old time square has exceptional sculptures and architecture and great restaurants.
Pretty. The clock is an easy one to check off- it's out in the open and free to all. There was a ton of people though- I would recommend seeing it early in the morning when the crowd's not so thick.
Great site to see. The clock was built in 1400s by a genius. Be sure and be there at the hour to see the animation. Great photo op.
Must see!. Be sure to read the history of the clock. Very neat! I enjoyed visiting the tower as well, worth the fee. Phenomenal view of the city!

Ok, so it's an old clock. It's in an ornate building. We were there when the chimes rang at 4 pm. But it really seemed like a non-event although the crowds enjoyed it. Sort of expected figurines would do something.

Tick tock. Visit it by day and by night, stop at cafe adjacent for drink before the noon or midnight hour and see it strike and show the longest. Afterwards daytime, go down a couple of doors and climb the clock tower for 360o scenic view of Prague City. Take elevator up and walk stauirs down.
display of the hour. every hour you can see a marvelous sight of the 12 apostles and the bells ringing and the site on top of the tower is breath taking.
You haven't seen Prague if you haven't seen this. And pay the minimal amount and either walk or catch the lift to the top of the tower to get a fantastic panoramic view of the city.

worth battling with the crowds. The astronomical clock is a 3 part clock, which tells the time in hours as well as fete days and the astronomical time. Every hour the 12 apostles can be seen in the upper part of the clock, including one which appears to be holding a cup of tea.As its over 400 years old and still telling the time accurately its extremely impressive

One of my favourite places. You can walk into this square and if it wasn't for the constant clicking of tourist's cameras, you could imagine stepping back in time or into a different world. I never get tired of visiting here and one day I'll even learn to read the clock. Visiting during the day and night is very different so try to experience both.

Great opportunity to see the city of Prague if you go to the top. Spent a lovely hour making our way around the top of the clock. Cost little to get in and there are elevators that can take you right to the top so no need to worry about lots of stairs !At the top you get to see all the sights of Prague from a birds eye view and all around are plaques with which direction you need to be looking to see certain landmarks.Was very busy the day we went so took a little while to get round as is quite narrow round the edge (but very safe) so only one way traffic roundWould recommend this to view the City and get some great photo's

Yes its crowded and yet, it is an engaging hourly show. Lots to see, even if you are just walking by. When the hourly show occurs, you see and hear many things including the ringing bell and the moving skeleton of death. The colors of the clock are eye catching as are the face details.First saw the clock 15 years ago, when Prague was still the wild west and happy to see it remains a steadfast icon of the city. Go and see it.

Weddings and Clocks.. The famous Astronomical clock ( which has Earth as the centre of the Universe) is by the old town hall: a succession of wedding couples came out when we visited, to have their wedding photos taken in the Square. Contrary to our guide book, it was possible to enter the Church of Our Lady of Tyn.

A must visit in Prague. Watching the clock is a must for any tourist. Despite the crowds its worth seeing. We saw it in the snow with a wedding party getting photographed underneath as the Town Hall is also the registry office. At night it has a different charm. i particularly like "Death with his scythe".We didn't go up the tower but went into the Tourist office and Art gallery.There is a fee for the tower

Not Much To Say About This. We stood twenty minutes with hundreds and hundreds of people for this clock, which does something on the hour. That something is a door that opens and you get a 20 second peek at some figures behind the doors. We laughed when it was over and said "that's it?" On the other hand, if you are strolling by on the hour, of course stop and watch. Just don't leave where you are to rush to the clock like we did!
A beautiful must see while in town.. This clock is still fully operational and beautiful to see both during the day and at night. I didn't go into the tower, but the view must be amazing if you do.

Best buy between viewpoints. The view from the top is beautiful. You can circle the top clockwise so everything goes pretty smooth. It is fun watching other tourists watching the clock around the hour.From downstairs when you catch the apostles passing by the windows, watch death pulling the rope, it is the best part, and since everything ends quickly, try to catch it some more times.

Clearly overrated and much too crowded. Extreme crowd of tourists...The clock itself is not the most exciting thing I've ever seen, it's really overrated. I guess you should have seen it while you are there but I definitely wouldn't go to Prague just to see a clock with some puppets ;-). Moreover, the crowd is really terrible, be prepared to be pushed around and yelled at.

Watch your pocket.. When the weather is nice this is definitively place to stop and see. But be aware, that in a crowd there are many pickpocketers. And they are good at it. Too many tourists are vivtims of these skilled thieves. They are extremely well organized, and if they get your credit card it is cleaned in about 30 minutes. But if you use common sense it is nice place to spend day. Close to the Venceslav Square, Charles bridge, and Vltava river.

Prague astronomical clock. This tourist attraction is well worth the visit. It can be best seen from a restaurant across the street. It features a rooftop dining area with great views of the clock and the surrounding town. I would suggest reservations is well worth the effort. The restaurant is called the U Prince Hotel.

Best Views from the Top. Well worth the 200czk for admission for two people. The elevator ride up with no lines was a surprise and the walk up reading the history of the clock was a nice leisure visit. The panoramic view was spectacular. Make this a must on your tour of Prague.
Famous clock. the square is a lovely old square with lots of entertainers, not to be missed. the clock well, yes you need to see the famous clock. however it wasn't the most exciting thing we saw.
Astronomical clock. Most beautiful clock i have seen in my life. The puppets are overrated however. Best to view in the evening to avoid extreme crowds of tourists.
stunning. visually and atmospherically amazing, restaurants and bars more expensive than those in adjacent side streets, so shop around, but don't miss it!!!

Go up the tower for the views of the city. The Old Town Hall and the clock are in the Old Town Square. A highlight was going up in the tower of the town hall, there is an elevator! and getting to see the amazing views of the city from the tower on a beautiful day. The astronomical clock draws unbelievable crowds yet I am not sure it is worth all the fuss. To me it can't compare to the clock in St. Marks Square in Venice but if you happen to be there near the hour, stop and watch if you can get anywhere near it. I much preferred grabbing a drink at one of the nearby cafes on the square and listening the bells chime.
gorgeous building and square. mobbed. Beautiful. Huge crowds gather to watch the clock. Easy to find and pass by as you explore this city
A key landmark.. The view from the top was worth the euros. Line up quickly after the clock chimes to get up the tower and into the elevator.

Crazy intricate workings!. The Astronomical Clock is not to be missed--especially on the hour! Be sure to read about it in a guide book, or take one of the walking tours with a guide who will explain the workings of the clock.

clock. A very beautiful clock it was amazing to see back then just how skilled people was. A must see when vistng prague, prague is a very interesting place and would recommend it be something everyone should go.

Pretty cool, actually. The clock is terrific - detailed and gorgeous. The tower is very worth going up for the view of the city and wonderful picture opportunities - but please note that it is VERY crowded and you have to be patient and not suffer from claustrophobia. There is an elevator! The inside of the tower is actually a ramp rather than stairs so you can wind up to almost the top and look at the history of the clock displays while you climb. Very well done.
