Wonderful place. Same as most places in Prague, I didnt know where to begin when it came to writing this. The Old Town square is wonderful - full of people, buzzing with atmosphere and home to my favaourite building in all of Prague; Church of Our Lady Before Tyn. A great place to spend an evening, in a restaurant watching the world go by - along with the thousands of tourists. The Astronomical Clock is also a great attraction. Take a trip up it at night and look out over all of Prague. Most people took the lift (which I found a bit strange - doesnt this ruin the experience of the clock) so instead, walk it. The path is sloped so no stairs to go up apart from a metal spiral at the very top. But once you're up - its beautiful. Again, you get a great view of Church of Our Lady Before Tyn. A MUST SEE!!!

It's a clock with limited movement. Based on the crowds that were gathered I was expecting something awesome from the clock. Unfortunately I was slightly disappointed based on other clocks in different cities with moving pieces. If you are there around there on the hour, stop and look, if you are going to wait for more than 5-10 minutes, just keep moving. The town hall itself had beautiful views if you pay to go up -really a great view over the city.

Amazing to watch. It was amazing to watch the clock in action when it hits the top of the hour. To watch the windows open and the Twelve Apostles march by, the figures on each side move, and the rooster crows, and then the bell tolls the hour.

Fantastic Clock and History. What an absolutely fantastic piece of work , for something that was built in the 11th Century I can appreciate the brain power ,mathematical work , and the physical work that has gone into a truly great clockBeing able to go to the top of the clock tower and take in the sites of old Prague town was majestic and gave me a better idea of how big old town is, defiantly one of the highlights of Old Prague town
And Right On Time. Gotta see the clock at the top of each hour as it exhibits the movements - climb the tower for great view of the Old Town Square
A must see in Prague. A very interesting and attractive sites to see in prague. We watched the chimes at 12 o'clock from a bar nearby. Very good.

It's a clock to those of us without clock interests. The clock is very special I am told. You can buy small copies of it in Prague, paintings, and photographs of it, all sorts of souvenirs of it, but for me, it didn't really do much. It reminded me of the Munich clock where I stood waiting for something to happen, and was disappointed when it did. Those of you interested in clocks will however disregard my review quite rightly, and go along to see this most unusual and unique piece of work.

take the stateroom tour. The state room and underground tour is worth waiting for. You can only go with a guide (different languages every half hour). The rooms are ok but the undergrond area is very interesting, the guide explains about the history of old Prague and shows bits of the old town underneath the current buildings. English of the guide was difficult to follow but still worth taking the tour

Whenever in Prague, this is a DON'T MISS!!!!. I believe that the Old Town Square, Astronomical Clock and surrounding area is the heartbeat of Prague. There are hotels, cafes, restaurants, Tye Cathedral and many, many shops. The Charles Bridge is just a 10 minute walk from there.Don't miss this when you visit Prague!! We love just walking around the Square, finding a seat, listen to the music and people watch!!
Fascinating piece of engineering. This clock attracts a lot of attention from tourists around the clock .its a classic piece of Prague

Old town hall, tower & astronomical clock. The clock strikes on the hour so you have to be there on the hour to see it working. The hall gives access to the tower (not free) above the astronomical clock. There are quite a few stairs to climb but there is a lift. The view from the top is great. It does, however tend to be crowded so you have to be patient if taking some photos. We didn't explore the town hall.

Beautiful tourist trap. We absolutely loved it, but found it very touristy. TGI Friday's, really?! We tried to sit at bar/restaurant in centre and they were very abrupt, do we left. Did us a favour actually as we found a lovely restaurant off the main square. The clock is great, a must see on the hour, every hour.
Haha What A Silly Thing. Huge crowds to see a few tiny figures go round..what a joke and so crowded go elsewhere in Prague rather than waste time here
very nice site. evry one that come to the city go to see the clock take some picter and move in . you dont need to be thermore the 15 minuets/

magical. the old town square is always crowded with tourists and also pickpockets! so beware! :) the old town is lively with musics all over the place and happy people greeting you. the most significant thing here is the astronomical clock which seems so magical and amazing that it would do the fancy thing every hour. Must visit place in the world!

A great place for a weekend break. Lovely and historical attraction. Apart from the actual site there is plenty to see in Prague old town and it is easily walkable being quite compact. There are plenty of places to stop to eat and drink and I loved all the little shops in the area selling traditional souvenirs. Do not come away without visiting a bohemian glass crafting shop where there are things to buy ranging from reasonable to outrageously expensive. If you get tired of walking take a horse drawn carriage with a tour guide as they are very knowledgeable and you can see and learn the towns history from the comfort of your carriage.

Making Time. Okay, you are in Prague, so you have to see the astronomical clock do its thing. Hopefully you did not cross the planet just for this adventure, however, because you will be channeling Peggy Lee ("Is that all there is?") after the top of the hour. The clock really is beautiful, but the hourly cavalcade of local saints that is the big show is a trifle underwhelming. You still gotta see it ....
beautiful views from tower. The elevator to tower is a must and the clock very interesting. The square is most beautiful at night.
Wow!. To think this was built in 1410 and we can go and stand right next to it. My mind was thinking of all the people through the centuries that had stood right where I was...wow!
The cock a doodle doo is a must. One of those things you have to do but the little cock a doodle doo made it for me as he chirped when it was all over - the town square is lovely

Staré Město - Astronomical clock. Below the Astronomical Clock are 12 medallions with the signs of the zodiac, added by Josef Manes in 1865. This clock is spectacular in Winter and even crowded during. At the time we were there , it was snowing and was so cold but didn't leave us tired to look at it. You can view there many guides from different nationalities that will give you the best information ever and would make you visit the town with its monuments as well a day Kutna Hora 70 km out of Prague.That is a place that you should visit as soon as you get to Prague! :D

Don't miss this!. My husband is a 'clockaholic' [that is, he loves clocks] so we always make sure we see various interesting clocks when we travel. This was one of the more interesting clocks we've encountered around Europe and other areas of the world - the clock striking the hour isn't particularly unique but the statues are fairly different and very cute. However, what was particularly interesting to both of us was the Astronomical clock - even though I'm not nearly as interested in clocks as my husband is, I found it fascinating to see the complexity and beauty of this particular clock tower. And we found the glockenspiel 'show' interesting enough to plan our walking tours so we could see it more than once during our short stay in Prague. We purchased a small book, available in multiple languages, explaining the history and mechanics of the Astronomical Clock - very advanced technology for the times!You can also go up inside the tower in an elevator, which is really worth the small fee they charge - it was very crowded, both outside to watch the hour striking and inside at the top of the tower. We had to wait in line to enter the elevator to go up and again to descend, but it wasn't as annoying as many other crowds, perhaps because it was almost all people who shared a common interest. For the most part, everyone was considerate and even though it was raining during one of the displays, people did their best to hold their umbrellas so they wouldn't block the view of others wanting to see the clock - in some cases, even putting their umbrella away so they wouldn't disturb others. In addition to the entertainment from the clock itself, there are many interesting things in the surrounding square so it's well worth the time to see this and you'll have plenty to keep you occupied while you wait for the clock to strike the hour.

Interesting time piece.. The astronomical clock attracts hundreds of tourists as the hour approaches. Don't miss the different activities on the clock. Try to see it more than once so you can check out each section during the movements
What Time is It?. This is worth many pictures and it is important to learn it's history. Take a city tour and you can learn about the 12 Apostles and the history of the clock!

What a thrill!. The first night we arrived in Prague, we walked the few blocks from our hotel and into the magnificent square which houses the Astronomical Clock. Upon first glance, the square and clock take your breath away. Just beautiful. You'll be caught up in the energy of the square. Many fine cafes and impromptu musicians.

Worth a visit. Visited the square several times as it was on route to other places. each time the clock was about to strike the hour, large crowds would gather. The event is nothing startling, a clock striking the hours and some statues rotating. More interesting is the actual Astronomical part to the clock and the history. The views from the top are worth the climb. Saying that there are not many stairs to climb. There is a ramp going around the inside of the tower to just below the floor of the top level which you then access via a tight spiral staircase. Access is controlled by a green and red light, though some tourists either didn't understand red meant stop and give people from the opposite level priority or were just being ignorant as some tourists are.Once at the top the views are fantastic.On a funny note, we were waiting for the clock to strike when a tourist actually stopped me and asked for the time. I then pointed out the various clocks, thinking to myself, is this location as famous as it is made out to be?
Historic area. We were there on a rainy day, so many people with umbrellas watching the clock, but it is high enough to see. Great area to people watch and rest.

Come here. I've reviewed this elsewhere, but will say again that it's a great spectacle that you have to visit when you are in Prague.The clock does get very busy on the hour, so keep your wits about you with your personal possessions.
Fabo view, worth the time and climb. A1 attraction for Prague. Great 360 degree view. Background on clock on the way up. Nothing not to like.

Nice experience. It's a really eye-catching experience, specially if you stop to realize it was built some centuries ago. It's a must-go if you're in Prague, and really doesn't take more than 5 minutes to see it all. Just be aware it gets really crowded in front of the clock, so take care with pickpockets and this kind of stuff. It's really safe there, but we never know.
A must see. great area to walk around and enjoy the little restaurants, shops and admire the great and rich architecture of Prague!

a big disapointment. I'd been looking forward to seeing the clock but oh dear what a let down. Again tourists are the problem. Though you can nip round the corner and get a slice or two of Prauge ham washed down with a glass of black beer, very tasty.

Nice to look at but .... The hordes of people which collect at five minutes to the hour, every hour, ready for the astronomical clock to chime would make you think that it's more impressive than it is. It looks great and I'm sure it's a feat of engineering but the hourly event is pretty underwhelming, in my opinion. I won't spoil it for you because, let's face it, if you're going to Prague, you're going to go and see it for yourself anyway so make your own mind up.

something that most people stop to watch ( no pun intended). Crowds gather around the Astronomical clock at the change of the hour. we dined in one of the outside hostelries and smiled at the passing of each hour. Good fun, interesting and a realy good atmosphere.

Awesome Clock. I didn't go up into the tower (another time!), but the clock itself is an amazing spectacle one has to see when visiting Prague. It was raining on a Monday morning, but there was still a throng to watch the clock work its magic.

Clock Tower is a Must See. We stopped by the square and decided to go ahead and climb the Clock Tower because it was so cheap. The climb to the top takes a while but there are elevators if you need them. Either way it was definitely worth it because the views from the top are absolutely amazing!!!

Climb the Clock Tower. The clock is interesting from the ground but its most outstanding feature is its tower. Climb to the top ( if you are fit enough ) and check out the incredible view of the old part of town. Well worth it!

Excellent 360° view of Prague. Nice view of the main hallmarks from the tower top. A small price to pay for a small place to be in! You walk around an outside corridor that is very narrow and gets easily crowded.

Nice area to chill. The Astronomical Clock itself is beautiful. We had our meal at the restaurant just opposite the clock, had some beer while waiting for the 12 apostles to 'come out'. They moved so fast... if you want to take pictures of them you need to be fast... I think this is one of the most beautiful areas in Prague (and Charles Bridge and Prague Castle). Nice place to hang out and buy souvenirs. Go up the tower for some great photos. There's a lift up and we're really happy about that. LOL. Go there again at night, it's even prettier~ I really love this place.

Still an amazing experience.. I visited the Town Hall and the Clock 40 years ago. The clock is gently renovated over the years and the technique behind the moving figures and the astronomic remains mesmerizing. The crowds are enormous when the clock chimes and the figures are moving. It is an advantage to see the clock together with a guide, because of the history of the Astronomical clock and a number of details of the figures when moving are not easily detectable and quite interesting to watch.

Extraordinary once explained . You definately need a local to explain this to appreciate this in full. Once you have this it all makes sense and if like me you come from a young country it is an amazing creation for it's age.

Nice to see but nothing special. I didn't think the clock was anything special. Just to let everyone know the clock only does it's little show on the hour between 9 am and 9 pm (I think maybe sometimes until 11 pm?). We waited one night at 10 or 11 and it didn't do anything, then we checked our Lonely Planet book and confirmed that it doesn't move EVERY hour on the hour, just between certain hours, so just keep this in mind. There are big crowds by the clock all day long also, so it's not hard to miss! It's nice to look at but I didn't really think it was anything special, except for the fact that it's really old and it's fascinating to think about it being built hundreds of years ago!
Be there on the hour and expect large crowds. The clock in Old Town is a big tourist attraction worth seeing. Expect large crowds on the hour when the clock chimes and the figures move about.

A bit deceptive. People tell you that something wonderful will happen on the hour, but all it is is 6 guys walking across the clock. Not worth the hype. The clock is interesting to see, but we recommend going at a time when there are not tons of people waiting for the top of the hour.

Worth the trip up the tower.. The Old Town Hall is one of Prague's most iconic images. So much so that you will find it on the front of Starbuck's City Icon Mug for the Czech Republic. This hall and tower date back to the 14th century. You can pay a fee of 100 CZK for adults (obviously children are cheaper) and go up to the top and get some nice pictures of the center of historic Prague. The Astronomical Clock is a tourist favorite and with large crowds gathering in front of it every hour on the hour. When the clock chimes at the top of the hour there are figures that move about, and a mechanical rooster crows. This is one of Prague's top historical attractions and shouldn't be missed. If you are planning a visit to this wonderful city, then you must put this spot in your top five sites to see, if not top three.
Beautiful. Try to be at an hour o'clock, view from the tower is good at day and at night, look for a good place for a great picture.

Prague Astronomical Clock (Staromestska Radnice). The view from the top of the tower allowed a 360 degree view of Prague. The price of admission was very affordable, and there was a choice of elevator or stairs. Lots of photo ops along the way and at the top.

A Reminder. The Astronomical Clock which strikes every hour brings so much of meaning to a world who is forgetting God fast! Every strike of the hour is beautiful narration of life's mortality and God's reality for mankind. Excellent!

A must see, if you can handle the crowds. There is 1 minute of action when in the hour a set of characters appear in two small windows above the famous clock. During and shortly before that time the crowds are huge. You probably want to see it once, but once is enough...
One of a kind timepiece.. Too many tourists and tour groups but if you like action and street artists this is the place. Square is lined with cafes.
excellent architecture. A trully wonderful piece of architecture. The clock tells more than the time.We did not have anyone toexplain to us about the clock. We just appreciated its design.

Wish I could read the clock. Watching the clock is a marvel having it explained starts off ok but them quickly becomes complex but it is pretty amazing. You can actually buy a small working clock as a souvenir hopefully it will come with instructions on how to read it. We have not done the tower yet but hope to in the next day or so. Not sure of the cost but the entrance is right next to the clock.

It's a working clock!. I didn't stand around to watch the show. It's more of I happen to catch it. It's really nothing much.. I think the most important thing is to read and understand about the design of the clock and be amazed that it's still working since day one!

Great if you can stand the crowds. Absolutely stunning clock. I have never seen anything quite like it before. But the crowds spoil the experience. Hundreds of people pack into a very small area and some tourists can get quite pushy. Everyone waits for the top of the hour. A couple of minutes later the show is over and the crowds disperse. Now you can take your time admiring the architecture of this truly elegant piece of work.
don't skip!. Although this area gets extremely touristy and crowded, it is definitely worthwhile to wait and see the panoramic view of the city.
Stunning. Without a doubt, this is one of the most spectacular clocks I have seen. It gets very crowded around it and at peak times is very difficult to get a good position for photos.
Crowded. It's definitely one of a kind experiences. It does get very crowded as there's only a small viewing area. Try to go early in the morning.

Great views. The clock was on our 'to see' list and we were thrilled to enjoy the festive mood of the throng of people looking at it. There were 2 weddings being photographed as well. We walked up the spiral staircase to the top of the tower and marvelled at the sites of the city to be seen from there.

The one everyone talks about.... Seemed like everyone I mentioned Prague to asked me about this clock - I had never heard of it before so am clearly not very well informed.There is no denying that it is interesting and attractive but to be honest once you have seen it for a few minutes then that is enough. Luckily the clock is located in the Old Town Square, which is a large area with plenty to see and do and some decent (though probably slightly more costly) places to sit outside and eat. This means that you don't have to make a special visit just to see the clock (and maybe be disappointed) and you can also wait until the crowds thin out to get a better look yourself.

Fun!!!. The clock puts up a show on the hour--I think the one around 11am is the best and most complete. It's super complicated to figure out how to read the clock, but it's very fun watching the show. Be sure to keep a close eye on your belongings...You can climb the old town tower or take the elevator then get a panorama view of Prague--land of red roofs. It's worth the climb, since you also get a good view of the old town square!

Let down. The astronomical clock was quite a let down. I joined the crowd just before noon to watch the figurines appear. They were very sorry figures. The entire show was over very quickly and the collective voice of the crowd said, "that's it?". It definitely needs some renovation and restoration.
So-what time is it?. See it, watch the 30 second show. watch your wallet. and be amazed it was built in the 1400s. But keep your expectations low.

An amazing clock. We made our way to Old Town Hall to view the Astronomical Clock -- a must see in Prague. We found an outdoor cafe with a view of the clock. My husband went to the top of the clock and had a magnificant view of the city. A must see.

Watch youself. The square and Astronomical clock are fun to see, but in the busy squares watch your wallet and ladies watch you hand bags. The pickpockets are notorious in the squares and on the trolley. Zip your purses and carry them with the zipper forward. Men, please don't carry your wallet in your back pocket.

Going up the tower is a must!. The Clock is undeniably lovely but the little show that happens on the hour is a bit anticlimactic. It's something that has to be seen while in Prague however, but don't bother gathering around it for ages like some people do – go get some Trdelnik and come back! Going up the tower however is brilliant and you get a great view from the top, seeing Tyn Church from that angle is breathtaking. It's equipped with a lift too so no effort required. Very much worth the 100kc for sure.
Great Views from the top. Enjoyed visiting the clock, walked to the top of the tower although there was a lift available. Spent ages at the top admiring the views and taking photos.

you will find suddenly a good crowd in prague. what a place small place surrounded by beautiful architecture, good and fine dining places, number of people performing various activities for tourists, can have quick and lot of photographs. this place is lively in prague

Tell person who issues tickets for tower to liven up. We recommend to go up tower as the view is amazing but, the guy who you buy tickets from is very rude and grabs money from your hand. He is literally the most rudest person I have ever met, I hate stating anything bad about anybody but he is unbelievable and should be sacked as he is not a people person.sorry

It all happens on the hour!. So,you want the time ,the date and the astrological sign? This 600year old jobbie gives it all to you.And ,on the hour, you get a procession of the apostles,too.It's like a big cuckoo clock on steroids

Nice views. The place is worth the (paid) visit, the site from above is very nice, the place is always full of people. Visit it around by the end of the day and wait to enjoy the visit and sight of Prague at night.

Worth a look. Fight your way to the front of a huge throng of people on the hour to watch the mechanical figures wheel out. It's a nice sight, and one that should be on your check-list, but don't be expecting something too grand, especially compared to the amount of spectators! To get a good look at the clock, which is lovely, aim to avoid anything up to 15 minutes before the hour- the crowd begins to gather early.

A place to see and be seen!. This is what Europe is all about. A massive town square overlooked and ringed by architecturally magnificent buildings. If you don't like crowds, then don't go. This place is popular. The clock faces south, I believe. So, make sure you are on the right side to see the hourly performance. (Top of each hour)

Must See - try to get a good spot from the cafe opposite. Beautiful experience. Beware of pickpockets though as it can get really crowded below. Only thing we would have done differently is go to the grand cafe opposite to the clock and get a place upstairs so you can see the apostles walk from a higher elevation.

Nice, but.... I guess this is one of the attractions that must be visited. However, I felt massively disappointed when the hour struck - it was kind of anticlimatic. But maybe this clock is not for everyone...

Crowded but pleasant. Old town is so wonderful to see with a great variety of architecture within the plaza. Everyone raves of the clock, so don't be disappointed if the major ceremony of the clock does not meet your anticipated entertainment event.
a must do. a must do when in Prague, we visit for the Christmas market and the crowds were huge, but a lot to see and do

Best view, great for pictures. This old tower is much better than the tv tower. Great open view. A little crowded but worth visiting. Instead of taking the elevator take the stairs and have your camera ready for great pictures.
Lovely place. I just couldn't leave that place any more. If the weather allows it, make sure to stay on one of the terraces in the market and enjoy lovely viewes of the square.

Lovely!!. A wonderful area, make sure you charge your camera, its picturesque to the point of disbelief. Also make sure you take two walks past the astronomical clock, because its incredible to see day and night. (Also at night the crowds were less)

Loved the Clock. Beautiful clock. Go early before the hour to secure a good viewing point. The evening viewing is less crowded. It's amazing to read about the history of the clock and the surrounding square. Grab a coffee in one of the many cafes and take it all in!

Interesting. Interesting tour, there's also a tour to undergrounds which is even more interesting.
As for watch, it's better to see them ringing from outside.

Wonderful! Spectacular!. So much to see and take in , all in one square..... Don't forget your camera! ... Fantastic Architecture, great market, music, buskers, good restaurants , just relax take it all in.... Not to be missed.!,

Definite WOW.. We walked to the top in the evening of our first night in the city. WOW. Beautiful view. I did not realize the history before I purchased the informational brochure. It costs a small fee to walk to the top but it is worth every cent.
A must see. Every hour on the hour the clock comes alive. Very interesting but gets very busy. Avoid peak times or arrive 15~20 minutes before the hour

Great Views of the Old Town. Really like that they have lifts right to the top and the great views, plus there are information boards at the viewing platform for all of the important buildings you can see. Can get very busy though and it can be a pain if others stand in one place for too long as the platform is narrow, although it is a one way system which is good. Price is reasonable.
Great Atmosphere. The entertainment, sights, food, tourists make this a great place to go to. The evenings were warm and dry the result was a lovely time.

Stunning to see and amazing skills to create. We visited this attraction several different times during our stay. To absorb the craftsmanship of the clock is best done before 9.00am and the crowds arrive, however to watch the clocks activities as it chimes on the hour is worthwhile even with lots of people surrounding you.Well worth the time to see and appreciate the workmanship of the era.

Highlight of the Old Town. The astronomical clock is not to be missed. The skill of the clock maker all those centuries ago is outstanding, and you must be there for the performance. We were fortunate to get a table at a restaurant right opposite, and sat in the sun watching people jostling for a view.
love hourly performance. Structure is very old and perhaps needs better restoration but hourly performance on tower makes it interesting enough to stick around. Entry fee for going on to top tower.

Wonderful views. The view from the top of the tower on a clear day is wonderful. For those who are not fit, it is possible to get two lifts which almost get you to the top (there's a little spiral staircase for the last bit). One direction has a view over the city towards the castle, and the other has a perfect view of the spires of the Tyn church, and all the goings-on in the Old Town Square. A trumpeter serenades in each direction after the clock strikes the hour during the day.

Check out!. You will undoubtedly be in this area close to the hour so make sure to gather around the clock about 5 minutes prior. It gets busy. Fun "cuckoo clock" type show that lasts maybe a minute. Then after climb the steps to the top of the tower. Great view of the city!

History AND practicality!. To get to the Old Town Hall and this wondrous astronomical clock literally walks you through history. The Tower housing the Clock preceded it by about 150 years: the clock itself dates from 1490. The Old Town Hall sufferred massive damage in WWII but, as with so many other things in this beautiful city, the restoration not only of the original but of all the surrounding buildings has been meticulous in restoring the authenticity of the surrounds and the sense that you are experiencing living history. The elaborately gilded and presented Clock parades the 12 Apostles on the hour every hour between 0900 and 2100, so be sure to obtain the best vantage point for your photography before the immense crowds gather to witness this special and unique presentation. Why is it so much better than a similar display in Munich? Because Prague's is also astronomically correct, it has scenes of life in each of the 12 calendar months portrayed in the lower disc, and it has the relevant zodiac sign also highlighted. It is something to behold and, in the splendour of the Old Town Square itself, will create an indelible impression on you. The Tower housing the Clock can also be climbed (fee payable) to give you some truly special views over the Old Town ("Stare Mesto").

Beautiful medieval town hall & Clock tower. We loved the town hall with its own character. Thousands throng in front of the clock tower every hour to see the clock striking & the beautifully craved characters coming out to wish. I felt privileged to see such a spectacle of history repeat itself seamlessly until this day and age.

supper buildings. had been on a walking tour we had arranged and started in this area and i must say in the day time its lovely but at nights its amazing love the architecture of the buildings and even more so light up at night
Wow!. The view from the top is phenomenal. The clock itself is a sight to see. Definitely worth a visit. It was fun to see all the brides too.

As good as everyone says it is - the only astonomical clock I've seen. I'm not into clocks or anything, but this one is pretty darned neat. Make sure to go near an hour so yo see the movements of the characters as it chimes. Sit at a cafe for a coffee or meal while you wait. There are some right in front of the clock. Or wander the rest of Old Town Square while you wait.

I agree with the clock being disappointing. Waited with hundreds of others to see the clock on the hour. Yes for how old it is it is a feat, but I was disappointed. My husbands however was not. I guess it is just what you have set your expectations for. The square was very pretty though and I enjoyed walking around it.
Original. A lot of streets give you there and it's a show you've never forget to visit. Every hour, you can hear a music to advise that it's o'clock and the clock becomes alive.

Clock was a bit of a disappointment. Worth a look as the clock is very intricate but we found the show to be a bit of a let down. The market place is fantastic though for lunch or a snack in the afternoon when wanting to keep warm. Great stalls with very interesting gifts.

Astronomical clock an amazing piece of horology. Many people used to Hollywood special effects are disappointed by what they see. But our guide Callum of Prague Royal Walk Free Tour made it clear that what we were seeing was remarkable 15th century technology in clock making. That explanation with the accompanying story about the horrible treatment by the merchants of the clock maker made teh visit very interesting.

Fascinating. Crowds gather every hour to witness the workings of this extraordinary clock that is very difficult to read as a timepiece but has many other features.The last show is at 10pm so don't wait for the 11pm show there isn't one.Also you can pay to go inside and have great views of the city or chose to have cofee on the terrace of the hotel U Prince for similar views.
What fun!!. The clock is charming - the view from the Tower is great. It is a great place to people watch!! Watched the clock go off many times during our 3 days in Prague. A must see when in town.

Amazing engineering feat in the time. It was amazing to see the intricacies of this clock in Old Town Square. To think that they had the talent and skill to put this together in the 15th century. Every hour on the hour there is an amazing couple minutes of different parts moving and dancing etc. I think it stops after 9pm I heard....definitely worth the stop on the hour.
fairy tale. it was very cool to watch the clock ringing,you must visit the astronomical clock if you go to Prague it's fantastic to have this experience

ASTRONOMICAL CLOCK. A really fun experience, but beware that it only operates until 600PM.Another point is the huge numbers of tourists that suddenly appear 5 minutes before the hour and are oblivious of anyone else in the area, particularly the Oh My Gosh ones.

Astronomical clock: A tad underwhelming. We haven't been up the tower, so this review is solely on the astronomical clock.You will probably walk past it several times during your stay in Prague, and I think it looks pretty cool. It chimes on the hour and every visitor "should" probably at least once join the crowd and watch it go off.The whole spectacle only lasts a minute, two minutes tops. The figurines on the inside to I think three loops, so if I remember correctly there's three or four different figurines, that's it. Given that it doesn't cost anything it's ok to go see, but if I were super short on time (eg if you only have one day in Prague or so) I wouldn't waste much time waiting for it or plan my day around it.The old town itself is spectacular, though.

A trip to Medieval Times. The whole old town in Prague is excellent, but the center of the old town is the Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock, which is really breathtaking, especially when the clock strucks e.g 12 o'clock and 12:30, because statues come out of the cathedral and strike the bell! Also, the old astronomical clock which naturally still works as long as there is sun, is a special spectacle. I recommend these sites, and Prague in general. If you haven't been there still, program it for your next trip.

Worth seeing. The astronomical clock is definitely worth seeing and a work of art. Make sure you arrive early to get good views of the figures on the hour. Also be aware of pickpockets especially at this attraction.
A must see in Prague. Chimes on the hour. Get there early so you can see the figures that move when the upper doors open. It gets really crowded.

Definitely worth going up. When you visit the old town square, you will find this rather interesting astronomical clock. There are animations on the clock tower on the hour which were interesting, but probably not worth waiting for if you happen to arrive on the half hour as you may be disappointed.What is definitely worth doing however is going up the actual tower for 200CZK. The views over the city are amazing and you'll get to view what amazing architecture the entire city has.You'll also get to learn more about the history of the astronomical clock tower as you climb the stairs up (elevator option also available) if you're interested).The tower is especially worth going up if you enjoy photography as unlike most towers with nice views, this one isn't actually covered by glass or plastic so you can actually take some really nice photos.
Magnificient. Beautiful monument. The evenings are overflowing with tourists. Loved the vibrant atmosphere there. Beware of pick pockets in this area as its known for pick pocketing.
Unique clock. The old town hall was a very interesting place and that astronomical clock was very unique. Definitely a place that should be seen while in Prague.
A must see. What an interesting clock. Get there early to get a good spot when it chimes as it gets VERY crowded. In a good location around the old town square area.

Very ancient with interesting history.. I recommend going with a good guide to really appreciate the workings of the astronomical clock and to learn the history of the old town. Keep you wallet and valuables well secured, there are a lot of pick pockets and hustlers in Prague.

Fabulous View!. It was worth both the money and the climb to the top of the tower for a stunning view of Prague. It can be crowded, so we waited until just before the top of the hour when everyone else was waiting to watch the clock and made our way up quickly to the top. Coming down, we saw a long line to come up!

see it to believe it. this was a wonderful experience. Every hour the clock chimes , little figures move around the windows, a skeleton figure rings the bell and then a bugler sounds at the top of the bell tower.

A Great Experience. What a lovely location. Wait till you see the clock work at the top of the hour. Lovely restaurants nearby. Especiall the Hard Roack Cafe, where I found the best Brownies! A truly dream place with history of the middle ages

Interesting clock to see. This was interesting. Located right in the Town Square.We walked all the way up to the top, and looked over the town Sqare from the top.Never realized how touristy Prague is.
Have to see it!. It lasts but a few minutes, but the event is worth the crowds. Funn, silly and oh so historic. Worth the time
meet here. Great little show every hour on the hour. Also a great meeting place and to see the craftsmanship of yesteryear.

Try and visit early..... as its very busy as its such a popular area. Worth a visit. A good place to people watch as so much is happening. Plenty are showing off their talents...singing/playing instruments etc

A Prauge Absolute Must!. Hang around Old Town, watch the Clock, look for all the little things that happen, try to stay clear of the huge crowds that will usually gather to watch. Its a great area to have a beer, yet it is also one of the most expensive since beer can be cheap in Prague...and really some of the best beer in the world. Also great to walk to the bridge. Amazing place!
Great way to spend an evening. Plaza in the area around the clock--lots of local craft, food and drink booths. Performances by local entertainers. Great way to spend the evening.
Great but too crowded. Wonderful view but no one was directing people so it was very hot and frustrating. Love the architecture and all the red roofs.

Don't miss the view from the top of the tower!. Learn the history of the clock by walking to the top - or, take the elevator and walk down, learning about the clock and its constructtion.Lovely views of Old Towne Square from the tower.Outdoor restaurants across from the clock where you can enjoy lunch and watch the clock on the hour!
Awesome piece of engineering. If you go to praga please take some minutes to see this clock. This clock has a lot more functions that you will imagine and also a great history related.

Perfect Views Over Praha. A great place to spend an hour or so looking over the great city of Prague. From the tipity top you can see for miles and miles on a clear day and enjoy a fantastic panoramic view of Praha. When deciding from the clock, be sure to run down the rickety staircase which takes you to the lift to get to the bottom. I'm sure it's not allowed but why not indulge your inner child?Grab an ice cream from a vendor outside the tower and see the clock from outside.
Love it still. This was my second visit to Prague and the Astronomical clock still delights me. Look out for the skeleton that rings the bell

A must see if you are in Prague. As we planned for our trip to Prague we were told that the Astronomical Clock in Old Town was a must see and we were not disappointed. Our first time at the clock was at noon and we enjoyed the "show", but we did not really think it was a "must see". Our second visit to the clock swiftly changed our minds. The hourly "show" at the clock is quaint, but the MUST SEE is the view from the top!! If you do nothing else in Prague, you should see the view from the top of the clock. 360 degrees of the city in all it's glory. If you are not into heights, you may find it a bit disturbing as the observation ledge is open with about a waist-high wall. But if you are fine with it, be sure to step out on the corners and look down on the Old Town Square.
Amazing. Definitely worth waiting for. We wandered around a bit, and got back just in time... amazed. Spectacular artist...
Must visit!. We loved the views from the top of the tower! I would recommend going there early to avoid long lines. The elevator shaft also looked interesting top-down.

Amazing clock however glad we can rely on a wristwatch!. Lot's of people for this hourly show but unlike other places in the city where it the crowds impacted your appreciation, someone the crowds here seemed part of the festivity. Watch for wedding parties! Because the clock is in the Town Hall evidently a lot of people go there to be married. We saw four different couples while we waited for the clock!The clock was created in the 14th century but heavily destroyed in WW II so much of the clock today is a reconstruction. The clock keeps time in Bohemian and modern time; shows the times of sunrise and sunset. In the 19th century the circle below shows the signs of the zodiac, scenes from the seasons and a ring of saint's names, one for each day of the year. The show is over very quickly but is fun. Watch the skeleton which represents death; and the doors open above the top ring. After the show the hour is rung but depending upon when you go, the time may be wrong as it doesn't recognize daylight savings time! Be sure to climb the Town Hall Tower as it gives a great view of Old Town and helps orient you to the rest of Prague. The cost is nominal (60 Kc - about $3.00) and can be reached by an entrance to the right of the Astronomical Clock. There is an elevator.

Avoid the crowds!. The Astronomical Clock draws in unbelievably huge crowds as hundreds of tourists wait in front of it in anticipation of the "show" that happens every hour, which really isn't that impressive and is probably the most overrated thing to see in Prague. However, the Astronomical Clock itself is very beautiful and has some interesting history behind it, and the great views from the top of the tower are well worth the climb (but there is also a lift that takes you up)To fully appreciate this unique clock, try to come here early in the morning to avoid the crowds!
Orjol clock. Be on time to get great possibility to see the Orloj clock. You will not be there alone so be aware that there is lot of other tourist too.

Beautiful clock, beautiful square, 'show' unimpressive. The square is a must visit, I even think the clock is a must see, however the 'show' on the hours is unimpressive. I would recomed seeing it at least once, but don't be surprised if you don't get the hype. Go early in the day 8 or 9 am to avoid crowds or get a table at one of the resturants right infront and enjoy an overpriced beer.

Pearl Anniversary. Draws a big crowd, and applause, for the hourly operation of the clocks figures. My favourite was death ringing his/her bell. We went up the tower and were rewarded with great views across the city towards the castle and of the square below.

Really cool. It is definitely a site to see! The "show" that happens every hour on the hour is not all that exciting but I would definitely stick around to see it once. There are massive crowds during this, so just be aware of your surroundings. All in all a really cool piece.
Beautiful Architecture. The square is filled with beautiful buildings and the most exquiste architecture. TheAstronomical clock was something to behold!!
unusual. the clock is beautiful to watch its so unusual causr its in the main square its near lots of bars and cafes

Nothing special. So you are in the area at the hour any way and there are crowds of people in front of it so you wait and watch.......and on the hour surprise surprise a bell strikes and figures go round and appear at the windows cameras flash and that's it. Nice to say you have seen it but don't wait forever as it is not that special.

Cool show, nice story. It's not breathtaking but it's pretty cool, to watch the little show that they put up, and hear about the story as well.
10min stop and go
Beautiful area!. You can't miss this area. It is beautiful, and very lively. Shops, restaurants and lots of history. You won't regret it.

Beautiful old clock with a little movement each hour. Lovely ornate clock which is a must to see. If you use the stairs in the tower then you can read more details about it. But if you just want to look, then be there on the hour with the crowds (watch your bags). The actual clock movement is minimal so dont expect too much. The Grand Hotel just opposite has rooms that look onto the clock.
keeping time. This was an interesting clock. A large crowd gathered to see & here the music on the hour. If you want a closer look its worth spending time here.
Clock. Not as good as expecting, interesting none the less. Fantastic underground bar/restaurant just opposite, definitely worth a visit

Cute clock. We tried a few times to see this and kept missing it because we were looking at something else - make sure you get there early and stand patiently or you wont see much as so many people wait, its very quick though but lovely to see
Astro Clock is beautiful. Do not miss taking a look at this. Good luck reading it but it is just stunning! The colours and detail exceptional!
Good place to meet & Eat. I don't think I could add to the compliments already bestowed on this tourist attraction. Nothing to dislike and the atmosphere in the square is brilliant.

prague. You must see the Astronomical clock. We were there in December and the christmas market was there. There was lots of tourists and you can spend the whole day there. There is lots of restaurants and shops. Great fun!

Astronomical clock Prague. Opposite the clock is a nice cafe. Go upstairs and find a window seat. You will then be immediately opposite the clock face. Enjoy a delicious coffee with a high calorie pastry and watch the clock on the hour. Amazing piece of old technology.

A stunning piece of mechanics. We were stunned by the beauty of this clock - though as others have said, it gets very busy around the hour, so keep an eye on your belongings!We stopped by here again later with a guide, who explained how the clock is read, and there's also a booklet for sale upstairs in the Old Town Hall at the entrance to the tower (pass through the red tourist information office a few doors down) if you are interested in knowing how it works. If you do climb the tower, there's lots of information about the clock and those involved with it along the ramp to/from the top.
It's Cool. You can see the medieval show every hour on the hour. The little skeleton rings the bell and the saints come marching by! Really a marvel in its time.
Stunning. Must see, the atmosphere is incredible, always busy no matter what time of day. The clock is amazing!

Nice. Not the best of Prague. The clock is nice and worth your time. We didn't see the hour changing because we just pass by but even so is good for taking some pictures. You have to be quick for it.The around the clock area is wheelchair friendly.

Try and get a guided tour of the inside.. Although the town hall looks OK from the outside, you are really missing out if you don't try and get a peek inside. Normally the only part you can see inside is the tower, but we were lucky enough to get on a guided tour of the inside and it was wonderful. The tours only run 2 or 3 times a week and so you have to book beforehand, but you get to see a much more fasinating side of history than you would just outside with a guide. We also got to see parts of the Hall that are not open to the general public including the cellars, meeting rooms and inside the clock where the little figures are before they pop out. The tour ends at the tower which is worth the climb if you can manage it. It really was one of the highlights of our visit.

Get there early. Every hour the square fills completely to see the clock strike the hour. You wold probably have to go two or three times to see everything this clock does. Because of the tight area nd number of people be watchful for pick pockets.

Take a guide. Either take a guide or read in detail before to go to the clock. Theres a lot of significance you'll miss otherwise. Lovely town hall, and interesting clock, lots of food and drink around.

Really nice. I went to see the inside of the the Old town Hall. There are tours to see the ceremonial hall & the underground. Nothing of particular interest, just 4 or 5 rooms. Afterwards there is the underground which is visitable only through the tour. Then I went up the clock tower. Good views of the old square. The first part of the ascent is with a lift, then it's just walking. Not that hard to go up, although. On the whole, the tour of the interiors isn't that great. There are much better elsewhere. I would suggest to skip it, just going up the tour for some great views
Astronomical Clock. Wow - don't forget to wait for the hour - apostles and bell ringing skeleton - today there was a trumpeter at the top - so cool!

Clock is amazing.. The clock is amazing but don't ask me to use it to tell the time.:-) so different. It was very busy at that part of the square when it was about the strike the hour as everyone wanted to see what happened. Didn't have time to climb the tower but will definitely do it next time.

Awesome clock. Really cool to see such an old clock still working. I don't know why everyone crowds around it because there isn't much to see. The apostles are a little hard to see and the "show" lasts like 30 seconds. But I guess you gotta see it! Looks awesome

wait for a cookcoo and nothing happens. we stopped to have a drink by the clock as there were people waiting for it to strike past the hour mark and nothing happened when it did (well we didn't see anything)

A piece of history...but remember, it's HISTORY.. I've been obsessed with this clock since, well - since I knew it existed. That being said, anything - and I mean ANYTHING - that this clock does beyond the "telling time" function is going to be gold-plated for me. However, there are tourists who go to Prague (my husband being one of them) and have no idea what this clock thing is or why it's important. Then the clock strikes the hour aaaand...some little figures appear and a skeleton rings a bell and the display is over. I don't know if I should be sad that at every hour a HUGE group of people stand in front of the clock (standing room only, please!) and get disappointed after the display or that I should be happy that this piece of history that a lot of people don't even know about is now getting noticed. They offer tours of the tower all the way to the top, which offers the most AMAZING views of the surrounding countryside, so please - spend that additional 7 EUR or $5 or whatever your denomination is and see the amazing views and the walk through history!
Tough on neck!. Could not quit figure out the clock but that's Okay. Saw the apostles and the rooster. I'm easy to please. Its a should see.The story behind the clock is a good one.

Go early if you want to go to the top!. Clock tower is gorgeous and attracts huge crowds at the bottom to watch the hourly display. We chose to also climb the tower (220 Kc for family of 4) which is worth doing as the views are fantastic. We were luck as we happened to go early just as the crowds were building - after which the queues inside the tower (where you can't see them from the street) are phenomenal. Is very cramped and can only move one way around the tower with very limited space for people to queue. As we left the queue was backed up down the spiral staircase and moving VERY slowly. Definitely worth seeing but go early!

Clock is fascinating - see it with the Old Town Square. I loved the history of the clock as well as the beauty of it. Still not sure I understand completely how it works. But don't get overly stressed about seeing it at the "top of the hour" - yes it does have some movement then but it's pretty minimal. And there will be major crowds at each top of the hour. At other times you can more easily see the clock and take pictures of it. I recommend sitting for a coffee in one of the restaurants directly across from it just before the hour so you can see the movement without having to fight the crowd.

Huge crowds, but interesting. You can't do much about the hoards of people. Luckily, the clock tower is up high enough so that you can see it with all the people milling around. It was nicer to go to at night, just to see the lighting and people watch.
Fantastic place. Worth spending some time there. You must have a good guide to know all about the clock. A must see. We had a great guide that gave us a lot of info.
Worth seeing. It was good but try to go there near the struck of the hour if you don't want to wait around for the next hour.

It's a must too because they say so. It's a must because EVERYONE says so. You stand around, watch the clock and by the time you blink or recover from everyone else camera flashes, it's over. It's old, survived wars so it's a must. Just not high on my list of GOTTA DO in Praha.

Definitely a must see. If you are in Prague, don't miss this! It gets a little crowded when the clock chimes but the town square has a lot going for it with the different style architecture and all of the outdoor cafes.

Iconic. This clock is the icon of Prague and Czech Republic, please do not miss it. Before visiting it (if you are not with a guide) you should probably read about it a little bit so you can understand how it works and how to look for the time on the clock (or you can just raise your head a little bit higher and see the normal, regular clock above) because the beauty of it lies in its story and its amazing mechanism, do not expect too much on the Clock show because really, it is short and there is nothing much to see.For those who are not really interested in astronomy, mechanism and history, it is still an incredibly beautiful artwork that you can admire and take picture with. Try to be early in the morning if you want a good picture, the clock show is at 9 am and finish at 11 pm, it will always be crowed around the clock in this period.
Shake the Bones. Clock is a somewhat tired and overworked version of town clocks you've seen elsewhere. Watch the reactions not the clock. Folks are still waiting.
Astronomical Clock. Real amazing it still works and works right.... Difficult to understand how could they make such a mechanical device which works so accurately even now

Astronomical Clock. The clock was interesting to see. If I had more information on it, I might have been more interested. It was fun walking around the square but nothing spectacular. Perhaps if I had more of an appreciation of history.
Must see. Free audioguide at the entrance on the 3rd floor to download via bluetooth - don't miss it. Nice panorama from the tower to city.

Underground tour. We enjoyed this tour. Our guide Ava was very informative although she did speak great English did not always understand us. She showed us under the town hall and had very nice manner and was very helpful in taking photos etc.

Amazing. A guide talked us through how the astronomical clock worked. I wanted him to repeat the whole thing over again! It is just amazing to see such intricate design and think this has been in use since the 1300s I think they said.

Interesting but not a must visit!. Our guide was a nice young lady. The showed everything, told some nice stories and we ended up between the fundaments of the building. Nice, but that's it. Clock from the inside is far from special.

Lovely views. Part of the OldTown Square, the astronomical clock strikes every hour and hosts a mini puppet show. If you want a great view, directly in front of the clock is best to see the full potential. The crowds were not too busy when we went but as people are close together and are watching the clock they can be caught unaware by pickpockets - as always be mindful of your belongings. To go into the town hall, you need to purchase tickets (around 100CZK). This, however, did not allow you admittance to everything and some of the rooms inside needed further payment. In the town hall, you can either walk up the steps or get the lift to the top & see some fantastic views of Prague. If you walk up the steps, there is lots of information about the clock & it's history.

right in the centre of prague. located right in the centre of prague, this is an easy thing to tick off the list. a little ''show'' happens on the hour where a little puppet type thing pops out of the clock a couple of times. there are lots of bar crawl reps around here so prepare to be hounded if you're young, i'd still recommend one though as it's a great way to meet like minded tourists out for a good time.

Right place in right time. Old Town and also Astronomical Clock was very fascinating. I strongly recommend everyone to go up to the clock tower to see the panaroma of Prague.(as i remember, tickets were not so expensive). If you are lucky to see the Clock on time(or to be on the top of the Clock tower like me), it will be an enjoyable moment for you. Moreover, if you have a chance to visit Prague around the Christmas time, you can see the dynamic side of Old Town with street fair, colorful pine trees & crowds, street entertainments, cafes and bars with full of people.

One of the most popular attactions I've ever seen.. The clock is several hundred years old and on the hour some of the 'statues' on the building come to life. Again keep an eye on your pockets and hand bags as a very large crowd appears when the clock chimes.

A long wait for a short experience. Old Town Square is architecturally beautiful. If you happen to be there close to the hourly "clock" viewing then hang around. Don't even try to take pictures of the parading characters in the clock. Just enjoy it and buy a nice postcard.

Entertainment on Time!. Our guide made sure our group was in the Square, ready and waiting before three o'clock. Then everything happened like clockwork: figures popped in and out, rang bells and moved around and it was a lovely entertainment. Again, huge crowds made it difficult for those of us who are not tall to see well and to take good photographs, but the experience was certainly entertaining.The guide had already warned us, though, to be careful of pick-pockets in the crowd. Our good guide then purchased tickets for us to ascend the Tower, thankfully by elevator, and the view of Prague's rooftops was wonderful. It was a little scary, though, that some of our group insisted that they could feel the tower swaying under the weight of all the tourists up there!

Entertaining.. The old town hall and astronomical clock are a must-see. We timed our visit to see the clock "on the hour" after the chiming and automina display, a trumpeter appeared at the upper balcony. The square has great views all round. There are several cafes and bars as well as street food sellers. There was a jazz band entertaing the crowd when we visited.
Clock. Lovey clock but bait disappointed when it chims but it was nice. And you an go to the top with lovely views from it

Lovely clock but disappointed. Went to the square to look at the clock waited 10 minutes for the clock to hit two pm, At two pm the lock chimed twice but he characters did not come out of the lock it was very disappointing.

Nice show. Went to Prague in the beginning of July and the city was packed!! Got at the square at 10:45 am, positioned myself nearby the clock and waited for the 11:00 am "Show". There were so many people, there was even a wedding going on! But it was worth it. The show is very nice!!!

THE Clock. Best clock in the world! Make sure you show up 5 minutes before the tolling of the bell. Also, very important, IF you are taking video, get right in front of the clock and hold the camera very steady. You would be wise to watch youtube before you shoot to know what to focus on.

Decide if Five minutes is worth the crowds. As this is on everyone's must see list, the crowds are large. The actual clock movement only takes less than five minutes. The figures do not come out but rotate within the clock opening..To stand and wait for an hour in order to get a good spot depends on your time . Be mindful of your wallet and pocketbook as the crowds are large!
Amazing clock. The oldest working clock in the world from what I learned. An amazingly ancient and charming clock . The townhall and this clock are quite a sight .

Town hall- great, Tower - Overcrowded. The town hall operates the visit with a mandatory guided tour which is very interesting. The tour is almost an hour long. The clock tower is just an accident waiting to happen. There is an enclosure on the top with a door that goes out to the 4-sided balcony. You can walk up to the top of the tower or a lift goes right up. This system of human traffic is poorly organised. There is very limited space atop the tower's waiting area but the lift keep sending the crowd up plus those that walk up causing the waiting area to be packed whilst people in the balcony are staying long to take pictures or just pushing to move through. Seriously avoid this place if you have very small children, have difficulty with mobility or is claustrophobic. My experience is in summer where the whole of Prague is besieged by tourists, perhaps it'll be better outside of summer. The view on the top is great but manoeuvrability was so bad we didn't go all around it.

Clock is very cool with nice surprise at the end. There will be huge crowds of people hanging out around 10-15 minutes before each hour to see the clock chime and all kinds of very cool things happen as you watch the clockNice surprise at the end - worth seeing one time
A true cultural landmark. A still working clock of this age is truly worth seeing. It still looks great and is a must - see while in Prague.

Good view from the top!. We bought a prague card so decided to go up the old town hall tower to get a panaroma view of the old town. One major plus for the tower is there is a lift to take you to the top! No need to walk up the stairs unless you want to do it! We have been up quite a few towers and cathedral during out trip so getting to the top without the hard effort is pretty refreshing. Once up top, you get a pretty good view of the city. Most of the main buildings in the area are explained on some nice information board on the tower. You will be offered a panaroma map of the area on your way up too. It cost a bit but is a good sourvenir. If you are just after the information of the buildings, then don't bother buying it as the information board offers more info. We spent about 20 minutes up on the tower before coming back down using the stairs which went around the lift. On the way down you get a lot of information about the astronomical clock. Time your visit well so that you can be back down on the hour mark to watch the astronomical clock. We didn't do the museum tour as it needs to be a guided tour and english tours are scheduled on certain hours so check on the time if you plan to visit the museum. Overall, a good place to visit and probably a must see when you are in Prague. Can't really miss it unless you are not in the old town at all as it is right there in the town square!

great for admiring buildings. We saw the clock strike the hour which was nice but not long and almost little dissapointing afterwards. The area surrounding was lovely and we enjoyed a celtic sounding band playing in the square whilst we enjoyed delicious cooked ham ( gammon)

Amazing!!. This is an incredible work of art and ingenuity! The amazing part is not what the clock does when it moves on the hour but rather the fact that this astrological clock is older then the founding of the US and still functions and accurately tells the time, month, season and sign all at once! Anyone who says its underwhelming does not get the historical achievement!
Phenomenal design. We loved the astronomical clock and walked by many times. Stand with the crowd and listen to it ring. It's very intricate and lovely workmanship. Don't miss it!
fully restored clock. The clock looks great...caught it right before one pm.I have no dislikes to report on the clock. I likedeverything.

Definate one of the top things to do whilst in Prague. Fascinating clock, very pretty to see. Great views from the top, for a very small fee. On every hour a trumpeter plays from the top tower. Even bought a mini replica clock for my home. Worth seeing for sure.

Listened to all the hype...I was disappointed. Every guide book and person who's been to Prague says "go and see the astronomical clock, you can't go to Prague and not see it." So I went. I was so underwhelmed. To say everyone raves about it, it really isn't much to look at. It's not as impressive as everyone says.

Wow!. We were just going through the small streets, and at some point this big square shows up with a huge astronomical clock! Makes an impression:) clock is beautiful! i was mad I couldnt take nice pictures with my camera;/ (not enough pixels)...square took our breaths away! went there several times because it looks amazing:) and can assure everyone, it is astonishing at night!:)

wonderful place to people watch. A great place to sit and let the world go by. The Astronomical clock draws in the crowds as it strikes the hour with mechanical models upon the clock playing a tune. You can also watch the street entertainers.

Nice but very crowded.. It's very annoying that the typical tourists pushing each other just to see the clock. Although most of them haven't got a clue about any history. I think it's a bit overrated.
Awsome. Prague is magic place.Don't miss site and when every full hour apostles came out and golden rooster sings.You can see this between 8am until 9pm.

Nice clock, especially if you bring children. The clock is a clock, so that is pretty much what it is. But it is really beautiful and definitely worth to swing by if you are in the neighbourhood. It is in the centre of the old town so it is not a detour. I think the best time to visit would be in the evening when the lights come on. Good photo opportunity.

Clock. Make sure you're at the clock on the hour, to see the clock working, and then watch and listen to the trumpet man at the top. Make a visit to the top to see the lovely sights around Prague too.
Beautiful but crowded. As many of tourist places in Old Town, this is also fulfilled with tourist. If you want to avoid it, go there later in the evening.

The clock is underwhelming- the real treat is taking the tour to see the interior. The clock itself isn't all that impressive. Be smarter than most of the tourists that watch the clock and leave. Take the guided tour inside the old town hall and you'll see some fantastic paintings and beautiful rooms. Then they'll take you down into the underground rooms and tunnels from the 12th century. They were used as storerooms and a prison and are really really interesting. I also paid $20 to take a "Prague Underground Tour" and the underground I saw on my $5 town hour tour was better.

worth 5 minutes, but disappointing. Its something to do for five minutes if you are in the Square on the hour eating an ice cream A happy crowd stands and waits, and then you get a few seconds of hard to see movement of the skeleton and figures.
A must see in Old Town. The Astronomical Clock is lovely. The crowds do tend to gather and can be a bit overwhelming, but it is worth the visit.

Amazing views from the tower. While most people have said the astronomical clock itself is overrated, you should still stop by on the hour and watch the clock do its little song and dance. It is not all that impressive (especially with the kinds of technology we have now) but it's pretty cool considering the fact that the clock was built in 1410. Even if you miss the clock strike on the hour, it's still worth climbing to the top of the tower to see the views of the city. There is an elevator inside that can take you right to the top, or you can walk up a ramp that spirals all the way up. On all four sides you get an amazing view.
astronomical clock. make sure you get a good spot on the hour as the square becomes very busy and the cafes fill up. it is well worth seeing.

Working piece of antique art!. I was amazed at the beauty of the clock and that it was built so very long ago. It is one more symbol of Prague's great history. Take a stroll through Old Town and make sure you are there upon the hour.

Unique clock and magnificent views from the tower. The astronomical clock is definitely worth seeing and can't be missed as it is right on the Old Town Square. You can go up many towers in Prague but this one offers great views of the Old Town area. If you want some really good photographs, this is definitely the place to go. It is accessible by a climb up/down or by lift. The climb up the tower itself is in keeping with the historical building. This attraction appeared to be suitable for wheelchairs as the lifts were spacious and the tower climb/descent is by ramp rather than stairs if the lift option is not used. This is a good place to visit when you arrive in Prague as you can locate parts of the town from the view at the top.
Fun. Although highly over rated, We went up the tower and when you are up there, you find nice views waiting for you. It is also worth to wait for the astronomical clock rings and see its display.

Majestic Clock. This is Majestic, superb cultural experience but it's always crowded on the hour because everyone is jostling for a place close enough to the clock.It's truly majestic and an experience to savour.Better still it's better to sit in one of the outdoor Restaurant around with a cold drink or meal and enjoy every minute

Unique site. A must-see in Old Town! Go at the top of the hour, so you can see the figures move. An unexpected surprise was the fact that people get married at the court house next door, so you can often see couples leaving to the applause of the surrounding crowds. A very unique and fascinating clock.

Why Not? It's pretty Neat.. Pretty Cool looking. The Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock are right in the thick of Old Town Square. If you are going to Prague, there are only a few major tourist areas worth seeing anyway (Castle Distinct, Old Town, and Jewish Quarter). So, why not check it out? The outside is free and to go inside only costs a couple bucks. If you like the outside enough- go inside. If not, snap a picture and go grab a Trdelnik. The clock goes through it's routine hourly, so I don't really understand waiting for more than a few minutes for it, just catch it another time.

Fun but go early. This is a touristy type of event that draws a crowd so do yourself a favor and go early. Check for times. It is a fun event both whimsical and cultural. You can grab a drink or food in a nearby street cafe.

Not nearly as high up as I thought it was. Clearly a "must see" in Prague. You can't tell the time from the clock, but that doesn't stop the hordes of tourists standing there open-mouthed on the hour watching the clockworks perform. (Probably they should also watch for pickpockets!)I expected it to be about 300 feet in the air but it's only about 30 feet up - just high enough to see above all those ipads held over people's heads for the photo op.You gotta do it. But to truly enjoy the clock, go between hour:05 and hour:55.

Not so crowded experience. We left Dresden early morning then reached this important destination in Prague to see something unique and ready for close scrutiny, just saw the clock up close as the space is soon taken up, clock strikes every hour on the hour but to tell you the truth we enjoyed their beer much just second to Munich beer garden.

nice views. We went up the tower of the astronomical clock early, as soon as it was opened. Its high up and when you are up there, you find nice views waiting for you. The guy that plays the trumpet is nice.. It is also worthed to wait for the astronomical clock rings and see its display.

People watching is better than the clock. The clock itself is historic and worth seeing once, but what I found more interesting was the people watching in the square. Also saw several newlyweds take pictures in front of the clock.

You know when you expect something to be amazing....... Judging by the crowds of camera toting tourists eagerly pointing lenses at this unique piece of medieval engineering as the hour tolled, I was expecting to be amazed. It is good, but not as 'wow' as I'd expected, leaving me a little deflated.

clock was a bit of a fizzer. Dont blink or you willmiss the clock at the hour when things happen but the area of the old town is a buzz. The clock is better appreciated in the time when its not performing when tourist are not congregating.

Deserves close scrutiny. We didn't have much time to really explore the sights but the clock tower was really remarkable. There's a clock that tracks the earth's movement through all the zodiac signs and one that tracks each day of the calendar year, indicating the saints that are celebrated on each day. Amazing.

Something unique - but be prepared to jostle the crowds. If you're on the square near the hour, you cannot miss the crowds gathered to watch the little show. Great to see, but if you really want to see the clock up close, wait until just after the hourly display when the crowds leave.
Treat. Great stop on a busy day, very crowded, but managed to grab a table at the restaurant across for an amazing view
The Clock. Get there early as the space is soon taken up, clock strikes every hour on the hour, OK but nothing to write home about.
A must to see. It is in the main area of old town, never miss it especially when the bell ring in a round hour... it is amazing thing to see

Very quaint but worth seeing. Lovely aspect to a visit to he old square. Crowded at 3 pm. Hold onto your bags as pick pockets are operating in the area. But don't be concerned as long as your smart and be carefully with bags
Wait until o'clock to get a real treat. Really enjoyed seeing the 12 apostles at O'Clock and hearing the bugle being played. Also really good to hear everyone clapping after bugle finished

Clock and Tower. We enjoyed watching the astronomical clock with hundreds of others. After that we went up the elevator to the observation area on the Old Town Hall. Very worthwhile for the views. Amazing.

great view of city. One of the must see sites in the city. Great view of the Charles bridge and the churches adjacent to the square. It was very crowded as this time was the height of the tourist season.

The clock isn't all. Love the clock. From an engineering stand point it is pretty cool. The other neat thing about it is that almost anyone who is married in the town gets there photo beneath it. As a result it doesn't take long to see a bride, groom and photographer standing beneath the clock. Fun to take pictures of them being photographed. They have a great wedding time stamp. This explains all the rose petals on the ground should you come across the clock w/out a wedding couple in sight.

Nice to see but nothing special. As I read in some blog before I go, it was nice to visit the Astronomical clock during the time that apostholos appear. It was 15sec, nothing special but good atmosphere, everybody were there to see and clap hands this moment. The square is very crownd. To eat something take a look in the small streets around the squere
the old square. This is a place not to be missed. Sit at an outdoor café, have a drink and enjoy the ambience! Every hour, the clock comes alive with bell ringing and the dance of the apostles.
A show every hour. Quite the story behind this most unusual clock!! Every hour provides an entertaining show. Well worth the wait.

Quick stop. This was one of my favorite stops on our free (Sandeman's) tour of the city because it is the '2nd worst tourist destination' after the Mona Lisa. Rather than wait for the hourly show our guide gave us a hilarious reenactment and described all the different clock functions. Had I gone on my own this probably would have been a lot less memorable. But it's definitely worth stopping by, grabbing a quick photo, and moving on. Just try to avoid it near the top of the hour because it gets crowded around then.

Everybody loves it. If you are in Prague, this is "a Must" to see. All the tour guides tell it, and this is a truthMaybe not so interesting when you see what the clock can, but honestly speeking, isn´t it nice? Yes, it is precious.
stand with everyone else. Every hour on the hour, the Apostles move... It's fun watching everyone (tourists, of course) gather as the clock starts to ring in the hour.

Magic. A little tip to cheer up your mood for those who live or work nearby and have to pass the crowds waiting for the clock on the hour to get in motion: wait about 1 minute past and parade just below the clock when the cock crows. You will get all the applause from the crowds and feel like a star!

Another unigue bit for historic Prague mosaic. you are back in year 1410 and see unique clock not showing only walking apostles and other movin statues but giving you a picture about people knowledge about universe before Copernicus etc. Highly recommended to read guide or join tour group.Don´t forget to be there at " o ´clock " time .Beautifull view from top of the tower.

Take the elevator to the top. Watching the clock and listening to it is nice but the real treat is the view from the top of the tower.It gives you the perfect sight of the whole of Prague-don't miss it.
