Be sure to stick around for a few seconds after the noises stop or you miss the chicken (maybe it is a rooster). Take the time to go to the top of the tower. You buy tickets at the base of the clock but enter through the Old Town Hall. It is not expensive and it is an easy walk up ramps or you can take the elevator for no additional cost. On the way up (or down) there are informational posters on the walls that give the history and significance of the clock.

Magic Time. What a magical sight. It's awe-inspiring to think that this medieval clock is still here for us to marvel and behold. This thing is cool and huge! Seeing the astronomical clock really brings you to the realization that you are in Prague and that's an amazing feeling. The old town square is just exquisite, sort of like Brugge, and I highly recommend you stop by. Also, this where a lot of the tour groups promote and meet up. If you are like us and coming without a set agenda, this is a good spot to learn what adventures you can get yourself into.

Impressive Clock and Square. The centrepiece (well, "slightly around the corner ... piece") of the square, the Astronomical clock, is very cool. It goes off every hour, get there a few minutes beforehand - it gets very crowded with fellow tourists. Another idea is to have a drink/meal at one of the restaurants looking onto it. Look out for the chicken/cuckoo above the apostles at the end of the sequence - seems to make the crowd cheer/laugh every time. (I feel for the waiters working around it!).The rest of the square - St Gyn's church, the street performers, the national gallery and street market stalls - is lovely, and so picturesque. It's also where the romantic horse-and-carriage rides set off from.Nearest metro is Staromestska - just a few minutes' walk (past the authentic KFC!).
Not much to see.. Tourists wait around for the hour to pass hoping to see several movable figures. Don't bother. They barely move.
Great. Great place with a rich history. Strongly recommend to take a guided tour to this place to hear some great stories from old times.

Must see. The clock is fabulous. Each hour it chimes at the top figures appear at a window amazing. The clock face is a work of art beautiful and very colourful. Gets crowded when it is due to chime so watch out for pickpockets.

interesting. full of restaurants. the clock rings every hour on the hour. nice place to hang out and have a cafe or snack, even lunch. prices are affordable. a tourists spot. u can take a ricksha in this place

Must See clock!!!. The 12 Apostles /astronomical clock was just plain amazing when you consider that it was built in the 1400's and survived WWII with a little rebuilding. Here's a great tip for the clock. Plan to stay for two top of the hours so you can experience once at ground level (large crowds) then immediately go inside and ride the elevator to the top and experience it from atop the tower. Not only is it one of the best views of the city you'll also hear the trumpet play from all four sides which is exactly as they did back in the 1400's. Highly recommend the clock and old town.

Truly a wonder no matter the hour. The clock is a marvel of medieval engineering but the performance on the hour is a bit disappointing. We were lucky enough that a local group of singers provided an impromptu performance. If you feel inclined you can climb up the tower for a great view over the old town.

Touristy but don't miss it. You only need to see it once, but you should see it. The delightful mechanical Astronomical Clock is a must see. Don't get too close- it can get pretty crowded and it's nice to have some perspective.
fine. Was nice to see but was not that impressive compared to other things to look at. Was not very busy here and we just took a few photos then moved on.

disappointed. We waited for the clock to strike and were disappointed .We thought it would be more entertaining than it was. It was one of the highlights for some people as the place was crowded waiting for it.

A must on the Bucket List. Any Prague native will tell you this a must do. In the heart of Prague, the Astronomical Clock goes off every hour, on the hour and you get a show from it. Go early, as it does get crowded with people and be ready with camera/video for the clock. You can also go up the Hall tower if you'd like for a small fee
DO NOT MISS THIS. This 600 year old clock is incredible. One must look up the history and workings of this extraodanary clock.

Must see this classic in Old Town Square -- Free!!. his is definitely one of those "must see's". The Old Town Hall & Square are surely the heart of Prague and is a special favorite for all tourists. It can get quite crowded. Every hour on the hour, "death" rings his bell and Jesus & his 12 apostles come out to say hello to everyone in the square below. Bring your camera!!

Not to be missed!. This is definitely one of those "must do's". The Old Town Hall & Square are surely the heart of Prague and is a special favourite for all tourists.Every hour on the hour, "death" rings his bell and Jesus & his 12 apostles come out to say hello to everyone in the square below. Below the clock are the 12 signs of the zodiac.Make sure that you also take a visit to the observation deck of the Old Town Hall tower. It costs 100kr and you can either walk up or take the elevator. Entry is from an adjacent building. Most people prefer to take the elevator so there will probably be a queue leading into the narrow gap leading to the tower. We chose to walk up the ramp and found it easy going (a ramp is certainly easier than hundreds of steps) There is a small spiral staircase at the top of the ramp into the tower (which is monitored by a set of traffic lights to alert the people in the tower that others are on the spiral staircase).The view is quite spectacular - don't miss it!

Crowded but very interesting.. We saw this very old astronomical clock toll a couple of times. The design, history and utility of the clock in the middle ages was unbelievable! I would encourage an "early in the day" visit, 10AM or before. Otherwise unless you camp out for 30 minutes right in front of the clock, you may not be able to see what's going on. The clock and old town hall and other historical buildings in the Old Town Square make it a destination all by itself.

Unusual but overrated. The Clock is very beautiful and detailed but if you wait a long time for it to ring then you'll be a bit disappointed when it does. I like the surroundings though, but it's quite expensive here, so just stroll around and take your beer elsewhere.

Anti climax. A friend who had been to Prague recommended this attraction and I must admit, I was really psyched up. I was seated at the restaurant just next to it, pilsner and camera in hand ready for the big moment. Then it happened and I thought, is that it ? I appreciated it's beauty and age but the actual on the hour performance was an anti climax. A few biblical puppets popping out. Go there and have a look. Take some pictures but leave before the hour as you have nothing to miss. The Old Town Square is beautiful with lovely buildings.

Go early, get coffee, claim your ground, enjoy the BRIEF show!. The actual clock procession is very brief, however people watching prior to the show is part of the fun. I recommend going early. There are several coffee shops located in and off the square. Get a nice drink and claim some space then enjoy all the people streaming in after you.The Astronomical Clock itself is awesome! If you are in Prague you have to see it.

Bit of a let down. Maybe we had too high expectations. The clock itself is wonderful. What disappointed was the appearance of the apostles. We were expecting something more colourful and visible with much more noise. Still something to see though.
Astronomical Clock. Every hour the Clock has a kind of a show alot of people gethering to see it. Nice to be in the tower above and to look down to see all the people.

Don't Just See The Clock!. Of Course, everyone who visits Prague experiences (with hordes of our camera totting fraternity), the astronomical clock. But that is not enough, trust me. You must buy your ticket to the tower, and this is one of the few towers where you can go right up to the top by a circular elevator. Of course, if you climb up there is lot of information to be had on the Old Town Hall and its various historical details. The views from the top is just stunning! You will see the Old Town square and the magical city of Prague from a different viewpoint. You must do it!After you are through, buy an inexpensive ticket of just 60K (discounted as you have done the tower) and take a one hour guided tour to the Town Hall (they do it in English at regular intervals). You will get a different feel about the place and also visit the underground Romanesque Basement, the water wells, prison, and also see the Town Hall rooms which are presently in use for ceremonial occasions, admire the beautiful art works, fireplaces etc. All in a space of entire duration of 2 hours. Trust me, you will come out enriched. Very few people do that, they are just happy with the clock.

Beware when the clock strikes. Beware of pick pocketers when the clock is striking everyone you talk to warns you. A good meeting place and plenty of restaurants, the free city walking tours leave from here.

Magnificent. To imagine that the King had the clock maker blinded once he created the clock is awe inspiring. What a masterpiece. Grab lunch at one of the cafes right there so you can relax just before the clock strikes.

A truly magnificent clock. The Old Town Hall is famous for its beautiful facade clock which dates back to the beginning of the 15th century. According to one of the legends the functioning of the clock is linked with the prosperity of the whole Czech nation. If the clock stops running the Czech land will suffer bad times or be affected by war. The square can be busy and chaotic, but full of atmosphere with lots of shops, beautiful buildings, cafes and restaurants.
Beautiful Clock. A large group of people gather at the clock to see the actiom of the clock when it strikes the hour. A must see in Prague.

Orloj - Easily one of the most easily recognisable clocks in the world.. We recently visited Prague for a few days, staying right on the old town square which afforded us much time around Orloj, otherwise known as the Astronomical Clock. This is the third oldest (and oldest working) astronomical clock in the world, beautifully situated in the Old Town Square in Prague. The hype about the 15th century Orloj is well-deserved. The clock itself is attractive, photogenic and it is entertaining to watch the 'The Walk of the Apostles' hourly performance while visiting the Astronomical Clock. Crowds gather quite heavily upon the hour to see the show. Crowd gatherings seemed much larger during our recent visit to Prague compared to those in the past, you still have nice vantage points due to the height of the clock face. We did find that this was still possible to visit first thing in the morning when the old town square was clear and have Orloj, all to yourself. That was nice. Another nice way to experience the Astronomical Clock is from Cafe Mozart, which is on the second floor, across from and facing the Clock, affording very nice and unobscured views. Overall, Orloj is one of the two most easily recognisable clocks along with Big Ben in London, in our opinion. It is a very good attraction that is well worth experiencing multiple times when you are visiting Prague. It costs nothing to experience and has a nice history to it as well (Its worth reading up on the history of Orloj before visiting), making this an easy five star attraction in the city of Prague. In addition to seeing Orloj while visiting the Old Town Square, you should also make a bit of time to visit the Church of the Virgin Mary before Tyn, the Church of Saint Nicholas, the Jan Hus monument and you can visit the row of stands that sell sausages, drinks other foods, making this an atmospheric place to spend some time while in Prague.
Must see the clock strike the hour. Can be a little crowded and restaurants and shops are often a rip off, but hard to beat the atmosphere.

Nice building, with a lot of history. We experienced a very interesting and well priced guided tour through the various halls of the different parts of the Old Town Hall. It is also very interesting to see inside the clockwork of the astronomical clock. The visit can be combined with climbing the tower, offering an excellent view over Prague.
clock. huge crowds collect to watch and listen to the clock strike on the hour(not the 1/2 hour as we found out after waiting 20 mins!)

See for yourself. The Astronomical clock in Prague was made at the latest in 1410. It is equipped with two large dials: the upper is astronomical, the lower is a calendar dial. The astronomical dial is a special, movable map of the heavens, on which we can observe the current positions of the Sun, Moon and signs of the zodiac. This is a fascinating attraction and worth while seeing.

Good place to start Old Town. The hourly event of the apostles going around the window and the trumpet blowing from the top of the tower is really cool and is definitely worth seeing at least once (if not more)... sit back in one of the cafes and enjoy it for repeat value

A pleasant sight!. Yes, the Town Hall and Astronimiacal Clock on the main square are quite a sight! Most amusing to see how people suddenly gather together to enjoy the chimes and figures that pop out!A worthy visit!
In the Crowd with other tourists. Too much people waiting for full hour but really some of the greatest attraction in Prague. If you avoid the most popular hours you can catch some medival feelings.

Sit at a table Buy a drink and watch it happen. 14:40 was the perfect time of day to sit at a table right in front of the clock, Vodka tonic and an Iced Tea ran about 8 Euro's, hard to beat the view and people watching as you sit and relax and let the clock do the work.
This was best show. in 16th century so please hollywood films watchers, don't be disapointed. In middle ages peoples can wait for show all day. Anyway, I think you have get the point.
Go there at round hours (xx:00 o'clock). Every hour there is a clock show you can enjoy. Beware of pick-pocketers who might steal your wallet while you are watching in the crowd.

Fun People Watching. Worth seeing just for the pagentry factor, but don't expect to be overly wowed on the hour. It is a rooster that goes "caw" - impressive only because it has been doing so for 600 years. Reading all of the exceptional names on the name-day portion is fun as well. Look up the history of the clock, the lore as well as the truth, and then go and enjoy watching all the people gathering and waiting to look at a clock strike.

great tour, fascinating tower clock. i had an excellent tour of the old town hall (in English). the astronomical clock is the place to go if you're interested in clocks - take your time going up the stairs to read all the exhibits about clocks.

The Beauty You Come to See. Just like in the photos, beautiful, full of history, a bit mysterious...Millions of other tourists. It's an excellent piece of modern history to marvel at. Go on a guided tour of the area to learn about its unique history. The plaza itself has history all around if only you knew where to look.Not far from the Charles Bridge, this is one of the top 3 reasons you come to Prague.
Amazing!. Beautiful site to see! Go early as it gets crowded and hard to take good pictures. Also, good at sunset.

You have to see it if you're in town, but don't set your expectations too high. The 'show' is pretty underwhelming, but the clock itself is magnificent if you can understand what it is actually showing you.
If you're not in time for a show, grab a seat at one of the moderately overpriced cafes and wait it out over a beer.

Love the clock. It is a unique, awesome, great attraction. I wish I could go back now! The fact that it is still functioning with most of its original parts is incredible. And the four men flanking the face of the clock all have historical significance.

Impressive. A lot of people actually tell you that they were disappointed with this attraction. Well I wasn't to be honest. IT was great to see such an impressive charade of characters coming out of the clock and putting up a great show for you, not to mention the musicians on the top of the tower who also trumpet in sync. What we couldn't (and probably nobody else) understand was the astronomy part of it. It was way too complicated.

a must see. Very very very crowded especially if the tour groups come in and stand right in front of you but well worth seeing it do its magic each hour. It's difficult to get a good picture of it while it's chiming the hour due to all the people and if pick pockets are supposed to be a problem in Prague this might be the spot to worry; but this is a unique item that you can't see just everywhere.

Beautiful. Wait for the clock to strike on the hour. A real treat. Be prepared for crowds and pick pockets. This clock is beautiful. If you can get on a narrated tour you will learn so much history about this clock. The history in Prague is sooooo interesting. It is such a shame that the beautiful historical and architectural sites have SO MUCH graffiti on them.

Clock watchers in Prague. Make sure you get a place dead centre to really see all the characters perform as the clock strikes. Don't worry if you are pushed to the margins at first. The clock strikes on the hour, every hour. You will get your chance.

Old Town Great, Clock Not So.... The Old Town Square was a really happening, cool place to be! As the hour approached, we made our way to the Astronomical Clock to see the show that we had heard so much about. To be honest, the show was quite a let down. I imagined more of a German coo coo clock with many moving parts, and this was just a few statues who moved their arms. Maybe I missed the history of the clock, or another point, but after a minute of watching it (it goes for 2 or 3 minutes) I was ready to move on.

Wonderful views from the clock tower. Get above the crowds and enjoy the view from the clock tower - it is worth the pennies spend to get up there. Views are great. You can especially get great photos of the Tyne through the "tower windows"

Always Good to Observe. it's very interesting to stand on the street and crowd-watch as everyone gathers to see the clock "do its thing" on the hour, and it's remarkable to realize that his clock has been going for centuries. The area has lots of shops and restaurants, too. Watch out for pickpockets as you watch the clock, but enjoy the very festive and anticipatory atmosphere. It's also worth paying the small fee to go to the top of the clock tower where the views are quite beautiful.

Always Good to Observe. it's very interesting to stand on the street and crowd-watch as everyone gathers to see the clock "do its thing" on the hour, and it's remarkable to realize that his clock has been going for centuries. The area has lots of shops and restaurants, too. Watch out for pickpockets as you watch the clock, but enjoy the very festive and anticipatory atmosphere. It's also worth paying the small fee to go to the top of the clock tower where the views are quite beautiful.

Prague. It was so much fun to see the clock!! There were LOTS of people here and one person in our group did get pick-pocketed here. It is great to see, but as in any large city where lots of people gather, protect your belongings!!!

Very lively!. We loved it. The Astronomical Clock is a real must. The atmosphere around it is very lively and one can spend some time around the place just wandering through the narrow streets and labyrinths.

a spectacle every hour. a beautiful and intricate timepiece, that stands around three or four stories high with ornate decoration and an hourly show--what could be bad? (There is one downside, but perhaps it will teach a valuable lesson--one of the characters on the clock, depicts "greed" as a man, and used to be called the Jew, complete with horns that have now been removed, a sad commentary on the racist history of Prague).

I love the clock!. My son, who is studying in Prague, thought I was hilarious for wanting to visit the clock again and again. But, I love it. It is colorful, complex, very close to the ground ( at least the lower dial), and for me, a real icon of the genius of astronomical and zodiacal calculation in the 15th century. The hourly show is cute, and is worth a look, but be forewarned: the "show" is quite short.

Looks impressive ...... But doesn't do much! Visitors stand around (on the hour) waiting in anticipation for the clock to perform some entertaining chimes, changes etc but noting happened on the day we were there - maybe it was being renovated??

Place to visit!. New time on the Old Town Square. A lot of people. Be careful on your purse. Don't eat and drink on on square (it is crazy overpriced) - just walk two blocks in any direction for same great quality and half a price.

Just in time !. A truly magnificent attraction an a square full of atmosphere. Situated in the Old Town Square it is full of great looking restaurants including the rooftop restaurant that we visited for lunch at the U Prince Hotel. The location,food and service was first class.

Less Impressive than You'd Think. I'd say this is fun to watch only if you are in the area and not necessarily something you need to make a special trip to see. It's not as impressive as other clock displays in other locations in Europe.
Beautiful and interesting. Interesting stories abound about the clock and it really is lovely. It will make your head hurt if you try to understand all the hands on the astronomical clock!

A must see in Prague, but..... It really is over rated. This does not detract from the beauty and the complexity of it, however it just does its thing for around a minute every hour and that is that. Go and see it, but don't think it will be the highlight of your Prague visit.
Prague's symbol. Very nice and elaborate clock on a magnificent plaza, quite crowded but exciting, stunning architecture and camé buildings - the heart and charm of Prague!

Worth the walk up. OK, you can get a lift to the top of the tower but try walking instead - you will appreciate the fabulous views that little bit more! Look doown on the crowd staring up at the clock and feel good that you havbe walked the entire distance!
Interesting. We arrived just before 2pm and were at the back of the crowd, but were still able to stand back and photograph this clock doing it's thing. Very amusing and ingenious!

A must see!. This is probably my favorite in Prague. There are so many things to do even in the month of December. The Astronomical Clock is very unique. Never seen anything like that before. You have to go on top of the tower & you will have a great view of Prague. When we went on top of the tower, it was night time & the view was spectacular! It was very festive & colorful.
Cute. A chronometric novelty rather like a Disney cartoon with a silly plot. The one in Lier, Belgium, is better, if you like clocks.

2 day Prague Trip. Lana and I spent the night in Prague 2 weeks ago and it was just fantastic. We really enjoyed the city for its old town center with all of the great places to sit outside eating or drinking and enjoying the Astronomical Clock on the old town hall. We've never been to the top of the town hall where the trumpeter plays... one day! A very unique experience. We stayed at a little place just 6 tram stops from the Charles Bridge. Love this city!

Great unique site.. You must check out this site at the center of Prague intown. Don't worry about seeing the unremarkable hourly "clock-turn", but it's worth the price to walk (or elevator) up to the top of the clock and visit Prague from high-up.
Huge Crowds to see some statues go around. I know this is supposed to be a big deal -- and it is a beautiful old clock -- but honestly, I expected more of a show, and was a bit disappointed.

Busy and expensive. Very busy with tour parties, best to go in winter. The cafes around the square are fine but expensive; sit inside and it is much cheaper.. Horse-drawn carriages, people pretending to be statues, buskers, etc., all the things I would like to avoid.

The star of any visit!. It is world famous and deserves the reputation. It strikes on the hour so during the busy times hundreds of people are there but it is worth seeing and working out what it all means before getting the guide book!
Go Early. The Astronomical clock just has to be seen but be sure and be there for 9.00am or even 10.00am. After that there are so many tourists about it is impossible to get a good look at it

Surprised to find an elevator!. The view as lovely and the luxury of finding a modern elevator was very welcome! All around the top were photos and details about things that you could see from the different aspects - which is a much better visitor experience than say the Empire State Building where you have to guess or buy a guide.

Go late at night for the best view. There always seemed to be large crowds of people here throughout the day so I found visiting late at night to be best. It's prominent colouring looks great in pictures in the dark too.
interesting. This is interesting, but a bit too touristy again for my taste. The place was so crowded too. However, it was part of the list of things to do and we weren't disappointed.

Awesome!!. Even if you get a guide to this place with you, it's better to read about the clock before you go there... There are many details that u'll realize if you get in touch with it before!!! Enjoy!!

An obvious MUST while in Prague.. Undoubtedly – the best show in Prague.When you see the figures of the clock moving and ringing the bells and watch the crowd clap their hands in excitement, you know you're in the right place, and yeah – the astronomical clock is wonderful.However, the better experience is to actually climb the tower and take a look at the stunning view from above – most of Prague is seen. The red colour of the rooftops if almost too overwhelming, and the nice contrast of the numerous churches makes this a view to die for. Literally.

Exceptional Clock Tower. a Whole lot of fun to watch the clock strike on every hour, it is also great to go up on top of the tower and see the entire city. Great views and very interesting place to visit.

Nice to stop for a while....to see the clock the tick. was there on Apr 17th, 2013. After a nice walk visiting various stops in Prague...its good to stop and see the old architectural clock....just a 15 minute stop ...get there 10 mins before any full hr ...fun for kids....beware of thief's as it gets crowdy...have time get up the clock tower though not needed..its a small tower....if you want a better look of old town clinbing powder tower is more fun...
Unusual clock. The clock was set to GMT so was the wrong time for Prague! There were lots of people waiting to see the figures move round on the hour, and many even clapped the clock when it moved!

Gorgeous but expensive. As with the rest of Prague, this area is architecturally beautiful. However is a hive of tourist activity and everything within and within quite a radius is very expensive and aimed at the tourist market. The street food, although delicious, was extortionate.

Simply amazing. Watched the clock at midday when the disciples came out then did a full tour inside when we saw the innards of the clock and then did a full guided tour of the Old Town Hall (right down to the dungeons!!) We also went right to the top of the building (in the lift) where the panoramic views are spectacular. More athletic people can use the stairs.This visit is a must when in Prague

Go up the tower!!. The astronomical clock is one of the most bizarre things I have ever seen, but it is stunning nonetheless. Visit before the crowds gather for best pictures but stay with the crowds to hear the people clap as the bells chime - as I said, bizarre.You can go up the Old Town Hall Tower (50Kc for students) for brilliant views of the Old Town Square a much further. There's a lift but consider the climb - its a slope, no steps, and there is information about the history of the tower and clock on the walls. It will make you appreciate the views even more! Seeing as the crowds at the bottom were large, we were surprised by the lack of people at the top, but very happy and felt somewhat privileged. Plaques have info about what sights to spot.I would encourage anyone going to Old Town Square to take the time to climb, as they won't be disappointed!
Great People Watching. A great place to watch the world go buy- save your drinks and meals for places OFF the beaten track though- pricey and not as good!

Ding Dong goes the time. The clock is fascinating to look at, the design is incredible. But unless you are there around the hour mark, don't stand about for half an hour waiting for the clock to strike, as we found it rather unexciting, some plain carved wood medieval type figureheads appear, around 30ft of the ground , sort of spin round and disappear, then a small skeleton pulls on a rope, the bells ding dong, and the show is over.

View from the top.. The clock is beautiful and interesting. Take some time to observe the details and try to be there when the figures animate (every hour). The magnificent view from the tower is worth the ticket. The hour is announced by a trumpet sound played by a valet.

Don't miss this most unusual attraction. It is located in the city square of the old town and every a.m. at 11am it has a full out displace. This is also the location for picking up the Free Tour (look for the yellow flag), which found extremely helpful.

Beautiful, but crowded. We visited at the last days of the Easter market, so the square was unusually crowded. The buildings are beautiful and the Astronomical clock is definitely worth the wait till the full hour. Be sure to enter the clock tower too, for a great view of Prag and some clock history. If you don't want to walk up, there's an elevator.
Neat experience. I would not spend a lot of time here, however it is very neat to see the chiming of the clock and the disciples coming out..This is an incredible work of art.
Another must see. The clock is definitely worth seeing. It's an amazing feat of engineering. It's hard to get a picture of it on your own though, with the crowds of tourists thronging the square.

Simply amazing. Simply amazing that such a large group of people gather together to watch such an insignificant event as the clock chime. It is a skellaton pulling a rope. The square provides a central point for meeting tourist guides etc. A good place to start from when first ariving in prague.
Medieval times. Felt like it would have been normal to see horses and knights. The clock tower is huge and very beautiful. The Town Hall building is very impressive also.

Pickpockets. Had my back jeans pocket felt as someone tried to get my wallet. Don't let that put you off just be aware and be careful. The clock is amazing and huge crowds amass outside. Loads of other artists to entertain you nearby.

Better on the Hour. The real experience happens on the hour, when the mechanicals of the clock get into full swing. The more hours it counts, the better the show... So get there at noon and bring your video camera!

Incredible!. If in Prague it would be hard to miss the Astronomical clock because of its central location. It is a testament to true craftsmanship, knowledge and dedication to time! It is well advised to take the time to read of the history of the oldest working astronomical clock in the world. The town hall is unique in that you can travel to the top of the tower by elevator and get a breathtaking view of Prague city and the are surrounding it. It is surprisingly high and one can feel a little queasy looking down below! Well worth a visit!

be sure to take the tour inside. We really enjoyed our tour inside the old town hall. The tour took about 45 minutes and showed both the new and older parts of the building (including the very interesting basement/cellar). Our guide spoke excellent English and had a great sense of humor.After the tour, we took the elevator/lift up to the top the tower for some fantastic views of the city. Really glad we did both.

Filipino in Prague. This part of Prague is packed with tourists when we visited. It could be a little crowded for getting to places around or just trying to get a good position for pictures. Nevertheless, it's a very good place to see architectural wonders of previous centuries popular in European cities. Prague is one of the most beautiful cities in Europe and the thriving tourism industry is a testament to that. The Astronomical Clock is most frequented for photo opportunities for good reason. It's a beautiful creation that Czechs are lucky to own.
You will know when the hours turns by the crowds!. By quarter to the hour the crowds gather for the clock to 'come to life'. Get there EARLY in the morning to avoid the chaos.

Get a table at a coffee shop opposite the clock.. Clock strikes on the hour and is great spectacle, in one of the most beautiful town squares in Europe. To avoid the crush of people and tour groups, book a seat at a coffee shop opposite the clock about half an hour before the strike.

So busy and very touristy. Although we went there - it is somewhere all tourists go! - it was not our favourite place as there were so many tour guides looking for business and so many people in front of the clock/building. Going up the tower was worth it as you got away from the crowds and looked down on them all! Good view of the city from up there.

Get a good spot!. After seeing the Strasbourg astronomical clock, this one is a bit on a smaller scale. Be sure to get there 10 minutes early to get a spot right in front of the clock. If you are on either side, you may miss out on seeing the Apostles wandering across the windows. Stay too, for the trumpet player at the top of the tower and watch him wave from each of the four sides! He plays after the bells have finished tolling.
Astronomical Clock. What is all the fuss about. It's a clock!! albeit a very old one.Apparently the second most disappointing tourist site in Europe after Stonehenge

Astronomical clock. Not alot really happens, but when you consider the age of the clock, what does happen is pretty impressive! There are lots of crowds waiting on the hour. We liked seeing the newly weds coming out of the town hall after their wedding ceremonies!
Magnificent views from the bell-tower. Magnificent views from the bell-tower, and reasonably priced. A bit of a tight squeeze up there with all the other tourists. Worth it though.

Obligated to Watch. Such a big deal is made about this clock. It is an impressive, albeit perplexing, piece of technology. I was told the top of the hour is unimpressive, but I felt obligated to go watch it. I mean, I'm in Prague and that's what you do, right? At least I went, at least I can say I saw it, but underwhelming is a compliment. One word of warning to those who go. Prague is notorious for pick pockets. I would imagine this is a prime opportunity for them. It's a huge crowd with lots of people looking up AND holding cameras overhead leaving them open to get picked. Just make sure your valuables are secure if you decide to go.

What a let down. The Astronomical Clock was a disappointment. Crowds watch the clock every hour while doors open and figures move across the opening and then the crowd wave to them - whats that about? It was more entertaining watching the pick pockets at workl - beware!

Good view of the city. We paid 100czk (about 4 euros) each to go up to the old town clock tower which is pretty reasonable! It gives excellent views of the city and there are picture boards to point out the important landmarks in the city, which we had fun spotting. We took the lift up but took the stairs down so we could read about the history of the clock (got bored after a while).

Important Historic Part Of Prague, But Don't Expect Spectacular!. The Astronomical Clock is the main attraction in the Old Town Square. Crowds gather for it's short performance every hour, it is a skeleton pulling a handle and the twelve apostles going around in the circle. Although nothing amazing it is atmospheric and a huge part of the Prague historic culture so it is not to be missed!Next to the clock is the Old Town Hall where you can take a tour into the underground rooms, which are still on original medieval street level that is why they are now under I went with the World War II In Prague Tour and it was very good, eerie and quite spooky. There are things like jail holes, dungeons, old kitchens and even medieval scripts still present on the walls.

Over-rated. Having travelled extensively through Europe I thought this attraction was over-rated. People crowd round the clock every hour to watch the most boring display, a cuckoo clock would be more exciting.

"Meh" 2 (with apologies to hellobayo). The clock itself is a lovely piece of techie, along with the story behind it ( the poor builder was blinded when it was finished, so he couldnt go and build another). However the "show" on the hour is just embarrasing. Hundreds of people gather to have a "wow" moment, and instead get an "Eh? " moment ..The view from the top of the tower is good, though :)

Short but Sweet. It is almost more fun to watch the enormous crowds than the clock itself. The clock goes off every hour on the hour, with a small "show". Be warned, it only lasts a few seconds, and then it is over, and some will be very hard to see as it is up very high. The skeleton rings his bell, the 12 disciples rotate about, and the rooster gives a very sad sounding crow. The trumpeteer then blows his horn. The best part was paying to go to the top, although in busy times, plan on a long wait; took up 45 minutes just to wait in line to get to the top. But the views from up top are great of the city and Tyn Cathedral. If you are there during the top of the hour, you can wave down at the people in the square!

Great views from the Clock tower. Great views from the Clock tower nice to see it at night when everywhere is lit up we went at Christmas time was lovely to see the Christmas tree & decorations from above. It nice to see the clock chime on the hour. It always attracts a crowd of people a few minutes before it chimes great Atmosphere.

Great view at the top. The astronomical clock is definitely worth a visit. The clock itself is very ornate and pretty. Be sure to be around just before the hour though since it gets crowded pretty quickly in front of the clock.The 100Kc entrance fee was completely worth it. Even if you're not interested in the history behind the clock and the mechanics of it all, the views from the top of the tower is spectacular. One thing to note though is that the walkway is quite narrow at the top and can be packed with over-excited tourists, so be careful!

well worth the visit. After 5 visits to Prague, just found out you can visit inside both the town hall and the tower, with a lift inside , price was good as well, 160Kc each lots of history and English guides at 10:30am and 1:30 pm plus you get to see the inside of the clock. Address: Starometska radnice, Starometske namesti.Directions: Old-Town Square
Wow. So much to see especially the clock that comes alive on the hour. Vendors statues and much more. I liked the viwe of the city from the top of the tower.

Easter Markets. We had a wonderful time taking a horse driven carriage through Old Town while shopping for Easter Eggs and linens. The astronomical clock is just beautiful and be sure to catch it on the top of the hour for a quick show it puts on! Restaurants, souveniers galore and beautiful crystal are all available in the square.

Beautiful and historic. Situated just off Wensleslas Square, this is a wonderful piece of historical science, with some showboating moving parts! Stand and watch at the hour (especially midday) to see what I mean.

A must see.... The clock is phenomenal, but not worth hanging around for the hourly strike, which does attract big crowds. Was disappointed with that. But the clock itself is stunning and intricate in detailed artwork
Astronomic Clock OK. It's an interesting atraction for a touristic journey. Old buildings and scientific places always call the attention. And of course everything seems well cared.

Don't get TOO frustrated by the lines!. The views from the top of the clock tower are AMAZING. Once you are there, it will make you forget all about the long, unorganized wait in the line. Actually, when we went there wasn't much of a line at all, but this ain't DisneyWorld -- they hardly have the whole waiting in line thing down to a science. It's completely disorganized. But like I said, those memories will quickly fade when you take in the amazing views from the top.
Jam packed tourist trap.. Very picturesque but jam packed with tourists and far too busy. Worth a short visit to experience though.

First time in Prague? Go up the tower to get orientated!. Its only 100k each to go up the tower, admittedly, not much on the way up to read but some nice panels on the history of the clock but the money shot is the 360 views all around which can give you better perspective on how far or close by some other attractions are, Prague Castle, the Monastery, the National Museum, St Agnes Convent etc all look easier to get to, some on foot....if you fear of heights be careful since the very narrow ledge means that people push and jostle past and the ledge even slopes down towards the drop so just be mindful of that - you can stay inside and get a decent view around but not great.

Surprising. Well worth the 100K to get into the tower. The square was full of the Easter market so from ground level it was hard to get a good feel for the place. Going up the tower gives you a 360 view (with no glass like the Petrin Tower). Really helps you to orientate yoursleves and you get to see those red rooftops and spires. Wish we had done this on our first day. If you were disappointed by the clock, you wont be by the view from the tower - great for photos - brilliant.
Interesting!!. Looks lovely . However beware of pickpockets as our guide advised us. The clock has an interesting concept to it , so pay attention to the guide.
Magical. We visited this square at easter and were pleasantly surprised to find an easter market. Really good atmosphere and fantastic architecture, and very cheap to eat and drink :-)

Must visit place and amazing view!. This square is like a fairy tale! It is usually crowded during daytime, but still you can enjoy the bell chiming and the clock show. The history of the Clock is very interesting and you can get the information brochure at the cash desk next to the Clock. It is worth to visit the Tower (100czk = 4 euro) - the view of Prague is just amazing.
Impresive views from balcony. The "Orloj" is the oldest clock in Europe still working and its very rare. Its shown planets (Sun and the moon phases)

Picture post card setting. This square is steeped in history. Beautiful architecture on every building, lovely clock tower and amazing sculpture in the square with lots of sculputes on the buildings. Can get crowded when it's nearing the hour for the bell chiming but not unmanageable. Very picturesque setting and lovely to see all the craft stalls.

That's something. This is Amasing, is the place in the square (huge square) that you see so many people together. The Church with the Astronomical Clock is an atraction that everyone see in prague.It is worth it to see every hour for a few seconds, smart thing for that time.

Fantastic view. Well worth CZK100 to get to the top of the tower and get a magnificent view of the entire city - the Astronomical clock is a must seen as it is still working. Avoid restaurant in that area as there are tourists trap.

A beautiful historic masterpiece. The clock is incredible from a historical perspective. Go early to watch the hourly display. Grab a coffee in a nearby cafe and watch the apostles appear. The figures next to the clock represent vices such as greed. The short display is worth an early morning visit.

Old Town Astronomical clock. old town itself if beautiful and filled with stalls - food and souveniers and is also filled with restaurants and pubs and if you would like a horse&cart ride there is a que of horses waiting for you to hop in . We went up to the top of the clock where the view is fantastic everything looks different from so high up , we went at around 11am/12 and alot of people seemed to go then too , so i would recommend going at a random time , because there isn't alot of space to walk around and the less people the better

Cool clock, Great view. The workmanship on the clock is fantastic, but the striking of the hour was anti-climactic.The trip to the top on a clear day is absolutely worth it. Stunning views of the city all around. We took the lift up and the ramp down. There aren't stairs in the tower but a well designed ramp that eased our way down past descriptive placards and clock gear.

herd of cattle in a slaughter line.. it is a neat clock. not the greatest thing to see in the square. people crowd around to watch the show on the hour. either go very early or very late otherwise you will be in a concert type crowd like cattle herding there way to the slaughter line.

A work of art. There are always huge crowds to watch the clock strike the hour, when the figure of the apostles appear. It is a beautiful piece of work and a trip up the tower is a worthwhile way to spend some time and see Prague from up high.

Be there or be square..... It is a great piece of work this clock. A lot of detail to look at. Best time to go is between 8am- 10am. Go grab a coffee while you wait for the hour to come by. There isn't a lot to see and if your there for the timely photo you want to be in the centre as the sides get obstructed views. Beware of pick pockets because surely there are a lot of people around... some maybe not trusted. Advice - *Be early 8am - 10am * Go up the tower, or grab a coffee if your waiting for the hour* Enjoy some of the history of the building, you can peek in through the tourist info area around to the right
Go up the tower!. You must go up the tower! It wasn't expensive and is a really easy sloped climb (there is also a lift). Amazing views of Prague and the square.
The view tower. Dont forget to visit the view tower to get a look over the Prague roofs. Beautiful views from the top. Couldnt get enough pictures.

More to see than just a clock!. A major tourist spot - the clock gets very busy on the hour when the crowds gather to hear the chimes. We visited just before Easter when the square was full of stalls selling traditional Czech food, drink, arts and crafts which comes highly recommended.

Stunning City. I was in awe when I first walked into Old Town square and saw the clock. It has been extremely cold since I have been here and made the walking tour from old town around the city a little hard to enjoy. We left two stops before the walking tour was suppose to end and found the closest bar to warm up with Prague's delicious beer. The city is magically beautiful and full of history.

Neat old clock. Seeing a clock that complex and that old that still works is pretty awesome. There's big crowds on the hour to see the appearance of the apostles. It wasn't as exciting as perhaps we thought it would be, but still worth seeing.
clock is o.k but old town is very good. Clock is just o.k nothing much visit top of the hour to see the activity on the clock. What is amazing is the surrounding old town and the atmosphere

Stunning view. The clock itself didn't do much for me. It was pretty, but I did expect more. However, going up (or taking the elevator) to the top of the Old Town Hall. On a sunny day the views are amazing. You can see the Castle far away on one side and on the opposite side, you can have a birds-eye view of the square below. The prize as of March 2013 is 100 ck (app. 5$/4€). Its a really good place to get an overview of the city.I recommend that you take the stairs up and the elevator down (or reverse) so you get to experience something new and something old.

Must see. A highlight of the Astronomical Clock may be the little mechanical "puppet show" that plays upon the hour, and then the lively trumpeting by some chap standing high up in the tower above. The Astronomical Clock is beautiful and very well preserved. It is worth climbing to the top of the clocks tower. Great views.

Interesting, but the view is better then the clock. The tower is a great place to visit - view is just breathtaking, you can take lots of very nice pictures, especially at sunset. The clock is nice, but I've expected much more then that. But you still shouldn't miss it!

Well worthy trip to the top of the clock tower beautiful views though a bit pricey.. Go inside and admire the lovely views over Prague. Clock very pretty. But the views are pricey as you have to buy a ticket, can't remember exactly how much but trip only lasted about 15 mins.not the best value for money. Once inside you had to pay extra to see other parts, pay into toilets which are not very clean at all!
go up the tower. The clock is fascinating but the best bit is the view from the top of the tower. Not too expensive either.

Must be there!!!. Had researched some of the highlights of Prague for our first visit and as always we found some excellent and helpful reviews on this site. We visited Prague and the city was everything we had been told that it would be, but maybe a little colder than we'd expected . The Czechs love their meat so we had a great range of meaty and hearty restaurants to choose from. We headed to the Astronomical Clock on our second day there and seated ourselves in a lovely little outdoor seated area and ordered a few cocktails. We had the perfect view of the entire display on the hour. We were amazed to hear that there was a real trumpeter at the top of the clock tower, as we had thought it was a recording. That was the cherry on the cake for us. The area does tend to get crowded at the times of the chiming but not so much that your view would be restricted as the clock face is above eye level, so no matter who is in front of you, you will still get a great view. This Astronomical Clock is the third oldest in the world and Prague should be very proud of this amazing structure. There is a lovely atmosphere in this part of town too, very party like and friendly.

A must stop on your visit to Prague. Everyone who goes to Prague seems to visit the Astronomical clock. It is a huge old clock with different faces, roman numeral, astrological and more. Additionally every hour there is a rotation of some of statues of the apostles that come out for a brief second. Your initial reaction will probably be like ours when you see what happens every hour on the hour (very brief) however the clock is very ornate and beautiful and there is an interesting story behind it.
Unique. The astronomical clock is definitely a sight to see. Very unique and a special part of Prague's history. Cannot be missed
Can't be missed. Just a short walk from the Savic Hotel, this iconic clock is a centerpiece of the town square and a major tourist attraction. Great fun when the clock strikes the hour!

The area rather then the clock !. Prague's old square is beautiful and so is the clock but this waiting on the hour for the little doors to open, well it is just ok. Munich and Brussel's clocks are a bit better for this, but the area itself is beautiful and is probably the nices of the old town squares in Europe.Word of warning, on the hour you could have a very big crowd of tourists all gathered and besides not being able to see it is the perfect area for pick pockets !

Chimes up in Air. I have seen People kissing and Hugging fellow beings or stranger's, just as it's New Year every hour.... The group of tourist are always flocked around it's always better to go early or late night to have your portrait..I recommend to take a stairs above to see great view city and passer's by and enjoy street musicians from four corners.
On The Hour. On the hour the clock has some moving puppets which little doors open for you to see them. you must get there about 5 mins before the hour as a large crowd can gather

Not quite sure of the attraction. A fascinating clock but don't quite know what the attraction was.... dont try and get past as it chimes.. hoardes of people poised with cameras.... .. seen once is enough!!
TICK TOCK. Very busy around the top of the hour...it's okay but not that just a spectacle. Unfortunately the animation only lasts around 1-2 minutes.
amazing clock. amazing clock. If you want to see it on the hour I suggest you arrive in the square around 15 mins early as once the windows open it can be difficult to see the images.
Be there on the hour!. The clock has some extra special surprises on the hour so make sure you visit then - some very old traditional history....

Pretty cool clock. This is the main draw in the main square in Prague. it is an elaborate clock to say the least. Pretty much during daylight hours at the top of the hour, the clock does its little routine. There will be a large crowd every time it happens. All I can think of every time I see this is how much of a pick pocket target I feel. But you have to see it while you are in Prague.

Get ready to be wowed!!. Had researched some of the highlights of Prague for our first visit and as always we found some excellent and helpful reviews on this site. We visited Prague in June 2012 and the city was everything we had been told that it would be, but maybe a little colder than we'd expected for June. The Czechs love their meat so we had a great range of meaty and hearty restaurants to choose from. We headed to the Astronomical Clock on our second day there and seated ourselves in a lovely little outdoor seated area and ordered a few cocktails. We had the perfect view of the entire display on the hour. We were amazed to hear that there was a real trumpeter at the top of the clock tower, as we had thought it was a recording. That was the cherry on the cake for us. The area does tend to get crowded at the times of the chiming but not so much that your view would be restricted as the clock face is above eye level, so no matter who is in front of you, you will still get a great view. This Astronomical Clock is the third oldest in the world and Prague should be very proud of this amazing structure. There is a lovely atmosphere in this part of town too, very party like and friendly.

Very impressive!. Get there early before the hourly striking to get a good view of the figures moving on the hour. Old Town Hall has impressive painted ceilings and glass , also go up the tower above the clock for a birds eye view of Prague across the rooftops.

Oldest Clock in the World. If you are in Prague then you will most likely be in Old Town anyway! In that case make sure to stop by and see the oldest clock in the world the Astronomical Clock, exceptionally interesting design!

Every hour on the hour. Get here early to see the clock striking the hour if you want a good speck,as it gets very congested at the top of each hour,but do remember it goes through the motions every hour on the hour,i heard one american that it was a life changing experience,well it has nt changed my life but i am still glad i have seen it.

The clock was Astronomical and filled with some riddles!. I missed the Bell chiming because i was in traffic, tried to wait for the next hour but ended up wandering away to the National Museum and taking a cab back halfway back to the Hotel! Every cab knew Hotel Roma!

attractive. When you walk in the old town square you will directly notice the Astronomical clock and the tower.İt is fun to watch people who are waiting on the hour.The view on the tower is so nice so dont forget to go upstairs.

View from the top. Be sure to go up to the top, finding where to get the tickets was a bit tricky but is in a door underneath. The view was breathtaking of one of the most beautiful of cities in Europe.

Old Town Hall. We met City walking tour guide just before the hour in front of the clock. The guide gave us a full run down on all the various aspects of the clock and how to interpret. The whole area is alive with history with alley ways going back to Roman and medieval times. Loads of good reasonably priced restaurants and coffee shops. The whole skyline is ablaze with towers lit at night - very atmosperic.

Must see tourist attraction. There is always a crowd waiting to see the astronomical clock with its cute musical show on the hour. Make sure you take the trip to the top of the clock tower for the amazing view of the town square and the roof tops of the old town. Watch the door beside the clock the door to the town hall is where the newly weds take their first steps as husband and wife
Missed the hour. Visited the Town Square a dozen times but missed the on the hour display EVERYTIME. The clock is a beautiful sight at any hour.
Beautiful. Just a beautiful old town, near the cathedral and the astronomic clock, many gelaterias near and stores to buy. You must go.

Be ready to have your breath taken away. A highlight of the ancient clock may be the little mechanical puppet show that plays upon the hour, and then the lively trumpeting by some chap standing high up in the tower above. But once you are done with that show, head inside and up to the top of the tower for a magical view of Prague's Old Town Square and its surroundings.The colourful buildings below, the majestic Church of Our Lady before Týn, and the other buildings that spread out towards the Vltava River all come together to create a beautiful sight.The sight is even more lovely when the Christmas markets are up in full swing.Get your cameras ready.
Go Behind the Clock !. Fab clock ...Great to watch every hour but get the underground Prague tour to get behind the face and see how it works !
Cool thing to watch. I thought this was cool. It's better to see during the day though at night wasn't bad. Tourists gather every hour on the hour but there was lots of room.

Worth a Visit. Nice attraction, beautiful construction. Would recommend a trip to the top of the tower (if you don't mind heights!), for which there is a small fee. Look out for the little bell ringing skeleton :)
Nice clock and great view from the tower. I would recommend everyone visiting the Old Town to go to the top of the clock tower. It offers a great view over the town and the surrounding buildings.

A mysterious feeling. Every one is there. So it must be a very special place. And it is true it is a special place to visit. Old town hall and astronomical clock are occupying the same building. The astronomical clock seems to be getting more attention than the Old Town Hall. The Astronomical Clock is more colorful, looks much more interesting. Few people is interested with its history. Every body is waiting in front of it to see the walk of the apostles and striking of the time. Once they saw the apostles walk, they move away. The same people return to the same spot the next day again again. There is a funny thing which attracts people to this clock. When you visit Prague one should go and see it. But don't let yourself carried away by its mystery.

Astronomical Clock and Tower. So far we haven't been able to see the show at the Clock Tower. We did go up to the viewing area and it was a nice day so the view was incredible. For 2 students and 2 adults the cost was only about $15 USD. Well worth it.

Great views from the tower.. The clock is worth seeing on the hour, but be prepared for quite a brief show! The clock itself is beautiful and a real work of art. There are terrific views from the Old Town Hall tower. A lift takes you to the top, through the centre of the tower itself. It's a one-way system at the top because it's pretty narrow. On a cold, clear winter's day the views were wonderful.
Totally unspoilt.. Another place unspoiled by modern day living. Street entertainers are good especially the jazz bands.
a clock. nice to see. we started a free guided tour of the city and this was included. very interesting story but a clock non the less

Lovely place. All the square with the cafes an restaurants is amazing! The clock bells every hour! You must go during the day and one more time during the night... the lights on the tower shines pretty much! Must try the czech candy next to the tower...

One Day Tour of Praha (Prague).. The Old Town Hall stands in the Old Town Square which has historic importance and is a medieval square where protestants were executed for uprising against the Catholic King in the seventeenth century.The executioner then went to a local pub which is still there for a drink , as he was tired from the days work of some twenty four hangings and three beheadings! The site is marked on the square !the astronomical clock chimes twice a day at two '0' clock in the afternoon and nine pm in the evening and has legends behind it.It is a beautiful structure and the town square is bristling with activity ,night life and wonderful shops and restaurant.A truly electric atmosphere gracefully combining and exhibiting the synergy of modern and old!The
Expensive!!. BEWARE! We went to a cafe which was not far from the clock. Our mistake! We ended up paying £25 for a coffee, wine and a water!!

Amazing. This was the first time in Prague for me so forgive me for being blown away. But Prague Astronomical Clock has got to be one thing you have to see when you are in Prague hands down that a clock made in 1490 and it still works and better than my Seiko. If you are in Prague this you need to visit this place and then go up to the clock tower
My favourite attraction.. I loved the astronomical clock. So beautiful and so well preserved. It is well worth climbing to the top of the clocks tower. Great views .

Pretty but a little disappointing. The Astronomical Clock was recommended as a 'must see'. You have to get there on the hour in order to see the clock in action. We just missed it and so spent an hour exploring the square - which is interesting in itself and has some nice shops. There are also musicians (of varying talent) which is quite jolly. However, when the clock struck the hour, we did see the animated statues moving round but were left with a feeling of 'is that it'? Nice to see if you happen to be there ...

Technical wonder!. One of things in the universe that should be seen by own eyes!!!;)). Living in Prague I pass by this place everyday, but still cannot understand how all the information on this Clock should be read:)). And of course this noon ceremony with moving figures - it's so cute;))

Make sure you go up the tower!. We did the tower on our last day and it was amazing, great views of Prague so managed to get plenty of Panoramas! You can either walk up (not stairs but a graduating ramp) or get the lift) It is about 100kcz per person (which works out to be about £3!) so very reasonable and you can read all the information about the clock on the walk up.

The clock. This is in a lovely square with lots of cafes and quaint buildings. We watched the clock chime 11 whilst enjoying hot chocolates in one of the cafes, it was expensive though. The square gets crowded with tourists and guides marching through it armed with their umbrellas.

Astronomical. I don't know why people say this clock is one of the most over rated sights in all of Europe - my friends and I found it fascinating! The clock was built hundreds of years ago and has such amazing (and deadly) history.Make sure you are there when the clock strikes on the hour - but not from 10pm as it stops late at night. A must see when visiting Prague.

Beautiful Clock!!!!. Impressive clock in Prague. Every 1 hour clock hit the bell. Every tourist watches this wonderful scene. I missed Pragues whenever I looked at the picture of this clock and nearby churches(Tyn Church and St. Nicholas Church).

Amazing Clock. A wonder of a time gone by-an amazingly picturesque and complex adornment the clock is well worth braving the hourly crowd to see the procession and bell ringing skeleton. Telling the time from it however is a different story since its not that clear how it actually works

Imagine,how it looked like till May 1945. It is one of the most attended attractions in Prague. ORLOJ (Czech word for astronomical clocks)is a masterpiece. But imagine : the whole BIGGER wing of Town Hall was destroyed in May 1945 during fights in a Prague upraising against nazis. Now there is a little park on this place...Watch your wallets / backpacks here, as not all people around you are interested only in sightseing !!
amazing. The clock might not look that attractive on pictures, but when you stop and stand in front of it, you'll change your mind!! It is an excellent engineering masterpiece from 1410AD.

Hot Choc Mit Rum. Standing watching the 'skeleton' dong the Clock (on the hour every hour) and watching the figures appear from the windows was magical... The snow falling made it even more spectacular... dont forget that Hot wine or Hot choc Mit Rum in hand whilst watching... Great laughter and applause from the smiling tourists as it happens!

Blown away !!. A MUST visit when in Prague. Very interesting stories on who build it, repaired it etc. Be there at 11 o'Clock in the morning, there is a big crowd that awaits the event of the day when all the clock's doors open, caractors emerge and bells ring. It all tells a story.

The tower view is beautiful.. We went up the tower of the clock, the clock it's self is stunning. It's 200 Karona each which I thought was a bit steep but actually it's worth it. The views are stunning & theres loads of info & other rooms & bits to explore on other floors. Well worth a visit.
Get 15 minutes earlier for best spot. Get 15 minutes earlier for best spot.A lot of couples taking their wedding photos around here.The clock itself is a remarkable piece of art and engineering.
Worth a visit. Beautiful buildings, gorgeous clock but was quite disappointed but it's action :) Was expecting more after waiting 10min at -5C, but still quite spectacular work of art.

Lovely Place at night. We arrived here at night just in time to see the Astronomical Clock chime. A must see if you are in the area. The old town in general was amazing too lots of history and very picturesque.

It's so old, believe it or not!. It's bricks color from black to yellow, stones and blockes windows of different size. Those walls saw a lot of punishments and tortures and executions of course. Clock's dingle and skeleton shakin' it's rattle, and people get out from doors - You'll want to see them!
Must see. You do have to see it if you visit Prague, not that special but you really can't avoid this if you are walking around Prague.

Amazing piece of history. Another "must see" (there are so many) in Prague. Please take the elevator to the top of the tower that is a part of the old town hall. I recommend doing this in the evening for a stunning view.
Some nice photo opportunities. Be aware that pick pocketers operate when the clock strikes and the figures do their little show! Read up or get a guide to explain how it works!!

worth the wait. loads of cafe bars near and food stalls , sat in front of clock and waited till 3 o clock , then the action begins and it was worth the wait , amazing architecture and well worth the visit...

Amazing!. With staying at the Hotel U Prince, the Old Town Square, and Astronomical Clock were both right on our doorstep, but what a sight to see. Its like taking a step back in time, and seeing true History. There are various tours you can do, and a tourist info in the square so you can learn all about its History. It truely is a remarkable place.

tick tock. when you stand outside on the cold square and watch the little people strike the hour you may feel like one tourist in front of me put it "as disappointing as Christmas" - but when you hear that the guy who designed it had his eyes burnt out so that he could never replicate it for anyone else, you see this clock in a whole new light.
Beautiful architecture. I wish I would have had a tour guide to explain everything in detail. So much to look at and learn. It's definitely worth a stop and a drink at one of the cafes on the square

A Must for any visit to Prague. Not sure if it does it every hour but we were there for 12pm when the clock strikes. You must fight the crowds and do this if you visit Prague. Treat yourself to some hot wine and a sausage from the stalls after watching the clock....great in the snow!

How could you possibly avoid it?. Proof that museums are not dusty repositories of dead things, the whole area is alive at all times (baroque music when we were there) and the crowds are so young you feel rejuvenated.
great views. A definite must is a trip to the top of the astronomical clock - amazing views over Prague and very interesting

tower. It is an excellent view from the top of the tower. the balcony is a little narrow, so you may experience people waiting for you to move forward. But it was built years ago without tourists in mind :)
Overall a very nice place to go for people who like to observe old city roofs, and a panoramic views.

beautiful. The astranomical clock is very beautiful and strikes on the hour every hour. Its lovely to see although it dosnt do that much really. I expected the figurines to come out the windows at the top but they dont they just go past and the skeleton rings a bell...lovely to see just once though

Excellent view from the tower. If you visit the old town square you are likely to visit the town hall and connecting tower with great view over different parts of the town. Get good pictures of the square and its buildings. Elevators take you up and down and in February there where no waiting. The astronomical clock is beautiful and worth several pictures until you get the perfect one. Crowds are there every even hour.

One of the oldest clocks still works perfectly!. Amazing clock with a variety of exciting features. It provides information on: time, sun / moon, star sign and the events that characterize each season. Recommended to visit this when it strikes the hour, then it shows its unique properties!
The Clock Tower. Well worth the £4 to go to the viewing area at the top of the tower. There is a lift part of the way and then easy slope to walk the rest. Great views over the Old Town
Vibrant!. Great atmosphere and loads going on every day. A great mix of cultures and interesting street entertainment.
Amazing clock. Definitely worth a visit to see the clock and the town hall. However, don't bother waiting around to see the clock on the hour, very disappointing!

Difficult clock to read. Its a beautiful clock and symbol of Prague but I could not read the time on it. It is definitely worth spending 100 crones to go right on top to get beautiful views of Prague.

One of My Favourite Visits. The clock is at the very centre of the old town on the main square. To me it is the main symbol of old Prague and everything that I love about the city. The tower offers good views of the old town and there is a separate, poorly publicised tour, of the underground passages, tunnels, dungeons and old streets that run under the tower and its adjacent buildings. We purchased tickets for the underground tour from a separate agency just off the old square - I don't believe that you can pay for access at the tower itself. The ground level in Prague old town was raised in the Middle Ages after serious flooding. As a consequence when you enter the old buildings you are entering what was originally a first floor room - hence all the old buildings having extensive cellars (their original ground floors). Don't miss the underground trips - they are the best part of the tower visit.

Fascinating and entertaining clock. The astronomical clock is fascinating and if you take a town tour, your guide explains the variou dials on the clock faces. Every hour on the hour, a large crowd comes to watch the clock as it goes through it's elaborate but brief chiming. A skeleton figure halfway up the clock structure pulls a chord that rings the bell in the tower. Then two panels slide back and figures representing the twelve apostles rotate past the windows (6 in each) and last of all, a golden cockerel crows, flaps its wings and turns its head. This all lasts about 20 seconds.

Picturesque. The old town hall and astronomical clock are at the heart of the old town square. On the hour the clock chimes into action. Make sure you are there early as the queues to see the event can be long!

The starting point of all Prague tours. For six months, this city was my homebase. Whenever we had visitors, this was the starting point.Down Charles St, across the bridge and up to the castle on the other side of the river

Great views. Not the easiest place to get tickets as poorly signposted, but worth the visit as some really good views from the top.Not far to climb and a lot of narrative to read on the way up. Not much more if you want to take the lift, but recommend walking.

The most beautiful clock ever!. Never have i seen so much detail in one single building, the clock was so intricate and it looked like something you would expect from a fairy story. Very busy area but worth fighting the crowds for a look!

WONDERFUL VIEWS. A journey to the top of the Astronomical Clock Tower is a must when you visit the Old Town Square. Nothing can prepare you for the views - absolutely wonderful. You feel on top of the world. A great camera moment.

Much ado about nothing.. The attraction is that the working parts are original 15th century, even though they have been repaired. The display on the hour is fun, but is just as good as in similar European clocks. The astronomical dials were incomprehensible to a mere tourist but I am sure they would be impressive to an astronomer.

One of our favorite tours. Make sure to purchase the tickets to go to the top of the tower. Make sure to walk, there is an elevator but the climb is part of the experience.The views are amazing.Also make sure to buy the tickets to the tour of the cathedral and underground. Takes you under the streets and to original levels of Prague.Very small price for each about 10 bucks per person for both.Well worth it.

Disappointed. I was very disappointed with the clock. It look stunning but what happens when on the hour was very disappointing. Still you must see it when in Prague as it's in the old square which is simply stunning.

Strongly recommend going up the tower!. I love the old town hall and astrological clock. My favourite part was going up the old town hall tower. There is a lift for those who don't feel able to climb stairs. The stairs aren't too bad to climb, the tower bit is a ramp rather than steps and the very last bit is a spiral staircase which is quite tight but there is a traffic light system to ensure no one else is coming down or up at the same time. The view from the top is brilliant. Looking down on the square is great, the crowd watching the clock look like ants around the chocolate box houses and there are great views of the rest of the city.

A Treat. I can't repeat it enough. It is mandatory to read up on the Old Town Hall history to really appreciate everything that is available to be experienced. The clock is really a marvel of technology and it's operation should not be missed. Go and enjoy.

Church Tower with a Clock. Watching the figures of the saints spin by at the changing of the hour is interesting to watch if you've not seen an old clock tower in action before. They are in many old cities throughout Europe and are a testament to the engineering and masterful skills employed in constructing one of these things in a day when such things were incredibly difficult to do. Without such comprehension it's easy to see why people seem to react with an almost disappointing "uh that's it ?"

Strange story. Be sure to read the history on this famous clock and it's inventor. crowds gather on the hour for the mechanical display which is rather lame but fun to see once. nice outdoor cafe's just across the square.

Interesting. The clock itself is interesting, it has a few faces and a few distinct ways of telling the time. Be sure to be in front of it at 11 am (or a minute before) to see the 12 Apostles appearing
This clock is amazing. Take a tour and listen to the background and history of this clock as well as it's amazing qualities. It is AWESOME! Read about it, at least!
Fun to see. Quite a crowd gathers every hour to see the clock 'do its thing'. Great fun but in Jan you definately need some mulled wine to keep you warm whilst waiting :-)

Very interesting thing to see!. Would highly recommend adding this on your list of things to see while visiting Prague! The detail of the clock is amazing! Around the clock are plenty of restaurants and other things to do and see.

Take the lift up to the top of the tower. We passed the clock several times a day during our week's stay and on our last day found out how to get to the top. Enter through the tourist office and turn right and take the lift to the 4th floor where you will find a ticket office. The lift from the 4th floor to the roof is something to behold - it is like stepping into a space capsule. Ticket prices are reasonable and the view from the top of the tower is magnificent although a bit windy and cold in the first week in January!
Do not miss watching the clock ding dong. Death with a bell on the tower....Anice experience yo watch charecters come out of the clock. /make sure to be there on time.
Ok ish. This is ok to see but if you do a bit of research there are lots of other great things to see in this city, very tourist trappy spot, and watch out for pick pockets.

Picture-perfect. I walk past the town hall and clock tower many times during my stay in Prague at different hours of the day. Never fail to snap a picture each time. And there was a great student street orchestra when I was there. Too bad I only get to hear them play one piece.

Be there at the hour time and get on the top!. The clock is simply beautiful. To be honest, I do not understand how the clock works. It looks a little complicated, guess there must be a book or guide that explains you how to read the time on it. Every hour there is a little 'show' at the clock, the skeleton will ring the bell and then there is a kind of rotating figures at the windows for you to see. I heard the guys around there said it last 26 seconds (but I didn't count it though, so it was not confirmed). The show, honestly, didn't have anything special. It is cute to see for you to put a smile and laugh out loud after it finished, but do not expect much. There is a bird's eye view tower at the top at clock. It is worth to see. You can see the town of Prague from that. The view is magnificent and it cost like 50 kc for students discount.

Historical place II - Luogo storico II. I'm here only to update my previous note. The company that cares about the Old Town Hall changed and things go a little bit different.
