The organisation now is deffinitely better. There are guided tours along all the place - the gothic chapel, historical halls and the cellars, you don't need to read a text any more. The tours are each half an hour and there is a schedule with the languages for all the day. You can enter without any problem, see when there is a tour in your language and there you can organise yourself. Every day languages are Czech, English and French, then you may have a tour in German, Italian, Spanish and other language - depends on a day. In case you don't want to wait for a tour - you can go with a text by yourself without the cellars - that is only with the guide. The tickets are even cheaper - the full price is 100 crowns, combined ticket (halls, underground and tower) is the same - 160 crowns, reductions for students, opencard holders, seniors (over 65 and 75) and a family ticket.Sono qui ad aggiornare la mia precedente recensione - in quanto non mi era piaciuta la traduzione fatta da trip advisor - ora la faccio direttamente io :).Siccome è cambiata la gestione al municipio, sono cambiate alcune cose. Per vedere le sale storiche ci sono ora le visite guidate che partono ogni mezz'ora (il prezzo è compreso della guida) e ogni mattina ci sta un orario di tutte le lingue in cui si faranno le visite quel giorno. Quindi voi venite, vedete gli orari e potete tranquillamente scegliere in che lingua e a che ora fare la visita e secondo questo vi organizzate la giornata. La visita dura circa 45 min e i costi sono quasi uguali. Il biglietto combinato - le salle, i sotterranei e la torre - costa uguale - 160 corone, il biglieto separato è un poco più economico - 100 corone. Altre riduzioni per gli studenti, bambini, seniori (più 65 e 75 anni) e biglietto famiglia.Le lingue assicurate sono ceco, inglese e francese, poi secondo i giorni fanno cambio tedesco, russo, italiano, spagnolo e altre. Nel caso in cui non vuolete attendere la visita, riceverete il testo e le salle vedete da soli - senza i sotterranei. Lì si può andare solo con la guida.

nice to see the once. the clock is more intresting if taken in context of its age started being built 1410 would have been a major form of entertainment then probably.i came saw it was entertained for 5 minutes. some people come back every hour to see it i recomend doing something else with those hours, also every bar restaurant and shop is 3 times more expensive than the rest of prague. watch for pickpockets while staring at clock i did see some eying tourists up

The clock is OK if you like that sort of thing.. I did not actually go up the clock tower, but the views are supposed to be good. Personally I would recomend the view from the palace if that is what you are loking for.The clock is interesting and the show that it puts on each hour is quite unique, though I am not sure it would be worth taking a trip to Prague soley just to see an antiquated timepeice.

Get up there!. Even tho I've been to Prague 4 times, I'm just as fascinated with the clock as I was the first time I saw it. Make sure you're there on the hour! You don't want to miss the skeleton with the drum!The square is of course most beautiful when it's dark and I urge anyone to go up in the tower, it's perfect if you're on a romantic date, you'll see Prague from all sides. Don't forget your camera!They close at 10 PM.We were here days before X-mas and it was SO stunning, I actually had tears in my eyes. :)
Beautiful clock, and beautiful views. Even though our guide took the 10 minutes it takes to explain how the clock works, I still have no idea.The view from the top of the tower was great as well.

Very Cute. We visited in off season and even then it was busy. The day we visited it was -12c so we sat in one of the out door bars under a blanket and heater while drinking hot choc and had a lovely spag bol. We arrived just at 3pm so missed the display then and so waited for the 4pm one and it is just lovely to see, brought a smile to our faces.

A day in Prague, Czech. Prague is a nice city where you can walk around and take in the sites in Old Town. I also took a 3 hour tour which was recommended by the Concierge at the Hilton Old Town. The tour was great since it was winter and pretty cold for being out in the weather too long. The guide was very informative showing various Government Buidings, the Prague Castle, St. Charles Bridge, and then the tour connected to an enclosed, warm boat ride down the River.The Hilton Old Town is a perfect location for seeing Prague. I was only there 1 day but a 2-3 day stay would be terrific if you have the time.
Magical at Christmas time. Like a page out of a storybook - definitely worth visiting at Christmastime! So much to see and very interesting. Take your camera!

Don't miss the tower view. The Astronomical Clock was very interesting and when I was there on the weekend they even had a live trumpeter who played from the tower. Please don't miss paying a little extra to go up into the tower. Take the elevator and you'll get a wonderful 360 degree view of the city.

Stay for the trumpeter. Don't be late as the show starts exactly on the hour. Very Medieval and unique with characters the pop out the windows at the top during the chiming on the hour. Make sure you get a good spot for photos.

fabulous views. Views from the top of the tower are wonderful - worth going up even on a misty, snowy day. There is a lift up the centre of the tower or you can opt to use the ramp which spirals around the inside of the walls - there is a short steep spiral staircase at the top of the ramp. The clock is beautiful and large but the movements that happen each hour are not spectacular - don't worry if you don't happen to be there at the right time to see it in action!

Go up the tower. The town hall tower is worth a visit, and if you can't face the steps there's a lift. The view from the top is magnificent and well signposted.The clock is less impressive, but worth pausing to watch on the hour.

Must see in Prague. I have now visited the clock several times and I am still not bored of it! It is one of the best sites in Prague and each time I discover something new about it. Do not miss the clock on the hour!

Enjoyable visit, and unforgettable chimes on the hour.. It has to be done when in Prague, but when visiting the Old Town Square don't forget the clock and it's party piece with it's on the hour chiming. Get a good spot for both the camera and video.Enjoyable and free.

The Astronomical Clock.. Amazing! I never knew such a clock existed besides reading about it in books. It's real, it's old, it's beautiful. It makes u feel like luck has just brushed your eyes. A MUST see.

Old Town. We went just before christmas and the christmas tree in the square was wonderful well worth braving the cold to see. Had a job to see the clock when it was striking because of the crowds of people but worth looking at even when it's not striking.

Interesting. One of the first things you realize when you come to the astronomical clock in old town square is you don't know what to do with it. There is an hourly show where some drama happens but other than that there is nothing much that happens. But apart from that the old town hall area is bustling with shops and tourists and is very colorful.

Go up and go down!. You can go up to the top of the clock (there is a lift) you need to use the doors by the tourist information - go in here and they will direct you views across the square are fantastic but the vertigo may kick in!! This year we also went below the clock on a ghost walk which was great! Mostly done at night and not for the disabled this was a real eye opener as to how the level of the city was raised due to continual flooding
Beautiful Prague. Must take the elevator up to the top for the fantastic view of the town and rooftops. You can time it also for the trumpet blower every hour on the hour.
Interesting to see but couldn't understand it!. We stood with plenty of others waiting for the clock to perform but wished I had read up on what it all means, as I just couldn't fathom it out.

old town clock. a beautiful sight with a lovely sound, does get really busy watching it from the front, but can be still seen easily, quite a long hike up all the stairs to the top but well worth the view, a really nice historical , beautiful recently renovated astronomical clock, dont miss it

Make sure you get there on the hour. The square was crowded and unless you got there earlier than exactly on the hour you would miss the movement of the clock, the square is filled with beautiful old building and the wait was worth it.

Busy but has to be seen. Lots of people - clock chimes every hour on the hour but it's one of the things on every tourist's tick list and you should see it. Watch out for pick-pockets as you easily distracted looking up at the clock
I thought it would be more. If you are in the area at the top of the hour watch the little show, otherwise I wouldn't hang arround. The clock itself is beatiful.

Not very interesting. When I was researching things to do in Prague, every guide that I read suggested that we should see this clock.
But at the end is not super cool! And when it starts to ring a lot of people stay close to it to see the dolls that come out, so be aware with pickpockets...

Go to the top!. Views of the Old Town Square and surrounding areas of Prague are very dramatic from the top of the tower. Try to be up there when the trumpeter plays on the hour. Very crowded area, but well worth the visit.

atmospheric. Go into the tower, top floor. worth it. If you're lucky enough to go in the winter and it snows, you cant hear any of the noise from below, all the buildings old and new look alike under the snow and you feel as if you've been taken back in time. You get cold and wind struck but its worth it. Dress up warm.

Interessante / Interesting. When we get to know that this is the oldest clock of its kind still working, we really think how amazing it is, but when we just see it (both the clock and the square), they are just a beautiful place to see.Qd se sabe q este é o relógio mais antigo do seu tipo e ainda em funcionamento, pode-se surpreender com isso, porém, sem o saber, não passam de um relógio interessante e uma praça "comum" de se ver.

Old Town Hall. Visiting Prague just before Christmas was beautiful timing. The square was filled with street performers and Prague's Christmas Fair was in full gear. Real Christmas spirit pervades this old world setting.
a must!. Beautiful! Beautiful! Beautiful! Just don`t miss it! :) If you go there on the winter, don`t forget to get some hot wine while listening to the street musicians :)

Amazing Astronomical Clock. Had read about this clock in a book about Prague set just after ww2 so was eager to see it. Quite amazing but get there early as the crowds build up as it gets nearer to the hour - so you can see the wonderful display.
A little overrated but must see. The clock is as touristy as you get, but just enter it and join the crowds to see the clock movement once an hour

Old city charm. The old town square and the adjoining astronomical clock is one of the top tourist destination in Prague.The clock is beautiful and the adjoining tower provides Ariel view of the whole city.The atmosphere is like party with so many ppl around and some street artist as well. The town square is pretty big open area and hence many public events are hosted here.

Stick around if you are there at the hour. Well, if you hear all the "must see" and see all the people gathered round the clock.. you will probably be disappointed when you see the actual happenings. However, if you are in the area at the right time, why not stop by and take a look?Every hour, from 0900 to 2100, the clock will sound the hour with a procession of the 12 Apostles, a skeletion will ring the bell and some other statuettes will be shaking their heads. At the end of the procession a cockerel will crow and then someone at the top of the clock tower will sound the trumpet. I really like the trumpeting part lol. You can pay to go up the tower but if you just watch from outside, it is free.
complex clock. Yes, it is easier to look at the clock above the astronomical clock. It puts on a great show as there are puppets that go around. Must see!
So Touristy. Everyone goes and sees it, but it's a fuss about nothing. Bessie going to the nooks and crannies and explore.

Absolute must see. On the hour, the two windows on the clock open and the figurines of the 12 apostles appear for a few short minutes. It is fascinating and to imagine how those early craftsmen could build such a marvellous contraption without computers and sophisticated equipment is simply mind-boggling.

unique sites and prague icon. Astronomical clock in Prague is iconic similar to the Big Ben in London. Within its sites is the Old Town Hall and few hundred meters to Tyne Cathedral which is also an icon.Tourists flock to this area in numbers and now I see why this site is unique and wonderful.
Go to the top. Although it costs a bit, go to the top of the Old Town Hall. There are elevators all the way to the top. Don't miss the mosaics on the 2nd floor.
Was expecting more!. The square surrounding the clock is very nice and cosmopolitan, but I was expecting more of the clock.
Anticlimax, much?. It was a great attraction, but just don't get your hopes up for something worth a huge reaction. The chicken at the end sounds sad, but it does have a certain charm to it.

a world reknown landmark..... No trip to Prague would be complete without staring in awe at this amazing spectacle. Astonishing to think of the history and events played out in the square since its construction.
Reminds us Americans of just how young a nation we are. This same clock was chiming before the Pilgrims hit Plymouth!
Street meat next door to Prada. Nice street merchant offerings if that's your thing. Was still in Xmas decorations but the area seems to be burgeoning at all times of year.

A great view across the city.. The clock is a great tourist attraction with hundreds of tourist waiting for the clock to come to life every hour. A great spectacle for all. The clock is a amazing peice of work, we had the different dials faces etc explained by our guide, so its worth finding our what everythings means. I paid and went up to the top of the clock tower for the views across the city. Not for those who suffer for vertigo. Space is very limited at the top and it can be quite bust. Great views across the city and of the Old Town Square below.

Ding Ding Ding Ding. I was here for four days right at the start of the Christmas market in December and I was in for a treat. The Old Town Hall is absolutely buzzing at this time of the year and I must say it looks really lovely, with plenty of picture opportunities. It is surrounded by numerous shops and restaurants but I don't recommend most of them since I am sure they are overpriced. Venture into the narrow streets and increase your odds of finding a cheaper, better place. If you are interested in wandering around and getting lost in the old streets of Prague, the Old Town Hall will serve as an excellent reference point for you to get back your bearings. If you based your experience of Prague's Old Town Hall on viewing the 'performance' of the 600-year-old Astronomical Clock, I am almost certain that it will be flat and anti-climatic. But the clock is not what the Old Town Hall is about. It is a busy, crowded and touristy place but like all great squares and plazas in the world, you should not miss it for the incredible atmosphere it generates.
Great experience. It's a good experience to see how the clock works when it rings. You must arrive 15 mins before it rings to admire the complexity of its mecanism. Impressive and pretty.

What's the Fuss?. The Town Hall was really lovely and the fact that we went a little before Christmas meant that the area was getting ready for the Christmas market. Sadly, we missed it by a few days but the atmosphere was truly lovely with vendors selling handmade arts and crafts, bakers baking some delicious cinnamon-y bread, and vendors selling grog and hot wine. Definitely buy the bread and dunk it in the hot wine. Now, for the clock--I don't get what the fuss is about other than it is a really old cuckoo clock that chimes on the hour (and half with half a performance). Pedestrian traffic stops for the 15 minutes before it sounds and you would think the Pope was approaching with hundreds and thousands of people gawking to get a view (look up people--no need to push to the front). The square is exceptionally lovely at night too.

Must see. How can you go to Prague and not visit it? The clock is beautiful and worth a stop. Make sure you get a good spot, because you can be overrun by hundreds of tourists =)Old town is a great option for a walk after you have a meal in one of those many restaurants or a delicious Trdelník

Make a visit to the Astronomical Clock. If you want to visit the tower with the Astronomical Clock, you should know that the entrance is cheap (110 CZK per person) and the view is absolutely incredible. You can see the entire market and the rest of Prague. Being an important attraction point, you will find it very crowded when you will rich the top. For a fast visit, you can use the internal elevator.
Charming. The clock is fabulous. The area very touristy evn on a old January day. Nonetheless lovely and charming
Disappointed. Given all I had read regarding the clock I had higher expectations. On the hour you see two doors open and figures spin on a wheel. Not a reason to visit Prague.
tick tock. The clock and the square around - you need to be there for'on the hour' to see the clock in operation..... Fun but not asgood as I had been led to believe... However, you must go there
Hourly Show. Make sure to watch the clocks animation that occurs on the hour and tour the underground which starts at the Astronomical Clock!
Overestimated.... Totally overestimated sight - loads of tourists, nothing spectacular, though nice to see, especially if you get an explanation.

Great Views from the top. The astronomical clock draws in the crowds on the hour to watch it's automation. It's worth seeing but not as spectacluar as the guide books make out. What is worth seeing is the view from the top of the Old Town Hall. Tickets are available from a little room under the clock but if there are queues here go inside the Town Hall (where the tourist information is situated), take the life to the 3rd floor & get your ticket there. Then get the tower lift up to the top or if your feeling fit you can walk up ( I prefer to walk down!).The views from all four sides (on a clear day) are great. You can spend as much time as you like up here but it can get a bit crowded.Well worth a visit.
Nice Panorama. The clock itself is wonderful, so please do not miss it, is really worth it. Beside you pay a few euros and go to the top when you see all prague. Sunset viewing highly recommended
A Prague "Must See" and it's free!. A must see in Prague...hard not to when you walk by it ten times a day! Lots of tourists...but hey, its free. Why not stop for a photo op?

ok BUT get there near on the hour. Lts of chez get married by the clock people running around in wedding dress this is the local town hall Clock ok but we got their at 13 05 so had just missed the clock working....so we deceided to go in side and go to the top the nice thing is got loads of stairs BUT their a choice of going via lift.....stairs are not for the faint hearted my daughter took the stairs i took the lift once up on the top well worth the view, you got north south east west roof top views and they have put discription of whats what HONEST well worth small fee but good vaule..... as coming down we stop and as if we like to look around the town hall and see the figue from the clock this was free so we did they only as a few people this was great we went under the town hall and were given a history lesson was lovely there was only 5 of us in the party....if they do not ask you MUST ask them we love it...painting and the halls were amazing......when we came out side just manager to catch the figue coming out of the clock not as impressed as inside long way up small figues but again worth a visit
Beautiful!. This was stunning to watch! The 26 second showing, the clock performs is fascinating! be quick though! It's on the hour every hour but is over in a flash!
Be Here On The Hour, You Will Be Rewarded. This clock is amazing and the history behind the clock is worth hearing. If you study the clock and all of its parts it will make sense to you, eventually!

I love this "little" clock. I am amazed by this clock. Seriously. It is not "wow" spectacular but it is amazing. This clock was built over 600 years ago and still works and that is a great feat of engineering. All of the little pieces have to work together. 600 years ago this would have been almost a miracle sighting. The workmanship alone is fascinating. I watched in the rain the first time and came back later at night to watch again. If some people want just "wow" they should just go to Disneyland. If you want culture and history, this is the place to come. Also, head to your right and stop in Caffrey's Irish Pub.

Give Up. I still don't understand exactly how the astronomical clock is supposed to work. Give up. We will probably never understand.Depending on the time of your visit, you may encounter the holiday (or Christmas) market. Then the throng around the clock is augmented by the throngs of the market. But look to the right of the clock and buy a ticket to enter the tower (entrance to the right) and go up in the tower for a unique experience. Inside is stunning in its own right. Don't take the lift down again - take the stairs and look at the construction. If you can, do the tower at night. Beautiful photographs to be had all around.
Amazing. historic and amazing did not go the top to busy over new year loved the clock chimes on the hour. Lots of atmosphere with the christmas markets

Oldest working astronomical clock in Europe. Neat piece of history, and it's an amazing to look at the craftsmanship of the sculpture and art. It had an entire clockwork-like show pop out every hour from 8a-8p, plus a Babylonian clock.
A Marvel to Watch. The clock is an absolute marvel, we couldn't help but wonder about the genius of the builders and how it has worked for so many hundreds of years.
Have to see it. You cannot miss this one in Prague, it goes on every hour and wait for the skeleton there, that's the most famous one of all the characters.
Old Town. Worth seeing during the Christmas period - The Christmas market, festive tree and church bell sounds when combined while you wonder around the market are beautiful.

Beautiful place, poor presentation. The clock is very beautiful, and it is located in a square full of interesting itens of the Christmas street fair. Me and my husband had missed the noon presentation, but it was pleasant to be in the square until 1 pm. Nevertheless, the "show" is very simple and it is not a must view spetacle.

Beautiful and Amazing. During our site seeing through out Prague, this is definatly one of the most amazing place got to see. when if you happen to be near the clock when it chimmes then you are definatly in for a show. all in all in it a wonderful photo worthy site to see.
Center of Prague Tourism. The place to be when the clock strikes and the action starts, Be there or be square. Particularly nice with nearby Christmas decorations and market

building - ok, but clock show - disappointing. the building itself is very interesting. But that "show" every hour as a part of Astronomical Clock is very disappointing - just two windows opens and few figures shows. Everything go on lest than 30 sec., and people wait in front of clock even half an hour to see that poor show.
welcome 2013. great everybody welcoming the new year just watch out for fireworks being let off in front of the clock

Do the tower tour. We usually keep our eyes out for good views when we visit cities, and the view from the tower of the Old Town Hall didn't disappoint. It's not a bad walk up (long ramp - not stairs) and there's an elevator available if it's needed. From the top you get great views down onto the square and across the city as well as towards the castle. It was only about 100 CZK for myself and my wife (at a student rate) and was worth every bit of that.
Amazing clock. An amazing piece of mechanical genius! It's worth buying a leaflet about the clock to see how it works... It shows the season, the time, star of the zodiac, and more! Amazing!

Beautiful clock - be there when the hour strikes. The astronomical clock is located on the side of the town hall at one side of the Old Town Square. It's a beautiful thing - but hard to imagine how it might work! Huge crowds amass in preparation for the striking of the hour - and the movement and chimes are over in around 30 seconds. Worth seeing at least once.

A must see, but not worth waiting for the 'show'. The clock is really interesting, and worth getting a guide book or tour to explain the relevance of the figures etc. The show itself on the hour is actually quite underwhelming, so don;t wait around for it, just try to coincide your passing through at the same time.

Lot of tourists!. Astronomical clock was much smaller than i expected. If you are going to visit Astronomical clock you should go see it in the morning because afternoons and evenigs there is so much tourists that you can even see it.
Astronomical Clock. Join the crowds waiting for the clock to chime on the hour. The clock is beautiful and the figures on it "dance" on the hour.

traces back to the 14th century. Impressive historical sight. Make sure to stay as the clock strikes the hour especially at night. The clock looks amazing as it sets off and then the bugler performs. you will remember this moment forever.

You will be disappointed. And maybe even pickpocketed.. Do not get me wrong. The town hall, astronomical clock and entire Old Town Square are real marvels. But waiting for a full hour to se "apostle figure show" is really not worth it. If you do wait, watch your pockets whent it begins, there is usually huge crowd under the clock tower...
Climb the Stairs. Pay the fee to climb to the top. Great views of the Square. There is also a elevator should you not fancy the climb.
Bit boring. It chimes on the hour and little figures pop out. Not worth standing in the cold waiting for the hour to chime.. View from the top of the tower however is good.

Something for the photo album. This is certainly a place to visit.You will not have seen anything like this anywhere else in the world. Every hour the clock gives a great show to everyone in the square. It is fascinating each time you watch as there is always something you did not see the first time around.
It's a clock, but I still can't tell the time. It's a very old clock that still works and every hour the status start moving. but once you've seen it once there's no need to stop again.

Great! Except the Earth Revolves Around thu Sun, Not the Other Way Around. In the old town square, there is an astronomical clock. It chimes every hour from 9am until 10pm. When it chimes, the four statues (two on the left side of the clock, two on the right) start to move! Also, 12 apossels move across the clock. A great attraction, though the inpatient type should get there on the hour!

Views are amazing. The climb is a quite difficult and there is a lift for those who don't like spiral star cases but for 110CKZ (approx £4 ) is a good way to spend an hour! Be there for the clock stricking the new hour and meet the jester!

bit mental when you go.... if you go to see it ring it is really crazy because there are so many people, so I suggest going at another time to just see the clock. the show that it puts on its not that amazing because the parts are so old they cant move much
Cute. As you will be there anyway, take the time and watch the clock. You do not need to rush there and any spot in front will give you a view.

Lovely clock. Apart from the impressive building, if you can wait for a rounded hour to see the clock moving, it is a very great moment. Then going on top of that tower will give you a beautiful view of that nice square.

Go on the hour. Visited it twice. Once in the morning at 9am with the chiming. Read that it chimes each hour. It was freezing cold and the StarBucks opposite looked so inviting. Visited it again the next night and the place was absolutely crowded (shoulder to shoulder) as there was a Christmas Market at the Old Town Square. Lots of activities, food, festive stuff. A woman was making giant bubbles (like close to a metre in diameter) with a rope-like wand, enchanting all the children who watched with awe. Great if you want the festive feel!

A Prague Must-Do. This is where the main square in town is. The clock is cool to see and every hour it does a simple little display of old Prague architecture moving. One of the best views of the city that I got was on top of the tower at this location. Take the first elevator up, but choose to walk up to the top once you finish with the first elevator. They have historical things about the clock you can read. Bring your camera!

A must go. Heart of the historical prague. It is a must-go spot for visitors to Prague. I am impressed by the clock for its complexity and aesthetics. Everyone should go up the Old Town Hall to have a look of the beautiful city.
wonderful. The old town and the astronomical clock is a place you should visit if you are in Prague. The architecture of the buildings is just amazing

a piece of history. even though i though it would have been bigger. the clock is well worth seeing. it does its thing on the hour every hour. well worth the visit on the edge of the old town square...

Go at night!. The view from the top at nighttime looking over the Christmas markets was just beautiful. Dirt cheap to get up there and the stairs were very manageable, though there is a lift too if you are unable or unwilling to take the stairs.
kind of boring. Once you have read about it in the tourist books, there isn't a whole lot more to see. It is exactly as described.
Nice to see, as it still runs. Nice piece of architecture, mechanics and illumination. This landmark looks good day or night. You can walk in and get upstairs
Extraordinary !. This place is the definition of an old medieval place.Will remain in your memories for the rest of your life !

It's a long way up!. It was surprisingly cheap to get a ticket to the top of the Old Town Hall (about £3), but that may be relatively-speaking, as our comparison was with the extortionate Rome prices, having visited the Italian capital a short while before. The views from the top of the Town Hall are amazing and definitely the best way to get a panoramic view of the city, worth the ticket price alone! There is a lift for those who find it hard to negotiate the journey to the top on foot, though it is not really 'stairs', more of a long, continual incline that wraps around the inside of the tower in a big square spiral!The clock was a little disappointing in its simplicity and brevity, it was over before we knew what was happening, but still a nice and quaint little quirk to see while you're there, plus it is free, so who is complaining!?

Don't miss to go up in the tower. I missed it the first time I passed, but last night I got up in the tower and got a great view of Prague in the winter night. I can only imagne what it will look like in the spring...

Great place. It is a place to visit for its historic background but the number of eateries and small item sellers around have kind of spoilt the charm to some extent. But otherwise, lovely to be there..

a tourist attraction.... The old town hall is a very beautiful monument in the centre of the old town square. The clocks on the outside of the monument are very spectacular, and the old town hall is open for visit. I wouldn't recommend to visit it actually, because you have to pay for it and the view isn't so special. You'll have the same view from other Prague monuments for which you don't have to pay and they're even better.
wow. how cool is this clock the day was freezing and everyone was wrapped up and drinking hot wine but on the hour a crowd joined us and wow the clock and the trumpeter on the roof well cool
Time for a visit. 4th visit never fails to amaze, just how does it work?Wonderful area of Prague, very expensive as you would expect but well worth the crowds.

Wondrous clock!. The Astronomical Clock is a landmark in Prague and for good reason. It is an amazing work of art that tells the time by minute, hour, day, month, astrological sign, and even the season. Every hour the apostles parade through the glass windows while the figures of greed, avarice, death and a Turk animate. There is even a gold chicken that flaps its wings. You can go inside and climb the steps - or better yet take the elevator - to the top for an amazing view of the city. On your way back down, talk to the friendly attendant and they explain how the clock works and you can pick up a copy of the brochure that explains it for a small price. Don't miss it!

Meh.... So during one of the city tours I took, the guide assembled us 5 mins before midday. She told us not to expect too much and thank goodness she prewarned us. Although it must have been quite impressive back in the day, to see little puppet like figures come out. The brief trumpet performance was... simply rubbish.
Historical landmarks. Like most buildings in Prague OTH & Clock are amazing with brilliant Gold in most designs, how do they keep them clean!

Clock is a mystery. The clock is amazing - but how does it work an what does it do? No one really explained this to us - we just stood around and looked at it. Guess we should have done our homework ahead of time - which is a recommendation! But it is lovely and interesting and located in the town square, so you can't miss it
Most loved. Don't miss the fanfare when clock strikes hr...everyone gathered there waits for it and applauds it...even if u don't want to go inside n enjoy with the crowd outside...

Beautiful City!. We visited during the Christmas market. It was crowded but people were friendly. We enjoyed the wonderful street foods and unusual handmade Christmas decorations. The market square with its architecture is breathtaking! Prague is one of the most beautiful and interesting cities I have ever visited! I plan on visiting annually from now on!
Amazing Clock. It is fascinating to watch the clock on the hour, all the different statues move, everything just comes alive and then the bugler comes out, not to be missed
Don't miss the Clock... Anywhere one stands around the Astronomical Clock offers a good view. The area becomes very crowded, especially on a Saturday night..
Plenty of tourists. When you come along during busy times you never feel like stopping but once in a year it is nice to watch this marvel.

Best view in Prague. For a moderate price (55 KR min, 105 KR maximum), you'll get to see an amazing and colourful view of the Square, and also a scenery that goes from the Castle to St. Vitus cathedral. Don't miss it.
One of the top ten must in Prague. Amazing genius loci. This is like Time square in NY or Eiffel Tower in Paris. If you are there, just look around and perceive the atmosphere.
Interesting but definitely overated. If you don't know the history of the clock, it is definitely overated. Do not waste too much time with it.
Unusual. I didn't know what to expect whilst viewing this, however it was beautiful, an absolute masterpiece, although I still do not understand what it does! Would thoroughly recommend a tour guide.

Fantastic!. The astrological clock was as going back in time. Fantastic experience. The man who created this clock was an artist and a genius. The area was very crowded because alle turist wants to see it.

Modern and old all in one. I was expecting an "old-style" tower, climbing 300 stairs in a narrow stairwell. Not so in the Astronomical Clock Tower - very very modern, glass elevator and all. The history of the tower is explained on panels on the way up, so maybe it's a good idea to walk instead of taking the elevator. The top of the tower is amazing for taking photos, of course.
Amazing after all these years.. The clock draws a large crowd, and you can enjoy it from any angle. We especially like the view from the top and watching the trumpeter up close.

The view was GREAT1. We went up into the tower and the view was beautiful. We could see the Christmas Market and the Square, the castle. It was just amazing. The clock when it chimed was fun to watch.!!
Beautiful old town area. Enjoy the sights and sounds - the clock was beautiful but I wouldn't wait an hour to see the characters move -- arrive 5 min before - large crowds
interesting and an engineering feat. Funny very old clock worth watching on the hour between 9am and 10pm. Try weekday mornings to avoid the crowds. (need change for loo inside the town hall)
Be there on the hour. You won't miss it as there is always a crowd awaiting the chiming of the clock, the trumpeters etc. It is definitely worth seeing more than once as you notice more each time.

One of the great clocks of the world. Watch the clock perform, climb the town hall tower for a great view of the old town and don't forget to look down at Prague's fabulous pavements.It's crowded - make sure your bag is safe!

A bit of a let down. Astronomical clock. Just an old clock in an old square. It was good to see how the clock has lasted the test of time.. (Ha ha) but when you see it in action it was a little bit of a let down.

Well worth a look. We went up to the top and the views of the city are impressive. A young man plays a trumpet every hour from all four sides of the tower and usually gets a round of applause from the tourists below
View from above. Yesterday I found photos from 17 years ago I had taken from the clock tower! Fewer people were visiting the square that summer than we saw in October 2012!

Memorable. Not the most complex mechanical clock display I have seen, but entertaining, if only for the finale, which is a gilded cock attemping to crow but which sounds as if it was being strangled! Got a good round of applause and laughs from the crowd. If you want to see a one off event check out YouTube for the millenium celebrations. Brilliant

tourist "must see". You walk through old town square almost every time you leeavs the Savic Hotel.which is brilliant,The decorations,especially the tree,are spectacular and a Visit to the top of the tower of the Astronomical Clock should not be missed.We also joined a tour of WW2 Prague,which was fascinating and included the under ground sites of the old town hall.The guide of our tour was Marek Taborsky,who was knowledgable,informative and amusing.We booked at the hotel desk,but you can reach marek at ww2in Prague@seznam.cz

Beautiful View. Only a 20 min walk from our hotel (Hilton Prague); the Astronomical Clock was a great spot as it is centrally located (and like all of the sites in Prague, has a unique historical background). Because I was travelling for a work conference, I did not have much time to visit all the historical buildings of the city. Climbing the clock tower was great because I was treated to an amazing panoramic view of the city and saw many of the sites that I would otherwise have missed. Be sure to be there on the hour so you can watch the clock chime from the ground below.

Surprises!. I hadn't done a lot of research about Prague before I came but I had heard of the astronomical clock and it was completely fascinating! I could just about make out the zodiac part, but nothing else, I am still stumped! It is just so clever and intricate it really is fascinating.The surprise came on the hour, every hour. A little display occurs in the windows just above the astronomical clock. A little fanfare sounds and the disciples of Jesus appear in one of the windows, which is incredibly charming. Lovely.
lovely clock but !!!. Lovely clock,waited for it too chime,very overated in fact quite dissapointing the views from the top are good though.

Interesting!. The Astronomical Clock is rather interesting. Not only is it one of the oldest clock around, it works too! We were treated to a short show by the clock's moving figures as well as the blowing of the trumpet by someone dressed in a medieval outfit high up in the tower. Definitely worth a visit when in Prague!

Don't miss. Not the prettiest clock of this type I have seen & the figures that I thought would pop out of the windows actually just moved past. There was also a fellow playing some sort of trumpet right at the top but it was not really easy to see him. The clock would have been better sited on the wall facing the square as it is rather cramped when the crowds gather but of course it wasn't put there for modern day tourists. But it was all good fun.

Hidden City under the Old Town Hall - well worth a look!. I went to Prague for the second time this December and was really impressed by the tour of the Old Town Hall - which I didn't even realise was there when I first visited!There are two parts to this tour - a self guided look around the various inter-connected houses comprising the Town Hall (which includes an interesting view of the back of the Astronomical Clock mechanism) and secondly a guided tour of the underground section. Our guide for the second part gave the tour in English, Russian and Portugese and was incredibly knowledgable and enthusiastic about the history of these areas.Fascinating history, well conducted tour and very good value.
Wait and watch. We all enjoyed the hourly spectacle. The trumpeter was fun and could be heard from quite a way a way.

High expectations poor results. We went to see the Clock that every guide to Prague says is a must. Well, the clock itself is a masterpiece. But if you wait for the hourly "show" with thousands other tourists you should know that it consists of several wooden dolls appearing in a window for a few seconds and some bells ringing. That's it!!!

great views but to many tourists. Visiting Prague we had to visit this place to see the clock, both it and the buildings were stunning to look at , there were lots of food stalls to pick from and gift stalls to get those things to take home, but beware of pick pockets they are prolific in this area,but Prague is safe otherwise due to the high level of police and security staff

Added extras. Last visited about 15 years ago and don't remember the Herald playing, from the top of the Town Hall, when the clock chimes. It was delightful. The variety of street entertainers was amazing and I never felt forced into giving money.

Due to croud. A lot of tourists are impressed due the "singing" of the astronomical clock - what can I say, was nothing special about it just a lot of croud but if you like to check out buildings, its a lot to see.

I'm such a tourist I had to do it. On the hour the clock's windows open and you see figures moving inside. Unless you're opposite the front you will miss this. It gets busy from about 15 minutes before so get there early if you want to witness the event. The best thing is to have a look at the view from the top. There is a charge for this.
Christmas Markets. Go to the top of the clock tower for the best view of the city. It is inexpensive and there is a lift to the top if you don't fancy the walk up.

Amazing views. Beautiful architecture and photo ops. Paying for the ticket to go to the top of the Astronomical Clock Tower was worth it if you like taking photos. A full 360 degree view of Old Town Prague and more.
Old Town hall Prague.. Wait to see the clock strike, because one does. Climb the tower too, because the views are excellent.
Unique. Maybe a crazy clock, but still a must see in PragueCome 5 minutes before the hour and don’t forget to clap hands "after the show"

What time is it?. Traveling Europe has definitely forced me to read my history. Usually my wife feeds me little lesser know factoids to peak my interest (because I love lesser know factoids), then I need to know all the information around it. This clock is one of those crazy intricate clocks that tells you everything from the season to the size of your shoes. The craziest part of it is that is was made in the 1400's! Yes, at the same time that Tamerlane was killing 20 million across Asia, the plague was killing Europeans, Columbus was getting lost in the ocean, and to get around you walked or rode a horse...these folks were creating clocks that were accurate to the tenth of a second. To read all the information on the clock, you need a 15 minute course of instruction or a real thick manual. I like machinery, and this one is pretty cool. Make your way down to the Old Square and watch it on the hour, but beware; everyone else is heading there as well, and it will be packed. Expect to be there for 5 minutes and then continue seeing all the other things to be seen in Prague.
Cool clock. If you can brave the crowd, you can watch figures do their little show on the hour. The show is quick. Not Disney, but it is much much older.
A must see!. Beautiful, historic clock draws hundreds of tourists so beware of pickpocketers. Best experienced at noon.

Don,t make a special visit. The clock and tower is worth seeing but As it operates every 30 minutes, I personally would not make a special visit to see it.There are crowds that flock to see it and are all pressed together,so beware of pickpockets whilst you are watching.

Go at 5 minutes before the hour. We were lucky with our timing, we arrived just in time to get a hot mulled wine and wait five minutes to see the clock strike the hour. It was just as much fun as the guidebooks said it would be. We also came back at night and went up the tower to get a view of the square.

Superb. Until you see this clock you will not totally understand. Every hour crowds gather in front to watch the display come to life and the trumpet is then sounded from above and then cheering from the crowd - must see.

Beautiful Square but Scary Crowded on our Visit!. We visited this area during the first weekend in December while the X-Mas Market was going on. This probably was our mistake. While the clock is magnificent - the square surrounding it was so crowded that I feared for my son and my lives. People were pushing and shoving and there wasn't anywhere to go. I hung on to my 11 year old for dear life. I especially felt bad for smaller children and people in wheelchairs as they were really stuck. A little boy behind me was crammed into me so many times he was crying.Again, the clock was AMAZING - to think that in the 14th Century (i think) they could have such knowledge of astronomy is just incredible. I would just make sure I went during the day or a less busy time of the evening.

Don't miss. Don't miss this clock hit the hour you will get the trumpet performance on the hour each hour. We had a private guide to show and explain all the detail, but I'm sure a guide book will do. Lots of cafe and restaurants around the clock tower so you could sit and watch.

Gorgeous clock.. Our room looked out onto the clock, so we got plenty of it which was great. Definitely worth going up the tower which is very reasonable to do, there are several lifts and a great view when you get there. A must.

Great History!. Be sure you read up on the clock or have a tour guide tell you about it. You will not be able to figure it out on your own! If you are there on an hour you'll see the little figures perform their play, and if you're there at 6pm you'll get a bonus trumpet performance!
Must see.. Make sure you get there at least ten minutes to the hour to get a good place to see and photograph as it gets very busy.

fun to watch the clock. pleasant surrounding and impressive to observe. btw, the old town hall is only 700 years old. have a cappucino at the cafe next to the clock while you wait for the hour to turn.
Interesting piece of history and engineering. A must see. The clock is interesting and the trip to the top of the tower gives you a great view of the old town.

Tick tock, and then some!. Seeing is believing, don't miss out on the clock's amazing show at the top of the hour. For the history buffs, read about how old it is and the different dials inside, very fascinating.

Interesting clock. Very popular with tourists. Hang on to our belongings while taking the picture. They are awaiting you!!! Built in 1493 or thereabouts, worlds oldest working astronomical clock. Surrounded by tourist souvenir hawkers and shops..... Kind of takes away from the moment.

Astronomical Clock. Get there before the hour strikes and have your camera ready to take photos.
The cafe just opposite the tower is great to eat at too and gives a good vantage point!
Favorite attraction in Prague!. I loved seeing the Astronomical clock and walked by every day! Every hour there is a little show and a trumpet player. This is one of my favorite memories of Prague.

Old Town hall. What a beautiful building and so much more beautiful from inside. Stain glass designs, chandeliars, 100 years old Beer bar inside, grand entrance to the theatre, ceramic designs on the wall, oh, it was just funtastic.

Classic. This is of course a must see in Prague not just the clock but the entire square. The wife never wants to spend the money to climb city center towers but when we are up there looking at at the view she says it is worth it. So climb the clock tower as well. Also at night there are a couple restaurants that have outdoor seating. Yes way over priced but worth sitting down for a beer and/or dessert at the top of the hour. The crowds are long gone.

Crowd puller. You cannot go to Old Prague and not see these sites. The clock is very famous and certainly pulls in the crowds every hour taking pictures of the figures as they move. The tower will give you a breathtaking view of Prague.

The most popular site. Irrespective of what else people do in Prague - everyone waits for the hourly show - and it's worth it. BUT it does get very busy on the hour so get there early. Also it's the only place where we were warned about pick pockets.
very neat. Get there early to get a good spot. It's a neat sight with an interesting history and worth the visit.
crowds. This is a must see.... but very crowded... keep hold of your bag. The bars near by cash in... You can go up the tower, and get high up views of the city.

Really unique!. The Astronomical Clock is really unique. Definetly worth spending some minutes looking at it! Make sure you see it both at night and during the day. The observatory on the clock tower is really worth at night to enjoy the views of the town.
Loved it!. Had read about the clock prior to our visit but we were not disappointed. Lots of things to watch as the clock strikes the hour

One of the key attractions. You have not been to Prague, if you have not seen the astronomical clock - it is a must! Do not miss the dance of the saints and that skeleton of Death playing with the sand clock. Tick tock...

Nice place to hang out and meet friends. It is nice to see the Astronomical clock but don;t plan your day around it. Instead make room to go around here several times (on your way to and from other cool places AND arrange to spend a few minutes waiting for the clock to do its display). Crafts, ok food, beer abound around. Good place to reconvene when people decide to go separate ways for a while
Climb the bell tower. The view is wonderful from the bell tower and not busy if you go first thing in the morning. Photo opportunities with 360 degrees of access are the best in Prague.

Fantastic! - you will love this.. If you go to see this try and time it so you will get there for the hourly chimes, and to see the little man at top of tower, in colourful cloaks, waving the flag from all four parts of the tower. I think he is supposed to King Wencelas, but it is lovely to see. Also, the mechanical figures which pop out, which is a good photo opportunity.

Go there ans see it - on the hour!. This historic sight is probably the best all round view that you will get of Prague. I recommend that you go there in the morning as it gets pretty packed in the afternoon. Try to go up earlier (don't forget your camera), then get back down just before the hourly chiming. The square below can get very busy at this time so be prepared for some hustle and bustle. - Well worth a visit.

Well worth a look. this is a magnificent piece of work, considering its age!! the clock chimes every hour and its well worth a look at least once while you are there. after there is a jester man at the top who blows his trumpet. best of all, there is a starbucks in front of it so you can get a coffee and wait in the cold!

A highlight. The clock itself is interesting but you only really need to see it chime once. The best bit for us was going up inside the clock tower. The view over Prague that you get from the top is fantastic and it's great to watch all the comings and going in the square below.

Must see!. This is like walking into a steam punk movie...absolutely amazing in the center of old town! We were lucky enough to see the "month" change at midnight on the 30th of June. Loads of great restaurants to sit and watch it from as well!

Cool Clock!. The clock chimes between 9 am - 9pm every hour, really interesting to see. A 'jester' blows the trumpet from each corner of the tower to send the time across Prague - so nice to see these old traditions being continued
A must see. Get to the square in time to see this at least once during your visit in Prague. To realize how old this clock is and still functioning....Amazing!
Breath taking!!!. The view from the astronomical clock is amazing. You can see the all city from up there. And the square is also lovely, with lots of local tents selling traditional food and cakes

For the Clock itself, only.. It's cool? yes. A must see? true. Worthwhile? yes. Don't get me wrong the Old Town Square and the building itself are amazing some of the best things about Prague. However the actual clock showing itself, is very very crowded with lots of people to watch a genius design at telling time. Again very cool. However the spectacle itself is more the gathering of many people for the show that doesn't last very long and leaves many people in the square who've read so many great things about it a little bemused. Up the tower the view is amazing during the day with great photo opportunities.
Worth a visit. Defo worth a visit great trumpter and good acts all over the square good food and beer! Take a horse and cart around the city centre

an amazing piece of clockwork art. Well, I don't know how to call it but clockwork art. It has three dials, the astronomical dial, representing the position of the sun and the moon. figures showing time, and a calendar dial to tell the month. looks wonderful, and is one of the many prague landmarks

wonderful place. one of the most important site to visit in prague and it is mandatory to stay for the clock to ring. it is a symbol for prague and even you stay only one day in this city, please go to see it

A bit crowded. The astronomical clock is definitely one of it's kind. Go inside and look at it's complexity. Go up on the tower and enjoy the view, it's a bit tight and crowded, but the view is amazing.

Nice area, even on a rainy day. The weather in Prague is cold and rainy, but you can enjoy a coffee in the Old Town area, since most of the restaurants have heaters outside and smooth blankets on the chairs.

Best show at night. Well, the show when the clock beat each hour is cool, of course. My advice is to see it at night, when it's dark. In this case the skeleton and the whole atmosphere around feels better:)

You have to go!. One of the things you have to see if you are visiting Prague. Perhaps a bit underwhelming as there is so much other wonder around you. We passed it a few times and on one occasion were there to see what happens on the hour. It was extremely busy then but the rest of the time there seems to be a never ending procession of bridal couples having their photographs taken.

One of a kind- Astronomical Clock. Every visitor to Prague has to hear the trumpeter and watch the tower. I think he plays every hour on the hour. Then you must go up to the top. The view of Prague is spectacular! We were also lucky to see a bride and groom come out of town hall.
Fun to watch.. Be sure to get to the clock before the hour strikes as the crowds are large and you'll want a good view. Watching all the mechanisms and moving figures was lots of fun.
Buzzing. A beautiful square surrounded by very beautiful building. A good place to grab a mulled wine and people watch
Most interesting. Wonderful to watch. Remember to look at all the opening windows. Also look at the top of the tower to watch & listen to the Horn. Take lost of lovely photo's

Landmark not to be missed. The inside of the tower has been completely renovated with a spiral encline very easy to negotiate and a very interesting lift for the tired...Beautiful view from the top over the whole city.

A must see. If you're visiting Prague, this is a must see! At the top of each hour you get the enriching experience of precision, beauty, and heraldry all in one. Be sure to bring your video as well as still camera -- you won't be disappointed.
Climb. The clock is all very well but don't miss out climb the tower!Great view and each side has info on what you can see.

Simply beautiful. Actually, the town hall and the clock are part of the square. Must be seen striking on the hour, but you need to get there five minutes before in order to have a place to see something.

Amazing views of he city. The clock tower is located in the main square and can be easily identified on the hour by the crowds of tourists waiting to see the display. Pay the 105 k to go to the top of the tower you can walk up the many flights of stairs, or there is alift to the top.The view over the city rooftops is amazing, and there are notice boards around the tower pointing out places of interest and a little of the history . If you are there on the hour, you can wave at the tourists below and get a close up view of the trumpeter signalling from the tower. The only downside was a lot of tourist tripe on display & sale; souvenir coins, pay to dress up in costume etc, and the staff seemed to be totally indifferent to visitors and very bored.

Beautiful - no idea how to tell the time tho!. The Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock were the end of our day long tour, so could easily have been an anti-climax. However, they weren't. The clock is stunning, our tour guide explained how to tell the time on it, but couldn't quite work it out, other than the month of the year! Make sure you're there on the hours to see and hear the 'hour' being sounded out.
atronomical clock. everyone had said we must go and see the clock, but when we got there and watched i was very disappointed i expected alot more
Hourly event. The most visited site. Crowds line up and cheer after the clock strikes the hour. The square gets crowded even during off season.
Beautiful historical place. I love this artistic building, beautiful and unique. But in the peak season, the area is too crowded

Get the guided tour under the town hall. A superb tower to visit (even if .. and I will get lynched for this....I though the astronomical clock wasnt the most exciting thing in the world!).......if you get a chance go on the underground prague tour.....you see whole streets and houses of the medieval city under the town hall and areas hidden away.....very interesting and a really good tour guide.....AND.....little bit of historical nonsense for you that i was told on my tour.....after the original inventor of the astronomical clock had finished making his wonderful timepeice the city elders (or whoever emploed him) gouged his eyes out so he could never make another one.....strange but true....apparently!......

Crowded but a Must-See. The Astronomical Clock is really fun to see, even more so when you realize how very old it is ( 15th century). A true engineering marvel . But, go EARLY - - 9 a.m. is probably the perfect time to see the Apostles blessing you as you look up at the clock striking the hours. By 10, this area is VERY crowded.

Inches from old town square. Beautiful historical clock. Many people gather to hear and see the hourly display. Most of the fun is just in being here as the hourly display adds only a little to the already present great charm of this area.
On of a kind. The legend says that after the clock master finished the astrological clock masterpiece, the emperor had him blinded so his work could not be replicated anywhere else.
understand the history. Understand the history of this clock before you go see it. Otherwise, you will feel disappointed, but it is engineering genius!

Work of art plus a great view from the top. The Astronomical Clock is a must see when visiting Prague. We visited it rather early in the morning when the flood of tourists had not yet hit the streets. The stunning view from the top is worth the walk up the stairs and while walking you also learn some history that is written on the walls of the tower.

Technology and art. The most interesting single object in Prague, the Astronomical Clock, is something that you cannot easily forget. Wherever you stay in the city, your steps will take you to this very spot, probably on your very first day in Prague. It is like a magnet for travelers, a beautiful piece of technology and art which every hour offers a brief show with movement and sound, set in motion by the figure of Death. The clock has worked very well for centuries, but even if it didn't it would remain as a beautiful at piece.
Amazing view. A must - see attraction in Prague ! The view from the top is amazing, never mind if your head gets a little dizzy
Missed the hourly show, every time. We never quite managed to be at the clock at the right time, so we didn't get to witness the hourly show.Visually the clock is stunning.

Busy. Lots of tourists and tour groups gathered here most of the day. The show is on the hour every hour from 0800 to 2200 but it is rather bland. Town Hall used for marriages all day and is quite colourful

Great view from the top. A fabulous clock - heard so much about it from all of the tourist guides around it. Definately go on the hour to see it moving. Also a trip to the top of the tower is a must. Great views over Prague
Ok. Its a beautifull looking clock, but is a bit of an anti climax of the moving figures, however the cockerel at the end was a crowd pleaser as was the trumpet player from the turret.

FUN! GO!. Every hours, hoards of people stand waiting for that clock to strike the hour. Our guide from Tauck Tours was so proficient. She knew where to stand and stood with her back to us telling us what everything meant. We loved how the figures come to life and the skeleton raises his head up and down saying, "YES! YES! YES! "EVERYONE WILL DIE" The other statues move their heads saying"No! NO! NO!" At the end, a rooster croaks and moves his wings up and down! Trumpeters are also heard from the top of that clock where you can go. Fun! Be careful of pick pockets! We had no issues with them but were told to be careful.

Tourists. It does not really matter if many people say that the clock is not worth it, because if you are in the city you must to see it. Then you can say also that it is not worth it, but at least you will know by experience. It is a must seeing attraction. You will not like it, but can you really imagine yourself going to Prague, see all the tourist waiting for the clock and not stop as well? Impossible

Even better than Trumpton. Gather with the rest of the audience for the hourly show under the clock tower. I was particularly fond of Death (a skeleton) as he pulled on a string. Afterwards, a trumpeter in Medieval garb plays a melody with a bit that sounds distinctly like the Christmas carol, Good King Wenceslas. Very entertaining and I didn't get bored of it.

People watch. The clock itself is a wonder but in the square there is so much going on, nice to have a sit and have a coffee and just people watch to recharge your batteries to crack on with the hustle and bustle

astronomical clock. This clock is interesting and totally unable to be read by normal humans! It is worth seeing of course. When it strikes there is some movement here and there but I have seen other clocks of this type so not overly inpressed with that part. The best thing to do is buy a ticket and take an elevator to the top of the clock tower. The view is spectacular. It is a bit crowded and at itmes I expect it is literally full but it is worth the wait. You can also walk up or down if you want.

Amazing!. To think that the mechanics of this Astronomical Clock is hundreds of years old and is still accurate to this day is amazing!.Can't believe the crowds who assemble below it, every hour to see the movement of characters in front of the clock and to hear a real live trumpter play a tune in 4 different directions ie north, south, east and west. I overheard a tour guide, say people stand to watch and hear this every day in the year...and I believe him! Great atmosphere!

Great piece of history. I would recommend you go up the tower just before the hour strikes to see the city and also the trumpet player who blows his tune after the clock has done its thing. It's best to get some history on the clock and the meaning of the statues on it because I was a little dissappointed with the hourly display. I think I was expecting something grander. However once someone explained to me the history and meaning of the clock, I could appreciate it more.

Don't leave without seeing this. The clock is situated in a bustling square which is crowded most of the day and night. Lots of people gather round the clock on the hour to watch the display. Great place to watch the world go by whilst listening to musicians.

clock and square. it seems that everyone makes for the square and the clock although I can't see why as it doesn't do very much. The square vibrates with energy and is very cosmopolitan with just about every country represented somewhere
For sure sightseeing n.1 in Prague. Every time im in Prague I must see this! It´s funny that there are a lot of people that are waiting about 20minutes to see this 2 minutes show :))
The Clock. The clock is a must see while you're in Prague but much more interesting is the working behind the clock which can be seen from inside the Town Hall.
What a Clock. Although we did not go up to the tower, we certainly enjoyed walking through the building and reading the history of how the building and clock came about. Certainly recommend a visit.
Don't miss it. The clock itself is a must...But don't miss to climb up the tower and have on of the most beautiful views of the city.
nice to look at but disapointing show. No need to be there when the bells ring. Go there any time else and you can get a good look at it and take some great pictures.
Interesting. The clock performs its thing each hour and the square gets very busy, but definitely worth a look. The architecture of the hall is intriguing.

The Clock. Everybody cheered once this old clock had finished chiming.. The whole atmosphere is great. Again very busy, Downside was the horse carriages came around in front of the clock and peoplepushed back to get away from them and this could have caused some problems,!!

Learn the details to fully appreciate the clock. This clock looks interesting when you stumble upon it in the square. And it's fun when the crowds gathers around on the hour to hear the chimes, followed by the trumpet and a round of applause. But when you read about how it works (!), and how long ago it was made to work that way (?!?), it will really blow your mind. It's one of those attractions you should learn about in order to fully appreciate - whether through a guide book or an actual walking tour guide (there are lots to choose from) it's definitely worth seeing, and besides, you can't miss it.
the clock is fun. and the old town hall includes a tourist information center with lots of flyers about local attractions and performances.

Full of charm,old buildings,restaurants & shopping. Crowded but delightful and charming. A must see-loved it.The shopping is mostly high end but the restaurants are varied from expensive to moderate. The clock is great.

Easy to visit with fantastic views. This is a great place to visit and offers people with walking difficulties easy access to great views over Prague. A lift wisks you to the top of the tower so there is no effort required in order to have a prime view over the Old Town Square.
Impressive. After reading about and seeing pictures of this clock i have to admit it is very impressive and well worth seeing. The entire square is beautiful and the history of the area amazing.

Go to the top!. Once in Prague, you must never let pass your chance of seeing the city from high, so don't hesitate to climb the Old City Hall tower. The view of the Staromestske námestí from the top is stunning! And perfect will also be your photos! By only 105 Czech crowns is something of which you certainly won't forget during your visit to Prague. Prague, view from the top, is even more beautiful...

Everyone visits !. All our town center wanderings brought us here several times over several days - it's a good place to get your bearings & look at your map before you visit the next part of the city.Most walking tours start here - it can be very busy here ! You can also get the horse & cart tours here.
2nd most disappointing attraction. Went on a City Bus Tour when the Astronomical Clock was described as the 2nd most disappointing attraction in the world (after Mona Lisa!). I thought it was alright

Looks nicer on a photograph. I can appreciate the craftsmanship and history that makes this clock a must see sight, however, people crowd around to hear it ding on the hour which gives the pickpockets a feast, when you are looking up at it they're at work. Weddings every 15 mins. The clock is tiny in real life. Cafes and eateries around the area are a rip off and the food is atrocious. Nobody wants to help, asked a worker where the synagogue was and she rolled her eyes, sighed and snapped 'round corner.'
360 degree wonders. The clock is certainly unique, the square is a scene all by itself, lively, though touristy, but still cool.

Highlight of Our Trip. This was the most fascinating place we visited on our trip. We watched the clock several times and tried to figure it out. It is amazing that it was built so long ago and is so mechanically sophisticated and intricate. Be sure to go to the top of the tower to see the trumpeter on the hour.

The Clock. I loved the tale of the clock. A man built the clock, they poked his eyes out so he would never rebuild another clock as beautiful as this clock. The man threw himself into his creation and the clock never told time again.

Beautiful square. The square is a lovely place to visit at any time of the day and night and provides some lovely photo opportunities. The restaurants and surrounding gift shops are all very quaint and at night everything comes alive with street performers and people. Make sure you see the clock on the hour, if only to see everyone randomly applaud it. A lovely square in the heart of Prague. Partially enjoyed the guy stomping around a pan for no reason! He was brilliant!
Astronomical call. One of the most important must visit place in Prague. There is a big crowd to watch the clock bell at every hour. Nice place in the night.

Amazing clock located right near the Old Town Square. This clock features an hourly "show" that attracts hundreds of tourists. Make sure you keep an eye on your personal belongings when you watch the show as people are packed together pretty closely and it would be easy to get a purse or camera lifted. That being said it is worth it to watch the short show and read about how intricate the clock working are.
Amazing Instrument from the 15th Century. See it more than once. See it early in the day before everyone else but see it at least twice. It is amazing.

History and Charm. I really love this wonderful piece of art. Love the clock which is the meeting point for many free walking or bike tours. Old Town is clean, pretty much safe. every corner there is a piece of historyor art. Street food ; potatoes, ham and sausages are pretty safe to eat. Beware of the gigantic portions otherwise you will ended up paying more than you expected. For the cubist art lovers, there are very few buildings with this type of arquitecture, only located in Old Town Prague.

Beware the crowds. At 11 o'clock in the morning the trumpeter comes out and blows his trumpet. So the crowds gather in their hundreds which might be off putting for some The clock is wonderful and the whole square around the area is marvellous to see.

Clock is good, but may disappoint. I think you really need a guidebook or person with detailed knowledge to "wow" you with the clock, but we did (at second try) manage to get there in time for the striking of the hour which was good, but not quite as dramatic as imagined. Get a position a bit further away from the tower for better effect. And wait for the trumpeter!

Lovely!. The old town hall was lovely, but the astronomical clock was a bit of a let down, though gathers hundreds of people on the hour to watch the saints go round at the front. Blink and you will miss it!

Astronomical Clock. If you are here on the hour it is very very busy but worth seeing just once! There is a trumpet player who plays a fanfare from the top of the tower and the clock is very interesting.

No idea what the fuss is about. Sorry but there's a whole palaver made about a rather nice old clock but nothing dramatic or interesting goes on. Just a few bongs a door opens and some drab saints pop out for a couple seconds. This is closely followed by a trumpeter parping from the parapet and cheers from the assembled tourists. Perhaps dazzling for the serfs in days gone by, but now a brilliant focus point for the local pickpockets.

Fascinating timepiece with a good view from the top. The clock is worth viewing on the hour, but go back and instead of watching the clock watch the crowd watching the clock.Go up the tower to get great views of the city but use the lifts unless extremely fit.

Dont miss the hourly chime.. We stood in the square and waited for the clock to chime on the hour.So many people doing the same.You are warned that the pickpockets take advantage of such a place but we didnt have a problem.

Look out for the trumpeter at the top of the tower. The clock itself is fantastic and we really enjoyed joining the crowds on the hour to hear the chimes and see the stautues moving on the hour. What a surprise however to see a real live trumpeter right at the top of the tower also.

Take time to go up and view the crowds below.. We saw the clock strike from ground level and then made sure we went up the tower for the next hourly strike. One problem, the lift was out of order!! Get your tickets from the right hand side of the clock. Great views from the top and you get to witness the crowds building and also the trumpeter play.

Relaxing. We got to sit in front of the clock in one of the restaurants outdoor seatings...we watched the clock which we all thought was really cool. Had a snack and watched the carriages take people around. Toured some stores and took in the beautiful sights!

15 seconds and that's it?!. Lovely piece of engineering, but the hourly bit of show is slightly overrated. Crowded with tourists and it's also meeting point for many walking groups which adds to the human traffic. The view of the square (be it from the tower or just the middle of the square) is really something else...grab a local beer, sit somewhere and drink in the architecture and atmosphere.

We loved the many clocks. We stood and gazed at it for quite a while and marvelled that it could have been built so long ago. We also enjoyed our visit to the top of the tower, where you can look out over the entire city.

Worth going to the top of the Tower. We were in Prague for 5 days so we had a lot of opportunity to see the clock & be there when it does its hourly show. It's amusing to see the tourists reaction when the show finishes. It's worth paying 105 Czech crowns each to go to the top of the tower. The views of Prague are gorgeous & you will get to see the trumpeter do his thing beside you. A must-see when in Prague!

Beautiful clock, disappointing display. A beautiful piece of clockwork but the display on the hour is so disappointing! Would not recommend waiting around to see it, if you think you are missing something, you really aren't.
lovely. A great place to go to the top and see Prague, get married and watch the crowds of people while you sit in a near by Cafe.

A must see. A true engineering marvel. Take the tour and walk up the tower to overlook the square. There are lots of shopping and food that surround it as well.I highly recommend going to this area in the evening. It looks even better when it's lit up.

Busy with photograph takers. The hall again looks like another smaller church or castle with the locks on the side which make such a wonderful photo. You need to turn around & slightly to your left when the sun goes down capture the traditional side look out for the little wizard looking manplaying some sort of traditon folk music box whilst singing

Hmmm, there are more interesting clocks in other cities. You have to see this clock once at the top of the hour just so you can say you've seen it. We found it rather disappointing and it doesn't have the charm or intricate movements of town square clocks of many other European cities.
A Fun 60 seconds!. Worth a watch when in the area. It's over when the trumpeter plays the closing! This is a prime spot for pick-pockets, so have your valuables in front of you!

Visit the Clock Tower!. Don't pass up touring the clock tower itself. The cost is very reasonable and being at the top with the trumpeter at the top of the hour is a great experience. You feel a part of everything and the view of the square is incredible!
must see. we weren't inside, but from the outside it is also a stunning place. The best time to go - noon at the working day, otherwise you'll meet a ton of people

Daft clock!. We stood for ages waiting for the clock to perform but were disappointed when it did very little! But the trumpeter on the tower was good. Long queues to get up the tower but worth it for great views over old town square
A great experience. Every hour people gather round the clock to watch the performance and no matter how many times you see it, you are always drawn back to watch again.
Astronomical Clock. This is a must see!!!! But make sure you do a tour to find out the history of the clock, as there is a wonderful story attached to it.

Great view of the city from top. A must see for all visitors to view Prague from top. Not very expensive. Walk around the place was a pleasure and there are large open areas and eateries around. Prague has a sizable English speaking crowd.

See it both in the day and at night. A must see when in Prague
