Take the time to see it both in the day and at night it takes on a different life at both times of day
meet me at the clock. We got to see this great monument at noon as well as later in the day. What a neat area! So crowded, however.
clock this!. Fascinating and quirky - you can be sure there are crowds on the hour every hour (and most of the time in between!!).

The clock is impressive, the 'show' not so much.. The age and history of the clock is very impressive, however to battle the crowds for a 1 or 2 min. 'show'... it wasn't worth it! Visit the clock at any other time than the 'hour' and get a great view of a very intricate design that's been here since the beginning of the 15th century. It's beautiful!!
Livliest place. many choice of restaurants, activities to view. Good people watching of people watching the astronomical clock
Get a good speck early. Very touristy. It was a slight disappointment as we were expecting more things to move on he clock. Great atmosphere on the hour. In the middle of the Old Town Square...

Amazing atmosphere. the astronomical clock is not to be missed. Sitting next to the old town hall, the place oozes with its typical European charm. Even the clock which is hunderds of years old is well preserved to this date and reminds one of the sheer architectural genius that would have gone in to build such a thing

beautiful buildings and atmosphere. Prague is a beautiful town with great old buildings and squares, bridges, a canal... Most of the buildings You want to visit are not for free. That's a bit of a pity. They charge for everything, even to go into a church??? In Belgium we have lots of churches for free, so...

Clock watching Delight. Again it was very busy on the 12 o clock chime ,but great to hear the buglers trumpet from the top of the tower.Obviously appreciated by all nationalities visiting the site,we even saw a party of monks there.We went there with our excellent guide who was able to relate the history of the clock ,which was a bit scary!!

City Delight. The area is simply amazing. Very historical & enjoyable area to visit & take in all the tourists, shops & restaurants. Close to other attractions & walking distance to all other tours & hotel.
Fun. The clock tells the tale of how life goes by quickly. Every hour during the day the clock put on a great show and at night a nice laser show is put on.

Wow. Just being able to sit and look at all the splendid buildings was good enough there were jazz musicians and food stalls with all sorts of local food etc very impressed with the spicy spiral potatoes must try it

Very neat clock!. We first watched the clock strike the top of the hour from a nearby restaurant (Hotel U Prince- AVOID!). We watched again after lunch, just more closely this time. Very cool. If you enjoyed the Glockenspiel in Germany, stop to see this.

Fairy tale place. The whole of old Prague is like a fairy tale but alas us tourists have made this particular area very busy. Can't understand why people want to trail around in huge groups. Makes it difficult to get around sometimes with these groups clogging the area.

It's nice to see, but look after your personal belongings!. When it's almost ticking (The clock) everyone's eyes are up and not feeling a thing in the crowd, people were robbed right there without noticing. It's nice but I wouldn't wait so long with a such big crowd just to watch it tick, tock.

Didnt go in but outside lovely. We didnt go into the town hall we watched the clock from outside. As said before the clock is worth a visit but does get very busy, make sure you have your camera/video recorder at the ready.

Something to see!. You will know something is going on when you see the crowds building in front of the clock. On the hour this amazing piece of artistic machinery goes into action. Learn for yourself or learn through a tour guide, the history of the old town hall and exactly what this astronomical clock is doing. It's quite a little show that always gets a round of applause when it's finished. It's not to be missed. The trumpet at the end, is a call for the audience to come up to the top of the tower, for a small fee of course! :) As always, when you are stationary in a crowd, beware of pick-pockets.

Great view from top of clock. Outstanding 360 view of Prague from the top of the clock tower. Buy your tickets at the base of the tower, then exit the office and the entrance is to the left as you are facing the clock tower. Well worth the time (plus you get to view their very unique elevator inside the tower).

You simply have to!. There is no excuse to not see this - the clock is amazing! The history is interesting too so get your hands on some info before you go so you can understand what you're looking at!

On the hour. This clock chimes on the hour, wont give too much away but worth being there just to see it,very quaint. If you want for a few Koruna you can climb the stairs to be at the side of the clock when it chimes. You can not miss it as there is usually a good crowd but they do not spoil the view

Unique and notice. A must and please proceed with the Sandeman Free tour! We took it in Spanish with Moises and he was awesome. Prague not an expensive City! Pls pay attention to the clock's history and its detailed surrounding figures!

beautiful clock. I hadn't researched this clock and just happened to be there for the chiming on the hour, I knew something was going to happen by the huge crowd underneath the clock! Quaint little show, worth seeing, and the clock itself is stunning, really intricate, you will get a better look when its not chiming time!
Amazing. This must not be missed if you are walking in the old town. Easy to find just spot the place where the biggest crowd is. This is probably the busiest attraction in Prague.

DOnt miss it when it strikes!. Every time it strikes there is like a full drama happening on the clock tower...but while you are glued looking upward for 20second, watch your wallets and purses...its when Pickpocket experts strike...

Cool Clock. It's free and enormous. It's pretty convenient to get to as well. I didn't make it there when it actually rang but it was impressive anyway. I can only imagine what it would be like with the ringing!
Great view from tower. Well worth taking the time and paying to go up in the tower for a splendid view of the old town. There is even an elevator all the way to the top.

A phenomenal invention!. Take one of the free tours which start with the Astronomical Clock so you can learn all about it. The guy who made this was extremely talented. I won't tell you the whole story as its worth finding out for yourself when your there. The actual chiming of the clock on the hour that everyone waits to see is alright but once you've seen it once you don't need to see it again. But as I say the clock itself is fantastic. If you have the time go up the clock tower and for a great view over the old town square and to see all the prague rooftops. Nice view!

Must see!. Before you go do some research so you will have a better understanding of what the clock does. This was built some 700 years ago! The technology for the time was amazing. The crowds will be large. I recommend having lunch or a snack at one of the restaurants so you can sit and watch in comfort. We did that more by accident than on purpose but were glad we did. I think this rates as must see for Prague.

Beautiful Clock, But Better Seen Not at the Top of the Hour. The clock itself is gorgeous, but the crowds that gather around it for the short "show" (figures, including Death, pop out of it) that takes place at the top of each hour are just nutty. It's for sure worth seeing once, but much more enjoyable when the show isn't happening and you can slowly take it all its ornamental intricacies.
WHAT A TREAT. Don't you dare miss this! Huge crowds at the top of each hour to watch the show when the clock strikes12:00! Half the fun is just watching the crowds gather then respond.

fun place to hangout, eat, and people watch. the clock tower is a must see, whether you're into astronomy or not. make sure to get there on the hour so you can see all the parts move. there's a huge crowd that gathers right in front of it 5-10 minutes before each hour. old town square is a fun place to either grap an afternoon drink, or an evening dinner. at night Tyne church lights up and is a beautiful sight.

Great history with an amusing twist. Such is the attraction hundreds gather on the o'clock to see the clock do its bit and then a trumpeter seronades from the tower. Up the tower then for some really fantastic views across the city!

A central attraction. Just be there, although so will hundreds if not more tourists.Outdoor restaurants overlook it, but be careful of pickpockets in the crowds. Old guys playing jazz nearby in the square

Worth it to me. I was so looking forward to the clock striking to see what happens. Might not be much too some but it was exciting to me. To see the figures come to life just for a minute or so. Now, what I found interesting was the weddings that took place while we were waiting. Now, the most surprising was how YOUNG the brides and grooms were...they seemed to be early teens...I only assume part of the culture for this region.

A must see, but read about it first. The history of the clock and what the different miniatures represent is very interesting. The mechanics that takes place at the hourly chime are somehow dissapointing and not as expected, but you cannot leave prague without seeing the clock.

Amazing. I didn't know about this clock until we stopped in front of it and it was working. Surrounded by so many coffee shops and restaurants. You can ride a wagon too. Wonderful place. It is a must in Prague.

Read the history first before you see the clock. You'd appreciate the Astronomical clock more if you know the history behind it...It is not on the side of the building facing the Tyn Church. You have to go around it - we discovered this on the second visit to the Square.
clock. The clock area is very congested. Be careful, it is a good area for pick pockets. We didn't know much about how to read the clock until we had a guide that explained all it's working parts!
Worth seeing. The clock is amazing, but the crowds are daunting. Go once to see the festivities on the hour. That will be enough!

Awesome place, great vibe. Loved the old town of Prague.. walked around these streets for a long time. Dont miss being around the astronomical clock when it strikes (every hour).. it is a nice view. The restuarants around are really nice and people are friendly. The churches around the clock are a sight to see..

Beautiful. Not sure what it is about this clock, but it pulls you in and doesn't want to let you go. Could spend hours looking at it. We just missed the special moment one night as we were returning from a Beer tasting event.

Touristy? Sure. Memorable? Absolutely.. Don't even think about visiting Prague without stopping by for the hourly "show" provided by the Astronomical Clock in the Old Town Square. Try to arrive at least 5 minutes early to acquaint yourself with the clock's features (wooden statutes and allegorical figures). Then, on the hour, the figures begin to move and doors open at the top to display 12 mechanical Apostles (starting with St Peter and ending with Barnabas) who reveal themselves two-by-two to the crowd below. A costumed herald plays a tune from atop the clock tower before he waves cheerfully to the throng below. The hotel directly across the street has a rooftop terrace where you can also watch the show while sipping some of Prague's excellent beer. A must see/must do while in Prague.

Amazing clock ....and crowds. The clock is truly amazing, given its long ago origins. However, the crowds of tourists are equally amazing. Attempt to view this either early or late in the day to enhance your experience.
Fantastic atmosphere!. Lots of entertainers and on the hour trumpets and music fill the air. Although a little crowded and busy in the afternoon hustle and bustle.

Well worth a visit. Typical tourist trap but the Astronomical Clock is amazing and should not be missed. Try to be there on the hour to see an amazing sight.Beware of pickpockets as the square gets very busy on the hour, every hour.
another must see. Yoy need to be there on the hour and watch carefully! Walk to the top and be there when the clock strikes !
Pretty to look at.... ...but a bit disappointing. The good thing is that the clock is practically at eye level, so photographs are easy!

Very old existing and working clock. Try to be there around 6 pm when there is some action with the clock
Lots of people gather to watch around that time
Amazing. My favorite site in Prague- get there a few minutes early to avoid the crowds, climb up the tower, and get a lesson from the guide in the tower in how to read this marvel

unusual. The astronomical clock is quite something to see.
There is always a massive crowd waiting for the clock to spring into action on the hour, every hour.
When it starts 2 doors open above the clock and the 12 apostles appear.
At the end, a bugler plays in the tower above the clock.
It is a really unique experience.

A must to see Prague from the top of the clock tower. We watched the clock's performance several times whilst in Prague and I loved it every time. Dozens and dozens of tourists flock to the clock every hour to watch the performance and at the end of each performance a trumpeters in costume play a tune of their horns from the clock tower and the other towers in the city. We took the lift to the top of the tower on our first night and what a magnificent sight we saw over the beautiful city of Prague lit up at night. Well worth it! Highly recommend doing this.

Amazing!. The clock is simply amazing! It is beautiful! The only problem is that its beatuy attracts large crowds especially on the hour when the clock moves. You still should watch the clock at the hour but it is a little disapointing but I guess impressive as well for when it was built.

Name giver clock tower. Clock tower is at the old town square.And you will reailsed it .Actually, it is not clock tower, it is astronomical tower and according to story, christians are getting their name by the towers astronomical possitions. For example,if you were born at 23 december, your name willl be Elena...Also,ypu can go to the top of the tower and make nice pictures

CROWDS. Wow you would think they were giving something away, before the clock goes off on the hour, people are crowded into the square to see the clock revolve the twelve apostles past a window, a skeleton ring a bell and a rooster crow. Although worth the look, it is amazing how crowded the square gets at that time.
exquisite design. ive never seen a clock like it! the craftsmanship and creativity were remarkable! you should not miss going to the top of the tower, beautiful view and great photo opportunity!

Where Most Travelers Come to!. Nostalgia. The people flock here not for learning what time it is, but for the revolving figures atop the structure, every hour on the hour. And, for kicks, there's also a trumpeter who plays from one of the windows preceding the marching figurines. Amazing! Around the immediate area are fine restaurants and shopping too.

If you visit Prague, you have to see the clock.. If you visit Prague, you cant leave without seeing the Astronomical clock, the history associated with it is fascinating as is the way in which it was engineered and works, as others have said being one of the most popular sights it gets pretty crowded all day especially 'on the hour'Its worth going inside aswell, as what you learn about its history and the sight from the top of the tower is great.

Different from everything and incredible!. The clock itself is beautiful but try to be at the o'clock hour, I mean from 9am, every hour. There's a little show for free, even with a trumpeter on the top of the tower! Also you can take a lift to go up and see beautiful views of the city, the only problem is there's so little space and it gets overcrowded...
Must see, but always crowded. This area is always busy from around 8am to 8pm, but if you pick a time not around lunch, then you can get a great view

The clock is worth watching. I was skeptical about watching that clock. But it is indeed fascinating. The teens enjoyed it. Also scientifically impressive. And the whole place is beautiful and loaded with so much history.
Clock. This is a fantastic piece of work. It should be visited on the hour to hear and observe this marvellous clock.
A crown jewel at the Old Town Square. Always crowded with people, particularly tourists, like us, awaiting the marching but lumbering statuettes at the stroke of every hour. Very interesting.
priceless. beautiful view from the top, you can even see the castle district. the staircase is filled with historical info and how the clock was constructed. worth the small fee

A marvel of technology!. How in the world did they know? This clock is over 600 years old and offers a medieval understanding of cosmology along with the later addition of the 12 Disciples of Christ.Know in advance that crowds can be heavy and the total "show" is only about 3 minutes long. You need to arrive before the top of the hour and position yourself such that you will have a good view.While I recommend against eating in Old Town, my wife and I arrived at about 20 minutes to the hour and sat in an outside cafe and ordered two drinks and an ice cream to satisfy the owner and allow us both a good viewing location and the comfort of sitting for about half an hour. The cost was worth it.The clock really is a marvel and when seen with the knowledge of its age and so on can be enjoyed most fully. It is fun to see the Twelve parade past their windows and turn to look out during the chiming of the bells.Afterward try to climb the tower as it affords the best view of anywhere in Old Town.

must see. it's strange but hanging around without a map get's you always at astronomical clock. maybe because of the mistic ways the city was projected :)it's a must see point. every day at 9:am and 9p:m you can enjoy the ritual of the clock. very particular moment of our visit in Prague don't even thing sitting in the bar in front of it. i payed 130 corona (about 6 euro) the beer . and the funny thing was they labeled it as 50 corona.i guess it's the usual tourist trap :)

amusing. we watched the clock working, on each hour figures representing Jesus and others going round, a gold cock crowing and flapping its wings and a trumpeter. the clock itself is very intricate. we got the lift to the top (105Kc for adults, (£3.50) concessions available) from where we could see the old town square with many ornate buildings and views over the city.
Great attraction. There is quite a show around the clock with street entertainers. It is quite crowded, but there are great photograph opportunities
A must see. The clock is crowded on the hour, but it is worth seeing at least once on your visit. The trumpet player from the tower adds a nice touch as well.

Old world charm. This is the place where all the tourists gather and cheer as the clock does it's thing. Impressive. Obviously the town square is the place to be and you cannot miss it and say that you were in Prague.
Beautiful and so interesting. It's amazing to think that people were able to create such a beautiful and scientific piece in 1410.

Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. Loved watching the clock works come on! You would do well to have a guide for this part of town because there is so much of historical relevance. A guidebook is not quite good enough for the local stories.

Check out the view from the clock tower!. Be sure to go to the top of the tower for stunning views of Prague! They do have an elevator. You can walk all the way around while at the top for 360 degree views.

One of the most beautiful places in Europe. The Prague Town Hall, an interesting building itself, is especially known for the Orloy medieval clock - a must-see for all visitors to Prague. Make sure you learn the legend before you go there - it is believed that the clockmaster was blinded after he had finished his work, so that he would not be able to construct a similar clock for anyone else. It is worth seeing the clock when it strikes the hour - the figures, including Death, are set in motion then.Consider getting to the top of the Town Hall tower - there is a lift and some steps, admission is not very expensive and the views are breathtaking. You can see the Old Town, Hradcany and much more!
The tour was informative!. We took a tour of Old Town Hall, Library, & Astronomical Clock Tower. The view of the square below & Prague was great!

The beauty of the clock is not in its performance every hour but the fact that it still works!. The place becomes packed near the hour. Be careful of your belongings. Tip: Read up beforehand on how to decipher the clock.
Busy area. The square was so full we couldn't really see the clock. Tried several times over 4 days. Lots of stalls selling food so bring local currency.

Don't miss the clock striking the hour. Be sure to see the clock when it strikes the hour and enjoy all of the movement. Also worth the price of admission to go to the top of the tower. The views of the square and the city are amazing.
Clock. For very little (just over £3), you can scale up to the top of the clock tower and look over the entire old town.
The clock is amazing. Get the history and you will be so dazzles by that clock and the square. remember is chimes on the hour:)

A must in Prague. I was very happy to see that this time around the PLACE was clear of all the vendors that were on the premises last year around the same time ... At least now you can enjoy the beauty of the Place where the Astronomical Clock is located. This clock is THE CURIOSITY OF PRAGUE together with CHARLES BRIDGE.

Impressive clock so old. One of the most impressive attractions of so many that Prague have to offer for the visitors. Make sure you get there at the hour when there is a magnificent display of saints, music, movements, sounds, cheering from the crowds, picture and movie takings. It is quite an amazing experience to see the display it performs at the top of the hour for so many centuries so far. The clock has got to be one of the oldest clocks still working that anyone would have a chance in their lifetime to observe. A must do
Beautiful!. I loved it because it is so big, old and beautiful. It's well cared for, and you can spend hours staring at it. I did not like that it was so crowded.

Beautiful scenery!. Lots of crowds gather for the clock's hourly animation. (Watch your pockets!) Located next to the town square, a fascinating piece of technology and a great place to sit, have a meal and people watch.

Go to the top!. The elevator is a convenient capsule (only takes 4 people at a time) to take you to the top of the Old Town Hall. Best views of Prague and also worth meeting the trumpeter who plays after the Astrological Clock does its thing at the top of the hour.
Attention it's . o'clock :)). There is a lovely show on astronomical clock hourly. Everybody is there to see the show with their cameras. You have to be careful about your bag or sth.

Good but Desapointing. Its beautiful, but I was expecting more from the clock.
Its very simple, and at night there is no light on the clock, very difficult to see something.
THE attraction in Prague!. Seeing the clock "perform" on the hour is a must while visiting Prague. Fun and a mob scene. Be careful of pickpockets, however.

More Hype than Reality. The best part of this is that we tagged-along on with a tour group who had a fantastic (and entertaining) guide. The clock is a complex instrument and while he did a great job of describing it, my head still aches. The actual "performance" at the top of the hour leaves a bit to be desired.

interesting but really crowded. Everyone gathers to watch the astronomical clock chime, so it starts getting crowded about 15 minutes before the hour. Even if you get there ahead of time there's a chance someone tall will stand in front of you!
Unique. The astronomical clock is a beautiful instrument and is a key feature of Town Hall. Be sure to time your visit. Get a good spot (among the thousands) and enjoy!

Astronomical clock. Wow!!! Have never seen a clock like this. It was really worth looking at. My first thing to do having seen it was to buy a souvenir version to take home to join all my other much loved 'unusual' clocks. I loved the hour strike where the figures moved past the windows above it and then a real-life trumpeter played a piece of music. This seemed to be all day and everyday. There seems to be a terrible story behind it all though according to a tour guide, where its inventor was blinded after making it so that he wouldn't be able to build another clock elsewhere.
everyone is watching. Nice gathering place, you can see everyone waiting to see the clock opening doors. The place is vital and full of cafes.

Put aside some time to explore the Town Hall. Town Hall is the TIC. Often holds art exhibitions. Upstairs the rooms have painted ceilings. The clock is interesting if you can actually see it in the sea of people.

Busy spot. Pretty crazy/busy around the Astonomical Clock to watch it chime which made it very hard to see anything (especially since I'm not too tall). Decided not to wait in the long line up to go up the tower.
Fun. The clock is nice, and the square is huge and lively. It's so much fun to be there with the crowd, basking in the culture and the food. Walk around a bit, you'll enjoy it.

Old Town Hall. So many people, great area to people watch. Seeing people running to the Clock at the top of the hour can be funny. Nice area to just sit and have a few relaxing moments of people watching.

Awesome. It’s amazing to think how something so old can still be so relevant! Be sure not to miss the show at 9pm. They incorporate an overlay video onto the clock, and is a really cool thing to watch! Watch your wallets, this area is known to be a known pickpocket area
Worth to visit. If you have some spare money and time then it is nice to go up to the tower and have a view over the Old Town Square. When I as there there were fireworks and it was worth to be there

It has its moments. This is a must see when you go to Prague. The clock itself is a wonder and climbing to the top gives a great view of the city. BUT...when you stand outside on the hour with millions of people to watch the show, don't get your hopes up! It's not that great, very calm and only thing to remember is the clock has been working for hundreds of years and that's amazing in itself.
AMAZING!. 600 plus years of history all sitting their right in front of you to see, watch, admire, and marvel at. One of the main things on the bucket list and definitely worth it.

great sites and fun way to spend an afternoon!. this clock is incredible and there are so many wonderful things to do in old town. take one of the 2-3 hour free walking tours, fun and very informative.
Learn about the clock before you visit. Is is worthwhile to hire a guide or learn from a travel guide about the history and function of the clock, aim for the on the hour service

WORTH A WALK. The crowds gathered (hold on to your handbag) the locals looked at us like we were strange and then the clock struck, little underwhelming after all the hype but worth ticking off the list...
works every time. an amazing piece of functioning history. The appearance of the apostles is brief but fine. the clock even keeps the correct time.

One of the Many Great Sites of Prague. Czeska Republika's Astronomical Clock is a wonderful sculpt to see in person. No photograph can do it justice. It sits in the Olde Town Square with plenty of other sites to visit whilst in the Square. One shouldn't have a hard time fetching a taxi to take you back where you need to go (i.e. hotel). This place has many many tourists, although you won't have to worry about being heavily approached by people wanting to sell souenirs like you are in some countries - not here. They will help you if you wish to buy, but will not heckle you. And that makes all the difference. While visiting the clock - don't hesitate to ask another tourist to take your photo with the Clock in the background - for they themselves may need a fellow traveler to snap one of them with it too. :-)
Weddings. We arrived again and again at this place and each time there was another wedding couple. So romantic. Such a great place.

this is prague. old town square and the astronomical clock really are a must see the square really sums up prague the buildings around the square are great to see the coffee on sale on a cold snowy december morning is really somthing else you must go here and you can pass it on the way to charls bridge

One of the sights to see. It didn't wow me but I was told that the tolling of the clock is something you should see while in Prague. The clock is very pretty and the little show only takes a couple of minutes. Might as well see it while you are there.

wonderful. Everybody there under the clock to see what's happening.
This clock is one of the most visited monuments in Prague.
Particular and unique. Cannot lose it
Picture Perfect. What a beautiful sight day and night you could never tire of looking at it and then the bugle player arrives to make it even better....a joy!

Must see. If you did not see the Astronomical clock then you did not see Prague. Even the hourly attraction is quite disappointing, this does not decrease its value. Take your time at the town hall, have 360 view of beautiful buildings.

Just come and look. At the right time exactly 14:00 all the Staromestska Namesti was full of people that raise their head to see the show of the pupets in the clock to hear the music and the trumpete on the tower. all the cameras and camcorders were on 45 degrees up and everyone were looking up to the clock to see the great show.
the square. so much to see and do here, just sit have a coffee and people watch. plenty of coffe shops, street vendos and street cafes. enjoy enjoy enjoy

Free /Tip walking tour. The old town square is a wonderful meeting place, an hub of excitement and entertainment day,and night..the astronomical clock attracts many many people every hour on the hour haha it's great ...meet Jana with yello umbrella for added attraction around old town square...
Great. This site was great fun, the clock was entertaining and the amount of tourists around it was fantastic .... Go see :)

Read some of the background before seeing it. We were with a guide who explained the history of the clock and the significance of the 4 characters surrounding the 2 blue doors that open for the 12 apostles. The clock is beautiful. Be careful of your belongings because it can be very crowded as people push together for the best view.
impressive. to think how old it is and still works! wow! of course we expected some miracle, but what we saw was so worth the wait!

Must see on the hour. Climb the tower for great views but be in the square at the top of the hour. Cafes have good food / drink and everyone is relaxed.
Clean safe and friendly

be on time. when the clock strikes the hour the different characters change above the clock . when the show is over you can go into the clock tower and take a lift to the top and take pictures of the area

Worth seeing, perhaps only once. A nice unique part of visiting Prague, but the clock can get very busy and blocks some of the main passages in/out of the Old Town square at these times.Having visited several times before, I have seen the clock on many different settings, but on the whole it is probably not as exciting when you have seen it for the first time. Again, definitely worth stopping and seeing the fun unfold if you're in the area. For a different view of the clock, you can see this from the terrace rooftop bar on top of Hotel U Prince. It's around 75kc for only 0.4l of beer, but on a nice day offers a good view of the clock, away from the crowds.

a little disappointing. The astonomical clock - was disappointed - the 15 minutes of crowd anticipation then the short sight of the apostles - all over in a flash! The square is an eclectic mix of food, people and noise, worth a stroll through!
Crowded. You need to read the history of the clock before you visit it. The clock has animation when it strikes the hour. The best place to view is from the restaurant opposite to avoid the crowds.
Fantastic!. A magical place, like living in a fairytale of gothic architecture especially when the bats came out at night as well!

Clock is a wonder!. The clock is marvelous and everyone mills about, waiting for when it springs into action with trumpets from the top and figurines rotating around. It's quite short so you may need to stay a bit around the tower until it happens again but it's high enough where even the crowds won't obstruct your views!
Hang out here at lunchtime. Loved the street vendors and the people watching. Statue of Jan Hus was excellent. Very safe and fun.
Brilliant. Amazing views from the top. Be sure to take the underground tour. One of the best we have been on. Guide spoke very good english and presented the history in a good way.

cool clock.. we were lucky to be just walking by at 1.55pm and wondered what all the crowds were looking up at. we found out that on the hour a parade of figures come out when the bell rings. a nice sight and again a good vibe around the square with all the people.

Living history. We loved the beautiful historic buildings, watching the clock's parade of figures on the hour, and the view from the Tower. There was a great vibe around the square, but so many people, it was liking swimming upstream.

People say its overrated but its really cute!. Even our tour guide said this is the most overrated tourist attraction in the world but we do beg to differ! This is one of the oldest (and coolest) clocks in the world (constructed in the 15th century I think) with one of the most elaborate dials ever. If you look closely it doesnt just tell the time, but also has the zodiac cycle, the old czech time scale with harvesting cycle, and movements of the sun and the moon. The Apostles come out to greet the crowd every hour and the four figures at the sides of the clock represent Vanity, Greed, Death, and Pleasure - apparently the 4 undesirable qualities during that era. We joined a walking tour starting from the Stare Mesto and our tour guide shared an interesting story about the clock maker as well. We went up the clock tower at dusk and had an amazing view of the old town square when the lights lit up. We would definitely recommend this attraction!

Must See. Look up your guide for more info but unlike other similar clocks elsewhere this is a masterpiece not to be missed. Get there at least 10 mnutes before the hour to take some snaps before the guide led groups elbow their way in.

A marvel!. The astronomical clock is fabulous to see change on the hour. The area gets very crowded so get there at least five minutes early and watch out for pickpockets who may take advantage to people distracted by the movement of the clock.

It's a must-see but move on quickly. The clock tower is a must-see in Prague. It's pretty cool to watch the hourly show, too. But after you see it once, you're pretty much done. Rumor is that there are a lot of pick-pockets in the area, too.

Great view from tower(*****); skip the chiming of the clock (**). A visit to the Astronomical Clock is worthwhile to check out the intricate clock design, which includes shows time, astrological signs, moon phases and calendar with name days. The architecture of the tower is also interesting. Less interesting is the "performance" of the clock at the top of the hour. If you happen to be in the Old Town square at the right time, sticking around for a couple of meetings is okay, but I certainly can't recommend hanging out for any period of time just for this. It's very crowded, and the whole thing lasts only a minute or two. A skeleton pulls the chain, ringing the bell; some Apostles come out and a rooster crows. That's about it. However, the view from the tower is great. You buy a ticket at the counter a few doors to the left of the clock. You can then walk to the top, or take the sequence of two elevators. Once there, the 360 degree view of Old Town is quite unique.

Beautiful. Absolutely full of 12th century history. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay in Prague as the city is breathe taking with its Gothic architecture and medieval charm. Just be wary of pickpockets and taxi drivers.

thousands converge. Tour groups, individual tourists and many more people head here to see this famous feature. Stand further back to watch the clock and pick a meeting place before hand in case you get separated. Once the clock has finished the square gets a lot quieter as tour groups walk off for the next site

Simply put: a must-see.. Not much to say about the Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock that hasn't been said here. It's a MUST-SEE and a nice, entertaining (short) show. See it once, see it a thousand times, it's up to you (seeing it more than once will let you see some details that I'd bet you missed.)
The Astronomical Clock is a waste. This is the most overrated attraction in Prague. Don't waste your time waiting in the crowd - visit the one in Munchen

Great views from the Tower above the Clock. Buy a ticket to ride the elevator to the top of the tower above the Astromonmical Clock. Watch the clock chime below from the square, or above from the tower.
We could have stayed on tower for hours watching people in the aware. Views are amazing!
very. very cool looking and when it is operative it is fun to hang out with the masses and wait for the performance

It's cool!. Don't know why people are saying it's not worth waiting around for, it goes off every hour from 9am til 9pm so you know exactly when it will chime so why wait? Just get there 5 mins beforehand? It's so old and amazing that they could make something like this so long ago... People just expect too much these days. Worth a look

Go up the tower...and get there early. While I sort of agree with some of the posts that it's a bit overrated, I think that is perhaps part of its attraction - you can't come to Prague and not be part of the crowd that gathers on the hour to see some little people go past a window that has opened, have a trumpeter play (I don't remember this from 4 years ago) and hear the bells ring for whatever time it is.....when it's over, you can't helping thinking "is that it??" but then you walk away smiling that you got sucked in and waited with the crowd to see it!I got there at 9am and there was probably only about 40-50 people there - I think it gets much busier later in the day so if you are staying close by, well worth it to get there early.I would also highly recommend paying the 105CZK to go up the Tower. The view is amazing! Again, go early in the morning as there are less people - probably only 5-10 others when I was there at 10am....I think everyone else was in the crowd downstairs waiting for the clock to do its thing at 10am!
Beautiful clock. Beautiul clock with a lot of interesting history about it.Old town hall is beautiful both day and night, lovely views from on top of the tower.

Great for Christmas. We were there while this Christmas market was on, so everyone was in a good mood, and the square was quite busy.The clock display is well worth seeing, as many of the locals will tell you.Turn up early to be at the front of the crowd to watch it though because it gets very busy!

Nice to see but slightly overrated. Great old building and in a nice part of town. Everyone said we should go to see the clock chime on the hour sober went with several thousand others at 11 in the morning. Not a big deal - a couple of small doors open and you can just about see some shadowy figures revolving inside.If you're in the vicinity, fine, but don't make a special trip to see this.

Probably good but not working. We waited for about 20 minutes to see the clock do it's thing but in the end it bonged but the mechanization did not work. Apparently characters were supposed to move about the clock tower. They told us that repairs had been done a few weeks ago but I guess it needs more as it is very old.

Well.... I'm not saying the Astronomical Clock isn't interesting, it's a beautiful clock, but I don't think it's worth waiting for the show in the crowd, because you can't see very well and it's not the best astronomical clock I've ever seen (Starsbourg has a really nice one). However, if you go on the top of this tower, the view is awesome!

overrated. the astronomical clock is really lovely to look at but thats it on the hour the figures move slightly a cockeral with a very bad throat sort of coughs and some bloke blows on his trumpet it really isnt worth waiting around for

Unmissable. You could not visit Prague and not come to see this world famous clock - we have probably watched it half a dozen times over the years and it still amazes. It is always good to be able to take in something like this without a fee, but if you have the time the tower is also worth a visit for the great views of the town, especially if there is a market on in the square. Our best viewing was whilst eating in the Spanish restaurant opposite one evening, which allowed us to sit back and enjoy the show during our meal.

Beautiful clock and square. The astronomical clock was worth watching ring in the hour twice during our stay. Each time we noticed new things that it does. Amazing that the 600 year old clock is made of wood! Have a beer at one of the local pubs while you wait for the new hour to ring in but make sure you have a view of the clock.

Wow. Astronimical Clock, a guard will play the trumpet every hour on the top of the tower and crowded tourist watching on the ground and queuing to go to the top for a bird view of prague which is Amazing ! :)

A lot better since music. It's become a lot better since they added the music, but the astronomical clock is still one the most overrated tourist attractions in the world. Which is kind of what makes it worth it seeing?

View from the top!. Well worth a visit whilst in Prague, you must go to the top of the tower. The view from the top was the highlight of my holiday, even though I had visited most of the top attractions. Its amazing how many people gather on the hour, every hour to see the clock in action, watch out for pick-pockets,I noticed some dodgy people in the crowd. people

Beautiful building and amazing clock with tons of history.... My number one tip would be to have a wander past avoiding at the hour, every hour so be able to enjoy the view without a mass of other tourists. Albeit I can't deny it's quite cool to be there amongst the crowds to hear the gongs and watch the show.Aside from the show, it is a magnificent piece of architecture and worth a visit if you have time!Tip - do some reading up on the history of the clock or join a tour group which all gather in the old square for some in depth knowledge of the area.

INTRERESTING. Magnificent feature of Prague. Very crowded area. The clock strikes and provides a `display` on the hour which is worth watching. Care though at this time as being so incredibly packed in this area apparently pick pockets abound!
Well worth climbing the tower. The clock is amazing, get there before quarter to the hour as crowds can get quite large. Well worth climbing the tower for the views from the top (theres a lift too!)

Worth a visit. We visited here whilst on a trip to Prague. To be honest I wasn't that wowed by the clock (and I don't think my children would have been either), although the fact that it dates from the 1400's etc is amazing - it is a big tourist attraction and so everything around the clock is always busy and more expensive!If you stay and watch the changing of the apostles watch your bags and cameras - there are police stationed on the square to help if there is a problem but there are pickpockets everywhere.We visited in August and the most charming thing was that about once an hour a newly emerged couple came out of the town hall married! This was great to watch and really interesting as there seems to be a set of traditional wedding photos in Czech Republic that have to be taken (there were brides walking about everywhere!).We were given a tip that the view from the town hall tower is good, but they charge 110 czk just to get to the top of the tower, we were told to go to the Hotel U Prince which is just behind the town hall, go to the lift press the button for the top floor (scenic view) and have a drink there where the view is just as good if not better (and less than 110 czk)

A MUST EXPERIENCE. This is an amazing invention that is still functioning perfectly. This is a ´can´t miss´ sight. Be sure to get there on the hour to watch the clock work its magic. And, be sure to get the bird´s eye view and climb the tower.
Worth A Visit. Crowds start to gather about 15 minutes before every hour to see the clock give its show. It's worth putting up with all the other visitors to see.
Town Hall. The town hall on the plaza across from the great church was interesting due to its papal hat tower. A great part of the town landscape.

Fascinating. We could have stood and stared at this clock all day. We actually walked past it a few times before realising where/what it was. We heard the chiming and saw people running to see, it was lovely. Everything is so quaint. We took loads of photos in Prague.
too much hype. A must see in Orague, but as may have expected, with so much hype, the activity of the clock is a bit of a let down- however, the clock is beautiful

Extraordinary place. The Prague Astronomical clock is a 'must visit' in Czech Republic. A very busy tourist attraction with plenty of food, nice restaurants and shopping spree. Just get here and you can easily spend the whole day. The clock tower itself is most outstanding.With its few hundreds years of history, it really make my visit a special sensation one.

Lots of people...but find a quiet spot and it's quite nice. Walked to the square in time for the clock to strike 5pm and for the great pronouncement of the time by a bugle/horn player. It was crowded and crammed with tourists but I managed to find a nice quiet spot to sit and watch the proceedings in wonder. The cafes in the vicinity made it a great place to chill out and people watch

amazing, particular. Amazing, particular, but not so impressive. Just curious at each hour the movement of the statues, the sight of the skeleton, the trumpets... Easy place, a bit overrated and crowded.

After Wenceslas Square a real gem!. We visited Wenceslas Square having been told it was a 'must see' and were bitterly disappointed. Then we stumbled across the Astronomical Clock which was delightful. For a very small fee you get to climb the clock tower and see out over Prague. You also get to hear the trumpeter play after the clock strikes on the hour. Lovely. Take time to watch the characters at the front of the clock move as the clock strikes on the hour.
fun clock. Very interesting, a must see. Make to go up in the tower, the best view of Prague. Sometimes the windows don't always open on the hour, a great excuse to go back!

great tour. Take the tour and see the apostles inside and up close and personal. They take you down to the archeological digs and it is fascinating. The guide was very knowledgeable. We felt this as well worth the money
Cool clock!. We didn't go into the hall itself but we did have a look at the clock and I have to say it's definitely worth having a look.
The trademark of Prague. Very extraordinary indeed! If one wants, there are steps leading to great view of the city. I didn't try it but I am sure that it would be great. Next time maybe....:)

Cool and Magnificient. As I was resting and enjoying the ambience of the square, at the corner there's this awesome Old Town and Astronomical Clock. Its rings every hour and you can hear the bell ringing, followed by strong played trumpet from the top most of the building.It sure do pull lots of crowds and every hours there will be a great number of spectators..you will not missed it.

Simply excellent!. I was surprised since I did not know what was going to happen!!I had to see it twice!Every hour-sharp, it is a show with the figures and sculptures at the façade! two small windows on top of the clock open and the 12 apostoles start to show one by one. Below the windows, on the clock's side four little statues start to move too... they represent: Vanity, Greed, Death and Pleasure.Worth seeing it!!!

Fun!. Waited for the clock to do its thing both at night and during the day. Both fun, both different. It is a short routine, but always makes 'em applaud. Hard to believe the clock is centuries old. A must-see.
Amazing clock. The clock is amazing, you need someone to explain everthing it is showing. Time, star signs, all sorts of things. It is also just very pretty and watching it strike the hour is cool
Clock tower. Definitely a must....you can take the lift all the way to the top, what a view, make sure you are there on the hour when the trumpeter is there!!

Must see. The astronomical clock is probably the most characteristic feature of Prague. There are no vendors in the old town square as in other European squares therefore you can enjoy this medieval masterpiece without any frustrations. However, it gets very crowded 5 minutes before the hour since everyone wants to watch the figures that come in motion at the hour therefore do look after your belongings and watch out for pickpockets.
A must see!. All i can say is Wow! What an amazing Clock and it is truly mind-blowing that this was made so many 100's of years ago! Must see the clock strike to see the animations!

Feel the vintage!. After watching the hourly ceremony of watch figures climb up and do not forget to have a little conversation with an old lady inside the clock who sells brochures of the clock history. Do not scip to but the brochure as it tells the story of the clock.everybody will feel their sould will become younger when yhey walk in the old town squre. Do not forget to try Terdelnik. mmm it is so tasty!

Brilliant. I first saw this clock about 20 years ago on my first visit there, at the time you could only look up at the clock, but now you can walk up the tower of which the clock is part and have great views over the city. If you do not want to walk up the stairs there is a lift that you can travel to the top and back down.

Great Ambiance and people watching. Great atmosphere and spot to take a break. Good views from clock tower but can get crowded. Read a bit about the clock before hand as the animatronics are great for when it was built but will not impress the Disney generation.

Definitely go to the top. Of course this is crowded when the clock goes off, but its up high so no matter how far back you are, you will get to see it all. It does happen quickly though, so be sure to be out front a little early. We went to the top for great views of the square.

climb the tower. It is a very touristy place, sure, but that doesn't mean it can't be beautiful. You can enjoy a wonderful view of the Old City from the tower. Take the stairs, it's an attraction by itself

A must see in Prague. Worth seeing once, but the crowds are getting bigger and you need to remember to watch your belongings. Excellent performances nearby so plan to watch some of those, and visit the tourist information centre for tickets, hotel bookings and other activities and advice.

Historical place. Old Town Hall was established in 1338 when the king, John of Luxembourgh granted the city the right to have their own town hall. Nowadays the Town Hall consists of 5 medieval houses from which it is possible to see only 4 of them - actually only the rooms used for the city council reasons. On the first floor of the Town Hall you can visit 4 historical halls and a gothic chapel with the figures of apostoles. You recieve a text with the explanation and history of the rooms and you spent the time you like wondering around. Each hour there are the guided tours into the cellars - romanic and gothic rooms, very suggestive places - the problem is you never know in which language the tour will be as they decide at the moment considering the majority in the group. On the third floor of the Town Hall you can visit the tower and its panoramic view with is wonderful. The prices are 105 crown per each floor but if you buy a combined ticket on the first floor, you actually pay only 160 crown, which is more convienient. On the first, second and fourth floor there are private exhibitions. The guides are very friendly and helpful, mainly the younger ones.

Best views at the top of the tower. The Astronomical Clock is one of the most beautiful I have ever seen. Definetely worthy to wait for the hour to see it in action. Go to the top of the Old Twon Hall and enjoy the best views of the city. Also on the hour you will see a trumpeter announce it to the four sides.
Fantastic architecture. Gratuity is fixed in the restaurants and as a result, waiters don't seem very attentive. Be prepared to wait to be served!!
Get there around the hour. Always very busy here get there on the hour for the little show well worth a watch, a good photo opportunity

Climb the tower and tour the town hall. The tower is directly above the astronomical clock. You can take 2 elevators, or climb a few steps and walk up a gentle incline with things to read on the walls. The view from the top is great. I would recommend going up before 10 when it is less crowded. If you're up there on the hour you can see the trumpeter as well.If you take the town hall tour on the same day you get a discount, although neither is particularly expensive. If you walk down the steps rather than take the lower elevator, you will find the entrance room to the tour. You buy the ticket there. The town hall is quite interesting to see, but make sure you look out for the guide taking you underground. This will take you below ground, to buildings that were once at street level. Most interesting.If your timing is right, you can see the trumpeter at the top on the stroke of hour 1. Then you can take the town hall tour and end up behind the clock on the stroke of hour 2. The mechanism is open for viewing.
Short!. The clock tower is very cool, but I didn't realize how short the 'show' is on the hour. But I like the trumpet guy at the end!The underground of the town hall was interesting.
A must see!. This clock was a must see, however, be warned that it is most definitely a tourist trap area with some of the bars and restaurants being very expensive.

Don't wait for the clock.... The square is nice, very expensive, just to walk around is nice. the clock is a complete bore. walk by when it's not "on" and it would be enough to understand what happens when it's going... (full hour) It's not as impressive as you would imagine
worth it. Again a must see, I wish I had more time to see a lot more. A lot of history in this town so soak it all up.

Great view from the top!. I like to visit Old Town Square in the morning before 9am. You can walk around freely and take photos. It's very crowded after 10pm, especially 12noon. Everyone is rushing here to see the Astronomical clock!I paid 105 CZK to go up the Astronomical Clock. You can choose to climb up or take the lift. The view is GREAT! One of the best place to see the Prague City (all the directions)! It really worth your money!
a must do. well worth the entrance fee to go to top of tower, gorgeous veiws from the top also got to see man blowing his trumpet on the hour

Unique. Although many will say this tourist trap is overrated, it is beautiful and unique (and free!). It is truly amazing how complex its design is (especially given how long ago it was built), and the history of its maker and the symbolism is also very interesting.

Amazing Clock. The clock comes to life every hour on the hour--crowds come to see & cheer the clock on! Definitely go to the top of the clock tower (there is a lift) for some great views of the city, and take the tour of the Old Town Hall and underground area, accessed beneath the Town Hall.

Good but slightly overrated. Its a beautiful clock, not quite sure how it works/reads but nonetheless its pretty to look at. As is said in so many reviews, the chiming is a bit naff and overrated, with the bugler being decent enough.
We never made it up to the top of the town hall as it was packed every day.
Very cool clock. For the astronomical clock it is important to go on the hour to see the show.. Not sure about the tour, we didn't partake in that..

Not much to see. We were expecting something totally amazing when the clock hit the hour, but it was a bit of a wet fish. Some trap doors open & a few models pass by the window but that was about it. A trumpeter does a tune out of the top of the tower on all 4 corners which gets a big round of applause. Worth paying to go up to the top for great views.
Great Views. The clock is amazing to see and the views from the tower are lovely. The place will get swarmed with tour groups sadly so try and go at somewhat odd times.
Beaut.. Been to many old city squares but this one with the totally unique Astronomical Clock which is a major attraction in itself is something else.
Wow. The astronomical clock can keep you entertained for quite some time, especially if you are interested in complex machines. The craftmanship alone is impressive enough, though.

A charming piece of history. Make sure you catch the clock on the hour as when you realise it was built in the 15th Century it is astounding to see the figures around it coming to life. If you want a good view I'd recommend getting there about 0845 so you can catch an early display before it gets too busy with tour parties.
great views. lovely area , loads of bars restaurants the clock is a must see we walked up teh tower and the reviews from here are outstanding

Cute. This clock is so interesting and beautiful. We didn't go in but admired from afar.Great little show at the top of the hour, good to see and visit this area. Beware if you choose to sit in any of the restaurants in this area, they charge ridiculous prices for the simplest things, we paid nearly AUD$7 for a coffee. It would be wise to check the menu before sitting or having something to eat and drink away from the square.
Much ado about nothing. I suppose you have to crowd into this square once to see that there's really little to see in the chiming of this clock

Nice photographic opportunity. The clock is worth seeing as it is an attractive piece, but the anatomical display (whilst impressive for when it was made in early 15th century) is not really much of a show to be honest!

Free entertainment. It's a beautiful clock and a must see when you are here, but it was also very fascinating to look at all the people gathering too see it at the hour with their cameras ready. We had a drink on the roofbar of Hotel Prince with a perfect view over the crowd and the clock.

Beautiful. This clock is really something to see. The old town hall and surrounding surrounding square are beautiful with many shops (especially if you are looking for crystal), restaurants and out door vendors. Check out the spider bikes!!

Always busy on the hour but worth seeing. You can tell when it's Bering the hour as it gets so busy. However for those visiting for the first time or who haven't been for a while it's on every ones list of things to see. For the more ambitious climb the tower for the best pics
If you don't go up the Clock Tower.... ...you've missed one of the best attractions in Prague. Do it! The 360 degree views are phenominal. It's worth the price, and the lines move quickly.

View from the top of the tower. While watching the astronomical clock is a must do, the real must do is to go to the top of the tower for the view. It is fantastic. You will not be disappointed unless the weather is bad. It is cheap to take the lift up and worth every penny. Bring your camera!

A lot to do about not much!. I guess you should go to check it out, just so you can say you saw this astronomical clock...especially when you then go to Munich and they compare that Glockenspiel to the list of "a lot to do about not much" also.

A must. If you do not have seen the magnificent old town hall, you missed a great part of Prague. You should take a guide to tell you about the astromical clock: the symbols, figures and there meaning. Otherwise you're simply one of the people stearing there.

Inspiring. Loved the quaint streets and the square. The clock attracted quite a crowd so it was nice to sit outside a bar with a cocktail or two and just enjoy the ambience.
Would love to repeat that and hope to sometime soon.
Visit Off-Peak. If you want to go up into the tower, try visiting at off-peak times. For those who are claustrophobic, climbing up and walking around the tower can be tough when it is crowded.

Watch the other tourists. The clock is overrated. The most interesting thing is the crowds waiting for the (tiny) figures to come out. Also the parade of brides getting their pictures taken at the cathedral doors below the clock. We saw about ten Asian (Japanese?) brides getting pictures taken together--not sure if this is a destination wedding place? But it is very alive as a multicultural tourist place--get away from here to experience anything to do with Czechs.

Incredible. The Astrological Clock is amazing structure with incredible view of the Old Town from the top of the tower. Per clock tower lore, scholars have not deciphered the meaning of all the figures even today.

Astronomical Clock. The clock is beautiful. The chiming of the clock is a bit overrated but worth a few minutes wait if you have it. We did not go to the top of the tower, but I wish I had. It looked to give a beautiful overview of the old town square area.

Worthy. A good sight and lots of crowds and tour groups who push in front of you just as you are going to take a photos. Despite that, a wonderful building and to see the clock strike the hour is spectacular

not worth waiting for. the little windows open on the hour and you get a glimpse of tiny figurines...nice to see but don't waste your time waiting here if you have more important things to see and do...it's over rated!

Crowded but worth it.. Unsurprisingly, the Astrological Clock is THE meeting place for tourist groups in Prague - especially coming up to each hour when the figures above the clock 'perform'.DO NOT MISS the view from the top of the Tower - amazingly they have managed to instal a lift without desecrating the building and the views are truly stunning.

Wedding venue July 2012. Superb wedding venue and the staff were really excellent. Medieval and baroque interior giving a superb ambience. And, of course, what could be better than the astrological clock outside for the wedding photos.

Just A Few Minutes to Enjoy. Find a central location about 10 minutes before the hour to take in this amazing time piece. The highlight is the trumpet player at the very top viewing gallery. Take the time to check out this historical icon in Prague's old town square.

Nice Area. The area is very crowded near the clock but still very cool to watch and the trumpet player up top is pretty cool. We also saw it at night, not as crowded and we were able to get some great photos. We didn't climb up to the top, I would suggest going to the castle for views of the city. The views there were amazing!
Fun to watch the clock!. This is a one-of-a-kind clock and it's fun to watch what happens on the hour, every hour from 10am-9pm.

Gorgeous and very unique. This is an absolute must-see! At the strike of every hour, except from midnight to like 7:00 am, the clock strikes and the little characters come out of the clock and the trumpeter plays a song from high above the clock. Since this is a large gathering, beware of pick pockets. If you can time right, grab a bite to eat at one of the outdoor restaurants facing the clock and watch the show while being protected by the restaurant's barriers.
Go up the tower for the views. The clock itself is amazing and I loved the trumpet fanfare that went with it. Climb up the tower (or take the lift) for spectacular views over the old town and beyond
Beautiful area. The astronomical clock and nearby square were lovely. Many people taking photos of the clock. The narrow cobbled streets were quaint.

Enjoy the Clock then Climb to the Top. Interesting place and great views from the top. There's an elevator up if you please. View of the square below is excellent. Space at the top is tight, so best to go early before the crowds. They open at 9.
Old Town Hall and Clock. Make sure you understand the meaning of all what is going on when the clock strikes the hour and many parts start moving. A masterpiece!

Brilliant. The astronomical clock really is a marvel- when you think how old it is!Get a free walking tour- they all start off outside the clock at 11... so be there a little early and get the whole thing explained- even if you decide not to continue the rest of the tour. You'll also see the clock's magic on the hour. You really can't go to Prague without seeing the clock- it would be like missing the Eiffel Tower in Paris!

What a sight.. This was my favourite bit of my holiday, i was so excited, we climbed all the way to the top at 10am when the clock chimed, then on the next day we were outside at 10am to watch the movement of the clock. I was not disappointed, FAB.
Unique clock. The clock strikes every hour on the hour and although it's just a very short display, yet it is worth the wait. If you want a closer view, queue early because the place is always full.

Blink and who's will miss. Hugh crowds for a 2 minute spectacle! Very busy at every hour before clocks chime. After seeing it you wonder why you waited so long to see the figures move behind the doors and the trumpeter trump!

great place but lot of tourist. the Astronomical clock is a beautiful clock and it makes everyone applaud and clap every hour at the hour. there´s a lot of music at the square.....a great place for children, but there´s a lot of tourist

Astronomical Clock and old town hall. Very nice to see what happens on the hour each day. Crowds there. Tours start from outside the Tourist Office,next to the clock. Very easy to see Prague, just need good shoes!

Nice but not overwhelming. We were defiantly expecting a huge spectacle after arriving to so many people gathering and waiting.
It was nice but not overwhelming. The clock is lovely and so are the surrounding buildings. However this was on of the most touristy areas we had been in and just wanted to exit once the clock had gone off!

A main sight of Prague. The Astronomical Clock in Prague is the oldest astronomical clock that is still working. It's one of the most recognizable sights in the city and therefore, it's one of the most popular areas for people to gather in the main square. Every hour on the hour there is a display of moving figures and a trumpeter that plays a tune from the top of the tower. If you want to see this I suggest arriving a little early to get a better view up front. It tends to get crowded very quickly.

FANTASTIC!. What a clock and building. For a truly great spot, grab a seat in the street cafe opposite the clock with about 20-30 minutes before the hour. Order a tea, coffee or beer and wait for the minutes to tick by. If you don't want to do this, then be prepared to stand in the large crowd! After that, take the lift to the top of the tower!!

Astronomical clock. The astronomical clock, like the clock in Bern, is a bit simple to our modern tastes, but not less enjoyable as the people watching are ridiculously pleased with the mechanical figures. You will probably find yourself laughing along. There are several beautiful buildings near the astronomical clock. Don't miss the one a few houses down with the Black and White engravings. This was Kafka's house in his youth. Didn't know that when we were there, just thought it was pretty and found out later.

The touristic centre of prague. The Square itself is impressive and has been well-maintained and/or restored. As you would expect, it is lined with restaurants, shops and other activities relating to the tourist trade.The astronomical clock draws the biggest crowd when it goes through its performance every hour on the hour. For a fee, you can go up the interior staircase to the top of the clock tower for the best view of Prague

One of Prague's must see places. I loved the old down,especially the astronomical clock.At night,every 30 minutes people gather around it to see the laser show directly on the clock.It's just wonderful.Afterwards you can enjoy a tasty duck in the restaurants nearby.Lovely end of the day !!!
Overpriced Restaurants. There are a number of quality restaurants in this vicinity. We were in front of the astronomical clock at the one we ate at, and it was expensive.

Loved the trumpeter!. The square was packed as we waited for the clock to chime 1100 hrs - the clock is a marvel but make sure to look up immediately after the clock is done its "performance". A trumpeter pokes his head out from the tower and plays a tune, not once but 4 times - one on each side of the tower. Everyone gets a view!

Medieval astronomy anyone?. The oldest astronomical clock in the world that's still working. Grab and ice cream and your camera and watch the Death figure strike the time every hour. Apostles and other figures march inside a little window that also opens on the hour. Aside from the throngs of tourists, it's quite an old artifact. Great interest for those with a passion for medieval astronomy.

A great ritual. The clock's attraction are the figures represented - death, greed, the Jew and the Moor, that parade out of the windows. There are skeletons and when the clock finishes chiming, a herald trumpets from all four sides of the tower. Very entertaining, but it is very crowded - watch your valuables!

Worth a watch. The asronomical cl;ock is worth a look, be there at the hour as it performs, with the 12 disciples parading in 'cookoo clock' style. After that the trumpeter does his bit from all four walls of the tower, which you can climb up and watch close up if you want. Crowd reaction is great, clap and wave, but it is a magnet for pickpockets as people look up and stare at a predictable time, so watch it.

Great views from the old town hall. We were staying nearby so passed the Old Town hall several times daily but we were out early one morning so decided to go up the tower. The Old Town Hall has an entrance fee but it is worth it to see the Old Town from high up. I took some really good photos from the top of the tower. Thankfully no tall buildings have been allowed to be built otherwise this historic place would not be so enjoyable. There are two separate lifts - best to get them both as the steps are quite steep and narrow in places. Mind you if you go up the stairs there are lots of informative displays. The astronomical clock is set into the tower and is free to anyone who is passing. It is beautiful but when it strikes on the hour it is extra entertainment. Go early to avoid the crowds. It gets really busy from 11:00 am onwards. As others have said it is the audience that is more interesting than the clock as it strikes. The figures as they pass the two little windows under the cockerel are quite entertaining but go past quickly.
If walking by, go ahead and look. If you find yourself in Prague and are walking in the main square, by all means stop and look.The clock is not all that interesting.Very crowded in the area.

Well worth seeing!. The Astronomical Clock is really fun to watch when it strikes on the hour. It only lasts a few minutes but it is fun and worth seeing. Very crowded but you can still see the clock easily enough.
Not bad. I guess this is somehting you should see whilst in Prague, the clock is impressive. Just beware of pick pockets as it can get quite busy.

Must see. In the center of the Old Town Square, this is a beautiful clock at any time. But the show really occurs every hour on the hour, when music plays and little figures dance around. Truth be told, the reaction of the crowd is more fun than the clock’s performance.
Worth the wait. We thoroughly enjoyed this unique experience. Both: watching it from the street as well as from the Tower. A must in Prague!
Fascinating clock. Very nice hall, the tour was very interesting and try to get to the clock early as the square get's crowded when the chimes ring.
Every hour..... The clock is very beautiful and it goes off every hour. The performance is watched and cheered by tourists. A must visit tourist attraction.
Too many people. I was astounded by the number of tourists. We are loving the place to death.

Unique. When we got into Prague, started walking around an looked for a restaurant, ended up just sitting down at a restaurant in the Square, not aware of the clock, turns out we were directly in front of clock when it went off at 10:00. Turned out we were buy the clock more then 1/2 dozen times throughout our stay in Prague, even trying to time our walks to be there at the hour.

Astronomical Clock. The Astronomical Clock "rings the bell" every full hour. Watch the figures as the move when the clock rings the bell. It is a bit tricky to understand how the times shall be read but it is a very nice clock.The Old Town Hall serves a lot of weddings. You can expect to see perople just married if you stay at the Old Time Hall for more than one hour.

Interesting. Located on a main square and quite cool to learn about if you're anything interested in history, astronomy or science. It's beautiful and so centrally located that you likely will walk by it in all cases.
beautiful but too much tourists. it is a wonderful square but the 1000's of tourists on that place disappointed me

Interesting, and yet .... I would give this just a 3, except when you consider when this clock was built, it's quite fascinating. By today's standards, it might be a bit of a "was that it?" I did witness several people standing around waiting for something more to happen after the hour chimed. My friend and I went to a hotel across the street from the clock, up to the second floor tea room and had tea and cakes while we watched the display from their windows. That was much better than standing with the crowds, wanting a front row space, down on the street.
Fabulous Architecture. Great place very Cosmoplitan and amazing Architecture
A Must See. This clock is a must see when it chimes on the hour and the best bit is the trumpeter at the top of the tower who always gets a big cheer from the crowd below.

Great tourist spot. Really reasonable price for what it is, if it was in any other country I bet it would cost double. Also they've made it completely fitness friendly by having the elevator to the top although we wanted to walk the whole way up the ramp and even that was easy enough. Views are spectacular and on the hour is a great little demonstration of chimes and bells and a costumed person with a horn.

Clock plays music every hour & crusader sounds bugle. We ate at the cafe directly in front of the Old Town Hall and Clock and had wonderful service and views of all activity. Go early enough for corner table. Crowds assemble in the square in front of the Clock tower early but our waiter was charming, the food was excellent, and we had perfect views. As soon as I can locate the name of the cafe I'll post it for you all. This is a must do in Prague!

Best sight!. Went completely looking for the clock and it was good fun. Even if it is just a clock. Stood in the pouring rain but was glad to see that every little thing (the moving heads, skeleton etc) was all in working order.

Good to watch for a while... Beautiful scene!. Try to coincide your trip to the Old Town Square with the chiming of the clock on the hour - you will see a fantastically historical show from the automatons, and a theatrical fanfare from each tower face. Don't base your whole day around it though - if you time it right you can catch it all inside 15 mins.

Cheery and Crowded. So, if you're willing to brave the crowds, and indeed, I think you should, visit the clock - especially when you can see the 'show'. It's worth it, just avoid the restaurants in the square (average) and stick to standing and then grabbing food/drink elswhere.
Wait for the moment. Wait to see the Astronomical clock sit in one of the amazing restaurants and cafes in front of it.

Its a must see !. This is located at the old town and you wont be alone to see that as there are quite a lot of people waiting for clock to tick . The astonomical dial of this mechanical clock with the moon dial and some caricatues surrounding the clock is amazing .
not sure. not sure what the hype is about, the clock doesnt do too much
A genius invention!. It was very entertaining to watch this amazing piece of clever engineering! Nevertheless, its not a place for someone who does not like crowds!

Very historic, very touristy. What beautiful and incredibly historic buildings, covered in grafitti, surrounded by Tour groups and bar crawls and restaurants with plastic menu's. Going up the clock tower was well worth the views.
Worth a visit. You can travel to the top of the tower with the clock on it. Just head next door. Opposite the clock is a great bar with a rooftop terrace.
Astronomical Clock.. Massive and interesting clock. The moving figures which appear on the hour though are vastly over rated.It was over so quickly one comment overheard was "Is that it then".
Not that interesting. We waited in the sun with hundreds other tourists to see the clock play at the hour, but was disappointed with the show. Really not that much to see
Excellent view!. an awesome and breathtaking panoramic view at entire Prague! A must see attraction!
Good view. Great place to up and see the town overlooking the old square

Great views. The views from the top were well worth the small fee. The climb up wasn't bad... Just pay attention to the red/green light to avoid traffic jams with those going up/down in the opposing direction. The clock display at the turn of the hour was great. It gets a bit crowded and rowdy when this clock chimes, and some in the crowd can be 'opportunists' ... so a seat in one of the nearby outdoor bars is a great place to take it all in when yu come down from the tower.
Impressive architecture. Like nothing I have ever seen. The clock and cathedral had many carvings that cover the entire church. The ceremony was nice.
Nice but crowded. Interesting square.. get a table outside a restaurant on the square and people watch.. fun..

Go see it!. Loved the trumpeter from the balcony of the Astronomical Clock ( done solely for the tourists, but it was a fun touch) on the hour. Story behind the clock is interesting - we didn't get a chance to climb the clock tower so I don't know about that.
clock is lovely if you climb to the top. Buy a ticket to climb to the top, it is worth it the views are simply wonderful.
How amazing!. A must see! It's an amazing work of genius and the story behind it is worth being told.
