tower worth a visit. the clock chimes are a little dissapointing, for anyone over 48 you will know when I say, I expected it to be more Trumpton like, but well worth a trip up the tower to the observation tower, fantastic views of the city

Hundreds of tourists can't be wrong!. Every hour the clock, which is in a tall tower that can climbed fairly easily or via two elevators, goes into action. The hands turn, the men turn around, and a trumpeter at the top of the tower plays a song. Be sure to get there 10 minutes early for the best spot.
Panorama view of Old Town on top of the Clock Tower. If you got a chance, stop by at the clock tower and go up to the top. You'll see a panorama view of the Old Town Prague in every angle.

A Masterpiece of a clock and a nice town hall. The clock is the centerpiece of attraction of the old town square. It is very nice and gets even better on the hour when the clock does the "song and dance" show. I have seen many such clocks, but this was one which had the most number of things happening. Infact it all happens so fast that we saw it 3 diff times to appreciate the full actions. We also saw the clock from inside, which you can do if you take the tour of the city hall. The city hall was good, but the catcombs tour under the city hall was great. If showed how Prague many years back was a city around 10 feet lower and due to floooding by the Vltava river time and again, the city kept rising. They have still maintained the old houses and give a nice tour with explanations.

neat atmosphere. The astronomical clock was neat to see at the top of the hour. It comes to life! Eating outside in the old town hall area was great too for people watching and admiring the buildings!

Well worth a visit.. Still visit this lovely building each time I visit Prague. Watch the crowds gather before the clock strikes each hour. I went up the tower a number of years ago and the views are great.

An icon of Prague. The UNderground Tour gives great information about the Old Town Hall. (I'm sure there are plenty of resources that do, but that is how I experienced it.) The Astronomical Clock is lovely. The square gets very crowded around the operation time of the clock, but is well worth the effort of getting there.

Gorgeous Clock.... The Astronomical Clock is stunning and well worth a look see. On the hour the crowd gathers in front waiting for it to strike. Bit of fanfare, but nothing too earth shattering... however it seems to appeal to the audience as the end is always greeted with cheers and clapping! It really is a sight that you cannot stop taking photos of, as is the rest of Prague!

Astro clock. If yo want to get a good view of this clock and its workings, get there at least 20 minutes before the hour.There are a lot of tourists that want to get the best spots.Also a lot of visitors don't care about how they block your view, arms , cameras, kids on shoulders.This is a very old clock with a lot of workings to be seen if you look particulary closely.The best thing to do with this site is set your camera to video. Then you will get to see all that happens when the bells chime.You can also go up into the tower for a view over all of the town.Also plenty of food to be had in the town square.One thing about the clock, is that if you miss it, go back later .

The place to be!. Its got a great buzz at night around here - lots of dining choices - they had the Euro soccer on a huge screen in the town square - very organized. It is an easy walk to the Charles Bridge down intruiging small streets - very safe, we wandered around at midnight and felt fine. By the way, its not far to walk to the new town district from here, but dont bother, there's too much history and cool options to see in Prague than bothering with the New Town district.

Hog roast. There are a couple of fast food outlets doing hog roast in the square but note that prices stated are per KG and not per item !!!I got caught out and paid 3 times as much as I expected as each meal is weighed and the price given as they pass you the food... a bit sneaky !
tourist attraction. The best tourist attraction in Prague. Don't forget visit the Old Town Square and its Old Town Hall.

An Engineering Masterpiece. See the clock, take some pictures. Its extremely crowded at that spot, so every guide book states to be weary of pickpockets, although I never felt unsafe, you do get approached for drugs by dealers or for fake currency exchange. Be weary of these scam aritists, they'll offer you a favorourable exchange but you'll be getting obsolete Bulgarian currency in the deal!

Fun to see. Make sure you arrive in time to see the clock "perform" at the top of the hour. We did not climb the tower but many did and got a different perspective. The square is filled with interesting architecture, churches, statues, and restaurants. The buildings are all amazing colours and styles. Fun place to be in the thick of things in Prague.

Astronomical clock is truly a wonder of the world. We were fortunate enough to find a dining spot right in front of the astronomical clock and Old Town Hall. A highlight was witnessing a bride and groom emerging from the beautiful Town Hall while they posed in front!

Wonderful People Watching Site. Plus there are numerous food and craft vendors in the square. I spent a few hours wandering the area, bought a sausage on a bun and a cup of hot cider, and just people watched while waiting for the clock to do its thing. I was there in September 2010 and the weather was still very warm, perfect for sitting in a square until 10:00.
A must see!. It is fantastic! Take your camera and video it, since you can take a picture afterwards. The trick is to go there early so you can get a good spot...Enjoy it!

So old but so clever and still shiny!. The Astronomical Clock was beautiful and attracted a big crowd all craning our necks to watch the action when it chimed the hour. A lovely display of figures came out and at the end a trumpet was played at the top of the tower.

on the hour. Loved this clock with all its detail and architecture. What a sight to see the workings of it all when the clock chimed on the hour. Make sure you go before the hour or visit one of the restaurants to get a good view.
A must see. Brilliant atmosphere and plenty of places to have a beer.

Incredible clock. The guy who build the clock was made blind so he couldn't create another one, he take is revenge by destroying one of its mechanisms and it didn't worked for a century. Go visit it because it is one of the biggest symbols of this awesome city.
Impressive. I loved this clock. There is always a crowd around on the hour and I found the best time for photos was 9:00 am. Noon was very crowded.

Great show. The clock is just great to look at, although you need to consult a guidebook or two to understand its complex elements. For example, one bit of it tells the time in Babylonian mode. This may seem incredibly arcane, but we still use the Babylonian 60 based system to count minutes and hours (perhaps we should decimalise time?)Aside from intellectual or aesthetic appeal, what I really liked about the clock was the happiness it gave its audience. Everyone was delighted, a great burst of applause rose on the several times I witnessed the 'on the hour' ceremony and the trumpet blasts to conclude the show are wonderful.
Must See. Incredible how this operates and how many centuries old. Great food vendors at the square.
Interesting. The architecture of the Old Town Hall is gorgeous, like so many other buildings in the Old Town. Crowds around the Astronomical Clock are constant.

classic Prague. Clock is an amazing work of engineering. Pay to go inside the town hall to see the apostle statues from the inside. The town hall isn't a must-see, but it is a cool way to kill sometime.

Wow! That clock!. Every hour small statues get out of the tower and there are some in front that move. It is amazing to see the squeleton pulling a rope. Take your camera. And the man in the upper part of the tower with a trumpet saluting the four cardinal points of the city!

Clock visit. Very beautiful squares and old narrow streets open up to the astronomical clock from the 15th century. Every hour the 12 apostles appear ( added I think in 17th century). Always very busy

Um, we weren't sure we were there at first.. We literally had to ask if we were in the right place. The clock is not huge and the tower and Church of Tyn had odd hours. Be prepared to pay to go inside churches and then pay extra for a "photo permit." Hmmm.

interesting. Can't imagine going to Prague and not seeing the Clock. Watching the Clock chime the hour from the square is free but there is an admission charge to go to the top the of tower. We took advantage of the student discount and went up. The view from the top was worth the trip because aerial perspective of the historical buildings.
Very pretty. The clock is amazing. Hard to believe it has been working for so many hundreds of years without fail. Lovely square. Just expensive food and beer there.

Busy but definitely worth a look.. The clock is beautiful and the chimes/bugler are definitely worth seeing but the latter was a bit of an anti-climax (I had expected it to go on longer). Does get really busy though! The climb up the tower to the viewing platform is also well worth it - beautiful views of the old town and the wider city.

Astronomical Clock. The buildings, easter markets, restaurants etc.... I am simply in love with the Old Town. So much history..The beauty of the Astronomical Clock mesmerizes me every time I go there. When you go up the clock, you ll see a great view
Beautiful historical attraction with amazing views from the top!. A must see in Prague. The Astronomical clock, the views from the viewing deck and everything else make this one place you can't miss.

Nice square that links the attractions of Prague. Old town is a must visit place for all visitors to Prague. It's a link between Wenceslas Square to Charles bridge with many sights and shops along the way, though the food here is on the expensive side. While the astronomical clock is nice and pretty, the hourly "performance" is over rated.
Very spectacular. The clock is very spectacular and is supported by the buglar who follows the clocks chimes and compliments the experience.
Old but disappointing. All those people waiting to see/hear the clock, didn't do anything for us. Pretty cool how old it is, though.
Popular Place!. Astronomical Clock is one of the most famous places in Prague! There are lots and lots of tourists near this clock every day, who takes pictures!
Well worth a visit. The view from the top is spectacular - great photo opportunities.
One of many tourist things to do. The tour guides say that the clock is a bit of a disappointed but are quick to point out that it IS very old. It's charming and worth seeing.

A fascinating attraction. On the hour the clock has dancing figures and a wonderful chime. Also up the top of the clock tower a trumpeter played lovely music.
We went at 10am and then went and had coffee close by and watched it at 11am again, It was wonderful.
Interesting. This is a beautiful and interesting clock in the middle of Prague. It "performs" on the hour and the area does get very crowded so again watch out for pickpockets.

It is just a clock. Nonetheless, it is a Prague staple that requires little effort to see. Swing by the clock two minutes before the top of the hour to be amazed by a 500+ year piece of technology. The history is a must know so I would read an online article about it or have a guide to really appreciate its beauty.
Impressive.. The infrastructure of the tower itself was very impressive. The clock itself is a fantastic and fascinating piece of machinery
Great view of the city. Wonderful place to get an overview of the City, unfortunately everyone thought so too, so it was a bit crowded. Lovely clock.
Too bad this was all they had to live by. For modern travellers this is a disappointment. All the watch makers display more interesting clocks. At least the cukoo clocks do something

Get there on the hour. Even though it is only 45 seconds it is worth seeing what happens on the hour. Amazing from a clock that can tell the position of the stars and is so old. How did they manage to achieve that?
stunning site. This is simply incredible. Not much more to say really

Tourists, tourists everywhere.... The Astronomical clock is of course spectacular, that is why every single person who goes to Prague absolutely have to see it, but therein lies my rating of "average", there is no chance whatsoever for you to get a "clean" shot of it, there are flocks of tourists walking about, standing and gaping, aiming their cameras high above their heads to get a good pic...And there are streetvendors everywhere, they sell everything from grilled pork to their mothers if need be.If you aren´t a fan of crowds, try to make your visit here as short as possible.Dining here is also much more expensive than if you go a couple of blocks in any direction.

Astronomical Clock. It is a really cool clock and nice area around but it does get packed with people. After seeing it once I was good to just walk past this area fast the other days. But it is a must see and make sure you see it when the clock goes off.
bit of a damp squib really. Like others, we waited for the clock to strike the hour & it was all a bit of a disappointment really. Worth watching only if you happen to be there at the right time.
busy on the hour!. A must see when you're in the square, every hour on the hour a crowd gathers to watch the clock come to life and the trumpeter emerge from the tower
Unusual. A must on your list of things to do and see. Very busy area and lots to do so you must explore the whole square.
join the crowd. best to get there a good 10 min before and find a good position and be prepared to defend it but well worth it.
Sit in the restaurant!. Closest to the clock.....have a beer, and take a load off! Its over in 30 seconds....but who cares, your sitting with a beer and a view! Fun.
Interesting. This is a fascinating piece of machinery, but sad that it is a recreation as the original had been destroyed.
Busy but worth a walk through. Very busy on the hour when the clock turns. Great place - you've got to try the fresh roasted pork stand! Yum, melty in mouth!

Great experience, but very busy. The Astronomical clock is one of those must dos for anyone visiting this wonderful city but it does get very busy. We went back more than once and even sat in one if the nearby cafes enjoying a cocktail one of our visits. The clock is stunning and there is so much to see from the apostles on one level to the bugler at the top it is hard to take it all in.
Intriguing. Worth visiting and learning the history behind it. We did a free Sandeman New Europe Tour of Old Town and learned a great deal of history behind the city - much recommended.
Good view. Climbing the tower yields an incredible view of the Old Town Square and Prague in general.

Did you know. that underneath the Town hall is a labyrinth of passages that used to be on the surface - neither did I!!!check out the Underground TourClock is fantastic - you must see it when it chimes the hour
.... NOT Special. it's beautifull but not something special. Yes,it's nice to see it but you cant stand there for one hour and stare in it. You just pass by it
Gives that old time feel. The clock has been a wonder from the times it was conceived. Its history and lore just adds more charm to the whole thing!

long wait. we wait for the clock to chime. it was really grand and the atmosphere from the people waiting below made it feel really special despite the clock chiming being a norm.
i loved it cause this is what i dont get to see so often.

Chimes on the hour and then there's a trumpet player. A must see while in Prague. Be sure to have someone point out all of the parts to you. There's one part with the astronomical piece, time, one for names...It's cool.
Astronomical Clock. There are several cafes to sit and have a drink or something to eat and watch the clock (and the tourists go by). The Clock is wonderful!
excellent. this was brilliant to watch. get there early on the hour.
Interesting clock!. It's ordinary unless someone explains the history of the clock to you - in which case it's very interesting and you will appreciate it more!
Fabulous Clock. Lovely area to stroll and shop, or eat as far as that goes. The clock on the tower is remarkable, on the hour the Apostles circle and push Judas out of it...

My favorite spot in Prague. The astronomical clock in itself is very cool. It has an interesting design. But the best part is the area right outside the clock: a market. They have everything: fruit, vegetables, trinkets. It's a great place to grab something for lunch and hang out.

Fun and a bit of a mystery. Make sure you take the inside tour of the tower and Roma ruins below. You will find this in the Information office just left of the clock. Well worth your time and gives you a great look into history and gives you deeper understanding of Pragues heritage. There is also a surprise behind the clock you can view.

Worth seeing but don't blink!. The clock is amazing, so much detail to take in but it's a long wait for the action and when it happens, suddenly it's all happening! Then it's all over and you know it's a very long wait for the next time!It's well worth waiting for though so why not fill in the time by climbing the tower and seeing the amazing view. You might even be lucky, like I was, to see the 'man at the top'..... you'll know, I can't tell you!To see the clock is free but you pay to climb the tower. Or why not position yourself in the right cafe beneath the clock and enjoy a glass of wine or a coffee while you watch?

Good to see. Town hall seems to be one in one out on the wedding front, lovel venue if you want something different for your wedding and even strangers offer you their goodwill. Clock is lovely but doesn't match the hype - the one by Fortnum and Masons in London is far more impressive
Breathtaking view from the top!!. Even though there is a considerable charge to go all the way to the top, it is worth it once one makes it to the top. The view is unbelievable awesome!!
Has to be seen. Is pretty impressive for its age. Makes a great picture and if you can try to get there for the hour.........biggest cuckoo clock you will ever see.
Worth a look....... If your in Prague, you have to go and see it........bit anti-climatic, but still worth a visit!x
A sight to see!. This clock is beautiful and very unique. You can have a cafe and watch the clock from one of the local restaurants.

Prague, Jun 12. I was thrilled to visit the Astronomical Clock waiting till noon to watch the action. I was a little disappointed that the figures of the popes just appeared at the windows next to the clock face. Maybe i was expecting to see something like Munich... Beautiful archetecture.

the famous old clock in Old Town. The old clock located in the Old Town is like a logo for the city. It features a number of time around the world. The clock show happens every hour. Attracts a crowd each hour. The clock was first installed in the early 1400s, making it the third oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still working apparently .Worth seeing.
It's a clock... Didn't get that excited by the show on the our, it was very busy as well. Going to Prague you do have to see this but I wasn't very impressed
Need that photo. Yes, you must watch your wallet in the crush of tourists looking at the clock each hour, but it is a "must see" if you want to claim you visited Prague.
A beautiful part of the city. Another wonderful spot in a beautiful city! Make sure you are there when the clock moves and the music plays...every hour on the hour until 9pm

Great experience.. The clock is stunning. The best part is you stand around listening to all the grand noises and then at the end you are waiting for the rooster to make his grand entrance but it sounds more like a dying cluck than a cock a doodle doo! Make sure to have a guide or iphone app inform you of all the symbolism. It's actually a very interesting story. Legend has it the man who made it had his eyes poked out and tongue burned off so he could never share the secret of how he made it. Don't miss seeing it.
Astronomical Clock. It's gets very busy at the top of the hour. Make sure you have plenty of battery charge for your camera.
Beautiful surroundings to have lunch. We went to the square most evenings to people watch and sit and have a drink. Lovely atmosphere.
Beautiful architecture. Well that clock!! all the hype and you expect something grand, a disappoint ment but was warned from this sites reviews!
Interesting. Learning about the famed Astronomical Clock was very interesting and enlightening -- a must-see if you're visiting Prague!

Beautiful!. Such a gorgeous monument! The physics behind the clock is complicated, so I suggest getting a guide (or some wikipedia research) to make the most of it! Make sure to go on the hour so you can see the show!

Clock Tower and the crowds. The crowds begin to gather at least 30 minutes in advance of the clock striking the hour. I'd like to say I stayed, but I did not. Being pushed and shoved in the midst of so many people, while trying not to lose my children is nerve wracking. The clock and tower are wonderful. The workmanship is impeccable. The story behind the clock and how the clock maker's eyes were plucked out so he could not create another one for another king, was sad. If you really NEED to see the clock move when it strikes the hour, there is a little outdoor cafe directly in front of the tower. Go in and have lunch, grab a table on the outside patio. Enjoy from there and don't get shoved all around while you stare up at the tower.

A bit forgettable. We stumbled into this area after going to the market and maybe because it was so packed with tourists and guides, but there wasn't much room to look at things properly. But I was excited about the hourly show... Extreme let down with a guy at the top playing a trumpet. Not sure what I was expecting, but didn't excite me at all.

read about the clock before seeing it. Music plays and figures of the apostles at the top of the clock rotate at noon each day, This is a must see tourist attraction, but it may seem a bit lame if you do not read about the clock before visiting it. See Wikipedia's discussion -- you'll be amazed at everything involved in the clock. It is truly astronomical!

Special... Also a must see when you are in Prague. The Astronomical clock is an unique piece and its special to be there to see it working and when they play the trumpet from the tower. The halls are worth a visit when you like historical rooms, paintings, statues..
Disappointing. Clock not as impressive as others we have seen .figures are only visible if you stand directly in front
Worth a look. The clock itself is great but dont bother to wait for the hourly show its not worth the bother. Take care of pick pockets around the clock at showtime !!!!!

The central meeting point!. This is the first that you must see, many tourists will be there and really worth to wait for seeing the \third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one that still working!!!!
very pretty. the clock is very unusual & well worth a visit try to get there on the hour for the saint's appearance.
beautiful. well worth a visit, is like being on a film set, its so beautiful, clean, just doesnt seem real!!!!

magical. simply a wonderful collection of medieval and historic buildings .please be careful .the taxis you phone ( AAA was the company we came to trust , dont get into an AAa taxi ) are fair priced .the taxis you find at official ranks will charge you between 40 and 100 % more .the taxis you find on the streets will charge you between 300 and 1,000 % more

the clock. you have to see this make sure you are there on the hour as the whole clock thing comes alive finish off with somthing really special I will not tell you , as you have to go your self but it is marvelous
got to see. brilliant square with cafe's and stunning clock that moves on the hour with figureens
Nice...but crowded. Most tourist attractions were crowded...mainly because of the time of day (Saturday) and nice weather
Beautiful!. The clock is just beautiful! The details are rich and impressive, and the history behind it is fascinating. Worth many photographs!
Show like no others. Every hour the astronomical clock performs a magnificent show, make sure you are there!

Fun to be in the crowds when the clock chimes. There is really nothing we disliked! I have yet to figure out all the features of the clock? A must do is to take the elevator to the top of the Old Town Hall where the panoramic view is Fantastic!

a long walk up but good views. he tower gives great views and the clock is a work of art, one of only 4 astronomical clocks in the world and i think the only working one. Goes off every hour and theres a nice little trumpet played with it. look closely for he little skeleton and moving parts

Over run by tourists. Yes there are some beautiful buildings in and around the town hall square, however I do not understand the fascination with the astronomical clock. The hype is blown out of proportion and as a result the area is swarming with tourists and over priced bars and restaurants.

Beautiful!. Both are stunning landmarks in the heart of old city. Unfortunately we did not get to see the moving statues of 12 apostles of the Astronomical Clock (we were there at 11pm and a lot of people gathered but nothing happened apart from the clock string 11). Otherwise, unique and beautiful clock, very popular with tourists.

clock. At the base of the clock to the left is the town hall were many people were getting married. the bride and groom walked around the square prior to the event. we saw many Japanese getting married there as well.
Too much hipe for a one minute show. Old town hall area is a good central square very vibrant with a lot happening. The astronomical clock is a must see. However the one minute show on the stri
Vibrant. A very vibrant & fun place. Watched couple of Euro 12 games on the big screen with lots of food & entertainment.
Clock this. A main tourist attraction for obvious reasons - the design of the clock is unique and in attractive part of the city

Number one site to see in Prague. I loved this old clock. I could not see it go off too many times. I loved it everytime. You must also go to the top of the tower to see the view. Its amazing. Don't be put off by the height. There is an elevator that takes you all the way up.
nive clock. Very original clock. It is a must for everyone to see while in Prague
Great Clock. Watching the clock do its thing on the hour is a must in Prague.
Astronomical clock. Go for midday. The crowds were not as big as we thought and you could certainly get a good view.

It's fun! Ignore the criticisms. I'll happily admit that this isn't a multimedia extravaganza but let's look at the basics - it's five minutes out of your day and it's free!If you want to go up the tower and take in the views then you can do this for a nominal charge and you can also take a lift right to the top (well, three, but none the less that's more than you get in many other towers of a similar age!) When you get to the top there's a narrow walkway round the edge where two people can squeeze past each other (just) so it can get a little claustrophobic and it does prevent wheelchair users from getting round, so they'll be confined to the room at the top.As for the display on the hour, as I put above, it's fun, it's an impressive achievement based on the age of the clock and it's an important bit of Prague

The clock is a let down, Old Town Hall is great. You stand outside staring up and then not much happens on the hour. I think I am jaded because I've seen the Munich clock which does a lot of things. The Prague clock is pretty, but 12 apostles popping by and a rooster crowing is not very exciting. That said, the view from the Old Town Hall is amazing. Definitely take the time to visit the viewing deck. They have a great elevator which is interesting for engineering buffs. The Old Town Hall also has lovely room of murals.

Worth seeing. Make sure you climb (or take the lift) to the top of the tower for a magnificent view of old Prague. Also, if you take a ghost tour you will be taken into the lower levels of this ancient building ... spooky!!
the clock is amazing. each hour the clock chimes, and a bugler performers afterwards. quite a site to see - dont miss it
Brilliant to watch!!. Stunning clock with a bit of a show on the hour!! (if like me you're too tight to pay for tour guides just hang around until one arrive and mingle at the back lol)

Highlight of the day. I honestly did not know the Astronomical Clock offered such great and free entertainment! What a sight to see all the tourists pointing their cameras at the clock to watch the show. No words will do justice to how cool it is!

Great views from the top. This is probably the best thing to do in Prague especially if you want to see the whole of prague in one place.. the tower is amazing- you can either walk up or take the lift (obviously i took the lift..lol) and once you are up there it is just brillant.. amazing sights from the top. I would definitely recommend people to go.

Um!. If you want a pamoramic view of Prague, climb up to the top of the tower of the Old Town Hall. The astronomical aspect of the clock is good providing you can understand such things. However, if you are expecting great things to happen when the clock strikes the hour then you will be dissapointed. It's almost a waste of a couple of minutes of video tape.
fantastic. Loved watching this clock on the hour so intricate and the bugle player up top was great.

View from the top!. We went up to the top of the clock tower and had a great view of the beautiful city and the square below. Good place to take photos.Down below in the square we cheered the display of the clock at the top of the hour with the others in the crowd. Everyone enjoys it!Then, we found that the sausages from the vendors in the square were fantastic! Plus there is shade near the vendors.

Clock is beautiful, performance a bit disappointing. I love the idea of the clock and it is beautiful to look at. Very detailed and distinct features. The only downer was that the actual performance of the clock when it struck on the hour was a bit underwhelming.
A must!. Brilliant! It only lasted a few minutes but was worth it!
Unique & fascinating. On the hour Death rings a bell and the clock performs- 12 apostles go past windows of the clock. Useful to read about clock components before visit.

Too many tourist. Nice place with too many tourist all round the clock. Went both day & night as we want to capture both day & night scene. But to our dismay it is always crowded with people. Its ok to have people but when there's too many, it feels too commercialize. To me, its not so enjoyable. The restaurants there are chill but the price where almost double to that away from the tourist spot like here.

You gotta see this chime. Read about the astronomical clock before you go, so you can attempt to understand all the strange wheels and numbers. It is worth being here on the hour to see all the machinery. Skeletons bang gongs, a chicken cackles, priests circle round, and we saw more each time we witnessed it. Be prepared to be packed like a sardine. The square would be nearly empty, then 10 minutes before the hour dozens of tour groups following the raised umbrella of their guide would pour in front of the clock. Thousands it seemed. After the last chime, a trumpeter plays final notes from the tower.
Nice Area. My sister and I really liked this area. Great place to stay, shop or eat a meal. We were able to hear the trumpet play on the hour.

If in Prague, part of what to see.... The astronomical clock is really quite an interesting site & the old town square is very picturesque as well. The hot dogs & fried sliced potatoes in the square are not to be beat...so venture at lunch or snack time! (or at least these things were in the square when we were there before Easter...it may not be a regular thing) Our favorite in Prague were their traditional Trodlos...just typing the word makes my mouth water!

So small to be so popular. The clock is much smaller than people expect, but it is fun to wait and watch the skeleton ring his bell, the Apostles coming through, the cock crowing, and the bugler announcing the hour.
A skeleton ringing the bell?. A delight to all who have gathered on the hour to watch the skeleton ring the bell. If you watch closely, you can see all kinds of eerie things going on

The stars align at the Old Town Hall!. The Old Town Hall is several centries old, and has a magnificent astronomical clock along one side. On the hour, figures come out for a very brief period before retreating back inside the clock. There were lots of tourists around the clock at all hours of day and night, and lots of entrepeneurial Czechs selling wares in front of the Old Town Hall. A bit too commercial for my taste.
Yeah, it's pretty cool.. After 5 times to Prague, I still enjoy seeing this go off on the hour.
So busy. Wonderful to see, but the crowds. We visited late at night. It was still crowded, but there was a chance to look at the buildings rather than fight the crowds.
personal favourite.. If you time it well (on the hour) look to the top of the astronomical clock. Although its crowded its certainly something to see.
Tick tock!. No trip to Prague is complete without joining the crowds that gather for the hourly display of the clock characters parade and the trumpeter that accompanies it.
Well worth a visit. This is well worth a visit. The clock is beautiful and one of a kind.
How did they do that centuries ago. This is truly a must see. The clock is fascinating and a marvel of design.
Nice to see. Could not appreciate the clock as much as I'd have liked to. The square is so loud, crowded and commercialized it was somewhat disappointing.
A REAL TASTE OF PRAGUE. Do you want to see what Prague is about? Go to this place. End of story.
Tourist magnet. The clock display is over-rated but it's still worth a viewing, because it must be done. A trip to the top of the tower was worth the fee for the views.

Vibrant. We were in time for the 5PM music - but later i heard, it happens every one hour. Hundreds of tourists had gathered around. There were musicians playing the center square. the square was full of energy and buzzed vibrancy! Sit down in one of the cafe's and enjoy the evening.

Get there for 'On the hour'. The clock is in the Old Town Square and is very easily identified by the fact there are hoards of people standing looking up at a clock tower before the top of the hour. When the clock strikes the hour a series of faces move around the window above the astronomical clock.

Go to the top!. The view from the top of the Astronomical Clock tower has to be one of the best in Prague. You can walk all the way around the top of the tower, so you get a 360-degree view of the city and you can get some great pictures. If you time your visit near the top of the hour, make sure to stay out of the way of the trumpeter. You're going to be at Old Town Square at some point on your visit, so plan an extra 30 minutes and make the trip to the top of the tower while you're there.
Orloj. Another of the must-see parts of Prague. Every hour on the hour you'll see the throngs just waiting for the clock to show its magic.

If you are there... watch it.. The clock, on the hour, has a 20 or 30 second "show" that is worth watching with the rest of the throngs if you happen to be near it during the top of the hour. I would not make a special effort to see it, although it is a marvel and the story behind it is interesting, the event itself would not be worth a special trip.Sitting in one of the restaurants having a cold refreshment spanning the top of the hour would be a good way to enjoy the spectacle.
Xmas Market. We went at xmas and the market and clock looked fantastic - although discussing when you think the man who designed it had his eyes taken out so he couldn't design another clock!
Very Special. Make sure to go up the tower and be at the top just before the hour to hear the trumpet playerwhat a great view. well worth it.

Beautiful timepiece in a beautiful city. Before we reached the old town hall we had seen numerous photographs in the guide books, but attractive though they are they do not do this ancient structure justice. The clock is a riot of colour, and although the symbols are generally recognisable, they did not facilitate the telling of the time! But who cares, it was just gorgeous. The Old Town Hall is a typical medieval tall building with a tower on top, and a walkway for the public around it. The interaction of the trumpeter and the crowd up in the tower, caused much laughter amongst the crown in the street below as the trumpeter had difficulty finding a spot to sound the trumpet, at our 2pm sighting. He then had to go round to the next side of the tower, and repeat the process! He is colourfully dressed and well worth seeing. best to see him on a dry day, though, as your heads are tilted upwards for a few minutes.

Medieval astonomical clock shows the medieval perception of the Universe. This clock is third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and is still working. It is first installed in 1410. It is one of most visited sights in Old Town Square. The clock tower is decorated with exquisit coats of arms and different royal symbols. In announces every hour with 12 apostles passing by the window above the astronomical dial. The wooden figures of apostles with their attributes appeas in the window every hour with some of the sculputure begin to move. Astronomical clock consists of two parts; one is Astronomical Dial and another is Calendar Dial

Great fun to see the clock in action. The astronomical clock was a spectacle to see. In hearing about it ahead of time, I thought: Yes, whatever, so it chimes and something comes out and goes back in. Haven’t I seen that just once or twice before? We bought The New Guide to Prague from a street vendor only to find out from our guide the next day that it was a ten-year old edition. Not to worry, the mechanisms of the clock have not changed since 1410 when it was built. Yes, you read that year correctly. It was astounding. A death skeleton pulls a cord, making the clock chime, he turns an hour-glass slowly over and over to signal the passing of another hour of our lives. He’s in company with vanity, greed and gluttony of pleasure. Several of the disciples traipse across two open windows above the clock and above them still, at the height of the tower, a trumpeter outfitted in A Knight’s Tale fashion tops off the hour with a tune. Everyone applauds and in that moment we are all united as people enjoying a show always are—together in time for thirty seconds.

On the Hour. At noon statues of the twelve apostles appear followed by a trumpet fanfare from the top of the old town hall. Just remember to keep an eye on any valuables as pickpockets are known in the area, but the police have a van close by
Gorgeous. Lovely to see, go on the hour and you will see..and hear the trumpeter!
Everyday. I walked past the clock tower every day and always stopped to see the show and here the trumpeter

Be sure to see Municipal House!. If you like music, Art Nouveau & Alfonso Mucha, you will love this building. Be sure to take a behind the scenes guided tour which is well worth the time & cost. We also attended a lovely chamber concert in Smetana Hall which was quite a treat. We enjoyed a delicious lunch in one of the building's 3 fine restaurants & drinks in the American Bar.

Clock on!. Loved all the beautifully painted buildings in this area! The clock tself is quite charming when it rings on the hour and the skeleton pulls he bell cord. The trumpeter was kind of funny... dressed in medievil gear but with a pair of raybans on! Hang around long enough and you will overhear a tour guide in your language give some interesting facts.

Totally overated. Totally a massive let down, and causes lots of congestion, does'nt really do anything, I respect the architecture, even love it, and the history weeps tears, but why do people stand there for 59 minutes is a mystery!!!

Stunning area!. This part of town is absolutely gorgeous, the Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock are truly amazing - there are many shops, restaurants and PEOPLE in this area, so be prepared to navigate through the tour groups (if you're not part of them!)! It's a great part of town to start a wandering adventure through the back side streets of Prague!

festive atmosphere. i enjoy the sights of the many old structures , the people , and of course the clock itself , specially when it does its hourly ritual . . i enjoy the sounds of different musical bands within the vicinity .. there are many shops available , and the indoor/ outdoor restaurants
Beautiful. learned so much about the history of the clock, bought pics and books to remember it all. A must see for everyone. Beautiful site .

You have to do this. People gather 5-10 min before the hour to watch the movement at the top of the hour. It is on a beautiful church, and is itself beautiful. On the hour, a skeleton pulls a string that causes the Apostles to circle around in the windows above and take a look at the crowd watching. The food vendors near the clock deserve a look to there are all kinds of amazing things cooking nearby.

Way to crowded.... Yep, its a clock and its pretty interesting to look-at. Don't expect to be able to see the action if you grab a table for lunch during peak times.... best to walk in just before the top of the hour....
Get there early and stand directly in front.. This is very crowded and you cannot see anything from the side.
combination of many things. combination of many things. Great place to see the history of the Prague. Avoid eating there. Tourist trap

Kind of a let down. I had previously seen the clock in Munich and was expecting something similar. The rooster in the clock came out and crowed a few times and then went back inside the clock. The astronomical clock is interesting to look at and it is an engineering feat, but it is not worth waiting around for the hour for the clock to crow. Everyone in the crowd looked at each other and said, "Is that it?"
Clock is great - view is better. Don't miss going up in the tower just above the clock. The views of Prague are terrific even if the narrow passage is crowded.
amazing. Because of the crowd it was not possible to go up the tower but we took excellent pictures.
one of the best things I have seen in Europe!. I took a tour inside the clock. don´t miss it! the gost tour is really good and scary!
Clock watching. A very interesting clock, best to stand in front on the hour to get the best show, watch out for the skeleton on the right! Pop into Starbucks afterwards..great baristas, so friendly
be there at noon. for the bell ringing and trumpet blowing.It just ads to the mystique of prague

quite disappointing. We gathered round the astronomical clock with the other hundreds of tourists awaiting for the clock to strike on the hour to see what this famous clock was going to do.........the bell chimed and then a skeleton rings a little tiny bell for a few seconds and thats it! Some one blows a trumpet at the top of the tower for a bit of extra excitement and its all over! I know its really old and i appreciate that its been going for hundreds of years but theres alot of better ways to spend your time in Prague.

Quaint square with beautiful architecture. Enoyed a beer on the roof top terrace of the Hotel U Prince, available via the hotel lift. Open to every one, has fantastic panoramic views of the historic centre, including Prague Castle and St Vitus Cathedral.
a good clock. some information about the clock would have been a good addition to this. Worth a look if you are passing by.

Crowd pleaser right off the main square. You will be able to find the clock by looking for the crowd that gathers before the top of the hour. Good thing the clock is up high so even someone short, like me, can see the action. Watch the skeleton on the right-he kicks things off by ringing the bell. The apostles parade out the two doors up top. Then look up to the top of the tower to see and hear the trumpeter. He will wave when he's done! Better yet, climb the tower your second trip to the clock just before the hour and stand next to the trumpeter to wave to the crowd with him.
Tick Tock. Amazing time piece and worth a photograph. It would have been good to have some interpretation nearby.

Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock (Staromestska Radnice). Underwhelming. We had a coffee at a cafe just opposite the clock and waited with baited breath for the show to start. It was okay, a little corny but at least I can say I've seen it. Typical of anywhere though, the coffee at this cafe cost about $10 Australian, whereas coffees elsewhere in Prague less touristy cost about $1-$2 Australian. It soured the experience somewhat.
do not miss to see it. try to visit just before the time change to a full hour - very interesting
Don't miss the chiming of the Hour. The clock is unlike any I have ever seen and since it is not too high easy to see and photograph.
One to see. The astronomical clock draws crowds every hour and its worth a look. Make sure you time it so you arrive when its about to chime.

If I could like this past five stars, I would. This clock is just too cool for words. It's just fantastic. I don't remotely care how one looks like a tourist gaping at this thing, it's well worth the slack jawed stares. Just DO be careful about pick pockets, make sure you've got your street smarts about you. You'll make a good target if you're staring upwards and not paying attention. But do go and watch the figures that come out when the hour strikes. It's delightful. I've never gone inside for the views of the surrounding square. I usually just sit here and watch the clock and enjoy the vibe of the area.

Stop by on the hour to see the clock and trumpeter in action!. We got to the clock just before 12 noon and a crowd had already gathered. A skeleton rings a bell while the 12 Apostles file past the windows. After this, a trumpeter played a fanfare from the tower - hilarious! Great fun.
Fun. This is a neat clock demonstration and the place is always crowded. Do this if in Prague
Worth a stop. This is definitely worth a stop - you can explore the town hall and also climb to the top of the tower for panoramic views of the city.
Loved the history. Very interesting although still couldn't work it out or tell the time from it!! Beware pickpockets at the busiest times i.e on the hour when the clock chimes.
Closed. Last time I was in Prgaue I coud not visit the Library (Clementinum). It is now re-opened, but unfortunately the Astronomical Clock is still under reconstruction.

Felt like a child again!. The clock is so beautiful and it is good be here on the hour when the figures come to life as the clock strikes. It is something to see and enjoy and to watch the crowd is certainly also a bonus. We also enjoyed the sounds of the trumpeter on the hour.
All for the clock. the crowds are really busy in the morning and get less as they go on through the day

Old Town Prague. The center of Prague is its Old Town square and it's most popular attraction is the Astronomical Clock. The clock itself is very cool and a vist to the top of the clock tower is recommended. Every hour there is a short show of sorts when the clock chimes and the apostles parade through a window. It's similar to the ball dropping in Times Square in that envy one gathers around the clock at the top of the hour. As long as your expectations are kept in check, it's worth a visit.

Really interesting. The clock is well worth looking at , especially on the hour whenn all the figures come to life. The climb to the top of the tower is a bit hard going but the view is worth it.
The town hall was interesting

Top Notch Tourist Attraction. Be sure to place yourself in a bar at the base of the clock so that when the hour strikes you are in a position to enjoy it all! We were lucky enough to be in Prague for 3 days and witness the clock chiming on more than one occasion. Our final evening we planted ourselves under the clock, in a bar and were fairly successful in watching and photographing the show.

What is the fuss about??. Yes nice venue, but ...... the when the hour comes the tiny figures come out the trumpet player plays and everybody claps - is this really the top attraction????? I think not!!

Charming, inventive and OMG the crowds!!. The Astronomical clock is a beautiful, complicated timepiece, and the mechanical show on the hour is a must-see. Best to grab a seat at one of the sidewalk cafe's at least 45 minutes prior. TIP: It's wall to wall onlookers all day, so take care with your belongings. The show, though brief, is mesmerizing and it's easy to "lose" a purse, backpack or wallet.

Way disappointing. Not much of a show at the Astronomical Clock. And after a few days of hearing the trumpeter every hour, it actually got downright annoying. If you hate crowds, avoid the area for at least 20 minutes before each hour!
Take a few shots here ;). and also dont forget to visit the upstairs! the view of city is unforgettable.

First stop in Prague. We saw the Astronomical clock and town hall as part of a tour. Our guide provided such a rich layer of history to what we saw. Old Town Hall area & the clock can get very crowded as many tours begin there.
Impressive, but hectic. Definately worth seeing, but go early, especially if you have small kids or want a good picture. Starting around 9 am the crowds come in and gets to be a nightmare.

fantastic. didn't cost much, great view from the top. From the top you will see a roof top terrace bar across the road from the clock which was fantastic. I think it belongs to the prince hotel, just go into the hotel lift which takes you to the top floor. A must. We also climbed the tower at Charles bridge and the castle. Great fun.

1/10 for attraction rating !. On our first day, we got caught up in the crowd waiting for the clock show....... what a waste of 10 minutes of my life waiting ! The crowds were immense so we were anticipating something great ....... thoroughly disappointing and couldn't understand the whoops and clapping coming from fellow onlookers. Considering it's one of Prague's most popular draws in the city, I was expecting more of a sight than the two doors opening to reveal some statues on a rotating platform (which represent the Apostles).As the last chime fades, a trumpeter in the tower, wearing a yellow-and-red uniform, plays a short tune to the crowd below, waving to them after his performance. He plays on each side of the tower and is applauded each time....... I think once would have been enough !

Astronomical Clock Prague. The Orloj, or the astronomical clock, situated in the old town square is worth a visit. Large crowds gather every hour to hear the chimes and see the 12 apostles march through the trap door. It is an imposing clock - one of the oldest and most elaborate astronomical clocks ever built . It's history can be traced from 1410 when first constructed. The clock faced a great number of breakdowns over the centuries. In 1490 a craftsman named Hanus Carolinum worked on the clock. Legend has it that fear of him replicating it, led to him being blinded! He is said to have thrown himself into the mechanism to destroy his work. It was repaired periodically through history in 1787 by watchmaker Jan Landesberg, In 1805, and in 1860 went through major renovation. It was seriously damaged in 1945 during the war and then it was only on 1st July 1948 that the bells were chiming again. I truly enjoyed the music it made...and would recommend a visit - if only for the history in which it is steeped!

Was that it????. A beautiful piece of machinery, but believe me nothing to write home about. The hourly "show" was as big a letdown as the size of the crowds that watched it. I videoed it to show the folks back home, but minutes afterwards I deleted it as it would have been just too embarrassing to show it. Nice as a picture only.
Nice!. I liked the architecture, the idea that it is hundreds of years old. Nice for photoshoots

Worth the money to go to the top. We headed up the tower of the town hall around 11am on a clear day. Despite the crowds, we got stunning views of Prague and took heaps of photos. The astronomical clock wasn't as exciting as I thought it would be, but the masses gathered beneath it nonetheless!
Perfect view!. There is a lift:) And the views - really perfect! Higher only fron TV Tower!

More than just a clock. An amazing and entertaining clock The oldest part, the mechanical clock and astronomical dial, dates back to the 1400's with moving figues being added later. Make sure you are there at the striking of the hour. A must if you visit Prague.
Festive atmosphere. Very pretty section to stroll around. Had a cup of coffee waiting for the clock to strike 12. Not a big deal, but the touristy thing to do.

Quirky. The area around the clock gets quite busy on the hour as people gather to see the clock strike. I would recommend going in the morning when it is a little quieter. A quirky little show of puppets is cute, and I loved the skeleton pulling the bell! There was also a live trumpet fanfare on the hour from the turret which was pleasant - I'm not sure if this happens all year round or just around Easter.
Fun to watch. The old town square is the place to be for dining, conversation, etc. the clock is fun to watch. I believe it stops it's performance at 9pm so make sure you see it before 9.
Amazing technology. The clock (Orloi) is amazing, wben you think of an almost 300 year old device. Watch the show, wait for the herald with his trumpet at the end.

Cute disney like clock!. VERY cute clock, and on every hour before it gets too dark, little figures run passed in the clock. Beware of the MASSIVE crowd that comes around about 20 minutes to the hour... You may get stampeded and keep an eye out for pickpocketers
old town clock. worth the wait to see it a couple of times as you'll miss things on the clock the first time you see it, very intricate workmanship.

Be sure to be there at the top of the hour. this clock is hundreds of years old and an amazing piece of art and mechanics. It is still fully functional. Read up on it before you go to really appreciate what is happening.
Nice to see. Although it is one of the musts in Prague, the crowd around the astronomical clock does not allow to enjoy it. Still it is nice
Kepler would be proud. Really intricate clock, very cool looking (half the fun is trying to read it).. worth a ten minute wait at the top of every hour- once.

Must see the Clock. Prague itself is a most beautiful city cram packed with places of interest and all those wonderful historical buildings. A visit to the Charles bridge is a must along with the astronomical clock, make sure you get there early before it strikes the hour as it does attract a lot of attention. if you like classical music most of the serious old composers music is played in the various buildings in the city.
So busy, but good.. The area around the clock was packed unless you go early, before 10am. Lovely area to stand in although trying to get through the crowds can be quite difficult.
Cool. We enjoyed this beautiful architecture and it was convenient to cafes.
View by day AND night. Remember...the outstanding thing about this clock is its age and how technically advanced it was for its time! You're not in Disney World but a medieval city.
worth it!!. Really worth going up the tower, some of the best views ever!

A must see - can not miss if you are in Prague. The Astronomical clock in old town Prague is the oldest such clock in the world, built back in the fifteenth century and has functioned on and off through the centuries, today it is functional and has been so for quite a few years. Appearance-wise, it is a masterpiece and in such a a beautiful, restored condition. One can look at it for hours, studying all the details, statues, drawings, colors, and definitely in trying to understand the mechanics and how it functions. Also at the hour the Clock chimes and a procession of the statues comes in and out of the windows, as well as a skeleton statue that rings the bell.Once there the visitor should definitely go up the clock tower, it is quite a hike on a narrow stairscase, but the 360 degree views of the whole city is worth climbing every step. If you are into photography, the views will offer some great pictures. I climbed up in the afternoon and the place was packed, so give yourself about 30-60 minutes if you plan to take some good pictures and to take in the views. Now I wonder how it might have looked at night...There is no fee to see the clock, but there is a small one to go up the tower.The clock is situated at the opening of Prague's town center, so once done with this attraction one can explore the rest of the beauty that old town has to offer.
Astronomical Clock. It's a lovely place and interesting such an old clock working perfectly fine
Worth a look. Clock looks very impressive. Didn't hang around to see "the hour" as weather was exceptionally hot.
Iconic Prague. It's a must, even if you miss the clock striking !Expensive to eat around and about

Whatch out for the pick pockets!. a criminal part that flourishes in Prague - but probably less than Barcelona and Venice - the clock tower show, once an hour is a popular place to search through the purses of tourist staring at the clock.

Be sure to climb to the top. Very neat, it gets crowded on the hour for obvious reasons, if you go early in the morning there will be less tourists around. Definitely buy the ticket to climb (or take the elevator) to the top. The views are great!
must see. this is a must see if you're in Prague :) it's pretty interesting and you get the trumpet guy playing a song from the top of the clock every hour so it's quite fun ^^
Repeat performance. We were in Prague for three weeks and I think we visited the clock every day.
Again, good people watching. The clock is pretty cool, even if it is funny to see a thousand people staring at a wall for 5 minutes, waiting for something mysterious to happen...

So much culture, but go when the tourists are sleeping. The clock and Old Town are wonderful to see, but get PACKED with tourists during the day. Be sure to make your experience a positive one by getting up early and seeing it around 7am at the latest...and hit up Charles Bridge around the same time. You can go back later in the day and see the chaos that you missed in the morning.
part of the Square. Cant see the square without seeing this gets busy on the hour when the clock moves and the trumpeter blows.
turist atraction. unique clock and every hour make tourist happy with small figures on the windows who tell you a small history abot the clock

hundreds wait for the hour beat. How can one dislike anything about this Monument and just sit in one of the cafes and enjoy watching the Clock
inspite of the hundreds who stand there

Really beautiful - be sure to get there on the o'clock!. We discovered this on our first day and ondered where there were crowds of people literally standing across the street - we soon found out at 1pm! Really sweet little show - watch out for the skeleton of death and three of the seven sins!
Don't Miss the Hornblowers. Beautifully preserve clock tower that has live hornblowers at 2000hr. Very entertaining and worth the time to stop and see.
Clock. Whilst famous, the hourly performance was rather pathetic

Coolest site in Prague. Just awesome. Read up on this clock before you go to see it. It is not only visually appealing, it has amazing legends and history behind it. The old town hall is also great. I would pay to go to the top of the tower, it's the best view of old town that I could find.
A must of Prague visit. Worth to go there especially just before the whole hour when the Astronomical Clock play its performance.
Simply entertaining. The clock is worth watching. Fun and simple, it has an amazing history. It drew a good crowd every hour and always ends with round of applause.
Tick-tock clock. Watch it on the hour. No visit to Prague can be complete without standing once with the clock gazers on the hour every hour.

Like being in India. Prague reminds me a lot of India...Crowded streets, lots of people wandering aimlessly, and tourists being bled dry at every corner.Yes, its a very nice clock, that has a lot of history. But when you add hundreds of people all trying to cram together to watch it chime, it becomes less of an attraction in my book...The streets around the clock are all just bleeding tourists of their cash, as their is nothing to do.I probably sound bitter about Prague, but trust me, once you see that the tourist attractions are paying $30 for some ham, and $8 for a beer whilst dodging pickpockets as you amble around wondering what it is you are there for....It will happen to you too....
Wonderful old clock. Make sure you see this clock on the hour. It is very crowded so watch your bag.
Clock. My fiance' really wanted to see the Astronomical Clock, and it was worth working our way through the crowd.
Watch out. Watch out in more ways than 1. The clock is spectacular but watch your pockets and bags... Pickpockets can be spectacular too.

The jewel in the crown of Europe. Prague is beautiful - whether you have been there or not you will have heard of just how stunning the city is. But you can't really say you've seen Prague if you haven't stopped and mused upon the Astronomical Clock at the Old Town Hall.This, along with St.Vitus' Cathedral, are my two favourite beauty spots in this magical city of 100 spires and tens of thousands of breathtaking sights and sounds. I LOVE PRAGUE and I recommend you get yourself there sometime very soon. You will be enchanted, bewitched, totally taken in under the spell of it's unequalled charms.Just be prepared for some very COLD weather if you dare to brave it in early springtime - anytime from May to September is perfect !

Prague horologue. This was the highlight of my visit. i watched the clock welcome the hour four times in three days, Highly recommend climbing the tower and buying the booklet guide so you can understand what you are seeing. It really is a medevial masterpiece,both of science and beauty
Make sure to visit at night. It is very beautiful piece of Art.Make sure to see it at night since it gives you different feel.
the most famous attraction. Its too crowdy but its worth to see and hear the clock and to climb the tower and view the city from it.

Clock with crowded square.:-). This place is almost every hour crowded.:-)It is better to go there max 10 minutes before and you can still find yourself good position to look.I you are there sooner, like 13:30, for example, dont wait and go explore the side streets.Yes, the place is crowded, but not so much, most people go there 5 minutes before.Also watch for pickpockets and weird looking guys, they probably want to steal something from you. Or they want to sell some worthless stuff to you, even they say it is rare or original. Do not trust and watch out.Anyway, it is nice place to stay for a while and relax. One of the best sights in Prague.
A must in Prague. A very busy/crowded square with many sidewalk restaurants.Pedestrains only, and a short walk to everything
Coolest Clock. Every hour on the hour, the clock chimes, the figures move, and the horn blower plays, This is definitely worth seeing.

Old Town Square. Old Town Square is a fun location. The astronomical clock is interesting and draws quite a crowd. Be sure and see and hear it's chime and trumpet! We stayed at the Old Town Square Hotel. It was excellent - very elegant and perfect location.
Nice show. Near of the Stare Mesto Namesti, it is a piece of fine engineering and art work. Wait to the full hours to assist to the bells and the Apostles walk.
astronomical clock. it's amazing to see hundreds of tourists stand in front of the clock every hour with their heads up waiting to watch the show which lasts for less then a minute

Try to spend some relaxed time around this neighbourhood. Learn about the clock and the buildings before you go. Try to walk around the small streets that surronds the Old Town Hall, there are some hidden treasures that smell history. The eateries in the square are truly special and I would prefer to have my food and beer and continue to walk around if it is lunch time. If not then choose a front table from a cafe that is facing the busy square and enjoy the moment. I was there for half a day but I still wish I had more time and surely will do it longer on my next visit. This place is really the taste and smell and view of the historic Prague and a big must !
Giant Clock. I like it when it struck 12pm. It's like a lot of tourists went to check out what will happen on the time. We waited and waited... finally a guy from the rooftop horn his trumpet....

Strike the Hour with Trumpet Chorus. A very picturesque tower of old, wait for the hourly striking of the chimes, see the blue doors open, whats behind? Very colourful, and the trumpet player at the top of the tower plays a good tune on all four sides

A Journey back in Time. Ancient Buildings and magnificent churches, one of the most beautiful historical sights in Europe.Romanesque, Gothic, Baroque all buildings standing with pride in this beautiful square.Walk or take the elevator to the top of the astronomical clock, the view is stunning or sit back and soak up the atmosphere over a cool beer in one of the square's restaurants.

Have a beer and watch the world go by...... This is a great place to buy a beer and people watch. The clock is amazing and the market is also worth a look around - Be aware if you ask for a piece of the roast ham you can buy directly off the spit it will not be cheap! Around 300 crowns!!

astronomical clock. Must go up to the top of the clock tower, and should be there on the hour, then go back down and be sure to watch the clock on the hour. Try the fried cheese! Great place. Loved it!

More gastronomical then astronomical.. The square that houses the famous Astronomical Clock is always busy, packed for the hourly mechanical display of marching Apostles and full of eateries of every imaginable quality. To be honest, the clock is no big deal. A lone trumpeter blows a few notes on the hourly striking to add a touch of drama. He'd need to plummet to the ground to make much of an impact. But go and see it and the Square anyway. Everybody does!
Usual tourist location. Full of people staring up. But it is pretty. And great location.
Worth a few minutes. The Astronomical Clock at Old Town Hall was quite the tourist draw. I would have been disappointed if I hadn't been in the right place at the right time.
Astronomical Clock. See my review of Stare Mesto (Old Town). Be there for the active figures on the hour and keep a lookout for activity at the top of the tower!
Beautiful building. As it was freezing cold and we had been walking outside for some time, we only spent a short time here, took some photos and went into a restaurant for food and drink to warm up!
clock. Magical feel about it. Full of history - like stepping back in tim.

Something everyone does in Prague. Is to wait for the Astronomical clock to chime the hour. The animation is something to behold and it is a truly Gothic experience that matches well to this Gothic square. It does get crowded but you can find a restaurant up one level in the area to provide an unobstructed view. Bring binoculars to observe the detail.

The main attraction in the square. The main attraction in the square, be there 5 min before the hour, watch the giant coo coo clock. We also saw a couple of bride and grooms there coming out of town hall.

Highly enjoyable. The clock on it's own is worth travelling to but the magic happens on the hour when the crowd gathers round to watch the astronomical clock in action. Don't skip this during your visit to Prague.
great views. A good idea on your first day is to climb to the top of the tower to get your bearings. No steps, just a slope, or you can take the lift.The clock is beautiful.
Worth a look. Oldest astronomical clock still working in the world. Just a easy stop as you walk by. Nothing elaborate but no reason to miss it either.

Trumpet fun. During the day this watch has many viewers and the best is when the hour mark. There are figures in motion, a parade with the 12 apostles and then a guy dressed in costume of the seventeenth century plays the trumpet from the top of the tower.
Be there on the hour!. Great to see the workings of the clock. Impressive tower and spires. Gets very crowded but worth it
Worth the wait. Hang around for the hour and the clock to chime. Big event, every hour!
Sweet Clock. Clock was really a thing to look at. The event on the hour was worth the wait, as long as its not more than 15 minutes.

Been here, done that. I went there and I waited for it to start.
- It didn't caught my attention first time.

Be prepared to get squished!. We walked past this during the night, which was way more calm and serene. Then we managed to do that around 4 PM. A bit surprised to see a crowd gathering near the clock, we stood there too, waiting for something to happen. It's quite amusing to see the clock doing its work and little figures pop out and at the end, a guy will play a trumpet from the top of the tower. It's quite fast to end, but do mind your bags. Since everyone is trying to get a good spot, getting an elbow here and there is possible. Pickpockets too.
Nice for people watching. You will watch the clock once only but the square around the clock is great for people watching.
Prague Old Town Highlight and its really great!. Prague Old Town Highlight and its really great!, not only on the day time but also in the evening !
Mouse in the clock. I felt like the mouse running up the clock. It is fun to watch from the outside, but also fun to view from the inside. and the views from the clock are really nice.

Great view from the top!. We went up to the top of Astronomical Clock and there are such beautiful views of Prague and all of its red roofs from here-definitely one of my favorite things that we did in Prague! Old Town Square is a great place to grab lunch or dinner or a snack from a street vendor. We spent a lot of time in this area even if just passing through.

Small square but great clock. The town square seemed small on the clock side so be prepared for a crowd to watch the show, the square opens up to a larger space, we enjoyed the Easter market booths and treats

Clockwork cool. The crowd around the astronomical clock at the top of the hour is huge, so watch your pockets. However this is something you'll want to see in Prague. At the top of every hour, the clock does something that is best seen rather than described. And then a trumpeter at the top of the tower plays a little tune. And the crowds below clap and cheer. It's very cool to think about how amazing this clock must've been to people hundreds of years ago. It was probably like what you thought the first time you saw an iPhone. If you take one of the free walking tours, which I would recommend, the tour guide will tell you all about the symbols surrounding the clock. It's a pretty interesting story.

Make sure to get a good view of the clock. On the hour, every hour the astronomical clock puts on a show. Crowds gather every hour for performance but make sure you stand front and middle to get a full view of the apostles and various other figures. The first time we saw this we were to the side and we missed seeing the apostles moving. It's worth getting there a few minutes early to get a good place.

Intrigueing clock and wonderful views of Old Town. After viewing the hourly chime and display, it is well worth a visit inside to the top for a wonderful view and to see the Apostles figures rotate from the rear.
Got to go. You have got to see this for yourself - weekends are obviously busier than week days but be prepared for crowds at any time
Clock peformance. Great to see the clock performance on the hour and was made even more special by the fabulous Easter decorations and market that surrounded it.
Good to chill. Great place to chill in one of the restaurants either to have a meal, a snack or a sundae and glass of wine whilst watching the 12 apostles appear every hour.
old town and astronomical clock. the places round there where way too expencive and poor service and the clock on the our got EXTREMLY overcrouded and perfect for pickpockets.
Clock. The clock is good, but a bit over-rated in the guidebooks. I recommend seeing it, but it's not as impressive as Munich.

What an entertainment value!. Every hour on the hour, the clock chimes, various statues move and appear/disappear and just when you think all the hoopla is over, a trumpeter (live) comes out on the tour and provides a live fanfare. And, the crowd goes wild!

One visit to the clock is all you'll need. The Astronomical clock is on everyone's list of things to see. It's a neat clock and fun to watch when it goes off. You probably won't need to see it again though! The square itself is beautiful and there are many shops, cafes and bars where you can spend your time (and money- these places are NOT cheap by Prague standards).

Go to the top. I'm glad we stood and watched the Astronomical Clock but I wouldn't describe it as a life changing experience. It is worth going to the top of the Old Town Hall Tower to get great views of the city.
Its really just a clock. Its nice to look at, while walking to something else. Way too crowded. I wouldn't bother waiting around for the hourly show.

LOTS OF HAPPY PEOPLE. The atmosphere; wonderful guide who told us all about the clock, and we found ourselves constantly going back to find the bits we had missed, as it is quick to take it all in. First time I missed the skeleton ringing the bell; it is knowing where to look. Loads of people but that adds to the atmosphere and the cheering is so lovely to hear in the day and age from such a cosmopolitan crowd who although they don't speak the same language, can appreciate the simpler pleasures of life, so live the moment; you won't regret it.
View from our room. We loved looking at the crowds gather to watch the clock each hour. The old town square is one of the most livel places in Prague, you'd never be lsot for something to look at.
Good fun place. Lots going on and food to try from the stalls? Clock worth a look.

Little show every hour. You shouldnt miss little show starting every hour during day-time. TIP - The hotel Princ offers roof top restaurant with magnificant view on the Astronomical Clock. Restaurant is not easy to find. Go through the hall, take a lift to the top floor and than use stairs for anhoter floor. It worhts the efford

Heritage at it's best. The clock and the tower is an amazing sight, the clock itself is a truly magnificent piece of art. The hourly 'show' of the figures on the clock is entertaining and the trumpeteer at the top of the tower is memorable. We paid to go up to the top of the the tower and from there the views of Old town square is amazing.
Interesting but far too crowded. Stumbled upon the astronomical clock just before show time. The place was crowded beyond belief, Clock was interesting but nothing special in my opinion

So interesting and fun. Be sure to time it properly at the top of the hour so you can see this clock in full swing. Lots of great places nearby to grab a drink or snack and enjoy this sight. We love to see it a night, crowd is less and much more pleasant environment.

You HAVE to see the clock!. Hundreds of people gathered to see the clock strike the hour and to see what happened then! It was fun and exciting and the crowd cheered and clapped like crazy people! The Old Town Hall is a beautiful building to view.
great clock. watch your bags! in order to see and appreciate the whole event at 12 noon stand directly in front of the clock - to the side and you will miss the best bits.

Get into the spirit!. I've heard people say "what's the big deal" about the Astronomical Clock. I reckon it's great fun, beautiful views from up the top, bustling excitement at the bottom. Just get in the spirit!
The heart of Prague. You just cannot go to Prague and not see this fantastic clock and the square with all the marker stalls.
Amazing!. The Astronomical Clock was amazing to see. A must see when visiting the city
Right by our hotel. The clock is amazing - the square gets very busy so keep things close but good atmosphere

amazing. the astronomical clock is as amazing as it is beautiful. At the top of each hr you can observe the clock chime, the apostles? pass by followed by the 'golden' crow 'crowing' and a bugle player to announce the hr. Please do not miss going to the top of the tower.The view is breathtaking!
A must see. Take the time to be there when it goes off. Easy walk from anywhere in the city.
Unique. It's a pleasure to be at a historical site and witness such an eventful site

Spectacular. The Clock is really exceptional, but that you can see already from all the pictures posted. If you plan a trip to Prague, don't miss the Old Town, where you can enjoy all this wonderful places. My only advise is do not go in August. It is too crowded.

Don't get your expectations too high. It's an amazing clock, I really like the design and considering how old it is, it still really works. It'll take some expertise to actually read the astrological part, but if you need a simple real-time clock, just glance overhead for a normal one.People gather around whenever there's a time change from 9:00 to 21:00 but I hate to break it to you that it's not über awesome. There's some pseudo-cuckoo clock action going on and some trumpets playing. Of course, see it at least once. During the time I was in Prague in the same area, it gets tiring seeing it so many times. It's also pleasant to take pictures when it's in-between hours so there's not so much crowd.The Old town Hall Tower, even though you have to pay (4.25 euro), gives a good view of the whole vicinity. There's an elevator but you can take the stairs, too, for the some mini exhibition/gallery on the way up.

Beautiful clock, beautiful view!. I love the clock, it's so elaborate, ornate, and beautiful. Also the view from the top of the tower is not to be missed! I took one of my favourite pictures of Prague there, looking over all the red roofs and the castle etc!
Extraordinary. The clock was really amazing! It almost was a beautiful mix of art and mechanical creativity.

Worth a climb, different every day... Quite a spectacle, get there on the hour to see the clock figures moving and hear the trumpeter on top of the tower. Also you'll often catch brides stepping out from their wedding ceremonies here. It's also a good place to find a walking tour guide (much recommended.

Best neighborhood in Prague. We kept finding ourselves in Old Town during our stay in prague.
