So much to see, and we lucked out by being there during their Easter market, where stalls full of food, drinks, crafts, arts, blacksmiths, etc. were erected up and down the square. Beautiful sights all around, the Astronomical clock is an amazing sight to see (watch it do its thing on the hour every hour!), as well as Our Lady Before Tyn Church. Amazing.
A must see. I have to admit the clock was smaller than I thought it was going to be, but none the less, this was worth the stop. The clock is a very cool site.

A MUST SEE!!. The clock is simply beautiful. A work of art dating back to the 1400's, making it the third-oldest. There are four figures flanking the clock that are set in motion on the hour, but be sure to check the times of when the clock stops the animated figures so you don't risk missing this sight! The four figures represent four vices that were despised at the time of the clock's making: Vanity, Greed, Death, and Hedonism. The statues of the Apostles appear at the doorways above the clock, with all twelve presented every hour. After the clock chimes and the figures move, a trumpeter appears at the very top of the clock and trumpets over the crowd. Be warned that while this is a not to be missed sight, Pick Pockets know that unsuspecting tourists will have their attention diverted and their eyes upward and not on each other. Watch your bags, purses and wallets here!
great place to get married. My wife and i were married inside it is a great experience
Do It!. Great view of the city. WELL Worth the climb up to the top. Try to go on the hour when the trumpeter will be up there signaling the time.

Great square!. Many interesting buildings and places to eat or just sit outside having a drink, there is also a jazz bar/restaurant. From here all main places of interest are within walking distance. The restaurants on the square as in all the tourist area's are quite expensive, but just a few minutes away in the side streets, the prices come down quite significantly

Magnificent!. These are both just off a square which is almost always full of tourists from every country imaginable. The Old Town Hall is a beautiful building but the show stealer is the Astronomical Clock. First of all,anybody interested in Astronomy will note that there are actually three modes shown for us laymen the interesting thing is what happens at 12 noon. The rooster crows and moves, the skeleton and the Merchant also move and, through the windows, one can see a procession of the Apostles move. The guide explained that the skeleton represents Death and it is telling the Merchant that it will soon be his time and the Merchant shakes his head because he does not want to agree.
What?. Dont stand around waiting for the little man coming out at every full hour. Its over in 30 seconds, and you will be very disappointed.

makes the town gather. I knew that I wanted to go and see this old clock for it was a mix of technical achievement, stunning design and heritage, so I shouldn't have been surprised when everyone else had the same idea. On the hour, everyone within range gathers around the base of the clock to witness the mechanics and drama of this wonderful old timepiece that commands attention.The square that it's is plays host to many street events too; like night markets, performers and or course tourist/ tour meeting points.
What a fascinating time piece. Superb craftsmanship, intricate details. Was there at 8am so the sun light was making the gold decoration sparkle. Amazing square and clock tower.
Watch the clock strike the hour. There is so much to see when the clock strikes that you need to see it more than once.
In awe. This clock took my breath away. We even forgot to take puctures at first as we stood together just staring up at it. Just left us both in awe.
Clock. I think it is worth going to see. Gets crowded on the hour. The display of the 12 apostles is a little disappointing but definitely worth visiting while in the Old town square.
A Prague Must See. Interesting and the hourly chime causes a lot of excitement
Oh God it that it. Its hard for 200 year old (or more) technology to entertain us in 2012

very crowded. this is a must to see, but gets very crowed on the hr.
the building around that area are really lovely and you must take a trip up in the lift to the tower for a great view over prague.
it costs 110KC
A real hoot. This clock is beautiful but I don't understand the hype.
Unique clock. This clock is unusual with the zodiac on the bottom dial and looks very impressive with the twelve apostles passing the two windows on the hour.
Interesting. Very amazing and historic, but this is the "meeting" spot for thousands of tour groups!!

Worth seeing. The clock is stunning and worth a visit. DEFINATELY climb up the adjacent Town Hall Tower for an amazing view. The hourly chiming of the clock was neat, Not so much for the visuals, but for the bugle player at the top of the tower that sounds his horn at all cardinal directions, side after side.
good value. you can go up the clock tower and the views over prague are great. not expensive either

Fantastic sight. Fantastic sight, its a must see!
Worth going to the top of the tower for perfect views of the city.

Expected more - what I'm not sure. We waited until the hour when we expected "all 'ell to let loose" with this 'amazing" clock. We were somewhat disappointed to find that a couple of windows opened and figures appeared, and that was it. People cheered as though they'd won the cup....

The oldest and 1 of 3 still working!. I was not able to find out where the other 2 working clocks are but this is one of them and it is beautiful! There are a few others in Europe (Sweden, France, Wales) but the Prague clock is really beautiful! Every Hour you will hear its sound and a man dressed in middle ages gear plays the trumpet on top iof the clock tower to announce the hour as well! It is fun and i wonder if that is his full time job!

Not to be missed!. No visit to Prague would be complete without watching the hour change on the Astronomical Clock. The square tends to get very busy at this time so it's best to arrive about 10 minutes before. It was quite cold on the day we were there so we availed of the take-away hot wine from the cafe in front of the tower, which made the experience all the more enjoyable!!!
must see. See the clock ticking twice - at first in front of it in a tourist crowd and then go into the tower to the top: from there it's seen funnier xDD
View from the top. Excellent view of the city from the top! Nice rooms and exposition to visit in the Hall

Bugler is a new addition apparently. Its a must do in Prague. The story behind the clock is very interesting but apparently the bugler at the top of the tower is a new addition - so if you saw it more than three years ago there's something to go back for!
great buzz. great food and atmosphere steak lovely at el toro - and pizza great too

Good bur unpleasant experience. Reviewed above as very good although we were pressed into buying tickets for a recital, etc. that evening in the Smetana Hall in the Municipal House. Sadly it was almost empty and the musicians were good for first half and then very poor and amateurish thereafter.
Be there at 10 minutes before the hour strikes!. Fun to watch what happens when the clock strikes the hour. Beautiful architecture
Must see!. Everyone who visit Prague must see this! It´s good to stay here for a while and enjoy play of bells and puppets on the clock.(1-hour intervals)
I liked the climb. The view was worth the climb and the climb was not bad. Elevator is available also.
Great fun at 9am and 4am!!. Great fairytale feel, loved the narrow streets and churches and markets

The most famous clock in the world. The fame of this clock has come from the XV century, and if today it seems a litlle bit disapointing for turistm it was one of the most impressive cientifical achivements when it was built.

Worth seeing, but very busy!. This is a must-see in Prague. Make sure to stop by. There are free tour groups starting here as well, you pay the guide in tips at the end. Totally worth it. This place is a meeting point for many tourist groups, so look at the Astronomical Clock, take pictures, and get out quick as it's packed with tourists all day long. Visit early in the morning if you can, busy in the evenings too.
Must go to the top - fab views. Best views of Prague with lots of info, lovely to hear the trumpet from the top every hour.
a must see!. in the center of it all, and an absolute great work of architecture and history
Take the time to see the clock. Its simple, just be at the clock on the hour and see the magic, trumpet player and all...another must see
Prague by night view!. in the middle of the old town, great view of buildlings and monument around and further!

A wonderful place to learn about the history of Prague. Loved the Old Town and you must go up the clock tower and see see the vista, also have a tour of the cellars too.Do watch out for the food vendors that put up prices for 100grams in weight they rip you off with a giant size portion, we ended up paying £22.00 for our taster of potato and cabbage and Prague ham(didn't quite understand the money at that point)we had so much ham that we fed one of the many poor tramps that unfortunately roam the town.
some interesting things. some of the buildings are lovely, we missed the clock by a few minutes, darn it! there are huge crowds of school kids and tourists, watch your wallet
Perfect. Nothing else to say.... I miss the beauty. The place is very clean and the Mayor does good job

Better than Venice Clock Tower!!. On the hour windows open and figures of saints move round, followed by the trumpeter from the tower above sounding out the city anthem. The clock is beautiful to look at anyway but join the crowd and get a view of the hourly event, then find a table at a nearby cafe. However watch the drinks prices as they can make a fixed price meal become an expensive afternoon deal

old town and astronomical clock march 2012. lovely old square with lots to see, lovely bars and restaurants to try traditional czech food, the clock strikes every hour and figures move, a guard plays music from the top of the steeple, go up inside the lift to get a lovely view of prauge
Loved it. Loved this tower and it's in Old Town Square so great place.

Try the pastries. The astronomical clock is worth while, film it if possible because so much happens at the same time, in the square there are venders selling a kind of 'curled around a pole' pastry, try them, try lots of them.

Very cool, but watch your valuables. The clock is amazing to see, but I did see a few people attempt to pick a pocket while onlookers were distracted during the hourly show. Keep wallets in front pockets, and purses back at the hotels and you will be fine.

O WOW! I couldn't get enough of watching the astronomical clock, it is so beautiful and interesting.. I was only in Prague for a few days to attend a conference and as soon as I could leave I took the underground train to Old Town square. The astronomical clock intrigued me as I studied some of its background beforehand. At 12 o'clock of each hour the clock goes through a ritual of movement of the figurines on the clock, where each of them has a meaning and a trumpet is blown to end it off. Masses of people gather in front of the clock in anticipation of the clock 'coming alive' and the last movement ends at 21:00 every day. There is so much more to see and experience on the Square and surroundings, lots of curio shops, even the informal market and the Jewish area, all within walking distance.Worthwhile to spend money on a short tour with a travel guide who gives you background on all the places they take you to, most of the tours include a trip on the river. The popular tourist areas of PRAGUE is so beautiful, generally restaurants are a bit expensive though.
Astrological Clock. Another must see site - 600+ years old and the square fills with visitors from all over the world to see it chime.
Look up!. It was worth the wait as we stood in a throng near the bottom of the clock. Be sure to look up!
Nice!!. Try to be at the right time to see the clock functioning ie past every hour. Good eateries nearby.
Don't miss it!. Be there when the hours strikes! Atleast in the evening it was a guy on the top of the tower playing a trumpet :o) Not sure if that happens every hour.....

The meeting point for tourists, the heart of Prague. I think this should be the starting point for all your plans in Prague. Tourist info next to the astronomical clock with his nice history. You can enjoy watching the mass of tourists resembling at the head of each hours (10 minutes before each hour) to see the clock show (squeleton, statue, the coccorico..). You can climb the tour and see the trumpeter contributing to the show. Just close to it the building that wars partially destroyed during the recent ages. You can also see the crosses on the floor, ask for their history. In the other side of the place, the famous cathedral. Sometime, you can enjoy some shows like the joker. Around you can find many shops, cafés, marionettes theaters, etc. Not far also you can find the powder tower, the city hall, the commercial center Palladuium etc.
Clock is not a big Deal.. I did not find the clock a big deal, not worth standing in line and wait for the show , but if you can get a seat in one of the restaurants across it, than see it.

Awesome clock with interesting history. Don't bother signing up for a tour to visit this or any of the other sites. 10 minutes on Wikipedia will give you plenty of information you can print out and bring along to read when you're there. The crowds can be so big (and often the tour groups themselves have 2 dozen people or more) that you're unlikely to hear your guide anyways. Save your money, go on your own, and enjoy the clock and nearby square at your own pace.
Spectacular views from the tower. remember the guy plays his trumpet on the hours so make sure you are there.

Not up to the hype. Very intresting to see. Don't expect a show. Two windows open to see the 12 apostles walk by the window. The don't even come out through the windows. It was short and disappointing. But considering how old it is. It is and important piece of history.

while looking up to see the show, always be aware of your belongings. The view from the clock tower looking out on Old Town Square is quite impressive. The "show" on top of the hour is worth seeing if you happen to be around at that time. If you are not, it's not worth it to stay and wait. There are a lot of other beautiful places to see that are close by (St. Nicholas Church, Church of Our Lady of Tyn, shopping for souvenirs). Just walk around and come back at the top of the hour. Once you are watching, be aware of pickpockets! Pickpockets have set up an office near the Clock tower, as well as tram numbers 22 and 9.
amazing view!. The clock is a real beuty and paying to go upstairs is totally worth it. it can get really crowded up there specially at the right hours when there is a little "show"!

Amazing architecture & mechanics. The clock is really something to see. Situated in the Old Town Hall, it was begun in the 15th century & rebuilt many times. When it strikes the hour, different figures move in & out. Beautiful to look at & free!
Good fun. Enjoyable experience to see it taking place, but do not expect some extraordinary performance!

One of Prague's top five things to do.. OK, well, you've got to see this thing. It will appeal to the engineer and artist within. It's like a grown up cuckoo clock. And it's really old.But don't expect fireworks. Matter of fact, when the cock finally croaks out his last crow, you might wonder if you've missed something.But you're there for the spectacle, and the wonder at how old this thing is, how it's evolved through the centuries, how it survived WWII (actually, it didn't), and just how the heck did they make all those parts move in sync.And if you're there in winter, find a table at one of the sidewalk cafes (propane heaters and blankets provided), grab a cup of hot chocolate and watch the show.By the way, if you need to know what time it is, don't forget your watch as this clock is truly an "astronomical" clock. No hour hands. But it will tell you sunrise and sunset, and the phase of the moon, and the day of the month, and the signs of the zodiac, and just exactly where the sun is in it's path around the earth ... Wait a minute. What!? Yep, it's that old, before Copernicus had persuaded us otherwise.
The Clock. Our guide explained how the clock worked but we didnt see it on the hour do to the length of our tour.
Interesting to see. But nothing special IMHO. There is performance at 6 PM with trumpet on top of the tower with Astronomical Clock, but from square You cannot see much

Worth Waiting for the Clock to Strike!. The Astronomical Clock is a clock from medieval times and has a unique design though I didn't know how to decipher the time but the . Each hour, the clock will strike and there will someone at the tower who would blow the trumpet. Best time to take photos is during the daytime as there is not much light around at night. Read up the history of the clock to appreciate more of the clock as there was a time when the clock was 'cursed' by the one of the makers whose eyes were blinded so that he cannot make the same clock else.

Take the trip up the stairs!. Watching the brides and grooms come en masse during the week to the Old Town Hall was as unexpectedly great to witness as the trumpeter sounding the hours off from the top of the tower. Be certain to take the tower tour, it is worth the small fee to get a birds-eye view of the city below.
Very Interesting!. Watching the clock was great as it moves and chimes every hours ont he hour. We also went up the town which gave us amazing views across Prague!

wonderful. This is the place where everyone comes to watch as the clock strikes on the hour, the area gets really busy as everyone watches as the apostles pass by the windows and the trumpeter sounds from above in the tower. Now if you like history and ghosts then you must go on the underground tour which is directly underneath the tower of the clock, be prepared to get a cold tingle down your spine.
Old Town and Hall and Clock. Interesting part of City, great but sad story to that wonderful clock
a neck strainer. make sure you catch the clock display on the hour,its worth it.And as a bonus we found a good place to eat on the square with good prices.

well worth the wait, magical, we went back 4 times. it is a very interesting clock and there are many things to see on it while its chiming on the hour,there is also a tour of the tunnels underneath the clock building

A must visit in Prague!. I really enjoyed seeing this clock and tower. Looks pretty nice. You can enter the tower besides the clock but also at the information point. You can see the tower from the inside and also see the statues that appear when the clock strikes every hour. See them from another side. You can go up in the tower by elevator or 'stairs'. It's just a path that go's up not really stairs. You have a great view over the old town square and over prague. A real must. When the clock strikes it is very crowded. Better to see it early in the morning, you can take the best pictures. There is no fee for seeing the clock, there is for getting inside the tower.
Love Prague. Love Prague, cannot fault it! My fav City I have visited so far. Highly recommend

Be very afraid. The clock strikes on the hour every hour. The skeleton will ring the bell of death. The Apostles will walk round further up. However, the golden rooster was not working so a man now blows his horn from the top of the clock tower.
Shouldn't be missed. I have lived here for 20 years,but still it is something that I enjoy passing,and still I occasionally wait for the striking of the clock if I have time...

Not the best clock ever. Not the best clock in ever, but worth a look. Every hour there is a little show where characters come out of the clock. There is a live person up on the top who playes trumpet.

The smell of the Roasting Ham makes it worth it. A lovely square, a famous and unique clock and some lovely eateries around. As you may expect the bars/restaurants nearest to the clock are the most expensive, but there are plenty of good value places just down the side streets.
Once in a lifetime... We stopped to see what everyone was looking at and arrived just in time to see the Astronomical Clock chime. It has to be seen to be believed!
Lively area Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock. A good selection of little shops and cafes, very busy but very interesting. Black Light Theatre near this area defo worth a look!
big. You can't miss the astronomical clock, it's a good point to meet.
Amazing. It is in the old town city center, walking district, and it lovely

Picture Perfect. The clock and square are the most popular stop on any visit to Prague. Since we stayed near the square, I was able to get up early, well before the crowds. I loved sitting with a cup of coffee and watching the shops come awake.
Amazing Place. How the place is filled with so much historical architecture is truly unbelievable, and so many old stories and legends, it takes you back into the past.
Clock. You have to move aroundto get the wonderful views....take the time to wait until the next movement, moveto a different vantage point to getthe most of each view.

What a view.. YOu really must go to the top of the astronomical clock. We had been to Prague on 4 previous occasions and missed out on this experience, Easy access via lifts/ stairs with stunning views over all of prague. Not for those with vertigo( my friend could not make it to the top) He really missed out on the experience. A trip to prague should not miss this attraction

Lovely tradition. Watch the astronomical clock on the hour, the 12 disciples appear behind the doors, but I really enjoyed the bugler at the top of the tower that plays to each four corners of the tower.

Very Romantic. A lovely part of the city, very romantic and full of live, cafes, restaurants, stores (including souvenirs ones) but a bit pricy in general as it's the most traditional and touristic part of the city except for the castle.A place for romance, definitely!

WOW what a clock. There were crowds gathered around the square and Astronomical clock but I was finally able to have a photo taken in fron of the clock. It is very interesting to hear the clock and watch the horse drawn carriages travelling to and fro. Altl together an amazing experience and wonderful city.
A Must See!. Ensure you visit Old Town Hall on the hour to witness the skeleton ringing a bell on the Astronomical Clock! The clock is amazing and a must see when in Old Town Square.
Must see but watch for pickpockets!. Unique(?) clock that is worth catching on the hour but this is boomtime for pickpockets that operate in the area to prey on distracted tourists

A masterpiece. Quite an amazing clock, and although our guide explained what all the symbols etc meant, I was still rather confused as to how it works, but quite a crowd pleaser, and of course its in the Old Square, so you can`t miss it. Worth a trip up the tower, great views!!

Well worth a visit........ We stayed 2 mins away from the tower and its well worth the visit. Every hour on the hour the clock chimes and the trumpets play! make sure you stay around to watch.We went up the tower which cost approx 100 koruna each and was well worth it. The views are stunning and some great photo opportunites from the top. Definately take the lift though! as some very steep steps up!
Beautiful Craftmanship. Most ornate but the scramble for the hour performance was rather a let down.
Part of a walking tour of Prague. Interesting and pretty, part of a walking tour of Prague so did not spend a greatdeal of time here as we had too much other stuff to see and it was awfully cold

Astronomical clock at night is great. You really need to visit the clock at night and go up. it is something like 35 crowns to go up (I think), and well worth it to take in Prague. Great views all around the city and if you think it is beautiful during the day, you should see it at night
Fascinating. just fascinating!!!!! It draws a crowd on the hour every hour. A trumpeter from the very top of the tower completes the performance
Stop and have a look. Great to watch when it gets going and good for taking photos if you're in to that. Be warned though it gets very busy, lots of tours stop here and it gets quite congested.

Mesmeric!. I was waiting to be completely underwhelmed as we waited with a pretty large crowd in front of the clock, but then everything kicked into action. The detail is amazing, the disciples turning to wave as they go by. The backstory of the clockmaker is mildly distressing, but highlights how highly the clock was revered when it was unveiled. What made it for me, was the fact that as the first bell chimed, snow started falling and the crowd all cheered. I hope you get as lucky! Wonderful!
Centar of Prague. You must visit this place, there are so many restourants and taverns with national cuisine. The square is crowded with many young people
the best picture of the trip. nice to have the clock as background on a picture!!!
Astronmical Clock. We never witnessed the wonders of the changing of clock and we survived. The clock itself is neat but so busy. That is a main tourist area.

Nearly missed it!. We missed the clock twice before seeing it from the restaurant opposite. Even then there was so much going on that we had to watch it yet again to see all the moving parts. We advise that you get there well before the hour!
Tyremarxx. A lovely, if expensive by Prague standards, square with a clock that is a wonderful of mechanical ingenuity.
Go to the tower. The tower is a good place to view Prague in night. The entry is not expensive.
Whats the time?. interesting clock but difficult to tell the time!crowds tend to accumilate every hour to watch the movements.
Beautiful .... lots and lots of people. It's lovely when there's no-one around (when would that be?!)
Amazing. Just loved the unique beauty of the town, dont visit prague during winter time"

Have your camera at the ready. The clock is lovely and we watched it several times on the hour, don't forget to look up once it's stopped ringing though as there's very often a musician at the top of the tower ready to play a fanfare!
On the hour. See it on the hour every hour, everone gathers! The views from the tower are magnificent! Good value for money!

The price is worth the view. I am sure anytime is great to see Prague, no matter how you split it there are going to be loads of tourists. I was no exception that is for sure.  It will run you about 10.00 Euro to go to the top. Stairs or elevator its up to you. At the top you get a great view of the city. You cant seem to take a bad photo from this point.  Every hour there is someone who plays a short tune on the trumpet. On a side note, Krakow is upset about this because they claim that Prague is now a "copy cat" with this new addition to Prague's Hourly clock watching. Either way its no matter to me, both places are great and Prague's tower is very nice. The whole city is great really. Get a little bit out of the city center and things get even cheaper. I was just there and yes the beer (Pivo) is still cheaper then water. :)
A must see - even though its not spectacular. not the most amazing site but the clock is cute to see on the hour

A tourist's must. Be there before the hour so you have a frontal view of the Clock. If you have the courage, climb up inside the Tower (fee payable at entrance), the view over Prague's Old Town is splendid.
A must see. Get there before the chime and stake out a good spot for the show - it's an amazing clock and a fun environment to hang out in!
nice to see. nice area to visit but a bit pricey to eat and drink around that area
Yes, it is an astronomical clock. It is an astronomical clock. Well preserved. I believe people there are into astronomical study will be fascinated about it.
One to see. In my opinion you must visit the Astronomical clock at least once! It is exactly like the pictures.

Watch then climb!. Definitely show up on te hour to watch the clock do its thing, bit make sure to grab tickets (door located on the right hand side of the clock), so that immediately after the last chime is seen you can dash inside and beat the crowd about to attempt the climb. The view is worth a million words.

On the hour. Stumbled across this, everybody was hanging around the entrance to this church looking up. Realised it was the clock. Waited 5 minutes for 12 noon and saw the whole thing with the religious characters. Good tip is to take a video of it

I Don't Get It. Don't get me wrong, a very pretty clock set into a stunning building. But the mass of crowds flocking to it every hour was overwhemling for what is an over-hyped demonstration. Don't go out of your way to see it.

The Astronomical Clock. There is only one of these in the whole world. It was the most unique experience. Every hour the clock would begin to strike and the figures along side the face move and a man waves a flag from the very top of the building and blows a horn. Amazing
A must. Try and visit the clock at midday to watch for the disciples and cockerel and finally the trumpeter playing from the top of the tower
Unforgettable clock. The astronomical clock is such a delight, you must go see it when it plays + the trumpeteer does the salut!

A real plus. You have to watch it a few times to really get to see all that is happening. I think you need to read a guide about the clock first.
If you could video it you would watch it again and see much more on subsequent viewings.
GET THERE ON THE HOUR. Make sure you see the clock when it strikes the hour.

Visit on the hour. We happened to walk by at 5pm and really enjoyed the delights of the clock on the hour. It was a great landmark that helped us to navigate around the city as well as beautiful to look at.

Look at the beauty! Tresure with mistic history.... The most complexed watch, moving statues, architectural tresure of the Czech nation for years...was partly damaged during WW II, located on Old Town Square...be ready for many turists there...this place is in every single tourguide in Prague...
View of Prague. Nice view of the whole Old town of Prague. Interesting astronomical clock, a centuries old invention...

Beautiful but super crowded. We went at the tail end of Easter Market. Unfortunately, that means loads of people. We never got to get close to this clock because it was always surrounded by throngs of photogs. The upside is that the Easter Market brings lots of vendors into the square.

Don't stand and gawp, climb the tower!. Lots of people visit the Old Town Hall to see the astronomical clock, but for the equivalent of about 5 Euros you can go up the clock tower and get some amazing views of the Old Town and beyond. It gets pretty crowded at the top, as space is obviously limited, but it's worth it for the view and the unusual photo opportunities it offers. It also stays open quite late, so if you're looking for something to do in the evening this is a possibility. If you choose to take the staircase you can also read the display placards, which will tell you more about the history of the tower and the clock than you will find in the guidebook. The entrance is not immediately obvious - buy your ticket from the little kiosk at the bottom of the tower and follow the printed instructions you get with the ticket.
Must to see. One of the most interesting places in Prague. The Astronomical Clock is interesting and lots of people coming to see it.
Always fun to watch the crowd form. It seems that there is always a crowd when the clock does it thing. Very interesting metering mechanism for tourists coming into the square and restaurants.

What a view!. Crowds gather around the medieval astronomical clock to catch a glimpse of the lovely 'Walk of the Apostles' on the hour. My husband and daughter went up to the top of the tower via the lift and they said that the view was stunning (not for those who suffer from vertigo!)

Tourists trap. Everybody must see and everybody is disapointed :) It used to be something special in the 15th century, today it is a crap - especially if you dont know the history behind it. And wath out for pickpocketing!
Got to be done!. Make sure you're there for the mid-day chimes to see the apostles appear and the trumpeter playing.
Its ok. A lot of hype really,and you will wonder what the facination is when it draws all the crowds in each hour

A landmark in prague but not so great.... It is a beutiful and must see attraction but the time observing the clock is short. It is very crowded and for my is like having a picture in brooklin bridge to show you were there. My suggestion is to take a picture and keep exploring praha. There are many interesting things to see in the quarter. Also if you like jewelry, there are dozens of them, amily selling granate" with gold ald silver.
Best view of Prague from the top. For 105 CZ (about £3), go to the top of the tower and you're guaranteed the best views over Prague. One of the highlights of my trip. Loved it!
Wonderful!. Sat in the little cafe opposite drinking hot chocolate whilst watching the clock at 4.00 in the afternoon. Then the piper came out at the top. Lovely!

You cannot come to Prague and not check this out. At night this place is beautiful, during the day, full of tourists, but a great place to pick up a tour, which is worth doing.The clock is over rated until you learn a bit about it.
Good view from the top. It costs about 105 CZK to go up the tower, but the view from the top is worth it, particularly at noon when the sun is on top, and allows you a good view of all the town.

A must see. We couldn't find this at first as it isn't actually in the old square but round the corner. You have to take a photo as it is so unusual but you need to get your spot quickly as it gets quite busy when the clock is due to strike. We were there at midday so got to see all the twelve apostles come out and there was a trumpeter in the tower as well. Worth seeing
Magical. The buildings are fabulous,so much to look at.On the hour look to the top of the Tower,a bugle is played,,its quite emotional
Interesting site. I missed the chiing of the clock and the operation of the figures in it but enjoyed seeing the astronomical decor. Worth a five-minute detour!
Lovely to see!. Beautiful to look at and although we didnt go into it we didnt feel wr missed out of any views that we didnt see from the castle. An amazing piece of work.

Tourist Info Point. The main tourist Info point is in the town hall. The staff are very helpful and keen to advise. BE AWARE!! We bought the 'Prague Card', which entitles you to free/discounted entry to various attractions in Prague, namely the castle. However when we tried using the card, a lot of the attractions listed were no longer valid and did not accept the card. We bought a two day pass on a Sunday which i would definitely NOT recommend, as most galleries/museums etc are closed on Mondays and some on Tuesdays. It sounded like a good deal at the time, but it ended up wasting quite a large chunk of our spending money.

Somewhat of a Tourist Trap but I liked it :). Our tour guide told us that this was the number 1 tourist trap in Europe..... but it's great to see. Being in the Old Town Square (which is a must see anyway) you'll get plenty of opportunity to look at it.
Beautiful, really cool clock!. The clock was so beautiful it was almost hypnotic, I could have stood there and stared at it for hours.

amazing. this is a real wonder! I have neves seen anything like this man made wonder! the story... the years it has... the information it provides are totally amazing! a MUST SEE WHILE IN PRAGE. THE HOURLY SHOW IS MARVELOUS!!!
Clock. A real piece of timekeeping. Drew huge crowds every day.
Must see. Read the story of this clock..you won't believe it!
Old Town. You really feel like you have stepped back in time! We even took photos of the cobblestone streets!
Masterpiece. What an amazing piece of art. Wait for the full of hour to see it working. And climb the steps to its top.
U Prince. Take a wicker seat in the Prince bar with a cold beer under a heat lamp...if it's cool. People watching...best pasta around.

Amazing clock- worth a visit. This clock was very technical for the era. Lots of things to watch when it strikes the hour. A bugler plays on the hour at the top of the tower.A word of warning... watch your bag while you are taking photos. There are pickpockets.
Photo op. We watched it chime a many times over our 7 day stay. Loved the man who plays the song up the top and then waves to the crowd.

Want to see Prague from above?. A great trip up a great tower. See the old rooftops of Prague with views of Prague castle and Tyn Church. Charles Bridge seems almost a stones throw away as you set your mind back to how Prague must have looked around the 15th century.
A top attraction in a top city in Europe

Stunning views of the city centre.. When in Prague, do not forget to actually enter the town hall (entrance of information centre) and take the lift up the tower. For 4 EUR, you will get an incomparable views the OLd Town and whole Prague. It is stunning. I used to go there with all the visits, sometimes even on my own to cheer up when I lived in Prague and now head there every time visiting Prague. You may also take a guided tour inside of the building, offered in many foreing languages, and you will love it.

Not to be missed - Nothing like it anywhere else.. We were so amazed, we arrived just before 1.OO p.m., along with hundreds of others, so much happened, what with the clock striking, the "magic show" with the figures, and the trumpeter from the tower. What showmanship. So delighted we stayed for the next show, and ate in one of the sidewalk cafes.
Over rated. The clock stops at night so do not freeze while waiting for the big show.

Town square nice - Clock a bit of a disappointment. Beautiful square but too many souvenir shops. The clock striking the hour was a bit disappoiting. Expected more. The Peeping Tom clock in Coventry does more. The trumpter at the top lof the tower was impressive. . The architecture is lovely
Astronomical Clock. Unique attraction and a must see when the clock strikes on the hour, but get there early as it becomes very crowded.
WOW. Great structure and really cool! But couldn't understand how to decipher the dials/hands and what they signify. A plauqe or a leaflet would have been useful.
Get there early!. Brilliant but get there early for a good view! Strangely the clock is not on the main square but almost as you leave so we all had to squish up to see the show. Well worth seeing!

A STITCH IN TIME. The whole "Orly Experience" is interesting and sometimes unfortunately "hyped". It is a must see and even thought crowds will wait for literally an hour sometimes to watch the clock come to life at the top of each hour its important to know that the whole "performance" is only about 3 minutes long and what one anticipates to be all the bells and whistles that has justified such a large crowd is often not the case. However after the grand performance of the "marching saints" past the little blue windows and the clanging bell you can hear the muffled surprised chuckle from the collective crowd as if to say... that was it? But its in good fun and considering when it was built the technology was amazing and the history equally quirky and interesting.

Simply beautiful!. If you walk through the Old Town Hall, you will automatically cross through the Astronomical Clock. The clock was first installed in 1410, making it the third-oldest astronomical clock in the world and the oldest one still working!! There is some magic about Old Town Hall itself which can't simply be put into words, one has to experience it himself!!
be at the clock at exact times. If you go nearby the clock at the axact times, you'll see many people taking pictures waiting for the clock to ring and puppets to move. It's interesting.

great bustling meeting place. loved the clock and the atmosphere around this area very bustling but friendly. lovely shops and food stalls around .guided tours tended to go from outside the old town hall and you could join them if you wished just go up to people holding up umbrellas to enquire . we did one and enjoyed the walk round very informative and interesting being shown things we would have otherwise missed seeing.

The heart of the City of Spires. Enjoyed the bustling square, which had a huge Christmas market when we were there. The hourly show at the 600 year old astronomical clock features a procession of apostles and figures. The live trumpeter announces the hour from all 4 sides of the tower. Be sure to climb up the 200 foot tower for a dazzling view of the City of 100 Spires.
cute square. A little touristy but beautiful nonetheless. Extra special when there is a festival or Christmas market!
Amazing astronomical clock. The clock is very impressive even today and much more so for being built in the 15th century. The history makes it even more interesting. Well worth a visit.
what a clock. very interesting to watch as the hour came around. Lots of visitors and locals in the square- nver seen a clock like it.

Breath taking. A must is a trip up the clock. We didn't realise till the second visit that there is a lift. But word of warning make sure you take the lift all the way up we didn't and found ourselves further to climb than we thought. Not for the faint hearted as it can get pretty packed up there but the veiws are worth it
Centre of old town. Excellent jazz band busking on Sunday. Mulled wine, Italian ice cream, and famous Czech beer of course, all around £1.
Obvious tourist attraction but very pretty.. It was a charming area with a good restaurant opposite. Clock chimer was not as spectacular as others we have seen in Germany. Japanese loved it though!!

Tourists treat. What a view - but only if you don't suffer from vertigo.Just don't get too close to the open turret style walls - you feel as though you could fall over at any moment. You may have to jostle your way through the crowds at the top but its worth the effort. The astronomical clock is great and draws a crowd when its due to chime. Also watch out for the trumpeter and his fanfare

Be on time... The Astronomical Clock is really something to watch in action. If you can read up on it before going it will add to your enjoyment and understanding of all you will see. For instance, when this clock was made people were not concerned about minutes, just hours, so there was no minute sweep. An additional clock for minutes had to be added later. To watch all the characters move and what their significance is, is quite clever. If you get there early and get tired of waiting...don't give up, it is worth the wait.

Incredible. One has to be there at 11am just to enjoy the bugler! The clock itself is incredible and some reading up on it beforehand will made the visit worthwhile. We did and knew to look for the intricate movements (skeleton moving and ringing a bell) as well as starting to see the complexity of the mechanical construction
Clock was under repair. Surrounded by scaffolding but still a beautiful sight

A diamond of Europe. I have been to Prague many times through the years and never tire of it. There have been definite changes to it since the early 1990's when i was first there but it still holds a lot of charm. One secret that many people don't know about is that you can climb to the top of the tower just to the right of the clock. It is VERY worth the view. You can see much of Prague from the top and if you are a photographer, this is a must. The area is swamped by tourists and while in the past year I have been there in March and in December/January, there were a LOT of tourists. I cannot imagine what summers are like. Still, it is worth visiting. At the same time, realize that there is so much to see and do in Prague that is great that this is only one attraction.
Favourite spot. Went here most nights while in Prague, great atmospheres. Lovely place to just sit and have a beer or a coffee in one of the restaurants.
Wonderful experience. The area was extremely crowded, but really beautiful. Witnessing a wedding celebration was an added bonus.
Old Town Square at Christmas. Nice to wander around the stalls at Christmas, the Astronomical clock is interesting to watch on the hour. Must see!

Very interesting. Tyn church was a nice surprise. Clock looks so complicated - would have been nice to have some instruction (though my husband disagrees as he says I would have 'wasted' time trying to work it out.

Must take picture from the top of the Astronomical Clock. You don't have to climb the stairs, you can use the elevator, it is not very crowded (at least not in winter time). Try to be there at sharp hours to see how it works.
Lovely buildings. Astronomical clock is great to see but a little over rated. The old buildings and churches around this part of the city are beautiful.

Great Views of Prague.. The astronomical clock is really worth a visit, climbing to the top to see all of Prague was a great highlight of my trip. The clock as well when it chimes bring a lot of excitement to the square. Great experience
nice view. the view was breath taking from the top of the clock

Amazing. The astronomical clock is really an outstanding piece of art, on the hour the "Walk of the Apostles" & other figures are really worth the wait. After this, on the top of the tower the a trumpeter in the tower, wearing a yellow-and-red uniform, plays a tune to the crowd be low, waving to them after his performance. He plays on each side of the tower. We also went up the tower one night & it is a beautiful view, worth the 100 Krona
Beautiful old building with ornate Astronomical clock.. Be there on the hour to see the figures appear and rotate. Eleven a.m. to hear the trumpeter playing a fanfare.

Best Christmas Market Atmosphere. Loved coming here for the Christmas market. Even though what was on sale is not that exciting, it's the atmosphere you come for. A bit of mulled wine, a look at the most amazing decorations and with the backdrop of the church, you are just waiting for Batman to come flying out of the roof-tops. A very gothic feel to the place. The Astronomical Clock is also fantastic to see. Allround a marvellous place but walk a bit further if you don't want to get ripped off on drink/food!
Great diversity of buildings, but very crowded.. The area has some very neat old buildings and great architectual details to see, but the crowds were huge, and it was very hard to move around.

Expected more. We thought the figures would be bigger and more would happen when the time sounded. It's ok - it's very close to restaurants and nice squares - just don't line up too early to see the figures spin.
An interesting tour. Enjoyed the tour and the trumpeter that added to the theatre of the clock chiming the hour, best go up 10 to 15 minutes before the hour.

Remarkable!. We went to the top of the clock tower, and were standing near the young trumpeter who was signaling the chiming of the clock. The scene from the tower, out over the beautiful Christmas lights, was magnificient.

Great views from the top. We took the lift to the top of the tower and enjoyed some amazing views of the city. We happened to be up there at midday when a bugle is played from the top and crowds cheer below- a lovely experience.

Great Views. Another must see. Buy a ticket for the lift, unless you are under 30 and very fit! Try and arrive at the top at around the hour so you can see the herald play his trumpet. Avoid the glass walled cafe opposite, unless you have money to burn.

incredible. Just looking at the town hall with the Astronomical clock will bring a smile to your face. Get there just before the hour and watch what happens when the hour strikes. I will not give it away !!! The town hall and clock are a major subject of the paintings of the square and rightfully should be. This is also a favorite location for tour guides to be.

Weddings at the Old town hall. Me and my husband got married there on December 2011 I highly recommed this place for weddings very elegant and classicalso go to the top of the building at night for a beautiful view of the city

Staromestska Radnice. Once again, if you're walking through the square, take a look. If you happen to get there on the hour when the clock strikes and the trumpeter plays, fine, otherwise do not spend too much time here.
Clock. Had to see with all 10,000 others. But was nice. Be sure to stop to see on the hour, 8, 9, 12 so you can see it in action

An extraordinary piece of art right in front of your eyes. I went to visit Prague this August with friends and Astronomical Clock left the biggest impression on me. It is absolutely the prettiest and most amusing landmark in Prague, even though I must say it's one of the most beautiful cities I've ever visited. And I've been across Europe. The most amusing part of it comes when it's round hour (e.g. 8.00, 11.00...) when a little play is presented. What is it - I won't say, check it out yourselves!

Historical Traditions. this is a fantastic visit with Amazing details in its architecture. There is a little jester who blows his trumpet at the top of the tower every hour on the hour. It's a long walk up but they do have lifts for the less able bodied or lazy

Go to the top if you have the time. The clock is a wonder in and of itself. Seeing the skeleton and apostles do their thing at the top of the hour doesn't get old. Today, we went up the tower. The views were amazing! Yan walk around the top and see a 360 degree view of Prague with all of the major sites. If you are able either walk up or down or both he inside versus the lift as you can read about the history of the clock and how it was almost destroyed in 1945 after WWII.

The square is a great meeting place!. Everyone can find the clock, so it is great meeting place. Many people stand wait for the clock to strike on the hour so they can hear the chimes. Buy a snack and sit and eat it in the old square.

Wonderful. This is amazing! If you haven't seen them you weren't in Prague.
Love the skeleton!

Best photos in town are taken from top of the clock tower. The best photos of Prague must be taken from top of the clock tower. From this vantage point you may see the old town square as well as the serpentine cobblestone paths that meander outward.

Watch the bugler. We went up the Astronomical Clock - walk or lift! and watched the bugler - best time is 1pm. The view from the top is truely amazing - it feels like you can see the whole of Prague. It's interesting to see some of the roof tops of restaurants and wave at the people enjoying a beer - some even wave back!

interesting. Crowds gather on the hour to watch the clock but it is over so quickly. Look into the fascinating history of its building. The atmosphere with the Christmas market, and cafes is wonderful.

Wonderful view, and you can skip the stairs.. Entered the base committed to walking to the top, but found the elevator ride was available. Spectacular views and a new perspective of old Prague. And, on the walk down, was able to read an interesting display of the history of the tower and clock.
Entertaining. Everyone loves the clock, so much fun to watch and really exciting to go to the top and get the best view of the market and beyond.
Fantastic tower. Must see the tower with its watch mechanism when clocks strike.
is something.... The astronomical clock is something! I took more than 10 pictures about it. great!
Amazing view. Definitely go up the old town hall. The views are just spectacular. Make sure to bring your camera. Some of the best views of the city from here.
Great show. Astronomical clock was really great...such a crowd had developed to see the chiming, definately worth seeing

It`s a clock..but what time is it ??. Probably the most famous clock in europe !! But, it`s difficult to tell the time, as there is "too much information" you need an instruction manual to decipher it all !

excellent. a must see when you go to prague. the place is always busy with tourists and some nice bars and hotels are close by. when the clocks strike on the hour everyone cheers you have to go the and experience it for you self. went there several times during my stay. also the xmas market were on and the colour and christmas trees were the best i have ever seen,
Brilliant. Well worth paying the £5 to get the lift to the top for fantastic views
It's fine -- crowd watching is more fun. Draws big crowds -- again, be attentive of your person. The crowd itself is more entertaining.
Nice watch!. Try to get there every full hour, as the clock moves and the angels go around the clock..

Old Town Square and its monuments. The Old Town Square is one of the most beautiful places in Prague. It is worth waiting till Astronomical clock reach the hour and it plays its little performance. The Square is amazing in Christmas time and even in the evenings has its charms!

On the hour, every hour. We were lucky - at 12.00 we saw the astronomical clock and the trumpeter, from down below. Then at 1.00 we climbed the tower to join him, and watch the throngs down below (including a bride and groom, who danced for the crowds)
Make sure you go up the tower. The tower is the key thing for me here - offering 360 degree views of the city. Get there early to avoid the crowds if you are there in peak season.
Bit of a squeeze but fun. On the hour you will know what a sardine feels like but the clock is impressive.
must seen. a lot of croud, nice view from the tower and must see the change of the time every hour and whats going on there!!! also must eat TRDELNIC traditional sweet of prague!!!
Astronomical Clock. Very enjoyable to see. Well worth getting back to the square to see.

Overview of the whole town and Interesting clock. A visit to the top of the town hall with Elevators. Allows you to have the view of the whole Prague city and its significant buildings around. This is follow by a slow walk down to the ground floor to observe the Astronomical clock which chimes every hours. Need to pay for the elevators or access up but it's worth it.

One of the most renowned places to visit in the city. Definitely worth a trip to see the oldest, working Astronomical clock in the world. It's amazing to consider that it dates back over 600 years!I was in Prague the week before Christmas and so there was something very special about being amongst the Christmas markets in the square below the Old Town Hall when the clock struck upon the hour and the trumpet player sounded from the tower above and waved to the crowd! ...I am a sucker for Christmas though.
Fabulous setting. Our guide told us more about the architecture of the clock. We would have missed many interesting points had we been on our own. Our guide was excellent.
relaxed people. always some activity, musicians, stalls at festivals and beautiful European History

Super touristy but fun. The best part was walking up the tower to take a photo of the horde of tourists in front of the astronomical clock. A visit to Prague is simply not complete without having seen this clock.
on the hour, every hour. once you're there just look up and see the Clock at work, quite remarkable! then journey to the top of the tower and see it all over again! :)
Unique and re-visitable every time. Make sure you learn what you can about both the history and the operation of this great work of science and art.

Beautiful clock - climbing tower a bit of a letdown. This was beautiful to see and we thought would be great to climb to the top of the tower for some photos with a view, only 100 Kc each so about 3 pounds (I think) not really worth it the views from the castle etc just as good if not better, great to get your bearings though for walking the little side streets.
Always a large crowd. Well worth a look and to see the clock chime, there is always a large crowd so make sure you get there 10 - 15 minutes early so you can actually see what is going on!
A great stop.. You should definitely check out the Astronimical Clock while you are exploring Old Town. Its a quick stop!
Christmas Markets and Clock. Christmas markets here were full of atmosphere, it is worth waiting to see the Astronomical Clock at the top of the hour, large crowds gather so you cannot avoid it.

Clock is a little lame but it's a nice area. It's a nice area for wandering around, beautiful buildings. The clock, which draws crushing crowds, is not worth the wait for the 'show' - it's just as nice when it's not chiming and you can actually get up close!

Join the crowds as o'clock is due. The clock and its history are fascinating and far more interesting than the theatrical pageantry which comes into play; when as the clock strikes the hour moving apostle figures and a trumpeter dressed in red and gold can be seen and heard marking the time.
Great show - huge crowd. People gather to watch the little characters on the clock do their thing, and I like the actual human in costume who joins in from the tower.
Pretty cool. Every hour on the hour you get a little show. Everyone stops and watches, pretty cool!

Great views but.... The views from the old town hall tower are great but crowded and the astronomical clock is over rated. With all the other tourists we jostled for position to get the best view of the hourly display of apostles from the astronomical clock to be find it lasts less than a minute and is a bit lame. The actual clock face is fantastic and amazingly detailed.
Get a Guide. You will not understand anything at all or appreciate this site unless you have a guide who is a good historian.

Worth the trip to top of the clock tower!. First of all, at night during Chrstmas time, this is a truly special place to be. One of the prettiest squares in the world. For a small fee, you can take the stairs or elevator to the top of the clock. Spectacular views and great for picture taking. We did this during the day. Don't mss it.
Don't get too excited or you might be disappointed!. Cool clock, but not exactly an HD all singing and dancing experience. Once you know the history though it's pretty cool.

Medieval astronomy. The Old Town Square was bustling with people. The Christmas market was great with vendors selling their merchandise such as, black smiths, food, jewelry and other crafts for sale. The Square was decorated with a huge Christmas Tree, a wooden nativity manger scene and of course the astronomical clock.I was enamoured with the clock and the Colourful History of Prague. I would definitely recommend purchasing a ticket to climb the tower. The view point from the astronomical tower was spectacular.
A must-see. One of Prague's major tourist drawcards is to watch the clock strike the hour and to see the figures of the Apostles emerge at the top of the clock.
astronomical clock. when we first saw the clock its mesmerising the figures moving and a trumpeter played a christmas carol at the top of the tower then we went to the top ..lift..views spectacular
Not to be missed - on the hour. Get there at about quarter to the hour and just enjoy the atmosphere

Fantastic clock.. Its worth the wait! only does the full programme on the hour but well worth waiting ! If you are waiting any time, DONT GET RIPPED OFF BY THE HAM SELLERS !!!! In the square there are a few stall holders selling "Prague Ham". 89 CK for 100 grammes. (Thats £3 for about 4 ozs!) They will but at least 500-700 grammes on a plate and they very quickly ask if thats ok. If you say yes, you have then commited your self to buying it all. Thats £15-£21. If you say its too much, very morose and grumpily will remove some but just a little, and then they ask again. Maybe not a con but very expensive so be warned!!
Wonderful Square. Gorgeous square, the buildings are jsut amazing. Clock was very interesting!
First City Hall in whole country. Watch the clock and then go inside and visit the Old Town Underground underneath the complex.

Stunning Light show... At night, the 10 min light show repeats itself, brings the Astronomical clock into life, telling the history of the town with sound effects and an exceptional light show. a Must see.
Amazing Clock. Got to see the movement of the statues inside. Definitely ahappening place- center of the square.

a little disappointed. The clock was not as we expected but the lift to the top of the clock was an amazing deal. Time your visit to just before the hour when the trumpeter sounds the turning of the hour by blowing his trumpet to the crowds below. Gives you a fab view of the city and it looks like the closing to the film willie wonka just beautiful

Pretty setting. Nice setting - we sat in a cafe and watched the astronomical clock. (Warning the cafes in this spot are expensive.) The whole place is a bit like being in a fairy tale - great to wander around - there are lots of small details on the buildings which you don't see at first glance.

Astronomical Clock. The Clock is the centrepiece of the old town square and makes a stunning photograph.
It is a one of a kind.
The Clock. This clock is a great attraction for tourists and locals alike as on the hour the doors open and the 12 deciples appear and a trumpeter plays from the topof the tower.
BREATHTAKINGS. U can view prague and the whole of old town from here! the view is stunning and breathtaking!

Nice Christmas ambiance. You see the crowd gathering underneath the Astronomical Cloak. You know something must be up. You whip out your camera. Music plays when the cloak strikes at the hour. You know it must be something special because even the performer at the square stops singing when the cloak strikes at the hour.Then people at the top of the tower wave at you. You wave back at them. After that that was it. Then there is the Christmas market. Must try - mulled wine. The hot dog that I had was average but enough to keep you warm during winter. There's a Tourist Information Centre just next to the Astronomical Cloak. There are flyers that give you ideas of what to do and see in Prague. My personal favorite experience - take away hot Mojito from a shop located near Bogner store.
Amazing attraction!. Stunning astronomical clock dating back to the 14th century. Great to be there on the hour for the little ceremony, and the views from the top of the tower are wonderful.

ok. interesting clock to look at but don't expect it to do anything, the trumpeters are people at the top of the tower which if like me your eye sight isn't the best you can just about make them out (should have brought my binoculars. O.K but nothing special

Prague's landmark. The most popular attraction in Prague. Try to be there at the top of the hour and enjoy the sounds and effects. But be aware, it can get too crowded. We took the elevator to the top of the tower and had good views of the city and the surroundings.

Go for a ride to the top of the clock.. Great from below, but what a view from the top! Worth the 5euro admission price. It does get a little crowded up at the top. Perhaps they should regulate the people flow a little better. Cute hourly shows from the top of the clock!

clocks away!. This clock has to be seen to be believed. The movement on the hour attracts big crowds who all ooh and aah at the same time. Then the bugler plays and it is suddenly very emotional. brilliant!
disappointing. disappointed with the show like many others who stood there waiting for it to take place. Not much to see only couple of figures which passed a small window and a little music playing.
Birthday treat. Well you must be at the clock on the hour but best time is 12 o clock .
Must see. If you come to Prague and don't see it you hyave never been to Prague
Interesting to see but over rated. Free old clock that gives a little show every hour. Very crowded but worth a stop to see on the hour.
Lots of atmosphere. A lot of action, a lot of people, restaurants are touristy, but very good....
lovelt. it was fascinating.watching the old figures turning around.on the hour every hour

Magical centre. The clock still attracts the crowds. The best place to see it in winter is from one of the adjoining bars with a glass of hot pear juice. The Christmas market with stalls, concerts and an enormous Christmas tree is just magical.
A true masterpiece. The main attraction in the town. Crowds gather round on the hour. See for yourself why!!

Astronomical Clock. As it is a major tourist attraction we had to visit the square but once you have seen it there is little else to do but shopping. We were luck as the christmas market was on but I am not sure what we would have done if it was summer.

what a clock. one of the best i have seen there is a free tour that leaves at around 11:00 from under the clock its worth the time and the history to the clock you can take town hall tour and see the working of the clock as well ask at information beside the clock
Historical Buildings. Beautiful Historical buildings line the Old Town Square. The Astronomical Clock has to be seen as the hour strikes.

Wonderful for a short break. We went for the Christmas market's which were very well done. Most enjoyable walking around the stools with a hot rum punch made christmas shopping a joy it may have been the punch. Great atmosphere night time was lovely

Iconic Prague attraction. Perhaps Prague’s most iconic attraction, the Astronomical Clock and Old Town Hall are pretty awesome. The detail on the clock are amazing, and seeing it live is so much better than looking at any photograph. Expect a ring of crowds around the clock, with tour guides explaining each and every component. You can even eavesdrop to learn a little more about the clock if you want. A must see in Prague.
Crowds. Early morning is the best time to take your pictures - unless you can deal with the large crowds.

Magical. Be sure to visit the Astronomical Clock early in the day and miss the crowds at the top of the hour when the clock begins its show! Lots of tourists visit this spot and it is packed from noon on. It is a spectacular site to watch and well worth the visit. Don't miss it!

The number one thing to do in Prague. This is obviously the most popular attraction in the Old Town Square and just before the hour strikes it can be really crowded. The trumpeter plays from the top of the tower and then the clock strikes the hour to a wonderful display which needs to be seen. My advice would be to get there before 9am - we did and we were right in the front row. It's also well worth going to the top of the tower (we walked up a series of ramps which we very easy, but there is also a lift that takes you up). The view from the top is amazing.
Clock watching. Everyone crowds the corner on the hour, but I didn't see much happening - was expecting something more spectacular

Wait for the change of hour. The astronomical clock is great and the old town center with the Christmas market beatiful. There was even a "Welcome to Prague" show, where girls dressed in the folk dresses danced their folk music, VERY nice. I recommend you wait for the change of hour to stare at the Astronomical clock and you will see figurines coming out of the tower and dancing...is great.
Worth the visit. Wait for the hour. But it is packed with groups... Try to come later in the day...
Mesmerising. Stand with a hot chocolate and watch the hourly performance ending with the sounds of the trumpet as the astronomical clock completes its hourly ritual.

It's good to see them. Nice historic place with interesting clock. Town hall is good to see it. It's recommended to go to the basement, which also used to be dungeon.
About the clock - you can see it not only outside but also when you go upstairs in the townhall, you can see all the figures from closer.
Clock Tower. Worth a visit to the tops for the views incredible recommend the lift stairs go on forever!!
Anti Climax. Felt that the build up to this was bigger than it deserved. A wonderful sight but somewhat of an anti climax when you got there! Nevertheless, well worth seeing!

Awesome site. Read up on the history of all the working pieces, ie, the skeleton, evil looking creatures, angelic creatures and such. Be around the square on the hour so you can see the trumpet being sounded from the top of the tower.

Facinating. This has to be a highlight of anyone's visit to Prague, especially if you are a watch and clock collector. No you can't carry it home except in photos. I got my share. Be sure to go the top of the tower and look out over the square.
So beautifull. Very charming and beautifull clock. Howhever when the time is right everybody stares at it. Take a litle time after to see it with less peolple arround

History!. Crowds gather on the hour to watch the display on the Clock, which has mechanical figures doing various things. Get there early if you want to see it through the day - it will be packed!A herald goes round the top of the tower blowing a trumpet so you know that the display will be happening shortly - keep an ear out if you want to see it!I would recommend that you watch it at least once during your visit, then go to one of the many decent restaurants around the Square, or Hard Rock Cafe just off it.

Be aware of the high prices.... Be aware of the high "tourist" prices in the restaurants and shops in the square near the Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock, if you are hungry rather walk out of the town square and find a little restaurant on the outskirts where the prices are more reasonable. The clock is beautiful - and well worth a visit.

panoramic views.. Be lazy and take the lift to the top of the tower, where you can see the whole of Prague laye out below. Be there when the clock strikes the hour and a herald blows his trumpet and wave to all the crowds gathered below

Too Popular!. Problem was we were there along with the Christmas Market crowd. Soooo many people it was hard to enjoy. The venue was obviously an important destination for travelers. I wish I could have visited it before the crowds came like in say 1900.

Crowds on the Square. We went several times to the square....to see the clock, have a snack, people watch. For several nights there were many people there mourning the loss of 3 hockey players killed in the Russian plane crash. They had set up a huge area of red candles along with memorabilia. Seeing the clock itself (jam packed on the hour) was not so much, but the square was wonderful.
On time!. Wait for the right time to observe the effects and sounds of the watch and to wave for the trumpet players.
Clock. Went up in tower-best view for picture taking in the square.

Delve deeper. The masses assemble on the hour to take in the clock at its best. You can read other reviews that will describe what happens with the little doors opening and the saints peeking out. The masses then move onto the next stage of their tour wondering what all the big fuss was about. Top tip: go into the tourist information next to the clock and go up the stairs to the second floor. Here you can get a tour of the old government buildings and see the inner workings of the clock You can get a close up view of the saints when they aren't doing thier little rotation trick and up close you can see the intricate detail that went into their creation. I understand they were fashioned by a famous local marionette maker. You then get a tour of the cellars which was an unexpected highlight and then the visit isn't complete without a trip up the tower where the view is brilliant.
time travel. sit at the cafe right in front of the clock: there is a heater and blankets for your lap; the Irish coffee was great!

Don't miss the Old Town Hall guided tour. This tour is not well publicised! You get tickets from a desk on the first floor above the tourist information office, there are a couple of tours a day with an English-speaking guide timed to start just before the hour so you can see the clock mechanism working from the back. Then you look through the rooms above ground - not very interesting, but then - the main point of the tour - you go underground and walk in and out of the houses and along the original 13th century streets 10 metres below ground where street level originally was. Fascinating.
a must see!. on the hour, every hour a trumpet is blown! make sure you get there during day light to enjoy the hour tick!
Very Cool Old Clock. I saw it on the free walking tour from Sandeman's New Europe. Hearing about it from the guide (Michael) made me understand and appreciate how cool it is.

This clever 600-year-old clock tower is the natural heart of Prague. This astronomical clock, built in 1410, is surprisingly colorful, and with multiple moving hands and rings, you can spend several minutes deciphering everything it's trying to tell you, from the time of day, to the phase of the moon, to the current sign of the Zodiac. It's set in the side of a marvelous stone tower, and this building epitomizes the Old World charm I was delighted to see in Prague. It stands in Old Town Square, which is the heart of historic Prague, and the plaza is large enough that you'll always find a place to stand for a good view, despite the crowds.Every hour on the hour, the clock puts on a show: statues of the twelve Apostles emerge from its doors, two at a time, before turning and reentering the tower. At the same time, four other statues (always visible on the exterior) shake; I like to think that they're trembling in fear at the emergence of the Apostles, because those four statues symbolize various sins and evils. From left to right, they represent vanity, greed, death, and lust. This show is quite brief, even when accompanied by the bell chimes, so the city has hired a trumpeter in medieval garb to sound a flourish at its conclusion, giving the tourists a bit more showmanship. The locals say that all tourists should come here twice: once to watch the clock show, then once to watch the crowds watching the clock show, with the inevitable look of disappointment at its rapid conclusion. However, I watched it a couple more times after that as well, marveling at the engineering skill that allowed people hundreds of years ago to construct a mechanism I'd be hard-pressed to replicate today.There is no fee to look at the building and clock from the outside, though there is a small fee to go up to the top of the tower. The nearest public bathrooms, which charge a nominal fee, are inside the tourist center that's located just to the left of the base of the clock tower. There are many cafes and street food vendors in the square in case you want food or drink while waiting for the top of the hour.

beautiful clock and surrounding plaza. One of the most beautiful areas in Eastern Europe. Be sure to get there when the trumpeter plays. The down side of this are the crowds in the summer and it takes time to get a good picture without strangers being in the scene with you.
Not to be Missed. One of the Highlights of Old Town Square and Prague and not to be missed. Take the lift to the top on a clear night for a beautiful view of Prague and the surrounding areas.

Good to see. It was a nice clock to look at, very interesting, but very crowded!! We instead enjoyed going up in the tower and getting a great view of the city! While we were up there the trumpet player came up and was playing the trumpet to annouce the hour. Interesting experience!

An unforgetable experience. If you go to Praha, don´t miss it. The first place I went where everybody is looking up, and at their watches, because they are worried if they miss the hour. The astronomical clock it self has twelve ficures, and they go around at the first minute, then they close the window. After the turn around, a trumpeter plays a trumpet.

Interesting. It was a highlight of our trip Took the escalator to the top to see the wonderful views over the red roofed buildings and green domes We were there as the clock chimed and the Jester played the bugle amazing
Astronomical Clock Captures an Audience. Don't miss this animated clock in the historic center - quite a sight to see every hour on the hour!
See the clock toll on the hour. When the clock tolls, the statues pop out and the musician plays the horn from each side of the top of the tower. Must see.
Fantastic. I loved watching the figures at the turn of the hour and being up in the tower when the trumpeter blows his horn as the clock strikes the hour.

Nice, but short. I read a lot about this attraction. Its very nice but short, just some minutes, but you must not miss it. Better early if you dont want to stand in a croud, or late in the evening, when lights is on. Some recommend to sit in a caffe opposite the clock tower, but its wery expensive here and because it takes only minutes, not worth it. You can have your caffe (or tea, or beer, or vine or whatever you want) some other plase close by cheaper, here you pay just for the sitting place.
Astronomical Clock. We had a great tour guide from Discover Prague who told us the history and myths about the clock. It was also near where we met up to start our walking tour.

A bit less exciting than you might have expected. The clock is fairly intricate and cute, but there is a Disney-like quality to the experience. I think this is a must-see in Prague, if you are a tourist, but don't carry high expectations!

Great view from the top. If you've got the patience to queue to get to the top, you'll be rewarded with fantastic 360 degree views of Prague. The clock itself was good, but you will need to get there at least ten minutes to the hour if you want to find a spot to watch it.
Enjoy the view, both day and night. Easy to photograph and enjoy the annimation. Return in the evening when tower is illuminated.
Right out of your childhood dreams. Be there on the hour to see the full theatre. We missed it a lot as there is so much to see in the pretty town
A great place to people watch. Worth a glimse. Keep your eyes open, however, the show lasts 37 seconds.

nice attraction. It is hard to understand why all the tourists wait in the cold (or hot) to see some figures moving. But I have to say we also waited and it was nice. I recomend to read about it before you watch, it will enhance the experience.

Some Clock.. Half the fun is looking at the crowds of people round you peering up at the clock and clicking away with cameras. Every time I found a good vantage point some clown would then stand in front of me waving arms up in air.

magical. can't miss this, it's the attraction in Prague, amazing clock and square, worth it to have a supper or dessert right by it, surrounding touristy restaurants overcharge in comparison to other places, but still CHEAP and worth it for the views
I can see for Miles & Miles. Go up the clock tower and take in the view,but beware the narrow spiral staircase!

Interesting Myth. The myth behind this clock is that the emperor had the clockmaker blinded by hot pokers so he could never make something as beautiful again.
