Some find it a disappointment, and admitedly it isn't a huge "wow" when the clock strikes the hour, but it was definitley a technological feat at the time, over 600 years ago, and for that it's worth all the praise and recogition it gets.

great tower views. The tower views are excellent {easy access to the top in a lift}. The hall was more interesting than I expected having incorporated several burghers houses over the years. Check the timing of guided basement tours {on the hour I think} as we skipped ours as the timing didn't suit us.
A must see in Prague". Make sure that you see the clock on the hour when it is moving. And then go up in the Clock Tower for awesome views of the city. You will NOT be disappointed.

Very crowded. These are fantastic to see when passing through but there are HUGE crowds. Prague has so many less busy options for toursists that I would suggest walking or driving by to get a sense of this - there's not need to splurge on a full tour unless you are a die hard history buff.

Fun but be prepared for the crowds.. Too many people, but a very interesting clock. We didn't go there with a guide (thank God!), but it is helpful to read about it in a guide book like Rick Steve's to enhance your appreciation.

This was an amazingly complex clock, very old, and very beautiful. The Astronomical Clock is on the main street that goes through old Prague, crossing the Charles River and going down to the Square. In addition to time, it shows the phase of the moon. There are several statues that are incorporated into the clock. The design was unique--unlike any clock I have ever seen. One of the best things to see in Prague, and it is worth standing there a while, to see how it operates.
WHAT A TICK_TOCK CLOCK. Stay for when the hour strikes to see the special figures and the surprise aromas at the end.

you'll always find yourself back in the square!. Centre of the old town with beautiful buildings all around you. Not expensive either at the cafes and pubs around there. And still some oldie worldie finds off little back streets.
Astronomical clock. Be there when the hour changes, nice to see the figures moving

See the inside to get the full picture. The Old Town clock's exterior is worth spending time examining because of the variety of measurements it displays and the exquisite nature of the work. The moving apostles which are discloed every hour were carved by a famous marionette maker. It is MUCH better to see these from inside the city hall. The tour of the five buildings which are connected to create city hall is wonderful and this is why we rate this so highly. One has to go to the second floor of this building to take this tour, but once inside, the astronomical clock figures are visible in all their glory.
Viewing the clock is free!. Don't sit in the nearby restaurant expecting to get the best views. There will be a 1000 people in front of you.
Great. Its a must visit. Gets quite busy but you have to see it. Make sure you take a good look as there are many things to see on the face of the clock.
clock is animated. clock is fun to see on the hour when it's animated. Live trumpeter plays. Lovely cafes in the square for snacks

Go on the hour!. When we arrived in the square we had no idea why there were so many people gathered. Then we walked over to the Clock. It was about to chime! What a neat clock. Woth it just to see the chimes and the characters on the clock move.
Perfect. The Clock is marvellous, but until you hear ít´s story then you will realize the true glamour of this piece of art
What a crowd!. We just made it in time for the clock to strike! I didn't realize that such a crowd could gather in a short period of time.
elevator up, ramp down. Great views of the city... the crowds are nuts at the hour, and frankly it's not worth the crowds and wait at the hour, see the clock off the hour and it will be more fun.

Interesting, but what is the big deal?. It's easy to find and near lots of other things. The clock is interesting in a Disney sort of way. Worth the trouble? Sure if you're walking by the the showtimes.
nice but. it's a nice toy but there is so many people there that you can't focus and of course in the end it's just a..toy.what;s the big deal?
Must see. Should see all the show that goes on when its 12 oclock. Really really nice! A must see in Prague

Brings back memories of childhood. This area is magical, with a fairytale feel and look about it. Crowds stand and wait for the clock to strike, figures to move and the sound of horns from the towers.

Superb atmosphere at night. Whiost walking through old Town Square we had seen a stage being erected over the week we were in Prague, but no idea what it was for. On the last night, sat outside enjoying a beer when the Prague Philharmonic Orchestra turned up and gave a free concert. Absolute class.
The Clock. Busy at all hours of the day as groups wait to see the clock in action!
Interesting. Waited for the hourly show of the Apostles. Beautiful work.
Brill. Underground tour of the Old town hall was very interesting

Go up the tower!. it was only 100 Krona and well worth it for the view! If you time it right for 'on the hour' you will witness the fan fare that happens and crowds flock beneath and a jester blows this trumpet. Have some hot red wine whilst taking in the atmosphere!
The jewel in Prague's crown. The crowds build up waiting for the hour then all expectations are dashed when a damp squib fizzles.
ASTRONOMICAL CLOCK. To be honest this was a bit of a let down, I expected much more! There were always crowds there, but nothing really happened!

Nice view from the top, postcard view of the clock but very over rated. The views from the top are nice (worth 100kr? I'm not convinced) and the clock looks good on a photo but it's over rated as an attraction. A big crowd gathers every hour to watch the little statues move when the clock strikes the hour, but the main sentiment from the people around us was "Is that it?" (the best comment we heard was "I'm sure that was stunning 600 years ago"). There was some applause for the piper that plays from the top of the tower following the puppets but here's the thing; according to our tour guide, they only added the piper 3 years ago to liven it up because it kept getting voted as being over rated! Credit to them for taking action, but there's a limit to what they can do to this one.You have to go and take a photo of the clock hence you're in Prague, and pay to go up to see the view if you want, but it's not life changing and don't expect too much from it.Kinda sorta recommended.

Astronomical Clock - Interesting. We did not go inside the Old Town Hall. However, we did observe the Astronomical Clock. At first it seems a little corny until you realize it is about 800 years old. It is very short but is a must see. It is pretty crowded every hour.
Packed. Full of nice little cafes and bars and the fantastic Kafka book shop. This does get rather crowded but its well worth it.
Old Town Astronomical Clock. Again, very historic place and very reasonably priced. Lots of choices of restaurants and souvenir shops. Try their white beer.

Great Views but Dangerously Crowded. The views over the city were second to none and come highly recommended. The tower is fully disabled friendly as there's a lift all the way to the top, although I opted to take the stairs.At the top, it was very crowded however and I would almost say dangerously crowded as the balcony is very small with people jostling to take the all important photos. Stay safe if you visit!
Astronomical clock. Clock lovely, lots of interest in it from tourists.

A Lucky Happening. After watching Jesus and the Apostles make their faithful march by the windows at the top of the astronomical clock, we took the advice of our friends and paid the small fee for touring the Old Town Hall. Overall, it was a great experience, and there were two wonderful highlights. The first was being able to go to the very top of the tower and view the Old Town Square from that vantage point. It was fantastic--chilly, but fantastic. The second highlight was that as we were about to leave after viewing the amazing rooms used by the current mayor to meet with dignitaries, the lady at the desk encouraged us to go back to the room where we saw the apostles from inside the tower. We waited five minutes and then had the rare privilege of seeing them march from the inside vantage point. Great memories.
Not quite Blockbuster entertainment.. Over rated. What the hell even was it? I still don't get it. The trumpeter didn't even do a virtuoso solo. Unimpressed. It was awful.

Nice building in the Old Town Square. The building and astronomical clock are nice and there is a great view from the top. Many people had told us to be sure to see the clock on the hour, well there is too much hype around the hourly "attraction". On each hour, figurines of the 12 disciples appear through two windows of the tower... I was expecting more after all of the talk. If you miss the hour, don't worry about it.
Very interesting to see if you are in the area..... But beware~! Make sure that you find a place to stand to take pictures... at least 10-15 minutes prior to the new hour. This area gets packed fast!
Great To See. Great to see something so old and intricate. Be aware that the clock strikes on the hour every hour but the Saints only make an appearance between 8:00 and 20:00.
Classic European Charm. A visit to the old town square and the Astronomical Clock is a must!

Be there on the hour. The apostles don't appear for long when the clock strikes the hour! Loads of people congregate to see the clock strike - take note that there is no need to push your way to the front as the action takes place high above and can be easily seen!
Definitely worth it to go up the clock tower. There is a photographer up there taking photos of tourists with bohemian costumes.. Recommend that..

Don't miss Old Town Square. Beautiful, restored old town square. The Astronomical Clock is a big attraction and tourists crowd around it upon the hour, but it is the rest of the square that is so charming. The buildings have been repainted their original colors (after they faded to gray during Communism) and there are outdoor cafes and wonderful shops. A vibrant heart of the city.

A Must See!. And everyone is there! Giant crowds gather every hour to witness the" spectacle"-- It was far more enjoyable to watch folks see it for the first time. Amazing to think this clock and the parade of apostles has been there for several centuries, but it is mild for today's special effects generation. I liked the flute-y tooter at the top! We climbed to the top for a spectacular view of the city!
Busy busy. Never went by without lots of tourists on a guided tour staring at this whilst their guides droned on. Saw it, photographed it, moved on!
Take the elevator to the top. For a grand view of Prague take the elevator to the top and walk around 4 sides to see the town from a bird's eye view.
Clock and concert. The square just adjacent had a concert going on with great food and great music. Get to the clock early for a good spot, then climb the tower for a great view of the square.
Nice Again. Visited a 2nd time in 3 years. Enjoy the view from the top of the tower.
if u don't see this you have't been in Prague. Try also going up to the tower. It's a great view from there. The lift up looks good and the ticket is not too much.
Postcard pic. Very cool clock, and great people watching. Watch out for pick pockets - duh
ok. It gets really busy to see this clock, waited to see it and thought is that it. I probably being a bit harsh but i was not that bothered about this attraction, was nice to look at.

Fascinating clock. The clock is a wonderful piece of work, and there is a lift to the top of the tower which affords great views. The first-floor chapel was closed on the day we visited, unfortunately. There was a wedding in the Town Hall, and we saw the bridal couple and the stretch limo outside!

Unique attraction!. It is amassing to wait with crowed of people, moment when clock is going to make a performance of announcing time! It is a whole papet performance every hour and the most amusing is to watch people around it! You shouldn't miss it!
Miroslav and jelena micic
Belgrade, Se4bia
Loved the mapping on the clock!. It was amazing and very well done. I hope they consider doing it again next year.

WONDEFUL PLACE. We walked all over Prague in 5 days looking at all the sites. The clock is beautiful and something to see, lots of open space for kids to run and there was a wedding the day we were there.
Cool. Very neat. If you get the chance, be there when the hour turns so you can see all the clockwork figures move.
Clock. Many people in the square, read the background to the clocks history, worth visiting
Great. this is the world heritage and for people of the world, do not miss

Street and Tower Marvel. Whether viewing the clock from the street, or the e ntire city from the clock tower you have in one location the best all around that Prague can offer. Having been blessed with beautiful October weather the panoramic vista from the top of the tower is totally awesome.
The future. You can see, probably the future watching on the Astronomical Clock but sure the past, just the skeleton now...
fascinating. well worth seeing but packed with tourists. we were warned about pickpockets there but had no problems
Fascinating. A must see - go on the hour to see what unfolds! I would imagine the trip up the tower would give you great views, but I'm afraid of heights!!

great wedding venue! magical. I only wish it has snowed to complete the fairy tale! The clock is amazing and stunning to see again and again. Our wedding was in the Old Town Hall, a magnificent historical building adjoining the clock.
Neat. It's a necessary stop to anyone visiting Prague. On the hour, the clock performs its little show.
A must. The clock is amazing. On the hour, watch the skelton start the 20-second show. We returned to watch this 14th century marvel again. The crowds cheer and clap. Quite amazing.
Go also at night!. They have this holografic projection over the clock that goes on at night around 21:30. Don´t miss it! I was mesmerized!
The Old Town Hall Clock. Never changed over the years - one of the best tourists in Europe
The Only One in the World. Learn why this astronomical clock is the only one in existence. It is an amazing creation and not to be missed.
Quaint again. Sorry I was expecting more of a display - I went a twelve o'clock as well!
Fascinating clock. Didn't visit the Old Town Hall, but did spend a while watching the clock. Would have been longer but my wife wanted to keep moving...
the clock. the astronomical clock is a beauty and great to watch on the hour. large crowd gather to witness it. we also saw two newly weds there for their photographs in front of the clock

A lift to the heavens. The clock is surrounded by visitors when strikes, to watch the 12 Apostles appear in a small door about the clock.They are Somewhat small and difficult to make out. The lift to the top of the tower is quick and the views all around the square are fantastic, when the clock strikes a youth comes to each side of the tower and blows a fanfare on his trumpet. A spectacular evening sky of reds, blues etc when we reached the top

Old Town Hall was interesting and historic. We toured the old town hall and found it to be very interesting and lovely. Several rooms are medieval and beautifully decorated with the city seal and the seals of the nobles. There is some wonderful carved wood furniture.  Be sure to ask about the tour of the crypt area. The crypt area is interesting and generally closed except when accompanied with a tour guide. We didn't know about the tour until we asked about seeing the crypt and then learned about the tour with the guide. It was worth seeing and fun. When you tour the old town hall you can also see the inside workings of the astronomical clock and get a close up view of the figures of the apostles that appear on the hour. The astronomical clock is fun and fascinating. On the hour, the tourists gather to watch the clock's operations. The figures on the front of the clock move their heads, the skeleton turns the hourglass upside down and the doors on the top by the gold rooster open and the apostle figures parade by the opened doors. It goes quickly. Because of all the warnings of pickpockets, I kept my hands in my pockets on my wallet and our money. We didn't have a problem but it pays to be safe.
no words. just come and see it! there are no words to explain: like explain the sunlight to blind

Fabulous light projection on clock. If you are visiting Prague you have to see the light projection show which goes on inthe evening from 7.30, its really brilliant! It is projected onto the clock and hundreds of people gather to watch. The old town is a great place to stroll around and there is something diferent going on there everytime you go!

A unique feature that every visitor should experience. Ensure you come at the correct hour, so that you can fully experience the mechanical and engineering marvel that is the medieval astronomical clock. Even if it was a modern device it would be a wonder, but the fact that it is hundreds of years old is just breathtaking. I have not been inside, or up the tower, and I'm sure this adds a great deal to the already wonderful experience.
Unbelievable get there on the hour the sight is one of a kind. A marvel to the imagination of man and the fixation on religious beliefs.

Nice to see , but don't stay to long. You may not have missed this when visiting prague butt if you are nota clock lover/repairman you might after 3 minutes think : is this it ?Besides that you are warned in every book about prague and everywhere aroundthe astronomical clock for pickpockets at this sight so you aren't complete at eas also.

Top Of Astronomical Clock !!. Easy to find lots of reviews of Old Town & the Clock Tower, but, maybe few know youcan take an elevator to the TOP of the Tower for an Incredible View of the City of Prague & all it's Red Tiled Roofs, mountainous hillsides and the Castle across the river!it was exciting and fun to discover accidently that you can go up to the TOP.try it, so worth the views!!

Great to be seen seated at the café across from the clock.. The Astronomical Clock in Prague is really a must when it strike at the full hour.A tip: take the opportunity for lunch and take a seat at the café just across from the clock. You won't have to stand up to wait to see the show, you rest your legs and feet and grab something to eat.

Perhaps the best in Prague. The Astronomical Clock is a must see in Prague. Situated in he Old Town Square, the surrounding restaurants and cafes make for an amazing people watching site. Busy, high energy and interesting would be my take on this location.

A must see. It is in the heart of the olcity and is a must for all visitors, It has various features as it striikes the hour and gets very busy around the hour. When we visited there wasa light show on it in the evening telling thestory of it since it was built in 1410. Only an annual event in September but well worth seeing.

Quirky clock on the wall. The reviews build this up and when you get there not much happens. It more fun to watch the reactions from the crowd. While we were there we saw 4 wedding parties all trying to get there photos taken in amongst the tourists, a very strange sight.

Surprised to see it. Was lost going to this Square but when we finally saw the Clock, it was worth it!
Everything said about it are true, was just surprised that it was not in a tall Tower as I pictured it in my mind, but it's better that way - so we can take good pictures in a short distance only.

Very lovely !!. All this area the old prague , old street with colorful houses leading to the central square and its famous astronomical clock is very lovely, narrow little streets and shops, this atmosphere ( exept the thousands of people!! :p) brings you in another time, you can't keep your eyes off this wonderful architectures !! A must in Prague !

It's worth it to go to the top!. Most of the people that comes to see this building admire it's ancient look and crowd the street waiting to see the astronomical clock do its show (once an hour?). For me, the highlight of this attraction was to go to the top of the tower and see the great views of the city. To get in, you can buy tickets at the base of the tower, but then you have to go two buildings down (past the astronomical clock) and then through the glass doors to get the the lift.

Really cool once but overrated. Astronomical Clock -I honeslty thought this was pretty cool but it really is overrated..You cant help but think how difficult it mut have been to make such a unique clock back in the day just amazing.. but you stand there amongst hundreds to see it ring the hour and a guy comes out after and plays the trumpet for applause..puhleez! But still cool, just dont miss dinner over it!

Unique... don't miss it!. The Astronomical Clock is very unique. Don't even dare to miss it when you're in Prague.Every hour the clock shows how a beautiful spectacle with it's movements. It's not long tho! ly last a few minutes. Don't forget to check out the history behind this clock and to discover the building nearby as they are also nice.Conclusion: Stunning... you will not find such clock often...

Beautiful at any time of day, not just on the hour!. Crowds gather on the hour to watch the famous clock's movements, which only last a few minutes. The movements of the characters is interesting to watch, but the clock is so beautiful at any time of day or night! Bring your camera!

Only the astronomical clock. Didn't go inside the hall, just watched the clock. I guess that when it was made, it was a thing of magic, but i have seen better animated clocks. It's ok, but don't get stressed out about seeing it. It runs for 30 seconds every hour during daylight, so there is plenty of opportunity to see it. The more interesting aspect is how to tell the time by it?!?!

Must have been amazing when it was built but a little hum drum now. Did I mention that Prague is filled with crowds? Nowhere is this more evident than at about 10 minutes to the hour in front of the astrological clock. And when the hour comes around the show is underwhelming. Maybe I was reacting to feeling like the salami in a sandwich, but I'd just skip this attraction (and the famous bridge) and wonder around the backstreets of old Prague on both sides of the river. Otherwise you'll feel like cattle, especially in the summer time.
You can not miss this place if you are in Prague. A very beautiful building, the astronomical clock is beautiful, town hall is nice. Town hall tower is a must I think to see the place from above.

Do your research on the clock before you see it. The astronomical clock is really a work of art. It's hard to take it all in the brief time one usually spends for the "hourly" show. Knowing about the parts of the clock ahead of time is helpful.

MUST SEE!. This astronomical clock is spectacular- beautiful, thought provoking, interesting, and entertaining. Figures become animated every hour on the hour. Tourists and tour groups begin to gather about 15 minutes beforehand, but they are all gone five minutes after the brief show concludes. It is definitely worth sticking around a few minutes because the clock's value extends far beyond the animated show. Take a few minutes to examine it and try to figure out everything the clock shows you- time of the day, time within the year, time within the zodiac. Wow! Read about it on WIkipedia- the article is short but fascinating, and it will make your visit to the clock more meaningful. Also, the Czech website for the clock has phenomenal pictures: http://www.orloj600let.cz/.The clock is part of the Old Town Square and most tourists stop by St Nicholas church there. And they notice the numerous beautiful buildings from the Habsburg rule. The square and the clock tower really are gorgeous. But I think that a lot of people pass by the Jan Hus memorial, and that's a real shame. Jan Hus was burned for heresy against the Catholic church, for such things as suggesting Mass should be given in local language, rather than just Latin. He has become a powerful figure for the Czech people, representing strength during times of oppression (and goodness knows that the Czech people have needed such a symbol!). My favorite part of the memorial is the hooded crouched figure on the far right. His hand tells such a story!

unmissable!. Don't miss to get on the top of the tower! You will get to see the classic view of Old town and overall of Prague. Even though it's crowded and small, it's worth spend fair price ticket to see such beautiful view!

Great view over prague and interesting clock. Actually you have three attractions in one here1) The astronomical clock. One has to marvel at the skills of the people who built this clock which is after centuries of working still running and running well. Take some time to find out for yourself what the different scales and pictures mean and what it is. It is also displaying some figures at 12 with the skeleton as the last.2) The old town hall which can be seen from the inside giving a good impression of how rich and splendid Prague had been under Habsburgian rule. Also a lot to see here in the details3) The tower of the old town hall which gives a great view of the old town (and the crowds who want to have a look at the clock). From here you can actually plan your vsit around. There is an elevator, but I recommend walking you see more of 2) if you do so. 2 and 3 have a fee, 1 is free.

great views, but really crowded, try to arrive early. When I walked past the tower at about 10 am there seemed to be hardly anyone at the top, but by the time I found the entrance and got to the viewing platform it was ridiculously packed, and by the time I got off the viewing platform there was a huge line to get to it and also a huge line to get into the museum part (which I decided to skip).Despite the jostling I managed to get some great photos (Prague's roofline is one of the best in Europe), I thought it was very worthwhile despite the crowds.Given that you'll be smooshed up against a whole lot of other people you probably shouldn't come here with a bag that doesn't have a secure clasp - but, from what I've heard, it's a bad idea to go anywhere in Prague with such a bag!

Town hall inside. Most tourists seem to go up to see the view but the council chambers of old town hall are really worth a visit. Wonderful dark wood panels decorated with gold and different old coats of arms of Prague. Does not take long to visit it and is really beautiful. Can also see the clock from inside.

Good, but Petrin Tower is better.. Our trip up the tower was a mixed one. The views were spectacular & the building itself was great, but the trip was spoiled by how crowded the tower was. The pathway is about 3/4 of a metre wide & massively overcrowded. As seams to by typical in Prague, there were many rude pushy German tourists elbowing their way through without regard for anybody else. There were no one way signs, so people shoved and pushed from all angles. Having said that, I would have recommended the tower if I hadn't gone up Petrin tower the following morning. For the same price, the views were just as spectacular, but it much less crowded.

great view and information about the city. We were delighted to find a free braille guide to the city at the information desk. The view from the tower was excellent and easy to access by a lift if you don't fancy the stairs or ramp. We really enjoyed being at the top when the trumpeter played!

Have the inside tour of the townhall, you might be surprised!. We (semi-accidentally) had a private tour in German (just the 2 of us) from one of the lovely older ladies at the Old town hall. We had not seen the Clock strike, just seen it a bit on the outside, but the lady brought us to the inside of the clock at the right time, which was nice to watch, not in a crowd... The history of the townhall was well worth a guided tour, now we know why there are so many cellars in Prague. The excavations that have gone on underneath the town hall are impressive and paint a nice picture of how every-day-town-life must have been several centuries ago!

Prague Astronomical Clock. Prague Astronomical Clock (Orloj) is mounted on the southern wall of Old Town City Hall. The oldest parts of Orloja, a mechanical clock and astronomical disks have been made in 1410. Astronomical Clock (Orloj) consists of three parts: the astronomical disks representing position of the Sun and the Moon in the sky;" Course of Apostles "with mechanical figures of apostles; a dial with the medallions representing months. Clocks look tremendous. Many tourists are going to look and listen to each hour their work. Having heard to time we have taken a walk on the center of Prague and have come once again to a town hall (Old Town City Hall). In the top part Orloj there are two big windows, closed шторками. Each hour approximately one minute prior to peal of bells dark blue шторки c white snowflakes open and in windows figures of Apostles and other characters start to move. Simultaneously the big figure of a skeleton of the person, located about astronomical disks calls in a hand bell. After that small doll performance curtanes are closed, the hand bell becomes silent and starts to beat a chiming clock. Magnificent words from a song A. Pugacheva “ …. The Old watch still goes … the Old watch witnesses and judges… ” occur for memory from chiming clock Orloj.

Forget the Clock just get up to the top of the tower and enjoy the view. The clock may look fantastic but i would not hang around for the hourly "entertainment" with the dozens/hundreds of other tourists. Nothing exciting happens.But if you pay 100 CZK to go up the tower you will have a truly wonderful view of the city centre.The guys at the cash desk beneath the tower are funny to watch dealing with some truly stupid people.I will never forget my wait for a ticket

Cute to watch. We missed the clock going off the first two hours we were in the square. The third time we were at an angle watching the clock. I thought that the aposotle figures came out this small black door that is to the left of the clock face, not so. Kept watching the door and nothing was coming out then seconds before it was all over I saw the aposotles going around inside the tower. There are two small blue doors at the top of the clock face, one on each side. These doors slide open and the figures are inside the tower and move past those windows. It does go fast! so know what your looking for and at. We saw the clock go off countless times after that during our 2 1/2 days in Prague and it never failed to give us a good laugh.

Go inside after you watch the clock!. It's too bad that the Town Hall and the Clock are lumped together in one entry here because I found the Town Hall way more interesting than the overhyped clock. The Town Hall consists of a central building with some neat rooms, a cellar with a lot of history and a tower that has probably the best view in the city. Normally I try not to use guided tours, but the (free) ones here are useful because you won't understand it otherwise (especially the cellar).This building is a little complex, but this is how you should do it. Go to the tower itself and buy a ticket, then go into the main building and go to the second floor to buy tickets to the town hall. If you have a tower ticket you will get a discount. Ask what time the tours start so you can plan accordingly. If you have lots of time (ie, 30 minutes+) then go up the tower and come back down for the tour. Otherwise you can just kill some time for it to start.Tip: Don't sit at the nearby cafe waiting for the clock. Problem is that hoards of people will just stand infront of you and your great seated spot won't see anything at all!

It happens fast!. This clock has been here since the 14th or 15th century, although parts have been replaced. Yes, you can tell time with this clock, but it is complicated. Just look at your watch or check your cell phone. On the hour the 12 apostles of Jesus make their appearance. A skeleton rattles an hourglass, and a rooster crows the hour. After that trumpeters on the gallery at the top of the tower blow their trumpets. It's over in less than 30 seconds. The square is filled with people, so be aware of your belongings.

It was fun to watch. Once.. Prague is a stunning city and we wished we could have stayed longer. The only hard part was the huge crowd that was present everywhere, especially in the Old Town. My kids loved the Astronomical clock, so we had to go back and watch the little figures again. As for me, I was glad to see it once. The clock was made in the 15th centrury and it shows the date and the signs of the zodiacs. According to the general legend the clock maker had been blinded not to be able to make another one.

Beautiful square but don't wait for the clock to strike the hour. I think the Old Town Square is a must-see in Prague. It is well cared for and the architecture which is very varied is stunning. The square is dominated by the twin gothic towers of The Church of Our Lady before Tyn and the Old Town City Hall with the astronomical clock. Both are beautiful buildings. When the clock strike the hour, death in the form of a skeleton rings a bell and figures of the apostles appear at windows in the face of the tower. It can be a bit of an anticlimax for many people (the common question heard is "Is that it?") so I wouldn't advise waiting for it. You can also climb the tower of the City hall and get a good view over the square and the rooftops of Prague. There are plenty of places to have a drink and eat in the square but cheaper alternatives can be found away from the square.

Just for the View. The clock and the hall have nothing special but going up to the tower and watching the city from there worth the effort. There are both elevators and stairs leading to the upper floor of the tower, so, it's not a tiring experience. Pity that there are very few explanations or signs around and you're expected to figure out everything on your own.

Disappointed. Waited for 20 minutes to watch the clock chime and was expecting more, it lasted for a couple of minutes and sounded like a badly tuned jewellery box. I normally really enjoy historical sites, but I think this clock is overated.Very pretty building though and it is worth seeing, but dont go out of your way to watch the clock chime. We did not climb up to the top, perhaps I am just being a bit grumpy because I missed out on that :+)

Buy a postcard instead!. It really isn't worth going out of your way to see! If you happen to be walking through then go and take a pic but otherwise don't waste your time. Even when the bells were chiming it took about 2mins to even notice the little figurine moving and hitting the bell things!It doesn't help that there is a smell of horse urine about the place, and I am a horsey person so things like that don't bother me on the yard but when I have to skip over puddles on my holiday I'm not impressed!

the center of prague & #1 place to go - and go up in the clock tower!!. every single hill or tower in prague claims to have "the best view". but the astronomical clock in my opinion is the one to go up in. the views really are spectacular.i always like to mention that i am afraid of heights, but it wasnt that bad. there is an elevator that takes you up, and although it is a narrow walkway at the top, it does feel pretty enclosed. i get vertigo in high places (st peter's cupola in rome almost killed me), but i did not suffer much here & its worth it.the square is so charming & beautiful. it's my favorite part of prague. i absolutely despise the way people compare prague to disneyland, i think it's so ridiculous. prague is clean & well manicured & preserved....and it was around 500 years before walt disney was born. prague INSPIRED the design of disneyland....not the other way around.enjoy it and dont listen to the disney talk. i stood and stared at this square for an hour the first time i saw it.

Well worth a visit. I was not at all dissapointed by the clock. i thought it was beautiful and great fun. We were there in February so the crowds weren't too big at all. The tower is definately worth the climb (there is a lift too). The views from the top are outstanding.The old town square was a realy nice place to spend some time. The atmosphere was great too. We enjoyed a cup of hot wine while we waited for the clock to chime on the hour. Hmmm mising it already.

Old Town Square and the Clock a 'Must See'.. The Old Town Hall and Astronomical Clock is a wonderful attraction. Fanfares when it chimes the hour and figures coming out. I cannot say it dominates Old Town Square as there are other things like the memorial statue of Jan Hus and the Museum of Alphonse Mucha, but it certainly stands out and is a miracle of engineering knowledge from long ago. The Old Town Hall suffered fire damage some years ago and much of the building is gone but the Tower remains and the clock is well worth the visit. If It's a cold day as it was on our visit, you can get a great view fro the windows of the Cafe's and Restaurants opposite while having a nice warm drink.By the Mucha exhibition is a restaurant that serves local food and don't miss out on their homemade minestrone soup followed by Goulash and dumplings and then strudel to follow. Good value meal.

Overrated. Ok, so the building here is pretty cool, but the clock is a waste of time. i guess it's one of those things you feel obligated to see while in town, but please don't hang around for 25 minutes waiting for it as you will be most disappointed.

Fantastic view over Prague. The Old Town Hall on the Old Town Square is a must see and a must climb! After a climb to the top you are rewarded by 360 degree views of Prague, the likes of which I have not found elsewhere in the city. It is higher than both of the Charles Bridge Towers so if you only climb one tower, make it this one!You can take in the views from a walkway around the outside of the tower at the very top, or if you are a little timid when it comes to heights, you can stand behind glass from inside and still enjoy the sights whilst feeling a little more secure. The climb to the top is long, however there are lifts at all stages should you wish to use them, so even those with limited mobility will be fine.The Astronomical Clock (on the outside of the tower) is also worth a look. Parts of it date back to 1410 and every hour on the hour you can hear the skeleton ring the bell and watch the twelve apostles parade before two little windows. There are always huge crowds at the bottom watching this and it really will not be the most amazing thing you see on you trip, but if you are visiting Prague you will visit the Old Town Square, so why not stop and look? The clock is very accurate so you don’t need to stand and wait for 10 or 20 minutes.There are various galleries inside the Old Town Hall and these cost a little more than the basic ticket price to climb the tower. I am sure if you make the climb, you will agree it was money well spent!

Disappointing. We happened to be passing when the hour struck and how pleased we were. Some people had waited there for 20 minutes, trust me it is only worth a 2 minute wait. If you think back to when it was first used then it is amazing but in this day and age it was very disappointing

A good location to watch the clock. Suffering from colds, my husband and I knew we could not stand in the crowd gathering to watch the hourly event at the Astronomical Clock -- but the Grand Cafe Praha, directly across the street, has tables in front of windows directly across from the clock. Grab one of those of tables at the window, enjoy some refreshments and get an unobstructed view of the clock and the figures moving around. LOVED the location and the hot chocolate with cream and being able to sit and see everything.

Lovely to see but beware!. Old Square, Town Hall and Clock were lovely to see early in the morning, before the crowds appear. Even whencrowded, the atmosphere is still lovely. However, BEWARE of changing money around this area. I was standing waiting at a money exchange booth, when my husband was approached by a small, well-dressed, possibly Indian man, offering a better rate than the exchange booth. Caught off guard, we exchanged £60 with him and found instead of 2 x 100 Krona notes, he gave us Hungarian notes, worth about £3 each. This left a nasty taste in an otherwise lovely area of Prague.
whats all the fuss?. not as exciting as everyone seems to think, seen one clock perform seen them all

2nd Best View in Prague. Seeing the clock: pretty neatSeeing the clock chime the hour: Could have lived without itGoing up in the tower: One of my favorite parts of our trip in Prague!The tower view was wonderful, just see the pictures. I could have stayed up there forever. We saw all of the square, the castle, the bridge, neat side streets, roof top terraces, the opera house top and much more. Definately worth the money to go to the top. You can either ride the elevators all the way up, or you can walk up the spiraling ramp (not stairs). Up there everything is good to photograph. A must do in Prague.When you get back down, make sure to drop through the lobby area where you'll see the old front door. The tiled ceilings are amazing (see picture).

Best view in Prague in my opinion. Not only is the Clock really cool looking, the view from the top of the tower is amazing!!! I didn't do the tour so I can not comment on that but i did pay the 75c to go to the top and check out the view and was throughly impressed. I personally thought the view was as good with not better than the views you get from prague castle. I am really suprised this does not rank higher, this is a must do in my opinion!

You'll take so many pictures .... It's funny just how large the crowd gets for the same show every hour. But you will probably watch it more than once. The sound the doors make when they closed made me laugh every time. Don't worry about getting a great spot early, it's not a big deal, as you can see from wherever you are. The clock isn't that high up so you can see everything quite well. Get a good guidebook and read up on the features of the clock, as all of the characters tell a story that is worth knowing before you see it. We were there for the Christmas Markets -- grab some hot wine and wait for the top of the hour.

The most interesting part of the square. The clock is very tall and impressive. This is a must-see site in Prague, and a tourist should be sure to be there when the clock strikes to see the figures. Inside is tourist information with many brochures as well as vendors attempting to sell tickets to musical performances. Opposite the clock are several bars with high prices by Czech standards. This area is filled with tourists after dark is a late night option for seeing the clock as well as shopping and eating. Be aware of pickpockets.
Unusual. Take a seat, enjoy a coffee overlooking this unusual attraction. The Apostles' show is over very quickly but it is worth seeing at least once!

Beautiful clock. Beautiful clock and you need to be there to catch its show! So much happening in the Square but make sure you are there to watch the clock. The apostles are fast so make sure you're ready! A must see in Prague.

A must-see place. Both Old Town Hall and Astronomical clock are at the historic center of Prague. Especially the astronomical clock is the most known place of interest in Prague. It's the place that people meet each other and its the place that people, tourist mainly choose to drink a coffee or eat. You can't visit Prague without seeing it. The astronomical clock doesn't show only the hours. It has its own history as it shows the signs of the zodiac . The most funny attraction of the clock is when the 12 Apostles appear in the clock and all the decorated statues on the clock statrt moving. It really worth to see this attraction and generally to have a closer look at the atsronomical clock.
